comments: We had a great stay at the cottage. We loved the warm beds after a chilly day of activities. Quiet neighborhood which has train or bus services into the city.  Teresa and Hugh made us feel like we were staying with family.

Teresa and her husband are a wonderful and warm couple! The apartment is great, you feel like at home and the atmosphere was great because Teresa treated us really well. The location is perfect and thanks to all the information and tips from Teresa you can experience Dublin from its best side! If we go back to Ireland or Dublin, then one hundred percent to Teresa! 

ps

leaving and love you, Teresa
Great place to stay if you want the experience of a local.
Very welcoming home and kind hosts. We had a very good stay and enjoyed our time at Teresa's home.
Welcoming and flexible host. Nice stay in Dublin.
Lovely couple, who took good care of us. We really had a pleasant stay in Dublin.

Would 10/10 recommend Teresas place if you are going to Dublin! A 20 minute tram ride into the city centre, located in a beautiful neighbourhood. Teresa was thoughtful, quick to respond and always available for anything we needed - a truly lovely host.

Staying at Teresa's was like staying with family...she was s wonderful hostess!!
When visiting Ireland again will definitely choose Teresa's cozy Irish cottage!
All was wonderful. All the details were present and we had a really good stay in Ireland. The place is really calm and Teresa and her husband were really friendly with us at every moment

Teresa's space is very comfortable, extremely clean, and very cozy. 
It was my first week in Dublin and I had only good experiences. Close to the house there are some pubs, and a shopping center with two malls. The train station is 10 minutes walking distance and there is a bus stop in front of the house. Teresa and her husband are kind and very special people, they did everything to make us feel at home, starting with a good hot tea when we arrived.

Highly recommend the stay. : )
Amazing, warm, gracious hosts!
The airbnb was perfect, with an amazing breakfast, they were really simphatic and with a great hospitality, giving advises and everything to a great days, I really recommend

Teresa and Hugh were so nice and helpful. Teresa sent us information about buses and trams before we arrived, so we knew exactly how to get to their house and how to get around Dublin. I would recommend a stay here.
Very happy with my stay over the weekend. Went for longitude only really there for sleep but lovely hosts very friendly with great comfortable rooms. Would definitely stay again.

Teresa and her husband are great hosts who always had a helping hand for us. Their house lies in a safe and quiet neighbourhood, which can be reached by LUAS (and a short walk) from Dublin centre within 25-30 minutes. 

The house and the room, we lived in, had everything we needed for a short stay in this wonderful city. The room was fully equipped as was the kitchen and the bathroom, everything is as given in the descriptions, it's tidy and really nice. 

Thank you for a lovely time in the "holy cottage" in Dundrum/ Dublin!
We loved staying there and would always recommend to also do so when going to Dublin!

Churchtown,  aka dumdum is about 15-30 minutes from the city centre of Dublin depending on which public transit you take,  which is so easy to get to within minimum walking distance. Ms. Teresa's cottage is quaint and very comfortable. You feel like you belong there automatically. Spacious one room accommodation that is clean and super comfortable. Shared space in the kitchen and bathroom for now more than six total guests at a time. Their backyard garden is amazing and so great to sit, enjoy a cup of tea with fresh fruit or toast and jam that is provided daily. Muffins and cereals as well are usually on the menu. This was such a great time, I can't wait to go back!

Staying with Teresa was the best decision we could have made. 
Teresa and her husband Hugh are incredibly friendly and really take care of their guests to make sure they feel welcome. They have lots of information about exploring the city, restaurants, pubs, things to do, public transport, you name it.
The room was bigger than we expected and very pretty with lots of attention to detail. The room, bedroom and kitchen were perfectly clean. Teresa offers a lovely breakfast as well, different kinds of bread, jam, nutella, cereal, tea, coffee... you name it. The perfect way to start a long day of sightseeing 
Our personal highlights were the fluffy towels and the heated blankets.
I would absolutely book this place again,  not only because of the stylish room but also because of the wonderful hosts.
Great location for getting in Dublin and exploring. Super helpful, friendly and knowledgeable about all the local attractions and interesting places to go. Thanks for a great stay!
Very good people in a cute house, very comfortable !
Really enjoyed our stay. Bedroom was smaller than expected but hosts were lovely.
A very warm, inviting place to stay. I had a wonderful experience, and they were so kind and helpful with the best tips for getting around and places to go.

It was easy to find. Very clean. Nice breakfast. Lovely garden, if our stay had been longer we would have sat out there too. Nice and peaceful after a busy day in the city! Thank you for your hospitality!
Great location, lovely tips to find the perfect spots around the city.

Excellent location
Super host
Teresa and her husband are exceptional hosts, and their home is terrific. We couldnt have asked for a better stay in Ireland.
The host canceled this reservation 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Teresas place is a quite locality and is very stylish with very thoughtful touches. She and her husband are very respectful of the person staying at the property and at their toes to help when needed.

Hosts were brilliantly helpful. The house was amazing and near everything we were interested in getting to. Also Teresa is a saint. We had a minor scheduling issue and they worked through it with us without a complaint and were super kind through the whole thing. You wont find a more lovely couple in all Dublin and that is saying something. Everyone we met was super nice.
Very kind and sweet people. A pleasure to stay with them!
Teresa and Hugh are wonderful hosts in their cozy cottage in Churchtown. Great spot for launching into exploring Dublin.
Both of our hosts were very helpful. It's very easy to get to the house from the airport and to Dublin. Great experience!
Great location with easy transport links. Nice friendly atmosphere and lovely hosts.

Teresa and Hugh were both amazing, kind, helpful and thoughtful. I love my stay in their beautiful and comfortable home and would choose to stay with them again should the occasion arise once more. Highly recommended! Great location for shopping, the mountains, sea and Dublin centre, very close to transport links too if you don't have a car!

We had a wonderful time at Teresas place! The room and the house are neat and clean, the bed really comfortable! Teresa and her husband are really charming and will recommend you the best place of Dublin to visit. Thanks for all the advices and see you surely soon!

Despite the late hour we wer greeted super friendly. Our room was perfectly equipped,  clean and big enough for two people. Breakfast was included in the price and there was a lot of choice. The house is super cozy and the two hosts (Hughie and Teresa) are super nice and lovely. We felt right at home. With the bus or the train/tram one arrive within 20 minutes in the City centre. The connections are good. I would recommend the accommodation to anyone who doesn't want to live right in the centre of Dublin. You could also meet some other guest and have nice conversation with them. Dundrum is a very beautiful and idyllic place. Perfect holiday with a perfect accommodation :)
Very nice hosts, all good.
Gorgeous backyard with plenty of seating, beautiful kitchen with 3 walls of windows, and free arking on site! They are very friendly people with a lovely home.

What a wonderful little home with warm and caring hosts! I could not recommend Teresa and her husband more; they were both happy to tell us about different places to visit in the area and were interested in learning about our lives back in the States. Our room was cozy and had everything we needed for our week-long stay. The Holly Cottage was the perfect home-away-from-home for our first trip to Ireland and we couldn't have asked for better hosts.

Theresas place is fantastic - I stylish and tidy Irish house far from the city center but very accessible with the bus - the ride offers the possibility of capturing the citys beauty :) You also benefit of a breakfast with a view - part of the kitchens walls are made of glass and you can see the beautiful garden. 

She was very hospitable and offered a lot of information regarding places to visit as tourists. 

I would gladly return there!

T and Huey are so awesome!! Their house is sooo cute and very close to the 14 bus that takes you into town. They are also very helpful with tips around the town, and on what you should do. Highly recommend!
Fantastic host. Felt like home
Very friendly and helpful people, they are very organized and have a good system
Beautiful home and amazing hosts! I would definitely book with them again.

Teresa was very friendly and patient with us, although we had some unexpected changes in our travel plan. The flat was very comfortable, tidy and nice. The breakfast was also very good. During the night the water heater turned on every now and then, which was quite noisy and kept waking the sleeper up. However, we can highly recommend Teresas place!
Accoglienza calorosissima! Teresa ci ha guidati prima ancora che chiedessimo informazioni. Casa molto pulita, persone gentilissime.

We spent a lovely week-end at Teresa's place. The cottage is very well situated, it's very easy to get to the city centre and Teresa and her husband provided us with all the information we needed about public transport, places to visit etc. The house is cosy and clean, the bedroom really nice, the only problem is the water heater which is really noisy and kept waking us up at night. But for the rest of it, it was a great stay and we thank Teresa and her husband for their hospitality !
A great alternative to an expensive Dublin hotel. Teresa is so friendly and it is truly lovely to come back to a suburban atmosphere when travelling. Simple transport options into Dublin City.
Such a welcoming place to stay near Dublin. The cottage was even cuter than we could have imagined, and the hospitality made us feel at home. Would definitely come again.
The cottege is nice, a bit away from the city center. Bright kitchen where self service cold breakfast is served. Room not big but cozy.  Good value for money! Thanks!

Teresa and her husband have a wonderful small house in churchtown. To the City Center it takes you about 30 to 45 minutes.
We had a nice little double room. In the bathroom it can get a bit busy,  as three room share one bathroom with toilet. 
Breakfast is continental and good.
Amazing place to stay in a superb location, hosts are lovely. Would highly reccomend.
Comfortable accomodation, convenient for Dublin amenities. Lovely hosts.

Teresa and her husband run a lovely B&B. The rooms, while modest, are comfortable and very clean. Their location is well situated to grab public transit and Teresa is wonderful with help to get out and about with suggestions and directions. The only suggestion I have is for folks that are light sleepers and that is to bring ear plugs. The cottage is lovely, but there are noises in the early evening with other guests using the common washroom etc. Not unexpected with common facilities.
Teresa and Hugh were so accommodating! They're lovely home was always clean, and they looked after us very well! Definitely would like to come back again

We highly recommend Teresa's house. She is such a amazing host and her home is perfect. Everything was clean and she had basic food for breakfast (i.e. bread, peanut butter, cornflakes, milk, orange juice). Also she waited when we arrived and gave us useful advices. She is more than willing to make your stay as comfortable and convenient as possible. If you're on your way to Dublin I' recommend staying at Teresa's home.
Great place to stay, lovely  home
Teresa was a lovely host and i would very much like to visit again!
Cosy, comfortable clean space. We had a lovely time, really appreciated local tips for restaurants and day trips (visiting Howth was great!).
This place was amazing!! Norah is a wonderful host!
Yes
Margaret and Gordon are lovely and their house is quite and is wonderful to stay , highly recommended
Nice home. Comfortable bed, even for a big guy like me.

Margaret together with her husband Gordon are wonderful hosts. I couldnt have asked to stay with better hosts especially as I was a lone traveller. 

Their home is within access to bus routes so it is cheap and easy to commute from airport and into the city centre (‚Ç¨3 one way to centre from the bus stop at the end of their road)  on one bus no. 16. 

Theres a super value supermarket across the road where I got a leap card to load with bus fare (‚Ç¨5 for card). Theres also a pub across the road. 

I felt totally at home here. Nothing was too much to ask. And so laid back I didnt feel like I was getting in their way. 

I will definitely be visiting again and highly recommend Margarets place.
Extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful hosts. Quiet location but within easy reach of bus stop to city centre and airport.

Nice place, near to a bus station, the host are really welcoming.
I recommend.

Small room & very comfortable bed! Perfect for the single traveler & for a short stay. I felt at home  Margaret & her partner are super kind & love to have a conversation. They also offer a small breakfast! It was a surprise to me as I was not aware of this genuine perk. They also were accomodating to my unavoidable last-minute late check-in. Communication was timely! 
As for location, it is close to the airport & a 30ish-minute bus ride to the center. I definitely recommend!
Warmly and welcoming homelike place with a cozy and comfy bed.
Margaret is a lovely host and the place is close to the university, very clean, and my stay was incredibly easy and low-key. Highly recommend.
Had a nice stay in Margaret 's home. Room was nice and clean, quite location ideal for city or airport. Bar and shops also close to house.

Margaret was a wonderful host! Easy access from the airport and to the city center! (Only one 20min bus to both!) Cozy room with a really comfy bed, 3 min walk to supermarket and a REALLY good Thai place called Mama Thai.
Ideal location, cosy and warm
Margaret and Gordon are super nice, the place is clean and location is just perfect. I will definitely recommend friends visiting Dublin to stay here. :)
Convenient distance between airport and town. They provide a simple breakfast which I appreciated as I could get started with my day straight away!
Was looked after so well by these guys, they have a great sense for hospitality and go out of their way to help. The room was really cosy too. Would definitely stay again.
Margaret's home is very homely and welcoming. Nothing is too much hassle and offers great value for money, close to airport and only a short bus ride from the city centre.

Margaret was very kind and welcoming, you get an authentic Irish family vibe from them it was lovely. She was very understanding of my need for rest from jet-lag and would check in to make sure I was okay. Both hosts are very kind and accommodating
Expect a quiet, welcome place to stay where you are well cared for.
Friendly and flexible host and nice neighbourhood.

Magaret and Gordon are such wonderful hosts! They welcomed me as an old friend and were always interested in my actions, what my plans are and how I enjoyed the daytrips! They were so nice and helpful, I think I have special expirience, I twisted my ankle at my first day and they helped me with everything I would've asked for! Lovely people! I would always come back because I felt so safe!
Excellent value .  Location  is 20 minute bus ride from the airport.  Hosts are helpful ,friendly & accommodating.

Margaret and Gordon's house was a FANTASTIC place to stay on my vacation (holiday (-:). I arrived by taxi and the neighborhood was so cute. I was let in and led to my room, did a little unpacking, and then got to hang out with Margaret for a bit until Gordon came home. Right away I felt like part of the family. They are a delightful Irish couple with lots of hospitality, stories and tips to offer.  I loved watching the family dynamic and felt comfortable making myself at home.  We went grocery shopping together which was fun for me as a traveler. 

Gordon had lots of Irish jokes and songs to share with me and we spend ages laughing and joking. Margaret introduced me to her family living next door and I had the most delightful time playing with her granddaughter.  It was wonderful to have people to chat with at tea in the morning and dinner at night. 

Gordon and Margaret offered me tips for traveling during the day, suggestions of places to visit and to see, and how to get there most efficiently. Even which buses were the best. I had fun following their advice and it made me feel more confident on my day trips. Plus, I knew I could contact them if something went awry and I needed assistance. It was really the complete package for someone traveling on a budget.

Thank you both for the wonderful week in Beaumont and for your hospitality - I would suggest that anyone who wants a homestay experience in Ireland should stay with this delightful family.

-Giselle
My best airbnb experience ever!Great price for the offer!Perfect location, easy fast access to the city center,The place was very well located by public transportation or even by feet.
A hospitable couple who looked after me well for my one night stay.
Amazing hospitality! Will help you figure out local transportation! Overall amazing stay!

Perfect for someone arriving at a late flight or having an early one.
My stay was really short, as I arrived late and had a bus to Belfast early the next morning, but everything was as I needed.
Margaret and Gordon are welcoming hosts.  The house is pretty and the location is ideal between the airport and the town.
Margaret is kind and friendly and the location of her place is ideal for airport connections.

This place was great. Margaret and Gordon were awesome. They were very hospitable, and even offered breakfast which was great. The place was real close to the 16 bus which you can take to downtown Dublin or to the airport. The room was very nice and cozy. The bed was very comfortable. It was just what I needed for my travels to Ireland. Thanks so much guys!
Margaret and her husband were incredibly helpful, provided everything I needed and made me very welcomed during my short stay. Thank you.
Margaret was a lovely lady so kind and it was a home away from home. Location is perfect for city centre and airport and she arranged taxi in morning.
Small, but nice and quiet room in a qiet neighbourhood. Close to various bus stations. Very friendly hosts :-)
Great location, wonderful hosts and a comfortable bed!

I had a lovely time at Margaret's place. Everything went smooth and she's a very kind and generous host. I really recommend her place and I'd love to go back for another stay. I wish you and Gordon all the best Margaret. Regards from France.

Friendly, efficient and hospitable service with a personal touch. Quick responses online and happy to work around you with check-in times. Clean and comfortable room, nice house in a quiet Irish suburb and all-round great craic
Easy access to the airport and the center of Dublin from there. Margaret is a very helpful and kind host. Comfy bed and breakfast are a big plus!

About 25 minutes to City Centre by Bus 14 or Bus 16. Friendly guests and hosts. Good pubs in the area and a supermarket near. The Beaumont neighborhood where it is located is quiet and calm during the day and evening.

Margaret is kind, accommodating, and quick to respond. Her place is in a safe residential neighborhood conveniently located across the street from a grocery store and restaurants. Its only a 15 min taxi ride into the city or 10 min ride from the airport (or very close to the bus stop!). Had a great stay and would return!
Nice place to stay for the first days in dublin

The house is nice. The room was clean, warm and comfortable.
Margaret was very friendly.
It suited me perfectly.
Margaret was very welcoming and helpful, good communication, house clean, and handy location. Would stay again.
Very welcomming hospitable hosts

Margaret was a very welcoming and friendly host. We had some nice conversations too. She gave me some tips on where to go for food etc. I stayed with Margaret for just one night. The house is conveniently located in a quite neighborhood close to the airport. The bus stops around the corner and takes you to the airport in less than 15 min. Despite my short visit, I enjoyed my stay.

The room is ok when you expect to have a small room with a single bed. The mattress is very soft and I had problems to sleep on it. The location is not really central- you first need to go to the bus stop around 10 minutes and then it takes around 30 minutes to downtown Dublin. If you do not like smoke you should not stay there as it is a smoker house and you smell it strongly in the room. For 1 or 2 days the stay is ok but the room is very small.

Place was just as expected. Margaret and her husband are very nice and will definitely make you feel like home if you let them. Had a great time during breakfast with them and they helped me with tips to visit the city. The location is very convenient to get to the airport too.

The best part of my 2 week trip to Ireland was meeting Margaret and her husband.  They were filled with great suggestions for places to visit and eat and always made me feel welcomed.  They have one of the few Airbnbs that offer a light breakfast and it was nice being able to keep food in the fridge for meals and snacks .   I highly recommend this warm and wonderful Irish family to stay with for your trip.
Nice place, close to bus station and about a 30 minute ride directly into the city centre!
Nice place to stay near Beaumont hospital and airport
I really liked it. Nice bedroom, good location - only 30 min from city centre by bus. Also Margaret and her husband were really nice and gave good tips regarding local transportation.
Ms Margaret is very helpful person and i had a wonderful hospitality :)
Robbie is a fantastic host with a great sense of humour. The place is lovely & suited our needs perfectly. Will return!
A warm host who knows how to talk. The house is clean and the connection to the city is very good.
Good location with very easy bus access. Robbie was always available for questions and to sit down for a tea (he lives on the 3rd floor of the flat).
Robbies is very convenient for anybody working locally. It is quiet and safe. Good value
Absolutely amazing very comfortable and has an amazing view and places to visit. Transport is just outside the estate. Very comfortable and quiet good for a get away.
Another excellent visit to Robbie's lovely apartment. Lovely welcome, comfortable bed and great hospitality.

Friendly, polite, restful, clean and comfortable. What else do you need. Home away from home.

Many thanks Robbie.

Robbie was a brilliant host from start to finish. He was quick to respond to my queries and gave me an in-depth overview of the house before we arrived. He was really friendly and the house was perfect for our stay, close by to UCD and other amenities. Would have no problem to recommend Robbies for a great stay.
Robbie is a wonderful man and very attentive host. He went out of his way to make our stay as comfortable as possible and help us find our way around. I was sorry that our stay was so short.
Alojamiento muy limpio, Robbies es super atento y amable, el desayuno perfecto, seguro que volvemos alli. Gracias por todo.
A charming apartment. Rob was very hospitable and provided a lovely breakfast.
Really nice house, good location and Robbie was very hospitable.

This is a great place to stay (this is our second time, and it would be more if I didn't tried to book it too late in few occasions). Our host Robbie was very warm and helpful in every way possible. Every time he suggests a new local attraction and he always nails it! His house is cosy, spacious and inviting - great value for money. I am sure we'll book him again as soon as possible.

Robbie is a great host and wonderful conversationalist. I highly recommend for anyone passing through or rambling round Dublin. To anyone wanting to get the local (Website hidden by Airbnb) better man than Robbie. Great value and much cleaner than many other places that Ive booked through AirBnB.  I will be staying again the next time I need a room in Dublin.

1)Robbie is a gorgeous host with great hospitality! We arrived in Dublin late at night but we still cook dinner together. 2)Cozy environment and nice neighborhood! 3)Easy transportation where the bus station nearby:) 
We all had a great time spending in Robbies place and Dublin:) thanks again
Robbies place is in a great location. Easy to commute into Dublin and other nearby areas. Robbie is very hospitable and kind and has great local recommendations.
Great place to stay
great hospitality and brilliant location
great host, location and value
great again
Pleasant and calm atmosphere.The best host who I ever met.Robbie is very good interlocutor, from whom we learned a lot about the history and culture of Dublin
Very clean, very easy to access and parking right out the front. Robbie is a friendly guy who went above and beyond with his hospitality.
All are fine. Just the address given by the owner incorrect.
Robbie has a very nice house in Dublin. He is very friendly for his guests.
Robbie is a great host. It was a very smooth and hassle free booking. Will definitely return.
Robbie is a really friendly guy, his place is spotless with comfortable beds. he was very helpful telling us where the local eateries were. If you choose to stay here you won't be disappointed
Very friendly host, nice accommodation. Thank you!

We had a lovely one-night stay at Robbies as we recovered from our jet lag. The house is even nicer than it looks in the pictures, and the large windows and high ceilings really make it seem huge! The beds were comfortable, and we all slept well. Robbie was an outstanding host, helping us with luggage, providing refreshments (and breakfast!!), leaving detailed instructions around the house, and including sweet touches like leaving a childrens book of Irish history on our sons bed. While not really in Dublin, this place was easy to get to and could make a nice home base for exploring Dublin, the East Coast, and beautiful Wicklow.  Highly recommended!

Robbies place was lovely. It is right by the bus lines so it is very easy to get to the city center or anywhere else you might like to go. His home is spacious and Robbie is a friendly and welcoming host!
Another excellent stay in our Dublin home from home. Highly recommended.
Lovely location. Great hospitality. Comfortable home.
Robbie is a extraordinary host and let none of our wishes open to really feel like being at our ones home. It was a great stay and we got also great tipps for discovering Ireland.
Great place to stay. Very clean and spacious. Robbie was great and helped us with whatever we needed!
Very nice house. Friendly man. Al facilities you need. Felt like home.
Fantastic host, great place to stay. Will certainly be back. Thanks Robbie.
Thanks Robbie, it was a real pleasure to stay in your accommodation. Marc Elvire and the happy kids.
Great place. Robbie is extremely helpful and welcoming. Highly recommend!

Robbie is the most excellent host. He gave us such a warm welcome and went out of his way to help us. His setup is superbly done. The bathroom is extremely clean, as are the bedrooms. The whole place is peaceful and calm and lovely. The beds are fantastic as is the quiet, darkness and fresh air, and I slept like a log. Robbie accommodated me and my parents in two charming proper separate rooms for the same price as one room. Much much better than a hotel and the cultural exchange aspect was such a joy. Robbies instructions and communication was extremely helpful and detailed. Airbnb legend!

The beds are glorified camp beds that are rock hard with thin mattresses. No lock on bathroom door. Host is delightful and very helpful. Place is easy to find only 25 mins on bus to city centre. Very basic but clean and lovely breakfast provided.

Thankyou so much Rob for a great stay. Excellent communication prior to arrival, nothing left to chance, brilliant directions on how to get to his home. 
Once there we were made to feel very welcome, lovely area, direct access to town. 
Stay here, the craic was great 
Great sense of humour and lovely bloke too! Thank you
Clean, easy to find accommodation.

Robbie's place was perfect to stay, the room was super clean and cozy. Robbie was really helpful with everything we required. Also the location was perfect, on a quiet neighborhood but well communicated with the city center. Highly recommend!

There was a great experience to stay in Robbie's house. Beautiful, clean and cozy home and good location. He couldn't be with us but he left a lot of directions and prepared supper. We spent great time. I recomend him
We stayed at Robbie's place at the beginning of our trip around Ireland.  He was very welcoming and sociable, gave us a lot of useful information on the trip.
Easy going, great hospitality and plenty buses into town.
A very kind and gentle man
Robbie was a gracious host, super helpful with recommendations, letting us do several loads of laundry and giving suggestions for our next stops. He was a great host
Clean, warm house. Robbie was a very thoughtful host who couldn't have done more for us.

Fantastic place to stay. Very comfortable and Robbie was easy to deal with. The rooms were immaculate and service outstanding. We will be back!. Robbie was very knowledgable on the area and local transport to get us to the location from town.

This apartment was very nice. Great directions and communication and very accommodating hosts. Easy check-in. Clean, beautiful apartment with full kitchen and large bathroom, washing facilities and television. 1 double bed, 1 single bed and 2 pull out couch beds make for close quarters since the bathroom is off the bedroom but nice if youre a tight knit group. Highly recommended!

We found the apartment fairly clean and well stocked. It was easy to access public transportation to access Dublin. There are several convenience stores nearby, as well as a playground. Unfortunately the wifi was not working during our stay, which was a bit inconvenient. Also the couch/sofa bed mattress was thin and uncomfortable and very squeaky, with road noise quite prevalent in the common area. Having a washing Maschine was nice. I would recommend this Appartement overall.
Very nice flat and easily accessible to most of Dublins attractions. I would recommend it ; )

Very lovely place. Loved the living room the most, it was bright and spacious. The fireplace was a pretty spot considering we don't have them where we're from. 

Only thing - the floor was so thin, every step my family and I took would make such a noise to the point that we had a neighbour complain. We feel bad about that.

But all in all, everything else was great. Location, etc. Even provided a book to help us around the house.
Great trip. Flat was nice and clean and there was everything we needed for cooking. Not  far from city center, 5 min. walk to tram and Tesco. Also very nice neigborhood and good pubs near.
We were very satisfied with the stay.

We stayed three nights in the house. It is well located and organised. Just two notes: the sofa is a bit uncomfortable to sleep and the burner is a bit slow. But everything else was perfect and clean!
Comfy for no more than three. Beautifully appointed, nice area.

We spent 5 days at Grainnes's place and we had a wonderful time. Downtown is not located far away, you can easily get there by bus or the Luas or you can try the local bars nearby, very much recommended. The welcoming was extremely nice, we got many tips where to go and what to see, in which order. This was beyond my expectation and I did not experience such a warm welcoming anywhere before. The flat is well-equipped, I would recommend staying at Grainne's place.
great location
Great!

Danielle and Francois are tremendously kind hosts. This was my first Airbnb experience and it was fabulous. Danielle was very quick to answer my questions before the trip and after the trip was great when I forgot something and had I come back and pick it up! Their home is the definition of Dublin quaintness - quirky with different levels and bright colors. The room was very comfortable. They also have the cutest cat! He gives pets out for free. As everyone else has said, the crepes are divine and they made sure I was able to have them even though it was unavailable on their typical Saturday morning crepe time. Would love to stay with them again.
The bed was cosy and comfortable, the pancakes were super and Francois helped me greatly with taxis. A very considerate host.

Great stay for the second time at Danielle and Francois! 

Spacious room, great people, good location. 

Thank you so much again, would recommend this place to everyone!

Great Airbnb experience! Awesome location, host and house. If youre lucky enough to stay on a Saturday night dont pass up the crepes Sunday morning they were amazing. Will stay here again if Im in Dublin!
Excellent place.

Danielle's place was probably one of the best Airbnbs I have ever stayed at! Danielle was very respondent to all my messages and was very understanding of my later than expected check-in. The house is very clean, and there are various teas and coffee to enjoy in the kitchen. She even gave me lots of local recommendations and really helped me enjoy my stay in Dublin! The crepes that Francois made were also really delicious!

We had a delightful time staying with Danielle and her family who were warm, welcoming and happy to chat/offer local advice or let us do our own thing. Danielle also provided us with a shelf in the fridge, fast wifi, a cat to give hugs to and a superb collection of herbal teas. The bedroom was simple but great: large bed, no external noise, heating and lock on the door. The location was perfect: only a minute or two from a Tesco Express, laundromat, bars, pubs and trendy cafes and lots of beautiful instagram-worthy Georgian houses/streets. It's also only a 2 minute walk to buses that go straight into the city centre, all the tourist destinations or to Dublin airport. I stayed the final night alone as a young solo female traveller and felt 100% safe in both the house and neighbourhood and would highly recommend it.
Highly recommend. Great location.
Very friendly and nice hosts in Dublin, we can certainly recommend to stay with Danielle!

Danielle and Francois were excellent hosts. They were so welcoming and accommodating, their place was beautiful and clean and had everything we could possibly need for a lovely break in Dublin. The pancakes were much enjoyed by us both and we would recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking to stay in Dublin. The location couldnt have been better, out of the way of hustle and noise yet easy walking distance to all the local attractions. Danielle and Francois were available when we needed them but gave us the privacy that we wanted whilst sharing their home. Leo the cat was a very welcomed addition. Thank you for having us, we will be back in the future.
Great place! Great host! 10 stars!
Very comfortable room. Well located. Host was friendly and informative. Crepes were fantastic!
Clean, comfortable, and great location in Dublin.  Danielle is thoughtful and welcoming. Perfect room with blackout shades for a good nights sleep!

Danielle and Francois are warm, well-travelled people. I enjoyed my privacy, while also feeling welcome. The space is beautiful. The bathroom fixtures and bathroom tile might be original; I have certainly never seen the like. The upper bedroom itself was quiet and spacious. It was no problem at all sharing the bathroom or making a cup of tea in the kitchen. The location is very good, and Danielle is responsive to all concerns or questions. A great experience.
You can expect kindness in a big foreign city. She and her family went out of their way to accommodate myself and my daughter.....open heart, open door and respect for the Airbnb true purpose!!!

Danielles place was just perfect for my first trip to Dublin.  The house is a charming Georgian with lots of character and located on a quiet street in the Portobello neighborhood - but within walking distance to the city center.  The room was much bigger than I expected, and the bed was very comfortable, indeed.  Most of all, I enjoyed the kind hospitality of Danielle and Francois.  And I highly recommend booking an extra day to stay with them to enjoy the delicious home-made crepes made special for guests just on Sunday :)

Danielle's place is centered in a lively and convenient area of Dublin - the location was central to many of the places I wanted to check out, while still allowing me to feel like a local. Her home is clean, quiet, and perfect for anyone traveling solo (I was). Danielle was so accommodating and gave me great suggestions/tips. Her husband and daughter are also lovely and very welcoming. Thank you for a great stay!

I had never really stayed within a family situation and was a bit concerned, even though I knew them as I stayed downstairs last year. Not to fret it was as though I was an independent member off the family. Coming and going as i did an yet knew if I needed something they would be there
Danielle and Francois were very welcoming and friendly! Their home is beautiful and in a great location.
Really nice and charming place and hosts! Centrally located to the city. Comfortable beds. Overall a great stay and value for the money :)

I really enjoyed my stay with Danielle and Francois. I was in town for the marathon and stayed for 2 nights. Lovely room, nice and warm and the bed was comfy. I was treated really well and the crepes on Monday morning were amazing! I will definitely be back to stay again. Thank you!

This is my second time booking with Danielle and Francois. I love staying in a beautiful late Georgian house with a view, across a quiet street, of other beautiful late Georgian houses. Portobello is a great little neighbourhood, very close to my favourite cafe and to multiple interesting restaurants, and an easy walk to the National Concert Hall, the National Gallery, Stephens Green, Grafton St, etc. The house itself is quiet, and it was wonderful to relax in the huge bathtub after my busiest day. I see no reason to stay anywhere else when in Dublinîunless someone else beats me to it!

Loved this class. Inna is warm, welcoming, funny, and has truly infectious enthusiasm for chocolate. If youre curious youll learn a ton î Inna is a scientist in her day job and is happy to dive as deep as youd like into the physics of chocolate crystallization, phase changes, etc. The class involved a lot of tasting, of course, plus you take home the chocolates you make. Highly recommend!
Norah was excellent host. We spend a short time with her but she was very friendly. The house is more closer to the center than we expected and is clean and comfortable.
Norah is very friendly and welcoming, cozy interesting house ,  would stay again
If you love chocolate, its a must go! :)

Inna is a great host! She made it special for our group by adding a couple of more edibles and chocolaty treats. She also customized a bit to accommodate the recipes more kids friendly and gave more suggestions to make it even better on our own the next time.
Very interesting lesson. Recommended to all.

We loved the experience. Inna answered all our questions patiently, we got an opportunity to learn and know the basics of chocolates. We definitely recommend it. The best part is that Inna made us comfortable enough to email her questions when  we experiment it ourselves.
Great host! Interesting and fun experience.  Host is very knowledgeable and passionate about making chocolate truffles.

Lovely place to stay. Norah is a great host and very friendly. She is more than happy to help you and will go out of her way to make you feel comfortable. Location is fantastic and very affordable. Hopefully I'll get to stay there again.

Warm, caring, and knowledgeable regarding chocolate would be great adjectives for Inna. She is a hospitable host and is passionate about chocolate. She made the learning experience fun and educational at the same time. If you love chocolate and want a personalized experience on how to create truffles, this is the class for you.
Inna taught me more about chocolate making than I ever thought Id learn. Highly recommend!

Inna was a wonderful host, and we really enjoyed learning about sourcing, preparing, and styling/decorating chocolate as part of a team event. Inna was a warm and welcoming host, and happy to answer any of our questions. Definitely recommend for chocolate lovers or anyone looking for a new skill.

I had such a wonderful time. I brought a friend of mine to enjoy the experience with me. Neither of us had me truffles before but we were  very interested in learning. You made it very approachable-very easy and understandable. Really fun and exciting-lots of hands on experience. It was great to have a little drink and sample some chocolates before we started. but were very interested in learning. You made it very approachable-very easy and understandable. Really fun and exciting-lots of hands-on experience and it was great to have a little drink and sample some chocolates before we started.   I would totally recommend this class. We left with 3 to 4 samples of each travel we made so a total of nine pieces of chocolate  which were delicious.  We met some lovely people. Her home was beautiful  and clean and she was very organized and ready for class.   Wonderful time!

I really enjoyed the chocolate truffle making class. I loved a personal touch of having mimosas. This made the class relaxing and didnt feel like a jobù. I really enjoyed playing with chocolate and making my own first nakedù truffle: it is something that I can take and make at home. It is a great event to do with the loved ones, if you are vacationing or simply want to get away with friends.
Inna was lovely!!!! We had so much fun learning how to make truffles.  We left with a deep appreciation of how delicate chocolate work can be... And a recipe to try our hand at it for our kids
Inna was incredible! She's extremely personable, knowledgable about chocolate and all of our guests had an incredible time. Highly recommend

I had the pleasure of booking a class with Inna for my dads birthday.  He and I absolutely loved the hands-on nature of the class.  Inna was so friendly and generous with her knowledge.  She made us feel relaxed and welcomed us with plenty of truffles and champagnes.  We left our class feeling full from plenty of delicious chocolates and excited to try it at home.

My husband, in-laws and I absolutely LOVED learning how to make truffles with Inna. She was a fund of knowledge about tempering chocolate, making ganache, and how to take several different kinds of truffles. I had basically no knowledge about working with chocolate, but came home with little bags of truffles I'd made! We have a GREAT time and I highly recommend this experience!

We had a wonderful experience.  Even with a little experience in making chocolate desserts, Inna was quick to take me beyond my knowledge and lead us on a very intensive course about chocolate truffles.  She was very well prepared to get us through a fairly complex discussion and completely participatory experience.  And we left with the fruits of our labors!  Lemoncello flavored truffles are spectacular.  I'm looking forward to trying for myself after I lose a couple of pounds...
It was a great and fun experience. Imma was so accommodating and wonderful. So a delicious and fun way to connect.

Inna was a wonderful host! We started off with a wine tasting where we tasted different ports and Inna told us about wine history. Then, she walked us through the truffle making process step by step, and we were able to get very hands on with the chocolate! In the end, we made several different types of truffles under Innas supervision. Overall, a really great experience and would definitely recommend for any chocolate lovers :)

This class is so fun! She is very knowledgeable and really makes the class with how cool she is! We made 3 different types of truffles, tried a bunch of other ones, and had mimosas! So fun and would recommend

Fantastic experience! Inna was very knowledgeable about the subject, organised the class in a structured, well prepared way, and made it easy to learn the skills required to make truffles at home. Highly recommend!

I surprised my fiance with this class for his birthday and what a delight it was! We learned all about the California wine industry, enjoyed delicious Port and snacks, and then got into the nitty-gritty of truffle making.  My fiance loved it. I loved it. Inna even offered a small gift to him and the other birthday in the room. It was a great experience and I'm now super excited to make our own truffles in the future.

We had such a fun time making chocolates with Inna. She's friendly, knowledgeable, and gracious. 
I highly recommend this experience to anyone interested in chocolate making. 
And the chocolates were delicious!
We loved this experience. Inna was a great host and I would highly recommend her to anyone!

We had an absolute blast learning how to make truffles with Inna. The experience was hosted in her own kitchen and living room, which makes for a very intimate atmosphere. I was blown away by her hospitality, passion for truffle making, and cheerful disposition. I can tell that Inna put a lot of thought into designing the class to be engaging, and she also did a lot of prep work before the class to ensure that it would proceed as smoothly as possible. I felt that the class was just the right amount of participation - everyone got to contribute to the truffle making process, but she was there the whole time to guide us and make sure we didn't cause a disaster in the kitchen. The truffles turned out delightful. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone.

This was a fun evening of wine, dark chocolate, and getting inspired to make truffles. The truffles we made were a delicious souvenir of the class that didnt last long ì But we also got info sheets to give us guidance on making truffles at home.

It was such a treat to get to taste the different wines and enjoy some chocolates/cheese platter before we started the class. The methods taught can be applied in the everyday kitchen and it was so enjoyable (and delicious!) learning how to make three types of truffles. Dark chocolate for the win! The whole experience felt really fun and intimate - thank you, Inna, for your hospitality!

We loved Inna's class and would highly recommend it to anyone interested in learning about chocolate making! We made 3 types of truffles and Inna made it so easy to follow and understand each one. She was very patient and did a great job  emphasizing the key aspects of truffle making vs the things that didn't make a big difference in the process. It was easy to focus on what was important, and  Inna made sure everyone got to try doing each step. The portion of the night about port wines was informative and a great addition, too. And of course you leave with a bag full of delicious treats you made  10/10 experience!!!

Wow! My husband and I chose this as our date night and Im so glad we did! Number one, I love chocolate and Innas chocolates are incredible! She is a kind and thoughtful host which character and knowledge. We did the port tasting and she prepared various cheeses and nuts to pair with them. The cooking is all hands on so you really get to make the truffles. She also has these tricks of the tradeù shell teach you which is priceless if you really want to be able to recreate the magic of the truffles! Definitely worth every penny!

Inna is a great teacher, and her recipes and techniques truly do create the best chocolate truffles! We enjoyed the port tasting and brief history lesson, as well as the hands on chocolate session. We highly recommend Innas course for a fun and delicious time!
A bliss! Just go and do it!!!

My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our truffle making experience with Inna. She was the perfect hostess and we learned about the history of Californian wine and port. We were able to enjoy some port and samples of the chocolates we would be making. Then we got our aprons on and learned how to temper chocolate and managed to make some really professional looking truffles which tasted delicious and got to take them home in a goody bag. It was a lot of fun and has inspired me to try  doing it at home.

We were group of 7 guys trying some truffle making for the first time. Inna handled us great, responding great to our personal vibe and teaching us the art of truffle making. While this is not something we traditionally do as a group the entire group felt really positive about the overall experience and about Inna's style in particular
Really enjoyed making truffles and drinking Port. Highly recommend!

Very nice experience and inna is very knowledgeable about wine and chocolate...
A good host!!
Great class! It was a great choice for my wife and I on our anniversary, Id gladly do it again

Inna was a gracious and very friendly host. She was ready on time and made me feel welcome. It was a very interactive experience which I really appreciated; we went through how to make ganache and temper chocolate, she instructed us on the do's and the dont's. There was complementary background music that didn't intrude in the experience. I came out with a good understanding of how truffles work and truffles that I was involved in the making of.
So much fun! Trust me, save up for the extra wine pairing event as well. Inna has a legendary taste and wisdom with her passuons
What a fun afternoon! Lee Ann was friendly and the workshop was chill and fun! Went home with a lot of goodies!

Excellent class and time well-spent.  We had a great time learning from Lee Ann and we took away some great natural products along with knowledge on how to create at home.  I really recommend this class, even for those who are not crafty.  It's great!
It was fun and got to meet new people. Lee Ann was more than willing to give you one to one if you needed. The class was a very relaxed atmosphere.
Great hands-on experience. I really enjoyed getting know Lee Ann. Definitely recommend.
This experience was so much fun! The host Lee is sweet and incredibly helpful and created such a relaxed atmosphere to make the bath and body products. Cant recommend this enough!

I booked this experience for my boyfriend, myself, and his friend, for his birthday weekend. SO SO GLAD I DID!!! All three of us had such a great time with Lee Ann! She was very fun, talkative, and informative! Highly recommend! We came home with SO much more product that we made ourselves then we ever imagined we would!

This was a spectacularly fun experience. I did benefit from having a lot of personal attention since I was the only one at this particular session (11am on a Wednesday in early April- not surprising I was a loner!). Lee Ann made me feel welcome & we chatted a lot while we created- turns out we have a lot in common (besides just being artsy!). I enjoyed my time & the conversation. As a teacher, I know classes can be different with a larger group dynamic, but I can totally see Lee Ann being able to translate her expertise into a bigger class size too. I absolutely recommend this workshop!
A wonderful experience!

This was such a fun experience -- and well worth the price!  We learned a lot, got new skills we'll use again, and walked away with a big bag full of our creations to use ourselves and give as gifts.  Met AND exceeded our expectations! My daughter even asked if Lee Ann might offer week-long camps because she wanted to do more!  Thankful to have found this opportunity for our visit to Portland!
Fun experience making bath bombs, lip balm, and lotions. Highly recommended.

Highly recommended! Lee Ann creates a comfortable and relaxed environment and makes the experience fun. Lee Ann engages conversations and is great with kids! This is the second time my daughter and I have taken this experience with Lee Ann, and we had a great time!

If I could give this experience 10 stars, I would! Lee Ann graciously welcomed my group of friends into her studio for a private workshop experience. She is highly accommodating and a master at her craft. I highly highly would recommend this workshop if you want to try a new experience. This event was so much fun and she made me feel incredibly special on my birthday! I would definitely return for other classes if I am in the area again.
I felt so welcome there from a very first minute! Lee knows how to get people exited. Time passed so quickly.

It was a very interactive experience. Lee Ann was great at addressing any concerns or questions.  She was very knowledgeable and super nice.  Directions were easy to follow and the products came out amazing. The entire experience was super fun.
A great home in Dalkey, plan on taking the train into Dublin to save some money (about 30-40 minutes). Safe neighborhood and wonderful town. Would definitely recommend.
It was really fun activity and the quality of what we made is great. Eventually, I gave what I made to my friends :)
Will come again enjoyed my stay
Great location and very close to public transportation
Lovely location, nice an friendly host
Great place in a lovely area. Would recommend staying if you get the opportunity.
We had a great time. And were super stoked with what we took home. Great way to learn how to make your own.

Pauls place is in a great location within walking distance to the lovely town of Dalkey and close to the DART train into Dublin too. Its really like a small house of your own with 2 bedrooms plus the living room with convertible bed, kitchen area, laundry, bathroom in a private, quiet, nice residential street. Paul is super helpful and friendly. Great place to stay!
Great accommodation in a great location in a great town.  Absolutely  would recommend!
The house is very well located, train station is near, 30 min to Dublin center.
Pauls place was amazing. Great location, and he was very friendly and helpful.
Great place to stay we will definitely go again

This is a lovely private property with lots of thoughtful touches to make it a home from home.  We had plenty of space and the beds were very comfortable and it was so quiet at night that we all slept very well. The kitchen was well stocked and everything easy to use. Paul was very friendly and flexible with check out and we would definitely stay here again when next in Dalkey
Cute and fun

Really lovely stay - beautifully appointed and spacious house.  The host has thought of everything - lots of very helpful little accessories. Warm and comfy, gorgeous location, even had a bit of a water view from the bedroom. Highly recommended.

Paul's place is great and Paul is a great host. The house has all you need and is nicely decorated. We all felt at home!
The location is perfect, 5 min to the Dart station! Dart trains run often and take you to Dublin in 30min. Dakley village and area are also very much worth a visit. I would 100% recommend this house!

Pauls cottage is very conveniently located just a five minute walk to the DART station in Dalkey and the historic seaside town of Dalkey. The home is very secure behind locked gates and the interior has everything  you would need for a very comfortable stay. Paul and his wife are excellent hosts, going the extra distance to make sure their guests feel oriented, comfortable and welcome in Ireland! I would highly recommend staying in this home to any small family! Eunice from Mystic, CT USA

We had a family wedding in Killiney and had family over from abroad. Paul made them feel welcome and treated them like family. Thank you for the kind and thoughtful touch of champagne and snacks on their arrival. They had a wonderful stay. Cant recommend enough Paul and his lovely home. Thank you.

Great amenities! The washer and dryer were a life saver! He even had bandaids in the bathroom, thank goodness, because I injured my finger at one of our castle visits and was able to protect it when we arrived back at the house. The gated entrance made us feel super safe as well. It was a great stay.

I was beyond happy with this experience! I booked this class for me and my sister for her birthday present, and it was so amazing. Lee Ann is very knowledgeable and friendly, and an amazing host. I couldnt believe how many things I made and took home with me. Well worth the price! I will definitely be booking a class in the future.
We had a fabulous time, it was everything we hoped for.
A 5 star experience!
Paul was very nice and always available to help.

Paul is a fantastic host, he communicated constantly prior to our stay to ensure we had everything we needed. Check in was simple and the house is very homely with all the amenities you would need. A great place to stay and I hope to visit again in the future.
Dalkey is my favorite village in Ireland... and Paul and Geraldine are my favorite hosts whenever I am in town.  Thank you both for being GREAT hosts !!!!!   I'll be back :)
Great place in a quiet neighborhood.
Amanda and Paul are very friendly and helpfull. It is a great place to stay when visiting Dublin. Close to the Airport and just 25min to the City center.

Amanda's place is clean, inviting and you find everything you might need. If you require anything else, be it bicycles or a fresh set of towels, Amanda makes sure you get it and that you can feel at home.

Amandas place was just what my son and I needed after traveling for over a week, it was great because you could cook there, do a laundry and a quiet place away from city.  I would stay again.  The 27a bus was quite convenient (a walk to stop)  , also the trip to Howeth was so easy from train and a beautiful spot.  We loved it. Thank you.

It's a lovely place to stay in a nice neighborhood. And it's perfect for visiting Dublin as it's just a five minute walk to the next bus station which brings you directly to Dublin. We really enjoyed the time!
Great!

We had a lovely stay, Amanda had tons of great information of local attractions, the best was her own information book she put together about suggested visits, how to, for the (Website hidden by Airbnb) Apartment was perfect size, comfy, clean and we felt safe. A city bus stop is close by & public park to run in. I definitely would stay again.

It's a good house to stay long or short period, not really near from the center of Dublin but enough to have everything not far, not noisy at all.
Amazing hospitality with Amanda.
Definitively we MUST comeback.
great place for a stay in Dublin, right by the bus route and close to a grocery store
Fantastic experience! Great host! 10/10 would stay again!
It was a great stay at Amanda's place specially we were able to use the bikes to roam around Dublin..

The flat was clean and comfortable. Quiet neighbourhood. Felt safe. We purchased a visitors LEAP pass which made to use of public transport much more convenient but had problems with our first trip prior to purchase of the card as the buses only accept coins. Although the bus stop was 10 minute walk and 20 min to the city we found the time spent catching public transport a took a large chunk of time out of each day. Supermarket 15 min walk away.

Great place to stay for a few days in Dublin. Really clean and tidy with all the amenities. Communication with the host was excellent and we took up suggestions for places to go which was excellent. We chose to take the train to the city centre and this was an easy 20-25 minute walk and very cheap. Would definitely stay here again!
Pleasant stay.
Eenvoudige accommodatie. Voldoet voor een paar dagen. Lange reistijd naar centrum.

Everything exactly as stated in the description. Very clean, everything worked perfectly, great location - both train and bus access. Amanda provided many nice tips for trips and how to get around. I recommend to stay at her place! I even got extra service as Amandas husband saved me when I kind of locked myself in the room. :) Thanks a million!
It is a super cozy apartment, close to the center of Dublin and everything you can imagine.  My mother and I had a very pleasant stay here.

The is very cute with a lot of equipments. 
The host are listening and responding quickly. 
We loved ours stay in this flat we recommend this accommodation.
Rare Affordable option for Dublin, confortable for a couple or for 2 friends. You need a Phone To get To the city by bus, once you know where To go, it Will take you 25 mins.
The place was very good, tidy and clean. Close to the center if you are visiting Dublin. I would recommend staying here, 10/10.

Amanda's place was very clean and comfortable. The information pack provided is very helpful and her response to messages prompt. There is also easy access to public transit and a nice large park nearby. I would definitely stay again!
We had a wonderful Weekend at Amandas place! Tidy and clean.

The property is close to the airport.  The faint, low rumbling you hear are airliners landing, but it's not intrusive.   The path through the athletic fields wil get you to the bus stop faster than taking the sidewalk through the neighborhood.  This is the stop for the 27A bus into town.  It takes about 30 minutes, depending upon traffic.  You can buy a LEAP card in town giving  you unlimited travel on the local bus routes, tram routes (Luas), and local trains.  The nearest shopping to the property is a shopping mall with a large Tesco at one mile (1.7km) away.  The nearest train station is in the opposite direction at slightly over a mile (1.8km) away.  Unfortunately, the 27A doesn't go near either of those destinations.
The bedroom curtains are a little thin, so it gets light rather early.  The kitchen has a good selection of pots and pans with lids, but the choice of utensils is limited.  There is a rubber spatula with a strangely curved blade and a plastic ladle.  There are no sharp knives, a cutting board, or mixing bowls.  The cutlery consists of three forks, two dinner knives, a soup spoon and a teaspoon.  There is an aluminum baking pan in the oven, but it has peeling paint, and I wouldn't put food into it.  The oven and stovetop are missing half of their original knobs along with the temperature dials, so cooking can be hit or miss.
The shower stall has some problems.  One of the doors comes off its tracks very easily.  The top of the frame itself is literally held together with duct tape., so the doors don't close completely.  There is no mat on the floor, so you will need to use a towel for the water that comes through the crack.  There is no anti-slip mat in the shower.  The outside of the frame could use a good scrubbing.
There is a washing machine, which is good to have, but there was no washing detergent.  We supplied a box of washing soap, and anti-slip mat for the shower, and ice cube trays .
Simple, well-maintained space with owners right next door. Wide open public space nearby and walkable streets.

Was a very nice spot!! It is on a corner so there is total privacy from neighbours. Very nice location,  Esay bus route into city, also close to a super cute town!  We did meet some neighbours and they were quick to smile and welcome us in! 
We would def stay here again and would highly recommend it! Thanks Paul and Amanda!

Very accommodating hosts, communication is very open and they're extremely helpful with anything you can ask for. Was very pleased with the cottage and how clean everything was kept. Instructions were easy to understand.

Amanda's place was perfect for my visit to Dublin! The space was a great size. There are 2 twin beds, a full bathroom, and a kitchen with stove and oven. The space is a 5 minute walk to the nearest bus stop which takes you straight in to Dublin city center. Amanda was fantastic with communication. She booked us a taxi for our 6am flight, and you can message her with any questions you may have. Overall, she was a fantastic host and I will definitely book with her again if I am back in Dublin!

Space was great and very comfortable. Parking was easy and the place was conveniently located to a rail and to a bus, so we didn't have to do much driving. Amanda, and her husband, were very nice and helpful.

Very kind hosts. We had an issue with the toilet and they got the parts and managed to fix it almost immediately (even on a Sunday!!). Lots of suggestions and tips as well. A bit of a ways from the city centre but once youre comfortable with the busses its easy to make your way around.

Amandas place was so clean. It is adorable and cozy. Its about a 30 minute bus ride from city center but the bus stop is really close by. Amanda leaves a really helpful information packet in the room and is also great at responding to any questions. 10/10 would reccomend.
Perfect airbnb for us, will stay again- thanks Amanda

This b&b is conveniently located minutes from tourist attractions just north of Dublin and offers basic amenities, as listed. (bring your own body wash and shampoo)  The mattresses and the couch were well lived in but the annex was comfortable and warm.  Having a washing machine/dryer was definitely a bonus. The other appliances worked well. Apart from a curious incident when a couple of drunk individuals tried to open our door one night, the neighborhood was quite. Finding the apartment was a bit challenging because we arrived late at night time and we couldn't see the house numbers very well. We had minimum interaction with the host because we were gone most of the time. However, they made themselves available and communication went smoothly.
Clean, well equipped, cca 20 minutes from city centre by taxi. Recommended!

The location was quiet and very comfortable. It was easy to get in and out of the heart of the city. I used nearby public transportation which was cheap, quick, comfortable and helped me capture some cool photos of the city. Great place and friendly people.
Lovely place. The host is super friendly, great communication. Would definitely recommend
Very cozy space

Sheila is a great host that took great care of me and was always quick to help me when there were problems. The room is small but comfortable and clean as was the bathroom and the kitchen. I'm not the most social person but Sheila always gave me enough space and a quiet place to learn for my studies. It was very easy to get to the city centre and the tcd from her house. I had a great time staying with her!
Friendly and accommodating host. Room clean, quiet, safe and comfortable. Conveniently located. Would definitely recommend.
Sheila is the best of the best and her home is great :)
Really enjoyed my stay at Conors! Would absolutely recommend! Didnt get to meet him in person but his tenant was really nice and his responses very quick!
Lovely house in a great location. Conor was very responsive to any queries etc

Rachels place was great! The room was comfortable and I felt like I really had the place to myself most of the time. It has a lot of character and Rachel was a very helpful host and accommodating. Overall, had a great stay.
Nice room in a very pleasant and quiet area with easy access to the city and local business district. Rachel was a very friendly and helpful host.
Great place to stay. Rachel is very welcoming and her place is the literally closest to bus stop

A very lovely couple and a nice charming room. 
Absolutely high recommendable! Thank you for everything :-)

We had a great time at the BnB. The room was very small and the shower wasn't high enough for my husband but it worked out very well. The bed was super comfy. Breakfast is only toast, jam and cereal but was enough for starting the day. Brian and Phyllis are very lovely. DART is only 7 to 10 mins away. And eagle house has some fun live musicians which is only 5 mins away.
It is a cozy place located close to the ûcenter. There is a nice living room and great breakfast.
Brian And Phylliss is a great little Bed and Breakfast with in walking distance to a cute town.

Friendly host especially Brian who is happy to chat, great stay overall~ A little old but shouldn't be a big issue, location not in central Dublin but still easy access to/from airport and Dart train to/from Central Dublin.
basic but good value for money , great location between 2 DART stations and local bus routes . Good location to explore the Dun Laoghaire area
Aircoach stop within 5 min from the house is a huge convenience. Good eating places within walking distance too.
Had a lovely stay with Brian and Phyllis! Really look forward to my stays in their welcoming home.
Bed was very comfortable, shower was hot, room was clean. BUT, room was freezing cold, even though we told them; could only get out of bed on one side bc room so small
all good - enjoyed the stay
Great
Lovely en suite room. It is in a great location. Only 2 blocks the village center with its excellent selection of restaurants and shops.
Preis leistung ist ok. Gute S Bahn anbindung.
The place was clean, accessible, no issues with parking and they facilitated my later than expected arrival.

Had a lovely stay at Brian and Phyllis's place, they provided us with a cooked breakfast and the location is very close to the Dart station which was very convenient. Would highly recommend for a short visit.

Myself and sister were disappointed in our stay. We loved the location and the surrounding area was beautiful, however we found the room extremely dated and dusty. We also felt the room smelt very musty, forcing us to go and buy an air freshener. We slept poorly due to an uncomfortable bed, and noisy surroundings.
Had a great stay with Brian and Phyllis again! Two of the nicest people and always make you feel very welcome!
Excellent B&B in great coastal location, 5 walk to train and hosted by friendly couple. I'm sure I'll stay here again

en dehors de dublin mais a 20 mm avec le DART qui est tout pret de chez bryan 
bonne adresse
Great location and great value, Phylliss and Brian were very helpful

Fantastic little B&B! 

Phyllis and Brian are very welcoming people.

The B&B is in a quiet residential area, but very close to the sea, pubs and shops.
A colleague stayed in my place and found the accommodation excellent and very comfortable.
Absolutely love staying at Brian and Phylliss place. Always very comfortable and such lovely hosts. Great location too!
A very warm welcome, good advice where to go and some helpful information. Thanks

It was nice to stay here. Good start with breakfast. Close to train that goes directly to Dublin (30 min or so). 5 min walk to a few restaurants and the sea view. Room a little small and older but a part of the charm.
Good place and nice hosts

Nice old house, with parlor as breakfast room, and available to make tea anytime.  Old style feel. Family share nicely seeing to check-in, cooked breakfast if desired, etc. Nice old bnb near coffeeshops, seashore park.
We arrived quite late but Brian and Phyllis let us stay for the night. Everything fine. Thanks again!
Great breakfast
Great location.  There was only a 5-10 minute walk down to the waterfront and places to eat.
Slightly dated decor as expected but hard to fault when it's clean, tidy, in a great location and very reasonably priced.
Great, I'll visit once again if i am there

I had a brief overnight stay in Brian and Phyllis' B&B which was perfectly suited for my needs. Everything was clean and tidy. The location was nice and quiet so I could sleep soundly during the night. Although I did not meet Phyllis, Brian was very friendly and helpful. I overhead him giving advice on places to visit and eat to some American tourists who were also staying in the B&B, and he seemed willing to go out of his way to ensure his guests had everything they needed. To top it all off, the room was great value for money. I would definitely recommend Brian and Phyllis' B&B and would visit again myself. Thank you both :)
The place was as described, but unfortunately it was noisy (I could hear the doors opening/closing and the neighboors speaking in their room) which woke me up a couple of times in the morning!
Cosy place with breakfast included
Clean and great location!
Enjoyed our stay at this B&B. Good value place with character. Great location, within walking distance of good bars, restaurants, and the DART station for trains into Dublin.
Brian and Phylliss place is great value and is a short walk to the commuter train into the centre of Dublin.

Lovely location, I had no problem finding parking for my car on the road. It was near Dun Laoghaire and near Killiney Hill for walks. I was very happy to have my own ensuite with the bedroom. It's nice to be able to make a cup of tea in the evening, thanks! I hope to return.
Great value, hearty breakfast and local knowledge
My request to I arrived late and leave early was not an issue. Would stay again.
Bit dated but ideal for my needs. Close to town and amenities and I felt safe walking in the area after dark. The room was fine and overall good value.
Joanne is so nice and hospitable, she made every effort to  make me fill comfortable and welcome, ill will be staying again at her place when im back

Joannes place was great. Joanne was a great and friendly host. A clean, quiet place a bit removed from the chaos of the city centre but a short bus ride to get there. The place is very nice and friendly. I highly recommend this place.

Cosy and comfortable room. Joanne was very helpful and answered all my questions. The location is great as the bus stopping outside goes directly to the city centre. I would highly recommend staying with Joanne.

What a sweet host Joanne is! she's very welcoming, warm and her smiley face made me smile too. also, she let me do early check-in and late check-out which was really helpful for me to manage my plans. the room I used was a little small but the bed is super comfy, the view through the window is nice and didn't have any problems staying there. highly recommended! will def. wanna come back Joanne's if I have chance to come back to Dublin.
The room is comfortable and clean. It's a great option for staying a few days while you visit Dublin.
Place is cozy and worked out great for my stay for a few days. Welcoming and friendly host. Check-in was a breeze. Provided useful transportation tips.
Somos muito gratos a Joanne pelo acolhimento e apoio nos dias de Dublin
Joanne is an amazing host! Her place is very cozy and the bedroom was very clean!

This was an awesome and very worth stay in Dublin! The place was nice and tidy and Joanne was extremely welcoming. I would highly recommend bringing coin Euro to get on the easy bus ride right outside to the city. Not worth taking a taxi when the bus is under 3 euro. Will definitely be coming back here if I am in Dublin again!
Nice, quiet area quite close to the airport. Joanne has been very nice, warm and helpful host.

Great place to stay. Bus stop is exactly in front of the house and straight to city centre. Joanne was very quick in replying message. She was also very nice, giving a lot of tips in how and where to explore Dublin. Place was clean and comfortable. Will book again if I am in Dublin next time!
Great location, very welcoming, hot shower, great breakfast

We loved our stay at Brian and Phyllis's bed and breakfast. The location was perfect for us-- just a short Dart ride (train) from downtown Dublin. Beautiful and picturesque waterfront, very near to the James Joyce Tower and Museum. We enjoyed our strolls by the water and checking out the local pub. Our room itself was very comfortable and clean. Will definitely stay again!
Very nice hosts and a very comfortable stay :)
Great location and value for money.
I've stayed here a number of times and it always feels welcoming, plus its in a quiet area and near the sea, so all round a great choice.
I have stayed several times and hope to return on many more occasions. Brian and Phyllis have a very comfortable home and are lovely hosts.
PROPERTY AS ADVERTISED. CONGENIAL HOST.GOOD LOCAL KNOWLEDGE.HANDY FOR EIRCOACH. NICE NEIGHBOURHOOD.
very nice hosts, good option for a few days in Dublin and Dun Laoghaire
A traditional Irish B&B in a fantastic location
Great value and great hospitality. Thank you.
Great place to stay. :)
Too bad to mention.
Brian is a great host and his house it's so beautiful.
What a find. A cosy stay, quiet surroundings very comfy bed. Nice continental breakfast. Close to the sea and public transport.
Very comfortable room en suite, good breakfast, perfect location.
GREAT COMMUNICATION, EASY CHECK IN, JUST AS DESCRIBED
bit older than expected.  nice light breakfast.  nice stay for a day.
clean, cosy and quiet in good neighbourhood close to the see ! Great communication as well
Very comfortable and plesent stay. Will be staying again!
Great place to stay! Always very hospitable.
A friendly, and very well located place to stay!
Simple room in a cosy B&B located 5 min walk from Dart and 10mins from Dun Laoghaire village. Amazing value

Brian and Phyllis are wonderful hosts, very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them.  My son enjoyed talking to Phyllis about Zambia and loved his breakfast which was very filling.  Would definitely recommend them and cant wait to go back.
A nice clean comfortable quiet place. Close to the Dart to get to the city of Dublin. I would go back again if going back to Dublin.
Bring your own toiletries and hairdryer.

Unfortunately we were not comfortable at this bed and breakfast. The pictures are misleading. The room is tiny. There is literally 6ù between the one side of the bed and the fireplace. The bathroom is tiny and is really a shower room. Without the picture of the bathroom you truly dont know what you are getting. I could not say that this is an Award winning bed and breakfastù. It is definitely not up to our standards and we are not 4 star people. You can book a nice hotel in Dublin for roughly the same cost. I would recommend that you do this instead of staying here.

This was the best experience that I had with airbnb ever. Chriss and Emma were the best hosts even if we couldn't meet personally. A couple of days before our stay, they sent me all the information that we needed about the house and the city. When we arrived to the place, they had food and drinks for us, and also a map of the city and everything that we needed. The house was perfect, and we absolutely enjoy our stay. I definitely recommend them! Thank you so much and I hope to come back for the next St Patrick's weekend.
