A wonderful home in close proximity to the city center. My family and I met Chris during our stay - he was kind, helpful and the perfect host. If youre thinking about booking this Airbnb, I highly recommend it. Thank you Emma and Chris for opening your home to my family!
Sarah was a wonderful host.  Great communication.  Lovey home.  Highly recommend.
Spacious and luxurious space, perfect for a break in Dublin, dont plan too much for your trip as you might not want to leave the house! Very comfortable beds.

There arent enough words to describe how amazing The Stables and Sarah are.  Sarah is the the host all hosts should model themselves after.  

The accommodations were cozy and perfect for what me and my friends were looking for.  

Absolute perfection!
Lisa and I loved Sarahs place, perfect spot in Dublin

A really wonderful space near Phoenix Park, Zoo, Downtown and airport with absolutely wonderful hosts. The house is spacious and worked wonderfully for our group of 8 including 4 children.  Sarah really went above and beyond to help us out.  Highly recommend.

Sarah was an exceptional host, and the property was a truly special space! Fantastic communication, gorgeous grounds, amazing pool, incredible and historic location.  AirBnb at its best.  If youre traveling to Dublin and want to experience something special, this is the place.  We hope to return soon! Thanks so much Sarah, youre an AirBnb rockstar!

I stayed at Sarah's in a group of six to celebrate my friend's hen do in Dublin for one night over the weekend. I expected it to be lovely based on the photos and previous reviews, and our stay exceeded expecations! The home is absolutely stunning, and Sarah went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and felt at home, from allowing us to check in  early as we had a very early flight when we arrived, to taking our bags to the airport to meet us the next evening so we didn't have to carry them around with us after checking out. She also offered us lifts whenever possible into the city and offered us discount vouchers for attractions we visited. Sarah's own home is separate from the guest house but she was available if ever we needed anything. She also has some gorgoeus dogs we met which was a plus :)  
The home along with the pool and sauna really felt luxurious and Sarah is a truly kind host so I would absolutely not hesitate to book here. One of the best airbnb experiences. 

Thanks again x

If we could give 6 out of 5 Stars we would. The place was absolutely spectacular from start to finish. Clean, homey, and thoughtful. Sarah was the most delightful host from a welcome when we landed to making sure we had everything we needed. We wish she could run every Airbnb.
Lovely peaceful location if your looking to be away from the busy centre. Relaxing environment
Excellence in all aspects

Sarah and her property are a rare find in todays world. Her warmth is matched only by her home at the Stables. This picturesque Irish property is in a quaint and quiet neighborhood right next to a park with many activities. Sarah aims to please and treats her guests akin to her lovely family. The three things that I find most important in an AirB&B are: the
 bed, shower pressure, and the cleanliness of the apartment. All three are exceptional in this lovely home. Not only does Sarah provide a lovely place but she also has a wealth of knowledge of Dublin. It was a privilege to meet Sarah, her family (including the dogs) and stay in her AirB&B.

if you want a taste of heaven in dublin this is the place as you have a serene environment with a heated pool and sauna next to a wonderful park and great hosts in a lovely setting inside and out in a historic renovation

There isn't much to say that hasn't already been said.....however I will add that I am a repeat visitor to Sarah's wonderful home.  The first was with my family in July 2017 and now with three friends for a week of golf.  Sarah's home was as fantastic as ever but it is her excellent communication and friendly and warm hospitality that sets her and this property apart.  I showed my wife and kids the pictures I took and now they want to go back and stay in Sarah's home again.  I have stayed in quite a few AirBnB properties and this one stands out above all the rest.  We will be back!
Sarah was a fantastic host with such an amazing house. Very accommodating and there for anything we needed. Would definitely recommend this property!

Sarahs home is huge and lovely. The four of us stayed on the upper level with the living room and kitchen   We had everything we needed to fix quick meals   The beds were so comfortable. The water pressure was great. We did not use the pool or the sauna but they were available to us.  We felt very secure and safe.

Wow! Amazing stay for my birthday with a few of my friends. From the get go, Sarah was so welcoming with her very friendly dogs. She even added balloons & processo! Really thoughtful touches. Bed was so comfortable and had an amazing sleep, pool & sauna area is perfect. Pricy but very well worth it. Would 100% recommend to friends x

Sarah was the sweetest! She is a magnificent host and makes you feel at home. I would stay there a hundred times more. Her Air Bnb was the cleanest place I have stayed and the quaintest. She went above and beyond for us and I am forever grateful. Thank you for making our trip spectacular.

Sarah is the most hospitable, warm and wonderful host we have ever experienced! The property is absolutely GORGEOUS and is so conveniently located. It accommodated our family of 8 so perfectly.  Our stay was nothing short of perfect! Sarah is personable and kind. Very helpful with anything we needed. Perfection !!
1 A location!

Easily the best airbnb stay and host I've ever had.  The location is removed enough from Dublin to feel peaceful and relaxed, but still accessible.  The close proximity of the park was a big draw to us, and the home itself is top notch.  The best part of the experience however is the host. Sarah is one of the kindest people, and her dogs add yet more charm to an already top-notch stay.
Sarah was a great host.  We really appreciated that she was there to meet us when we arrived.  The home was very clean, cozy and comfortable.

Our visit to Sarah's home was truly memorable and beyond our expectations!  Our family filled each room and all were delighted with their accommodations.  But most of all, we were impressed with Sarah's hospitality from beginning to end, including wine and cheese by the fire after a day of touring.  It is a lovely place in a great location, and we highly recommend it to anyone visiting Dublin.
This place is a must stay! Sarah was a great host. Sarahs house is close to town and the airport. I highly recommend this place!

Sarahs home is an urban oasis in an ideal location. The house is next door to Phoenix Park. Given the proximity to the park, and Sarahs nature-friendly landscaping, it is almost as if you are in country retreat. When you want to go to town, jump in a cab and soon you will be in the midst of Dublin. When you want to some peace and quiet, it is a quick trip back to a spacious house in which the old and new have been tastefully blended to create a welcoming living space. The beds are comfortable, the showers have plenty of space and hot water, and the house is hospital clean. Truly a home away from home.  

And, Sarah is friendly host who genuinely wants her guest to enjoy their stay. From her first welcome to the time you leave, Sarah goes out of her way to make sure that guests are doing well and getting what they want out of Dublin. The combination of Sarah and the house make for a pleasant and memorable experience. Highly recommended!
Sarah was a thoughtful, gracious host.  The location was fantastic and wouldn't of asked for anything more.

Sarah was amazing, from restaurant reviews to sharing her familys Irish history, she was so welcoming.  The place is amazing and very different from other places.  Beautiful comfortable bedrooms and the location right next to the park is great for late afternoon walks and an easy cab ride/drive into center Dublin.  Highly recommend!

Sarah's place was the highlight of our trip. We got a warm welcome from Sarah after a long day of travel from Kinsale. The rooms were sparkling clean and the place was outfitted with everything we needed. It fit all nine of us comfortably. The kids loved the pool and the sauna was perfect after a long day of sightseeing. The location is perfect - just on the doorsteps of Phoenix Park (perfect for a morning walk) and easy access to Dublin. Our only regret was not staying longer. Sarah's place is one of the best AirBnB properties we've stayed in.
Excellent stay.  Sarah is an amazing host.  All needs met.  Strongly suggested.

Our family of 7 expected Sarah's place to be a highlight of our travels around Ireland, and it exceeded our hopes!  Her hospitality was stellar; she was so very welcoming and responsive to our needs. We enjoyed everything: the lovely rooms, beautiful courtyard bursting with flowers, peaceful and handy location, recommendations for places to eat and visit, AND of course, the pool and sauna.  It's so important to sleep well and get refreshed, during the intensity of travel, and this place more than filled the bill.  We enjoyed laughs and good conversation with Sarah and her husband, in between touring the great city of Dublin.  Anybody who gets to stay at The Stables is lucky indeed.
Wonderful accommodations in an excellent location. Whole family was very gracious and helpful. Great way to experience Ireland.

What word sums up Super Sarah? Wow? Awesome? Fantabulous? All of those and more.   She begins as your host and continues on to becoming your friend.
Thank you so much Sarah (and Michael and sons) for making our week with you so memorable. We will certainly return, all being well.

Full of character, inspiring relaxation, comfortable, spacious, with exceptional perks (loved the pool with its cathedral ceiling, and the Island feel of the courtyard).  Phoenix park as a neighbour was an added bonus, with great walks, and biking trails.  Sarah was a great host!  Recommend highly.

Brynn, Sean, and Kevin

We had a wonderful stay at Sarah's place. The property is unique and beautiful. Sarah and her family are so kind and we enjoyed chatting with them. The pool was a big hit with my family. We will definitely stay here again next time we are in Dublin.
Great for a large family.  It is very quiet and the space is very comfortable.
Gorgeous accommodation, friendly hosts! Right on Phoenix Park within easy walking distance of a couple of great pubs. We only stayed one night but thoroughly enjoyed the space. Would recommend.
Unique place to stay! Hosts are amazing. Great for extended families with four bedrooms and room for all. Having the indoor pool was a great twist when you have a young family.

The Old World Stableyard is an incredible oasis from bustling Dublin and is as breathtaking as the pictures show. The sauna and indoor pool offer a wonderful way to rejuvenate after a long day of enjoying the unique opportunities the area offers. Beds are comfortable and the place is very clean. The kitchen living space is a nice gathering spot and you can kick up the entertainment more in the area where the pool table is located. My favorite spot was out in the courtyard sitting at the patio table enjoying the views and serenity while relaxing. Great place to stay! Highly recommend it!
Great location and beautiful space! You will not be disappointed if you chose this home for your group!
Exceptional,quiet yet a quick cab ride to the city.  Would stay again.

The Stables at Castleknock are simply exquisite!

The arent enough words to describe this elegant yet comfortable airbnb. Sarah was the most welcoming and interactive host weve encountered - in the best ways possible.

The bedrooms are comfortable and roomy. The kitchen and tv room are cozy. Some of us took advantage of the pool, sauna, and game room. 

The location is perfect, just outside Phoenix Park. Its a lovely area :  safe, clean, upscale. We took taxis to and from town, for a cost of about ‚Ç¨20 each way.

You can see why this place was named Irelands Most Unique Airbnb Location of 2016!

Just a splendid holiday for all!
The place was just as described and Sarah was an amazing host, friendly, welcoming and helpful
extraordinary space with elegant touches.  Fabulous location and warm and inviting host.

Sarahs home is gorgeous, comfortable, luxurious & spotlessly clean. Its in a fantastic location beside the park and ideal for a group of close friends or family. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay & made the most of the lovely facilities on offer at this great home. Thanks Sarah & family for your hospitality & kindness.
A must stay if you are coming to Dublin. With Phoenix Park in your back garden and a swimming pool and sauna this is ultimate place to relax.
Location, amenities, hospitality...this place has it all. A special property that is truly one of a kind.

Sarah was on hand to give us a guided tour of the property when we arrived, which is beautiful. Very peaceful area and the park on the doorstep was a real treat. Sarah told us about a great taxi app which actually works!! It was perfect for a group of ladies celebrating a birthday. I would recommend this place to others.

What a great property - highly recommend!  We loved everything about it.  It was clean, spacious, and incredibly comfortable.  Was such a great start to our vacation, especially after long flights to get there.  The sauna was exactly what we needed after a long day of travel!  Sarah goes above and beyond to ensure you are taken care of.  We had some problems with our rental car and Sarah was incredibly helpful.  Just can't say enough about Sarah and her beautiful property!

This place was everything I had hoped for. Sarah is an amazing host - she drove us to dinner, took us to the grocery store and even offered to pick up our Mom and Aunt if they got too tired on one of our day trips. She is truly a nice person and really made us feel warm and welcome. The space is beautiful and very safe.  My husband and Brother in Law used her husband's and son's clubs for a day of golf which was super nice of  them. I'm not sure my husband would lend out his clubs to strangers, but I thank them for allowing that. Thank you for making our stay in Ireland even better! You will not be disappointed if you choose this AirBNB for your visit to Dublin.

I would tell anyone, The Stables in Dublin with Sarah as you super hostess is one of the Best experiences you can have. The site is one of a kind, located in a beautiful part of Castleknock, next to Phoenix Park.  The hostess Sarah is exceptional. She is extremely knowledgeable but more importantly is a kind person who makes you feel at home.

An absolutely perfect and relaxing space for our last night in Ireland! Super comfortable beds, tons of movies to choose from, and everything else you could need. Sarah was a very helpful and accommodating host. We will be back for a longer stay!
Fabulous home away from home

Sarah's place is a fabulous house. She is a great host , helpful and responsive.  A good social space for guests without being on top of one another . Definitely one to consider for large groups travelling.

The outstanding hospitality we received here sets the bar high for Ireland. We immediately felt as though we were part of the family, and the Airbnb itself was unbelievable. Definitely stay here if you have the chance!
This is an awesome place to stay. We can not say enough great things about it. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. We can hardly wait to come back.

Sarah is an outstanding host, offering to pick up groceries and provide an occasional lift to Castleknock Village. She and her family were the perfect guides for things to do and see in Dublin! Phoenix Park is an amazing place just a half a block away. The Castleknock restaurants-especially Castello Bruno were incredible! We enjoyed the sauna and the location is just a quick cab ride to major attractions!! I recommend you stay here with family and friends to enjoy the magic & charm of Dublin!

I cannot speak highly enough about Sarah and her beautiful home. Our flight landing time was outside of check-in time, and she welcomed us with tea and conversation. The rooms are so comfortable. As silly as it seems, the water pressure was note-worthy. We stayed in many hotels and BnBs over the course of our honeymoon travels, and the water pressure here was phenomenal in comparison. The space is absolutely gorgeous as well. We will absolutely be back. Sarah is by far the best host we have ever had, and she is a genuinely wonderful person.

A fabulous night away, location, space and amenities were perfect for our weekend and the hosts were just so welcoming. Its easily accessible from the main roads and airport and a short trip into the city centre. 
Were already planning on booking for next year! Thanks again for a lovely stay.
Great location. Free on street parking was a huge bonus. Very close to Lidl and Tesco. Walking distance to Phoenix Park.
A cozy flat with everything equipped and Fiona was very helpful and gave us some travel tips. Easy to access and highly recommended.
Great apartment and close enough to town to walk. I would recommend
Liam and Fiona's place was the perfect base for us and our two kids.  It was clean, had everything we needed, and was in a good spot near Phoenix park and bus lines straight to the city.
Very nice appartment, not too far from the center (30 min walk) in a nice and quiet neighbourhood.

Liam and Fionas place was great with everything we needed. It was a short 5-10 minute walk from 2 grocery stores, the trendy neighborhood of Stoneybatter, and Phoenix Park. The buses get you into the core of the city in 15 minutes, or its a 30-40 minute walk. Liam and Fiona were super responsive and helpful. Take them up on their offer of arranging a ride from the airport for more local tips. We had a lovely time!
Accogliente confortevole e pulito. Il centro si raggiunge in circa 15 minuti a piedi.
A quiet place to stay and very clean.
We had a great stay at Liam and Fiona's place. The studio is well located, safe and quiet and not far away from the city center. Liam and Fiona are wonderful hosts, available, kind and helpful.

Lovely clean place to stay and excellent bus service right outside.
If you miss the last bus back and get the tram make sure you get your bearings right or like us you could end up walking half way back into Dublin city centre before realising
Great place. Really comfortable location. Clean, warm and relaxing place.

Traceys location was perfect for me. A lovely and quiet spot far enough outside of the city, but with a very doable walk into downtown Dublin. Extremely comfortable space, and Tracey was second to none in regards to local suggestions and travel advice. All the things she recommended after assessing my personal taste were both my favorite memories as well as things I probably would have missed if I was solely planning on my own.

I was going to do more bouncing around the country with single, overnight stays, but realized how much easier it would be do just do single day tour bus trips from Dublin to the west and the north. If youre not going to rent a car, this is the best way to maximize your time as you can really hit any part of this country and back in a single day. 

However you go, Traceys home is great and I would definitely stay here again if I was back in Dublin.

I think this host will be great for needy travellers but not for independent minded or business travellers. She sent at least 36 messages plus several phone calls in a 4 day span, and was a bit obsessive with the entire process from even before I left my home. 

The nagging started before Id even arrived in Dublin. I arrived to her home about an hour late, because I had missed a stop, and had to order and wait for a taxi - that took about half an hour. She might think my tardiness was enough justification for continuing to nag. I dont. 

I also felt that she spoke down at me upon arrival. For example, she felt it was necessary to teach me how to use an elevator (she did that speaking really slowly, as though I might be unintelligent and need that kind of support). Then mentioned in a condescending tone that I might be directionally challenged, so guided me through her hallway in a step by step super patronizing fashion.
Prima ruimte. De locatie ligt aan de oostkant van Dublin en is met de bus vanuit het vliegveld goed er bereiken. Ook in de avond geen enkel probleem.

Tracey is a lovely and helpful host, quick to react to questions, ready to help you out if needed. The carpeted bedroom and en suite bathroom are clean, you get towels, a great duvet, there's a fridge, an iron,... (But no microwave or tv)The little balcony is a great add on. There are some shops and public transport close by. So in all a good choice for a trip to Dublin!

The room was clean and large; the flat was in a nice location: not too far from city centre in a safe area; Tracey was excellent and friendly and provided us with advice on bars and restaurants etc.; we had a great stay in Dublin! 

Would thoroughly recommend this place for others.

Tracey was incredibly friendly and welcoming. On the first night, I had managed to leave my phone in the taxi, and I had no idea what to do. Tracey, though,  knew exactly what to do and helped me get my phone back. In addition to that, Tracey provided lots of great recommendations for eating and hanging out. I'll definitely stay with her again if I'm back in Dublin :)

Our stay in Traceys apartment was great. Communication was easy via the Airbnb app. The room is spacious and cosy. Tracey provided a lot of local tips to us. Moreover, she kindly offered some free drinks as well.
Very clean place. Tracy is a nice and very friendly host. We can recommend staying at her place!

This place is in a great location. You can get to many bus stops and the dart so you can make it anywhere you need. Tracey absolutely knows what's she's doing, communicates extremely well and quickly, and had the best suggestions! The room is a great size for 1 or 2. Has everything you need, but be aware: no microwave. Otherwise, perfect stay!
Traceys place was fantastic!  Great location, wonderful accommodations, very friendly and helpful host. Would definitely rent again!!

I stayed at Traceys place for a week and it was perfect. Very close to all the action of the city but with a nice quiet place to relax and sleep at. The room, balcony and private bath are excellent. Tracey is extremely helpful with travel tips and suggestions for not only Dublin but throughout all of Ireland. She responds to messages thru the app very promptly. The bed was comfortable. Theres a nice large desk for working on planning your travel days. The bathroom is very nice with a shower with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The WiFi signal is really strong and consistent. Theres a grocery store right around the corner and a small refrigerator in the room to keep your things cold. She provided some nice extras like coffee and tea, along with cereal, chips and other snacks. The bus # 1 or 47 stops right outside the door and takes you right into town in a few minutes. The DART (Dublin Area Rapid Transit) train station is a short walk away. I highly suggest taking it to the Howth station on the coast and walking the cliff walk. Not strenuous at all and the views are breath taking. Id also suggest buying the Visitor Leap Card for the number of days youre there. I bought the 7 day one and used it to and from the airport and all places in between. The LUAS (tram) station is also a short walk away and can take you to town or straight to the Heuston Rail station if you need to catch a long distance train. All in all, this was one of the best AirBnBs Ive ever stayed at and for the price, especially in Dublin, you cant beat it. If I ever come back to Dublin, which I hope I do, Ill definitely stay here again. Other travel tips - see the Book of Kells, take the Musical Pub Crawl, do a day trip to Glendalough and Kilkenny, do a day trip to the Giants Causeway, Carrick-a-Rede rope bridge, and Belfast. Theres just so much to see in and around Dublin and Traceys is the place you want to stay at to enjoy it all!

Absolutely amazing! The room is lovely and huge, and there is everything you need available, from a fridge to a balcony and comfy bed.  But the best part is Tracey, who is so hospitable!  She gave me tons of travel tips, and even some fruit to take along on a daytrip! She is a wonderful (Website hidden by Airbnb) like staying with a friend!  Great space, great host, and great value....You will love your stay!

Traceys room was spacey and decorated with so much style and love. I had everything I needed and more including a comfy bed, working space, a great view from a balcony and even a mini fridge in the room. The room was super clean, the communication was quick, easy and always super friendly. It has a bus stop nearby but everything is easily accessible by foot as well. Would recommend it without hesitation.

We stayed at Traceys for 4 nights over the weekend and absolutely loved it! She is an amazing host, welcomed us in the street when we arrived later in the evening and had written down many useful and detailed tips for things to do in the city. She made us feel right at home. The room itself is very comfortable and clean and tidy and has everything you need if youre not planning on cooking dinner for yourself at night. We were more than happy with the fridge and kettle. It was very private, in fact we didnt see Tracey again at all after check-in as shes working a lot. The location is great, its a quiet, pretty neighbourhood. We never took the bus and instead walked to and from the city centre, which usually took us about 20-30 minutes. It was lovely. We can wholeheartedly recommend Traceys place and would definitely stay again ourselves.

Lovely bright large room. Super friendly and helpful host.
Great location, not central but close to many area that we wouldn't have seen had we stayed in central Dublin. 
Brown's cafe in Sandymount is a gem.
Thanks Tracey!!
This place is in a great location, central to everything but very quiet. The host is friendly and very helpful. Highly recommended.
Lovely place, lovely tot .. I felt like I was at family
This place was awesome. Tracey is super helpful, the grocery downstairs is very convenient, and we had everything we needed. It was a short walk to downtown and in a very nice area.

Tracey is absolutely fantastic. Located in South Dublin, it is walking distance to city Center. Whats nice is that its a straight shot down one street from one end to the other to walk through the heart of Dublin.

Everything was as listed, highly recommend.

Tracy excels in the market of AirBnB and made me feel welcomed. 
There really are no complaints. Great location, great tips, comfortable, quiet,  and adequate amenities.

I had an amazing stay at Tracey's place. The communication was spot on and the location and guidance from her was perfect. The apartment is on a main road and quite visible anyway.
The checkin was super smooth, and Tracey was very flexible with my late checkin.
Coming to the room, it is very spacious , sparkling clean and very cosy. Almost everything that you need for a great stay is available in the room itself. 
Overall, I would definitely recommend Tracey's place, it is in a prime location with great connectivity.

Spacious, clean, room. Loved that the bathroom was ensuite. 
Tracey was very nice giving me some suggestions of what to do, and where to go. Didn't see her again after check-in.
The small frig was nice, as I kept some cheese and crackers to munch on.
Great location if you are spending the day, out and about. It is about a 35-40min walk to city center. So no bouncing back and forth during the day. It is close to bus stops, if you are comfortable with using public transportation. 
Would recommend this space.

We had a perfect stay at Daragh and Edward's place. The house is in a very nice area and really close to the city centre. They gave us a lot of tips on Dublin and they were very kind and friendly! Definitely recommended :)

Daragh and Edgar were superb hosts with excellent recommendations for what to do while in Dublin. My friend and I were only in town for two nights, but with Daragh and Edgars help we were able to make the most of it! The guest room is cozy, and the terrace is so lovely. You really cant beat being walking distance from everything! My friend and I used transit only once, and that was because of the rain, not the distance.

They gave us so much information and help in so many ways. Just amazing. Their house is also just walks away from anything and everything. I highly recommend even sitting down to talk about anything, truly a good time!

Great location, warm hosts!  I think this listing is perfect for one person, but it may feel tight for two people, depending on how you use it.  If you're comfortable lounging in the shared living spaces, or if the weather permits using the amazing private balcony, then two people would be comfortable.  Overall, I definitely recommend staying here!

Pretty small house and in quite location, near nightlife and historical interesting places. We love the terrace where we can view the classic dubliner roofs. :) 
Daragh is kind and gentle host, he recommended us his favorite places in town ... trust him. :)

Daragh is a wonderful host. We appreciated his hospitality.  He showed  us places to go and where to eat.  The room is lovely with a little deck off of the room. His place is in an amazing location near all the special places to see while in Dublin.

We had a awesome time there, it felt like home. The location was perfect, close to everything. The host was incredibly nice, gave us tipps and breakfast. He was very welcoming and helped with everything he could. 
The house is very nice and we would totally repeat next time we go to Dublin.
10/10
Great room, location and hosts!!
Fully recommend. What a lovely place to stay and wonderful hosts.
fantastic location, and super friendly host!
If you want to explore more Dublin, talk with Daragh and Edgar,they are so warmhearted to share everything they know with you and give the best advice. We miss them: )

The apartment is great, the location is perfect and Daragh and Edgar are such good hosts! They were very attentive and helpful recommending us good pubs and restaurants! We would doubtlessly repeat! :)
The hosts are very friendly and attentive, the house is impeccable and the location is great.

This was a great location- a 10-15 minute walk to all the important tourist spots- Guinness, Temple Bar, Jameson, etc. The street and area was super cute and felt safe. The hosts were accommodating and nice!! Would recommend to any travelers!

Incredible hosts and what a great hospitality. Daragh offered us to try gin and beer. Great location and walkable to pretty much everywhere. I would highly recommend Daragh to everyone. Hope to see them again!
Fantastic location and and even better host, would definitely recommend
Great location and very nice hosts!
Great location. Offered to let us drop our bags early and store them on the last day which was much appreciated. Really friendly and chatty.
Lovely private room! So close to everything downtown. I would totally stay here again!

Daragh's place was so warm and cosy! It was the perfect place to base myself as I found it so central and easy to walk everywhere! Daragh himself was lovely, welcoming and although we never met in person, was easy to communicate with over text! Bed was also very comfortable!

Rachel ithank you for your very warm welcome and hosting in your lovely sweet home!!

It was feeling like home and part of a family and not only guests in a foreign city, even by having our privacy!

Even we had everything for making our breakfast

We enjoyed our stay and hope to come back soon!

Big and warmest hug!

Doris and Markus
Lovely house, great location for South Dublin area.

Very nice and comfortable stay indeed! Would recommend. Thanks to host Rachel.

Regards, Sudeep

Alojamiento impecable. Algo alejado del centro pero hay tres buses directos con parada a 30 segundos de la casa(sin exagerar). Rachel muy amable, preocupada por tu estancia pero a la vez brindandote tu espacio personal y privacidad. 
Una bonita estancia.
Rachel is very nice person to talk to and she was very welcoming..
Comfortable, friendly and located ideally for the purposes of my visit.  We will certainly try to stay with Rachel again on future visits to Dublin.
Very pleasant stay. Marvellous hospitality. Highly recommended.
Fantastic stylish apartment in the heart of Dublin! We stayed there for 3 nights and it was the perfect location and price, walking distance to everything! Thank you Diane we will be back soon
Nice place, great location.
Absolutely wonderful hospitality and incredible venue and place to stay.  Top class!

Really nice 
Thanks to Diane for her reactivity and help

This was a perfect apartment for my solo trip to Dublin. Its a great location, about a 15 minute walk from the temple bar area and right next to a bus stop. The apartment was very clean and felt safe. Diane was very quick to communicate and help if I had any questions about Dublin or the apartment.

Diane's place was as described. High quality fittings throughout with a very nice interior design. I would describe this apartment as luxury. It is located very centrally and quiet secure. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to family and friends.
A well-located, stylish small apartment.

Highly recommended. 
Functional and nice apartment.

Stayed again at Diane's place as it is convenient and she is very amenable. The apartment is very comfortable and secure. Due to being on a main street it can be a little noisy at night or with the morning rush hour traffic. Not a problem if you need to be up and about early. I would still continue to recommend this place though.

Stayed again at this place as it is comfortable, clean, great location and secure. I've found Diane as a host to be very flexible within reason with good communications throughout. Will continue to book when there is availability and I'm visiting / working in the city.
We loved Dianes apartment. It was very stylish and the location was great. We recommend this place and Diane was a great host. We simply loved everything.

Stay regularly at Diane's place when working in Dublin. Great host,  who although is away, ensures everything is organised before your arrival. She has an excellent assistant who meets & greets and provides an overview of the apartment. Highly valued.
Clean and tidy flat and quite central

Diane is a wonderful host.  She not only responds quickly for any questions, she will check in with you to be sure all is well.  Her apartment is beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean, comfortable and secure.  I would not hesitate staying there again.
Nice place in good location about 15 minutes from Temple Bar. Diane is easy to communicate with and the apartment is nice and clean.
Very stylish flat and very clean. Not far from the centre and corner shop opposite flat is very convenient. Would 100% recommend staying here.

Diane's home is a nicely furnished, clean and comfortable place and Diane is a very nice and caring hostess. The location of the apartment is quite okay regarding getting there from the airport, with plenty of supermarkets around to buy groceries. There are also coffee shops and pubs nearby to go for a coffee or a beer and the street is quite busy with people and traffic, but not particularly noisy. It was also easy to commute from the apartment to other parts of the city and all the main attractions are at only around 15 minutes walk away. I warmly recommend staying in Diane's home, especially if you are a neat person yourself! Thank you very much for all your help <3

Dianes apartment was the perfect place to stay in Dublin. Very centrally locates, you can walk to just about any part of the city. Dianes place was spotlessly clean with several nice touches. One thing that my wife and I most appreciated was a short itinerary Diane had prepared to help us get accommodated to the city. Highly recommend staying at here BnB.

Stayed at Dianes place for two weeks as a base while I was working in Dublin. Spotless and facilities were as it said on the tin and worked well for me - and close to a Luas stop so getting around was easy. Would recommend to those who need a base in Dublin for a long weekend etc.

Great option to stay in Diane's charming apartment.
The apartment has enough items to make quick meals.
Excellent location, close to shops, easy access, to get around with all of transport nearby.
We were very pleased!
The apartment is very well furnished, every detail is thought through.
Very stylish and nice place to stay in Dublin.

Staying at Diane's was a pleasure. She was unable to greet me, but her neighbour was able to help out to get me on property and show me the apartment. Though Diane was travelling abroad at the time of my stay, she was easy to get in touch with and even did the occasional check in with me to make sure I had everything I needed. 

The apartment was clean and cozy. The building itself is secure and safe.

Being so close to O'Connell Street was a huge plus as it is the central hub of sorts to get to anywhere you need to go! Diane also has a binder full of ideas for things to do!

Such a beautiful property.. extremely clean, stylish and cozy. I would highly recommend this property as its for a good value, near the city center and gives you a great experience in Dublin. I loved it!

I stayed in Diane's apartment for a week.  Her apartment is very conveniently located to catch multiple buses that took me everywhere I wanted to go in the city!  The 123 bus stop is right out the front door and a number of other bus stops are within 3-4 blocks from the apartment (including the stop for the very affordable Airlink bus). The apartment is a large building near a number of mostly Asian restaurants and grocery/convenient stores.  I had 2 very good meals from places on the same street as the building.  The apartment building is very secure with 3 doors to get the main hallway.  Inside the apartment, the decorations are as in the photos.  The kitchen has all of the basics (I cooked 3x). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom/shower was spacious enough. Water pressure was good once I got the hang of the system.  The living room sofa was very comfortable, especially after such a long day of being a tourist.  Others have  noted the street noise.  It honestly didn't bother me at all since there was nothing excessive or too disruptive.  Diane was always very responsive to any questions and was very welcoming. Overall, I thought this was a safe, convenient, and good place to stay at while exploring Dublin!
Beautiful clean apartment. Felt like we were staying in a nice hotel.
The apartment is gorgeous, located in the city center. It's a fabolous pied a terre. Diane was SUPER kind to me, I've spent 10 days in Dublin and I truly recommend her

This was a lovely clean comfortable place to stay and it met all out needs, the local shops and pubs are all on your doorstep and we had great craic in he Black Lion pub. Macari's chippy across the road make the best chips I have ever tasted and we kept going back for more. Bus stop is just outside the door but we found that if there is three people then a taxi is just as cheap and much quicker. I had no need to call the host during our stay because everything was great and just as described. Loved our stay.
super great! recommended

Our family loved this home. It was everything and more.  From the roll top bath to the espresso coffee machine and little sun trap garden ! The atmosphere in the morning walk and contrast warm evenings along canal ! Beautiful.
Would highly recommend staying at Sineads house. It is perfect location and also Sinead is a fantastic host.
Fabulous, clean and quirky! Great location and very friendly host. Would highly recommend and can't wait to come back and stay again.

What a wonderful place! Right on the canal, beautiful quiet neighborhood close to everything. We walked everywhere, it was so easy. I highly recommend it! There is an awesome bakery around the corner. The place is clean and the beds are super comfortable. Sinead is an awesome host! Ask her about the Leapfrog corkscrew interactive host/ traveler challenge :) I will definitely come back!

In a word this unit is "rustic". For a three or four 20-something friends, this place would be great. You could hang out along the canal together,  save money on meals by cooking together and so on. My university students would have made the most of this unit. The host was very nice and a clear communicator. Had the description been a bit more accurate, I would have likely opted to spend a few more dollars for my mother and I to stay in a hotel.
We had a great stay in Sineads house and really missed nothing.  It has a warm atmosphere and is really good lokated to walk to the town center.
Great location in a quiet area. Easy 30 minute walk into down townù area.

Sinead's cottage is a fab place to stay for a trip to Dublin. Situated in the Portobello area of the city, there are many shops, cafe's bars and pubs in walking distance. The popular areas of Camden Street and Harcourt Street are a 10 minute walk away and it took us about 30 minutes to walk into the centre of the city to Temple Bar. The Cottage is clean, modern and spacious however it retains its character. It had all the amenities we needed for a long weekend away.  Sinead was excellent at providing us details such as how to get to the cottage from the airport, how to check in and where to find things in the cottage. She also helped us arrange to leave our suitcases there after check out as we weren't flying until late in the evening. I would highly recommend this cottage to anyone who is looking for a stay in Dublin. It was close enough to walk to the tourist areas, yet far enough from the central areas of Temple Bar and Grafton Street that we felt we experienced the real Dublin.

Things that were great: location was awesome, Sinead's responsiveness was great. Quiet neighbourhood. 

Things that couldn't be avoided: key to get in was not turning properly, Sinead was there in 5 minutes to get it sorted out. Biggest issue - fire alarm went off every 30 minutes from 645 in the morning until we left that morning. Luckily Sinead answered and got us the code but was annoying nonetheless but unavoidable I think, just one of those things. 

Why not a 5 star: some basic things were missing - baking sheets in particular, instructions to run the oven (in general, the oven is not our style, old school and takes forever to heat up and cool down; we cook a lot so would be helpful to know from the outset), instructions for the radiator (we're spoiled and like it warmer and especially with an infant), in general the place was a little 'cottage' which I guess fits with the title, but I think we missed the mark in our booking, and should've gotten something more modern with more modern amenities. 

In general, the place was very nice, Sinead's responsiveness was second to none, the place just wasn't our style.

Location was good but not great value for money.
We had issues with hot water which were not resolved. The house is tired and has a damp smell throughout. I offered the host some constructive advice but she was offended and replied with a sarcastic comment.
Great place Just 15min. Out of the city center its clean great beds and shower

What a cool place!  It was such a pleasure to come home to Portobello after a busy day in Dublin. The area is quiet and quaint and still close enough in to the city to reach everything easily.   The decor is happy and interesting and the bright, airy, private space is everything we could have asked for!  The separate washer and dryer were a definite plus!!  Our taxi driver was very happy with our choice not to stay in the touristyù heart of the city and he quite approved of the location as well :)

Great communication from host prior to our visit. The house is cute and spacious in a lovely location by the canal .. and its dog friendly! We could walk to the city or Rathmines in the opposite direction for restaurants, bars and shopping. Some standards had slipped in certain areas of the property compared to the photos and would benefit from a tidy up and a bit of TLC, ie garden areas, cobwebs and a bit of damp. Really wouldnt take much and Sineads Place would be idyllic.

Sinead has a lovely home. It was the perfect place for my mom, sister and I to stay on the final days of our trip through Ireland. I think it would also be a great place for friends to stay as well. The house was super comfortable and clean. Portobello is a great area of Dublin thats easily walkable to center city (20-25min) and its also close to good food and bars (like the Eatyard and Richmond). Sinead was very helpful and responsive as well. I highly recommend this Airbnb!

Sineads place is in a great location to explore central Dublin and Portobello. Everything on the doorstep. We walked everywhere and lots if things to see on the way. 
Sineads communication  was excellent and the house is really cute and quirky and has a homely feel away from the buzz of city living.
Great house in a nice area of Dublin - walking distance to town and to good pubs and restaurants. Sinead was very helpful - perfect spot to spend a long weekend.

Sinead is very responsive, and really nice, and its  a very cute flat! 

Retro vibe, but mod-cons so it is very nice. Very clean on arrival, very nice and checking in and out eezzy-peezzy! We had some hot water issues, wasnt a big issue for us, but could be I guess.

Really cute and easy bus ride to downtown. Lots of shopping and restaurants to stop by. Also, lots of local venues close by.

Overall, very nice!
Great and spacious home right by the canal. It's close to all the actions happening in downtown but a nice quiet place to rest at night. We highly recommend this place!
Nice location, quick response from host, nice shower, full kitchen, just what we needed.

This inspired cottage has charming traditional features and artistic flare. The cottage was perfect for us, a couple, because it was large, easy to enjoy, adjacent to the canal with swans floating by and a fun 20 minute walk to the heart of the City. Our highlights were super comfortable queen bed, easy undesignated free street parking, large shower, canal walking path, and a 2 minute walk to a local Italian restaurant for dinner. The cottage is old fashioned but VERY comfortable. We enjoyed homemade breakfast in the well-equipped kitchen. We appreciate the hosts extras such as extra towels, wash cloths!, myriad shower products and travel book collection. Its easy to recommend this place for a visit to Dublin.
Great space that has been given  the right touch. Nice wee home

This was our first time in Ireland and my friend and I wanted something cozy and close enough to the city to walk. This little gem did not disappoint! There are little pubs and restaurants everywhere within a 10 minute walk. We arrived early and Sinead let us check in with no problems. From the moment we got there it literally felt like home. When my hair straightener broke, Sinead had her husband drop one off for me! The place does have a musky odour but we're Canadian and it just smelled like a typical cottage to us. The canal is right outside the door and you can walk along it and feed the swans. The neighbourhood was quiet but you could get to Grafton St., Trinity College, St. Stephen's Green and Sr. Patrick's Cathedral in about 20 minutes by foot. All in all we lacked for NOTHING. We will 100% be back next year!
Sinead's place is wonderful. Wonderful, stylish apartment in a fantastic location. Easily walkable to lots of great restaurants and sights. Would definitely stay here again!
Soggiorno piacevole e rilassante

Great place to stay, good location and price.  Liam and Fiona were great with communication and tips for what to do and where to go! Place is within walking distance of shops and supermarkets and not a bad walk to the town.  Apartment is equipped with everything you would need and sleeps 6 comfortably (in 3 doubles).  Would recommend staying here.
Rundum gelungen.

Very nice victorian appartment in good Location.
The Communication with the hosts was really great.
The driver took us directly from the Airport to the appartment and back.
Well be back.
Pied a terre impeccable !!
The host canceled this reservation 81 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Wonderful place to stay, a bit tucked out of the way from the sights in Dublin, this made it quiet and comfortable. Fiona is wonderful and very helpful!!

The city is beautiful and so is the Appartment. The interior were nice and the books on Ireland were very helpful. Also the amenities provided were useful. 
The location is nice and the neighbourhood is also warm.

We were 5 guests and the place was very comfortable. Liam and Fiona both offered us very good attention and the communication was fine. They also arranged a shuttle from the airport that was good too. Thank you for hosting us. I would definitely recommend this place to stay in Dublin.
Very clean comfortable beds and easy transportation via buses.
Convenient place to stay when visiting Dublin, great access to shops near by.
We enjoyed our stay here. Fiona was very quick to respond. Our only complaint is that the living room area was a bit chilly.

This is a amazing place to stay very clean and well taken care of. Fiona was great to deal with very genuine and available to help at anytime.  Would certainly  go back again. Would  recommend this place to stay.

Liam and Fiona's apartment was perfect for our family of four as we explored Dublin and the surrounding areas.  The apartment itself was quite charming, comfortable and very clean and had everything we needed to get going for the day. We also appreciated the local tips, they were quite helpful.  L Mulligan Grocer for dinner and the Cobblestone for drinks & music were perfect. It was also great having Hanlon's Corner a block away for breakfast as well as food and drinks after long days when we wanted to be close to the apartment - the food was quite good. The amazing Phoenix Park with the Dublin Zoo, which was great, are just a 10-15 minute walk away and well worth visiting.  Getting to the city center was a piece of cake as the bus stop is within sight of the apartment and the ride is very quick.  Getting to Trinity College to see the Book of Kells was maybe a 15-20 minute ride.  Once downtown, the city is very walkable with lots to offer.  While downtown check out Klaw (2 locations in Temple Bar) for great food! From Dublin we were also able to visit Malahide Castle and the incredible playground nearby as well as the fishing village of Howth one day, the stunning Glendalough and the Wicklow Mountains National Park ("the garden of Ireland") another, and Newgrange (get there early!), all reasonable car rides away and well worth day trips. All told we loved our time in Dublin and thank Liam and Fiona for hosting us in their lovely apartment!

Lovely restored Victorian apartment not too far from the city Centre. If you enjoy walking its no problem, we did all our exploration on foot. Close to buses otherwise. The apartment was very clean, and the extra tall ceilings made it even more spacious. Bagels and fruit were left for us, and Fiona was always a quick text away. Also, two grocery stores within a five minute walk making buying those breakfast needs extra easy. I would recommend this apartment to anyone who doesnt want to be in the middle of the bar scene and likes to urban hikeù around cities ‚ù§Ô∏è

Great place, great location! 
Very luxurious
Alojamiento perfecto en todos los aspectos.

Fantastic Victorian flat - a few minutes walk to centre of town. Clean, tidy with a good touch of class. 
Lovely place. Thank you
Nice flat with good transport links. Only one sofa, picture shows two, but overall very pleased.

Nice spacious flat and really handy to have a washer and dryer. Location is very handy with the park close by and only 30 minute walk into town.
Liam and Fiona were great and always responded promptly to any inquiries. There were also very helpful and did what they could to make us feel welcome. Would definitely book with them again.
Fiona and Liam have thought of everything you will need for your stay! I appreciated their quick response and recommendations.  Absolutely lovely stay at their AirBNB.

Vrlo ƒçist, luksuzan i dobro opremljem apartman. Kako je apartman lijep iznutra tako je i zgrada izvana. Domaƒáini vrlo ljubazni i uvijek spremni pomoƒái te nas prije puta uputili u mnogo korisnih informacija za nase putovanje.

My family of five ( kids 2,6,8) had a wonderful time. We loved that it was such a quick walk to phoenix park, which they really enjoyed playing at even though we did not get to see any deer. It was easy to catch the hop on/off tour from the park which the family loved. So convenient to have washer and dryer available and Fiona was super helpful with getting it started. Our room was super cozy, quiet and dark which was great for helping the kids sleep in after long days. Perfect for fixing up breakfast and found several restaurants in neighborhood to bring food back and enjoy with kids in peace and quiet after long day. Grocery store super convenient to get to as well.
Amazing space!
The apartment was comfortable and Liam and Fiona always reply very quickly. We had a great stay in Dublin!
Brilliant apartment in a nice quiet area, nearby to the park. Great hosts and very kindly allowed us to checkout late. Thanks!

All in all great, just as stated in the description. The house is located 15 Minutes travel time with the Tram to City Center and it Takes 15 minutes to the Station. Teresa is a very lovely Person and will be there dir any issues.

Teresa and her husband have a lovely cottage, a short, direct walk from the Dundrum Laus stop that takes you into the city. If you're headed to Dublin I'd greatly recommend considering this option as lodging because the service was unmatched.
We really enjoed the stay at Teresa's Holly Cottage. Teresa and her husband were very nice and helpful. The house is very cosy you can easily get to the centre in 15 min. by tram or bus.
It was great to stay at Teresa¬¥s home, lovely cottage, very clean and quiet. We could use the kitchen for a light dinner as well. We enjoyed the hospitality and the great tips for visiting Dublin.
Teresa is so heartful and kind. We touched her caring. The place is so cozy. And the kitchen in the morning is full of sunshin. The is so amazing. Thanks to her place, Dublin is our best city!
Great hosts and awesome place to stay!
This is an amazing place to stay with awesome hosts. Teresa and her husband are genuinely good people who love their country and what they do. Will stay again!
Lovely house, only 15 minutes away from the closest Luas stop (Dundrum). Safe and nice area. Teresa and her husband are lovely people and we enjoyed our stay very much!
Very nice place, would recommend.
Wonderful host, perfect location, host gave us useful tips on Dublin! Really enjoyed our stay and would go again! Highly recommend!

I loved this Airbnb so much! Really easy access to public transport, a lot of tips for things to do around Ireland, self-service breakfast and a quiet neighbourhood just outside all the busy streets of Dublin. Teresa and her husband are very flexible and so sweet. They helped us with all our questions regarding our travel plans. Totally recommend!

Teresa and Hughs Holly Cottage has the most comfortable beds!  They are the sweetest people and Teresa can answer any question you have about what to do, where to go and how to get there. We also loved her recommendation to eat at the Bottle Tower just down the street.  Loved it so much we went back the next night.  This is a great place to stay in the suburbs where its less hectic!

Teresa and her husband are excellent hosts! Their place is immaculate and provided everything we needed during our stay. They were super helpful in familiarizing us with the town and gave us all the local tips that made our experience so great. They provided a lovely breakfast that helped us to save on costs for our trip and they were just a delight to be around.
Wonderful place, great host who helped us find our way and were super understanding and flexible as we arrived later than expected.
Teresa and Hugh were very welcoming. Their suggestions for food and things to do during our stay was much appreciated. The garden area is very lovely and relaxing.
Best wishes

Teresa and her partner are the most wonderful hosts you could wish for! They know the area like no other,  have a lovely place that is clean and has all the amenities you might need, and they provide a very nice breakfast! Since the house is located a little outside the city centre, it is nice and calm and you get to wake up to birdsong, while the city is but a short tramride away. All in all, I would recommend, and I hope to be back one day!
This is a great little cottage in a lovely part of Dublin. The neighbourhood is safe and vibrant with some great pubs and restaurants, highly recommended.
We had great time with Teresa and her husband, the cottage is very lovely :)

Lovely place to stay. The hosts are amazing! We got great tips where to visit in Dublin and it really helped us to decided what to see. Place was clean and cozy.
Getting to the centre of Dublin was easy from here. Great stay!
Teresas place was perfect for our short stay!
Teresas place is great! Super friendly, helpful local tips and recommendations, and cute cottage. The location was great for both Dublin and getting a bit into the country.
We stayed for 5 nights Teresa and her husband were very helpful they made us feel at home, great with maps, tips on where to go and Tea.

Teresa and Hugh are exceptional hosts. Their home is very clean and comfortable. Breakfast is a huge plus when staying with them. The bus and tram are both very close and bring you directly to the city centre. I highly recommend staying here for all those visiting Dublin!
Een heerlijke plek om te verblijven als je in de omgeving van Dublin bent. Goed voorzieningen en nog betere verhuurders. Teresa doet er werkelijk alles aan om het je naar de zin te maken!

Teresa's house is lovely and comfortable, welcoming and sweet.  It's in a quiet suburb of Dublin, tho there's still a great pub on the corner and direct access into town on the #14 bus.  Her beds must be the most comfortable in Dublin.  It was a pleasure to stay here.

We had to figure out the bus to Kilkenny on our last day, and she spent a lot of time with us to figure it out.  

We highly recommend her hospitality.
Nice hosts with an easy access to the City center. Even able to catch a day trip and get into the city for 6:30 am
Teresa is great at communicating and very friendly and welcoming. We felt right at home in her space and enjoyed the interactions we had with her and her husband.
Teresas place was lovely and exceeded our expectations.  We got a quiet, comforatable room close to amenities, and just 40 minutes from town. The hosts warm personality was an added bonus.

My friend and I enjoyed our 5 night stay at Theresas Airbnb. We liked our room with 2 single beds, nice shared washroom, everything very clean. Good choices were provided for a help yourself breakfast. The tram is only a 10 minute walk away, gets you in to Dublin within 15 minutes. Theresas husband kindly picked us up at the bus as it was rainy heavily and he provided us with a map and went through how to get to nearby locations. It was a great stay overall and I would highly recommend to stay here.

Things you must do in Dublin: go to a pub, try fish and chips, and stay with Teresa in Churchtown!! Her home is absolutely beautiful, when we arrived she and her husband gave us a ton of recommendations that helped us plan our trip! The house is very close to the tram station and the bus station, so it was very easy to get to the city as well as the airport. Teresa is a lovely host and will always get back to you as soon as possible if you have any questions.
Teresa is such a warm soul and that makes her an amazing host. Her home is lovely. Everything was clean. Food was fresh. I would highly recommend to stay here.

Teresa is very friendly. Her home is well located, and she provides great information and recommendations about what to do and see, along with maps. If you need anything, just ask. We had a great stay, and would recommend her highly.

Excellent hosts and in a very good spot for access into dundrum and the city centre 
I have stayed with Teresa before and would highly recommend her 
Great value for money
A good place to spend some time in Dublin. Teresa is very helpful and kind.

Sparkling clean, quiet, convenient to downtown Dublin.  We enjoyed our comfortable, attic room with private bath.  Noeleen is a great host, helpful, and nice.  The light breakfast of fresh fruit, yogurt, toast, coffee and tea was just right.
I wouldnt necessarily recommend this place as I did not feel especially welcome.

Noeleen is a great host. She makes you feel at home right away. Very nice, always willing to help. We had a great time at her place. The breakfast was very nice. I would strongly recommend staying at Noeleen's. Muchas gracias.

This is a very nice place to stay at while you're in Dublin. Noeleen is a perfect host, kind and interested and she gave many tips on what to do. It's clean, comfortable and it's great that breakfast is included.
It takes about 30 minutes to walk downtown, but with a Visitors Leap card you can travel unlimited for 24  or 72 hours, or a week. You can reach Noeleens house by many different bus lines.
Noeleen was an amazing host! She was there to help with any questions we had for getting around the city or things to do while there. Very clean and a good location!
Een fijne rustige plek, goed te bereiken met openbaar vervoer. In ongeveer 15 min ben je met de bus midden in het centrum. Het isschoon en er is een vriendelijke gastvrouw met een prima ontbijt .

Noeleen was a wonderful host. Her home was quaint, clean and bright. The attic room where we stayed was private enough for the two of us. Location was also nice being about a 20 minute walk to the city center, or a $10 taxi ride.
A little too small for 2 people over 6 feet tall

Loved our stay in the attic room. Great location in Glasnevin and Noeleen was excellent hostess. Bus stop right there. Good variety of food and pubs short walk away. Close to botanical gardens and Glasnevin cemetery.
We had a lovely stay and were very comfortable. Its a quiet spot with nice local walks to enjoy as well as not too far from centre of city by bus.

Noeleen & her home are awesome! She has a fantastic knowledge of whats going on in and around Dublin or of things to see and do. Noeleen is a fantastic host!!! Couldnt be any better Ive stayed with Noeleen twice now and would not hesitate to stay again. Thanks Noeleen

Snelle respons per mail, uitgebreide info over hoe de woning te bereiken. Vriendelijke ontvangst. Daarna vonden wij de host eerder afstandelijk. We hadden gehoopt op wat inside informatie, andere dan in de boekjes over Dublin . Het ontbijt was niet wat we verwachtten : enkel ontbijtgranen en beperkt aantal sneetjes droog brood.  Bij ons volgend bezoek aan Dublin zoeken we geen airbnb meer met ontbijt gezien je overal , in iedere levensmiddelen winkel kan ontbijten

We visited Dublin for my birthday weekend, we booked the accommodation last minute and Noeleen was very responsive and helpful during the whole process - before & during the stay! Personal touches like a homemade muffin with a candle on arrival (my actual birthday) was a wonderful surprise. Highly recommend as great location, near the High Street (bus stop nearby the property), overall stay - great! Thank you, Anna & Dan

Noeleen's place is just as described - a private attic room with a view, along with a private full bathroom just for your use. Noeleen is a lovely, kind host and we completely enjoyed our stay in her home. Breakfast is light and healthy and self-serve,  exactly the way I prefer it. We walked everywhere and didn't take the bus or tram at all, although it's very convenient and stops right outside the house (note that we are dyed in the wool walkers who prefer to soak up the city through the soles of our feet). Noeleen's recommendations were all excellent - don't miss the Kilmainham Gaol tour! It was fascinating. We would return to Noeleen's in a heartbeat. Thank you!
Wonderfull time with Noellen. Great place: warm, quiet and clean, and a lovely person.

Noeleen was a great host, providing a map and helpful recommendations.  The space itself is very pretty and comfortable.  The neighborhood is a short and convenient bus ride from the city center.  I would have loved to explore more of Glasnevin itself if there had been more time, as the National Botanic Gardens and the cemetery where many revolutionaries are buried are right there.

We were so glad we booked with Noeleen. Communication was fast and really informative and Noeleen offered a warm welcome. The room was a really good size for two people with the bathroom just down the steps (bath always a plus, decent shower). Breakfast in the beautiful dining room was a real bonus and the selection of toast, cereal and fruit set us up for the day and saved us some euros! The location is a little way out of the city but there are loads of buses and we got a 3 day LEAP card so it wasn't a problem at all. Would be happy to stay with Noeleen again!

Noeleen is a welcoming host and she will give you great recommendations for restaurants, shops or museums. 
Also the Glasnevin cemetery and botanic gardens are right next door, and it's really worth visiting.
Perfect location. Cool building
jederzeit wieder

What a gem!  Most visitors to Dublin don't even get a glimpse beyond the front door of the Georgian townhomes - let alone stay in one.  Our flat was every bit as lovely as the pictures - and so very comfortable.  Karin provided thoughtful touches and useful information.  We really enjoyed the neighbourhood, with a convenience shop, cafe and coffee shop all within a block.  And the location gave us an enjoyable 20 minute walk right into the city centre.  Our stay here really made our trip to Dublin extra special.

Wonderful stay with Karin in a fantastic space. Lots of great, thoughtful touches. Milk in the fringe, shampoo AND conditioner in the shower, extra pillows on the bed. Karin is a natural host and the space is really impressive - how many opportunities do you have to sleep in an historic building in a round room?! Loved it

Great location for a quick walk to most everything. We loved exploring Dublin and never found ourselves too far from our home to walk back. The space is cute and in a beautiful building. Karin was very attentive! Thank you!

Karin was great to stay with. Room was beautiful with such great touches, not just your average room. She took the time to highlight a map showing us all of the must-see places in the city, which helped tailor our trip to make sure we hit as much as possible in a shorter stay. Thanks again!

What a beautiful Apartment, if you want a nostalgic and cultural place to stay this meets the bill.  A beautiful apartment with good amenities in a Georgian Town House.  Couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay and explore Dublin from.  Walked everywhere and covered a lot in our short time.

We had a wonderful stay in Karin's Place and in Dublin from wednesday evening until sunday morning. 
We can reccommend it to anyone, except if you are taller than 1,90m  - then the rain shower will not be high enough for you.
If you want to visit Dublin, look no further , this is the total package!

Wonderful location on Mountjoy Square.  Karin was a fantastic host - friendly, helpful, and available anytime.  She shared great advice regarding rental cars (your really dont need one), taxis and local attractions.   The space was very comfortable for our family. Beautiful space with very high ceilings!  Neat, authentic neighborhood feel, very walkable and near just about everything (we walked the 15-20 minutes to Temple Bar and surrounding areas). Great Asian food around the corner on Parnell Street (Pho Viet was excellent).  Absolutely perfect!
This place is great. Easy to find. Easy to get to all the attractions and the apartment itself was wonderful. The host is great and has many great tips on what to do in Dublin. I would def come back

Karins place is even nicer than it appears in photos (which show it quite well). It was a wonderfully restored space that felt historic while having modern amenities -  a perfect respite from the vibrancy of Dublin.  The Georgian townhouse is beautifully restored, as well.  I enjoyed the diversity in the neighborhood, too, with a variety of shops nearby, and Mountjoy Square is a pleasant green space as well.

I found it an excellent location to explore the sights of central Dublin and would love to return at some point.

Karin does a great job making you feel welcome.  She goes out of her way to provide nice things for you. Her directions are excellent. It was a joy staying there.  You can tell she wants to do an excellent job, and make everything lovely for her guests.

A beautiful space in a great location with a great host. What more do you need?  Very close to everything to do in Dublin. A few blocks from bus service to and from the Airport. A few blocks from the tram going into the heart of the city. A few blocks from the Asian restaurant quarter where you can get great Sichuan food and a whole lot more. 
Our host brought us down some baked milk custard desert she made and it was wonderful. 
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Karin's place is in a great location and is a stylish loft. Check in was super easy, and the place was as expected in pictures shown. Lots of helpful tips and recommendations were given and communication was timely. The only issue we had was that our lock broke, but after a short time we sorted this out with Karin and were able to regain entry to our apartment. Would stay here again and recommend for sure! Thanks again for a great stay Karin!

Karins apartment was beautiful and clean. She accommodated our request to drop our luggage early. We met Jackie and she had some excellent tips and recommendations for breakfast at King Fisher about a ten minute walk from the apartment. The apartment was exactly as pictured. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Dublin. Close enough to the touristy core of Dublin but far enough to not be noisy at night.

A beautifully appointed apartment just a short walk away from all the action on OConnell and beyond.  Comfortable bed, great rainhead shower, fresh flowers, an extensive list of recommendations, well-stocked kitchen and breakfast items provided made for wonderful stay.  Visit the Kingfisher restaurant on Parnell for a brilliant breakfast and the best scones in Dublin.  My only suggestion is that if you are a light sleeper or prone to disturbed sleep, consider using ear plugs for the morning traffic noise.  We highly recommend Karins property!
Nice apartment very close to Croke Park. Ideal for a concert

The room was very nice and within walking distance of everything in central Dublin. Unfortunately, my host did not inform me that the front door of the building was going to be replaced during my stay. I came back from a day trip at 9pm on Tuesday to find the front door boarded up with no keyhole or door knob. I had received no messages about this. I am very lucky that another guest was in the building who heard me banging on the boarded-up door and shouting my hosts name, who came down to show me around through the back. I was not made aware that there was a back entry where I could use my key. The back entry was through a small door, about 4ft tall, behind the garbage bins. The room itself, however, was very pleasant, in spite of that experience.
Very pleasant stay! Beautiful studio apartment in a great location and a super helpful host.

Great location within walking distance of the city center. We walked every day we were there, it takes about 5 mins to get to O'Connell St and 10-15 to get across the bridge into Temple Bar and Trinity College Area. Apartment was nice, quiet, and cleanly. Nice architecture and easy to find transportation to and from the airport. We took a taxi from the airport, and public bus back to the airport to pick up our rental car. Karin was very thorough with information and prompt responding to any questions! Definitely recommend the place!

The apartment was so beautiful and charming with 5 star touches. A great place out of the noice and making you feel like a local. Wonderful place I would recommend to anyone looking to have a memorable visit it Dublin.

Karins place is lovely and the loft bedroom is charming. Karin was communicative throughout the entire process, and everything was very well organized. Its a great location and easy to explore Dublins sights-highly recommend!
A lovely flat experience in a great location!

Karins apartment is a chance to stay in a historic space in Dublin. The kitchen has been modernized and has all the amenities you will need. It is walkable from Connolly station where there are several large grocery stores and only a few minutes from the Parnell LUAS stop.

Karin's place was wonderful.  A picture says a thousand word, but the pictures do her beautiful place no justice.  The flat was homey, but so very elegant.  Her attention to the smallest details was astounding.  She even had a universal charge converter available and waiting on the mantle.  Everything was there for our first breakfast, which negated the shopping.  She even did a last minute load of laundry, so we could continue on our journey with clean clothes.  The home was centrally located, close to everything and the neighborhood felt quite safe.  My only regret was that our stay in Dublin was so short that we didn't get to spend enough time enjoying this lovely home away from home.  Yet, it just gives us another excuse to come back to Dublin!
Location is perfect, you can walk almost anywhere from there.  You have a complete access to the place so you can come and go as you please.

Charming studio with everything you need for a great stay in Dublin. Well-appointed kitchen, great light, comfortable spaces. Convenient location (10-minute walk to the Liffey River; 20 to the convention centre; and away from the hustle and bustle of Temple Bar). Karin's hospitality really makes this place special. The fresh flowers in the entryway, personal check-ins, and tasty baked goods are a real treat!
Wonderful, beautiful and large apartment with thoughtful touches and amenities. The hosts are super responsive and friendly. Highly recommend.
You wont find better than Karins. Fabulous unique studio with a loft and a GREAT host

Karin's home is beautiful. The flat I stayed in was exactly as the pictures conveyed and was a beautiful spot to call home for my few days in Dublin. Karin was very attentive when I had an issue, and was very pleasant to speak with. The flat is in the heart of the city, which comes with the accessibility of all public transport and most things in walking distance. I really enjoyed my stay.
This place was super cute. I liked the layout, it was nice to be able to cook meals here, and we were walking distance from all of the places we wanted to go!
A super little flat in a great location. Karin goes out of her way to make you feel welcome and it really feels like home. Well worth a visit.
A lovely, conveniently located place that had all the amenities you could ask for. We were able to walk to a majority of then local spots in Dublin. Overall, would recommend!

Beautiful building and stair case. Great location. Fully equipped. Very roomy space. Relatively quiet given the proximity to a major street. Very close to the Hop on Hop off bus service. Also a reasonable walk to down town.
Good location to city center. Walkable area. Highly recommend The Celt pub on Talbot.
We would highly recommend this lodging. Beautifully decorated, comfortable, well equipped, great location, thorough guides to the apartment and visiting Dublin. Karin is indeed a super host.

Karins BnB is very nice. The apartment is  lovely, and located within walking distance to the main Dublin area, and transportation. 
We really appreciated the  tips she gave us about getting around, and all the amenities close by.

This place was wonderful and so was Karin. The place was spotlessly clean, Karin gave loads of really helpful information about how to get to the apartment, how to get around the neighborhood, and advice on how to get around Dublin (all of which made everything so easy for us as first-time visitors to the city), and I honestly have nothing at all to complain about. Ive never had an Airbnb host who was as detailed and informative before. We spent three very enjoyable days in Dublin and it was great having this place to go back to after a long day of sightseeing.
Make sure you a bottom-floor flat if you want a night's sleep.
Beautiful house in a convenient location. Everything is in great condition. Would definitely recommend to that who visit Dublin.
Karins home cant be beat. She also went above and beyond to make sure we had a pleasant stay. It exceeded our needs and I hope to stay here again someday.
Karin is an excellent host. Some lovely amenities and special touches.  Great local tips.
This apartment is beautiful and you'll love the Georgian period styling and decor.  It's located near the center of Dublin making most of it walkable --  really a treat to stay there.

Lovely apartment, really quite lush. The bed was very comfy, kitchen had everything you needed - even had milk, eggs, coffee, tea, nice and yoghurt. I could have moved in! Very close to centre of Dublin, not far to walk at all.

Cosy warm, unique, well equipped apartment with lots of info about places to visit and eat etc., great books and dvds... we could have happily just stayed in!!
Karin and Jackie were easy to communicate with and quick to respond, there were eggs, milk, jams, smoothies... a really good selection of basics and beyond which was perfect as we were exhausted when we arrived and didn't need to go straight out shopping! We were able to leave our bags on our last day and borrow an umbrella... 
Would love to visit Dublin again and would definitely stay in the Oval Room again :)

I started off my AirBnB experience with Karin in 2013, and was delighted to return to a different flat in her beautiful Georgian townhouse for this stay with husband in tow. It was just as lovely as I'd remembered it. The furnishings are beautiful, the kitchen really well equpped, and place stylish and comfy. There's everything here for a lovely stay., one you won't forget. There are some good restaurants close by, or supermarkets if you fancy staying in. Everything's really well thought through. The whole place is gorgeous. You can't go wrong, and I'd never stay elsewhere in Dublin.
