Perfect cozy getaway. Very clean, and comfortable. With all the touches to make you feel you are the heart of Dublin.

Charming historical loft which is great for a stay in Dublin. The building is beautiful and had lovely details including the lilies. Karin also responded promptly to messages. The only downside is many locals said the neighborhood is not the safest so we ended up taking cabs home each night.
Great host and awesome space! Karin and Jackie were great hosts and the place was unique and very clean! I recommend staying here for sure!

Karin's Georgian studio was adorable! Tucked away in Dublin 1, it was away from the revelers downtown, yet very easy to get to by Tram and a short 7 min walk. The building itself was across the street from a sweet park. Inside, I loved all the original architectural details of the apartment, especially the large front window with folding wood shutters. Karin provided some breakfast items, which was very helpful as I arrived quite late in the evening. She also had a large map and other information waiting for me so that I could plan my walks and errands. Overall, I recommend Karin's studio without hesitation.

Our stay with Hans and Deirdre far exceeded our expectations. They greeted us warmly and their home quickly felt like our own. If we were to return to Dublin we would stay with them again without a doubt. Hans gave us great information about what to see and where to eat. As three young women, we felt safe and comfortable in their home as well as in Dublin. Thank you, Hans and Deirdre!!

Our stay with Hans and Deirdre was the best of all our Airbnb experiences.  Hans met us at the door and after getting us settled in pointed out all the attractions on the city map.  He even drove me to one attraction and got me admitted even though it had been sold out online.  Breakfast was excellent, including Deirdre's homemade scones; and they sat down to eat with us  where we had wide-ranging conversations as well as suggestions on restaurants and bars.
We had the whole second floor of the house, a sitting room, bedroom, and bath, all very large, comfortable and private.  We are so thankful for such a wonderful visit and would love to stay with Hans and Deirdre again if we returned to Dublin.
Great breakfast and conversation. Sparkling clean. Thanks!
Great location close to St Stephens Green.  Host is friendly and accommodating.  My wife and I truly enjoyed our time in Dublin and highly recommend this place.

This really is great location to explore Dublin. Central enough for all amenities, although never noisy, and relaxing in the evenings, also note the extremely comfy beds with quality cool cotton bedding...slept like a log!

Hans and Deirdre have wonderful hosting skills, they are two of the loveliest people you could ever wish to meet, we started every morning greeted with  genuine smiles, great conversation, and a  lovely fresh breakfast, .
Hans has a great knowledge of the local area and the history, which he shared with us, this was invaluable and really interesting.

Thank you so much Hans and Deirdre for making our visit to Dublin so amazing!
Hope to see you both again next time we are in Dublin.


Julia and Sam.
xxx

Margaret and her husband is very friendly and makes you feel right at home! At breakfast they take time to sit and talk with you which is very nice. The room was very good and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and there was good shower facilities. 
The house is close to public transport - that goes to the city center or the airport

We were welcomed graciously. Our host was able to help us learn the layout and navigate. On the last morning of our stay we had breakfast with the host, which was very nice to have a conversation with someone who is local. We learned a lot. Very hospitable.
Margarets place was in a great location and overall a good opportunity to stay in dublin.
Margaret and Gordon are very nice and friendly. We enjoyed talking to them.  Also our little daughter loves them.
Me and my parents had a great stay here, everything met our expectations. Margaret and her husband Gordon are both very nice and approachable, will go out of their way to please their hosts!
Doporuƒçuji. Fajn hostitelka  :)
Very nice people, good place to stay with breakfast in the morning and nice communication. Direct bus connection to city center and airport. Was great.
Margaret is very friendly and welcoming, her house is easily accessible using public transport and close to the airport. The room had the basics amenities for a stay for a few days.
Room is quite big and its on the second floor.

We will definitely book at Margaret again when we pay a visit in Dublin next time. The whole family is lovely and very kind! Definitely recommend the place! If you buy a leap visitor card, you are good to use all public transportation in Dublin, therefore it does not matter that this house is not situated in the city centre. Nice environment! 5 star :)))
Located Close to bus route to city and airport. Close to supermarket and takeaway. Able to use kitchen for evening meals was a bonus.

Margaret was such a kind lady who made our trip so much more enjoyable by offering us tips and insights as to what to do around the area. Definitely recommend her home it is just outside the city so you dont have to deal with the hustle and bustle but not too far to where you cant take a taxi to go enjoy it :)
Great place, close to the public busses that take you to and from the city. Not too far from the city though just a few kilometers away. Margaret was lovely and communicative.

Margarets home is so lovely! She was very accommodating and great with communication! Her home is about 15 minutes from Dublin Centre which is alright but in a quiet neighborhood! Absolutely lovely stay!
Margaret and Gordan are the perfect hosts, so kind and helpful and willing to answer any questions they can! Bus stops right near which were easy to catch and only a ‚Ç¨17 taxi ride into the centre
A lovely place to stay with a very polite people in there.

The place is really clean and the host is very caring and friendly and always willing to help you with everything she knows about. :) 
Definitely, recommend Margaret's place to other people like me that visit Dublin for some time! :)
We stayed for three nights at Gordon¬¥s and Margaret¬¥s house with our 2-year old son. They were great hosts for the three of us!
Friendly people!
Margaret und Gordan sind sehr hilfsbereit und freundlich. Die Lage und Erreichbarkeit zur Innenstadt und dem Flughafen sind ideal.

Good value for money if you're on a tight budget. Margaret and Gordon gave us many informations about bus routes to the city center, things to do with a child and even local and live forecast and news ;)
Margaret and her husband were very helpful and kind and we had a very pleasant stay

Good twin beds. Breakfast was a lovely surprise as it was not expected. Need to check in with host when coming and going, I think this must be an Irish custom. We did not and the host came to our room to check we were okay.

Margaret was a great host, accommodating me last minute. Her place is an easy bus ride from the airport and an easy bus ride to Dublin city center. The bed was warm and comfortable and the shower was awesome. Highly recommendîmuch better than a hostel!
Very kind and accommodating!

Conveniently located in a lovely area, in between the airport and the city centre with a very good bus route in and out of town. Warm and friendly hosts who were very accommodating, would highly recommend.

Good location next to plenty of facilities, such a SuperValu supermarket, interesting pubs with live music and lots of fun, and also bus stops anywhere. Margaret and Gordon are a lovely couple and offer their best to the traveler.

Margaret and her husband are very welcoming hosts and take good care of their guests and their needs. We felt safe in a very clean room. The rest of the house was not as clean but still okay. They provide everything you need and have a lot to tell. The bus connection is great. Its easy to get downtown and to the airport within 20 minutes.

Margaret's place is just as advertised. The room was clean and comfortable.  If was the first time we'd booked a room rather than an entire private space, so it was a bit of a new experience, especially with the shared bathroom facilities.  Margaret and Gordon were very friendly and helpful.  We basically used the place as a crash pad for sleeping as we were very busy on this trip. 
The location was good for getting my daughter settled in at DCU.  The only additional thing I'd mention is that if you're sensitive to cigarette smoke, you probably would be affected here.
She was lovely and welcoming and she went above and beyond to make us feel at home

You can expect a very warm welcome from Margaret and Gordon. Margaret will make you feel at home and Gordon will tell you where to go, what to see, and the best way to get there. I cant wait for my next visit.

Margaret and Gordon are amazing hosts. They are really nice, helpful and provide you with good information. The rooms are clean and the location of the house is very convenient with a supermarket just across the street and the bus station nearby. The neighbourhood is nice and quiet. We really enjoyed our stay there and would recommend the place any time.
Margaret and her husband help us a lot in everything we need. Very kind people.
Spacious room with privacy. 10 minute taxi ride from the airport, and also easily accessible via direct bus from Dublin city centre.

Pleasant hosts.  Congenial and friendly.  Close to the airport and local bus transportation.  Our room was clean as was the shared bathroom. Convenient location for sightseeing in Dublin and the surrounding area.  Gave us a great tip on visiting Howth, a local active fishing village close to their location.  Also gave us hints about shopping, restaurants and evening entertainment close to them.  We recommend their location if you are visiting Dublin.
Shirley and Robert.

Margaret and Gordon are great hosts, very welcoming and personable. The location of their home is a quick walk to the bus 16 that runs to the south side of the Liffey, Trinity College area so very easy to get downtown. This same bus line runs to the airport as well, so an ideal location to save some money with public transit and an affordable place to stay as Dublin can be quite expensive. Would stay again!
A nice stay in a frendly part of Dublin. Nice tips and verry frendly People. Thanx!!
Great location, welcoming hosts:)
Margaret is a lovely host. I was made felt welcome and the room was plenty big with a comfortable bed. Will definitely stay again!

Margaret and Gordon were great hosts, very chatty and friendly. 
We stayed 4 nights and were comfortable there. 
You get exactly what you pay for, which echoes exactly what we saw from reviews we saw before booking. 
The one issue we had was that the communal areas of the house smelt of stale smoke, but it didn't effect the room, which smelt fine. 
Everything was clean, tidy and spacious.
Sehr nette Leute!!!
It's a nice place but the house rules are very tight and breakfast is just cereal or toast...

We had two nights at Margarets house. Everything was fine. We had a nice chat with her and her husband as well. The walk to the bus station is about 6 min. from there you can get to the airport and the city center in about 30 min.
Thanks for having us.

Margaret Place was great.We have a great stay. very convenient to public transport to go to city center as well as to (Website hidden by Airbnb) is great. Room is big  and nice.We recommend Margaret place to  families,couples,solo travelers and to all peoples travelling to Dublin.
Wonderful and unique accommodations at a fair price! The neighborhood is eclectic, safe, and packs plenty of good food/entertainment. Karen is a great host!
Quiet comfortable studio with everything you could possibly need close to the city shops and attractions

Beautiful Georgian apartment! Superb location, great hospitality. Karin helped so much with making our stay the most memorable and easy.
Highly recommend!
Place was cute and cozy. Just be careful if you are tall as the ceiling in the bed upstairs loft is low. Im 5/7 and could stand upright while tapping the ceiling.

The flat is in a good location, an easy 20 minute walk from the centre. We really liked the fire and the breakfast items that were left. However I felt it was a bit overpriced for what's quite a small space and the communication was a bit slow. There's also lots of signs and messages telling you what not to do in the flat, which does make it harder to feel at home.
Couldnt recommend this property highly enough. It delivers on every level.
Karin is a wonderful host and makes sure you know what is available and expected.  Her place was clean and within walking distance of everywhere, we wanted to go.
Karin is an absolute gem, lovely location and home... Thank you

What a special place for us to stay. We loved the Georgian house  with its original features and great location. Also enjoyed the foods that were left for breakfast. We had a wonderful weekend in Dublin. George- ious !

You can expect a fine Georgian room, cunningly adapted to include bathroom and kitchen without damaging it. Your hostess is friendly and very knowledgeable. You will find yourself at the heart of Dublin, ideally placed for exploring the city.
This is a charming home in a great area of Dublin.  So easy to get about town in the plentifully taxis.   It was so nice to come home to this charming condo after a full day site-seeing!
great hostes

I was charmed by Karin's lovely Georgian flat when I saw the photos online and the real thing certainly exceeded my expectations! She is the consummate host who has thought of everything. A stocked kitchen, a bathroom loaded with toiletries, wonderful books and DVDs, a working fireplace (we didn't use it), heaps of guide books and maps in addition to her own excellent suggestions... I could go on and on.  The street was perfectly quiet during the night and a quick 15 minute walk to the River Liffey. Karin herself greeted us warmly. I can't imagine a better Air BNB experience and I can't wait to go to Dublin and stay with Karin again!
Lovely apartment, very quiet and comfortable. Interesting neighborhood north of the river. Hosts provided a lot of useful information.
Interesting and informative host and great spot. Ceiling is a little close in sleeping area, but guests are warned about this.

Thank you Karin for hosting us in Dublin.
We had a love stay and Karins place was very comfortable.
Location was walking distance to the centre and the River.
We love Dublin!
It was just perfect! There are no more words needed :). Thanks a lot!

Karins place was an overall good stay for us. She was thoughtful and left some foods for us in the fridge and was quick to respond to anything we needed. The location was a 15 minute walk to downtown and was pretty safe. My only complaint was the shower was very small but other than that it was a great stay!
Truly marvelous experience all 'round.
I did book this app for family members as a birthday gift, they loved it.

We enjoyed our stay in Dublin and Karin's apartment is in a unique area of Georgian homes.  We thought it was great to see this bit of architectural history up close.  The location is ideal for getting around the city; we were able to walk to all the main sights, and there were lots of shops, restaurants and coffee shops nearby.

Wonderful studio apartment with mezzanine. Great location 15min walk to GPO. Easy check in process, lots of things you need in the cupboards of the kitchen and bathroom, and hints and tips for the local area. Not a bad thing to say about it. Highly recommend

Such beautiful apartment, the perfect location for a weekend in Dublin. Quick communication and in-depth information ahead of visit. Great location in Dublin, easy walk into the city centre. We were greeted very friendly by Jackie, she made us feel very welcomed and even helped getting early entry to the apartment.

Karins place is very organized!!! Lovely cutlery, high end dishes, best of all sharp knives! Well stocked kitchen. Close to our concert venue 3Arena.

Barbara
Marvellous! Loved it.
Great place, great location..a really neat space! Karin was awesome and very helpful.
Karin is a wonderful host. Stylishly presented apartment in a great location.
Place was perfect location you can walk everywhere or catch bus/cab. She has a large bathroom and nice kitchen. We would stay there again
Our host, Karin, was accommodating and welcoming and provided many useful tips.  The location is perfect for touring in Dublin.  The B&B was well-equipped - we did not lack for anything.
Loved this apartment close to everything and walking distance to attractions

Karin is the best. She gave us tips about what to see while we were here. She was very accommodating and helpful. Couldnt have done any better. Its a gorgeous old building As well. We would definitely return and hope to someday. Thanks, Karin!

Karins place was nice and clean. You do have to walk through a bit of a rough area when waking to any of the tourist sites and I would not recommend walking at night, take a cab. There is a lovely little pub and grocery right down the street. There is a china townù two blocks away and an absolutely amazing Turkish kebab one block away. Nice visit overall.

This is an beautiful, well-furnished space. Karin was easy to communicate with, check-in was seamless, and there was a comprehensive local guide left in the apartment.

The only thing to be aware of is the low ceiling over the sleeping loftîeasy enough to deal with once youve encountered it. Wed happily stay here again.
This is a charming apartment with a loft in a quiet building. II is in a great location. Karin was very helpful and responsive prior to our arrival and everything about our stay Was perfect!

Wow! This was the most beautiful and welcoming AirBnB we have stayed at!  It is first of all a very charming space, an oval apartment tastefully decorated. And a working fireplace in front of a deliciously comfortable sofa was the perfect place to while away a cool summer night. Karin has all top end appliances and she keeps her units in immaculate condition. She stocks the refrigerator with items for breakfast which was a very homey touch.  Bed and pillows provided a wonderful nights rest. We enjoyed our conversations with Karin, as well. This is an exceptional place to stay.

Absolute gem in Dublin!  Gorgeous Georgian house converted into apartments.  Karin has added some wonderful touches and I just loved staying there.  The apartment had everything I needed and more.  Location is an easy walk to Dublins shopping area and some great places to eat.   I would highly recommend staying here, a great find!
A really interesting room in a good location.  I pretty much walked everywhere from there. Karin is very responsive to questions and provided a great guide for the room and things to see and do.

Beautiful apartment conveniently located to walk to nearly all major Dublin sites.  It is as it appears in the photos.  There is a remarkably efficient use of space with a fully equipped kitchen (a nice touch being some light breakfast in the kitchen on arrival, adequate for one breakfast), small but nice bathroom and loft bed.  Detailed instructions for check in, departure, restaurants etc were provided.  Street noise mentioned in some other reviews was not a problem with windows and shutters closed as instructed.
WiFi and TV reception were spotty.

This accommodation was spacious, attractive, and well located to take advantage of all the attractions of Dublin. Karin provided a great deal of useful information in advance of our arrival. Although we never met, I had the sense that she is very much involved in insuring that the room is well taken care of. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

Great location and hosts provide plenty of amenities such as coffeemaker, cooking supplies, etc. Best of all, they provide a super convenient laundry service for only ten Euros!

Place is a little older than I expected. Bed is a bit barebones and uncomfortable, which is my biggest critique. Towels were very coarse - better to bring your own.

Overall host is very communicative and their instructions are well laid out. Very tourist friendly and many guidebooks and maps provided.

Good privacy too. Its very much a self service experience.

Recommend based on excellent location and laundry service.

An absolutely charming apartment nicely located in a quiet area. There was fresh fruit, smoothie, yogurt, coffee and tea when we arrived. Karin left lots of brochures and thorough instructions for everything you could want to know. Space is small and cozy with a bedroom loft and lovely interior design. There is a nice selection of books by Irish authors on the shelves. We enjoyed just sitting reading on the comfy couch in the evening. We would love to book again in the future.
Great little place to stay. Close to the city center (walking distance).
I had a nice time in this unique, classic apartment. Karin left detailed tips and everything I needed was in walking distance.

Not kidding at all when I say this is exactly what I would pick if I could have any apartment :) it's so adorable, with a touch of history, the round room is really unique, and it's very cosy. The location was fantastic, you're a stone's throw from transit and about 20 minutes walking from anything you'll want to see while in town. My only critique is that the shower is very teeny, so be aware if you're a large person! It's nice to have access to a fully stocked kitchen, and Karin and Jackie were very eager to help in any way during my stay. I would absolutely highly recommend!
Margarets place was very convenient and a great value. Perfect for a short stay near Dublin.

Margaret and her husband were very friendly and informative. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. They even prepare breakfast and sit with you, its a very great opportunity to get to know them. The smell when you enter the house is amazing, a lovely touch! And regarding the bathroom the shower was very nice! It was a great first air bnb experience!
Lovely attic room let out by an equally lovely couple. Margaret gave us hints about where to go and how to use the buses etc. Great price for a room so near the bus route to the city.
This is a great space for visiting Dublin as its close to both the airport and the city via bus. Theres a nice pub nearby and Margaret was very hospitable
Marg and Gordon are incredibly hospitable hosts! They made us feel right at home from the moment we arrived. The house is in a quiet neighborhood that was very easy to take the bus into the city.

Gordon and Margaret were lovely hosts. The room was spacious and very clean and the bed was comfortable! The location was great, halfway between the city center and airport makes it ideal for travel. I definitely would stay again.

Margaret and her husband were absolutely awesome. They provided us many tips what to see and visit, they were very talkative, helpful and gave us privacy. Margaret also rang taxi for us when we needed it but it's very close to the center and airport by bus, too. We recommend that everyone stay with them if you wish to visit Ireland.
We really enjoy the stay and the hostess we're very nice and friendly. The bus was near the house and leaves at the center.
Friendly hosts and great value place to stay in Dublin.

I stayed with Margaret for one night before getting a flight from Dublin airport. Location was handy - 10 minute drive. Margaret was there to welcome me and guided me to local spots for food. I had a great sleep in a comfy bed in the attic room - very quiet and comfortable. An enjoyable night and I'll def stay again as the need arises.
Great room in a good location.  Very friendly hosts.

Margarets place is great for those visiting Dublin on a budget. It is easily accessible via bus and was a good location to stay for concerts at Malahide castle. Margaret is great at communicate and was very accommodating with an early check in time.

Very nice room and cosy. Easy access to the center 
Margaret was very friendly
Margaret y Gordon son muy amables me ayudaron a llegar bien a su casa me ayudaron con direcciones para llegar a sitios que ellos me recomendaban ... lo recomiendo

Margaret and Gordon are warm gregarious people who keep a tidy place and offer a home away from home, with easy access to transportation to the city. Gordon took our suitcases up to our attic room and I heard and saw him do the same for other guests on the first floor. Breakfast was a surprise as they provided hot tea/coffee and a simple tasty breakfast. They helped other guests check in to their flight, told us how to get around, ordered us a taxi. Wonderful hosts!
A very confortable house. Margaret and her husband are very welcoming and give you all the information needed to reach the city centre or the airport. My week-end was amazing, thank you !!
Enjoyed my stay. Every thing was clean and comfortable. Quiet and safe area.  I would be happy to to stay here again.   Convenient location.

Margaret is very hospitable and served a great breakfast. Her husband Gordon was very helpful at checkin and guided me to a nice Thai take-away place for dinner. They let me park my rental car in their driveway. The room was very clean as were the bathrooms. It was also quiet and very dark at night which was great. The mattress was a bit old but if you dont mind that, the place is great!

Very lovely people ready to wait for you in case of late flight.
Place nicely connected with buses to go to the city center
Was just missing places to hang damp clothes in the room

Margrets place was in a fantastic location from both the airport and the city center. The breakfast was a full meal with juice, coffee, toast and cereal. We were wonderfully welcomed and the couple was extremely friendly and helpful about any questions I had. I definitely recommend staying here !!

Very nice hosts, 
close to bus which takes you into the centre, light breakfast in the morning - all fine :-)
Great host, always available to answer any questions, spotless facilities and great location
Everything was perfect! The location is very good, very hospitable hosts, would highly recommend
Margarets place was lovely and comfortable. I would highly recommend this place

Matts bed and breakfast was just what we expected. If youre looking for a quick, in-n-out spot in advance of an early morning flight, this is your spot. Check-in was very clear and Matt was responsive, there is a great pub two buildings down (Kealys), and the breakfast downstairs was an added bonus before a long day of travel. I stayed in a single room (3 beds), and everything was fairly clean. The bathroom wasnt sparkling clean, but it was fine.

Matt's place is very near the airport and so very useful to get to the airport for a morning flight.  We found it to be quite expensive for four of us to stay here but perhaps it is inline with other prices in Dublin.
We were disappointed with our stay.   The place isnt inviting to say the least. Its very basic and bare bones. A question of cleanliness.  Not for a family.
This place was awesome so close to the airport and great food next door
Good place to stay if looking near airport.

We were a bit disappointed with this guest house. The address given for (Hidden by Airbnb) maps was confusing. It kept trying to take us around the back side near an office building and parking lot which was not accessible to the house. It would be helpful to note it is across the street from the rental cars. The beds were okay. The door handle to the guesthouse was almost falling off. The breakfast was disappointing, just a loaf of bread, a bowl of fruit and instant coffee mix. Overall, it met our needs of staying close to the airport but wasnt the warm Irish welcome we hoped for.
Good location
Very Close to the (Website hidden by Airbnb) convenient.
Basic accommodations, one notch above a hostel and therefore over priced. Compared to the 4 other Airbnb we stayed at in Ireland it  was disappointing.
Within walking distance (10 min) from the airport. Quiet place to rest your head during a layover. Would recommend.
Very convenient location for the Airport within Walking distance. Room is a bit worn but the price is competely adequate.

(Zero stars not available) Doors to bedrooms share keys, so if you expect a secure stay don't stay here. We were woken up in the middle of the night by someone entering our room with a key!! We were startled awake at 12am and as a result we got NO sleep what so ever because we became fearful for our families safety.  We had an early morning flight so we wanted to get to sleep early.  However they do not turn on the hot water until 7pm and it does not get warm enough to take a shower until 8pm.  We had been traveling all day and got to the Hostel at around 4pm and could not get cleaned up until 8pm.  I call this place a hostel because that is all this is.  For the price you get uncomfortable beds, people screaming outside, no hot water until 8pm, and strangers unlocking your door at 12:30am. 
 We were in Ireland for 2 weeks and stayed at various locations across the country...this was by far the worst accommodation we've stayed in...in Ireland or anywhere else for that matter. The owner never responded to our emails about security issues. Honestly, pass this one up folks!
Great time!

This place is nothing fancy, purely functional. If youre looking to stay close to the airport for a reasonable cost this is it, but its bare-bones in regards to housing. Clean, and easy to get to the airport on a free 10 minute shuttle. Nothing like the family run B&Bs in the rest of Ireland we stayed in, but you get what you pay for.
Basic but spotless, excellent location to the airport and facilities for breakfast if your leaving early in the morning.
Lovely location, but awful host
Fine family room for a quick stop close to the airport but not much else.
Good location near airport
Good location for dropping rentals off and a short walk to the airport. Definitely recommend if your flying early morning next day.
It is a good place when you want to reach the airport in time in the morning. Rhe bedroom was nice and clean. The breakfast was a bit scanty.
This location is perfect for any traveler that needs to be at the airport early in the morning. It is literally right across the street from the car rental return yard.

Matts place is good if you want to be within walking distance of the airport! But expect a pretty mediocre room and bathroom. Cleanliness was okay. My friends and I were only there for about 8 hrs so it fit our needs and our expectations! But its not ideal for a long or luxurious stay.
Sehr sauber und gut gelegen direkt am Airport
Ideally located close to the airport and car hire.  The common breakfast area was well supplied and clean.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Beautiful accommodation :) easy to get there.
A fairly barebones bnb but the location is amazing if you want a stop over that is very close to the airport!

Good location near many attractions and restaurants/bars. The hosts worked to get us a free parking spot, which was a huge help as we rented a car. The amenities and fixtures in the unit itself are average.

We enjoyed our stay at Daraghs place!  The location is great (pay close attention to his instructions for how to find the entrance), the flat was clean and smelled nice, and Daragh was SUPER fast at responding to any messages/questions/concerns I sent. I definitely recommend this place! We would stay here again if we returned to Dublinîespecially if its during the warmer months so we could enjoy the terrace and wonderful view of the cathedral, park, and Patrick Street.
Nice and clean place in a great location. Daragh was very helpful. I recommend this place :)
Great location! Close to so much to see and experience. The balcony view is especially appealing.
Lovely host, beautiful apartment! Perfect location.

What a lovely spot right by St Patrick's! We spent a number of hours sitting out on the balcony overlooking the church. Very easy to walk to everything we  could ever want. The hosts were friendly and communicative throughout the trip! We would definitely stay again on return to Dublin.
Fantastic location, walking distance to temple bar, Guinness factory, plenty of bars/ restaurants/ cafes & right across from St Patricks cathedral.

Daraghs place was very lovely with an extraordinary view of St. Patricks cathedral and the park. A convenient walk from all of the major stops makes for an easy time exploring! Daragh was extremely accommodating and allowed us to check in and drop our luggage early after a long day of travel. Fallons nearby was a great recommended pub and Arthurs had a delicious meal. Would recommend this flat to anybody who will be in Dublin!

Unfortunately, I was not happy with my experience in Daraghs apartment. After reading this review, you may very well decide that the things that disappointed me about the apartment are not the kinds of things that would bother you. But personally, I would not rent this apartment again. And Im sorry and sad to have to state that. With that mentioned, there certainly are a lot of positives about this apartment. The location is pretty wonderful. Its so close to the city center, and there are plenty of great restaurants, and shops, and just about anything you would need or want within just a few blocks. The proximity to St. Patricks Cathedral right across the street, and viewable from the apartment windows and balcony, is super charming and kind of romantic. The cathedrals park and gardens across the street are really beautiful. In good weather (hey, it can and does happen in Dublin!), its a great place to sit and people watch and take a little break from your hectic travel schedule. The park flowers are gorgeous. Super location. Daragh is a very nice guy. If there is something/anything he can do to help you, he certainly will. Hes eager to make thoughtful suggestions, and hes a very congenial host. His restaurant suggestions are especially excellent. However, I found the apartment to be in poor shape in terms of being worn, and in terms of a serious brown and black mold problem in the bathroom within the grout throughout the shower/bath area. I shared all of this with Daragh after my stay, as none of the worn or mold problems could have been remedied during my stay. They all require a period of maintenance when the apartment isnt in use, otherwise Im sure Daragh would have tried to help. I found the laminate flooring to be very worn and in serious need of replacing. I understand from Daragh that the apartment is scheduled to be painted in early June, and thats great because it really does need it. The doors are very scuffed and worn. There are black water stains on the wooden countertops around the kitchen sink that looks really bad. Ive stayed in more than 18 different apartment rentals in Europe and the US, and Ive never come across an apartment in this kind of worn condition. It was especially surprising and disappointing given so many positive reviews. I can only guess that the kinds of things that Ive mentioned here that disappointed me are the kinds of things that simply didnt bother the people who wrote those reviews. Everyone is different and has a different personal perspective. I get that. Ive been very honest about everything Ive mentioned here, and I hope it will help you in making your own decision about the apartment you ultimately decide to rent in awesome Dublin. And it certainly is awesome. I also hope my review will encourage Daragh to continue making improvements to the apartment. Best of luck to you on your upcoming vacation!
Very nice apartment with a great view :)
The view from the apartment and the communication with the hosts were spectacular!

I really enjoyed my time at the apartment.
The apartment is really central and is only a short walk from a number of major attractions such as Temple Bar and the Guinness Storehouse. 

Daragh is really helpful and provides a lot of useful information about the city which helped us make the most of our trip, and helped us arrange early access to the property to ensure that we could leave our bags and explore Dublin ASAP.

Thanks again!
Amazing location with a beautiful view! Incredible local tips. Daragh was really friendly and helpful when we got lost on our way from the airport.
Daraghs place was great! The location was ideal for all the best sights of Dublin. The flat was perfect for us and Daragh was brilliant with tips for great places to eat and drink!
Sarah and Edgar were wonderful hosts.  If we make it back to Dublin I hope we can stay there again.

We had an amazing time. The apartment was great! Very good location with easy walk to Temple Bar, Guinness, and other major areas.  Very much appreciated the quick communication to help with checkin and provide us with recommendations for the local area. Would definitely be happy to stay there again!!

Terrific reception upon arrival. Apartment is well located across from a coffee shop, cathedral and park.  A bit noisy from the street with the windows open during the day and evening due to traffic, which was better at night. However, earplugs were welcome. Lovely small balcony overlooking St Patricks Park and St Patricks Cathedral is a bonus.

Very nice stay at this conveniently located apartment. If it were my apartment I would add living room curtains (the window is open to the busy downtown street) and make a bit more efficient use of the small apartment and bedroom size but it is a perfect location and was good for simply a place to sleep and relax for the evening. Thank you Daragh!
Overall good experience. Great location and good tipps, especially the legit coffee co for breakfast.

Great hosts, very amazing location!So close to everything! Very walkable even with a baby! Loved having morning coffee out on the beautiful patio. Thanks for the lovely experience and awesome recommendations!

We never met Daragh in person, but he was extremely responsive. One of Daragh's local friends met us personally and let us in, along with giving us some local travel tips. The apartment location is great - easy 20 minute walk to some great sites.

There is nowhere better to stay in Dublin!! We were walking distance to everything we wanted to do and Daragh left a great list of local places to try. He was very quick to reply to questions and genuinely seemed to care that we were having a great experience. Recommend Daragh highly!
Look no further! This spot is perfect! Perfect location, amazingly clean, and a great host. We couldnt have been happier! Book it now!!
This place is ideal for staying in Dublin.  Forget the hotels and stay here.  You can walk to everything youre wanting to see and you actually get a feel of the city.  What a nice place!

Overall a wonderful experience! Great communication, great local tips and recommendations for the area. Space was as destructed. Location was perfect for Dublin with St.Patricks cathedral in sight from the the balcony! Would definitely stay again
Fantastic location, so many thoughtful touches throughout and so safe and secure
Nice appartment near the city centrum and not far from temple bar
Daraghs place was perfect. Close to many restaurants and other interesting things!
Great location!! Daragh was very responsive and the apartment looks just like the photos.

Daragh and Edgar are great hosts and very helpful with easy communication. The flat was beautiful and really in the best possible location for exploring Dublin for the first time. 
Dinner on the balcony each evening was a big highlight! Very grateful to have found this spot :-)

Location was great and within decent walking distance to everything we wished to do in town. Hosts had great communication and plenty of recommendations. The flat was well cleaned. Floors, doors and especially the sofa are very worn and tired. - to be fair to guests looking to book either the pictures or the flat need updating accordingly, as do the WiFi login details provided on the app. Difficulty working the shower and sink which had a tendency to turn off and had trouble warming up. Overall a decent stay but not quite as we were expecting.
An amazing stay! Great location! Daragh gave some amazing recommendations and provided a comfy apartment!
Great place, great location, great host. Daragh couldnt have been more helpful. Fab place to stay for a get away!
Great host, available and helpful, Daragh and Edgar made our long weekend so easy, they gave awesome tips and the location is just perfect !

Perfect location for visiting Dublin! Daragh was always quick to anwer any questions. The apartment needs some small repairs done, but we did only use it to sleep, so it didnt bother us. We had a great time in Dublin :)

perfect location
no nightstands
floor of the bathroom slidy
Great stay, definitely recommend!

What a wonderful place from which to launch your Dublin excursions. It's in a quiet part of town, but easily walkable to key sites such as St. Stephen's Green, nightlife in the Liberties, Trinity College, the riverfront and more. Daragh also supplied us with many tips for what to do and where to go. Very helpful. Would love to stay here again on a future trip to Dublin.

Great location and an attentive host who will be able to provide you with great places around the apartment. A perfect base to explore Dublin with the hop-on/off bus stop just over the road! Apartment is a little more tired than the pictures let on.
Wonderful space and location :)

We stayed at this apartment for 3 nights and were happy with the apartment. Communication with the hosts was always really fast and they also recommended a lot of local places for us to find food, drinks and nice places to visit. The apartment was at the perfect location indeed and it was close to everything you might want to visit. We didn't even need to take the bus once as everything was at walking distance. The apartment felt homey and we were happy with the apartment. As some others mentioned in their reviews, it doesn't resemble the pictures that well anymore, as it a bit worn out and in need of some fixings. But it didn't really bother us as we only were at the apartment at night to sleep (perfect bed btw). So in the end we were glad we chose this apartment due to its location and the quick helpfulness of the hosts :).
Great, very comfortable apartment and location
This place was AMAZING! The hosts were so kind and accommodating for our trip. The location is AWESOME! My friend and I could have a nice beer on the patio and look out at the park. So amazing!

Good location. Host was great at timely communication and allowed early check-in, which we appreciated. Clean, however, many items and areas were not in good repair. We did not have access to the building complex security gate and were instructed to contort our arms, stick our hand and entire arm through the gap in the gate, and press the button. This was not secure and put us at risk for muscle injury. We were disappointed with our experience here. Depending on your expectations/tolerance, you may have no issue with this place, as it does have many upsides. We would stay in a hotel or different Airbnb next time if we were to visit the area again.

This flat was good situated and the flat was very bright nice.  But there were some problems to get hot water in the kitchen. The dishwasher was out of order.  The temperature in shower was difficult to adjust. The big bed was too hard for us. Thise things could easily be fixed and then the apartment would be very nice.
Fantastic location! Walked everywhere we wanted to see! Perfect for the young traveler.
Lovely location and good communication with the host. Apartment is very dated compared to the photos, however its a great space with the added bonus of a balcony.
Daragh was a really wonderful host. He had so many great suggestions for our time in Dublin. The place is perfectly located to walk to anything and was in a great quiet, safe neighborhood.
Great location. Clean, simple accommodation for a night or two. Daragh is exceptional and gives great tips and is quick to respond to all communication.
Great location, view, and living room!
Great location and very clean.

Great location, great value, and great hospitality! We particularly liked that this property is just slightly separated from the busiest part of the city, but were within 10 minutes walking to just about any location that we wanted to go to. Would definitely stay here again!
He was so helpful and kind, even he bought dessert for us;) he always respond instantly. location was perfect. The flat was clean and comfortable. Thank you for everything. You are the best host;)

This was a great place to stay, it was qwirky as advertised. Easy to check in and out and only minutes from the city center. Bus stops in both directions and great pub locations down the hill. Phenix park and Dublin zoo walking distance from the place.

What a fun place to stay! I felt like a little kid again in a lot of ways staying in a fort or something. Eddie is a fantastic host. Helpful in giving local tips and suggestions! Would recommend Eddie as a host to anyone visiting Dublin.
We had a lovely time at Eddie's place. The location is great, very quiet and safe and the studio is charming! Eddie is a wonderful host, helpful and available.

A nice cozy room that is in a great location, we took in the scenery at the park which was an excellent walk.  If you are hoping to walk out your door into Temple Bar this isn't for you.   The bus access and taxi fares are reasonable.
Eddie was a fantastic host. The location was perfect. We enjoyed our stay and would 100% return next time in Dublin.

Eddie was an outstanding host, very communicative and helpful of all our needs.  The Airbnb studio had a lot of character, was quite small, but had everything we needed.  Loved the skylight window in the bedroom, looking out it at night and hearing the animals from the nearby zoo was amazing. His place is located close to the hop on hop off bus stop that we used to get around.  I would definitely reccomend his place to others!
Eddie,s is very personable great host. We had a lovely stay.
Great place to stay! A bit tight for three people but we knew that going in. Great location. Eddie was very responsive and helpful. Would definitely stay again next time I'm in Dublin.
Eddies place is great! Just perfect for those who want a comfortable, quirky, and easy-to-get-to place in Dublin without all the noise of city center.

This apartment is great because it is so easy to get to everything. We enjoyed walking  in Phoenix Park and took Bus 46 into the middle of Dublin often. In fact, its so close to the zoo, you could hear the lions settling in for the night, every evening. Its a great location and the apartment works well too. Eddie was quick to reply anytime we had a question and an incredibly amenable host.

I think that calling it "quirky " is fine, but should definitely be described as small, especially if it is offered to 3 people. The day bed is very uncomfortable as either a couch or a bed. This home is lovely unfortunately for us, we were just too cramped and unable to get a full night's sleep on the beds. Eddie was a wonderful host, and I'd recommend the place to anyone
Great spot! We spent our first 3 nights in Ireland here while we got acclimated to the culture and lifestyle. Eddies place is in a great location and was very comfortable and cozy.
Very close to a nice park and close to downtown safe neighborhood

Nice studio, prefect for two people, a little bit to small for tree. Very clean. 
Private bathroom outside but near by the studio. Nice and quite residence, less than 10 minutes away from the tram station (Heuston station), coffee shops, pubs, etc...
Very friendly host.
Less than than 30‚Ç¨ by taxi from the airport

Ed was an amazing host. He was super polite and gave us great places to see that were more local than the tourist places to see. The area is beautiful and the home is really cool with fun history. Ed was very accommodating and all around amazing to meet.

Exactly as advertised: a quirky apartment with a kitchen and living area and little bedroom up the ladder. The bathroom is out in the hall. About a 10 minute walk to the bus lines that take you to the center in 10-15 minutes. Everything was clean and Ed gave us a list of really good recommendations for local fare and fun. Nice for two people, a bit tight for three; the sofa downstairs had a horizontal bar at about shoulder level that is not so comfortable to sleep on. But it was all fine and quite good for the price.

The apartment is very nice, it is in a good neighborhood and close to the Phoenix Park, very good location since this allows you to walk through the park without having to go too far (it's a good place for running). About the center of the city, it is a little far if you want to go walk (in fact, only about 15-20 minutes) but it is very well connected, so this is not a problem. Finally, I think that the ideal for this apartment is for 2 people, but we have been three people there for a whole week and we have not had any problems. The host is very kind and friendly. If I return to Dublin, I would repeat this appartment.
Great host, very friendly and willing to help with any questions you may have. Nice spot to stay in.
Excellent place and service
Great location! The village of Lucan was a great spot to have dinner. We also appreciated breakfast in the morning along with tea and coffee! Checking in and out was easy.
Very clean, pretty apartment with loads of details. We loved the breakfast and the dog.
Great hospitality, great stay

Such a pleasant experience. I highly recommend!  I stayed here with my mom and brother. We arrived late in the evening and left the following morning, enroute to the airport.  The host was kind enough to wake up early and put out a lovely breakfast in the morning. It was a pleasant surprise.

Siobhan was very welcoming to her lovely home.  We had a nice, but brief, rest before our plane departure the next morning.  Comfortable beds and delicious breakfast!  The route to the airport is easy, although one might  expect 30-45+ minutes to the airport during rush hour.

Very happy with our Airbnb.
Very friendly. Very comfortable and clean.
Wonderful home and a sweet and welcoming family. Highly recommend this home!

Siobhans rooms are beautifully decorated, bright and comfortable. The dining area is also gorgeous, and the cooked breakfast was a nice touch. The house grounds are spacious and include a couple of seating areas surrounded by garden. Our only regret is that we stayed just one night.

Highly recommended if you stay in Dublin. SIiobhan's house is so comfy and she cooked a perfact breakfast for us! Also she offered some useful suggestion about our trip. BTW she has a beautiful garden and a lovely yard.

After a long day of travel, we stayed at Siobhans place and were bummed that it was only a stop over. Her home is beautiful and hospitality is amazing. Best nights sleep Ive had in a long time. Breakfast was extremely tasty and in an absolutely beautiful dining room. Very helpful with local tips of town and transportation options. Definitely recommend and would be happy if our travels brought us back.
Such a beautiful property!!  Siobhan made our stay exceptional!!
Twee kamers aan het einde van de gang van hun eigen huis. De gemeenschappelijke ruimte is niet alleen voor de huurder. Fijn ontbijtje.
Great place. Highly recommended.
Lovely home with comfortable beds and a great host. Would recommend.
Beautiful home and wonderful host!  Siobhan is lovely and very gracious.
The rooms were very nicely put together, and Siobhan was very welcoming. The breakfast was also delicious.
The Fairy House was a beautiful and comfortable house to stay in. It was an easy commute to the Dublin Airport. Siobhan was a wonderful hostess and made us a delicious breakfast.
Fantastic place. Wonderful breakfast and the location is great.

Siobhan was SO kind and thoughtful! She ordered our cab for us in the morning and said she would have breakfast ready for us earlier than normal so as to accommodate our departure. We were expecting toast and cereal - she provided homemade French toast and bacon!!! And then special made an egg for our little boy so he could fill up his tummy with something good before his flight  we would definitely recommend Siobhans place and would stay here again!
Beautiful home in great location I totally recommend it
Great place to stay  for a visit to Dublin .  Worked very well for our  small  family . Gracious and kind hosts .
Great host and breakfast. Rooms are nice decorated.
Amazing location to explore Dublin. We had 2 toddlers with us so the grounds and the trampoline provided great sport for them. Great breakfast in a relaxed atmosphere. Very enjoyable overall.

We felt very fooled by Siobhan's listing as we were literally staying in the two spare rooms in her house living in amongst her and her 4 children. The bedroom doors have keyholes however we weren't given keys so our bedrooms containing or valuables were constantly unlocked leaving anyone in the house free to roam in. I've stayed at several air bnb's in the past and I've always had a key for my bedroom door, we felt quite unsafe by the arrangement. It was a very very strange set up, we  had one ensuite bathroom and then had the share the main family bathroom with her sons. . very awkward when you're waking back to your room in a towel and bump into one of her teenage sons!! The location was perfect as we had a party close by however, I would 100% never stay here again.
Good location for travelling onwards after arrival at Dublin airport. Nice pub close by for a beer and music
We had a lovely stay in this eclectic home with very welcoming hosts.

Siobhan is the essence of what AirBNB is! A fantastic home with lovely bed, great facilities and an amazing weekend breakfast. Being this family home makes is a very welcoming and safe place and we never felt like us or our belongings were ever at risk. 

Siobhan and her family are absolutely amazing and were an absolute delight to have a chat with. They are certainly not overbearing in any way shape or form and we had plenty of space.

I would 100% stay here again and I look forward to a return trip to Dublin soon.

Everything was perfect.  It was a pleasure to stay in the beautiful home that is named Fairyland.  We were greeted by their sweet golden retriever and enjoyed walking up the stairs lined with lavender.  Siobhan recommended a local restaurant Carrolls which wound up being one of the best meals we had in Ireland.  After a restful night sleep Siobhan cooked us a delicious early breakfast at 7am because we had to catch our flight home.  Highly recommend!
A truly lovely place to stay. The hosts were amazing. Couldnt do enough to help. Breakfast was very tasty over the weekend and local knowledge helped with our holiday.

Group of work colleagues stayed here one night before a wedding. Big house, lots of space. Would be good to know which areas are in/off bounds. Lovely breakfast - but early but much appreciated before a wedding!

The Fairy House is truly lovely! The town of Lucan didn't disappoint. There are several charming pubs within a short 5 min walk. The grounds and setting are beautiful. House is inviting and Siobhan was very accomodating to our family. She was quick to respond to multiple questions. She had croissants and coffee out for our very early morning departure. She booked a cab for us the night before. So many very nice things about this property and the family who lives here. Its an ideal location for traveling to the airport and value for money is excellent.

Only thing I would mention, is that this is a household with teenagers. We experienced a little loud music, pizza deliveries, family conversations and late night phone conversations as well as tiptoeing past the children's and master bedroom to get to our own rooms which felt a little awkward-especially having to catch a cab at 6:30 am while the house slept.

We travel a lot and have stayed at quite a few airbnbs and vacation rentals by owner. This situation was a first for us. It wasn't bad,  just unique and something I think guests need to be aware of. I'm sure it was my mistake in booking in not understanding the dynamic of the property. This is a fantastic home and the hospitality was outstanding.
Useful stopover on the way to the port.

Siobhan house is a very charming B&B in the outskirts of Dublin. There is a 5 minute walk to Lucan village, where some pubs are located. Also the bus stop is in Lucan village, the bus to Dublin city centre takes about 25 minutes. We can highly recommend Siobhan and her fairy house for a trip to Dublin.

Excellent location with easy public transport into Dublin. Comfortable rooms and the use of a huge sitting room just for guests. The cooked breakfast every morning gave us stamina for long days of seeing the city. Siobhan was very helpful and her household has a nice relaxed feeling. Highly recommend this place.

Fairy house was easy to find and really cute. Lovely family and we felt very comfortable.  Quick walk to a cute village.
Comfortable,  clean and delicious breakfast made our stay enjoyable. Siobhan is a very friendly,  welcoming host. Would highly recommend
Great place close to city!

Siobhan made our stay more than comfortable.  She and her family were engaging, trusting, and caring.  The beds were perfect, the house is amazing, and even the family dog was welcoming and friendly.  We would stay with Siobhan again.
The fairy house is in the perfect location. A 5 minute walk from the adorable village of Lucan that you will not want to miss. Siobhan was a fantastic host and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there.
Siobhan was a wonderful host. My only regret is that we did not get to spend more time there. Love stay in a beautiful, charming home.
Auch das zweite mal hat alles wunderbar geklappt. Kann diese Unterkunft nur jedem empfehlen!
Siobhan was quick to respond to my questions. She has a lovely home with comfortable beds. She left a great breakfast for us in the morning. We only wish we had more time to stay and enjoy it!
Beautiful and cosy place!
Lovely house, wonderful hosts, can't say enough nice things about Fairy House
Cozy house!

A comfortable room on the edge of downtown Dublin. 

Close to the Dart train if you're going out of the downtown area, and close to bus route #1 which comes every 20 minutes or so. A little inconvenient to reach from the airport if using public transit, and expect a cab to cost 40 euro or so with traffic.

Despite me booking only a day in advance Norah and Audrey went out of their way to make sure everything was ready for me. Felt very welcome. Made me realise how much I prefer staying somewhere with a home feeling rather than a hotel with a tv and kettle in every room. Nice location. Just round the corner is the nature reserve and the lighthouse which Audrey recommended, and which were great for an evening run.

The good
The place is located in a very nice and safe area. There is a grocery store 10 minutes away and a lot of restaurants (there is a burger place 10 minutes away, BuJo, that is superb!). 2 minutes away is the bus stop that takes you to downtown (its a 20 minutes ride, but the public transport is great and comfortable), and to my taste the neighborhood is way prettier than downtown Dublin. 
The room is very spacious, and the bed is very comfy. The main restroom is very pretty and you get a good shower.

The not so good.
You should be aware that it is possible, as it happened to me, that the three rooms in the house are rented to other travelers, and so that you are paying to stay in a guest house. The way the space is described, and some of the comments in the past reviews, made it seems as if Norah has one room to rent and that she and her family live in the same house. And so, someone like me, could want to rent the space to interact with the locals in their own home. My experience was as follows: 1. I do not know Norah at all (or any local living in the house). 2. The house has 3 rooms each one of which was rented to visitors. 3. From expecting to be hosted by locals, I soon realized that I was paying to be in a guest house (with zero interactions with locals and all the problems of sharing a house with people who do not own the house and dont care whether they have cleaned after themselves in the common areas.). 
In addition, there is no way for you to lock your door when you leave the house (and, as I say,  there are other travelers in the same house), and there is no safe to keep your valuables. 
There will be some milk, cereal, bread and coffee for breakfast, but depending on the other guests you might not want to use the kitchen if it is extremely dirty (the fridge had a horrible smell).
Great stay - Nora was quick to respond to any questions. Easy stroll into the city. Parkrun just 200m away.
Norah's place was super cute and the bed was very comfy. Nice sized bathroom. The lock on the front door is a little tricky but that in no way hindered our stay. We really enjoyed Norah's house.
Great location nice quiet neighbourhood
very nice host, central location , clean and cosy room.

Sonia was very prompt in responding to my messages. She gave great recommendations for local food and drink. Sonia even allowed us to check-in before our designated time to better accommodate our travel plans. Her cat was super friendly as well!
The location is amazing, best spot in Dublin, walk everywhere. I had a very nice stay at Sonias apartment, she was always gentle and available. Thanks!
Great place to stay in Dublin in a very central area.
All information perfectly as described. Sonia was responsive and welcoming me personally although I arrived in the middle of the night.

Sonia took such great care of me arriving in Dublin on my last night traveling in Ireland. I slept like a baby in the comfortable bed and convenient, private room. Also, cutest little cat ever!! The apartment was conveniently close and short walking distance to all the greatest downtown Dublin has to offer. Enjoy the music, cuisine and ambiance of Dublin at Sonia's place!
Posizione splendida , casa confortevole e Sonia una persona speciale ... bella esperienza

Sonia was a kind and gracious host.  The room and bathroom were clean and very comfortable.  The slippers and snacks were a nice touch.  She has good suggestions on local places should you need it.  The space is exactly as advertised, and the cat is very cute.  The location is fantastic, within walking distance of everything.

Sonia is a wonderful person. Very friendly, helpful, and nice. She is a perfect host. I recommande her place not only for her hospitality but also for the place: a nice, big room, very clean, near a very clean bathroom. The bed is so comfortable, I wish I can have one like that! The location is perfect, very central: near O'Connell St and Temple bar, and there are a lot of shopping, food, transportation all around. The place is very very quiet too. And her cat is amazing. I had a wonderful stay and I hope I can come back. Thank you Sonia.

The room was large, clean and well equipped -she had maps and even some orange juices and energy bars for emergencies :). House was quiet and close to downtown and main transport routes. 
Sonia was extremely kind. Arrival was easy to arrange and communication was fluent all along. She even had some good suggestions for moving around the city. 
I do recomend her place.
Sonia was very friendly and welcoming and her home was in an excellent location.  Near everything but quiet

Sonia's place was perfect for my business travel needs. Her detailed communication made finding her apartment and the check-in process smooth and easy. The double bed was quiet comfortable and the room very quiet. I slept well. The bathroom was spacious and located directly across from the bedroom door and just off the entryway. That gave me full privacy in the late evening and early morning. The wifi was very good. Sonia left two bottles of water and some crackers in the room, appreciated after a long day traveling. The location on the northside of the Liffey just west of the Ha'penney Bridge is convenient to city centre and there are several convenient restaurants and coffee shops next door.
Wonderful location at an amazing price!  The host was lovely to meet, and the stay made the trip to Dublin quite hassle-free
Amazing location! I didnt spend much time there, but the bed was very comfortable, and Sonia was helpfulîoffering recommendations for food and luggage storage. Would highly recommend!
Amazing location, bed, and amenities. Really appreciated the snacks and water available after a long day of exploring.

Sonia's place is wonderfully located, very convenient and comfortable for all my needs. Sonia herself is lovely, I was traveling by myself and am very happy I got to know her. Also she gave me great tips on what to do in Dublin. I definitely recommend staying with her! Thank you Sonia I had a great time :-)

Perfect location and was pretty much walking distance to all attractions and bus/tram routes.  I travelled solo and felt incredibly safe in this district. 

The room is spacious and clean! 

Sonia offered many local tips and was always available to assist.  

Would stay here again.

My stay at Sonias place was perfect. The location is very handy and close to anything you might want to visit in Dublin. The bed is large and comfortable. No noise whatsoever at night. I would definitely recommend it.
Sonia's room was central, close to everything (pubs, restaurants, shops, landmarks) and sparkling clean. She was really helpful, friendly and polite. I'd recommend her room to anyone!
Sonia was very nice and her place clean. There is a cat FYI (in case you have allergies, which I didn't know about till I arrived). The building is very secure which was great.
My visit was very quick in Dublin but Sonia and I could coordinate our schedulings (arrive, batchroom usage, leaving) well. She was nice and her place to.
I had a great time in Dublin and enjoyed the accommodation pretty much! Everything was clean and orderly. Sonia was very kind and courteous and I can recommend her accommodation to everyone!
Great location and very close to all tourist destinations in Dublin. Sonia was very pleasant and lovely. Definitely recommend!
Very nice and close to the city centre. Enjoyed every second!

What a great find! Karin's apartment is amazing, and so is she! Very helpful and friendly, really goes above and beyond to make sure you get the most out of your stay in Dublin. Great access to transportation (5-10 minutes walk to various bus stops/hop on hop off pick up points), as well as walk able to the temple bar area (took us about 25-30 minutes). Looking forward to our next trip to Dublin and will definitely be staying at Karin's apartment again!

Karins place is beautiful and in a great location. She provided fruit and homemade bread, which was appreciated. 

However, there was too much information in the listing, the house book, and the messages I received from Karin. There was some conflicting information that made the check-in and general stay a bit confusing. 

Once we arrived, we couldnt find the bedding for the cot and the heat was off. I called Karin to ask where we could find the bedding and asked about the heat. She walked me through how to reset the boiler light to turn the heat back on. I had to do this 3 times in the 5 days we were there.

Karin told me I was supposed to let her know ahead of arriving that we would be using the cot. This expectation wasnt clear in the listing. 

About 45 minutes after our phone conversation, Karin came to the apartment to give us bedding for the cot, but was not polite and welcoming. We asked if we could help move the furniture to set up the cot and she looked at us, but did not respond, then she moved the couch herself with a shove and a deep sigh.

In addition to these experiences, the bathroom door handle and one of the locks on the apartment door were malfunctioning during our visit. Karin wrote in a message to me that both have been repaired since our departure.

Overall our stay was pleasant, but updating the information in the listing and in the house book will help future guests get the most current information and avoid confusing and frustrating interactions between guest and host.

This place is fantastic. It's in a Georgian home with many of the original features. It's an easy walk to O'Connell Street and all that central Dublin has to offer. There could be a bit of street noise at times but it didn't bother me.  Karin and all of my hosts in Ireland were very friendly and helpful and really helped to make my trip to Ireland spectacular.

We had a great time! Karin is a great host. She popped in both nights we were there to say Hi and ask if we needed anything. It was very thoughtful and really nice to meet her. It was also great because it gave us an opportunity to ask about a few things around town. She really knows her stuff and are very thankful for everything. Highly recommended.

What you can expect from Karin is amazing service, detailed information specific to your trip and how to maximize your time in Ireland. She gave us some great advice prior to landing and upon our arrival we had excellent information to plan our days. The rental space was beautiful. Great touches and wonderful little treats in the refrigerator.
This was a very cool building to stay in. Karin also gave us a lot of really good local tips for getting around. I would recommend.
Wonderful stay...close to City Center, all buses and rail station. Easy walking distance to all center and fashionable quarters. Thanks, Kate

Karins place is wonderful and full of character. She was available to give us recommendations for dinner and was quick to help us when we accidentally locked our keys inside! Located in a great neighborhood about a 20 minute walk to the city center.

Beautifully-appointed, spacious apartment overlooking the park and neighborhood. We love to walk and found it very easy to get around. Karin is a very helpful host and I highly recommend staying here.

Karin was easy to communicate with and was quick to respond. She had left detailed instructions on everything in the apartment and a lot of useful information about the neighborhood.
Her apartment was very nice and we had a good stay.

This flat is a wonderful, historical place to call "home" while you're in Dublin. Karin is a thoughtful, responsive host who provides great information and local tips. The flat itself is warm and inviting. The kitchen and bathroom have everything you need to be comfortable. The location is great -- close enough to nightlife or tourist fun, but just off that beaten path so you can experience everyday Dublin. We would gladly stay here again and encourage you to!

Genuinely one of the nicest places I've ever stayed in.  Huge floor to ceiling windows - Karin had left fresh eggs, milk, coffee, tea, fruit and yogurts etc for us - so I sat by the window after check-in and just relaxed and watched the world go by with a huge pot of coffee.  Karin had a booklet with lots of great tips on where to go locally for food, drinks, shopping etc which was great for me as I'm not overly familiar with Dublin.  I always end up going to the same overpopulated tourist traps so having her local knowledge was amazing.  One of my favourite trips away ever

We loved Karins place!  The view is amazing and the decor enhanced our experience.  She thoughtfully had adapters in each plug in, fresh fruit and cooking necessities.  Wish we had planned to stay longer than 2 days.   The location was easily walkable and public transportation all around.  We would definitely recommend this place.  Doug and Kelly, Canada
Fantastic, stylish compact apartment within walking distance of the city centre. Great communication, highly recommended!

The apartment is really gorgeous and its an one-of-a-kind experience. The place is extremely clean and the location close to center. Everything is well thought out. Even if it is on a noisy street, it is truly worth it.

I selected the 'better than we expected' option when reviewing Karin's flat. However, I feel that gives the impression that we didn't expect a lot from the flat when in reality we were expecting a high standard given the positive reviews and Karin succeeded in surpassing  these high expectations, much to our delight! We greatly appreciated the provision of fruit juice and eggs etc. it was such a thoughtful addition and brought instant relaxation after a busy morning of travel (and filled our hungry bellies).  Karin even provided some toiletries which was another lovely touch. 
Karin was incredibly flexible with our travel arrangements and was happy to store our bags for us both before check-in and after the check-out time which meant we could really see the most of Dublin. 
We would be delighted to stay with Karin again if the opportunity arises, I cannot sing Karin's praises highly enough.

The place was great.  All the space we needed, coffee maker, and adapters to help with keeping our electronics charged.  Is on a busy street, so there is traffic noise after a certain hour.  Still, found everything else to be better than expected.

Ive had a wonderful stay at Karins Georgian studio. Communication on forehand was great, with handy tips and explanations. Welcoming was warm and Karin took the time, was very friendly. There were a lot of extra goodies in the fridge and I;ve felt so welcome. On departure, my flight went hours after checking out: no problem, Karin let me put my luggage in the hall, so I could go signtseeing (I went to beautiful Howth). Very recommending!!!
Came to Dublin for a concert in croke park. This apartment is literally round the corner, cheaper than a hotel with far better facilities and added extras. Would definitely stay here again!

We had a great stay! The location was great for us, just a couple minutes walk from O'Connell street and the Spire, and a really easy walk on towards the river. Great access to North Dublin sites. Lots of restaurants and pubs nearby, and views of Mountjoy Square Park right across the street! Inside, the home is absolutely beautiful, a well-maintained Georgian mansion, with amazing details that continue in the apartment itself. Nice private space, fantastic working fireplace, giant windows, and just tons of historical features. Cozy bed in the loft area. Great kitchen, with lovely thoughtful touches, including yogurt, fruit, coffee and more. Check-in was easy and very self-sufficient, and we were able to leave our bags early or late as needed; would definitely stay again! What a great chance to experience Georgian Dublin!
Great Space in a lovely Place!

Kirans flat is one of a kind and her hospitality is unbeatable. We felt so at ease with her that she feels like a family by the end of our visit. The classically decorated flat has everything we needed: from Mocha pot to handheld blender î and the fridge is filled with goodies like yogurt, milk, eggs, and all kinds of seasonings and sauces upon our arrival. One day we even came home to find a tasty walnut malt loaf on our table! The WiFi signal was a bit weak at first, but upon our request, Kiran promptly replied with an immediate solution, and went so far as getting us a brand new shampoo when she found out we had run out of it. She has the most useful tips for exploring and getting around the city/country too.  Kiran is a hidden treasure and so is her flat. We would definitely stay with her again.

When we arrived, it was late in the evening, but Karin had left us easy-to-follow instructions on how to access the apartment ourselves. The house the apartment is in is beautiful, and the apartment itself is gorgeous as well (that chandelier!) There were three of us, and there was a rollaway bed provided so no one had to sleep on the couch (which is a bit hard, but it matched the aesthetic of the place.) There was also fresh fruit waiting for us in the kitchen, which was a nice touch. The location is unbeatable too. Overall an excellent place to stay for our weekend in Ireland!

We had a wonderful stay at Karin's place in Dublin, and a very warm and easy welcome. The studio is filled with interesting decorative touches and is both roomy and lovely to be in.  It's also a great location to many sites.  Very happy with our experience.
Really nice apartment, but street outside is very busy.
Splendid place.
Karin is a great host. Her recommendations are spot on and she is a prompt and clear communicator. If you rent the flat on the street (number 3), it can be a little noisy.
Great place to stay, beautiful views of the park, amazing space. Loved it.

A lovely spot in a real Dublin neighborhood. The space was beautifully decorated with a library of Irish and Dublin travel books. Loft arrangement was fine for us since we are both under 58ù. If you are 5 10ù or over I might expect some head bumps.  Karin was gracious but responsive and efficient 

Favorite nearby pub was Ned Kellys Hogans Stand. Ask about the sneaky shortcut out the backdoor of the pub!  

Easy to use AirCoach from the airport drops you just south of Parnell street about 10 minute walk away. Take a left and then Slight uphill walk to the park. 

Highly recommend if you want to be out of the hubbub of the Temple Bar etc.

This place is charming and beautiful. We were able to walk to every part of Dublin from here. The giant windows look out into the park, so picturesque! Feels like home. It is a little loud at night, so earplugs recommended.
Karin was easy to communicate with, her space is beautifully decorated and so unique!

A special gem of a place, inspiring and beautifully authentic. The host Karin offers an Irish warmth which removes all the stress of travel and eases you into Dublins culture.  The surroundings will certainly inspire the creatives and romantics.

This is a wonderful place with many special touches:  fragrant lilies in the foyer, beautiful linens and throw on the bed, fruit, eggs, butter, coffee, tea and other basics in the kitchen, and a first-rate library of guide books and Irish novels.  Karin is warm, intelligent, knowledgable and an all-around excellent host.   It's hard to imagine a nicer, cosier place to stay in Dublin.

Such a great and beautiful loft central to everything. Karin is quick to respond and was very helpful with communicating tips and tricks for navigating the city. She also allowed me to drop my stuff off early so that I could explore. The loft itself is beautiful and fully stocked. Perfect for a lovely retreat. Would highly recommend.
Beautiful apartment. Karin was a lovely host. She went over the interesting history of the house, and provided us with milk, eggs, coffee and yogurt. Very thoughtful and appreciated.

The interior of this apartment is very impressive. The amenities, kitchen area, bathroom, and living areas are very nice. Although, it is on a busy street and there is a lot of noise from the cars and many buses that pass by. Karin was very kind and quick in her response and communication between her was good.
