Although, the area surrounding the apartment was mentioned as "safe", we did not feel comfortable walking around on the streets in that area of the city.

Karin's Studio is a lovely place to relax in well -appointed comfort in an authentic  but modern Georgian Dublin townhome.  Everything from the Irish breakfast goodies to the guidebooks , literature and and viewing material were exceptional.  I truly appreciated the fireplace  as well. 
The bed was extremely comfortable and cozy. But, if one is a light sleeper, ear plugs are recommended  as the single pane glass (historical ordinance) does little to block out the road noise.  
That aside, it is a beautiful, historical and cozy, romantic abode.

Lovely apartment and walking distance to O'Connell Street where the tourist Information centre is located. Connolly Station is also close by and we took the DART train to Howth (25 min journey) a pretty seaside village with a great selection of fish restaurants. The  apartment is located on a busy road and with the single pane windows you will hear road noise.
Beautiful space with great amenities and within walking distance from most of Dublin's attractions.

Excellent location, being about 10 minutes from the river and close to lots of local amenities like shops, restaurants and pubs. The space has a cosy but grand feel to it and the facilities in the kitchen are perfect if you want to cook/prepare breakfast; Karin makes sure you have everything you need! Highly recommend for short or long breaks in Dublin.
Karins place was just as described and we had a great stay there. The size was perfect for a couple, and communication was very easy and quick. Would definitely recommend staying here!

It's a cozy flat where there's a bed upstairs for 2 and a cot for another person. The location is amazing! Pubs and great food already within 5 minutes of walking and the city center starts about 10 minutes from the flat.

Fabulous gem! Everything we wanted and more. Karin has been so helpful from the start to the end of our stay. Wonderful breakfast touches, warm home that made us feel so welcome. Cannot recommend highly enough.

The place was spotless, very comfortably decorated. So many extras. The loft is not tall, but neither am I. I slept like a lamb. Super helpful with letting me leave my luggage for a rental car pick-up. Exceeded my expectations.
This place had the perfect location. It was right across from Temple Bar. The place was very clean and neat.
This apartment is bright, spacious and lovely, with all amenities provided! Excellent location and Dardo was a great host, very accommodating and patient with us. I would definitely recommend!

The suite is simple but well equipped if you wish to cook for yourself, good wifi and spacious enough for up to two couples.  Location is about as central as you can get for downtown Dublin.  On a busy road with the road noise subsiding by midnight.  Handy recommendations provided for restaurants, pubs coffee and market/shopping within close walking distance.

Since we did not have our own transportation during our stay here, we were thrilled that it was right across the street from the Hapenny bridge, and all the hot spots were within walking distance.  Just be prepared: being so close to everything does mean a little more street noise at night, but it wasnt so excessive that it kept us awake! The host was fantastic and greeting us upon arrival, and gave several great recommendations.  Would highly recommend this place for those looking for convenience in location.
Amazing location right by HaPenny Bridge and Temple Bar, sparkling clean, responsive and flexible  host!! Thank you!!!

Dardos place was everything it was described to be.   Clean, comfortable, and equipped with all the necessities you may require. The location cant be beat!  In the heart of everything. While there we walked to everything. No need for a car. Dardo was great as well.  Quick to respond and very welcoming upon arrival. Would definitely book with Dardo again!

We really enjoyed our stay in Dublin. Dardo's apartment is even nicer than it looks in pictures and was spotlessly clean. The apartment is within easy walking distance of almost everything of interest. Dardo was really helpful and friendly before and during our stay. Would absolutely recommend.
Great host and location.
This place was chic and in the perfect location in Dublin. Close to Temple Bar but without feeling like youre in a touristy area. Will stay again next time Im in Dublin!

We stayed at Dardo's place for a few nights in April.  The apartment met our expectations and accurately reflected the pictures and description noted on Airbnb.  My wife was escatic to see that there was both a hair dryer and straightener in the bathroom.  Dardo quickly answered our questions and was able to accommodate an early check-in request, which was a huge help.  His recommendations for restaurants and pubs were great.  The apartment's location was awesome and was in walking distance to everything.  We would definitely stay at Dardo's place again in the future.

Location, location, location. Darios apartment is a spacious modern space with high ceilings and room to spread out and relax. After a few minutes my wife said  if this place had a drier and washing machine it would be perfectù  2 minutes later she opened a cupboard door to find a hide hole with both. We will be back.
This is a great location. Spacious, stylish, useful room.

Dardos apartment is perfectly located and really beautifully designed. Super spacious and secure, very clean and with all amenities it really is special. We would highly recommend for a long weekend in Dublin!
Great
You can't beat this location! Close walk to everything in Dublin! The apartment was comfy and has everything you need for your stay.
Dardo was a fabulous host. Very courteous and his place was a perfect base to explore Ireland

Dardo is an expert host, his apartment and hospitality are superior. If you are looking for an urban vibe in the center of Dublin with all amenities then this is your spot. Dardo was excellent at communicating and provided all we could ask and more.

Our first stop in Ireland was fantastic. Dardo's apartment had everything one needed. Our family of 3 were very comfortable. Location can't be beat! Beautiful views!!! Very clean! Local suggestions were wonderful! Convenient for walking everywhere and right on the bus line. We particularly liked The Merchants Arch, right across the river. Live music and fun atmosphere. Thanks for making our first trip to Ireland so welcoming!

Dardos home was great for our short stay in Dublin. Fantastic location and great communication from Dardo, the street youre on is quite busy and made sleeping at night a bit challenging, but other than that very nice.

Location is perfect!  Just across the hapenny bridge from Temple Bar with a great view!  Dardos space is trendy and clean. A vast supply of travel books to read and the basic amenities one may need. Communication was quick and friendly. We stayed with our kids and they were comfortable on the futon sofa bed.  I highly recommend staying here for your time in Dublin!

I booked the apartment because we were going to a concert. I didnt get to stay there in the end because I had to work but my brother enjoyed it. He said Dardo was nice and friendly, and the accommodation was clean and tidy, with lovely views.
Fantastically central location & stylish space.  Would definitely stay here again!
Dardos apartment was in a brilliant location, safe, super clean and comfortable; and he was extremely helpful. We loved our stay.

This flat has absolutely everything you might need for a trip to Dublin. Incredible, perfect location. It is literally steps away from the Hapenny Bridge and walking distance to loads of pubs, restaurants, and attractions. Stylish and unique space with lots of room for two. The bed was comfy and windows let in lots of natural light. Dardo was a fantastic host - quick to respond, very helpful, and gave us great tips for enjoying the town like a local. If were ever in Dublin again we would absolutely stay here again.

Dardos place is in a PERFECT location. He communicates with renters well and met us at the place at checkin to make sure we had everything we needed. The place is very clean and within walking distance of everywhere in Dublin.
Dardo's place was very clean and welcoming. He was very helpful and it was a great place to stay after landing in Dublin.

Dardo is a wonderful host! From the very beginning he was warm and welcoming, offering many suggestions of how to get to places and things to do. His apartment is clean, spacious, and right in the heart of the city. We could not have asked for a better experience. We will definitely try to book again when we come to Dublin I think the future!

Fantastic studio apartment with views over the haùpenny bridge and river, lots of bars,cafe restaurants and a mini mart right on doorstep, Very central - nice area, Would suit couples or a couple with younger children who dont mind the very adequate pull out sofa bed,  Very good apartment & would definitely stay again, Dardo was great to do booking with

Our family of four stayed in the unit for three nights. We loved the style of the flat and everything was very clean. Dardo was responsive and helpful with suggestions. In addition to being a nice space, the location is just phenomenal. It was fun to watch the Ha'penny bridge as it changed in character and pedestrian traffic at different times of the day. It's right outside the window. We greatly appreciated being on the far side of the River Liffey from the more hectic Temple Bar area, but having the activities there and the sights at Trinity College only a couple minutes away by foot over the bridge. Within a block or two of the flat, there are lots of places to find food (restaurants or groceries), coffee, drinks and other more specialized shops that may interest some (a gaming store, a health food market, a Hawaiian poke shop(!), all within half a block). It is a fairly busy corner, but it quiets down at night and generally we did not have any problems sleeping. Overall, a great central spot for exploring Dublin by foot. Highly recommended!
Great place to be
Dardo was very accommodating and responsive, and the apartment was lovely - nice and clean, had everything we needed, and is in a great location!
Dardo's place was well maintained, stylish and very comfortable. It is in a perfect location. Dardo is a delight to work with.

This place was absolutely incredible. The apartment was spacious and clean, the location was close to everything! We were able to walk to St. Patricks Cathedral, O Connell Street, Temple Bar area, Trinity College, and the Guinness Storehouse (that was the farthest, about 25min walk). HaPenny Bridge is literally right outside the window. Not necessary to rent a car if youre staying here. The bus to catch a tour to the Cliffs of Moher was within walking distance too! 

Dardo was an excellent host, he met us at the Spire on OConnell Street, helped with luggage, and made great recommendations for places to eat around the apartment! I would recommend him to anyone. It was our first Air BNB experience and it wont be the last thanks to amazing first impression.

Excellent place to stay! Very close walk across the bridge to temple bar and other great pubs! Beautiful view of Hapenny bridge and the water. Apartment was very clean inside and spacious! Dardo was very quick to communicate as well. Would definitely recommend!

Great location. A little noisy at night but this is to be expected based on location. If you are looking for a quiet relaxing stay I suggest leaving Dublin and finding a country stay. If you want to explore Dublin with hop-on hop-off, shopping, etc then this place may be adequate.
We would definitely recommend staying here, great location and Dardo was a wonderful host.

Fantastic apartment in a fabulous location. Our host was wonderful and helped us not only locate the apartment but assisted with some tips for Dublin generally. 
The apartment is a little noisy at night, but that cant be helped due to the bustling location.
Otherwise, we highly recommend this apartment.
We had a wonderful time at Dardos apartment. The position was perfect for easy access to all the sights. I would recommend this to all travellers

Really enjoyed our stay at Dardo's .Very central ....Beautiful views ! Busy area ! Enjoyed sitting at window watching the world go by ....

The place is very nice and in adequation with the pictures. The location is absolutely perfect, near all the shopping centres, main streets and touristic areas. 

Dardo was great in receiving us even though we arrived later than planned. The apartment was clean, comfortable and very pleasant to stay in.

Dardos loft was beyond amazing. You absolutely cant not beat this location, right in the heart of Dublin, we were able to walk everywhere with no problem. I can not recommend this place enough!!

Great location, all accomodation in the appartment, Alison is nice.
Loved staying in Alison's place! Beautiful apartment, amazing views, and a great location for exploring Dublin. Would definitely recommend!

Everything was fine. Good communication, easy check in, a very nice host and a quiet and tidy room with a very comfortable bed.

Alwyns place is very comfortable and in a great location.

Alwyn is such a great host with great local tips for things to do. Her cute little dog Jake was also very welcoming! The location is at the Blessington Basin which is a beautiful park. Alwyns flat is right next to a delightful park, in a central enough part of town to walk to most places pretty easily and quiet enough to keep your windows open at night. Alwyn is very clear and hospitable, she even made me breakfast!

Alwyn was a great host. She was quick to reply to all the messages I sent her and carefully explained everything I needed to know once I arrived. She also helped me find the Airport Express Bus information that I needed. Her home is in a lovely residential part of town but only about a fifteen-minute walk to the center. 
She made me coffee before I left and offered me Irish bread and butter.
Alwyn is an excellent host very informative regarding suggestions as to what to do during your stay,nice lady and nice clean house in a nice part of Dublin very cute dog Jake. Highly recommended
This is a great location and a most helpful host. Room and bed were very comfortable. Highly recommended. Thank you Alwyn ( and Jake, the dog)

Alwyn is an excellent host and I felt very comfortable and at home as soon as I walked through the door and she introduced herself. The room is lovely and I had two great nights sleep there. I couldnt recommend this place enough for a visit to Dublin. Ill definitely go back next time I come to the city. Its around a 10 minute walk to the centre of Dublin.

Getting to the address:
When you leave the airport go to the bus park. The bus park/station is broken down in to zones that are clearly marked up. Go to zone 15 and get on the number 16 or 41 bus - the buses are very frequent. I got on the number 16 bus - get off at the stop named Fredrick Street it is the stop after the junction of Fredrick Street North/Blessington Street. The bus is 3/4 Euro and you need the exact change. 

Getting to the airport:
Walk to Rotunda, Parnell Square West - which is 8 minutes from the Alwyns. Get on the number 16 bus - exact change needed again (3/4 Euro). The bus goes to T1 and T2 at the airport and takes around 30/40 minutes.

Alwyn is a wonderful host and her place is in the perfect location if you are looking to explore downtown Dublin by foot. A short walk to great pubs, restaurants and sightseeing but far enough that you will be able to get a quiet nights sleep. Alwyn and her pup were so welcoming and the breakfast was delicious! Highly recommend for solo travelers looking to explore the area!!

Alwyn's place is fab - it's perfect for the single traveller. Located quite close to the city centre, with bus and Luas literally a couple of blocks away - it's quite easy to access. Alwyn is a lovely host - very welcoming with a calm easy manner - I was in my room, knowing where everything was in the house and how to use it within minutes of my arrival. The room itself is great - plenty of space and huge light from 2 big windows. The single bed had proper linen sheets, excellent pillows and a wonderful cozy duvet. Although the house itself is fairly small, my room was perfectly private and quiet. Jake, her wonderful terrier, is a complete joy. Over breakfast, Alwyn and I discovered we had friends in common - I left feeling like we'd known each other for years - thank you Alwyn, I'll def be back!

My only regret is not staying here longer! Alwyn made my first trip to Ireland a pleasant one. Her home is in a quiet neighborhood that is about a 10-15min walk to O'Connell Street (or you can take the bus that goes halfway). Very nice person, who made me breakfast every morning and was lovely to talk to. I can definitely recommend her!
Super gelegen.  Alwyn ist sehr hilfsbereit und gibt gute Tips.

Alwyns home was perfectly located right near the city center. I enjoyed my stay so much and wished I could have been there longer. Would highly recommend a day in Howth and the hike along the coastline! Alwyn was kind and her dog Jake is the sweetest!
A nice stay.

Alwyn was a fantastic host that made sure at all times that I felt comfortable. This includes, among other things, flexible check-in/-out times, tips for food and drinks around the area and breakfast in the morning! I had a pleasant time during my stay in Dublin, thanks to Alwyn!
Alwyn is a great host and very kind. I felt very comfortable in the space and I would stay here again.

Alwyn's room was clean and cozy. Alwyn is a lovely lady and it was a pleasure to be hosted by her. She even made breakfast for me in the morning. The area is nice and quiet and the bus stop was about 5 minutes away on foot. There is a beautiful pond with swans and ducks right by her house where you can enjoy the view. Food places and pubs are a couple minutes away. Would definitely stay here again.
Thanks to Ms. Alwyn,Ireland becomes my favorite country.
Excellent location and great hospitality, would absolutely stay there again.

Alwyn has a welcoming presence the moment you step into her home. Both Alwyn and Jake, her lovely Jack Russel terrier, give great company and reassurance, and truly are great, superhosts! Alwyn's home reminded me of a cottage on the beach. It gave a very down-to-Earth feel and made you feel at home. The bedroom is spacious and having a one of the windows open gives a nice breeze. The bathroom is on the other side of her home, so be sure to bring a torch so you can find your way during the night. Her home is very centralised in the Dublin City Centre. You can get just about anywhere by foot which is really nice. For every where else, purchase a Leap card for ‚Ç¨5.00, you can continuously top-up the card with more Euros as you need. There are no public toilets in Dublin, so do keep that in mind when you are planning your day trips into the city. If taking a ferry, plan to take a local cab to Irish Ferries and book your ticket over the phone if you are able. There are so many lovely parks close by, like St. Steven's Green and Trinity College. If you enjoy rock climbing, there are several places in town to explore. I set out on the Gravity Climbing Centre and it was excellent. Great staff and lovely company. If you love to read or just want to experience an eccentric bookstore and secondhand book exchange, then (Website hidden by Airbnb) is your place. I would almost go back to Dublin to re-experience it all over again. Overall, my experience in Dublin was wonderful. And I know that I will be back there in the future, and most likely with my mum. Thank you for being such great company, Alwyn and Jake, and for making Dublin a wonderful home away from home.

Alwyn is an outstanding hostess with a lovely home. She offered me tea as I arrived, gave me all the information I needed about transportation and things to do in the city, and even made breakfast in the morning! Her home is clean and comfortable. I highly recommend Alwyn to anyone considering a stay in Dublin.

Alwyn gave me wonderful hints for sightseeing/Irish folk music/dining. Her house is wonderfully placed in a calm and pretty area, so close to the center that I had everything in a walking distance. I enjoyed my stay with her (and her sweet little terrier) immensely.
a nice room, a nice host family, quiet environment, gladly come again

Alwyn's place was a great place to stay in Dublin! I had stayed a longer time in Dublin at a different Airbnb and only stayed at Alwyn's place one night after traveling in other parts of the country and before flying out the next day. It's pretty well located -- right next to a nice park and maybe a 15-minute walk from the main downtown area of O'Connell Street. There are also plenty of restaurants nearby if you don't want to venture as far. I didn't spend a whole lot of time in the house itself, but Alwyn was very responsive to messages and was nice enough to let me drop off my bags earlier than the stated check-in time. The room was comfortable and the bathroom is a shared one, located downstairs off of the kitchen. This is Alwyn's house, so you should not expect hotel-like accommodations, but it was a comfortable stay and a great base for exploring the city. There's also a lot of wonderful artwork around, much of it done by Alwyn herself. Her dog, Jack, was also very cute and friendly. Alwyn gave me some good recommendations for places to go in the city and cooked a light breakfast in the morning (a softboiled egg and toast with butter or jam). It was a short trip, but I'd definitely stay there again if I'm ever visiting Dublin!
Terrific spot to stay in Dublin but not smack in the middle of the city. Loved the ability to walk one way and find some quant sights and spots to eat, or the other to hit the city Centre.

Alwyn's home provides the bare necessities- a great place to stay if you are only there for a day or two.
Other comments where quite accurate. The room is great, the area is great and Alwyn is helpful.

I had a great stay here. Alwyn was a super nice and relaxed host. She catered for my late checkin and even made me toast and eggs in the morning before she left! The place was clean and I was given enough privacy. It is about 15-20 mins walk to the main sights but a bus can be taken instead. I loved how the Basin was just outside! Really nice. I stayed during the colder months but the place was nice and warm and Alwyn even had an electric blanket on the bed.
Very close to center and quiet place

Quiet community near the blessington street park.Good location with a lots public transport around the place. 
Alwyn also a friendly host,provide a lots of useful advices to me. Really helpful.
The place is located in a quiet residential area. Alwyn is a great host, easy to talk. The room is basic, but spacious, located upstairs. It was an excellent stay!
Alwyn is a great host, it was very easy to communicate with her and she wait for me although I arrived very late in the night. The room is confortable, so I really suggest it
Cozy little room a bit north of the city center. Alwyn and her pup are great hosts and she was super helpful and accommodating during my stay. Definitely recommend staying here.
Lovely - absolutely recommend
Alwyn was a great host! She offered tips about where to visit in the city, made breakfast, and even let me check in early. Great location within walking distance to city centre.

Alwyn ist nur zu empfehlen
sie hat den Titel Superhost verdient

Alwyn (and her adorable jack russell Jake!) made me incredibly welcome in their home. The room was clean and cosy with plenty of space. Alwyn made me a wholesome breakfast to start my day, and had helpful suggestions of points of interest to visit. The location is excellent - an easy walk or bus to the centre, and has a number of great restaurants and cafes nearby. Would wholeheartedly recommend!

Incredibly warm and welcoming hosts. James and Tom made our stay in Dublin much better. The breakfast was delicious and the room was beautiful! The location is great, its a 15-20 min walk from the city center and 2 minutes walk from the main road where you can catch a taxi. 
Tom and James were very helpful throughout our stay,  we could not have asked for better hosts!
Immer wieder gerne

James and Tom are very kind-hearted people. Their hospitality was so great that we felt so very welcome the minute we walked through the door to this beautiful house. 15 minutes walk to the center. You can park the car in the street in front of the house. The tips Tom and James gave us made our trip to Dublin just perfect. We highly recommend this location if you want to have a great "home" for your vacation in Dublin. We definitely would come back!

Tom and James were a delight! Incredibly charming and fun to chat with, not to mention the amazing space. They went above and beyond in giving us a ride to pick up our car at the impound after it had been towed, and gracious about it to boot. The location is ideal, the room lovely, literally the best bathroom in all of Irelandîand the showerîwow! Im going to try to figure out how to get that water pressure!

Highly recommend. Will definitely look them up next time Im in Dublin.

Tom and James are the loveliest hosts we've had the pleasure of staying with. They're home is as warm and cozy as they are. Breakfast was great and we even got to go to a local place for a delicious breakfast with Tom on our last day. We also had the best sleeps while staying here - great bed and room! We would DEFINITELY recommend others stay here. Thank you, James and Tom!
James and Tom are hosts in the original spirit of AirBnB. They made us feel welcome to their beautiful home, gave us good tips to the area, and we enjoyed talking with them.
Really welcoming folk. We arrived with bicycles in bike boxes - something new for Tom & James. We'd recommend them to all as very friendly hosts. We will be back for sure!

The stay with Tom and James was delightful and thoroughly enjoyable. They are true gentlemen as well as charming and thoughtful hosts who are generous w their time and energy. Their home is well appointed, very comfortable, including their lovely backyard. When I come back I will certainly revisit staying w them again.

Our stay with James and Tom exceeded all expectations. Their beautiful home is perfectly situated in Phibsborough; walking distance from many different food options, stores, etc.  It is also within close proximity of Dublin city centre. All parts of their home, including the shared living spaces were meticulous. James and Tom went out of their way to make us feel at home-they provided a light breakfast as well as great traveling tips. 
We would highly recommend a stay in their home and hope to be back. Thank you James and Tom!
We really liked staying with Tom and James. It¬¥s a lovely house in a good location.  Very welcoming and easygoing. We do reckomend!

Our time with Tom and James (and Misty, their cat) was a unique one. Aside from friends and family, this is the first time weve experienced a host offering to eat breakfast with his guests. So its a great time to get to know someone who lives there. The place is in a quiet neighbourhood where you can feel at home in. Their backyard has a little garden that feels like a world of its own. So you can take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city. But getting to the city centre is literally a short bus ride away, and its also located within walking distance of a LUAS stop. Even though our stay in Dublin was only a few days, it was rich enough that it makes us want to return to get more out of the place!

James and Toms home was very comfortable, clean and welcoming. It is located a short bus ride from OConnell Street and there are eating places near by.  Check in was easy and uncomplicated. Tom and James made us feel at home and were delightful hosts. I would highly recommend their home.
James and Tom are very nice,  helpful,  good suggestions where to go.  I do highly recommend.  We spent there a very nice time.

From the moment we were greeted at the door, we knew our stay would be wonderful. James and Tom are very hospitable as well as great people to chat with over a beautiful breakfast that they  served. The accommodations were clean and the bed and linens so very nice. Great location, a 20 minute walk into downtown OConnell street and all that Dublin has to offer.  Would definitely return to stay here again.

We stayed in September 2019. James was not there but we met Tom! It was not just a stay at their place as Tom welcomed us very friendly and took time to chat with us, gave us tips for dublin and was just so kind to us. The place was very clean and looked like the photos. The breakfast was really nice! The city centre is not far away so you can walk or take the bus.

We had really good and interesting conversations with Tom. He made our first Irland Trip very special. Thank you for that!

If you want to have more than just a place to stay you should go to James and Tom. We would definitly stay with them again!

Cindy and Jonas
James and Tom are great hosts, in a beautiful and well located house. This is my second stay with them and would recommend this home without hesitation.

Tom and James are very congenial hosts. We thoroughly enjoyed their company and our stay with them. Their recommendations re pubs, eating and activities were spot on.  The bus into the city is conveniently close, but its also an easy walk. Breakfasts were lovely.

James&Toms house is located in a quiet neighbourhood that is in a walkable distance from city center (30 min). There are nice restaurants, pubs, shops in a 5 min radius and bus&tram stops nearby. 
We spend almost a week at James&Toms place and we felt like being accommodated by distant family. They were helpful, welcoming and chatting to them about the world couldn¬¥t be easier. The house itself is lovingly decorated, has nice and spacious rooms and the breakfast was tasty. It was one of our best stays with airbnb and we would recommend James&Tom to anyone.
Second stay in a week! That says it all. Siobhans hospitality, great location, and comfortable bed make this an easy choice.
A lovely house with great hosts. Really appreciated the beautiful breakfast. Thanks.
Large clean room and en-suite. In a quiet area.
Excellent hosts! Very quiet place and closer to my appointment meeting. Highly recommended.

Thank you so much for having us stay in your beautiful home, such a lovely space and very central, we will definitely stay again should we visit Dublin again. Booking was easy and communication clear, very central accommodation in a lovely area.
Kate was a fantastic host. Very helpful and fast on the communication. Was happy to let us have a late check out also to accommodate the timings with our flight. Great house and great spot.
The location cant be beat. Its quiet, but close to everything.
Stayed at Alison place for nearly 6 weeks. Nice place, good coffe, short distance walk to everything. Good place!
The best spot to stay. Everything was so close by. Also, the best view of Dublin. It made my first time visiting Ireland so memorable.

Unfortunately, my stay at Alisons place didnt start off well. When I got to the apt, which was not so easy to find, the concierge told me that there were no keys left so I couldnt get in although I was told beforehand that I can arrive at any time î and I was even late for the official time as stated in the profile. Alison was on vacation so the communication took some time. It came out that the cleaner completely forgot. After 2.5 hrs I finally had the keys. After this unfortunate start, I had a nice stay at this place. Great view from the loft, great location. Hope the key issue was only a one time thing :)
A wonderful time! Alison is very kind and will answer any questions you have. I got sick on my trip and she was very generous, telling me where the nearest clinic and pharmacy was.
Great place to stay. Very nice and welcoming host. Great tips for bars and places to go. Highly recommended
Great host and location, recommended!

Lovely place, Alison was just wonderful, welcoming, very warm person and easy-going. 
The location was perfect and the view from the apartment is just stunning.
Great location, great view, great host!

Walkable to just about everything! trinity university, Christchurch cathedral, Dublin castle all within a few blocks. Dave gave us some great food recommendations. the room was just what we had hoped for and a great bargain for the location.

Dave is a superb host. He provides plenty of insight on the city of Dublin and ensures you won't run out of things to do. The place was in a perfect location, being in the Temple Bar area, yet just outside to be quiet. I would recommend Dave's place to anyone!

A friend and I stayed here for St. Paddy's weekend, and we had an amazing time! We rocked up with no plans and no prior knowledge on what to do in Dublin, so we followed Dave's (extensive and detailed) advice and we feel we really got the best out of it :) Top marks!

Daves place is simply perfect! Right in the heart of temple bar and within walking distance of most shops and food places. Dave is probably the most helpful host I've ever had! Very knowledgeable about the surrounding area and with helping us figure out local transportation for our trip.
Enjoyed my time in Dublin. Dave is a great host and the apartment is in the perfect location. Would not hesitate to stay here again

I took an airbnb and travel break for a while, but the stay with Dave was the best experience to get back into it. He's an incredibly good host, thinks of all the small details and knows the best spots around town.  We even got to hang out with him at the pub and had a really good time :) All you can wish for and then some - that's a stay here!
Dave was a great host and ensured all lines of communication were open between guests. We enjoyed our stay and the location was great!
Great host! Nice place!
The flat is ideally located, Dave has great tips for his hosts, everything was very smooth
The apartment is just on the edge of Temple Bar, this means it is fairly quiet but within a short walk of all the action

Great spot to stay in Dublin. The location is just perfect. 
The apartment is very nice and we had everything we could need.
Communication with Dave was very easy. 
The fact that we could leave our luggages before or after in the apartment is a great advantage for the travellers. 
The only ¬´¬†disapppointment¬†¬ª was for us about the mattress, which we did not feel really comfortable. (Too soft, but everyone has different expectations on this).
We would be definitely recommend Daves place to anyone!
Cant beat the location for this price.  Dave gave great recommendations for what to see and do, and he was super fast in responding to every question.  Thanks very much, Dave!
Dave is a great man! We got a lot of tipps were we can park, were are good pubs and so on.... The apartment is great :)

The bed was a bit firm but that seems to be pretty common as I'm finding out! There was quite a bit of noise outside until 2am on Friday but it is to be expected... It's temple bar! Very quiet on Thursday. Apartment was very central and great value. We were very grateful for the fan and host left an assortment of helpful things in and around the apartment. We barely saw our flat mate and when we did he was polite and friendly. The host responded quickly to every message as we had flight delays. I'd stay here again.

Dave is an amazing host! He wasnt even in Dublin during my visit but stayed on top of everything and quickly responded to anything I needed from him. This is in addition to very detailed and clear instructions and tips he provided in advance!  The most organized and responsive host I have ever experienced.

Location is superb - right at the edge of Temple Bar and within walking distance to many other attractions. Airport transfer as well as HopOn/HopOff tour bus stop is literally across the street. Area is safe and very lively. 

My room and bathroom had everything I needed. I did not use the rest of the apartment but did notice that the kitchen is fully stocked. It was surprisingly cold in Dublin that weekend and I loved how my room was nice and cool for sleeping but the bathroom always stayed warm.

Initially, we were very excited to stay at Daves place as he gave a long explanations of meet up, check in and things to do in the city. It seemed to be a great deal, location and host but when we got to Dublin that was not the case. We had agreed on meeting at a location not at the Airbnb and the plan was for me to message him when we arrived at the airport so we could plan the timing accordingly. Our plane was slightly late but I messaged him as discussed when we landed. I also messaged him when we got on the bus and were headed towards the meeting location. Then again when at said location. This was over a span of two hours without a response. We continued to wait another hour but he never responded. We had a snack at a cafe next door waiting for a response and still nothing. We ended up having to cancel the reservation since we had all of our luggage with us and wanted to make sure we could find a place for the night. It was very disappointing and upsetting that there was no communication so last minute causing us to lose money and a place to stay.
Great place to stay! All important things in reachable distance.
I would highly recommend Dave's flat. The flat has everything u need, and its location is super close to the Temple Bar, which made our trip really easy!!
Had a very good stay at Dave's place. Everything is very well organized. He is taking a lot of care that every guest is perfectly informed about all necessary details
Dave and his colleague are nice people. The place is in a fantastic position and the house is good enough.

What an amazing experience! Dave's place is right in the heart of Dublin. It is primarily located near all the major attractions such as Christ church and Dublin castle. The room was clean and tidy. He made sure you have everything at your comfort and more.... I definitely recommend Dave's place to anyone on a long or short visit to Dublin.
After an initial contact problem shortly before the trip, contact and meeting point were slightly changed. Then everything worked out perfectly. The location of the apartment is great! Thanks Dave!
Amazing space right at the end of temple bar. Easy to find, close to several places in walking distance. Really loved it.

Perfect place for Dublin! A bit expensive, but it's Dublin! The apartment is close to Temple Bar but in a quiet place. The room is large enough and all the apartment is clean. Best communication ever!
Thanks for the cookie jar ;)

The location of Dave's accommodation is absolute magic. You are in the middle of all the action and can catch local transport to anywhere you need to go. Just off the main street at the back of the building so very little noise. Bed smaller than normal double at 130cm wide. Washer and dryer worked very well. TV great. security first prize - after coming from South Africa?? Cosy and very livable space.
Amazing location and nice place.
Although weve stayed with Airbnb hosts many times, weve never encountered a host as thorough and professional yet personable as Dave.

Daves place was comfortable and centrally located.  There was some construction noise and people being loud but thats to be expected considering how close to the downtown we were.  The map he distributes is very helpful.  He went above and beyond to help transport a camera that didnt get unloaded at the airport in Colorado.  Thanks Dave!
Zeker een aanrader. Perfectie locatie en duidelijke uitleg over Dublin. Passie voert de (Website hidden by Airbnb) de hoek leuke wijnbar,Piglet.

Dave's place is perfect for a quick trip to Dublin. As a solo female traveler, I felt completely safe staying there. Dave was great at communicating quickly (even when I asked for the name of a fish and chips shop at 9pm), his check-in was great, and he had a lot of nice touches like tons of recommendations, cookies, filtered water, and hair dryer. The place was a bit small, but tidy and neat, and in a super central location (I never had to order a taxi/Uber the entire time I was there) - in short, a great value for the cost.  You can hear a lot of noise from the street, but that's because it's in the Temple Bar (touristy drinking) area. Even so, it's on the slower/quieter side of Temple Bar, and with some ear plugs, I didn't have any issues. Thanks for a great stay!

Dave is an excellent host, really friendly, helpful and communication was easy. The room was great, very clean, comfortable and Dave even left some cookies which was a really nice touch! The bathroom which I had to myself was extremely clean and had plenty of hot water for a nice shower. The location is perfect if you want to be directly in the middle of Dublin, everything is within a short walking distance. Overall I would highly recommend Daves place.

Dave takes joy in providing just the right touches for those traveling to Dublin. He makes you feel welcome in his home and adds thoughtful touches throughout. A delightful place to stay in the perfect location to Temple Bar.

I would highly recommend Dave's place! Dave is a wonderful host--he sent me an extensive e-mail ahead of time full of travel instructions, places to eat, things to do, etc. Upon arrival he accommodated an early check in for us. He gave us a tour of the immediate area and went over a map of with us, giving us a lot of insight into the area. Many of our favorite places we went/ate were recommended to us by Dave! The location is also superb--anything of interest in Dublin is within walking distance.

My husband and I stayed at Daves place for a couple nights while staying in Dublin, and we are happy we did! It was easy to get to his place from the airport, and many thanks to Dave because he gave such helpful tips from the beginning. When we arrived in Dublin, he was in constant communication with us, met us at the bus stop, showed us how to get into the place and gave us advice on places to see and places that locals really like to go to. He was also available as little or as much as we needed during our stay. We greatly enjoyed the accommodation and it was a great location! I highly recommend.

Great location, steps away from temple bar area, great pubs and local attractions. Dave was incredibly helpful with check in and gave us wonderful tips on what to see. The room was clean and bed was comfortable.

Our stay with Dave was great. The apartment couldnt be in a better location. You can get to nearly every part of the city within 20 minutes. Dave gave us some awesome tips about getting around Dublin and gave us so many spots to check out. He even went out of his way to let us borrow a tripod when we said we wanted to take some photos on the river. Great stay overall!
Perfect Destination, near by a lot of visting points, walking distance, a very polite and helpfull hostman

Dave was great! He collected us and walked with us to his apartment where he took the time to familiarize us with Dublin and some of his favorite spots to tour and eat.  We loved our stay, the room was awesome and the bathroom extremely clean.  We cant recommend this host enough! A+++++!
An excellent host! Can't beat this location. Everything is within walking distance! Place was clean and well organized. We highly recommend the place!
Amazing location, great shower, comfy bed, and spot-on tips on where to eat & drink. Dave is the best. I look forward to returning!

You need to stay here. Dave is amazing. He made everything about our stay in Dublin easy, including meeting us at the bus stop and providing a map of central Dublin area that made navigating to everything we wanted to see easy. 
Little touches like tea and cookies were so thoughtful and we loved checking out his recommendations for food and drinks. 
If you can book this very central location for your time in Dublin, do it! You will not be disappointed. Make sure you check out the Boxty House and the Queen of Tarts while you're there!
Great location. Near all attractions. A great host.  A must stay.

Daves place is wonderful, and he is a great host! He goes out of his to help his guests and is so hospitable. He also provides great recommendations and tips for the area. The apartment is right by Temple Bar area and very central to everything. I would definitely recommend staying here!

Daves place what exactly what we needed, exactly where we needed it. His communication was great, especially the day of our arrival. He was very thorough with his explanations and made us feel at home. He also went out of his way to make sure we found the correct route home, as construction has rerouted all of the local buses. We are happy to stay with Dave again if we ever find ourselves back in Dublin.

Daves place is literally 3 mins walk to all the live music bars etc on temple bar. The accommodation is exactly what you see in the pics with nice little extra touches like tea, coffee & biscuits in your room and even has shower gel/shampoo for you to use in the bathroom . You can use the lounge area however we never bothered as just needed a base and a place to sleep. Dave was a great host , thanks Dave.

Dave did a great job greeting us. He gave us as much space as we wanted but was willing to converse about his community. We had a great trip and the location is close to everything. Get your Irish breakfast at the queen of tarts. Its a minutes walk and they even have yummy gluten free options.

Dave was an all-around excellent host. As soon as we arrived in Dublin, Dave was very responsive and helped us navigate the local bus system to easily find his place. After that, Dave went over a comprehensive map of Dublin with us and provided suggestions of things to do. During our stay, Dave remained responsive while still making us feel like we had the whole apartment to ourselves. Overall, we had a great experience in Dublin and Dave played a large part in that. Thanks Dave!
A helpful and informative host whose main concern was our welfare, comfort and enjoyment.

Dave was a great host, has plenty of excellent tips for all types of travellers. He is very accessible as a host. Place was cozy and location was excellent, we were within walking distance for almost everything we wanted to see and visit. Thanks Dave!

Dave is a wonderful host and knows his way around Dublin. His place is in the perfect location and is close to many restaurants and bars. Dave also has his own map of Dublin that was very useful and had all the best local spots on it. He took the time to show us around and even picked us up from the bus stop. Daves apartment was very clean and had everything we needed.

Daves place is very comfortable and in a great location, accessible to everything.  Both Dave and Dwaine, who was filling in for Dave while I was visiting, were very friendly and helpful, responding to every query completely and very quickly. I would happily stay in Daves apartment if Im ever visiting Dublin again.

Im very disappointed in this Airbnb. We went without water for over half of a day and the person assisting us didnt respond for 8 hours.  I wouldnt stay here again unless the host actually stayed in town for the next stay.

Weve had a great stay at Daves apartment. It is well situated,  downtown, with good attractions in the neighbourhood, nice and clean. We were impressed with all the communication (complete guide) that Dave sent to us. We would definitely come back here
Dave's place is a great location from which to visit Dublin.

What a fun little place this is and a fantastic location. We were able to walk where ever we wanted to go, and even walked our way just about 2 miles to Kilmainham Gaol, which I highly recommend by the way. We picked up a few odds and ends at the Centra in order to make our own breakfast and have some snacks on hand seeing as there is full access to the kitchen. An extra little perk was that we found out the Pixies were in town our last night there and managed to score tickets (to the sold out show!) and the venue was literally about 2 blocks from the apartment!

We had an excellent stay at this spot in Dublin! Great location for airport transport and very close to Temple Bar and Trinity college. We were greeted by Dwaine and had all around great interactions with him and Dave throughout our stay. Would recommend

I stayed at Dave's apartment for 5 nights and it was an amazing first AirBNB experience. Dave and Dwaine were great and kind hosts. If you are going to spend time in Dublin and want to stay in a good location, Dave's apartment is a great choice!
Ideal location,rooms comfortable

I really enjoyed my stay at Daves place in Dublin. The location was second to none, situated close to any restaurants, pubs, shopping, and attractions you could wish to see. His place was clean and check-in/out was a breeze. I did not meet Dave, but his co-host Ivana was prompt and helpful when checking in. I would highly recommend staying here when visiting.

This was perfect for the location to the city centre! Dave and his crew were fabulous at the communications, meeting up, and answering any questions. The flat is pretty hip and the everything was exactly as advertised! Dave's detailed messages were REALLY helpful!! I hope I get a chance to stay at the property again!
Great place! Terrific location. The host was lovely and very accommodating. Would definitely stay again!
Perfect location. 2 bedrooms were great for our family of 4 people. Garrett was very kind answered  fast to all our questions.
Fantastic location in the heart of Dublin! Clean and well appointed. Would stay here again!
We had a fabulous time in to his lovely apartment. Very central yet quiet. Garrett was very helpful and accommodating.
Location cant be beat!  This isnt a quiet retreat; its right in the middle of the city, and its so convenient to all of the local sights.

The apartment is in a fantastic location, and was well appointed, clean, and a really nice space. Garrett was extremely accommodating and went out of his way to greet us, despite a 5 hour delay with our flights to Dublin. We had a great time.

Garret's apartment is as fantastic as it looks -- the location is ideal, being so central and easy to get to (the bus to/from the airport stops practically right in front of it). The building is very secure, and the apartment itself is beautiful -- fully equipped with everything you need. (There were even extra plug adapters in the kitchen cupboards for our electronic devices, which came in quite handy, as we were travelling from Canada!)  We arrived early, well before the official check-in, but Garrett made arrangements for us to drop off our bags and get the keys anyway. And a nice bonus is the Queen of Tarts cafe, right beside the building -- delicious breakfasts and pastries.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Garrett's place to anyone visiting Dublin -- it's a great value!
Great place and an amazing location. Garrett was always available when needed. Thanks so much!

Garrett was super helpful and communicative. We were able to drop our luggage early which was an enormous help. The location was amazing and very clean and organized. Plenty of space for a family of 5.
A perfect place to stay in the Temple Bar area, easy access to any location.
Great location in Dublin.  Host a little slow in responding and host made a bizarre request for me to post a picture if my passport on to my Airbnb profile.

This apartment is perfect for a Dublin City break. It is perfectly situated within city (only a few minutes walk from temple bar), spotlessly clean, and full of amenities. Would highly recommended to anyone.
Perfect Location!  Beautiful apartment! Nice host! We will be back!!!

Perfectly located in the centre of Dublin.  Garrett's instructions were very helpful including how best to get from the airport and the length of time it would take.  We arrived exactly when he said we would! The apartment was perfect for our family, very clean and well-appointed.  Garrett also gave us tips about where to go and how to get to where we needed to.  Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Garrett did a great job communicating the check-in process. Apartment is very well-located if youre going to be out and about in the Temple Bar area. Everything was clean, beds were comfortable. Nice place.
Clean, cozy, and so centrally located. Only spent cab fare to pick up a car in Kilmainham. Perfect for either a first-time visitor to Dublin or a seasoned traveler.
Great location for exploring Dublin. Roomy and clean. Easy entry and nice to have a lift to the 3rd floor!

The last stop on my family's Ireland vacation. We spent two nights at Garrett's place, which as described is about the best location in Dublin for seeing the major attractions. In a day and a half, by walking a couple of loops we pretty much managed to see (and have time to enjoy) all of the biggest draws. The apartment is very secure and the beds and space are comfortable. Garrett is a great host and an amazing communicator providing excellent tips.

Garretts place is in a perfect location for exploring Dublin. Major sites are close by, great restaurants and pubs and an easy walk to supermarkets for any supplies. The flat was a great size for our family of four and the lift was a bonus for moving luggage.

We loved the amazing location in the heart of  Dublin. Everything we needed was in the apartment.
When we had questions about Dublin Garett answered quickly.
We had such a good time!
Great apartment, great location, helpful host, all you could need.

Great flat! You couldnt want for a better location. 

Garrett was super helpful with arranging for us to drop our bags off earlier after an early morning flight.

A great spot right in the heart of Dublin.  Clean, comfy beds. As would be expected from the awesome location, there is some street noise, especially on weekends - so may not be best for light sleepers.  Host was easy to communicate with. I would stay here again.
This apt has all you need in Dublin
A great apartment for our family of 4.  Great central location that allowed us to walk everywhere we wanted to go.

Charming immaculate two bedroom with a nice little kitchen and bathroom.  The location is outstanding with all the best nightlife close by.  There is a fair amount of street noise in the bedroom with two beds... but a fan helps create white noise.
Great place. Great location.
Very central location! Garrett was very responsive to e-mails.  Apartment was clean but could use a refresh in terms of conditioning.

This apartment worked beautifully for us for our days in Dublin. The location was perfect for our plans - we walked most places easily and found everything we needed for meals and shopping within a few blocks.  Our family of 5 was comfortable in the space , and we were not bothered by street noise. A great place to stay if you are visiting Dublin !
Perfect location, would recommend for a short stay in Dublin

We had a great time in Dublin at Garretts Apartment. Our flight had a delay, so we Camera little late for our Check Inn. Garrett waited for us and explained everything. Thank you for your patience.
The location of the Apartment is just perfect. We explored Dublin by feet and had absolutely no problems with long walks etc. 
The Apartment has everything you need. Lots of towels, well equipped kitchen and good WiFi.
We enjoyed every single day and would love to come back one day.
Nice compact flat right in the heart of Dublin's Temple Bar and practically within walking distance of the City's many attractions, historical sights and shopping.
Garrett's description was accurate.  The location was great but a bit noisy but tolerable at times as he had indicated

Garretts place was perfectly located for our stay in Dublin. It is in Temple Bar on a rather busy street so it was a little noisy, but nothing we didnt expect. The furnishings were a little tired, but the place was very clean and had modern appliances. Garrett was very helpful and responsive to all communications.

A very funky apartment in an amazing location. Its full of lovely little details and has everything you need. We had a really comfortable and enjoyable stay. Garrett was a fantastic host, very accommodating and helpful. Highly recommended!
The apartment was great! Easy check-in. Clean. Stylish. Accommodating. Had a wonderful time, and is one of the best options for your money as for AirBnbs in Dublin.

Apartment is in a great location. We loved walking out the door and into the city. Lots of great places to eat and sites to visit within walking distance. There is a washer and dryer in the apartment and other thoughtful touches. It is older and smaller but worth it for the location. The beds are comfortable and the street noises were not bad. There are fans in both rooms that can be used to drown out the noise.
Fantastic location and very responsive host. Definitely recommend.

My husband, sister and I stayed here for 2 nights and honestly we could not have asked for a better location in the city! Garretts place was so convenient and easy to find, a great central point to everything we wanted to be near.

The place was ideal for 3 people, 4 might be the max capacity without feeling too cramped (but honestly when youre in Dublin you never spend much time in your room anyways!) Garrett and his wife were excellent hosts, always willing to help and they were very quick to respond to our messages. 

We hope to come and stay with them again in the near future. Highly recommend you book their place!

Garretts space is accurate to the photos and has so much history. The large sash windows allowed for views and so much light. The location is perfect and security in the building was above expectations.  Garrett was quick to respond to any questions we had and we loved the coffee machine and all the little extras he so generously provided. 
Thank you for a wonderful stay in Dublin. 
Kathy Jocelyn and Erica

Garrett is definitely a superhost! He was very communicative and gave detailed check-in instructions. If you are a history-buff, you MUST stay here!!! (Ask Garrett for his write-up on the history of the building & apartment.) The view from the apartment of city hall and other period buildings were what sold me on this place (and it is definitely worth it!), but it wasn't until after booking that I learned its absolutely amazing history. (If you are a fan of Dublin writers, paranormal fiction, and Irish history, this place is for you!) 

The apartment was clean & stylish yet relaxing after a long day of touring. (The building elevator was particularly appreciated after doing so.) I wanted a place that was walkable to most of the tourist spots yet not in the middle of the craziness of Temple Bar; and its location in the heart of historic Dublin made this extremely easy. And while we did walk to other areas to shop and sight-see, there was so much in the direct vicinity that it was unnecessary to travel far. And although the apartment kitchen was fully-stocked with the essentials, cooking isn't necessary with all the delicious places to eat close-by. I particularly recommend the downstairs bakery, Italian restaurant, and the 100-year old fish & chips shop 3-mins. away on Werburgh St! 

And when it was time to check-out, the taxi stand right across the street made getting to airport in the pre-dawn hours quite simple. [Side notes: While there is an elevator in the building, due to the historic nature of the apartment, the floors are uneven with small steps between rooms, and there is very little area on either side of the toilet. So the place would not be particularly accessible for those with mobility issues.]
Great location...walkable to all the hot spots....Trinity, Guinness, GPO, Temple Bar...
Great place and location! Garrett was very helpful and accommodating.
Second time in row in the same place, I guess you do not need more. Fantastic place, very well maintained, perfect location and a great host.
Maria's home was very nice, clean and cozy. Maria has been very kind. The bedroom was large and comfortable.  Good and quite position. We recommend Maria's home in Dublin!

It's a lovely apartment (or room in this apartment) which is nice decorated and has everything you could need. The location is really great and it has a perfect public transportation connection if needed. The bed is comfortable and there had been a lot of storage space in relation to the room size. I would recommend that apartment to anyone.
Great location with good nearby eats and a near many bus stops to and from.

This place is in a great location and easy to get to as well. Communication with Barbara was great and she checked-in with me during my stay and made some great recommendations. About 15-20 minute walk to the city center.
I would recommend this place for business trips. Very comfy beds, full utilities inside, easy-going host, close to shops and transportation means.
Wonderful spot!

This was our first AirBnb experience. It will be hard to follow! Sarahs home is beautiful, spotlessly clean, stylish but still homely and welcoming!!! Sarah is a great host. We can only recommend this property!

Sarah is a great host. She knows the value of details. She was always ready to help us and at the day we arrived she left us some food. My kids were hungry and tired and this detail made the difference for us.  Thank you!
Beautiful place outside of Dublin with easy access to the city on the light rail.   Wonderful host!

Great location & an amazing place! Close to the Luas & grocery store.  Sarah was also a fantastic host, who answered our questions promptly! No need to hesitate about renting this property, it will not disappoint, it truly is a gem!

Lovely house, stylish and comfortable with everything you need. Fab location very close Dundrum shopping centre for shopping, restaurants and supermarket. LUAS (tram) on your doorstep direct to city centre (we used this daily).
Gorgeous house in a fantastic location. Sarah was very helpful and quick to respond to any questions. Stayed here with my husband and parents - everyone was very comfortable and happy with the stay

This house is a cute escape from reality with the gorgeous amount of natural light and amenities. Sarah is an amazing host who makes herself available whenever needed and provides an amazing tips & tricks booklet that quickly became our bible for finding restaurants/fun things to do. The Luas (tram) is a 2 min walk from the cottage and will easily get you anywhere you desire inside and outside of Dublin at a low cost. Highly recommend taking advantage of this hidden gem!

Sarah was a great host. She helped out with the check-in and give us some transport trips when the light rail was temporary disrupted.

The place is exactly as shown on the pictures, showing a great comfortable and cosi place with design touches at every corner! Definitely a place to repeat. 

Kind regards,
Javier.

Fabulous home with everything you would need. Sarahs attention to detail is fantastic and we really appreciated all the little touches and information provided.  

The location is terrific, with easy access to the large Dundrum Shopping Centre as well as public transport. We tried several of the restaurants recommended by Sarah and they were great.
Absolutely adorable and very close to everything!  A nice mall with lots of shops and restaurants close by. I would definitely come back if in the area again!
Amazingly clean, small touches were above and beyond. Communication was quick and accurate. Location superb. Highly recommend. ‚Ô∏è
Sarahs house is very nice.  We enjoyed our time there. Sarah was extremely helpful and responsive, and she  left a good array of amenities. It was a well stocked kitchen.  No complaints at all.
Sarah's place was an absolutely treat!  Perfect place to wrap our holiday up.  Location was amazing, right beside public transportation, gas station and shops

Sarah is a great host.
However the place is very far away from Dublin central. Its actually in a satellite town Dundrum in the outer suburbs of Dublin being at least 30mins away by car. The trains Luas give accessibility but take time due to traffic conditions on the roads to central Dublin.
The water heating has a recurring issue.
The interiors of the house itself is tastefully done and is a pleasure to live in.
An excellent accommodation in very nice location, easy and quick transport to city center using LUAS, a huge shopping centre walking distance. I would recommend to all.

Beautiful space and gracious host! Sarah was quick with her communication and just as quick with her kindness. She was so accommodating throughout our stay and helped us through an unexpected flight delay.
Gorgeous home.  Wonderful access to Dublin.  Thank you for allowing us to stay!
Sarah has a beautiful home that feels like a sanctuary to rest and recharge.
Very professional helpful and fair.

Sarahs home is a wonderful place to spend time. Its aesthetically stimulating and super cozy at the same time. The location is great, so close to the Luas and Dundrums city center. Sarah is very helpful and thoughtful. Having been to Dublin several times, I was so thrilled to have had a new & unique experience.

We are repeat visitors to Sarahs beautiful home. I honestly dont have any suggestions to improve #3. It is exactly and consistently as shown, spotlessly clean, bright, peaceful and the location is perfect. Easy access to transport, to a super Fast coach service to the airport if needed. DTC shops restaurants minutes away by foot. Lidl! Dealz! Im only Worried that the next time we want to stay it will be booked out. Thank you Sarah.

Great space, awesome host, brilliant location with local / city access. Hugh shopping complex & local shops in walking distance. Great eateries to choose - we loved the Drundrum House Pub!
Highly recommended place to stay - thanks Sarah!

Sarah welcomed us after a long flight and it made a big difference in making us feel comfortable in our new temporary home. Our little family of four had an incredible week at Sarah's place.  We used the LUAS nearly every day for our adventures and Sarah's place is a short 2-3 minute walk to the station.  The home was spotless, beautiful, and incredibly well-appointed.  We also used Sarah's guidebook for nearly all of our adventures in the area.  Use her thoughtful guide,  it's wonderful!! 

  Simply put, one of the best airbnb experiences we have had thus far.  Highly recommend!

We loved our stay at Sarah's cottage. It is a great location with close access to Dundrum (lots of dining options as well as shopping). It is a very near to the Luas station which is an easy mode of public transportation to get into downtown Dublin or other locations. The cottage is beautiful, well designed with so many stylish and thoughtful elements but it is also practical and comfortable. Sarah was excellent with her communication and flexibility around check-in and check-out times. Would definitely recommend staying here and we would love to go back and stay again!

Absolutely five stars from us. Sarahs flat is charming, spotless, and cozy. Sarah has been an outstanding host. I highly recommend staying here.

My husband Jack and I just arrived from America and Sarah was very welcoming and helped us get settled and started here in Dublin. She is very thoughtful and responsive. We even had a lovely surprise of treats waiting for us. Super comfy beds and very clean. 

Thanks Sarah!
Great location . Very bright and cheerful space. All the amenities you need.
Excellent location and value for money. Cosy little private house. We loved our first trip to Dublin.

After reading many of Jim's good reviews, I was entirely disappointed in my experience at his unit. Jim provided a deceptive and untrue description of the unit. Remarks that he will not enter unit unless proper notice is given; instead comes inside, unannounced to drop off "shampoo", contacting me after the fact. This is 100%, unacceptable and an invasion of privacy. What if I was in the shower or sleeping? Unacceptable invasion of privacy. 
Boiler is on a timer, and unit was freezing cold 24/7. Small, ancient, unsafe space heater could not be left on due to fear of fire or electrical hazard. Unbelievable that in the cold, Irish winter, Jim would not allow the inadequate heater to run sufficiently. Description stated that Jim is flexible with check-in, however,  after contacting him, he showed no flexibility whatsoever. Linens and towels were stained and did not seem sanitary. Washer & Dryer are on a remote timer, Jim tries to force the occupant to pay extra to wash clothes when the equipment is already there and available to use. WIFI coverage was borderline unusable on my mobile, with constant drops and disconnections. The only useable connection would be if I held my mobile by a window. A WIFI repeater is needed to maintain a good connection in the unit. Jim's frugality has severe repercussions on the unit's viability.

Great spot for a weekend stay in Dublin during St. Patrick's weekend. We loved having a little kitchen area to cook a meal, and the bed was much more comfortable than we expected a fold out to be. The walk to the train station is less than 10 minutes, which was very convenient.

The place is tucked back off the street and very private. You can come and go as you like. Its so near transport , the sea and shops close by. Its really all I needed. All the things for cooking, and nice big tv. 
I highly recommend this getaway casbah
A lovely stay; it was a pleasure to meet Jim and he was a lot of fun, many happy returns.
Own studio with bathroom. Nice for a short stay near Dublin (35 minutes transport to the centre)

Jim had everything set for us when we arrived. Private little studio outside of his place with all the amenities you could need. Met us with a smile and recommendations for fun things to do nearby. Great location and very comfortable! We had such a lovely visit. Would stay again.
Clean, convenient and comfortable - it was easy to get to Dublin centre and the room was perfect for what we needed

The place is located in a very neat and green park-like neighborhood, but its like half an hour by DART from the city centre and DART doesnt work at night, so youll have to take a cab which will cost more than 20‚Ç¨ if youll need to get back at night. The place is fine, and its great that travel adaptors were available. Of cons, the floor is really cold and no house slippers were available to help manage that. The bathroom is a little cold too, Im guessing some people will find issues with taking a shower there.

I'll write out a list of pros and cons for both your own discernment as well as a subtle nudge for Jim and his snazzy lil den.
We never met Jim so all our interactions have been purely virtual. Having said that, he seems like a reasonable, friendly fellow, and everything's been straightforward. He was kind enough to have laid out a crib for our arrival, as I had mentioned we have an infant, and his was one of the places listed that was baby-friendly. We stayed for two nights in early May.

PROS
ìCrib
As mentioned, the place is generally infant-friendly, without sharp objects or scratchy surfaces. Jim is kind enough to supply a crib, however I found that one of the crib walls kept collapsing/wouldn't 'snap' into place, so we ultimately couldn't use it. We did use the crib's mat for the baby, as that helped protect them from the cold of the floor.
ìPrivate, Quiet, Clean
Cozily tucked in a driveway in suburbia, it's quiet and calm. Which suited us as we have a crying baby. It was also pleasantly clean, though the bins could do with bags.
ìLidl
This is probably one of the best features of this place. Lidl is about a 12 minute walk, which gets you outside and from where you can stock up on preparing your meals for your travels. Also, the wider transport (train) link to Dublin city centre is very easy to get to, and a similarly short walk away.
ìResponsive host
I had a question about drinking water, and texted Jim at some ungodly hour. He responded to me once he got up early the next day, cheerfully. It was nice to be able to contact him and get a pretty immediate response for any queries we had.

And now, the cons...

CONS
ìFloor
The floor, as mentioned by other guests, is very cold; and you can't walk around barefoot for too long without having to put on some socks (which then causes you to slip). A rug would go far, and/or those disposable white slippers you sometimes get at fancy hotels. We stayed in early May, which is Spring.
ìWi-fi
As mentioned by others, the wifi is poor. If you're coming from the UK, 3 allow you to roam without having to buy an add-on, so we weren't too affected. But a wi-fi signal booster would be well-suited, particularly foreign travellers without mobile data.
ìCleaning fee
The cleaning fee was just over ¬£20, which I think is steep. I suspect it's a way to recuperate rent income whilst being able to list the property's rate competitively.
ìMugs
Would be nice if the place had bigger mugs!

MISC
ìWater
No kitchen taps. This isn't such a big deal. I'm only pointing this out because the description lists 'kitchen', which can make you think that those would be included. Whilst you certainly are able to cook, I was under the impression that there would be taps in the kitchenette area. The bathroom taps do deliver drinkable water, however.

This fully equipped studio apartment, where I stayed for 6 days, is a fantastic place to enjoy Dublin and the surrounding area. With the Dart, a 5-minute walk from the studio, you can reach the city in 20 minutes. Within 10 minutes you are in Sandycove on the coast where you will find various shops and restaurants.
Jim and his wife provide you with all information regarding Dublin, surroundings, restaurants etc if you want. 
Many thanks for making me feel at home at your apartment.
Very clean and safe
Super :)

Place was clean and tidy. Jim was very nice with a lot of great information about the area and suggestions about what to do while in town. Great location, close to the train station and easy access into Dublin.

A very nice, clean and comfortable place. Ease of checkin-checkout was incredible!
Highly recommendable!

We were at Jim's place for 10 nights, and it worked out very well. He and Virginia are quite nice and helpful. The location is excellent-- in a lovely, convenient neighborhood near the metro that goes into Dublin. The internet was spotty, so people dependent on the internet might want their own connection. As fo us, we had a great stay.

My husbanda and I booked Jim's place for our first 2 nights in Ireland. It was very easy to get there from the airport and we walked to the Indian restaurant up the street which was delicious. Three DART station is within walking distance and was very easy to navigate. The room itself had all the basics needed for a comfortable stay and we enjoyed being a bit outside of the city. We walked just a few minutes to the aircoach bus on our third day to get to our rental car. All in all Jim made everything super easy and was quick to respond to any questions we had about getting around.
My daughter really enjoyed her stay here.

So this place is tiny, but if you look around, you should find everything you need.  Jim was a great resource for local events.  The neighborhood is very nice, with good restaurants and and groceries available.  It's also within walking distance to a beautiful promenade along the harbor, and perhaps best of all, the train station is only a few blocks away.  Driving around downtown Dublin is not recommended.
Nice cozy place in a really good neighbourhood. Good choice if you are lone traveller.
Great place and good price
You will have a lovely clean space in a great area within walking distance to all you need
It's a little nice  appartment. We  have verry felt  confortable.
Awesome space n location
Great little place to stay for 2 people
Great place for lone travelers!
Excellent stay in such a nice neighbourhood

Great location about 20 minutes by train outside of the city center. Lovely home and host is very quick to respond to messages. The town the house is in is also great - we enjoyed several of the restaurants after site seeing in Dublin all day!

What Jim presents is exactly what you get - and a little more. He was very helpful upon my arrival and getting situated. If you have questions or recommendations he has a lot of answers, (Maybe not all, but no one does!) It was exceptionally easy to get around on transport and see the many sites while I visited my conference. (Took a couple extra days!) The quietness of the area is amazing! Unless you need city sounds to sleep, you will sleep like a baby! There is a great grocery store nearby and most everything really is within a 10-minute walk from the place. (I am a fast walker!) Enjoy your stay here, I did!
Great studio apartment, I was in Dun Laoghaire for the Ironman and the location was absolutely perfect. Jim was very flexible with my check out, which was very much appreciated. Highly recommended!!
Everything was perfect!
Very helpful host and location both for Dublin and coast was excellent

We had the most amazing time staying in this bnb. It's a small studio but it's absolutely PERFECT for two people. Jim is a fabulous host. The space is super clean, well organized,  has great amenities, a book with tons of information regarding restaurants, public transportation, etc.
Would stay again!
Jim was a fantastic host! He was very friendly and helpful all the way around. We loved our stay here!

Anne-Marie and Sam offer a tranquil paradise in beautiful, wooded rural surroundings but also near to Dublin city and the Dublin Mountains.
The house has a warm ambience of family life, art and nature, and you can expect a very warm and personal welcome.
Amazing host,extremely helpful and went out of her way to make sure we had a great stay
A warm welcome awaits in a lovely family home in the countryside very close to the M50 and with easy access to the city. I was there for one night on a work trip and would definitely be back.

Yet again, a great Air B&B experience was had by all of our team staying and working at the very friendly Rathfarnham House belonging to Ann-Marie & Sam, whos jewel of a place, which has both beautiful grounds and a wonderfully cosy living space, left us with a very happy experience across the board!
Kind Regards
Mel & The Peninsula Team.
La estancia y el alojamiento fueron maravillosos y Sarah estuvo atenta de todo en todo momento

Sarah is a wonderful host. She was very warm and welcoming and provided us with great information. Her home is beautiful and in a great location. Its so easy to travel into the city on the light rail and  traveling to and from the airport via bus was very easy. Absolutely loved staying in her home!
Wonderful place great location.
Quiet room with en-suite.
Roy is very kind, gentle and helpful. It was nice to talk with him and he got a lot of ideas what you can do in dublin :)
