Only problem was the bed , very uncomfortable but again for the price and you own place its something you would expect
Very quiet and well located!

Hi Amanda! 
Thank you so much for the weekend! We thoroughly enjoyed staying at your place! It was cute and comfortable, having read a couple of reviews about the uncomfortable sofa bed we were a bit apprehensive however we had the best sleep (might have been because we didnt stop all weekend)! 
The addition of the bikes was great and we made good use of them on a long cycle to the local fishing village on the Sunday! 
Although a note was left about only having a short shower, I managed to wash my hair when I needed without getting a surprise attack from ice cold water!
There were enough plates and cutlery and the cooking facilities were ample! 
A quick response to any queries was received! 

Overall a lovely first stay in Ireland! Thank you very much!

Amanda and Paul's place was great! They have a ton of information about the studio and things to do around Ireland. The amenities were great for our stay and there is street parking for people that are driving. There is negative reviews of the bed but there is extra bedding we used to make it more comfortable. Overall It was a great stay!

Our stay at Amandas appartement was good. The late checkin and checkout were great and fast. Sadly the tv wasn't really working. The appartement is very close to the airport, but it takes a while to go to the city center. All in all we were happy to chose this appartement because it had all we needed and was very close to the airport.

Location is further afield from Dublin than anticipated, however we had to cut our holiday short due to unfortunate circumstances so cannot comment much. The house was easy to find, a little hard to get luggage round the side gate past the oil tank.
Lovely place and lovely hosts...everything was working and had help when I needed. Very clean and well located. I definitely recommend

The place was clean and cozy. The transit to get downtown was very easy and available at any time at night. There was a strange sound continuously throughout the night, so if youre a light sleeper I would bring ear plugs. Besides that, the place was good.

Nice small place for a decent price. It is a bit out of town, but its easy enough to get to centre with a bus. Amanda was always quick to respond and help out with wathever we needed. It was a pleasant stay.

A very pretty house, in a strategic position. Easy to get from the airport and also easy to reach the down town in a short time. The description of the house and the services is rather accurate. The owners are available people and the communication is fast. It was a good stay

The place was lovely and only a short bus ride from town. Perfect location for a day trip to Howth and for visiting Dublin. The sofa-bed was comfortable and the kitchen was perfect for what we needed. Nice location, good price, well worth it.
Good place to stay. Clean, in a very quiet zone, near the bus stop for the city centre
Nice Accommodation very cheap and okay for staying few days.
Was a very private room with an attached bathroom, and was a good value for the location. About a 10 minute walk to the train station that will take you to city centre.
really nice place! the room really felt like our own and we were close to the train station and bus stop

I had a great stay in Dublin thanks to Rob and Stef. The room is lovely and is equipped with everything necessary and beyond that. Lots of books, brochures about sights and things to do in Ireland and schedules for trains and busses. Smooth check-in. I recommend this place!
Thanks for everything,
Greetings from germany!
Rob and Stef are really great hosts, the room is lovely and cozy for two people, would love to stay again if we visit Dublin.
Great!
Rob and Steff are really nice and helpful. They made us feel at home with their hospitality. The room was small like seen in the photos but really cosy.
Mooie plek in een van de buiten wijken van Dublin. Goed bereikbaar. Prettige gezellige kamer. Van alle gemakken voorzien.

Everything is perfect accept for the sun to come too early in the room. It would be better if there would be something to keep the room dark in the morning. Bud we were really happy to stay at Rob and Stefs room. Very good bed to sleep and very quiet place and all the book about Ireland and Dublin were  very nice. We would stay again at their house if we come back.

People very friendly and helpful. The place is also very nice but a little bit far from the center. 
I recommend it!
Great spot, good for a couple or 2 people who don't mind sharing a small space. Everything you need!
Rob and Stef are great hosts. Their place is clean and easily accessible to the city centre. We will definitely stay again and highly recommend them to others.
Sean was friendly and accommodating. The apartment is at an unbeatable location for spending time in Dublin!
Location, and hospitality cant be beat!  Great guys, easy check in and check out.  So close to Grafton Street & City Center.

Very nice host and convenient location 
Will be better if there is a bin in the room
Room was little small but sufficient for 1 person. Sean was very friendly. The house is located within walking distance from city center. Overall I had a comfortable stay.

Great location, and a great host in an amazing city! Only about a 15 minute walk (with great views) to downtown. Loved my stay at Sean's place. He has a great personality. It is because of people like him that I prefer Airbnb over staying at an impersonal hotel. I highly recommend Sean's place!
The advertisement is exactly correct.  I was quite comfortable.  Sean was a great host and the location was exceptional!
The apartment is in the heard of Dublin, walking distance to all famous places in the center. And Sean is very friendly and good guy.

Amazing location and the best value for Dublin at this time. I am very grateful for everything. Room is right next to the bathroom, door is right down the stairs - all I needed. Casual and very relaxed home, there is also a backyard which is quite rare. Very cool dude and incredibly nice, up front about everything - communication is key. Housemates are great as well!
A cozy room in a great, quiet location.

Sean was a great host! He was very available and nice! The location of his house is awesome, near the city centre and easy to find from the airport. If you dont mind about the noise of a musical band (what a really enjoy), thats the place!

Seans place is not only in the perfect location (easy walk to nearly every part of the city, I saw so much by walking just a 3km perimeter) but the space is very nice and makes you feel at home. Pictures are accurate and I felt right at home immediately. Plus if youre musically inclined, youll get along with Sean in a heartbeat! Super welcoming, helpful, and fun host; highly recommend!

I stayed at Seans place for two weeks and had the BEST time! Him and his housemates were all super welcoming, great fun and really made me feel at home whilst I got myself set up for a new life in Dublin. Was genuinely a little sad to leave and cant recommend staying with him enough.

For at least two people living under the same roof and only one bathroom for all people it should be not allowed to host strangers. No privacy!! Walls are so thin that any noise is heard in the entire home. Attitude of host is more than annoying. Issues with cleaning, everywhere in the home there are flying hairs of the 2 cats and 2 dogs running around. Disappointed as the price paid was very high compared to what you get....
Excellent accommodation and friendly welcome.

I loved staying at Jane and James' and can only fully recommend it to anyone visiting Dublin. They are a wonderful, openminded family and such sweet and caring hosts. I was warmly received by Jane who got in touch with me the second I arrived at the airport and came to pick me up at the bus station... and Jane and James made me feel super welcome and at home throughout my stay as well. We sat together and chatted over a lovely (healthy, organic) breakfast, and Jane even invited me to join them for a Sunday walk to Wicklow... 
The  house and room itself are beautiful and very clean (the bathroom is new!) and exactly as described in the pictures. I particularly liked the location - the house is located conveniently close to the LUAS line, yet in a quiet neighbourhood so you will find some peace and quiet after a hectic day in the city. I would gladly return! Thank you so much again, Jane and James!
Hello, I enjoyed the brightness of the room and the cleanliness of local. Jane is very welcoming.
I had a lovely time at Janes place. Check-in was easy and communication was fast and efficient. Ideal location close to UCD. Would stay again. Thank you!
Jane is wonderful, nice, and so attentive to everything! Her place is a short walk from UCD and Luas, excellent place!
Jane is a really kind person who seems to be very used to visitors so she is really relaxed! She does her best that her guests are feeling confortable. I really enjoyed my stay there.
Warm-hearted hostess. Very clean. She invited me to a Barbecue party. Its really nice. I enjoyed it. I will definitely recommend to my friends if they come to Dublin.
Very good location, around 8 minutes to Luas and the mosque
Great place at a good location, close to everything and Very friendly hosts!

I really enjoyed my stay in Georgia and Gats basement suite! The location is absolutely amazing - it was a very quick walk to Temple Bar and surrounding area. Communication was also great, and they were very helpful with communication and recommendations. I would definitely stay here again.

My friend and I stayed at Georgia and Gar's place for a week. You simply cannot beat the location; we walked almost everywhere we wanted to go. The space is clean and stylish and minimalist, with everything we needed to make ourselves dinner we picked up at the grocery store down the block. The washer/dryer was key to packing light and traveling with only carry-on luggage. Georgia was always quick to respond and solve any problems/answer any questions. Top notch!
Central apartment - ideal for exploring Dublin. The flat was very clean and well equipped. Check in was easy and Georgia was a very good host. Everything we needed for our short break in Dublin
The place is clean, stylish and conveniently located in a central yet quiet area (about 7mins walk to Trinity college and another 5 to the Temple Bar area). Would recommend!
Nice apartment which is not far from the city centre but still quiet.

This is a great apartment and a great location at a great price. Forgivable obstacles at check-in were overcome. The kitchen is well-equipped, the bed is comfortable, and there are plenty of places to arrange ones things. A welcoming beer decorated the refrigerator. Internet bandwidth ranged from 110 Kbps to 30 Mbps. It was hard to buy a train ticket at the former bandwidth. The latter bandwidth was agreeable, but its presence was difficult to predict. The bed is a bit narrow for the available space, about 1.75 m. Having learned what I learned about Dublin staying there 6 nights, if this apartment were available I would be delighted to stay there again, ha!, even for a month. What a great place! If it is not in what the French call the hypercenterù, it is not very far from that place. Location, location, location.

What a weekend! We had such a great time!!!! And so close to Windmill Lane - for a U2 fan an unbeatable location! The flat is super, clean, comfortable and lovingly decorated! We also loved the environment friendly attitude and your quick and positive replies! Overall: We had THE best time! Dublin rocks and this place does too!!! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Great location, nice place!
Comfortable, quiet and convenient!  Georgia was a lovely host!
We had a fantastic time,the flat is fully furnished, super clean and very very well located! Georgia was very nice and helpful, thanks for everything :)

I and two friends had an amazing stay in Dublin in Georgia's apartment! Especially the location is great! A quiet street with a supermarket a stone's throw away and a great beginning point to roam the city! All facilities were good too! Check in and check out went very smoothly and Georgia was very friendly and helpful.

A fantastic apartment with a great location, just a 10 minute walk from the centre of Dublin. Really clean with modern fixtures and fittings. Although we didnt meet Georgia, she was incredibly responsive in her messages and left us clear instructions for finding the flat as well as how to get in. The apartment had a double bed and a double sofa bed which was more than enough for my friend and I. Highly recommend this as a reasonably priced apartment in Dublin!

Georgia and Gars place is in a walkable area of Dublin close to many things. The living room and bedroom are spacious and nice. WiFi and TV worked great. The bathroom could use some more cleaning and smelled a bit of mold. Shampoo and toiletries were almost empty when we arrived but we found more in the cabinet. Host responses were pretty slow but she said she was on a cycling trip with little reception. Overall, it was serviceable.
Wonderful apartment within walking distance of Trinity College and surrounding sights.  We would recommend this place to anyone looking to explore Dublin.  We would definitely stay here again!

Stay here for 4 nights having come over from England for the bank holiday weekend. Its around a 10 to 15 minute walk from the temple bar area. The place was clean and tidy and the sofa bed is comfortable. There is a supermarket at the end of the road too. All in all a very good find and would recommend.
Lovely, cosy flat. Very convenient location for town. Could do with a deep clean in the bathroom but otherwise perfectly cosy and comfortable.

Nice apartment, good location. But did not fully enjoy our stay as hot water stopped working half way through our 3 night stay and host did not reply to messages until after we checked out so we had no way to fix the problem. She said that air bnb messages did not go through so if you choose to stay here I would suggest you get a phone number or email to contact host if needed. Apartment was clean other than some old/dirty grouting and loose tiles around the shower in the bathroom.

Super apartment, location is brilliant, an easy  walk to all the sites, Temple bar only 15 minutes walk along the river.  Great supermarket across the road. Georgia was a great host and met us on our arrival, lovely extra touch of a bottle of wine, very thoughful.
The flat was cosy and in a great location for all our needs. We were hardly in but found it was a good base. Thanks.

The stay at Declan's was really lovely. Despite not being in the centre of the city it is on a direct bus line and with a Leap card the distance is no problem. The communication with Declan prior booking has been very quick. Declan is really friendly and helpful regarding tips in Dublin as well as in the neighbourhood. I would recommend Declan if you want to stay in a cosy room with a welcoming host.

Oustanding experience. It was all perfect. Room, bathroom, rules, the host. I felt at home! Declan is an amazing person and is always willing to help. Do not hesitate to stay if you are looking for a cozy and comfortable place.
well stocked kitchen ...I look to cook.

This apartment was lovely! Stayed here for the weekend for our trip in Dublin. The location was brilliant, a 20min wall into the centre with sights to see on the way! And accessible pubs/restaurants to get to very close by. Couldnt fault the host, she provided us with everything we needed and was on hand to help if we needed anything. Thank you very much!

Eileens flat was a great home-base for our weekend in Dublin. Eileen was an amazing host and the communication was outstanding. There are pubs and restaurants close by that we enjoyed (Two Brothers Cafe and Jays Place for breakfast were delicious). It is walkable to get to the city centre but we relied mostly on taxis to get there. The flat itself was very clean and homey. Would recommend to anyone visiting Dublin!
Eileen was exceptionally hospitable. The apartment is beautiful and the location is perfect, only a few minute was for the shops and central.

Eileen is a great host and very quick to respond. Eileens place was the perfect quiet location , but within walking distance from the city. It was very comforting having Eileen staying below us ; yet still incredibly private. I would recommend staying here. It was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you so much ! -Logan&Kurt

Great apartment and location - just what we were hoping for. Eileen was there to welcome us even though we arrived very late in the evening. Close to the centre and public transport. Would happily stay again!

Eileen was such a lovely host. We really enjoyed our time in Dublin. She was very helpful and the flat is in a perfect location for a bus into town and even to the airport. Thanks so much for letting us stay! If I do come back to Dublin Id definitely book again!
A lovely home from home feeling. An excellent location, could walk into town but also the bus stop at the end of the road was very useful! Close to shops and nice pubs too.
We spent two nights at Eileens flat. She was great with communication and check in. Her flat was clean, sunny and quiet. We found it easy to get to downtown with public transportation. No complaints!

We had a great stay at Eileens lovely and really well equipped apartment. Everything was found as described and the flat was absolutely clean. Whenever we needed something, Eileen was really helpful and made our stay comfortable. The apartment is in walking distance to the centre (20 minutes) and there are some pubs nearby.
If we should come back to Dublin, wed book Eileens cosy apartment again.

We loved to stay at Eileen's house. Everything is as described, the place is super clean and tidy, close to many shops, supermarkets, pubs, public transports... Not in the centre of Dublin, but easy to walk and, as a plus, in a quiet zone. Eileen is a great host!
We had a great stay in Eileens flat. The location was excellent. Would definitely stay again.
Eileens place is a wonderful place to stay in Dublin. Close enough to walk to attractions but far enough away to be quiet. Eileen was also wonderful to work with.
Eileens place is spacious with lots of natural light along with a great view.  The location is excellent with buses and restaurants around the corner as well as historical sites nearby.

Eileen's place is wonderfully comfortable and very conveniently located within Dublin. It's far enough away from the pubs so you get some peace and quiet at night. However, it's very close to the bus lines, meaning you can be down to Parnell street in minutes. She's got a lovely updated bathroom. And a fully equipped kitchen. I'd highly recommend this apartment for your Dublin adventure!

Eileen's place is comfy with a lovely view of the skyline from the living room. It's quiet, clean, and has a very comfortable bed. There is a pub and several good restaurant options nearby (I recommend Kebab House). To get to the main attractions it's about a 30-minute walk but if you want to cut that time in half, you can walk 4 minutes to Phibsborough Luas tram station (green line), which is a convenient way to travel to and from from Eileen's flat. There are also bus stops nearby if you have coins and exact change. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Dublin.

Eileen was a fantastic host, check in was quick and easy! Her flat is clean and has a beautiful view of the garden and church steeple. Every appliance works well and its very clean. There are some amenities in the kitchen like cereal and coffee. There are nearby shops to check out. We ate breakfast and had amazing coffees at Two Boys Brew.

The flat was a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Temple Bar. The neighborhood was quiet and safe at night.

We would definitely stay there again!

Eileen's place was great, really clean and spacious. It was lovely for the two nights away, super comfy bed too. Eileen was great with communication and even allowed an early check in, which we were very appreciative of. Would happily stay again :)
Thanks for a wonderful stay in Dublin. I felt at home right away and would always come back to stay in this lovely place.
A nice clean place located near bus stops and the Phisboro luas stop. Eileen was quick to respond and was a great host.

Eileen is a great host providing speedy replies to my queries and very accommodating by allowing us to check in earlier than the scheduled time to enable us to return our rented car in time.
Eileens place is a lovely well lit apartment, equipped with good amenities for a most comfortable stay. Eileens place is conveniently located within walking distance to: 5-19 mins to Tesco supermarket, 2 mins to bus stop into the City centre or Blackrock, 4-5 mins Luas Tram stop for a quick ride to Temple Bar area, or a delightful 20-25 mins walk to OConnell Street.
Will prioritised to stay at Eileens place again as and when Im back to Dublin.

Eileens place was lovely, clean, and perfectly located for a stay in dublin. It states 20 minutes from town but although that may be the case it is down one main road, and there are a few great places nearby. Me and my girlfriend really liked the location, and eileen was the perfect host, she responded within 15 mins when we messaged her. Great weekend.

Eileen is a lovely host and we enjoyed our stay in her little flat. Its quite private and was just what we needed. We used the tram (Luas) to get around Dublin by purchasing a day flexi-pass, and the nearest stop is an easy 5-min walk. A Tesco is close as well as some restaurants. It was a nice location and not too far out of the city at all.
Nice place near Dublin city center.

Great flat, ideally located for croke park, city centre and even the park and zoo (if you're up for walking a bit which we are!). Nice pubs and bars nearby, and shops close too. Eileen is a great host, quick communication, everything was easy and smooth. The flat has everything you'd need, is clean, well maintained and has great facilities. Highly recommended!
Eileen's place is absolutely lovely, clean and feels very much like a home away from home! Great location - would absolutely recommend!
Nice Appartement, Thank you Eileen for hosting us !

This place was super! It was beautiful, spacious and in a nice quiet neighbourhood. The fact that it is bit of a walk from the city centre allowed us to discover a part of Dublin we may not have visited otherwise and enjoy a quiet stay! Eileen was also very available and quick to respond. Would definitely stay again and recommend it! Thanks again a bunch!!
Besides how pleasant the flat was, the best part of this was the location and cool non-touristy neighborhood!

Great spot about 15-20 minutes walking distance to Dublin City Center/Temple Bar area. Approx. 25 minute taxi ride from the airport. Apartment is right on the bus lines, but we didnt mind the daily walk into the city. Apartment was extremely clean, seemed recently renovated, and Eileen was an incredibly kind hostess! We recommend Two Brew Boys for coffee and breakfast, and BoCo for dinner which are both about a 10 minute walk from the flat. It was nice to spend time in Dublin during the day then have a quiet, private place to rest in the evenings.
We really enjoyed our stay.  Eileen is a great host and her apartment is just as described, very homely and sparkling clean. Everything we could ask for. Thank you Eileen

Great one bedroom flat. Comes with shower over spa bath in the bathroom, well set up kitchen open plan living area with washing machine. Bus stop into town 2 minutes walk, tram 10 minutes walk, bus stop to airport 10 minute walk. 
Eileen was very helpful with check in and accommodating.

Eileen's place was great. Only spent a couple nights for the last bit of our journey but it was amazing! Bed was so comfy, very clean cute space. Close to the city centre. Around a 25 min walk. You can get a cab for 8-10 euros if you wish but the walk is quite nice. Eileen was nice and met us upon arrival. Very lovely to have met her and would definitely recommend.

Absolutely perfect little spot to stay in Dublin. Eileens place was incredibly clean, cute and had everything we needed. Also neighborhood was nice and quiet, but still fairly centrally located. Plus lots of good food just a couple blocks away. Eileen was also incredible kind and hospitable, but definitely gives you your space. Definitely recommend!
Super Unterkunft einer unglaublich tollen Gastgeberin.
Lovely lady, super helpful, great flat.
Eileen is a great host - her place is very clean and is a great location to visit Dublin.

This house was perfect. So were our guests. Ann was very informative and it helped us plan our days. The house was everything it was advertised to be.   Shopping close.  Train is close.  Taxi is there minutes after theyre called.  (Dont drive in Dublin). Leave it to professionals.  Parking is impossible anyway. 
Thanks Dave and Ann!

A great home in a wonderful location. 

We were a family of 6 adults and 3 children and the house was perfect. The location was great! Public transport, hotels and shopping centre all within walking distance. 
Dave and Ann were very welcoming and were great hosts.

Dave and Ann are Super Hosts for good reason: Everything about their home is wonderful!  If you are finding this listing searching Dublin, and want a downtown location then look elsewhere.  However, if you would prefer to stay in a clean, quiet, lush, and secure neighborhood (as we do) then this is the place!  Dundrum City Center and the LUAS (electric tram to Dublin) are a short walk away.  
Great amenities, quick responses to questions, helpful hints, variety of food choices, shopping - this house and location have it all!

We were a family of 7 staying at Dave & Anns for 5 days and we had a great time. The house was lovely and clean and had lots of toys for the kids to play with. There are 4 good sized bedrooms with double beds, and our hosts had an extra mattress and toddler bed for the kids. Everything we needed was provided and there was even food in the fridge for us upon arrival. Communication with our hosts was excellent, they were quick to reply and happy to help. The house is situated close to a big shopping center that also has restaurants. The Luas is a ten minute walk and takes only 15 minutes to city centre. The AirPort Shuttlebus is also only a few minutes walk from the house. We were very happy with our stay and will recommend this place to anyone looking to rent a vacation home in Dublin.

The house is very well equipped, beds are comfortable spotlessly clean nice location
And you are made to feel very welcome indeed.

Dave and Ann's home was definitely our favorite home in Ireland.  From the moment we arrived at their beautiful home and were greeted with Ann's kind smile, I knew our group of eight adults would be comfortable during our stay.  Ann explained everything we needed to know about the house, the appliances, and the local area.  They also have a very detailed book that reminded us of anything we needed to know, such as how to get to the nearest store, how to use the oven, and how to set the alarm.  (Some of us were a bit nervous using different appliances and alarm systems, but her instructions and the book made our apprehension completely unnecessary.)
Dave and Ann's home is beautiful, spacious, spotlessly clean, comfortable, bright, and full of modern conveniences.  It is also well-insulated and very quiet at night despite proximity to a main road.  We spent a lot of time outside on the patio, and their yard is positively gorgeous.  We also loved the fantastic showers, the extremely comfortable beds, having an electric coffee maker, the well-equipped kitchen in which we cooked something nearly every day, the grill on the patio,  and having a clothes dryer since some of us did laundry on a day that it rained.  Our two friends who'd shared space with each other for a week were grateful to finally have their own rooms!  There was nothing missing or with which we weren't happy during our stay in this lovely home.
The location was perfect for us; we wanted to spend time in Dublin but didn't want to stay in the city.  We felt extremely safe in this home and in this area.  We were able to easily walk to the Luas stations and local shops, and car trips to Powerscourt, the mall, the airport, and various other places outside Dublin were also easy.  We didn't ride the bus, but the stop is only about a one minute walk from the house.  I absolutely recommend Dave and Ann's home as an ideal place for a family to stay near Dublin, and I would love to stay there again on our next trip!

Great house for our family reunion. Spacious, very well set up. Everything you need and more. Lovely outdoor space with deck and garden. We felt very comfortable there. Very convenient for public transport into town. Lots of shopping close by. Recommend highly!
An immaculately clean, well equipped, well appointed house with some thoughtful additions

This house is an exceptional one! It was so clean & well set up, we had 8 guests in total & there was plenty of space for all of us. Dave & Ann gave us a lot of useful tips about the area & left a lot of extra touches in the house which made our stay very comfortable. Its also in a brilliant location, close to shops & transport making it very convenient. I would highly recommend staying here!

Fantastic large house in a lovely safe neighbourhood. Easy walk (10mins) to a large shopping centre that has everything you need. Short walk (5mins) to local small supermarket which was surprisingly reasonably priced and stocked a huge range.  House has 4 decent size bedrooms and 3 separate sitting areas so plenty of space for a large group. House has large amount of natural light so is bright and airy and has a lovely welcoming feel to it. There is a beautiful garden and deck. My only minor issue was that there was limited hot water so with 5 ladies in a house together, it was a fight for the first shower and a constant struggle to ensure the last person had any hot water left. Dave and Ann were lovely friendly host and responded promptly to any communication.  I would definitely recommend this house. Thank you Dave and Ann for the use of your lovely home.

The house is perfectly located in a cosy and lovely part of the city. It is also very close to the luas train station and bus station which makes transportation to any part of the city very easy. It is perfectly clean, very elegantly decorated. The hosts Dave and Ann and their family are great and think of everything. We appreciated everything.

Maeve was an outstanding host and really made it a special experience for us! Her place was absolutely perfect, clean and centrally located. We loved the little historic corner. Maeve was always quick to reapond and gave us lots of great tips for our stay. We loved every minute of it and would defiantly stay again! Thanks for everything Maeve!
Maeve and Alex are very nice. It was a easy communication and my friends and I had a really good time. This is for everyone who like to visit Dublin and enjoy the nice people there

Maeve is a special person. He was always helpful and helped us whenever we asked for information and general tips about the house and about Dublin. The house is great and offers us good conditions to enjoy the whole stay in Dublin without worries. The shower is good, the beds are great. There are several buses near the house that take us to the city center in a few minutes. I really want to thank Maeve for all her attention to my whole family.
Fantastic countryside house, our room was for 3 and our dogs and it was huge. Fresh coffee settled us in and the room was warm. James and his family were very friendly. Would recommend.

Great host and nice home. Spacious and a large kitchen/patio area. Anything you would need from a kitchen was available and the house is very stylish/quaint. Only thing to keep in mind is the distance between the house and Dublin center, which is somewhat far by foot.

This is a really special place. The house is full of character, beautifully light and engaging. The location, a short walk to the Luas or a slightly longer stroll into town is perfect |(and yet it is in a really quiet street with little noise or traffic). Caroline's personal touch and guidance was 1st class (the Thai takeaway recommended is really good). My boys loved the house and felt really at home, and it was a special weekend with a big birthday for my wife. The house and Caroline's little touches of kindness made it all the more special. We would definitely recommend to others looking a great base for Dublin & would certainly stay again ourselves.
The host canceled this reservation 111 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
We had a very good stay.  Appreciated the detailed advice on what to eat and see in the area.
Caroline is a lovely, thoughtful host! House is in a convenient location, highly recommend !

Our group enjoyed Carolines place very much! Its comfortable, colorful with a great shower and a lovely garden. We liked the neighborhood, and the walk to town was easy and interesting. Caroline was very responsive and even allowed us to check in early. Thank you, Caroline!
A pleasant and well equipped house. Good and fast communication.

Convenient location about 20 minutes from the centre of Dublin. Very quiet area with grocery shops within walking distance. We were able to have a flexible check in/check out time which was great with a toddler! Great kids area inside and outside and toys to entertain.
Very considerate host who left beers and wine for our arrival, prompt and helpful with all communication and recommendations. 
Would definitely recommend staying here, especially if young family.
D

A great place with a great host. Feels like staying at home. A modern property which has been furnished with style and quality. Lots of thoughtful extras such as a nespresso machine with capsules, tea, biscuits, snacks, bread, milk etc which came in handy. An excellent choice for those staying with a family as Caroline also provides a cot and loads of childrens toys! All in all a fabulous experience and we wouldnt hesitate staying here again.

We thoroughly enjoyed staying at Sandra's place. It is a comfortable and cosy home, lovingly decorated, with a fully equipped kitchen, a lovely sunny sitting room and a cute garden. The house is conveniently located between centre and airport, both of which are easily reachable by public transport, the bus stop being very close to the house. Furthermore, the communication with Sandra was excellent, so everything worked smoothly and we spent a great time in Dublin!

It is a spacious accommodation with nice features such as a whirl pool, Barbecue. The location is perfect. Close to the centre but near enough to the M50 for country side sightseeing. To get to the  city I would strongly recommend the public transport. Taxi or much cheaper of course the busses. At rush hour it's the quickest way to town. By car it could take up to 90min for 7km

Plenty of space and wonderful amenities. Sandra has thought of everything. The house is immaculate and close to everything you could need and Dublin city center was an easy 20-25 minute drive. 
The back garden is a respite at the end of the day. 
Sandra went above and beyond to accommodate our needs and made our stay in her home thoroughly enjoyable. 
I highly recommend this property!

Sandra was a perfect host and responded, literally, within minutes to any questions we had. She checked in regularly during our 10 day stay and made herself available when we had some difficulty figuring out the water heating system. 

The house is perfectly suited for a family or group that prefers not to be directly in Dublin. It is in a local neighborhood with nearby access to stores and restaurants (try the Little Venice restaurant î yummy homemade Italian).  Even the neighbors were helpful and eagerly accepted delivery of our delayed luggage for us. 

We drove a rental car throughout our stay and easily found parking in the city but buses are within an easy walk to the house. The purpose of our trip took us to golf courses to the North so the Santry House  was located midway and allowed us to easily go either direction.  My husband even learned to master driving on the left!

The house was well stocked, very comfortable, and clean making it a true home away from homeù.  The only small problem we had was learning the trick with the twice daily water heating system but Sandra helped us to work that out. The upstairs shower has low pressure but the downstairs is great. 

We truly enjoyed our stay and give Sandra and the Santry house a heartfelt five starsù!!!
Thanks for quick responsiveness Sandra!! Great location - walking distance to bus stop.... near by mall ... bright lovely house.

We (three colleagues) being on a business trip to Dublin combining it with two free days to walk around were more than happy with Sandra's place: beginning from the location and ending with check out experiences.

- Booking was seamless, Sandra instantly answered all the questions and supported when I had a pending payment issue with my bank;

- Check-in instructions made our first day as smooth as possible - as if we would have own key to enter own house.

- The house itself is very cozy, not big but more than enough for three people - you will find everything needed - literally everything for your everyday life; the kitchen is well equipped so it was a pleasure to cook there breakfasts and a couple of dinners - big dining table will easily accommodate up to 6 people; there are washrooms on the ground- and first floor; bedrooms are warm and cozy - so it's value for money paid for sure.

Even though Sandra's house is located in quiet residential area (the fact we really enjoyed after noisy Dublin downtown) you can find everything you need in 10 - 15 min walking distance: big shopping center Omni, small Takeaway shops (great pizza btw) just opposite the street, 3-5 min walk to the bus stop to get to the city center (30 min by bus as Dublin streets are not too spacious to accommodate its traffic) or just take a taxi and for 20 EUR and in 20 Min you will be in the city center.

I would really recommend Sandra's place for business or family travelers.

Sandra, once again - thank you!

Sandra was such a thoughtful host, and even accommodated our early check in ... was so appreciated after a long night of travelling. She was also  quick with helpful  responses  to any inquiries. Her clean home was just like described and in pictures posted.  We were not disappointed at the accommodations that added to the Irish experience.
This home is in a fantastic location for getting into Dublin and to the airport.  Bright and sunny home with a nice garden.  Very quiet place to stay.  We enjoyed it very much.

The house and location is great.  It is a relatively easy bus ride to the centre or a short drive.  The area is quiet and please to walk around.

It is also easy to leave the city or travel around to visit other areas; we went to Glendalough, Howth and Newgrange and Knowth whilst there.

John and Diana were great hosts and very responsive to any enquiries.


Id recommend them.

John
The host canceled this reservation 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The house itself is a beautiful family home in a great location across from the River Dodder. The house is clean, modern in its finishing and very user friendly in layout. Beautiful garden very well taken care of as well. The house instruction guide left for us was short, simple and very easy to understand. We had our 10 month old cocker spaniel with us and had great walks down by the Dodder river and into Bushy Park. Really peaceful and quiet location aswell. It's the perfect place for a peaceful quiet break away but still within close proximity to Dublin city to explore. John & Diana were perfect hosts, leaving us food and supplies on our arrival so we could settle in without having to go straight back out searching for supplies. We highly recommend John & Diana's place and hope they can accommodate us again on our next visit.

Our family highly recommend John and Dianas lovely home. We were so comfortable there, and so appreciated their thoughtfulness and care for us during our stay. We arrived exhausted from a trans Atlantic flight to find the ingredients for a lovely Irish breakfast waiting for us. They checked in with us to be sure everything was OK, and made sure we had everything we needed. They are amazing hosts!
The kids loved their garden.

Bernadine is very conscientious and wants her guests to have a great experience at her home. I did!  

I was able to relax after two months of moving from place to place. 

The location was perfect for me. The bus downtown is 15-20 minutes. The walk to the bus stop is maybe 5 minutes. Its super easy to find your way. 

The house is also about 20-30 minutes to the airport (non-rush hour). Bernadine ordered my taxi, which was very helpful and stress free. 

The neighborhood is quiet and relaxing. Bs home is lovely. Archie, the dog, is adorable and well-trained. I had a lot of great conversations with B and her husband. 

I definitely recommend staying here. If I return to Dublin, I will definitely stay here again.
The stay felt very comfortable, Bus directly to the city center. Cute room with private bathroom, would definitely stay again.

Good location, only a short walk away from the bus stop to the city center and located in a quiet neighborhood. The room and bathroom were both very clean. Bernadine was always there to help with any issues and gave great advice to explore Dublin.
Everything was perfect, super hosts would definitely stay again
Very comfortable room and bed, clean bathroom, great hopitality from the hosts, overall great experience.

Arriving late in the airport, it is just without comparison to get picked up in the rain without waiting time, getting driven to your destination and getting a cup of tea/coffee and a little snack. Nice room and a good sleep. After that, I was driven to the train station to continue my travel. What to say? Just, thank you....

Des and Sinead are very hospitable, very friendly, and overall excellent hosts.  I was in town for a job interview, and they went out of their way to help me get where I needed to go in an unfamiliar city. Thank you Des and Sinead!

Our stay here was great! We needed a place to stay close to the airport on the way out of Dublin, and this was perfect! Des and Sinead were on the first floor, but we had plenty of room in the upstairs for our party. And breakfast in the morning was delicious!

Lovely, clean, relaxing and homely environment. My mum and I really appreciated our stay here. Sinead picked us up and dropped us to Dublin airport. Her and Des are lovely, friendly and welcoming hosts.
What a wonderful place to stay. They took care of everything, breakfast was wonderful and their hospitality even better. Id stay here again in a heartbeat! Thanks Des and Sinead!

Des and Sinead are the most hospitable and kindest people! Our airbnb experience was perfect. They helped us a lot during our stay with traveling and everything. I truly recommend to stay at their place.

Sinead and Des were really kind and supportive as I was having trouble with my rental car. They welcomed me with a nice cup of tea and showed me the house! It's perfect for an overlay stay as it is very close to the Dublin Airport!

Des and Sinead were fantastic! Their place was clean, neat, beautiful, quiet neighborhood and they were so accommodating. They knew the right spots for us to go out for dinner and nightlife. Super close to the airport, about a 5 minute ride, easy back road access.

It was perfect for our early morning flight. Des and Sinead were great hosts friendly and helpful with good tips about the surrounding area for a late night bite and conversation. Entertained my 10 mnth old and provided a cosy place for the night.

Fed and Sinead housed my family of 7 before our flight and not only did they arrange transportation for us, but went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and at home.  Their house was spacious and clean, with an excellent location by the airport. It was the perfect end to our Ireland trip to be in a wonderful home with caring hosts.
Highly recommended location! Sinead was an amazing host offering great tips for our time in Dublin. Fresh breakfast and great conversation made this location extra special!
We enjoyed our brief stay. Sinead was the perfect host. Comfortable beds. Clean shower. Hearty breakfast. Highly recommend her place!
Excellent hosts, very kind and thoughtful.
This is a great spot and the hosts are super hospitable. One of the better ones on our trip! Recommend for sure!

Fantastic hosts! Felt like family while we were there. Super helpful with planning places to go in Dublin as well as accommodations with picking up from the airport and bus travel to the city. Made a delicious breakfast every morning. The room was great as well. Would highly recommend.
Amazing hosts couldn't ask for anything more, would 100% reccomend

Des and Sineads Place was excellent. 

Pros
1. It is near the airport
2. Clean room
3. Great breakfast
4. Great communication

Cons
1. The bathroom was shared. From the description it feels like a private bathroom!
2. There was no shampoo in the bathroom

Would recommend to others.

Cheers
Sunil and Sapna
Beautiful, clean space, lovely breakfast and Sinead was so good to meet me at the bus stop and help me with directions!
Great hosts, even gave us a lift to Malahide Castle!
Great and better than expected. Very hospitable hosts!

Any questions you have and the country,  they are more than willing to answer. They are very eager to help accommodate you as best as possible and they are very relaxed people. The place itself is very comfortable, clean, and has a home like warmth to it.
Great room in a nice neighborhood close to the airport.
Sinead and Des were such great hosts. They went above and beyond with their hospitality. Rooms were lovely. Comfortable and so clean. Would highly recommend

Cannot recommend this place enough for travellers, pre or post-airport arrival, airport staff etc. Anything! They're super friendly, super helpful about the local area and their welcome and hospitality was second to none! Would highly recommend for any purpose.

Very quaint, comfy place. Des & Sinead were very friendly, communicative and helpful. They offered tea upon arrival, offered airport pickup/drop off and even gave recommendations of what to see and do in Ireland. Very hospitable! The bedroom was clean and comfortable. Also they put a sealed bottle of water in the bedroom with glasses to have before bedtime. Very sweet touch and they also offer a light breakfast in the morning, as well as accommodating for any diet or health restrictions. Really wonderful stay! Highly suggest to anyone.

Des and Sinead are two very wonderful people, and they are sure to make your trip even better than you thought it would be. From the moment I walked in the door my experience was fantastic. Their place was immaculate and decorated well, and the two are extremely helpful, kind and respectful. They've got great recommendations from transportation to locations, and, like it says on the listing, they'll even pick you up from the airport. My room was a big and very comfortable space. If I could give them more than five stars I would. I greatly recommend staying here if you're considering it.

Des and Sinead went above and beyond to ensure my husband and I had a great trip to Ireland! They are not only amazing hosts they are also extremely knowledgeable about the area and things to do! They literally thought of everything (like a juice pack when they knew we would be out using our phones all day  -which was a total life saver). Breakfast was always delicious! Being picked up at the airport was such a huge plus (especially when jet lagged!). We were able to fit so much in to a relatively short trip and staying with them made our stay that much better. We will definitely be recommending them to our friends and family and plan to stay with them again ourselves as well. Five stars!

I was so lucky to stay at Sinead and Des' home last weekend. You feel like you are visiting a family. Clean room, comfortable bed, amazing breakfast and great hospitality. Playground just in front of the house, so very practical if u stay with kids. Direct bus to city centre and airport is 5-10min by car which is very convenient. Both hosts are very helpful with any tips/questions you may have.  Highly recommend and would definitely stay again. Merci bcp!

Thank you so much! From the moment I arrived they were accommodating and warm. They invited me to eat dinner with them and told me about Ireland. They even set up a taxi for me to take to the airport in the morning.

Very clean, cute and neat. Felt like I was at home. Very sweet people with the experience of top notch hospitality!
Excellent hosts, warm athmosphere, highly recommended.
Nice room in a family house, close to the airport, you need a taxi to go to the airportand there is a pub where you can eat 10 minutes wolk

Des and Sinead showed us outstanding hospitality and service above and beyond what was expected. Everything from showing us to the nearest pub, giving us advise on what to see in Dublin and picking us up/ dropping us off at the airport made our short stay in Dublin a real joy! Thank you
We had a lovely stay at Sinead and Des place. They offered great local tips and were super helpful!!

Absolutely fantastic hosts. Great communication and very friendly hosts. Thank you for feeding me after a long journey was an unexpected bonus. Was pleasure to meet you both and to stay at your place. 
Would strongly recommend. Thank you again
At Des & Sineads you can expect outstanding hospitality, a great location,    a good value and a comfortable, clean room.

Des & Sinead's place was fantastic! Very clean and stylish place with everything you need. In a great location, right next to the airport. Would definitely stay here again! They went above and beyond on with there hospitality. They picked me up from the airport and dropped me off at the bus stop. Sinead made a delicious breakfast of eggs and toast for myself and several of the other guests. Can't recommend this place enough.
Very clean, comfortable, and hospitable, including a terrific breakfast and just minutes from the airport!

We had a great time with Des and Sinead and wish we had stayed with them longer. Our last night in Dublin turned out to be rather special thanks to them and their adorable dogs. Sinead coordinated our arrival well and very kindly picked us up from the bus stop and showed us the way to come back later. 

The place is just a 5-7 minute cab ride (costs around 12-15‚Ç¨) from the airport, so very convenient as a base if you're flying in or out of Dublin. It is also a 30-minute ride from the city centre with a direct bus that stops very close (5-8 minute walk) to their place.
The room was very comfortable with two large beds and cosy interiors. The ensuite bathroom was also spacious and tidy. There is quite a spread for breakfast though we didn't have time as we had an early flight. Overall, our stay was very comfortable and we'd surely stay with them if we're ever in Dublin again :) 

Des and Sinead were so much fun and we had a great time chatting with them and a couple of guests over dinner and drinks. So glad to have met them!
Des & Sinead are everything Airbnb is about.  They are warm and friendly. Anywhere they are hosting is exactly where you want to stay!
Nice cozy charming old house well located in Dublin.

The house was perfect size for our large group of 12. The location in a great area of the city. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Nicole was very kind and helpful,  and gave us all the tips for the area.
Stayed for st Patricks weekend, ideal location can walk to temple bar area in 20 minutes or taxi for around 12/15 euros. Ideal for a stag do or party weekend with self check in and check out.
Located well and the house was perfect and exactly as described
>Was super - exterordenary
Our stay was short and great, would definitely stay here again in future Thank you very much to the host Nicole

Nicole was an amazing host and has a truly unique and interesting home. Her description of the home is completely accurate, it is an old historic home but you can tell she has lovingly put a ton of work into its upkeep and restoring it for modern use. The kitchen and living room areas are open and well decorated. They have all of the essentials. The bedrooms have plenty of beds to accommodate large groups and the main bathroom is really cool. 

Nicole herself was a great host, she communicated very well and responded quickly. She accommodated our groups early arrival by meeting us before normal check in time (we booked an extra night prior to ensure it would be ready) which was greatly appreciated! She allowed us to store our luggage on the way out as well as some people had late flights.

The home is in a great location with the Jameson distillery so close and nice cafes and bars on Smithfield square. We walked to Temple Bar every night and it was about 15-20 min walk. Uber and taxis were also available. 

This home is a great option for a large group looking to have a great time in Dublin!
Fantastic host, great location and a fantastic house for student groups like ours!

Once you know this is a party place and thats what you want, youll love this incredible, eccentrically decorated place. The location is a great place to be in the city, away from most of the tourists, but with a lot going on.

A really very old historic house with all the advantages and disadvantages that are due to the age.  
For what we wanted to do with our "8 Man Tour" ok (visit as many pubs as possible).  
The location of the house is perfect, in 15 minutes walk to Temple Bar, 20 minutes to the Guinness Storehouse only 3 minutes to the Jameson distillery.  
Nicole is a good hostess, always available and very uncomplicated.  

We had a good time in Dublin.  Slainte
The location is fantastic, and the description of the home is accurate - read thoroughly to see if it's a fit for your group.
A well located very quirky house for large groups with a range of sleeping options and fabulous communal space. Nicole is a relaxed welcoming host

A great space for our family! Historic charm and lots of rooms to spread out! Very clean and a great (Website hidden by Airbnb) need to use our rental car as so many sites and pubs were nearby or only a quick bus/Dart/taxi ride away!
The hosts description of the property is very accurate. The house is spacious and quirky with lots of character, the beds are comfy, great location and excellent value.

Thank you so much for having us stay, we all really enjoyed our stay! 

I really appreciated everything you helped us out with when it went wrong. You was so helpful

Nicole was a great hostess and provided detailed and timely communication. The house is well located and in easy access to much of Dublin. However, I must be honest in my overall review. Upon reading the description of the house, I was intrigued at the notion of a historic home and didnt blink an eye when learning about it being restored. It did not bother me that it was imperfect and that the layout included three flights of stairs, an unconventional bathroom, and multiple beds in one or more rooms. I was prepared and excited for quirky. I was not prepared for the condition of the home in terms of smell, paint, floor coverings, and carpet. While we were there, the entry and stairwell leading to the second floor had such a strong odor that we had to contact Nicole. It smelled horribly of mildew and decay. She came to clean, but the smell returned by the next morning. There was physical evidence of rodents in the home, and the smell of mildew wore on many of the nine of us in the home. The conditions of the walls were in need of repair. The carpet leading up the stairs was very, very unclean. The unconventional bathroom layout did cause some stress in terms of working around 9 guests and their bathroom needs. This house has great potential. It will be great one day. But, in the meantime, its important for future guests to truly understand that the underlying issues are more than just cosmetic. The environmental issues with mold, dust, decay, and so forth are definitely unhealthy and of concern.
This place was located close to Jamesons distillery and was within walking distance to most things in Dublin.  Overall a good place to stay for a big family.

This place is hard to encapsulate in a review. Staying here is an experience, lots of space and great location but it is one of the oldest houses in Dublin so it has its quirks. meeting the host and hearing her stories were an integral part of the adventure.
Extremely reliable, friendly and understanding.
Wouldnt stay there again. Over priced and dirty. Seemed a nice lady but ruined my birthday as all friends were so dissatisfied
This house was conveniently located near restaurants, grocery store and the train.  Made it easy to see Dublin on foot or take transportation if you want to.

We stayed in this property at the beginning of July for 3 nights to celebrate an upcoming wedding.  This property should be avoided at all costs,  if you are expecting it to look anything like the photos you will be greatly disappointed.
Every part of the property has issues which are not just down to the age of the property and a need of paint as the host would have you believe.
The property has many health and safety issues starting with the stench as you enter the building.  This come from the damp, mould and mildew that is evident on every floor.  The stench is a mixture of damp, mould and filth and permeates to every floor.  We had to buy scented candles to try and mask the stench.   During our stay the few windows that could be opened led to a plague of flies entering the property, they came from the garden area that could not be accessed.
Other safety issues are the electrics, there are broken sockets and light fittings and dubious wiring. There are broken floorboards, unsafe bannisters, raised threshold with raised screws.  Wall coverings are held together with masking tape and plaster to the walls with baton.  
The property looks like it should be condemned and locals told us it was supposed to be.  No one in the local area could believe it was being rented through Airbnb and they warned us to keep our bags and belongings with us as we were not safe.
We were a group of 14 women of various ages and not one of us had ever experienced staying in such squalor.
The property made our trip memorable for all the wrong reasons.
Very helpful owner, good communication and very flexible and accommodating. As mentioned by others, floors and carpets very unclean. Lots of space for a big group.

The home is definitely in a great location putting you close to many attractions and points of interest and Nicole is an extremely helpful and friendly host.  The 12 of us all had a place to sleep for the night which is all we really required.  It has great potential for being a real destination house but currently there is still room for improvement.
Nicoles place was great for what we needed.  Communication with Nicole was quick and always helpful.  Nicole also makes terrific recommendations for the area.

We stayed at this property for a hen weekend in July. I have stayed in many airbnbs over the years and have only had positive things to say about my experiences. But I cannot find anything good to say about this house. 
As per the description of this property we were expecting the house to be a little rough around the edges due to its age but what we found at the property was far from a few rough edges. Every part of this property had issues. Starting with the smell as you enter the building. It was clear that none of the beds had been changed with some of the bedding noticeably dirty and covered in hair. Immediately on our arrival we had to find clean bedding and change them ourselves. There were flies throughout the house, the bathrooms were visibly dirty, the showers had grime around the tray and the carpets didnt appear to have been hoovered for some time. This is not what we had expected, not least considering the exorbitant cleaning fees. 
In addition, there were multiple health and safety issues on this property. The windows had to be propped open with sticks of wood to keep them up, and when we did manage to open them, they were dirty and falling apart from the damp. Other safety issues, noticed and pointed out to us by the fire service were the electrics, including broken sockets and light fittings and unsafe wiring. The fire service were shocked at the number of safety issues in the property, nor could they believe that the property was being rented out as an Airbnb.
There were broken floorboards, unsafe bannisters and exposed screws. There was little thought to fire safety; over the four floors, there was just one fire escape through the main entrance with the second door to the back garden bolted shut.
On the second night of our stay, a water pipe burst in the kitchen and we were forced to evacuate by the fire service when we were informed the house was unsafe to stay in. We were told that the key issue was not the flooding from the burst waterpipe but the state of the electrics in the property that made the flooding so dangerous. If we had realised the extent of the health and safety issues at this property, we would not have booked. 
We were a group of 16 ladies of various ages, two of which are pregnant. We had nowhere to go on Saturday. We had to walk half an hour to a 24-hour McDonalds as this was the only place open and we were informed the safest place for us to go. We decided to travel to the airport at 3am and were stuck there for hours with no sleep. Nicole offered us no support during this ordeal, and only questioned why we had phoned the fire service!
Staying here ruined the entire weekend and the stress and risk this stay put us all in was completely unacceptable. We are currently pursuing a full refund for this stay and would warn anyone thinking about booking here to AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Our group of 13 thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Nicoles beautiful home. This house was huge and in a perfect location. Check-in was delayed a few hours but that was all for good reasons (brand new flooring throughout the home!) Note that there is no washing machine in the house as noted in the listing. We had piping hot water & with 13 people thats hard to do! All in all, we would definitely recommend this home!

Cant thank Nicole enough for our overnight in Dublin! Very difficult to find a place to host such a big group who are allowed to be loud! One of the best nights in a long time. The bath was a highlight

Just back from a fab weekend celebrating my hen party. This house is unreal- so quirky and different. I was worried it might not be to everyones taste because of its age but I couldnt have been more wrong. The whole group of 12 loved it. The communal area was perfect for socialising and everyone said how homely it felt. The main bathroom really is an amazing feature. Nicole was so friendly and check in was smooth and easy. Her passion for the local area is incredible and she gave us some great tips about where to go/eat etc. The fresh flowers were an added bonus to make us feel welcome. Thank you Nicole, we will be back!! Danielle

Nicole's place was a great central location for our group to explore Dublin.  The kitchen  was well equipped for cooking some of our meals.  Nicole has a passion for this historic building.  She has taken great pride in making it as modern as she is allowed to do.   There are a lot of steps but our group is pretty active so  not a problem for us.  We thought that only having two bathrooms would be a problem but we managed just fine.  There is lots of hot water.  Nicole is a very welcoming host and had lots of suggestions.  She was quick to respond before our stay and during it.  Would stay here again.

This house is great for a large group, Nicole was very informative and friendly upon arrival. She gave us loads of great tips and recommendations. We had such a fun stay here and would definitely come again!
What a great space and location!

The house had nice accommodations¬†for the seven people in our group. The location was great, close to public transportation, pubs, restaurants, and grocery stores. Nichole, the owner, was very helpful in recommendations.I would stay there again.
We had a great tym

THis was a house with a unique history. Since it is older,  there were areas of the home that had a musty smell (that became challenging for 2 of us with allergies). Despite its age, the home has a lot of character and Nicole is investing her time and money into renovating it. For us it wasnt in a neighborhood conducive to us-we like to walk wherever we can and we didnt feel safe if we planned to walk here individually or even in pairs (there were 6 of us and we didnt feel safe once it got dark)

Nicole was very friendly. She met us nearby the accommodation and pointed out local favourite places as we made our way to the house. So polite and welcoming. Big thanks to Nicole. Plenty of room in the house for the 11 guests.
Thank you xx

Amazing place at the city centre. And highly cost efficient too. You can visit the major places within city such as museums, library etc by using the public transport and it is very nearby.

Totally a very comfortable and economic stay.. Enjoyed it very much
Close to several sites we wanted to see! Very comfortable

Nicole was an absolutely amazing host. I organised a hen weekend for my sister, there were 15 of us and each of us were blown away with Nicole and her amazing house. 

The house itself was spotless. The rooms decorated lovely and the property has such character. Very well located - near a Lidl and a Health Food Shop with traditional Irish pubs best by we couldnt have asked for a better place to stay. 

Nicole is honest in that the house is old so there are some things that could be changed but why would you want to when a house has such amazing character? 

Nicole was very accommodating and helpful providing us with tips and recommendations and a thorough tour of the house. 

Thanks again Nicole, your house is wonderful and so are you!!

Nicole was an excellent host. Communications were quick and helpful and she was very flexible with our check in timings. The house is superb, with bars, the river and supermarkets all within walking distance and it was the perfect location for our weekend away. Would definitely recommend for fellow travellers! Thanks Nicole!

The host met us outside and was VERY informative! The historic house was cool. As stated in the discription its an old house so some things are a bit weathered, but it was a neat place to stay, and the renovations were cools Great location!
Great hospitality, great place for a large group.
Nice house and great location! Would stay here again :-)

Nicole was a lovely and accommodating host. The house was very clean and had some character. The location was perfect as its very close to Dublin City centre. It was perfect for our stay of 8 people. We hope to return some time in the future.

I had a big group come to Dublin and this place was fantastic! The location is perfect for a tram or taxi to take you into town and the house itself was perfect and spacious for the group of 15 I had!

Eddie is an extremely considerate and helpful host. He was constantly making sure our stay was as pleasant as possible. The room has a unique look, but overall it feels like a home away from home. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a cozy place to stay in Dublin!

The communication with Eddie is very friendly and fast. The apartment is very charming and the location is great. The bus stations are in walking distance and walking into the city is also possible. I guess the house is very old and the walls were not very think. We could hear every step the people upstairs were taking. But I would still recommend Eddies apartment to everybody who is enjoying Dublin.

We had a very enjoyable stay at Eddie's apartment. He was very friendly and helped us a lot for example for some touristic informations. He also hired a taxi for us if it was necessary.
Just be careful with the linked locality on (Hidden by Airbnb) maps. At first it linked us to an address about 200 meters away from Eddie's apartment. In the 2nd try it worked... Maybe it's fixed now.
Greets Matze
Excellent place, great host and hospitality! close to the city centre, what's not to love!

We were in and out the most of the time, but he place was amazing to use for quick stops and rest. The esthetic was awesome and the place had everything we needed. The best part was Eddie and Carol. The nicest people in all of Ireland who are willing to help you and give great site seeing advice. Would use this location again.

We enjoyed staying at Eddie's appartment.  
The bedroom is located at the garden side of the house, offering quiet and peace : no traffic noise at all. Easy and frequent connections to the city center by public transport. 
Eddie is very considerate and makes you realy feel at home.

Comfy bed, nice shared bathroom good location ( bus route etc) 
Friendly and helpful
Good spot for a couple of days in Dublin. Eddie is a very nice and helpfull guy.
Gorgeous house right next to the park! We had a great time and Eddie was a lovely host.
Eddie welcomed us very warmly. We recommend the service offered by him.

Eddie was a very good host, communication was excellent. Although house (cool place with many historical details) is not in the center it is very close to a beautiful Phoenix Park where some wild deers live.

Our stay at Eddies house has been very pleasant! Its a lovely place close to the city centre. Eddie was very friendly and explained us about how to get around in Dublin etc.  Definitely recommended to stay here if you are going to Dublin for a citytrip ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Ok
I had a really great stay at Conors. Its such a lovely house in a fantastic location. Conor is super helpful and accommodating. Really cant fault it, you wont find better in Dublin!

I have spent the summer with my girlfriend in Conor's house when I was working in Dublin. I would recommend the place to everyone - from a student looking for a longer stay to a couple visiting Dublin for a weekend. The location is lovely and a walking distance from the city centre.
Conor is a great host - he always responded immediately to text messages, he knows all about Dublin and can share lots of local tips and places to visit, depending on what you're most interested in.

My stay at Conor's wonderful home in Portobello was better than I could have hoped for. The proximity to the city centre was fantastic and I loved walking around the neighbourhood and along the Grand Canal. Conor was a terrific host and worked hard to ensure that I was able to make the most of my stay. I would certainly choose to stay there again given the chance. Highly recommended.
The house was very convenient and in a great location, with a full kitchen and a pretty nice collection of dvds. It was a bit drafty so might be better for the summer months rather than winter.

Lovely home, very welcoming and cosy! The room has everything you need and the breakfast in the morning is perfect to get you started for the day. Steve and Ayelet provided us with allot of local tips. The ones we tried out were great. Thanks for the hospitality!
The location and the house are great. The hosts are nice and give great travelling tips.

My sister and I had a lovely couple of days staying in Steve and Ayelet's very cool and creative home. They put together several guides/recommendations which were so useful, and which we followed for most of our trip. The breakfasts were exactly what we needed and a nice touch. Comfy bed, good amenities and very helpful hosts. Thanks Ayelet and Steve!

I would have given Ayelet and Steve 10 stars, however they only allow 5. 
Needless to say, we HIGHLY recommend staying here. 

To start, Ayelet and Steve are the definition of the perfect hosts. They spent time with my boyfriend and I on our first night, exchanging stories/ casual conversation, as well as giving us great suggestions for food/ fun in Dublin and all over Ireland. They made us feel right at home. Honestly it felt as though we had known them forever. 

Their home is super cozy, extremely clean and very accommodating to all of your needs. Their home is full of amazing art work that they have collected as well as original pieces made my Ayelet, herself. 

Their home is in a prime location. Youre able to walk a short, yet scenic distance to Guinness brewery and center city, Dublin. The walk is full of the most friendly locals and welcoming pubs. 

Again, we highly recommend staying with these wonderful people to anyone looking for a quiet get away to one of Irelands beautiful cities. 

Thank you again Ayelet and Steve, looking forward to building our friendship and staying in touch! :)

For those of you looking to meet a real Irish artist, Ayelets the person you want to stay with! The house is filled with her artwork, along with custom art by her family and friends, from paintings to stained glass. Its like staying in a gallery. Shes very thoughtful and nice to speak to. (We never met Steve but we assume hes nice as well.)

The house is spotless and the simple breakfast was much appreciated. We wouldnt recommend this house to anyone who cant handle narrow stairs (the room is on the second floor) or who want to stay super close to Temple Bar (the house is near Coombe Womens Hospital). Also, for those of you from more tropical climates, Id recommend that you bring an extra layer in case youre not used to the insulation in old houses. Otherwise, I would recommend this to mature, clean, respectful travellers who want to stay in a quiet residential area.
We had a very nice stay, the location is well communicated to everywhere we wanted to go and Steve & Aylet  made us feel like being in a friend's house,and gave us tips  for local places & pubs.

Ayelet and Steve are wonderful hosts, who are open to providing you with any tips you may need. Not only that, but their house is adorable, and the morning breakfast they provide is a great way to start your day!
Exactly as described and pictured,  perfect for a short break in Dublin. Would highly recommend

Ayelet and Steve have a lovely house with fascinating artwork on the walls.  The Maryland area the house is in doesn't look great, but I decided to solve that problem by always getting a late-night taxi home.  I was perfectly happy to walk the 7 mins to the tram during the daylight, but at night I used the MyTaxi app to be delivered straight to the door (Uber doesn't exist in Dublin).  It was usually under ‚Ç¨10 to travel from Dublin's Temple Bar area to the house.
The bedrooms are upstairs but the bathroom is downstairs.
Cereal, coffee and wonderful Irish soda bread was always laid out neatly for me to serve myself in the mornings.
Really great hosts in a lovely quirky house. Location very close to public transport and a super comfy bed.

Ayelet and Steve's place is the most unique and stylish Airbnb I have ever encountered. It's fully of quirky art and unique touches. Ayelet and Steve are both very friendly and were helpful in answering any questions we had. A simple breakfast was provided. While the house is not super close to downtown, there are bus and tram stops close by. Walking downtown will take about half an hour. We thought the neighborhood was pretty nice although some of our cab drivers mentioned it was a bit 'shady.' I get the sense that it's an area that has gentrified in recent years. Regardless, we always felt safe walking around. Two things to be aware of at the home would be the creaky staircase right outside the bedroom door by the head of the bed (not ideal for light sleepers!) and there is only one bathroom in the house, and it's on the ground floor level. We had a great stay and will never forget this amazing house.

Ayelet and Steve are great host. They are very friendly and they told us a lot of tips for the trip. The room is clean and there are many attractive art works. If I come back to Ireland, I definitely choose here again.
Very nice, clean, Ayelet & Steve are welcoming and really committed to helping you have the best experience in Dublin!

Ayelet and Steve are fantastic hosts. Easy to communicate with, and all of the photos of the space are accurate. They are there to help by answering any questions you have, and they are absolutely lovely to talk to. A perfect example of true Irish hospitality. They are fantastic, I cant recommend this place enough!

First at all, Ayelet and Steve are really nice people, really open mind, they will give you great recommendations about the city, and theyre house is really pretty and is near to city center, just like 20 min walking and so close to the bus lines, everything so clean and the bedroom was comfortable. 100% recommendable.

Steve and Ayelet are very kind, hospitable and friendly. They react very quickly to every need you may have, they also provide you suggestions and advices to enjoy your stay. The house is pretty but suitable for a short stay. Maybe the house rules are a little bit rigid.
It was a pleasure to stay in Ayelet and Steves home. It was clean and tidy. Ayelet gave us a warm welcome. The breakfast was nice. We recommend this place to others.

Ayelet is incredibly friendly and knowledgable about Dublin. She is happy to share tips and she makes you feel very comfortable. The house itself is lovely and perfect for 1 or 2 nights. To enter the bathroom you have to go via the living room and kitchen and the guests bedroom is right next door to the hosts bedroom so its not as private for a longer stay. The breakfast was also very nice! Thank you for the hospitality!

My wife, Sierra, and I loved staying with Ayelet and Steve. Ayelet is a talented and thoughtful artist who has great tips for enjoying the best of Dublin. Steve is a warm-hearted and friendly host who made being in the home very comfortable. Would recommend as an AirBnB spot.
What a great stay. Therese and Rory are such great hosts.  Their home is beautiful,  well appointed,  spacious and very central . We highly recommend staying here!

Therese's home is a great spot for a family vacation! The home is very comfortable and has multiple living spaces, so you feel as though you can spread out and relax. We really enjoyed the garden, with the trampoline, gas grill, outdoor table, and fish pond. The power shower in the master bathroom is very refreshing and there is plenty of room to park out front. They have changed the bedroom configurations a bit, so three bedrooms now have larger beds and one bedroom has a child-sized bed.
