The town of Blackrock is not even a 10 minute walk, with lots of great restaurants and shops. The house is also very close to the water, which also made for great walks. 

Our daughter really was the perfect age for this house, at 19 months and very mobile. There are two open steps between the kitchen and living room and another step off the outdoor patio into the yard. She was just able to navigate them safely, though younger walkers might struggle. We also had to keep our daughter close, as we couldn't figure out how to close/lock the doors between the living room, kitchen, and hallway, which led to the stairs to the second floor. 

Therese and her family were very accommodating and responsive and we would absolutely stay at their house again!

We were 2 families staying for 10 days in July , the location is ideal for the nearby DART station and buses , Seapoint beach , Dun Laoghaire town and harbour and some great pubs and eateries in nearby Blackrock village  
The house is ultra modern and very spacious with plenty of room for 2 families (2 children each) , there is off street parking and a back garden that was great for outside dining and the children enjoyed the trampoline.
Therese made us feel right at home and there were plenty of initial supplies before we had a shop  , plenty of towels and great facilities for washing and drying.
We would highly recommend.

Therese is a great host and communication is excellent.  We hired a car and the house is about half an hour's drive from the centre of Dublin, there is parking for 2 cars in front of the house, behind an electric gate.  There are train stations at Blackrock and Seapoint, both about 10 minutes walk away.  

The house is spacious and comfortable and is a real 'home from home'.  There is a big kitchen and 'garden room' leading out into the garden which has seating and a gas barbecue.  We loved spending time relaxing in this room.

The house has everything you need, including a well stocked fridge!  Such an advantage when you're flying in and obviously limited with what you can bring with you.  There is a supermarket about 15 minutes walk away when you need to stock up.

Seapoint is about 15 minutes walk away, it's obviously a very popular place for swimming, although we just stuck to paddling!  Of course there are loads of places to visit in and around Dublin, and Therese's house is a great base, having the advantage of being close to the coast and the city.  We definitely recommend a stay here!
Great location near the DART station; ideal for a family;
great experience. would stay again!!

Sam was a really friendly and welcoming host who made sure that everything we needed was readily available for us during our stay. He was really quick to respond to any queries that we had and we felt completely at home in his apartment in Dublin. The space was stylish and clean, and we loved the 3 cats who made the place feel like a home away from home. The location was also perfect! I would recommend Sams place to anyone travelling in Dublin!

Sam was an amazing host, communicated with us super efficiently and quickly before arriving to his place. The only downside of his beautiful penthouse apt is that it was sometimes hard for us to leave because of his incredible sweetheart and smart cats. My husband also learnt that he wish to have one of Sam's cat kind for himself in the future. Thanks Sam for inspiring us growing our family! All the best, Sam!

Great location! Short walk to just about everything.   Nice sunlight room, a little snug. Lots of stairs up to the unit, so keep this in mind when packing. Sam was quick to respond & getting checked in/out was very easy. 2 super cute cats, but we didn't see to much of them.

Sams place is perfect for a stay in Dublin. Sam is welcoming, kind and meticulously thorough with check in procedure and providing a comfortable stay. We were able to cook, shower, do our laundry and use his apartment as if it was our own. He does have three cats who mind their own business and we loved them. The room is comfortable, bed is very nice and we all-around recommend Sams place. And it is basically on Temple Bar, couldnt ask for more.
An excellent location! Sam is a considerate host and the space is lovely and private. Do be prepared to walk up 81 steps, but it's well worth the climb!
Amazing location
This place had the perfect location! We were a short walk from city centre and Sam provided a great list of recommendations for places to go during our short visit.

Although we could not meet Sam and Abdullah personally, we enjoyed our stay very much. The apartment is perfectly centrally located in the heart of Dublin and is only a short walk from the temple bar and other attractions. The apartment is very clean the entry and exit procedure is very simple and I would recommend this apartment to anyone. 
Thank you for the nice time and see you soon 
Deniz

Sams apartment is perfect for your stay in Dublin. Very centrally located with food and bars near by and easy access to public transportation! 
Sam makes you feel at home and provides privacy even while being in another persons home. 
Hes a lovely host and I would recommend him to anyone and everyone!

The location of Sam's apartment is very conducive to setting off on foot to explore the Dublin City. Sam was very good at responding to questions and was quite good at offering local/insider tips to the city.
Great space and fantastic location

Sams place was my last place my niece stayed at on our holiday in Europe. The cats are so cute and incredibly friendly. Sam greeted us at the apartment with a huge smile and great music. He provided a list of places to see and eat that were close by and hes tried. When I return to Dublin I will definitely stay here Again!
Perfect location for exploring the city and Sam even have great travel tips for our next destination as well. Had a lovely time in Dublin

Had a perfect stay at Sams flat - its confortable, well located, you have all the privacy you need but the hosts are lovely and that includes 3 beautiful cats which are a pleasure and dont bother you at all. You cant really find many places which offer better value for money in Dublin - highly recommend it!

Amazing location close to everything you need! Easy check in! And Sam was great at communicating and accommodating to us dropping off our bags early. Sam also has three super friendly cats! Was great to be welcomed by them. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go!

Sam's was a perfect spot for us to stay in Dublin:: walking distance from the main attractions and in a quiet, rooftop apartment.  The check-in process was very clear and helpful, and it was super handy to have the building laundromat available to use, as we like to travel with only a few clothes and wash them as we go!  We do wish there had been a way to lock the apartment from when we left--he keeps the door open (we could lock the deadbolt when we were there, but did not have a key to lock it when we were out).  However, it was on the top floor of a building that felt safe and secure in general.  All the plants and sweet cats made us feel right at home.  It would have been nice to know the cats come and go through the cat door though, before we panicked thinking we had lost them while Sam was away!

My sister and I stayed at Sams apartment in early June 2019 and we had a great time. The apartment was very clean and had a great location. We were able to easily walk to many big attractions from the apartment and theres lots of great food options within a 10 minute walk of the place. Sam also provided a few adaptors which was great because we had brought different adaptors for the rest of our trip. There were three cats that stayed in the living room area and they were all very friendly and cute! I would recommend Sams apartment to anyone traveling to Dublin.

This is more than you can see and greater than you can imagine. Sam is an amazing host in every sense of the meaning. The accommodations are clean and inviting with a sense of a welcoming warmth. I give Sam 35 stars . I look forward to returning.

Sam was an amazing host. I'm just sorry that my mom and I were there for such a short time that we didn't get the chance to chat with Sam more. Plus the location could be beat. Word of caution, there are 7 flights of stairs to get up but Sam was great and brought our luggage down for us when we were leaving.

We really enjoyed our stay at Sam's. Although we never met him (our paths just didn't cross!) he provided loads of information on the area, and we felt extremely welcome in his home. His cats were amazing, and we could really relax in his apartment. 

He was extremely responsive and kind to us - thanks so much Sam!

The only qualm we had was the cleanliness of the apartment. It was generally not as clean as I would have wanted - the kitchen could have done with a bit of a sprucing up. Also, when we arrived (while I think Sam was probably at work), our room wasn't turned over. The sheets weren't changed, and there was rubbish in the room. We should probably have said something earlier - but, the total Brits that we were, we didn't say anything, and Sam unfortunately didn't realise until the next day. Sam was lovely enough to provide a cleaning and service refund, which was not expected at all! So if there's a problem, Sam will 100% solve it - just let him know as soon as it occurs! 

Thanks Sam, for a wonderful stay.
We felt instantly welcome at Sams amazing flat. It was decorated beautifully with all the plants and the terrace was fantastic. We would definitely book again

Do not be fooled by the miss leading photos of a clean and fresh smelling apartment. 
The terrace on my arrival couldnt be more polar opposite to the one listed. When you walk into the flat the first thing that hits you is the smell of the cats and their food. 
Due to reasons I wish to not post on here, I had to book us into a hotel which has left a massive black cloud on what should have been a nice birthday trip. When confronting Sam with this issue he was unwilling to resolve and just pointed me in the direction of Airbnb knowing full well the final say is had by himself.

All in all wouldnt advise this Double room in a penthouse flatù to anyone, much better off in a hotel in Temple Bar, unless of course youre going just for the catsù which apparently is a thing.

Things Sams add fails to mention:

(1) the bed youll be sleeping is is the most comfortable bed in the world and you wont want to visit the rest that Dublin has to offer because youll be far too comfortable in the bed. 

(2) Sams apartment is incredibly close and easy walking distance to nearly everything you can imagine. 

(3) Sam is an incredible host, friendly, and sociable. 

(4) the apartment is clean and quiet.

Appartment was the same as described. We didn't have any issues with the cats. 
Place was very close to many restaurants and attractions

The 80+ step spiraling staircase leads you to a beautiful view of the Dublin skyline.  Being 3 blocks from anything you could want is ideal, as well as having such an accommodating host with 3 adorable cats.  Top-notch experience!
This is the most conveniently located apartment you're going to find!
The listing is accurate and the location is great. We never got a chance to meet Sam, so it felt like we had the entire place to ourselves.
Lovely place in a super central location. Enjoyed the company of the cats and plants. Sam is a very helpful and nice host, definitely recommend this place.

This place was awesome! It was in the heart of Dublin. Walking distance to everything. You dont need to waste the money renting a car while youre here. the place was beautiful and the cats were too cute :)
Stay with Sam!! My 80 year old grandmother did the stairs, so can you! Sams place is in the ideal location and his hospitality was on point, not to mention the adorable and cuddly cats!!
Great neighborhood to be in and within walking distance to everything! Clean room and fantastic balcony views.
This is a great place in the city centre.  Sam is very accommodating and gave us some useful tips on how to enjoy our time in Dublin.

Sams apartment is a DREAM! The room is beautiful and clean, the bed is super comfortable, and the patioîvery cool, especially in the evenings, where you can see The Spires point glowing. The apartment is located centrally, and everything to see and explore in the city is no more than a fifteen-minute walk away. Sam responded very promptly to my messages and inquiries, and I especially appreciate how he helped me with my luggageîboth upon arrival at and departure  from the apartment. Thank you Sam!

Clean, private room. We loved the garden area at the top! Here were cats in the main loving which we loved but may want to keep in mind if you have allergies. It can be a bit loud if you sleep with the windows open at night since it is in a more busy area of Dublin, but that is to be expected with such a central location! Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper!

Sam's Airbnb was a wonderful experience! The location is convenient to the city centre. There are restaurants, bars and shops nearby. A short walk brought us to the River Liffey. From the river, we found our way to Temple Bar. We did not need a taxi nor a bus. We have been to Dublin many times. We love it! On our walk from our Airbnb, we discovered a new favorite restaurant. Zaytoons, an Arabic restaurant with wonderful food. It is easy to follow vegan/vegetarian diet there. The roasted stuffed peppers and stuffed aubergines are amazing. We ate there several times. Sam is very friendly and accommodating. He has three lovely cats who are willing to be cuddled by strangers. The guest room is well done. Lovely and comfortable experience. We would happily stay there again.
Very good location yo get to the bars and restaurants in Temple Bar. Accommodation very clean and comfortable
Wonderfully located, clean place to stay, with the added touch of a few friendly cats :) Host was very kind and helpful as well.
Perfect location for a weekend in Dublin. Highly highly recommend!!

Great location and warm hosts.
I worked at my computer in the living room, and found the cats very relaxing.
The location is perfect, the amenities were great.  He has three cats but they are very friendly and don't bother you. Communication was very good and Sam was very helpful. We would stay here again.

Sam's a very friendly host, interested in people and their stories. My husband and I had some very nice discussion with Sam when our timetables intersect. 

Location of Sam's place is fantastic - a short walk to virtually anywhere in the city centre. The built-in "stair-master" whipped us in shape - 81 steps walk to the top floor suite and no elevator. Could be intimidating at first but the rewards are cool view, nice breeze, and getting fit and ready for your many city walkabouts!
Sams place was in a great location and was very clean! We loved our stay in Dublin!
We really enjoyed staying at Sams place. The apartment is located close to city transit options, shopping and a lot of restaurants.

Sam's place was perfect for our Dublin visit. It is very centrally located for everything we wanted to see and do--pubs, music, museums, historical cites. We bought a bus pass we never used because everything is so walkable. The room is very private and the bed very comfortable. Though neither of us is really a cat person (we have dogs) we loved meeting and getting to know the very friendly kitties who graciously share the space with Sam and Ab. We appreciated the exercise the four story climb provided everyday which, at the end of a long day out and about, we affectionately dubbed the "stairway to heaven ".

Location was great, right in the centre of Dublin. Sam was a great host. Unfortunately, we didnt see much of each other as my husband and I were out a lot. We would definitely stay again at Sams place.
Sam's place is in a great location, walking distance from many different interesting neighbourhoods. The apartment is beautifully decorated. I would definitely stay here again my next time in Dublin.

I loved staying at Alan's place. The location was perfect for me -- a pleasant walk along the canal to get to work and great location for restaurants, morning coffee, etc. I felt like I was living in the neighborhood I'd want to live in if I actually lived here, which was exactly what I was hoping for. The upstairs was beautiful and full of sunlight even on somewhat gloomy days. I'd absolutely stay again.

The two separate bedrooms and bathrooms make it an ideal flat to share for 2-4 people. The kitchen and living room upstairs are bright and spacious - perfect for hanging out. Also, had no issue finding free parking close by. On top of that Alan is a terrific host. Had a brilliant stay!

I am deeply sorry about what happened on the first day. I mean I was come very late night. I know she has working every morning early. But she wait for I come to the end..  

The house was great like my home. 
I was happy with you ..
Amazing little space for one that is well located.
It's a good quiet place a bit pit of the centre :)
Nice place and friendly hosts. Cheap, quite, clean and warm. I would repeat. Thanks you for everything!
Very convenient location close to the city centre and easy public transport!
Comfy spot in a location right by the bus stop. Good bang for your buck
clean, quiet, spacious, excellent lighting and bus station is very close, that takes you to the center in 15 or 20 minutes. I recommend Mis Elva¬¥s place 100 %
Excelente!!
Great location for public transport
Tranquilo.
A place to put your head after a long day

I enjoyed my time at Elva's home! The room was clean and very comfortable for me to stay in. The family dog, Buddy, is so cute! Elva's sons are nice and always said hello to me. I would recommend this host and would stay here again!
Elva and her sons were nice.
Elvas home is so comfortable- I was on Dublin for an academic conference and the room has a great desk for working. She was a very sweet and welcoming host and Buddy the dog is a wonderful addition!

This was an outstanding place to stay! Not right downtown, so youre out of the hustle and bustle, but really easy to get to with public transport. Elva was great too!! Either having something prepared for breakfast or leaving it up to me, the whole experience was enjoyable. Also their dog is really adorable too.

I stayed 4 week at elvas lovely house. The check in was very easy. Elva is a very friendly person. She is used to tourist so she speaks a very good English to understand. The room is small but totally comfortable. Elva was really friendly. I could asked her everything and she always tried to help me. I enjoyed the talks we had.  I rent a bike so it took me 20 min to cycle into town. But there is a bus station just in front of the house. I am so glad to met Elva and her family.

Elva is a great person and the place is the best BNB I had so far. It is very good connected with the Bus to city center, the room is lovely and tidy, the persons are friendly and the area is very quiet! The prize was amazing and I enjoyed my stay very much! Thanks to Elva for the friendliness!

I highly recommend this place! Elva and her sons are very nice and their dog is cute! I did not find it so cold in the house, but the electric blanket is really pure luxury! The room is good as it is! I was there for 3 weeks and I felt very well. You do not need more! Once a week I was able to wash my clothes. The bus stop is almost on the doorstep. I would like to thank Elva very warmly, also for the nice conversations and for the invitation for dinner, which I could not pursue, which I am very sorry. Top accommodation! Great people! Gladly again!
Really nice place to stay!
Elva was an amazing host. The house is really close to public transportation and the bathroom was always clean. It was a really short trip but I had a great time.
Aguir and his wife are a wonderful couple, it was good to met you. They are really sweet and ready to help in case you need anything.
Lovely home and lovely people!

Nice Appartement, really close to Dublin and Howth. Train station is just a few minutes away. Aguiar and his wife are great hosts, they gave us advices and theyve been hearty and   Interested! We would definetely come back!

Accommodation is great and although it is away from the center there are many places of interest like a large beach, a castle with beautiful gardens in Malahide. A direct train to the city center is nearby. The hosts are great young people who like to advise you on everything you need. We were very happy to meet them.

A friend of mine and I spent a long weekend in Dublin and definetly chose the right place to stay. The communication with Aguiar was quick and easy, same as the check-in and check-out. The flat was clean, the two cats just lovely and the bed as cozy as you could wish.  During daytime there is a good connection to the city centre, in the evening you have to look after the schedule or take a taxi.
The only thing to mention are the train and airplane noises close by - we weren't disturbed, only for others to know.
A place to recommend!

The Aguiars are very friendly. They answered our questions and gave us very good tipps.
I can just recomend a stay in this appartement :)

Absolutely lovely hosts! Perfect location, homely, welcoming, just loved it!
Would definitely go back
a really friendly host and a clean and tidy accomodation. Thanks a lot for everything

Aguiar and Vinnie are two very lovely people. They helped us with all the questions we had and showed us great hospitality in their flat. They are two very open minded and kind people.All in all, amazing hosts and a great Airbnb!
Das Ehepaar Aguiar war sehr freundlich und unkompliziert.

Aguiar and his wife are very friendly and their flat is in a convenient location with both DART trains and buses to Dublin a short walk away. The room we slept in had a comfortable bed and was quiet, however, there were issues with cleanliness both in the bedroom and the bathroom we were using (it didn't seem as though these rooms were cleaned before our arrival) and the bedroom was very sparsely furnished (there was no hairdryer and only one towel per person).
Great communication, Aguiar is extremely good host! Thank you!

Aguiar is a gracious host that stayed up to help us with a late check in, help us on future adventures with recommendations and provide excellent details on whatever we needed. The nicest host! Thank you Aguiar!
Just needed somewhere to put our heads down for the night after a concert in Malahide. Did what it said on the tin
Brilliant hosts, lovely people and an excellent room. Very comfy bed. Slept great.

Bright and spacious place, kitchen has everything you need
Some noise from neighbors and the close by airport
Ras parfait...
The place is nice. Hospitality is great. Train station is really near so Dublin is easily in reach. Elvis and Piaf made the house cosy
They are very friendly and always open for a conversation. Dublin was easy to reach by train. They also have 2 lovely cats who will make your stay even better.
A clean space and comfy bed near beaches but with quick links into the city.
Aguilar's hospitality is outstanding as is his kindness and willingness to interact with guests, the neighborhood is nice, the bed is very comfortable and the fluffy cats are the cherry on top!

Very nice couple with cute cats. The communication was very easy and they where very  helpfull with tips and anything else we needed. 
The house is next to a train station which is very convienent.
We would  reccomend to stay here.
Thanks for accommodating us.
Aguiar is very nice host, willing to help us with the transport and everything we needed. Housing nice, comfortable bed, cats ... :-) everything was perfect, we really enjoyed our staying in Dublin.

Aguilar was very hospitable, and the location made it easy to get into Dublin. However I dont recommend staying if you have even the slightest allergy to cats. I dont have a serious allergy and we kept our door shut but the cat hair made our stay difficult. I understand that it is hard to avoid cat hair in a home with two friendly cats, but I would use discretion if you have any level of cat allergies. Otherwise, the house was clean, in a nice area and close to the station.

Priscilla was a great host. She welcomed us in the evening and showed us all the flat, which was exactly as in the pictures. Everything was very clean and well organised. Their two cats are very quiet and friendly. We would definitely recommend staying with them if you want to be close to the city but avoid all the noise.

The place was wonderful! The location of the apartment is not too hard from the city center but it is also in a good area! Also, it is close to the airport! The hosts are wonderful. Super friendly and welcoming! I suggest this place if you plan on traveling to Dublin, Ireland.

Matt's place is very close to the airport, which is handy if you have an early flight. The breakfast was good and self-service. The beds were not really comfortable, but okay for one night. Unfortunately the heater didn't work and it was really cold in our room...communication could have been better in this case, although matt usually replied quickly

The location for Matt's AirBNB was a good location. It's literally 10-15 minute walking distance from the Dublin Airport, and is near a lot of bus stops for you to take into town, which is 40 minutes away from the place. The place was nice and clean, and would definitely recommend for those trying to find a place near the Airport.
Great spot at the airport. Highly recommend if youre looking for an easy wake up before a flight.

Matt's place was so conveniently located near the airport. It only took a few minutes to walk to the place after having a late flight arrival at Dublin Airport and then easily accessible for catching an early morning flight. The continental breakfast was nice. He provides several different kinds of cereal, toast, milk, juice, coffee, and fruit. The serving room was nice and quiet to enjoy my breakfast meal. The shower was nice and hot. The bed was very comfortable. I would highly recommend Matt's place for catching an early morning flight.

As stated.  Super short walk or taxi ride to the airport.  My wife thought this had breakfast included, although there is an area like a dining area, there were some fruits but not a breakfast.  

Excellent for quick in and out!
Perfect location. Nice B&B for one night.
Best location for flying out from. Very good, reasonably priced food in bar close by.
The building is not fancy but it is clean. The location is perfect, you can walk to the airport and car rental offices. There is a good restaurant next door.
Matt was very friendly and accommodated our early checkout time, room was as shown in the images, nice and clean. Would recommend.
Great location for a early flight out for an easy walk to the airport!
Nice place to stay with a great location. Next to the airport and a few minute walk to an awesome cocktail lounge. Easy to check-in as well.
Surprisingly quiet for an airport location. Great communication from Matt and some travel tips for our plans. Toast, cereals, fruit and tea & coffee in the mornings.
Very uncomplicated and super easy communication! We arrived very late and they put the key in a locker. Ideal for just one night.

close to the airport and car rent agencies.
tidy.
small rooms and some noisy due to traffic
Everything was clean and tidy.  Matts instructions made check in easy even with us arriving late and leaving early.

The three bed room we booked was as expected. We used the room only for one night before we collected a camper close to the airport for our one week stay in Ireland. The provided breakfast in the breakfast room was good. We can recommend Matt's Cloghranguesthouse B&B.
Great place very close to the airport. Basic and simple accommodation but very clean and comfortable.

This B&B is located directly across from the car rental return, so very convenient. Beds were comfortable. Did not avail of the breakfast as we left too early. Quiet and slept like a log despite being right next to airport. Recommend.

Had a great stay here.  Matt is a very accommodating host. The location is only about 10 to 15 minute walk to the airport which is very convenient for early morning flights. The price was much cheaper than the nearby hotels. The room was clean and comfortable. There is also restaurant next door. There is a major road in front of the building, so there was some street noise, but it didn't impact my sleep.
Great to catch an early flight

Matt knew what he was talking about... location, transportation, etc.  Comfortable room and everything was spotless.  Can't say enough about convenient location to the airport.  Surprisingly not noisy.  Yes, an occasional rumble, but really just a low level background hum trust didn't disturb me. Going back here again

Thanks for a lovely stay. In one word our stay was superb. Brendan was thoughtful kind helpful and always available. We stayed for five weeks and had a blast. What you may or may not see through the photographs is the incredible energy that Brendans apartment possesses. 
I do hope my future travels brings me to Dublin  and if that should ever materialize I will not hesitate to stay in Brendans apartment. Cheers
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Fantastic location sandwiched between Dublin Castle and City Hall across the street from Temple Bar.  All of the tourist sites we were hoping to see were within a 2 mile walking distance.  The day tour buses to Cliffs of Moher, Giant's Causeway and similar sites are located within 4 blocks as is the 747 bus from Dublin Airport.  We did our grocery shopping at Dunnes which was about 4 blocks away.  The apartment is 2 bedroom, 1.5 baths with a spacious common area and a reasonably stocked galley kitchen.  One of the bedrooms had a brand new, comfortable mattress which arrived on our first day.  We ate out more often than our normal airbnb stay due to the diversity and quality of nearby restaurants and pubs.  Luke's communications were excellent though we didn't have the opportunity to meet as Luke was on an international trip.  We were met by Luke's Mom, Serena, who was extremely gracious and welcoming.  We stayed for 12 days and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.  We would definitely stay at Luke's again.

Lukes place was amazing! We met his mother Serena at check in and she was so incredibly kind, warm, and helpful! Lukes communication was also so quick and helpful! The location is PERFECT, and the home was lovely! When we come back we will definitely stay here. Highly recommend!

Fantastic place and location! Honestly you can't beat this location. 2 min walk from Temple Bar, but not loud at all. Literally in the center of Dublin sites. We were 2 couples in our 30s/40s. The space accommodated us perfect. Rooms are on opposite ends of house, so there is privacy. Luke was a great host and got back to us quickly even though he was out of town. We never got the TV to work (not Lukes fault, but hopefully fixed). The only thing we suggested was simple house instructions. We weren't sure where to put trash, etc. Overall we absolutely loved the place and would definitely stay again!! Don't forget to start your day off with and Irish coffee across the street. Unbelievable!!

Lukes apt. is centrally located in Dublin close to, and walkable to most major attractions.  The location is the highlight of the apartment.  It was spacious enough, and the two bedrooms are at opposite ends of the apartment which is great for privacy.  The trade-off is that it does get noisy at night especially when the bars close.  Weekends are much noisier than mid-week.  There are 1.5 bathrooms but only one shower which was fine for 2 people, but could be a challenge for 2 couples.  The half bath is rather small with a small wash basin which would be a challenge for a bigger person.
Although Luke was not there (traveling internationally), we were met by his mother Serena who lives upstairs. She was very nice and informative, and also left some basic food and kitchen supplies (as well as ponchos for the rain).  It was great to have coffee and milk for the morning before we got to go shopping and the brown bread with creamy Irish butter was quite tasty.
We did have a higher expectation for the cleanliness of the apartment- the kitchen and appliances were in need of better cleaning and the bedrooms did not appear to have been vacuumed prior to our stay.  We were also a bit leary of the washer and did not use it.  
Overall, Luke and his Mom were very friendly and helpful when needed and the location of the apartment was a big plus.  It was also a bit pricey compared to other Airbnbs weve stayed at but it is priced primarily for the location as previously stated.  A very good choice for a young couple looking to be centrally located in the heart of Dublin who are not light sleepers and enjoy city living.

Luke is a great host! The apartment is clean, well-stocked, and in a great location - a short walking distance to just about anything you need (food, pubs, public transportation, activities, etc.).  The apartment looks just like the photos. Luke responded quickly when we asked him a few questions and even left a couple of rain ponchos for us (which we didn't even need!). If we go back to Ireland we will definitely try to stay there again!

If you are looking for accommodations in a very central location, this is the perfect place. It has a lot of charm being a very old, historic home. All the necessities are there and includes a washer and dryer. I would recommend it and should we ever be able to return to Ireland, I will try to stay here again..

Luke's place is the perfect location to enjoy the sights of Dublin with Temple bar within a block, a quick walk to Trinity College, the train station and many other activities!  The apartment was beautifully appointed with everything we needed!

This space is a great location for travelers who want to be in the midst of the action. Its location to the major festive (bar areas) cant be beat. Its about a 5-8 minute walk to Trinity College (even with the hordes of people). In the evening it did get a bit warm and we had to open the front window exposing us to street noise and revelry of party-goers. The back bedroom has an amazing sliding glass door that kept the area cool at night. Luke is amazing at correspondence even when hes on holiday. This is a great place for couples and solo travelers who are into the party scene! We enjoyed our time here immensely.
Newly renovated living space near everything in the city of Dublin.  Great Pubs and restaurants.  Right across from a live theatre and on the entrance to Dublin Castle.

Fantastic apartment right in the heart of Dublin. You couldn't ask for a better location and the apartment itself is surprisingly peaceful despite its central location. Luke is a fantastic host and always responds rapidly to any or messages or queries. Thanks a million for a great stay!
What a nicely decorated apartment this is. It looks recently renovated. Great location. 10 minute walk to Trinity College and near by cosy restaurants. Luke answered fast.

We stayed at Lukes place for 2 weeks. You couldnt ask for a better location, adjacent to Dublin Castle and within easy walking distance of many interesting areas....churches (eg Christchurch and St Patricks..also check out one of the oldest, St Michans, shopping...Grafton St, Henry St, museums-we particularly like the Yeats museum and the Little Museum of Dublin, Trinity College, the lovely St Stephens Green park, cafes and restaurants-Queen of Tarts nearby, Avoca, (Website hidden by Airbnb) well as the easy access (Dart) to some of the small fishing/seaside communities - Howth, Bray, Dun Laoghaire etc. The highlight of this Air BnB is its historical significance; built in 1790, for a time it was a charity of the Sick and Indigent Roomkeepers Society. Fortunately the house was preserved and renovated and to this day is a testament to the dedication to, and the priority for, maintaining and keeping this piece of legacy and history alive. And one can sense the history inherent in this home. Its a good place to make one feel at home amongst the locals in Dublin. Thank you to Luke for all his info and quick responses and for allowing us travelers a glimpse into the past.
Lukes place is very well located, literally everything is only 5 mins walk away.
Location is hreat.  A nice comfortable place right in the city. Easy access to cafes, transport and food outlets. Will definitely stay again.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would love to come back again sometime.

The house was sparkling clean, the view was absolutely outstanding and Myriam was a great host, welcoming us with food essentials etc. 
P.S There really are horses outside the place!
Nice apartment, though its more like a cottage in feel, wonderful scenery and view
Wonderful location.  Peaceful and serene.  Great host.  Perfect start to our Ireland vacation.
Would definitely recommend staying with Natasha if you are coming to Dublin. Great hospitality and accommodations in a central location.

Natasha was a lovely host with great communication prior to and during the stay. 

Beautiful and clean home. I was kindly put up in the double room of which the bed was a very comfortable as well as the surroundings. The bathroom was big with a really good power shower.

Excellent location with amenities at the end of the road, within short walking distance to Stephens Green, town and tourist attractions with the addition of good bus links for further afield and to the airport. 

I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend. 

Thank you Natasha ! x

I had the single room in Natasha's house and highly recommend it. Everything is just perfect: The cosy room, the sportless bathroom, the lovely house and interior, the sweet little garden, the location - very quiet but central, too - and the great friendly host, Natasha, who was most helpful and offers a lovely breakfast in the morning. I had a great stay.
What an amazing place and host! The proverbial home from home and more, amazing hospitality, great location, beautiful space, one could not ask for anything else. A complete gem, highly recommended!
Very nice and cozy place! Very friendly host.
Natasha has a beautiful house that is a haven of tranquility a stone throw away from the city hustle.  I highly recommend her a non invasive and perfectly charming host.

Natasha is a lovely welcoming host and her place is so stylish, full of character and situated very centrally. Appreciated the info from Natasha on what's on, especially as it was Culture Night in Dublin. Natasha's place comes highly recommended - a real treat.
A warm, comfortable environment in a great location.
Its a good place to get a real spirit of Dublin.

We had a very homely and warm experience for the 6 weeks in Dublin. The house is equipped with great amenities and is convenient to get to city centre / grocery stores. The interior design of the house is really cool! Iain was prompt in responding to our queries. Thank you for the hospitality! It's a pity that the house might not be on Airbnb listing in the near future. If possible, we'd definitely like to return to this house when we visit Dublin again!

I had a great stay in Iain's apartment. It was very clean, nicely decorated and more than spacious with two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a living room and kitchen. Attractions such as Trinity College or Temple Bar can be reached on foot in 10 minutes. Iain always gave me good advice. I can only recommend him. Gladly again.

My friends and I had a really great (Email hidden by Airbnb) municaton was excellent and the appartment is  well located and very comfortable for 4 adults. I definitely recommend staying there and will not hesistate to do it again in the future.

A cool Dublin townhouse in a very central location. Easy to get to from the Airport on the Airlink bus (747).

The house design is quirky, but this really worked for us as we had friends with a baby so the downstairs bedroom was great for them. 

The kitchen is fully functional with a large fridge, hob and microwave. Bathrooms were clean and not too small. 

Living room had all the tech you'd need and great for chilling out in the day or evening. Good selection of books and music to browse through.

As cyclists we found the bike equipment very useful and there are two bike hire shops just 100m or so away. We used River Cycles which was easy and cheap for the day.

Great location. 5 mins from the centre and close to good pubs and bars. 

Iain was a great host and very communicative. The house manual was very informative and comprehensive. 

Would stay here again for sure.
Great place, great location, excellent host and amazing local suggestions.
Great location and lovely host

The apartment was beautiful and cannot recommend this place enough. The location is ideal for all the Dublin go-to spots and is close to a ton of pubs. Everything was clean and we loved the upstairs projector room! Would definitely stay there again! Cheers

Beautifully designed space in Dublin! Steps away from the airport bus (747) and we could walk to the Dublin Castle, Temple Bar, and tons of other sights. Iain is a great host and we loved staying here.
Very clean, great location, easy check in and communication with Iain. Would highly recommend.
Everything really nice, great host, big flat, beautiful, perfect location! Nothing to complain about!
Zentral gelegenes Altstadthaus mit besonderen Details. Toller Wohnbereich unter dem Dach.
A perfect weekend apartment!!! As everything, the location, hospitality and fun apartment. Ian is great.

We (4 ladies) stayed 4 night in this wonderful apartment. It was exactly as described, everything we needed was available. So nice details all over the house (pictures, decoration, even the equipment in the bathrooms!), very stylish and nothing was missed. The house is located very close to the city hotspots - within Dublin downtown but still quiet and aside the trouble. We could manage everything walking on foot, perfect!
Iain was a perfect host as well, very nice, taking care and responding directly! Really appreciated him to be that available and taking care about our stay. Absolutely recommend this apartment - we definatlely plan to come back soon :)

The location was great. Also wonderful that you can access the apartment with a digital keypad. Also we were able to drop our luggage early which was helpful. 

The beds were comfy as well! 

As some noted there are a lot of stairs do keep that in mind!

Excellent location , lovely home, comfortable beds, all you could need for a great stay inner Dublin 
Will come back for sure 
Catherine

The house is centrally located and yet it is very quiet.  The apartment is very personal and chic. On the three levels you have plenty of space and we felt right at home. Everything was exactly as described. I especially want to mention that the whole house was very clean and tidy. Iain was a very good host, he answered quick an precisely. We would like to come back anytime and recommend this holiday rental. Besides this, Dublin is great, vivid, rough, beautiyful,  interesting...
Excellent location. Lots of room.
Terrific location close to everything. Space has great character and comfortable beds.
Its such a pleasant trip that everything is perfect. The location is perfect.

Iains place was perfect for our first trip to Dublin.   The apartment is in a great location... everything is within a few blocks walk.  The apartment itself is very comfortable, charming and quirky in the best way.  

We didnt have the pleasure of meeting Iain in person but he was very helpful and responded to all my messages immediately.  

We had a great stay!

I was on a week long trip for work and this place gave me a nice little escape to unwind after a long day. It had the creature comforts of being in someones home vs a hotel or bare bones air bnb. I really liked that I could park right out front with street parking which made having a car super easy. I wish I was able to just rent one room as it was only me staying so the price was a little higher than my needs required but would certainly stay again.

Ian's property is well located to all that Dublin has to offer.  It seemed to be a residential area, so not as bustling and loud as other areas of the city, but so close to everything that we wanted to do while visiting the city.

Amazing place... Amazing decoration, really cozy appartment ... Very nice area, close to everything. Easy check in and check out. Even though I didn't met Iain, 2 times that I texted him during my stay, he replied in few minutes. I would recommend for sure the house for everyone that wants to visit Dublin
Great location within walking distance to Temple Bar and many great sites!
We had a lovely stay at the house, it was homely, comfortable and in a great location. Iain was more than helpful during our stay and we'd it recommend to anyone.
The host canceled this reservation 176 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Great location, great interior style, great character, great amenities. Iain's place was an overall great option and we would definitely be okay staying here again. You can walk pretty much anywhere within the city limits. It was easy to come and go as we pleased. It was kind of tricky to find the exact location at first, but we figured it out. We were able to get snacks and water and then store them in the kitchen nicely. The laundry machine was great to have since I pack very lightly (although I tried to use the dryer but it didn't seem to dry too well - maybe I did something wrong?). The artwork and books are really fun to browse through. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and easy to use. Overall, the place felt welcoming. Iain was nice and easy to communicate with.

Thank you so much Iain for sharing your home with us! The location was ideal, as the home is thoughtfully located a few streets away from the main city but still close enough that you can walk to every attraction easily. The communication was fast and effective, and the beds were extremely comfortable!

Paula provided a comfortable experience, and was extremely helpful with any questions I had. The house was very lovely, and well decorated with a cute backyard perfect for relaxing and enjoying a good meal. Several delicious restaurants within walking distance as well. 

Great experience overall :)

I would highly recommend the accomodation at Paula's  house to anyone. She is very helpful and likes to give tips for sightseeing and excursions. The room is clean and several bus routes to the city centre can be reached within a minute.

Natasha was a fantastic host for my solo trip to Ireland. She was very responsive and even let me check-in early. Her place is lovely (the pictures dont do it justice!). It is multiple stories with a picturesque garden. The kitchen has so much bright natural light. The neighborhood is just a short walk from most of the tourist spots and near great restaurants away from crowds. Totally safe to walk about! Would highly recommend and would book again in an instant!
Natasha is a super host, courteous and very well organized. Her house is a real gem in a very central area: clean, spacious and tasty.

My stay at Natashas home was lovely.  She is a great host. Her home is centrally located which made it very easy to get around.  The bed is very comfy. I enjoyed my stay.  I highly recommend staying in Natashas home.
Natashas home is cozy, pleasant, and in a great location. She was highly accommodative and quick to respond.

Wonderful host and wonderful location. The location was perfect for my weekend stay in Dublin. Ideal for shopping, eating and meeting friends. Natasha is a warm, welcoming and insightful host so would highly recommend.

The Kavanaghs Mews is well furnished and spacious. We travelled as a familly (4adults and 2 kids 2.5 & 4.5 years old). We found everything we needed including groceries and pharmacy in walking distance.

A spacious quiet safe location in Dublin,  and while removed from city centre, transportation is all around and we walked almost everywhere within 40 minutes.  Self check in/out was easy and we had a nice Irish welcome basket to greet us as well.   For those who need a larger space and the ability to cook, it is a good travel option.   Kicking us off every morning were the sea gulls and bright sunshine.  WiFi is very weak/spotty though so I'd recommend making sure you take advantage throughout the day in town/tours.  Good recommend though for families traveling to the area and really felt like locals in the Mews!

Really great apartment in a lovely part of Dublin. 
We had 3 nights here for a friends wedding and it was the perfect location. 
Clean, spacious and a lovely welcome basket was a nice touch. 
Short walk into the city centre and lots of good restaurants and bars near by.
Fantastic location & great host & accomadation!
A nice place, quiet and safe. Farther out of city center than I was expecting based on description.
As wonderful as it was the first time we stayed 3 years ago. Incomparable location. We will be back!

Unas place is great- spacious and stylish with lots of pubs, restaurants and bars in walking distance. 

A great place to use as a base to explore Dublin. Will definitely look to stay here again when in the area.
Perfect situated in order to discover Dublin and its surroundings. Well recommended!

The Mews is located in a fantastic area of Dublin. Great for walks to Baggot St for restaurants and the Herbert Park for the kids. A perfect place for us to base ourselves. The Mews is well furnished and very comfortable for our whole family.
Super location for the Dublin Horse Show. Great space in the property. Great access to city centre and restaurants.
Enjoyed stay.
Excellent location and great hospitality!! Fantastic!
House with a great history. 20 min walk to City Center for those visitors without a car. Wifi was spotty through the entire stay

Great location for RDS, tucked away in and quiet in the city. Loved the open fire and a welcome basket of food was great. 
Would definitely recommend.
Super sejour

El alojamiento es tal y como se describe.
Nos sorprendieron con la variedad de desayunos que ofrecen.
Lo mejor la hospitalidad de Margaret.
Delicious cooked breakfast, warm & comfortable room, gorgeous location, with very charming hosts. Highly recommended!
Kathys place is in a really great location, close to the Dart station & Dun Laoighre town centre. Kathy & her son Andrew were really friendly & super easy to deal with.

Great room, very conveniently located for transport into Dublin as well as shops and restaurants around Dun Laoghaire harbour.

The hosts were lovely, and I'd happily recommend anyone stay here.
Excellent location and a very kind host! I can only recommend it!

Kathy was a super host, I cannot expect more. She was polite and offered me all help that I asked for. The home was clean, spacious and well furnished. The place is as described in the post and all amenities are very near by. You have a scrum diddly's right at the street corner. Dart/Bus is a 4 min walk. The pier is nearby and a great place to spend at leisure. I would recommend anyone to definitely stay in her place!

This was a very convenient and easy stay for the end of a month in Dublin. The house is very central for a travel base into downtown Dublin, or south to Dalkey (via DART) and easy to drive or take a tour out to Wiklow Mountains . Easy walks to groceries and restaurants in Dun Laoghaire as well as the Pier /Harbour.  Internet worked well which can be hit and miss in some Airbnb's/BNB's I stayed. I was out most of the two days I stayed but the kitchen was also clean and well set up, bed/bedroom clean and comfortable and Kathy was kind and helpful.
Kathy was a great hoestsst, very kind in welcoming his guests

Kathy is an amazing host! The location is good as well. It is literally next to a nice harbour and the neighborhood is nice and quite. 
The room is warm and cozy. Surely I would recommend it to others:)
It was great to stay in Kathy's place. Near transport and Kathy was fantastic host. Thanks a lot
Great location and host!
Handy location if you are travelling on the DART.  All went well.

Had a fantastic stay in my favourite part of Dublin. Just wish I could have stayed long 
The fresh bread was divine 
Hope to visit again soon  xx

I totally recommend staying here if your staying in Dublin. Its close to the DART and several bus stops if you want to go into the city. Its really close to the pier which is a great place to go for a peaceful walk! Kathy is also very friendly and accommodating!!!

Staying with Kathy was a great experience. She was very friendly and accommodating! The place is very clean and tidy, and just a few minutes walk to the Dart. It is the perfect spot to be outside the city to relax but still close enough to get there if you want to.
Bob is awesome. Very knowledgeable about Dublin. Sat down for coffee upon arrival and had a great conversation. Will definitely return when available!
Great value stay.  Thanks Bob!

Bob is not just a superhost he's a mega ultra host. There are simply not enough superlatives. His place is not only clean, charming, and well located but Bob himself is knowledgeable, helpful, and humorous. He goes out of his way for all of his guests. He really knows Dublin and communicates it well. Plus he's got that espresso machine.

Bob was awesome--my flight had a significant delay, causing me to check in 14 hours later than expected, at about 2 in the morning. I communicated the situation to Bob and he was more than understanding and stayed up to let me in, show me around, and give me a brief overview of the city with a free map. Great place, close to everything, lovely experience.
Bob's place is a great, affordable option in Dublin! Thanks for everything!

A true superhost. Bob does everything to make your stay pleasant from the very booking. 
I would definitely recommend and stay again at his place.
Bob is a wonderful host and his place is great! He gave us valuable information and recommendations which made our stay much more enjoyable. Highly recommended!
Bob was great! Sat down with me and pointed out some great spots to visit in Dublin.  Very happy with my stay.

Cosy room in a typical little house full of charm. The house is located in the very city center, close to all the things you need to see. Bob provided us a very warm welcome and told us all about the right adresses to visit.

Bob is a great host and really pulls out the stops getting you oriented to the town. 
His place is homey and a really central location. Bed was very comfortable. His kitchen is well stocked.

Bob is a great host and works to make sure everything is perfect for your stay. His place is in a great location to all the popular places (only a few minutes walk). I liked it because it wasnt in the mayhem of the tourist area so at night the neighborhood was quiet, but it was close enough that getting anywhere was a breeze.  I walked my entire trip and had no problems getting to what I wanted to see.  Would recommend staying here and will if I ever visit Dublin again.

Bob has the perfect place for a visit to this wonderful city. We came by cruise ship and getting to the house was not easy. Bob help us through the problem in a very timely matter, and he was there to greet us as promised. He gave us a lot of suggestions as to what to do and where to have our meals in the city.  

Bob is one of the best Airbnb experience for us. We would highly recommend him.
Bob was an amazing host.  Super accommodating, and had wonderful tips on things to see, things to eat, and things to do around Dublin.  I would stay here again!

Bob's place is homely terraced house  in a great location at the heart of the original Dublin. Bob is a great host, with deep knowledge of the city and attention to detail around the house. Recommend.

Bob is a wonderful host. Easy to contact and very friendly. He gave many helpful tips and and a wonderful recommendation for a genuine pub experience. Great location, too. We were very happy with our stay.

I loved staying at Bob's place! It is super close to a number of things and he gave us a ton of local tips. We went to the Teeling distillery which was just 3 minutes walk and there really nice breakfast place was right outside his door. It is also just a few minutes walk from St. Patricks Cathedral and a delightful fish and chips place (Leo Burdocks).

Bob was very accommodating and kind. He gave us helpful recommendations and was very knowledgeable about Dublin. The place itself was described accurately and we had a very comfortable stay. It was easy to walk everywhere and to get a bus to/from the airport. Would highly recommend!

We had many delays getting to Dublin, and Bob was understanding and ready to accommodate every one with quick responses. When we finally did arrive after midnight, he was there to greet us and get us settled in. The room was quiet and very comfortable. Coffee and cereal in his garden in the morning was a wonderful start to our trip. I would recommend his place and hope to return soon!

This place is perfect! It's a great location and a very cosy, secure and comfortable place to stay in the heart of Dublin. It's a lovely place, privately tucked away from the main strip but still in walking distance to many attractions and the heart of Dublin. The hosts are lovely and very helpful. This is a great place to stay and we would love to come back!
Bob is a great host, very helpful. His place is in a great location. I will recommend his place and the opportunity to meet a wonderful guy.
Bobs place is wonderful for anyone visiting Dublin. We could walk to any place we wanted to see!

A very clean and confortable place to stay.  Very nice touches, with flowers and lots of plants, and restful decor.  Super fast responses to my messages, and many thanks for all your help, Bob,  with the changes to the bus route leading to your place.

It is a nice simple house. No luxury, but youll find everything you need for a nice staying. Rooms (3 bedrooms) are small but it is typical of this area. Position is good: 15 min walking to the main attractions. House is in a quite street. But the really super value is Bob. He was the best host I have met in many years. He will be not an host but a friend that helps every guests in any requests, suggestions, dubts. He knows very well Dublin. I will come back to Bob for sure.

BOB IS SUCH A GREAT HOST! the location is near local stores, bars and restaurants. If you are looking for anything bob will have a solution. Its a short stroll to mamy sites in the area and worth renting the room! Would definitely stay again.

The things I appreciated most from my stay at Bobs was that I was 
greeted by Bob at the door and explained to me how things worked. 

I felt safe and appreciated the tips about taxis, suggestions of what to see and the safer areas of town to visit. (my concern)

My room was neat and tidy and the bed was very comfortable. The coffee was an added bonus as was the cereal and fruit for jet lagged midnight meals. 

I would be happy to stay again should I be back in the area.
Perfect host, perfect location, all there you need. Thanks Bob, I'll be back!

Bob is a nice lad, I arrived late (around midnight, plane got delayed) and he handled the situation perfectly.
The house is well located, really close to the city center by foot. Also, it's in a dead end and very quiet. The bed is comfy, I had very good nights rest.
There are some cereals/milk/coffee/tea for breakfast. You can use the kitchen to cook something as well.
Overall really good experience!
Bob takes pride in the neatness of house and having clean PRESSED sheets on every bed.

Laid-back, comfortable and a great location. Unassuming and easy base from which to explore Dublin.  Even before arrival, Bob was in communication to suggest the best (up-to-date as the bus stops had changed)) way to get in. Bobs gave a warm welcome and introduction to the house, the neighbourhood, places to eat and things to do. The location is brilliantîaround the corner from the National Archivesîand walking distance to most central attractions. The coffee / espresso machine got my days off to a good start¶and the complimentary cereals, teas etc were certainly welcome.

We had a great time at Bob's place! The area is perfect for exploring Dublin, the communication and check-in were supereasy and very pleasant and the whole appartement is very clean. Thank you for having us Bob!

Bob's place was great value for the low cost. He was super helpful, great communication and very informative and helpful when I arrived. The 3 bedroom place shares a bathroom but that was no problem. Very quiet neighborhood, slept very well.
everythings good!
Place as described. Great location.
excellent reception, wonderful accommodation, perfect location! I highly recommend it!
I enjoyed staying at Nadia s place.
A great room with mountain view and big double bed. In general, a, clean and spacious house with comfort and really sweet hosts. Till next time.

We loved this house so much it was hard to get over our jet lag...we didnt want to leave and kept taking naps in the cozy space! Wed return in a minute! Arron was super quick to respond to every question. The location is ideal, right around the corner from two beautiful parks, and walkable to everything.
It felt really special to enjoy these accommodations for a family holiday.
We loved staying at this beautiful location, close to everything but still private and quiet. I highly recommend staying here for a memorable experience in Dublin.

The description of this unit is quite accurate. It's a well situated flat. It's very quiet and the rooms are nicely furnished with old pieces. We especially liked the bright, sunny kitchen. The living room is a little darker, but overall the unit is very pleasant. Our family enjoyed it very much.

Such a gem - and what an amazing organization. We were left wanting to plan an entire trip around Ireland just to stay at their locations.  Absolutely perfect location.  Airlink from the airport drops off at the end of the street.  Grocery store at the corner.  Dozens of pubs/restaurants/coffee shops all around.  Yet amazingly quiet due to the location at the center of the block.  Comfortable beds (queen/full/full) with great bedding.  Fully equipped kitchen with washing machine and dishwasher.  Large living room isn't pictured, but has a comfortable couch and several armchairs.  Thanks for a wonderful stay!
They say that there is no place like home.. well, you might feel otherwise once youre welcomed here. Think about visiting your uncle and aunt at a beach house out of a movie. Thats the feeling I had!

Eamon and Margret was soooo great! 
It was really nice to meet them both. I really hope so that we'll meet again. 
Their house is so great and cozy, it really felt like home.
Second time around and the hospitality just doubled. Great people with a big heart who enjoy hosting and making everyone feel at home.

We said in advance that we were going to arrive late and, as having a baby with me, I needed confirmation that was ok.
We got there at 1am, finding an couple of nice old person waiting for us, kind, smiling, taking time to make us feel home at that time in the night.
Same warm behaviour in the morning.
The nicest people I ever met.
A special memory of Ireland for us.

Was made feel so welcome from the moment I arrived. I was well looked after, I dont think I went a second without a cup of tea in my hand, I was in my element. Absolutely brilliant hosts and would recommend to anyone!

Eamonn and Margaret are wonderful hosts. Their home is in a quiet corner of Portrane with good connections into Dublin. If you want to travel by public transport, get a Leap Card. These fine folks made me laugh every day.

I spent such a good long week-end at Eamonn and Margaret's place.
They live in a cute yellow and white wood-built house, yellow being Margaret's favourite colour!
The place is a bit hidden, along a quiet narrow road ending to the beach (no car park there, it is protected).
It looks like everyone in this area built its paradise corner, some in concrete, some others in a mobile-home, long ago, when we didn't have so many rules, which makes it a bit special and unique.
It was exactly what I was looking for to have some nice and long walks along the beach. If you push it in the direction of Donabate, you have a small portion of walk along the road but then, a every nice coastal walk from one Martello tower (Portrane) to another (Donabate), passing along the incredible huge Victorian style Portrane ex-mental hospital.
But what made my stay unique is really the kindness, hospitality and joy of the hosts, they really make you feel at home and you would dream of having them as part of your family!!!
Your next guests are lucky.
Quiet place, great hospitality and wonderful hosts!

Eamonn and Margaret were the perfect hosts. They are so lovely and welcomed me into their home with open arms. The room is a good size with a comfy bed. They are in a lovely location close to the beach.

Eamon and Margaret are the most conscientious hosts you could hope for. They are so welcoming and so warm. Withing minutes we felt at home. They are a pleasure to be around and leave you to your own space when needed. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. To stay here is a complete pleasure and if you are umming and arring please just book it!
We couldnt have picked a better home or more welcoming hosts! Beautiful beach house and so comfortable! Everything was absolutely perfect!!
Eamonn was very quick to respond to my messages and was very obliging.  My father was staying with Eamonn as he was working close by and he was content with his accommodation.

Just back from a lovely stay with Eammon and Margaret. We went down for a concert at Malahide castle, the house is so handy for public transport, there is a bus stop just at the end of the road. The house is cosy and the welcome was fabulous. Eammon and Margaret are an absolute delight to be around! Will be back!

I would most definitely recommend staying here. Eamonn and Margaret were fantastic hosts. Nothing was to much trouble. Very friendly couple. My daughter and I were at Malahide for a concert, Eamonn dropped and picked us up from the train station. Great breakfast would definitely stay there again
Wonderful stay in a nice location with friendly, helpful and warmhearted hosts! Hope to be back some time!

Eamon and Margaret are lovely hosts. It was a pleasure to stay in their home. Margaret made a beautiful breakfast in the morning. They treated me like a family member even though we had just met. I would recommend to anyone to stay with Eamon and Margaret.
Lovely hosts! We had a wonderful short stay in this Chalet near the beach. Eamonn and his wife were so welcoming and kind. Would recommend to stay here!

This airbnb was a wonderful experience.
Absolute amazing location. Super close the the beach. Fantastic beach walks!
Also it is very close to the airport, which made is booking. Perfect if you wanne escape the busy Dublin.
The rooms were very cosy, very comfortable beds. Absolute quiet at night. We even got a breakfast at 6:30 AM in the morning. Always would come back!
Lovely people who were so welcoming, felt like we knew them for ages!

I would certainly recommend staying with Eamonn and Margaret.  They were very welcoming and accommodating throughout our stay - nothing was too much trouble.  The location is perfect for anyone wanting to either visit Dublin or experience a peaceful seaside break - it's only minutes from the airport or a short train journey to the city from nearby Donabate.  We will be back!

Really nice place in a quiet country side by the sea. Really nice friendly hosts and very helpful especially with transport. If you are looking for good value, honest caring hosts, a quiet location and for a touch of a typical Irish village experience then look no further than here. Highly recommend.

Eamonn and Margaret are wonderful, friendly and thoughtful hosts that made me feel right at home. The room is cozy and the bathroom spacious and pretty. The nearby beach is fantastic, and the house is about a ten minute walk from the local pub. 
Thank you so much Margaret and Eamonn, I hope to be back!
Comfortable homely place in beautiful sea side location. Eamonn & Margaret very friendly.
Nice and great stay. Very friendly people, have great tips and be verry careful to visotors. Next time we will come again.
Persone squisite , ti fanno sentire a casa.

Unbelievably welcoming, and shared in some great conversations and good laughs. An overall great end to what was already a fantastic trip to Ireland. The epitome of Irish hospitality :) Thank you, Eamonn and Margaret.
Lovely friendly couple who went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable
They are very kind and warm like a family

This place is situated in a fantastic central location. 5 minute walk to Temple Bar area and good traditional local pubs on your doorstep. Everything that was needed for our stay was provided. Communication with James was with prompt responses and he was more than happy to help us out. I cant recommend this place enough its outstanding value for money with everything you need in quick walking distance, thank you!!!
A spacious and clean apartment in an amazing location. I would definitely stay here again.
James place is a no frills apartment with a great location for a short stay. He also provided tips & tricks for my first AirBnB rental and trip to Ireland.
As other reviewers said, the apartment is pretty bare bones, but James' communication is awesome and the location is well worth the $$$
This place was great.  James was super helpful with check-in and giving us tips on parking.  It was super close to everything.  The apartment had everything we needed plus extras.

Such a charming place to stay in Dublin! It's very close to lots of restaraunts, a grocery store and it's within walking distance of Trinity College where you can see the Book of Kells. There are about 3 flights to climb, so keep that in mind if you have lots of luggage. The apartment is quite large with an open floor plan and huge windows that let in tons of natural light. They're a bit drafty but the space heater takes care of the chill no problem. Good kitchen set up. A nice tub for relaxing after a night pub crawling. The bed was a bit uncomfortable but not to the point that I couldn't fall asleep. I would totally stay here again.
James place was perfectly located right in the center of the city and the place was sparkling clean.

James' loft is as cozy and lively as Dublin city itself. The location is perfect, 50 m away from the river bank! Gorgeous windows views and a clean, huge space. We'll return, because we loved Dublin, dubliners and James's loft!

We were pleasantly surprised at just how close the flat was to everything-extremely central. Such a beautiful spot and great communication from James! He told us good breakfast spots near by and made sure we had everything we needed. Would 100% recommend this place to others and will definitely be coming back.
Great location!
Great location! We had a little difficulty getting into the place, but once we were there it was great! James was helpful, and responded quickly.
We stayed here during a long layover in Dublin and it was perfect for a short trip.  The apartment was clean, the bed was comfortable and the location couldn't be beat.  Thank, James!
Amazing space. Great neighborhood. Steps away from the nicest and cutest streets and shops
Jamess apartment was perfect for what we wanted, had everything we needed and was in a great location, communication was fast, only slight downfall bed was a little uncomfortable.

A decent value for money and great location. However the bathroom faucet configuration makes it impossible to use warm water and my girlfriend scalded her hand because the one tap was so hot. No electrical outlet in bathroom and the other outlet near a mirror didnt function properly with the adapter. There wasnt a top sheet on the bed which was not appealing.

Perfect location! I hate to write an excellent review because Id like to keep this place a secret. :) James was an amazing host and checked-in periodically to see how things were coming along and to see if I needed anything to help my stay be more comfortable. The apartment was perfect for me and has everything that one can need or want. Thanks James for everything!!!
Just like in the pictures, perfect location. Perfect.

Overall we had a good experience staying at James place in Dublin. Navigating the city isnt the easiest for us so this location was perfect. There was a parking garage just around the corner so that worked out great. I will say if you are elderly or out of shape this is not the place for you to stay. There is about 3 floors of steps  that you will have to carry your bags up and down. Also, the place could  stand for some updating/ upgrades. If you can overlook the decor, paint job, and outside street noise this place will be a great place to stay in Dublin.

I usually give people the benefit of the doubt, but after flying for 6 plus hours and then having to walk around an unknown city to Jamess wifes old work to get the keys at 5:00 in the morning it makes it hard. The accommodations were subpar at best. The bed felt like we were sleeping on a box spring and the pillows were paper thin. The couch had a giant rip in it, and there was only a small heater for the whole place. I would not recommend this place to anyone staying in Dublin.

The apartment is in a great location, perfect for exploring Dublin. It can get a little noisy during the night due to its location above a bar, but nothing some earplugs won't sort! The space could do with a lick of paint and the bed isn't the most comfortable.

Nice place. Simple place. Not fancy but if you want that go to a fancy hotel. This place is clean and has what you need (clean bed, shower kitchen)
It is close to the sites. Easy to get to from the airport. Grocery store is close. Great value for the price. Host communicates well.
The location is great.
Great location! James was very easy to communicate with and quick to respond

Like other reviews said, this Airbnb is a great location but bare bones. I was surprised to walk in and see how bare bones it was. The bed was basically a box spring and the windows were quite drafty. It was just a place to lay our heads. Bonus is that James was very responsive and helpful. Overall, Id say if you want a good deal and location, and dont care about the Airbnb itself...this would be the place for you.

The apartment is a GREAT location and a very quick walk around central Dublin and Temple Bar area, shopping, sites, etc.  It's located on the 3rd floor so be aware of that.  We just came off a cruise so we had luggage to carry up as there are no elevators.
It's secure with magnetic locks and you have to get through 3 doors to arrive at the apartment, which again made it very secure.  We appreciated that.
The apartment is having some work done and needs a little more care but its a big open space and equipped making it a great option, again, considering it's location.
James was VERY easy to get a hold of, made easy arrangements for us to get the keys and offered lots of suggestions for the area.  If you like the price, book this apartment.
The best location, very clean, and great host!

Like many have said, very bare bones. Also one of the most uncomfortable mattresses Ive ever slept on. Fantastic location though, so if you want a simple place to stay to be able to experience the city center and temple bar area, this place is for you
Great Location!
Thank you for a great stay! We couldnt have asked for a better location!

This Dublin apartment is an incredible value. The location is amazing - right in downtown Dublin and walkable to anything. For the price, you cannot beat it. James is a responsive, accommodating host and helped us get an early check-in after a very early flight. Just note this is a 3 floor walk up if you have heavy bags!
Great location, good communication with the host, bright and comfortable appartment
Didnt end us staying here. James was kind in his responses but due to conflicting schedules we and issues with getting into accommodation we had to cancel
Perfectly situated for a trip to Dublin, nice & surprisingly quiet accommodation.
Jamess place was in the perfect location, close to everything, and super spacious. Communication was easy and he was accommodating. We would definitely stay again!
The description was exact. Well located and the check in was made through an attendant in a Cafe really near the studio. I recommend it.

I chose this place primarily for the location - it looked like a short walk to everywhere I wanted to go and didnt disappoint!
I was a little concerned by reviews that mentioned problems with noise, but I didnt have any issues with that at all. This could have been due to me staying from Tuesday to Friday, but I didnt notice any noise from the bar downstairs or the other local pubs.
The space itself is bright and clean with all the basic amenities, and Id recommend the nearby Brother Hubbard for a fantastic morning coffee/breakfast/brunch! I would definitely stay here again.

Location, location, location! Five min walk from Dublin Coach stop and the airlink 747 to the airport. Literally across the street from Templebar and down the street from O'Connell. Everything is walkable- even the three flights of stairs was no bother. The cafe's and bakery nearby will literally make the morning sunlight streaming through the spacious loft something out of a novel. 

There's everything you need to stay in with the Spar just down the road.

James was very accomodating and kind! 

Will be staying here again if I can.

Just stayed one night and it was perfect for 2 of us. There are a few flights of stairs to go up. It's in a great central location and still we had no problem with street noise being too loud. Plus, this was the only place we stayed that had a good working fan!

The place was great, very very much central, even though there were bars close by the noise wasn't too loud, it also stopped very early so it wasn't an issue.

The place is a studio but very spacious, has lots of unique items in the house that give it a good vibe, really enjoyed the space. 

The bed was very comfortable.

Perfect location! Close to all the action but you're on a side street sort of so you can sleep easy at night. Easy and flexible check-in. The place is bare bones but it was perfect for us to sightsee. Bed is extra firm and there's no AC and the windows won't open. Oh and you're on the 3rd floor. But price for quality canNOT be beat!
Jamess place is centrally located and check in was a breeze. Big, open apt in a very secure building. Great spot!
Great location. Within walking distance to everything in Temple Bar and the train station. Only negative were the stairs to the third floor.

This place is in a great location, but youve got stairs to walk up to get there with some flashing lights in the stairwell.
