Nice quiet room with everything you might need available to you. Location is spot on. Easy access to shops, restaurants and Luas tram.
Absolutely wonderful house, the bed was very comfy for me and I enjoyed every minute if have been there.
Would highly recommend!

Lovely home, clean and very accessible to public transport. Didnt have a hard time commuting to and from airport and city center. Check-in process seamless as i arrived a bit late and she's not in the house. Mary is also considerate - she allowed me to leave my luggage post checkout. 5‚òÜ host. :))))
Great room near the city center. Highly recommended.

Johns place is very conveniently reachable via bus (city busses as well as a direct link to the airport) and everything was absolutel great.
The property and room is easily accessible, with the attached bathroom you also have some privacy and the king-sized bed was so comfy, that even my wife (who never sleeps too well in a bed thats not her own) had a good nights rest.

Great location if you want to be close to Aviva stadium. Very good directions to the house and how to access it. Bedroom was clean and tidy on arrival but the house was very cold. We had been caught in a snow/hail shower so a cold bedroom didn't add to our experience.  We asked John to put on the heating and he had no hesitation in doing this. Initial check in time given was 6 pm, this is very late,  we asked John for an earlier time, this was arranged without a problem. We booked this property because John had stated it was 700 metres from the 3 arena, he had made an error and it was a 35 minute walk to the 3 arena. John apologised but we wouldn't have booked this room if we had known its actual location. The living room is not available to residents which we respected, however somebody was playing musical instruments in the living room until around 1am. John is a pleasant person. This review is very different from all the others and can only assume it was an "off" day.
Nice accomidation and great location. Highly recommend staying here and will love to stay there again next time were in Dublin

John was a great host and everything went smoothly. The room was clean and everything was as described.
The place is 30 minutes walk from City Center and it is very easy to go there either by bus or walking.
Perfect!

I have stayed here on quite a few occasions now so have written previous reviews, all positive.  Pleased to say it's still a great place to stay if you want to be in fashionable Ballsbridge and John is always a pleasure to converse with.
Excellent place to stay. Clean, warm and a friendly host. Very close to amenities and great value for money.
The room was really nice and in the great location. John is a great host!
Lovely clean comfortable room and bed in excellent location.   Host was excellent and extremely responsive and so helpful.   Would recommend highly and will definately stay again.
John communicated very well. We were just there for one night but it was great having a private bathroom in our room! Very comfy bed as well!
Really convenient to the RDS exhibition spaces. Loads of good restaurants and pubs in the vicinity. Comfortable room with a good shower.

This is a cheap comfy room in a capital city, youth hostel style, a private room with a good bed and located opposite the football stadium, easy walk into the city or catch the bus.  Has an ensuite that does the job.  Great communication with John.

The good things about this listing:
- Beautiful neighbourhood.
- Very easy to get to town (bus stop a few meters away).
- Pubs and shops close by.
- Good lighting in the room, due to the big window/door to the patio.
- New and comfortable bed.
- The room is nicely decorated.
- Flexible check-in time. Very easy check-in process.

The bad things about this listing:
- The smell. 
- The towels were very old, stained and smelly. 
- The bed covers looked and smelled like they hadn't been washed in a while.
- We didn't get hand soap, shampoo/conditioner, hand towels. 
- We weren't offered coffee/tea/sugar, or other basic cooking items. 
- We didn't get a bit of space in the fridge to save our food. 
- The toilet didn't always flush properly, we had to keep a bucket in the bathroom. The cistern took a long time to fill as well.
- Communication with the host about the issues we were having.
Definitely recommend!
All good.... Great location near rail and bus.  Nice food within 200 meters.  Well appointed

John is a great host. 
With quick answers and great tips for dinner. the room it was great quiet clean, everything you need to rest from a working day or making tourism. 
I totally recommended!

We had a pleasant experience here, and would recommend it to two travellers who might be on a budget. Check-in was easy and the place was accurate to the photos and description. The ensuite bathroom provided some privacy, and the place was clean. It is situated in a nice area, not too far from the city centre. Would definitely recommend.

Spot on and easy to follow directions to find the house (I also highly recommend the AirCoach is coming from Dublin Aerport). Access was just as described. Room, bed, and bathroom were perfect, clean, and ready for my arrival. Location is great; lots of good eating options just around the corner (suggest Crowes), near an ATM, very close bus stops.  Neighborhood felt very safe; I am a single older woman and returned on foot from a couple of miles away at 10 pm and felt perfectly safe.  Highly recommend!
Enjoyed my stay in Dublin! Very convenient location and comfortable bed. Liked having the private bathroom.

Really well located house, in a quiet neigbourhood, close to the beach and really easy to join the airport. The room is as expected when you look at the pictures, and clean. It was really easy to find the place with the informations that John gave us, and it was easy to checkin.
We only spent a night at John's house but the only problem that we had, is that the house isn't really isolated. We didn't expect to ear every little noise in the house. It was a problem for us, as we have a light sleep, it was really difficult to fall asleep at least before 1 am, as you ear people talks and even the TV. If it isn't a problem for you, the place is a good place for you to stay to visit Dublin !
Great place to stay- easy to get into town. John and jade are very helpful!
We were only there overnight but found a cozy room off a sunny patio with en-suite. A nice neighborhood. John gave great easy to follow directions. Recommended.
John was a lovely host, and it was great staying at his place.
Great place and great location! The room was very clean and comfortable.  I would happily stay at Johns place again. Highly recommend! Thank you.

Johns place was the perfect location for us.  The room was exactly as described and check in was very smooth. We really appreciated John allowing us to drop of our bags early in the day.  Thanks a million.

Great location for anything going on at the RDS (only 5 mins walk).  Very private road with on street parking which was great for us.

John was very helpful throughout the booking process and couldnt help enough with any questions we had.
Logement moyen.

Excellent spot if you are attending the RDS. It's literally across the road. No Parking and it costs ‚Ç¨2.40an hour until 6pm on the street. Late check in and early leave. Bit expensive for what they are offering but the location is perfect so it's kinda worth it. Host not very responsive to messages.

Perfect place in beautiful Dublin. With Leapcard best place to explore Dubiln and suburbs and beaches. Gereat locations very nearby, more pubs or restaurants as mentioned, SPAR and TESCO  and interesting SKY-TV Locations. Embassies of US and GB nearby seem to be more safety. Bowling and Crocket in a nearby Herbert Park and "AVIVA" football stadium rachable by foot. PERFECT!
Great room in a great location for exploring Dublin. Excellent value for money, lovely and clean a d easy to find. Would definitely stay here again.
Stylish room a little outside of the city center. Great stay for a night and easy check in

John's house is situated in a good area - three pubs, a small SPAR for groceries and a pharmacy are only a two minute walk away. The bus stop is only a 4 minute walk away, you can reach the city in about 15 minutes (and get back on the night bus in 6 minutes).
John made sure we could drop off our bags at the time requested and use the room shortly after that which was great. John was able to give us recommendations for where to get the best food and drink which was much appreciated!
The bedroom and bathroom were nice and clean, the bed itself very comfortable. The room has direct access to the small patio which is really nice if the weather is right.
The only down-side (in our opinion) is that the house has - so to say - paper-thin walls so we were hearing the doors getting shut as well as the noises from the room and bathroom next door.

Johns place has such a unique-artsy feel! The location was perfect. A coffee joint, bar and pizza place are right around the corner.  The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. A perfect place for young couples or single travelers.

Awesome location in Ballsbridge. Unfortunately, the space was lacking in cleanliness and listed amenities. John was very kind and helpful, so the issues we experienced may have just been a one-off thing.
Great location, awesome host and really good value. Highly recommended.

We stayed for 3 nights and everything was perfect. It's not luxury,  but it was nice.
The room was clean and having our own bathroom allowed us to get up really early for tours we booked without bothering everyone( I hope.. we tried to be quiet :D)  The location was terrific and easy to get into the city center. We went to the local and everyone were nice to us.. which is a plus.
The room was clean and quiet and the bed was comfortable.
We felt safe in an unfamiliar city and we loved the neighborhood. So cute.
we will recommend to friends.
Lovely room in a great location. Nice and quiet but with good selection of local places and easy access to central Dublin.
We didn't actually meet John but he replied to messages really quickly. The room was exactly as described and perfect for our trip as we only wanted somewhere to sleep....the bed was comfortable.
Very comfortable and excellent location.
Great place with lots of local amenities. John let us park in his gated parking and we taxied into town

Great room if you only need a room for staying a night or to. Not the place to stay if you need a place to be longer time of the day. You basically have bed, a cheer, a bathroom and that is it. As this was all I needed I did have a great stay. John was always quick to respond to me contacting him.

Thank you for opening up your home to us, John. We really appreciated how helpful you were when we were in a bind. We waited too long to book accommodation for Foo Fighters in the RDS and when a friend suggested that we try Johns AirBnB we just went for it. We were not disappointed and I can happily say that we will be staying again soon. The room was spotless, the atmosphere was chilled and we got a great night of sleep in our quiet corner room. Thanks again and keep up the great work! :D

Great host! John was able to give us lots of useful information, to make the most of our short stay and was extremely flexible and helpful in accommodating us when we had problems with our flights! Thanks John!
I would say nice place, you can go to the city center by public transport easily.

A bit far out from town centre but wonderful if you like walking. Its about a 30 minute walk. Many restaurants and conveniences near by. Lovely and quiet neighbourhood and we felt very safe walking around after dark.
Great location & good stay
John was quick to answer any questions and his unit was very convenient to and from the airport. A comfortable,clean, and quiet room.
Safe & quiet neighborhood. About a 30 min walk to Dublin city center. Very easy check in.
Perfect for trips to the Aviva stadium with pubs and restaurants minutes away no frills does exactly what it says on the tin

Johns place was great! He got off early the day we arrived to accommodate us coming in early from a long long long day of flights-that was more than we expected him to do! The room was great, quiet, and had a lot of character! I especially loved the bed-so comfy! It was close to a few restaurants (within walking distance) and very close to a bus stop which was really nice. We had a great time in Dublin!

A great room in a lovely house. Very friendly hosts. A short stroll to many restaurants and pubs and a handy Spar. The only downside for me was that the description says there is free parking and there isn't. I found a parking space on the street but I had to be out on the street at 8am the next day to buy a parking ticket. The machine wouldn't accept payment the night before. The house is in a gated courtyard and you need to punch in a code every time you go in or out. Memorise this code! Otherwise you'll end up going back in for your phone like I did!
friendly host, quick response, easy check in, great location close to center and transport means.
Great location, quiet and central.
Great location for RDS events

I spent one night here and apart from having a hard time finding John's house (but I am older and it was probably my ineptness!), it was totally as expected. A good place for me to drop my head for the night, and there is a nice hotel nearby for breakfast.

We throughly enjoyed our stay at John's. It is in a great location (30 minute walk to city center) very safe, clean and close to amenities. John is very welcoming and had a great sense of humour. Would certainly stay with him again!

Johns place was everything we needed for a quiet place close to everything we needed :)
Check in was easy and bus to airport was just a few steps away.
Can highly recommend to stay with John. 4/5 stars because the heating only worked at day. So a little chilly at night. Besides that, perfect stay
John was not in town during my stay, but I managed OK by myself.
Lovely space. So close to all the amenities and public transport. Very comfortable!
John's place is in a great location and very reasonably priced. Would recommend
Easy to check in , out , very close to RDS . If you go to RDS , the best location. Highly recommend.
Lovely ensuite room, heating was on, so we were lovely and warm. Towels, shower gel and shampoo all included. Comfy bed and pillows. No hassle getting keys etc.
This is a great apartment in a fantastic location. Very close to almost everything in the city. Michelle is fantastic and very easy to work with.

Beautiful Apartment-Perfect Location!

This was my 4th visit to Dublin; I usually stay near St Stephens Green.  However, this was my boyfriends first trip & I wanted him to have the chance to be in the heart of it all!
The apartment is less than a 2 minute walk from the HaPenny Bridge (North Side) and about a 5 minute walk from the AirLink bus stop on OConnell Street.  
Michelles  check in/check out instructions were spot on, no issues whatsoever.
The bed was so comfortable, and we really appreciated the plentiful towels!  The shower pressure was fabulous.

We had one minor issue (which was beyond Michelles control) as the WiFi was not working when we arrived.  I notified Michelle and she had it replaced by the next day. To me that is a sign of an excellent host! Things can and do go wrong, and how the host handles those situations is what is important. 
We would not hesitate to stay here again. Thanks again Michelle for wonderful accommodations!

Gretchen & John
Nice little place. Clean. Location is perfect for doing tourist things. The bed is firm and comfortable. I recommend it.

We had a wonderful week-long stay at Michelle's apartment.  As many other reviewers noted, the location is perfect!  We especially enjoyed The Lotts Pub at the corner (the Snug Bar was our favorite), and Butler's Chocolates for coffee in the morning.   The apartment was very clean and had everything we needed for a great stay.  The bed was very comfortable, too!  Great place; highly recommend.
great hot shower, amazing comfortable bed.. great location.. can be loud at times.. but so central.. just bring earplugs for sleeping and you'll be fine
Very close to the City Centre but not as happy with the street it was on due to noise outside the window. Michelle was very helpful and fast at responding.
Siobhan's place was spacious, stylish and had all amenities we needed! We had a great time, thank you :)
The host canceled this reservation 91 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Responsive host!
Agreat location and a very comfortable stay.

Lovely, spacious and bright flat. Siobhan and Kevin responded quickly so communication was easy. Just a point of caution: the AirBnB map sent too far down the road so watch out and if you cross the small pedestrian bridge, you've gone too far.

Great 2 double bed apartment is a nice area not too far out of the city centre. Siobhan was a great host/contact when we had slight issues with getting in and in the lead up to arriving. Lovely open kitchen/lounge which is especially beautiful when the sun was shining. The two bedrooms were beautifully decorated and the main bathroom had all the amenities required for a couple days trip. Overall our group was really pleased to have found Siobhans apartment for our weekend getaway.

Clean and cozy flat with many rooms for four people, the late check-in worked without any problems. No personal contact to the host but there was fast communication most of the time. A good place to visit Dublin!

First time in Dublin and we loved it. The apartment was very stylish with very comfortable beds and lovely warm showers. The walk to the centre was a little longer than expected (about 40 mins) so we ended up getting Ubers but with a group the cost wasnt so bad. Local shop down the road was very handy. Overall nothing to complain about really, we enjoyed the stay, thanks for having us!

Great apartment to explore Dublin!
Also very convenient with children, as there is a dishwasher and a washing machine for clothes and enough space. Well equipped and there is a small shop just around the corner.
Comunication with Siobhan and her husband was very good!
We would recommend it!
Nice apartment in a quiet area a bit less downtown but bus nearby, convenient neighborhood grocery. Very comfortable bed ideal for 4 people to discover Dublin these museums and its Pubs
Nice apartment within  12 minutes walk from various bus stations.  Kitchen is well equipped. The surrounding area is quite. No annoyance from neighbors. Even good Wifi  and television with Netflix.
Wonderful apartment with great location and a view. Everything went really smoothly with Siobhan and Kevin.

A very comfortable apartment not too far from city center: a 10 minutes walk station Drumcondra, 15 min ride to city center.  Only a few local restaurants and grocery markets.   The apartment is well supplied with bathroom paper, shampoos and conditioners, body wash, etc.   Beds were very comfortable and we loved the Netflix.  The 2-in-1 washer-dryer was very handy after ten days on a cruise.  But it is tricky to operate, took more than 3 hrs to wash and dry.   If you are from Canada or USA, an AC adaptor is a must to use our own electronic devices.   Overall, we enjoyed the stay.
Great place to stay, easy check in and check out would highly recommend
Great place, very clean and comfortable. Recommend to anyone.

Siobhan's place is conveniently located in the nice Drumcondra area. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to local pubs and restaurants. Be aware that it is very near the massive GAA sports complex so the area is very crowded and congested on match days. All local pubs are packed on those days as well. Check the calendar. You can easily walk to City Centre in 35-45 minutes as well. The flat is in a larger building with a mix of full-time residents and other short-term guests. The unit is mostly well-stocked, but if you plan to cook you will need to provision with any spices, etc you may need. It does not appear anyone lives in the unit full-time. While other reviews mention the comfort of the beds, both my travel companion and I found them too hard/too firm for our taste. We also had an issue with window blinds being broken, which was inconvenient given the long daylight hours of the time of year. Siobhan assured us the blinds would be replaced, but it was unable to happen during our stay.

The apartment is walking distance between 2 major bus routes making it easy to get anywhere in Dublin quite quickly. And it is just far enough out of the downtown to be a quiet retreat from the hustle of Dublin. It has everything you need for a great visit of Dublin.
Siobhans flat is lovely. The location is great and is about a 20 minute walk into the centre of Dublin. We really appreciated how clean the place was. Oh, and the beds are comfy.
You will have a fantastic time with excellent eating places at a short walk from the apartment.

Great venue and location in Dublin
 Close to pubs and great food. Two bedroom spacious apartment. Will definitely return.

Beatifully arranged, very clean and cosy apartment. Ideal to stay in at a Dublin visit. Fits perfectly for 4 persons. Walking distance to city center and also close to the airpiort. I can fully recommend!
Fun apartment to stay in which is in close proximity to downtown Dublin, restaurants,  and nightlife. Would definitely stay here again when in Dublin.

L'arribada va ser complicada.
Falten estris a la cuina. 
Hi ha estris de cuina inservibles.

We enjoyed our stay at Siobhans place. It was very clean and had everything we needed for a relaxing stay. The beds were very comfortable and the condo is quiet. Its a bit of a walk into downtown Dublin. (About 30 minutes) however, there is a bus stop down the street if you are not up for walking.  We chose to walk and always felt very safe.
The one thing to note is you need to call when you first get there to get buzzed in before you have keys. For our group we try and travel without using our phones in non WiFi areas to help reduce expenses on our cell phones. We had to be sure someone could make that phone call which cost a bit extra on our cell phone plan. It wasnt a huge issue, just something to note. 
I would highly recommend this condo. The price was great for being close to the city.
Excellent location for Croagh Park and lovely apartment.
Lovely apartment for a stay in Dublin with a good equipped kitchen.
Very nice apartment
A very clean, comfortable, and quiet place to stay.   Nicely located near Croke Park.

The place was nice and relatively roomy for a two bedroom.  The beds were moderately comfortable but the furniture was dated. The common areas were kept clean. 
While it is far from most things it was handy to have a convenience store right on the corner.

Carl's home is beautiful, bright, colourful, clean, fresh and has a marvellous little garden. It's situated a bus trip from the centre of Dublin 25-45 min depending on the traffic. The room and bed are very comfy. There's a big wardrobe with drawers to use. Plenty of space for everything. I'm a bit allergic and had no problems with that whatsoever. No wall to wall carpets and no strong perfumes. 

I've saved the best for last: Carl is such an awesome person. So welcoming, kind and helpful. I enjoyed great conversation, suggestions about what to do and see in Dublin, a relaxed athmosphere that made me feel 'at home' immediately. I've had the best 2 weeks in Dublin and I would love to come back and stay with Carl again in the future.
Carl is a very polite and friendly host. It was a really comfortable residence, in particular in view of the small price. All in all even much better than Ive expected!
A very convenient place if youre looking for a quiet and safe environment, yet great for visiting both the city and its surroundings.

Even though we had a  good time in dublin and Peter is a very interesting and kind guest, I feel that you should be aware at booking that you will be sleeping on the floor due to the fact that if you have back issues that matress would be unsuitable for you. Rather than that the flat was alright and dublin is a very nice city. Cheers

The first thing I want to say is that Momo is very nice, kind and ready to help. I had to clean the previous guest stuff because she couldnt check me in and gave me the instructions to do it, and she gave me the cleaning fee back.
I had the whole house for me. Its close to RDS Stadium, supermarket, pubs...all walking distance.
The only huge problem for me its that is a place unbearable dirty. I felt very uncomfortable because of this.
But all the rest was great.
Thanks Momo!

Hi, my boyfriend and I passed two good nights in this home. Peter is really kind, we are however a little disappointed by the lack of attention by Yi Chang. But she had work, it happens and we respect that. Then concerning the accommodation itself it is a bit far from the city center, Dublins transport are very expensive so we preferred to walk, which took us minimum 30min to reach the center. The room and the bathroom were very small, as expected, but enough to sleep a weekend. On the other hand the kitchen remains small and not very usable. Otherwise, we recommend this accommodation for a short stay, the price is correct.
As per the description, the facilities are on the basic side, but it's a great location on a quiet road near to Central Dublin with everything you could need. And Yi Ching is a very welcoming host.

The Place is exactly like described. if you are looking for a GREAT location,  Sandymount is the place. the walks to the beach and the city streets are great for chilling after a long working day. Peter is an Awesome guys and very helpful. all you need with this couple is to respect the calmness of the place.  i was able to stay there for a full month. the room is not so comfy, yes, but one can make anyplace a home they want to.

I was so happy to have stayed there. this place helped me a lot with my move to Dublin, and Peter sure is a great GREAT guy.

I really recommend this place for one person. if  that person is willing to walk/bike around and willing to respect the place's quiet environment just like the couple who lives there respects your privacy.

Simply, if you want fancy and  willing to stay in your place throughout the day, you better pay 200 Euros in a hotel... this place is great for smart travelers  who prefer spending their days exploring and living outside and heading back to eat, shower, rest a bit ans sleep.

Sam
Great location for attending a match at the Aviva Stadium, with the dart close by
Super friendly and helpful hosts. Its a cute and cozy place in a nice neighborhood. My colleague and I were on a work trip and it was super convenient for us. Thanks and hope to see you guys again!

Firstly, the host is really nice and helpful and received us when we checked in.
But that was the only good thing about the place. The house itself is in poor condition and needs a renovation before it can be rented to the guests.
The main door lock was jammed and it took forever each time to get inside the house. We had to keep trying in the cold to get it to open.
There are no lock in the room or bathrooms.

The other thing is that the flush does not work. Sometimes it did and sometimes it did not. The shower is also hazardous and the glass is loosely fit. The towel rails in the bathroom are all broken. The blinds are also in horrible condition.

Also, there is NO breakfast in the house.
I paid extra for this place for that feautre but it was not there.

Kate's place is in a great location if you are going to the 3 Arena for a concert. only a short walk. it has easy access to the tramway service as well. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the area was!

East Wall neighbourhood of terraced rows surviving despite development of modern blocks. Easy transit from airport bus and supermarkets nearby. Tram or bus to town easy.  Lovely lived in feel. Would return.
The host canceled this reservation 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Once again, Ali and her mom were wonderful hosts. I am so happy I found this place!
This is the place to be

Ben's place was extremely clean, spacious and private! Ben was great at communicating and even allowed us to drop off our stuff prior to check in so we could begin exploring Dublin! We had a great experience!

Nice, private floor with spacious bedroom and (small) bathroom for ourselves. Check in was good and response to questions for local bar and restaurant suggestions were fast and helpfull. Nice walk from the accomodation through St. Stephens Green towards the city centre!
Ben was especially accommodating with arrival times and checkout.
The host canceled this reservation 75 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Easy access to airport.  Walking distance to many great places.

Great location, great value for money, perfect little space, lovely little additions e.g. water, chocolate, tea bags and milk for our arrival. Just short of some sugar then my tea would have been perfect! Many thanks for a great stay

This place is in an awesome location! We found some great places to eat nearby, and its a nice walking distance to St Stephens Green and Grafting Street. Same with restaurants and a convenience store. 
I read prior reviews saying the bathroom was small, and I agree- its tiny.  Previous guests mentioned that the shower head was low, so it was hard to shower if youre tall. Im 510ù, and could adjust the height of the shower enough, but its also just a really narrow shower. We also had to step into the shower to close the bathroom door. 
Overall, we enjoyed our stay here. The bed was comfy, the small kitchenette was very convenient, and as I said the location was awesome!

Our stay at bens House was Nice. Good located to explore the city. 
His mom and his brother welcomed us VERY friendly. There were enough adapter for all our chargers in the room , also the small fridge is very usefull. Our flight back home was very late, but we could leave our laguage in the house and come back whenever we had to! Thanks a lot!
Bens place is a perfect location to walk into Dublin. A nice spacious bedroom which is quiet.
Great location. Very clean and private .

Listing is exactly as described. Spacious, clean and very private area in a lovely house. Communication was first class, and checkin very easy (due to a lockbox) despite arriving and departing at some pretty antisocial hours!
Great location and place!

I always read the reviews and discount the odd rogue one. However, I have to agree with Tibi Jan 19. The apartment felt neglected despite the entrance and house looking stylish and immaculate. The heating was not an issue due to the time of year and the bed/bedding was fine.

The bathroom had not been cleaned between visitors and when I requested that it was, nothing noticable changed. The tiled walls and corners showed that the space needed a proper spring clean. We went on to stay somewhere else in Ireland where it was acknowledged that the facilities would not be pristine and this was reflected in the price. Its all about expectations.

The place is very convenient for the bus to and from the airport and is in a good area. We did a lot of walking and ate in the city centre, early evening, on the walk home so we didnt have to walk in again. This meant we came back to the apartment mid evening. There was only one armchair to sit in, so not very comfortable.

We were very grateful to be able to drop off our bags before the room was ready and the instructions were good. 

As everyone points out we did not meet Ben. It felt as if he was a student living elsewhere and letting out his room at home, without feeling the need to provide a quality experience. The apartment was functional but not the treat we were expecting for the price.

Beautifully decorated space that is very private. It was very clean and quiet. I loved the kitchenette with a washing machine. Its an easy 25 minute walk to Grafton street and Trinity college. There seemed to be plenty of bus stops but we never figured it out- we prefer to park and walk everywhere. The area is cute and had several restaurants. There is a small grocery/convenience store near by where we got breakfast items.

Ben's place is perfectly located just on the edge of the city. We enjoyed exploring the local area and adjoining suburb of Rathmines as well as along the canal. The airport bus stop is conveniently located close by. Although there is a bus stop a few metres up the road, we chose to stroll into the city each day, returning via a different route each day and enjoying one of the many pubs near our accommodation for dinner each evening. The location is very quiet ensuring a good night's sleep!
Lovely BnB within walking distance from town. We enjoyed our stay and slept well!

Bens home was excellent from outside and in. The Georgian style exterior is gorgeous. The interior is fantastic with a nice bedroom with Apple TV kitted out with Netflix etc. The kitchen is ideal with great amenities. The bathroom is perhaps a bit small but is lovely too. 
The check in is ideal and location is good if a wee bit far away if intending to walk everywhere. Walk to the main town is a reasonable distance but very do able. 
The only issues were with some cleanliness but these were very minor. Overall had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend to other guests!

This apartment suited our needs ideally and provides comfortable accommodation at significantly lower cost than hotels in this stylish district of Dublin. 

The apartment has the amenities one might require for a short stay in Dublin and the location is excellent with a high-quality convenience store close at hand, public transportation available from the street or nearby, and the city centre within walking distance.

Visitors with restricted mobility should note that this is a basement apartment so stairs and the compact bathroom may raise issues of access. This was absolutely not a problem for us and I only mention it to guide others; we would definitely look to stay with Ben on future visits to Dublin.

Lovely place to stay.
Lots of info given about local area. 
Great neighbourhood.
Cosy feel. 
TV a little small and the remotes felt a little sticky, but did the job (Netflix available).
Cool decor.
Very squeaky bed but super comfy. 
Upmarket and safe area.
Good facilities nearby (local shops and cafes). 
No locks on the door from the main house to the basement but the front door to the house was secure. 
Plenty of plug sockets.
Small kitchen and bathroom, however they have what you need.
Although we didn't meet the host, he was very helpful and gave us all the info we needed, including a contact number if we needed any assistance. 

PERFECT LOCATION!!!!!!!!! 
Bus stop right outside the house to get to anywhere you want to go. 
Would definitely recommend and will stay again if I go back to Dublin. 
Thanks for having us!

Bens place is in a great location just 20 minutes walk to the heart of Dublin. Great to have parking on site. Super easy check in and an overall great experience in his downstairs bedroom. Nice to have the kitchenette to save some money with making breakfast ourselves. And very responsive with all my questions I had, thanks again Ben we'd be glad to come back!
Great location, comfortable, effortless!
The space is in a great area in Dublin - more residential however an easy walk to the city center.  It's a lovely apartment and worked perfectly for me and my daughter.
Great location - quiet neighbourhood and close to sites downtown. Easy check in.
Not quite as it seems
About a 20-30 minute walk to the city center. Safe neighborhood. Nice to have the whole basement to ourselves.
A beautiful setting in a great location for exploring the city. The apartment had lots of information, local recommendations and finishing touches that made us feel at home.
Eine nette kleine Unterkunft mit einem noch kleineren Bad, doch es hat uns an nichts gefehlt.

The appartment is situated in a great area with the bus stop very close by but if you wish to do so, you can walk into the City Centre as well. This should take you About 15 to 20 minutes. We did not meet Ben in person but the communication with him via Email was very friendly and he answered all of our questions in a polite and swift manner. We did however meet his Mum Sally who was very friendly and did her very best to insure that we would have a lovely stay.
 The appartment is exactly as it is pictured online, if not nicer. You do however have to be aware of the fact that the bathroom and especially so the shower are quite small, so if you are rather tall you might have difficulties standing up straight. This can be seen in the Pictures but we wanted to let you know anyhow. We would definitely recommend Ben¬¥s Airbnb if you are looking to spend a couple of nights in the lovely City of Dublin. But a longer stay might prove difficult since you cannot really cook in the appartment.
We took a cab there then bused around town. The location was close to the bus stop
Bens place is quite cozy and only a short walk away from the center of Dublin. We very much enjoyed our stay.
Ideal location for what we wanted, nice area and good for transportation around the city.
Wir hatten eine kurze aber gute Zeit in Bens Unterkunft!
Great location. Quick walk to temple bar
Excellent location, we mostly walked everywhere. Hosts were friendly when we bumped into them and flexible to allow overnight hire car parking. Thanks for having us!

Great location a lovely warm feel to this home,
You can walk, bus, taxi, into the city.
Local shops, coffee etc

The location is great, walking distance to center of Dublin, grocery store across the street and great local pub just one block away,  

Cleanliness was ok, a bit tired.  Be sure there are enough towels during your stay.

Room nice  close to city got everything you need.
Thanks host.

Fantastic location, close to fun bars, pubs and the city centre, as well as being really easy to get to from the airport. The room itself almost feels separate from the rest of the house, with a private bathroom and little kitchenette. The check in and out was really easy, and Ben is very quick to answer any questions and is really helpful. Would recommend!

Location is better than it looked on a map, very close to bus routes to and from the airport and an easy twenty minutes or so walk to the downtownù area. This is more a base for visiting Dublin than a place to relax in. The  very small kitchenette is adequate for tea, toast and microwave but little else. Has Apple TV which may be good for regular users but was not for us.
Very nice room clean and comfortable close to city center would stay again

Cynthia's apartment was lovely and clean, it had plenty of space and everything you needed for a comfortable stay. She had all the necessary things needed including some food and tolietry items. The location was close to bus stations and supermarkets and not far from the airport. The areas surrounding the apartment building didn't feel entirely safe, the surrounding building itself had smashed glass and graffiti on some doors. 
The apartment it's self was good to stay in if you will be doing day trips and home at night.
Enjoyed our stay at Cynthia's place. Lot of space to sleep and good beds. We also watched a movie using the installed beamer. Great!

Stayed at Cynthias apartment for 5 nights. Clean, comfy and Cynthia is very easy to contact. Lucas was there to meet us by the time we were checking  in. No problem at all. Plus points are the home cinema which my husband and son enjoyed at night time and the desktop which is very handy for me doing my work. There are convenient stores near the area. Overall, we had a great time!

This cosy upstairs airbandb is located close enough to Dublin for easy access by car or public transit, yet it is on a quiet street with an ocean view. It is also close to the beautiful seaside areas of Howth and Malahide. The place is well equipped with many thoughtful extras like a toaster, kettle and coffee maker and a little stocked fridge with delicious yogurt, water etc. The two separate rooms are perfect for a small family or individuals travelling together who want their own privacy. The beds are comfortable and have good quality, warm duvets. Everything was spotlessly clean. Dee was a wonderful host to make us feel at home.

Great place that I would definitely recommand.
Deirdre is really kind and accomodating.
It's nice to have your own floor for some privacy but still you're in Deirdre's home which is also nice because she instantly makes you feel at home.
Great view of the sea through the window, good location, nice beds, nice bathroom and nice breakfast: thanks a lot Dee!

Amazing place with beautiful views and great facilities but most of all we appreciated Deirdres kindness and personal attention in welcoming us into her lovely home and treating us like family. Perfect if youre looking for somewhere peaceful with 5 star hospitality and comfort.
Een mooie lokatie 20min buiten het centrum van Dublin.

Dees home was more amazing than even described and her hospitality is unmatched to all others. She let us check in earlier since our flight was an early one, worked with me when I incorrectly booked the date for our home, and was just overall  a wonderful host. She also provided a filling breakfast in addition to water bottles and coffee- all with a beautiful view of the water. Im so glad we found her place and would highly recommend to anyone else looking in the area.

Such a delightful home that I hope will become a base whenever I am back on the north side of Co. Dublin. Comfortable and spacious, and Deirdre was exceptionally thoughtful and gracious as a host. The last Airbnb in a two-week+ tour of Ireland that included a castle and an alpaca farm and this was still one of the very best. Highly recommend.
It was a lovely home, quiet, comfortable and charming. Deidre was a wonderful host. Thank You for everything!

Well done Deidre and Pat.  Thanks so much for your hospitality.  Ideal arrangements for our group of 3.  Nothing was too much trouble.  Quiet location in easy reach of city centre by bus, with uninterrupted views of the bay.

Dierdre and Pat are great hosts
Really friendly and always available if you need to ask for anything
The accommodation is in a great position for the city and for peaceful walks away from the hustle and bustle if required

Dierde's place was a joy to stay at.  Even though we were only there overnight before our flight out she went out of the way to make us feel at home.  A beautiful spot for a stay.  Great accommodations and a great location.
We chose this place as it was convenient to the airport but it was so much more. Dee is a fantastic hostess. She made us very welcome and the accommodation was excellent.  I highly recommend this B&B
Deidre could not have been nicer. Perfect location and great accommodations.
Friendly host great breaky, very helpful. Clean and very comfortable
Very hospitable and the accommodation was very attractive with wonderful views.

Deidre was an amazing host, she provided a yummy breakfast and she was at hand to give us ideas for our day.
Her place was so sweet, with comfortable beds and a lovely outlook.
Deidre really was a lovely person to talk to, she was so friendly.
we really enjoyed our stay in her home and would love to come back in the future.
It was a short stay and wish we could have stayed longer. Deirdre and her husband are very nice people and went out of their way to make our stay pleasant.
Our stay in Deirdre and Pats place was fantastic, the most hospitable hosts and made to feel very much at home. The area is lovely, very clean and comfortable, would highly recommend it.

perfect to visit Dublin; very well indicated
 to get from the airport it is better to take a taxi for about 23 euors, but then there is a bus station close to the location, which drives you in the city center in 30 minutes; deirdre's home is very nice, perfectly clean, with a view to an estuary, next to a beautiful parc. both rooms are large enough, and the common space beteween the rooms is very cosy; there was enough food for the breakfast and also to make sandwiches for the departure; everything was just perfect! Deidre made everything to feel us confortable, she gave us good advices for what to visit, and how to get there. thank you very much!!! everything was just perfect

Location, Location,  Location! Deirdre's  Home is a hidden gem, located on the Dublin Bay. You are walking distance to a magnificent park, many small shops and restaurants, and also yet a very secluded and quiet home. 
Highly recommended.
Excellent hosts, beautiful home with ocean view.

Fantastic location near to the centre of Dublin in a lovely cul-de-sac which  means its completely silent at night. The house is quite roomy with great flexible downstairs area and giant TV. The garden is huge and great for relaxing evenings.

A beautiful 3 bedroom home with 2 bathrooms. The house was exactly as described. Kitty was so accommodating, helpful and quick to reply. Walking distance from almost everywhere you would want to go in Dublin. Decorated beautifully and felt very homely.

The welcoming was exceptional. It feels like home.
The area is full of nice address to go out and walk around.
Keith's place was amazing very clean very stylish close to everything. Great stay !! Recommend to everyone going to dublin

We had a great time staying at Keiths place. For us it was the fact we felt like we were in a local area and really got the feel for the area and loved coming home at the end of the day to relax. Comfy bed and warm home. Easy communication with Keith. Easy walking distance to all destinations. Love Dublin! Would recommend for couples or group of 3 who would enjoy above sentiments
Nice place. Good location. Everything within 10-20 min walking distance.

We (3girls) stayed at the flat for a few days. It is very bright, cozy and beautiful apartment! There is everything what you need for the nice stay.
The communication was very easy and also we received very helpful recommendations(thank you for them :) )
The area is very local and nice. It is just 15-20 minutes walk from the Temple bar, even less to the Guinness Storehouse. 
We found very cool pubs and caffe next to the flat.
I will definitely stay at this apartment during my next visit!
Keith is a great host, always tries to find a solution for any problem immediately. We could easily reach him by mail.
Good location, good communication, and a decent flat overall, with some issues related to upkeep and cleanliness here and there (mainly in bathroom).

The place is clean and close to the center of Dublin. There are good cafes to eat nearby. Check-in and check-out were super easy, instructions and communication are very clear. We had great time in Dublin and Ireland.  Thank you, Keith!
We could live permantly in the appt. Very quiet . Very central. All neighbours answered to goodmornings. Great little house
Perfect location and very cute rental. Couldn't have asked for anything more.

Keith's place is very comfortable, and quiet, and provided a great resting place in the Liberties between our adventures. Restaurants and shops are convenient, and we thought it was a great place to stay when catching a gig at Vicar Street. (We saw Squeeze, and is was fantastic!). We intend to stay there again sometime when the weather warms up again.
Very nice and comfortable house, easy and fast communication, Keith provided very helpful advice. The location is perfect to discover the city on foot. We enjoyed our stay a lot!
Very well located place close to centre of the City. Perfect for a weekend trip

My friends and I had the most amazing time in Dublin, it was so easy to stay in Keith' place. The location was great, only a 15/20 minute walk into the city centre (Temple Bar area) and everywhere else we wanted to go. We arrived into Dublin late, got to the apartment late but it was so easy to let ourselves in with the lock box. Keith gave us excellent recommendations before we arrived and we loved the city itself. Would recommend this house for location/ value - there is a sofa bed to make it suitable for 4 but for 2 nights we really didn't mind and found the house comfortable/ cosy.
Nice tiny house in a perfect location! Uncomplicated and friendly contact!
Great place to visit Dublin. Daragh and Sara gave me a lot of tips. Wonderful hospitality. Thanks!

Daraghs place was amazing! He was so helpful and gave us many insider local tips! The place itself was very hip and homey. The location was in the center of town, but in a more local area to get a break from the tourists. We walked everywhere, no need for public transit! Stay here if you ever come to Dublin!
Really good location

Little cosy room near the city centre, perfect for a couple.

Daragh is a great host. Late check-in (12pm) was no problem at all. Hospitality was great and he gave us some good advice on things to do. Would recommend!
Well this is my third time at Daraghs place, that pretty much sums it up. Amazing host. Will definitely stay here again.

The listing is exactly as Daragh describes. My mom and I stayed for 2 nights. Its super close to St. Stephens Green, Grafton Street, and Trinity College. We had easy access to everything and there are tons of restaurants & stores along his road as well. It does get pretty loud on the street at night due to the many pubs that are around. We brought ear plugs though & used a white noise app on our phones and had no issue going to sleep. Daragh is very nice & hospitable and we enjoyed staying there.

Daragh was really nice, showed me in the map all city and gave me some tips. The flat is really comfortable and everything was clear. Also, the flat is in a great localization, close to all touristic points.
Good room, good location, good guy
Daragh went out of his way to let us drop our bags off early after our flight. Location was good. Kitchen was quite messy; seemed to be a lot of clutter.
Daragh is a very friendly host with a great flat in the centre if dublin. Definitely a place to come back.

This room at Daraghs is in the perfect location! We had easy access to all the main parts of the city. Plus, the Airlink bus drops off/picks up only a 2 minute walk from the apartment! Great place to stay if youre in Dublin and wanting to walk around to all the great tourist attractions.
Daragh was a very kind host. He allowed us an earlier check in and a late check out! He also suggested us very good places to enjoy Dublin. Everything was great
Daragh is lovely and very helpful! The room is very well located for getting to the centre, it has lots of bars and restaurants right outside too. It was perfect for stopping over a couple of nights!
We had a lovely time at Daragh's home.  He and Sara made us very welcome.   Central location and easy walking to everything.  Clean and comfortable too.   Good value for a place in Central Dublin.

Very nice place close to the city centre. Daragh is really friendly and always available to support and provide tips and suggestions. Bathroom in sharing was generally clean, I just had some difficulties with shower water temperature. I will suggest this apartment to my friends!

Daragh is very polite and quick to help with local maps and suggestions, or anything else you may require. The neighborhood is very conveniently located with buses nearby going to the most famous places near the city center about every 5-15 minutes. Also near buses to and from the airport.
Great value, close to transit. Would definitely return!

Daragh is an amazing host.  He was so helpful and accommodating.  His home is gorgeous, that of an artist, with a beautiful relaxed and welcoming vibe.  My daughter and I loved our stay.  The location is brilliant!!! We will definitely stay there any time we are in Dublin!  I highly recommend booking with Daragh.
Fantastic location, especially for the price!! Daragh provided wonderful recommendations for food, drink, and transport :-)

Daraghs place is a great location to the city center and either a reasonable walk or bus ride away! Daragh is also great about suggesting local places to eat and see! I would definitely recommend this location!

Daragh and Sara are wonderful hosts. When we arrived, Daragh explained everything, showed us on the map where there are coffee shops, places to eat. Very helpful. The location is central and near all city sites.
Daraghs place was great! Central to everything in the city. Walkable to everything
Great location and value for money

Pros: Great location for a night or two as you are right in the centre of Dublin so no time wasted travelling. Some most interesting art features in the apartment! Friendly and helpful host in Daragh.

Cons: One bathroom for 4 - 6 adults; a most uncomfortable hideabed - we had to sleep head to toe for each to be comfortable enough to sleep; noisy with traffic sounds pretty much all night î perhaps to be anticipated in this location, but Im kind of surprised that this was not a main comment in other reviews. 

All in all - for the price, an acceptable place to spend a night or two in Dublin.
A nice small room in a great location, its perfect for a short city trip. Pubs and restaurants are really close by, therefore it can get a bit loud in the room.

Good place if you can deal with the noise on the street at night. It is extremely loud but I had ear plugs so that allowed me to sleep. Daragh is quick to communicate and has lots of info and tips for travelers.
Great location, nice place, helpful hosts!

- good location / close to town
- hospitable Host
- We can advise it! :)
The apartment has a very good position, in the city center. Daragh is very helpful for any need. We strong recomand this location.

Daragh's place was great. His place is located just outside the city center in a really cute neighborhood. Easy to get to by his from the airport. It is off a busy street that can be loud but if you wear earplugs you'll be fine. Daragh was super helpful with places go see  and places to eat. His recommendations for food especially are so good. The space is cozy and he offered coffee and tea in the morning. Definitely recommend a stay.
Great place for the value! Really loved the location, close to shops and good food.

I recommend Daraghs place. The location couldnt be better. There are tons of restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores on the street in front of the apartment. Theres an express bus to the airport right in front of the apartment as well and it takes 45mins door to door. Hes great at communicating with thorough instructions on how to get into the apartment and use all of the keys. Daragh is friendly and warm. We had a nice time chatting with him.
Camden is a very cool neighbourhood and Daragh is a very friendly accommodating fellow.

We had a really nice stay with Daragh! The apartment is clean and comfortable. It is very close to the centre but in front of the house are a lot of bars and restaurants as well. During night you can hear the people outside but if you keep the window closed it is okay. We enjoyed the pubs around.
Thank you Daragh!

Daragh's home is exactly as described. The room is comfortable and cozy. The location is amazing and Daragh is a wonderful host. He was able to accommodate our early check-in, provided us with a map and directions and made several  excellent recommendations for food and drink. Light sleepers need to be aware that as Daragh has said, it is a vibrant street.
Daragh is a fantastic host and his apartment is in a great location! I would definitely recommend staying with him. It was an ideal situation.

We can definetely recommend this place! Daragh was really nice and helpful and answered all our questions quickly. The flat is cozy indeed and we felt welcome and comfortable there. It was easy to get there and you can reach basically everything by foot from here. Our next stay in Dublin will be at Daragh's place again :) !
Very nice and cosy room and although we did not get to meet Daragh he was giving us lots of tips and handy information. A recommendable stay in a very nice area of Dublin. Thank you!

Daragh's place is ideally situated to discover Dublin for a few days, he is really nice & reactive and has lots of advice/ideas to give not to miss anything in the city! We really enjoyed our stay, thanks Daragh :)
Most INCREDIBLE location! This is right in the heart of Temple Bar District - best part, a mere minute walk from the best bar EVER, Bad Bobs. Send Bad Bobs. *Note though however, there was no Wifi.
Heel centraal gelegen

Amazing... unbelievable quality and location for the price. Very fast responses and worked with me on extending past my check out day. Recommend to anyone coming to temple bar... its been loads of fun

Appartamento situato al centro di Temple Bar. Ottimo per visitare e vivere i tipici pub irlandesi! Oste sempre disponibile e cortese!
Consigliato
The apartment was nice and clean and its great value for money and really central. Great place to stay

The location is incredible if you are looking for somewhere close to everything and easily accessible. Great if youre just looking for a place to crash at night. However, aside from the great location and accessibility, the flat itself is really barebones and a bit rundown.
Great location.
Nice apartment for visit and party in Dublin

Pros:
Brent was a fantastic host, offered some great recommendations and was really quick to respond. The location is fantastic if you're looking for a short stay within the temple bar area and everything was within walking distance.

Cons:
No WiFi or TV, but there's plenty of WiFi in bars nearby! The place could have done with a good clean.

This is a great location! We were able to easily walk everywhere we wanted to go and for being in such a busy area it is not too loud at night. Brent was responsive to our questions and gave great recommendations for food and drinks!

Overall, the place was great! The location was the best part! We were a 2-3 minute walk from Temple bar and the nightlife! Everything else was only 10 minutes in any direction! There was great food nearby, too.
Great location.
Overall is OK, but washing bedsheets and towels is recommended before using them.

We really enjoyed staying in this flat. It was clean and right next to Temple Bar! As 20-somethings it was reasonable for us. The elevator was an added bonus

However, there is a strip club nearby. We didnt notice really - no noise or sketchy people. But I would not stay here if you have an issue with it!
Great location,  bare bones and underwhelming as far as amenities go. Great, central spot if you are wanting to be out and see the city.
It's located in downtown and there were so good places everywhere.

Really nice stay! Flat was right in the city center but still quiet at night. Hard to find somewhere else to stay for this price. Really worth it if you want to stay close to the tourist spots and temple bar. Checking in and out was pretty easy!
Amazing location great amenities thanks
Basic accommodation, a little run down and in need of a few upgrades. But an excellent location close to Temple Bar.
Loved the location, within walking distance to anything you might need. Very cute and hospitable.

Had a very good stay. My husband and I  brought our 7 month old baby on his first international trip and Conjn kept us in a more private space so we wouldnt disturb the other guests. We had a pleasant stay and would recommend to other travelers.

Great location, with parking which is certainly a bonus in Dublin.  Clean room, beds and ensuite bathroom with soap, shower gels & towels provided.  Hairdryer provided and a good one not the daft ones you get in hotels that dry nothing.  Very friendly hosts who are most accommodating and helpful.  Breakfast is an added bonus served in a breakfast room, cereals, toast, wheaten bread, ham, cheese & jams with fresh orange juice, tea and coffee - excellent start to the day.   20 - 25 minute walk or a 5 - 10 minute bus into Temple Bar, very handy.  Would definitely use again next time we're in Dublin for a concert or show.
Perfect location, 15 mins walking from everything ! Great beds, clean, comfortable room in a lovely Irish house. Nice breakfast to start the day ! Would highly recommend!
Very clean!! And the hospitality was so wonderful! Conj and staff were pleasant and sweet, we slept great, and breakfast was great!

Great location. We enjoyed our stay. However, the walls are very thin so you can hear everything from the surrounding rooms. If youre a deep sleeper, like me, it wont bother you... my girlfriend on the other-hand had a bit tougher time sleeping.
Easy check in & great location for traveling! Bus stop steps from bnb to/from airport. Great rooms & super comfy beds!!!

Simple, nice, family run bed and breakfast. Location is quite good its about 20 minute walk to the city. The hosts let us leave our bag before checking in which was really helpful. Breakfast is a nice touch. Alma around the corner does an amazing brunch.

I stayed with Conj when I arrived and left Dublin. (I was driving the countryside for the week.) The room was clean and well stocked with any toiletries I may have needed. I loved that I was walking distance to many local bars, parks, and other attractions! A light breakfast of toast, ham, cheese and cereals was a nice touch also! Highly recommend!
Great place in a nice area, close to the city centre and has everything you need! Con was very quick at responding to any queries I had prior to the trip!
The hosts are a very sweet couple and very helpful.

I wish I could give more than 5 stars for the penthouse. Patrick's daughter Sinead let us know it was ready earlier than we expected and left detailed instructions on how to enter as well as instructions for washer dryer which we needed to use. Everything was spelled out very clearly. It was wonderful! It was impeccably clean and well cared for. There were staples in kitchen as well as fresh eggs milk juice and bread. It was beautiful weather so we could take full advantage of the view from the deck. We wished we could have stayed longer! Thank you so much for sharing your home and extending such a gracious welcome. We would recommend this to anyone. It was only my husband and I but the place is very large and would be great for families also.
Great little b n' b to stay in while passing through Dublin. Short walk to city center and lovely breakfast!!
A wonderful little place, very friendly people, yummy breakfast!
Nice spot close to downtown with free parking. The bed is not very comfortable though.

Great location. 15 minute walk to some of the most desirable locations in Dublin. I personally loved the walk because we got to see the city, had access to everything, but were also in a fairly quite location. Very clean and very private. The morning breakfast was cute and filling. Thank you for a great stay!

Great stay at Conj's B&B, the apartment was clean and had everything we needed. The only thing I would say is that breakfast is a little limited compared to other B&Bs we have stayed at in the area, but we still left in the morning feeling full. Thank you.

Reasonable location -about 20 or 25 minute walk to St. Stephan's Green. Very enjoyable continental breakfast. Very small room -bed only, no chairs. Affords good value accomodation reasonably close to tourist areas.
Super friendly, clean, quiet cozy and central. We enjoyed our stay there.   thank you!
Handy for the centre and a great Indian restaurant not far away.

Conj and Catherine are very hospitable hosts! The rooms are sparkling clean, the breakfast was very nice and they gave us some great suggestions in the area.  They live in a great neighborhood. Its a very walkable area! We would stay again if we found ourselves in Dublin.

Thank you for sharing your home with us!

MaryKaye and Tom
This was a great place for us to stay while passing through Dublin. Close to restaurants and easy to find!
Exactly as pictured. Clean, convenient, and Con was incredibly flexible and accommodating with our check-in since our flight arrived at 5 AM. Good value and location.
Good place to stay
Place is just great. Close to everything, affordable, clean and Conj was super hospitable and kind. Would stay again for sure.
This was about a 20 minute walk from Temple Bar area. It was good for an over night stay. Host and his wife we're friendly!

Very nice Bed & Breakfast, Conj gave us a warm welcome and some useful tips for our stay in Dublin. The place was very clean and tidy, the room was spacious enough for the two of us and we even had our own bathroom. The breakfast is from 8-9:30 am and both bread and cereals were offered.
The accomodation is close to the city center and several busses stop in 1 min walking distance, including No. 16 which also goes to the airport (cheaper than No. 747).
Overall a very nice place with nice hosts, good connection to public transport and a quiet neightbourhood. I'd definitely stay there again!
Perfect place to stay in Dublin. Walking distance to nearby pubs and attractions yet in a quiet part of town. Really yummy breakfast too!

This B&B is run by a lovely Irish couple. The accomodation was clean and within walking distace to the city centre. It is also very close to transportation into the city centre. The airport bus drops you off within a 5 minute walk. A continental breakfast is also provided. A number of pubs and stores are close to this B&B. I would recommend this B&B.
This is a good place to stay. Clean and simple decor. Friendly hosts and good location.

Conjs place was nice but few things i noticed. Noticed that our blanket and sheets had stains on them, after reading the reviews I was expecting a little more. The bed was comfortable. They were very nice. Breakfast was light, so you may want to eat something after but overall decent place to stay.
Very nice place and great breakfast. Would recommend to anyone!
Our room was nice and cozy, quiet, cable tv, en suite bathroom and a nice breakfast in the morning. Just what we needed for a night passing through the city.

Conj and Kathryn are wonderful hosts and go to great lengths to make you welcome. We arrived late but Conj still met us at the door and helped get us settled after a long flight.  Very close to the town centre and easy to catch public transport in.   Highly recommend.

The location of the BnB is perfect. 15min walk to Grafton Street and St.Stephens Park. Check in was smooth and Con even carried my suitcase up the stairs. Breakfast in the morning was great. The Irish Ham and soda bread was delicious. Thanks again Catherine. Would definitely recommend this place for your stay in Dublin
Immaculately clean and in an excellent location, within walking distance to all major attractions. Breakfast in the morning was an added bonus.

We had a great stay! Conj and everyone at the B&B were very welcoming and kind! The room was exactly what we expected. Although the bed was a bit uncomfortable. Overall we had a great stay while we were traveling through Dublin!

Conjs place was great for our one night stop in Dublin. It offered a convenient location (walking distance to all sites we wanted to see), and it was ideal having a private bathroom. Conj was flexible with check-in time and met us on our arrival for a straightforward check-in.
Fantastic Location.
It is an old B &B but the rooms and bath where clean and spacious. The breakfast was continental but fine. The host was very helpful with maps and directions!

Con J was a very helpful and attentive host and the accommodation was well situated , very clean and comfortable and really good value for money . Con was easy to communicate with and gave us all the information we needed prior to check in.

Con J was a fantastic host and his place was clean and cosy. Unfortunately, we weren't able to stay long! Con J was extremely responsive and met us at the door when we checked in. The place is only a 10-15 minute walk from the city centre, so a really convenient way to see the city. Thanks for hosting us Con J!
Very helpful and good location.

The accommodations were OK, nothing special but adequate.  The location was further from the city center than I expected, my fault no Conj's.  It is a residential neighborhood with not many restaurants in the immediate area.   Breakfast was continental with no hot breakfast offered.

Conjs place is a nice stay. Close to downtown. Conj will even move his car to let you park in his spot. They have a nice little breakfast nook and they do a cold breakfast with ham & cheese with cereal and granola choices. This was our first B&B experience in Dublin! Very friendly folks who are accommodating.
We had a nice stay at Conj's place. Our hostess was very friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping was very good - ironed sheets were a treat! The room is small but very good value for money.

This B&B has quite narrow curving steps up to the second floor rooms.  The breakfastù consisted on some cheeses and 2 slices of ham and one slice of toast.  Not a filling breakfast if you were hoping to set out on a good day of sightseeing.
Con was a brilliant host, was very helpful and explained how to get about on the luis and buses. The bed was comfy and his house was clean. We will definitely be back again to stay

Lovely area, a 10-minute walk from Grafton Street. The room I was given was spacious, freshly renovated and extremely clean. The breakfast in the morning was good and offered by a lovely lady. Definitely will come back
Great location and price! Close to lots of bars and restaurants.
Lovely hosts, very helpful and welcoming. Great location and a very homely and cosy place. Definitely would come again.
Lovely place and very comfortable bed!

We had a great time at our stay here. We were able to walk into the heart of the city and see everything we wanted to see. Breakfast was great and our host was accommodating to our early check in. Lovely stay!
Great place to stay! Close to city center and wonderful hosts
Very nice B&B. Close to city center.
The room was clean, but very small
The BnB was a great experience! In such a lovely location and a beautiful room. The breakfast was amazing and hospitality made me feel like I was at home!

This BnB is so sweet and comfy. The room was exactly what we needed, with an en-suite. We were able to get a taxi very easily and tour around the city. Conji and his wife were kind enough to let us keep our stuff there, after check-out, until our flight left. Also, breakfast was superb.
Room is a little smaller than anticipated, but walking distance to everything in city and clean.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Convenient amenities nearby- bank, convenient store, restaurants within walking distance. Clean and comfy room. Others staying in next rooms were courteous and quiet. Be prepared for the tight streets.
Great location. Close enough too the live action in town but just far enough away to get away from the noise of the city at night.

The bed and breakfast was what I expected based off other reviews. Nothing super fancy. The room was as pictured and everything was clean. Breakfast was the option of cereal, yogurt and toast. The walk into town was a bit further than expected. About a 25-30 minute walk to where we wanted to go. The bars and neighborhood in the surrounding area were fun! Would suggest going to Ryans and Devitts for a good time and traditional local music.

Easy to find
 parking for our hired car. clean and simple. A short walk to main attractions and easy to get out of town. Kind hospitality and lovely gluten free bread for us
Great place to stay and so clean and nice breakfast

The Airbnb is located really close to the city centre, aprox 15min walk. Many Bars and Restaurants are near by, as well as a supermarket.
It is still a very quiet area where you can sleep with your windows wide open.
The breakfast is simple but perfect for a good start in your day.
Your host is lovely and will help you with every need.
We enjoyed staying at Conjs. It was in a great location and was only a short walk away from the city centre. Conj provided us with a handy map as well.
Accessible to the main sights by long walk or tram. Good pubs in the area. Not much sound proof between rooms. Decent breakfast.
Fantastic hospitality! All around great place to stay.

We loved our stay here as our first stop in Ireland. Check in was easy and we were able to drop our bags early and go exploring before settling in. The room was perfect in every way: clean, comfortable, plenty of small extra touches, and quiet. It was an easy walk to most places and the map that Cathy provided us was very helpful in planning our day. Of course having the WiFi helped us find details about bus routes, museum times, etc. Speaking of buses, the city bus 16 practically drops you at the door, but the 757 Airlink bus is quicker from the airport, although more expensive, and only a short walk to Conjs door.
Breakfast was plentiful and delicious,  and we loved visiting with Cathy during breakfast, a very personal touch.
We look forward to our next stay here.
Nice b&b near the City, everything like described and expected. Next time in Dublin we will book this B&b again. Recommendation!
Great location and friendly staff
We loved our stay at the Airbnb! Conj was very helpful and helped us with our luggage and tips for Dublin. Thanks for sharing your place!

Our stay at Conj's place was incredible. The room was well worth the price, as it was very clean, comfortable and convenient. Checking in and parking was very straightforward - we were greeted right away and told exactly where to park. There was coffee, tea and a kettle in the room which was a very nice touch.  The blankets and bed were very cozy. After the first night they came in and cleaned our room and replaced our towels! The location of this place was also ideal for walking to the city centre and even all the way to Phoenix Park.  We would definitely recommend a stay at Conj's place!

We stayed at this lovely BnB for 2 nights after flying in from Canada. Conj was kind enough to let us check in serveal hours early to let us rest. We were met at the door and a gentleman kindly bought my luggage up and showed us around and offered to answer any questions we had. We were offered a nice breakfast each morning. Over all it was lovely and very close to everything we needed.
This is a great place to stay, close to Dublin city centre. Comfortable bed, easy check in experience. The breakfast was incredible!

Thank you so much for hosting us, we had an amazing time and cant wait to come back !! Big thank you to Conj for welcoming us with open arms and Katherine for the delicious breakfasts and sweet wishes. Until next time !!

We stayed at Conj's bed and breakfast on three separate visits as a transition in and out of Dublin and each time had a great experience. Conj and Cathy are so welcoming, the room is clean, comfortable, and has everything we need for settling in and easily walking around Dublin to explore the sights. Breakfast is very generous with lots of choices. The neighborhood is quiet and close to bus stops, a variety of restaurants, and a small grocery. We would definitely stay here again. It began to feel like our home away from home.

We were able to park our car here early and Conj met us outside and made sure we were in the right spot. He also held our bags for us, so we could enjoy the city. The space was everything we expected and perfect for our quick stay.

Small but comfortable room in a very quiet and tidy part of Dublin. All the main tourist attractions are within a 30-minute-walk radius. Rooms are perfectly clean and the staff was very forthcoming! Suggested!
The place is very cosy and clean. Central location - walking distance to all city attractions (20 minutes max), multiple pubs nearby.
Its everything you need for a weekend break.
Good position

Location is quite near to city center (15 minutes to walk). Romms are small and kept simple but bed and bathroom are okay. Breakfast is nothing special, cereals, toast, bread, cheese, ham, marmelade and honey, but was fine. 
For people who want to visit city center it is perfect. Parking was free in an area where you have to pay everywhere. And we could keep the car in place until late afternoon without paying. Nice host and absolute recommendation!

The host, place and location themselves...WONDERFUL. The location is ideal! Steps from the 16 bus route which travels to and from the airport. Very clean room, tiny, but it had all the necessities. The only thing I would say was a negative was the other AirBnB tenant, they were very loud at very early hours and with the thin walls that doesn't allow for much privacy.  I wish there was a way guest could rate other guest,
Lovely hosts. Great location.

The house is in good location, walking distance to most attractions, but at the same time quiet and peaceful. There is a small convenience store 3 minutes away. The host was very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and warm, there were toiletries in the bathroom. We enjoyed the breakfast too. Thank you.
lovely place to stay, spacious room, super clean and bright and warm too, really friendly hosts made me feel at home, highly recommend
Just perfect, nice couple, nice house, nice room... Top top top ! :)

My stay at Ger and Jeans was great! It was my first time staying in a private room and they made it very enjoyable. I would have liked to stay more than one night so that we could continue having interesting conversations.
Amazing friendly couple, in a warm and friendly and clean house, hosts were always eager to help in any way.
Simply Superb on every level.  They work hard to make one comfortable and to create an enjoyable "home away from home".  An absolutely lovely couple.
Hosts Ger and Jean were really welcoming, both had a great sense of humour, the facilities were great, I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to others.
Very approachable couple. Spotlessly clean and tidy house in idealic South Dublin location.   5 stars .
Thank you both for a lovely welcoming stay in your home as you were both very inviting and warm people.

Ger & Jean are extremely welcoming and easy-going. I felt right at home within 8 minutes. The room is very clean and comfortable and the house is ideally located in Dublin city but on a picturesque and quiet street. I look forward to my next stay at the Wren's Nest.

Really fantastic place . Tje host couldnt do enough for me.
Huge big room in a lovely quite area.
The number 15 bus is 5 minutes walk away .

I really enjoyed my stay here, it was lovely and easy going. Such a beautiful home in a gorgeous area. So friendly and accommodating I would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a place to stay in this area. A beautiful garden and house is spotless and lovely and quiet at night.

Very friendly home,  really nice vibe from once you ring the door bell to when you close the door the morning after.
Very helpful  hosts, spotlessly clean, comfortable bed, light breakfast in the morning, what more could you ask for?
As always, a top quality stay. Looking forward to next time.
Great welcome to a lovely home.
