Stayed here for 3 nights - great, central location very close to all the touristy things we wanted to see. Apartment is on the fourth floor so hardly any noise from the busy street below. Good value for money and would stay here again.
Maeve and Ken were excellent hosts! Their place is just a quick bus ride into the city, but far enough away to be in the quiet. Great conversationalists who had good local tips!
Maeve and Ken were great! We were nervous that their home was not in the city center, however; we had no issues getting to the city with the easy to use bus system.

Staying here is a must if you are looking for friendly people and hospitality. Immediately upon arrival, we felt like we were home away from home. We got a very detailed rundown on what to do in Dublin, and even a little history! Breakfast was great, and is a nice way to converse with the hosts and other guests. They supply bus passes for the bus stop across the street and give you everything you need to travel to the city center. It is also located right next to a nice pub, a convenience store, and some places to eat if you do not wish to go far. This is by far the best Airbnb my girlfriend and I have ever stayed. Wished we stayed longer!

Maeve and Ken are just lovely hosts. Everything was clean, the breakfast was very good and their tips about what to do in Dublin (good pubs, good restaurants, nice places around Dublin) were fantastic. The location between the airport and the city made the traveling very comfortable and we definitely planing to come back to Dublin in a while. Maeve and Kevin helped us to fall in love with Ireland and the Irish in just two days :)

Ken and Maeve are the dream hosts! They have every detail in the room and in their home covered. The breakfast is light, but delicious and the conversation is fantastic. They gave great tips for touring in Dublin. They made us feel as though we were family, and it was a little tough to leave! We would stay again in a heartbeat.

Maeve and Ken are wonderful, sweet, welcoming  hosts. I stayed with them as a solo traveller for a couple days. The en-suite room is clean and roomy, and their place in Dublin is in a more residential area (but a quick and easy bus ride both to downtown Dublin as well as the airport). They gave really helpful tips on places to visit and sightsee as well. Would definitely recommend staying with them!

I stayed with Maeve and Ken last week for business purposes for 2 nights. I received a warm welcome on arrival. My room was spotless and had everything I required. I was provided with all local knowledge of bus services, restaurants etc in the area. Each morning a lovely breakfast was included.  The location was very convenient for getting to city centre with a frequent bus service from across the road. I would highly recommend Maeve and Ken's home to stay in. They could not do enough to make my stay pleasant and welcoming. I look forward to staying with them again in a few weeks.

We had a lovely stay at Ken and Maeve's home. Right from the moment of booking till our checkout, they were responsive, prompt, caring, warm and their home charming and comforting just as it is described in their info. The stay is more or less midpoint between the airport and city center and with quick access to public transport. Restaurants, cafes, pub and mall all on the street. Our room with an ensuite was right for us two. The lounge, kitchen, garden areas added to the comfort and experience. Maeve and Ken gave us all the info needed for a good visit and much more with their conversations. I highly recommend.

Maeve and Ken welcomed me very warmly to there house. Both are very communicative and also like to give advice on food and experiences in Dublin. The two are real hosts with passion! The room was perfect, clean and the breakfast was also delicious. The location is just 15 min. away from the airport, so the arrivel and departure is very easy. Also its good for city visits, as the bus connections (0.5 min. away) are really good. Even better when you download the dublin bus App, where you can see, when your next bus will leave. 

Over all is these air bnb an absolut recommendation! Thank you for all!

This apartment is beautiful and located in a great part of the town. The apartment has a full kitchen with a washer/dryer combo. Note to anyone not used to using smaller European washer/dryers they do not hold a lot and take FOREVER to wash and dry a load of clothes. This is NOT a negative mark on the apartment as its just the way things are there.  Maeve was great and she was always very prompt on her replies! She helped settle us in and answered all of our questions. The apartment had a great view of the castle, and the unit is located with easy walking distance of many local pubs and restaurants.

My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and could not have asked for better hosts!! Maeve and Ken are so sweet, hospitable, and offer helpful tips for seeing the city and the country in general. Amazing experience!!!!
Maeve and Ken were both very friendly. They were great about giving tips about Dublin and suggesting places to visit. They were great hosts. We enjoyed our stay with them.

Maeve and Ken are very nice and lovely hosts. We were very welcome. A very nice apartment with a very nice garden. They gave us lots of interesting tips for our first round trip in Ireland. We felt very comfortable there and say thanks again for everything!

Thanks for being such warm hosts..... great room, good breakfast and great coffee along with great advice.  We had a wonderful stay and the bus pass was very convenient. We will definitely return and look forward to seeing you again.

Maeve and Ken are an excellent couple. If you want to stay in a great home with good an nice people, this is the best choice. I loved the bedroom, the house, the breakfast, Maeve makes an excellent breakfast and I feel like home. I definitly recommend their house to stay in Dublin.

Maeve and Ken are splendid hosts that will make you time in Dublin a great experience. They are kind, helpful, knowledgeable and not intrusive. They are always ready to help. 
The hosts provide excellent guidance about Dublin, instructions about public transportation (including a bus card with a discount), and information about shopping in town. And can tell much about Ireland's history and current events. Plus, being world travelers, Maeve and Ken are curious about other cultures. Very nice.
 Their residence is spacious and modern, and the guestrooms are clean and comfortable with several amenities. In the mornings, Maeve and Ken offer a substantial breakfast. A great opportunity for interactions between hosts and guests. 
The location is very good with a drugstore, convenience stores and a pub nearby. It is accessible to the city center with a bus, whose stop is about 100 feet from the house. Very convenient and practical. 
 Dublin is a vibrant city that combines Ireland's tradition and modernity.
 My visit to Dublin was very pleasant thanks to Maeve and Ken's hospitality. Their lovely place is highly recommended.

Great place to stay in great location. Marvel and Ken did everything they could to make us feel at home. Our room was spotless and comfy and they went the extra mile in many ways to ensure our stay was wonderful.

Our first experience with Airbnb was definitely successful thanks to Maeve and Ken! They were so accommodating and welcoming, it truly felt like we were in our own home. I would highly recommend staying with them if visiting Ireland!

I highly recommend staying at Maeve & Kens Airbnb. It was such a perfect stay. Everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The place is located right across the street from multiple bus stops so you can access just about anywhere from there. There is also a nice shopping center right up the street, about a 5-10 minute walk, very convenient. They gave me a great recommendation to go to Malahide and Howth and even wrote out directions for me, ended up being one of my favorite places I saw! Only bad thing I could say is that if you are a light sleeper, bring some earplugs as this room is located right by the front door. Was not a problem for me but if other guest are coming home loudly at night, it might be problem for you. Overall, I had an amazing stay 10/10!

Above and beyond hospitality!
Super hosts for a reason.

Made my first visit to Dublin amazing.
Will look to stay with Maeve and Ken when I come back another time

We had a really warm welcome in Maeve and Kens house and get a lot of informations for our 2 days trip to Dublin. It is very familiar, all guests have breakfast together in the kitchen. The house is perfectly situated on the busline from airport to the city center. Our room and ensuite bathroom were clean and well equipped. We really enjoyed the conversations with the other guests and especially with Maeve and Ken.  The accommodation is highly recommended.

Maeve en Ken zijn zeer gastvrij, ze geven leuke tips voor het bezoek aan Dublin. Ook hebben ze kaarten voor gebruik van de bus. Hun woning ligt heel goed voor een bezoek aan het centrum en is dicht bij het vliegveld.

Maeve and Ken had a fantastic space for travelers wanting to experience Dublin. We were grateful for the separate space we had. While it was a room and bathroom within the house, we were given our own keys, so we could come in and out of the house very easily. Breakfast was a delicious spread laid out in the kitchen every morning, and tea/coffee was regularly offered. We would highly recommend staying here, whether you're staying or passing through Dublin.

I booked this place for my friend and her child. Maeve and Ken are such a lovely couple. They are very caring, warm hearted. My friend doesn't speak English well, they were very patient and played and spoke with her little girl.

Maeve and Ken went above and beyond to make each guest feel welcome and we learned a lot about Irish history. Our suite was private, but we also got to chat with Ken and Maeve and other travellers at breakfast  - the perfect combo. They were amazing hosts and shared so many great tips for travel!
Wonderfull hosts, friendly welcome and good advices for visiting Dublin, nice room, very clean, easy way to the city center with the bus.

A wonderful stay! My husband and I enjoyed the garden and hot tub as well as the delicious breakfast spread daily. Our bed was very comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean and well equipped complete with robes and slippers. As the other reviews mention, the location is ideal between the airport and city center. Bus was convenient and the fare cards provided by Maeve and Ken were helpful and even had some money loaded on them from the last guests. We learned a lot about Irish history and perspective from Meave and Ken. It was very interesting and we were glad to have stayed here. The level of their hospitality was above and beyond. Very pleased to have met these lovely people.
Ideal hosts, helpful and cheerful.  Maeve and Ken made us feel welcome and offered realistic plentiful tips for Dublin and the area.
Very nice and openminded hosts

I want to express my thanks to Maeve & Ken for these wonderful days stayed in Dublin.

Maeve & Ken are very warm, caring and kindness could make you feel like at home.
They also share great tips and advices to enjoy Dublin, such as many local restaurants, places which can experience Irish culture. 

Their house is also perfect situated between city center and airport, so you can access anywhere easily.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND staying with them when you visit Dublin!

They responded to all our queries fast even before booking and after as well. It was very easy to get to their house from their airport. There is a bus stop right outside the door. Bus for the airport and also for the city is always available from that stop. We stayed for 2 days and both days were very comfortable in terms of the breakfast and the room. Maeve and Ken were both kind enough to share about the city and they were always eager to make our stay best. Would definitely visit again and recommend!!!
nice to be a short bus ride from the city center and not in the middle of the hustle and bustle.

Just spent two nights with Maeve and Ken Gavin. We couldnt have been treated better with a warm welcome and many chats over the two days. Everything just perfect. Lovely ambiance and comfortable sitting room for guests. Would highly recommend a stay at the Gavins.

Ken and Maeve were extremely friendly and were quick to answer any questions we had about Dublin, the house, etc. they have a lovely home and breakfast was perfect. I would highly recommend staying with them!
Expect to be treated to the perfect hosts!

Perfect stay! everything was great. Delicious breakfast, friendly people. He make you feel at home and they can give you a lot of information about Dublin and Ireland, so you will not miss out. The location is between the airport and the center.
Great host and a perfect home would recommend

One of the most gorgeous places we have ever stayed. Perfect for getting away for the weekend or longer. We stayed here with good friends on St. Patrick's Day. We would defenetly stay again. There is nothing you will miss. 
Thank you, Deborah. :]

Thank you Deborah and Ultan! We greatly enjoyed our stay at your townhome! It was within walking distance to everything, the home was clean and spacious, and you went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Definitely a great place to see when visiting Dublin!

Deborahs space was immaculately clean and so welcoming coming off of 18 hours of travel with a toddler. We enjoyed the comforts of their beautiful home. They had clean cozy sheets and luxurious duvets on every bed with fresh towels. The space was well decorated and cozy for our family of four. Our little girls had books to read and a pack n play to sleep in. Thank you for making our time in Dublin so special. I highly recommend Deborahs place and hope we can return sometime in the future.
Superbly designed and comfortable house, easy travel to the city and nearby amenities. Wonderful communication and support from Deborah and sultan, cant recommend highly enough!

Fantastic property in a great location. We had a wonderful time staying at the property and we didnt have to contact our host during our stay as everything was in very good order and detailed instructions were left at the counter. The place was tastefully decorated with all the amenities you need. We strongly recommend this place which is so close to so many wonderful cafes, restaurants and tourist attractions.
BEAUTIFUL home within walking distance of everything you need in Dublin.  Far exceeded our expectations.  We will definitely be coming back.

Our family of three had a wonderful week-long stay at Deborah and Ultan's lovely house in Dublin's vibrant and homey Portobello neighborhood!  The historic home has been beautifully restored and decorated, and was tricked out with everything we could possibly need during our week long stay.  We loved hanging out in the comfy living room looking out the wall of glass windows to the sweet brick walled garden, where the sounds of birdsong were all we heard. The house feels very private, as it's tucked away down a  little lane up the road a few steps from the very pretty Grand Canal (which has a nice path for walks or biking) and we heard no city noises, even though all the basic needs (i.e. grocery, pharmacy, cafes, restaurants, pubs, bakery, butcher shop, etc. ) are just a few blocks away.  It's within easy walking distance to St. Stephen's Green, and we found that the traditional tourist attractions like Trinity College, Dublin Castle, Christchurch Cathedral, the Gaol, Temple Bar, etc. all were about a 10 minute taxi ride away.   The home's interior is truly lovely--the design is very pretty and hip, and there are lots of interesting things to look at, but it's also super homey and easy to live in. The beds were very comfy, and the charming kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed to cook breakfasts, have snacks and drinks, and prepare a few main meals when we wanted a break from restaurant dinners.  Deborah and Ultan were extremely responsive to all our questions and requests for info and help both before and during our stay, and we found all their recommendations for restaurants, cafes, etc. to be spot on.  The house is a little gem in a very cool neighborhood, and we could not have been happier with our stay--it was very hard to leave!!
A perfect place to relax after a busy day! Kick back and listen to the birds singing in your private garden! You'll forget you are in the middle of a city!
Amazing from start to finish. Beautiful house and Deborah couldnt have responded any quicker to the questions I had
Fabulous place. Very spacious. Deborah was extremely helpful, attentive, and responsive.

Deborah and Ultan,
We absolutely loved the house in Portobello!  It was everything as described and more.  The space was more than ample for 5 adults.  The house location was perfect to walk to most places or to the bus stop.  We loved the atmosphere of the home which made it great to come back to after a day of exploration to rest and visit with each other.  Clean, smartly decorated, we would love to stay again!  Thank you so much!
This home was lovely for a few days in Dublin! Very stylish, clean, and in an awesome, non-touristy neighborhood. Thanks for having us!

This home lacks nothing! Perfect space, perfect location, perfect hostess!
We arrived earlier than expected from Galway and Deborah was kind enough to let us store our bags in the home and directed us to a fabulous spot for brunch. The house is so quiet, the few sounds we heard from outside included the birds singing away in the lush greenery.  There is absolutely everything in the house, it is beautifully laid out with an amazing use of space. The garden was a favorite spot when the sun finally showed up! The beds were all comfortable. There were six of us, and we never felt cramped. As far as location, this was a perfect spot as we did not want to be in the center of the city, this was close enough to walk if we opted, or a very short taxi drive away from all the amazing things Dublin has to offer. 
Overall, a wonderful experience!

This house is stunning. Its very clean and has all the comforts of home. Deborah is easy to communicate with and provides great tips for local activities and restaurants. We were walking distance from town and it was the perfect location. You will love this place!

As promised. We were 6 old friend traveling together and it worked out well with this town house. Easy to access and in walking distance from City center (20-30 min). Very good communication with host.
Do it!

Great place to stay! Very welcoming home environment and had all the necessary amenities for daily life. Wonderful location and the recommendations for food and entertainment by the host were spot on! Would definitely recommend others to stay here. Deborah was always great at responding quickly and ensuring things were going well for our group.
Lovely place thats all

Everything was perfect and we had a wonderful time in Dublin. Deborah organized everything very uncomplicated and the house felt like a real home to us. The size is really good for up to 6 people. Thanks again Deborah for the good time :)
What a charming, warm and unique space. So enjoyable! Highest possible recommendation!
Beautiful bright and airy space that is cloae to everything! Nice private courtyard, off street parking, and a fully equipped kitchen. Would definitely stay again on a return trip!
Lovely townhouse! The perfect way to start our Dublin vacation! Our entire family enjoyed it very much.
Great location and very comfortable space for my family. There are little considerate touches around the home that are very appreciated. I would not hesitate to book here again in the future.
Excellent stay as a group of six, convenient location, great shared space, stylish bedrooms, very fast and friendly communication, highly recommended!

We loved our stay in Deborah's house! The house was lovely and clean and had everything we needed. It is in a fabulous location very close to the downtown core and sights yet in a terrific local neighbourhood with a fabulous feel. We would highly recommend staying there while visiting Dublin.
Comfortable stay within easy walking distance of all of the sights in Dublin. Deborah's recommendations for restaurants/sightseeing were also spot on.

Deborah was such a wonderful host, always available to answer any questions within minutes! Deborahs home was comfortable, well equipped and in a great location. The home was very clean, organized and beautifully decorated. It accommodated our large group of 6 adults and two children comfortably. We enjoyed our stay and hope to be back soon!
Very comfortable, clean, and stylish. Close to Dublin center but very quiet and secluded. Great place to stay!

Overall, this is a lovely property in a quiet, residential part of Dublin.

We had a slight disagreement with Deborah in that she felt that we didn't care for her home in the way she expected.
In her welcome book, she had mentioned the importance of her terrazzo floor. We were very cognisant of this and felt like we did a good job keeping it as she expected (sweeping the floor and immediately cleaning any spills) but when it came to check out, Deborah was not happy with how it was left. Unfortunately, it was a wet weekend in Dublin when we were there, and so in hindsight there may have been inadvertent (and to our mind, invisible) footprint stains left behind that we didn't see.
We apologised for this and we do recognise that Deborah is a better judge of her terrazzo floor and we hope it's all ok now.

For the right people, this is a fab property but just be cognisant that this is a quiet, residential area and that the terrazzo floor should be well looked after.
House was spot on. Host was even able to help sort an issue my in laws caused for themselves.
Wonderful stay. They were so accommodating to our family. Beautiful home that was very cozy.

Wow. This place was great! Deborah is a fantastic host, and the house itself is lovely: tastefully decorated, close to everything, comfortable, and even fun (check out the 80s Alphabet on the wall upstairs!). I had to work a lot this trip, unexpectedly, and it was a comfortable place to do that, too!
We really enjoyed staying at Deborah's.  The place was very cosy, well situated, and gave us a welcomed break from the hustle and bustle of Dublin.  Would definitely recommend.
Great location, only around 20minutes from the airport and close to town. Tom was great in allowing us to complete a late check in.
Everything as described, clean and tidy. Helpful tips, good public transport or 20-30min by foot into the city centre. Neighborhood was very quiet. Would book again

The apartment is located in a nice area close to the Modern Art Museum and Kilmnham Goal,not far from Phoenix Park,well connected with buses and Luas to the city centre.Tom is a very friendly host.He welcomed us at night giving us a lot of info. Perfect for a couple.The bathroom was very clean but the heating water system and flush too noisy.The kitchen should be a bit better equipped and the wardrobe was very dusty.

Tom's son met us at the apartment very late at night due to our plane being delayed which was great. The flat was ok, the bed was rather small and uncomfortable, the couch was too. It could have been cleaner. Communication could have been better, we Airbnb messaged him and didn't get a response back for a couple of days which worried us, however after sending  an SMS a reply was quicker.

Tom was very hospitable host.

Accommodating to our very late check-in time,he personally came by to ensure that we had everything we needed as well as provided tips and guidance for our stay.

The house itself is easily accessible by either the bus,or the tram service - which is just a short walk away. You can expect about a 20-30mins travel time to city center.

There is a small grocery store to address your needs too.

The amenities such as the water heater and radiator were a little old,but Tom was quick to guide us on operating them.
Be prepared to overlook things and adjust your expectations accordingly so as not to spoil your holidays.

The flat was very clean and tidy and communication for check-in and out was great! The flat is across the street from a bus stop that takes you straight into the city centre. Pretty close by by taxi as well. Great stay!

The place itself is lovely but the host is not quite responsive. Moreover they request the extra electricity charges in cash (which is not allowed by Airbnb). I managed to pay this over the app and I would suggest that others request the same. Location is good though, about 20 minutes from the city centre.

Beautiful place, awesome location, and great price!  The host was so sweet and even provided some snacks for us in the room on arrival and had milk and juice stocked in the fridge.  We felt very safe having a key to enter the building and to enter the room.  The kitchen was great with updated appliances and well stocked with glasses, mugs, plates, and utensils.  I can't say enough great things about this place, we were so happy with our stay!
Apartment was lovely. Everyone was very friendly and was in a great location. Will definitely be back.

This is a very well situated place to stay as it is close to the city but not too crowded. Staff were very friendly upon arrival and departure. Facilities were excellent. I would recommend for anyone to stay here.

Brilliantly located, comfortable apartment and very safe and secure. Very central and close to tourist sights, restaurants and shops but quiet and peaceful. Helpful staff in the building. Would stay there again!
Amazing apartment in a fantastic location in the heart of everything. Highly recommend.

Riona was a great host, the apartment is very nice, spatious and modern. The location is great as well! A great experience. On top of that, we were travelling with a smal kid and had no problems whatsoever.

Me and my two friends had a lovely stay here.
We were able to check in about 5 hours before the original check-in time, which was absolutely great. We were also upgraded to a bigger apartment which extended all of our expectations. Both the standard of the apartment and its location was very good. Riona was quick with her responses and in general very helpful.
We would absolutely recommend others to book a stay here, and would love to come back ourselves!

Dont wait to book! 

What a great experience we had at Liam & Fionas location. We were able to get around by walking pretty easily! We were also provided with a top 10 list of things to do while we were in Dublin & the list didnt disappoint! We did literally every single one! We felt like it was home away from home. They had everything you needed to have a comfortable stay. We definitely are already planning to come back again!

This space is perfect for anyone wanting something economical but still close to the city! Love the small space and the beautiful view! Enjoyed early morning walks into the city as well. Perfectly placed right next to a Lidl. Would deff Insteon recommend this space to anyone!

We had beautiful time in Dublin. We really loved to be there.

The apartment is absolutely perfect and very well-located. There was everything what is needed during a holiday.

We got a lot of hints about the places, restaurants, pubs, shops, public transportation etc. It was very useful.

The communication was fast and easy with them.

We highly recommend them and their apartment.
Great hosts and a nice little place.  They provided excellent notes on nearby restaurants, transit links, sites of interest, suggestions on live music venues, etc.  Really wonderful stay!
Relatively close to city centre, had everything you need for your stay, and near stores to buy any extras.
Since I have nothing positive to say. I best say nothing at all.
This is a value for money apartment easy to get  to and comfortable
This was where we stayed on our first night in Ireland. Comfortable, clean, well located close enough to walk to many attractions but far enough away as well! Thank you Liam and Fiona!
This place was great, and an awesome location. The host where very helpful and was very quick to respond and make sure we had everything we needed. Would definitely stay again.
Home from home with everything you need. Brilliant location and amazing views. A great base to explore Dublin!
Beautiful view and great location. Room was smaller than expected. Would be perfect for a single person.
We had a lovely time in Dublin and the location was perfect. Walkable to all sightseeing venues.
Had a wonderful time at Liam and Fiona's place.  Fully equipped and very clean.
Liam was very friendly, apartment was very clean and good walking distance to town, would definitely stay again, thanks!
Great apartment - compact space equipped with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Good location to explore city by foot and with easy access to bus routes.
Fantastic place and location! Thank you Liam and Fiona!
Slightly removed from the city in a cute neighborhood.  Great walking distance to Jameson and Phoenix Park. A few great pubs and restaurants in the surrounding area.
Cute little studio apartment. A little further from main attractions in Dublin so be prepared to walk or pay for a taxi. We had a nice stay but definitely would have liked to be closer to the city!
The apartment is very well connected via the public transport. Due to this I recommend a leap card for visitors.

Marie's home is comfortable, warm, and extremely cozy. I loved having coffee every morning in the bright kitchen. Marie provides a light breakfast spread which is great. The bedroom had plenty of space for luggage, and the bed was fantastic. Marie's home is very close to the city center, and is within an easy walking distance of the bus stop. I loved my time in Ireland, and staying at Marie's home made it so much better. I have no criticisms, and highly recommend Marie's home to anyone visiting Ireland.
I cant recommend Maries place highly enough! She was a gracious hostess, gave helpful insights about the city, and checked in with me to make sure I was having a pleasant visit. 11/10!
Marie is an excellent host... friendly, helpful and kind. It was a great experience being hosted by Marie. Many thanks

Marie is the best host mother I ever met!

I stayed for three weeks,  she was always kind and told me about Dublin.
When I caught a cold, she took care of me.
It was really good to see Marie! Thank you!
Amazing place and great location, Marie is so nice and you just feel right at home. I highly recommend this place.

Marie is lovely and thoughful. The room and her home are clean and bright. Upon arrival she offered tea or coffee and a tour, she had a dublin guide book in the room and was quick to offer suggestions and tips. It was a lovely stay.
Wasnt as close to the city center as thought. But was an OK place to stay.

Although I spent very little time at the place, Marie was a lovely host. I enjoyed our conversations in the evening when I came home. Her house is in a great location- the buses are easy to navigate and if you choose to walk it takes 15-20 minutes to get into the center of the city.  Marie shows she cares greatly about female travelers which was much appreciated. Thank you for your hospitality, Marie!

This was a lovely place to stay, not far from the center of the city but removed enough that it was a bit more quiet and relaxed. Marie was very kind and welcoming, and it was a nice home base to have for my first time traveling to Dublin.
Instructions for the check-in were very clear and detailed. Marie waited to greet me in person a gave me a warm welcome. Overall it was a very homey stay.
I stayed with Marie for the second time, because öshe  is the perfect host in any respect.

Maries home was in a great location. It was very easy to walk to and from the city center each day. She offers a great breakfast spread each morning and her home is as advertised. I enjoyed chatting with her in the mornings before I left each day.

Marie is a nice host. If you have any queries she is happy to answer them. I asked for an extra blanket and she provided me with one. You can also cook in the evening. 
The communication with Marie stayed formal. It is a stay for people that are out of the house the whole day and prefer only to have a place to sleep.

Marie is amazing and I adored staying with her. Her home is cozy and inviting, and the bed is extremely comfortable + comes with extra blankets if you're like me and get cold quite easily.  If it's a good day, it's quite nice to walk to the city centre or the DART, and if not, there are multiple bus stops nearby. As a host, Marie goes above and beyond- she even scheduled a cab for me so I wouldn't have to wait at the bus stop at 3 in the morning. She's incredibly funny, kind, and an overall badass lady, if you'll pardon my swearing. I looked forward to all of our chats, however long or brief they were. The only thing I will say is that the wifi is a bit dodgy up in the room, but honestly I didn't even mind. It really felt as if I was  truly coming to a home away from home every night, and I would book again in a heartbeat! Thank you so much Marie, you're a gem!

Maries house just has 30 minutes walking to city center, and there is bus 16 to Dublin airport, its so convenient! In the house, you can find everything you need, and also Marie offers the breakfast. Highly recommend!
Very good location, very clean and a good place to stay! Communication was excellent - everything as expected.

The apartment is located in a really cool area and close to the city center. It has a well equipped kitchen (even with dishwasher) and two seperate bedrooms. We felt very comfortable and we were sad to leave the place. Highly recommended!

My husband and I stayed here for two nights as part of our Spring Break trip and loved it! Maria and Marco have done a fantastic job of making the space comfortable and accommodating. It was more spacious than I was expecting and the location was very convenient for what we were wanting to do. We highly recommend staying here to anyone who is visiting the area:).
Close to everything and really helpful hosts.

Great pizza place less than a minute away, and a convenience store round the corner which were very handy to have close by! Also close distance to key tourist attractions, and the hosts reply to messages very quickly
Great location and wonderful host.
Very nice place close to City Centre.
Perfect location. Just off the beaten path but within a 15-30 minute walk of all the best Dublin has to offer. Ideal for the few days we spent.
Appartement parfait pour visiter la belle ville de Dublin

In terms of space and location the apartment couldnt be faulted. Two large double bedrooms - walking distance to everything you need and would want to see as a tourist visiting Dublin. There is also good shops and restaurants immediately out the door. 

The only downside is that although the place is kept generally clean there was mould in the bathroom and second bedroom on the ceiling and the whole place could just do with a little bit of TLC - a lick of paint,  on the walls and door frames, a little money spent on making the amenities more up to date and fresh and just to make the place feel more homely. 

All in all the flat is worth the cost per night - but with a little bit of time and money spent on it it has massive potential to be even better. 

Marco is very communicative, helpful and friendly as a host and gave clear instructions and advice before and throughout our stay.

WOW! The apartment was great and spacious, very clean and lovely. The outstanding part was the host- I've never felt so welcomed and guided on a trip! I definitely recommend getting a GoDublin pass because the Airlink 747 and the rest of the bus system is a must. Of course, everything is walkable as well but the buses provide greater freedom. I wouldn't hesitate to come back again.
Very roomy apartment in nice neighbourhood.  Plenty of space with easy access to hop on hop off bus stop, we also walked easily to other sights (Guinness).  Good local pubs close by.
Good spot and nice location.  Thanks for the visit!
This place is near convenient store and markets.  Safe area.  Thank you Marco.
Very good location, easy access to downtown, hosts are very helpful and answer your questions very quickly. If I went back to Dublin, I would stay at their place again

Maria and Marco are wonderful hosts. Their communication is quick and precise. Unfortunately, the apartment itself was not up to par with the description. Although they had described it as fully renovated, it was in the processù when we arrived. There was mold on the walls, especially the bathroom. The bathroom also only had half of a shower door, resulting in a lot of water on the floor after each shower. Another frustration was that the hot water was only readily available in the morning and ran out quickly. If you had to shower at night it must be quick for you have to give the warm water a boostù from the water heater tank. Another downfall was the WiFi. If you are a traveling worker I would not recommend this place for the WiFi was not strong enough for me to work on my computer. Overall, the location was in a decent spot and there was a lot of pubs and restaurants in the area.

Great location, basic but overall clean and spacious apartment. 15 minute walk to Temple Bar area. No TV or radio. Pubs and 24/7 supermarket with a nice deli counter around the corner. The Glimmerman is a great pub. Watch out with the waterboiler, this does not switch off automatically! If you are a light sleeper I would recommend bringing earplugs although the noise was not to extreme, the street is fairly quiet. Excellent communication from Maria and Marco!

Maria and Marco are really helpful and made everything so easy. The place is very spacious and relaxing. Great location as you can just walk into the city centre. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Conveniently located,  clean and practical, a perfect starting point from which to discover Dublin (make sure to check out the Cobblestone nearby for local music!). The host gave us very detailed directions and was easy to reach for our whole stay.

Maria and Marco's place was great! About 15-20 minute walk to all the main touristy things (Brazen Head, Temple etc.) but there was a lot of stuff to do right around the apartment too that was great ( we especially enjoyed the Cobblestone (bar)) its about a 30 euro cab trip from the airport but they provide you with instructions on how to take the bus as well for much less and it would have been very hard to figure out without their helpful guidance.
Nice apartment in a cute neighborhood. Loved napping in the recliners after a day of sightseeing! Quick walk for a night out in temple bar and really close to the train station.
A very comfortable apartment not too far away from the centre of Dublin. Hosts very welcoming and quick to communicate if we had any questions.

Maria & Marco were the most responsive hosts I have used. Their place was just as advertised right in the heart of everything a tourist would look for. I will recommend their place to anyone traveling to Dublin!
Good and helpful hosts. Quick to reply. Basic flat but very clean.Good location .
Apartment is bigger than what you expect. Around the corner, there's  a market where you can get shampoos and other basics if needed.
Very nice stay at Karens. Just as described and extremely clean.
Karen is a great host, everything was result good. 100% recomendable
The place is okay but I wouldnt recommend booking for more than one night.
Nice quite place and exceptionally clean house.
Clean, well furnished and secure room with good internet in a pleasant area of Dublin.

Pre-booking communication with Karen was excellent and she did me the favour of holding the room until I was home at the weekend to scan in my passport and update my profile on this site.  The location is ideal, only five minutes to the DART station and the house is practically on the seafront with great views of Dublin bay and the coast down to Dun Laoghaire; the village of Sandymount is only a short walk away and there is a circle K station close buy for buying a few bits and pieces.  The house is spotless, the bedroom as well as the bathroom, and the shower is great with good water pressure and a wide range of shampoos, conditioners and shower gels on hand.  I would definitely recommend this room for a good value, short to medium length stay in Dublin.  A kettle to make tea or coffee would be nice and, with no access to the kitchen, a bigger bottle of water for the guests to drink would be practical.  I had a bit of a run in with a cat one night-he bit and scratched me-so I'd advise anyone not to rub him,  but all in all I enjoyed my stay with Karen, so it's a thumbs up and thanks from me.
Karen is a very friendly host. Highly recommended
Karen is a very friendly host. Sparklingly clean. Great location.
Excellent Host. Highly Recommended.
Karen is a great host! The bedroom in which I was was very clean, as the bathroom I used. Everything was perfect, in particular the communication with Karen. 100% recommended
Nice, clean room in great location. Karen is a friendly host.
Stunning apartment, tidy, clean, stylish, amazing bed, wouldn't change a thing! Would happily stay there again.
Stay was great They have nice and clean rooms. Careful when checking out as anytime after 11Am (even if it is a few minutes) you will be charged
Great location, so comfortable and so friendly.
the house is in a great location, the bus stop is nearby! Marie was very kind, made me feel at home!
If ever I return to Dublin, I will check to see if Marie has a room available.

Lovely house and lovely hostess!

You should definitely stay here!
Marie was a gem! The breakfast was spot on and I'd happily stay again. What a bonus being located right on the canal. It is a straight shot to so many things!
Great place to stay

Marie is very lovely and her home is cute. The bed is very comfortable and she is so kind to have breakfast placed out on the table in the morning. The area is safe and  over 20 mins by bus to the City Centre. If you plan to leave out early in the morning to the airport by bus check the schedule because many buses dont run early on Saturday and Sunday even later. $3 euro one way on the bus to get to and from the city center. 17-22 min walk to get to the train/tram stations.

Marie is a very nice host. I enjoyed talking to her about Dublin and how people live in Irland. Sie is a retired teacher and I loved participating in her live experience. Thank you and all the best Brigitte

We spend a great moment in their lovely place! They are very nice!
Super clean, quiet, and lovely place. 
And delicious eggs! 
We recommend for sure!!! :) 
Thank you again for everything.
Fantastic place to stay with perfect hosts - would come back to Dublin just to stay here - and the garden is a hidden gem - six stars!
The Lost BoatHouse is probably one of the nicest AirBnB's I've stayed at. The room and bathroom were gorgeous and it is in an excellent location. I would highly recommend staying here!

Paul & Stephen's home was absolutely PERFECT for our trip!  It was our first time to Ireland & they made us feel so welcome! At first we thought we would be too far away from everything, but we ended up being able to walk all the way to the Guinness storehouse very easily (about an hour walk though). Easy access to the light rail which takes you to the further side of town. Both Paul & Stephen were great with giving us directions/shortcuts/and restaurant suggestions! They let us drop our bags off early while we waited for our room so we could start exploring & let us leave our bags when we checked out until we got our rental car.  The fresh hen eggs were amazing too! They have such a beautiful home in a quiet location (country feel in the city).  If we ever come back to Dublin we will DEFINITELY be staying here again.

This accommodation is so good. We had the ensuite room which was exceptionally clean and very spacious. 
Stephen and Paul are very welcoming and helpful but not at all intrusive. 
There was tea and coffee available as well as a toaster and a fridge if you wanted to make your own breakfast.
It's a pleasant walk into the centre of Dublin with Ringsend village very near by.
We had gone to Ireland for the rugby and couldn't have been better situated for the Aviva stadium - literally a stone's throw away.
We would definitely stay with Stephen and Paul again and we will be recommending them to our friends and family.

I had very comfortable time like home in her house.  There is very clean and lovely deco in her house.  Also Noeleen is very kind host! she recommended very beautiful park nearby her home and nice galleries. i wanted to visit good galleries :)  location is good. I can go to city centre in 15 mins and close to dublin air port.  There is nice restaurent nearby her home (Botanic House Restaurant & Bar)  Thanks for staying your home very comfortably!!!
Noeleen is a very kind and welcoming host. I felt at home at all times. Perfect refuge after a long day in the city.

AMAZING host. The breakfast is lovely and helped save a little extra money for me. The center of Dublin is either a quick (less than 20min) bus ride or a lovely walk down. I felt so well taken care of. Cant say enough how wonderful she is!
I would recommend Noeleen's place because she is a very special human being that make you feel at home. Also, she is pending about your needs and her place is very nice, sparkling and very homey!!

I stayed at Noeleen's place for one week and can really recommend it! The "little blue room" is "little" indeed, but absolutely perfect for 1 person. There is a bathroom nearby for private use as well as a dining room. Everything is clean and tidy and a breakfast is provided every morning. Noeleen is such a kind person and has lots of tips on what to see and do (next time, I will definitely visit "the happy pear" ;-) The house is located on the north side of the Liffey, close to the famous Glasnevin Cemetery and the botanic garden. The city center lies within walking distance, but there are also several busses that stop right outside the house. It's a nice 15 min. walk along the canal to reach the train station. I really enjoyed my stay and will come back whenever I'll be back in Dublin.
Noeleen is amazing. Besides being incredibly helpful, she keeps a very organised and clean house. She is attentive to every detail to make our stay comfortable and memorable.
Just lovely!  Noeleen was kind and thoughtful, checking on me while I was battling jet lag. Her home ya comfortable, quiet and just as represented in photos.  Stay here, you wont regret it.
Great communication and great hospitality
Had a pleasant stay. The nearby cemetery and botanical gardens are well worth a visit.

Noeleen and her house are lovely! 
The little blue room is small, cute and stylish, containing everything you need. 
The blue wallpaper gives a lot of character and tranquillity to the environment. 
The house is gorgeous and one can say that Noeleen takes a lot of care in cleaning and arranging everything around. About the breakfast... it's very yummy and if you are lucky she will make an apple pie as the one I had, then you can watch the garden from the window and hope to see appearing her cat.
The place itself is in a wonderful location, near Glasnevin Cemetery and Dublin Botanic Gardens (go there!). You can walk slowly towards the city centre (20 min about) or get on a bus (10 min to O'Connell st). There are some little restaurants and take away nearby and a huge Tesco 10 min away. 
Yes, I would definitely suggest you this place.
Nice house with all the necessary comforts to feel like at home. Highly recommended
Nice and cosy house. Jon is a very nice host and you have to walk only 20 minutes to the city. You can buy some groceries near by.
Die Kommunikation mit Jon war super. Er war sehr hilfsbereit und freundlich.
Great place to stay at. Jon is very nice and helpful. Perfect location to travel around the city with bus stops near by
Fantastic house and great location! Loved staying there.
Nice homey place to relax and enjoy. Wonderful restaurants and pubs very close. Jon was very accommodating and welcoming, answering all our questions and issues very quickly. Would highly recommend.

Jon is a fantastic host who was always available if something came up of importance regarding the house. The place was quaint and small but had a brilliant location with it only 5 minute walk from the dart!
Great value, excellent location if you are ok with nearby trainline and gym noise.

Jons place was what we needed for our stay - a place with lots of room and located in a fantastic area. Place could of used a more thorough cleaning, but was okay. The address on the ad doesnt seem to be where the house is actually located. We spent a good amount of time trying to find it and unfortunately missed our tour. Contact host before arriving for exact address.

Jon has a very nice and big house. We stayed with four people. There is a convenient kitchen with all kinds of cutlery. Jon had coffee, tea, milk, butter and bread for us. Bathroom is big, shower is hot and (big) towels are provided.  The house is located close to the docklands and within 30 minutes walking (a nice walk) you're on Grafton Street. Close to DART train stations. Jon's place is a good place to visit Dublin and nice quiet place for staying.
Great place to stay. Very convenient to the RDS.
Easy communication, great hospitality and good location. Easy access to the train, taking you right into Dublin. Corina was a lovely host!
Comfy room with a fabulous location just a few blocks from the train station. Very convenient. Also great proximity to Howth, a really beautiful, quaint fishing village turned local attraction.
A lovely place for your trip + great comunication!! We were pleased. :)
A really nice host! Thank you

Corina went above and beyond as a host! She was very friendly, and even helped us order a taxi to the airport and made a lovely warm breakfast. The room is clean, and the location is very close to both the city centre and Howth.
Thank you so much for having us!
Would highly recommend Corinas place! Great location and the friendliest host.

If you are looking for home away from home this is the place for you. Corina was fun to interact with and very knowledgeable about the area, what to see and how to get there. The room is perfect for young people traveling together.
We had a great stay, everything was clean and beautiful. Corina was very kind with us so we felt in home.

Lovely polite host. Very helpful with directions into the city & even made us a sausage butty on arrival because we was starving. Located in a quiet area which is near the train station. Would stay again.

Corina was welcoming and offered information on the local area as well as traveling to and attractions in Dublin and Howth. The apartment was clean and cozy, and the breakfast we were served each morning was a nice way to start the day !
Warm onthaal, heel vriendelijke gastvrouw, propere kamer. We hebben er van genoten!

Corina is the kindness person on this planet. Sweet, loving, informative, and caring.  An excellent host. But her attic room is only god for 3 people. And No more. Otherwise excellent location for getting around.
We stayed here for 1 night before flying out - Corina was quick to reply and very helpful. The space was spacious and perfect for what we needed. Thank you!
Clean and calm accomodation.
Great communication, excellent hospitality, clean and tidy place to stay for a long weekend. Easy to get into Dublin either driving or catching the train. Great value and highly recommended.

Perfect location, you can easily access all of the local attractions in about a ten minute drive, some even walking distance! The space is ideal for solo travelers or a couple. Check-in was easy, they provided plenty of tips and resources for how to explore the area. 
Definitely a great deal!
Everything OK.  Everybody who is able to read maps knows that the studio is not in the city center with restaurants, good shops, etc., but close to the tram stop.

The apartment is good for staying a few days in Dublin. Grainne provides a few maps and tips for every guest and made our arrival very easy, as she already gave us tips how to use the transport from the airport to the Airbnb. The apartment has everything you need. Supermarkets are nearby and the Luas to get to the city center is very close. We had a nice stay.
A great little place just on the fringe of Rush.  Easy access to the beach, great local pubs, near the airport and northern areas of Ireland.

Mary was a fantastic host. She was very friendly and accommodating and even let us use her baking pans from her own house. The home was a very nice space, fairly small but perfect for what we needed. The kitchen was fully stocked with plates, bowls, etc. and even tea and coffee. My friends and I had a very relaxing time lounging in the house and walking on the beach, which is right outside. The beach is very quiet (in early May) and has lots of lovely shells. There isnt a whole lot to do in Rush, but it was a very nice beach getaway.

Great location, right on the beach and a quick ten minute walk away from town and the pubs and restaurants there. The place is well equipped with everything you would need for a few days away and the hosts are very friendly.
Beautiful location, perfect facilities for families, highly recommended. Mary and Jason were perfect hosts

This is my second time staying at Mary & Jasons beach getaways and it was even better than the first time! Such a beautiful and cozy location. Mary is so accommodating and helpful! Thank you again! :)
Great location on the beach.

Marys place is very clean, spacious, perfect for families but not only! You really are at the beach and Rush is very nice! You have pubs and restaurants nearby and Dublin is just approximately 40 min away, the airport is even nearer!
We will definitely come back! Thanks again for everything! :)
Lovely place and very attentive hosts.

We loved our stay. Mary was very quick with all the responses to our queries. The location was great. It was lovely to wake up to the sea view, hear and smell of the sea. The beach was literally on our door step and sandy and almost private during our time of travel.
Will definitely love to go back and stay there.
Thank you.
A lovely location beside the beach but close enough to visit the city if wanted. Apartment has everything you need and beds comfortable.  I would stay there again for sure.

Mary & Jason were so helpful for the end of our visit to beautiful Ireland!  Our luggage was delivered much earlier than our reservation due to miscommunication on our part and they were so gracious to hold it for us.  Also, we didnt get a chance to grab coffee before we arrived and they shared theirs with us!  So friendly and accommodating. We would definitely go back.  Although it was a bit chilly I walked the beach and my husband went for a quick swim.

It was awesome at May and Jasons. The apartment is super nice! Next to the beach :) 
We would definitely come again. Thank you for that great weekend!
Good food and nice people!

This suite in the B and B was just right for my two close friends and me. The hosts met us right away and showed us our room and gave us some dinner suggestions. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. We were in a nice neighborhood outside of Dublin central with some good dinning options which we walked to, about 15-20 mins.

Het verblijf bij Maeve en haar man is fantastisch! De kamers zijn perfect voor een City trip en het ontbijt is heerlijk. Tijdens het ontbijt kwamen Maeve en haar man geregeld gezellig een praatje maken en we hebben veel leuke aanbevelingen gekregen. Wat een lieve mensen! De ligging van de bed and breakfast is prima. Iets verder van de stad af, maar het centrum is goed bereikbaar met de bus. Wij hebben een erg leuk en goed verblijf gehad en willen deze bed and breakfast iedereen aanraden!
Lovely place and very friendly hosts.
Meave's house was sparkling clean.  Lovely location.  Nice friendly helpful hosts.  Would definitely recommend.

Maeve and her husband are so wonderful and welcoming. They helped us find where to buy LEAP cards (for public transit) and gave us some tips. I wish we could have stayed longer. This is an exceptional place to stay.

I had a very good experience staying with Maeve and her husband! They were welcoming us warmly even though we arrived quite late in the evening. The breakfast is a real irish experience :) My parents will definitely stay here again when they visit my sister in Dublin!

Maeve was extremely helpful and her house was very very well  situated for my needs.  The room was extremely clean and  Maeve's poached eggs were perfect. If I am honest I think it is a bit of a stretch to describe the room as a 'luxury cosy room' as it was  no more than a  perfectly pleasant bedroom: there was no ensuite and no where to sit apart form the bed because of the size of the room. I would definitely recommend it though.

I made the reservation for my uncles and they really enjoyed the service and the service that Maeve and her husband provided to them.  They really enjoyed the house and its location.  They were very attentive and did their best.

Very clean and well kept home in a nice part of town if you want to stay outside of the hustle and bustle of the city, with a long seawall nearby for walks along the water with options for food and drink. Maeve was very hospitable where her custom breakfasts and room cleaning is a nice addition vs my other Airbnb experiences.

I had a wonderful time at Maeves place. She was kind, warm and friendly. She made us lovely breakfast in the morning. 
Her house was sparkling clean.
The only advice I would give is to check with Maeve in advance on how the heating works in the room. It can get chilly at night. 
Thank you Maeve for your wonderful hospitality.

Maeve's place is lovely. 
She is a wonderfully welcoming host who answered my questions promptly and was lovely to stay with. Lovely room, clean ensuite and delicious breakfast. A really good find for us, good location for what we needed. Nice area. We hope to be back. Maeve and her husband are great hosts. We had a great stay

Maeve and her husband were really friendly and hospitable. They told us how to get in the city centre and whats worth seeing. The accomodation has a shared bathroom and included breakfast. We enjoyed our stay at this charming house.

Shay & Meave great hosts. Friendly, warm & welcoming.. They both were very helpful giving directions etc. Their place was clean & Id recommend to anyone looking to stay in Clontarf. Thanks for lovely stay
Great place to relax outside of the city center. Near a beautiful park and some local food / pubs. Maeve was a very nice and attentive host.

Maeves place was perfect for us as we had hired a car (Street parking was easy) and needed a few nights in Dublin to get settled after a few long flights from Australia. Breakfast in the morning was great and Maeves tips for what to see and experience in the city were great.
Very friendly hosts. Nice, quite and very clean room. Very rich breakfast. in general, a good experience!

Maeve was attentive, very kind. An excellent hostess. 
Highly recommended!!!
Clean, comfortable and excellent host
nice clean room.  only there for a late evening sleepover before flying out.  highly suggest for overnight before flying out.

Maeve and her husband were so nice and welcoming! The Place was very nice and cozy, everything was clean all the Time and the area nearby was p erfect for a walk! The breakfast was delicious und Maeve had some very good tipps about places I could visit! The Bus station is just a couple minutes away! In addition to that the communication before my arrival was always on point and Maeve made sure to be contactable! 

I would definitely recommed staying with Maeve and her husband during your visit as they make you feel very comfortable and like you are visiting Family! :)
Maeve and Shay are super excellent. The breakfast provided is truly delicious and the bed is just comfy. I would recommend anyone stay at their place.
There are 130 direct buses from the house to the city center. Very convenient and can be connected to the airport bus.

I really enjoyed my stay with Maeve and her husband. They were very welcoming and nice, the breakfast was great and the room cozy and clean. There's a bus station nearby and the beach is within walking distance. I would come back anytime and definitely recommend staying here  :)

This was a great experience for me. Maeve was very accommodating and gave me tips on local restaurants, pubs, and places to see around the sea front. The room was very clean, had an electric kettle for tea and coffee, and fresh linens and towels. Breakfast was included and was delightful. Eggs, bacon, sausage, and black pudding as beans. I very much enjoyed my visit and plan to return.
Maeve was very welcoming and the room and location was perfect. It's just a short walk to the sea front and a very nice restaurant for dinner. The breakfast was also great.

Lovely B&B in the heart of Clontarf. Very easy to get to, nice sizeable room and great hospitality. Excellent large cooked breakfast as well

I was recommended all the good local restaurants, cafes and bars, and was even lent an umbrella due to the bad weather.

Maeve and her husband couldnt have done any more, and in an expensive city, the stay was great value.
Great location, had all facilities needed. Would recommend
Enjoyed our time in this small cosy place. We didnt have a few things when we arrived but Tom was great at communicating and had those things resolved really quickly.

The location was even more amazing than expected - pretty much everything wanted to see or do was within walking distance. The area felt safe, the self-checkin was very easy, and Tom was very responsive when messaged. 

The house itself was even cooler than expected- the layout was really novel (in the best possible way), was roomie enough for a family of 3 + our family friends, and the wall art added a *really* nice touch to the atmosphere of the place.
Tom's place was great! Look forward to returning
Great places!
Definitely recommend

We had a great 2 night stay at Amanda's place. It was clean and comfortable and Amanda's family was very helpful. It's located a little out of the city but very easily accessible by public bus or taxi. There are also some nice shops and restaurants within walking distance to the house. Dublin was fantastic!
Ideal accommodation, Amanda was a great host, also allowed us check in rarly, very helpful

This house was really great! We arrived during a rain storm, and Amanda's husband greeted us and got us all sorted out. There is a very nice street to park on behind the flat, and it made it really easy for us to come and go at our leisure. The home is also very close to the bus stop, so getting into Dublin was very easy.
We had plenty of room for our family of six. Everyone got great sleep on the comfy beds! Amanda, the host, was very sweet and checked in on us from time to time to make sure we had everything we needed. We felt very welcome, and really enjoyed our visit. The next time we are in Dublin, this is where we'll stay!

Very modern, clean apartment. Host left us bagels, butter, tea and milk; so thoughtful and much appreciated. Easy to get into town on the bus; remember they take coins only. Amanda and her husband were wonderful hosts!!

This is a great place to stay for a visit to Dublin. It is close to the bus route which goes directly into OConnell Street. Local shops are within easy walking distance for groceries. The apartment itself is behind the owners house, accessed through a back gate, behind which guests can park their car.  It is clean and has modern decor and a well equipped kitchen.
Amanda has been an unbelievable host and has really went out of her way to accommodate us.  It has been a real home from home and will return again very soon!
A great spot, easy to access! Lots of places (i.e., groceries and restaurants) within walking distance. Amanda was available when we needed her and had lots of information.

Great hosts, Amanda was lovely as was her husband. Very attentive to our needs and couldnt do enough for us. We actually extended our visit!!  
The property was very clean. The facilities were great in the property and if there was anything we needed Amanda was right on hand to help us out. The location was fabulous and local amenities excellent. Definitely recommend a stay and we would definitely visit again.
Amanda is such a helpful host, the apartment is very nice and clean.

Very close to Dublin city. It was a little difficult to find, since we were unable to call the host, since we did not have Wi-Fi or cell service. But once we got there, the stay was terrific. Easy to drive to Dublin!
Safe town to stay in, close by the grocery store. Bus access as well!
Great place
Great place, about ‚Ç¨15 in a taxi to the city and the same to the airport. Amanda and her husband were around to welcome us and help us with directions to the local village and Dublin. Thanks again!

Thanks for having us in Finglas, 5 people fit in this flat well and it was very clean and modern. There were some issues with hot water on a timer which were sorted by the host. If you dont have a car there are taxis running and a bus (we didnt try the bus) into Dublin. Tea and coffee kindly provided. Thanks!
Jack is a great host and is very pleasant. The bed was comfy and had a window that opened nice and wide for the warm breeze. Great central location. Cheers Jack! X
A beautiful home. Geraldine is a lovely host, very thoughtful and helpful. Plus breakfast is offered!

Geraldine is helpful and extremely friendly in every possible way. She even picked us up and dropped us off at the airport . She spent a lot of time answering questions. She made us feel like visiting a relative. 

This is a beautiful Victorian house that has been lovingly restored. The bedroom was clean and extremely comfortable. There is a direct bus route to the city. Would love to come back sometime.
Great place to stay! Geraldine and her husband are very nice, and the residential environment is quiet, and you need about 40 minutes to go to the city centre with public transports.

We really enjoyed our stay in Geraldines beautiful Victoria-style home. Geraldine was a fantastic host all throughout our stay. She graciously allowed us to check in many hours prior to check-in with little notice on our part (which we apologized for and for which she was very understanding). Our room was spacious, clean, homey, and the bed was very comfortable. Geraldine laid out for us a wonderful breakfast spread each morning and was often there to keep us company in the mornings, which was lovely. Geraldine, being a local, also had many excellent recommendations for what to see while in Ireland and really eased our way around the city by providing us with directions and instructions and even allowing us to use one of the reloadable bus cards that she had available for guest use. Bathrooms were always clean and readily available for our use. Absolutely no complaints about our stay. It was everything we had wanted and more. Will definitely stay again on our next venture to Dublin.

Geraldine was such an amazing host. Her place was perfect for our stay. It was a short walk and about a 15 min bus ride into town. She also gave us some info on things to do/places to go. Would highly recommend staying here. Bed was super comfortable, very quiet and relaxing environment.

I haven't seen such a beautiful house till date. 
1) Cleanliness - Top notch
2) Host's Nature - Cool and welcoming 
3) Ammenties - Bountiful
4) For us guys it was " A home away from home".

Thanks Geraldine

Sean is a wonderful host. He allowed us to check in a bit early. He was there to greet us when we arrived from the airport.  He spent a good amount of time showing us around the apartment and shared many ideas/suggestions of places to go and things to do.

Sean is a wonderful host! His home is in a perfect location, the terrace is great, and the beds are very comfortable. He also gave us a bunch of suggestions on things to do in Dublin and accommodated our late check-out!

We had a lovely time in Dublin at Sean's, the apartment is perfect for a long weekend in this great city. We enjoyed the rooftop terrace with his view over the temple bar district. 
The location of the apartment is great, we reached everything by foot. 
It's in the middle of temple bar, that's why it's quite noisy at nights. We hadn't had any problems with it, but if you're a light sleeper, earplugs would be useful.

It was just great!
The location is in the heart of Temple Bar and you can reach everything per foot. On rooftop terrace you can spend some cozy hours with a view over Temple Bar and the beds are very comfortable.
On the Check-In Sean gave us very usefull tips, for some spots we can visit. Sean also answered within minutes everytime when we chatted.
We had a very good time in this apartment.
If i come again, i definitly choose this apartement again!
Great central flat.

We absolutely loved our stay at Seans apartment. Sean is an excellent host and very very knowledgeable about the area and full of recommendations and local charm.
Perfectly clean and tidy apartment with lots of extra towels and even adapters for foreign electrical equipment. The location simply cannot be better. It was amazing to be so close to everything. Literally just step outside, and youre in the middle of the buzzing street life of the most lively area in all of Dublin with pubs, food and live music.

Sean, is an awsome host, he welcomed us personally, showed us around and gave us some great tipps. The apartment is in the middle of temple bar district and I was suprised... it wasn¬¥t as loud as expected (closed window). The terrace is big and has a great few. We loved to have our morning coffee there. The apartment is nice, very clean and has everthing you need. Both beds are very comfortable. I highly recommend Sean¬¥s apartment and would love to stay there again.

Seans place is fantastic and full of character. I especially loved the location in Temple Bar it was very convenient for me as I was visiting a lot of friends and family in Dublin. Communication with Sean is really good, I got very quick responses to any questions I had for him.  I would definitely stay with Sean again he is fantastic and very reliable. I love the roof terrace and garden a great place to chill out.

Perched high above the bustling streets of Temple Bar, Seans place is the perfect spot to in one moment, put your feet up and relax, and in another, be immersed right into the heart of the pubs, live music and liveliness that Temple Bar has to offer! The apartment is chock full of interesting art and wonderful books, which we enjoyed perusing. It is also centrally located, which made it very easy to walk around to most all of the attractions in Dublin. Sean was a wonderful host, and communication with him was five star from first to last. There are a lot of stairs to get up to the apartment, so if you have any mobility issues, thatd be a downside. Otherwise, a great place to stay!

A great central location and Sean is a friendly and knowledgeable host. Travellers here should be aware this is noisy at night being in the main bar and club area of Dublin. The apartment has space for 2 couples but one of the bedrooms is also the main living room. The roof terrace is a very useful extra area if the weather is good. The kitchen is small but has the necessary amenities and there are local shops for groceries.
The apartment is overall comfortable and spacious and we would recommend it as a good location to easily explore Dublin.
Seans place is in a fantastic location to take advantage of all the great sights and enjoyment that Dublin has to offer . Great roof terrace also to relax and unwind at the end of the day.

This apartment is in a great, central location.  Everything you need is within a short walk.  The rooms are clean and the rooftop is a great perk, we ate dinner outside both nights.  Because of it's central location, it can sometimes be noisy at night. Sean is a great host, very warm and helpful. We would definitely come again!
It was super lovely, Sean is a great host, location is perfect so as long as you dont care about noise from bars (and enjoy it instead) you will have a great time here!! Terrace is great as well :)

Sean was a Terrific host and apartment is in perfect location - walk to everything.  Only way to see Dublin!  Had a car one day in Dublin - worthless!  Important to be able to walk to everything - and we did!  Saved the car for the several nights on the wild Atlantic way - which was great contrast with Dublin.....

Centrally located in the heart of Temple Bar. Easy access to many great restaurants and bars. Rooftop patio provides an escape from the hustle and bustle of the streets below while still allowing you to be immersed in the atmosphere of the area.

The best place in Dublin, no better more central location for the city.  Seans place is super clean, check in was with him personally and he wants you to enjoy his city.  Comfortable beds and plenty of towels and hot water makes this an outstanding location and apartment to enjoy the capital city of Ireland.
Great place. It is clean and very centrally located. Sean is an excellent host. I would recommend this place to anyone.

It was our first time in Dublin and we loved it. Let me start by first saying that Sean himself was fantastic. He personally greeted us which was such a nice touch and he was very accommodating and helpful to our needs. The place was great - exactly what we were looking for - spacious, comfortable, and walking distance to everything! It was especially great having a washer/dryer in the apartment. The rooftop deck was lovely. Everything was great and we would definitely stay here again! (Only note is that since it is in the Temple Bar area, it can get a bit noisy at night. If you are a light sleeper like me, ear plugs and/or a sound machine or white noise being played on your phone is a huge help)

Seans apartment is clean, spacious and in a great location. Its in walking distance to all the great pubs and attractions nearby. Sean went above and beyond to accommodate our early flight arrival. He also responds right away with any questions you might have . I highly recommend staying here if traveling to Dublin!

Sean is a great host. The location is amazing and the rooftop is super unique. Just a word of warning, it is loud outside until late (like 5am). Not a complaint (some of the music is great), just be aware. Also, there are 3 flights of stairs. So if anyone in your party is mobilizing challenged, not the best choice. Overall though, I would highly recommend.

Sean was a fantastic host. When we met with him he gave us a ton of insite about the area and suggested all sorts of great places to visit and eat at. Top notch host!! I just wish that the bar across the street wasnt so darn loud!! We had to sleep with ear buds in in order to fall asleep.

If you want to be in the middle of night life, this is perfect. Weve loved to be around all the pubs and walking distance to the citys point of interest. Sean gave us a warm welcome and good advices that we appreciated. Weak spot: the flat is a bit small for 5. The kitchen equipment is really minimalist, not even a wine glass per person.

This is a good place to stay if you're looking to be somewhere fun.  The flat is functional but not fancy, and the roof deck is a nice perk.  I'd say it's a better place for backpackers than for families, given that the building is in the middle of a busy bar street. Sean was very nice and communication was good.  Just 2 things everyone should know:  1.)  It's a walk-up of about 4 small flights of stairs, so it might be tough on those with limited mobility.  2.)  It gets loud, especially on weekends, and sometimes until 2 or 3am. So either bring earplugs or stay out drinking until then.
Overall, my friend and I enjoyed the place and would stay there again, but it's probably not a place where I'd stay with my young family.

This rental offers the perfect location for anyone visiting Dublin, especially for the first time.  The vibrant Temple Bar location is perfect for dining, sight seeing, pub hopping or just wandering on foot.  Its easy to get to and Sean was there to meet me even though I arrived early.  He was readily available during my stay but fortunately not needed.

We had a wonderful stay at Seans place. We were central to the city and an easy walk to the bus for day trips out of the city. Sean was an incredible host and got back to us right away with any questions. He also gave us wonderful recommendations. It is in the bar district, so it can be loud at nights, but we were fine with earplugs. Beds very comfortable and just a great place!
Emma was very helpful and she runs a clean household. Very comfortable bed with a clean bathroom. Wonderful stay!
It was the perfect place for my trip. It's very conveniently located to public transport and the room is cozy and quiet! I would definitely recommend staying here.

Emma's place is exactly how it is in the pictures. Very clean. The part that I liked is that it is very very near a  bus stop and Dublin has a great bus service so the city centre is never that far away. Its also right next to a lovely canal and its a nice walk along the canal.
And its quiet outside. The occasional car going past.
The house is quiet and the dog is a darling. Very friendly.

Emma's place is comfy & cozy. Well kept & perfect for your traveling needs.  It is easy access to public transportation & local attractions. Emma is a great communicator, she answered my questions & gave me suggestions for my explorations.  I truly loved my stay there & it made my experience all the more greater! Thank you!!

Emma's place was clean and had all necessities. Her daughter was helpful and her dog was friendly. Emma was clear with instructions and patiently explained to me the directions when i got lost and confused. It was a pleasant stay.

Emmas place was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. She responded quickly to questions and was flexible with our check-in time. She gave us our space once we arrived but was a kind host and we enjoyed our stay.

Our stay at Emma was very nice. We were welcomed very friendly and felt comfortable. The room and private bathroom were well furnished. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bus stop was one minute away, so you are very quickly in the center.
Comfortable room in an apartment a 30 minute walk or short bus ride from the centre of Dublin

We had a great stay in Emma's apartment. Before and during the stay she is always available and answer you very fast. 
The room is the same that you can see on the pictures.
