The apartment is not located in the city center but it is very well communicated with tram and bus (it takes around 15 minutes to reach the center), furthermore the neighbourhood is very calm!

Emmas place is in a great situation, a short cab ride from anywhere. You enter with a code to the building which is temperamental but hopefully will be fixed soon. We came in late both nights and had to call Emma to let us in.
2nd (Email hidden by Airbnb) fortable and clean.
Emma was very helpful and the room was quite comfortable. Would recommend!
Absolutely fantastic place. Great location where you can get a more local side to Dublin that the downtown touristy area. Very comfortable apartment and the sweetest dog. Would recommend
Great place to stay in Dublin. Only a few minutes away from the closest tram station. The bus station is right in front of the appartment. Emma was a great host.

Pictures and description as in the air bnb profile.
Everything super clean!
Super cute small dog Jackson, who also welcomed us with Emma.
You have a bedroom and a small bathroom for yourself, Emma also offered to use the kitchen for coffee/tea but we didn't need it.
Walking distance to the eg temple bar 35 minutes, taxi around 15 Euro, bus 3 Euro.
We definitely had a nice stay at Emma's apartment in Dublin and can recommend.

Emmas place in Dublin was great for our short stay. The apartment was clean, the bed was comfortable, and having an en suite bathroom was a nice plus. The blackout curtains definitely helped us in the morning after a late night out at the Dublin pubs. We lucked out with the weather and ended up walking to Jameson one afternoon, which took us about 30 minutes. The area is clean and safe. We would recommend staying here.

Emma's place was easy to find with her instructions and close to the Luas station. The room was nice and clean with a jug of water available in the room. I was able to come and go on my schedule. It was also easy to get the tram to Heuston for the transfer to the airport (good to board at the first stop as the bus gets crowded!) Overall, a great place to stay!

Emma is a terrific host, very friendly and helpful. She communicated clearly and quickly, and she ensured the room was spotless upon our arrival despite a quick turnaround between guests. She also gave us great tips for local pubs and restaurants.
Emma was a great host with a cute dog. Good location, right by tram into Dublin. Very clean, comfy bed and excellent tourist information.

I would highly recommend Emmas place! Emma is a great host and she helped us out with figuring out how to get the visitor Leap cards. It is easy to get anywhere from her place!
Meeting Jackson the dog was also really fun! He is super cute!
I highly recommend Emmas place!
Not great, I don't recommend it...

Emmas place was easily accessible from public transportation, making getting around Dublin a breeze. The neighborhood features a couple of sweet little bakeries. Biggest downside is that it is situated on a busy road with lots of traffic noise, even through the night.

My friend and I justed needed a place to crash for one night and Emma's place was great for that - clean, comfortable and the ensuite made it feel private. Location is great too, short drive away from some very nice restaurants and pubs. We didn't really hear the noise mentioned in a few other reviews, we had a really good sleep. The only thing was we weren't too sure where the breakfast was (it is self-serve) as I didn't get a chace to meet/talk to Emma because of our late arrival but that could have easily been rectified had I contacted Emma (she is quick to respond), however we were rushing off so just skipped brekkie. Thanks Emma for a lovely stay :)
Great communication and easy check in/out. Very nice room.

Emma was so hospitable and was flexible for our situation. Her dog Jackson is a sweet soul. This BnB is just a quick tram ride to everything downtown Dublin. She was our first experience of Ireland and it was a pleasant experience. -Kolt & Kels

Emma was a great host who gave detailed instructions on how to get in and around her space and neighbourhood.  We didn't get to spend much time with her, but had some nice playtime with her gorgeous dog.  Emma's place is in a great spot that is  close to all the things you'd like to see in Dublin.  It's particularly near the Kilmainham Gaol which, as we found out, is a very popular attraction.  Grab tickets for it early.  It's only a short walk away from Emma's so it's easy to take advantage of... if you can get in.

Perfect room for staying some days in Dublin,  near to tram and with bus connections to the center. Clean bedroom and bath with all you need. Shared Living area with integrated kitchen was very homely and spacious. Although Emma was abroad while we stayed at Dublin, she took care of us and made sure everything was fine, e.g. provided stocks for a simple breakfast.
Room was OK
Emma's place provides everything you need for when you are out and about. Great location with easy access to public transport.

Communication with Emma before and during stay was great.Very easy and quick access to both tram and buses into the city both only minutes walk from house.Loved having a private bathroom as I'm an older lady. Would definitely come back to Emma's place.
This was a very lovely room and in a safe area. Buses run right past the door so getting places in the city was easy.

Emma is very responsive and provided lots of good tips for the area. The place was very clean and tidy. The parking is limited at the building but there is street parking nearby. Some sound such as conversation and music can come through the walls at times, but not at any absurd hour.
Emma was friendly, and it was nice to have the en-suite. Parking is very difficult to find.
A great location for those using public transport.
Emma was a friendly and professional host. Her room had everything we needed and the location was perfect.
Emma was great to communicate with and the room was very comfortable. We enjoyed our stay very much!
If you only need a bed, a pillow, a place to bathe and near to mass-transit access to Dublin...this place is for you.
Great host. Emma was very prompt and her home is beautiful.

Emmas flat is located within easy taxi or public transport distance from central Dublin, but we decided to walk which takes about 40 minutes, with a very nice bakery just up the road. Emma made sure we were able to check in easily and left us to our own devices. The room was comfortable and clean, overall a great place to explore from.
The place is awesome and Emma is fantastic. Detailled instructions made it all so easy and she makes one feels at home. One of the best hosts weve ever stayed at, for sure!

Emmas place is cosy, comfortable and easy to reach. Youll have a bus stop right at the front door and the next LUAS stop is max. 5 minutes away. Shell provide you with any information needed. I would definitely come back and recommend her place to my friends!

We had an amazing time at Emmas place. She gave us detailed instructions on how to arrived and was waiting for us. Her dog Jackson made our stay! :) The room is very confortable and clean. The village really nice, we usually took the Luas to the city center. Thanks for everything !
Stanza abbastanza accogliente, con bagno privato, un po' scomoda la posizione, bisogna spostarsi con i mezzi.....
We had a very nice stay. Comfortable, clean, and easily accessible to the city.

Emma is a great host. The room is spacious and clean and has an own bathroom. The location is quite good to travel to the northern part on the city centre by tram or to the southern part by bus. I can definitely recommend this accomodation. Thanks again.

This apartment is exactly as described, and is very clean, comfortable, and well located. I could walk from it to some of the places I wanted to visit, and bus and tram stops are just a few minutes away. The neighborhood feels safe, and I was glad I chose to stay there. Emma is a great host, very interesting to talk with, and communication with her was good. Her daughter was helpful to me too on the night I arrived. So I recommend Emma's apartment to anyone visiting Dublin who wants a clean room with a private bath, and a considerate host.
Peters place is very stylish, relaxed and spotlessly clean. Its also in a really cool part of town with a nice walk into the centre along the canal.

An amazing place to stay! The house was warm, clean and cosy with a marvellous interior design. Peter was friendly and helpful and we are very happy to have met him. Staying with him has left us with wonderful memories from Dublin!

A very warm welcome in a lovely home. 
The city centre is easy to get to and the public transport links are close by. Peters tips and recommendations are really helpful. 

We would recommend Peters place.

I had an amazing time at Peter's place. I moved to Dublin because of my new job and Peter was a really helpful and nice host. I highly recommand his place for ppl visiting Dublin but also for longer stay.

Peter was a super friendly and very helpful host, and overall we really enjoyed staying with him. His home was easy enough to reach by bus from the airport, it was sparkling clean and just a quick bus ride into the city centre. The only thing we didn't appreciate was the additional sexually explicit and religious art in our bedroom which weren't shown on the photos. Overall though, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend Peter to others looking for a place to stay in Dublin.
Peter gave us a really warm welcome and good advices for our stay. His place was lovely and cosy and we enjoyed our time.
Peter was quick to respond to our questions and very helpful. The  location was right next to multiple bus routes so you can easily get to the city centre. We had a nice stay!

We staid 2 nights at Peter's place, and we couldn't have asked for more from our stay. Aside from being spotlessly clean and very stylish, Peter keeps a very quiet and calm atmosphere, which we appreciated. We also took advantage of some great local tips and recommendations from Peter.
Stylish space, clean warm and friendly. Lovely spacious room, great on street free parking. 10 minute walk to the luas. Peter is a brilliant host full of local tips and great for directions.

Peters place is very stylish and only a few minutes with the bus away from all the Dublin city action.
Peter also got allot of knowledge about Dublin. He gave us allot of great recommendations about places to eat and things to do and see.
His communication is very good, he is very friendly and helpful.
We had a lovely stay at Peter's house. Everything was very clean and welcoming. Would love to come back in the future!
No thanks

Great host, great house, SUPER clean! Location is good, bus that leads into the city center is around the corner. Peter is super helpful, approachable and knowledgeable. We loved our stay! - Desiree and Alex :)

Peter is really a Superhost! He is so friendly, helpful and kind¶.there are not anymore words can describe him! He is wonderful!
His home is so lovely: very clean and tidy, nicely decorated and placed in a very quite and safe area.
There are many buses for city centre or you wish to go. Any time Ill come back to Dublin, I will hope to stay with Peter.
Very clean home with a very welcoming host.
Lovely room in a neighbourhood close to the City Centre. Peter was a friendly host.

Peters place was the first place in Ireland where we rested our weary heads. It was artful, Sunny, quiet and top-notch clean!  Peter was exactly who we needed - a calm, friendly presence. Thank you, Peter!!

Peter's home is absolutely lovely - it's more than a home, it's his own passion project. The bathroom is gorgeous, the shower is amazing and the bedroom is spacious yet cosy. Everything was well-kept and super clean. 
Peter himself is a very kind and enthousiastic host and we had a great time staying with him. He also gave us some great pointers for places to have breakfast and things to visit, advice we took him up on and didn't regret at all. 
The neighbourhood is quiet, about half an hour's walk from the city centre, but there's a bus stop around the corner where buses pass very frequently. We definitely recommend staying with Peter!

Peter is the best airbnb host ever! He welcomed me at home and I really enjoyed chatting with him. 

This is the kind of airbnb experience I always expected but never really got, you travel to a new place and you stay with a nice person who shares his home and as well as his life story with you. You get to live in a wonderful place that shows the hosts personality and thoughts, and from those chats you also get some new perspectives. You are not just staying in an apartment you are also making a new friend.

My holiday in Dublin got so much more special and memorable because of it.

(I also want to add that this house has the cleanest bathroom Ive ever seen in my whole life...)

Thank you Peter for a lovely stay. We really enjoyed our time in your Airbnb. We loved the stylish decor, comfortable bed and good location. We also really appreciated the local recommendations- especially the Two Pups for brunch. Recommend for anyone wanting a comfortable, quiet and clean place to stay in Dublin.
nice~~~

Peters place is wonderful, we would rate it 5+ stars really easily. Common area was really clean, the bedroom was warm and we had a comfortable bed. There was no noise in the neighborhood, so no problems to sleep. 
His spot is around 20 minutes walking from downtown, so most things we planned to visit we achieved without public transportation even though there are bus stops close to his place. 

As host Peter is really lovely. He shared detailed informations on how to arrive to his house, so it was really easy to find it from the airport. He also recommended nice restaurants which were really great. 

We would definitely recommend Peters accommodations.

5 stars everything. Easy access to the city centre using public transportation. The place is just lovely, very clean, quiet and you can notice Peters effort to make you feel that your home, this made our trip a hundred times better :)

The house is very charming, spacious double room, the place is clean and near to the city center (just a few bus stops). Peter was very communicative and welcoming, he suggested us good places to enjoy Dublin. We ll surely be back :)

My stay at Peter's home was so much better than I could have hoped for. I came to Peter's house after having moved to Dublin by myself, and he made sure I felt welcome and at home. 

Peter is a fabulous host. He is warm and friendly, sociable but never overly so. He treated me like I belonged there and went above and beyond to ensure my safety and comfort. The house is always clean, within walking distance to all amenities and the city centre, and the room is bright and comfortable. I highly recommend the place for both single people and couples. I will miss his generous tea selection and our chats!

One of the most wonderful experiences that myself and Safiya have ever had, never been more welcomed and looked after! The house itself is incredible and really does possess the cleanest bathroom in the world! We will be coming back to Ireland hopefully many more times and will definitely be staying here every time. If its your first time in Dublin and you love art and food, Peter has so many amazing recommendations!
Great place!!
Brian was very nice and helpful without bering intrusive. The Apartment was perfect for three people and very well located.

Great location, very close to Dundrum Luas station, great flexibility (we got there earlier than the checkin time and everything was ready) and there's also parking space for those renting a car. Thank you, Brian!

Brian's place is a lovely 2 bedroom flat. The bedrooms are roomy and the hardwood floors in the hall and front bedroom are a great touch. The beds are super comfortable. The location is great. You are a short walk to the Luas line and the Dundrum town center. Would stay there again if given the opportunity.

Perfect apartment for a family to spend some days in Dublin and to enjoy a nice and quiet area with all the main places very close, as Dundrum tram stop, supermarkets and restaurants. The bedroom for kids is very lovely and the other bedroom is very comfortable too. The house is clean and equipped with all the essentials. Brian is very kind and helpful with any request! For sure we will come back there for the next travel to Dublin!!

Brians apartment is very close to the Luas Station and also to the Dumdrum Town Center. It is definitely a very good option if you have to visit Dublin for a short time or also for longer periods. Things to improve: the kitchen is too basic and there are no dishwasher.

A quiet neighborhood in Dundrum is the start to your cozy home setting in south Dublin..Brian's home is warm and comfortable;private and perfectly located for super access to the local "LUAS" service to the city center...Everything you need is no more than five minutes away from your rose laced private entrance...Can't wait to return!

A lovely annex at Brians house. Very convenient to go to the stores in Dundrum and very close to get the Green Line Metro to Dublin (15 min). Brian is welcoming and gives all the information about his location on arrival
Good place really close to all you need (luas, supermarket, etc.). Quiet place with some parks and playgrounds around. Brian was very helpful.
We had a great time in Dublin and staying at Linas apartment was perfect for us. Everything was just how described and getting to the city centre was easy and uncomplicated.

Lina was very accommodating after a mixup with the booking schedule, so this was not the original listing that I had intended to purchase, but ended up being the place that we stayed during our visit to Dublin.  Lina was always extremely respectful and responsive, and the place appears as described in the posting. Realistically, though, travel time to the city falls more around 30+ minutes by one public bus. There was also a burst pipeline in the neighborhood during our stay which rendered the shower unusable, which was unfortunate for our three night stay. Of course, this was outside of Lina's control and she was willing to provide a small refund for the inconvenience.   It is also worth noting that it is possible to hear the guests staying in the room adjacent to this one through the wall, but it wasn't a problem for us.  I would recommend this place to young travelers who are looking for somewhere cheap to stay for just a few nights and don't mind a small space (there was only two of us and it was fairly cramped) with some travel time to the city.
Muy a gusto

Linas place dies exactly what it says , I was a bit rushed so I didnt really get time to enjoy my stay, I got what I needed during my stay , woukd if liked sugar for the coffee, but everything did what I needed for my quick stay .. but a lot of stuff in the small, room could do with less furniture in room ..
Good location just outside of Dublin city. It is a bit small so it was perfect for my friends and I who are college students and wanted an affordable place to stay.
The accomodation was good and fast to reach and the information from Lina very good!!

Lina was a really nice host who gave us some good tips on how to get there etc. We had a really nice stay! The flat is quite small but we stayed for 5 days and it was totally fine! Also the small kitchen was really nice to have some breakfast in the morning etc. All in all we had a really nice stay.

Place was nice. A little small for 4 people but we made it work. The location is much farther than a 10 minutes ride though. We took the bus everyday and its take at least 30 mins to get to the city. Location is safe, though, just not quite as advertised.
Don't even think about it. At any price, you are so far away from making connections or anything you would like to do, you will be happier paying more anywhere else.

We stayed four nights in Linas studio apartment and were a group of four people. Its small but definitely alright for a couple of days. 
The apartment is located a bit outside Dublin city center but its super easy to get on a bus or a train even in the evening. 
You can walk to the grocery store in about 20 minutes. 
We definitely recommend the studio apartment and would come back!

Cosy room with all the amenities youd need! Was clean and linas Communication and instructions were great! 

Room is about 30 or so minutes out from the city but the bus stop is basically at the front of the house which was super handy! (Although keep in mind buses do stop running at about midnight.)

The place was nice and had everything we needed. It is very small, so maybe for 4 people isn't quite ideal. Lina was very responsive and gave us tips for buses and grocery stores nearby. However, the place was quite far from city centre. It took us 40-45 mins by bus. The buses (and trains) are not that frequent and sometimes it will drop you off on a farther stop from the house. The closest grocery stores was 20-25mins walk. Overall, we enjoyed our time.
We left the space after 5 minutes inside.
Cosy apartment, good proximity to everything you would need. Lina is a very friendly and accommodating host.
Thank you for letting us stay in your home. It was a great location within walking distance of main attractions. Lina was very communicative from the start and let us drop luggage off early. Becky x

Our stay with Lina was amazing! She was incredible at communication, with fast responses and such kindness, she made our stay easy and efficient. The location is great if you want to be close enough to walk to places on Dame Street, but far enough outside of the action where you can just grab a drink at a local pub.

Would definitely stay again, and highly recommend her space to anyone else looking to travel to Dublin for a week and who doesnt plan to be in the apartment except to sleep!

Great host. Great communication prior to arrival. The room is small,two bunk beds that are comfy, and the room is clean.

Thirty second walk from the bus to the centre of Dublin which is only about ten minutes away on the bus so really easy access to all of Dublins attractions. 

Definitely recommend!
Good location close to city highlights.
Just to sleep, perfect !

Linas apartment is as close as you can get to the Guinness Factory and is within walking distance of most of the rest of the attractions. The room is a bit cramped for more than two people but this apartment is great if you only need it to sleep!
Great location!
Great location and value for the price. Lina was easy to communicate, nice and kind.
Overall great place to stay! Didnt realize we were sharing the space but it worked out completely fine. Location is great if you dont mind walking into the city center.
Perfect location!

As other reviews mention, it is small, but we only needed a place to sleep. Great proximity to Guinness store house and great little pub on the corner just down the street. A little bit of a hike from the metro, but doable. Local taxi (NRC) had terrible reviews, but Lina suggested them and they showed up right on time for our morning departure.

Linas apartment is clean and cozy. If youre looking to stay somewhere thats not directly in the hustle and bustle of the city centre this is the place to be. Its a great neighbourhood with a small local bar at the end of the street. From the apartment it is approximately a 20-25 minute walk to the Temple Bar area, there is  regular buses running which also adds to convenience. If youre wanting to visit the Guinness Storehouse or catch the DoDublin hop on hop off bus its only a short walk away. 

Overall a highly recommend apartment to book. Thanks for your help Lina
Small but a great location with plenty of amenities and a kind host. Thank you for the stay!

Great stay in Dublin near city center with my two sons. Lina was a great host and there were no surprises. She very accurately detailed the description of the apartment and was very responsive with communication.

Lina was a lovely host, friendly without being obtrusive, responsive and prompt in her communications, and warm.  Her place is well located, clean and comfortable.  Lina provides some nice extras such as slippers, a fan, and cups, kettle and tea or coffee making provisions.  Although the room can accommodate 4 individuals, it is a quite small space and so was a bit cramped for 3 adults plus luggage. However, it served our needs fine, as we were primarily looking for a place to sleep. A nice place to use to explore Dublin!
The space has everything you need, however is a little tight for more than 2 people, host is very kind and helpful

Visited Dublin with two friends for a few days. Lina made some good recommendations and communication was very easy. Apartment is in walking distance of the most popular streets (the bus station would be right next to it). I would book the same room again:)

Good location, only a 10min walk to temple bar, 1min walk to the Guinness factory. Lina was very nice, welcoming and friendly, we only seen her  when we checked in, didnt hear or see her for the 2 nights we stopped there. The apartment was very small, there was only 2 of us and it was cramped. It was clean and tidy but the 2 bunk beds take up the whole room. I would stop here again, good value and nice host
Absolutely the best location! Shes great! Had a great time.
Clean and tiny room. Very nice and responsive hostess.

Great little room for people who don't spend much time in it. Has great little local bars around that I would recommend. Downtown is actually 15-20 minutes walk away. It's alright in the morning, but a little rough late at night when you've been walking all day!

Well situated accomodation. 
Small and cosy. 
Lina was very helpful and responded rapidly when I had difficulties finding the entrance late at night.
Great! Good hints like getting the visitor leap card at dublin airport
Location was great; it was within walking distance of many of the famous sights. Room was a little tight, but perfect for what my friends and I had planned for Dublin.
Nice place to stay  and get some rest. In very convenient location with quick access to the centre (walking distance).

Small room but perfectly clean and great place close from everywhere, you can do everything by walk.
If you looking for a place to use only for sleep and be close from the city it's really a good price!

This place is good if you are only looking for a place to sleep and shower. Aside from that the space is a bedroom in the host's apartment (which is cold 90% of the time), it is not very functional as there is a lot put into it to be accommodating but lacks the aspect of accessibility. The bathroom facilities are also very small and shared with the host. However, it is kept very clean and the host is very friendly and accessable.

Really clean and cosy room!  The bed was very comfortable and its bright with a big window. Rodrigo is great at communicating with you and always responds quickly. 

The area is nice and very good for the airport coach or a short cab into central Dublin
Very nyce
Great little place about a mile and a half outside the city center. In a great neighborhood. Definitely small but perfect if you dont plan on staying in the room much.

Great location for those looking to be close enough to all the action but far enough to have peace and quiet. The bus route to/from the airport was very convenient. The LUAS was a great form of transportation to get where you wanted to go (quick and fast). The neighbor is very peaceful and save at night. We would get back to the Airbnb late night and had no issues walking from the LUAS. I would advise to check the times the LUAS stop operating as its different from week to weekend. If doing the Guinness or Jameson tours, I recommend you go early as possible to avoid the crowds. That way you have the rest of the day to enjoy. Much thanks to Rodrigo for allowing us to stay! Highly recommended.
Small but quiet with bed and a good shower. I wouldnt want to cook anything here.

Rodrigos place was a fantastic launch point for all of our activities in Dublin. We were walking distance to virtually everything we were hoping to see and do! Rodrigo was quick to respond to any questions or accommodations and the check in process was seamless. We would definitely stay here again. 10 min walk to a fun pub called the Barge, live music, good food, friendly staff. Cheers!
Great place to stay in Dublin

Great apartment in picturesque Ranelagh district in south Dublin. Comfy for a shorter stay discovering a fantastic city.

Convenient for the city centre and all the wonders it has to offer, as well as lesser known gems on the doorstop. Also very convenient for the airport on the Aircoach - 700 route.

Local restaurants were brilliant. A trip to Dublin should not be without a sitting at Clanbrassil House ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) and The Winding Stair ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) Both top notch!

Rodrigo is a great host, with quick and informative conversations.

I'd definitely stay again.
We enjoyed our stay at here. Good value for the location and easy walking distance to center city. Nice quiet street close to Ranelagh shopping district.
Lovely room, very clean and plenty of space for two. Powerful shower and heater works well to heat the room.

Rodrigos accommodation was great for our short trip to Dublin, but itd be perfect for a long stay. There was plenty of space for the two of us, and the apartment is in a beautiful neighbourhood. A short, 20-30 minute walk into Temple Bar and surrounding area made travelling around the city very easy. We would highly recommend staying at Rodrigos accommodation for your trip to Dublin.
Really happy with my stay here, was exactly as described. So close to the centre, especially using the trams. Would definitely stay here again if I was to visit Dublin again.

Overall we had a nice stay in the appartment (the hot shower and the location were really positive). However, if you travel in early spring, like us, and the outside temperature is around 5-10 degrees celsius, the appartment is not really warm.
We had an amazing time in Dublin while staying at the apartment! The room is nice and cosy.

It was amazing place! I stayed there because it was near my office. The place is 10mins Walk from the air coach from Airport but it was fine. There is no washer but the place get really chilly at night if you dont switch on heater and the heater will switch off itself in the middle of the night. But, it is a lovely apartment.
Fantastisch appartement met een goede bereikbaarheid tot het centrum op een rustige locatie.

Roderigo's place is just as described on the website and by other travellers.  Communication and ease of access could not have been better. It's simply a very compact bedroom with an adjoining shower room. The outside front terrace with seating is nice if the sun shines.  The road and area of Ranelagh are charming (and the main reason we chose to stay there). There is easy and fast access to the centre of the city. 
All good!

Loved our stay in this property. Rodrigo always responded very promptly to messages. He took the time to contact us a couple of days prior to the trip containing really useful information about the quickest/recommended way to travel by aircoach (700 route) to the property from the airport, including which stop - information which makes your journey a lot easier! The journey from the airport couldn't have been easier and helps when you can leave bags prior to check-in.  We walked from the property to the central parts on the City throughout our weekend, roughly 10 mins to St Stephen's Green and about 25 mins to the Temple Bar area. The room was really clean with a very comfortable bed.

Everything was clean and comfortable. There is a small bathroom without window and you have to go through the bathroom to get to the sleeping room. But it was a very cosy and nice room to stay for three nights in dublin.

Rodrigos place was perfect for a weekend stay in Dublin. The location was ideal and within walking distance from plenty of nice restaurants and bars. The street itself was nice and quiet and the room had everything we needed when we were done exploring. Thanks again for a great stay!

Rodrigos space is perfect for one person or a couple looking to explore Dublin. It was very clean, comfortable and well located. We were able to utilize the public transportation to anywhere we wanted to go. The local bar (Blackbird) we visited twice was within 10 minutes walking distance and was a great place to have a beer!
Great place to stay.  Good value for money.  Close to transport and only 25 min walk to city  and dart

Really happy with this little apartment, great instructions for when we arrived, we left our bags after the time we were told we could as we were early, the cleaner kindly moved our bags neatly into the room once she'd done her job. Lovely place and only 10/15 minute walk from the centre, would defo stay again as the price and cleanliness of the place was fab! Trustworthy airbnb :D
Bright room in a beautiful neighborhood. Comfortable bed and good shower. Close to airport shuttle bus and light rail into Dublin City Centre. Rodrigo could not have been more helpful or responsive.
A comfortable place to stay close to Dublin centre. Check in was really easy and the place was immaculate. Would recommend to anyone visiting Dublin!
Great stay!
This is a perfect base to explore Dublin and the location is fantastic with lots of great restaurants and coffee shops within a very short walk. We would definitely stay again.

A terrific location to all the amenities, really enjoyed the Ranalagh Village around the corner and had great dinners there.   Easy walk into tourist spots.  Our private bedroom was very quaint and just as expected.   We enjoyed the patio area when the sun was shining.  The bed was comfy and good shower.  (note the entry is at the front and through the bathroom, but no big deal).

The place was nice and in a cool area of Dublin. We felt safe here and enjoyed the space. 
We would have enjoyed more than one towel per guest considering we were staying at this Airbnb for four nights. 
Other than that, check in was easy as it was self check in and we enjoyed the private entrance to our room.
very nice place, central, Rodrigo is very kind -  suggest!
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Rodrigo was a FANTASTIC host! Easy check-in/check-out and quick responses if needed.

The location couldnt have been more perfect! Easy access to public transit and a beautiful part of town. If were ever back in Dublin, well definitely try to stay with Rodrigo again!

Great spot- nice walk to plenty of places. 
Very quiet
Great location, very clean and cozy! Small but exactly what you need while in Dublin.

The place was on a beautiful street, very easy to get to through the use of the city buses. There were plenty of little shops and cafes near.

The room itself was everything we needed for a 3 night stop over, bed was comfortable, bathroom was very clean. 

Dublin was a very lively, cultural city, definitely coming back in the future!
Small studio and close to public transport. Easy to find and get in and out of. Very clean and easy thanks!

Nice contact, but unfortunately not personally met. All information about the stay has been described in detail. Beautiful apartment in a quiet area and everything easy to reach. Come again gladly. Accommodation is highly recommended.
Fantastic location in a lovely neighbourhood. Quick responses and good communication. Comfortable room in a quiet area. We walked everywhere and found great local places to eat . We would stay again!

Nice appartment near Lesson street, 10 minutes to go from bus stop (coming from airport by Aircoach) to get to Northbrookroad, WLAN was running well, very quit road.
Stephen's green can be reached in about 25 minutes by foot or even faster by Dublin bus!

We had a lovely stay at Rodrigos. We really enjoyed the accommodation which is situated in a great location. Nice, quiet neighbourhood and an easy walk into the city centre. Hope to stay with you again when we visit Dublin next!
Overall a good stay a little far for the city, but overall good for the price.
Great cozy place in a closeish area to the center. Very good and clean.
Excellent location, nice bed and pillows. The directions to the place made it very easy to find.

Goede kamer 
Douche met goede straal
Rustige woonwijk
Vlakbij 2 ontbijt restaurants en  buurtsuper met erg goede broodjes/koffie hoek 
Dichtbij opstappunt stadsfietsen
Beetje vochtig ruimte, maar niet hinderlijk

Communication with Rodrigo was very pleasant. Apartment was ready at expected time and luggage storage was possible before check-in and after check-out. Apartment is small and cute, ideal for couples staying for a short time in Dublin. Neighborhood was calm and very beautiful! Recommended :)
Great place to see the Dublin sights. Compact but you wont be in your room   Clean stylish quiet
We enjoyed our stay in Rodrigos place very much. The area is great and its so close to town and the LUAS.

Rodrigo's place is simple but stylish and very clean, just what I needed for a couple of nights. Rodrigo is very easy to contact. There is access to the Luas stop and it was good to be able to walk home from the Luas stop as it is such a safe area; Ranelagh, which is about 5 minutes walk, is a lovely high street with lots of cafes, restaurants, bars. Rodrigo's  was a simple , convenient spot in a picturesque part of Dublin and I will look to stay here again.
Cozy room, great location, but cold and stuffy bathroom.
This is a nice room in a lovely neighbourhood. Easy walking distance to Dublins attractions. The room was clean, and the bathroom was fine.
It was ok for a short trip to Dublin.

Great little place, well located near the center, perfect for a weekend in Dublin! 
We enjoyed our stay here very much and would book again with Rodrigo.
Great little place. Highly recommended. Perfect facilities for a short stay and a great location.

Great place to stay in Dublin. It was freezing during our visit but the room was lovely & cosy. Really good location - close to airport link, good range of shops & restaurants close by, lovely area, short walk to the city centre. Highly recommend.

Its a well located room in Leigh Annes family house. We arrived very late for flights issues and Leigh Anne was there waiting for us. 
She and her family were so lovely and made us feel so welcomed, we forgot we were not at home. 
If we go back to Dublin, and we have to, well surely talk to them.
Call us when you come to Spain, please! 
Xxx.
Wonderful place! A bit far from downtown but we did not mind the bus ride. Lots of good local recommendations by Leigh Ann.

It was a lovely and easy stay in Dublin :)
Thank you for all the recommendations
Friendly welcome with hosts ready to help in every way.  Great  location and some very good restaurants nearby.

Leigh-Ann and David were wonderful hosts. Very gracious in opening their home to us. The room and private bath were perfect for our 2 night stay. Very close to the bus stop with a nice short walk. We would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone looking for a stay outside of the city center.

You will be sure of a warm, friendly welcome from a lovely family.  Great location, close to the city and all its attractions.  The accommodation was spotless and parking is not a problem.  Highly recommended.

Lovely place to stay, Leigh-Ann and David are very friendly and helpful. Their dog Sammie is adorable and she loves visitors. The bedroom is located parallel to the kitchen between the main living area and the guest living/shared space and is therefore not completely private but this was not at all an issue. Had a relaxing, peaceful and enjoyable stay, thanks guys!

Leigh-Ann's description was most accurate.
We recommend their accommodation.
A lovely family and a clean and quiet space. The bed was excellent!

Leigh-Ann is an excellent host.  The accommodations were exactly as described and it is quite convenient to the bus stop.  She gives excellent advise and clear directions on how to get anywhere.  The bed is comfortable and the area is extremely quiet at night.  I recommend this Airbnb highly!

This place has everything you need.  A large comfortable bed, a private bath, your own sitting area, wonderful hosts, and a location very close to transportation into Dublin city.  Pubs and places to eat are within walking distance.  Communication with Leigh-Ann was easy and prompt, and everything was as presented in the ad.  We would go back.
Thanks for making our stay special
Leigh Ann has looked really well after us. The space was sparkling clean and really lovely. The location is amazing! Thanks a lot again!

This is a great location for going to the city centre and being able to get to Howth by bike so you can enjoy the busy city and beautiful scenery. Leigh-Ann and her husband were very helpful and had lots of great suggestions.

The location is great and the space is immaculate. She makes you feel like a welcomed long-time friend and that, to me, made the stay special. Easy access to downtown and a pub nearby too for a quick drink, this spot has everything you need and more.
Leigh Ann is a magnificent host! She is friendly and helpful! The place is sparkling clean and very comfortable!!

Leigh-Ann and her family were very welcoming. The location was very convenient with a bus stop to the city a few mins walk from the house. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had a great stay!

If youre on the search for a place to stay in Dublin and enjoy staying somewhere thats clean, private, and enjoyable then look no further. 
Leigh-Ann and her family were unbelievably welcoming to myself and my partner on our transition to Ireland. We have both moved here to attend one of the universitys for the year, and needed to search for a place to live. We found Leigh-Ann and stayed at her house for about 3 weeks. She gave us advice about how to navigate public transportation and tips on trying to find an apartment in the bustling city of Dublin. 
There was never a moment that felt as though her family wanted us to leave, because Im sure 3 weeks can be rather overwhelming to most individuals. However, Leigh-Ann was always asking us how our days went when returning and asking if we needed anymore help. She even went as far to write a reference letter for us, which was more than we could ask for. 
Honestly, this became more than just an AirBnB for us, it felt almost like a home away from home during our stay. I could have never asked for anything better than our visit to Leigh-Anns. 
So, if you would like to stay in a place that truly loves having your company during your adventures in Dublin, then you have found the place that youre meant to be. 
My partner and I are forever grateful to Leigh-Ann and her wonderful family, and we will definitely keep in touch.
Very friendly family.

The stay in Clontarf was really comfortable! Everything was clean and we had enough space for our luggage. It was also nice that we had the opportunity to use the livingroom on our own.
 Leigh-Ann also provided a little breakfast for us.

The communication was very easy and always friendly and there was a quiet and relaxed atmosphere in the house. 
You can get into the city by bus within 15-20. Furthermore you are living almost next to the sea, if you stay at Leigh-Anns house and there are two pubs and 3 restaurants near to the house. I can recommend the accomodation!

...what can you say what is not already written? I don¬¥t wanna write again what everybody has written. sure everything is mostly  correct about a small bedroom and a bathroom without window, but hey, you¬¥re on holiday not at your home!!! if you wanna have something represantive, something big, something you can post at social media, please go anywhere else and leave this beautiful and more than kind place on earth for the real backpacker. here you will get the single chance to dive in and get contact with a young family who is willing to let you take part. this was so emotional and friendly. Thank you Leigh-Ann and may the sun Always shine on you. Hope to see you again. Angela&Andre S.
buena alternativa general

This home is a Must Stayù...We are so Happy we stayed here... 1 minute walk to bus...15 minute drive to Downtown Dublin..only 3 Euros.

Clontarf is a Beautiful..Quiet neighbourhood close to the Sea...Great local Pub...ùPebblesù..Nice Restaurants within walking Distance..Takeout close by..Try the Fish and Chip Place...cheap Eats..but really Good.

Home..Sparkling Clean...Very Comfortable and Cozy arrangement!

The Host was Perfect...She so easy to communicate with..Works really Hard to Please Vacationers!!!!

Thank you for having us in your home..You and your Family made our 4 Nights in DUBLIN a Wonderful Experience!

Teresa and Doug

We had a very comfortable stay at Leigh-Anns home. She also accommodated letting us drop our bags and giving the house key early so we were able to go into Dublin to enjoy the afternoon & evening after returning our rental. We got to and from the city with ease via a 20min bus ride (need change 3euros/ride). We were ok with doing a lot of walking downtown Dublin once the bus dropped us off near OConnell street & River Liffey. Do make sure to note the description about house rules/hours of use (6pm-10am). This wasnt a problem for us because we stayed out exploring in downtown Dublin all day until 9/10pm. We would recommend staying with Leigh-Ann!

We enjoyed our stay at LA's place very much. The place was very cozy, warm, with good atmosphere. Ann made sure we always had everything we needed throughout the whole stay there. Everyday when we returned back from a day at city, there was a warm, nice and clean place waiting for us, where we could rest. The area was very quiet, we havent had a better sleep in years! :)

Leigh-Ann and David were very welcoming and everything was just as described. The bed was super comfortable and I had lots of privacy!

Things that are helpful to know:
- the house is not within walking distance of the city centre - personally, I think it's completely worth the peace and quiet you get during the night which you certainly won't get in a flat in the inner city. However, the bus stop is about a five minute walk away from the front door and the bus will drop you smack-dab in the middle of Dublin city. If you're planning on dropping in multiple times during the day, it might not be for you. I usually left in the morning and came back in the evening and found the location wonderful.
- Leigh-Ann has a very young, enthusiastic dog. I love dogs and she was very, very sweet. If you're scared of dogs, again, this listing might not be for you.
- the listing stated one of the house rules as no showers past 10pm, which at first led me to believe there was some sort of "curfew" as well; there isn't. I came home after 10pm a few times and it was never a problem. Long story short, if you want to stay up late haunting Dublin's pubs, you can. Just be considerate of the fact that other people are sleeping in this house as well. 

I had a great time and I'm sure you will too, because Leigh-Ann is a very good host!
The best host you'll ever have!! Leigh-Ann is always available to give advise and will assist in any way she can.  Her whole family is very welcoming and makes you feel at home.

Great location, 20min from city center by bus, close to sea
Owners are very kind and helpful.
Bedroom is very, very small but nice
Water system is very noisy, it's forbidden to take shower after 22h not to wake up owners (a bit annoying after long day in city center)
Coffee offered but not real breakfast
Though good value for price

We had a good time in Dublin! Leigh-Ann is a very good host and we felt at home right away. The room was very nice and clean and we loved their dog Sammie! Next time we're in Dublin we would definitly go back here!
Lovely couple and lovely house. Would be delighted to stay again.
100% recommendable. Everything was perfect!
Amazing people and a nice place to stay
Ed and Juliane were great hosts, even the noise that they mentioned on publication never was a problem for us. They have a great place, and a good location to reach the downtown
Good people and great place. Close to bus station and shops. Just 20 min by walking to the centre. Highly recommended.

Cosy and clean room with a comfortable environment. 
The house is in a peaceful neighborhood, close to the city center and Phoenix park. It's well communicated with Luas, bus and Dublin-bikes. Easy to arrive from the airport with bus 16 (you only have to walk 15 minutes). 
The host will answer all your questions quickly, and that is really helpfull. 
If I need a room in Dublin again, I'm sure I'll go back again.
Thanks guys!!
great location and host

The house is beautifully located by the sea. A bus stop is just around the corner, and the next DART station about a 20 min walk away (and it¬¥s definitely worth every walk you take, as the area is really nice). The Forty Foot beach, a wonderful promenade for evening walks, a supermarket and lovely little restaurants are in walking distance. This area of the city is definitely one of the most beautiful ones.

The house and the rooms are really lovely, clean and cozy. The kitchen and the bathroom both are big, clean, and easy to use, you will find everything you need there. As kitchen and dining room are one, you can cook and eat both with a gorgeous view outside over garden and sea. The garden is a gem, as it is very large and you can sit there and watch sunset and sunrise. 

Suzanne is a lovely host. She welcomes you, guides you through everything you need to know, explains everything patiently, answers every question that one might have. I really enjoyed my stay there and can recommend this accomodation and the host from the heart.

Susanna's place is located in a great location with fantastic views of the sea and in a quiet area. Susanna is friendly, easy-going, open, chatty and flexible. The rooms are clean and guests can use the kitchen. There is added bonus with a large area outside to watch the sea, swimmers and vessels passing by. Would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to stay in Dublin.
The host canceled this reservation 42 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
3 lovely month in Crea's house ! The accomodation is perfect ! Near the city center by walk or public transport. There is all you need around the house. I can only recommend!

I had a confortable 2 months long stay at Crea¬¥a place. She is a nice person always available for any kind of help. The neighborhood is maybe not one of the best in Dublin but it is located in a very convenient position and the house is very close to the bus stop leading to the city center. The room is big and the bed confortable. Crea would sometimes have guests staying overnight for few days but I never got bothered regarding that. Overall a nice stay except for a little accident happened over a weekend when there was a break in into the house while no one was there and my smartphone was stolen. Maybe setting on the alarm of the house would have prevented that and I think she will do it from now on. Except for this my stay was good.

Crea is very hospitable and generous. She has a lovely home and the room and bathroom are clean and very comfortable. I felt welcome and at home and while I was able to be independent and do my own thing, Crea was always on hand to provide advice or help if I needed it. I thoroughly recommend her home as a place to stay.

Crea is a fantastic host. I can't recommend her enough. She was so kind and chilled. The house is bright and welcoming. The room is big and bed is so comfortable. Crea has thought of everything. It's super easy to get to town by bus and tram (luas). Fantastic stay! Thanks Crea!

I absolutely loved staying at Creas place. The house and room were nice, cozy and warm, and more than anything, Crea is such a lovely, caring person who welcomed me warmly and helped me with a lot of things. I always enjoyed chatting with her with a nice cup of tea/coffee. I definitely recommend to everyone!

My stay was amazing at Mary and Jasons home. The view from the bedrooms windows is breathtaking : from sunrise to sunset you can enjoy the seaside. It was so nice to cook here the flat is perfectly arranged. Everything can be done by walk : supermarket, pubs, hiking path. 
Thanks a lot for your tips and reactivity for everything. Hope I can come back very soon.
Excellent location by the beach, walking distance to a pub and bus stops.
Great location right on the beach...
Great place for right time of year to enjoy the beach.  Walkable to town and good restaurants.

Mary and John's place was great! The location on the beach of the Irish Sea is just gorgeous and so convenient to the little town where we were able to get a delicious dinner! The place was decorated very nicely, it was comfortable and clean and Mary was very friendly making sure we had all we needed at check in. It was also very quick and easy to communicate about checking in and when we had a question about checking out. It was close enough to Dublin and the airport but far enough away to be super peaceful. We really enjoyed our stay, it was a perfect way to end a beautiful holiday.
Fabulous views and beach. Some of the best pub food in Ireland, great Guinness and an amazing view to have breakfast too
Wonderful location on the beach. Plenty of room & clean. Resturants In walking distance down the beach. Mary is very friendly host. Easy commute to Dublin by train.
Lovely place to stay! It was beyond our expectations, clean, cozy and comfortable!
Great stay at this air bnb. Its right on the Irish Sea and has great views. Easily fit 5 people. Best to drive to the train station and then take the train into the city center

Mary and Jason were excellent hosts. They had a sheet of all local amenities in the area which was very helpful. The place was spotless and the location was gorgeous. Would highly recommend them as hosts.

We were extremely disappointed with both the property and hostess. 
The property is hidden in the back of a sketchy area.
The hostess was not welcoming. In fact,  she was irritated and abrupt upon check in. She became very defensive about her property. There were stains on the sheets and we heard rodents in the ceiling during the night.  For theses reasons, we checked out in the morning and didnt stay a 2nd night as planned and Mary would not refund the fee.
Los departamentos de Mary y Jason son muy lindos , con camas muy comodas y equipamiento general muy completo.

Beautiful location and apartment.   Everything was clean and big enough for all 5 if us.  Great hospitality especially when flight was delayed and arrived late.  Communication was easy.  Would definitely stay again.

This place is spectacular! Great location on the beach, kind and attentive host in Mary, close to transport to Dublin. We enjoyed getting to know Rush a little and loved our time on the beautiful beach. The apartments themselves are lovely and homey, with wonderful patios and (Email hidden by Airbnb) munications were easy. Mary is an ideal host. We will be back.

What a gem! Beautiful apartment in a stunning location. Immaculate, had everything we needed. We had a wonderful stay. Mary and Jacob were very helpful with any questions I had before hand and were very helpful whilst we were there. The beach is second to none and to have it right on your doorstep was a treat. We will definitely be coming back.
The time we spend at Mary's place was absolutely great. The apartment is very nice and it's located directly at the  beach. We enjoyed it a lot.

Mary and Jasons place is right on the beach, comfortable and clean. There are
close by  restaurants and the view is wonderful.
Absolutely stunning location, beach outside the door, apartment very cosy, Mary an exceptional host!
Mary and Jason's place is amazing. The Irish Sea was outside our bedroom window. Mary and Jason are amazing hosts  and provided recommendations on anything we asked.

Location is FANTASTIC!!!! We were able to walk to the train and bus station and walk to restaurants, shops, and historical sites. The only taxi we needed was the short ride to and from the airport.  Even though the apartment is in the city center the building is situated in such a way that we never were disturbed by the noise of traffic and I was able to sleep through the night.

This flat was exactly as advertised.  It was clean and comfortably furnished.  The beds were very comfortable and it was quiet at night.  The location was fabulous and close to all the major areas that we wanted to explore.  Stephen was the perfect host and accommodated our requests.  I have already recommended this rental to friends and family.

Our family was traveling to Dublin for a few days and were not expecting the experience we had. 

Once we were escorted into the apartment (after waiting outside in the cold for quite some time past check-in) the woman who escorted us tried to leave us there as quickly as she could. Once we settled in we realized that although the linens had been cleaned, the trash was still full and left out on the deck and there were leftover used bathroom products and makeup sponges in the bathroom. More upsetting than the cleanliness issue, was that the electricity ran out. During our second day stay we ran out of electricity and had to wait for the actual host to come and punch in the paid code to turn the electricity back on (in the meantime, we had to take cold showers and had no heat or fridge). We also had troubles with the water heater/closet - throughout our trip it made constant noises and the closet was full of rags covering old leaky pipes. 

When we contacted the host about these issues, he was responsive and apologetic, but separately gave us two differing excuses for why he was having a hard time. Unfortunate things happen, but when you pay for a place to stay there is a certain quality you expect. 

We loved the location, but were pretty disappointed overall, especially considering the price for this listing. This could really be such a great listing and experience, and we regret that it turned out this way.

This apartment is in a perfect part of town. Walking distance to every tourist area, literally across the street from Dublin Castle and about a 5-10 minute taxi ride to Guinness and Jameson distillery. Great place!

Great location for easy walk to Trinity, Stephens Green and Temple Bar area. Very comfortable sleeping and quiet though close to busy night life. Stephen was very quick to respond to any communication. Enjoyed our stay.

The location of Stephen's apartment could not be better. It is close to everything with a walk or a very short taxi ride. This apartment has a lift/elevator, which we found very helpful. It has a secured entrance. We felt very safe. Stephen was immediate with responses and was very helpful during our stay in Dublin. The apartment is perfect for 3 people. You could make 4 work. The larger room has a queen-sized bed. The smaller room has 2 twin beds and not much extra space between the 2 beds. The kitchen had what we needed to make tea and have a quick breakfast. The bathroom has a tub and shower and is not cramped. It was a comfortable apartment and much better than a hotel, in our opinion! For the price and location, this was perfect for us.

Stephen is a thoughtful and flexible host. The apartment was very clean and the location is fantastic. However, every room is a bit smaller than I expected, based on the pictures, and I cannot recommend staying here if your group has 4 adults. For two or even three adults it would be great, and fine for 2 adults and a child or 2 (under 13).  We managed, but I would not stay here again with 4 adults.

Great place in a quiet street at a stone's throw from all the main places in Dublin.
Stephen was always quick to respond, and everything in the apartment was just fine.
We had a great time in Dublin, and a good taste of excellent Irish hospitality. Highly recommended!

It was a great location and really comfortable! Rooms are cozy, and yes, a bit loud at night, but not as bad as others said. I really appreciated the easy check in and friendliness and the local tips! The only issue we ran into was with the hot water for the shower (we needed to boost it after each shower) and the slow flushing toilet (it took around 2 hrs to refill--which he said was normal). We managed! Well worth the great location!
Great location.  Stephen was a great host and gave us some wonderful food suggestions.  The twin beds and down comforters were very comfortable.

Stephen was a really nice host! We had a late check-in and a friend of stephen welcomed us. During the stay, stephen did message us if everything would be ok. He even offered us to leave our luggage a little longer in the appartment because our flight left in the evening. Thanks for that again!

Amazing apartment, amazing location, host is fantastic and went above and beyond to assist us during our stay.  You will be happy you were able to book this amazing place in Dublin.  Hope to stay again someday.
Due to circumstances outside our control we couldnt stay here, but Stephen was quick to communicate with us and provide us with other accommodations.
Place is in a great location.
Absolutely perfect central location, and a great flat. Stephen was a wonderful host, responded quickly, and had some awesome recommendations for places to try! Would absolutely stay here again!

This apartment worked very well for our family of four, including 2 teenage boys. It was the perfect location for us - right in town and walking distance to everything, but quiet enough to be a retreat. The beds and couch were comfortable and we appreciated having Netflix to relax with during down time.  We also loved the little deck and the view. It would be great to have a couple of deck chairs available to make better use of that space. The biggest down side to this apartment is the plumbing. The toilet was bothersome - often didn't flush completely and needed a lot of time to refill. But, I'd read about this in previous reviews, so wasn't surprised. We got in the habit of using the restroom in restaurants or museums before returning to the apartment to make life easier. The shower is tricky, too. You couldn't leave it running or water would get all over the bathroom floor. And, as mentioned in other posts as well, the hot water tank (or something like that) in the hall closet drips continuously. All in all, this is a decent apartment with some quirks in a prime location. I wouldn't advertise it as "luxury", though.

Thanks again for the great stay ,in this quite place right in     the city center!Thanks  Victor for the warm welcome when  we arrived  late in the middle of the night.We hope to come back soon ,and from now on this  will be our address in Dublin!!
Perfect location, very friendly and (check-in-)flexible host!
The apartment was lovely. Very comfortable and had pretty much everything we needed. Also a superb location for seeing Dublin from.
A great place in the centre of Dublin city. We found that nearly everywhere we wanted to go was no more than a 5-7 minute walk.
The host canceled this reservation 17 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 38 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great location! Great apartment. Great experience!
Good location with about a 20 minute walk into town. Friendly host.
Great location and awesome local tips.
Great space in a great location and very warm and welcoming host. Would stay again without question!

I've waited a few days because I want to be constructive and have a clear head. I'll start with the positives: this space has a lot of potential. It's very private and roomy and within easy walking distance to city center. It's in an up-and-coming area with a very good cafe and restaurant around the corner. Well stocked corner shop across the road with all the basics.   BUT, this flat is in dire need of repairs and of a good deep clean. Much is broken, including shower cubicle doors which hang loose and don't close, a broken stair leading down to basement which is dangerous, most of the lights don't work and some are hanging broken from the ceiling with exposed wires.  Every dish or piece of cutlery we pulled out of the cupboard had food crusted on it. The floor in the kitchen was sticky and there were moldy rolls left on the counter.  The place had had a quick surface clean but  there is accumulated dust and grime in corners, along baseboards and behind doors. The shower stall really needs a going over with hard brush and bleach.... lots of pinky mold/bacteria that builds up on the grout between shower tiles.   On top of the state of repair/cleanliness, it was very disappointing that the flat wasn't ready for us when we arrived at 5pm, despite having confirmed the time the day before (and the listing saying checkin was anytime from 3pm). 

I hope these issues will be addressed before this property is let out to future renters.

So so. The Place has potential, but IT screams for some renovation or tiding up. Its a bit dirty, but you get used to it. For 3 days it was ok. There was a problem with the heating (there was no heating), and it was quite cold. Fionnula gave us additional heaters, so it was warm again. She was nice and helpful. Concerning the prices for Dublin, this was one of the cheapest. We had low expectations and it was just as we expected. The location is great because you need about 20 min by foot to the city center. If going for a weekend or so, its ok.

My wife and I had a horrendous experience with this AirBnB rental. While we found that the host was responsive during the booking process, that was not the case the day prior to or during our check-in. The day of arrival we tried to reach out to the host through Airbnb messages, (Hidden by Airbnb) , and SMS to see if we could check in early. We failed to receive any sort of response (later she claimed via Airbnb message to have sent a message earlier that did not go through but AirBnB customer support says that there was no issue with their system). When we arrived at the location early (~12:30-1pm) she did allow us to drop our bags off early and ~specifically~ said she would clean the place prior to the official check in time at 3pm. We left the location to allow time to clean and returned at 3pm. In person she stated that her son had been at home the previous night to party in Dublin and had used the rental the previous evening; later via AirBnB this changed to previous Airbnb rentersù. Upon return (during our official check-in) we began to experience severe issues with the property and host. 
The first issue we discovered was that the property had not been cleaned. A quick walkthrough showed several problems: the bed sheets were dirty, the sink was full of unwashed dishes, several used acrylic nails and false eyelashes were found on the couch and the bathroom floor, and general dirt and what appeared to be salad leaves on the floors. Further inspection revealed more worrying conditions than just general grime. The fridge had old food in it that expired months ago. The freezer was filled with frost and unusable. The toaster oven was covered in grim on the inside and clearly had not been cleaned in a while. There were lights falling out of the ceiling. In addition to 2 empty rolls of toilet paper on the holder, there was 1 spare toilet paper roll on the top of the cabinet in the bathroom, but this was thoroughly saturated with water and covered in dirt. The shower looked as though it had not been cleaned in a long time and appeared to have black mold on the grouting. There were makeup stains on one of the couch cushions. There is a door in the bed room that leads upstairs that you cannot lock from the renters side yet allows full access from the main house. However, most concerning is the fact that the dry wall above and behind the bed has water damage and peeling paint. Its clear there was or is a leak in those two areas and that the damage has yet to be addressed. This is concerning due to the possibility of mold behind the drywall. My personal observation is it appeared someone tried to scrub the walls with cleaning agent, however, these two locations were directly above the bed, and worse, in the murphy bed where the bed sits against the wall (meaning the mold from the wall was likely in contact with the bed).  
Within 20 min. of check-in we contacted AirBnB for resolution of the stated issues. After explaining the issue with the property and providing photo evidence of each issue to 2 different AirBnB customer service representative they finally contacted the host for resolution (more than one hour after the initial conversation and check-in). From my understanding upon discussion with the AirBnB rep, the host told AirBnB that we did not ask for the place to be cleaned when we showed up early. The host then showed up at our door and asked if we would like to leave so that she could clean the place. Bear in mind that this was the beginning stop of our honeymoon, where my wife and I had spent at least 20 hours non-stop in travel time, and it was now 5pm after spending over an hour on the phone trying to resolve this issue when we really wanted to eat and rest. We inquired as to how she would fix the larger issues like the dry wall, freezer, and very dirty shower grouting. Her response was a flustered and angry Ill tell you what¶thanks!ù She then angrily turned around and walked away. At this point AirBnB fully refunded our rental, but we were forced to find and book a hotel that evening with very limited options and time. AirBnB offered to help rebook us in a new AirBnB, however, due to the fact we had booked this accommodation weeks earlier, there were no other comparable options in either location or cost to the original booking. A hotel was the only available option to us at such a last minute, and the cheapest one cost us an additional $1,000 above what we expected to pay. AirBnB reimbursed $291 of this cost but it is still a substantial loss for us.   
This was an especially frustrating and disappointing start to our honeymoon, which included a large monetary loss and a wasted day and a half dealing with the host and AirBnB. We were fully aware of the limits to the accommodation we had booked and were not expecting a penthouse, but we were expecting it to be meet a basic level of cleanliness and safety. I cannot stress enough how much I would recommend staying away from this location and host due to the issues we had and monetary loss we suffered.
Perfect venue for events at Croke Park, just a few minutes walk away, lovely cafe round the corner for breakfast and a short walk into city centre.
Perfect space to yourself, with everything you need. Cosy and comfortable and absolutely everything we had hoped for. Will be the first place I look for if I ever come back to Dublin!

We stayed for two nights at Fionnualas Place. 

Pros: 
We really did like the location in a nice neighbourhood with nice houses and in walking distance to Dublin center. 
Bed comfortable and clean
Fionnuala is nice and flexible with the arrival time. The check in was really quick but ok. Communication was easy. There was milk in the fridge and she left us some pastrys on our last night.

Cons:
Eventhough the Bed was clean and comfy the rest of the appartement needs a deep scrub. 
Specially bathroom and kitchen wasnt clean. It felt a bit as if every now and then one corner is cleaned. 
Specially the toilet and the sink in the bathroom were dirty. Also the fridge and the glases and cutlery in the kitchen

Conclusion:
If you dont care much about cleanness you get a clean and comfy bed in a nice neighbourhood
Convenient location for walking to city centre

Wonderful place to stay that was much larger than I had anticipated. Hosts were very nice and super accommodating. I highly recommend this place and will be looking into again when I return to Dublin.

The house is on nice street close to the centrum of Dublin. Flat is under the pavement. It is a little bit unclean. But bed and bed linen are good and clean.
You can use bus to the centr (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) . For breakfast you can use very good Cloud cafe - just the corner on main street :-) For dinner you can use an excellent small italian restaurant Da Mimmo.
This accommodation is very good for 2-3 nights.

We where going to an event at Croke Park, location was ideal and very good value. Small but suited us for one night. We found the place to be basic and could be cleaner but nothing that was a big issue. Steps outside need replaced, wood is rotten in places and dangerous.
Nice little flat easy walk into Dublin center

I feel as if you're renting an Airbnb its an extension of your home. I truly hope this host home is cleaner. This place is filthy. Too much detail to go into lets just say the ENTIRE place needs to be cleared out and scrubbed like its never been scrubbed before.  Walking barefoot just long enough to realize I needed to put shoes on ASAP. Never been mopped and rarely swept is my guess. I large collection of partially used personally product are left behind in the bathroom. Cabinets are full of opened food packages. 6 bottles of olive oil?  I get the impression someone lives here when not rented, which is ok. But you need to do more than just change the sheets when a guest is coming. it looked as the sheets were changed? It's listed as a 2 bed unit. When we arrived there was only 1 towel and ZERO toilet paper. Only one bed had sheets. I messaged  Fionnuala about more towels she stated that she didn't know how many people were coming? Two of us on the reservation, lets go with two.  Lights hanging from the ceiling, paint falling off. I paid $126.00 USD to stay one night. It's not worth $1.26 USD. Its all very unfortunate. This place could be great place is only host took a slight bit of pride in her rental. Fionnuala seems like a nice person. And was respectful of our privacy, but she need to spend a day scrubbing this place top to bottom.  I can't recommend this Airbnb. The only good thing about this place was the wifi speed.

Budget accommodation, unreliable communication with host, place looks not  maintained from outside, very bad smell by the front door. Kitchen is not functional, uncomfortable bed, all of this would  have been ok IF...  we has been able to sleep !  First night loud music until very late, 2nd night a  20 min dog barking session around 4am. It does appear that we were overcharged as well.  Did not use the kitchen at all ! So disappointed !

First of all the check in was great,
Fionnuala came and showed us how the water worked etc so our first experience with her was good. However after our first night it just went from good to bad.
1) There were alot of flies around the apartment but we didn't let that bother us.
2) There was alot of dust around the place and it seemed like there was no cleaning done at all.
3) The shower was in such bad condition in a sense that the shower door was just hanging off a clip or something. The window by the room we could not open because of people smoking stuff etc and alot of rubbish was around which explains the flies.
4) The WORST was the noise issue.
She did not think for a second that there were people staying downstairs, loud music was played at night talking loudly and then on top of that dogs barking late at night. We didnt mind the noise during the day but it would be nice to have a quiet evening but we didn't have that here for the few days we stayed.

Please take into consideration as to what your getting yourself in for 
The description that is given about the page is NOT accurate there are things listed there that are not available like the washing machine for example. That is all i would say.
Nice little basement great for crashing in after exploring Dublin in the day or night! Close enough to the city centre to walk but also easy enough to get a short bus or taxi ride.
Fionnuala's place is really cosy and a great central location! We had a great stay.

Fionnuala is a nice, friendly and super fast responding host. The place is not to far from the city (15min walk). Also the GAA Museum and croke park stadium is just 5min away. There is a bus station nearby also. You will have as much private time as you need in here, because of your own entry. Nevertheless, the place was not the cleanest so I will check next time the comments if it will be better again.

When we looking for a place I read a few reviews criticising cleanliness and noise levels but we decided to go ahead. Im glad we did ì we found it fine. There is a note in the Airbnb description suggesting that guests not expect hotel standards, which is why the price is relatively low for a self-contained flat close to the centre. 

As for noise, I personally enjoyed the strains of Patti Smith and the Doors wafting down to us on the Saturday night. We had a previous experience with hosts who made us feel that we were breathing too loud, so this more relaxed attitude was most welcome!

We were in town to attend an event at the convention centre, so the location was very convenient. The bed and living room area was comfortable and lounge-worthy, which is what we needed after being out all day. 

On a critical note... It was already getting autumnal in the evenings, especially in a basement (Dublin is cooler than London, even in August). We wanted to put the heating on for a bit at night and discovered that it didnt work. There was also a damp odour, which turned out to be a problem with the drains.

I brought this up and it took a couple of tries to get the heating and the drain seen to. The first time or so we were told there was no problem and 'it wasn't cold'.  We also needed to ask for spoons (none in the kitchen) and towels. But once this was sorted out we were happy. 

Other guests should be aware there isn't really a full kitchen for cooking big meals ì there is a two-ring device in a corner that might have been difficult to cook in, plus a rather crochety toaster-oven. This wasn't a problem for us because we were at the convention most of the time and didn't do any cooking besides making coffee and toast. But it might be useful to point that out in the description for others.  

While taking the criticisms above into account, we did enjoy our stay and found Fionnulas place a nice little flat for our purposes. She's very friendly and I appreciated her interest in my writing too. I'd recommend it to others, especially if they're attending an event at the convention centre.

Great location, Small flat with double bed and sofabed, Kind host.
But very eclectic  / old fashioned, basic quality accommodation in need of a lot of TLC.
Great location if you are walking or using public transportation. Local restaurants and pub are great.

Excellent location 
Super Host 
Would definitely recommend
I stayed here for one night and found it to be perfect for my needs and excellent value. Would recommend.
Great space and location and cost effective for the price. As expected.
