Great host, friendly and plenty of tips to help you with your trip

The apartment was comfy, quiet and at a very good location (close to the city center, buses, restaurants,...) Fionnuala was also very helpful regarding the checkin and checkout time. I will recommend it :)
Basic but stay ok
Cozy, friendly apartment within walking distance of everything!
15 minutes to city centre
It was a very nice stay amongst all the art. I recommend it.
Great and quiet place only 25 minutes from the city with a nice little garden. Pubs, restaurants and markets just around the corner. Aircoach stop 10 minutes at Upper Leeson Street. Enjoy!
Very good location. Bit on the expensive for what I received. House is quite cluttered and room is sparcely furnished. But a very friendly host.
Had a great stay, John is a fantastic host, very helpful and flexible.
Paul was a great host. If you need a quiet place which is relatively close to City Centre, this provides great value to you.
Great location and good vaue for money.
Amazing location, great host and nice place to stay at :).

Paul is a nice person, very cool guy, he is concerned about everything and makes sure the guests are comfortable. The place is a traditional antique Irish house, with a few improvements. I liked everything about my room, the round window, the window on the ceiling and the decoration.
Nice place to stay close to the center, sharing the facilities of the house with Paul, the owner of the house.
Great value in a great location.
Amazing hostess and location! Clean and all
The place has everything that a person will need for day to day use. Plus it's spacious, can accommodate 4 persons.

This is an ideal stay for a solo traveler. Everything was clean and the accommodations were as described. I was able to enjoy the reasonable walking distances to the most popular areas of the city, and easily use public transportation nearby when needed.  Rose was friendly and extremely helpful to provide travel tips, both within the city and traveling to other cities.  I love to stay out late, and this was not an issue returning to the apartment after hours. I would stay here again!
Great place conveniently located near many popular areas! Rose was very accommodating and provided many helpful tips.
Incredible stay.  Well located, Rose has been very helpful with everything

Rose is a very nice and attentive person. She guides me to find my way in Dublin and with the buses. 
The rooms are very clean.
Just it would be good to change the matrass which digs in the middle.
The flat is very well-located.
Thank you for your warm welcome !
Isabelle

Rose is very friendly and provide travelling guidance from Belfast as well as local tips getting around Dublin city. The home is conveniently located in the city centre within walking distance to all tourist spots in the city and bus stops are all nearby. Great location, clean room and friendly host!
Perfect location and very clean. Rose was very helpful during my stay.

The location of the stay is really good! Everything is nearby, the main bus stops to the airport or to other tourist spots are just few minutes away! Rose is really helpful and replies quickly to my need!
Warm welcome and great willingness to find information re.transport+ directions

I recently had the honor of sharing the home of Rose in Dublin.  If your looking for the 4-Seasons, this is not the place.  It is small, functional, affordable, location is wonderful and it is clean and cozy.  My host Rose could not have been nicer.  A complete delight to visit with and helpful with advice and directions.  Her friend had to check me in and he was super nice, even walked me to his favorite lunch spot down the road.  Rose works from home so she is very accessible.  WiFi and TV in the shared space, frig and cooking made available (I only used the microwave oven).  I felt like a roommate who had known her forever by the end of the stay.  She is originally from Brazil but speaks English with no issues at all.

Location is perfect to experience Dublin down town.  Buy a Leap Card and put about 5 euro per day you are staying.  You can always top-off at train stations or link to your credit card.  Guinness is a bus ride away (I walked back).  Howth is a train ride away, wonderful 1/2 day adventure and walk on the cliffs.  Great food all over!  Pints and pubs all around!  All the busses, pubs and trains have WiFi, so if you out of country no need for cellular service, just use WiFi for directions and calls.  Hint, stand next to a bus that is parked (out of service) and use the free WiFi for calls and maps).

Wear good shoes!  I did a lot of walking!

Thanks for the stay,

Cheers,

Jim
Rose is a great host, her place is clean and cosy, and in an excellent location.
Consiglio vivamente questa accomodation nel centro di Dublino. Mezzi di trasporto e pubs a 5 min camminando. Rose e' molto disponibile e gentile!

The space is small (as advertised) but more than adequate for a single traveler. Rose makes you feel at home and provides her hand-picked recommendations for food and drink in various areas of the city. The location couldnt be better, as it is a short walk or bus ride to any major area of the city center (located within a minute or two walk from stops serving many bus routes). Highly recommended!!

Rose was an amazing host. She gave me tips of places to see, place to eat and was extremely quick with all communication responses. Rose was a delightful host and I would not hesitate and to book a stay with her!

Hey guys .... I would definitely say this Rose was excellent in her hospitality . Place was so appropriate to stay as in ,it was near to all important places like Temple bar , bus stops to take some tour, Tesco  etc. She was very helpful in guiding me all through . Thanks Rose

Rose is very kind and welcome me warmly.
Her response is quick and flexible for the check in progress. Everything is very clear and the room is definitely comfortable for a solo traveller.
The location is ideal and the whole apartment is very clean and tidy. I highly recommend it

You will have a wonderful stay at Roses flat.  She is very fast to answer any questions via the app, or text.  I very much appreciated the early check in so I could catch a nap before exploring Dublin!

Her flat is in a perfect location. The bus from Dublin Airport drops you off 2 blocks east, and the return stop is basically right outside the front door.  Access to the center of town, the Temple Bar area, is very easy via a 15 minute walk south, or via tram which stops a few blocks to the west.

The Kingfisher down the street at the corner opens at 8am for a fantastic breakfast, and in the evenings dinner is also great.

I highly recommend Roses flat for a stay in Dublin!!
Convenient location to city and airport, clean space and wonderful host!

Der Aufenthalt bei Rose war sehr nett. Sie war immer ansprechbar und hat bei allen Problemen schnell und gut geholfen.
Das Zimmer ist klein und die Ausstattung Basic. Alles war sehr sauber.
Great quiet location a little outside the city Centre.  Modern updated space that was super comfortable.

Good location to walk or catch the 79 bus into town or back , dont Uber they are dearer 

Apartment private area very clean and great place to relax

When you're traveling internationally, life is bound to get in the way at least once or twice, but when you have a host who responds immediately, does everything they can to help, and goes out of their way to take care of you and make things right, no amount of difficulties can't be remedied. These folks are truly amazing and made our lives so much easier! Not only is the place lovely and in a perfect location, but they'll do whatever they can to make you feel at home and to ensure you have the best trip to Ireland possible!

We had a fabulous stay here over St Patrick's weekend. Rachel & Ricky were great with communicating with us. 
The apartment is perfect for two couples - loads of space. 
It's right next to Kilmainham Gaol & it's easy to get into the city ( buses & cabs). 
I preferred that we weren't right in the centre as it was so busy . 
The pub across the road was good fun ( Patriots Inn) - lots of brilliant entertainment & nice food. 
I would definitely return to this apartment and this area.
We enjoyed our Stay. Good location. Nice appartment. Clean! Just great! Only thing was the lights in the restroom and that the dishwasher didnt work.

A nice, clean apartment within walking distance of the city center. There are a few things to see and do nearby like the Kilmainham jail and the Museum of Modern art, but it is not super busy or loud, and you can walk to the city center.
Wonderful stay in Dublin. Really made sure our stay was lovely. The location was tidy and very close to the city center - highly recommend.
Great place to stay. Highly recommend.

Great location and super clean. Was met by Rachel and she showed us around. Apt is well equipped with all modern conveniences. The patio was a bonus to have my morning hot chocolate. Had two sets of keys  so guests could split up and be on their own. Will need to take a bus or the tram to get to center city where most attractions and tour pickups are located. Grocery, a pub and several take out food places just a few steps away.
The flat is clean and very nice and by bus and tram you can easyly get up town

Great location - easy to catch the tram  or bus into the city centre. Very clean. The patriots inn across the street was a good spot to end each day.  Enjoyed Dublin castle, the Kilmainham Gaol, Howth and Irish friendliness and hospitality wherever we went. Hoping to return soon.  Our stay was grand!!

Rachel was a fantastic host and the apartment was amazing.  Rachel personally met us to check us in and she was extremely patient as she waited around (we were late) for us to figure our way around a new city.  Our very personable host took us around the apartment to give us all the information we needed and took the time to see that we were comfortable.  Thank you so much for making our trip 1,000 times better!  This location is literally across the street from Kilmainham Gaol jail and has plenty of amenities in the immediate area.  If you are not driving, a bus stops at the jail so there is always easy transport to the heart of Dublin city.  If you are driving, it's a 6 to 10 minute drive to anywhere in Dublin.  Such a convenient location.  We would definitely look to stay here again if we are blessed with visiting Ireland again in the future!

Very cute space tucked away in an otherwise busy city. The privacy was fantastic but slightly difficult to locate unless guided which Geraldine was gracious to call. Its very close to the Gaol and War Memorial Gardens which I recommend walking to. Otherwise you will want to taxi into the city centre of Dublin as the place is a 25+ minute walk. Appreciated the travel pamphlets scattered through the apartment and overall amenities!

Its  a great place and very clean, close to the city center. If I go back to Dublin
I would stay there again if available
Great location and communication!

Great little apartment! We were directly opposite the kilmainham jail and could jump on the hop on hop off buses which literally take you where we you would need to be! Arrival was easy and Rachel gave us a great tour and explained everything to us as well as giving us some great local tips! Close by to the zoo which is a great day out! The parks which are so abundant are lovely for a quiet walk around! We had a fantastic trip and can't wait to do it again!
Great location close to all that make Dublin special. Safe location. I would love to spend more time here. Everything you would want from a superhost.
In a great location and a wonderful home base to explore Ireland! Very much recommend for your next trip to Dublin!
Great location and great host had a good time

A great place in a fantastic location, if you are happy to be a short walk outside of the city (don't let this put you off).  A great apartment with lots of little extras left over from previous guests, that we just did not expect.
Terrific apartment.  Great location.  Awesome owner and manager.

The location of this place is wonderful: across from the pub and the jail; two blocks from a grocery, bakery, coffee shop, and bus stop. We appreciated all of the travel guides left for us and especially Rachel's patience during check in as our flight was delayed! The train noise others mentioned was almost unnoticeable; we thought it was distant thunder. 

Do note that the dishwasher is broken and seems to have been for a bit. The washing machine was broken during our visit but our sense was that was more recent.

We enjoyed our stay here, very warm welcome and a perfect location for exploring from. The washing machine wasn't working as it had been broken by some previous guests and the fan and some of the lights in the bathroom were also broken so a bit of maintenance needed but we still had a good stay.

Great appt, easy accesible by car including parking in garage. Restaurant next door, supermarket with good coffee bar around the corner. Irish pub on the corner. City centra is 30 mins walk while you pass the Guinness factory. Uber (meter only) is appr. ‚Ç¨ 22,-

The apartment is in a great location for visiting Dublin and has everything you would need. The rooms were comfortable and there is a little balcony. There are a few things that weren't working but that didn't interfere with our stay. Check-in took a while on a hot day but Geraldine was very helpful and chatty and the apartment was lovely and cool when we got in. I would happily stay again.
Nice and quiet, a bit further from Temple Bar area but if you are looking for a clean quiet place to sleep, this is perfect.

This place is very well located in Dublin with walking distance to a pub, bus station and stores. This place definitely needs some maintenance work as some of the things in the apartment didnt work during our stay.
Location was great and communication was efficient. Many things were not working; lights, washer, dishwasher, freezer and hot water for showering.
Great location. Lovely apartment. Ideal for our nights stay.

Great good sized apartment and great location as just across the road from the Gaol.  Walking distance to the Guinness Storehouse and short cab ride to Temple Bar. We really enjoyed our stay in Dublin.

Overall the apartment is lovely and is well located. Its in great proximity to eateries, shops and transport. Rachel was very nice and helpful throughout the whole process. 

There did seem to be a few things broken/ not working throughout the apartment. None of this bothered us as we were there for one night.

Geraldines place as one of the nicest, best located and real value of all the places I have stayed. The place was very clean, modern, had everything we needed to feel at home.
Location is very convenient, near shops and public transport. Rachel was very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this wonderful apartment!

Location is perfect. Friendly reception. Nice apartment.
Place is in need for some maintenance. Dishwasser hadn't been working a long time (according to other guests). Shower didn't work properly. Most lights in the shower were broken and ventilation was also broken (and had also been for a long time). Smelly towels.
Do visit Kilmaonham goal. Must see!
I highly recommend this accommodation.  Clean, spacious and excellent location.  Geraldine and Rachel were great hosts.

Hi there,
If you look for a modern and clean place, you should opt for Geraldine's place. Her flat is amazing so is the neighbourhood.
Lovely apartment in a good location. Easy access to tram to get around. Opposite Kilmainham Gaol which is well worth a visit.
Great location, very clean, lots of room! They had lots of supplies for babies & children to stay there, if thats your situation.

Ideal location: Kilmainham Jail 3min away, right opposite recommended Dublin Bikes station (and another station nearby), 2min away from Hop on/Hop off bus stop, 20min to small but amazing Dublin zoo and 20min walk to/from Houston Station with Airport bus link.
Great apartment in quiet residential area with tea, coffee, salt and soap/gels included. We enjoyed our stay there, host was very accommodating about check-in and check-out times which gave us almost one day extra. Thank you.
Great place to stay with a family while visiting Dublin.
Lovely apartment in a fantastic location! The apartment was sparkling clean and Rachel was fabulous!
The apartment is in a great location - quiet,  secure and right near a bus stop. There were little bathroom supplies in case we forgot something which was nice. The apartment was also nice and clean.

Rachel was lovely, greeted us on arrival, and gave us a tour of the apartment. The location was very convenient-you are steps from Kilmainham Gaol, a city bus stop and bus stops for a couple of the hop on/hop off tours. There are a couple of pubs and a grocery store a short distance down the road. There is a cafe in the adjacent building that serves good coffee and light breakfast items.  We were a group of four and found that the apartment had sufficient space for us.

This apt was amazing. Really great quality value. The place was really clean and very comfy. Parking free on premises was really handy. Im looking forward to coming back to Dublin and stay there again. Thanks!
Great place to stay and explore Dublin.
Great location easy access to the city good sizes spaces ideal for family stay

Perfect location and super clean apartment. 
The apartment is really spacious and has lovely little personal touches to make your stay better. 
We would really like to visit Dublin again and I would always chose to stay here. 
Absolutely fantastic - Thank you!

The apartment is really lovely, beds are comfortable & great for a few people sharing. Close to amenities & transport. We loved our stay here & recommend it to anyone wanting a modern & comfy home away from home

A great apartment in an excellent location. Rachel you were great
Thanks
Max

We were extremely disappointed with the stay in general. We originally told the hosts that we would arrive by 6pm, but plans changed and we would be arriving by 3pm. We contacted the hosts hours before we arrived but werent finally responded to until much later. We called the 3 different hosts and not one of them answered until finally Richard picked up the phone and told us to meet at 5:15 at a Hilton(down the street from the apartment). 5:15 came and went, but nobody was there, finally we called Richard back and he said someone will be there shortly. Then, Rachel called us and told us to meet her at the cafe down the street(closer to the apartment). Rachel wasnt at the cafe when we arrived and had to call her to come out to meet again. Finally, we checked in.... PHEW. And... were additionally disappointed that the apartment wasnt cleaned upon our arrival. Rachel stated that she worked that day so she was finishing cleaning up as we were arriving. (Which could be why they didnt answer our calls, wanted to clean, but communication would have been nice). There were a couple of trash bags needing to be taken out, which she did after we arrived. We then experienced the following issues:
-There were supposed to be 2 double beds, but there was 1 double bed and 2 single beds.
-The dishwasher was broken.
-The shower head was broken and you had to hold it up to wash yourself.
-The pictures of the apartment were clearly old since there were different couches pictured and extremely worn down.
-Crumbs all over the counter next to the toaster.
-Broken siding down the hallway.
-Fan didnt work in the bathroom so you had to keep the door cracked to not fry the fuses(stayed by Rachel).
-Floors were extremely dirty; not swept or mopped.
-Freezer was completely frozen over and could not be used.

The location was the only saving point, but other than that we were very disappointed in the stay. We feel deceived by the pictures and by the description and feel as if that information should be updated. If you post a check-in at 3pm have the apartment cleaned and ready to go by 3pm, not after the hosts are present at 6pm. 

As a PS, the check out is leaving the keys in the broken letter box and running out to the car on the street.
Lovely apartment in an excellent location. Good secure parking and the hop on hop off buses are literally over the road.
Great location and sweet host.

Great location, a 20 minute walk to most tourist attractions in the city. 

Rachel was very sweet and answered all of our questions.
The five star reviews are all spot on ì this place is amazing! Fantastic location, clean, comfy and affordable. Im definitely going to stay again. Thank you for having us!

We felt it was over priced as we had on going mainenance issues of broken dish washer, bathroom door didn' t lock. Surely when the host knew they had the appartment booked they should have made repairs or refunded some of the payment as they didn't fulfill what was paid for. Also rumbling noise of trains could be heard as the appartment is below ground level and poor mobil reception. Location was good.
Very central location! Rachel checked us in and she was fabulous
A lovely, homely apartment just outside the centre of Dublin. Fantastic value for money. Would definitely come again.
Had such a lovely stay here for my graduation in DCU. Rachel was so helpful and lovely. Would love to stay here again when I am up in Dublin as it is in a great location. Thanks again!

Becca and Patrick were amazing hosts; kind, welcoming and accommodating. We felt right at home, and received many great tips about what to see in the city. The apartment is in a quiet area away from noise but a short walk from the bus that takes you right into the city. Would love to stay again!
Unfortunately I had to cancel my trip but Piotr was really helpful and understanding.
Piotrs place is great! Highly recommend it. The location is a quick ride to both city Centre and the airport. Thanks, Piotr!!

The bedroom and bathroom were very clean. Everything was organised and prepared. The communication was great. We didnt discuss that much because we left early in the morning and came back late but the woman was really kind with us ! I highly recommend to stay there ! Thanks a lot !

A very nice place to stay, very clean.
Piotr and his girlfriend are very nice and gave us great advice to enjoy Dublin!

Piotr's place is a 20-25 mins direct busride to the city center, so it was quiet but still easy to get around. The room had everything we needed, and Piotr and his girlfriend were very welcoming and friendly people. They have two adorable, always excited dogs :) Altogether it was a very pleasant experience :)
We had an amazing stay at Piotrs place! Really nice hosts, great location and 2 cute dogs. Thank you for your kindness and the very useful tips you gave us!
Good location, about 10 minutes from the airport, good communication and quiet place for sleeping.

Had a good stay at Piotrs, their place is really close to the city centre with a bus stop right outside the house which made it great for us spending the weekend in Dublin. 
They were also really friendly and helped us with whatever we asked for.
Lovely stay
Awesome place! Super close to the city, clean and very great hospitality!

We had an excellent stay at Peter's. He was so helpful and welcoming and the place was sparkling clean. He had set out some snacks and coffee/tea supplies in the room which was a very lovely touch. The only downside is that it's about a 20 minute bus ride from the central city, and (like everything in Dublin!) the bus fare is somewhat expensive so it does add up over time. I would definitely recommend to a friend though, it was a very positive experience.
lovely place with the cutest dogs ever :)
Our hosts were extremely lovely and the place was exactly what we needed for our short stay in Dublin.
Piotr and Monica are very welcoming.    My son loved playing with the two little dogs! Thanks for the ride to Howth and airport! Wish we could stay longer.
Warm welcome with practical help for transport, amenities etc. Clean room with tea/coffee amenities. So so convenient for the bus into town! 20 mins to OConnell Street.
Piotr accommodated us very last minute and was an excellent communicator. The room was comfortable and clean. There was easy access to busses right around the corner.

Very kind.
Perfect room (with kettle and coffee at your disposal), and possibility to use the living areas without problems.
Very accommodating, I was able to arrive and leave at times different from those arranged on the application, and this was graciously accepted.
I recommend.
Great place to stay and cute dogs!
Sehr freundliche und hilfsbereite Gastgeber!
Place was okay. Good thing about it was the location. host was helpful in giving recommendations for things to do in Dublin.
Great little spot right in a cool area! Bailey was awesome, he gave us a bunch a tips for where to visit and places to see while we were there. The apartment was exactly what we needed for our stay!

The location is fantastic! Its within walking distance to all major tourist spots and next to lots of restaurants and pubs. Because its in such a central location, it can get noisy at night. Bailey also knows a lot about Dublin and Ireland in general, so he gave us good suggestions on places to visit in other parts of Ireland.
very ideal to be in the city center , very nice cool & warm Welcome from Bailey

Bailey's got everything you need if you want to kick off your stay in Ireland to a good start. A really good position, not too noisy even though you're right next to the temple bar, and really chill. If you've got questions, Bailey's here to give some really good tips about what to do in Dublin, he's got you covered.
Very centralized in Temple Bar.
Bailey was a fantastic host. He gave us a rundown of Dublin when we first arrived which was very helpful. The location of his place cannot be beat. Would definitely stay here again.

Bailey is an excellent host and offered great suggestions on things to see and do
. Location was perfect, everything is within walking distance.
Perfect spot! Everything we wanted to see was very close. We thought we would use the buses more and didnt need to. Only heard the noise if we focused on it.
Couldn't ask for anymore really. Good host, would highly recommend.
Best location in Dublin

My daughter and I stayed at Baileys place while on holiday. Bailey is a great guy and was very knowledgeable about Ireland. It was lovely meeting him. His apartment is as described. I love that its in the heart of the city there is so much action. We cant wait to stay with Bailey again.
Super convenient location, there was a bit of street noise but otherwise a comfortable stay.

Bailey, the host, was Amazing! Gave us so many great tips. He went above and beyond what is expected of an airbnb host! The place is located in a great spot. The house was clean and stylish in a retro sort of way! I would definitely go back to this place if i decide to come back to Dublin for a visit!

Bailey is a great hostel had great recommendations particularly for food near the flat. I thought it might be noisy being right above temple bar, but it really want bad at all. Stay here over a hotel for sure!

My mate and I stayed at Bailey's lovely apartment over the weekend. It's located right next to the Temple Bar Pub and about 20 yards from the river, and we basically walked our way to all the nice places/ pubs/ restaurants/ casinos in Dublin. So yeah, of course, the location is just absolutely great - really doesn't get better than this!! It comes with its minor drawback though - it can get slightly noisy in the night from all the street murmuring but its hardly a problem if you shut the bedroom window. That apart, the apartment is quite nicely done with spacious bedroom and bathroom. Bailey was a fantastic host to us and was very helpful right from the day that we made our booking. I would recommend this place to anyone who's visiting Dublin to have a good time!
Great location good place to sleep

This accommodation has a great location, just in the middle of the Temple Bar neighborhood. The hosts (Bailey's parents) was really nice with us and recommended some good places in Dublin.
However, the facilities are really old and in bad conditions, and the shower head was broken, while the bathtub was dirty.

My son and I recently stayed at Baileys place. Bailey was super helpful with loads of advice about places to go in Dublin. We missed our first night because of a delayed flight and Bailey offered to let us stay an extra night,  no-charge, since we had missed the first. Our schedule didnt allow for us to take him up on that, but I was so impressed that he offered. The location is perfect. Cant think of a better place to stay location wise.

Bailey's place was fantastic!  Location was safe and perfectly situated to walk out the door and experience all the adventures of downtown Dublin! The room was super clean and had everything we 2 girls needed (including a hair dryer - so thoughtful!)  Bailey is incredibly kind, responsive (immediate responses to all questions), and very passionate about where he lives. He is a professional tour guide so he knows where you want to (and may not want) to go.  Overall would love to stay here again! Thank you so much Bailey for such a fabulous first trip/introduction to Ireland!

You can not get any closer to Temple Bar than Bailey's. He is a treasure trove of info for Dublin. He even had adapters in our room for us to use. If you want to be in the middle of it all and with someone who knows Dublin in and out Bailey's is a great place to stay!
Great location , only 20 meters from Temple bar - perfect for anyone wanting to explore the nightlife :)
Amazing location. Amazing host.
Susans place was lovely! Very clean and stylish. Would recommend staying here - would definitely stay again

Our stay was brilliant! My whole family loved your flat and would 100% come back. The local area was lovely, we ate out at union 8 and got a birthday cake for my sister from the bakery up the road. Really couldnt have asked for more! Right on the bus route into town as well as a 5 min walk from the kilmanhaim jail where you could get on a hop on hop off bus tour! Couldnt recommend more!

Susans property management team was very responsive throughout our stay. The apartment is bright with a large living room... but it needs many minor repairs, some general TLC (which we found surprising given the price). The bedrooms face on to a busy street, which could make it tough to get a good nights sleep. But the apartment is so conveniently located near a bus stop and tram, about 15 minutes from downtown.
Susans place is very comfortable and clean. It was great for four adults.
Everything as expected. We came with 5 people and the flat was big enough.

Susan's space was great for our group.  It's an easy walk to Guinness, Temple Bar and right on a main bus route.  Check in was easy and we were lucky to find street parking right across the road (free on Sunday.)  The street is quite busy, so a bit of traffic noise.  The apartment is bright and spacious, needs a little TLC but was very comfortable with lots of good quality linens and comfy beds.  A good place for friends or family to stay and keep to a reasonable budget with all mod cons.
The host canceled this reservation 109 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This apartment is on a major road and unfortunately you can hear all the road noise. There was no coffee pods for the coffee maker unfortunately. Communication with the host is auto-generated as I got the exact same messages both times I stayed here. Overall was an good experience, good value for bigger group.
This was our second time staying here, overall the accommodations were okay. It was nice to find a big enough place for 6 people.
Great place to stay. Value for money
The Susans house is confortable, it has all you need to stay a few days in Dublin. However, it is a bit noisy because the street has lot of traffic.

The apartment is stylish and well equipped in a non-touristy neighborhood with several good restaurants and a couple grocery stores within walking distance. One drawback is that it's on a busy street so there is noise from the traffic, but if you aren't sensitive to that then no worries.

we enjoyed our stay very much. location is great, you can reach the center by bus in a few minutes. we had a lot of space and it was clean. comfortable beds, helpful hosts - very easy to to reach and friendly.
it is a bit noisy as there is a busy road in front of the house - nevertheless recommendable, we would go again!!

This apartment is in a very convenient location, close to public transport, and food. We toured a great percentage of Dublin and the eastern coast without ever renting a car. The road out front is a little busy but quieted down at night. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Nice size apartment providing good value to spread out. Susan is a great communicator!   Good access to transport to Dublin Centre.  

Only one note, this apartment is on the 1st floor on a very busy street and there is no air conditioning, so a bit noisy as windows must be open for air circulation.
Fantastic base for our trip to Dublin. Amazing location and amenities. Lovely flat. Would recommend

Very nice clean, stylish apartment. Taxi is about a 15 minute drive to Temple bar. Loads of amenities in the apartment and instructions were very clear and straightforward to enter the apartment. Fantastic stay for a long weekend in Dublin.
Generally, happy with the quick response from Susan, cleanliness and spacious unit.
A very lovely and secure space in the city! Susan's spot had all the amenities we needed for our trip and Susan and her team were extremely responsive. Thank you for letting us use your space!

Susan was able to accept my last minute booking request when my original Airbnb canceled on me. However, her communication was not the best when it came to check-in times. The time when booking is set at 3:00pm. She then messaged me that it would not be ready until 5:15pm, and then later on messaged me again that she made it possible for a 3:00 check-in when in fact it was not ready. I had no car and the weather was terrible, she never told me when the apartment was ready. She said I could drop my luggage off but never got in contact with the cleaners to let me in. There were also broken things throughout the apartment. The toilet and light were broken in the second bathroom. The floorboard was broken in the entrance to the master bedroom. The carpet in the living room was dirty and one of the sofa beds was broken. However, the rest of the apartment was very clean and it was in a nice location.
Had a great stay here check in was quick and easy with a spacious and well set out living area. Good location just a short ride to the Centre of all the bars and restaurants.
Spacious, clean apartment about a 40min walk from central areas.

Susans place was very clean and all amenities were just as described. Check in was easy and the place is a quick walk to Guinness, Jameson, Kilmainham Gaol and Phoenix Park. Its not right downtown, but a very quick taxi ride. Susan was very responsive to all of my emails. We had a great stay!

Really nice apartment, above my expectations.
The automatic check in and check out was really fast and easy.
The flat big and clean.
The only less positive thing was the noise from the street and the walking distance from the center (25 minutes) but there are buses and taxi. I would come back.
Super helpful and accommodating. Location is great and easy to walk to all the hot spots in Dublin.
Kiran was very hospitable and explained to us everything that we needed to know. Very cosy and comfortable home. Highly recommend

Kieran was an amazing host. This was our first time using an Airbnb and it will not be the last after our experience! We were made to feel super welcome, the place was spotless with extra lovely touches, the bed was extremely comfy, Kieran recommended best places to go and how to get there. Staying at Kierans definitely added to our brilliant trip away!

A+ 
Previous reviews were on point. Great host, room, location. Highly recommend for a stay in Dublin!
Had a terrific stay for my first Airbnb trip. Can see why Kieran is rated as a super host. Back there tomorrow!
Great place to stay
Everything was awesome and I would highly recommended his Airbnb.
Comfortable place within walking distance to great restaurants, nightlife, and tourist attractions.  Also, super easy to get to and from using the airport Airlink Express bus.
Another great stay at Kierans. Will book again if I can find availability!
Fantastic comfortable room in a great location and Kieran is a wonderfully accommodating host. Highly recommended.

Highly recommend this gem in Dublin. In a quiet neighborhood that is walkable to anything you want to see and do. Kieran is a perfect host and the accommodations are very comfortable. Definitely where Ill stay whenever Im back in town!
Kieran is a great guy and clearly takes hosting very seriously. The room was immaculate and had lots of nice little touches. He gave us good pointers for getting the most of a short stay in Dublin.

Kieran made our visit to Dublin a rousing success. Our plane arrived early, and he was not only accommodating in letting us drop off our bags, but was there with a map and tons of great recommendations for places to go and things to do in Dublin. He steered us towards some great eateries and we had a lovely time during our four day stay. The room was perfect, full of personal touches and everything we might need, from water and glasses to a hair dryer, space to hang and store clothes, a tv with Netflix provided and even travel adapters in more than one socket so we could plug in our devices. We were over the moon. If it was warmer we would have used the garden patio area, which was cute. Breakfast was three different cereals, coffee, various teas, oj, milk, bread (with several jams and Nutella available) and fruit. Honestly, if we had been able to stay an extra day we would have just to enjoy the home away from home vibe. Spotless bathroom and plenty of towels and a comfy bed rounded out the great experience. He was generous as a host in every way. Would definitely stay here again if in Dublin, without a doubt.
Great location,and superb host,Kieran is a very knowledgeable guy and was able to point me to a great Vegan restaurent nearby...amazing food

Very nice place to stay in Dublin. Kieran is a great host. His spotless two bedroom flat is a 10-15 min walk away from the Temple Bar area. When I was here Kieran had to travel elsewhere so had the flat to myself from the day after I checked in. Kieran has plenty of local info and was happy to chat about Dublin, sights etc. A simple non cooked breakfast was also available every day as well as use of the kitchen for teas and coffee. If I were to visit Dublin again I would be more than happy to stay at Kierans place again
Kieran is a great host, willing to help you get the most out of your stay. The location is great- easy walking distance to so many sights. Loved my stay!

My stay at Kieran's was lovely and easy. Accommodations as advertised - comfortable, quiet room, great neighborhood, and excellent hospitality. Kieran gave me some great tips for activities based on my interests. He also knew that I had an early morning trip to the airport, and had generous light breakfast options waiting for me - much appreciated! I'd be very happy to stay here again on a return trip.

Kierans place is fantastic for those looking for a place in Dublin! Very clean, great location, and Kieran provides lots of recommendations. Easy check in and check out. A great experience - I would highly recommend.

5 Stars all around, for everything at Kieran's residence. 
My girlfriend and I were returning to Dublin after a week of traveling through Ireland, and we stayed at Kieran's place. We were already excited to book his spot weeks ahead of time, but so pleasantly surprised at how awesome our experience was. 

Easy place to find, with an actual address (a lot of places in Ireland do not have an address believe it or not). Kieran is hyper responsive to all communications and provided three different ways to reach his home: Taxi, public transportation, and train even. Talk about above and beyond. 

His location is a 10 min walk to Temple Bar Square, and even when you walk around the corner, there are a ton of restaurants and pubs to enjoy. The residence itself is very cozy, stylish, and 100% sparkling clean. We were provided a comfortable bed, bath robes, water and glasses in our rooms, snacks, and a full selection for breakfast in the morning. It was truly a home away from home. Kieran has Netflix set up in the bedroom and we could sign in in the living room if we wanted too. 

Also, he is a wealth of knowledge for the city so you can ask him anything and he is very helpful with recommendations. When we visit Dublin again, we are 1000% booking with Kieran if he has availability.

Kierans place is situated perfectly to explore the city. He was a great host and thoughtful gifting us an Easter egg on Easter Sunday at breakfast was a very nice touch. Would definitely recommend and book again

Kieran's place is immaculately clean with great access to Dublin highlights. I so appreciate the lengths he went to make our stay as easy as possible, especially in the form of directions from the airport to his home, as well as numerous photo map files of his specific area. Thanks Kieran for your wonderful hospitality!

Kieran is a lovely host.  Helpful with local tips, advice, and recommendations.  His home is clean,  quiet, and very handy to all that Dublin offers. His room is comfortable,  clean, and the garden a refreshing and respite from the busyness of Dublin. I highly recommend this host and accommodation.  Tops!

Keiran was a great host, very welcoming and helpful, always willing to answer any questions. The room was lovely, the bed comfortable and breakfast, set out each morning, was a lovely and unexpected bonus. Location was perfect, quiet but walking distance from the beautiful St Stephen's  Green and all sights. Thank you Keiran for a lovely stay. I highly recommend it

it's a very nice place to stay in the city center.
It's so quiet that you feel great.
Kieran is very respectful and available when you need informations.
I absolutely recommend.
Perfect location & super friendly host! The bedroom and bathroom are very clean! Breakfast is okay!

Kierans room is spacious, comfortable and clean. My partner and I had stayed in Temple Bar the week before but much preferred this area due to access to local bars and cafes for breakfast. A two minute walk to the bus stop to make our way to the airport. Kieran was up for a chat or to leave us be when required. The bathroom had a nice shower that had flowing hot water. Stay here if you want to be a little off the beaten track but close to the city centre.

Kieran's place was one of the best decisions we made on our trip. His location is perfect for downtown experiences, and it was walking distance to all our favorite pubs, restaurants, and attractions. The accommodations were truly hotel grade - Kieran's little touches like chocolates and chilled water and breakfast set out each morning were above and beyond expectations. He has a collection of maps of the city and various resources for you to use, and he's full of amazing suggestions, recommendations, and local neighborhood history.  The bedroom was spotless and comfortable, and Kieran even hooked up guest access to Netflix on the TV in the room. You have access to a back patio that gets fantastic morning sunlight as well. We would stay with Kieran again in a heartbeat.

Great host, great location. Quiet street around the corner from great restaurants, pubs, bus line. Kieran was an outstanding and thoughtful host - offering some breakfast choices, including gluten free. Apartment clean as a whistle. Would recommend without any reservation.

Cozy little home in a great location.  We were able to walk to everywhere we went downtown.  Kieran is very welcoming and provides breakfast food in the morning.  My mom and I had great visit to Dublin staying here.  Thanks Kieran!

Had an awesome stay with Kieran! The apartment is beautiful, spotless, and had more than enough space for 2 people. Kieran himself is a super accommodating, hospitable, and communicative host that made us feel at home right away. The local travel/transportation tips and complimentary breakfast in the morning really set him apart as a host, as well. Would absolutely recommend staying here! Thanks for a great stay!
Amazing location near cafes and restaurants and St Stephens Green. Kieran is a great host and the room is quite comfortable.
Loved the space and location,  so nice and convenient, I was truly shocked and blessed.
Perfect place to be on Dublin town. Thanks to kieran

Great place to stay to visit Dublin. Temple Bar area and city center are an easy 15 to 20 minute walk away. The room has a nice sitting area on the outside that was nice to use in the evening. The bed is firm but comfortable.  The shower is hot. Kieran was extremely helpful during our stay, even ordering us a taxi on the day of our departure. Breakfast was great and helped get our day started. Kieran is a great host and very communicative and helpful. Highly recommend his place to stay in Dublin.
Great place. Keiran is a very helpful guy. Thanks for hosting me. Would definitely love to be back sometime.

Great location, close enough to everything. Room was spotless with nice touches like water, chocolate mints, netflix and lonely planet travel guides for dublin. Also breakfast laid out every day was a lovely touch. Your privacy is respected massively with sometimes forgetting kieran was even there! But he was always at hand to answer any questions regarding tourist information. Would definitely return again.
Great location, very comfortable, great communication. Kieran was very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend his place to anyone wanting to be in the downtown Dublin area!
Kieran's place is clean, friendly and within walking distance to all the attractions.
Its was a great place to stay. Super close to everything that you want to see. Thanks Kieran
Thanks Kieran, great location to city Centre, very clean and comfortable, very enjoyable stay.
Very comfortable place with private patio outside your bedroom door.

Kieran was an outstanding host. The amenities and the details he put into the accommodation were very thoughtful, from the water and chocolates he left for us in the room to the lotions and shampoo provided in the bathroom. He had a simple but beautiful breakfast spread for us in the morning as well. The location was great and his place was spotless! I would definitely recommend staying here!

Kieran's place is filled with books and music with everything neat and tidy.  It is stylish in a reserved way.  By that, I mean the apartment does not hit you in the face with trendiness but presents the care on the part of the owner.  Once you get the hang of Dublin -- which is not an easy city to find one's way around -- you realize that Kieran lives closer to the center of things than you might guess from looking at a map.  A tram runs just two blocks away that will take you to O'Connell street with a stop in front of the General Post Office.

He offers a comfortable room with plenty of storage and access to small patio, should you like to spend time outside at breakfast or reading maps.  He also provides a simple breakfast of coffee or tea, juice and milk, with bread for toasting as well as cereal.  

Kieran seems to know every bit of Dublin.  He is a good source of information.  However, he works out of his home and respecting his time is the guest's responsibility.  The bathroom is shared.
Kieran is a great and super friendly host  I felt well al the time. The room is nice and comfortable. I had everything I needed. Will come again. Thank you very much. All the best

Kieran was a great host. He made sure I had everything I needed and was helpful in directing towards where I needed to go to get to the airport the next morning. Very comfortable accomadation. Would recommend.

Kieran was my first host in Dublin, and I couldnt have made a better choice. I was exhausted from an overnight flight and the comfortable bedroom was very quiet and peaceful. Kieran offered good suggestions for hearing traditional pub music and put out a good breakfast as well. The small patio adjacent to the bedroom provided fresh air and a relaxing breeze.

It was my first time traveling solo out of the country and Kieran made my stay a warm, hospitable experience. Hes a down to earth guy that is easy to get on with. From his helpful tips to the lovely gesture of chocolates and water by your bedside upon arrival, I would highly recommend his place! 
If you are a music lover you will be in good company with Kieran, and all great music pubs are in walking distance from his place. 
If I am ever back, I plan on staying there again!

Kieran is a really nice guy and his accomodation is really awesome. It's sparkling clean and he has thought of every detail. The breakfast table was already prepared every morning. And most important, the location is great, all Dublin hot spots are in walking distance and you feel totally safe in the area. I  would highly recommend this place.

Incredible location in Dublin!  Close to the Guinness Factory and great restaurants. The bed was comfortable, excellent linens and Kieran was accommodating to let us drop off our belongings early. Very happy with our stay in Dublin! Thanks so much Kieran!

Kieran was a wonderful host, providing us with a delicious breakfast everyday, invigorating coffee, and tailored local tips. The location is perfect for exploring Dublin and we will definitely return!
Central location. Host very friendly and space neat and clean.  Would recommend.
Excellent place and Kieran is great guy, very kind and considerate! Thanks a million!

Kieran was so helpful with local info and directions and advice ... nice touch offering breakfast ( not a full Irish I might add ) lol , great base for local pubs and only about 10 mins walk from temple bar area , overall great host , location

Kieran is an excellent host. He gave me an excellent overview of Dublin with useful advice. His location is excellent and the place is very comfortable. I strongly recommend his place for a trip to Dublin.
Great host and location! Located in a quiet neighbourhood and a walkable distance to many tourist attraction! 10/10 would recommend kierans place when visiting Dublin
Kieran is a great host, very thoughtful and helpful. His home is very comfortable in a fabulous location and the breakfast is lovely

Kierans place was spotless, roomy & comfortable. He provided helpful tips on local attractions, especially the local music & writing venues. We enjoyed thoughtful extras like lovely thick towels, choccies & helping us to orientate Our Dublin travels. We had a great stay. The room was private & had everything we needed in a fab location: just around the corner from all central attractions, including a good variety of restaurants, parks and transport. Kieran helped make our stay in Dublin much more authentic and interesting. Thanks mate. We highly recommend your place.

Had a great stay over at Kieran's place, great hospitality with water on the bedside and breakfast standing ready for you in the morning. And he was kind enough to tell me where to go for good pubs and showed me on the map how to go there. Highly recommended to stay here also because if it's just a 5/10min walk to the city centre.

Kieran's place was clean and quiet - a great place to stay close to many restaurants and a short walk to the Temple Bar area. The breakfast in the morning is a nice touch when you need to head out early and don't want to eat breakfast out. If you are staying in Dublin we would definitely recommend staying with Kieran!

Kieran's room is very neat and a lovely quiet place to stay. Kieran was really friendly and helpful and provided really useful tips on the fun things to do in Dublin. The house is very close to all the wonderful sights and pubs that Dublin has to offer.

This room is in a ground level apartment no more than a 15 minute walk from everything in the Temple Bar/Trinity College/St. Stephens Green area, a perfect location on a quiet side street but handy to bus and tram connections too.  it is equipped with extra towels, bathrobes (the shared bath is down the hall), and ample electric outlets with adapters for different styles of plug.  Abundant closet space and doors opening to an outside patio with table and chairs added to the charm.  Each morning the table was set for breakfast with fruit, cereal, breads, coffee, toaster, and in the refrigerator yogurt, butter, milk, everything we like.  The bed was very comfortable.  We saw the host only occasionally, since he tended to work nights, but our interactions were friendly and cordial, and he was willing to answer all our questions and offer advice on how to navigate Dublin.

Kieran's home is lovely and in such a great location.  Kieran was a wonderful host and thoughtful in ensuring visitors feel comfortable in his home.  Appreciated his tips on sites to see and some places to visit that locals frequent.  and he arranged brilliant weather during our two days in Dublin!
Great hospitality, great craic. Full of info re what to do/see. Knows Dublin to the last street.
The cleanest place Ive ever stayed. And Kierans so helpful if youre new to the area. When we first got there he took out a map and showed us all the places to hit up. Hes got my recommendation!
Kieran is an outstanding host, and his place is in a perfect location for anyone hoping to explore Dublin.
Great room, great location, super host!
Kierans place is a perfect home base for exploring Dublin. Perfect location, great value, and overall a comfortable and memorable stay!

Kieran was very helpful with directions and recommendations in Dublin. His place is at a great location just around the corner from the bustling city. Great restaurants and sights that are quick and easy to get to.

Kieran is a great host with good suggestions for visiting Dublin and a very friendly way of communication. His apartment is very clean and neat, located in a quiet side street just off of an area with lots of restaurants and very good food. We will definitely return, when ever we return to Dublin and Kieran has the room available. Absolutely recommendable!

Great breakfast
Friendly host
You feel like you have the flat to yourself
Amazing location
Room homely and stylish 
Clean
Great value for money

We had a wonderful time at Kieran's place. The location is excellent for walking around the city, with some live music pubs around the corner, also close to restaurants, etc. Kieran was very hospitable and friendly, giving us tips and answering questions. The room had everything we needed and we enjoyed the outdoor space on a sunny day. Definitely recommend!

After check in, Kieran was gracious enough to spend some time marking out various points of interest onto a map of Dublin. He also left a breakfast spread, which was a very considerate touch. The room itself was both clean and comfortable.

In het hart van Dublin mooie kamer.Ontbijt is goed met aardig wat keuze.
Wij  (ik samen met mijn dochter van 11)hebben genoten van Dublin.Kieran geeft goed advies.
Book with Kieran - if he has availability! The apartment is close to EVERYTHING! Kieran is lovely and super helpful.
Very convenient location close to the centre, very clean and quiet room and a friendly and helpful host. For an excellent inexpensive stay, I recommend Kieran's place. Alan Taylor, County Cork.

Very well located, comfortable and warm accommodation which will provide for all your needs during your stay in lively Dublin. Tons of food joints very close by will allow you to eat around the world, and still walk home to your bed. Good transport links too, handy for tram and bus lines, including the airport express bus. Kieran works from home, often late at night, but don't worry, he's neither a road constructor or a drummer so you won't hear a peep from him. If his work load is not too onerous, then he'll be happy to have a cuppa with you and share his deep knowledge of a city he loves, but recognises has its faults e.g high prices and gentrification. He's spot on with pubs, and we strongly suggest you interrogate him about the local music scene. A comfy bed and a more than adequate breakfast complete the deal at this excellent Airbnb.

Kieran's place was very beautifully done and sparkling clean. It was exactly the same as in pictures.
As mentioned, both the days we woke up to a good continental breakfast. 
Kieran was really warm and welcoming!
Would definitely highly recommend!

Stayed at Kierans for my weekend in Dublin, and it was perfect. The place is in the City Centre and is within walking distance of a good amount of the sights. The room was clean and well kept. 

Kieran was extremely friendly and hospitable and had a lot of good recommendations for places to go around the city. Would definitely recommend his place to anyone looking for a clean and affordable stay in Dublin!

Great place, well located, clean and safe. Kieran was a fantastic host, he was always available, gave us recommendations of places to visit, eat and drink. 

Totally recommend his place.
A really nice chap, welcoming and deeply hospitable. Good chat if you want it but perfectly happy to leave you to be if you prefer that too.
The host canceled this reservation 334 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great house for large groups

Beautiful, historic townhome in Drumcondra. Lots of rooms. Large living room, kitchen patio and four bedrooms. 

Location is  close enough to all the Dublin sites with short bus/taxis to the town center. Lots of great restaurants and even the largest stadium were walking distance away.

Owner was very hospitable and gave a terrific walk through. My family had a great time!

Alojamiento cercano al aeropuerto,hay una parada de bus en la puerta( nosotros cogimos un taxi para 8 pot 16‚Ç¨).  Al centro tambien fuimos en taxi por 20‚Ç¨ los 8. La casa es amplia,camas sufivientes paralos 8. No echamos en falta nadamas que el secador,y enseguida el padre de Lorcan no lo trajo. Tanto el menaje de cocina, como sabanas y toallas estan muy usados y desgastados. La casa no esta mal pero le haria falta algo mas de limpieza. Las posibles deficiencias de la casa se suplen por la amabilidad y predisposicionde Lorcan y su padre.
The host canceled this reservation 164 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Lorcan and Joe were very accommodating. Location is great. Not to far out of town but close to lots of restaurants and bars etc. walk to Botanic Gardens and easy bus or walk to city.
Would 100% stay again. Very kind host and great location.

This is probably the best airbnb I have ever stayed in. The kitchen has a good selection of pots, pans, and utensils. There's a clothesline in the back garden that was incredibly useful. The house was spotlessly clean, enormous, and very comfortable for my party of six. Best of all, theres a bus stop pretty much right outside the house, so it's very easy to get down into Dublin using public transit. If I ever make it back to Ireland again, I hope this place will still be available!

The unit was very clean and had plenty of rooms to accommodate my family.  Good location to nearby bus lines.  
I flew in at a very early hour and Lorcan was able to leave me a key so we did not have to wait. This was very helpful.
great place, great safe location for parking. ideal for what i was looking for, close to all amenities,  trains buses etc, pubs and restaurants.
Really good location in frequent bus route and taxi back from temple bar was only ‚Ç¨14. Everything clean and tidy, would recommend!
Great place! Would stay again.
Great place to stay!
Isa was a great host!  It wasnt too far from the city center and it was easy to find!
Good price for the apartment. Fine for a weekend trip.
What a cute place right near the Guinness storehouse! We had an easy checkin and parking right in front of the building. I would definitely recommend staying here!
Good place and responsive host. A bit out of the city center and quite small if you are 5 and have lots of luggage.

Great location!  I was pretty much 30 minutes away (walking) from all the places I wanted to see.  The bus stop is literally out front and was pretty easy to use and navigate...after a bit lol.  Very friendly greeting from Isla's daughter upon arrival...3 hours late.  My plane got delayed and it was still a pleasant arrival.   Would definitely recommend!!
Easy check in, easy check out. Easy walk to the tram. Had a great stay.

Convenient location, a Tesco nearby, good transport links (and walkable to the city centre as long as you don't have too much luggage!!), excellent communication with the host before and during our stay - and a lovely apartment!  All good :)
The appartment was okay. It was nearby the tram station and it was very quiet. We had all what we need, check in and communication was very good.
Very nice place with a very good host!

Isa does a good job! Good communication and provides everything necessary. This unit is close to light rail (red line) that takes you right to the center of Dublin. Its inexpensive and easy to ride with all day and weekly passes available.
It was nice place

Isa's place in Dublin is perfect for staying close enough to the city that everything is accessable but also outside of the bustle of the downtown. The apartment was sparkling clean and there were all kinds of configurable beds for any sort of stay. 5 stars all across the board!

Great place in Dublin, only a 30 minute walk from the Guinness Storehouse, or if you dont want to walk its a really short drive. The nearby area is less touristy so you can expect cheaper food prices compared in and around Temple Bar Area. The place is nice and comfortable and was perfectly clean when we arrived.

Isas flat was spotlessly clean and well equipped. Bed was very comfortable. We were allowed to check in early by isas daughter which was much appreciated. A little  distance from city centre but very close to tram stop. Great stay, thank you.
Good location and easy to find.
Perfect for a weekend stay
Clean and comfortable
Amazingly clean place located near a bus stop. Easy check-in and very easy to find.
Highly recommended, will be coming back
Great location, it was easy to get around Dublin! Check in was nice and easy.
The place is nice, clean and has everything you need.  It is located in a good spot to be able get wherever you want in Dublin.
Very clean apartment conveniently located, check in experience was easy and host was quick to reply to messages. Would recommend and use again.
Great stopover aftera long flight before beginning our ireland tour. Had everything you need and super clean. Great host who let us in early for a nap after our flight.

Isas place is ideal for anyone staying in Dublin. Close to the city itself (less than a 30 min walk, and a bus stop is less than a minute from her place), and the ability to privately park is an amazing value.

Good value for entire flat, clean and comfortable.
The location of the flat is handy for transfer to the city centre, however I wouldn't recommend bringing children or those of a nervous disposition as the locals can be a bit intimidating

Isa is the worst host I've ever dealt with. She was unresponsive, didn't honor our agreement, gives out the wrong phone number that a guy named Jonathan answered and it apparently happens a lot because he tried giving out a different phone number for her that doesn't exist. She ruined my vacation to Ireland, WOULDN'T RECOMMEND!

Cute apartment and perfect for spending the day touring. Several taxi drivers did mention we are in a rough area, especially after dark. We kept that in the back of heads, but really had no issues. Overall, this place is close to a lot with public transport within 10 mins walk.

The apartment was just as shown in the pictures. Its small but has everything you need, and the heaters were very efficient - important in the chilly weather! We heard only minimal noise from neighbors and it was otherwise quiet. Isa was very flexible with us, letting us check in early after a morning flight arrival, which we really appreciated. Free, on site parking is a great benefit in the city location. Everything you want to see in Dublin is easily accessible!

Matches the pictures exactly and was completely fine but you may be able to hear people in other flats if they're being particularly noisy - I personally didn't but my friend said they did. Great communication from Isa as well! Easy to find and perfect if you just need somewhere to rest your head for a night

Appartamento piccolo ma con tutto il necessario 
A poche fermate del bus dal centro 
Direi ok
Clean place. Isa responded quickly if I had any questions.
Okay place for short stay. Thanks for your kind hospitality

A comfortable ground floor apt. Big bed and a futon, both very comfortable. Heater works great. Amenities are very nice and the neighborhood is nice too. A comfortable place to crash for a night or two.
Would highly recommend to a friend

The location was what we expected and was convenient for our stay.  There were not towels provided the first day which was a big inconvenience.  

For anyone looking for a space to accommodate more than two people, DO NOT book this place.  The listing says it can handle six people and has four beds.  It really has one smallish bed, a futon, and two chairs.  It might comfortably accommodate 2-3 people.

I would not recommend this place especially for the price she charges. The heater didnt work. It smelled like something died because water was sitting in the washer and smellled awful. I paid $133 for a place that I thought would be cozy but it was uncomfortable and to expensive for the tiny space. Isa is very sweet as a person so this has nothing to do with her as a person. Just, if you have to stay there and absolutely dont have any other option then maybe consider it. Just a fair warning though...
A nice little flat close to public transport, a tesco and some good take away food.
Isa was helpful and quick to respond. Very handy to have free parking in Dublin as this often has an added cost. Handy location. Thanks

Niet geheel geschikt voor 6 personen; kleine badkamer, weinig ruimte aan eetbar. Echter wel genoeg slaapplaatsen. Slaapplek moet opgeborgen worden als men gebruik wil maken van de slaapbank om op te zitten. Prijs/kwaliteitverhouding is goed.
Good value. Free parking a plus.
Smaller than expected.
Broken window just inside front door makes the place feel rundown.  We parked where Isa suggested in front (off street) but another renter in the building said that was illegal.
Would recommend- thanks!
Lovely comfortable apartment. Very handy for visiting the Guinness Storehouse and a nice quiet area. The owner's communication is fantastic

A perfectly nice place.... City trip as couple for 3 nights . Suited our needs, well-priced, we didn't spend much time at all at the apartment, but used it as a base for exploring Dublin. We bought the DoDublin 72h transportation card and loved how easy it was to take a bus into town and spare our feet the extra mile it would have taken to walk. Not fancy, nothing crazy, just a nice place to be. I read some reviews about the smell, it certainly had a musty feeling, but it didn't bother us at all (I can't stand too much perfume)...

Spent two nights while visiting Dublin. Was a good place to lay our heads at night. If youll be in Dublin for a short trip and just need a place to go to and from it will get the job done. Most things accessible by foot but called a cab for a couple!

Serviceable, cute flat in the Rialto neighborhood of Dublin. We were using it as a one night stay in between arriving in Dublin and heading to County Clare. Walking distance from the Heuston train station, we walked on arrival and took a taxi on departure as we had heavy packs. We didnt have hardly anytime for this particular stay, but it was an easy walk to St. Patricks Cathedral so we were able to do just a little bit of sightseeing. Quiet at night and clean.
Clean & tidy close to the city centre but in a quiet location

The apartment was very small but slept 5 of us including fold down sofas. It was clean. There was parking at the front which was a bonus for us. The location was pretty handy- 5 minute walk to the tram stop, a bus stop right outside the door. Is a brisk 10-15 minute walk to the Guiness Storehouse

We ( family of 4 adults) stayed for one evening on a travel lay over. Isa's place was a good value. It's not fancy, but solid and clean. We were quite comfortable. We made the half hour walk to the Grafton St. Area. There appeared to be good access to the public transport to get into more tourist spots without walking.
Clean and central. Walking distance to downtown.
Dublin is ridiculously expensive. Surely something will have to give soon.

Central to city. Convenient.
Would suit 4 people vs 5.
We were happy with the apartment. Thanks Isa for all information that you provided and for your responsiveness.

This apartment is perfect for a short stay to explore Dublin. Its in the up and coming Dolphins Barn area with convenience stores a 5 minute walk away. Bus stop to the City centre is right outside and the tram stop is a short walk away. Small, modern property which is safe and secure. No frills but would highly recommend.
The flat is secure with parking and in good proximity to bus stop and city.

Better bedding ie: pillows / covers bit dated. 

The hand towel rail in the bathroom fell off onto my bare toe, no serious damage done but was painful. It was only then I noticed it was been held together with cello-tape. 

Bed comfort : 6.5/10
Sofa bed: 4/10 
Two single sofa beds :2/10 but I could personally sleep on them. 

The host was very informative & the apartment was very clean. Great location with parking behind gates.
Very good

This was a fine place to stay for one night, but it was not very comfortable at all. There were also very loud people in the building, which isn't really in their control, but it was still annoying. It smelled very damp inside and just generally felt not so great to stay there. It was nice because it was easy to get to and close to the Guinness Storehouse (and surrounding things).
We loved it !

Posizione un po periferica ma fermata autobus subito fuori casa. Ampio parcheggio privato nel giardinetto antistante. Spazi curati e puliti, wifi gratuita e persino adattatori per le prese della corrente europee.
Soddisfattissimo.
Lovely place, very close to the tram. Bit small but perfectly cozy, wonderful place to be if youre visiting Dublin.

Isa's place is well-situated, close to transport links in the city. Straightforward and streamlined check-in, with very fast replies to any queries. A simple set-up, but plenty of space, and the main sofa-bed is huge.
The apartment was very clean, spacious, and had good internet connectivity.
Good location, nice amenities
Clean, warm, and good location for tram to city centre.
Very basic, the location saves it.
Recommended. Easy travel by tram or 40 minute walk to city centre.
Cosy flat with plenty of beds for you and your squad. Buses to town stop right at the front gate.

Very good communications, reliable, easy. Accommodation is decent, 5 minutes to tram stop, 40 minute walk to Parnell Street so commute into the centre is manageable.
I would use this apartment again.

Gerry was really nice. He welcomed us, showed us the apartment and gave us a few tips to make our trip better and easier. Would highly recommend, even though it may seem like the apartment is a bit far away, but its totally worth it plus the bus line number 16 takes you directly from the apartment to the airport and viceversa. We had a wonderful time!
Very nice place, you get what you pay, supermarkets near and bus to the city centre 5*
Fit what we needed-he gave us excellent tips on parking and what was in the area.
Great place for 1-2 people, Gerry had great directions to the place and good local tips.
Great location, excellent public transit connections to all over Dublin. Nice space, and excellently supplied kitchen. Highly recommended.
Nice little place, minutes from DHC shul.
Great place! Perfect location! Easy to navigate! Comfortable little flat perfect for a week trip!
Great location, Gerry replied back quickly and the place was very clean. I would stay there again 100%. Bus stops were super close and the neighborhood had everything we needed.

Gerry's place is great! It's only five minutes from the bus stop and Gerry gave really detailed instructions on how to use transit to get to the flat, which was super helpful. The neighbourhood is absolutely lovely. Small amount of noise from the neighbours, but nothing out of the ordinary, and overnight was quiet.
The quality of the room is enough to stay alone. I don't recommend this room for a couple. The price is reasonable, but Dublin downtown is far from the place.

The apartment is comfortable and near enough to downtown  to easily navigate. Gerry was always quick to respond, and we got some great local tips and useful information. The neighborhood was quiet and picturesque, and the apartment itself is perfectly comfortable.

First of all Dublin and Ireland as a whole we enjoyed immensely. It is beautiful, charming, quaint, and vibrant all at once. Gerry's flat is out of the city a block away from the bus into downtown. There are awesome restaurants closeby. Definitely check out the The Lovely Food Company. The shower was hot and torrential. There is a washer and dryer on site. The bed was comfortable as well. My wife and I would stay here again for sure.
Lovely location! One bus ride to city center and the restaurants nearby have amazing food and coffee! The walls are a bit thin, so just keep that in mind, but it's otherwise a great stay!
Nice place.
The room is very well located and Lina was a very nice host, helped us with everything we needed!
The host canceled this reservation 9 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
We had a really bad time with Lina... but thanks to Airbnb we could leave the place and find something better. Thanks to the costumer service from Airbnb ‚ô•Ô∏è we would never ever recommend Lina.

The room was clean and ready to use. Easy to check-in and out with no problem. I would recommend people to stay as long as it is a couple, not three people. There are two rooms available and some of the pictures may be from the room you don't stay in. Keeping in mind it was a really small space it was clean, it is in a really great location especially for anyone that wants be close or plans on moving around the city by public transport since it is a 10 minute walk to Heuston station and a 5 minute walk to the tram stop that takes you to Connolly train station. Buses at the bottom of the street run really often too. Again, the stay was great and the place was quiet and clean but I just a heads up on the size of the space if three people are booking the space. Even though with its size the room is fully equipped which comes in really handy.
Lina was really quick and clear with instructions and answer any questions which made everything really easy.
Very nice house with good proximity to public transport
Christina is a great host, she responded to my messages quickly and she met us at the property and welcomed us. We enjoyed staying there and everything was nearby.

Christina was very helpful with check in, answering questions and responding to us. Unfortunately all of the mattresses were uncomfortable and the bathrooms didnt meet our cleanliness expectations. Overall, not what we had hoped for.

The environment of the house is clean, so you have feeling that you are in a park. It is not so closed to the center, but if you search for dynamic days and relaxing nights, that is the place. It is not such a big deal to travel to the center. And the feeling that you are at home, and have private relation, is remarkable.

Caroline and John are the best host you can get! Caroline is very welcoming and John always give good advises. The room was VERY clean and comfortable. And if you are a dog lover,  JD will be your best friend during your stay ( he can actually smile when he sees you in the morning). I will recommend this Airbnb to my friends!

We got a great night's sleep here! The beds were so comfy, the shower was clean and refreshing, and  the home was welcoming. Our hosts, John and Caroline, were helpful and a delight to chat with! Of all the Airbnbs I've stayed at this has been the most welcoming and overall the best experience I've had so far. The location is a bit out of the city of Dublin but it is close to a bus line that brings you straight to the city centre(30 min ride). John also offered to bring us to the airport for a fee and it was a great extra service they provided to us. They truly went above and beyond to make our holiday stress free. I highly recommend staying here!

We has arrived from Dublin some days ago. Carolines home is  a great location for visiting Dublin. The room was very nice, cosy, clean.  Caroline and John are great hosts. We had a great time and good dialogues with Caroline and John. Of course we would recommend them! We would like to come back someday. 
Thank you for your hospitality!

Caroline and John were absolutely lovely hosts! Their home was beautiful and comfortable while still being close by to the city making traveling back and forth a breeze. John had a lot of interesting stories and information about places to go in Dublin and just all around made my first time traveling alone feel extremely easy! I highly recommend them as hosts for everyone!
It is a bright, comfortable and very clean house, we enjoyed talking with the owners
Caroline and John are a lovely couple! The house is beautiful, clean and in a very nice area! Their dog has been a friend! Highly recommend!!

We really enjoyed our stay with Caroline and John. We're definitely coming back if we have the possibilty. It was really clean, we could make tee and coffee whenever we wanted and John gave us many tips for our short trip. We also had great conservations with them. We totally recommend them.
I stayed for a week and really enjoyed my stay, lovely house - sparkling clean. Hosts are great. Would highly recommend.

First off, you will receive amazing hospitality from both John and Caroline. They make you feel very welcome and at home. John is very knowledgeable about the area and on things to do and places to go to. The room was great! It was very clean and plenty of room. The bathroom was also very clean. The public transportation is very easy to access from their home to get around. Highly recommend staying with them for either a short or long stay. Their location is beautiful, quite and yet still close to the city. We will be staying with them again when we make it back to Ireland.
