Great location..20 minute walk to a all the action through nice neighborhood and some great shopping.  Bus frim airport stops very nearby.    Room very clean with all the necessities.   Continental breakfast was just enough.
Super Lage um Dublin zu erkunden

Communication with Conj was polite, easy and swift.
We were greeted and let in personally.

We liked the location very much. It is just a short walk to pubs, parks, shops and the city center. The room itself is a bit tiny if you are travelling with three persons, but it worked well. It has to be said, that you should consider bringing your ear plugs, because the wooden ceilings of these old buildings transport sound of others quite well.

I recommend this particular room to guests who are very familiar with each other, because there is some sort of open "window" above the door between bathrom and bedroom, which cannot be closed and therefore makes it difficult to maintain some privacy inside the bathroom.
The room was cozy, and on the first floor. The small garden in front of the house was just outside our window which was nice. Good location on a quiet street.
Good breakfast; walking distance to city centre, quiet street
Un poco apartado del centro, pero todo muy bien.
Location was excellent.
actually bigger than I expect, clean bedding. Near to translink 757 to airport.
Con's place was in a perfect location and such great value! We had a great time there
Great location, lovely hosts would recommend, if we stay over in Dublin next time we are across, we will be staying here.
Es war sehr sauber bei Conj! Man kann von hier ins Zentrum laufen und wohnt trotzdem ziemlich ruhig.
Lovely stay. Great value for money, very clean and good location. Conj very good at organising taxis etc. Would stay again for sure
Conj very helpful. Allowed us  check I early. Great location, easy to walk into the centre of Dublin. Would definitely stay again.
Great location and Accomodation is perfect
Great location...walking distance to the main shopping areas....
Basic accommodations. No frills. Good location for the price and clean.

Generally a good stay.  Very simple rooms, but I saw the pictures and didnt expect more.  Good location for the price.  Host allowed us to drop bags at 7am, which was nice because we landed at 5am and could not check in until 12:30.  Beds were comfortable.  Host was not very friendly or outgoing.  Didnt like answering questions. Asked her about breakfast end time and she just pointed to a sign that I didnt see instead of just saying, 9 am.ù Rooms were very warm but I didnt dare ask how to turn off the heat. Breakfast was simple, cereal, juice, toast, and ham. Plenty for me, but may not be so for others.  Rooms are a bit noisy to each other, but no street noise, so that was great. Overall, average stay, good price, simple accommodation.
Value for money and great location with bus stop at the end of the road
Very basic room, good value for Dublin, safe location to walk to, good restaurants and airline bus transportation easy 10 min walk
Wonderful place. Very clean. Quiet and restful. Kind hosts.
Great location, Spotless room, Great service
Best Place to explore the city. The city is just a few minutes walk away. The rooms are clean and nice. The breakfast ist very good an Conj is so friendly. I will come back! Thank you so much!

It's located very well (about 5 mins. walk from the Airlink bus stop, about 20 mins. walk to Temple Bar). Rooms were clean. Good breakfast. Tea & coffer facilities in your room, as well as hairdreyer.
Great place, very helpful hosts, very good breakfast. Would stay again.
Our room was very comfortable and clean. And extremely quiet. Very happy with our experience.
Great!

We were in town to run the Dublin Half Marathon, and only stayed for one night. The location was ideal for us for the start line but also only a short walk to the centre and some great touristy spots. The room was exactly what we were after, a nice quiet spot with comfy beds to get a good night sleep before the race. Our host was lovely and very accommodating to our needs.
Conji was very helpful, room was comfortable and location was great, thanks heaps
The host canceled this reservation 15 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Twin bed room with plenty of space.Lovely simple breakfast.20 minute walk to Grafton Street.A very enjoyable 3 day stay.
Just as it should be. Will recommend it to friends and Family. Great Price and quiet to sleep.

Easy to find and within walking distance from just about everything! The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Conk was very quick to respond whenever we messaged her and was always extremely helpful. Overall it was a great stay!
Sehr nette Gastgeber , gute Lage mit Verkehrsanbindung, Zimmer sauber und ordentlich.

Room away from the center noise, within walking distance to the city's biggest attractions. People who do not like to walk can use public transport (bus stop almost by the building). The hosts served tips on how to get around the city and get to the places we choose. It is important that there was breakfast and good coffee in the morning. Shower in the room and soft towels. Hair dryer and kettle for boiling water. The room was cleaned every day. Near the building there are shops and pubs and restaurants. We spent a good time in Dublin and the surrounding area, relaxing in a tidy room.
It was really cleaned. The owner is lovely.
Great location for exploring the city. Loved coming back to a clean and cozy room in between. Conj was very hospitable and accomadating!
Clean room, nice breakfast

An absolutely wonderful host and a really lovely Airbnb! We were so impressed with how clean it was, its perfect location and the stunning value for money! Again just want to thank our host so much, he was so incredible!
Excellent location.
A greate place to stay. It is a beautiful house and Annmarie is great host. We felt very welcome. The Dart and Pubs are in short walking distance.

The house is beautiful. Annemarie and her husband are really nice host. 
I booked the night for my sister and her partner and they were delighted with their stay!
Dalkey is a very nice place to visit.

Annmarie is one of the warmest people I have across. Staying at her place for the weekend was one of the best decisions I have made. Her house is tastefully styled, she goes above and beyond to make her guests feel welcomed, and the breakfast she serves every morning is delicious. I highly recommend her and genuinely look forward to visiting again.

Annmarie is a very warm and generous host, a true super-host ‚®.
The house and surroundings are very beautiful & breakfast is excellent.
The room is very spacious & the hospitality is great, made us feel very comfortable.
We had a great time!
Excellent facilities with a wonderful host. Great stay. Recommend very highly.
Nice room and lovely breakfast in a great location.

Annmaries place is an absolute pleasure to stay in. Stunning house and gardens, walking distance from Dalkey village and a string of pubs and restaurants. Lovely walk with sweeping views  starts over the road. Beautiful breakfast, Annmarie goes above and beyond, I can highly recommend
Annmarie was a great hostess , she looked after me so well , I really enjoyed my stay .
This is a great place to stay and not far from the main village of Dalkey. Lovely large room, beautiful garden and the best homemade scones for breakfast

Annmarie and her husband are really friendly, welcoming and warm persons. Beautifull house & garden. The room we slept in and the bathroom too, were spacious. The breakfast was lovely; with fresh baked muffins, delicious! Loved the whole setting and would definitely reccomend!

Annmarie has a beautiful property and a cute dog who is sweet and friendly. The bedroom we rented was large and had two beds and its own sink in the room. The bathroom was right next door. Annmarie cooked a gorgeous continental breakfast the next morning which was quite generous and unexpected! It was delicious.

Annmarie is so welcoming and the location is great. Short stroll to Dalkey village and beside the entrance to the lovely Killiney Hill which is great for walks. The gardens around the house are also beautiful.

Annemarie's house is in a beautiful location with srunning gardens. Right near a park for lovely walks. Annemarie is friendly and warm and served an amazing breakfast (much more than I expected!) In a beautiful dining room. Highly recommended
Very sweet, homey and spacious house. A bit far from the center, around 40 minutes walk. Well equipped. Enjoyed it very much.
Great house, great landlord, perfect accommodation. thank you

This was my second visit to Annmarie and it's always a pleasure to stay.  I particularly enjoy the beautiful breakfast served with homemade scones.  And, I sleep so well in my room; wifi is great.   I know and love Dalkey and it's always a joy visiting.  Fitzpatrick's Hotel is just around the corner and nice to relax and meet friends ; and, the Killiney hill is a great walk weather permittinng.
Annmarie is very thoughtful and friendly - her scones are delicious. The accommodation is nice and in a beautiful setting within easy reach of the Aircoach, local transport and village.
Great breakfast and very fresh room

Annmarie is a lovely hostess and has a wonderfully inviting home. My husband and I came here with our 9 month old after just landing in Dublin from the States. She had a cot set up for our little one and was more than happy to have us visit. Breakfast was also wonderful.
We felt right at home in Dalkey and would love to come again.

This is why I choose Airbnb over hotels! Annmarie was the consummate host, met me at the train station and took care of my every need. Her home is both secluded and within easy 5-min walking distance to downtown and the Dart train. But wait until you see her garden! Be prepared to be amazed. I wish my husband had been with me, perhaps next time. Id welcome the chance to stay again.

Annmarie and her family have a lovely home! There is everything you need and the location is perfect. Nice bed, great fresh breakfast and walking distance to seaside and beautiful little center of Dalkey full of restaurants and bars. Thanks again for all Annmarie!

This was a great stay after a long flight to Dublin and day exploring the city. We visited with our 7 month old and Annmarie was very accommodating and pleasant. Room and bathroom were just what we needed, garden was beautiful and the breakfast she provided was excellent.

Top class location, 10 minutes walk from killiney hill, beautiful woods, a lovely cliff walk. Also very close to Dun Laoighire, lovely house, lovely gardens outside. Very Good Hosts, couldn`t have asked for anymore. Hosts were  very friendly. Beautiful breakfast, lovely surrounds
Very friendly.  Room just as expected.  The garden is amazing. Good traffic connection.I would like to come again.

Annmarie was a perfect host, and made me feel at home on my first day in Ireland. I was greeted with hugs from her adorable dog, Lucy, which was the best welcome I could have asked for. Her house is gorgeous (especially the garden), and the breakfast spread was beautiful. If you are considering Annmaries home, I cant recommend it highly enough. Thanks, Annmarie!

Annmarie's home is perfectly located if you'd like to be with easy access to Dublin yet away from the crowd which was our case. Dalkey is a beautiful village with lovely pubs and walks. Annmarie's place is very homely and her garden is stunning. Thank you we'll definitely be happy to come back.

I enjoyed to stay in the very nice house with a wonderful garden and with Annemarie, which let me felt, that I come home.
The breakfast was great, Annemarie baked every day scones and brown bread and offered orange juice and fresh fruits.
Sitting in this nice diningroom with a little music in the background was the best start in my day.
Would like to come back to this house soon!
A car is good to have because the way to the pubs and the dart is 25 min. down the hill. There is a parkingplace in the garden.
Ann Marie, made her home my home. It has cosy touches everywhere. Especially at breakfast and in Ann Marie's hospitality!
Thank you very much for your hospitality and the magnificent breakfast scones!
The house was very noisy and there was no breakfast offered. I got very little sleep on the nights I was there. Went home feeling exhausted, not exactly the relaxing stay i had been looking for.
Annmarie's is a fabulous home. The bedroom was very warm, clean and quiet.The breakfast is wonderful too.

The most amazing host. Happy to chat or leave you to your own devices. Super house and well situated close to the centre. Warm friendly greeting and superb information pack. Spacious room and very comfy bed. Will definitely stay again.
The room is lovely, light, well-decorated and homey. Everything is very clean. Aoife is friendly and very accommodating. We couldn't have asked for better hosts!
Room is accurately described. Aoife's home is on a charming and quiet residential street.  A good location to walk or bus to Dublin's many attractions. Great food nearby also!

Aoife and Carla make you feel very welcome and at home as an invited guest, not a visitor.  
Her place is well located for getting to from the airport and is only a short walk to the Heart of Dublin City.  Whilst having some great local bars and eateries that you may not want to venture to the Centre....

Aiofe's home is on a quiet street. The room and bathroom were both comfortable, clean, and pleasant, along with the rest of the home. Aiofe provided coffee, yogurts, toast, and eggs each morning. She and her family were gracious hosts. Highly recommend!
Expect a lovely host family, a charming house, an ideal location, and to have an amazing visit to Dublin!  You'll feel at home with Aoife and Clara!
11/10 stay! Would recommend to anybody looking to go to Dublin. Location is perfect. Aoife and Clara are the best. No complaints whatsoever.
Aoife and Clara are super sweet and welcoming!
Great location, great host!
Friendly, warm and helpful host with excellent rooms and short walking distance to the city. Would highly recommend!
Aoifa was an incredibly kind, helpful, and friendly host. She had great recommendations and she was super flexible when we got in a bit early.
Aoife was an amazing host, with a lovely home! Thankyou so much for having us

We stayed 4 nights & The place was perfect! Big room , clean, cozy and quiet. Independent bathroom outside the room really clean.We had also breakfast included with bread, cereals, milk, juice, yogurt, jams and other things. We arrived the first night really late because of the flight, but she still waited for us. it was easy to find and really good location, 10 minutes by walk to all the most important places. Aoife was gentle and accommodating, we felt like home. I highly recommend this place!!
All perfect- just book & enjoy

Aoifes place is centrally located and super accessible to and from all the attractions we wanted to see. She provided a ton of great recommendations of spots to check out. Her place is located within a few blocks of 3 bike share docks, which made our transportation options super cheap and easy to use. Shes also a natural host - we loved the couple of times we were able to interact. She even helped us with theatre etiquette and some Dublin slang that we didnt know when we headed out to a play. Thanks Aoife!!
We had a wonderful stay at Aiofe's home! Everything was exactly as described. Thanks a lot!
Really welcoming and warm house and host. Easy to get into city centre without the noise.
Real

Aoifes place is nicely situated about 15 min walk from Temple Bar. Its a lovely place, and the room is spacious and clean. Great place to stay, you have your own bathroom and she supplies you with some breakfast that you can cook yourself. Would defiantly go back!!
Aoife's place is just the sort of charming place  you'd want to stay at in Dublin. Very comfy bed! Most things you want to see are within walking distance.  We would definitely stay there again.
We had a great journey at Aoife, the house is beautiful and clean and close to the center of Dublin.  I highly recommend.
Absolutely perfect. Nice, clean, comfortable, stylish room; kitchen and bathroom sparkling clean, stylish and equipped with everything you could possibly need.
Great place. Spacious bedroom, very clean bathroom!! Susan and her daughter are gracious hosts. And full of information. Within walking to the center of the city. I highly recommend it.

The location is nice and we enjoyed the fact that we acquainted with Aiofe. Excellent communication and accommodation. The space is incredible. High speed wifi, separate toilet, large room, super comfy bed, lots of little snacks for breakfast to welcome you,¬† 10 min from the all main attraction. Highly recommended and would stay here again.
Aoifes place is great! Very handy for the centre of Dublin. Excellent communication before our stay and excellent hospitality during our stay- thanks Aoife!

Aoife was a wonderful host! She really made me and my sister feel welcome. Our room was lovely, and Aoife provided a booklet of extremely helpful recommendations for the area. The location was also very convenient, with multiple restaurants and stores a close walk away. ¬†We highly recommend staying here.

We loved staying with Aoife and Clara! Such a cute place outside the noise of the downtown Dublin. We could walk to most points of interest in 15-20 minutes, which was perfect for us. Aoife's hospitality was second to none, and we truly felt right at home. We would definitely stay here again in the future!

Aoife and Clara were great. They are very welcoming and Aoife is there for any question you have. Having morning Coffee and talking with Clara was fun she has some great stories. Checking in was a breeze and when we left we had early morning flight and Aoife arranged for taxi to pick us up. She provides you a nice little booklet with a lot of good information. 
Their location is perfect. For long legs(me) it is about 10-minute walk to the middle of Dublin shorter legs (my Wife) about 15 minutes. The transit system is pretty amazing (coming from someone from NYC) everywhere you turn there is a Tram, Bus or Train at your feet. We had Bus option and Tram option within 5 minute of Aoife home. We highly recommend getting the Leap card transit 1-week visitor pass ($40 euro).  Recommend getting the pass on line before you go they will mail it to you. There is also regional trains that can get you to almost and part of Ireland. One day we took Day trip to Cork. The ride was nice and you got to see a lot on the ride.
We stay in Air B&B's a lot and this is differently a must go back to. Aoife and Clara we look forward to our next trip to Ireland and see you guys. Cheers Brian & Illiam
The location is prime and Aoife is a great host! It was a spectacular stay with great amenities and many great recommendations from her and Clara! Would love to stay here next time around (:
Aofie's place was incredibly cozy, we really enjoyed our stay. Aoife was amazing at referring us plenty places around town to eat and visit. Would very highly recommend a stay here.

Aoifes place is located right near a bus stop which meant traversing around Dublin was made easy.  Her neighborhood is quiet.  Aoifes home is very organized and we loved the towel warmer in our bathroom.  She provides a nice array of breakfast items.  The bed was comfortable and sleeping was easy. We  enjoyed chatting with Aoife and her daughter.

Aoifes place was perfect for my husband and I. Youre able to get to the central Dublin area in about 10 walking and there a plenty of bus routes within a 3 minute walk as well. We enjoyed the breakfast Aoife provided and the tips the help us around Dublin. The room was much bigger than anticipated and the bed is super comfortable! Aoife is so accommodating and kind we would definitely stay at her place again!
Aoifes place is near the bus station to major attractions and the place was clean and beautiful and the hospitality provided by her and her daughter was great! Thank you!

Staying at Aoife's place has been amazing! The house is near the city centre, in less than 10 minutes you can reach O'Connell Street and in 15/20 minutes walk you can reach Temple Bar and all the main attractions! Besides the central position, Aoife and his little lovely daughter Clara were so kind: they waited for us to check in even if we were late in the evening; our bedroom was clean, with a comfortable bed, a huge sofa and a wonderful big window from which we could see the beautiful Irish sky in the morning.
The neighborhood is very quiet and pictoresque, with all Victorian houses and their colourful doors.
For breakfast, Aoife and Clara provide us all kinds of cereals, yogurt, jams and it was possible to cook eggs and toasts. We had our private bathroom, well cleaned, with hairdryer and shampoos. 
All was perfect!! 
They also gave us many advices about restaurants, pubs and attractions!!
We really felt at home! Thank you Aoife and Clara ‚ù§Ô∏è

Super cute cottage in Stoneybatter area with lovely tall ceilings. Such a neat neighbourhood! Its about a 20-25 minute walk to downtown Dublin (temple bar area). Its a nice quiet neighbourhood at night if youre looking to escape the noise of downtown!
Great spot and great hosts.  Pretty easy walk to lots of great areas in Dublin. Maureen was quick to respond to any questions. Highly recommend this stay to anyone traveling through Dublin.
Clean bedroom and bathroom, very welcoming host and good location, a bit out of the busy center.

My friend and I had a lovely time staying at Victorias Place. Both her and her partner were extremely welcoming and helpful when looking for things to do around the area. Overall fantastic place and fantastic people! x
Veronica was absolutely lovely, as was the space provided.  The view was stunning and it was such a calm place to rest amidst the gentle hustle and bustle.  Would stay again.
great place
Veronica and her partner were fantastic hosts. Very friendly and welcoming. Her home is gorgeous, has a great view and very good location. We loved at our stay in her home.

This place is located in a very safe neighborhood close to restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc. The apartment is beautiful and with a great balcony view to the lake. It also has great amenities and a private bathroom. We had a great time staying here and would definitely recommend it!
Veronica was the perfect host with the most charming place in a great and accessible part of the city. Those views! Both tranquil and breathtaking:)
Very clean ensuite bedroom in an apartment in an interesting part of town. Veronica and her boyfriend were delightful hosts. I'd definitely stay here again.

Veronica and her boyfriend were exceptional with us and we had an experience that could not be topped while visiting Dublin. The place is located in an incredible neighborhood full of cafes, restaurants and pubs and is also very close to the city (walking distance). We loved the natural light in the bedroom (incredible furniture and lovely touches all around) and the king size bed and absolutely enjoyed hearing the water in the Grand Canal Dock. Veronica also had amazing recommendations for us which definitely bettered our experience in the city, more than we could hope for!
Veronicas place was perfect for our first visit to Dublin. Very modern and comfortable and a great location for seeing all the wonderful sights of Dublin.
Great stay at Veronicas - lovely apartment and very friendly welcome to Dublin!

This apartment is great! My husband and I loved our time here. The room is spacious for a Dublin apartment and has a great connected bathroom. The views are also lovely! I would highly recommend staying here.
Wonderful host, who goes out of her way to make you stay pleasurable.  Very helpful with tips about getting around Dublin.  Would stay there again!

Veronika's Room is perfect for seeing Dublin. At the Quays are plenty for cafes and restaurants for a quick bite or late night tipple. There is a taxi stand within metres of the front door and if you want to walk its only 20 minutes to Trinity College or O'Connell St. You wouldnt find a better place to stay in Dublin.
Veronica and her Boyfriend were very nice, and had some great recommendation. Your at Temple Bar in 10min if you walk but there are rental Bikes and Bus. Had a great time.

Veronica's place was beautiful, in a great location, and perfectly equipped for a comfortable stay. She is extremely hospitable and knowledgable about not only Dublin, but all of Ireland. She and her partner had great suggestions for places to eat, sights to see, and getting around the city. We thoroughly enjoyed chatting with them and staying in their cozy space. The view from the bedroom is gorgeous!

Veronica and her boyfriend helped make our first trip to Ireland special and memorable! Its wonderful meeting kind people. Our conversations were so enjoyable and thought provoking. 

The location is perfect. The room and bathroom were super clean. Water temp was great. Apartment was nice and cozy. Book your stay in Dublin here!!!

Veronicas place is sparkling clean with a gorgeous view. She gives great recommendations for eating in the area and in the city! Perfect walk into the city if you are looking for some exercise. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Dublin!
Nice en-suite room in a great location. Friendly and informative hosts.
Stay here. Veronica is a true beauty.

Fantastic location, within walking distance of the hustle n bustle without being in the midst of it. Perfect!!!
Beautiful apartment, lovely views and setting. 
Would definitely come back here if/when I'm ever back in Dublin
Lovely little room with a beautiful view. Bed super comfy perfect after walking miles around Dublin. Really enjoyed our stay.

We had a wonderful stay in this apartment. Veronica is very nice and her house is lovely! 
The area is very quiet and cute, 15/20 minutes walking from temple bar. The view on the canal is so relaxing.

I was staying in Dublin for a business trip and had a great time at Veronica's place. Veronica is a great host and made me feel like being home. She was very welcoming and gave me valuable tipps for the city. The room itself is well equipped, super clean, has an amazing view over the quay and you can see the sunrise from your bed. 
Would have loved to stay longer. Thank you very much.
Veronica is a great hostess and cares about quality experiences for each of her guests.
Loved our stay here. Very comfortable space and we enjoyed the beautifully decorated balcony !
Very nice accommodations, comfy bed.  Some very interesting decorations from Veronicas travels.  Nice balcony overlooking the water.

Veronicas place was one of the nicest of our trip to Ireland. The location is perfect being in a safe, newer section of neighborhood in Dublin! The views of the harbor are unbeatable, and even better when enjoyed from the wide balcony. The bed was also very comfortable! Veronicas communication and directions for check in were very detailed and helpful. Highly recommend her place!
Its a nice room in a modern building in a great area of the city.

I've had a very pleasant stay in Dublin. The apartment in top location is very clean, comfortable and lovingly furnished. The view from balcony and windows is beautiful. Veronica was very kind and helpful. Thank you very much.
Place and location were magnificent
V is a great host who has plenty of good recommendations in her pocket. The room is lovely and just perfect for two. Couldn't ask for more, we would go there again without a doubt.

Veronica was a very welcoming host and the room and en-suite was lovely, with a great view of the dock. There was plenty to do in the area and it was easy to get across the river or into the main city areas. Locally there are plenty of bars and dining place one of which was mentioned for brunch which I tried on Sunday. Being in someone's home can be a little daunting, but I felt comfortable and had all I needed for a great stay.
Nice apartment for a short stay in Dublin, easy walk to Dart station. Location has a good range of eating places and a well stocked food store.

All around perfect Airbnb experience. Veronica is thoughtful and delightful. We felt so at home in her condo and the location was fantastic (in the middle of the bustle, but SO SAFE). We especially loved being above the fresh market where we enjoyed donuts + salad bar (balance ). THANK YOU Veronica! Xx
My sister and I spent two nights in Veronicas home and loved it!  The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The location is great and she is a wonderful host!
Veronica made us feel welcome and well cared for. Here place is tastefully decorated and its a good set up. Great location and views
Good location, reasonable price, comfortable bed and a charming and personable host.
Stayed here for a concert in the nearby theatre. Although I normally prefer to rent a whole place, and this is a room in Veronicas apartment, there was plenty of privacy and I felt very welcome.
Lovely direct view of Dublin Grand Canal
Great location and excelled host    Veronica greeted us and not only made us feel very welcomed but gave us loads of recommendations for the area.  We had an amazing stay and cannot wait to return!
Awesome place and great location. Couldn't ask for a better host.

Veronica is a fantastic host, she couldnt have been more welcoming. The room is lovely and the bed very comfortable. The location is great for the Bord Gais theatre and very easy to get into town and to and from the airport.
Pleasant and extremely convenient. Veronicas warm welcome was a greatly appreciated plus. I recommend.
Veronica was very welcoming and communicative, and the room had everything I needed.

Not worth the price as compared to the other places we stayed at. The place was in a good location but was extremely tiny and felt crowded. Pictures online were misleading. Just seemed like the owners storage space which we lived in. Cupboards still contained the owners shoes etc and a huge cupboard taking up alot of space in the room which was locked. Everything was basic. If u just need a bed at a high price then this is for u. The common areas didnt feel like so as U get the feeling the owner does not want u there. U get sent from the door directly to the tiny room on arrival. Quite disappointing. Good location is what u pay for perhaps..

Dermot and Helen were wonderful in preperation for the trip and met us at the apartment to explain everything and give us suggestions for our stay. The apartment was very clean and we felt very save during our stay. Within no time you are in the city and there is a grocery store very close to the apartment. It was a wonderful place to stay.

I loved this place.  It was the perfect space for four people.  It was in a good location, not right in the middle of the main tourist area, but close enough and quiet.  There are great restaurants in the area, and a grocery store close by.  There were also nice touches like shampoo and conditioner already in the apartment.  Really enjoyed my time here!
The host canceled this reservation 177 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great place and location. Coffee and breakfast is close. The place is clean and secure behind a gate.

Dermot & Helen were really nice and helpful with all our questions. The apartment ist very close to the Temple Bar. The apartment was very clean and a supermarket is right around the corner. If you stay in Dublin for a couple of days it¬¥s the perfect place to stay as you also have a parking spot.

We had a fantastic stay at this so charming apartment.
The host was very attentive and made check-in so easy and convenient for us, in spite of the delay of our flight and then the traffic jam to the apartment. He was waiting for us patiently and with a kind smile, he explained everything about the house to us, and gave us some tips for sightseeing. 
The apartment was very cozy. The living-room was fantastic, with large windows and a door to a little private zone in the garden. The electric fireplace gave the room a nice atmosphere and was lovely to look at when we were resting at the sofa at night.
The kitchen was fully equipped, and the bathroom was good too.
The two bedrooms were cozy, and the beds were very comfortable.
We felt very much at home, and we didn't like to leave: we would have stayed longer!
The gated development in which the apartment was located was very quiet. As for the neighboorhood, it was very quiet too. You get to the river bank in 1 minute, and there is a SPAR supermarket round the corner. In 15 minutes walking you arrive to Trinity College and city centre. Location was perfect!
And the host allowed us a free late check-out, as no other guest was entering on that day. That made everything easier for us!
We hope to come back to Dublin, and if so, we won't doubt to choose this apartment!

I had a lovely time at Dermot and Helens apartment. It is nicely located just a 10 minute walk from downtown Dublin, in a quite part of town. We met Dermot, who was nice enough to let us check in several hours before the set time. When I contacted Dermot he was really fast to answer - for example I asked whether there happened to be an adapter for the power outlet (I had forgotten that we have different contacts in Sweden compared to Ireland..) and he answered right away where I could find a couple. It was overall a really nice experiance staying with Dermot and Helen.
The host canceled this reservation 25 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Had a wonderful stay at Dermot and Helen's place. The location was fab (just across from the convention centre and around 20mins walk to temple bar) and very close to a supermarket, coffee shops etc. The apartment itself was lovely, very spacious, equipped with everything we needed (and more!), very clean. Communication with the hosts was great, always quick responses and very helpful. Would definitely recommend staying here, we had a great time.

Staying for a week in Dermot and Helens  flat was a delight. The 2 bedroom flat was spacious and beautifully appointed  and spotless. The outlook over the garden was an added bonus as was the secure parking
Situated just minutes from cafes, pubs and eateries the flat was within a 5minute walk from a very well equipped supermarket.
All the tourist attractions including Trinity College and the Guinness Storehouse were within walking distance as was the shopping district. 
All in all we loved our stay and enjoyed meeting  Dermot who was there to greet us on arrival. 
Patsy and Peter ( Sydney, Australia)
April/ May 2019

Dermot & Helen's apartment is in a great location and had everything a traveller would need. Dermot is a great host and he came down in the middle of the afternoon to help us check in early. Would stay here again.
We had a fantastic stay at Helen and Dermot's. Wonderful location, very comfortable space, and an incredibly quiet building, it made for an extremely enjoyable trip to Dublin.

We had 2 nights in Dermot and Hellens flat and enjoyed every minute of it. The flat is lovely, spotless and well appointed. Walking distance to everything and cafes and supermarket 2 minutes away.  Highly recommend.

Dermot's place was perfect. Close enough to get to all the spots we wanted to get to, but quiet enough that we slept extremely well. 

Highly recommended. We had no issues at all.

The place is amazing! Very clean, well located a few minutes from the Temple Bar.
Quite spacious and the checkin/communication was great.
I would return for sure.
The accommodation was perfect in every way and Dermot and Helen were warm welcoming hosts. Highly recommended!

This adorable 2 bedroom apartment is within walking distance of a ton of great eateries and pubs, and other Dublin attractions. The hosts were wonderful responsive and the place was very clean and well decorated.

This place was clean and tidy with everything you need for a very comfortable stay. I can highly recommend this place for other travellers. It is only a stones throw from the centre of town and many of The great things DUBLIN has to offer.

In terms of location, you cant get much better than this flat. It is right in the heart of the Temple Bar area with easy access to everything. It is a basic flat but has everything you would need for a short stay. If you are a light sleeper, this might not be the place for you. There is a sitting area right below the bedroom and nearly every night there were loud groups of people that would gather until the early hours of the morning. Roisin was communicative and helpful.

An incredible space with all the basic necessities right in the very center of all the activity. It was so cozy there were times we would just stay in. It does get loud outside but thats how central the location is. Hope to stay again!
Great place to stay in the Temple Bar area.  Nice, clean, and tidy apartment that was very close to hotel standard.  We enjoyed our stay very much and hope to return some time in the future.

The location of the apartment could not have been better. It was right in the middle of temple bar. The only negatives were the internet was very weak and the apartment occasionally got very hot. Roisin was very responsive to any concerns we had.

The building was clean and was located in a very convenient location.  It is on a relatively quiet street that is in the middle  of all the things we wanted to do.  Some of the other reviews noted noise at night, but we live in a downtown apartment and found this unit to be relatively quiet for a city location. Although it is in Temple Bar, there are no establishments open late at night in the direct vicinity of the unit.  We stayed with our  adult children and wife and found the unit to be clean and offer ample room.
Thanks to the Host, for a wonderful stay, the hosts are amazing and the place is just incredible, my family had a really great time staying here. Thanks a lot.
This apartment has everything you need, we were able to walk everywhere and the apartment was very clean and had everything we needed. Was very impressed :)

Roisin and her husband were great hosts! The apartment was conveniently located to tons of great pubs and restaurants. 

Roisin only has one set of keys so plan your activities accordingly. And it is fairly noisy outside and inside (thin walls, yay screaming kids), so if youre a light sleeper bring ear plugs.

All in all she was very helpful for any quick travel tips and made mine and my Dads stay very comfortable!

This place was central to temple bar and the night life was amazing! Stay out till all hours and close walk home and very secure and safe! Recommended to anyone for this is a great location and shower and bath is great! Stairs abit steep if you arent user to walking up and down stairs all the time but we were only there to sleep most the time so it was ideal for us! Toilet and shower etc on the same floor as the bedrooms which was good to! Would advise this place to anyone whos thinking of partying and nightlife! X

The apartment was in a great location and easily walkable to all major sites and night life. Roisin was quick to respond to messages and very helpful. We also rented a car on our last day and the access to parking was an added bonus.

Excellent location, few minutes from Temple Bar. Everything is in walkable distance (museums, shops, restaurants). 
The apartment has everything you need and is sparkling clean. A bit noisy in the weekend nights, but you can sleep well.

The apartment was in a great location, completely new renovated, super clean and fully equipped. At the check in everything was very well explained and support was offered whenever needed. Highly recommended place!

We had an amazing time in Dublin and that was partly due to the great apartment. The host was amazingly quick to respond and the check in  process was very smooth. The  location of this centrally located apartment was close to the typical spots which tourists wish to see in Dublin. As others  have mentioned, since this apartment is located in the popular hotspot of the temple bar region, it can tend to get loud in the late evenings as people are leaving the bars. So please be aware of that. The noise Is not unbearable, but it can be loud much like typical city sounds.

A great place that is centrally located. We found it easy to walk to most of the main Dublin attractions. The rental is spacious and we enjoyed having a kitchen. As others have mentioned it is in the Temple Bar area and it can get noisy at night.

Yvonne and Alan were amazing and interesting to talk to, and the room is perfect. Its a short bus or rail from downtown dublin, and is located in a lovely suburb. The room was sparkling clean and fully equipped with towels, shampoo, coffee/tea, water, and anything else we might need. We had dinner at the pub down the road which was delicious and then Yvonne made us a lovely breakfast which we enjoyed in the backyard. They even drove us into Dublin the next day, which was above and beyond our expectations. Everyone should stay here if they can! It was a highlight of our trip.

Alan was an amazing host and the place was absolutely lovely! One of the best hospitality I've experienced among all the Airbnb places I've been to.

My friend and I checked in late at night due to a train delay but Alan greeted us warmly along with his dog and his cat. The room is upstairs with a small ensuite bathroom - all very clean and well kept. Breakfast was also absolutely amazing (everything was set out so nicely as well)! The bus stop is very close by from which there are quite a few buses connecting to the city centre. Would absolutely recommend.

We had a lovely stay in Clontarf. The location was far enough from the city center to be nice and quiet, but was only a short walk to the bus or Dart to Dublin. Alan was a fabulous host and even went above and beyond to drop us into the city. I highly recommend a stay with Yvonne and Alan- you will not be sorry!
Yvonne & Alan are wonderful hosts, so helpful and accommodating, made our trip to Dublin better than expected!

Yvonne and Alan are superb hosts.  We emailed the day before showing up that we probably needed to ensure a Late Arrival with them.  Not too late, but later.  They were very accommodating and gracious.  Their international experiences make them sensitive to exhausted yet determined travelers wringing the most they can from experiencing Ireland.  In other words, they understand.  My daughter and I would recommend them to anyone.

Stayed here the All Ireland weekend with my Dad and it's probably the best air bnb I have stayed in! The house is absolutely stunning and Yvonne and  Alan were amazing hosts! They completely went out of their way to make you feel welcomed. The breakfast that Yvonne prepared was so thoughtful! The pastries and fresh fruit were perfect! Alan even drove my dad and I into the town so that we could get a few drinks before the game! I would highly recommend this place and will definitely stay again when visiting Dublin!

Yvonne and Alan are terrific hosts.  We truly enjoyed our stay with them (thank you!).   They made the last couple of days  incredibly pleasant, from Yvonnes croissants to Alan's  excellent advice, and the interesting conversations with both.   We were delighted to meet them and appreciate their wonderful home for a couple of days.

The room is beautiful and has so many thoughtful touches that I really appreciated after a long day of travel. Yvonne and Alan were so warm and welcoming! I loved that it was easy to park at their place and get to the airport in the morning with a rental car, but also easy to grab a cab for a short ride to downtown. I highly recommend.
Great

Yvonne & Alan are great. The room was spotless and filled with amenities of coffee and tea. They have local knowledge and will give you tips on what to do. Don't skip the pastries Yvonne makes for breakfast!

Yvonne and Alan were lovely hosts. The house is great and bedroom/ en-suite was perfect.  Breakfast was amazing with lovely fruit and pastries. It was easy to get into the city with the bus stops only a minute away. I would recommend this place.
A warm welcome and a memorable experience
Excellent homestay amazing stunning home Alan and Yvonne made us feel so welcome  Lisa and Sandra

A lovely house with lovely people. Location connected with the city centre. High quality of staff bathroom and warm room with biscuits, cafe, chocolate. Breakfast made with love and attention. My best experience.

We arrived to a lovely friendly welcome from Yvonne to this true haven for weary travellers - so many thoughtful touches including special coffee and tea bags, cookies and chocolates.  Super clean and fragrant with scented sticks, wonderful beds and linens and modern bathroom.  We instantly rated it a high five stars plus.  We had just one nights stay before an early morning departure to the airport and settled into the relaxing and comfortable environment.  Unfortunately noise from planes made it close to impossible to sleep, and unwittingly we had not realised this may be the case being just 20min drive from Dublin Airport.  Im not sure how others have fared with this noise or if it was a one-off situation, but its not a place I could return to, despite it being one of the best Airbnbs Ive ever stayed in.

Alan and Yvonne's house is located on a quiet street with private parking in a lovely part of North Dublin in an area I know well as I grew went to school and up close by. 

On a short visit home from living in the UAE I arrived late at night and their reception could not have been better. The house is sparking and the room  and bed very comfortable. As for breakfast! Yvonne bake her own pastries so be prepared for a continental breakfast feast of croissants, muffins, waffles, scones and her delicious fruit bowl with local Irish yogurts. 

They mentioned that there might be aircraft noise from arriving aircraft into Dublin airport but for my 3 nights I had the windows open and heard no noise. 

I am a pilot and have operated from Dublin airport over many years and can honestly state that if there was any airport aircraft noise it would be only because of an unusual airport runway change due to strong winds or maintenance of the main arrival runway 28 which is used 90% of the time with arrivals normally coming from the East over the Irish sea by Howth and Ireland's Eye which is about 10 miles north of their house. I would not be concerned with aircraft noise if looking to book with them.

Highly recommended and I will be back.
Nothing Short of Fantastic!!  Highly recommend!!
Amazing home and hosts, Yvonne even made breakfast in the morning for us! Such thoughtful touches to the space as well! Definitely recommend staying with these hosts!

Beautiful house in leafy and serene Clontarf. Perfectly situated outside of the city center but close to the seafront. Clean, classy and thoughtful house/ bedroom. Very accommodating with arrival times etc. The breakfast was seriously high class, a wide assortiment to choose from surpassing the level of the so called 4-5 star hotels. Yvonne and Alan are truly fantastic hosts. Will return here again in the future
Great place to stay, Alan and Yvonne were absolutely amazing.
Great place to stay.  Friendly, a home full of style and lovely comfortable beds.

Great place to stay near Temple street, Trinity College, restaurants, etc. The townhouse is very clean and cozy. Frank's little touches (fresh flowers in every room and staples in the fridge) are very much appreciated. Can't go wrong.

Nice beautiful excellent condition Victorian house, well decorated with great artworks and good location within walking distance from town or few stops on the bus. Frank offered a very warm welcome and tips of the town.
Fabulous house very modern, very clean and beds are super comfy. Good location easy access to town and lots of surrounding cafes

Paula was a brilliant host and was so welcoming. She has a beautiful home and the Accomodation was perfect, comfortable and clean and tidy. The location was great,nice and quiet and  close to the RDS.there is also parking and a bus stop close by. Highly recommend.
Great host and great location.
Great location

Paula's place is in a great location with Ranelagh and its range of restaurants at your doorstep. The city centre is just a few stops away on the bus or tram and yet it is a quiet street, in a lovely residential area of period properties. The room itself is a bit small but serves its purpose and you have a private bathroom (not ensuite) all to yourself. I would definitely recommend staying with Paula, who is very nice and helpful, and she makes a great cup of tea too.
Great location. Paula was very welcoming. Cup of tea on arrival was very welcome. Lovely breakfast next morning.

This is a lovely, spacious apartment in the heart of Dublin, within walking distance of everywhere in the central city. The kitchen is well-equipped for cooking etc, and everything necessary is provided for a very comfortable stay.
Great Location!!  This apartment is within walking distance to everything you need.  Two Bedrooms and Two Bathrooms was perfect for 2 couples.  Had everything we needed.
Christine's place was wonderful - great space, clean, and accurate to pictures and description. Very well located and walkable to everything. I would definitely stay there again. Thanks, Christine!
Great location, super clean and Christine was wonderful! Easy check in and check out!
Very pleasant stay.  Location was perfect for our needs - very centrally located and everything we wanted to see/do was walkable.

The apartment is well located. However, the listing brags that this is one of the few listings that include (Website hidden by Airbnb) does not...we were told that this had been discontinued more than a year ago!

Although this was a nice apartment in a central location, we had no hot water for two of our four days (first and last).  Owner quickly fixed the water heater the first day and the next two days were fine. Then on our last night and morning, we had no hot water (none). Upon review of other renters reviews, I now see this is an ongoing problem. Renter beware. 
Owner did not reply to my check out message/complaint although she was responsive prior to that. 
Great location. Secure building with elevator (3rd floor apartment). Washer/dryer in unit.
Christines place was very clean, however there was no hot water even after it was fixedù, even with using the boost button. There was also no breakfast other than a box of dry cereal, and no milk.
Well located in Dublin City center. Christine and her friend were really  helpful to assist us during our stay.  Street a little noisy
A wonderful stay. Spacious, clean and in a great location!! Would definitely recommend!!!
Thats a comfy place, everything in walking distance.

Christine's property is the perfect location. A short walk to everything. Close to coffee, parks, playgrounds, restaurants, pubs. The flat was clean and had everything we needed. We had a great stay, and she was easy to contact and quick to respond. Would happily stay again.

Good accommodation for our stay in Dublin.  Very clean. Good Amenities. Great location close to St Patrick's & Christ Cathedral.  15 Minute walk to City centre.  Several restaurants close by.  Very close to city transportation and Airlink Express.  Would certainly stay here again.
Great location, walking distance to major sites very spacious flat, ideal for a family of four. Well equipped kitchen as well.

Christine's apartment is bright, comfortable and equipped with everything we needed.  The location is fantastic, close to all of the best of Dublin!  Christine responded promptly to answer questions and help when we needed it.  This was a wonderful accommodation and host!
Great place to stay if you are looking for a super central location. The apartment has everything you need for a 4 Person stay. We would book again right away
Nice space in a great location. Quick walk to everything in Dublin. The space was private, clean, and safe.
The Airbnb was exactly what we needed for our Dublin stay!

We stayed in this apt for 5 nights, the location is perfect, all the main attractions are at walking distance. The place was clean, Christine was very fast in replying to our messages and John, who checked us in, was quick and very informative. Everything was great!
Great location, very secure and safe. Christine was kind and thoughtful and even had a welcoming present for us.

One of the best Airbnb Ive stayed in. 
The location was very convenient, neighbor is nice.
This was a stylish and spacious unit, nice and clean.
Check-in and check-out was fast and easy.
Thanks Christine for hosting us.
Clean apartment close to temple bar area. A bit noisy as there is a lot of work going on around the area

Great location, we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. There is still construction noise but the building itself is super quiet--we never heard a sound from another unit. We really appreciated being able to drop off our luggage early and also the fast responses from Christine to a couple of minor issues.
The location and price are great.
Great location. Clean n tidy. Decent amenities.
Warm welcome and so helpful throughout my stay.
A lovely cottage stay, about 20-30 mins into Dublin. Had everything we needed and Angelina was super helpful about places to go etc.
Everything went great, Angelina was very accommodating and quick to reply to any questions we had.
Angelinas place was lovely. There were some special touches such as breakfast included. The beds were comfortable and the host was easy to communicate with.
A well located Air BnB for this part of Dublin. Angelina is a great host. You are left to your own devices. Not many instructions to remember; just to have a good time. Home from home
Recommend
Good location and nice clean space. Angelina is a very welcoming host.

Angelinas place is such a cozy and restful stay! Her personal touches and extras make you feel at home! Her place is extra clean and will accommodate with any needs while there. She gave us great suggestions on what to see and where to go while in Dublin! Shes such a sweet person and would recommend her place to any guests staying in Dublin but outside the city.
Great space, clean, spacious and fully equipped. lovely host..Will be back
Really great place. House is perfect and host Angelina even better!
My stay at Angelina's was perfect. The apartment is comfortable and functional. Angelina is very welcoming.
Great stay once again...especially the homemade honeycrusted muesli..mmm
Angelina was an excellent host. The place was clean, comfortable, and well appointed. The location was great. 5-10 minute walk to buses and great bars and food spots.

Angelina is an angel, and her place is fantastic! Quaint and in a quiet part of Dublin (but close to transportation and taxis to get around), it was the perfect place to relax and adjust to a new time zone. Everything was clean, and she had thoughtful touches (and food!) Highly recommend. I hope to be back sometime!

Angelina's accommodation is a gem.  It's in a very quiet neighborhood but close to many amenities.  Check in was flawless and communication was quick and easy. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend.

Angelina was truly the best AirBnB Host I have encountered.  She turned on a dime to help three very weary inconvenienced travelers out.  She was super fast on the response, super helpful in getting us to her place.  Had a sore-throat remedy ready to go when we arrived for one of our party that was ailing.  It was a one-of-a-kind experience!
Angelina was an absolute sweetheart! Made us feel very welcome, would definitely stay again!

My daughter and I spent one night at Angelinas. Its very clean and Angelina left biscuits and brack for tea and everything we needed for breakfast which was wonderful! I was warmly welcomed and Angelina was quick and helpful with messages prior to arrival. Easy parking outside and we enjoyed a peaceful and comfortable nights sleep! Thank you Angelina!

Angelinas a fantastic host, very thoughtful and communicative. This place is perfect if youre looking for a quiet home base just outside the city center that still gives you easy access to the main attractions. This was my first time visiting Dublin and it was nice having a comfortable, quiet place to return to after a day of exploring the city.
Great space and lovely host. Good location and very well priced.
Fantastic place! Absolutely loved it
Angelina is a great host and the place is just as described.. very private and comfortable.

Angelina was very warm and welcoming. She met with us and gave us tips on where to go and what to see. I would have to say her place by far was better than the other places we have stayed, and all the places we stayed were very nice!
Bradley and Deborah Jackson
Angelina was so kind and even let me check in early! Will absolutely be staying here again while passing through Dublin.
Angelina made my wife and I feel very welcome and even offered to look after our baby for us. I would stay with her again!
We had a very comfortable stay at Angelinas place! She was lovely and made everything easy for check in. Very clean and nice space, and good value!
Wonderful comfortable apartment, and also a great convenient location, not at all far from the city Center. Very much enjoyed our stay!
Angelina is a wonderful hostess - friendly and helpful when needed.  The apartment is spotless.

We had a great stay at Angelina's for the BonJovi concert. Angelina was really friendly and gave us good information about the local area and getting around. Little touches like breakfast being set up for us when we arrived and cold water in the fridge were lovely. Angelina's place was spotless with everything you need. 5 stars, we hope to stay again soon. Thanks Angelina, from Vicky, Bonnie and Emily.

Angelina is a thoughtful and kind host. Her place is spotless. As well as breakfast foods she provided little treats for us. It is a little further into Dublin than expected but the half hour bus service is very close by. I would stay again.
Good place to stay.  Handy location.  Tasty food for breakfast, and snacks too.

Angelina was so warm and helpful. We unfortunately only stayed with her one night, but next time we are in Dublin wed look to spend a couple weeks at Angelinas cozy, clean, welcoming space. She is just lovely.
Angelinas place was clean comfortable and in a good location

This is a wonderful combination of a lovely, quiet apartment and a fabulous hostess. Angelina is amazingly warm, hospitable and kind: she offered to make me food if I was hungry; helped me carry in lots of luggage; and let me leave luggage there for many hours the day I left, so it wouldn't be in my car in the city centre. The apartment was spotless; my single bed was very comfortable; Angelina provided breakfast food, sweets, biscuits and drinks. The wifi worked well. I would not only be very happy to stay with her again, I would look forward to seeing her!

We stayed in Angelinas home after attending a concert at croke park.  On arrival we were immediately taken back by Angelinas friendliness and warmth. Her home is absolutely spotless with everything you need for a comfortable stay , including milk and bread in the fridge and breakfast ready for the next morning . As well as WiFi and accessories in the bathroom. Well stocked kitchen with tv. Angelina home is 2 mins walk from bus stop into city centre.  We would certainly stay with Angelina again & although we only stayed one night her home is certainly suitable for a longer stay . Thanks again Angelina xx
Angelina was an amazing person and host very helpful I would recommend anyone to stay
Good house and amenities. Light hearted host. Extremely poor security.
Angelina is a super host. Offered me a sandwich after my long drive. Had a problem with shower and it was sorted almost immediately. Thanks Angelina. I would definitely stay again

Angelina stated that her place is a 10 minute bus ride to the city but this is not accurate at all.  Its more like 45 minutes to the city center and and it took me nearly 2 hours from the train station in rush hour traffic.

This apartment is close to a tiny village with a few restaurants. There is a bus 15 minutes walk away into city centre. The bus is sporadic on weekends. 
The host is attentive, friendly and helpful.
Angelina is a great host, very welcoming and the apartment has everything you need. it is very comfortable and spacious, with loads of extra touches. Great value for money and great location

Angelina was an amazing host. The place was super clean and nice, and had everything I needed. It was a quick bus ride to the city center. Angelina left a lovely breakfast and went above and beyond to make sure it was a great stay. Id definitely stay again!
Angelina was such a great host. She greeted us at the door and made us feel right at home. The place itself is spotless and has everything you need.

Angelina was a very welcoming and friendly host. Her place is clean and as photographed with some great thoughtful touches - breakfast and tea/coffee/milk all in the kitchen and she offered us use of her lovely garden if we wanted. The house is a little way out from town but easy to get to by bus/taxi and Angelina told us about local shops and pubs a 10 minute walk away. Would definitely stay here again if we come to Dublin.

This place was an excellent value. Hospitality was very generous. I received some wonderful recommendations for the two sisters pub as well as the orchard inn. It is a bit from downtown Dublin, which is what I wanted For my stay.

Angelina is a very kind and thoughtful host. Leaves the room clean and fully stocked with breakfast items. She offers plenty of information on local tips. Is a bit out of town. During rush hour the bus can take a while but avoiding rush hour, only about a 30 min bus ride. About an hour and half walk. All in all, a great experience.
Very nice place close to Dublin city center. You can catch the 15 bus about 1/4 of a mile walk up the street which takes you right into town!
I arrived after a long trip and was greeted with kindness, great attention to detail and a spotlessly clean space... Thanks a lot for everything!
The apartment is nice and comfortable. Angelina is very welcoming.
Excellant place to stay

Angelinas apartment was truly lovely. Spacious and very clean. Angelina was super helpful during checkin and gave us good tips on local pubs and easy directions on the best way to get to the city. Thank you!

Angelinas place is a home away from home in Dublin. Just a bus or taxi ride from the City Centre. Angelinas hospitality was fantastic and she made me feel comfortable and safe. I would absolutely stay here on my next trip to Dublin.

A super nice causey Appartment! With everything you need! Even adapter's to charge your phone! 
Angelina is very kind, helpful and it's fun to talk to her! All in all it was a good short stay in her house!

Angelinas place is like a home away from home! It has everything you need and more, plus its really clean and secure. Great hospitality from Angelina (she takes the time to explain everything during check-in) and thoughtfulness in simple touches like transportation recommendations and providing breakfast/snacks.

It was a pleasure to meet and stay in Angelina's apartment. She provided additional touches, milk/cereal/bread,which were so thoughtful. 

Access to city centre requires a small walk to the bus stop and then it's a 15/20 min journey. Ans that's good for Dublin traffic.

Great host. Great location. Great value. We had a lovely welcome and Angelina went the extra mile to supply Bread, milk, coffee and tea etc. And her cake was amazing. Do yourself a favour and book a stay.
Angelina was very sweet and helpful. The place is clean and comfortable for a solo tourist. The area is quiet and just outside the busy centre.

It is really easy to get to and from town form Angelinas, just a 30 minute bus journey (recommend getting a leap card). She is so friendly and had bought us some milk, tea bags and breakfast foods, and had baked some apple tarts for our arrival. I felt very safe during my stay and would recommend staying here
Good and clean flat in the south of Dublin.
This was a lovely experience. Angelina is a very kind host and her home is in a charming neighborhood. Very clean, peaceful and comfortable space. Great communication and smooth check in and out.

I had a lovely stay, thoughtful touches such as a slice of tart and the kettle boiled when I arrived. Angelina was a welcoming host and couldnt do enough for me. Its a spacious quiet safe house. Its close to the bus stop. Great breakfast, lots of selections of cereals, juice, toast, tea and coffee. Fully equipped kitchen if you want to cook. Also a great range of DVDs if you feel like a night in. Would highly recommend

Angelina was a lovely host and very helpful.  Her accommodation was a perfect place to stay while we went sightseeing in Dublin.  City Centre was only 20 minutes away on a bus that was easy to catch and a few local pubs and restaurants within walking distance.
Spotless, convenient location, friendly host

Angelina was friendly and helpful. Answered questions quickly and was happy for a chat but just as happy to let me do my own thing when I wanted. The space was clean, the bedroom was small but had Good storage space and the living area more than made up for it. 
Be aware that travel times can be tripled if travelling in peak hour. And public transport runs far less frequently in the evening, so if your relying on that check the schedule as they stop for the night around 11.30pm.
A quiet residential area with excellent transport links to the city

I found this stay very satisfactory, it was perfect for our needs. Excellent location and the small touches are nice. Bagels n donuts
Always good
Angelinas place was very lovely! She provided a very nice breakfast and her home is very close to Dublin and the airport! I'd definitely stay here again. She was a great host!

The place was clean and Angelina was very helpful with tips and suggestions. The place is a duplex and Angelina lives next door. The front door has a lock but the door to the Airbnb does not have a lock. Thats the only thing I wasnt too crazy about. Other than that, the location was perfect and close to the city center.
Very welcoming; comfy beds; great to have some supplies for breakfast. Useful to have free parking just outside. Useful location for us as we were visiting Rathgar just up the road.

Huis ligt in een rustige woonwijk, parkeren op het grasveldje voor de deur. Op loopafstand zit gezellige Ierse pub waar je prima kunt eten. Goede bedden, een goed verzorgd ontbijt en een sympathieke gastvrouw maken het een uitstekend overnachtings/verblijfplek. Dicht bij de snelweg; makkelijk voor wie de volgende dag wil doorreizen per auto.
Very well appointed and great communication.

Angelinas place is spacious and cozy. The house is very close to a bus stop that runs to the city center every 10 minutes. It is a bit of a trip to the city, but the busses run consistently all day. Angelina is the most friendly host that we have stayed with thus far. 

Lauren & Luke

This Airbnb surpassed my expectations, Angelina was very welcoming and the Airbnb had great amenities, was spotlessly clean, nice welcome touches and a good location. Great value and would highly recommend to others
Thank you very much, Angelina! :-)
Angelina is very welcoming. Her home is clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend.
Super host! super place and super value
Amazing hospitality, great finishing touches and all the amenities one could need. I was made feel at home and then left to my own devices, would definitely stay again.
Very friendly and welcoming. Nice clean space

This is a lovely clean, 1 bedroom mews in a nice part of south Dublin city. I stayed on my own but it is perfect, private place for 2 people. The area is nice with loads of restaurants and bars and is my preference rather than in the city centre. Rosie checked me in at my convenience, responded to queries quickly and when I wanted to check out late and then extend another night, she facilitated with absolutely no fuss.
I would stay again. Thanks Rosie.

We enjoyed the coach house very much. It was a great home base for our exploration of Dublin with the city centre in walking distance but also good connections on the public transport system and to the airport.
The apartment itself was cosy and felt like a home away from home immediately. Rosie was very helpful upfront, very friendly in person and simply a great host.
Rosie's place is great: it's clean, stylish, well-equipped and has a great location - almost in the centre, but in a very quite place too. I'd definitely recommend staying here. Thank you, Rosie!
We had great time! She was so nice to us.Thank you.
Great location, Rosie is a gem, place is small but really functional.

Rosie has a lovely home, cozy and perfect for two guests. Its a short walk from the lively area of Ranelagh, with good tram connection to Dublin center. If youre up for walking, you can take a stroll inti Dublin, passing through St. Stephens Green, in about 25 minutes. Highly recommended!

Rosie's apartment was perfect! It was tucked away from the street so noise was not an issue whatsoever. A very short walk to the pubs and restaurants of the area, and not much farther to the tram. To get to the city centre by tram does not take long or you can take a nice 20 minute stroll. Inside was very clean and comfortable and had all amenities needed. The hospitality we received was the cherry on top of a lovely stay. I would gladly come back!
Unbeatable location for Dublin. Warm and accommodating hospitality.  Highest recommendation from seasoned travelers

Nice cosy coach house, clean and in a good location, 5 mins walk from Ranelagh high street where you can find bars, restaurants, supermarkets and tram that will take you into the city centre in 10 mins. Rosie, the host, responded really quickly to all my messages prior to arrival and lives right next door so is on hand to answer any questions you might have during your stay.
Lovely stay in Ranelagh. Very convenient!
The place was nice.  The location was excellent.  Host was very helpful and easy to contact.

My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay here.  It's in a lovely neighbourhood and is a nice flat walk to St Stephen's Green and the city centre and only a 5 minute walk to local shops and restaurants in Ranelagh.  It's set down a quiet lane.  Rosie was very friendly and welcoming and helpful, giving us tips on where to visit.  We really appreciated the tea, coffee, milk and variety of breakfast items provided.  It was great not having to go to the shops to buy things in. We treated ourselves to breakfast at Cinnamon in Ranelagh on our last morning.  My daughter says it was the best French toast she has had!   Just a couple of things to note in case they matter to you, both the door and window (non-opening) downstairs are fully frosted, to give privacy from the residents' cars that park up to the building, so you can't see out from inside, other than from the bedroom window upstairs.  Rosie provided hypo-allergenic (ie non-feather) pillows and duvets as I had explained that I have an allergy to feathers but unfortunately the sofa is feather filled and, as it's quite old, a lot of feathers had escaped from it so they triggered my allergies!  Rosie realised during our stay that there were feathers in the sofa and was very apologetic about it.  So maybe best avoided if you suffer from a similar allergy!  The bed linen was lovely and fresh and the beds very comfortable so we slept very well.  The bathroom was nicely tiled and the electric shower was good.  Sealant round the shower could do with a clean and the Venetian blinds and dining chairs dusted (prob my allergies again that detected the dust!) but generally very clean - all the crockery and utensils in the kitchen were spotless.  We bought 3-day Leaps travel cards at the airport for 19 Euros each and found them to be very good value and so handy.  They cover trains, trams and most buses (not the Airport 700 bus which stops just 4 minutes walk from the accommodation but you could take one of the airport buses the card does cover from the airport to the city centre and then switch on to a bus to the accommodation).  I think the card runs from when you first activate (ie use) it rather than from when you buy it so worth picking up at the airport even if you don't need it until the following day.   We especially appreciated Rosie being so helpful when we asked if there would be a possibility of a late check-out.  She was very kind in letting us stay on that day as no-one else was booked in for a couple of days.  If you do need to leave your luggage somewhere there is a left luggage facility at Trinity College (downstairs in the modern glass building - 6 Euros a bag, I think).  It closes for an hour and a quarter over lunch so make sure you can get your bags back when you need to!  Book in advance if you want to visit the jail - it's sold out in advance most days!  Have fun in this friendly city!
Bring multiple power (up and down) converters if traveling from states. Short walk to Luas stop, which we found was most affordable transportation to city.

This place was located in a beautiful neighborhood.  A short walk from the Ranelagh village with charming shops and restaurants.  A nice 30 minute walk to the Dublin City Center that takes you right through St. Stephens Green.  A perfect opportunity to walk off those pints!  Rosie was super helpful with tips, suggestions, and dropping us at car rental agency when we left Dublin.  Oh!  We realized we forgot our passports at the Carriage House and she kindly brought them to us as we waited for our rental to car to head out to the country.
Rosies place was perfect . Very comfortable & all the boxes checked. Location was perfect, we walked everywhere which no problem. Very clean & spacious , love to stay again.

We loved this little coach house! It was perfect for the two of us. Rosie was a great host, she gave us step by step directions from the airport, offered local tips, and was just very nice! It was very clean, and had everything we needed. We also really liked that it wasnt right in the city- it was great to go explore during the day and then come back to the quiet little village at night.
Perfect place

We spent 3 nights in the coach house, had a very pleasant stay here. The house has everything you need and is located very quiet in a nice place. The city is nearby, you can have a nice short walk to St Stephen's Green and all the other attractions there! Rosie was very nice and gave us good advices what to do in Dublin,where to eat , which busses to take! That was very helpful. We had the possibility to stay longer on our check-out-day,which was great for us! Thank you, Rosie, and bye-bye! Greetings from Verena and Lena from Germany

The space is beautiful, comfortable, with a mattress you can get a great night's rest on. The location is unbeatable. So close to the LUAS! You can get to the LUAS stop in about 8 minutes if you're walking leisurely and waiting for the lights. The neighborhood is quiet so you'll be able to keep whatever sleep schedule you need, whether that's staying out late and sleeping in till noon or falling into bed at 9 and waking up at 6. 

The bathroom was clean, and exceptionally spacious by European standards! We've lived in flats where I would have killed to have a bathroom as lovely as this one. Getting to have a shower this nice while on vacation in Dublin was such a delight. 

The amenities! I nearly cried because there was already a kettle and tea available. All we had to do was grab milk from SuperValu on the way to the house. I cannot overstate what it means to me that I was able to have tea immediately once we were in the door. There were also plenty of utensils, plates, and some edibles like porridge and biscuits, in case the shops are closed by the time you get to the accommodation. 

Overall, it was a clean, comfortable, considerate, nicely curated, fabulously located place that I would choose again over the hotels in city centre any day. I'm endlessly grateful to Rosie for having such a lovely tucked-away little slice of comfort available for booking.

Rosies place is literally super! The house is very original and so cute, with the bedroom under the roof. Everything is well organized, lots of services and an exemplary tidiness. Everything is so comfortable that you can feel like at your home. Really recommend! Rosie is a very kind host, quick to answer and helpful for both check in and check out. The neighborhood is great, very quiet day and night, but close to one of the most interesting part of the city, full of shops, pubs and restaurants. The city center isnt so far, I always moved walking, in 30 minutes yes can arrive there, and the walk is really pleasant, being along canal and park. Hope to stay there again!

Our best Airbnb experience in Ireland.  Rosie and her son were great hosts and made us feel quite welcome.  Ranelagh is a quiet neighborhood with excellent restaurants (recommend Nightmarket for Thai food) and close to bus stops for easy transportation into the city.  The space is beautiful and well put together with nice touches throughout.  Would highly recommend and would certainly stay here again.

Very beautiful and cozy flat in one of the best areas in Dublin. Lots of restaurants and facilities and you can easily walk to the city center in 20 minutes. The host, Rosie, is really kind. Best Airbnb experience so far!!!
Nice place in a very nice area.
Nothing to complain. Everything was very nice and clean. Rosie was very nice, the location was close to the city and public transport. I can totally recommend that location!

Great location and very nice & cosy house for two! Good link to the central and to the airport as well. Rosie was a very friendly host and always quickly responded our question and inquiry. Would highly recommend this place!

Small remodeled coach house. Good for privacy, comfortable and large bed, good bus and tram options. Living area on ground floor felt a bit chilly and had an earthy smell to it, but the apartment was clean and suitable for two people. Nice neighborhood.
Everything good!

The Coach House is a gem.  The location is amazing, right in a wonderful neighborhood thats a quick 20 min walk from city center or St. Stephens Green.  If this is available, book it as soon as possible.  The beds are comfortable, the wi-fi is great, its clean, comfortable and very private.  There are marvelous restaurants just up the block and your host is the sweetest. Willing to go above and beyond.  If youre thinking about booking it, do yourself a favor and get it done.  You will not regret it.

Barrys place is at a prefect location for visiting Dublin.  If you take the Airlink express from the airport you can get to the Barrys place without a problem.
