The location is right at bus stops that will get you anywhere you need in no time at all. With the Do Dublin bus pass we were able to get all around the city from a stop right outside Barrys place. Even the on and off tour bus passes right by the his place. You do not even need a bus to get to the city city center.. its an easy walk. The place is spotless, comfortable, and had everything we needed. They are great host and enjoyed talking with them. Definitely a place we will suggest our friends to stay when they come to Dublin.

We spent a very enjoyable couple of days at Dee's place, which has great character as it is her own home which she lets out when she is away. Dee's welcome was very warm (as indeed was the Dublin weather!) and she was full of useful tips and suggestions (such as Fumbally, a cafe which is a short walk away and is excellent for brunch). She had also bought a brand-new feather-free quilt for us to avoid allergies, which was greatly appreciated. We enjoyed how bright and airy her home is and also the opportunity to recharge our batteries by sitting in her lovely garden. The city centre is 15-20 mins away on foot, so easily doable. As in much of Dublin, there is audible building work in the neighbourhood; we were aware of it, but it didn't mar our stay and it ceases entirely by late afternoon. We'd certainly happily return.
Dee has a very nice and cozy home. Very friendly and accommodating.

A lovely and relaxing home, set just outside the bustle of Dublin. Easy to get to the city proper, but located in a more quiet neighborhood. Close to the Portobello district. The host has an eye for detail and was v welcoming and accommodating, even left us fresh bread.
Highly recommend this place! Little bit of a walk to downtown but very safe location. Dee was a superior quality host!

We had a lovelay stay at Dee's. The Flat is ideally located and we did all our visits on foot. Dee kindly left us some delightfull bread and cheese and every maps we could need. She suggested a walk along the canal and it was truly gorgeous. I strongly recommend !
Dees place is close enough to walk to all the attractions and yet feels homey with nice touches like breakfast items and coffee making the stay easier from the start!
Great location for the local area of Howth. Wonderful water scenery and hikes! And so close to the airport!!!! And Jacquelines home is great for a family vacation in Ireland!

Jacqueline's place is close to coastal town Howth, about 20 mins away from Dublin airport. It was the perfect place to stay before our flight back home. Her place is adorned with fun  art work and vibrant colours and other visuals pleasing to the eye. We really appreciated the fully stocked kitchen, breakfast items and extras in the fridge! Beds were comfortable, the towels plush and Howth being so close by for fish and chips, makes this the perfect place to stay!
The accommodation is exactly as described. Lovely details make you feel at home immediately. Jacqueline is a great host.
Great location, she provided lots of helpful tips to help improve our time in town.
Great place to stay! Easy access into Dublin. Awesome location to visit Howth! Would stay here again
Good value and easy communication with host. Everything I expected from the advert.
Alles Super. Tolle Ausstattung. Mit dem Taxi oder Bahn ist man schnell in Dublin City
Place was cozy. Family of six fit nicely. Close to the water, nice walking/biking trail along the water. Short twenty minute bus ride into the city. Nice bakery and pub right across the street!
Great location close to all public transportation. Grocery close by as well as beautiful walks right out the door

Great place that is quiet and away from the downtown fray. Very comfortable and great restaurants in walking distance. Also walking distance to public transportation for super easy access to downtown Dublin. Grocery and pub around the corner as well as the church in case the previous night got out of control .

Jacquelines place was great. Great location to walk for breakfast/coffee; convenient for train/bus route, centrally located for tourist travel. Abundance of fresh sheets and towels and spacious enough for 7 people. 
We would definitely stay there again when returning.
Lovely house and facilities. Great service from the host. Easy access to rail services. We were attending an event at Malahide and this was perfect.
This is a clean, quiet, convenient home with plenty of space for everyone and a great kitchen.  Its not in the center of town,  but the train is fast and easy to use.

Great location. So close to the DART train. Eat locally at La Gustosa - walking distance and a view of the ocean. Lots to be had at the local mini shopping mall - bakery, corner store, post office, etc.  Jacqueline has lots of suggestions for things to see and do in the area and around Dublin and Ireland. Nice, quiet area.

The house is very comfortable and trendy, close to Howth and the coast, and conveniently located to reach Dublin by car, bus or Dart. Comfortable beds and airy and spacious rooms. Nice common spaces (kitchen, living room) to plan visits and relax.  The experience would be top if the host fixes a few annoying details (toilet sink drain was very slow, clothes dryer not working, no toilet brush in main toilet, the back garden somehow neglected).
Brilliant location to get into Dublin and explore the beau surroundings of north county Dublin.

Very nice house in a calm neighborhood. Convenient place to explore both Howth and the centre of Dublin while just a short drive away from the airport. It was convenient that it was possible to park a car just before the front door.

Wonderful house in a great location with easy access to the city on the Dart and Howth for the sea and lovely walks. Local shops are minutes away.  The house was perfect for our family with three children. Very relaxing. Thank you.

We really enjoyed our stay at Jacqueline's place. It was very clean nicely appointed and ideally located 20 minutes from Dublin city center, 20 minutes from airport and 5 minutes from the sea. Jacqueline was very easy to communicate with and extremely responsive. We appreciated the extra touches like coffee tea and milk that she left for our enjoyment. I highly recommend staying at Jacqueline's place and enjoying the local area. We had dinner at O'Connell's in Howth and it was excellent.

Jaqueline has been a great host! Such a comfortable place to stay. We arrived to find a few extras in the fridge and cupboards for us to use.   Natural light in her home, combined with fun decorative touches, make it very relaxing. She makes it easy to use the many items  in her home, and shared good tips on how to get around so we easily accessed both Dublin and Howth.  Restaurants she recommended were great as were the beautiful hikes we could took close by in Howth.  Bonus for us, was easy access to the airport too! Our family of four found it very roomy. Thanks Jacqueline! Would recommend for families or couples. Would stay there again.
excellent location to travel into Dublin and Howth, very friendly people in the area and a great home to come back to at days end.

Jacquelines house is in a good  location for travelling into the city with great transport links.  She was really quick to respond to our messages.  The house was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  There was ample space for us all.  I would highly recommend this house & Jacqueline is a great host.
Good location. Quiet and private.
We (2 families) spent great time there together. The house is very comfortable. We recommend house and cliff walk in Howth.
Great little place. Very convenient to Dublin city centre and Howth
The apartment is pretty, well equipped and clean. The landlord is very nice and answers questions quickly, if there are still questions open despite the very good documents.
Great place to stay.
Nice little town near Dublin, lovely house and very warm contact from host.
Great place, very clean and a nice base to explore the area. We enjoyed our brief stay.
This house was perfect for our short break in dublin.cosy ,clean home in a great location.i would definitely recommend it
Very comfortable stay. Would definitely recommend this house.
Excellent service and a great place to stay! Will be returning again
Warm welcome, comfortable accommodation and great location.
Cosy and quiet place where you wake up with birds singing. Isobel is a very nice host, with good tips for travellers visiting Ireland. Thank you!
Lovely accomodations, warm and friendly hostess.  Wonderful location close to the sea.  All needs accounted for - wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy the accomodations!

Isobel's place was amazing! I loved how she had so many separate spaces out back in addition to a lot of common spaces, so different guests could interact as much or as little as they wanted. My group loved her travel suggestions/directions for places to see! I especially loved how close her place was to the beach, so I could still have a place for a run, away from the roads!

Isoblel's home was just gorgeous and she is a gracious, kind and personable host. Perfect location if you are heading to the airport the next day...just 20 minutes. The beach and town are within walking distance and the town pub, The Harbour House, is lovely. Best beds and linens in our 13 day stay.  We will be back for sure! Thanks, Isobel!!!

Isobel's house is a nice place, close to the beach. On the plis side : the garden is wonderful, the rooms are big, the beds very comfortable with lots of pillows and blankets, there was a travel cot for our baby,and the shower room was nice. We were a little disappointed to get a room (not the bungalow we had  booked). The atmosphere of the house is very special, we perfectly understand that some people love the spirituality of the place and the fact that many people and guests share the house (whether Airbnb or llng-term rent). We are however very down-to-earth and this was not the place we prefered. However this only reflects our own thoughts and once more, we have been nicely welcomed and everything was provided for.
Isobel is a lovely host. She and her special house with beautiful garden has given us a fantastic holiday. Its nearby the beach for nice walks, you need a car to see all nice things in the area.
Isobel is such a lovely host. I would highly recommend her home to stay in if your visiting the area. A very relaxed stay and the location was perfect.
Isobel is a warm and caring hostess. We thoroughly enjoyed our time staying with her and highly recommend her warm and comfy home as a place to stay.

Beautiful place, super peaceful and Isobel was super responsive. My only thing would be that if you are planning to travel into Dublin city center, plan to spend a bit of money..the place was only 20 minutes from the airport but about 30-35 from the city center and we paid 35-50 euros each time we took a taxi. The bus is a lot cheaper, but it takes over an hour to get to the city by bus. Besides that, we loved our stay.
Isobel is so sweet and cool, very cosy place, overall great experience!
We can definitely recommend a stay with Isobel . Great hospitality, fantastic room and garden area. The house is located near beach and shops. If you need a stay in rush this is the place to be!
We stayed there only one night but we felt very confortable and we have regretted not to stay longer.
Very tastfully designed house and garden. Isobel great warm hearted host. Bring own breakfast, local shop nearby.
Funky place, warm hosts, a block from the beach.
Isobels place was  superb!It felt like home.Such a beautiful quiet property and our accommodations were large.  Very close to the local beach and grocery store.All in all a great place to stay!
Amazing place right by the beach!  So peaceful and a nice walk to play in the water.  Easy commute to the airport. Highly recommended!

Our visit was brief, however, Isobel was a wonderful host. She was very responsive even when our taxi driver could not find the place in the middle of the night. She woke up and greeted us. The room we stayed in was a bit tight for all 4 of us adults but was comfortable. She made us some tea and biscuits in the morning as well. We woke and walked to the beach in the morning which was less than a 5 minute walk. Would have liked to have enjoyed her lovely back yard, however, it was a rainy, windy day.

Isobel's home is lovely.  Very cosy and welcoming with a gorgeous garden. A short walk from the main street in Rush and the beach, easy reach of central Dublin and the airport.  A great place to stay if you want a city break with a bit of P&Q at the end of the day or for exploring the east coast. We would definitely stay with Isobel again!

Isobel is a warm,  and welcoming host,  with a beautiful home that she allows you to share. She obviously loves living where she does; the accommodation is spacious, clean and with lots of character. The sunroom and garden are a real treat, and easy walking distance to  the shops and the beautiful beaches of Rush.  A real gem in beautiful surroundings which I would highly recommend and would stay again. A great place to recharge your batteries and enjoy the relaxing and safe atmosphere provided by a brilliant host.
Nice hot shower, drinking water on table upon arrival, getting in was easy, 2 or more pillows per bed and had converter set up in the room, WiFi password written everywhere
Loved this home and home to go back! Isobel was kind and helpful and the room was great with cozy beds.
Isobel's home is a quiet and lovely house. The room is big and Isobel makes her guests feel comfortable, you can use the kitchen, bathroom, enjoy the garden, etc. Very close from Dublin and Skerries.
Amazing! The gardens are phenomenal, the styling is stunning, and the energy of the people and the whole place is welcoming and wonderful. Loved it!
Isobel house is so lovely and her garden is fabulous . Would definitely recommend this as a place to stay in Dublin.
Isobels home is in a very quiet neighborhood fairly close to the airport. Isobel is very personable and wants to make sure you have everything you need for a comfortable stay.

Its our second time staying here. Its far enough from Dublin to be in the countryside, and close to the airport.
Its very restful and beautiful.
Isobels a generous and lovely host. Loved our stay

Isobel is a great host. Erverything you need is in her house. The garden is very lovely and a really good place to have a coffee or a drink. 
Almu is very good located, supermarcet, ATM, bus station, beach and pubs,all this is in walking distance. 
I can highly recommend it!
Isobel is a wonderful host and her house is very comfortable.
The bedroom is very large, cosy and confortable. We just stay 1 night, but we appreciate the huge and quite beach. The location near the airport from Dublin is perfect to travel.

Isobel is really nice. The garden and the conservatory are beautiful. But the configuration of the room and access to the bathroom was not very practical for us. Besides, the floor of the higher stage does cracking noises when people walks.
Such a unique and absolutely stunning home. You can jump a bus or a train to Dublin, or just hang around Rush for quiet and calm. Isobel was a delight and we got to meet her dog briefly!

I assure you that you will be amazed with this adorable home - photos just cannot do this place due justice!  If you like plants and greenery and a relaxing environment- look no further!  Our only regret was getting in so late in the evening that we did not have time to soak it in.  Isobel is a wonderful, laid back host - very friendly (as we found most every Irish person we encountered, and welcoming.  What an amazing host and country.  Cannot wait to go back!  Thank you Isobel.
Isobels place is a little haven with vines of grapes growing over your head in the conservatory. A very relaxing space. Looking forward to visiting again.

Isobels space made for a very nice place to arrive in Ireland. We stayed 2 nights, and got well rested and time adjusted there. The conservatory space was really a delight to sit in. Isobel and other guests in the house were lovely to talk to. Access to the beach was really close. 

Such a treat!

We choose this delightful spot to catch our flight out of Dublin which is 20 minutes away.  It is very convenient with a grocery store and shops a short walk up the block. Isobel was very helpful and we wish we would have had more time to enjoy her charming amenities.
We spent a week in Ireland and Isobels was out favorite place! Our room was spacious and Isobel is a gracious and caring hostess. Highly recommended.

A short but very sweet stay at Isobels for a nearby family event.  Comfortable and cosy, her home is in a great location for a walk along the beautiful sandy beach whatever the weather. Isobel (and Rinty!) was very welcoming and extremely accommodating. Thanks again!

Of all the places we stayed in Ireland, Isobels was our favorite by far!  Warm hospitality, a spacious room and great location close to the airport.  Isobel was gracious and accommodating.  Highly recommended.
very clean, quiet and with charming furnishings - garden magical

We had a great one night stay before flying out from Dublin airport the next morning. The space was perfect, the kitchen well equipped, and Isobel was a wonderful host. Had great chats with her and other members of the house. We remember our stay fondly and highly recommend!
Isobel has a great place close to the airport and is an amazing host. I strongly recommend staying at her place, wish I had more time.

I would stay with Kirsty again in a heart beat! She is unbelievably friendly, funny, and hospitable. The room you stay in is small but extremely comfortable, that bed with the electric blanket feels amazing to slip into at night. Her whole home is adorable and is such a reflection of her! She really went out of her way to make me feel welcome, but also gave me my space as well. There was a mini fridge with goodies stocked up for me when I arrived, and when I told her I was vegan, the next day she went and bought me vegan ice cream and vegan cheese as well :) She's also extremely helpful and has loads of tips and knowledge of the city. Couldn't be happier with my stay there.
Kirsty is an excellent host, her home is cozy and comfortable, and the location is very convenient - you can be in the city center within 10-15 minutes. Would definitely stay here again!
Kirsty was the best host. Her place is only a 25 minutes walk into town and I felt really welcomed at all times. I would definitely recommend and stay again!
Kristy was an amazing host! I couldnt have asked for a better deal, place, or host. If youre traveling solo, she is host for you!

I loved my stay at Kirstys. Shes a warm, friendly, generous and just a lovely person all around. Tilly and Lefty are adorable dogs. The house is full of character and conveniently located. I would definitely come back for another stay if I find myself in Dublin again.

Kirstey was a very attentive host - wants to make your stay the best it can be. Her place is full of fun. Her place is as described - small and cozy. Not sure if it was mentioned but the bathroom is a ways away from the bedroom - it is down the stairs and through the kitchen area. I was welcome to take a soak in the great tub after a long day of walking through Dublin.  She even has relaxing bath salts for me to use.  It was easy to catch a bus down the street to get to the centre which took about 15 minutes. It felt very safe. Her two dogs are very sweet. Lefty even wipes his feet when he comes in from outside. Delightful.

Kirsty is a kind, fantastic, and attentive host who goes above and beyond what is expected. Her historical cottage is super cute, clean, and warm. I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend staying with Kirsty (and Lefty and Tilly - the two cute, little dogs) in a heartbeat!

I really cant imagine a better Air BnB experience than what Kirsty provided me. She was extremely attentive and friendly, a warm host willing to go the extra mile at all times. She shared her knowledge of the area (and she has a lot!), from the public transportation to the best places to catch a good rock (or country!) band. Kirsty helped make my Ireland experience extra special and I couldnt be happier.

Kirsty is a person who makes people feel safe and accepted. She has a way in having the perfect friendliness at the same time she gives the guest perfect space for privacy as well.  You will be quite alright with her ! 

Place is not far from the town centre. Walkable for those who can. A grocery store nearby, a pub and a coffee house.

I had an incredible time with Kirsty and the dogs in Dublin!
I strongly recommend her accommodation, just a few minutes walk to the city centre.
Shes also very friendly and warm with her guests!!

Kirsty is a thoughtful and easy going host and her dogs are quiet. I visited for a conference and had no issues with this conveniently located place. The room is small but it is a historic cottage so it is to be expected.

This cottage is charming indeed and felt very much like being at home. The tiny garden is a superb splash of colour and the bed is very comfortable. Being able to use the kitchen was a bonus too. Kirsty even did my laundry.

My stay was 5 days long and it was amazing. My plane landed very late and Kirsty met me and my taxi driver right outside so I can find the house in the darkness! Then every morning she offered amazing coffee and some snacks. 
I needed to go to IKEA one day but it was too far away and Kirsty offered to drive me there (!), wait for me (!), and then drive me back with all my stuff! 
Also, once I was moving out she organized a taxi for me. 

The location is not bad, just 1-2km to city center, bus stop 30 meters away

The place was exactly as on photos and dogs are tiny and very cute

I had a wonderful stay at Kirsty's. She's very friendly and accommodating, the place is cozy with awesome decor, and her two dogs Tilly and Lefty are an absolute delight. Convenient location with a 15-20 minute walk to center city and easy access to public transportation. Highly recommend.

A cosy room in a charming cottage a short walk from central Dublin, with public transport virtually on the doorstep and a lively pub just around the corner. Kirsty went out of her way to make me feel at home, was full of helpful tips and advice, offered breakfast every day, and was even kind enough to drive me up to Howth summit so I could take in the view. I couldnt have asked for a more warm and welcoming host!

Kirsty's place was unlike so many Airbnbs. It actually had character which was well thought-out rather than being an antiseptic cube of minimal decor. It felt warm and cozy just like a place you'd want to tuck into after a long day of roaming the streets of a rainy Dublin. The area felt safe and there are a couple worthy restaurants around that you don't need to walk to city centre to enjoy. The pups are very well behaved and are vv cute :D Would recommend staying

Una estancia estupenda, Kirsty es muy muy amable, hospitalaria, atenta y agradable. La casa es muy bonita y acogedora, y muy caliente, lo cual se agradece por el frio exterior. La comunicacion es muy buena y tiene muchas atenciones. Ha sido una gran experiencia, gracias Kirsty.

Outstanding hospitality from Kirsty! This place reminded me of a traditional bed and breakfast experience, and I loved it. Nice quiet street, roughly a 20 minute walk to attractions in the city. I highly recommend Kirstys place (not to mention, her two dogs are adorable!)

My stay at Kirstys was wonderful. I really felt at home with her and her two lovely dogs. We had lovely chats and wonderful laughs during the little moments we shared in the kitchen. The room is small but very cozy: I absolutely recommend it and hope I can be back in the future. Kirsty is so thoughtful to the needs of her guests: thank you is all I can say!
Beautiful home located at the top of the hill with a fantastic view. My family and I stayed here and enjoyed every second of this quaint little house. Hope to come back one day!
Lovely house and space. Great amenities in the house.

Very comfortable house in a perfect neighbourhood of Howth, especially due to the amazing view. Everything very clean and well prepared / organized. Due to the fact that it is a townhouse and therefore neighbours  are very close, it is most suitable for people looking for more silent environments.
Fab location with amazing views. Only a short stroll to the pier. Great weekend with the girls and our little ones. Thanks for all.
Great location. Beautiful home with lots of extras.
Most wonderful house with stunning views of a beautiful place. People involved were amazing . So pleased I made this choice. Will be back for longer next time,
Fantastic little spot that gives perfect access to the sites of Ireland. Paula was an amazing host, and we loved our time in Howth!

Paulas home is a great place to stay. It is very comfortable and decorated very nicely. We especially loved all the wonderful artwork. It was very convenient for traveling to Dublin and the surrounding areas. The town of Howth itself is a great little town. It is beautiful. It has plenty to do with really great pubs and restaurants. I highly recommend visiting.

There is no lack of space or storage in this house. I especially enjoyed the stylish and functional furniture throughout the entire place. Our group of 5 adults spent the majority of our in home time in the combined living, dining and kitchen space. The combo space is enhanced by skylights that make the room airy and pleasantly heated. There are enough couches to easily seat 6 people and plenty of surface space to set down drinks, books, etc. The kitchen is really well equipped for someone who enjoys cooking. There are plenty of pots, pans, cooking utensils, cutting boards, etc. (Finding aprons was fantastic). The minor negative note is the dull knives and scratched teflon that is found in just about all rental kitchens. There's a good butcher, wine shop and deli just down the hill. (Going back up the hill definitely provides you with excellent  justification for a treat).  Getting to central Dublin by car or public transportation is very easy.  Paula responds quickly and efficiently to all communications. To sum, it is a fantastic experience and I would not hesitate to book here again. Finally, I'd be negligent if I didn't  send a shout out to the lovely neighbor who checked us in. Cheers Margaret. It was great to meet you.

Our stay at Paulas home in Howth was the perfect end to our ten days in Ireland. The home sits atop a hill overlooking the harbour and village below. We were walking distance to the sea walk and pubs, many tea shops and restaurants, on another stay we would make Howth our home base. Thank you for a great stay.
A beautiful house, very clean, warm and cosy, very stylish. Generous with groceries being left, very handy for us. Second time for us as a family to have stayed here. We love it.

Paula's place lived up to our expectations. A very bright, airy living space, with everything we needed to make our weekend in Howth very special. The place was spotlessly clean and the beds super comfy. Would definitely recommend and would love to stay there again.
We enjoyed your place, the views were great and would recommend it to anyone.   It was an overall great experience.  we had enough room for our family of 6 and the amenities were top notch!
This is an absolutely great house and gorgeous town. We had an amazing family vacation!
We had a lovely time in Howth - The house is so comfortable and perfectly appointed. It was a great location for exploring Howth, Dublin, and the surrounding region. We would love to return someday!

My family & I really loved this wonderful updated home, its highly recommend.
Incredible location & witnessed beautiful sunset views. Hospitality outstanding, Paula is incredibly personable with a wonderful sense of humor, she had even arranged to have milk, butter, bread available, as well as tea, coffee & sugar. Fabulous amenities & very friendly neighbors who were very helpful.
We even played a few games of chess from their great array of games.
I definitely will return to this lovely home, if they are not fully booked after this review. Ha Ha

We loved at Paula's place. Lots of space, very bright. Tons of amenities. We've never an AirBnb so fully stocked. There were enough to towels to dry a football team. The kitchen was also well-stocked and allowed us to cook meals in some nights. Beautiful location with great view. Washer and drier on premises. The most amazing coffee we've ever seen. A quick drive to the Dublin airport. Close to the center but feels like a small village with great access to cliff hiking and walking along the pier. Excellent restaurants within walking distance (if you are okay with walking up a steep hill). Paula was communicative and helpful. She even let us check out an hour late because of our flight time. Would definitely stay again and a great place to end our three-week adventure in Ireland.
We hebben het erg lekker gehad in dit mooie huis in Howth. Vooral de grote leefruimte is ons erg goed bevallen.
Very comfortable house with everything you need, exceptional host. You will feel right at home.
A great house with amazing living space, location and views. The house was so very well equipped. You really wanted for nothing. So many nice touches included along with the welcome pack.

Paulas house was something out of a book. Picture perfect scenery up a quaint road, with friendly neighbors and everything you could need. The town of Howth is beyond great. It is 25 minutes from Dublin, and worth every minute of the drive as most of it is along the Irish Sea. When you wake up in the morning you can walk to the back patio, and have a clear view of the Irish Sea and the Island known as The eye of Ireland.ù The house has everything that you would need and more, it is stocked up perfectly. Paula even left us a welcoming gift of homemade Irish bread, butter, and milk- all of the finest quality. The home was extremely spacious with two family rooms, a large kitchen, a back room stocked with washer/dryer and a large bathroom w/ heater, 3 bedrooms upstairs as well as a good sized bathroom. A dream home on a magical peninsula. The restaurants and views down the pier were beyond what he expected. Highly Recommend!

This property was exactly as advertised. Very clean and very well appointed. Great location close to Howth village and local amenities. Nice touches from the hosts including basic food requirements on our arrival. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great home in a great location.

Beautiful houseîcomfortable, so much natural light, and with everything we needed for a wonderful family weekend. The view is spectacular! Check-in and check-out were super easy. Thank you for sharing your home with us, Paula and Ivan!
Fantastic location with gorgeous views.   Beautiful home!!

The house is nice and perfectly equipped. Especially the kitchen with coffee machine, two owens, big stove, dishwasher and an incredible amount of kitchenware. A lot of common area for sitting together, comfortable bedrooms with a lot of cabinets and chests of drawers for clothes. Positive is as well, that you will find there prepared basic things like teabags, koffee beans used for installed coffee maker, oil, different spices to flavor food and practical things like plastic bags, papier tissues, etc. 
But some things I have to also criticize: 1. Only very, very small refrigerator for so big house it total nonsense. Luckily was quite cold outside (second half of October) so we were able to let all drinks and part of food outside, but no idea how we would store there food for 5 ar 6 people during summer; 2. Very cold second bathroom in "utility" house which is behind the terrace; 3. Too difficult system how to control heating, hot water, lit a fireplace, etc. And unfortunately in the house book are just very basic information like ûset ON" and it's done. But in fact it is not.

Paula has a beautiful, immaculate and stylish home. The kitchen is very well equipped. Paula was thoughtful in keeping eggs, bread, butter etc in the refrigerator. A detailed manual on just about everything in and around the house made things very easy. The neighbour was very helpful in the check in process. The house is very close to the marina which has many restaurants, bars and some grocery shops. There is a lovely church just 5 minutes away from the house. We loved our stay in Howth.
Great family house with a view. Fully equipped and perfectly located in Howth. Paula is very reactive and always happy to help should any problem arise. We will come back!

A beautiful house in Howth only 5 minutes walk down to the main area (although the hills in Howth are fun). Excellent facilities and great communication with the hosts made everything convenient and easy.

Paulas home is ideally located in the beautiful village of Howth. The house itself is very tastefully decorated with beautiful bedrooms and great space downstairs for gathering together for meals and chats. The kitchen is stocked with everything you could need including cutlery, crockery, glasses, condiments etc. Towels, bathrobes and slippers are also provided which helps cut down on luggage. There is a patio area outside which would be a great gathering place in better weather. There are beautiful views of Howth and the sea from both the front and back garden. 5 of us had a very relaxed weekend and we hope to come back some day. We were welcomed and shown around the house by Margaret and Tom and they were next door if we needed them. Thank you Paula and Ivan.
A very welcoming cozy place and area in the outskirts of Dublin. Susan is happy to help with everything.
Susan was super nice! Lovely place!
Great stay and close to Dublin by train, Susan is super friendly and helpful!
Susan is super thoughtful and kind :) it was a wonderful stay
Susan was a great host and very accommodating. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Wold definitely return
Susan is a great host, the room is clean, comfortable and close to public transport !
A single traveling person founds peace, intimacy and deep sleep in Susan's cosy guestroom. Everything is well prepared and totally clean. Recommended!

Susan was such a great host, super friendly and helpful. Great room if you want a quiet time to yourself. In a beautiful neighborhood right outside of Dublin. The train was also super easy to take and drops you off very close to the house.
Susan was very helpful in recommending things to do and how to get around. The place was clean and I had no issues at all. And it was really nice being so close to the bus stop.

Susan's house is an excellent option for those travelling in or around Dublin. The train station is only a 5 minute walk away and Dublin is only 5 stops away. The house and guestroom are both very clean, and Susan provides everything necessary for an enjoyable stay.

Great location, five minutes from the bus stop and close to the train station. The room was as advertised with enough space for one person. Susan was nice and communicative, even gave me advice on which buses to take during my stay. 

10/10
The room is great and Susan is very friendly! Easily reacheable from the center by bus

Susan and her husband are very friendly and accessible for when you have doubts.  She has a lot of information about the city, compatible accessories so you can load your electronic items, toiletries so you do not worry about taking them.  While it is in a remote area of the city center, do not worry that it is very well connected and around you find Restorant of fast food and minimarket.
Excepcional. Muy detallista y encantadora.
Thanks Susan for the stay!

Susan has hosted me for the last 3 years and I always return because the experience is great. Susan and her family are very friendly towards me and I've grown more fond of their dog every time I visit. Really recommend Susan's place for anyone looking for an AirBnB around the area.

I had a super stay in Dublin helped enormously by staying in Susan's very comfortable home. The description is all it says here and more, and it was outstanding value for money.

Susan's communications and helpful tips and advice were in evidence as soon as I made the booking and got in touch with her, and the room is ideal if you need a comfy base while staying in the Dublin area.

The bedroom and bathroom - the main two areas visitors are likely to experience - were spotlessly clean and tidy, and there were some welcome touches such as a little kettle and bits and pieces to make hot drinks, and many thanks for supplying toiletries such as shower gel - a big help rather than messing about finding small enough ones to take on the plane. The wi-fi was excellent.

Although Susan's home is a bit out of Dublin centre, the train service form the nearby station (10 minute walk tops) is very frequent and gets you into the centre of Dublin in about 20 minutes. I gather there are plenty of buses from a nearby stop, too, but I didn't use them.

One tip you may have read already: get a visitors Leap travel card. For ‚Ç¨19.50 (at time of writing) it gives you train, bus and tram travel including the DART railway and Airlink buses to get you  to and from the airport. It means staying at Susan's makes even more sense as you'll spend next to nothing getting to and from the city.

Thanks Susan!
Susan is a super friendly host, bed is really comfortable and the area was very calm and quiet. Really enjoyed my stay!

Nice stay comfortable clean and warm.
Near to the bus station and near from centrum if you come with taxi.
Susan and her husband are so friendly and welcoming, made me feel like I was home. Thank you again!
Susan was amazing at helping out with local tips and stuff. So nice and welcoming, defiently recommended her if you are coming to the area.
Susan is a great host, very helpful and kind. The room and bathroom were clean. The location is good, about 10 minutes from the train station and 5 minutes from the bus station, very recommended.
Hospitable hosts and cozy room. Pleasure to stay with them.

Absolutely delightful place to stay. When I saw how cheap it was I thought despite good reviews... There must be something wrong!! It was comfortable, clean, quiet and fit the purpose of my stay. I would highly recommend Susan's home

Brian and Sheila went above and beyond in treating Vanessa and me with optimal hospitality and care. Brian picked us up at the train station when we arrived and gave us a detailed explanation of how to use public transport in Dublin to get around. He suggested lots of great places to go for food and drinks and the best times to catch the St. Patrick's Day parade. He would even cook us amazing breakfasts every morning before we'd leave to explore! Not to mention that Sheila has decorated their home with exquisite pieces of art that make their home resemble a chic gallery. Brian and Sheila made our trip extraordinary and memorable! I would highly recommend staying with them!

Brian is not just the perfect host, he IS THE HOST a tourist needs.
We love his house and is kindness, his breakfast and all the advices we needed about our journey.
The home is very very cosy and we sleeped so well. 
We would like to c one back agsin when is possible.

Brian and his wife are two super friendly and kind people. They have helped us with figuring out how to get to places and even prepared a delicious breakfast. Amazing hospitality and awesome bacon! The place is really cozy and the bed is comfortable.

Thanks!
Lovely spot to lay your head and explore the seaside. Close to Howth and the airport. Brian and his wife are lovely hosts and the breakfast was yummy.
A first class Irish warm welcome awaits you at Rosemarys fantastic garden lodge. Its ideally positioned for exploring Skerries and for a train hop into Dublin or further north.

A huge thanks to Rosemary that greeted us.It was important for us because we arrived very late. The house is not big,but very cozy.There is everything you need. Rosemary was always in touch and helped if we had questions. I really hope that we'll be back again!

Rosemary was super accommodating and helpful for local things to check out.  She baked us treats for our arrival and was much appreciated due to a long day of travel.  Super safe and ocean sounds of the seagulls were awesome.  Highly recommend staying at Rosemary's home-you'll never find a better host.  Thank you Rosemary.  Love, Michael and Kami
Immaculate and cozy, 5 minute walking distance to the train station. Rosemary was fantastic. We will definitely pass her details onto our family and friends.

Rosemary is one of the sweetest! She baked us some of the best scones Ive had in the Island and offered much help. She was a great topper for good spots around the area and was located not far from the airport ( Dublin ).
Our host Rosemary made us feel very welcome, freshly baked bread and a fridge full of goodies for us to enjoy.  Accommodation was very comfortable and convenient for both the bus and the train.
What a great place to stay, hospitality was fantastic and the surroundings were lovely. Great home made scones, directions to local sights etc fantastic

Very lovely host. Mary baked my girlfriend a cake, because we arrived at her birthday :)
The check in & out was very flexible and easy. Skerries is a beautiful place near Dublin where we enjoyed the ocean and natural beach.
Many thanks for this nice shorttrip!

Rosemarys place takes the hustle and hassle of the city away. A short half hour from the airport and youd be at home! Skerries, surprisingly, offers quite a good selection of restaurants and the locals are so cozy and friendly! In short, Rosemary, Skerries, Dublin and Ireland combined makes the perfect getaway for us! Thanks again to Rosemary & Michael, my hats off to this outstanding couple!!
Beautiful place with a great location. I loved my time in Skerries and wish we could have stayed longer! Hosts were very welcoming and went above and beyond! Will for sure stay at again.
A very comfortable and convenient private 'granny' flat very well situated for everything Skerries has to offer. A wonderful welcoming host.
Superb communication. Very lovely and comfortable accommodation. Wonderful hosts

Very cosy and clean place to stay in Skerries. Independant 1 room studio with all you need to be happy. TV, microwave, toaster, fridge, nice bathroom, ...). Fridge filled with lots of goodies, coffee, juice, everything was perfect.

Rosemary is a great host. She is a very nice and kind person. She responded quickly. She is very clean. When we arrived she even baked scones for us and left a lot of food in the fridge. Everything was provided - towels, shampoo and even toothbrushes. The place is in a quiet area too.

Rosemary's place exceeded our expectations. The weather was dreadful when we arrived, but her place livened up our spirits. She had made us scones on arrival and had stocked the fridge with different sorts of foods. She made check-in very easy and was extremely nice and helpful. The location of her place is close to harbor, where there is some nice restaurants and views. I would definitely recommend this place to others.

Rosemary provides exactly what is advertised which is great. The location of the garden flat is perfect in a quiet neighborhood. The hospitality unsurpassed. Walking distance from restaurants and beaches.
Rosemarys accommodation is private, comfortable and located near the center of Skerries, and had everything we required and had hoped for.

We enjoyed our stay here. Its a private space, very clean, had everything we need. We asked to check in early and they were able to help us with that, which was very much appreciated!! Its in a quiet town but also very close to Dublin and theres a train station within walking distance. Rosemary also baked us scones for when we arrived and stocked the fridge for us!

Highly recommended. It's perfect for a stay in Skerries. Clean, comfortable, great location and great value. Rosemary is a fantastic host. The selection of food she left for us was great and there was plenty of it. Left us a map and lots of information, taxi numbers etc. Would definitely stay again.
Its quite and beautiful place, handy to DUB airport. Host made a homemade scone for us, thanks a lot!
Excellent hosts very friendly and helpful had a lovely time perfect location and accommodation great

Very nice and cozy, little garden suite! Rosemary was a great host and she was very flexible for our check-in and out, she filled up the fridge with everything we needed for breakfast and the apartment is lovely. Skerries is a great place to stay with lots of restaurants and possibilities for nice walks. We definitely want to come back at some point!
Terrific people! Terrific place! They were amazing hosts and we would definitely come back!!

Had a lovely stay at this colorful apartment. Vanessa was extremely responsive and helpful the entire trip. Would gladly stay here again. If you've visiting Dublin and you're looking for a spot relatively close to...everything in the city, this is the place for you!
Vanessas home was great & a close location to everything in Dublin! Had an amazing trip & I would defiantly stay here again!(:

We loved staying at Vanessas home. It was very close to a Dublin Bike hub where we hopped on bikes to cruise around Dublin-what a fun way to see the city!! It was 10 min by bike to most of the places we wanted to see (Trinity College, Dublin Castle, Castle Bear, etc). Her home was very clean and felt like home away from home. Vanessa was very responsive to questions and gave very detailed information.

Happy with our stay at Vanessas place! Clean, cosy apartment! Only positive things to say except for an unfortunate situation is which the buildings fire alarm went off, so we had to exit the unit one morning.
This home was cozy, bright, convenient, and in an extremely safe neighborhood. The hosts were incredibly responsive and Id highly recommend this place!

Fantastic, modern apartment in a revitalized section of town near the water.   It's very clean and close to several restaurants, coffee shops, and a few grocery stores.   Although not in the city center, it's a short walk into town.   Communication and check-in with Vanessa was easy and prompt.  We would stay here again!
The apartment is exactly as specified. Very clean, well equipped and comfortable. Vanessa is very responsive. Location is great and we had a perfect stay.

Vanessa and Fabiano's place was lovely. It was very clean and a really good location, with a bus stop only a few minutes walk away that would take you pretty much anywhere. They were both so accommodating and lovely people, and were so helpful! Their responses were quick and they even came round to help with a WiFi issue. We honestly couldn't recommend this place more. Thankyou ! :)

Vanessas place was the perfect end to my stay in Dublin. It was in a great location that was close to great food and great sites. I loved the apartments decorations and they had so many goodies and tips ready for me when I arrived. Vanessa and her husband were amazing host as well. If I needed help with anything they were quick to action. Hopefully Ill get to stay with them again!
Lovely home in a great location near loads of public transportation options. You'll love the neighborhood!

Vanessa's place was a perfect home base for my work week in Dublin. It's quiet at night with respectful neighbors and close to most all tech companies, should you be in town for that reason. It's a very safe area and has some decent options when it comes to food and drinks. 
Vanessa was very helpful and communicative all through the trip and I highly recommend her place should it be open for bookings. Thanks so much for the great stay!

I've stayed at 40+ airbnbs during my trip around the world. This was one of the more expensive ones, but it was also by far the best. The place was excellent, the host was excellent, and location was excellent. There were so many thoughtful touches that make it clear Vanessa is an attentive experienced host. I wish every airbnb was up to this very high standard.

This place is wonderful. Centrally located, easy bus access to and from the airport, nice and quiet neighbourhood, great space, friendly host. We are definitely booking again next time we are in Dublin.
Amazing flat really nice hosts who went the extra mile! Would definitely rent again

This place is really amazing and an epitome of hospitality which you can expect out of Airbnb. Perfect location within the heart of Dublin, very thoughtful amenities placed everywhere in house and an amazing interior decor. Vanessa was really smooth in her communications and responses. She indeed is a super host. Would definitely visit again.
The apartment is amazing, it is located in a very nice location and has everything you need, it is also very quiet at night.. it really felt like home. Definitely going back soon
Wonderful apartment, great location, very responsive host! Highly recommended

Vanessas place was perfect for a week long stay in Dublin. It was comfortable and truly felt like a home away from home. The location is great for getting into the middle of the city but far enough away where its quiet and peaceful enough to rest in the evenings. Highly recommended for anyone looking to feel like youre at home while visiting Dublin

This is an exceptional find. Vanessa is wonderful and the apartment is absolutely fantastic. It's very clean, well laid out and very homely.
The little touches Vanessa adds makes all the difference. It a 5 star apartment in a great location, easy access to the city via bus, taxi or walking. I cannot fault this apartment and would recommend it to anyone lucky enough to find it available.

Cozy apartment in a nice, quiet neighborhood!  It is in the newer tech neighborhood but they do have a great old pub called The Ferryman nearby!  Vanessa was very responsive and check in was very easy.  The neighborhood is about a 20 min walk from the downtown part of Dublin.  We liked this because it was quiet and a nice place to recharge after our long days of walking around.  There is a bike share available nearby too!  There are a handful of restaurants and some shops nearby.  We loved this spot called Nutbutter!  Having the washer was a huge plus for us too.  Would highly recommend staying here.  Very comfortable apartment with plenty of space!

We got there later than expected, so the self-check in was worry-free. Venessa thought of a many details in the apartment that made our stay a good one. For example, we forgot to bring electrical plug converters and were impressed that the apartment had several handy. Also a list of nearby restaurants with opening hours helped us quickly find a place for dinner. The area is modern and there were more restaurants and grocery stores nearby than I expected. Overall the apartment was very clean and convenient. Venessa was quick and helpful whenever we had questions.

Vanessa's place is absolutely amazing! I visited Dublin for a business trip and the location of this apartment is great. There are lots of restaurants and amenities nearby and Vanessa even prepared some transportation cards for my convenience. Also, I especially love the chromecast enabled TV for nights that I just want to Netflix and chill!
My stay at Vanessas place was simply wonderful. She  is a perfect host,and the house had absolutely everything and was sparkling clean. It is also very well located. I highly recommend this place!!

Vanessa's place was the perfect home for our trip to Dublin. My husband enjoyed working from the apartment every day, and the wifi was super fast. Vanessa's home is bright, clean, and comfortable. She has all of the things needed for a business or personal trip. I'd recommend staying here, and would love to come again.

Great spacious space!  Location is south of the city in the docks area, but very walkable to all the sites of Dublin.  Space is clean and well supplied.  Vanessa communicates extremely well and provides everything you need for an enjoyable experience.  We would definitely stay here again when we return to Dublin.

I stayed at Vanessa's apartment while in Dublin for work. The apartment is in a great location on a quiet street. The check in process was easy. The apartment is immaculate and very spacious. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in Dublin!
Had a wonderful stay at Vanessas place.  The communication was quick, the local and transportation info was very helpful, and her flexibility with check in was greatly appreciated.  Highly recommend!
Everything was great. I will stay at Vanessa's place next time I am in Dublin.

It is a wonderful apartment which is perfectly located in a great neighborhood! I can only recommend staying there while in Dublin especially if you attend a conference at the convention centre as it is just opposite! Vanessa and Fabiano are great and generous hosts! I had a perfect stay! Thanks to both of you!!
Lovely apartment just as pictured and described. Perfect location for going into center of Dublin by bus ,bike or walking. Communication was great! Vanessa is a super host.

Vanessa and Fabiano were exceptional hosts and the apartment was the perfect home away from home. The apartment is very clean & looks just like the pictures. There is a hairdryer with a diffuser (just FYI for ladies trying to pack light) and they have multiple adaptors for electronics in the apartment as well. They provided many tips and recommendations on all the local spots (i.e. restaurants, pubs, grocery stores), which there are plenty very close by and many within walking distance. The apartment is in a GREAT location with easy to use public transportation close by. Vanessa and Fabiano provided leap cards (public transit card) for us to use and top off with money, saving us the hassle of having to go out and get one at the start of are trip & this way we were able to get to sightseeing as soon as we got there. Communication was fast and they were very courteous- they checked on us right before and at check-in, throughout the trip as needed, and before check-out, always making sure we were ok and had everything we needed. I HIGHLY recommend Vanessa and Fabiano as hosts and their lovely apartment in Dublin! Thank you both again for a lovely stay/experience from Natasha and I both!

I had the fortune of staying in Vanessa's wonderful apartment for a week. The location could not be better, a mere two minute walk from the Bord Gais Energy Theatre. It's the perfect hub whether you're travelling on business or visiting for a holiday. The apartment itself is modern and clean with lots of thoughtful touches and quirky design features. I especially enjoyed the cozy bed and amazing shower. The apartment also has excellent internet so you can plan your day's activities or chill by watching your favourite show in the evening. The apartment has everything you need with every home comfort to feel like you're staying at a home away from home. Highly recommended and would definitely stay again.

It was a very enjoyable stay
Vanessa is a great host
A
A lovely apartment in a great location. Vanessa is a fantastic host.

Vanessas place is tastefully decorated, and is spotlessly clean. It is located right at the heart of grand canal dock, which makes it easy to find restaurants and convenience store. Vanessa is quick in replying her message. She provided clear check in instruction for me, which makes check in a breeze.

A beautiful apartment in the best location of Dublin!
All the great touristic places are 20-25min walk (Dublin Castle, Temple Bar, beautiful parks like Stephen's Green, Merrion Sq. etc). Plenty of nice restaurants just few minutes away. We had a really pleasant time staying in the apartment.
Stylish, colorful apartment. Comfy bed, modern building with elevator, easy check-in and great location close to tech companies, restaurants, pubs.
Hosts were extremely responsive and the listing was in the perfect place for my work trip. Will be looking for this listing the next time I travel for work.
Everything was perfect, Julie is very kind and helpful.  Living is in beautiful part of city. Definetly recommend it.
Julie's place is simply great...a large house with stylish and comfortable (Website hidden by Airbnb) wife and I and our friends felt at home...this place has everything!

Mooie en ruime woning. Kamers zijn groot genoeg en badkamer is super. 
Er is een living beschikbaar en ook de keuken voor ontbijt is praktisch en ruim.
Op 5 min wandelen naar de bus en dan 45 min op bus voor centrum Dublin. Zelf met auto kan ook natuurlijk maar wij verkozen het gemak van openbaar vervoer (8,60 ‚Ç¨ voor 2 volwassenen en 2 kinderen)
Met de auto een 45 minuten van de mooie Wicklow Mountains en 20 minuten van de luchthaven.
Zeker een aanrader als je niet in het centrum zelf wil verblijven

Very comfortable house and nice environment. 
We recommend your house
Great space and great local tips! Thanks.
It was a nice stay. Good for sightseeing in Dublin and around. Very good connection to the airport by car.
Julie has a beautiful home and can offer excellent recommendations about the surrounding area.

The location was not easy to get to from Dublin Airport. It would have taken us over 1.5 hours by public transport, and with luggage, that would¬¥ve been strenuous. Instead we ended up renting a car. 

Location is nice and quiet with small stores all around,  Breakfast place around the corner was great as well as the Sushi Restaurant.

We took the car into Dublin and paid very high rates for public parking, as public transport system seemed to difficult.
This place is a must if visiting Dublin, its just on the outskirts. The rooms were spotless, the breakfast was plentiful. Julie and Dave are fabulous hosts really friendly and welcoming. Just perfect
Very nice place, very friendly host. Helpful tips.

We enjoyed the stay.
Place is great, clean and spacious. Breakfast included.
Host is nice and very helpful.
Parking in front, around 30-45 min  drive to city center, depend on traffic.
I recommend
Nice place in Dublin. Walking distance to the city. Tipps were awesome!

A very nice accommodation. The room was tidy and clean. The electric blanket was lovely. Bathrooms are shared (as you can read in the description) but this is not a problem at all. We found both bathrooms clean tidy and free every time. The (Hidden by Airbnb) are lovely and helpful if you need something. I reccomand it!
Very nice hosts and good location: the bus stop to get to the city center is right around the corner. Aside from some minor things everything seemed mostly clean.

Great value for a place which was walking distance to downtown. Johnathan, Ed, Clare, and Juliane were all good hosts and fun to have a chat with. Use of the kitchen was awesome and the guys were very gracious and kind when my wife accidentally broke their French press. Thanks for a great stay!

Excellent location. Full access to the kitchen.
Hosts are very nice. 
The house itself is a little bit old, but everything works as needed.

We had an amazing 5 nights stay here. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. They had exceptional communication. It is a very convenient place, with a bus stop close by and a Tesco and The White Moose Cafe around the corner. Also, a beautiful walk through the campus grounds is close by. Having access to Netflix and Playstation is a big luxury. This place will always be the first choice for us and comes highly recommended.

The house was a bit far from city centre (30/40 min stroll from Temple bar) but it was spotless clean and very charming. Its also a very quiet neighbourhood so we could sleep very well. The room was very cozy, the bed was comfy and both bathrooms were nice. 

We didnt use the kitchen as we only came back to sleep but it was well fitted. 

We didnt interact very much with the hosts but communication was very good. The guide was really useful! I would recommend you check the location of the house before arriving as some apps shows several locations under the same street name so if you arrive late at night its a bit annoying. 

We recommend them!
A really nice place to stay

Great, affordable place to stay while youre in Dublin. I personally think its a great spot to stay if you want to feel like youre a Dubliner and part of the city. Its about a 20-25 minute walk to the City Centre where all the action is. Otherwise there a few good restaurant spots and local pubs right the corner. Be sure to read the guide provided and just ask people where to go because everyone is so friendly. Cheers!
I enjoyed a lot Dublin. They were very friendly and I felt really comfortable there
Central location with friendly, helpful hosts.
Very nice place to stay and in a nice area

Jason was very reactive and welcoming regarding our last minute demand. The bedroom was perfect, the access to kitchen free, and you can be on the see front around 20min by walk, 15 by bus.
But above everything, Jason will do the impossible to make you feel good and confortable and provide you the best stay experience.
We strongly recommand to meet him!!!

Host was a friendly guy and left us to come and go as we pleased. 

The house itself didnt quite live up to expectation. We spent all our time in the bedroom as the living room was a bit shabby, and the kitchen a little dirty looking.

Would be happy to recommend if youre staying a short period and wouldnt be in the house very much.
I Spent one night in J's place, everything was perfect. Cleaned house and J was very kind in waiting me until late. Excellent service!
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
As a frequent guest, I couldn't recommend Aidan's place highly enough. I really enjoyed my stay and look forward to my next visit.
Aidans place is perfect for staying in Dublin. Right by bus stops so it is very easy to get into the city. He suggested some great places to visit and eat.
Aidan is a super friendly host. We got a ton of tourist informations. The apartment was clean and cosy. You feel like staying at a friends place. I can recommend you this place. Thanks Aidan :)

Aidan is an amazing host. We had a really great time at his cottage! He is super friendly, very helpful and provided us with lots of great tips on where to eat and what not to miss. We had some very interesting and great conversations with him. And we unexpectedly even had the opportunity to enjoy his fantastic cooking skills. ;-) The cottage was very cosy and clean. The bed and our room were very comfy and quiet. We felt at home right away. The location of the cottage is also perfect. We can only recommend this place for staying!
We had a great time at Aidans place! Aidan was a great host, the space was cosy and everything we needed. Great location and good value for money. Definitely recommend for a weekend away!
Aidan was a great host, made us feel extremely welcome during our trip and offered lots of useful advice about where to go and what to see
Great value for Dublin and very genuine guy :)
Aidan is a very nice and friendly host and he made us feel at home. He also allowed us to leave the luggages in the house on the last day, even with a very short notice. Highly recommended. ;)

Aidan's a great host, ready to help and fun to talk to. He didn't mind us checking in late (due to delayed flight), provided us with all the information we needed and even helped us with a couple of coins when we needed them for the bus to Howth. Even though we were out most of the time, Aidan's place felt like home and had everything we needed, and more. Location is quite good as well. We'd certainly stay there again.

Aidan was very welcoming, he gave us tons of tips about Dublin and even answered our questions about local things we were not sure to understand.
The cottage is close to the city center, we mainly used the bus as there is a stop 20 meters from Aidan place, that frequently brings you in the center in no time.
Aidan is a wonderful and caring host, totally recommend him!
Cozy spot for a short stay ì the description is very accurate. Aidan is also a great host ì he was very helpful with tips to navigate the city, public transport, recommendations, etc.

Nice located near busses, pubs and kiosk.
Short walking distance to trains and the city centre.
Aidan is very welcoming to his home, has a lot of tips about the city and that is just lovely to hear from a local and not a company.
Not the last time we visit Dublin indeed.
Convenient location and homely place to base yourself for a Dublin trip. Aidan is very accommodating and helpful.
Aidan was an amazing host! I will most definitely be coming back next time Im in Dublin :)
Great stay at Aidan's home. I recommand
Aidans been very thoughtful and kind since our first contact. His house is cosy and in a great location to easily reach the city center. I highly recommend him ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Aiden was really kind and very helpful host. He made us feel very comfortable during our short stay in Dublin
Great location and value. Aidan is a great host and will help make sure your time in Dublin is fantastic.
Fantastic stay! Aidan gave us some great local advice about many parts of Dublin, and was extremely warm and welcoming. Would definitely recommend and will be back if we're ever in the area!
Great host and location, sparkling clean room. Aidan is a super host who makes you feel at home in his place.

Aidan is a great host.
He answered quickly to our questions, he gave us a lot of good tips.
His place is exactly like the description, very clean and comfy.
Aidan is very nice and welcoming.
If we come again in Dublin, we surely try to stay here again.

The place was great and well located. The bed was really comfotable and the neighborhood was calm. It takes only 4 bus stops to get to the center. Aidan was really nice to us and easy going.  We higly recommand this place
Amazing home at a amazing family. Every morning fresh breakfast. incredible friendy. Everything is clean. I really enjoyed the stay at this home. i can really recommend this place!
Brian helped me with everything. It was like he was always going the extra mile with me.

Right next to the coast of Bull Island (my favourite corner of Dublin). Excellent spot for morning walks by the beach before starting your day. 4 minutes from the Dart train station and Dublin Bus on the main road.
Cosy and warm home with Brian and Sheila constantly making sure you have a pleasant stay.
Thanks guys!

So good I had to return! This is a great stay with great hosts! Very clean, comfortable, friendly, convenient to the city centre with excellent public transport links. The seafront is literally just around the corner. The cooked breakfast and tea/coffee in the mornings set you up perfectly for your day.

My staying was just perfect!! The house is beautiful and Brian and his wife are really lovely people. The location is very good connected with bus and train and there is also a small supermarket nearby. Absolutely recommended!!
A Clean, quiet house  with safe parking is top of my list while I'm working away from home. Brian's place is exactly that and also its close to everything that I need while I'm in Dublin City.

Brian and his wife have a wonderfully artisan like home with fantastic colours and design that makes you feel immediately warm, comfortable, and welcomed as soon as you arrive. The location is amazing in the fact that it is so close to the water with refreshing walks and breathtaking scenery to be had, but a short, short walk to the train station to do all the exploring youd like to do in the city and beyond. Breakfast was top notch and only topped by the conversation that went with it! I highly recommend adding this place to you Airbnb experience!
Wonderful breakfasts, tips for getting around the city, and excellent communication!

So nice, we stayed twice! We also decided to stay the evening before we had to catch an early morning flight. It was super easy to get to the airport in the morning and Julie made an early check-out super simple!
Julie was so lovely! She was very helpful in helping us learn how to get around the city and the accommodations were very comfortable!

Julie and David are great hosts and we had everything we need! The rooms were clean und special designed. We had many options on breakfast - thank you!
We recommend this place!
Nickel ;)

The host David warmly received us, the room was clean and tidy, the bathroom was beautifully decorated, and the 5 people lived comfortably.¬† The location of the house is between the airport and the city, convenient for check-in and parkingÔΩ°We will recommend this house to friends.

This is a BNB and people should be aware that there is a lot of shared space with the home owners. This isn't a problem so long as you are aware that this is the case.  The space provided was exactly as described and quite suitable for the purpose we intended.  A separate bathroom, shared between the two rooms we rented served us well, although a few  people seemed to have an issue getting hot water for their showers. There are coffee shops and pubs a relatively short walk and the airport is fairly convenient. Overall,  it was a good value and pleasant stay.
Julie is a very friendly and helpful person. The apartment is very big and clean.
Accommodations are clean and close to good restaurants.
Very convenient if you have a flight from Dublin.
So clean and functional. Worm hospitality and good advices. Highly recommended.
Lovely home with lots of modern and stylish touches. Hosts were very friendly and hospitable. Very clean and comfortable. Opposite a park with a playground which was helpful for our youngest child.
it was a great place to stay!

Wonderful space, convenient to Dublin and to airport, public transportation nearby. Thoughtful, well traveled  host who has designed the space and amenities with other travelers in mind. Clean, comfortable, welcoming. Would stay here again as our preferred location for Dublin area
Great place, sparkling clean.

Very stylish flat with loads of wonderful pictures of Julie's travels from all over the world.  Very comfortable, lots of room for large groups, and Julie went out of her way to help us when we got in very late and even had to stay late due to a rental car issue.  She is a wonderful and helpful host and I can't recommend her enough!
Beautiful space, convenient to the airport.

Our stay at Julies place gave us very convenient access to Dublin city and Dublin airport. Julie was so helpful, allowing us to drop our bags in early and giving us suggestions for seeing the city with limited time. 
The beds were very comfortable and the house equipped with everything we needed. We were grateful for a continental breakfast before an early departure. 
If we had more time there was a lovely outdoor area to enjoy but we chose to walk and eat at the local pub which is 5 star and a 2 minute walk away. 
This was a perfect stopover and Julie is a great host.
Julie is such a great host. Everything is as u see it and she went out of her way for us. Thanks for a great stay Julie. X
Very nice!
Julie is very kind and her appartment is really spacious and close to Dublin. The breakfast was very good. We recommend!
strongly reccomend Julia's place. great location , nice house , everything was as good as we expected.
Julie and David are kind and helpful people and their house in Ongar is really cosy. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the place to anyone.
Frances is an excellent host. Friendly, welcoming and great with communication. She has clearly put a lot of thought into being a host and it shows in all the touches. Very highly recommended

This is a great find. Frances is a fantastic host and multiple times on my trip went the extra mile to help. The location is in a residential area and near a bus stop, so the city centre is easily accessible in no time. The room was clean, fresh and had a towel, kettle and a mini fridge.
Very good option for overnight stays. Convenient if you need to visit UCD.
Frank and her dogs are very friendly hosts. I had a cozy stay at her place.

Frances is friendly person ready to help and make your trip in Dublin the most comfortable experience. Great location at minutes walk from the UCD and well connected to the airport. Strongly raccomended

Really Nice House, and great hospitality.
I¬†m happy to have been here
Really enjoyed my stay with Frances. It's a small room but super cosy, lovely home, very clean, and the room has a little coffee machine and fridge. Perfect!

Even though the space was shared, I had complete privacy and this was probably my best Airbnb experience ever. Frances could not have been a more gracious host, leaving me so many delicious snacks and offering to give me lifts. I left feeling as if I had made a friend...

Compact, comfortable, nicely accessorized room. Bathroom and shower right beside.
Helpful hosts.

Charming space in a historic home with lots of personal touches. The living room and kitchen are spacious,  with big windows and natural light. It was a good space to convene and relax. Although there is a night club in the lower level, the noise did not bother us.  Enda was a good host and accommodating of our check-in and check-out needs.

Enda's place is very comfortable and perfectly located near St. Stephen's Green so one can visit all amazing museums and other sites of central Dublin.  Enda and his partner live in a 300+ year old building so it has a cozy, baroque feel with all kinds of artwork throughout.  It is wonderful.  Enda charmed our 5 year old, and I would 100% recommend this for families with young children.  Thanks again!

As other reviewers have stated, Enda has a lovely home and the location is great. I did feel very welcomed as a guest, wine and snacks were left for me when i arrived. However, I would say to expect a more lived inù space than other Airbnbs- it very much feels like someones house, including a bit of clutter and not the cleanest place Ive stayed in (nothing alarming, just like youre staying at a family members home more than a clean space). For a large family using all the beds this would be a better value. As a single traveler or couple, I think I wouldve preferred a smaller, more tidy space. If you are looking for character and coziness, this place is good.
Lovely base for our family to return to after days of adventuring around beautiful Ireland. Enda was full of tips and gave us great recommendations. Positive experience!

This is a very much lived in apartment in a charming old building. Great location, easy access and walking distance to the heart of Dublin. There is a great deal of neighborhood noise throughout much of the night but we were prepared for that. Enda was very responsive to messages and provided suggestions about things to do and see.

Enda was a great host which made for a very convenient and enjoyable stay. The apartment is very large and filled with charming antiques and trinkets.  Great location. Although there is a night club in the basement of the building, noise only really came in through the windows - but that is to be expected on Leeson street. Thanks again Enda everything Enda, we had a great time!

This is a great place to stay, very roomy and very close to the city centre.  A bit quirky with the decor and furnishings, but we liked that.  Great host, with some provisions laid in for us which was an unexpected bonus.
great flat in a great location. Enda is a top bloke

This is a special place to stay for those who value art and the coziness that comes from staying in someone's actual home.  This is comparable to going and staying with very accommodating relatives.  This is not a minimalist house, and sports the everyday flaws of our own homes, but it has immense character.   We loved the various art and collections on display, and felt very comfortable.  Enda is extremely charming and took the time to give us thorough recommendations for the area although he was running late for his road trip.  Patti was hospitable as well and we had great conversation before they set off on their own journey.  We would highly recommend.
Really great place. Was a bit noisy from bar below.
Amazing place! Great host!
Great location, great hospitality, very flexible and great communication!
A beautiful old home, with some modern facilities, in a very good location.  Would not hesitate to go again.
clare is a great host I would recommend people stay with her you get a great view if you go for a walk around

Clare was an excellent host, and this was the best Airbnb Ive stayed in. Her hospitality was truly unmatched. Its a bus ride from the center of Dublin, and the neighborhood has shops around as well. If I ever make it back to Clontarf, I know exactly where Ill stay :)
Clare was very sweet and made me feel right at home
Clares home is in a picturesque part just outside of Dublin. One bus takes you from within 100 yards of her home into city centre. The amenities in Clares home were outstanding. Clares home is

I'm so amazed about the hospitality and the kindness of Clare. You will rarely find a host like her. She was like a mom, we had lovely conversations, she drove me to the center and to the airport and we went together to Howth... I definitely recommend her place without any hesitation & I would love to come back. Thank you so much.

Ive never been so comfortable staying at an Airbnb in my entire life. This is my second experience and the first time alone so I was a bit nervous staying at a accommodation hosted by a stranger. But Clare is the sweetest lady Ive ever had the privilege of meeting and your stay will be welcomed by a warm-hearted lady. She made sure that I had everything that I needed and gives tremendous hospitality to her guest. I highly recommend you to stay here. Next time I come to Dublin, Clare will be the first person I ask if there is room to stay. Shes the best. Thank you Clare for everything!
Everything is good. Its a very beautiful house. Very very clean.
A lovely home & a relaxing, trouble free stay. Plentiful breakfast foods available & Clare was very amenable. Close to bus stop & beautiful park. Will be back.
Clare's place is at a great location, easy to get around with public transportation. A comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Clare was also very helpful and friendly. Totally recommend it.
Stay with Clare! She is so sweet and so generous! Her place is a short bus ride from the City center and the bus stop is right at the end of the block. I highly recommend staying with Clare!
Lovely place, as described. Clare was a delightful and thoughtful host. Highly recommend.
Comfortable room in a pleasant suburb of Dublin. Kind and accommodating host, tasty breakfast and a beautiful home.

Clare is  a great host.
It is fin. You dont have to worry about it.
She always help us.

Clare is absolutely fantastic. So kind and accommodating and her home is lovely as well. I havent slept better in months. Easy access off the 130 bus and communication was great. Would love to visit again!

Clare is a wonderful host and her home was a pleasure to stay in. Traveling alone did not feel lonely with such a warm home to return to.
