I would highly recommend staying with Clare to anyone, especially females traveling alone. As it is an extremely nice and safe neighborhood.  I really enjoyed the location, it was great to get a break from the city. Bus transportation to the city was very convenient as well. Clare goes above and beyond. My stay was so pleasant, I highly recommend.
Clare was such a great host. Really nice and had a lot of great tips for the city.
Very nice hospitality.  Clare makes every effort to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
Clare was very welcoming, and was very quick to respond to all my messages and questions. The room and bathroom were very clean! Thank you!
Clares place is in the suburb of Dublin and is very accessible. I had an awesome stay. Breakfast in the morning and very close to attractions (city center) or further.
Clare is a lovely host and she made me feel like home in Dublin. The place is beautiful and you can easily take the bus to the city centre.
Clare is really helpful and the accommodation was small, but absolutely clean with all needed amenities. I highly recommend this place for a short stay in Contarf!
Clare is amazing and her house was amazing!! She was so sweet and kind and offered great suggestions including going to the city of Howth!! My experience was the best!
I had a great stay at Clares place! She is an absolutely amazing host and the room was so nice as well! Would definitely stay again if I come back to Dublin and would recommend to anyone visiting!
Highly recomended.  Imaculately clean. Lovely peaceful house in. Great location. Great host with great communication.
Clare was nice and hospitable, her place is clean and got a good location. Easy to locate and the bed was very comfortable.

Clares lovely home is in a lovely, quiet location if youre looking for a change of pace from Dublin City centre.  Take a walk in St. Annes Park, especially if the rose garden is in bloom. The bed was huge and comfortable.  The bathroom was nice.  The breakfast was plentiful.  Thank you, Clare!

Clare is an amazing host! Our room was beautiful and everything very clean. We had breakfast every morning in the house and she always offered tea at any time! We had nice chats with her and she also showed us around, she took us to the Clontarf castle. Such a great time, I highly recommend it!
Clare is so friendly and hospitable. Her home is warm and welcoming..The room is spotless and very comfortable.Would definitely stay again and would reccomend Clare's to anyone.

I stayed with Claire for 2 nights on a business trip. Claire was most welcoming and helpful with information about the area. Her home is beautiful and I would highly recommend it to you. I hope I will return to Claire's home again in the future.
Super place to stay with a very relaxed and friendly host.

I had a great stay at Clarens place. It's very homely and she offers a nice breakfast. There's a fantastic Park nearby, perfect for a walk or a picnic. And there are several nice pubs to grab a bite and a pint. Also, easy to access the city by bus.
Clare was lovely to stay with. She offered suggestions of places to eat as well as a ride in to town. The bus line to town is very conveniently located.
Claire went above and beyond and was an amazing host!
Clare is a great host - love staying there, great place
Great communication. Easy check in. Warm hospitality- nothing is too much. I will stay with Clare again.
Our stay with Clare was wonderful. Communication went super smooth and Clare gave us a lot of useful advice on what to do and see. Also, the area is very nice and quiet- a good place to stay!

A very great place. If you want to visit Dublin you can go there by bus 3 min walk to the stop and 20 min drive. Clare has many hints what to see and where to go. She is very nice and helpfull woman. Everything is clean and lovely. I would stay there again!

A perfect choice. A location away from the town, well connected, calm and relaxing near the ocean for a walk in the morning or in the evening. 
I did not miss home for a moment and I mean it as true as my words read. The home is very comfortable and clean indeed. Top it up with Ms. Clare's  hospitality and guidance right from the time of reservation of the the stay - I must say I had a very good time.

This has been by far my best Airbnb stay ever !! Clare is such a nice person and her house is so peaceful  I was actually sad to leave ! Haha If you are planning to visit Dublin, you would be lucky to stay at Clares !
First time doing AB&B and with Clare it went spectacular. She is very helpful and accommodating to her guests, so nice!
Clare is very nice and kind. The room is very clean, comfortable and quite.
Great place to stay. Very clean and comfortable room. Clare was very warm and helpful. She is great host.

Clare is a lovely host who provides great tips for the area and directions for getting around. Her place is lovely and the bed very comfortable. I highly recommend her home to anyone on a short visit to the Clontarf area.
I had the best airbnb stay at Clares house so far. She is a great host and I had really a fantastic time. I would recommend staying there especially for solo female travellers. ‚òòÔ∏è

Clare is passion and welcoming.
The room is much better than I think.
Everthing is good.
Easy to get into city centre.
Recommend
Great spot with access to st. Annes park and easy.bus access to town.
Ticked all the boxes, friendly hosts, very helpful, great location and the hosts were very accommodating to early arrival.
Very friendly and absolutely wonderful!
wonderful stay - great neighborhood and lovely space

Conors place was clean and had a very unique charm! The close by pubs and restaurants were wonderful and cozy! The commute to Dublin was a little farther than expected! Communication was fast and friendly! The pull out couch bed was a little different than we thought it would be but we made it work! Overall we had a wonderful experience at Conors!
Excellent location, comfortable accommodation and a warm welcome

Conors place is just as described.
Very warm and cosy with a super hot shower and a fabulous garden to gave that morning coffee!
Location Location Location!
5 minute walk to Aviva and to Sandymount Green for great coffee pubs and restaurants!  Buses trains and taxis right at your doorstep ..... I will most definitely be back

This lovely self contained basement flat is a real home from home with a good sized sitting room, small kitchen good for cooking in and access to the back garden. Sadly the weather was too cold for us to use this but it was large and inviting. The bedroom is a large double with a small shower within it. It is slightly dated but works very well. The cloakroom is separate with the basin with limited ventilation, which might be a challenge if 4 of your were staying. The sofa bed in the sitting room suited our 11 year old well but might be cosy for two adults. Additionally the glass of the front door and window beside it are not curtained so morning light might be a problem for those sleeping in the sitting room. 

Conor and Sabine couldnt have been better TH hosts. They greeted us on arrival and departure, responded immediately to any queries and produced everything we needed. They went above and beyond.

Only thing of note is that you do tend to hear the family above in the mornings, so if you are not early risers this might prompt a wake up call!

Overall highly recommended and we would love to return. Thank you Conor and Sabine!

Location was probably good. But we couldnt get around Dublin very easily. Parking the 2nd day was hard to find. It wasnt as clean as we expected, smaller than the photos indicated and just ok. Back yard was lovely and in nice weather it would be nice to sit out there.

The place is 20 minutes bus from city. It is in a nice area with great pubs, and restaurants. The unit is clean and warm. Spacious. Good facilities. Connor was great, looked after our bags for the first day. We had arrived very early. We were in and out to central Dublin and had a great time.
Cosy place, close to the center of Dublin. Easy communication with host.
Great host. Really lovely apartment with a super selection of books and movies.

Lovely lower level space, clean, and access to the back garden is lovely. Kitchen is well equipped and clean. Hosts were very responsive to any issues we had and we loved the village of Sandymount, such an easy walk. Also regular buses into central Dublin stop very near the front door, and lovely to get out of the downtown in the evenings for the local eateries and quiet streets.

My friend and I stayed at Conors place and it was perfect for what we needed. It was walking distance to stores and close enough to the city. It was nice to not stay right in the city and have a little retreat away. It was a great experience. The apartment was wonderful and super cozy.
Very friendly host, nice Appartement, very nice Garden, well connected to Public Transport

First, I need to express my gratitute to Conor for helping me out of a jam.  My passport fell behind the dresser and Conor found it, then mailed it to our hotel in Ennis.  Thanks a million.   The apartment was perfect.  Plenty of space.  Parking right outside on the street.  Clean and all the amenitities needed.  Because of the rain, we didn't get to use the yard until the last day but this extra space is a nice touch.  Bus picks up across the street and only 10 minutes to Trinity college.  Perfect stay.
Great place to stay in Dublin!

This is a great location with many restaurants and cafes within walking distance. Our favorites were the Girl and the Goose and Al Boschetto. Conor's place was very clean and the backyard was lovely. I only wish it had been warmer so we could have enjoyed coffee and breakfast at the table outside. We rented a car and parking out front was not a problem by late afternoon. It does get very bright in the morning, but I sleep with an eye mask so I was not bothered by it. The shower is located in a different room than the toilet and sink, but this is helpful when you have three people trying to get ready in the morning. Conor is a very friendly and helpful host.

Conor's place is very convenient to many great pubs and restaurants (we had a delicious dinner at the Merry Cobbler our first night in Dublin!).  The backyard is beautiful.  We found the guidebook very useful and really appreciated thoughtful additional touches like a couple of toys that were set out for our toddler to play with during his stay.  Thank you for hosting us!

Great location, friendly host!
We stayed in this great flat in June 2019. This good sized, very comfortable, 1 bedroom flat is an excellent base from which to explore Dublin. The flat is within a short walk to the delightful Sandymount Village, with its supermarkets, pubs and specialty shops. The bus into the city centre stops almost opposite the front door. Access is via a short flight of steps down from the footpath level and the shower is small, so visitors with limited mobility may want to look elsewhere. Despite being under the main house, there is quite a lot of natural light from the back windows, and guests can access the delightful backyard (if its not raining in Dublin!). It is worth noting that the flat is only 10 to 15 minutes to the ferry terminals. The only downside on our visit was a plumbing issue that our host worked hard to rectify. Conor is a friendly and helpful host. We would stay again!

The place is lovely and tasteful decorated. The family added some fresh flowers which made the place smell lovely and feel like home.
It had all the amenities I needed and located in a nice area and easy to get around. Perfect for a weekend get away.
I attended a concert at Slane Castle and it was relatively easy to get there from the apartment. 
Id definitely stay here again for future visits.
Thanks a lot, Conor & family.
Good basic unit. Very handy to shops and public transport. Has everything you might need.
Great location, and communication. Would definitely stay again!

Conors place was perfect for us to stay during our recent trip to P!nks gig at the RDS Arena.

The flat below Conors main house has everything you need as a home away from home!

Unfortunately we werent there long enough to enjoy the sunshine in the attached garden.

Top communication from Conor made this an excellent spot for our trip! Highly recommmended!

We had a great stay at Conor's apartment for two nights with our 1-year old son. It's a short walk to Sandymount with lots of cafes and pubs to choose from, and Conor provides a booklet with great recommendations. We took the train (DART) into center city Dublin and found it very easy to use and was only 2 stops away. The apartment itself is small but has all that you need. Our son enjoyed toddling around the backyard and sitting at the tiny picnic table, and we enjoyed that we could put him to sleep in the bedroom and still enjoy the living room and deck (after staying in one room hotels earlier in our trip, this was a luxury!). One thing to keep in mind that is not super clear from the listing is that the bathroom is split with the toilet off the living room, and the shower stall in the bedroom. Overall, great value and we enjoyed the apartment and location.

Great little space! Nice and homey with a large collection of books to leaf through, and a washer and clothesline for some emergency laundering! Within walking distance of a few nice restaurants and pubs, as well as some pretty scenery. Very close to the stadium if you're visiting for an event! This space made my first night in Ireland a nice experience.

For our first trip to Ireland, we 3 ladies from the U.S. saw Conors Bright and Spacious Apartment and Back Yard as a welcoming, sparkling & cozy accommodation. What we found when we entered was the FARTHEST from that.  The apartment was cold, dark and filthy with live spiders in the kitchen and cobwebs on the exposed drawer of silverware. The toaster was grimy and had not been cleaned in a very long time. The picture of the brown leather leather sofa with the orange pillows, we thought, was the pull out sofa. When we removed the cushions, flying bugs came out and there was dirt, cobwebs and crumbs.  There was NO hot water to wash our hands nor instructions how to turn it on.  We ended up starting the shower for some warm water.  Some one elses used soap and toiletries were in the shower. We went outside to the back deck and my sister stepped on a piece of rotten wood and fell through, twisting her ankle.  There is not a little white table and two chairs on the deck as the Conors pictures show.  The back yard was full of twigs and leaves, as was the trampoline and hammock.  The BBQ promised to be available for use was full of spiderwebs and had NO propane.  Hanging on the clothesline by the BBQ were sheets and towels, I imagine from the previous guest.  In the apartment, the only place to hang clothes is in an armoire.  It had 8 hangers, three of which were child size.  The clothes rack under the stairs had many coats and childrens clothes taking up space. The pots and pans on the stove and microwave are stored there because there is no room in the cabinets under the counters.  They are full of cleaning supplies. The walls and floors were mucky and unclean.  All in all,  a very unsanitary, unsafe and uninhabitable apartment.  We were and are highly disappointed to the extent we could not stay in those conditions.

When Conor greeted us, we expressed our concerns. We showed him the sofa, the kitchen and the back yard pointing out the rotted piece of decking that my sister stepped on.  Conor discounted everything we said and he NEVER apologized for any of it. Regarding the deck, he said Well, sometimes you have to replace a piece of wood, like I did over there.ù (pointing to a board that was newly replaced). Regarding the uncleanliness, Conor offered to clean the place while we waited. Conor said the person who watches his children did the cleaning for him this time because he was out of town. Conor told us Good cleaning people are hard to find in Dublin, thats why I do it myselfù.  The brown sofa was not the sleeper he stated.  The blue one was but when we pulled out the seat and back cushions, the was hard wood underneath.  The description says it is suitable for 4 guests. Maybe two adults and two very small children, certainly NOT 3 or 4 adults. There were only 2 sets of linens set out even though Conor knew there were 3 of us arriving.  We could not find another set of towels. Regarding the hot water situation, Conor told us there was a timer under the cabinets by the sink that controls the hot water.  There were no instructions in the manual about turning on the timer or how to activate the hot water, only instructions about the shower.

We told Conor that we just could not stay in these conditions and that we were going to a hotel.  It happened to be Pride weekend in Dublin and there were thousands of people in town. I said to Conor,  Since we are not staying, you can rent it out easily with as many people that have converged onto Dublin.  You wont have a problem.ù  Conors response to me and my guests was,  I cannot cancel the reservation and rent it again because that will affect my SUPER HOST STATUS and I will lose that distinction.ù  We all looked at him in disbelief. I asked him what sort of compensation he could provide since we were not staying and he only offered the cleaning deposit returned.  He said, Many people love this place, thats why I am a Super host.ù  Conor never once apologized, acknowledged our concerns or asked how my sisters ankle was.  Being more concerned with his status rather than the comfort of his guests does not make one a super host. I am appalled and dismayed at Conors lack of respect and integrity.  If this is the experience Conor wants to provide to first time guests to Ireland, I would never come back.  Thank goodness we ended up in a nice hotel for the final part of our vacation.
This is a really good place

Lovely outdoor space in backyard, basement apartment . We took early am tours out of town so had to walk an hour to those pick up points as buses don't run early enough but otherwise the location in Sandymount offers relief from the hustle and bustle of Dublin proper
Nice outdoor space, easy to get to waterfront, easy train ride to another seaside town, close to bus and transit
Great stay ! The place was well located, the garden amazing and hosts were reactive and careful. I would recommend this place

We loved staying in Dublin at Conor's cozy nook! It was such a sweet spot to start our trip to Ireland at. Not only was it conveniently located to the train for getting around the greater Dublin area, but Conor also provided such great knowledge of the fun spots within walking distance that we didn't even feel the need to venture out much further. We had so much fun pretending we were locals in his neighborhood and we wish we had more time to stay and try all the cool spots nearby that he recommended.

Nice friendly, helpful host. Apartment dated and could do with a deep clean but 
is a good location and adequate size for 2. The sofa bed would not be suitable for more than one child.
Perfect location for ya getting to the RDS arena for a concert. Lovely large garden space which we could use. Conor was very quick at responding to any messages. Definitely recommend!

This apartment is in a fantastic location close to Sandymount and the Aviva stadium. Conors communication and check in :check out is excellent.
The photographs have been taken with a professional eye and do not reflect reality. We found the apartment pokey, dated and requiring maintenance and upgrades. 
It was much smaller than we expected based on the description and photographs. Half the ceiling lights were blown and the hot water heater in the the kitchen was not working. Of course its simple to boil a kettle to wash the dishes (which is what I did) but it should not be necessary.
We did not find the homely touches other reviewers have mentioned but agreed with those that have said that the toiled facilities are cramped. Taking a shower in such a small space quickly became a art form. 
The outside area (which we didnt use due to our busy schedule) was wonderfully quiet, secluded and well appointed.

Excellent stay for dropping off my son at UCD while also working out of my office on Silicon Dock. Conor is a great host, and extremely flexible. Flat had everything I needed for the week. Will definitely be back.

Nice apartment in a quieter part of Dublin. Chose this place as we have a toddler and we needed the extra space for him to run around. Generally the place was nice, host was very responsive and allowed us to check in early which was a great help. Agree with previous review that it would benefit from a 'deep clean', including a tidy up in the garden as we couldn't let the little one play out there alone.
You can hear the apartment upstairs, the mornings didnt bother us as we were up early and out. But if you do have kids you can hear the banging/music playing etc through the floor boards in the evening when its bed time, it's not intentional, just every day noise.
Conor was so easy to communicate with and a wonderful host with such a beautiful home!
We loved our stay here! The space is very cute and clean, and the location is ideal! Conor is fantastic at communication, and always ensures you are satisfied! We would highly recommend!
Had a nice stay here! Very clean and quaint and the host was always easy to keep in contact with!
Nice place, nice area in Dublin
Great location with bus stop across the road. Very cosy but be aware the shower and bathroom are very small.
Nice clean space with great kitchen and very convenient location.
Great little place and very stylish
Great apartment. Best host! Good place in Dublin- quiet but not far from the city center. We had a lovely stay! Thank you, Conor and family!
Absolutely great place to stay, would 100% recommend this place, only 10/15 mins from the centre, parking available and a really comfortable and stylish apartment.
Great compact space with all facilities needed to self cater or close to restaurants / bars in Sandymount and Ballsbridge for night out. Hosts very responsive and welcoming. Highly recommend.

This is a very attractive apartment which provides a great base for enjoying Dublin. The number 1 bus stops outside and it is an easy bus trip into the centre of town. It is also only a short walk to Sandymount village and Strand and to the Landsdowne stop for the Dart train. We were very comfortable in the apartment which is warm and well- appointed - and ideal for a couple. Many thanks Conor!

Conor & Celine were the best hosts we've had. Unlike so many, Conor took the time to introduce himself and give us a tour of the space when we arrived. The place was lovely. Everything was clean and neat, and there was a giant fragrant lily in full bloom in our bedroom. Huge back yard in the middle of Dublin, there was parking right on the street. Celine was putting out Halloween decorations  one evening as we were leaving for a walk, she was so friendly and helpful and gave us great suggestions of where to eat. I can't say enough, they were great.
Great place in great location
The apartment was lovely and clean, good location as near train station and easy to get to the city centre
Really nice location away from the busy areas, enjoyed the stay! Thanks
We had A very Nice stay and the host was realy looking forwards. Also the breakfast was Nice and complete. Thanks A lot
Lesley is very kind and did everything to make sure we have a nice trip! I can definitly recommend to stay there!

Lesley and Brandon are wonderful and welcoming hosts. They help you around if you are new in town, and can give you tips even if you are a returning visitor. Thank you for the few days we spent with you.

Lesley and Brendon were gracious and welcoming hosts.  Their home is very attractive and spotless.  The bed was fantastic and we enjoyed a lovely breakfast along with great chats with Lesley.  Very quiet at night and easily reached by car or the Dart if you don't mind a bracing walk.

This was our first experience with airbnb and it really was perfect. Lesley and Brendan were really nice and caring, they helped us with the busses and gave us a lot of advice regarding sights and pubs in Dublin and in towns along the coast. The room was very beautiful and clean, with a lot of space and everything you need (i.e. hairdryer, water kettle, towels etc.). The breakfast also was really delicious and there was a large choice of different things to eat.
All in all, we really enjoyed our stay and fully recommend this bed & breakfast!
Brilliant room, lovely breakfast and fantastic hospitality. Lovely people with a lovely home and great seaside location!
If you want a nice peaceful place away from the city choose this place.

Lesleys place is absolutely amazing!! The location is great, nearby public transportation and places to eat. If you are looking to just walk along the coast and be outside, Lesleys place is the one!! Her home was perfect for our needs and for what we wanted to do in Ireland!! You will not regret choosing her place!!

Lesley and her husband went above and beyond to make our Dublin experience amazing! The home is beautiful, modern, clean and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to the area. Breakfast was fit for a king and enough for an army! The location was great as it was just outside the city, but convenient in that a bus stop was just across the street.

We enjoyed our stay at Lesley and Brandons very much. The room is very lovely, extremely clean and there is everything you need and more. 
Whenever we needed advice or simply if told her what we were going to do, Lesley told us what would be best for us to do.  The breakfast is very delicious and you can have everything you desire from Toast and jam to baked beans and eggs.
It really felt like home there. 
If I would spent some time in Dublin again  I would definitely come back to stay there.

Lesley's place is a few blocks away from the water, and great for anyone looking for a relaxing stay. It's about 50 min - hour bus ride from the airport and city center, but I really enjoyed the peace and quiet.
Beautiful wee place! Thankyou xx
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Good location, very stylish apartment with great decor.
Superb location. Cant be faulted.
Very nice flat, well located. Perfect!
Great place.

As a group of 6, we stayed at Sabrinas apartment for 3 nights. Sabrinas communication was very quick and she is incredibly flexible around our checkin. 

The flat is in a great location and across the street from Temple Street. Its also only a 10 min walk to the airport bus line. It can be a bit noisey at night from people leaving the pub, but it wasnt much of an issue for us. If you are sleeping in the living room (sofa couch) you will hear the beeping from the crosswalk often. The bedrooms are a great size. 

The flat is in an older building so the bathroom is tight, but manageable. At the time of writing this, the bathroom image shows a shower with bathtub. The flat didnt have a bathtub. Its a standing shower only. 

If you are looking for a home base for a few nights and like the nightlife, its a great option.
The best Place to be. Located very conveniently in the city, Very clean and absolute comfortable. It was perfect for the St. Patricks Day.. Thank you.
Fantastic location, had a very comfortable stay.
Very good and local space would highly recommend.

Clean, centrally located flat. Sabrina was great with check-in flexibility. In person check-in makes sense given the bit of a maze one goes through to reach the inside location once there and the need for both key and fob. We enjoyed our stay close to so many Dublin sights! She kindly filled the fridge with food to prepare a traditional Irish breakfast. Would definitely recommend this location.

Great location. Two coffee shops right next door. Short walk to many shopping and tourist sites. The washer/dryer combo was very nice. 

Be aware the bathroom is very small. The shower is fine, but the toilet space is very tight.

Sabrina's place is perfect!  You won't need a car the whole time you're there.   We walked to all the great attractions in Dublin as well as pubs and shops.  Sabrina sent me detailed directions (with photos) well before our scheduled stay which I was able to print out and bring along, thus,  saving my data plan.  American travelers will particularly appreciate the drip coffee maker (which is not a kitchen staple in Ireland)!  Sabrina also stocked the refrigerator with all the ingredients to make a full Irish breakfast!
This is the perfect location for staying in Dublin. Sabrina went above and beyond for us and is an excellent host. There were even breakfast items for us which was incredibly thoughtful and helpful.

We have booked the apartment with four people. The size of the apartment was absolutely sufficient for us.
The location is estklassig. Just minutes away are most of Dublin's hotspots, such as the Jameson Distillery, the Trinity Collage, or the Temple Bar Quartier.
Sabrina, our hostess was very sympathetic and helpful. The communication was straightforward and the answers to questions always came immediately. We can really recommend the apartment for a few days in Dublin and will definitely book again on our next visit.

Sabrina is a wonderful host.  The apartment location is a few minute walk to the Temple Bar area and next to a Hop on Hop off  tour bus stop.  Her detailed directions and maps make it easy to find and she greets you at the door to get settled.  The apartment is spotless and a nice size for the location.  A very good choice!
Had a great stay at Sabrinas place!  Awesome location and very nice apartment.
Great apartment conveniently located. Very clean and well stocked. Sabrina was  responsive and helpful

We loved staying here. It was cozy, had everything we needed, and in a key location close to everything we wanted. Sabrina was very sweet. We definitely recommend this home and would be back ourselves.

This place was in a great location, sparkling clean and tastefully decorated. Security in building was unmatched by anything we had seen in any other Airbnb. Sabrina met us at checkin and made us feel welcome.
The location is great. Close walk to everything and transportation to and from airport
Well located.  Living space accommodating  and Sabrina responsive.   Used it as a base camp and saw and did all that Dublin had to offer.   We would stay again.

This great little apartment is right in the middle of Dublin with the famous Temple Bar area just across the river to the south, and more local favorites around the north side. The apartment was clean and comfortable and includes the bonus of a washing machine! Sabrina is quick to respond to questions and made us feel very welcome. I highly recommend this stay!
Great location for staying in west Dublin!
Perfect location.  Close to everything and accommodations were great.  Great communication and check in was easy. Thanks for everything!
Very good location close to temple bar and transportation.  Quiet, convenient and clean.

Sabrina's apartment is in a wonderful central location. We could walk to Temple Bar and Trinity College easily. The apartment is compact but worked perfectly for the three of us. The beds are clean and comfortable. Check-in was a breeze and Sabrina was available by phone to answer questions.
Great location on a busy street minutes to everything!
Great price for the amazing location close to bars and shopping!

Enjoyed our stay in Dublin at this apartment was great, fab location really close to Temple Bar! Had everything we needed and very spacious for 6 people, sofa bed was comfy and kitchen had everything we needed!
This apartment is in a super location to many of the main attractions and areas.

The location of this place is unbelievable!!  You are close to everything.   In light of that, you could here a few late night people outside.   But being just over the river from everything was so handy.  Communication with the owner was outstanding!  Dublin was terrific!

Sabrinas place was a lot of space and an excellent location for the price. Hot water, good supplies in kitchen. The street noise was very loud and the windows do not block the sound- especially on Saturday night- noisy until at least 2am. But if you are not a light sleeper, then you will love this place for the location. I felt very safe , as there are several locked doors to get through to access the apartment. I recommend Mochaland next door for breakfast.
Great apartment, clean and attractive, with fantastic location!  Highly recommend.
This was an excellent location for pubs and other attractions. Would definitely choose this again when we come back to Dublin.

Fantastic location for walking both Old Dublin and the North City shopping area. Plenty of space (we had 2 adults and 3 kids). Sabrina was really helpful and a great host. The apartment is very nice and clean and we would recommend it to anyone. 

The people at the cafe downstairs are excellent as well. Easy to get a cab from the airport - took a little longer to get one back to the airport but not too bad.

Sabrinas place is in the ultimate location! It made site seeing in Dublin so easy as everything was on our doorstep. 
Sabrina was great to communicate with and supplied everything we needed for our group of six which made it a comfortable stay. My one comment would be that the apartment needs a decent clean. Its obviously been well used but just needs a bit of TLC to make it a 5/5 stay.
Great location. Hostess gave wonderful detailed information. Great size for our family of five.

The location is great to explore Dublin.  The seagulls in the area enjoy making a lot of noise at night and there is a crosswalk is under one of the windows so bring a pair of ear plugs for sleeping at night.
Its a really nice apartment. Good location and cozy. Though we are 5, It is spacious. Washing machine is helpful for us. Thank you!
Sabrinas place is a short walking distance to hot spots of Dublin and buses. She emailed us very detailed directions to get to the apartment from the airport and check in.

Sabrina's place was very clean and in an excellent location for walking to many of the top sites we wanted to visit in Dublin. Her condo had all the amenities we needed for a very comfortable stay. We would definitely stay at her place again.
Excellent location, very short walk to Temple Bar area.
Teriffic location. It was walking distance to everywhere we wnated to go. The space was very clean.
Super nice apartment with an awesome location. Walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. Just be aware that with that comes noise at night. Id recommend staying here for a fun stay in Dublin!
Very nice accommodation & close to everything!
Easy to find and a great location!
The apartment was located right in the middle of everything Dash perfect place to explore the city. It was clean, communication was easy. Will definitely stay here again next time.
Nice flat in great location.

We had a nice stay at Sabrina's place, the apartment is spacious, the location could not be more central and yet it was quiet at night. Sabrina was responsive and flexible to our late arrival. Highly recommended!
Great apartment in a good location walking distance to temple bar and main attractions. Apartment was clean and safe. Great host would definitely stay here agin when in Dublin

Sabrinas place was the perfect location for our stay in Dublin. It was walking distance close to all our tour pickups, great nightlife and all the sites- didnt walk more than 20 minutes to get anywhere. 
The beds are comfy, kitchen is great and there is a great seating area and couch. 
The only downside is the extremely small toilet space, not the best shower pressure and some sort of smell throughout the entire apartment. Not unbearable, but there. 
I would definitely recommend this place and stay there again- it was exactly what we needed for 4 people for a week. 
Thank you Sabrina!
The communication with the host was very quick, the apartment is really in city Center,so you can see all the attractions of the city! Apartment is nice and comfortable!

It's noisy from street activity and the bathroom sink is the tiniest I've ever seen, but it is a GREAT location with everything you need for a stay just steps from Temple bar area. Close to tram & bus stops, O'Connell street and one of the BEST fine restaurants I've been to (The Winding Stair)!

Unbeatable location in a very safe and secure building. Close to tourist/party district (can be noisy, but also very fun if youre a part of it). Walking distance to anything youd want to do in Dublin.
Great stay !!
A great location and good value
Great location! We felt very safe during our stay. The rooms are spacious and the sofa bed is very comfy.
Sabrina was very commutative and helpful when we needed. She even got us in to the Airbnb early! Which was nice. Her Airbnb is in a great location for all Dublin needs.
Location is close to everything. The apartment had everything you need for a comfortable stay! Check in was made super easy and the hosts were great communicators.

Sabrinas place is exactly as described. It is a bit noisy but being so close to Temple Bar and all of city center, we dealt with the extra noise. It was great being able to walk to all of the sites on our list. I would definitely stay again.
This is a great place in the center of Dublin. Bathroom is a bit tight but lots of room everywhere else. It was very clean, quiet, well equipped and as expected.

This apartment is brilliantly located on a building right next to the main river in Dublin. Super easy to walk everywhere in town. The place was clean, had two good sized rooms and a fairly comfortable pull out couch in the living room (nice and solid, not one of those filmsy spring filled ones that fold out in three parts). The kitchen, though small, was very modern, had everything you needed to cook breakfast and even had staples in the cupboards to help you cook dinner. The fridge was only half size but that was fine for us as we weren't staying long. Wifi worked great, and for those who need a relax because of jetlag this apartment seemed quite quiet in the evenings and even during the day. 

Sabrina was super quick to respond to communications and was able to offer information for parking lots nearby (Parking our car overnight, dropping someone off at the airport in the middle of the night, and then leaving before 10am the next day cost around 28 Euro from the closest parking lot). When I left my jacket behind by accident we were able to easily arrange to pick it up when we were next in Dublin, thanks to Sabrina's kindness. 

One thing you should be aware of is that the bathroom is tiny, as in you can only fit one person literally in at a time. As it's the only bathroom, it is the only toilet, so if you're there with more than four people you may find it takes a couple of hours for everyone to get showered etc. On the plus side the heating doesn't run out and I seem to remember good shower pressure. The place is a bit of a maze to get into so definitely don't leave your keys behind as there are multiple doors to unlock along the way. Sabrina provides you with all the instructions for that though. The cleaner forgot to leave out bedding for our fifth person in the living room pull out, but we managed to find enough in the cupboards to make things work. 

All in all a great option if you want to be in town and have a moderate sized group. Attentive hosts and clean.
Alles zu Fuss bestens erreichbar.
Great location in the heart of Dublin!

Good place to stay. Near bus stop from airport and had a meals and english breakfast in downstairs cafe very good.You can walk any were round the city a short distance away guinness brewery about 30 min away if you walk along the other side of the river a pub would recommend the Brazen head Irelands oldest pub great old pub.Sabrinas place is very good and i would recommend it.

We had a great time at Sabrina's apartment, we were five and had enough space for every one of us. The flat is clean, bright and spacious, conveniently equipped, in the very heart of the city. Indeed, the location is well beyond comparison. All in all a very good experience!

Great place in the city! Perfect stay for walking trips.  Good food and shopping.  Parking  was very close but a bit expensive.

Very secure and safe accommodations.  There is some street noise at night, so ear plugs may be needed.

Beds could have been a bit more comfortable but all in all it was  great experience.  

The host was very prompt and very detailed in dirctions and policies.
Posizione fantastica! Bellissimo appartamento!
Super cute spacious apartment, with a balcony, steps away from all the action in Dublin !!

Perfect location, clean and handy. This appartement is perfect to visit this amazing city. 
Easy check-in / check-out, Everything what you need to enjoy Dublin
Great location. Does what it says on the tin. Good communication with host.

Staying with Clare was a perfect way to start my Irish Adventure! Couldn't have asked for more! Clare let me check in early, gave advice and tips on the city, brought me to my first castle, around Clontarf to see the local views and even gave me a lift to city centre when she could! I can't say enough about how much I loved my stay! I'd been advised to be weary of the Northern part of Dublin but there  was nothing to fear in Clontarf. Such a beautiful spot!
Great place and Clare was amazing host! Definitely recommend to everyone :)
We had a great stay, Clare was so very kind and helpful. Made us feel at home. The place was nice and clean and the area was really nice and great to walk around!

Clare's home is one of the best places, I've been staying at Air Bnb. Everything is really clean and comfortable. You can find everything you need at her home. She is always there to help with tips regarding Dublin or the stay itself. When I was checking in, she was cooking and invited me for meal.  I was staying there for 4 weeks in total and I can definetly recommend the place. Especially when you stay for some more time, you can find a home at Clare's place. She is a lovely and very welcomed lady, who tries to do everything to make you feel home. There is a breakfast everyday, she provides towels and changes the linen weekly. You can also wash your clothes, if you stay for some more time. The neighbourhood is really nice and peaceful and there is a park just at the end of the street. The bus to the city is just 20 minutes. I've already booked my next stay at here home and I am looking forward to come back :-)
We loved to stay at Claire¬¥s house. Such a comfy and absolutely clean place. Also Claire is very nice person. She helped us with everything we need and she was caring. Thanks a lot!
We were attending a concert in Croke Park and stayed in Clare's Double Room that night. Great location and service. Room was clean & tidy and we had everything we needed
We had a fantastic stay at Clares! Lovely home, great communication and breakfast laid out in the morning :) Clare booked us a taxi and was absolutely lovely, wed love to stay again!
Clare is a lovely host. Her home is homely and in a great area. It was very handy for me to meet for business at the Dublin City University and my cousin not too far from there.

Clares space was clean, comfy, cheery, and quiet. She is a gracious hostess, very accommodating, and very kind. Her place was easy to find, and right next to a bus stop that went straight to the city center. She is naturally hospitable, and a delight to talk to - I would love to come back and stay again sometime.
Clare is phenomenally hospitable with great recommendations. The neighborhood is excellent.

Clare is an absolute doll! This is only our second stay at an airbnb but we couldn't ask for a kinder host. She was so accommodating and gracious and will do almost anything to make your stay enjoyable.  She has a wonderful outlook and sense of humor and terrific to talk to..  Her home is warm and charming with everything you could possibly need. Clare went above and beyond to make sure our stay was wonderful. We miss her already.

This is a great place to stay. Clare is a fab host and very hospitable. She provides local tips and goes out of her way to be helpful.
There are local amenities within walking distance.

Clare is one of thosr people you meet for the first time and it feels like you've known them for years. Extremely good host, everything was perfect. Clare was able to recommend great places to visit in the area. Comfortable bed, even my own shower, delicious breakfast... what more can I say? Don't hesitate to stay here.

Clares home is such a delightfully quite, clean and comfortable space in a very nice neighborhood. It is close to all public transportation, atms, grocery stores, coast line and more. Her hospitality is over and beyond any expectations in such a positive way. Immediately after booking, she provided an email with everything I could need to know for getting around etc so I knew then the stay would be wholesome. She does host other guests simultaneously, so earplugs are good if you are like me and slow to adjust to time zone differences. I will absolutely stay with her again on future visits. Having the shower in my room was a very nice convenience, and ALL of her rooms are beautiful. Her home has so much charm and positive, respectful and safe energy.

The time at Clare was very good! Clare is a lovely person and has always been friendly and helpful to us. She goes out of her way to make her guests feel comfortable. The room was very good also the breakfast. We would go back to Clare anytime and would highly recommend this airbnb. We wish all the best for Clare! Thank you very much!

My stay with Clare was absolutely amazing. She was so incredibly welcoming and kind. She treated myself and all of her guests like family! Her hospitality was wonderful and I just loved the entire experience. I would definitely recommend Clares place to anyone traveling to Ireland. Its especially wonderful for solo travelers because you will meet other wonderful guests.
Clare is a great host, I really appreciated here hospitality and support - can only recommend the place - very quite and still you can reach the city centre in good time! Thank you - made my stay
Clare is a wonderful host! Communication works great. Her house is in a quiet street, hence no buzzing traffic outside. The room as well as the house was clean and cousy. I'll be back :-)

Clare is an astounding host! She provided me with plenty of information before my arrival as well as clear instructions to arrive. She is nice, friendly and prepares amazing breakfasts! The house is impeccably clean and fully furnished! Five stars are clearly not enough!
Enda is an amazing host. He is extremely thoughtful and hospitable. The house is very well located. Totally worth the stay

Wonderful stay with Enda. He was a delight to chat with and had fantastic recommendations for our stay in Dublin. It truly made our experience. 

The house is an old Georgian building with character in every corner. 

Would definitely recommend, would stay again :)

Great location and wonderful host! Enda took the time to welcome us with a cup of tea and gave us great city recommendations that really made our trip fantastic. We loved staying here because it felt like we were staying with family. Would book again in a heartbeat!

A beautiful and tastefully decorated Georgian house close to St Stephen's Green. Enda is a charming and generous host who made us feel completely at home and offered excellent advice on how to make the most of a visit to Dublin. Street parking was close and convenient. We're very happy to have had this as our weekend home in Dublin.

Enda and Patty are wonderful ! Helpful, kind..lots of time for you....Enda parle francais aussi...donc un grand avantage si vous etes francais. !! Nothi ng too much trouble. 
Easy to recommend .
Comfortable, clean, simple room in a great location with a wonderful host!
A great place to stay in Dublin, they are really nice and Enda gave us some indications about the city that were really useful. Their house is beautiful and it's in the city center, near everything.
Very ncie person and good services. Antique atmosphere all around.  Extra tea and coffee as well as toasts and juice :)

Enda was a fantastic host, very helpful (guided us to the parking space, paid for it, etc). His life and place are full of art and culture --and location just a couple of blocks from St. Stephens Green is perfect.

Our stay at Ednas was great. It is a short walk to the city center and there are tons of entertainment options there.

Communication was great and check-in/out were also smooth. Enda gave us plenty recommendations on places to find a cold beer or some great food.

Enda was a FANTASTIC host! His hospitality was like none other.  Hes so humble and helpful, the moment we got in he pulled out a map and walked us through all the landmarks we wanted to visit. Quaint and cozy place, I would definitely recommend it and come back myself again.
We were made to feel very welcome in this beautiful apartment, great location next to St Stephen's Green and close to RDS Arena. 100% recommend!

Enda and Patti are wonderful hosts.  Donegal man Enda spent several years in Paris and is an art & antiques dealer so every wall in their lovely flat has amazing artwork. Patti is a teacher who is working on her PHD so they are a very cultured and knowledgeable hosts as well as being warm and welcoming.  Their flat/apartment is upstairs in an 18th century Georgian House (no elevator) just yards from the National Concert Hall and St. Stephen's Green.  It couldn't be more central. A blazing fire in the sitting room welcomed me when I arrived drenched  and cold in a downpour and a big cozy surprise awaited me in my bedroom...a hot-water bottle warming my bed!
This is a wonderfully lived-in, charming flat with wonderful, charming hosts. Will definitely seek it out next time I'm in Dublin.
Great location and lovely helpful and accommodating hosts. Lovely people

Lovely family that really makes you feel welcome and is happy to share all sorts of great tips on Dublin. Great place, convenient location, light filled room with space for 2 and private bathroom. Happy to visit again!
Great place, no problems whatsoever. Recommended!
Great location. Pretty much everything is within walking distance of the house. Enda is a great host who gave us a lot of tips for our stay in Dublin.
Great central location. Everything required there and as described. Easy coordination with the host and responsiveness during check-in and check-out times.

My daughter and her boyfriend stayed in Dublin with Enda for one night on their way from Toronto to London. They had a great visit and said the room was really comfortable, but best of all the location was only 10 minutes walk from the city center. Enda is an excellent host giving them directions and also letting them check in early as there was no one checking out before them. Thanks again, Enda.

Enda is a wonderful host who is very responsive, helpful, and always thinking of extra ways to make your stay better. The room itself is very comfortable and great-looking with its stylish, antique furniture and everything is very clean. Location is exceptional.
Comfortable and very convenient for Dublin centre. Although we didnt meet Enda and Patti communication was easy and they were very helpful. A great stay in Dublin

The Irish hospitality I received from Enda and Patti was fantastic from the moment I arrived. Enda gave me many good tips on places to visit and go shopping during my stay, and the tea and turf fire made the whole experience incredible.

For me staying in a B&B is all about meeting locals and getting a perspective of what it's like to live in a place.  Enda is a great host with an easy going relaxed manner. He shares local information and recommendations on what to see and do. The location is perfect to walk to everything.  Thanks Enda!
Great host and good location

Enda was an excellent host. When we checked in, he and his wife were kind enough to offer us a cup of tea and some good conversation by the fireplace. He listened to what we hoped to do our first night in Dublin, then gave us some recommendations which turned out to be perfect. The room was quite comfortable.
Good location and a very friendly host
Great location, amazing decor, full of interesting artefacts and paintings, very cosy indeed. Enda and Patti are informative, kind and engaging, thank you so much for our stay!
Lovely place, wonderful host. The bathroom was cold in the mornings.
Had a great stay at Serenas home. Was a lovely place !
Excellent house, location, and accessibility to public transportation

A unique, new eco-friendly, modern house in a wonderful location in southwest Dublin. Very close to a convenient bus line that runs directly to Trinity College and Temple Bar. The house has every conceivable amenity and is set back behind another house, making it quiet and safe. Well lit by big, modern windows. Toys available for small children, too. Highly recommended!

This home is well designed and appointed for use and efficiency--obviously much thought went into building it. For a single traveler or a small family, it is possible to gather or get some privacy as needed. Serena met us and walked us through, and her handbook is very helpful and inclusive. Shoppimg and transportation are in walking distance. I would recommend the home highly to anyone exploring the Dublin area.
Wonderful home.
This is a lovely house in a great area. Its close to shops and transport and easy to get around. Serena is a great host and very responsive.

Seren'a apartment is one of the best I stayed. The room is specious and clean. Serena with her husband are very helpful and friendly. Whole area is very quiet and peaceful. I really recommend this offer.
We enjoyed our stay in this beautiful and warm home. Serena and her family were great hosts. Very convenient to get to the city, but tucked away in a quiet location. Would recommend!

New and modern house. The room is very big. You can find a desk if you need to work. The private bathroom is clean with a huge mirror. Serena and her family are friendly and kind. They gave us useful advises and recommendations. They have a cute dog. We loved to spent the time in Serena's house. We totally recommend it!

Absolutely beautiful family and lovely home.  Great communication, the bedroom was perfect: nice and airy, comfortable bed and a space where I could get work done.  Loved the rain shower!  :-)  I did not get to explore the area as I was up in Dublin for college, but Siena recommended a pizzeria a short drive from their home, which I went to with a friend and we really liked it!
Serena's air bnb is a real treat. Beautiful home and friendly hosts. We had a great stay in Dublin and would definitely come back.

The house has a very good modern design. The room is exactly as shown in the picture. To get to the bathroom you have to go out from the room. The bedroom is very close to the kitchen, so sometimes is a little bit noisy, but is not a big deal.
Serena and Neil were very helpful and gentle hosts. 
I definitely recommend this room for a short term accommodation.

Best Airbnb we ever had! Serena & Neil are the perfect hosts. They welcomed us and gave us lots of recommendations regarding Dublin. 
Their new house is beautiful and the room/private bathroom were super clean. Definitely recommend them if you are coming to Dublin.
Wonderful room within walking distance of the city center. Wonderful hosts who are greatly responsive and glad to help.

We had a superb stay at Claire and Eric's. The private room was perfect - everything we needed, and we particularly appreciated the large, clear, flat surface for working at etc. It was warm, extremely quiet (even though on the road side of a small street, we didn't hear a thing), lovely and practical bathroom, comfortable large bed, and the location was fantastic. Claire and Eric are wonderful, helpful, thoughtful hosts - highly recommended.
Great location ! Eric and claire are very helpful . The room is so cosy and id recommend this place to everybody.

Wonderful place out of the bustle of the city centre but only a short walk away. We found a nice breakfast place close by and I recommend the Botanical Gardens just a short walk.
Eric and Claire are wonderful hosts and there daughters super cute. The room is well situated just by the front door and they have everything you would need.
We loved our stay and would come back.

Eric & Claire have a beautiful home and its really well located in Dublin especially if youre interested in more than just the pub/night life. Walking distance to the botanical gardens which are a magical must-see and the Newish Emigration museum as well as some awesome spots for food/live jams!

Our stay at Eric and his family was great! They are very friendly and helpful.  The room was beautiful and cozy with everything you need and even more. We also had our own bathroom. I would recommend it to anyone and I will definitely come back when Im in Dublin again. Thank you Eric and Claire for the great stay!

A great room at a great location. I stayed there for four nights and it was a very relaxing experience. Claire and Eric were great hosts. If youre someone who likes an early start to the morning and is looking for a relaxing bed to come home to after a long day out exploring this is the place for you.

Claire and Eric were perfect hosts, the room is huge, clean and they were very accurate in the information they provided. Their house is also in a really nice neighborhood and it's quite easy to get to the centre of Dublin/airport.
Claires home was really sweet and she was a very thoughtful host. We really loved our stay! Id highly recommend Claires home as a place to stay during your Dublin travels.

The room is actually much more spacious than the pictures and easily accommodated my niece and I during our brief stay. We had a bathroom to ourselves. The room itself is cozy and stylish, with very comfortable beds. It also came with a helpful map of the area. Youre right around the corner from a great restaurant - Two Boys Brew. Its an easy 15-20 minute walk from the Aircoach stop. We could access transportation on Berkeley and the walk to City Centre within 20 minutes. Check-in and check-out was smooth and uncomplicated. Id recommend this AirBnb for others in Dublin.
My friend and I had a great stay, Eric was very accommodating and we would recommend your place!
Great hospitality, from a very nice family and beautiful house
Very comfortable and stylish room with thoughtful touches. Great communication and helpful advice, fast wifi. Well placed for walking into town. Would stay there again.

We had a really great time in Dublin. Claire & Eric's house is a beautiful place to stay, very quiet, clear and in a strategic position to visit the city.
Really recommended!

We were very comfortable here, and appreciated the hospitality from Claire and Eric. Communication was great and the room was exactly as described.

Beds were comfortable and we appreciated the snacks and tea in the room. Be aware that you are staying in a family home so the children may be up and about in the morning.

All in all, a nice stay. I would return here.
very welcoming hosts. Be aware that there is no TV, no security for bedroom, no breakfast on offer and shower needs some pressure. Expensive for what is included.
A lovely place to stay. The room is spacious, comfortable, and clean, and Eric and Claire are very kind. Would stay here again.

Really courteous people who are happy about the guests! At no time did you feel like a disturbing factor, but always in good hands!

A small shortcoming is the bathroom, which is on a different floor from the bedroom. But it hardly disturbed.
great place in an idea location for the city. Very walkable.

Claires place is on a tidy street in North Dublin, not far from shops and restaurants and wonderful parks. Be sure to walk over to Blessington Basin - an amazing walled garden / duck pond. Less than a mile away is the National Botanic Garden and Cemetery - both world class with guided tours available. 
A highlight for us was Claires family - husband Eric and two preschool girls. They included us in their day, made us feel totally welcome, have great suggestions on where to eat and walk etc
Great hosts. Very friendly, kind and helpful. The space is large and clean. Quiet house and street. The wifi is really fast.  Comfortable beds. Really great overall!
Eric and Claire are great hosts- kind and helpful.  I had a restful stay in their home and was able to get into Dublin for the sights very easily.
Very friendly home, great rooms! Good distrct!
The location of the place is great. Claire and her little girls are an absolute delight. Although our stay was very short we enjoyed it.

Claire and her family welcomed me warmly into the room which was large, airy and included tea and coffee supplies.  Claire also supplied information about transport and laundry options. I look forward to returning in 9 days after a tour.

Claire, Eric and their girls were wonderful and thoughtful hosts! It was my first time to Dublin and I was traveling alone. They made me felt right at home! The place was very spacious, bright and clean! Definitely recommend this to others looking for a clean and quiet place to stay!

I loved my stay with this lovely couple and their two little girls.  The room was big enough, the bed comfortable and the amenities clean and bright. They were helpful when required but also maintained my privacy. 
Great location allowing ready access to the city on the nearby Luas.  Also a couple of great pubs and cafes within walking distance. Happy to recommend

Come stay here!! Claire was an amazing host. Right when my taxi arrived I was warmly greeted by her and her adorable kids. I was visiting alone with my infant and she was so accommodating, even offered to move the bed around and had a pack and play in the room with toys before we got there! I also was having a hard time walking around with no suitable stroller and she offered me her own stroller (which she absolutely did not have to do)!! Towards the end it felt as if I made a friend rather than just being a host. Will definitely be coming back on my second trip here. 100% recommend!!

We loved staying at Eric and Claires place. We felt very welcome and enjoyed the special effort they made to make us feel at home. We loved the location too and tips for places to go. Our favourite local tip was the  pub the Back Page and wish it could be our local too. Thank you Eric and Claire and thank you to your two gorgeous girls as well. Cathy and Phil
I cannot say enough good things about Claire & Eric. Their home is lovely & very clean. They are helpful, kind and very quick to respond.

Claire and Eric were great hosts! Many local tips and very quick, smooth communication. Very friendly and flexible - from check-in to check-out. Lovely room, just as described in the ad. 
We would always come back and can highly recommend staying with them!
Great location, very spacious room. Lovely hosts
Wonderful location. can walk almost anywhere. Claire and her girls are darling! Room is cute, very clean and new. Close to lots of cute restaurants.
Nice location - clean!
My husband had a great stay here! It was conveniently located for us, and very clean.
We had a wonderful stay at Claires and Erics. The room was as described and the flat was close to the Luas or the Bus to get to the city centre.

Claire and Eric's space is absolutely lovely and I had a great time staying there. The bedroom is spacious and comfortable, and although the bathroom is separate (upstairs) I still appreciated having my own bathroom. Apart from the tea and coffee on offer I was very grateful for the snacks! On this occasion I only dealt with Claire, who was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend their place.
Top top top

I had a great, care free time here. Claire, Eric and the children were very kind and hospitable. They offer a ton of accommodation and privacy and were easy going and helpful the entire time. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this to anyone passing through Dublin.

Claire & Eric are brilliant hosts with a gorgeous family home in an excellent location, lots of tips for local places to eat, and went above & beyond the call of duty to save my bacon after a booking error on my part. 11 out of 10!
Claire was a helpful, caring and lovely host. I can totally recommend staying there.
Great room, lovely couple and kids!
Lovely hosts and lovely room to stay. Easy access to the downtown Dublin and at the same time not too far from airport. Highly recommended.

Exactly as described. I was greeted by Claire, Eric & girls with a warm welcome. Communication was quick and easy. Bright, spacious room with comfortable bed and lovely touches such as tea making facilities &snacks even towels & a hairdryer. Selection of books and Netflix available. Bathroom upstairs. They provided a free daily parking permit, which was great, car was safely parked outside the front door on a quiet street. Approx 30min walk into city centre. No hesitation in recommending this lovely family home with superb hosts! Thank you for my enjoyable stay.

Claire and Eric are wonderful hosts and the room was even better than I expected. So much space and light and a feeling of caring. Plus I loved being in a family home in an interesting neighbourhood that was still walkable to the city centre. For people who want peace and quiet as well as the Dublin experience, highly recommended.
The place is really lovely and incredibly quiet. Eric kindness provide the perfect touch for a great experience

Eric and Claire are wonderful hosts. They are thoughtful and helpful and made our stay a pleasure. We were able to walk everywhere from their house which made for an easy sightseeing stay. We would definitely recommend them to other travelers!

This place is awesome! Claire and Eric were great hosts and their kids are the cutest! Room Super clean, comfy bed, great bathroom and super easy to walk around city! My only complain is that I had a short stay, but for sure Ill book again on my next trip to Dublin!

We had a lovely stay at Claire & Erics place! It was perfect for our weekend in Dublin... well located, clean, warm and cosy, and just a beautiful space. Eric gave us lots of great local recommendations for eating out, and Claires communication leading up to and during our stay was excellent. Id highly recommend Claire & Erics place to others visiting Dublin.

The house is located on a quiet, safe street just a short bus ride away from the main attractions. Sparkling clean! Claire and Eric were amazing hosts î super flexible with our weird check in hours, ready to give local tips and recommendations, and overall super welcoming! You will be sharing a house with them and their kids, but still have complete privacy and silence. I couldnt recommend this place more!
This place was great if you dont mind staying with an awesome family, so welcoming and a great host!!
A lovely home in a nice location. A very generous host!

Approx. 30 minutes on foot to reach Dublin city centre. The host was very welcoming, communication was super fast and efficient. As for the home itself, it's as gorgeous as the photos (if not more). Very warm, clean and comfortable, it's as is described. 11/10 would recommend it to others. If we were to visit Dublin again in the future, we'd definitely stay here again. Thank you, Deirdre!

A great house close to the city, would be a bit far to walk if you have kids and intend to do additional walking in Dublin. The house was spacious enough for our group and we enjoyed our stay. The neighbors were friendly and the the neighborhood was safe. There was a parking spot available each evening for us out front. Appreciated all the informative reviews.
He is definitely a super host the home is very clean wonderfully decorated in a great location close to everything within walking distance.

This house is very clean, big and has perfect location; quiet neighbourhoud yet close to downtown. Deirdre gave us a beautiful welcome with hot tea, fresh flowers and bottle of wine. House is a bit full with personal things and parking with rental car a bit uneasy with max. 3 hours and starting 7am.  2 showers for 5 people which could not be used at the same time is also a bit uneasy. But house is a true home and everything else was perfect. Kamala

Cathals place was perfect for our family. We loved the location-so easy to catch a bus and even easier to walk to restaurants and pubs. The house was charming and comfortable-we had everything we needed. Highly recommend!!
Would recommend this lovely house to all fellow travellers. The house was spotlessly clean, the neighborhood peaceful, the host knowledgeable and very lovely. 10 out of 10.

The home is absolutely lovely with several beautiful rooms that the family can enjoy together. The kitchen is bright and large with a large sliding glass door opening to a wonderful garden. The location is fantastic; a quiet area of Dublin on a beautiful street and yet a nice walk, or quick bus ride to anywhere in Dublin. All four bedrooms were comfortable. The house made our family time very special. Staying in the house was a highlight of our family trip to Dublin. Cathal and Deirdre are gracious hosts who think of everything to make your stay memorable!
A lovely, quirky, clean and spacious house providing an excellent location from which to explore Dublin. Many thanks, Cathal.

Cathal's home is absolutely lovely.  The location is excellent, on a quiet residential road near lots of shops (including a major grocery store).  The house is beautiful, and very comfortable.  We were met in-person when we arrived and were warmly welcomed.  My family loved their stay in Cathal's house; it was perfect for the six of them to relax and enjoy being in a home away from home.  We would absolutely stay here again.

We really enjoyed our stay at Deirdre's lovely home in Rathmines. The location was excellent, close to lots of restaurants and shops and an easy commute into downtown Dublin. The house is very comfortable with 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a powder room.  There is a lovely kitchen and family room at the back of the house that opens up to a small garden. We spent all of our time there. Please bear in mind that this is Deirdre's home, so there are lots of her personal items about. We would highly recommend and would stay there again.

This home is beautiful and equipped with all you need for your home away from home. It has a lovely garden and is reasonably  close to  downtown Dublin.  You won't go wrong with this pristine location.

Deirdre was so hospitable and flexible in meeting us to explain some of the particulars of the place. Since it IS her home, she had it well stocked with everything we needed. There were great directions for using the Wifi, television, etc. There were suggestions of nice restaurants/bars in the area and city center. She provided maps & brochures for some of the local hop on/off buses and other attractions -- as well as a complimentary bottle of wine! Just a nice, relaxing respite from the bustle of the city. Deirdre's home is a quick walk to local transit and not far from city center. We really enjoyed our time here!
Fantastic and beautiful home!
After a warm welcome, we felt like home in the house. Quiet area with good bus connection to the centre. Thanks for letting us stay!

Deirdre is an exceptional nice and friendly hostess. We arrived early in the morning and were allowed  to check in right away. Deirdre awaited us and showed us around. Her home is beautifully decorated and you have everything you need.  We very much enjoyed staying at her place.

Cathal's place far exceeded our expectations.  We were met with a warm Irish smile and offered a cup of tea while we went over the workings of the house.  
We were in Ireland for a wedding and the house was a perfect home camp.  We had two families sharing the space and never felt crowded.  The kitchen is a great place for conversation or to have a great fry!  The home is in a nice, quiet neighborhood with easy access to everything.  I highly recommend this beautiful home and hope to someday go back!

We had warm welcome. The location was excellent, close to lots of pubs and restaurants. The house was very lovely and comfortable. We loved the big kitchen and garden. We recommend it to everyone. We had a nice and wonderful days here. Thnx for all Deirdre :)
This is a beautiful home ideal for staying in Dublin if you want to see more than just the Temple Bar area. Cathal is a fantastic and responsive host.

Andrews place was fantastic for my friend and I. The location was perfect, as it is in the center of the city with only short walks to the river and Jameson distillery. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good place to stay in Dublin with great value. Tip of the cap to Andrew!

Andrew was an awesome host! Very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean as the rest of the apartment. A good location to stay if you want to visit the town center. The only minus point is the noise from the fruit market in front of the house that opens at dawn
Andrew is a great host, always available for any questions. The apartment is perfectly located

Andrew is an amazing host. His place is super conveniently located and 5 mins of a walk from Temple Bar and all the major attractions are at a walkable distance too. He also went out of his way and helped me with carrying my bag up and down the stairs. And is super friendly. I am a female solo traveler and his place felt absolutely safe. I would definitely stay here again if I visit Dublin. And would recommend it to everyone else.

Andrew welcomes us very well and helped us to carry on the luggage. The apartment is very good situated and every place in Dublin is 15/20 minutes by foot. The room is a little bit small but we could go in the living room and the kitchen (very well equipped). Andrew has a very good coffee machine to make normal coffee. 
The only little problem is the noise
In the street, because there are some constructions all around and we could hear the machines early in the morning.... 
But Andrew is very cool and a good host. I recommend this place.
Andrew is a great host who responds very quickly to messages. The apartment is in a fabulous location. Andrew was helpful with location tips and recommendations. Overall, good value for money.
Great location, walking distance to everything. Good for a quick stay!

The location is AMAZING!  You can literally walk to everything and we did!

Andrew is upfront about the noise from the Market below, but to be honest it didn't bother us much.  The room is a little tight with two adults and luggage but made it work with Andrew's help. 

Jameson is just down the street and Guinness is about 15 /20-minute walk.  Shopping and Pubs are just around the corner.  

A great location to find everything Dublin has to offer.

Andrews apartment is great for someone who wants to explore Dublin for the first time as its a short walking distance  to the most popular tourist areas such as Temple Bar, plus is right next to the busy OConnell street which has loads of shops and bus routes to the airport. Andrew was super helpful during our stay, would definitely recommended booking here!
The host canceled this reservation 76 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The appartement is very good located and perfect for a City Trip. You can reach everything by walk. 
The room is not so big, but for some days absolutly enough. 
Andrew is a very pleasent host and always helpful. So if we will come back to Dublin, we will book it again.

Andrew is a great host and the apartment is in an amazing location! You can pretty much walk everywhere. The living space was comfortable and Andrew also offered us cereals for breakfast in the morning which was appreciated!

The only downside was the noise - it was much louder and earlier than we expected. We assumed the noise would be just general hustle and bustle but it was more like beeping lorries and construction work down the road. A bit grating at first but eventually got used to it with ear plugs/headphones.

Other than that, it was great value and perfect for a short stay :)

Andrew's apt is very conveniently located. It was in easy walking distance to cafes, transit and important tourist sites. 
The apartment is in an older building but Andrew keeps it tidy and modern.  The bed in the guest room is very comfortable. The only drawback is the noise of the wholesale fruit and veg market coming alive at 430am across the street.

My husband & I stayed at Dees place for a week and it was very nice! It was clean and comfortable with everything we needed, and the bus stop to get to city centre is just a short walk away. She was available to answer a few of our questions, and she has a sweet & mellow dog & cat that will greet you as well. Checking in & out could not have been easier. Overall a quiet & quaint accommodation at a great price for Dublin.

Dee's place was absolutely idea while I was staying in Dublin, it was great value for money and had everything that you could need in terms of amenities that are provided. It was absolutely spotless and extremely homely. Dee herself was lovely too. You're missing out if you're coming to dublin and not staying here.
Sauber und Nett
Very nice apartment, super easy Check In and lots of privacy! The place is well equipped and neat. Good dog!

We had a great stay at Dee's place! It was so cosy and the facilities were great. We would definitely recommend it, to others who wish to stay with Dee. She was very welcoming and was willing to ansvar any question you might have. If we are lucky to pay a visit to Dublin again, we definitely want to stay at Dee's!
Very Nice moment, not far from City Dublin with the bus Line (27). Moreover you have a garden and it is very property !
Beautiful garden, adorable pets (who are not allowed in the unit), and unrivaled hospitality. The kitchen is well stocked and the appliances were extremely useful
Dee was an amazing host. She was quick to respond, so thoughtful. Her place is just outside the heart of Dublin in a good location with close amenities. Have everything you need. Would stay again!
Dee was a very good host and everything is exactly as described

Lovely, private and quiet separate cottage at the back of the property. ( i did not understand this from the website). Dee is an excellent host - very responsive to any requests or issues with the house. 
We could not work the TV -  but this did not matter to us. Likely our ineptness !!!! 
Highly recommended for the independent traveller who values staying in a  realù irish neighbourhood, privacy and value.
A very nice and clean place to stay. Dee is very helpful. I would definitely recommend staying here.
Great location.
