Patrick was a great host. His place is in a great location and he was great communicating with us. I definitely recommend using his place and hope it is available if I ever visit Dublin again.

Patricks apartment was perfect for us.  We were 2 couples.  Having a washing machine was very convenient since we will be traveling for 2 months.  The location in Smithfield was very convenient for touring around Dublin.  The Tram is just a block away, the express bus to the airport, other buses, and the Hop on Hop off bus stops are very near.  It is also convenient to walk to the tourist areas.  The location has plenty of restaurants, pubs and grocery store near by.  The location was also relatively quiet.  We would definitely stay here again.  Patrick provided us with loads of information. Thank you Patrick.

Pats place is spacious and comfortable (with great views over the Dublin skyline), and in a fantastic location. The Luas tram stops just outside but its also walkable to many Dublin sights.  With a number of restaurants, coffee shops, a pharmacy and a fresh food supermarket just below the apartment, its v convenient for meals and amenities.  Theres also a mini playground outside for kids.

Pat is a friendly host who met us exactly as planned and ensured we had all that we needed on arrival.  There were lots of tourist information leaflets and guidebooks in the apartment.  It was also nice to find a few useful food items left in the kitchen - condiments, sugar, tea bags, etc.

A comfortable and airy apartment in a fantastic location, walking distance to just about anything you could want or need in the city. Patrick was a great host--responsive and thoughtful. We had a great time!

It was a spacious, bright apartment in a good location but it was tired. 
The apartment would benefit from a fresh coat of paint and some TLC.  I felt the bedding and towels were of inferior quality, the towels being quite stiff.
Patrick was great to work with and the apartment is in a great part of town, making every thing walkable.
Patrick's place is perfectly located near all kinds of wonderful restaurants, pubs, transit and museums. It is quiet and clean, modern and comfortable.  We enjoyed our stay!

Pat met us and explained how everything worked.  He also told us of places to visit in the area.  We were a group of mature ladies on a girly 
weekend from scotland and the apartment gave us everything we needed and was very warm and comfortable
Modern house, good location!
Great location for access to Temple Bar and central Dublin
Very comfortable, great location and excellent hospitality!

Unfortunately we werent able to get in contact with Andy at all during the stay. I had messaged before arrival to ask about taxis, and called on arrival to ask about parking. He replied to my message the day after my stay saying hed been on a long haul flight, in those circumstances he shouldve given me an alternative contact or not taken a booking. 

The house was fine, although the thermostat was set to only 14.5 degrees when we arrived so it was very cold and too a long time to warm up. 

The house is well situated for a visit to the city and for for purpose for a night or two.
My two college-aged children stayed at Andys place and found everything as described.  It was a perfect location for walking to all the sites and check-in could not be easier!
Clean, great location
Nice, clean flat. Great location. Very easy to check in, good response from the host.

Great location! Easy walk to Temple Bar and many other attractions. Street was quiet. Parking was readily available during the week. We were not there on the weekend so I cant attest to that. Apartment was clean, beds were comfortable. Overall, a great stay!
Location! This place is a short walk from almost all attractions Dublin has to offer. Andy was quick to respond and gave us plenty of local recommendations. We would definitely stay here again!
Really convenient to city center. Walked everywhere! Easy check-in and check-out. Would stay here again.
Stayed at Andys house, my first Airbnb experience. It was so lovely. A real home from home. I would definitely stay again
Great communication and location. Very clean and cosy l!
Perfect area and adorable space!

Andy's place is a great location. Near everything but far enough away to avoid the noise. He has great suggestions for local spots and ways to get around. We did have an issue with the wifi not working. And the original description stated flexible check in time but we were then told strict check-in time of 2pm so we had to alter some plans but it worked out okay. Only other issue was with the smell. We experienced an odor when we first checked in. Could have been from the cleaner used but it was very noticeable.

Central, amazing location!  Close to everything, including the hop-on hop-off busses, 10 minute walk to the Long Hall library to see the Book is Kells, 5 minute walk to Temple Bar. The place was very clean and quiet and check in was code entry, very easy. We stayed here with our school aged kids and there was plenty of room for the 4 of us. It took a bit of time to find the fridgeîit is in the closet with cleaning materials and the washer.   Check out was strict 11 am î we were washing the dishes and starting to take out our  at 11 and the cleaning lady came right then at 11:05. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

cleaning was okay but could be better/the smaller bedroom on the streetside was very noisy/

location was great/communication with Andy and Check In very easy and good/

The appartment is very well located and it is easy to park the car.
Everything was perfect!

This home is in such a prime location for seeing a majority of the sights in Dublin! We found that everything was walkable from our Airbnb! Andy offered maps, tips, and brochures that helped us identify how to best spend our time in Dublin. Just be cautious of the bottom stair as its an older home and it has a bit of a slippery angle to it.
Very nice and central location in a quiet street.
Location, location, location. And did I mention location. Great place. Accurate description. Easy communication.

Andy's home was in a great location - close to Brazen Head, Trinity College and walkable to pretty much everything which was nice. I did think the living area would be a bit more spacious and the home would be a bit more "fresh"; also a bigger couch would be nice as seating 4 grown adults wasnt the most comfortable. There was a strange sewerage smell :/  Overall, the home served its purpose but personally wasnt ideal for our group.

An excellent place to stay. All was as advertised. The location is extremely central. The flat was clean, had reasonable crockery/ cooking supplies, everything worked well.
The only downside was that the smaller bedroom could be noisy if you have the window open which we did as it was hot. We slept well but if you were a light or sensitive sleeper you might find it noisy. The main room was fine. 
Otherwise this was excellent, Andy communicated well, and the location is great. I would recommend this Airbnb.

This listing is all about the location. Most of the sights are within easy walking distance. The house itself is comfortable. Check in was simple. Andy left detailed instructions and recommendations for local attractions. I would recommended this place.
Would recommend to anyone looking for a comfy place near everything--walking distance to all Dublin attractions. Hot water, heating, and all amenities were great.
Quaint 2 bedroom apartment. Close to the action in Dublin.

Andys place was in a great location and it suited us fine. Its pretty small but we spent our time walking around Dublin and not hanging at his place. Andy was thorough with his entrance directions and this made getting there and getting inside really easy. 

Also, the stairs are really steep so if you have mobility issues, you should look elsewhere as the second floor was really tight. My bride and I slept on the street side with the window cracked and it was pretty noisy for us. We woke up each night to drunk boys hollering in the street at 3a.m. and consistent traffic.

Home away from home ! You can't get any closer to the city than Andy's place and it was so quiet at night which was great. I would definitely recommend staying here and checking in was very quick and easy. Thanks for having us Andy !
Great place and perfect location! Highly Recommend! Brendan

We stayed for a few nights at Andys home in Dublin, amazing location and very clean. 

Just a block from Brazen head, finished our nights there with live music during our stay. 

Love the accommodation book, very helpful for house, restaurants, pubs, music, excursions and local etc.

Andy and Derek were both very helpful. Highly Recommended.
Decent unit. Very convenient.
Great spot! Thanks Andy!

Great location to everywhere you want to go! The apartment is in a quiet street near the oldest pub. 
Andy had great suggestions of what to do in Dublin. 
The living room was great to sit in at night and reflect on the days adventures.
Great accommodations.  Great location 10 to 15 minutes away from every major site.  Spacious house, so much better value than a hotel room/ suite.

Great location very close to Temple bar area and all the attractions.
Easy check in and was able to park on the street.
The floor in the upstairs bedroom has a soft spot and the stairs are a bit tricky so be careful.
Ligging is prima maar te duur. Uitzicht naar buiten is er niet.
Excellent location, fast and good contact, convenient check-in and check-out, quite easy parking on the street in front of the apartment, taking into account location.

Thanks for all!  We had a great time.  apartment location is great!  We managed to see a lot!  The apartment has everything you need.
Recommend
Perfect location.
Great location for Dublin, good little bolthole to use as a base for seeing the city. Andys communication was great, check in was easy and rooms were comfy. Thanks for everything!
Great location in quite area just outside of Temple Bar.  Walk to everything!
This house is a great location to walk to everything Dublin!
Awesome location!
Place was smaller than expected.  Second bedroom is very small.  We were there when it was really warm so we needed to have windows open and the noise was an issue.
Awesome Airbnb, great location and easy check-in!
Location is fabulous, the house is perfectly set up for a family of four, and Andys dad is a marvelous host :)
Great location close to attractions, clean, and comfortable for our 2 night stay.

This place was the perfect location. Easy walk to local places like Temple district, Jameson, Cathedral and much more.
Plenty of room and very clean. 
Very happy with checking in and host communication.
Great location, prompt communication, and nice little spot. Top notch!

The best location in the city.  Everything was so close. 
This was my third time visiting Dublin and this was by far the best accommodations.
The location is outstanding. Not too close to be disturbed by noise but well close enough to enjoy some of Dublin's highlights.
An amazing place to stay. Very modern and very clean, it's so close to everything. The host was amazing!!
A perfectly located place to discover Dublin!
Great location.  Clean and easy check in.   Loved it

Great location short walk to Christ Church Cathedral and Temple Bar as well as Brazen Head Pub, easy check in with the smart lock code and very clean. Good Choice if you want to be close to a ton of sights in Dublin.
Perfect location; short walk to Guiness and Temple Bar and Hop on Hop off bus lines.
Close to everything! Easy push button combination lock for quick and easy entry. Clean.
The location of this place is amazing. It is very close to all the action but very quiet. Keyless entry allowed the three of us to come and go individually.
Great location! Great for the four of us
Excellent location. Good host contact from start to finish. would highly recommend
Awesome amenities, great location (8 minutes to Temple Bar & 15-20 to the train), and very comfortable. Everything you need for your holiday! Thanks!
Good location and safe.

Cute, little house that is perfectly located to explore the city. Great pubs and restaurants very close, as well as most sightseeing spots. Andy even hast a list waiting for you in the house.
The house itself has a living room and a kitchen on the ground floor. Upstairs are the two bedrooms with a queed bed each. On of them faces the street, so you might hear possible noises outside, but not a big deal. Both bedrooms a very nice!

A great place to stay for a trip to Dublin. This apartment was located in the heart of the city --  most major attractions were within walking distance. The amenities and nice touches in the apartment were very appreciated, as well as the tea! We enjoyed our stay very much and would love to come back and explore more!
Maison agreable et calme. Pratique en transport a 30 min du centre ville.
Everything was great!

The place is well organized, sparkling clean, has a friendly atmosphere and has many thoughtful touches to make your stay more enjoyable. Hosts are friendly, helpful and quick to respond to messages. The bed was really comfy and the kitchen was great. My one criticism is that the shower pressure isn't as powerful as I would like but it's not a big deal. The location is very convenient for getting into town. Overall, my girlfriend and I had a great stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Brian, Ronson and Juan's place was very nice and clean. They had tea and coffee for us. Check-in process was very smooth too, good communication. 

They were also very helpful in helping us travel around Dublin with their tips and detailed instructions. Really appreciated their eco friendly stand as well.
Very thank you! It was a nice trip and you have done your part perfekt for it

Very good stay, super clean room with a whole cleaning structure inside the house.
We had the pleasure of meeting the amphitheans, what an attentive couple. Our hospdagem was very good, we used the kitchen that can be shared.
Very good location, about 5 minutes from Boombridge (Luas) station which is 15 minutes from downtown.
We recommend it for sure, and will return to stay if necessary without thinking twice.
Clean. Quiet area. Nice place to stay.

Guys whoever stays at this place can call themselves lucky! The host was super friendly, understanding, funny and caring. Whenever an issue came up they helped us out. Immediately. The bathroom was always clean and the bedroom was also clean. They even provided drinking bottles for during the day. Public transports were also close by so that reaching the city centre wasn't complicated to reach. If anybody is looking for a good time in Dublin and uncomplicated hosts should definitely consider this place. Also the facilities were always reachable for guests and the other rooms (dining, kitchen, livingroom) are also decorated familiarly and modern. We didn't happen to hang out in the garden a lot but once we did, and it was very nice to enjoy the coffee on the terrace. All in all, we had a great time there and you shouldn't hesitate visiting

Lovely hosts who provided informative, prompt and helpful communication throughout. The room was clean, bright and just right for staying in for a few days. With access to a shared kitchen, shared bathroom and a short walk to the tram into the city.
It was a great, quiet location outside of the city with easy access to public transportation.  The room was simple and fine.  We were hoping to meet Brian and Ronson, but sadly they werent around.
My parents enjoyed their room during 6 nights. The house is just 10 min walks from the Luas station which was prfect for easily going to the city centre.
Good location near the Luas stop. Loads of great recommendations for places to eat and drink and for live music, thank you for that!

Unfortunately, and strangely (given the other reviews), our stay was definitely not as we expected. In our case, specifically, the room was not clean. We imagine that other stays have been much more ideal, however our room was unclean bordering on unhygienic - it was definitely uncleaned, or poorly cleaned, after the previous guests. After good communication prior to our stay, the communication regarding some issues that required resolving was poorer. The room was cleaned adequately, but other issues were eventually ignored. The lock on the room was broken, there were some wires exposed on the ceiling of the bathroom, and the pipe under the sink was leaking creating a little puddle under the sink. This, it was communicated, would be fixed, but none were. It seemed clear to us that the hosts simply didn't have time for the maintenance required with hosting an AirBnb accommodation. Furthermore, and this was our experience, they therefore definitely didn't have the time to create the coziness advertised - we didn't feel welcome to use any of the shared spaces, mainly because the other people living in the house barely looked up to say hello, definitely not up for a chat or offering any advice (as also advertised). After all, this is an AirBnb that we are paying to stay in, not a favour that is being done for us - and we certainly felt like we were a nuisance in this space. We spent quite a bit of time contacting the hosts and Airbnb support during this stay, and it definitely tainted our trip.

This is our first negative experience with AirBnb, and we are disappointed with how the hosts dealt with this after us raising our concerns after the stay. We have not received any communication since the second day of 4 (nights) of our stay.

Besides this, the location has a good connection to the city, and our bed was comfortable. It was one of the more affordable rooms we found, and if none of these issues existed it would definitely have been good value for money.

The house is modern with cool funky tasteful decor and is very clean and well looked after.The facilities in general were excellent and the room i stayed was spotless and very comfortable.The hosts were extremely warm and welcoming and very helpful providing directions to the house,information on the local area and recommendations for bars and restaurants and so forth.There were also nice touches like tea,coffee and cereal provided,fresh towels and free wi fi.
I would highly recommend this accomodation

Overall this was a very disappointing Air B and B experience. 

My partner and I;
¢	travel extensively, 
¢	stay in Air B and Bs regularly, 
¢	are Air B and B super hosts in Canada,
and this is the only negative review that we have ever given.

Essentially, 7 St Finbars Rd is a boarding house. There were 8 other people renting space in this house and the owner/host lives off-site. We never met him or his partner, the other host. There are 6 permanent tenants who live upstairs and 2 Air B and B suites downstairs. The kitchen and laundry room are in constant use by all of these people.
The problems we encountered were as follows:
¢	The shared bathroom on the main floor has no ventilation and there is an overpowering smell of mould. The bathroom has no window or operating fan. The mould appears to be in the sub-floor level and everyone living in the house comments on it. The regular tenants use the upstairs bathroom. Both Air B and B rooms must use this bathroom. 
¢	We had only one meeting with a co-host. Juan briefly explained the house rules. We did not see the co-host again throughout our 4 day stay. We were not advised if we were allowed to use any of the common space.
¢	The bathroom sink did not drain. We advised Juan of this issue on the first day. For 3 days we brushed our teeth in the shower as the issue with the drain trap was not addressed.
¢	False advertising. The listing advertised that the hosts were a gay couple. This attracts people like ourselves. We are gay and were hoping to be in a home that was welcoming. Instead, we were 2 of 10 people in a small house where there was no communication between the permanent residents and the temporary (Air B and B) residents. 
¢	There were multiple posters and signs telling us the rules (eg. take out the garbage). But there was no attention to cleanliness of the bathroom or laundry area. No bath mats or towels were replaced throughout our 4 day stay (even through there was another Air B and B couple staying in the next room.
¢	The bed linens were threadbare and bleach stained. The pillows were ancient and lumpy.
¢	The 2 Air B and B rooms are aside the common bathroom and laundry. The Air B and B area (including the laundry and bathroom) is converted garage and the laundry runs constantly due to the high number of residents in this house. At times we would have to move the laundry racks and baskets just to enter our room, which was beside the laundry room. 
Overall, even considering the low price, this was our most disappointing Air B and B experience ever.
I had my best Airbnb-experience at his house. It was lovely.
We had a very nice stay for St. Patricks Day weekend at Rorys home! Rory is a really great and professional host.

Rory is a friendly, kind man.  Great conversation. Communication was great & he was very helpful when it came to making sure we knew when/how to get to the airport.  It would have been nice to have been provided towels,  instead of having to ask/search for them in the early morning hours.  Also was a bit odd that we were asked to take our rubbish away with us when we left. Otherwise, great stay.
Rory is an excellent host. Very nice, interesting to talk in a very nice way and gives you also good recommendations for the evening. The place is very nice, too. I'm sure I'll come back again
It has been a pleasure staying and Rorys! I can definitely recommend him as a host! From my arrival to the mindfully prepared breakfast, it has been a five-star experience. Thank you, Rory!

Rory was a super host to myself and 3 friends - he couldnt do enough for us and made us feel incredibly welcome in his home. Its an easy journey from the city centre by DART to Killester and then a short walk to the house. Plenty of food and drink options in the Clontarf area too.
Rory was a hospitable and very friendly host. His house is very centrally located in a lovely suburb and near to some nice restaurants and cafes. Would recommend
Great stay!

Absolutely wonderful host that goes above and beyond.  Rory has lovely accommodation in a very picturesque part of Dublin.  His location is convenient for access to town and a Dart station only a short stroll from his house.

Rory puts on a lovely breakfast that sets you up for the day and is a great man to chat with.

Id certainly recommend staying with Rory and Ill certainly be back again.
Rory is running a great house and breakfast laid out perfectly !!

The room and also the house were beautiful and clean. It is very close to the bay of Dublin and good for long walks. There is also a nice park closeby. Rory welcomed me with a nice chat and was very committed to his guests! Thank you for the nice stay!
Rory is a great host- very communicative and kind. Please note this is B&B style, where he stays in the home as well. Place was clean and had ample parking.
Great location. Bus stops nearby. Wonderful hospitality.
Rory is the great host!! He is very kind and gentleman. I would stay more days.Thank you very much, Roly!!!
Very warm welcome, impeccably clean house, I would recommend Rorys accommodation 100%

Rorys place in Clontarf could not have been nicer. He picked me up from the Dart station, drove me around where he lives, to show me the good places to have dinner and the lovely bay and park good for walking near his house.  The accommodation was quiet, and clean, and his morning breakfast was plentiful and tasty. One afternoon we had a lovely chat with tea and cake, and he even drove me to the airport. My stay at his house could not have been better. I highly recommend staying with him. The dart ride into Dublin is only 20-25 minutes.

Rorys place is spotless, quiet for a good sleep, modern, comfortable and homely, topped off with outstanding hospitality and a marvellous breakfast.
We will be back..
OK:)
Rory has a lovely home in an excellent location. I felt very welcome and would definitely recommend staying here

Fabulous hospitality, very clean home, centrally located, the host Rory was a pleasure to deal with and very friendly. Ample parking available and a very nice breakfast really went down a treat! We most definitely will be back!

Rory is a great host, alway (it's the second time I stayed there) very welcoming and up for a good discussion. The location is quiet and nice, but not far from a few bars and restaurants. The room, although simple, was clean and comfortable. Great stay.
I enjoyed my stay with Rory. He is a very nice host. Great value accommodation in a lovely area. Close to city centre.
Rory is the most welcoming host Ive ever met. Even more his place is spotless and close to public transport which will take you to all the sights you want to see. Highly recommendable!
Rory was a great host!  Wonderful rooms and an affable host! Great location, too.
Beautiful house in a nice area.  Short walk to the train, and then only three stops to downtown. Rory was a welcoming host.
Rory was very welcoming when we arrived and he went out of his way to help us. He made our stay really enjoyable and it was the nicest cup of coffee we had in a while.

Rory asked us what time we expected to arrive, and we gave him a ballpark figure. After (Hidden by Airbnb) maps sent us on a circuitous route we ended up behind schedule by an hour, although his initial message didnt convey an urgency regarding arrival time. For this reason, we were very surprised to receive a call, in which Rory  came across as quite rude. When we arrived at his place we were prepared to cancel the booking had his disrespectful tone continued, but he requested that we forget about the call. While he was pleasant throughout our time at the Bnb, his initial contact coloured the rest of our stay with him. Other shortcomings, such as only one towel and one toilet roll being left out would have been completely forgivable, but we will not be returning specifically because of the issue mentioned above.
Very nice

Rory is the best AirBnB host Ive had in two years of using the service. Super responsive when I was making reservations. Rory lives on site. He gave us tea when we arrived and helped us make our plans to go into town, he even gave us a ride to the bus station. He provided a wonderful breakfast in the morning.

Rory was an amazing host and a very sweet man. His home was beautiful and the room I was in was exactly what i was looking for. The breakfast in the morning was delicious and very thoughtful. The neighborhood was walkable, the communication was great and the check in was easy! This was a perfect Air Bnb experience. Thank you again Rory! Would highly recommend!
Kind hospitality from Rory, thanks a bunch

Rory was very kind and gave great tips on check in.  He offered to take us to the Dart Station. Open to communication during the booking process with quick responses. Very clean home.  Nice bedrooms with comfy beds.  Good sized bathroom.  :)
Rory is a great host unobtrusive but very thoughtful. His home is spotless and has a very homely feel. I definitely reccomend a stay at Rory
Great host really friendly and breakfast was totally unexpected and delicious.
Staying with Rory was a wonderful experience! We would love to return again!
Rorys place ticked all the boxes for our needs great location lovely area.  A great host all round.

15 min entfernt von killester dart. Super gastfreundlich.
Sehr sauber.
A detailed and helpful check-in, clean, comfortable and great location.
Very nice house and location, and amazing host.

We had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay. Everything was comfortable and very clean. The house is beautifully furnished and the breakfasts were tasty. Best of all was our host who is generous and kind, friendly and knowledgeable, good to talk to but not intrusive. We would be pleased to stay there again. Thank you very much Rory for all your help.
Close to all required amenities

Rory is an outstanding host; he takes the time to welcome, to offer a cup of tea, to offer guidance on where to eat etccc.  His house is immaculate and I was given a lovely breakfast. I highly recommend Rory.
Conveniently located near city and beside the sea. Very clean and comfortable and Rory is an excellent host, friendly and courteous. The breakfast was also very nice. Highly recommended.

Perfecte locatie in een hele nette buurt. De manier hoe Rory zijn gasten benaderd is fantastisch. Hij had tips en bracht ons (4 pers) zelfs naar de busstop en naar het station. Het allerbelangrijkst was voor ons dat alles brandschoon was!

Had a brilliant stay at Rory's. Very welcoming and easy to communicate with, served up a cracking breakfast too.
Had a single-bed room that I couldn't fault. Location is great right as it's near the Dart Station
A very nice quiet peaceful house with an incredibly helpful host
Thanks for the easy and convenient stay! Everything is Dublin was a simple walk away and airport connections were close by. Would definitely stay here again!
Thank you for having us at your beautiful home!

Charming spot in a convenient (but still quiet) location for dining and recreation in a hip neighborhood, with easy access to the attractions of center city. Really comfortable and well appointed, would stay again in a heartbeat!
We only stayed one night, Susan's place is in a great location very close and accessible to get to and from Dublin city centre. Comfortable beds and great shower.
Excellent host, very accommodating. House was sparkling clean also . Highly recommended
Great stay in a great place! Susan was very helpful and responsive. Location was excellent. The place was sparkling clean, comfortable and with top quality amenities. It has everything you need.

Susan's place is a perfect spot for exploring Dublin - great location with easy access to public transit, pubs, restaurants and parks. The house includes everything you would possibly need for a comfortable stay and Susan was easy to connect with for any issues.

Siobhan is the best that can happen to you, if you'll stay for a few nights in Dublin. It was really a home away from home and I felt welcomed and secure from the very first moment. Her home is thoughtfully decorated, clean and beautiful. The breakfast is a special bonus to start your day right. The Luas is just a few steps away from the doorstep and also a walk down to the city takes only about 20-30 minutes. 
I hope to return one day.

Everything was fine! Siobhan was very friendly. Weve felt welcome.
Breakfast was made with Love.

Siobhan was such a joy during or visit. Her home is the perfect location- just outside the main city but right on the green line to head into town. You likely wont need a car if you stay here, unless you plan to drive farther out from Dublin. This area is very foot-traffic friendly. The cereal, bread, fruit, and fresh juice were the perfect way to start the day for us, and it saved us money on our meal budget. Our stay was in March, and the house can get very cold, but there is a heater in the room & Siobhan let us know how to turn it on when we were there. She also had a heated blanket in the bed, which was perfect! Rudy, her dog, is super sweet and loves a god scratch under the collar. This was our first trip to Dublin, and I cant imagine a better spot to stay.

Siobhan has a wonderful and very clean house. The bedroom is huge and the bed is very confortable !! Thank you for your warm welcome and all the advices. It was for sure one of my best experience on Airbnb. The house is located in the north of Dublin but it's very easy to go downtown with the tram (about 15 min). We have appreciated the breakfast which was very good (with croissant !!). I can only recommend to go there !
Siobhan is an incrediable host! Breakfast is delicious! :) Location is great. We highly recommend this accommodation. Thanks for everything! :))

The room was as pictured. Siobhan is a lovely host with a warm, inviting energy and I enjoyed chatting with her each time our paths crossed. The tram is about one block away, which takes you directly to the city center. You could also easily walk to or from the city center, which I did several times. As a solo traveler, I felt very safe both in the house and the neighborhood. Would 100% stay here again!

My friend and I had a splendid time at Siobhans home. She welcomed us warmly and made us feel at home from the very first minute. Breakfast was wonderful, with berries and fresh orangejuice and so much more than I had expected. I would stay at her place again.

Siobhan is the consummate air bnb host and an excellent conversationalist. She goes above and beyond to make ones stay extra comfortable and special. Being¬†a dog lover Rudy made my stay even more homely.

I have stayed in Air BNB's throughout the world and have rarely come across such hospitality. I could not recommend Sionhams¬†place more!

Thank you Siobhan!

Anthony

¬†

Siobhan's place is a convenient Luas' ride from downtown. Her home is full of tasteful art, bright colorful decor with a large homey kitchen. Lovely plants grace the patio.  The bedroom room is large and very quiet, tastefully decorated and sparkling clean. We loved  it and hope to return when we visit Dublin!

For my first experience of Ireland for 6 nights, Siobhan's home was the Goldilocks just-right choice. Historic interior architecture. Each private room and common living space contained artfully eclectic furnishings, books, print resources. The breakfast table was a particular delight ..fresh flowers, orange juice, croissant, yogurt+granola, fruit+berries cup. Thoroughly comfortable large bed. Modest interaction with pooch Rudi. Siobhan enthusiastically offers suggestions for walkabouts of any interest, especially music (at Cobblestone Pub near Jameson Distillery). +Do take the DART train out to Howth village harbor for the scenic cliff-side-trail trek to Baily Lighthouse.

Location! in a local neighborhood (Phibsborough) proved a unexpected bonus: my first night happened to be 'musical bingo Thursday' at nearby Downey's Pub (older boisterous inter-generational crowd), and next day by chance got a ticket to the sold-out Bohemian FC match at historic Dalymount Park ..followed by Guinness 'til wee hours at The Hut ..next days delicious breakfast or lunch at Woodstock or Kennedy's cafes. Note these are all within 3 blocks of Siobhan's  ..at this rate I'd never see central Dublin! ..but the Luas tram stop or bus stop is handily at the end of the block. The Botanic Gardens (+Glasnevin Cemetery) and River Liffey at O'Connell St might be a brisk '20min' walk (in opposite directions) ..but may also likely take an hour ..because one readily encounters Dubliners welcoming/initiating a 'brief' chat.

We had a wonderful time staying with Siobhan. She was a local so knew exactly what to do and when. Our room was perfect and included little touches that meant a lot on our long journey. I would highly recommend. I felt at home even though I was many miles away.

Siobhan was the nicest AirBnB host I've met! She was very welcoming, knowledgeable of the area and helpful for a first time visitor. Very quick to respond and happy to help. Her place is very nice, she set up an amazing breakfast every morning and made sure I was well looked after with lots of little extras in my room. It had the service of a 5-star hotel with the feeling like I'm staying with friends or family. Quick 20 minute walk to the center. Her dog Rudy was very friendly and a great addition.

Siobhan offers hospitality and her special touches will make your stay more than comfortable. Delightful energy and a beautiful space. The shower has plenty of hot water and great pressure, she provides a beautiful spacious bathroom and 1/2 bath close to your room. Best Airbnb experience Ive had.

Siobhan is a great, friendly host and her place is perfect! Lovely and clean room, amazing breakfast, I would definitely stay here again. 
p.s. Rudy is one of the most adorable dog I have ever seen

Such a great experience staying with Siobhan and her dog Rudy. Her place is very clean and well equipped and she is extremely knowledgable. I cant reccomend it more highly. While it isn't city centre, I found the walk quite easy and enjoyable. Rudy is a lovely dog, very easy going and friendly.
Good stay during one month for studies in Dublin. There is all the necessary equipment for computer and mobile connections, chargers and adapters available on site . The host is very fine.

Siobhan is truly a special soul! Our stay was incredible! She welcomed my mom & I with coffee/tea/cookies.  Made sure we were comfortable and gave suggestions on our couple of days in Dublin. She was very thoughtful and welcoming. Highly recommend! Thanks Siobhan!

Shioban is a lovely and engaging host. Her pup Rudy is friendly and easy-going. The breakfast is yummy. The bed and linens are comfortable.  The shared bathrooms arrangement works just fine, so don't let it deter you from booking.
EXCELLENT AS ALWAYS

We had a great stay at Siobhan's place. She was very helpful regarding transportation and activities in the area. We also loved the breakfast provided.  Overall, we had a fabulous stay and would highly recommend.

Our host was spectacular! She was so helpful with helping us get around the city. Lots of great suggestions. Will definitely come back someday and stay with her again. Made us feel right at home and her dog Rudyù was adorable. Made the transition from leaving our pets that much easier.

I cannot express how grateful I am to have stayed at Siobhan's house.  She welcomes you with a smile and makes you feel at home.  Everything in her home is neat and clean, and breakfast is delicious.  If you need help getting somewhere she can always help you or recommend places to visit. We will definitely stay at Siobhan's house again :)

Siobhans place was one of the best aspects of our stay in Dublin! Siobhan is a lovely, welcoming host and made us feel very much at home. Our room was extremely clean and comfortable, and we loved all her thoughtful touches. Siobhan would lay out lovely breakfast foods for us each morning, and went above and beyond in assisting us with our needs. Would definitely recommend Siobhans place to anyone looking for a cosy stay with outstanding Irish hospitality.

The Best Airbnb Ive stayed at! Siobhan was born to host! :) Outstanding hospitality along with great breakfasts made our stay a delight! Siobhan went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed for a great stay. Thank you! Hope to be back soon! :)

Such a kind host ever.
If I have a chance to come back Dublin, I must choose her house again.
Great location, clean room, fresh breakfast!

A warm, inviting home, a beautiful bedroom (and bathrobes!), freshly squeezed orange juice, homemade granola and warm scones in the morning, and most important, a lovely, kind and caring host. And a friendly dog! What more could you ask for? We loved our stay with Siobhan!

It was a graet pleasure being guest in  Siobhans wunderful house , I felt almost being at home. Everything was perfect, very cosy room,  great breakfast, Food shops and public transport nearby but also  very easy to walk to the city centre.  Siobhan welcomes her guests with valuable tips in Dublin and surroundings. Highly recomended !!! Thanks, Siobhan

Siobhans place was a gem! Perfect distance away from the city center and close to public transportation. Space is clean and stylish, plus Siobhan goes the extra mile to provide breakfast goodies every morning. Siobhan was an extremely kind and welcoming host. She greeted us when we arrived and went through a map of local sights. We really enjoyed our stay! Thanks a million, Siobhan and Rudy :-)

From the first point of communication to the very end, Siobhan was an amazing host! She was kind, thoughtful, and generous.

Her home is spotless, beautiful, and located close to everything we needed and wanted. We parked our car on her street, as it was a very safe neighbourhood, and we decided to walk everywhere in Dublin. Though not in the central area, all the places we, and any tourist would want to go, was approx 20-minute walk away... and you're walking through some great neighbourhoods so it doesn't even feel that long. 

Breakfast was delicious. A combination of fresh pastries, fresh berries, freshly squeezed orange juice, and a warm cup of tea/coffee was the start to a great day. Her handwritten note what is also very thoughtful.

Siobhan and Rudy her dog, tops the list of great Airbnb hosts, and we've had many!

Our stay at Siobhan's place has been simply one of my favorite Airbnb experiences to date.  

We stayed in the downstairs room; we were the only guests during our stay, though there is another room available on Airbnb.  Our room was very clean, the bed and pillows comfortable; amenities included not only clean linens and towels, but also slippers, bathrobes, and a USB plug (for charging phones from abroad!).  The bathrooms, though technically shared, were sparkling clean as well.  Siobhan had also provided a thoughtfully-annotated book of recommendations for the surrounding neighborhood as well as the city.  

The location is not downtown, but it is about a 20-minute walk through some lovely neighborhoods or an even shorter tram ride to get to the city center.

Siobhan herself was the highlight of the stay.  She was warm, friendly, and engaging to converse with--truly a kind heart who made us feel at home.  We enjoyed all our morning chats with her in her cozy kitchen, over delicious, freshly-prepared breakfasts.  Her dog Rudy was also sweet and very well-behaved.  

In sum, if you like clean, homey spaces and heartwarming hosts, you would be hard-pressed to find a better stay than Siobhan's home.

Siobhan is a very welcoming, warm, thoughtful and enthousiastic person. She made us feel at home straight away. The bed in the backroom sleeps great and we loved her bedding. The breakfast provided in the morning is delicious and a very nice gesture.
Going from Siobhans to the city center is only about 10 min by tram. On a bright day it's a 20 min walk. For us the location was great and as a bonus it saves you a lot of money not to stay in an expensive hotel in the city center. 
Thumbs up for Siobhan!

I have stayed in many an Airbnb and this was far and away one of my absolute favorites if not my favorite (and I've stayed in a mansion with a large group of friends before lol).  Siobhan's house is more than just a house -  it's a home.  This fact is evident the minute you step into the threshold and are greeted with a warm genuine smile, a thoughtfully decorated interior and a furry tail wagging to greet you.  It was a treat to feel so at home when you've been on the road like I have for a bit!  There is beautiful art that is a feast for the eyes on the walls; everything is decorated with such thought, care and love!  

Her dog, Rudy, is adorable; shy at times and a giant love bug.  A much appreciated bonus was hanging out with him and chatting with Siobhan over cups of warm tea!  The living space is super cozy and cute to boot!

Breakfast is PERFECT and delicious!  I even left early one morning for a tour and she kindly prepared it for me the night before to be ready in the morning, freshly hand made orange juice and all!

If you want to stay in Ireland and get a feel for the country, culture and stay in a home this is absolutely the place for you!  While not in the city center its location is perfect!  Easy public transportation will get you to the heart of Dublin in 10 to 15 minutes as the tram is RIGHT next to her home.  It was everything I could have wanted and more. 

Thank you so much for a lovely stay and it was such a joy meeting you!  I couldn't be more appreciative or happy I stumbled across your listing.

We had a really pleasant stay in Dublin and it was partly due to Siobhan's kindness and hospitality ; probably one of the best hosts I've ever met through Airbnb ! We felt like at home from the second we got in her cosy appartment, where everything is exactly as described in her summary. She was most particularly very accomodating with us and full of good advices for making our trip enjoyable, and really discreet also for a shared flat. Therefore, we definitely recommand her place for your short-stay terms in Dublin. Thanks again for everything Siobhan !

I stayed in Siobhans home for four nights with my boyfriend in November. We had a lovely time staying with her, she is a caring and thoughtful host who goes above and beyond to make you feel very comfortable. Her home is clean and warm, in a nice area of Dublin with good access to public transport and not too far a walk from the city centre (20-30 mins). When we arrived Siobhan already had the electric blanket on for us and offered us a wide selection of teas. Every morning she prepared a nice breakfast for us so we could start each day off well. She provided lots of local tips and knowledge and answered any questions we had. We had an amazing time visiting Dublin -and staying at Siobhans (and meeting her sweet dog Rudy) - definitely played a big part in this! Would recommend to stay here when visiting. Thank you!

Siobhan's place is so amazing! It was honestly the best Airbnb experience that I've ever had. I loved all the little touches she provided during my stay - very thoughtful! She really makes you feel at home and it was so nice to come back to her place after exploring Ireland! Also her dog Rudy is a sweetheart so that is an added bonus :)
Siobhan's home was wonderful. She is kind and has some great advice about Dublin. Her dog Rudy is very sweet. The breakfast was a nice touch as well!

We had a really nice stay during St. Patrick's Day weekend. We could reach temple bar by feet and even a taxi was cheep going there. The house was cozy and I really liked the area. Supermarkets are just a small walk away. The only thing that was missing is a hair dryer and when asking for it, it was just said there isn't one. But overall it's a great place to stay in Dublin.

Petite maison dans un quartier proche du centre ville en transport en commun ou voiture.
Confort correct pour 4 personnes pour quelques jours.
Appartmeant was great .vey luxurious.great location ... great host ... couldnt be happier ...

This is a delightful apartment with all that you could possibly need. We are a family of 4 (children aged 16 and 11) and we stayed for an extended period of time.  It is spacious, clean and well maintained. The 2 bedrooms are large and comfortable and the onsite laundry room, with brand new washer and dryer, make daily living a breeze. The fridge freezer is also nice and big. The owner also included  many welcome gifts and thoughtful touches.

The area is also amazing. The building and grounds are well maintained and quiet. Its also lovely how little children play together, in the gardens, during the day. It is 15 minutes from the airport and right beside the train station, which takes you all over. The village is walking distance to the village for all your necessities.

My absolute favourite part of our stay was the proximity to Newbridge Farm! As a runner I could run the most beautiful paths woven through the farm. The farm also has farm animals and a gorgeous Downton Abbeyù manor house which can be viewed by guided tour.

I simply cannot say enough about this owners attention to detail and the value for money that this accommodation offers. 

We would stay there again and again and thank Niamh and Jeff for their hospitality.

Loved our stay here! We were very comfortable and cozy. The open kitchen and the balcony would be my favourite part of the place. The neighbourhood was nice too, pretty close to the supermarket and the train to the city. The backyard was nice as well, we were able to skate around and my little sister even made some friends. Would stay here again for sure!

Helenas place is perfect for solo travelers! The room is cozy and has a very homey feeling. The apartment is super clean and has a nice modern look to it! Location is absolutely perfect and convenient. Id never been to Dublin so this was one of my main concerns, but I had no trouble getting around. Its near 2 train stations (I believe Heuston and Connelly). And bus stops as well. Temple Bar is about a 12min walk. Christ Church and city centre were I believe 14min walk. If you have (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps on your phone, you can get just about anywhere you want from there, whether walking distance, bus, or train, itll tell you where to go. There is a grocery shop right across from you (1 min walk). And theres a little bistro right below your apartment with great food, as well as other restaurants in the square. Helena was super chill and helpful with my questions! I recommend her place 100%!
I was in Dublin for the weekend and this was a great place to stay. The location was perfect. My flight to Dublin was delayed but Helena was flexible with the check-in time which was really helpful!

Helenas place was great and it has Ams amazing location!! Not only was Helena a lovely host and every responsive, but I also felt very at home there! I still cannot believe how lucky I am to have checked in early in the morning and checked out in the late afternoon! Thank you!!
Helena is friendly and this was a great resting spot in a nice location.
Great comfortable space at a quiet and safe area
Helenas room, though small, is perfectly fit for purpose and is on a great location in Smithfield. Its everything it says on the tin!

I had to find a room at the last minute. Helena was quick to reply, helpful, and flexible about letting me drop off my suitcase early as I rushed off to a conference. The room is small, as advertised, but perfect for one person for a short stay.
Nice for woman traveling alone to stay at Helenas home

The stay at Helenas place was very comfortable and felt like home directly! My plane got delayed but she was very flexible and communicative and waited up for me until after midnight!
The room is small but the bed is extremely comfortable and the place is very clean. Thank you Helena!

Great location - handy for the LUAS and for buses (including the Airlink bus serving the airport, for 7 Euros one-way or 12 Euros return), and near the Liffey so it's easy to navigate back when walking around the city. Secure, gated complex, so felt very safe. On the square are several bars and cafes, also the Lighthouse cinema which shows art-house as well as popular films. Opposite is a food shop called Fresh, where you can buy a takeaway box of lovely salads, sold by weight, which you can mix and match yourself, and can add things like chilli & lime chicken. There are tables and chairs if you want to eat it there, or take a walk down to the river. The cutlery that Fresh provide is plastic, so not good if you're into recycling - maybe they'll change to wooden cutlery one day... Helena is a great host, friendly without being intrusive, and easy-going.
Quiet and cozy. Worked well for me.

I recommend this place. Photos are what you have to expect. Helena is a kind person who will welcome you in her house with all things you need to stay (towel, produce for shower, etc). The house is really clean in a quiet place, well located in few minutes of big commercial street.
Helena was super sweet and so accommodating. The apartment is in the perfect place to explore Dublin and was incredibly comfortable to return to after a day of exploring.
Very good location for turists; close to must-visit locations and hop on-hop off bus stop.

Helena was an excellent host. She was flexible with my delayed transportation and she helped me with a rather large bag. The space is tiny and cozy and was perfect for a quick overnight on the way home.
Great stay.
Helenas place is great! Felt very safe there.
Wonderful place to stay! Excellent location and a beautiful space.
Communication with Helena was effortless. The place is very comfortable and quiet.
Comfortable small room in a great location.
Helena is a very good host and good advice. Small clean room, exactly as in the pictures. Apartment very well located right next to the center. I recommend !

Helena is an excellent host, quick and nice in communication, also flexible. Her place is lovely, very comfortable and quiet. It's not far from the centre, where you can easily walk or go by a city bus. It was really a great choice for my short business trip.
Great location, Good Value, Clean accommodation and   Friendly host.
Perfect for a short stay, excellent location and accessibility, would reccomend!
Preis Leistung hervorragend

Great location, very easy check in with Colman, & a well stocked fridge, what more could one ask?
Thanks Colman.

Can't stress enough how AMAZING this place is. The location is pristine and close to so many great restaurants and bars. The rooftop terrace has a gorgeous view and the space is huge!! 5 of us fit more than comfortably. Colman was wonderfully helpful and met us upon arrival and helped us through check-in. Absolutely loved it and would 100% stay again.

The apartment has everything you need, and the location is perfect - literally in the center of Dublin, you have everything accessible (Tesco Express supermarket right in front of the house, and Tesco Metro - which is cheaper - is 5 mins by foot; bus /metro stations are not far, but you can basically walk everywhere). If you travel with heavy bags, the stairs might be a problem for you, but for us it was fine. We really enjoyed the hosts hospitality and quick replies.

Unbeatable location in Temple Bar, with The Porter House just crossing the street.  Colman friendly welcome us to check in and gave us a solution to leave our baggage untill our departure. Very comfortable beds. To repeat any other time in Dublin.

The location of this place is perfect. Smack bang in the middle of the best area in Dublin. The only issue with this is that the street did get a bit noisy with drunken revellers on the night we stayed which woke us all up. But overall it was a small price to pay for such a great apartment. It's spacious, well equipped and I was very impressed with the towels. There were loads and they were really big and good quality. Much better than you would expect in a short term rental.
Excellent accommodations, great location next to temple bar, great host, just remember a lot of stairs to front door.

The location is perfect, for going out or to discover the city. 
In the apartment is everything you need to have a mice trip.

Awesome host!! 

He assisted with our luggage.  He also left a very very nice Irish breakfast in the fridge for us which was an awesome surprise and friggen delicious the next day!!

The location was perfect for us.  No matter where you needed to go, we always found ourselves close to home.

Colmans place is perfectly located to explore Dublin and Temple Bar. Colman allowed us to check in a bit early and provided us a spectacular breakfast for the morning. We 100% recommend Colmans place.
Great spot right near everything.
Great apartment to explore Dublin. Perfect location, friendly host, good beds, clean, some nice food in the fridge.
Perfect place to stay while enjoying Temple Bar not far. Colman is super nice!

This is a fabulous Airbnb find. The location is superb and the hospitality warm. This quaint flat is full of character (including the rooftop patio!) and may be the best location in the lively Temple Bar district. And don't even get me started on the generously stocked refrigerator.
Everything was so nice, as expected! Thx alot

Fantastic stay! 
Our flight arrived early on a Saturday morning, before the 2pm check in but Colman was brilliant! He was easily contactable (which I was nervous about as hadnt been to Dublin or used Airbnb before) and he let us leave our bags and take a key so we could go back later. 

Location was brilliant, 5 minutes from
Temple Bar! The apartment was spacious and perfect for the 5 of us for the weekend. 

The little touches like fresh flowers and breakfast in the fridge were a lovely thought and very well received. :)

Thank you!

This is a charming flat, located right in the heart of the action in Dublin.  Colman, our host was extremely hospitable and made our stay outstanding.  Lots of room to stretch out, very clean and has all of the extras you will need to make your stay in Dublin the perfect experience.  I highly recommend this place, very nice host.  We are thinking about coming again next year!
Super beliggenhed

The flat is in a great location in Dublin's Temple Bar neighborhood, with lots of really good restaurants nearby, as well as being a short walk to Dublin Castle. Colman was a great host and the flat was clean and comfortable. If visiting Dublin again, I'd definitely look into booking the same place.

Colmans place is very close to the River Liffey on one end and to Trinity College on the other.  We had only a five to ten minute walk to get to so many places. Colman provided  a nice store of food to get us started and tea as well as granola and coffee.  He also carried our luggage up the five flights!  Thank you.  There is a nice rooftop deck too. It needs some work but we still enjoyed it!  Thank you Colman!
Fantastic host, very communicative. Would definitely recommend!
Marta and Kevin's home is so cute! It's cozy and in a great location, near food and bars as well as the public transport.
Marta and Kevin are great hosts. The room is very clean and tidy. Everything went fine. Thank you!
Marta and Kevin are two great hosts! Had a fantastic time at their place and can definitely recommend it to the solo traveller !
Marta and Kevin are lovely host, they are very helpful, I got a whole list of nice restaurants. Lola is super cute also. The location is very convenient :)
Great stay! Thank you!
Was a great place to stay!

Marta and Kevin were wonderful hosts - I had a tour that ran over by an hour so I ran late to the check-in, but they were great at keeping in communication and figuring out a way to check me in despite the change in plans. We had some wonderful conversations as well which made me feel right at home despite being a first-time solo-traveler to Ireland.  The location was extremely convenient, I was able to easily catch buses and navigate to anywhere in Dublin. I highly recommend their place for any solo-travelers to Dublin.
Marta e Kevin sono persone gentili che ti ospitano con grande cortesia.. casa localizzata a 30 minuti a piedi dal centro ma in quartiere tranquillo e con locali..

Marta & Kevin were amazing hosts, very friendly, kind, helpful and flexible, everything was so easy. Their place was great, very well connected to the centre and not far from the main attractions, clean and truly comfy. I loved their  dog Lola, so friendly and cute! She definitely contributed to create that "home sense".  I definitely recommend your place and will book it again next time I come back to lovely Dublin!:-)

Marta and Kevin are lovely, as is friendly labradoodle Lola! The room and house are both super clean and it's a nice quiet area. Lots of nice places to eat just around the corner. Great value and I hope to come back again.

Marta & Kevin were amazing hosts! They were very friendly, kind, and flexible. My flight landed extremely early in the morning, and they worked out a plan that allowed me to stop by before check-in to drop off my bags so I didnt have to lug them all over the city my first day. Their place was great, very well connected to the center and not far from the main attractions, clean and comfy. Their dog Lola was so friendly and cute! They made me feel right at home despite being a first-time solo-traveler to Ireland, and a first-time airbnber! I couldnt have picked better hosts for my first airbnb booking! I definitely recommend their place.
I had such a great stay. Marta and Kevin were amazing hosts and everything was super clean and easy to use.

I really enjoyed my stay at Marta & Kevin's place. It is close to the main street in Rathmines, with restaurants and amenities close by. I found the 30 min walk to the city centre  in the day time or late evening very safe and enjoyable. A great way to see Dublin!

The hospitality of the hosts were exceptional!
All met my standards and enjoyed a it staying at this clean and well located property.

Thank you to the hosts!

Marta and Kevin are lovely hosts. The house is comfortable, clean and the room very cozy. I had a great staying there. It's a 30min walking from the center city and lots of bus if you need. Great neighborhood. Hope to go back.
Excellent location and very helpful hosts. And of course, Lola was such a bonus!! Thanks for a great stay.
Marta, Kevin and Lola are very friendly and sweet! Super helpful with recommendations. The location is perfect, close enough to everything but also quiet enough for rest. Public transport was easy.
Great place down quiet road.

Such a lovely home in a great location! Marta and Kevin were great hosts though I didnt get to interact with them too much as I was out and about most of my trip. They were both very friendly and the place was perfect for my few days in Dublin. The location is amazing if you want to be away from the busyness of the city centre while still being in walking distance to everything. Highly recommend staying here!
Great
My mother has an enjoyable stay here! Excellent location!
Nice and clean room and very friendly hosts
Marta & Kevin are lovely hosts! Thanks for such a great stay in Dublin.
My second time here and once again a lovely stay in a great location. Excellent value in such an expensive city!
Marta, Kevin and Lola are lovely hosts. Clean & great location!

I had a really great time in Dublin. Marta & Kevin are very lovely host, and Hola is so cute and friendly. The location is perfect and convenient, near bus stop and shopping center. Highly recommend to stay here for your vacation.
Everything was fine. Kind hosts, great location. In the center, but very quiet. Good internet.
Lovely place to stay, so convenient to get in and out of the city centre! Marta and Kevin were friendly and welcoming, and made my stay very easy!
Perfect for a single person exploring Dublin or like me, working there. Good local eateries, well known cinema and very well served by buses into the centre. Simple stylish home and friendly hosts
A lovely couple. Easy to get around Dublin from here. Plenty of eateries nearby. Simple room, but spotlessly clean and warm.

I had a wonderful time at Kevin and Martha's place. They were very warm and communication was a pleasure. The pictures on the website so justice to reality as well.  Their place is very clean and has everything one needs. The location is ideal as it is located to a lot of shops and has easy access to public transportation. Lola is one of the friendliest dogs I have come across and an absolute darling! I highly recommend this place and look forward to staying here again.
Cheers!

The room is bigger than expected (by reading other reviews I have imagined it smaller) even if it is on the small side, but the bed was confortable, the temperature was perfect and there is everything needed in a room. Everything in the house was perfectly clean. The position in just outside the city centre, within a brisk walk on 25 min, othersiwe the bus stop is just around the corner with several buseds to the city centre. A lot of bars and supermarkets nearby. Kevin and Marta were very nice and friendly and I have enjoyed my stay in Dublin. Highlight definately is Lola, the cutest and sweetest dog!

beautiful house and nice hospitality! 
and a lovely dog there (Lora) :)

Ejs place is great if youre wanting to be close to the transport links to take you into Dublin, and also to the rest of Ireland. Its nice and quiet and you dont feel like your in a major city. Ej is great at getting back to you quickly and flexible with arrival/departures. Lovely apartment with great amenities!

First thing I must say..the place is beatiful, clean and on good spot! Bus stop, tram stop, railway station is just 6 minute away. And cherry on top..Ej is just great host! Always nice to us, helpful and really kind. We had as much privacy as we needed. I really recommend this place!
Very nice flat in a good location - near you can find a bus and tram station. Ej is a kind person and a good host. We were satisfied, everything was great.
A perfect room in a beautiful apartment. Thank you for this stay!
The room was nice and clean and the bed was really comfortable. Having a private bathroom is always the best. Ej was nice and he provided detailed information about the place and how to get there.

Ej really offers a beautiful accommodation in a prime, very quiet location. In 3 minutes walk you are at Heuston Station - from here buses go in all directions. Two nice bistros and a supermarket are just around the corner. It's just the perfect place to explore Dublin - thank you so much, that we were allowed to be with you!

Nice and modern apartment, Ej was very kind. Everythings like you see it on the pictures, 30 walking of the city center. 
If someday I back to Dublin I wont hesitate in contact Ej again.
Ej's apartment was great! It was very nicely decorated and fully equipped. The bed was really confortable. And its location good, just a 4 minute walk from Heuston Station. A 5 star rating!
EJ was a great host. There was good communication. Location is great. We loved our time there!
We had a great time at Ej's place, everything was nice and tidy in the apartment.

EJs place was a great find. Not too far away from Dublin city center a 25 minute walk to downtown and a train station right across the street! His home was beautiful and stylish and wonderful to come home to after a day of exploring.

Our only suggestion to future vacationers is to not have a car in Dublin. Free parking is difficult if not impossible to find. It would be easier to just explore on foot, bus or train.

Great location, close to Heuston Station,  trains, buses, trams and very handy to the CBD. Even though it is very close to the city, it is a very quiet and peaceful location. The room is comfortable and having our own ensuite is an added bonus. Ej is very informative and prompt with his replies. Would definately recommend a stay here
Great place to stay outside Dublin. Easily reached by transit
The host canceled this reservation 19 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great value and hospitality
We had a lovely stay with Berna. The breakfast was great and the location was very convenient for us.
Berna was a wonderful and accommodating host. Beautiful home.
Very clean space and the breakfast was quite nice. The hosts were accommodating with our check in and willing to give advice for seeing the local city.

The flat is correct and clean and very well located buses are just in front of the flat and you are at less than 10 minutes from the town Center. 
The only negative point was the shower we had hot water for less than 10 minutes and we had to put it on 20 minutes before taking it. 
It was a bit short for two peoples.
We had difficulties with the heaters too but Bernard helped us quickly.

Really small house with no control of the heating sistem which lead to period in which the house was cold plus 20 minutes waiting for the boiler to heat water for a shower. Host punctual in replies to questions and gave useful informations. I appreciated the free coffee in kitchen. Good location well-linked to the city center.

I writing this as an experienced host and traveller. I booked a room for 2 nights, drove from wexford to visit my sick mother in hospital, locked myself out of my room on the second morning, I had to go upstairs where the landlord Bernard lives and ask for spare key, he seemed very agitated, he unlocked and barged in, walking around, he spotted my dog lying on the couch trow over, and lost the head, using bad language and aggression. No way could I stay another night,. Its a tiny bed sit which is way over priced, no radio TV, no room to swing a cat,no double lock, didn't feel safe leaving belonging there. Cracked door, where it had ovbiously been kicked in. Hot water only lasted 5 mins after an hour wait . I told him if he had a problem with pets just don't advertise, to which he hung up the phone after more cursing.  I'm not one for confrontation, but there was no talking to this man. Enter at your own risk.

Nice and clean apartment, very well connected to the center of Dublin. Bus stop right in front. Shops are very close, and also some restaurants. Host was great, and the building is very quiet. The garden is also nice. We stayed here with our one year old baby and the apartment had everything we needed.
Top locatie!
Bernards place was in a great location with a bus stop directly in front and plenty of food and beverage options near. Also he offered free washer and dryers which was great.

A tiny 1 bedroom apartment in a great location. I strongly advise the owner to wash the towels and bedsheets thoroughly with soap and hot water. Be aware that you'll need to wait at least 20 min to take a warm shower.
Friends loved it would recommend to anyone

Bernard was friendly and accommodating of my early check-in request.

The place is small but comfortable enough. I was able to cook meals in the unit. Transit options were fantastic there, and it was also easy to walk to many places that interested me.
Unfortunately the apartment did not live up to our expectations and the host did not respond to our queries once we had arrived.

Great location - public transport /bus stop literally across the street, plenty of place to dine within a block or few.
as described
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Cheap and cheerful, but perfectly reasonable
Great location and local amenities, good resteraunts and pubs. Surprisingly quiet on the back over looking the garden
Great great location, and very relaxing space. It is my second time visiting this bnb.

We had a good stay at Bernards place. Very good host. He was present while we checked in. Communication was good. Overall for a short visit it's nice. Room is a bit small but I guess most places are like that. Location is excellent. Very well connected with local buses.
Muito bom...recomendo...

Nice litte appartement. I had my peace and quiet - however Bernard is available if needed. But normally everything is self-explanatory. I liked my way into the city by foot - otherwise buses are available (bus stops just in front). Loved having a vegan restaurant right next to the apartment.
Garden and washing rooms are available as well - but not used by me as I packed correctly for one week.
Would go there again :)

Bernard's place was cozy and convenient. It was small, as other reviews have described, but it was exactly what we needed and was excellent for the price. We spent our days exploring, and we were happy to have a place to come back to that felt safe, homey, and accessible. The shower was hot, the bed was comfortable, and the location was surprisingly excellent. It may seem a little far from the city center on the map, but it was across the street from a bus stop that takes you right to Temple Bar and beyond. It is a lot more peaceful than that area, while also still easy to get to. You can walk into Portobello, which has great food and drink, and there is a grocery store half a block away from the flat. I would recommend this place as a fantastic jumping off place for exploring Dublin, while also having a place to get some peace and rest.

Bernards place was perfectly located in Rathmines, close to all amenities you would need like restaurants and supermarkets.

The bus stop is right in front of the house and you can get to the city center in few minutes.

Bernard was very kind and swapped our room to another one he had available which would fit us best as we were travelling with a baby and a few bags!
I had a really nice stay! :)
Good place to stay if youre in Dublin. Good location to travel quick in to the city for a great price. Also Laura and Liam who live there are very nice people and welcoming. Thanks for the nice stay!
The host canceled this reservation 9 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I stayed for two weeks in Valerie's house. I met her and her family only a couple of times, as they don't live there permanently. They were really nice and helpful. 
Her niece Laura and husband Liam live in the house and are very nice as well. There is a busy road in front of the house, to which the only window in the small room opens. Due to the pub on the road you will enjoy conversations of the drunks returning home. Thin walls, banging doors and a very "loud" and uncomfortable mattress do the rest. 
All in all a very nice and lovely accommodation, just not the right place to stay if you're expected to be fit for work every day. Maybe better for tourists.
A brilliant place to stay, better hospitality than a 5*, great location, and excellent value.
Sehr zu empfehlen!
The apartment is really comfortable and there is everything you need. On top of that, it is super easy to take a bus into the city centre which is not far away.
An excellent host ! A really nice and gentle host, a beautiful bedroom.
It was a nice stay at Jims accomodation. It was great that there were 2 bathrooms.
Everything about this stay was great.  I will definitely try to come again.

Jims place is perfect. Hands down recommended! Jim was extremely hospitable, place was squeaky clean and fantastic located. Really comfy bed and brand new amenities. Jims place comes highly recommended for  your local Dublin staycation!!
Very resonable price in this city and nice local tips!

Jim has a nice and cozy house in a quiet part of town but within walking distance to the city centre. He has been nice and helpful and fun talking to over breakfast. Can highly recommend staying at his place.

Jim's place is great. It's in a quiet neighborhood but close enough to the center with a walk. The room was very large and bathroom clean and updated. Jim is a nice person who takes care of his guests. Would recommend his place to others.
Everything was great in the house. Thanks Jim for your hospitality. I hope I come back soon.
Couldn't have got better hospitality.

A great place to stay. Raquel and Ruben provide the most comfortable bed and were all around so incredibly helpful. I really wish I had planned to stay for more than 1 night as they truly made me feel at home. Would recommend to any and every solo traveler!

Great communication 
Lovely home
A little farther away from the center if town but in a nice area
Great location- close to LUAS, Dodder river park, nice coffee shop and small supermarket. Nice back patio.
Clara's place is really great and spacious. We loved our staying and would definitly stay there again.
Very clean and comfortable. Easy to get to city centre. Enjoyed the stay.
A comfortable house in a convenient area both from the airport and to the centre.

Conor and Ann were the perfect  hosts! They welcomed us with great hospitality and with kindness! We had a amazing time in Ireland and had the chance to truly relax during our stay at their place. They really gave us a beautiful and quiet environment to enjoy our stay. They helped us with the public transports, they shared good tips with us about the area and about Dublin, they prepared a convivial breakfast every morning, etc. We are really grateful and we highly recommend to stay there for a good time in this splendid country!

We stayed with Connor and his wife for three days. It was an absolutely pleasant stay. Connor is such an interesting character with so many stories to tell. We also loved their dog Nina. Howth is definitely worth visiting and Sutton is just a walk away from everything. We can totally recommend staying with Connor and Ann if youd like to visit Dublin, but you also enjoy the more rural areas around Dublin.

Staying with Conor was everything we wanted - a relaxed and calm place after sightseeing with good chats and lots of information and tips. I would prefer staying in Howth/Sutton over staying in busy Dublin - it's pretty easy to get into the City Centre anyway and takes about 1 hour with walking and public transportation. And I can really recommend the seafood restaurants in Howth and the Cliff Walk.

My Grandma and I stayed with Conor for three nights as we wanted to explore the Howth peninsula. He gave us the warmest of welcomes! He picked us up from the busstop upon arrival and, for a small fee, even arranged to drop me off and bring my Gran (who doesn't speek English) to the airport when we checked out - this saved us a lot of time and stress and it worked out beautifully. The room was nice and tidy and had plenty of room to put our stuff. I had lovely chats with Conor and his wife but they also gave us enough privacy in the evenings to relax. Their dog Nina is probably the most well behaved dog I have ever met, very calm and friendly.
The only thing I would maybe adress is that if you are a very clean  person, you should be aware that there is a shared bathroom. It was okay to use, just if you are picky about these kind of things, be prepared that it won't be absolutely spotless at all times.
If you are looking for an affordable cozy place to stay in a wonderful calm area near beautiful hiking spots and with a warm and welcoming atmosphere - this is the place to be!

Conor and Anne were excellent hosts! They were full of information on the local area and it was fascinating speaking with them about their own experiences around the world. We loved their dog Nina who was very well behaved. The room was fantastic and the place itself sits just outside of Dublin (probably some 20-30 minutes by public transit, less by car... depending on traffic). Its the perfect place when you want to stay near Dublin, but don't want to deal with all the traffic and noise of the city! You're also right next to Howth, by about 15 minutes of walking, which comes with excellent seafood and hiking trails.

Thank you for the great stay Conor and Anne!

Connor and his wife Ann are great! They have such a nice place in Sutton to spend your hollidays outside Dublin and it is much better than spending your time in the hotel. Connor picked us up from airport at late night and it is very much appreciated especially when it's your first time in Dublin. Very cosy place, breakfast, shower, nice room with two beds. It was nice to talk to Connor about the places to visit, and to listen some stories about him and his lifetime. Connor was very helpful with ordering a taxi for early morning events. There is nice place called Houth in the east from Sutton you can have nice time to spend for sightseeing. Thank you Connor and Ann for your welcoming and care!
I wish you good health and the four-leaves-clover luck in your pack :)
Best regards
Definitely recommended to stay at Lawsons'.

Conor's home is clean and comfortable.  The location is great for taking public transit to Dublin, Howth and the airport.  He is a wealth of information and is very interesting to chat with. The hike in Howth was one of our favorite things.
You can expect a very friendly welcome together with a comfortable stay. We enjoyed our trip to Ireland and would highly recommend staying with Connor!
