Conor and Ann are wonderful hosts and really made me feel at home. I had a lovely time. The area is great for walking.

It was unforgettable staying with Conor, Ann and their wonderful family. The cottage is in a quet and peaceful area. Our room was very light, cosy and clean. Conor is so helpful and ready to answer all  questions. His sense of humour is great. We liked talking with Conor at breakfast time. And we also liked Nina, a smart and well-beha ed dog. We want say many thanks to Conor, Ann for their hospitality, kindness, useful advice. Thank you that you made us feel at home! Higly recommend staying in this place.

Staying at Conor's place was the perfect touch to visiting Ireland. He and his family were extremely welcoming and were willing to go out of their way to help out. They had a lot of great recommendations and local tips for getting around. The area around Sutton is very beautiful and you are still very close to Dublin. Highly Recommend.
The contact with Bernard was easy. The location of the place is really good and in a safe area.

Bernard's place is as advertised. We stayed in #4 on the main floor. The apartment is dated but in good condition, Bearnard explained how everything worked and it was a good place to sleep after our adventures out. It was clean and has bus stops right outside to get to the city center. There are also really good restaurants near by if you do not want to go into the city.

Bernard's place is located in a lively high street at walking distance from the centre of Dublin. The place itself has everything you need for a short stay and has an amazing back garden that must be lovely during the summer. Bernard is very nice and quick to respond.
Bernard is a very warm host. He went out of the way to ensure our comfort and readily accommodated our requests. Cheers.

Great location
Great hospitality
We booked a studio flat and got 1 bedroom apartment. Great location, Bernard was very helpful.

Our stay was much better than expected. The apartment was well equipped, and very liveable even with the small space. The atmosphere of the neighbourhood is fantastic: bars, pubs, restaurants everywhere. Shops are cca. 20 meters from the apartments, so we could also do our own shopping. It was great.

A comfortable and tidy little apartment in a great location, with everything you could need within 300m. Having basic supplies provided was welcome as we'd just arrived from the US, but especially important to us was that Bernard allowed us to have our tortoise and cat stay, too.

Apartamento muy cerca del centro por lo que si te gusta caminar un poco, no hace falta coger autobus para nada. Nosotros cada noche a la zona de temple Bar y por el dia a todos los sitios andando. El apartamento muy simple pero ideal para lo que necesitamos.
Perfect place to stay if you want to spend a lot of time experiencing Dublin. Effective use of space and super clean! Great location.
really, really clean. feels way more like a little hotel suite than an apartment.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Simon's apartment is fantastic! Amazing location. We had to change AirBnB's last minute and Simon was so accommodating and hospitable.
A great and stunning place. The best in Dublin
Simon's apartments were clean and tidy and are in a wonderful location in Dublin. He was responsive and even came late at night to provide a spare key! Would stay again.
The apartment is in a great location and beautifuly decorated. I really recomend it. The host was very professional and helpful. I would keep this property in mind next time I am in Dublin.
The apartments are like the photos in the adv. Great location, you can walk to reach all the main attractions. Simon always available to reply to your questions.
Mooi appartment op loopafstand van het centrum.

My husband and I and our five kids had both apartments for three nights. A fantastic location right off St Stephen Green and we walked everywhere! The kitchen/common areas were spacious and attractive. The beds were comfortable. Two bedrooms downstairs and one upstairs and couches on both floors. Our six year old liked sleeping on the couch. We booked the trip last minute but Simon was very helpful and responsive and got us a great taxi driver from the airport.

Simpn's place is very cozy and charming, with an extremely convenient location.  Just steps from St. Stephens Green, a convenience store, breakfast spots and a couple pubs right below you.  We felt very much at home there.  Simon was extremely responsive and Fabi (the woman who checked us in) was very warm and welcoming.  We hope to be back some day!!
Great location, clean, with great communication with our host, Simon. It was a convenient location for us. Beds were very comfortable and breakfast as well as dinner right across the street.
tk
My family of 11 people were pleasantly surprised at the accommodations that Simon provided. Exceeded our expectations and Simon was a gracious host!

You can't stay in a better apartment in Dublin! Location is amazing - right on St Stephen's Green park and 5mins walk from Grafton street. There are 4 coffee shops right below the apartment which means you can go down in your pajamas and buy great coffee and pastries for breakfast! The apartment is two separate units which made it perfect for our stay. It is the apartment with the best amenities that we'veever stayed in. And on top of that it's been decorated in a really beautiful and stylish way! Simon was a very helpful host and accommodated all our special requests! I will recommend this apartment to anyone going to Dublin and will definitely stay there again!

Simons two apartments were perfect for the four folks in our group. The location is wonderful - everything you could want is within walking distance.  
Simon was also very helpful with tips. Would definitely stay here again.
Simons place was perfect in every way.  Location cannot be beat!  Comfortable beds...such a beautiful apartment...we almost hated to leave in the morning.  Great communication and easy check in.

I booked Simon's property for some US friends who were visiting for my daughters wedding.  From the outset, Simon  and his property manager, Fabi, were very responsive, confirmed our booking and stayed in contact right throughout the booking and check-in process, evening allowing my friends to drop off their luggage early while the property was being cleaned.  The property itself is excellent and the location in the centre of Dublin could not be better....everywhere is within walking distance and you have endless number of great pubs and restaurants on your doorstep.  I would have no hesitation in recommending to anyone who is visiting Dublin.
great place
Posto molto centrale. Appartamento super accessoriato. Consigliato per amici che viaggiono in gruppo
Lovely host and property, highly recommend

Simon and Fabi were super helpful and great at communicating. The flat was in a great location, however the 1st floor apartment was very small, which is just something to be aware of for groups of 4+.
Simon came to the rescue when our original apartment cancelled last minute. Excellent location and property. Highly recommend

Simons place is in such a great location right around all the tourist attractions, restaurants and bars! It was very comfortable and clean. I stayed with a big group of people and there are actually two apartments on separate floors so that was very nice having different bathroom and kitchen spaces for the group. 100% recommend staying here!
Big appartment in the center of Dublin. Good communication with Michael.
Very helpful hosts arranging great accommodation in perfect location!

Great location in Dublin! The apartment is close to public transportation, if youre looking to visit other places in Ireland. Michael was very helpful in letting us know which bus to take to/from airport and had great suggestions!
Wonderful apartment situated perfectly for enjoying a stay in Dublin.

My boyfriend and I stayed here when we came to Dublin on vacation. The location is great! It is right next to the river, temple bar area, and a lot of the popular sights. The host let us in the air bnb a few hours earlier than the set check in time so we could store our luggage. He responded very quickly when we had any questions. I would definitely recommend this place! Thanks for a great visit!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Dublin and in this apartment. The location is fantastic, just above a Tesco for snacks and The Celt for all of your pub needs. Public transportation is just down the street, and the shopping is great. The apartment itself is very cute and is a very good size. It could use a few updates in the bathroom and the bedroom, but overall we had no complaints. The walls are thin, so do expect some nightly noise being in the city. Thank you, and cheers!
Nice flat, clean,good location and Michael was always ready to respond
Perfect location! Easy walking distance to everything. The apartment was spacious and had many amenities. Fun view of a busy street to hear the hustle and bustle.
A fantastic, safe location. Airport bus comes to the street and a Tescos below is super! A 5 min walk to main street of city is perfect.

Just back from a great trip to Dublin and delighted with our choice of accommodation.  From the minute we booked right through our stay both Michael Michael and Marie couldn't have been  bigger help with great simple instructions to get us where we needed to be.
Check in was short and sweet - everything explained well so all we could've asked for.
Had a slight issue where no iron could be found but Marie appeared with one promptly- could ask for anymore.
Top tip - breakfast across the road and the Wooden Whisk, although a little pricey is excellent 
Will definately book the apartment  again when I'm back in Dublin

Location!  Only a couple blocks from the pole in the holeù or the spire.  Also 5 min walk to green line or red line of the LUAS stops.  So if looking for a budget place close to city center this is it.

Great central location within walking distance to shopping, 
site-seeing and restaurants . The apartment is very big with a well equipped and stocked kitchen. My only criticism would be that some of the furnishings are a bit shabby and the archaic hot water delivery system ( The hot water is on a two hour switching system which is this day and age is not very good, if. situation
I was staying with a friend for 4 days at Michaels. The appartment is nice and the basics are there. Dont forget an adapter! Location is just great!

Michael was very accommodating to work with as we were checking in from an early flight.   Even though it's on a busy street, the bedroom is in the back so you don't hear a lot of noise.  The pictures of the bedroom were a little nicer than the room was in person.

Peaceful and quiet, yet in the middle of it all! This was a great find in Dublin. Just off the main areas, yet quiet as could be. Convenient location to anything we wanted to do, whether on foot, bike, bus, or train (and we used all four in one weekend - even kayaks!). The flat is situated in the heart of the city, yet feels miles away when youre inside. The open dining/living/kitchen area made for lovely leisurely mornings people watching as I enjoyed my breakfast, and the location of the bedroom in the back of the house ensured a peaceful nights sleep. There are a few minor signs of wear and tear around the flat, but it felt like home. All the amenities I could ask for. Hope to visit again in the future!
Great location.
The host canceled this reservation 234 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 291 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 297 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great place to stay!! Literally walking distance to everything!

Pros: The place was easy access for the Airlink and buses to nice places like Howth and walking distance for monuments. Cheap local eats around and big living area

Cons:  the actual apartment had dirty carpets, bathroom bins not emptied and didnt feel clean. In a questionable part of town.
Shabby but not chic. But the location is very convenient - close to the Spire and the river.
A truly fantastic location, very close to many of the Dublin attractions and with everything we needed.
This apartment was centrally located and clean. The host was friendly and the place was a great bargain for the location. This was worth every penny :)

Michaels place was such a great location, close to OConnell St in Dublin, with lots of options for bus service. The apartment was also very spacious for 2 people, but some upgrades in the flooring & bathroom could be considered. We appreciated hearing back from Michael immediately whenever we contacted him - such a friendly host - thank you!
Bed linen could have been a lot better.

The apartment is in a good location. It is right in the CBD. We could walk everywhere we wanted to go. Our host Michael was very attentive and our stay was terrific. I found a Coffee Cartel coffee van in the next street that made good coffee and was only a short walk away.
Great location to explore Dublin. Clear instructions and had everything we needed
Great place in the heart of Dublin. Could not have asked for more. 10 out of 10 will revisit.

This place is the best! You cannot beat the location, which is central to literally everything you want to do in Dublin. Getting to and from Dublin airport and other cities in Ireland is super easy because everything is located right around this area! Highly recommend.

This review is actually of Rathmines Apartment 3, even though we were booked for Apartment 1. Elaine was easy to communicate with, and quickly met us at the apartment to let us in. The accommodations were accurate with the listing for Apartment 3. Everything was clean, and Elaine left us some goodies and breakfast items which was very much appreciated! While the Apartment is about 20-30 minutes from the city center, we preferred to stay in the suburbs which is why we chose this apartment. It was great to walk through the neighborhood and see how the locals live. The luas is a short 7 minute walk which takes you straight to city center. The only frustration with the apartment was the extremely spotty, and sometimes non-existent WiFi, which is hard as an international traveler to not have consistent WiFi in the Airbnb. But otherwise a fantastic place and we would stay again!

Elaine is an truly amazing host. She welcomed us warmly and responded to every question within minutes. The location is perfect, there's a Tesco (supermarket) right in the proximity. Transport to the center is at a 10 minute walk, so going/returning is very simple and fast. The bed was super hiper mega comfortable and the apartment is so cosy and warm.
Definitely the place to stay if you're going to Dublin.
Thanks again Elaine, we may return to Dublin.

This apartment was the best bag for your buck! It was just outside city center with easy bus access. Elaine was a very welcoming host providing us some treats upon arrival. It was the best airbnb we stayed at in Ireland!

Elaine's place was amazing! She met us in person to check us in, walked us through the space and even had some groceries for us during our stay so we wouldn't have to worry about breakfast. It was a great space, comfortably fit our group of 4 (two couples) with a great living area. The TV was a tad small, so we couldn't watch any movies together, but that wasn't an issue for us. 
It was right on top of a pharmacy and convenience store, so very easy access to groceries and toiletries, if needed. Within a 15 min walking distance were plenty of shops, restaurants and a movie theater. There was secure parking a couple blocks away for our rental car, and the city center was just a short drive away.
Overall, loved our time there and would be more than happy to stay again, should we ever be in Dublin!
Cozy, warm, well connected, highly recomendable

We enjoyed staying here. Good location in south Dublin, 12 minutes to LUAS and buses on the street or the next street. Elaine was responsive and helpful to messages. It was easy to meet Elaine as she works in the chemist downstairs. The flat is good, modern and well equipped. Bedrooms are not on street so good and quiet.

This is a very stylish apartment, comfortable beds and living space.  Elaine was a great communicator, and there was a lovely welcome food pack  - tea, coffee,milk, sugar as well as eggs and bread for breakfast.  Lovely toiletries in each bathroom. There was plenty of information about pubs, restaurants and things to do.  Easy transport into Dublin.  Highly recommended.
Apartment 1 Rathmines exceeded our expectations.  Elaine is a terrific and hospitable host.  The apartment has modern amenities and is spacious, clean, and stylish. Location is terrific.
Great place to stay. Would recommend. Very friendly and informative.
Very flexible host, even provided a pack-and-play for our toddler. The location was easily accessible to the city center by bus. Great for a long weekend! Thanks, Elaine!

Spacious 2 bedroom apartment and well heated in winter! Fully stocked kitchen so we were able to cook dinner each night which was appreciated. Right on a bus route so it was easy to get in and out of town.

Fabulous weekend staying at Elaines apartment. Great location, near to restaurants, bars and shops but nice and quiet for a good nights sleep. Prompt communication and the welcome pack was much appreciated. We will definitely book again when we come back to Dublin. Many thanks!

Great location and amenities and the flat had pretty much everything we needed for our stay. Elaine was a great host, on hand nearby for anything we needed but not at all intrusive. The only thing I would say is that there were were four of us staying there and we could have done with another sofa in the living room, but that's obviously not something that would bother everyone.
We had a great stay at Bernard's
Great place to stay while in Dublin. It's very convenient and accessible, and the apartment is nice and comfortable.
Great location and price. Place was very clean and organized. The hot water only lasts for a few minutes so you have to be quick, but I knew that before reserving it so it was fine.
Highly recommended. All my family stays at Bernards when they come to visit me in Dublin and everyone has been happy every time

Basic space, no frills, but all you really need when touring Dublin.  The location is quite nice and walkable with many conveniences nearby including groceries, restaurants, transportation, pubs, shops, etc.  Only down side was the the wi-fi was little bit spotty for watching Netflix. But the host was very responsive in resetting every time. I highly recommend if you are not looking for a fancy deluxe room.
Bernard is a great host, very helpful. Super location in the heart of Rathmines. Thanks, Bernard!

Bernard is an amazing host ! Very kind and accommodating. Helped us to start our trip on a good note ! Place was spotless clean and comfortable. Was able to walk to Dublin city center from here. Would definitely come back and stay here.

Location and transportation from the flat to the city center are so good, even tho I referred to walk almost any bus from the location stops in major highlights of the city. The boiler as mentioned is for quick showers only so if you are the type of person who needs a long shower after your day this is not the location for you. Very limited amount of electric socket if you are a gadget kinda guy like myself you need to calculate properly because of only one bedroom and 2 in kitchen. Other than that all was great would recommend this place to anyone who is visiting for short term visit.
Bernard made everything easy and convenient.  Would highly recommend this location!
Had a great stay at Edel & Gerry's! Clean and well located apartment in the center of Dublin!

Great location! Shower is the only thing I can complain about the water wasnt that hot. There no shower door. Bathroom was cold well we showered. Other then that, place was great. If we had a problem, they were quick to respond. I deal Place for a vacation. Walking distance to everything.

Perfect location!  The flat is comfortable and great hosts w quick communication. There is some street noise in the bedrooms, its a big city so that cant really be helped. We would definitely stay here again.  Thank you!
Very good location and very nice apartment.

The apartment was clean, secure, and located in a great spot. 10 or 15 minute walk to most major tourist locations and sites. Corner market, lots of taxis, and directly across from some great history. The only thing that could be improved would be shower pressure. We were told that it was normal for Dublin (Website hidden by Airbnb) We had a great experience! Would definitely stay again.

This spot is secure, safe and very central to everything you need or want to see in Dublin. It's near bus lines and in walking distance of many attractions. It's near beautiful Christ Church which is a wonderful sight to see as you leave the airbnb each day. The amenities are great, with a full kitchen! We loved staying here and hope to do so again!

The location of Edel & Gerrys place is beyond amazing and the beds are extremely comfortable! Their place is nicely furnished and the apartment/building is clean and secure. 

The only downside I have to say is the water pressure in the shower. It would be a strong trickle at best so if you appreciate a good strong shower, youll be left disappointed.

Great base for exploring the city. 

The apartment was exactly what we were looking for, somewhere comfortable just a short walk from the city centre (10mins to temple bar).

Would definitely recommend.

The best thing about the rental is the location, and it is very clean with a great kitchen. 
We were expecting everything to be pretty perfect based on what we were paying and the photos but there are a couple things that would have been good to know about the amenities:
The shower pressure is very, very weak. This is not something the support team could really fix, it's the shower itself. I mentioned this to them early on, but had a slow response, which was ultimately not addressed because we had a bigger issue of the living room heater not working during our stay...
There is no fan in the bathroom (and as you can see no windows)
The TV is not the one pictured- it is a small, "unsmart" cable/antenna-ed TV.
And as stated- we had problems with the living room heater (it stopped working altogether the last two evenings of our stay.) I reached out to the support team and they did try to help but because it was a holiday weekend, but were not able to get anyone into the place before we checked out. They were super friendly, but because we had a different representative every time I called, it wasn't the most helpful at times. 
Other than these things, it is a comfy, clean space in a great spot. Also want to add that the support team tried to make up for some of the short-comings by being accommodating about late check out. They also let us have an early check-in, which was really helpful for our travel schedule.
Great location in the city center. Host is quick to respond and was really helpful.

Great place! The location was very convenient and easy to get wherever we wanted to go. Little store on the corner we could walk to stock up on some snacks and everything else was a walk or bus ride away.

We booked this accommodation as a last minute trip to Dublin and we couldnt have found a nicer place to stay! There was 4 of us staying in the apartment and everything was as described. Comfy beds, clean towels, a nice shower with plenty of hot water and no issues with the appliances, which you tend to find in some places! Location is perfect, about a 10 minute walk to Temple bar and everything else not too far. Communication is great with very quick response times should you have any issues or questions. I would highly recommend staying here!! Thanks again Edel & Gerry :)
Fantastic location! The place itself was really clean and had everything we needed. The area itself was quiet, close to a soar for supplies and exactly what we were looking for!

Great location, amazing kitchen, and very safe complex. Our only issues involved finding the keys initially, and communication with the host. These were minor, and solved quickly. Id highly recommend this apartment.

Great location!  Central to so many things & an easy walk.  Great kitchen and well stocked, had everything we needed.   As others mentioned, shower pressure was low & some street noise in bedrooms, but still very comfortable stay - highly recommend!
Good apartment in a great location, super easy walk to downtown and airport bus.

This apartment exceeded our expectations.  I grew up in Dublin and know the city very well.  The location of this apt. is within walking distance to everything you want to see in Dublin and far enough away from the noise of the night life of the city.  Apartment was spacious, clean and matched the online description.  The hosts were accommodating, courteous and responsive.  Check in was simple.

Great location and great hosts.

A small issue with the washing machine but communication was easy and the issue was rectified.

Very nice apartment! Enough space for everybody and nice kitchen :) the beds were a bit uncomfortable but the couch was super soft and amazing! We had some issues with the bathroom sink though :) all in all a very sweet spacious apartment

Edel & Gerry's place was a great find.  Although it's in the city centre and so close to Dame Street, it's in a very quiet complex so there was no issues with street noise at all.  It was very clean and tidy.  Two good sized bedrooms with storage.  The kitchen and bathroom have everything you need.  We got on street parking outside the complex easily each day.  An ideal place for a Dublin city break.

Edel&Gerrys apartments was perfect for our stay in Dublin. Check-in was very easy, great communication.
The beds and sofa bed were both clean and comfortable. The apartment was very clean. There was tea bags and lots of things in the kitchen if we needed, which was nice touch. The shower was great! 
The location is very good all the restaurants is like 70m from the apartment. 
I would recommend for future guests. 
Thanks for having us, see you soon !
Odilon

Great location, beautiful apartment, easy check-in, and overall clean. Our only issue was that the water in the shower did not drain fast enough. We communicated with the host but the issue was not resolved. I would not disarrange anyone from selecting this place.
The beds and linens are perfectly clean, we all really appreciated that during our stay but I must say the shining star of this place is the amazing location! Thanks Edel and Gerry!!
The place was fine, the location was really great.
Very cool and central....a comfortable and clean house....thanks a lot:)
Nice, lightly rooms, enough for 5 ppl!

The Check-in prozess was without any problems. We get the key from the key box. In front of the cottage is a primary school and on week days it is loud sometimes.
The cottage was very nice, but for 5 people it is a little bit small (because only one toilet and shower) and the appartment was not very clean. 
Still we enjoyed our weekend with great city trips.

Great location close walk to Jameson distillery which was close to the transit
Quiet location and excellent eateries 
Again thanks Keith
A lovely, clean place to stay with great access into the city centre. The check in process was very easy, and Keith sent some useful guides and tips for the local area and the house beforehand.

We had a great time at this airbnb! Checking in was easy and Keith gave us some nice recommendations. Everything was really clean and enough space for 6 people. We would definitely stay here the next time!
Very cosy and clean apartment!
Great location, lovely house.

Very nice house in a central location to accommodate max 6 people. Keith was very friendly and helpful in providing all information needed. I would definitely book it again and recommend it to Dublin visitors :)
Keith is a very attentive host. His place is a great budget place for a family of 4 or 5. Supermarket is nearby. The place has everything you need for cooking and even a washer.
Keith's place was very clean and worked great for 6 adults.  The location worked perfectly for us.  We would stay there again.
We liked the location of this home, which for us was walkable to Dublins attractions, but out of the tourist fray.
A very clean and nice cottage in a secure area.

Fantastic location, close to town and the local area has so much if you didn't fancy going too far. Accomodation was great, hd everything you wanted and more. Definitely worth considering this place again in the future!

We had a great time at Kirwan St. Many fun places close by and a reasonably short walk to city center. Also spent a day in Malahide which is easy to get to by bus or taxi. Highly recommend making time for the castle/gardens there and meandering through this cute coastal town.
Great place for friends to stay at! Not noisy and not far of a walk to fun places.
Keiths place was wonderful! Clean and a great location near shops and pubs in Stoneybatter.
Great location- walking distance to all the sights- its a nice neighborhood- good vibe

House was great...near enough to public transport, was very clean and modern looking, every accessory possible was there and working. Bedding was super comfy. Only negatives would be that living room (alongside main bedroom) was upstairs, with bathroom, kitchen and twin bedroom downstairs, so it was a pain if you wanted to relax in living room but had to grab everything from kitchen downstairs. Also, I think we were there on the hottest day in Ireland, so had to open all windows which couldn't stay open so we had to use boxes to wedge them open with - however I don't think anyone else needs to worry about that unless you go in a heatwave!
Great location, walking distance to everything. Really comfortable and good lay out for a few friends. Would definitely recommend.
Access was super easy with the combination lock box. The instructions and tips sent beforehand were very helpful and Keith was very responsive with answers to questions.

Residential area, so relatively quiet with a grocery store and pharmacy near by. Check in was a breeze. It was very clean and organized, but didnt have any cozy touches like a real home would (it was quite bare, and a little spooky). The beds were surprisingly comfortable, and it was overall a very good stay.
Great location, comfortable and clean space.

It's a great place, good accommodation with enough space also for families with children. The close neighborhood offers some really nice places for breakfast, lunch and  evening party and it's close but not too close, so great balance. Nice walk to beautiful Phoenix Park and Jameson Distillery and plenty of bus connections to Temple Bar if you don't fancy a walk. Keith was a very helpful host. I recommend this offer 100%

Stayed for two nights as a group of 5 whilst visiting the city. Really nice space, everything was as pictured and the flat has good links into the city - tram/bus/walk are all possible.
Having one bathroom was a bit of a squeeze with five people but manageable. Check-in was super easy and Keith had even sent us a few guides of the area before we got there. Definitely recommended.
Cosy house in a really good location
Lovely quiet place in a friendly area near to lots of great places to bisit. Good local pubs, cafes and restaurants.  House was perfect.

This beautiful and cozy cottage is located in one of my fav locations in Dublin.- really easy to walk around and about 15min walk from town. The house is spotless clean, has good ventilation and yet nice and cozy.
Had a great stay! The place was lovely and we were thankful to stay there. The place is a tad bit out of the way, so be prepared for a 10 minute walk to the center of town, or use a taxi!

This cottage is ideal for a weekend visit to Dublin. My friends and I had a lovely stay here to celebrate a birthday and were delighted by the location and the comfort of this accommodation, how perfectly equipped the kitchen, bedrooms and lounge are, the nearby cafes (particularly Slice, which is 2 mins walk from the house) and how easy the communication with Keith was. We were also charmed by the friendliness of the Dubliners! We would highly recommend this cottage.

Property as described.  Great location and quick responses from host.
Great stay.
A great spot in Dublin!
The host canceled this reservation 226 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
La casa de Keith es ideal para pasar unos dias en Dublin, es amplia y muy confortable! Volveriamos de nuevo! Gracias!

Such a lovely place to stay. Paul is a great host. He gave us a lot of intormation and tips on what to do. Beds are really good, rooms are clean
 Location is not too far from city center, but enough far that you can see a different, more slow paced and local side of the city. Over all Lost Boathouse is a great choice if your coming to Dublin.
A lovely house and garden in a quiet area near pubs and shops and at a walking distance to town.Spacious and clean rooms and kind hosts. Who could ask for more?
Paul was very helpful with location suggestions and spots to check out. Went above and beyond my expectations. Incredible stay!

This apartment has everything you need for a trip to Dublin!
Clean rooms, a lot of space, nice interior, quiet side road and you feel welcome from minute one.
Paul has a lot of information about restaurants, travel opportunities, sightseeing, shopping and Dublin himself.
We really enjoyed our stay and would do so again.
Paul and Steven are very good hosts. Loved our stay in the lost boat house.

We had a wonderful experience at Paul and Stephens home. They were an absolute pleasure and the rooms/bathrooms were so clean and comfortable. The location was perfect also. Just a quick Uber/cab ride into the heart of Dublin and walking distance to shopping and restaurants. I only wish we had stayed longer!
Beautiful space. Lovely garden. Fantastic hosts. We had a wonderful time here!
Paul and Stephen are great hosts and the house is a great base for anything you want to do in Dublin, especially the south side of town.
Great
We highly recommend Pauls place!!! Loved the place and the hosts
We stayed for 3 nights with 2 adults and 4 kids and had a brilliant time. All three bedrooms are very clean, stilish and comfortable.

Beautiful and very clean home located in a quiet neighbourhood just outside the city centre.  We enjoyed A relaxing coffee in the morning with the view of a beautiful very well maintained garden. 
20 minute walk to Dublin centre through the park with lovely cafes and restaurants on the way which we enjoyed a full Irish breakfast before touring the city centre. 
Paul was very welcoming, polite and informative and helped us on our way to tour the sights of Dublin. Thank you. 
We all had a lovely relaxing visit in your beautiful home.
Excellent accommodations: clean rooms, clean bathrooms, nice sheets and pillows.  But most of all, Paul is an outstanding host.
Paul and Stephen are very nice hosts. Perfect stay in a nice quite place.

We finished our vacation at Paul and Stephens home.  What a perfect location, walkable into downtown, restaurants, as well as on the edge of a beautiful park.  We appreciated the hospitality and the hosts had great suggestions for our family.  It was a great way to end our trip.
Paul and Stephen were really kind! The house was clean and near the city center. Thank you for everything, we really appreciate it!

We - 4 adults and 2 children - felt at ease from the very first moment at the hidden boathouse. Stephen and Paul are outstanding hosts who really care about their guests. We loved the house, exquisitely furnished and very well kept, the rooms including a private living room, the wonderful garden, the fresh eggs from the own hens for breakfast, the Ringsend area with the possibility to play football and the good bus access to the center. Everything was great! Ursula and family
You can expect a good time in the house, quiet place, approx 25"walk to the City Center.

Paul & Stephen were amazing hosts and have a beautiful home to offer for visitors looking for a balance of convenience and comfort. Our group of three couples found the place very inviting. We wish we stayed longer. This was the first time we ever stayed in an Airbnb that was also owner-occupied, and it had all the perks without any of the potential downsides. We had our private space and they had theirs, yet they were able to provide advice and local insight that we wouldnt have gotten otherwise. For example, we arrived pretty late and still hungry for dinner; they are so familiar with the local eateries that they were able to advise us of our best options. Paul even provided his tablet to help with our search. They have been doing this hosting thing for so long that they know how to put on all the finishing touches. 

You have your own bedrooms, bathrooms, a living room with comfortable seating & games, a dining area, breakfast prep area including mini fridge & dishware, and access to the yard. 

Overall, it was a fantastic stay, very quaint, and we cannot thank Stephen & Paul enough for giving of their time and energy to help us make the most of our stay.

All I can say is, Wowù! We were completely satisfied with our stay at Paul's lovely home. In all ways it exceeding our expectations. Paul and Stephen were gracious, courteous, knowledgeable hosts. We always felt comfortable while we were in their home. They both were accommodating, patient, and kind at all times. They provided guidance and lots of tips on where to go, and what our options were. Their home is beautiful! There was a common guest room where we could gather. It was comfortable, nicely appointed, and had lots of conveniences so that we could be together with our family and friends staying in the home. The bedrooms were warm, cozy, and stylishly decorated. The bathrooms were top notch.

One of the unexpected pleasures was the ease with which we were able to get around. We never expected that a short walk through their lovely neighborhood park would connect us to convenient services and transportation. With our LEAP cards we were able to get anywhere in Dublin and the surrounding environs easily. I would recommend Paul's Airbnb to anyone.
Exquisite home, superb hosts

The stay at Pauls and Stevens beautiful apartment was very pleasant. We (five persons) felt very comfortable during the four days and we missed nothing, Paul and Steven are super nice and affectionate hosts. They are cooperative and helpful. Questions and messages in advance were answered immediately.  Everything was very clean, cozy and lovely decorated. The beds in the upper floor are very comfortable, the two bathrooms are modern and spacy, even the hairdryer had some real power! the beautiful, sunny guest lounge downstairs offers enough space to sit, relax, have some lunch etc. We used the bus, which is 8 min walk away, to get to the city center. 

I would definitely recommend the house and Steven and Paul as hosts!

This house is comfortable, quiet and beautifully ornate with a private outdoor garden, thoughtful amenities and amazing hosts (the space is shared with them).   Our family of 5 stayed here for three nights and there was plenty of sleeping and resting space (even to "office" and to do school work).   It was easy access from the airport with only a 15 minute walk to their place.  Of note, the common guest lounge had all the essentials, which we used for enjoying light breakfast and take out dinners, but there was not access to a kitchen or sink downstairs.   There is a small fridge and microwave oven.  Paul was thorough and responsive in communication.  He provided outstanding recommendations  (best Thai food we've ever eaten) and great advice about the area.  Well recommended!
Excellent location to Dublin, very clean, Paul and Steve are very good hosts made us very welcome
Super host, very nice and clean home.

We really enjoyed our Time at the Boathouse. We stayed there as a Family of 6 and had everything we needed. The 3 Double rooms where amazing and the Livingroom had everything we needed for breakfast. The communication with Paul was always quick and easy.

Stunning home. The attention to design- and need-details was top notch. When we first arrived in Dublin we stayed in a centrally located hotel. We then spent a couple weeks touring the country and then returned to Ringsend. So relaxing, but it also allowed us exercise time as the walk in to town was brisk and exhilarating in the October air, but very doable. Beautiful grounds, wonderful hosts.
Great host , lovely place to stay .

Paul and Stephen's place is wonderful and they are really great hosts -- gave us lots of helpful advice about what to do and see in Dublin & how to get there from the house. The rooms were all comfortable, the breakfast room was especially nice for our whole group to congregate in. The neighborhood is a little bit outside of the downtown area, which was nice for my family to have a cozy quiet spot to rest. Between the lovely Ringsend park & great local neighborhood-type pub they recommended, it felt set apart from the rest of Dublin in a really nice way
Paul and Stephen have a very nice place to stay, Well equipped, Nice and cosy and very clean.

Loat Boat House was actually easy to find. And it was easy to get there by public transport late in the night. It is close to bus station so hosts gave us Leap cards with some money on it.
Maybee you see as a minus liveing with hosts but this was totally fine. Paul and Steven have great advices about atractions in Dublin or other parts of Ireland, or renting a car, and they keep house very clean.

This airbnb is in the perfect location if you are looking for a weekend trip to the Temple Bar area. We loved just being able to step outside and get to the city center in under 5 minutes yet still had the peace and quiet of the apartment complex for relaxing nights. The room was spacious and clean with a really comfy bed and even a dish of chocolates to welcome us. The hosts could not have been more welcoming and have great suggestions for places to do and things to see in Dublin!
Good central location for exploring Dublin and nightlife. Host communicated well and was kind. Check in/check out was easy. The only downside was the cost versus cleanliness factor.

Quite easily the best Airbnb weve ever stayed in. We were greeted with a couple of pints of Guinness and Irish whiskey and plenty of great recommendations of bars and restaurants. The hosting couple were extremely accommodating and kind. It was the highlight of our trip.
Great location in the middle of Dublin. Nikola was a lovely host.
The place is nice, Nikola is very firandly and helpful! The location is perfect, close to almost everything in the centre! :)

First off the location is amazing, we were able to step out and immediately be in the heart of the city. For this alone we believe it was definitely worth the money for how much we saved on transportation.
The apartment itself was incredibly homely and inviting. We felt very comfortable and well looked after. The room was impeccably clean and tidy. The heating was on for us and some cold cans of coke. It had all the little extras, a selection of chocolates, lots of fresh towels, dressing robes and slippers! We were spoiled!
Nikola was very accommodating in relation to our check in, we where getting into Dublin rather late but he met us and walked us to the apartment. He was very fast at replying to our texts, Himself and his girlfriend Maya are very friendly and were very helpful. 
Overall 10/10, the accommodation can make a huge difference to a trip and having such a comfortable place to come home to really made it a wonderful time.

Nikola is a very nice host. He was replying immediately to all my messages and helped me with my luggage. The apartment was very quiet even if its so close to the (usually noisy)Temple Bar so I had a good sleep in the night. The location is excellent - you can easily reach Grafton Street, Trinity College, Temple Bar, public transport, shops and restaurants.

Nikola and Maya were incredible hostesses! Provided us with yummy delights and drinks. The location to the Airbnb is in the very center of the city and in a very cute and private community. Although the room and bathroom provided us with the main necessities, it was not as pictured on the listing. The place has carpet and my boyfriend is allergic to it- it was a tight space overall. But great location and service.
We didnt feel very comfortable here. It is cluttered and not too tidy. The bed was fine and shower was fine. You cant beat the location though and the apartment is very safe!

We had a amazing stay at Nikolas and Mayas home. We felt very welcome and the both were absolutly fantastic hosts. They helped us out with any issue and many tipps. The room was super cozy and very quiet, although the apartment is in the heart of Dublin! I can just recommend this airbnb. :) thanks for having us!

Nikola's apartment was great to stay at. It was very centrally located but still very quiet even though it is on a busy street. The room had thoughtful touches such as bathrobes, slippers, chocolates and cookies. Maya showed us to the apartment and was very accomodating and helpful when we had questions about getting around in the city. She even helped us with our heavy bags.
Nikola and Maya were so welcoming and we felt at home in our space. Super helpful and easy to communicate with.
Lovely friendly couple who will help you with anything and be very accommodating.

We stayed two nights with Nikola and his girlfriend Maya and had a great time! They were very friendly, amiable hosts. We were greeted with a beer each 
The place is very clean. the sheets and the towels were fresh and clean. The room isn't very spacious, as it's said in the description, but it t two small for two tall northern German guys to fit in.
So thanks for a great time in Dublin

Nikola and Maya are amazing. They very helpfull and very nice.  - I had a little accident at the 2.nd day Nikola write quickly a good adress for a docter. Both answer always soon as possible. In the room they have small sweets and fruits presented and they both gave good tips. On the last night we all went out to dinner and they showed me some of Dublin. It was great. Nikola and Maya was more as only a good host. For my the best place in Dublin. Thank you both.

The room is cozy, the house is very clean. I did not have access to the kitchen but the host is very helpful and you can ask him if you need to use it. The apartment is very central, you can do everything by walking from there, and the neighbourhood is very safe. The most famous pub Temple bar is just 5 min walking and there are many places for breakfast just near the apartment (in the same side walk). Was very easy to communicate with the host.
We stayed for the weekend at Nikolas and we were so pleased with its prime location. House was cozy and clean and the communication was superb. I do recommend that place for a weekend escape.

Fantastic location right by the Ha'penny bridge and walking distance to so many attractions in Dublin City! Nikola was so accommodating and even let us check in earlier and drop our bags because of an early flight into Dublin! Great hosts and lovely place. Highly recommend!
Perfect spot! Recommended !!!

The apartment is very clean and in a wonderful location. Check in and out were very easyîBernard is very kind, and responds quickly to messages. I would absolutely stay here again on my next trip to Dublin!

We spent Saint Patrick¬¥s  weekend here. It was quite nice overall, good enough bed and plenty of good restaurants very close by. 

The place is not in the city center but it is also a lot better priced than most of the places downtown.

Although I never met Bernard, communication was easy and quick. The room itself was exactly as described and for St Patricks Day weekend was reasonably priced. The room was clean and had a very comfortable bed.

Bernards place was clean and warm. Bernard was kind and flexible with check in time also which was very useful ! The location of this apartment is what makes it, in the very center of Rathmines you can walk everywhere or hop on a bus! Perfect for a short stay in Dublin!
Great location for me close to all amenities
Nice host and comfortable room

The flat is fully equipped and clean, everything was perfect and the only little note regards the bathroom a bit small and without windows, but considering that in Dublin is very difficult to have accommodation with a private bathroom, this solution was very good. If the whether is good the guests can also enjoy a beautiful garden with table, benches and barbecue. The position is good although not properly in the centre, but you can reach the centre in 20/30 minutes on foot, otherwise the bus stop is exactly in front of the building. Dont forget to switch on the warm water before use the bathroom ;-)!

Awesome! It has all you need!  
My husband, my two little dogs and I, stayed here for almost a month. Great location, pubs, restaurants, mall, park, cinema. 
Bernard is a greaaaat host!  
You should stay here :)
Great location, clean place and comfortable.

A good option for your stay in Dublin! Its located 10 min from the very center in bus, with a lot of restaurants near. Bernard is a great host. We had a problem at our arrival and we could contact him with immediate answers and solution. I recommend!

Amazing!! Despite of being a small apartment, it was absolutelly clean. The bed was very confortable, the small kitchen was more than enough and both shower and toilets worked perfectly. Highly recommendable!!
Everything was great, just like the description
The Rathmines is a great location and Bernard is a great host.

The apartment was perfect. Everything clean, it had everything we need. The location is one of the best things because you have some restaurants and places to buy food, and you have the bus stop in front of the house so it is easy and fast to get the bus and in almost 10 minutes you are in the center.
The bathroom is in the apartment, and the only thing that can disturb you is the small shower, but the rest is perfect.
You can turn on and off the temperature of the room and you have a kitchen, so what more can you expect?
It was a really pleasure staying there, and I strongly recommend to go there in St Patricks day, it was amazing.
Thank you very much again Bernard, it was a pleasure.

The place was ok. We had some issues getting the shower hot and the shower was incredibly small, even for me. My husband could barely fit in it.

The bed was incredibly small for us as well. Almost laying to top of each other to fit lol and the WiFi was very spotty.

The locations is nice tho.
Ottimo host, molto veloce nelle risposte. Posto bello ma non bellissimo... (Website hidden by Airbnb) bene se andate in alloggio solo per dormire. 30 minuti da l centro a piedi...

What a location, it is easily walkable to city centre, or simple quick bus ride in, yet just far enough to have its own village feel. It got better and better the more we explored. Bernard gives good recommendations but there is much more to find. Loved it.
The location was great and the room was quiet and just the right size.
Very nice place to stay, good central location and transport links. Bernard was extremely helpful throughout our stay.

Bernard's place was really easy to find and only a short bus ride from Dublin City centre. There was a bus stop right by the accommodation and the high street nearby had several nice pubs and cafes. The accommodation was comfortable, quiet and had everything we needed. I would definitely recommend this accommodation for any couples who wish to have a city break in Dublin, but do not want to pay the very high hotel prices.

We had an awesome stay at Bernards Airbnb. 
Even we had some difficulties getting there on time to check in, Bernard made it work for us to check in easily. The area is lovely with grocery stores, bakerys, bars etc right around the corner. The apartment was a very nice stay like we expected! Thank you!
Berna is very lovely and I hope everyone gets a chance to stay at her place!
Berna is such a nice person. Very helpful. She will be ready to attend ones needs and flexible if anything could happens.
Lovely place to stay and Berna is very helpful.  I had a lovely walk to Dun Laoghaire.  Bedroom and ensuite were sparkling clean.
Very friendly host with great accomodation!
Berna was a lovely host. Would recommend her beautiful place to anyone looking to stay.
Pleasant very knowledgeable &semi-private
Bernas house is a great location for visiting/ attending the Blackrock Clinic just 10 mins away. Berna was very helpful and welcoming.

We loved our stay with Berna. The house is nicely furnished. The address is very convenient, because there is a bus stop just five minutes by walk. 
The room was very good and we had our own bathroom which was a definite plus. Kitchen can be used which was very helpful for us. Betna provides you with breakfast as wel and was always eager to answer to any questions. Thanks for the hospitality.

We both loved the trip & our stay. Would 100% stay here again. Berna even dropped us off at the bus stop to go to Dun Laoghaire after a very early flight & trip to Dublin, Berna is very knowledgeable & helpful about the local area. Would highly recommend to stay here, bus ride into the city centre & close to The Seaside.

We had a lovely stay at Bernas home! We came in after 24 hours of traveling, and she made us feel so comfortable and welcomed! She knew all the great sights to see in Dublin, but also around all of Ireland! I would recommend this lovely home to anyone!!
Excellent host and very welcoming..
Great hospitality and Flexibility from Berna! Amazing location and solution.

Berna went way above and beyond to ensure me and my wife was set before we traveled! She made sure our boarding passes were printed off to fly out the next evening. She ever escorted us to a laundry mat down the road so we could do cloths before continuing our two week trip! Above and beyond amenities as well!
Highly recommended place for staying.Very cooperative and best host .Great hospitality from host. A home away from home experience.
A lovely place to stay south of the bustle of downtown Dublin. Thank you Berna and feline friend Coco.

Berna was very pleasant, helpful and informative  which  made our stay very pleasant. Her place was very nice clean and tidy so we would probably stay there again if we returned to Ireland. Also a good location for catching the bus into Dublin.

Not sure where to start with this review, within 90 minutes of arrival the Host Berna was offering us a full refund and telling us there were 300 other Air B&B's within the area to choose from, the reasons for this are as follows,
Upon arrival and after a quick chat the host told us to make ourselves at home and to make a cup of tea whenever we wished, she even went to the trouble of showing us where everything was and she then left to go to the shops. After unpacking my partner and I decided we would have a cup of tea, while we were making tea Berna arrived back from the shops, we said we were making a cup of tea and asked if she would like one also, her answer was astonishing to say the least, 
ITS COURTESY TO ASK BEFORE MAKING TEA IN SOMEONE ELSES HOUSE AND IF SHE WANTED TEA IN HER HOUSE SHE WOULD MAKE IT HERSELF.
She had just told us 30 minutes earlier to help ourselves to tea if we wished , she then accused me of walking around as if I owned the house, funny as I had only been in the bedroom that she had showed us and the kitchen where we were making tea, again not sure what made her say this. 
Her attitude as a host left a lot to be desired, the manner in which she dictated to us the rules she wanted us to abide by after the tea discussion I think she thought she was talking to 2 children instead of 2 mature adults.
In relation to the house itself,
No towel racks in the bathroom.
No toilet roll holders.

Bedroom
Smallest Double Bed we have ever slept in.
Wardrobes in the room were full of the hosts items with very little room for guests to use.

Kitchen
The kitchen was to put it mildly dirty, counters, stove had not been cleaned and we went to use the microwave and when we opened it looked like it had never been cleaned. The inside had remnants of food stuck to it that had to have been there for months.

Our overall assessment of our weekend was that this property for what it advertised as is not value for money, and the Host does not in our opinion have the required skills to run a business of this nature, 
We both appreciate that this property belongs to the host, but if you are going to rent rooms out (and they are not cheap for what you get) then you have to respect the people who have decided to use the property for vacation and do the best you can to ensure they at least enjoy their stay.

Just to say we declined the full refund as it was late Friday afternoon at this point and we could not guarantee finding somewhere else, besides we were supposed to be on holidays and had other plans

Value for money and overall enjoyment rating: 2/10

I had a very comfortable two night stay at Berna's place. It's in a quiet neighbourhood, just one bus trip outside of Dublin. Berna is a very welcoming host and kindly accommodated my needs. She very helpful in providing advice for my stay in Dublin and Ireland
Great location for us with family and friends all close by. Free to come and go. Berna very friendly

Berna is a wonderful host. She is very accommodating, helpful and welcoming. We were able to fully relax at her place after our long walks around Dublin. Her house is very conveniently located, with easy access to Dublin or the seashore. Thank you very much !

Bernas place is bright and airy in a quiet location close to a bus route to the city. The decor is tasteful with a lovely secluded urban garden. Berna is a considerate and chatty host who anticipates the guests needs. I recommend this Airbnb to other sole travelers. A big thanks Berna.

Bernas place was so nice! If youre looking for a place to stay that is a little bit out of the hustle and bustle of the city I definitely recommend! The room was super cute and clean, as well. Berna was a super kind host!

The house is nice. Berna was great helping with locations etc but the bedroom was abit fusty, the bed clothes didnt seam to be fresh. Abit disappointed with the breakfast. Bathroom shower needed abit of TLC too.
The host canceled this reservation 32 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Berna was very welcoming and communicated well. The room was clean, nice ensuite and the house is in a great location. Thank you!

Berna was a supreme host. She was extremely flexible with our weird schedule and helpful with transportation advice as we settled our daughter into a local university. The house was lovely, with sun shining through multiple skylights (we were lucky and had several sunny days). As weary parents adjusting to empty nest-dom, my husband and I were grateful to be able to stay at Bernas house.
Great location and local restaurants and shops good.
Patrick could not have been a better host. His place is exactly what you want to be close to everything and all of it walkable! We loved the amenities too!!
The apartment was lovely and Patrick was a wonderful host!
Patrick was great to help access the apartment.  Everything you need is at this location and youre able to walk anywhere thats a tourist destination.  Thanks for an amazing apartment!
Great location!  Very cool area.  Apartment has nice layout to enjoy while there.
Great place, wonderful location, walkable to almost everywhere in Dublin.   Would highly recommend.
We had a great family trip here
The host canceled this reservation 384 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The location of this apartment was great!  Close to pubs and restaurants.  Also the close proximity to mass trans was excellent!  We walked to Temple Bar and Trinity College.  Clean and spacious!
Extremely disappointed to hear Dublin no longer allows weekly rentals

Het is een fijn appartement om met een groep te verblijven.  De woonkamer is lekker ruim. De bedden zijn prima. Vanuit het appartement loop je zo het centrum in. Alles is prima per voet te bereiken. Supermarkt dicht bij.
A great apartment in a great location! Not far from temple bar or other tourist attractions. Patrick was a great host. I would definitely recommend this apartment if your travels take you to Dublin!!

Very stylish & spacious two level apartment in a great location. Everything you need for a perfect stay.  Patrick is an excellent host who meets and greets you with a warm Irish welcome definitely recommend.
I enjoyed my stay. Highly recommended! Thanks, again!
I would not stay here again unless nothing else was available.
I totally recommend this place to everyone!! The host are amazing! The view from the front door is breathtaking!! Will definitely stay here again!
Great communication, great place.  House is clean and down the sea. Perfect!
A nice place & a stunning view! Very close to the beach

This is an amazing spot to stay, beach couldnt be any closer and a really great communal lawn with picnic benches meant we got to enjoy the sea views when we ate too. The kids loved the space and we did too. We will definitely be back again.

The apartment is very well set out and clean, the extra touches of having baby cot and high chair provided and set up ready for us and providing extra beach towels made us feel really looked after by our hosts. The accommodation had really comfy beds and fluffy towels too. 

Id definitely recommend this place and Mary and Jason were great hosts with prompt responses and clear information.
Great out of the way & peaceful location, right on the beach & makes you feel at home. Awesome host, that is extremely helpful, I would highly recommend.

very nice, modern and complete apartment. Perfect location for the beach and Dublin. The hosts are very helpful and are they were giving us good tips like railway, food, etc...
We would come again with and without Family!
Lovely apartment in a great location overlooking the beach.
The location and value of this property are amazing!! Highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay near Dublin but also wanting a bit of space to enjoy the countryside!
Cosy apartment with wondeful ocean view. Breathtaking sunrise
Great apartment, great location right on the water, great hosts. Really enjoyable stay.
This place is clean, modern and on the beach. It was the perfect way to relax and unwind before heading home. Mary is lovely and we wouldnt hesitate to recommend this spot to family and friends!

This is a beautiful place to stay,  right on the beach, the sun on the water in the morning, walking down the beach to the Harbour Bar in the evening. A good starting point for touring round and sight seeing and really good hosts, helpful, informative and friendly. Left us with lovely memories. Highly recommended.
Elizabeth, Mike, Brenda and Roger. August 2019.
Lovely place and area everything great

Mary and Jasons seaside apartment is clean and modern. Mary was very welcoming to us and a great host. We loved the fact that we could literally walk right out the door onto the beach. Beautiful location in Rush.

The view is amazing. Waking up to the sound of the ocean waves is a dealbreaker for me! Mary and Jason are so kind and professional. I wouldnt have changed a thing about my stay. The apartment was perfect and the drive into the city was not far at all!

The flat was right on the beach with amazing views of the Irish Sea, and an easy walk to a cute pub with delicious food. Easy public transport into Dublin (around 45 minutes all up). The flat had everything you would need including coffee and oil for cooking etc. Modern kitchen and bathroom. Our favourite part was sitting on the picnic tables go watch sunrise over the beach at breakfast time! Would definitely recommend.

Great place to stay, spotlessly clean with sound of sea in background.
Stayed Friday to Sunday, apartment was ready for our arrival ahead of 15:00.
Hosts Mary and Jason were helpful from Start to Finish and responded instantly to messages. They are also generous, nothing was too much trouble, even extending our check out by several hours as we had a late flight. They epitomise everything a super host should be.
The apartment is good size, equipped with modern and quality appliances and very warm and cozy. 
The beds are comfortable and the quilts warm. Add to this the quiet location and the blackout and it is a restful place that makes sleeping easy and getting up a real struggle!
Bathroom is large and good selection of TV channels. WiFi easy to connect to and good for a number of devices.
Train from station is approx 1/2 hour and runs approx every half hour until 20:00 and low cost - around 7 Euros.
A tip for above you can use Visitor Leap card which is 10 Euros for 1 day our an incredible 19.20 Euros for 72 hours. This also allows you to use Luas, Dart, Buses in Dublin City and County. You cannot get the card on line, so try to get at Tourist Offices or allow time to post ahead of trip.
Overall a fabulous place to stay, spacious, warm and well equipped with great hosts who pride themselves on assisting their guests and providing a spotlessly clean environment. Rush is a good sized village with plenty of bars and restaurants, supermarkets and take seats.
I stayed with my wife and parents who are in their 70s. To a person we said we wouldnt hesitate to go back - you cannot recommend a place more than that

My family of 5 has stayed at this beautiful apartment several times now and as usual, everything was great. Mary is a wonderful host who is very friendly and quick to communicate. The apartment is very clean and has everything we need. It is close to a grocery store and a few restaurants/cafes. There is a nearby train station that goes to Dublin (and other places) and the airport is fairly close as well. The view of the Irish sea is absolutely stunning and blows me away every time. We love to take walks on the beach. Thanks, as always, Mary for making our stay the best it can be!
I stayed at Jan's place for 4 months for an internship I had in Dublin. The place is as advertised and suited my needs.  It was fun to chatting with him the other housemates!
Loved staying here. Nice people
Nice

I stayed in this room for a month once I moved to Ireland and while looking for a place to rent in Dublin.  I highly recommend Jan's property, it was exactly what I needed to get settled and I wouldn't change anything about my decision to stay there. The bedroom is rather small but I found it to be comfortable for one person. You also have full access to the bathroom and kitchen, including all amenities. At the time of my stay there were 4 other people living in the house, but sharing space was never a problem, as everyone works and has their own schedule. Jan and Justyna are clean, courteous, and easy to talk to should an issue arise. While the property is fairly distant from city center, it is easily serviced by bus lines, close to a Dublin bikes station, and a cab costs less than 15 Euros. It is certainly worth the value compared to other properties that might be closer to city center, and also helped me become familiar with Dublin's public transport. I also enjoyed being close to Memorial Gardens and Dublin Food Co-op across from Kilmainham Jail. Finally, I had to cut my reservation short after starting a lease in Dublin, and Jan was especially considerate in arranging a refund. If you're looking for a long-term stay in Dublin, you simply can't go wrong with reserving this room!

Superb location, close to the centre, right besides the canal, dublin bikes within a few steps.  Brenda is an excellent host, she made me feel very welcome. The place is really cozy and warm, with a small patio and the room upstairs is just superb.

I stayed with Brian and his lovely family during the St Patty's long weekend, and they were amazing. I can't even begin to describe the level of hospitality from everyone. Brian and his son Patty greeted me late in the evening, and dropped me off to the light rail so I could get into town (which was only a 20min ride in). The room is large and spacious, with a very comfortable bed. Kitchen well equipped, with views to the beautiful backyard where you could a glimpse of the two peacocks. I would highly recommend Brian's to anyone travelling through Dublin.
The family were really lovely, outstanding hospitality. Highly recommended.

Brian house is in a lively location in Dublin. We had courses at the weekend and this was just a short hop from Killiney and Stillorgan. The room is a great space and everything was spotless. Netflix on the TV, super comfy bed and Brian had tea and coffee prepared for breakfast the following morning too. We couldnt stay for breakfast but it was a  nice touch. Well worth staying here
Really comfortable stay in a beautiful family home. Hosts were very welcoming.
Albert went above and beyond in every way. Incredibly nice, friendly, and kind. Couldnt ask for a better host or better accommodations.

Albert is an amazing host! His house is right by the coast, which provides a beautiful walk into town to catch the dart. There is a bus stop right outside of his home in the main road (about a 2 min walk).  Albert was full of information and details to get us where we needed to be. We would definitely stay with him again!
Absolutely perfect... great communication from Albert and everything needed was provided. Delicious breakfast and all facilities were perfect too. Would reccomend 100%

Alberts home was nothing but perfect. It by far exceeded my expectations and if I could give more than 5 stars I would. We had access to the entire upstairs of his home without interruption and breakfast was on the table waiting for us every morning. I have already referred his home to multiple friends and family and if i am to use AirBnB in Dublin again, I would hope it would be at his home.

Thank you Albert for a wonderful experience.
Albert is an outstanding host! He is very friendly and his accommodations were comfortable and thoughtful.

Albert was so kind and very helpful from the first time I got in touch with him. We were so delighted with his house, located in a quiet and very nice area within a walking distance from the train station, pubs and shops. Thank you very much.

A very nice and cozy stay! Albert was very nice and helpful.
You wont be disappointed

Excellent place, very convenient to reach from the airport with the bus 102 and well connected to the city center. Albert is a perfect host, the room is clean and comfortable, Malahide is a beautiful location.
Albert is a real super host! Everything was perfect!

Albert was a wonderful host! He truly went above and beyond all expectations. On a rainy day, he picked us up at the train station so we wouldnt have to walk in the rain. He provided wonderful advice for outings and best ways to travel. The space was cozy and breakfast was delicious every day. I would definitely stay with them again (and I hope I get the opportunity to do so!)
We had a great stay  beautiful place!
Perfect arrangement with bedroom, private bath & a private sitting room where you can relax & eat breakfast at your leisure.

No hot water for (nice big) bathtub or shaving was annoying & disappointing. Never before in 40 years of travel have we been without hot water. The host did say he would turn on the water heater in the morning (for shaving), but there was no hot water when I shaved at 7am. Otherwise, everything else was OK. Host (Albert) was pleasant, the location is about 20 minute walk from 'downtown' Malahide.

What a very good experience. Albert cares lovingly for everything. The situation could not be better. 200m from the beach in a quiet residential area. A train station to Dublin in about 20 minutes on foot, bus to the airport, and a parking lot on the street in front of the house. Lovable little town. You have the top floor for yourself, the private bathroom is very pleasant, the breakfast is ready every morning in the small "princesses" room with fridge and kettle. We will be back definitely.

Great location, walking distance to Malahide town center and right near the beach! The private upstairs area was great for having coffee in the morning. The space was very clean and welcoming, would definitely stay again!
Great host, location and comfortable house!
Lovely place to stay - so handy & Albert is very friendly

Alberts place was truly amazing. It provides great access to the village, ocean, restaurants, and castle all within a beautiful walk. We honestly couldnt have found a better place to stay. The location allowed us to enjoy our stay and quick access to the airport.
Albert was a great host, quick to respond and great location if you're staying longer!

Great hospitality. Response time excellent. Albert allowed us to check in very early in the morning which was greatly appreciated. Great advice to leave our rental vehicle at his home and take the train to Dublin City center. Cost for 2 return Euro 12.50. Worked beautifully.
Location is a comfortable 10-15min walk to the village along the sea front. We would highly recommend this B&B - great location proximity to the airport and Dublin City Center .

Lovely home with private space for guests to relax and great amenities. Albert made us feel very welcome, and was quick to respond to any communication . So close to both city with great transport links and Airport. Malahide is a lovely village to explore and Albert's house is great short walking distance to village and also so very close to beach and walkways. Would highly recommend.

It was absolutely wonderful staying at Albert's place. Lovely home, which is a 10-15 min walk from the town centre. Parking available and it is a short drive to the airport.
Albert was an excellent host and I would definitely recommend staying at his place.
Great location just minutes from the airport. Had the whole floor... bedroom, bath, lounge to ourselves. Nice, light breakfast. Friendly host with great tips.

This is a must stay place in Malahide! Albert was exceptional and so welcoming! Their place is close to downtown and near the beach. Very clean and lovely place to stay. Would highly recommend anyone to stay at Alberts place.

Albert's place is a cute, well organized get-away in beautiful Malahide. It's also just 15 minutes from the airport which is why we chose it for our last night in Ireland. We arrived relatively late because our plan for the day had not worked out the way we had planned, but Albert was super helpful and quickly showed us everything we needed to know.

Albert's place in incredible. Our plans got changed, so we were unable to spend an entire day in Malahide as planned. However, Albert made our incredibly short overnight stay a true dream. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom was spacious and sparking clean. Albert went above and beyond as a host and personally retrieved us from the train station at 10pm and has a light breakfast (tea, coffee, cereal, scones, fruit, granola bar) available. You must, MUST stay with Albert when you visit Malahide. We know for certain that we want to come back soon.
Everything was great. Host really friendly and welcoming - room was  great. Very private use o  first floor.

Fabulous home, super host. We had a super stay in malahide and the house was within walking distance of the village.  Great to have the extra room with tv, fridge and treats. We really had a great stay . Highly recommend to any traveler looking for something special in malahide.  A special mention to the brack offered on our arrival.  To the baker - Yummy

Albert was a great host and answered all our questions and was willing to give us local information as well.
The room was very clean and spacious. 
Great location near the sea! 
We enjoyed a lovely sunrise on our way to the airport.
Perfect, quiet and private, 20 minute walk to town, 2 minute walk to the beach. Thank you!!!

Albert's place was fabulous! Just what we needed. He stayed up to greet us with our late arrival from the airport. The space was clean and breakfast in the morning was a great start to our day! His place is so close to the water for a lovely walk and easy walk into town as well. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends/family.
Albert is a fantastic host, both welcoming, informative, thoughtful and respectful of space. Made our trip very pleasant and we will definitely stay again when we come to Malahide. Thanks!
Lovely place, short walk from town centre. Great hospitality
Super place location and host, will be back

Albert is a very considerate host. He gave us very helpful information about trains and  
Local sites. The rooms are comfortable and there is  plenty of hot water in the shower. It is a great place to stay to visit Dublin and Malahide is a beautiful town.

A magic place with an amazing host. The house is about 10-20 minutes from the village center. It's very accessible and the walk is very nice, you're walking next to the beach it is really peaceful. Malahide village is so relaxing too, people are very nice and caring. Moreover Malahide castle and gardens are a "must see", It has such an incredible halo and ambiance it won't let you neutral.
And if you miss the city you can simply take a train from Malahide to Dublin and visit it.
If you want to go to a concert or festival in Ireland, Malahide is the place to go and the place to stay.

Personally I'm hoping to get back as soon as possible.
You can't get enough of magic, can you ?

- Camille.

Albert is indeed a superhost!  He made our first day in Ireland so wonderful with his exceptional hospitality, charming home, delicious snacks, and helpful suggestions for enjoying magical Malahide. His place is comfortable, clean, and a short walk from the beach and village.  Nearby Malahide Castle and Gardens is a real treasure for all visitors. Great AirB&B experience!

Alberts Place was easy to find and within walking distance to the beach and the downtown area where there was lots of shops, restaurants, pubs, etc.  We had the upstairs to ourselves.  Bed was comfy, water pressure in the shower was great and plenty of hot water.  There was also a separate room set up as a TV room and breakfast room. Breakfast consisted of muffins, fruits, granola bars, assortment of cereals, along with milk, orange juice and an electric kettle to make coffee.  Albert was always available to answers my questions, concerns and give us directions to various locations before and during our stay.  Wish we could have stayed longer.
Albert has a wonderful home. Off the main road and very peaceful. Very thoughtful with his accommodations. Will be back. Thank you Albert.
Excellence en tout
