Eadaoins place is flawless. Everything was just perfect. You can feel you really stay with the local. The location is so peaceful and safe!
Great location, beautiful home, spotless and spacious. Eadaoin was awesome - open and welcoming. Highly recommended.

if youre debating on whether you should book Eadaoins place or not, dont hesitate anymore! absolutely wonderful hospitality and knowledge of all the wonderful things to do in Ireland. even though its close quarters you wouldnt even notice, its like youre in your own space! bus stop located a short walking distance past a castle so a very nice walk! the whole trip was a dream, would definitely recommend!

Eadaoins is such a great host. She had so many suggestions as to what to do. Very friendly. Clean place. She is a very experienced host and, it shows she appreciates her guests from all over the world. I suggest her place. The 16 bus is not far and goes to the airport and the city center. Her dog is super cute.

Eadaoin is a wonderful and warm host and my friend and I really enjoyed our stay! Theres a park just down the block that we spent a lot of time in and at the local pub that is right across the street. We were super comfortable in the room, checkin was a breeze, and I felt a lot of freedom to come and go. Thank you for the fun stay!
Great place and amazing host. I definitely recommend staying here
Very friendly host, beautiful area, very nice to be able to use the kitchen. Fruit, yogurt, cereal, bread as breakfast a wonderful unexpected add-on!

Eadaoin is a super host for a great reason! She is SUPER! Super considerate, super funny, super engaging! She makes you feel at home, and very welcome. This was the start of our trip and it could not have been better. Eadaoin made sure we were well looked after.
Always willing to help out with our questions, making our stay comfortable and fun. Loved the garden and nieghbhorhood. We will definitely stay again, when we are next in Dublin.

we got a lot of infos for trips and she was very friendly! it's a very great house for staying some nights :)
the breakfast was great with many options.

We had such a great stay at their wonderful home. Eadaoin and her husband Michael are very kind and open hosts, felt like home right away! The house is nice and in a quiet area. Everything was clean and well kept. The transfer into the city by bus worked perfectly fine as well :)
All together we were very happy we chose this wonderful airbnb! 
13/10 stars!

Staying with Ann was a pleasure. We arrived earlier than we were meant to, but she invited us in and made us coffee etc. The room was very comfortable and clean, and it was a nice touch that she left us some bottles of water by the bed. She also facilitated parking for us right outside the house. I would highly recommend staying here. Thanks again, Ann!
Ann lives in a very residential neighborhood that is a quick walk away from a variety of cafe's and about a 30~40 minute walk into the city or a 3 euro bus trip into Dublin.

Ann is a wonderful and thoughtful host. She lives in the house and so knows all about the neighbourhood and is there to speak to if you need anything. She helped me with tips about local sights, dining options, and sightseeing recommendations not always in tour guides. She was most helpful and accommodating - when I needed a late check-out. I had a wonderful and homely experience.

Ann's home is in a quiet, residential neighbourhood. It is well connected by buses to Dublin city centre (about 20 minutes on the bus, and 2-3 minutes to get to the bus stop). Bus #16 gets you to her place straight from the airport, although it takes about 80-90 minutes.

Ann's home in Dublin was my home away from home. I enjoyed my stay very very much. Ann is extremely caring and jovial. Her spirit and concern for guests is exemplary. All the house mates are very calm and helping... There is an incredible positive energy about the house and it made Dublin one of my top experiences. Wishing the best to Ann and her family. Will come back. Definitely recommend.
Great host that couldn't do enough to help during my stay.

Anns place is perfect in every way. Situated in a quiet residential part of Dublin yet close to the city centre. I recommend Anns place for anyone who wants a short break in Dublin. Ann was welcoming, warm and hospitable. Thank you Ann.
Short but sweet stay! Thanks very much Ann!

Lovely neighborhood, quiet and residential but close to the city centre (connected by bus 16).
The house is very cosy, the room is spacious and bright, the bathrooms are perfectly clean.
Staying with Ann was a pleasure, she is so kind and welcoming.
Highly recommend.

Ann is an outstanding host. She served me toast and tea when I arrived, and stayed up to chat a little bit even though I arrived very late at night. She also was very generous with sharing her charger with me since I did not have one with an English plug, and is overall a very sweet person. Her place is very clean, stylish, and well-located, and I definitely recommend anyone to stay there!
Nice house,  quiet location & close to the city centre

Ann is very sweet and friendly. She responds quickly to any messages and/or questions and makes the check in process smooth. The room is spacious and very clean. There is lots of room to hang your clothes and to set out your items. The bed is very cozy and comfortable. The bathroom and shower are nice, clean and modern. Ann also made space for me in the fridge, which was great. Overall, definitely recommend staying here.

A lovely spacious room in a great part of town. 
Ann couldn't have made new feel more welcome and I shall certainly stay again if I am in the area.
A lovely welcome, very pleasant and comfortable room.  Perfect for a place to just put your head down for a short stay.
The house is very large and gorgeous. It is very comfortable and you can relieve the weariness of travel.
Peter is a great and responsive host with a ton of local knowledge. His place is in a great spot - have fun!
Really handy for getting around Dublin. Great communication, good location.

A great and cozy place. Perfect location and many hip and cute restaurants and cafes right around the corner. Peter is a great host and gave us many recommendations for places to see and things to do in Dublin, not to mention he helped us figure out the easiest way to get to the apartment from the airport with detailed instructions and map.
Wonderful host

Peters apartment was in a great location, very easy to get to and close to the train station (which we needed to travel west). 
There are many restaurants right around the apartment and its a short walk to Temple Bar. Peter checked in with us while we were there and was great at offering suggestions for places to go! Would totally stay again!
Had a wonderful time staying at Peter's place! Very accommodating and quick to respond!
Perfect location for our one-day stay in Dublin. Very spacious apartment. Guinness Storehouse is about a 30 minute walk but we love walking so it isnt a problem. Peter was a very communicative host.
Great location! Lovely and cozy little place. We met Peter's friend (since Peter was away traveling) and they were super friendly, kind, and gave us wonderful tips for where to eat.
This place is amazing. Perfectly located in the heart of Dublin, nice and clean with a very comfortable bed, and an extremely caring and forthcoming host.
Perfect location, a great find for anyone looking to explore Dublin.

Peters place is very close to the main central sights, it has a convenient lift and is and is super homey. Peters friend Viny settled us in and was very helpful and nice. Peter was very responsive with messages and provided us with useful info.
Place is very central so think again if youre renting a car cause parking wont be easy.

Would recommend!

Great location that was easy to get to and also relatively quiet. Peter provides great information on getting around and things to do. The apartment was neat and clean and the bed was very comfortable.
Great location and local tips from Peter were much appreciated! Would stay here again.

This apartment is rather barren with a bare single light bulb lighting the living room and the kitchen area. There was good WiFi and the location is (Website hidden by Airbnb) view at all from any of the windows.Host has apparently been away for some time. Most of the apt. was clean but Very simply furnished. Substitute hosts are nice but inexperienced.
Great value and a fantastic location! Very responsive to any questions or needs we had.  Helped make our stay more relaxing.
Great location.  Gym downstairs. Great host.
Great space, very central, well kept and great amenities.

Peter is an amazing host. As we just moved to Dublin we stayed for three weeks in his apartment. Peter replys very fast and he was very flexible in terms of days and late checkout. The apartment is located 5 minutes walk from the temple bar in a quiet area, Super recommended.
Great place to stay, close to everything and in a nice building, Peter and Viny were helpful and quick to respond, I will definitely stay there again
A wonderfully comfy clean place in a beautiful location.
Second time staying at his place! Very nice and highly recommend it!
Beautiful place and nice location but extremely overbearing and unprofessional host. I would not recommend this accommodation if you are a young, female traveller.

It was my first time using this service and I was a little anxious of what to expect but this apartment was perfectly located and good value for money. Everything had been thought of down to the adorable welcome board with our names on and all of the small and personal touches. Gerard was attentive and easily contactable and really the perfect host. His tourist recommendations were top notch and the apartment was perfect for a quick weekend getaway!

If you're looking for a clean & safe flat just a few transit/LUAS stops away from most everything, Gerard has it. As a host, Gerard was quick to respond & easy to chat with. As an added bonus, his insights on Dublin and Ireland are spot on!

Gerard is a great host with great hospitality and reliability. Always avaiable, always up for recomendations how to explore the city. His place is pretty personal and really nice. You feel really welcomed as guests. From Gerards place you can start your day- trips and reach the heart of Dublin in just a few minutes. 
Highly recomended!

I highly recommend staying with Gerard for any visit to Dublin! He was so courteous and accommodating, and made sure we always knew where we were going and how to get there. Such a wonderful host, and we'll be sure to book with him again next time we're in Dublin!

Gerard is an awesome host! He made my staying wonderful. His aunt is also an adorable person. She was waiting for me and showed me everything in the apartment. I saw her the first and last day. 
Gerard also gave me lot of information about local and touristic places for entertainment, eating and drinking :) 
He helped me a lot when I was there. I had an incident with a tour company and Gerard called the company and even went there to pick up my stuff while I went to another tour. 
He made my vacation very special. Thank you a lot Gerard!

Great place and superhost for our stay in Dublin! Clean, comfortable, and close proximity to all attractions. 
Gerard is indeed very helpful in providing travel tips and we would definitely recommend this place!!

Fantastic host with a beautiful apartment right next to Guinness storehouse. Very clean and comfortable with everything in an accommodiation that you can require. The tram to city centre takes just a few minutes with access right outside the door. The area is quiet and peaceful. I really recommend staying here.
Fantastic location, lovely flat exactly as described with warming touches. Gerard gave brill local advice and his flat made our weekend in Dublin easy and memorable. Definitely recommend!!

Gerard's place is great! You're a short walk or tram ride to all Dublin's attractions and the location is quiet so you'll get a great night sleep. The house is comfortable and has a well stocked kitchen if you like to cook. 

Gerard was a great host, quick to respond and gave us tons of recommendations. We'd be happy to stay here again.

Gerards place was amazing. Though we couldnt meet him he gave us a comfortable feeling. His aunt who has welcomed us was very warm hearted. Even his cousin who guided us was patient and friendly. The apartment was very clean and cozy. You have seen in every detail the thought we should feel at home. The location is perfect. The tram station is just next to the door. You can also walk to the city. We will definitely come back if were in Dublin. Lovely home. 
Regards, Jakob & Lavanya

Our stay with Gerard was excellent! Despite being away on business, he was able to keep us comfortable and informed about everything that was going on locally. He also made sure to give us several contacts so we had someone close by to call if we had a problem. The apartment was very clean and in a great location literally across the street from the tram shops. Would absolutely stay with him again!

It was our first time using airbnb and we couldn't of picked better host! We felt more than welcomed with breakfast and tiny touches! The tram is just outside and made our festival experience smooth and easy! Although we didn't get to meet Gerard, his communication from afar was great! We had no problems and he made sure we had everything we needed and more! It was such a relaxing experience, I would highly recommend to everyone i know!
Gerard is a great host and very helpful! Lovely flat, great location, would definitely stay there again!
Gerard was super friendly and helpful, gave us a lot of useful information and provided us with food and drink in the fridge. The house is really clean and cozy, would definitely recommend it.
Gerard was very informative and helpful with local recommendations and navigating through the city center.  He communicated very well up front and throughout the duration of the stay.

Gerard is a really friendly host, he gave us loads on information about Dublin, he was very understanding of us checking in late the first night and overall it was a pleasure to stay in his property. I can't recommend it enough.

Gerard was the perfect host. His place is lovely and a perfect choice, if you are looking to visit and explore Dublin.
Easy check-in and check-out. Perfect hospitality and support. Many useful tips about public transportation, restaurants and pubs, sights and interesting places.

Great space and Gerard had lots of thoughtful touches with breakfast foods, toiletry items, and local tips. Easy check in and very close to tram station. He responded to our queries quickly and his home was a great place to get some rest. :) Would recommend.
Such a great location and host, probably the best air bnb Ive ever stayed in!!

What can I say? I always keep coming back to stay at Gerard's beautiful abode. There is good reason why he is  a super host. He's very hospitable and welcoming with plenty of tips on what to do and see around Dublin and all over Ireland. There simply isn't enough space for me to write all the pros of staying at Gerard's place. You simply must experience it to believe it but book it before someone else does you'll be glad you did. I will be back. Cheers.
We had a lovely stay by Gerard in Dublin. The apartment is brand new and tidy with breakfast prepared for us. We got also a lot of usefull tips. Can only recommend!
Nice, small apartment. Nice area. 20 minute walk to city centre

Right in downtown Rathmines it was a great location. Walls were thin and people came in and out of the other apartments in the middle of the night. The room got extremely hot and the heat was kind of difficult to figure out. Also the hot water does not last very long. It was still usable for us as we only stayed a few days and basically only slept there. Value and location are great.
Good value, great location.

Such a cool place to stay. Good space, good bed, gook kitchen.
Maybe the bathroom it's a bit small but it's ok for 2 people.
The position it's super comfortable, markets bus stops and all you need are very near the house.
Bernard was so helpful and give us all information about check in and the uso of the house very quick.
Very reccomended, will be back in future probably!
Bernard and the room itself was great! Awesome location!
Clean, compact studio apartment in a lovely area of Dublin. Easy walks to town and lots of local shops and restaurants.
Very nice flat with all you need to spend a nice trip To Dublin
Great place, close to the city, clean, great host
The location suited myself as there many good eating places very close by & it was only a 20/25 minute walk into downtown Dublin .

Bernard is a great guy, very social and laid back. The apartment has a great location, easy to walk or take a bus to the city centre. The backyard is a great plus, the bed is rather small for two people but that's understandable given the space it's in. Kitchen is equipped with pots and pans and bathroom is adequate. I recommend this place.
It's well located, with many supermarkets and restaurants near by.  Bernardo is very attentive. The studio is small, specially the shower cabin, and it's in an old building.
Todo correcto. Buen barrio y buenas conexiones. Hemos estado a gusto.
Excellent place to stay with great connections to stay and no hassle checking in or out.
everything ok!great location!

The location in Rathmines is actually quiet great, cause it's a neighborhood that you would normally maybe not explore. But it has great coffee shops , bars and a nice vibe and only 25 min walk to the super busy Temple Bar tourist nightlife district. 
The studio is clean but very tiny. Bernard provides coffee and tea which is nice. However the place should get some makeover to justify the high price. There is literally no decoration to make the space cozy and comfortable. The bathroom fan is super loud and needs fixing. Shouldn't be an issue hopefully by the time others book in the future. It's good for a solo traveler but almost too small for a couple and therefore I think the price is quite high for what you get. But it's a great neighborhood and definitely a good way to explore Dublin.
Great location, great host.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Hello everyone, that was a lovely Saint Patrick's extended weekend at Bernard's. The place was just fine, above our expectations, not in the center but buses rode us there in 10 minutes. The room was just as it should be, maybe the bathroom wasn't that new and fresh but it's ok. Many shops around (Aldi, Lidl, etc) and cafes for breakfast. Ask Bernard for advice which traditional pub go to - it was just perfect! Thank you Bernard, good luck, cheers!

The studio in a fantastic location - great part of town and close to everything you'd want to be close to.

Bernard was also very hospitable and helpful as a host, and the place was clean and tidy.

On the down side, the kitchen area is very small, it took a while for the hot water to heat up, and even after it had heated up it tended to run out pretty quickly.

Bernard is easy to communicate with and extremely helpful in terms of navigating around the city.
  The studio had much appreciated  coffee as well as tea  in the kitchen was quite useful. Conveniently located within a two minute walk of Plenty of restaurants and simply jumping on a bus to get to city Center which is only about a mile away was ideal as well.
All excellent !! Thanks so much
Great place
Great location and pretty quiet for being on a buy street. The place was really small and the mattress wasnt very comfortable.

We had a rough start because we were told there might not be enough lock boxes for us to check in, so we were anxious if wed even be able to stay here! In the end it worked out fine thought even with our flight being nearly 2 hours delayed. The studio is small, but you can see that from the pictures. The bed is super comfy though and the duvet so soft. The location is a little out of the centre, but with good bus links. The hot water is an issue, you have to wait 20 minutes for the water to heat up, and then in the shower the temperature was fluctuating. Really hard when you have a busy day planned to get up 20 minutes earlier so you can have hot water for a shower... I probably wouldnt stay again unfortunately, I was just looking for a bit more for the amount we paid.
Great location!

This apartment is small and dated. It has a queen size bed with one bedside table and a small table with 2 chairs.
The kitchen is a very small alcove with a range with 4 burners and an oven. There is a refrigerator, toaster and kettle as well as dishes, cutlery and pots and pans and a coffee press. There are also oil and salt. Bernard supplies tea, coffee and sugar.
There is a hair dryer.
There was usually no hot water in the kitchen or bathroom. One is supposed to press a button 2 hours before taking a shower in order to get hot water. The supply, when this is achieved, is short lived - one gets 2 to 3 minutes of hot water.
When there someone in the apartment above, one can hear their footsteps distinctly.
The apartment was clean, the linens good and there was a dish towel. There is a place to recycle glass, plastic and paper.
There is a back garden with flowers where there are picnic tables and a clothesline.
Bernard is a friendly and kind person.
The apartment seems expensive, although Dublin is a very expensive city.
Bernard was a great host. Replied within 10 minutes after booking and allowed us to check in early. The place was clean and in a great location.

This is a great spot if youre looking for an authentic Dublin experience. It has all the basic necessities, but thats about it.

The bed is a double, but has a basic and well used mattress. The shower doesnt stay hot for long, but it works. No TV. 

Walking from here to the city center will take about 30 minutes if thats your plan. There are quite a few shops and restaurants / bars nearby the room if walking gets to be too much. That also means its loud though. Plenty of shouting people in the middle of the night and the kitchen exhaust fan from the falafel place in front is a fairly constant drone.

It was easy to find and Bernard was easy to get in touch with for check in.
Excelent studio and location. Bernard was a nice host.
Bernard was very helpful and quick to respond before and during our stay. The location was exceptional and very easy to get around from. Room was exactly as described. Would return in the future.

Bernard was a great host. The apartment was very well kept and the location is great, as you can gent to the city centre in a few minutes by bus. I few ever decide to come back to Dublin we will definitely repeat.
Rathmines is amazing. Wonderful period house in a nice part of Rathmines. Plenty of places to go out. Friendly host. Good communication and easy access to the flat.
Such a great place to stay! Great size with amenities and in a great location. The host was super friendly too!
Great location

Very easy and chill place to stay. One thing Id say is that I wish it was just a little bit closer to city center so we could have walked more. We ended up getting many taxis. Definitely make sure to wait the full 20 min before starting a hot shower. Otherwise this place was great to stay at especially if youre busy all day and just have a nice comfy place to come home to at night.

Bernard was always available to help us with our requests answering very quickly. The apartment is perfect for 2 people, clean and equipped with the essentials. Nearby there are supermarkets and restaurants and bus stops to the city center (reachable just in 15 minutes from the house)

Location was top notch. Very walkable to lots of things. Cute backyard for when the weather allows. We had issues with the water pressure and the wifi but Bernard provided us with a discount to compensate which was fair enough to me. 
Kitchen had almost all the basics. Could use a sharp knife and cutting board (we struggled to cut some takeout sandwiches) but was pleased by the coffee and french press! All in all, I would stay here again.

Great location . Still in the city but not too crazy busy . Great food and bars close by . We loved the black bird ( local pub ) Bernard recommend to us :) . Definitely would stay again .  Perfect space for 2 people :)

Bernard flat is very well communicated to the center by bus or a nice walk crossig the Portobello canal, the flat is very clean and bigger than you expect in the pictures, it has tea and coffee, etc and an incredible garden. Bernard answered all our questions very quickly and it was a peaceful sleep, no noise and comfy bed and pillows. Thanks again Bernard!

Bernard's place is in an ideal location. Approx 30 mins walking distance from Dublin City Centre and has lots of supermarkets and a movie theatre within 5 mins walking distance. The space is basic but has everything you need. The bed is  very comfortable. We definitely recommend!

We found the apartment very comfortable and situated in the perfect location for us. A straightforward walk of 30 mins or so into the centre or an easy bus ride. There are some excellent restaurants on the route too. The building is set back from the street which is nice, but the sound does come through - dulled enough for most, but bring sleeping tablets if you are a light sleeper. The apartment is clean and has everything you need. We had no trouble heating the water in advance for a shower. All in all highly recommended.

The apartment was ideal as a base for a short break but also cosy enough to spend plenty of time in. Bernard provided a heap of useful information about transport links and local spots. Really handy for getting into town.

Great location, well serviced by buses but also a very easy walk straight into centre of town. Surrounded by plenty of pubs, bars and cafes. Bernard also provides extra towels and shower products, which is very handy. Basic but comfortable for a city stay when you are mainly out exploring
Lovely place would stay again!

The house is very clean and cozy. The shower is great, the beds are comfortable. We just had a little problem to get a taxi because it was San Patricks day and the city was crowded. It costs about 10 euros to get to the center. I highly recommend Orla's house.

Very pleasantly surprised at the accommodation, three spacious doubles, nice living area and kitchen, handily placed for all our needs. Orlando was a great host, very communicative and nothing was too much trouble for her. Left us a package of food and milk which was very welcome. Amenities are excellent would not hesitate to recommend
House was homely with comfy beds and nice/clean bedrooms. Lovely to have breakfast and coffee supplied. Description above is accurate!

A great stay! I was in town for work and Orla was wonderful! Upon check in, she called with a list of local recommendations for places to eat, shop, etc. When we had some hiccups with the heater system, she was quick to reply to my texts and was very helpful. Thanks so much Orla!

Orla's house was really nice and cozy with a very nice style, and the beds were very comfy. We enjoyed staying there :) We had to check in quite late, which was no problem with the keybox and the given instructions, also Orla sent a lot of tips on how to get there beforehand. Inside, we got a lot of information about restraurants and sightseeing in Dublin, which was very helpful to us. Unfortunately, we did not meet Orla in person, due to our late arrival, but she always responded very quickly and explained everything to me. I would recommend her house at any time!

Had an amazing time in Dublin. Orlas place was fantastic!  Great communication with the host, no troubles with checking in or finding the place. Immediately felt at home at Orlas house. Highly recommended!

Three bedrooms in cozy house , two upstairs and one downstairs
No washroom upstairs
Pleasant and helpful hostess
Probably a good price for Dublin
Enjoy
Thanks Orla for the pleasant & smooth stay in Dublin!

This property's principal selling point is that it has three bedrooms which makes it ideal for friends who prefer not to twin share (or sleep) on a sofa bed. The location is not particularly chic, but is quiet.
Our living in Orla's house was great. The house is  cozy, sweet and (Website hidden by Airbnb) an authentic working class Irish neighborhood...! Everything was really great..!

Orla was a great help with any questions we had and very accommodating. Her home is a bit of a walk from the tourist part of the city, which is what we wanted. You can catch the bus right down the street but we choose to walk, its about a 25 min walk.  There is a fabulous little cafe right down the road that you have to try, their breakfast was fabulous!

The house is a lovely accomadation. It is located not far from the city centre and has several shopping possibilities nearby. You can find a lot of information about things to do in Dublin within the living room.
Three nice bedrooms. Very comfortable common room. Easy walk to the city. Kitchen small but functional. Orla super easy to work with.  Dublin is super busy so nice to be a little outside the city.

Orla ha sido muy amable  guardar las maletas despues de la salida de la casa hasta nuestra salida del avion. Gracias tambien por toda la informacion prestada y la comida disponible. Gracias por tu hospitalidad.
Absolutely a pleasant place to be.

Catherine's place is great located, in a calm part of Dublin. Near (5min by foot) to the DART train stop, and 15min by Taxi from Airport. This allowed us a stress-free celebration of St. Patrick's Day without paying a fortune for the night.

Great stay. Highly recommendable host.
Initially we hat some doubts about a room with curtains (instead of a door), but it was not at all a problem.
Very friendly and helpful 10/10

Could not recommend higher for new arrivals to Dublin! Warm, comfortable, clean and quiet with good access to the Public transport system. Absolutely perfect for anyone needing accomodation whilst settling in, or exploring the city!

The room is quiet, comfy and very clean and Estelle and Alan are wonderful hosts. They indeed provide a warm welcome and staying here feels not like having a place to sleep but rather like having a second home. Also Leo the dog is a sweetheart. <3 Couldn't recommend more!
Lovely ,quiet and clean accomodation. Worm hospitality.
We stayed at James' place before so had no qualms in returning for another stay. Highly recommended in terms of space, cleanliness, location and communication. A+
Great location, within walking distance to lots of attractions. Quiet and welcoming - we felt right at home
Charming house on the corner of Phoenix Park, making it a great location for getting just about anywhere. Quiet and safe neighborhood as well.
It was a really wonderful stay, the place is really cozy and the phoenix park next to it invites you for a quick walk. We'll definitely come back!

James was the perfect host leading up to and during our trip. We stayed at his property for almost 2 weeks and could not have been happier with the experience. 

This was our first time traveling out of the country with our (almost) 2 year old. We were thrilled to find a space that was so accommodating for children. James answered all of my questions about car seats, strollers, cribs and more. He responded quickly and thoroughly each time. 

When we arrived James arranged for some tasty cheese, wine and bread to be set out, which made us feel right at home. The space was clean and bright, and exactly as described. 

We were thrilled with how close to the City Center the property was and how easy it was to access the bus and the train. 

If we ever return to Dublin we will absolutely stay here again.

Perfect place to experience Dublin from-especially with young kids. They had all the necessary things to make traveling with a baby or toddler a breeze. There is a beautiful and huge park 5 minute walk from the house. The city center is walkable and bus lines are close. Necessary kitchen supplies were provided in addition to coffee, a bottle of wine, cheese, Irish butter, and bread. We would certainly stay there again.

A great stay!  The house is well designed and decorated with helpful kitchen / children's toys and equipment provided.  It's in a very safe and friendly neighbourhood and provides easy access on foot / public transport / car to the city.  Free parking is a massive bonus.  Angie who checked us in was so helpful and friendly and was available to answer any questions over the phone and (if needed) in person.  James' communication was A1 as well when booking / arranging our stay.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend  booking here.

Jamess place was perfect for us! The spaces were comfortable and we appreciated the thoughtful touches (wine, cheese, bread). James was not in town so arranged for his neighbor Angie to be at hand - she was lovely and helpful and like James, gave us great tips and suggestions.

The place was in a perfect location for us - just outside the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk everywhere, including the train station to Galway and an excellent art museum and huge public park minutes away. It was quiet, felt very safe, and super charming.

You must try Ryans Bar (Jamess suggestion) for the Guinness, mussels, and burgers - superb suggestion.

Thank you James! We hope to return again!
Excellent location, clean home
Brilliant stylish place and super location.

We had a nice stay at James place in Dublin. Great for exploring the city and Phoenix Park. My two and a half year old especially enjoyed all the toys available! James and Angie made sure we had everything we needed for him and our 6 month old tooîbaby gates, stroller, high chair, booster seat. 

The bus service into the city was quick and efficient (about a 10 minute walk to the stop). Taxis were less than 15 euro. 

Thanks James!

Leuke en rustige locatie op wandelafstand van de belangrijkste toeristische attracties van Dublin. De inrichting van het huisje is prima in orde. James is een geweldige gastheer; heel attent en reageert heel snel op communicatie. Kortom; een aanrader!

A terrific place to stay when in Dublin - car park outside the door and right across from a great park and the Zoo - short walk into the centre of Dublin and also close to station and bus depot . Lovely touches and everything there that I needed.  The wine bread and cheese were also lovely. Thanks James
A wonderful place in excellent location.
Cute house in a great location by Phoenix Park. Bus stop to city centre 2 mins walk, tram stop 10 mins walk. Perfect place for a city visit

We didnt meet James, but we met Angie who takes care of the property, she was very helpful giving us tips on where to go and do. She has a great personality that makes you feel welcome and at home. The location is away from the hectic city but really close to Phoenix  park. I highly recommend this place for families.  They left toys, a gate and books for our little girl. The room were spacious and perfect for the three of us. If you are thinking about where to stay in Dublin but dont like the busy feeling of being in a city, please book this place. Really easy access to the main attractions in Dublin by bus without feeling  crowded. We had a lovely stay at James place.  Thanks!

Great location, very nice and quiet apartment, and we appreciated very much the help provided by Angie who takes care of the flat. Bedrooms could benefit from better beds. Would recommend to our best friends.

This place is a real gem. It is modern and you can tell a lot of thought went into designing it. Its in a very nice, quiet location near a bus stop to get you in and out of the city center. James and Angie were very welcoming. They left a lovely bottle of wine and some crackers, cheese and an Irish soda bread for us when we got there. Such a nice touch. We had a wonderful time.
Perfect location in Dublin. Everything can be reached by foot. The nearby park is also a nice place to relax.
A very comfortable, welcoming, and well-equipped home in a quieter part of Dublinîhighly recommended!

Jamess place was a great base for our trip to Dublin with our toddler. It was a 2 minute walk to Phoenix Park and the playground and about a 10 minute walk to the Zoo. He had two bins of toys and a shelf of childrens books which were great for our son. We had a brief issue with the WiFi and James responded quickly to resolve it. The cheese, bread and wine upon arrival were a great touch.

Robbie's apartment is stylish, comfortable, spacious and immaculately clean- even nicer than in the photos, with a beautiful panaromic view over the Dublin skyline.
The bed and pillow were super comfortable.
The location is great- just around the corner from Bord Gais Theatre, and a few minutes walk from 3 Arena (where we were going to a concert). 
Robbie is a charming and friendly host, and was very easy to communicate with throughout. Highly recommended.

Warm welcome with tea and biscuits on arrival, friendly chatter and helpful advice on area. Use of kitchen facilities a bonus. Room adequate for 3 night stay and handy for 3 Arena which we were visiting. Pleasant stay and not intrusive. Great host, would recommend, thanks Robbie. !

Robbie's place was just great. The room was spacious and clean as well as the private bathroom. I enjoyed my stay. I especially love the hospitality from Robbie. He was very welcoming. We had a splendid chat with him on our night there. This was a great find!
Great host in a perfect place!

Robbie's apartment was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The bedroom, large bathroom and kitchen were set up very nicely. The patio views were beautiful. It was in a great location, only a few minutes cab ride to downtown or about a 15-20 minutes walk. We had a very nice night's stay here. If you have a car, the parking situation is a bit difficult as it's either park on the metered street (if you can find a spot) or to park in the nearby parking garage and pay the 40 Euros per night fee.
Lovely stay, we were attending a gig in the 3arena was in an Ideal location with bars and restaurants within walking distance. Would recommend.
Great value and ideal location! Super clean and a great host. Only a 3 minute walk to the Luas line and within a 10minute walking distance of 3arena!

Great place and amazing host! His flat is close to the city centre and to many restaurants. Everything was very clean (bed, bathroom, kitchen, etc) and he offered us breakfast every morning. I would definitely stay here if we visit Dublin again. Thanks Robbie!

Lovely apartment with everything we needed. Robbie made a cup of tea for us which was deeply appreciated since we'd just arrived in Ireland.  He told us about the neighborhood and the local restaurants as well as a fabulous pub that we visited that evening. 

The bed is superbly comfortable - we rested very well and found the neighborhood to be extremely quiet at night. The duvet kept us warm and snug. The shower is adequate with plenty of hot water.

The apartment itself is tastefully decorated, very clean, and in a great location - an easy walk to bus stops, Pearse station, and Temple Bar. 

I wouldn't hesitate to stay with Robbie again if I ever have the good luck to visit Dublin again.
A great welcome. Excellent hospitality and a lovely stay

Very tastefully decorated apartment with a balcony view of Dublin and walking distance to Grafton Street nightlife area. Robbie provided coffee, breakfast, and provided answers to all our questions. Absolutely would stay here again.

Robbie is an awesome host. 
The apartment was easy to find and the Check-In was super fast. Robbie even offered us some drinks. The apartment was very cozy and very close to the city center. 
I would recommend everyone to stay at Robbies place.
As others have said, this is one room in an apartment , not private. Good location.
Great location and would stay with Robbie again.
Non possiamo che confermare le numerose recensioni positive, host disponibile.
Robbie's place was clean, cozy, and very secure!!
Great location secure parking very quite, can recommend for a night in the city.

A lovely spacious apartment with great views of the city and easy access to the centre with frequent buses nearby. Robbie was very hospitable and informative about the city but not intrusive in any way.

Our one-night stay at Robbie's was great for our last night in Ireland before catching an early flight - very quiet despite being in town. The accommodations were as described and in a good location, and convenient to many restaurants.
Just enjoy the stay.

We had kind of an unusual experience as Robby was on vacation and we've had the whole house for ourselves. Maybe due to Robbies absence we were a little disappointed with the breakfast as there was no coffee and any other bread spread then jam. The location itself was very central and good value for money. We however were surprised about the high costs for parking (40 euros for a day)
Robbie is the perfect host!! very present, friendly and helpful!! could't make a better choice
Highly recommend. Great location for bord gais theatee + 3 arena. Quiet cosy + clean .

Great location for a quick (or even extended) stay in Dublin! Easy to get to via public transport, and Robbie gave detailed instructions to help as well. Beautiful and stunning views of the city with your beverage of choice in the morning. Unfortunately, our paths did not cross much with Robbie's, however, when they did, he was absolutely lovely and fun to chat with! I would highly recommend staying with Robbie to get the most out of Dublin.
A great location for a visit to Dublin.
Nice location. Room is a bit small for two big suitcase. Breakfast is nice.

Robbies place is exactly as described, great location and very clean. 
He is an unobtrusive host but happy to help with recommendations.
Everything was fine

Unfortunately I was only at Robbies one night however he made me feel very welcome and at ease. His local knowledge and tips on traveling around Ireland were great and have helped immensely. Check in was very easy and the location was great. Bed was comfortable and Robbie provided all the essentials, plus. I would definitely stay with Robbie again when next in Dublin

Me and my mother stayed with Robbie for a night while in Dublin and we had a great time. Robbie had great communication with me,even to the extent of checking in with me on arrival to make sure I didnt get lost. After giving us a good tour of the place he left us to make ourselves at home. The apartment is amazing and is in an ideal location. We had a great night with Robbie and enjoyed his company. He is a very good host! Thank you for your kindness Robbie.
Totally recommend Robbie and his apartment!  Location was 100% as we were attending 3 Arena and also wanted to head into town.

The location is great and very easy to access! We were within walking distance of most things we had planned to see. We were disappointed because the shower would not get hot. After a long day of walking, this was one thing that put a damper on our stay. Robbie is a very nice host and easy to communicate with!

Robbie has a great apartment. Easy walk into centre of the city and most sightseeing spots. We were at a music gig at the RDS and it was only a 25 minute walk. Would recommend Robbie's place for solo travellers and couples. There is on street parking which is free between 4.30 pm and 8.00 am. Saturday and Sunday parking is free all day.

Nice host
Nice place
Nice location (right next door to bord Gais)
Nice room with beautful view on the harbour
Robbie is a great host and has a clean and stylish apartment. I highly recommend.
Great location!  Thanks Robbie!
Very good location.  Breakfast provided.  Comfortable bed.
Clean and comfortable. Friendly host and close to the action.
Robbie was great. Very nice and easy-going. Super clean! All good! :)
Outstanding views! Perfect location! A wonderful host and perfect AirBnb experience.
Expect only the best with Robbie. Both my partner and I had an excellent stay.
We were well entertained by Robby and loved his stories and great apartment!
Stunning location, Robbie was extremely helpful and it was a pleasure to stay with him during our stay!

We had a lovely stay with Robbie. He was a very pleasant host, everything was exactly as described. It was great that he provided breakfast items for us to help ourselves to in the morning. Would thoroughly recommend his property
Good value for money and Robby is very helpful

Robbies place was just what we needed on the night before we had to fly home, sadly. Would have loved the opportunity to chat more with him, but we got in a bit later and had to leave early in the morning. 

Robbie was very kind, showed us around his apartment, offered us tea/coffee and the opportunity to make breakfast before we left (which unfortunately we didnt have time for but it was very sweet to know the offer was there). 

A great location, an elevator, and a comfortable space, as well as such a nice host made this stay awesome! :)
Very good stay ! perfect view and location, and very pleasant host !
Robbie also stays in the place but you would not know he 's there :)  Great location and all you need is provided.

Robbie welcomed us on arrival. He gave us helpful instructions for the locks. The bed was comfortable and the bedroom had good ventilation due to sliding doors and small deck. The  location was convenient for walking to major attractions, yet far enough away for a quite night sleep. Would recommend this place!

Robbie is very kind and friendly. He helped us over the phone to find his apartment building when we got ourselves turned around in a new city. The apartment was walking distance to all the things we wanted to see and do in Dublin, and offered great views of the city. Robbie went out of his way to accommodate our schedule, and let us store our luggage past checkout time. We will certainly look Robbie up again on our next visit to Dublin.

Robbie was a true gem! He helped us with SO many things: luggage, parking, directions! 
The bedroom was comfortable and the fresh breeze through the open door was fabulous!
The bathroom had plenty of towels and personal supplies! 
Breakfast was good; with many choices for food! He also had a French Press for coffee!! 
The location was easy for getting on the Hop On/Hop Offù bus and an easy walk from Trinity College.
Thanks so much Robbie for all of your help and information and for making us so welcome!
We loved being I. Your beautiful city!
M and J
Robbie was great! He and his wife met us with a cup of tea and tips for seeing the city. They also gave us a ton of space which was nice.
Really comfortable room with your own bathroom just outside the door. Robbie was very welcoming and very helpful. Great place to stay while in Dublin

Just the most wonderful place and host. The view is gorgeous, the bed comfy, the flat luxurious and spotless. Nothing was a problem, Robbie pulled in favours and got our parking arranged that saved me goodness knows how much time, money and hassle, and worked around our schedules. We couldn't have had a better stay.

Great, amaizing it was awesome to stay there, good location which is close to occean and grocery stores as well.
In particular, the host is frienldly and kind.

Robbie is a great host and provides everything you could wish to need throughout your stay. helpful host with good knowledge of the local area. the apartment is immaculately clean and Robbie very kindly provides bottled water, tea, coffee, bread milk and cereal. small touches that definitely do not go unnoticed. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Dublin you can absolutely do a lot worse!

Central apartment, easy to walk to everything. Great host. Robbie met us on arrival and showed us where everything was.  Breakfast included ... Shame we didn't have any, but we had an early ferry to catch.
Great place to explore Dublin. Robbie was a great host and the space was well situated for exploring the city.

It was a nice stay, we didnt get to talk to Robbie much but we enjoyed the mix between shared space and privacy. The room is a little small, but we were out walking all day and spending time doing stuff it didnt really matter. The bathroom is big and nice. It was a good stay for one night! Elevator is a bonus for sure.
This is a well-positioned, well-equipped apartment, however it appears that you have to share it with the owner.

Robbies house is just like the pictures showed. The bed was very comfy, the location is in a great spot within walking distance to local pubs, temple bar, trinity college, etc. Would definitely recommend!
I highly recommend staying at Robbies!  He makes a fantastic Host!
Great host! He is very kind and eager to provide information about the local area. Apartment was very clean and the location was good.

Robbie was a friendly host, quick to reply to messages and very helpful. The room was very clean with helpful tourist pamphlets. Reasonable walking distance to the main tourist attractions - we walked to temple bar area, Dublin castle, the spire etc.

The space is small if u r travelling with a (Website hidden by Airbnb) room to open up and leave open. Bathroom outside bedroom.....was it private ....not sure. Location was good to city centre and Robbie was helpful with any questions. Breakfast there amounted to coffee for us.

Robbies place was a great stay, location was great for seeing sites throughout dublin. Robbie was an excellent host and I would definitely recommend staying here if you need accommodations thanks Robbie
We really enjoyed our stay in the lovely apartment. The check-in was welcoming with coffee and tips from Robbie. The apartment was super clean. Location is great for a city trip to Dublin. Thank you.
Awesome place, local and highly recommended. Killer views!
We had 2 great days in Dublin. Had no idea Robbie was going to leave supplies for breakfast, that was so convenient. View from the balcony and front room is wonderful, we watched 2 amazing sunsets.

We had a great stay at Robbies. We arrived earlier than check in but he let us drop in and leave our bags until the room was ready. It was very clean and the room comfortable. Its just a short walk to the city centre and close to all forms of transit. Robbie provided tips and advice for things to do and how to get around. He helpfully pointed out all the landmarks one can see from his apartment.  I would stay here again.

Robbie's apartment is well situated, well equipped, you even get a breakfast and the communication with the host was good. Those looking for more privacy should bear in mind, that you share kitchen and living room with the host and your bathroom and sleeping room is just next to the host's room.

Robbie is a great host, very kind and a quick communicator. We had a great stay in his lovely apartment with both a fantastic view of the city and the luxurity of being able to walk downtown in no time.
We thoroughly enjoyed staying at Robbies place. It was bed large and clean and well situated. Robbie was most hospitable and kind!
Robbie was a great host! The bed was comfortable and the room had a great view. Nice quiet area within 15 minutes walking distance of the more busy areas.

Robbies place is just as advertised. Its 20-25 minute walk outside center of Dublin, 12 Euro cab ride. He was a gracious host and allowed us to store our luggage before check-in after arriving on an early morning flight

Robbie's place is awesome. We had a very warm welcome, he's truly a nice host. Showing us everything in the house. The room is comfortable, with a nice big bed. Enough space to store your stuff. Next to the room, there's a very clean private bathroom, so that you don't need to share that with others. Furthermore you can use the kitchen (Robbie leaves some bread, eggs and juice for breakfast as well!). Location is great too, within 10 minutes you're in the city centre by bus. Walking is 20 minutes. Highly recommended!

Robbies place was easy accessible and not a far walk to the city Centre. He was a great host and very informative. Anything you could possibly think of or ask Robbie had it and answered it. Very clean room and the view was beautiful. Will stay there again when I come back to Dublin.
Perfect place and excellent host. I totally recommend Robbie's place. I would choose this place again for sure.

Robbie was very accommodating. My husband asked if he had another wash cloth so he went out and got one for us. He told us great stories, and he was patient with our phone situation which lead to some confusion at the beginning of the trip. 
His apartment has a beautiful view and it is about a 30 minute walk from the city centre. There is a hop on hop off tour stop next to the hotel which is just down the street from the apartment. It was a fun tour, and it was a good way to get around.

Robbie was a terrific and welcoming host from the communication prior to our arrival through our stay and to our departure. He greeted us with a tour of the apartment, showed us our room and private bathroom, kitchen (with food items we could help ourselves to) and pointed out the sights from the beautiful view that graces his home. He was very knowledgeable of the area and offered guidance for activities we wished to do on our short stay. Our bedroom was nice, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. I would definitely recommended his stay to anyone looking to visit Dublin.
Great location with lovely view from living room. Nice courtyard view from balcony in bedroom. Spotlessly clean and pleasant rooms with lots of nice touches. Robbie was pleasant and helpful.
Robbie is a great host.  Very friendly and helpful
It was nice to start and end our trip with Robbie's place. The second visit was even better than the first.

this location is spectacular - one smallish room with a bath in the hall but works out perfectly for me because I am an early to bed, early to rise, person and Robbie is the opposite - it's like having the place to myself.  Gorgeous views, kind host - what more could you want?

Honestly cant thank Robbie enough. 


Amazing host, made us a hot drink as soon as we arrived, invited us to sit and chat with him before we ventured out. Brilliant host. Wed love to stay again in future.

Robbie was so kind to us for our stay. He was kind to check us in after his normal check-in time and we were free to help ourselves to breakfast and use the kitchen as we pleased. Thank you for a wondefull stay.
Wonderful location & great host

Robbie was an incredible host and his place is wonderful! He was very accommodating with our schedule. His place is an easy walk into the heart of Dublin and hes thought of everything you may need during your stay.

My friends and I really felt at home during our 6 weeks here. The location is excellent, home is clean, comfy and well stocked with all the facilities you could need. We particularly enjoyed the large dining table and living room, perfect for gathering together. The security of the house was good too. Yasmine & Colin were excellent hosts who were very understanding and made sure we were comfortable during our stay. They provided guides to restaurants and attractions and were quick to reply to any questions we had. Would stay here again if given the chance!

Great location and the check in process was simple. Thoughtful communication with the hosts and enjoyed their local tips. Be sure to limit your shower times. Its a good place to rest your head and store your belongings while out enjoying the city.

Yasmine and Colins space is in a perfect location, close to everything you could want to see in Dublin. The apartment is clean and has a great balcony looking out at the Dublin wall. We had a great time here and would stay again.
This is a great location. Walking to all the major attractions. Walking to grocery store and many restaurants. Hosts were so great with all communications. Would highly recommend.
The location is unbeatable, you can walk everywhere! The hosts were very responsive and helpful. The designated parking space came in handy for our rental to do day trips.

This place is a great find for staying in Dublin. The location is centrally located near all the main attractions. We went with three children under 5 and walked to everything from the apartment. Highly recommend.
Een ruim, fijn appartement op een superlocatie. Heerlijk rustig en toch centraal in het centrum. Gastvrije hosts. Super tevreden over ons verblijf.

The apartment is perfect for a long weekend in Dublin, perfect location and facilitates all your needs. Yasmine and Collin were super helpful and brilliantly accommodating on our final day with a late check out. Would certainly recommend!!

The location was outstanding for exploring the Temple Bar, River Liffey, and City Centre areas.  There was so many attractions, and pick up locations for planned day excursions were within walking distance.  The view was great and close to the action, but on a quiet street.  We appreciated tips for restaurants, and information about the mechanics of the house were helpful.  I would stay there again.
Great place and location.
Yasmine & Colin were great hosts and their place was perfect.
We had a great time at Yasmine and Colins place. The location was great and the accommodations are exactly as described- great value for 4 people.

We had a great stay in Dublin at this apartment. It was well stocked with many kitchen provisions that made preparing meals easy. The hosts were wonderful with communicating prior to checkin and made sure we were happy throughout our stay. We had our toddler with us and they left a few personal touches for her as well which made everyone feel welcome. Would highly recommend. Theres a nice park across the street at the St. Audeons Church.
Lovely experience.
Great apartment close to the major sites of Dublin. A perfect jumping-off point for numerous day trips as well. Comfortable, clean, and free parking. Highly recommend!
Spacious appartment on a excellent location. Owners respond quickly and are not so strictly about arrival and leaving the appartment.

Great location.  5 minute walking distance to everything, but still a nice quiet street.  Great view from the balcony.  You do have to climb stairs to get the residence, no elevators, but this was not a downside for us.  Television had Netflix, which was a great bonus (especially since I spent a whole day inside when I became sick)!  Showers were great.  Host supplied us with Shampoo/Conditioner, towels, and hand wash.  Balcony is great to enjoy a cup of coffee on in the morning.  Hosts were very communicative and helpful. You will not be disappointed staying here.

This flat was charming, lovely, ideally situated near all the best that Dublin has to offer, esp. close to 2 Airlink 747 stops if anyone is taking the bus from the airport (and you should def take the bus because it's like getting a mini tour of Dublin centre). And Yasmine and Colin were wonderful hosts--very detailed, thorough, and helpful. I was flummoxed by how to deadbolt the doors and about the wifi and called and Colin walked me through everything (in Ireland you lift the doorhandle up and then do the deadbolt--not something I'm familiar with as an American). Would highly recommend this flat to folks looking.

Fantastic location-10 to 20 minutes to walk to all major sites in Dublin! Also very close to some good restaurants and grocery. The park outside St. Audeon's Church, across the street, gave a beautiful quiet space in the middle of the city. As teachers, we loved being next to a school. Great size for 2 adults and a teenager.
Great apartment! Short walks to just about everything in Dublin! Hosts were great and very informative!
The host canceled this reservation 79 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
We had a very good stay in this apartment.  it is ideally located, perfectly clean.
Great location!  Yasmin and Colin are wonderful to work with - responsive, helpful, etc.  Everything was awesome though the beds could be more comfortable.
Loved the location, quiet neighborhood that was walkable to everything we wanted to do.  The apartment was very clean and as described.  It was the perfect size for our family of four.

This place made for a great stay in Dublin. The directions to his place were spot on and the place was really lovely for our stay, in terms of style and cleanliness. Note that this place is a climb up a few flights of stairs, and that there are several codes for parking in case you have your own car (and this might be a challenge if you are travelling solo with a car). Make sure you get all three codes from this host at the beginning to ease your exit and entry into the car park (and to avoid communication delays).
Wonderful place in a great location

Great location and great hosts. They are quick to respond by phone/email. Apartment is on the third floor and stairs only so my be an problem for some people with mobility issues. Over all great for families as they do have crib/highchair/toys.
Great location - walking distance to and from everything in and around Dublin that you would want to see. Great communication by the hosts
Apartment was in a great location.  Walked to everything, no need for public transport or taxis (other than airport).  Was clean and comfortable and Yas and Colin were very responsive and helpful

Perfectly located, right in the city center, still very quiet. The apartment is huge, cozy and well equipped. Yasmine & Colin are perfect hosts, they even let us stay until late afternoon. Thank you for everything and hope to be back! :-)

Great location!  Easy access allowing us to explore the city.  In addition the Neighborhood people were friendly and welcoming to visitors.  Very enjoyable time.  Only recommendation it to bring your own washcloth!

We had a wonderful weekend with our girlfriends in this modern, clean and wonderful apartment just about five minutes away from Temple Bar, the Heart of Dublin.
Everything was prepared, the keys, the beds, It was extremly clean and we could enter the apartment without problems.
I recommend it strongly because it is at the heart of the city, 5 minutes walk to Temple Bar, Dublin Castle and O'Connell Street.
The owners, even if we didn't met them, we just called each other and the guys were fantastic.
If you search for a cheap, modern and clean Apparment in the best Location possible please give the guys a message or a call.
You won't regret it!
The location is good , it is quiet and next to the tube. Also we had our own balcony. We got everything we needed like iron , hair dryer , even morning breakfast! Id recommend

Riham was especially helpful to us by extending check in times due to our very late arrival.  This was really appreciated but it also meant we had little personal interaction which was unfortunate.  But Riham's place was exactly as presented on line and we had no surprises and were made welcome to help ourselves to whatever was available.  All in all, a very positive experience for us.  Thanks Riham!  Kirby & Lynnette

The Place: sparkling clean, extremely comfortable, provided amenities and toiletries, quiet and peaceful, although we rented a room Riham was not there and it felt as if the entire place was just for us. 
Communication: although Riham was not there during our stay, her and her friend were 100% responsive when we contacted them and had questions. There was no delay and we never had a problem or were left waiting. 
The location: I would make sure you know the public transportation very well as it can get expensive. Also, make sure you don't depend on one bus stop, there are others whiting walking distance. Make sure your flights are during the day during holidays (Irish are very catholic and keep certain days from working). Nevertheless, it is well connected with multiple bus stops around and the train. And, if you don't mind, you actually get to see the outskirts of Dublin. 
Overall, our experience was great and we definitely recommend the place.
Belle chambre spacieuse
Very good

I had requested for an early check-in to which Riham readily agreed. She personally welcomed us into her home. Clean house and bathroom, wifi, kitchen access is what I wanted and got. She has a very cute six year old boy who has many toys and willingly shared those with my little daughter. It was very sweet. The bus stop and train station are just within a minutes walk. Riham also prepared dinner for us when she got to know that it was our first day of fasting for Ramadan. May almighty bless her family.

We stayed with Riham for 10 days and she was very friendly and kind. Her place was cozy and clean, and she even offered complimentary breakfast every morning. Her place, though a little out of the city, is located near many bus tops and a train station, which is convenient. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay.

Clean ,tidy and also perfect location.
The bus to city center just right in front of the building. Riham is a really good host. The water pipe in the toilet was accidentally broken but she fixed it without taking too long time. Perfect place to stay in Dublin.

Exactly as described. Basic room in an apartment with own bathroom (not en-suite). Very easy to train/bus. Took bus directly into the tourist area of the city center within 30 minutes. Easy to find and check in. Great value for a city with hostel beds going for over 50 USD each.

Riham is an excellent host, very friendly and helpful. The apartment was absolutely pristine and the room and bed were lovely and comfortable. Check-in was extremely convenient. Ideal location. I'd highly recommend Riham's place!
Riham was very accommodating and willing to work with me on my late booking and check in! Room was very clean and comfortable.
Absolutamente recomendable.  Todo facilidades.  Gran anfitriona.
Very clean, quick responses. Good location.

Fairly basic, but worth the price.
Comfortable bed....quiet at night....continental breakfast.
Private bathroom was nice....good shower.
Good location....we had a car, but bus and train into Dublin very close by.
All in all, good value in an expensive city.

It was perfect staying at Riham house. A comfortable room with free access to the kitchen its amenities. A bit far from the city centre but there is a train station in from of the condo. I home come back soon.

Excellent Airbnb. The apartment was clean, comfortable, and fit the description exactly. Riham was very kind and helpful throughout our stay. The bus stop was right next to the apartment building and transportation was easy to use. Definitely recommend staying here!

Such an amazing location and apartment!! Yvonne was so friendly and helpful. She picked us up from the airport and we were a bit delayed and had trouble with our luggages in the airport and she waited for us at the airport for over an hour. She showed us where to catch the train and bus and even wrote down the schedule for us. 10/10 recommend if you are looking for a location near the airport and for a friendly and very accommodating stay!
Extremely friendly host, gave us information about the city, and picked us up from the airport! Made our stay in Dublin very enjoyable.

Yvonne was a gracious host and made sure we felt comfortable. 
Sharing such a small space and being on our own vacation schedule, we tried hard to make sure that we didnt make noise when we came in or out. 
The beds were extremely uncomfortable, but it's a good place if you're only looking to sleep for a night. 
Plus its located right next to a diner and restaurant if you're tired and dont want to travel far or cook.

Yvonne was a fabulous host.  She picked me up from the airport and drove me there when it was time to leave.  The location is right next to the DART station so it's easy to get into town.  There is a pharmacy and convenience store as well as a few restaurants within a 5 minute walk.  I had tons of privacy and anything I needed was readily provided by Yvonne.  I had to pad my bed to make it more comfortable after the first night but afterwards, I spent the next 9 nights sleeping like a baby.  I would stay here again.

Yvonne war sehr nett und hat uns geholfen, ihre Mutter war auch sehr freundlich, als sie zu Besuch war. Die Stadtanbindung ist auch in Ordnung, unser Aufenhalt hat uns gut gefallen. Yvonne ist eine sehr freundliche Frau.

Yvonne is a very friendly person. We even met her mother. They both are great fun. We just needed a place close by the airport to stay before we left early during the night. We were very happy to be able to stay.
Lovely apartment, very well located, nearby DART station and airport.
We had a very pleasant stay! Great part of Dublin to stay in! Yvonne was quick to respond and helpful.

Yvonne was a friendly host, and it was wonderful that she offered to pick us up and take us to the airport for less than the cost of a cab ride! We appreciated the breakfasts, and her place is near a couple of little restaurant and right next to an affordable take-away spot. The part near her home is also lovely! Super easy to get into Dublin via bus (stops outside her building) or DART (very quick walk to station from her place).

It's an amazing location, the bus stops in front of the building and comes every 10-15mins, takes you right to Dublin. The train is barely 5 minutes away and can take you all over Ireland. Yvonne (and her mother Bernie whom we met during check-in) we're very helpful and made sure we had everything we needed. It was nice to be able to have breakfast every morning before we left, it saved us money and time for sure. Definitely a great place if you're looking for a bed to sleep in between days of activity and exploring. The apartment was clean and I felt comfortable leaving my things there while we ere out, use of the kitchen was wonderful and there were places nearby to grab food if needed. Highly recommend, would absolutely stay here again!

We couldn't wish for more! Such a wonderful hospitality - cozy room, warm beds, great showers and easy reachable place. Yvonne is an amazing cook, so she prepared us divine vegetarian 3-course dinner. We are so lucky we could stay there for two nights. Highly recommend her to other travelers. :)
Yvonne is a nice host. Her place is very close to the airport. Thx for everything!
Nice room and great breakfast!
It was a very convenient location from airport.
We never  made it to Yvonnes because she changed the check in to 7pm and never communicated to me or Airbnb after that. As a result, Airbnb cancelled the stay

We had a great stay at Yvonne's, who greeted us with tea on arrival. A nice breakfast was also served. The room was simple, but nice. Perfect for public transport connections into Dublin and Malahide and free parking in the area. 20 minute drive to the airport.
Cute two bed room and a very friendly host. We could absolutely recommend this place. :)
Located very convenient to DART station
Nice clean room, close to DART station and good value :)
Good location to Airport. Value for money with breakfast included.
It was great
Lovely apartment with great transport links to Dublin centre.
Perfect stay, easy to get there. Close to the city without the crowds. Yvonne was a great host.
Yyonne really nice person and met us really nice. Really good location and kitchen, she gave us a lot of food, is really nice. We had booking at last moment so she safeD us!
Very functionnal , location great with bus transportation ! And SUPER host !!! We felt really welcomed !!!

Yvonne will definitely try to accommodate your arrival/ departure time!
Yvonne's place is clean tidy and cosy, the bus that gets you within 15-20 minutes into city center stops opposite the house and is 3.30 one way.
There is a "last of us experience" (the game) if you like spooky half abandoned buildings (the park and right doesn't exist anymore but the car park does, it is hardly used and gives quite en eerie feeling, we somewhat walked in as we were looking for info on the park and ride - the elevator down worked, back up we had to find a non barricaded staircase - it honestly is a setting like in a zombie game).
However, you can use the boring parking :D park on street without charge.
It is a nice safe neighbourhood.
We had a splendid stay and would recommend it, if you aren't just in town to party as the last bus returns 11:30, but there is always taxis.

Tip: if you can avoid driving in Dublin, the street layout with bus lanes and co are on a different level.
Great place to stay.  It was easy to get to the city center, and it was a nice place to come back to after a busy day.
A very tidy house and very hospitable and helpful host. Great value in a handy location
As expected

A friend and I stayed with Yvonne for about a week and couldn`t have been wishing for a better housing for our trip to Dublin. 
Our flight was delayed so that we were arriving late at night, but Yvonne was so kind to pick us up from the airport even tho she had to work early the next day. 
The room was cosy and everything you could be needing was provided. The breakfast was more than we could have hoped for, with her providing different cereals, bread, spreads, marmelade and more. 
You need about 20-40 min. to dublin city center if you choose to go by public transportation, but there is a direkt route so that you don`t have to change busses or trains. 
Yvonne herself is a kind and attentive host, and always availabe for questions or anything else. 
We enjoyed our stay quite much and would recommend it to anyone.
Yvonne was amazing from initial contact to checking out, she was informative, hospitable, and friendly at all times, great experience, would highly recommend this bnb for future travelers

An ideal location as its not too far from the airport. Just make sure you specify the address carefully to your taxi driver as he misunderstood us and dropped us off at the wrong address haha. 

Took us a while to settle in and get to know the area as it was our first time abroad, but a neighbour in the area was very kind and showed us on the bus to the city centre.

Yvonne arranges your breakfast all ready for you in the morning after your first night which is a lovely touch. Plus she was a legend dropping us off at the airport too :)
Great host altogether !

Strongly recommended. We spent great time at Yvonnes place 
She is very nice and kind
I had a great stay and I would recommend!!
Very clean and cosy space, Yvonne was welcoming and helpful. It's in a good location for the airport and going into Dublin centre.
Such a lovely host, caring and really kind, complimentary breakfast was amazing!
We had a wonderful time there, the apartment was perfect for us and near city centre!

aspectos positivos: 
el casero te resuelve rapidamente los problemas que te surjan
a pesar de estar lejos del centro, tiene buena comunicacion por bus
calefaccion perfecta
agua caliente de la ducha perfecta

aspectos negativos
colchon incomodo
a veces ruidoso por la cercania del tren
en general sucio, las sabanas estaban manchadas, no las habian cambiado. mobiliario con mal aspecto en general y no alcanza bajo mi punto de vista un nivel minimo de limpieza para sentirse agusto, yo tambien he alquilado mi alojamiento en airbnb y dejo mi piso impecable para el nuevo que venga

The studio was perfect for our weekend stay, we walked everywhere, no need to take a bus, a train station to go to Howth is also nearby as well as a 24h bus to the airport (we took it in the middle of a night and it was a bit ahead of the schedule so it's better to go there a few minutes earlier). We didn't meet Rose and Brendan but they replied quickly to my messages and self check-in was really convenient because we didn't have to plan the time of arrival.
Quick response and great location
Everything was clean and comfortable. The studio is near the airport and the city centre. I totally recommend this Airbnb, thanks a lot Rose and Brendan :)

Rose & Brendan are very organized and make sure to give you all the information you need to get safely at the studio.
We had to call them to ask question and they were very responsive.

The studio location is very convenient: close enough to the city center but quiet enough to get some sleep, which is perfect.
What a gem of a place! Clean and cosy! Rose and Brendan were fantastic :)

Very close to City centre with easy access by public transport as bus stop a short walking distance away.
Free street parking as long as you can get a spot close by.
Comfortable bed
Basic facilities but all that is needed if all you wanted was a place to stay and spend time exploring the city.
Wifi
Super sauber und freundlich!
Very nice apartment. Small but with everything we needed. We enjoyed our stay and should I come back to dublin I will contact Rose and Brendan again
The place is quiet and you can walk to the centre. It's a bit tinier than expected but served the purpose. There is also a little shop down the street where you can buy some food.
The space is comfortable, very well located.  Public transportation os very close, although it is easy to do everything walking.

These hosts really go above and beyond, not to mention the room is furnished with everything we needed on our trip to Dublin. Got to save some money by cooling a few meals at the place. I would recommend this place to anyone.

It's great if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room.  There's no TV or sofa, but there is good wifi.  The location is near public transport, but we just walked everywhere.  There's some parts of town getting to the main area that are less than picturesque, but it was fine.  We took a cab a couple times when we got caught in a storm and it wasn't much money.  There's a little kitchenette which was wonderful to have with a grocer nearby, because by the end of our trip (we drove through the country ending in Dublin) we were absolutely sick of eating at restaurants.

The flat was very cosy and we a great Time in Dublin. Very close to the flat is a stadium , where you can go to a Hurling match if you are lucky. We really liked the idea of storing the keys in a safe outside the house . That way, you can arrive at any time.
The place is also great if you want to catch an early bus to the airport. It takes only 20 minutes.
The space was a tad small but sufficed!

The accomodation is the perfect place to stay in Dublin.
 It has everything you need like a hairdryer, shampoo, a comfortable bed to sleep, towels and kitchen stuff. The check-in was very easy.
You only need 10 minutes by bus to the city centre (2,15‚Ç¨ single ticket), 3 minutes to the next shop und 5 minutes to the rail and bus station. It was great!
This was a perfect place in a great location. 20 minutes walking to the heart of the City Centre and very close to markets. Room was cozy and private.

Great and accommodating hosts. Responding very quickly to any questions. 
The location is great too, especially if you like walking and seeing parts of a city that are not only very central.
