The bedroom was comfortable, cozy, and clean and we really appreciated the additional amenities included, such as shower supplies and the hot pot, coffee/tea. Sandy was a gracious welcoming host, with lots of information for visitors. She was very responsive, and accommodating to our requests. Overall a 5 star stay, and one of our favorite air bnbs to date. Future travelers, take a day to explore Howth if possible, the cliff walk is beautiful! Thanks again Sandy!

The house is lovely, clean and located close to the coast. Its easy to get to Howth. 
If you dont have time to spare take a taxi. The bus rout is beautiful but it takes some time from the airport.

Sandy was an amazing host. The communication was always very quick and she was very cooperative with our early check in and out! The place is very clean, she cleans the bathroom every day (there is a rain shower!). The bed is sooooo comfortable, very soft and just perfect after a busy day of walking around. The location is about 5mins from the Dart station from which you can get everywhere (25mins to Dublin). Also, if you want to explore Howth; its just 8 train minutes away! We really enjoyed our stay and the short daily banter we had with Sandy. Thank you!

Nice place to explore Dublin. Near to the trainstation from where you can get to Dublin in about 20min. The room was very clean and the bed was confortable. On top Sandy gave us towels and hygiene products to use. Thank you that for Sandy ;) 
We would definitely recommend this place and are looking forward to our next jurney to Ireland.
Sandy war eine super Gastgeberin. Immer wieder gerne.
Great stay, room perfect, great location - 5 min walk to Bayside DART station and 20 mins into the city, ample parking available around the house.

Had a great stay! Sandy's place is clean, quiet, and easily accessible by public transport about 20 minutes from Dublin's center. Very much recommend checking out Howth (a nearby fishing village with a nice seaside walk) while you're here as well.

We loved this place in Dublin! The location was great. We were within easy 3-10 minute walking distance to buses and green line tram (Cabra Luas), both of which took us to city centre quickly. The kids (11 & 14) loved the backyard trampoline. And they loved having their own rooms. We were able to use the washer and dryer, which was very helpful.

The Ruth's house town is really good situated in a quiet place close to shops, bakery, cafes... We really appreciate Cabra.
You can take buses or tramway to go to the City center of Dublin in 15 minutes.
We really enjoyed our stay here.
Dublin is a fabulous city!
Ruth is a great host, really helpful . And her house is perfect for a family of 2 or 3 kids.
My kids love your trampoline !
And as she is pets friendly, our dog (yorkshire) has discovered Dublin with us!! thank you so much for him!
Great family home in central Dublin. Ruth is a great host, very responsive and helpful.

We had a very nice time at Ruth and Colins house. The place is bright and very nicely decorated, the neighbourhood is friendly. Also it is only about a 5min walk to the tramway that take you to trinity station. We had the chance to meet Colin and the kids, that are adorable!
We had a great time. Definitely a bit of a walk into city centre, but we did it with two small kids and were just fine.
Great access to the airport and Dublin attractions. Ruth was very good at communicating details and making sure everything was ok once we arrived.

The house is in a nice, friendly neighborhood.  It was slightly farther away from the city center than I expected but once I discovered the local tram system, it was only a 5-10 minute ride.  I would recommend this place

We had a lovely stay here! The house is wonderful and we loved the bakery nearby! Its fairly easy to get to the Dublin centre and the area is quiet and nice. Ruth was very welcoming and responsive, she left a freshly baked bread and homemade jam for us. Such a pleasure to stay here!

Ruths place is bright and welcoming. We went in to Dublin by taxi which cost about 12 Euros. Ruth left some bread and homemade Jam on the table and put fresh flowers about the house which was lovely. We didnt have children with us but if we did I dont think they would have wanted to leave the house with a trampoline in the garden, Netflix and gaming consoles etc. The price was great and This was a trouble free booking. Ruth was a fabulous host.

Loved this place! It's a bright and stylish family home with lots of nice touches - and a great location in terms of local amenities and quick access to the city centre. Plus, Ruth couldn't have been more helpful in the run up to my stay. Recommend!
Very friendly host, always happy to share good tips in the region!
Imelda made us very welcome perfect host and accommodated us with our request for Gluten free bread.

We had a wonderful stay at Imeldas home. I was a bit worried about staying outside of the city, but there is a bus stop and a train station close by. Imelda provided us with recommendations for apps to download to get around easier and we had no issues at all. Imelda was quick to respond to messages and questions we had, and the check in process was very easy. Our room was clean and had extra towels, toiletries and plug adaptors for us to use. A lovely breakfast was provided to us during our stay which was greatly appreciated. Thank you so much Imelda for being so kind and friendly. I wish we wouldve had the chance to talk more!
Bring your own shower soap and ask about how breakfast workd
We had a really nice stay at Imelda's house. She was friendly and helpful, quick to respond to questions/messages. Very comfortable beds!

Imeldas home is lovely and it was privilege to stay there for the short time that we did. Shes a wonderful person and made our experience there amazing! Definitely a super host, no doubt. You wont be disappointed with your stay there! Also it is easy to catch buses from her home as well, so it is in a great location! Not too far from the bus stop nor the train station which makes it easy to get to the lovely coastal town of Howth and city center as well!
Imelda is a very kind person.  I recommend you to stay in her house. Moreover, public transportations are very close.

I really recommend it as a good place for staying outside the city centre. the beds were incredibly confortable and Imelda offers a very good breakfast! She even had the kindness of making a bag of snacks for us since we were leaving very early! The bathroom was shared with other guests and there was no big deal about it, however there were a limit-hour of 21h in the evening for taking a shower (because of the noise it makes), and that is something to consider if you want to hang out all day in Dublin and get back late craving for a shower - that's not possible there. Overall, a confortable stay with a very good price for Dublin!
Alles bestens!
Imelda is a super host, house is lovely and warm and clean also. Imelda is there if you need her and very happy to help.

We arrived early in the morning and Imelda was very flexible for us to check in early. This is a great location if you're going to be in Dublin. Transportation is great from here, buses or train is 10-15 minutes away walking. Make sure to use the leap visitors card if you will use public transportation inside Dublin
Excellent hospitality!!! Thank you!!

Imeldas place we found great because we could securely park and leave our car. Easy transport to the city. Doesnt take long. Comfortable and clean bedrooms and bathroom.  Imelda gave us good instructions to get around. Great host.

Imelda is a very kind and friendly host. She makes the best of your stay and will help you whenever needed.
Shes very good and fast with responding to messages. 
The room is very nice and quiet and has everything needed for a nice visit to Dublin.
My stay here was amazing! A great place to stay for a visit to Dublin

we had a good time.
The house and the room are well. equipped, very clean and comfortable.
Imelda is a very good host
The city center is good to reach.
- thanks!

We had a really nice stay in Imeldas place. The room and common areas were spotless. There were everyhting we need. Breakfast was waiting for us on the table when we got to the kitchen in the morning. She is such a nice and kind lady, we really enjoyed our small chats with her during our breakfast! 
The only thing we were not happy with was the location of the house. It was close to the airport but there were no direct transport, so if you dont take a taxi, you need to go to the city centre to go to the airport. For the city centre, DART and bus station was very close but their service wasnt so frequent. It takes 10 minutes to get the city centre by dart, however, one day we waited for 40 minutes to get on the train (maybe just because it was on sunday). Apart from that, the place was great! 
Thank you for being such a great host Imelda!
Great value for money accommodation
Imelda is a great host and she ensures her home is a home from home for her guests

Imelda had very quick responses and was ready to help with any of our queries. Her place was very clean, comfortable and was close to bus stations; buses take about 20 minutes to the city centre. Overall, it was worth it for the price.

This is a great place and she has thought of everything including an adapter for travelers in a little goodie basket if you forget anything in addition to shampoo etc. The breakfast was awesome and had so many choices. Your plate setting was set up for you so nice. There is a shared bathroom but be aware you may be sharing with up to 4 other guests in two other bedrooms. It was sparkling clean and I didnt mind expect the constant traffic in and out. The floor boards and stairs are very very loud and I could hear everything going on in both rooms. Not all guests are loud but there was a lot of noise with shutting doors, talking, coughing, and going in and out. So bring earplugs or headphones if you are a light sleeper for sure. Imelda was so kind and asked how I slept and always offered me and chatted for a few minutes. The bus to town takes about 20 min and was explained very well. Lots of information is available in rooms and kitchen. There is also bull island close by for a bit different experience than downtown Dublin.
Very friendly host, very clean rooms, nice breakfast. We enjoyed our stay and will come again next time staying in Ireland.
Imelda was great! She was there to greet us when we arrived and helped us feel at home. Imelda was extremely helpful with tips to get around the city and great places to eat.
Fabulous place that's sparkling clean with a helpful host who has thought of everything. Definitely would stay again :)
Well kept place with an organized and diligent host.

A great find! Imelda's place is lovely and an easy bus or train journey into Dublin city centre. Imelda is a great host, very welcoming and friendly. A good breakfast was provided and she also provided lots of useful information and a basket full of toiletries in case you'd forgotten something which is a thoughtful touch. We had a great stay here and would recommend Imelda's place to anyone travelling to Dublin.
Very nice stay at Imelda ¬¥s house. The house is cosy and very well located. Imelda is very caring and reactive. She will make your stay very appreciable. I highly recommend Imelda as host.
Imelda is a great host and I would definitely look to stay again if I were to come back to Ireland for travel!

Imelda is a friendly and welcoming host. The twin room was bright and airy,  spacious and very comfortable for the two of us. Bathroom was shared with other guests during our stay without any issues. The daily breakfast provisions provided are a lovely touch. We felt very much at home. Location was great for exploring Dublin city and returning to a quiet neighborhood at the end of the day.

Very clean and comfortable. Imelda is very fast to help you in any way. Answers in a flash. Very easy to get in and out of Dublin.
Thanks!

I dont feel this location is the best.  I didnt think it was close to the city or the airport.  Its a nice quiet area and if youre a runner - there is a park down the street to have a run around the track.

So in summary:  bathroom sharing is not the best.
The walls are thin - there are 3 guest bedrooms upstairs and you can hear everything from their beep on their phone, coughing, snoring, and when they come in at night.
Lovely and homely accommodation near Dublin city centre with a clean, cosy room. The host, Imelda, is a bubbly and helpful woman who makes you feel at home!
Had a lovely time. Thanks again.

This was our first Airbnb experience, and it couldnt of been better. Imelda takes pride in genuinely being a super host, thinking about what she would want as a guest and then offering it to those who come to her home. As well, she tunes in to her guests particular needs, in our case COFFEE !! For us we appreciated the continental breakfast that was an offer every day before we headed out. It was basic but with some variety of cereals toast and  buns. And coffee!
Imeldas response time is amazing, uncanny and we need more stars available to properly rate it!! We had an issue with trying to order takeout and we were sorry to bother her as it was in the evening. Didnt know what else to do.  the moment I sent a e-note to her I could hear her step upon the stair coming up to help us,  and cheerfully. Imeldas communications are clear and to the point and shes also a witty and warm person,  the quintessential Irish hostess! We enjoyed chatting with her.
The room is much cuter than the picture shows, with big windows and nice decor.  There is good storage so that the room is not cluttered when youre there with your luggage. The location requires some walking to get to transport, which as middle aged but healthy types we were fine with,  but If you have a significant mobility issues, maybe not for you as well as the room being on the second floor.

Things I loved:
-Great friendly host who was super kind and sweet from the moment I arrived
-Low cost 
-Room with a lock on the door, and a basket of items in case I forgot things like shampoo or toothpaste
-Quick and easy communication
-Near the airport

Things I didnt like:
-Not being told I wasnt the only person staying there during my visit.
-People loudly talking in the room next to me until 11pm or later
-Being woken up multiple times each night by people   leaving to go to the airport(2:30 and 4:30 am)
-Finding the bathroom dirty after other people used it, including blood on the toilet seat!!!!! 


Overall:
All in all this place was not what I thought it was. If I had known other rooms were being rented as well I wouldnt have stayed there. Plain and simple. The host was kind and generous, and easy to communicate with ahead of time. I only wish I had been told at some stage that other gusts would also be there as well since it made the house more of a youth hostel style environment that I was not okay with.

Staying here is very warm and comfortable. Feels like home. Imelda is a great host, she has everything you might need or might have forgotten and she let you use it ;) transportation around is good and easy, just better plan ahead your very very :) early plans during weekend as bus on Sundays goes only from 8 am.
Imelda is a great host! Had a lovely time here.
Great  hospitality. Imelda provided tips, as well as all types of luxuries that made the stay much more pleasant than a hotel. Everything was ready, and described accurately.

Micheal and his wife Tula are very welcoming hosts, and I would happily stay with them again.
The room is a single, but the bed is comfortable and the room is very clean. The apartment is in a very nice area, Sandymount, within a few minutes walk of the village, the DART station and the beach. Great value, especially considering that this is one of the most desirable areas of Dublin in which to live. Breakfast (cereal, fruit juice and fruit) being provided is an added bonus.
Friendly, helpful and courteous host. Lots of local knowledge and tips. Great for a bit of a chat.
Really fantastic location in an idyllic seaside neighborhood close to Dublin City Centre. Micheal was very hospitable.
Fabulous hospitality, warm kind people and an awesome location.
Great host, great location and very comfortable. Will definitely be back.

I came over to Ireland on the late ferry, and Micheal's place was perfect for a stopover. It's located perfectly for central Dublin, and Micheal was very hospitable and also very flexible allowing me to arrive late. Would stay there again.

This is a great location for access to central Dublin and to the coast. Nice quiet location but beside a great urban village location (Sandymount) with its restaurants and bars. On-site parking is a great attraction so close to city centre

Michael and his wife were excellent hosts and were overall very nice. Their place is a short walk to the beach and also some good restaurants. It was exactly what I needed for my short stay in Dublin. I definitely recommend staying at their place.
Nice room in this modern flat in a terrific location in Sandymount just outside Dublin City Centre

Easy check with Tula,  and great 
Location
Great hosts I had a great stay
Great location, close to Sandymount village and public transport. Helpful and friendly couple- already have booked with them again!
Second time booking with Micheals and it was a pleasure! Great location and great hospitality!
Lovely hospitality, thoughtful kindness, clean, safe, great parking, excellent location, fast, efficient replies. Highly recommended.
Perfect!
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great beach walks!!
Micheal was a great host, friendly and helpful , lovely apartment it had everything I needed in a great location
Great room near the beach

Michael and Tula's cosy place was ideal for me as I had a work conference in the city centre for 1 night. Their place is close to the city and in a quiet area that close to the beach. The host made it easy for me by meeting with the key. I was made feel most welcome and would highly recommend.

Michael and Tula were wonderful hosts; extremely friendly and very easy going. 

The location is perfect for the Dart, busses and of course the beach for a lovely walk.

I had a cracking sleep and just really enjoyed my time here.

Thanks again Michael and Tula.

Cheers!
Lovely host, great location. Took 5 min to walk to the train.
Good location, good value
Micheal is a wonderful host. He was really polite and very helpful. He even offers a simple and healthy breakfast to the guest which is always very welcomed.
A warm welcome and a pleasant stay.
Michael was a great host, quick and accurate location details. Room was perfect. Great breakfast. Parking was very handy. Would highly recommend and hopefully I can stay again soon
Exactly as described. Lovely people. Great location.
Pleasant host. Reasonably priced accommodation.

Overall my stay was fine. John's wife welcomed us and was very kind. She bought us bread and milk and was very kind to show us all the best spots in Dublin on a map that she annotated. The apartment is a bit of a walk from the main tourist attractions but it's a great little neighbor with a park nearby. Good restaurant options a 5 minute walk away and very close to the bus stop. On the downside, the place is moldy, especially the bathroom. I felt nervous to walk bare foot in the bathroom. It's very bare bones and small because it's not really a real apartment but rather an old closet or something transformed into an Airbnb. The only source of heat (which is essential in the winter when I visited) was an electric heater, which was not the best. During my stay the WiFi ran out, since it was a hotspot rather than a box. Unfortunately, it was impossible for John to give me a new one since the hotspot ran out at night on our second/last day. This place is a decent option for the budget traveler since it's the cheapest Airbnb available and cheaper than some hostels.

John was a great host. Hell help you out with any questions or requests you may have. He was very accommodating. The place is about an hour walk to the Guinness factory and about 45 to the temple bar. Not bad but not super close so keep that in mind. Overall, would stay again!

We were greeted at check-in and got suggestions on what to see - although it is very easy to use public transport from the place into town, we walked all days with no problem, since it takes maximum 30 minutes. The best tip we got was to take one day out of Dublin to visit the seaside.

John was an amazing host, he was quick to respond, and we had a great welcome chat with him. He gave us loads of local tips and ideas on stuff to see and do, he was quite the guide to be honest. 

The place was neat and just what we needed. He gave us breakfast and every morning we would walk to downtown Dublin, which is nice and close by.

The only negative thing I have to say is that the hot water ran out pretty quickly, but we got used to it.

Johns place was conveniently located at the best spot between downtown and being able to easily get to the airport. Would highly recommend for any stay, but certainly even more if you are coming from our going to the airport the day of your stay.
John has a great place!

The host was very nice offering us a lift to the city center by car, also they explained us the way for going to the best places and the studio. The location is good because you can go by feet to the city centre in 30 min, BUT the apparment looks bigger in the pictures and it is really dump so the smell is disgusting inside.
John very friendly made us very welcome and told us some places to check out around Dublin what we didn't know about
John is a perfect host. On arrival he greeted us and gave us tips. The room is ideal for two.  The property is 25 minutes away from the center.  We recommend!
John was very nice in giving suggestions about visiting the city and he had maps for us to use. He was available for us to contact him at any time, very kind.
Great!
Simple, convenient stay at John's. Close enough to city centre and plenty of public transport options. With an extremely jet-lagged baby (and parents) John's house provided all we needed. Cheers
Nice and clean accommodation, great communication.
John is a great host. He waited for us and assisted with the bags. He had maps and suggestions ready. John is a host eager to please.

John was incredibly welcoming and helpful. Upon arrival, John gave us a map of the city and recommendations for pubs and attractions to see. Even better, he drove us to the Spire so we didnt have to walk the entire way. The room worked well for three students staying for one night, but was definitely a bit cramped for all three of us.
John was extremely nice and welcoming, there was coffee and other small things that made the stay good.
The room was perfect for our one night trip to Dublin, everything was as described and John was great to keep in touch with any queries we had.
Near the airport, good to find, very clean. John gives very good information. Very friendly....
The apartment is close to City centre. We parked our car by the apartment and walked to the city. John had a lot of good information about Dublin, which we used alot.
Great place to stay! Would stay again

John gave great recommendations about what to see and do and where to eat for dinner in Dublin. He also brought over a few things for us to have in the morning for breakfast, which was greatly appreciated!
Situated perfectly. John is a wonderful man.
The room is nice and clean and everything you need is inside. John is helpful and easy to reach for arrival and departure.
John is a great host. The place is basic. Good spot if youre there for a match at Crome Park and easy access to lots to eat and see.

John was very kind and gave us very good recommendations. He even offered to let us stay an extra day, as a result of nobody booking it that day. He had some breakfast for us, and the location was great.
John is a wonderful host. Kind, thoughtful, great communicator. Recommend anytime!
We had a very nice stay at John's appartement!
Good for a short stay.
Worth it!
Great spot, close to things via walking, plenty of parking when I stayed.

Really appreciated the fact that John let us check in at late hours and check out really early in the morning because of our flights. Also, you will  find a Europe to UK adapter.

Great location, 10-15 mins from Dublins city center if you go by bus. Approx. 35 mins on foot. Drumcondra is really pretty.

For a short 2 night stay, the studio is relatively ok considering  its price. It depends on how pretentious you are.

Even though the listing doesnt state anything thats false, these are some things I didnt like.

The shower base was pretty dirty. The showers curtain was also dirty with signs of mold.
We had to ask for Wi-Fi. We had working Wi-Fi 2 days later. The space is way smaller than  it looks like in the photos. Theres no window or working ventilation in the bathroom. The butter and one of the jam jars were already eaten from. Not really willing to eat after strangers. More towel hangers would be useful.
John was great. Very personable and flexible! Wifi was down which was unfortunate as that was our only way to communicate with our families. Good for the value.
Comfortable and quiet overnight stay for two in the back flat. Quite close to ferry port. Older style and fittings but clean and just a few stairs.

John is a great host.
He is very accommodating and helped us out a lot. He replied quickly and gave us useful tips
 It was a great stay.
Small touches that make the difference for travellers - coffee, bread, hairdryer. Very clean.
Nice place, John was very easy to get a hold of and the location is very good
Very basic, good location, clean linen, place very tired and could do with a total make over.

Als je hier twee nachtjes verblijft, is dat prima te doen. Langer vind ik niet aan te raden.
De bushalte is inderdaad vlakbij, maar zorg dat je dan de juiste kaart koopt (de hop on hop off bus en de airlink stopt niet aan het einde van de straat).
Er was weinig voor ontbijt maar John ging speciaal voor ons wat kopen. 
In vorige recensies staat wat over vochtigheid en een nare lucht. Wij hadden daar geen last van maar dat kan ook komen omdat het prachtig weer was. 
Het tweepersoonsbed ligt prima, maar het eenpersoonsbed is alleen geschikt voor een  kind (dun matras).
John was a wonderful host - he had maps for us and great information about the city. He was welcoming, and there was fresh milk and breakfast foods for us. Highly recommend.
The profile is very accurate. Had a great stay.
Very close to public transportation to city center and airport. John was very responsive and helpful with local sights and things to do!
John's studio flat is simply, but tiny and clean. We could reach the center of Dublin by walk. John is very kind and helpful man.
The bus to downtown (120) is right outside the house. The house is nice and clean, but the pictures could be updated. And not all amenities are functioning.

Staying at Catherine's was great! The house is cosy and perfectly sized for our party of four adults and three kids. We loved having the garden with the trampoline for the kids and for a glass of wine before bedtime. The house is situated close to both the tram and bus and even works for a walk to town.
Catherine is a wonderful, thoughtful host and quickly answered all questions we had during the stay.

Our experience with Catherine's house was extremely positive. 
Catherine was very friendly and helpful, yet not intrusive. She greeted us at our arrival and she even let us find what was needed for breakfast. She also gave us lots of tips and useful practical advices (restaurants, places to see, transport and so on). 
The house is very comfortable and matched all our expectations. It is located in a quiet, residential neighbor, yet easily connected with the city center by bus (the bus stop is just a few steps away), tram or train. 
I strongly recommend Catherine's house for a pleasant stay in Dublin.
Catherine is a beautiful person and her home is great if you want to feel a home away from home x

James's place is a great place to stay! Our few nights here were comfortable and enjoyable! James's hospitality and location made our trip in Dublin fantastic. Highly recommend his place to anyone near Dublin's center.

We had a great stay with James. He was very accommodating and extremely helpful! His apartment is 10-15 min walk to the centre of town and is a good value in the city. Definitely recommend staying at James'.

James is a super friendly host, easy to communicate and happy to give you advice on what to do. The bed might be a bit small to fit two people comfortably for longer stays but for the two nights we were there it was just fine.

Jamess stylish and cozy Dublin home is made even better by the wonderful hospitality you receive - fantastic local recommendations, and a warm welcome after a long day exploring! We really appreciated Jamess and his housemates friendliness and the genuine and relaxed atmosphere they have created. We would not hesitate to recommend staying here!

The location is very comfortable and quiet.
James is very nice and discreet.
He will help you if needed.
James was a fantastic host who made us feel very at home in his beautiful house. He gave us great recommendations and the breakfast was delicious. Would highly recommend this place!
Great location for walking and access to transit. Parking was 100% trouble-free and it was nice to get a head start with breakfast.

Had a great weekend staying at James' home. The place is very stylish and James and Colm were very welcoming. Their tips about the area were so useful.

Be sure to check out the cafe, it has great atmosphere and tasty coffee.
If you're staying anywhere in Dublin - you simply can't go wrong staying at James' place. Attention to detail, great hospitality and help are clearly his trademarks.

A lovely place to stay while in Dublin! James is quick to respond, and his house is a really cool space. Breakfast was set up each morning, and he gave us some great recommendations. Street is a little noisy outside, even with the window closed (tram going by, etc) - not a problem for us but could be if you're a very light sleeper. Bathroom was shared but we didn't have any issues. Very clean. 5/5!
James is a great host. Good location.
James is a great host. His room is as described and his home is lovely. The breakfast provided was delicious and generous. Thanks James!

James is a fantastic host with an amazing home. We felt very welcome and looked after.
The location is great - very close to Temple Bar area. Would happily recommend to anyone going to Dublin
Very handy for the city centre and comfortable

Great space, great generous breakfasts & lively personalities.
Close to a bus stop & tram.
Very helpful with local tips & suggestions.
Only a double bed so a little small but still manageable & comfy.
James is a thoughtful, meticulous host. Everything works smoothly and our entire experience was lovely. Cannot recommend highly enough.
Nice appartement at 15-20min from Temple Bar. Breakfast ok.

James was an literal life saver for us. We booked another Airbnb, which let us down on the day I flew to Dublin. James answered my call for help as fast as lightning and invited us to stay with him. Thank you again for saving us that day!!

If you want to have an great time in Dublin, with a place to come home to and relax, choose this apartment! James and Alan will have everything ready for you, including a yummi breakfast! They are wonderful and kind people and great hosts!

James's home is absolutely beautiful, but also really welcoming and cosy. There are some great touches for guests such as a breakfast bar laid out with a continental breakfast, including delicious scones from the cafe downstairs, and a map of interesting places to visit. The location is fantastic as well, just 10 - 15 minutes walk from shopping on Parnell and O'Connell Streets. Don't forget to visit Jay's Cafe on the ground floor of the building for delicious food and a really warm welcome.
We had a great time staying at James's place.  It was very clean and had lots of charm.  The apartment is a 15 minute walk to the Temple Bar area.  Very convenient!

I really enjoyed my stay at Jimmys place. Such a beautiful home located in a quiet street but easily accessible from the city centre. Although James was out of town, I received the warmest hospitality from his housemate Alan who was just an amazing person. Its a huge house but I never felt like I was away from home. Having being on my own for about two weeks it sure felt nice to just unwind and chill. 
Thanks for stocking up the fridge. 
PS: I never needed lunch after the breakfast that was provided.

James' location is absolutely wonderful. It's in a great location that is just a 12 or so minute walk from the city center, making sightseeing all major sights a breeze. Plus, it's not everyday you have the opportunity to stay in a period home--much less one with modernized amenities that still retain its original charm. James has used his sharp expertise as an architect to turn his space into an amazing place to stay.

There were many touches that made us feel all the more welcome, including a personalized print-out containing information about our stay, and a self-made guide that shows his local recommendations. For us, he left out some basic provisions we could use to make our own breakfast, but there is also a great cafe connected downstairs. Highly recommended!

I had high expectations coming in because of all of the sparkling reviews, but I can with confidence say the stay exceeded those expectations. Do not hesitate to book here.

Make it a point to get Jays to-do list and check as many of the spots as you can, and also take advantage of Jays cafe being downstairs for your morning coffee or afternoon pick-me-up. Great location, and everything more or less is within walking distance. We didnt use transport at all. Cheers!
The location of the accomodation was perfect, James was really kind and helpful:)

Our stay at James's place was amazing! The house is in a quiet but central road, really close to the LUAS green line and to the city centre itself (about 10 min walking). There is also a nice bar just next to the main door; the owner is super nice and gave us tips for our stay. The room was super clean and endowed with everything one needs. Although we met James quickly only on our arrival, he provided us with really interesting suggestions for things to do in Dublin. Overall, we had a really pleasant experience at James's place, and we would definitely recommend his place to other travellers!
A great place in a great location!  Very clean and lacked nothing!  Worth it!
Best place to stay! Cozy and beautifull! Best location, you can go by Walking everywhere! The host is very kind and helpfull!

Simons house is beautifully decorated and a pleasure to stay in! Would definitely recommend it! A perfect distance from the centre to allow you to experience the real Dublin but also easily access all of the tourist attractions. Simon is a great host and was very responsive, getting someone over to help us when we struggled with the oven straight away. Thank you!
The flat was very clean, comfortable and a great place to stay as we explored Dublin. Simon is super responsive and offered good suggestions and recommendations.

My friends and I stayed and Simons for my partners 30th. We all had a wonderful time. There was 10 of us all together, the house was spacious enough for us all not to be on top of each other and the amenities were wonderful. Simon was very helpful in the run up to the trip and communication whilst we were there was perfect. Location was amazing surrounding area being quiet with only short walk into the city centre. Would highly recommend!!

Simon's place is as beautiful as on the pictures. We felt at home immadietely. We were a group of 7 people and it was enough space for everybody. The big table in the citchen especially was great for breakfast and evening drinks. Simon replied directly when we had any concern.

The house is located in a very nice area with a spar around the corner and nice pubs in walking distance.

It was the perfect choice for our weekend family trip!

Thank you again Simon :)
Simon's place is in a quiet residential area close to the city centre. Check in was smooth and swift and Simon provided us a lot of local tips. We had a wonderful stay in Dublin

I can recommend this house to anyone. Ive just stayed there for my 40th birthday. It is in the perfect location for the centre of Dublin. It is a beautiful well equipped house. Simon the host is very efficient. 100 out of 100. Well done

Simon's apartment was simply perfect. Everything you could wish for and more.
5* rating!
What a great house in a great location!! The kitchen is amazing!

Simon was a fantastic host. His property was fabulous and just as pictured and described. He was so helpful from booking until check out, providing lots of information about the house, the local area, hints and tips, things to do, places to eat etc. He was just really helpful! We will definitely be back to another of Simon's places.
This Airbnb was awesome. Lovely flat....

Great home!!  We have been to Dublin 6 times, and this home is one of the nicest that we have ever stayed in.  It is north of the Liffey, in an area that is less touristy.  There are many great pubs within walking distance.  We walked through the market area which had a lot of fruit and produce stands.  There is also a butcher shop that sells fresh meat and fish.  The large kitchen at the home is perfect if you want to make something at home!!
This a a great house for a group and is a beautiful home from home.
Plenty of room and easy location with taxis.  Only about 15 minutes from most sites

Simons home was absolutely lovely - a large space for 8 of us to stay in with plenty of room. Simon was very quick to respond to any queries we had and gave some useful information about the surrounding area.

The house is so wonderful! We felt at home and comfortable immediately. The house is located within walking distance from many restaurants, take away locations, convenience stores, and the temple bar area (1 mile or so). We greatly enjoyed our time with our family of 8 (including a 6yo and 2yo).

The apartment and its location was perfect for our party of 10 persons.  Simon was a fantastic host, who contributed with suggestions and advice for Dublin, and he was even generous enough to let us store our small mountain of luggage, includning sleeping bags, rain gear and a gigantic ¬´lavvu¬ª (Lappish teepee) in the apartment after checkout because of our late flight home. Thank you very much from all of us:  Family Norlund and family Matte Landgraff

This place is exactly as it looks on the site.  It is lovely and quiet and it is centrally located for your daily excursions around Dublin.  The kitchen provided a great place for us all to gather and talk about day!

Great home: Clean, lots of space, awesome kitchen, comfortable beds and great bathrooms! Very quiet neighborhood for sleeping after long day of international travel. Fabi was great - she showed us the house and was very welcoming on our first day to Ireland. The only thing we would advise is taking an Uber/Taxi to/from town especially with children.
Fantastic home, in a great location, with thoughtful hosts!
Good clean home beautifully furnished. However, the locality seemed a bit shady and  away from all the good restaurants/pubs which are around the city centre.

I loved staying at Simons house.  He was very easy to communicate with.  The house had so many small conveniences and touches that made staying there lovely.  We cooked quite a bit and the kitchen had everything we needed. This was also a very great place to stay with kids. We often walked to the park and Simon had a crib and a high chair which was super helpful.  We did puzzles in the kitchen and everyone looked forward to coming back at the end of a big day.

Simon's place is a fantastic choice. It's about a 15 minute walk into the centre so great location. The house was spotlessly clean and had everything we needed. Simon and our allocated house manager were quick to respond to any questions we had. Would definitely recommend for a group weekend in Dublin.

This was a wonderful home a quick walk from all the great downtown areas in Dublin. The host was over the top helpful to us with excellent tips that made our stay wonderful. Might be our best stay yet at an air bnb.   We would love to visit again.

Simon's home is awesome! There were nine of us here for the weekend celebrating a birthday and meeting up with old friends! There was plenty of space and it felt very homey! The house was clean and ready for us when we arrived! Simon also worked with us so we could check in early because of our early flight! The house is about a 25-30 min walk from the Temple Bar area, but only 10 minutes by cab! Every major spot is about a 5 to 10 minute cab ride! Amazing stay! Thank you!
Simons house was a great home away from home for our girls weekend. Gorgeous house, and great area for nice breakfast places / close to city. Would definitely recommend

The apartment is beautiful and in a nice neighbourhood. Walking distance from the city center if you're not lazy. Simon gave us plenty of information to get around and made sure we had everything we needed. Recommended.

Mary is a great host - chatty, caring, and a charming person as well! The house is really cozy and gives you a feeling you live at home, bedrooms are good and there was never a problem with a bathroom, even though there were several people staying at the house at the same time. Check-in and check out are super easy too!

The area is very nice as well, with many nice restaurants and shops and a trip to a city center is very fast and convenient with a tram. Would highly recommend and would stay again for sure! Thanks Mary for a great stay!

The room is ok and the heater work very well, the bathroom is big with shower. In the kitchen there are fruits and if you want you can prepare coffee and tea. The apartment is in a quiet zone so you can sleep without any problems, but there are pubs and restaurant around. Grafton Street is about 15-20 minutes walk so you can have a nice walk, the bus stop from airport is less than 10 minutes walk. I just saw Mary in the evening when i arrived but she was always ready to reply my questions while i was there, so she is the perfect host. The self check-in is very easy so i could arrive to apartment at 11pm and i didn't have any problem for the check-in, the last day she allow me to leave the apartment in first afternoon. It's a great place to stay. Thanks Mary!!!

I felt very comfortable during my stay in Mary's house. She is a very helpful, friendly Host. It is very central and you can discover a lot in the neighborhood. The room was bright and nice. I highly recommend her House

Cant beat Ranelagh for closeness to Dublin and a wonderful village atmosphere. Everything you need is within steps.  The #1 room I stayed in was on the small side, but the bed was super comfortable, and the bathroom down a few steps was spotless!!  Mary is a lovely host - I only saw her once or twice but she seems kind.  

Buy a Leap card at the SPAR (sp?) and dont forget to touch the pad when you enter and exit the tram.
Takes you into downtown Dublin in under 10 minutes!

Enjoyed this hone and would stay again : )
Amazing location, room, and stay. I would definitely recommend!
Mary is a great host and the place is very clean, cosy and also located just a short walk from the city centre.

The house is very close to the city which is easily accessible by either foot, bus or taxi. Mary is also very helpful and will provide any tips and also mentions some information on a welcoming sheet when you arrive.
Fantastic location,beautiful property and a welcoming host!

The room in Marys house is very clean and the bed sleeps great. You can easy acces the house with a code and own keys. Mary reacts very fast on questions. The house is in a nice area with supermarkets and restaurants. With the green Leap youre very fast in the City Centre.

Mary's place is wonderful.  It is in a central location with plenty of places to eat within walking distance.  The room was clean and in order.  The bathroom was clean as well and decorated nicely.  Check in was no problem at all.  My overall experience was fantastic and I would recommend anyone who decides to travel to Dublin to stay at Mary's place.

This place is in a great location and buses and luas are close by.  It has a nice village atmosphere with good restaurants and food shops and is very quiet.  Mary was very helpful with directions and orientation.  I thought I'd be sharing a bath with one other person but there were 3 others and no hand washing (important to me as it was the end of my trip).  A yoga studio is at the back of the house with classes in late afternoon, so voices and footsteps were not expected.

Mary was both communicative, prompt, and a wonderful host. While she was not able to welcome me into the residence, she did however send me prompt communications via the messaging app to ensure I not only arrived, but got all situated. 

This is a very conveniently located residence next to many local pubs and the tram that takes you into downtown. The only downside was the fact that the public transit closed at midnight, but that's no fault of Mary's. 

My stay here was extremely pleasant and I would recommend her hands-down!

This is a really well located place in Dublin. It is very convenient to get into the city by bus or tram. It is a very quiet room and the bed is comfortable. I enjoyed my time staying at Mary's place.

The stay at Marys was a lovely experiance. Firstly the check-in was a breeze; the instructions provided were accurate and to the point. The room was comfortable and cozy and perfect to come back to after a long day. The place was sparkling clean and maintained. Though Mary was not there, instructions and house rules were clearly provided and she was always available on call or message incase required. The house location is also very convenient with grocery shops, pharmacy, restaurants nearby; the tram stop is also a few steps away and the city center is only a few minutes on the tram. Highly recommended.
Clean and to spec. Superb.
It is a very nice location and easy to get to the city Centre. The bed is very comfy and everything was clean!

Marys place is beautiful and roomy! i had the comfiest bed and coziest room. theres so many places to eat right outside her door and the bus stop is right across the street. very convenient ! The only thing I wasnt thrilled about was the 10:30pm shower deadline. Other than that everything was perfect! Shes very flexible with check in/out times too. Thank you mary!

The room was better than expected, clean, good wifi and a big and confortable bed. I did a late check-in due to my flight being delayed and there was no issue.
There is a good italian restartant Antica Veneziaù literally 5 meters from the door and few other places on the main street. City center is 30 min away by walk.

Pros:
- Excellent location. The house is within the heat of Ranelagh village. Bus stop right outside and LUAS within walking distance 
- Great food around, and if you are looking for a long term stay, there are grocery stores around as well 
- The house itself has been tastefully done, its beautiful, quiet and peaceful 
- Kitchen available for use 
- Great bed with very cozy comforter 

Cons: 
- The exhaust of the property behind is quite noisy, so if you are light sleeper and keeping the window open, you may be disturbed
- If its a hot day, theres no fan or cooling system in place in the room, so the room can get hot 
- The water pump can get noisy, but showers are not allowed past 1030 pm, so shouldnt be an issue
The owner is very nice and the house is very clean and comfortable. The location is very close to the city centre. Highly recommend.
Mary's place is gorgeous, full of life, in the heart of Ranelagh and close to everything... The room and bed are very comfy and it's probably one of the best values in the City. Hat's off Mary!
Great
very nice place to stay and very nice bed thanks
A charming room in a lively neighborhood. Its a quick walk or tram ride to town. A great way to experience Dublin.

Great value in expensive Dublin. Lovely area and Marys place is steps away from cafes, pubs, restaurants and buses and trams. Warm comfortable place and Mary is so hospitable. I had a problem with my luggage and she drove me to the repairers to get it fixed. So lovely.

My stay at Mary's house was lovely and relaxing. Really comfy bed and soft sheets. Mary was on holiday while I was there but she replied to emails very quickly. The house had a lovely feel to it and is in a great location, near the LUAS, Aircoach and walking distance to the centre. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby too. Would highly recommend staying here.
Thanks Mary for having me for the weekend! The space is clean and you will feel you have some privacy too. The room was also warm and not too noisy, I think its great for short stays.
Mary is welcoming and friendly, the location is central and my bed was very comfy. All good.

Marys place was as advertised, comfortable, and easily accessible. The bed in the room was extremely comfortable, and I felt safe in the neighborhood and close to some great places to eat in the village. I highly recommend staying with Mary!
Second stay at Mary's place and I can only repeat myself: it's a pure gem in a preserved area, not far from City center, cozy and comfy, so what's not to like?!!!
Very nice apartment and location. Adrian is a very knowledgable host. We enjoyed our stay!
Really well located, walkable to the central attractions in Dublin, trouble-free and great communication from Adrian. Top value.
Good location! Adrian is a nice host who can tell you everything about the city.

Unfortunately the stay was terrible and we cannot recommend the apartment to anyone. Cleanliness of the flat was so terrible that Airbnb moved us into a hotel - I think that's everything one needs to know.
Nice Appartment. We could get in early in the morning, and leave in the afternoon. Thank you.
Great apartment in central location. Highly recommend....
Great stay in Adrians. Adrian was very speedy in response and had a lot details available for things to do during the day
Adrian is a realy nice guy. Communication is perfect with him and the apartment is cute. If you looking for a quite place to stay for a few days than it's a good choice.

Location is quiet but within a 10 min walk of almost everything, which is great. Communication was quick and meeting for checkin was simple. The lock on the door is a bit tricky but after a few times it gets easier to figure out.

Very accommodating host with excellent communications. Location was perfect for us, really enjoyed some of the local bars and cafes very close by. Easy walk to other bars, restaurants and shopping areas.

Adrian was kind enough to give us some really useful recommendations while we checked in and the apartment's location is great (very close to St Patrick's Cathedral in particular and everything is walking distance).

Adrian is an outstanding host - very accommodating and communicative; he even allowed an early check-in since we were coming into Dublin on a red eye.

The space was very cozy and comfortable and made a perfect base from which to explore Dublin.
Great location!! Perfect for walkable access to all that City Center has to offer and Adrian was a great host!!

Adrian was a great host; our flight got in late and he was very accommodating with waiting up for us to arrive and showing us around the place as well as giving great tips on the area and leaving a large amount of brochures around to make sure we made the most of our time in Dublin. Would recommend to everybody!

We had a great stay at Adrians place in Dublin. His place is cozy and very convenient for traveling. It is a very easy walk to the city Centre but is very quiet. Adrian provided the space with plenty of pamphlets and suggestions for local attractions. Thank you!

Adrian is an amazing host. He made it a priority to walk me around the apartment and confirm everything would work for me.  He also has tons of maps/local suggestions for the area.  The apartment is located within a 20-30 minute walk to just about everything in the city.  Overall, it was a great experience!

House is cosy and good for family visit. Shower pressure needs attention, and also the shower water on the main bathroom, which gets either too hot or too cold. Overall it was ok. Wouldnt call this an Airbnb Plus thou.

Karen and her home is so wonderful! I stayed here with my mother, husband and 9yo daughter, who called the home a "mini castle." There are so many sweet antiques, yet it's very warm and cozy. The beds were incredibly comfortable - all of us had a hard time waking up in the morning, we were so cozy! 

Karen was super easy to communicate with, and accommodated our crazy-early arrival time with no hassle. The neighborhood is great, there are great shops and pubs around the corner, or it's a quick taxi ride into the central part of Dublin. We would definitely love to stay there again. Thanks Karen!
It was a beautiful journey to us. The house is amazing and so wonderfully arranged. The decoration is really great! Karen is a nice host. We spent a great time.

This is an absolutely wonderful home for your trip to Dublin! We were so very comfortable every moment. The kitchen has a nice island for gathering around. The beds are extremely comfortable. The home is impeccable in decor. And the best part was all the hospitality and local tips from Karen. She recommended several restaurants that turned out to be our favorites of the trip! We cannot thank her enough for hosting! 

Also, all the cab drivers and tour hosts we spoke with mentioned what a poshù area this AirBNB is ... we felt safe the entire trip and loved the neighborhood! There is a grocery and loads of yummy restaurants all within walking distance. 

Highly recommend staying here and plan to again next time we visit Ireland!

What a gorgeous house and in a fantastic location!  Karen was a wonderful host, very flexible and helpful.  The house was delightful, with lovely antique finishes but modern conveniences like plentiful hot water, dishwasher etc.  It was a pleasant walk into the centre of Dublin, we enjoyed the exercise and also appreciated the pleasant neighbourhood and the perfect silence at night.  The beds and pillows were amazingly comfortable, the kitchen was beautifully appointed with everything you might need, and there were great shops and restaurants nearby.  We enjoyed every minute of our stay in Dublin and the house was perfect for our group of 6 (including one senior citizen and three teenagers).  Many thanks Karen for all your hospitality!

Karen has been the best host from North and South Americas and to Asia, I have done my fortunate bit of travel. Stayed with some pretty rough and great places in my travels but this place is a dream. Thank you Karen for sharing your incredible home with the 6 of us!
Slainte!

We had 3 generations staying in Karens home and everyone enjoyed it. The sitting areas are beautiful for a cup of tea/coffee in the morning and the blackout shades are a big perk in the rooms. The place is so stylish, we snapped many photos before moving all of our stuff in to remember it! LOVE the neighborhood
Karen is a great host and the house was perfect for our needs.

Had a lovely weekend at Karens house. She was a great host and the house is very very spacious, with Uber comfortable beds.
The location was about 20 mins away from most of the main parts of town, close enough to the action but  far away enough for a quiet night.
Thank you Karen!
Karen's place is lovely.   It's super convenient to town,  while being a real Dublin home!

We loved staying in Karens beautiful home. It is not only pleasing to the eye but also extremely comfortable. Our party of 6 loved the convenient location and enjoyed visiting with our hostess and her friendly dogs on the first day. She left food for us and made us feel very welcome. If we return to Ireland we want to stay again.

Karen was a wonderful host - attentive and always in touch.  To give you a sense of the type of person she is - upon checking out, we forgot our sons diaper bag at her home. I messaged Karen and after a few exchanges, she was nice enough to drive the bag to our next location. 

In addition to Karens welcoming nature, her home was lovely and within walking distance of the town. I would definitely recommend it to anyone wishing to spend some time in Ireland.

Karen is a wonderful host!! She is very friendly and happy to help with any special requests. She had bread and milk waiting for us when we checked in which was really nice! Overall we had a great stay at her home. The only negative thing I can mention is that we thought we were going to be closer to the city center of Dublin. It cost around 18-25 euros each way every time we wanted to taxi to town. Other than that the stay was wonderful! Very comfortable beds!!
Everything was as advertised. Our group would stay there again.

What a lovely home! Fabulous modern amenities housed in a charming Irish row home. Karen was fabulous. She went well beyond what is usually expected to provide us with a warm and welcoming stay. Be mindful of parking, as it is along the length of the street. Finding a spot can be difficult later at night, but we generally were able to find something. 
We cant thank you enough Karen. We enjoyed your wonderful home, and our stay in Dublin.
We loved staying at Karens! Beautiful home & lovely service!
Beautiful Irish home with lovely outside space to relax.
The house was wonderful and Karen is a magnificent host.  I highly recommend.

A really nice home in a great part of town.  We were particularly impressed with the interior decorating - the home had a classic feel but with modern amenities and appliances.  

Our host Karen was also very responsive to any of our questions and helped us navigate the city.

Overall, we had a positive experience.
Lovely, lovely home, beautiful details, very comfortable. Easy to make food and enjoy our group together - a very nice stay.

A home lovingly decorated with character and style, adorned with books and memorabilia from bygone times - great for a family getaway and the perfect setting for high tea! Karen is a very conscientious host and is on hand to help you with your every need as shes just a stones throw away in the little house at the back. The milk, coffee, fresh bread, butter and preserves was a really lovely touch. Please note: the 4th bedroom is not ideal for really tall people, as it is in the attic and has limited head room, but it does have a very cute en-suite bathroom and is beautifully decorated.

Karens home is warm and lovely. It is an old house full of character. As a host, she is very involved. She will walk you through every little detail at check-in, she is always available via text, and she has her neighbors watch over the house while guests are staying there. There are many strict house rules, and Karen is vigilant about adherence to those rules. Amenities are good, and so is the location. The listing is pretty accurate. Altogether, we were pleased.

Karen's place was fabulous! The home is full of character. It accommodated four single adults easily and gave each our own space.  The house became an sanctuary of relaxation. If we hadn't been sightseeing, I could easily have just relaxed in this home reading a book with a glass of wine in the salon, coffee in the morning on the patio, etc.  Public transportation was nearby; however, we used taxis to get about town. There is street parking on a narrow avenue but it was plentiful. Karen was a pleasure to communicate with. Communication was easy and quick. Karen met us at the home upon check in; very easy to chat with and informative.  I would not hesitate to stay here again on my return to Dublin.
Karen's house was an easy choice when we were looking for a place and lived up to the billing. It was full of character and comfort.

Karens beautiful home is in the absolute best location! We loved being walking distance to downtown Dublin, to the Luas, to groceries, and neighborhood parks. Plus, the neighborhood is beautiful. Karens home is gorgeous, and very thoughtfully designed. This home was our final stay after a month in Ireland, and it was so lovely to still have the outdoor space while in the city. And, the beds are so cozy! Karen was an absolutely wonderful host. She met us upon check in, was quick to respond to any need, and very gracious and helpful when our one year old became ill. Her neighborhood recommendations are spot on. 

Only two small issues for us. A washer and dryer are listed, but they were not actually accessible to guests. This was an issue since we were on a longer trip, and planned to use them at each home we booked. And, the home is listed as family friendly, but there were small ceramics or glass objects on every surface in every room which was difficult with two small children. Like I stated, small issues, but important to note for families. 

Overall, a wonderful stay with a very gracious host, and superb location!
Karens house is so beautifully designed, down to the very smallest detail. We had such a lovely time staying there, and would recommend it to anyone.

Beautiful house with very comfortable amenities. Karen was a wonderfully welcoming host. 

Point of note for future guests: as is the nature of such a lovely period house with high ceilings, it takes a while for the house to heat up so we turned up the heating earlier rather than waiting until it was cold. The heating is very easy to use though so this isn't a problem at all and once we realised this we had a very comfortable and lovely stay.

Myself and my boyfriend stayed here on our 5 night stay in Dublin. It was a perfect size for two of us and super cozy! The location is great - super close to a lot of top tourist attractions. For the spots not so close, there are taxis just outside along with multiple bus stops that will bring you everywhere else. We availed of the airport pick-up/drop-off and had some confusion with not being able to find the driver, however we got quick responses and everyone was very friendly in helping :) overall we loved our stay and I would highly recommend!
Great location, great value. Would recommend to others

A great location, great place with tons to do and a short walk to most of the cities best sights. I'd recommend anyone looking to take in both the relaxing side and nightlife of Dublin stay here, since you stay right in the heart of it all.
Good little 2nd floor apartment for 4 - 6 people. Has everything that you need. Brilliant location
Nice flat, the location is perfect for all activities downtown. We expected more noise during the night, but it was very quiet.

This apartment was perfect for our stay in Dublin. Located 15 minutes by car from the city center (30 minutes by public transit) and about 30 minutes from the airport it was very accessible to get to the things we had planned. However, the front entrance was gated and we had to walk up a hill with our luggage - which was fine for us, but may not be for others. We loved being able to relax on the balcony with a cuppa in the mornings and sit cozied up next to the fireplace in the evening.

This flat is a perfect location for easy day trips into Dublin via bus route while avoiding the craziness of the city.  Chapelizod has some wonderful pubs/restaurants/shops with a small town feel while being just outside Dublin.  As for the flat itself, the character of old wood floors and fireplace are timeless; however, the listing pictures are outdated and several furnishings have been changed since it was listed.  The space is almost overrun with the hosts personal belongings, making it difficult for guests to settle in and find necessary items (hairdryer, hangers or space to hang clothes, etc).  Other than that, the location and space are a great value.

Maeve,s place was great , very stylish and private. The parking was convenient and the location was ideal for us. 15$ taxi or 3$ bus to city center. The little pubs and restaurants right down the street were excellent. Would stay again!

We stayed at Maeve's for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. Since we travelled by car it was great not having any problems finding a parking space (since it is a gated community with a parking lot). Especially since parking in and near to Dublin is quite a struggle and can be verx expensive. The bus ride into the city centre was easy and quick and it also took us only about half an hour to get to the Wicklow mountains. The flat itself was great and very homey, though there were some differences to what is shown in the pictures (regarding furniture).
Maeve was an efficient and quick host! She explains her home very well and accurately. Thanks for your hospitality! Felt like staying at a friend's place.
The host canceled this reservation 42 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
This place was in a great location. Very clean and stylish. Wooden floors with a fireplace and balcony, was by far one of the best places I've ever stayed.

We stayed in Maeve's apartment while attending the Bloom Show in Phoenix Park. Perfect location, great views from balcony, quiet area. Shops etc all close by.  We used self check in and Meave was available for any queries etc . . . Highly recommend - would stay again!!

The place was lovely, stylish and in a great little village. Only downside was the host had left lots of her belongings, so not ideal if you need lots of wardrobe space, however it was enough for us for the weekend.

Great location for sight seeing in Dublin and further afield, with buses running incredibly frequently, even on Sundays.  Having access to Phoenix Park was a bonus, and seeing the many deer that live there made it very special.
The apartment has everything you would need for a very comfortable stay, including a delightful balcony with beautiful views.
Maeve is really lovely and was very helpful with many excellent recommendations.
All in all, our stay couldn't have been better.     :-))

This place is a real gem. The moment I opened the front door I felt a sense of calm and peace. The location is beautiful - I am so glad we chose to stay just outside the City Centre as it meant we had the best of both worlds. Maeves flat is really comfortable and homely. The balcony is just lovely - in the morning there is a lovely view over the river. But the real plus is the secret gate to Phoenix Park which is such a beautiful place.  We spent a whole day exploring the park and watching the deer. There is also a fantastic cafe in the village where I had the best avocado toast ever. It is very easy to get into the City Centre - buses every few minutes just a few minutes walk away.  I would highly recommend Maeves place and I am so glad we chose it.

Maeve is a kind and caring host. Her place is very cozy, there is a small supermarket, a very nice restaurant (The Bridge), and a bus stop nearby, all within walking distance!  Heuston station is 5 minutes away (get a Leap Card). If you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, and experience a village feel, pick this place. Highly recommended!

Great little apartment. The lovely Chapelizod village is nearby and you are only a short bus journey from Dublin City centre. Being within walking distance of Phoenix Park is a bonus. The apartment itself is ideal for one person or a couple: cosy and perfectly proportioned. Thanks Maeve for your hospitality and communication!
Beautiful house, beautifully presented with lots of thoughtful touches and very comfortable beds.

Cathy's Rathgar home was the perfect setting for our family vacation. It is in a lovely and convenient neighborhood, is spacious, comfortable and very nicely appointed. We really look forward to staying again!

Amazing house , extremely clean , beautiful garden , loads of space , close to the city , space out front for parking , cannot recommend enough . Hosts even had a hamper for us on arrival of biscuits , tea , wine etc.
A beautiful house and grounds.  Easy access to public transportation, and local shops and restaurants.  Cathy was a very gracious host.
We had a great time at Cathy's place in Dublin. The house was perfect for our family and is in a great location in Rathmines with lots of amenities nearby. Highly recommended!
A lovely place in a quiet leafy street and Helen is just a wonderful host and so helpful and accommodating
Nice quiet place close to the sea.

Caroo's house is very comfortable and has everything.  It's been renovated and is a lovely,  bright & comfortable space. There's a Eurospar nearby and theres a seaside walk at the end of the street. It was perfect for our stay.

Beautiful home in a gorgeous setting.  A 3-minute walk to the beach!  New neighborhood and quiet.  Beds are comfortable.
Be aware that this home is very lived in and the host's belongings are in every room, giving us a feeling that we were intruding in their home and that they were going to drop in at any time.  Had we known this in advance we would have been prepared.  Also,  for non-European travelers, educate yourselves on what a wet room is and how to turn on the water heaters as well as heating for the home.  (This applies to homes in general in the UK) Be aware that the water heater in this home will not accommodate consecutive showers.  You must wait about 20-30 minutes in between showers.  We made the reservation for this Airbnb with 5 of us staying here  so the host was aware of that.    After the 3rd shower there was NO hot water as the water heater failed.   Upon contacting the owner we were told we were supposed to wait for 20 minutes in between showers.

Carol was quick to respond to any and all questions we had and was very polite in all communication. The house itself was very nice and clean and had all the amenities listed in the posting. Would definitely recommend staying here to anyone traveling to Ireland.
Caroo has a lovely house, only 15-20mims walk to Skerries harbour. She was constantly in touch about our visit, and I would recommend her house to anyone that wants to stay in the area.

Staying at Carols place was the best choice by chance we could have made. After traveling around through Irland and sleeping in B&Bs mostly, we enjoyed staying in this cosy and nicely decorated house, which is situated close to the sea. carol is really fun to talk to and great company - we didnt  feel as guests, more like friends in the end - but you have to be cool people ;) we surely come back!!!
Good value  good location. Easy to access and navigate transport and close walking distance to stores and anything you would need!

Caroo's is a warm and well decorated house that I'm sure everyone will enjoy staying at. The house is super clean and with excellent facilities, especially at the price. Great value for money if you ask me.
Carol is a great host and made me feel right at home! I had a great weekend in Skerries, would definitely come back.
Fantastic clean room in wonderful house very near a beautiful beach.

Very nice house in a quiet neighbourhood. The room is lovely and the bed very very comfortable. Carol's hospitality was great, she is very caring and even cooked for me a few times. It's a 20min walk to the next train station and it takes another 30min to Dublin, which is easy to handle if you plan your day a bit. Mind that there are no trains/buses past 11.30pm.
I'd recommend this accommodation.
It is super tidy and clean accommodation. Karen is very kind and considerate. I absolutely enjoyed my stay there including the great morning walk alongside the beach(right in front of the house!).

Karen was a great host - responded promptly to queries, was available for check-in, left clear instructions and provided the perfect balance of friendliness and privacy during my brief stay. The bedroom and bathroom were very tidy, clean and comfortable.

Karen was a great host, she was friendly and welcoming. Her home is so beautiful and immaculate, her standards on cleanliness and security are high , which is only to be expected as she and her family live in the house. 
I had a lovely 2 nights at Karens and I will definitely stay with her again
Karen has an amazing place, easy to get there, clean, comfortable. She is thoughtful and very helpful. I would recommend her place for sure.

Thank you for Karen's outstanding hospitality. The highlights of Karen's are sparkly clean house, great location, and relaxing communication. Karen is very thoughtful and prepared treats in the room for guests. Absolutely recommend.

Karen's gorgeous home in Sandymount is everything the visiting professional or recreational visitor to Dublin would want. The home is the warmest I visited while visiting Dublin, the bed super comfortable. The decor is modern and tasteful; everything issuper clean, every nuanced detail thoughtfully attended to. There are some house rules that make it better for everyone including other guests and hosts. In a gated community on glorious Sandymount strand, it does not get much better. A super quiet but close enough to the centre of Dublin. Sandymount village is a treat with a couple of cute coffee shops on a sweet village green.
A great host in a superb location. Karen was very obliging and welcoming and the room and house were immaculate. I would recommend this accommodation to everyone.
Clean, well situated, and easy check in.
A nice clean quiet room. Would stay again. Thanks
Clean and quiet with a comfortable bed. Host obliging and helpful
Karen is super nice and considerate. The house is clean, well-equipped and easy to find. (Leaving away from the downtown actually allowed me to take a tour to Bray, super fantastic seaside.)

There are so many Dos and Don'ts and Rules to this accomodation that I wouldn't recommend it for a holiday stay, just if you need a bed for a work trip. Important to be aware that there is no access to any other room in the house except the bedroom and bathroom. Otherwise place is clean and comfortable.
Great location extremely clean and very comfortable
This place was great. Karen was a lovely host. She was so kind and helpful. I really enjoyed it here.
I enjoyed my stay at Karen's home. It was very clean, quiet and well organized.
Exceptional host, extremely nice, safe, clean, communicative
simple room; kind host; quiet neighborhood near the sea
Nice scenery

Hi,

A great place, very clean and convenient. Worth a visit.
Can recommend - clean, quiet, comfortable

I can fully recommend Karen's place. I had no issues at all, the place is very clean and well maintained. There is a lock for your bedroom door and Karen herself was very friendly to talk to. 
The local DART (light rail) station is only an 8 minute walk and it's right beside the sea, perfect for a lovely walk in the fresh air. I had absolutely no issues and will be using her place again in the future!
Karen was very welcoming and keeps the house very clean. Enjoyed a good nights rest.
Excellent place to stay. Exceptionally clean and tidy. Great location on the south side of the city. Great communication and a very comfy bed. Would recommend staying here if you get the chance.
A spacious and comfortable room, very comfortable bed and quiet neighbourhood. The house is beautifully kept and sparkling clean. Karen responded to my messages very promptly and was very helpful.
Elaines place is a great location in Dublin. Tidy and comfortable.
Emplacement excellent pour voir Dunlin!
Rey highly recommended host, apartment and location 10 mins from Temple bar on foot
Great experience, loved having breakfast essentials provided for us.
Very nice apartment, close to Dublin center. Highly recommended.

This apartment has everything you could possibly want from your Airbnb in Dublin.
The location is fantastic and the apartment is very roomy with two full bathrooms which comes in super handy when you are 4.
The beds are comfy and huge and there is lots of closet space.
The kitchen is well equipped with everything you might need from casual breakfast to a nice evening dinner.
Nice clean apartment with two bathrooms. Great location too!
Stylish apartment close to everything. Sparkling clean as well! Elaine is quick to respond and very pleasant. We would stay again.

The apartment was as expected.  The building was secure and had a nice garden.  Breakfast fixings that were left for us were a nice touch.  We had some issues finding where to pick up our keys, but Elaine helped us sort it out.  One thing to note is the hot water is very hot.
This is an awesome apartment with great amenities.  The location is terrific as well.

A very clean and modern place perfectly situated for those who want to see the sites in Dublin by foot.   We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed everything this place could offer. Check in was easy and the the area is very safe. I would highly recommend this place e to anyone!

Elaines place is located in a great spot. Close to Temple and also far enough away that the location was very quiet. Check-in seem-less And secure.

I would highly recommend this Airbnb...! Thanks Elaine!
Great location. Recommend
Great location
Elaine was great in keeping in touch. Any questions answered very quickly, check-in and check-out couldn't have been easier
Elaine's home is just what we expected, clean and close to all of the must see attractions in Dublin. We were also allowed to leave our bags prior to the 4p check in which was a plus!
We had a great stay at Elaine's place. The location was perfect for what we needed and the apartment was great. We would definitely stay here again!

A comfortable modern furnished apartment with secure parking and entrance as well as a gym, pool, steam room, sauna on-site. Located within 10-15 min walking distance of the city centre and most attractions. Restaurants (I recommend the one with Spanish tapas) and a grocery store are a few blocks away. Elaine is quick to respond and offers lots of recommendations for what to see and do. A welcome package of food is waiting for you to enjoy tea time and your first breakfast.
Great neighbourhood!  and very nice room with ensuite bathroom. Dublinbikes in the same street, so easy bike ride to the center. Woud recommend Shanes place.
Clean, great space! Excellent location within a good walking distance. Really lovely host, very accomodating, non intrusive and gives quick responses.
We loved Shane's apartment - everything we needed and more. The breakfast was a great touch.
Highly recommend this Airbnb. Great location, very clean, and the host was really hospitable, communicative, and informative.
The host canceled this reservation 15 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Breda does a fantastic job of taking an interest in YOUR interests and finding you things to do around Dublin!
