Breda was the nicest host; very kind and lovely person, always willing to help.  Her house is well connected both to the city centre and the airport, which is quite convenient. Besides, the room is cosy and warm and the bed is extremelly confortable. 
Highly recommended. Next time I'm in Dublin I will definetely stay at hers again.
Breda is a great host!  Very easy to talk with and she gave me a few great recommendations while I was in Dublin! My stay was very nice and I had everything I needed!

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Bredas house. I felt at home from the moment I walked in the door. Breda is a great host - she is very nice and her place has a good energy. The room is bright and cosy and I slept very well. Its easy to get to town and to the airport by bus, you can also walk to the city centre, its a nice route if you like walking.
Breda is very hospitable and intelligent, always ready to help.  The room is cozy, Breda provides everything you need for a comfortable stay.  thanks, I will always be glad to see you on a visit

A wonderful place to call home while on the road of your travels! Breda provides that special of care especially in the wonderful Irish breakfast. Located close to a bus route to get you seeing Dublin.
you will find a very well decorated, cozy apartment that will make you feel at home.

I had amazing two nights at Bredas very cosy and wonderful quiet place! She ua really a great woman and we had inspiring talks. Breakfast was very good. I felt like home from the first moment on. Would always come back again! Thank you so much!

Breda was super nice, the kind of host that worries about you and gives you tons of local information. The place was very welcoming and clean,  just what you can see in the pictures. The place is very well connected with a bus that takes you straight to the airport in one hour and just 20 minutes to the center of Dublin!! 

Also the place is not in the main city but in a lovely residential area, perfect to see how real Dublin looks like and not only the tourists area but still very close to the center.

This was my first time using airbnb and it was way better than what I expected, I will repeat for sure and I will be back in Breda's place if I have to return to Dublin =)
Breda is a great hostess. Everything was perfect: nice house, delicious breakfast, cosy room, kind indications about how to move around... I felt at home.

It was so perfect to stay in Breda's lovely place. It's easy to take a bus #16, takes only 20mins to the centre. Breda is open-minded and kind persin who has warm-hearted. I really enjoyed staying in her place also loved talking with her. We had a great conversation. Thanks Breda!
Breda is an excellent hostess. Very attentive to everything and I highly recommend her.
We loved staying at Gemmas place. Very clean, great location, and easy check in!
Great flat to use as homebase, we were 3 (which was a bit tight) but cool little neighborhood. We sadly were not here for market day, but will be next time! Check out LeGit coffee and Arthur's!

The unit was clean and as described. Check in was with the hosts brother who was a little condescending and said we could have parking if we paid him 5 euro. Other than that, the unit was fine and is a decent home base but not somewhere I want to spend much time.

Gemmas apartment is the perfect location for a Dublin vacation! Close to all major highlights that Dublin has to offer while providing a quite and clean place to rest at night. Gemma and her brother-in-law Josef were quick to respond and made checking in a breeze.
Everything was as described. We had a pleasant stay.
Gemma's apartment was a good place to stay for exploring dublin and had all the basics you needed.
Excellent
Good location for exploring Dublin!
We had a lovely time. The apartment was ideally located, very close to the city center but far enough away that it wasn't noisy. Check in was straight forward. Thanks

Gemmas place was the perfect spot for us during our Dublin stay. It was a great platform to adventure around the city, being just down the street from the Guinness storehouse. It was very easy to get to from the airport and we had no problems checking in with Josef, who was warm and welcoming. The apartment itself was spotless and we were very comfortable during our stay.

Awesome location! Can walk everywhere, or take a short Uber ride. Theres tons of toiletries left behind by other guests to cover things we forgot which was very convenient! Also loved being able to wash a load of laundry.

Very good location with anything you might need provided. We enjoyed that it was walkable to everywhere yet also felt like a neighbourhood and was quiet at night. We had a lovely check in experience and were shown how to get everywhere with a map. Thank you!
It was a nice place with friendly and helpful reception. Close to the Guiness and Jameson Museum. The city center is very close too by walk.

Great location, walking distance from everything you'd want to see. Great value and a lovely apartment  which was lovely and clean. Brilliant communication, we would defiantly stay again. Only thing missing was a tv. We didn't think we would miss one but we did notice not having one in the mornings whilst getting ready for the day and on the evenings when we got in. Iron and hairdryer are provided which is great if your travelling light, like we were.
Easy to communicate with owner. Josef was super helpful and friendly, however area unsuitable for 2 females on their own.
Gemmas place was perfect spot to hangout and relax in a great location accessible to the city center. We had all the accommodations we needed.
Gemma and Josef were super prompt - Josef was very welcoming. Lovely place in the liberties, a stones throw from many activities.
Good place for a couple of nights close to town. Very quiet.
Un gran condo en un lugar muy bien ubicado en Dublin.

Gemmas place is a wonderful location. A very short walk to the Guineas Storehouse in one direction and then about a 10-15 (depending on where youre walking) in the other direction is the city center of Dublin.
The flat itself is perfect for the traveling couple. Light and airy, the flat has a small balcony overlooking the courtyard of the apartment building. We had lovely weather and kept the window and door to the balcony the whole time we were in the apartment (albeit not that long!).  Joseph (Gemmas brother-in-law) greeted us and he couldnt have been nicer and more informative. He had excellent directions and recommendations. 
A last note for all those white-sound sleepers, Gemma provides a fan in the bedroom which is a great touch, personally speaking. Loved our stay with Gemma and will definitely recommend.
Amazing location! Close to temple bar area, city centre and Guinness factory. Josef was very welcoming and gave us lots of tips for where to go.
Lovely apartment the edge of the city centre. 5 minute walk from the Guinness storehouse
My stay was pleasant. Communication was easy and fast. Apartment was clean and comfortable. Good place to stay when staying in Dublin!
Good

Joe's apartment has great location! Our bus arrived just few blocks away and airport bus stops also very near. The center is within easy walking distance, yet the area is peaceful. The building is modern and quite. The apartment was perhaps just a little bit worn, which didn't bother us. Sofa-bed in the living room area was also good to sleep on. We were able to check in early, which was really helpful. Communication was good. Thanks Joe!
Totally fine place to stay for a night or two. Joe was very quick to respond and helpful.

Location great for walking into town and a quick 20 min taxi ride from the airport, close to a small supermarket too. Price was good in relation to the rest of Dublin. Thats where the positives ended for us Im afraid, for us it was really disappointing and my family were quite upset with the condition of the apartment having seen the advert look so lovely. 

The apartment is very grubby, a lot of things are broken/cracked/stained. The towels and bedding we were given were stained and threads were hanging off them. Theres basic amenities missing such as spare towels, tea dowels, dish cloth, TV etc, it was very basic. 

I aired my feedback to the host who wasnt very receptive to my constructive comments even when I provided photos - his response was to sarcastically imply I was the problem because I had had difficulty the previous day in finding the apartment (totally irrelevant to the condition of the apartment but hey). The description of how to find the building, although lengthy, was inaccurate (we were told it was opposite a tyre shop but there are no tyre shops or even garages opposite). 

I was provided 2 phone numbers to contact when I arrived in Dublin, the primary number wouldnt answer and the second number sounded completely confused and unaware of why I was calling which was very worrying. This person then gave me a third contact number to call, of a girl who was cleaning the apartment. She didnt say anything to us when we walked up, didnt show us how/where to use the fob, literally walked us into the flat, handed me a towel and left. We stood in absolute amazement. 

I appreciate the hosts comments that this is a home not a hotel so cant be expected to meet the same standards but in my view, if youre willing to rent out a property on Air BnB, its not unreasonable to expect cleanliness as minimum. In addition, we stayed in another Air BnB (again in someones home) the 3 nights prior to our stay here and it was absolutely perfect so I cant accept that its a home is a valid excuse. 

Lastly, the pictures imply that the apartment is in/overlooking the college (numerous people had said this when looking at the advert without me saying) and it isnt, its about a 5 minute walk away and overlooks building sites which cant be helped. However, I think the pictures give a false representation. 

I wasnt going to write a review but the response I had from the host this morning really took me aback and prompted me to write an honest review for future potential guests. 

In summary, if youre a young student who is not particularly concerned about cleanliness and nice presentation, this would probably be fine for you. If youre a family/friends/couple and you wanted a nice base for a few days away, I wouldnt recommend this apartment.

Joe is an excellent host! His apartment is in a great location for going on local tours and seeing everything Dublin has to offer, but just far enough from the busy areas to have a wonderful stay. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is considering a visit to Dublin!

The experience was amazing, the house is in a perfect area! With walk distance you go anywhere downtown. I suggest to everyone that considering a little vacation in Dublin, to stay at Joes place. Definitely we will back again if we decide to come back in Dublin

Good place for a weekend break.. Good location and building felt secure.
Place is a little tired, but for a base to explore Dublin, can't complain!

The apartment is pretty much exactly as described, and the photos are very accurate. The location is great, right next to trinity college, very near to temple bar. Its also really close to bus stops and a train station in case you need to travel to other areas in Dublin. The communication was excellent and check in/out went without issues. Highly recommended.

The flat is in an excellent location near Trinity College with all of central Dublin within walking distance, its an ideal base for a couple for a short break. The flat is a little tired but perfectly serviceable and although we didnt use it, has a very well stocked kitchen. Joe was a very responsive host, sorting issues quickly and offering recommendations. Great bakery for breakfast just round the corner too. Would stay again if in Dublin for a couple of nights.

Joes place is great! Its located very close to great restaurants and bars and only a 15 minute walk or so to popular areas like Temple Bar. Joe accommodated us when we requested an early check in and was quick to answer any of our questions. The cleaning staff met us when we were confused about how to enter the apartment and was lovely as well! This space is incredibly clean and quite roomy î complete with a great shower and bathroom, kitchen, super comfortable bed, and a balcony to relax and view the city from. I wish we would have stayed here longer!
A lovely apartment in the centre of Dublin. Spotlessly clean with absolutely everything you could think of.  I would definitely stay here again. Thanks Joe.
Super convenient location. Incredibly quiet. Host communicated with us brilliantly and the place was spotless.  Best air b n b experience Ive had in Dublin.

At great value to money only a few minutes walk from Temple, i'd definitely recommend this as a good option as a base.  Our host was very quick to answer any questions and checkin / checkout was as easy as it could be.

I stayed at Joe's apartment for a week, Sunday through Saturday, July 2019, in order to attend a work conference at Trinity College, Dublin. The location, regardless of business or pleasure, is the heart of Dublin city. It is literally around the corner from Trinity (if that is your need) but every possible attraction or amenity a visitor to Dublin needs is on your doorstep. 
The apartment had two double beds (1 bedroom, with a fold out couch/bed - perfectly comfortable). The place was spotless, the kitchen has everything you need on hand, there was piping hot water on demand, fresh towels, spare clean (and new) bed linen, wifi was really good. There was literally nothing else I could need or look for. One or two email queries to Joe were answered instantly (including one late on Sunday night after check in - exceptional response).
With the price of Dublin hotels in peak summer there was no way I could stretch a week in Dublin for work and allow time to catch up with friends. 
I can't recommend the place highly enough! BOOK!
Joes flat was the perfect location and a great spot to get around the city from.
Great location and accommodation. The system to get the key was a difficult hassle compared to most Airbnb experiences.
The host canceled this reservation 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Joe thank you for being our host. While our stay at your apartment met our needs, there were issues. The washer/dryer didnt work the best and the clothes I did dry turned purple. Im not sure if this was due to the previous load by perhaps the previous tenant. The refrigerator/ freezer was unavailable which could have been a big inconvenience for someone staying longer than two days.

The construction right outside this apartment made for a very early morning even for a moderately heavy sleeper especially when working past moderate jet lag. Although you cannot help this aspect, I think it should be mentioned to potential renters when they query. 

Although it is definitely apparent that you and your keeper work hard to be attentive to the cleanliness of this apartment, there are some things might need to be replaced. Such as, the board under the shower. 

The apartment is very warm and stuffy when walking in, we had to air it out every time we came in. 

The location was very central and we loved that. We did not use the dishes or stove. 

Also when we went to empty the trash it was difficult to find the utility room as it was written on the first floor when in actuality it was on the ground floor past a few doorways. We looked throughout the entire complex until we found this.

All in all, this is a good stay for a quick trip in the city.
Joe was easy to contact. He gave good instructions. His space was kept very clean however there was a very powerful cigarette smell

C'etait genial! Bonne localisation, apoartemment Beau et propre.

Grand merci pour l'accueil!
The location was great and communication was excellent.

Joes apartment is a fantastic place to stay while in Dublin! Taking the 747 bus from the airport to pick up the key was incredibly easy, as the bus stop is right in front of the pickup location. Its just a quick walk from the key pickup location to the apartment. The location is perfect for walking to the major areas. It is also in a great location for the buses to Belfast and DART. I felt safe walking back from the station late at night after I attended a concert at RDS arena. The apartment is clean and in a nice building. The coffee shop around the corner has fantastic coffee and fresh baked scones. Joe was welcoming and responsive. Thank you for allowing me to stay!
The location was great. Easy walking to Grafton and other areas. The apartment itself was clean and the perfect size for 2 people for a weekend.
Very nice apartment, close to the city center. It was clean and well equipped.  Very good experience!

Joe's apartment was perfectly clean, easy to find and check in to and Joe was really communicative and helpful before arrival. Great as a base to explore central Dublin and a short walk to the main tourist spots, shopping and bars. Thanks!
Awesome space and good location. Very responsive and clear instructions are given. Thanks for a great stay!

Not much I can add to what others have already stated. Great location, lots of amenities nearby (pubs, restaurants, grocery shops). Temple bar is 10-15 walk away, Grafton street and the shopping district is also 10-15 walk away. Apartment itself was clean and spacious, kitchen is v nice as from the photos with fridge, freezer, oven, toaster etc. Didn't have any problems with the check-in, or check-out process. Only saw a couple of other people in the building. Building itself is quiet, no noise issues. Pictures on the listing are accurate. No issues from me, I would highly recommend to others.
Very convenient, extremely clean and good value for money. Also, very clear instructions made it easy to find and use. And owner was always easy to get in touch with, very helpful.
The location is great. Nice spacious apartment with a nice balcony. We did have some issues with the water heating and the place couldve been cleaner but we had a nice time.
Great sta, nice place.. raccomended!

We had a great stay with Joe! The apartment was clean and obviously well maintained, and within walking distance of all the great locations we wanted to visit in Dublin. He also included a list of popular attractions and places to go! 

My only (very minor) complaint was it was a bit confusing finding our way to the apartment initially, but Joe had multiple open lines of communication to help us find our way safely and quickly to the apartment. 

Overall: clean space, great communication by Joe, and nice, short distances to many sites in Dublin from the apartment.
All ok
Great stay in a lovely, very central, cosy apartment.

Thanks Stephen for having us, it was perfect for what we needed and in a great location. Stephen is super friendly and very helpful. The bed was lovely and comfortable meaning we got a great night sleep.

Stephen was an excellent host and he made us feel very welcome. The bedroom and bathroom were sparkling clean and even though it was in an apartment complex in the heart of Smithfield, it was super quite and we could even leave the window open all night without being disturbed by any street noise. Stephen's little Pug was adorable. We would certainly come here again.

Steve's place is in a really great location! Every major attraction is easily within walking distance. Phoenix Park, Jamerson Distillery and a super fun lively cute pub called Cobbleson are ridiculously close to the Air Bnb. Steve goes out of his way to make his home as clean and homely for you.

The appartment is well located and you are near from almost everything.
Stepen is kind, full of energy and can give you advices about the surroundings.
Unfortunately some things bothered me, taking in account the price and the other Airbnb experiences I had in Dublin and Ireland. To make it simple and not to go into details the experience I had was not as good as expected. I hope it was unforeseen circumstances (and I'm not talking about the dof, who was really funny)
Stephen was a great host, very friendly and made us feel welcome. The flat is really well located, has everything you need and the decoration is quite stylish. Loved the dog!!

This was the second time we have stayed here. Loved it both times. It was a short stay but we were warmly greeted and well taken care of. The location is very convenient to the Temple bar area, Heuston train station, and city center. We definitely recommend this place to other Airbnb travelers.
Stephen is a nice and uncomplicated host, I felt very welcome and comfortable. His Appartement is located close to the city center.

Me and my mom stayed at Stephen's for a night and it was class! The house is cool and very clean. The double room is lovely, the atmosphere is really chill and the bed is super comfy! The toilet is fancy and super clean as well! 
We also had  a chat with Stephen when we came back home in the evening and he's a really lovely person! Then there's also an extra bonus: Maggiel! Stephen's dog! She's the little princess of the house! She enjoys cuddles and attentions! She's the cutest! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Anyways, we had a lovely experience art Stephen's and I'd definitely come back! I absolutely recommend it!

Stephen has been incredibly accommodating particularly since we arrived very late at night. His home is very clean and cosy with all necessary ammenities. His dog Maggie is very quiet and didnt bother us at all, quite the contrary, shes the sweetest. We will definitely come back here if visiting Dublin again.
Great location and solid accommodations.

Stephen was a great host! Very friendly and accommodating. Location is good, about a 15-20 min walk to temple bar and the airport bus, and about 5 min walk to Jameson. Very nice guy and has a cute pup as well! :)
Location is great. Quiet, by a 24 hour market and in good walking distance to the tourist spots and restaurants. Stephen is very friendly and accommodating!
Great stay. Stephen was super accommodating and a great guy. Great place and a great location - highly recommend

Excellent host.  Great place and great guy. Steven is adorable and makes you feel at home. Excellent location and even better apartment. 
If I ever return to Dublin I'll definitely stay at Steven's again.  Thank for everything my family and I are so grateful.
Brilliant location, flat was clean and tidy, Stephen was friendly and welcoming. Also has an adorable wee pug

Stephen was very hospitable and we felt so well taken care of and welcomed. We only stayed one night but loved how close him home was walking distance from all the sites downtown Dublin. Enjoyed a very restful nights sleep and loved hanging out with his pooch.

It may be a bit out of the way of the main city, but the place itself is close to a store where you can buy food and a tram line which is awesome! Stephen was a very welcoming and happy host who greeted us with open arms and had many suggestions but stated everything with such enthusiasm. His dog was also very cute and friendly. Always willing to share his food with us but we were too stubborn to not accept his offer, very hospitable. The only thing I will say is that the bed was hard for my comfort, but that is ever bed in Ireland I've slept in so maybe it's a norm there. 
Highly recommended place!

Room is tidy, clean and warm and bright. Bed was comfortable. Towels were clean and fresh. Bathroom was fine. Hot water and okay pressure. All in all we had a good stay. It is in a very good location. Hosts were very friendly and welcoming.
The location was very central for me in Smithfield and great access to fab bars and restaurants. A nice quiet apartment and cool  modern bedroom. Stephen is a lovely and generous  host.

The apartment is located at the center of the city and major tourist attractions and major pubs are at walkable distance. 
Stephen and Leo along with their pet dog Maggie were fantastic host, had great conversation making it a friendly stay. 
Was welcomed with a big smile and Stephen prepared breakfast and coffee for me which it self is enough to explain how good they were.
Everything was great, apartments location, condition are very good. Stephan is super owner. He support me in difficult situation. Highly recommend

Stephen was a great host, and put his best foor forward to make me comfortable and happy.  His responses are prompt, and provides all the necessary information to a new comer/ tourist.
The apartment was cosy, and room/ washroom was quite well kept, clean and comfortable. Location was nice and suitable, in the city centre, with good public transport facilities within walking distance.  
Stephen has an amazing collection of sculptures of Lord Buddha, very tastefully decorated/ placed in the apartment. His initiative of growing tomatoes and other vegetables in his small balcony is worth appreciating. 
A must mention is Maggie, very cute pug, a nice companion in the apartment. I do intend to visit Dublin in this lifetime, and spend more time with Stephen and Maggie..
Wish you all the best..

Very nice and clean appartment in great Location.
We absolutely recommend it.
The Communication with the hosts was really good.
Thanks to Fiona and Liam.
Well be back some day.
Very nice and clean apartment, not too far from the city centre. We didn't have the chance to meet Liam and Fiona but they were really helpful with us, I totally recommend their place !
Great little apartment to stay in. Location is accurate to the description. Very clean and relaxing place. We enjoyed our stay!
They are really nice and worry about our stay and comfort. The apartment it's nice a bit far from of the centre.
Sehr schnelle Antwort bei fragen oder Problemen und gute Lage
Everything was perfect... the communication, the room,  the location... everything was fine. I  higly recommend the accomodation of Liam and Fiona!
Liam and Fiona's place is nice and cozy.

Great stay! We were given lots of helpful tips about local spots to visit for drinks or eat. The driver we were given from the airport to the apartment was great! He had great communication the day before the flight to know exactly where to find him. He also gave us direction from a map once we got to the house. Host had great response time to answer all of our questions. Seamless check in and lovely small place right outside of the city centre.
Great little space, perfect for one person but would be a bit squishy for two. Very clean, easy access to buses, great communication from hosts
The apartment is really tiny but equipped with everything, which surprises us!! Located not too far from the city center and it is really quiet. The quilt and pillow could be cleaner.

I had a great stay and this was the perfect base for my travels while in Ireland. It was especially comfortable for a solo traveler and it was a relaxing stay for my week of day trips and my time in Dublin attending a convention. The public transportation options were especially valuable. The communication from the hosts was great and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.
Great location, 30 minute walk to central Dublin. Very clean! Had everything we needed. Enjoyed the pubs they recommended.

Very nice and cute apartment. Liam and Fiona gave us all the instructions nice and clear to get there and get the key. They were also very fast responsive.  
The place was very clean and organized. We had everything we need. We were able to cook our meals perfectly.

The location is great. Across the street from the bus stop. 2 minutes from a pub, supermarket, coffee shop. 10 minutes from the park. The view from our apartment was also very nice (4th floor). The bed was a sofa bed, bit very easy to assemble and comfortable. 

Weve loved our stay there! We will definitely stay there again.

Good, clean apartment. A bit sparse, but it met all our needs. The hosts were extremely communicative and provided extensive helpful instructions to ensure a smooth process. The apartment is a bit outside the main city, probably about a 15 minute walk. We enjoyed our stay and would book again.
Liam and Fionas studio was cozy and welcoming. Our trip to Dublin was amazing and we loved staying in the studio. We cooked meals in the kitchen, always felt safe, and the unit was very clean!
Clean, quaint and very responsive. My mom has trouble going up the flights of stairs, but other than that everything was great.
Great host, helpful and friendly, great apartment very central easy walking distance to all big sites and venues!
They can expect to have issues with the toilet. The hot water fluctuates but it had a rather large sitting area. Pots and pans for cooking and two nice size bedrooms.
Malcolm was a great host, would highly recommend this apartment for its location and ease of check-in. I would stay again. Thanks :)
Great location and a well appointed clean apartment. Exactly what we needed for a few days in the city.
Nice apartment within walking distance to city center!

I don't think I'd stay at this place again, unless the price was dropped down to an appropriate level (around 100 Euros), or unless Malcolm fixes the issues that multiple people have complained about. The explanations that Malcolm gives are unfortunately not true.
Malcolm's place place was clean and we'll located for our needs. Correspondence was excellent.

This is a great location for visiting Dublin, and the host was responsive to our texts. The beds were comfortable and the apartment was quiet. We had difficulty figuring out how the heating works. The carpets and shower could use a little attention. All and all it was a reasonable value for the Dublin area.
Great place to stay in the city. A quick walk to the luas

As always we had an amazing stay in Dublin. Such a marvellous city.
The apartment was not our favourite. Even though the location is perfect and in walking distance of everything and easily accessible from the airport or if u want to do a day trip to Howth for example.
However the place was a bit dusty and we had quite a few problems with the hot water arrangement. 
Since the host was not very communicative it felt a bit uncomfortable sometimes
Malcolm's apartment was excellent.  It was very convenient to everything we needed in Dublin.  We would recommend it to future guests
Basic appartment with ok location.

A comfortable and well supplied accommodation. The location of the unit is excellent for visitors to Dublin. Close to a transport hub it is also within walking distane of many of Dublin's main sights. It was perfect for us as first time visitors.
Malcolms place is great! Clean, great location and roomy. I highly recommend it!

The apartment is located in a gated community which is good since there are many homeless people and drug addicts striking around on the north side.
The apartment is well sized and the beds were comfortable. It was silent. The instructions on how to get to the apartment were very good and there was also an information broschure in the apartment with good tips.
The apartment was rather damp and it was obvious that the host doesnt live there on a regular basis.
Very nice, quiet apartment situated in a great location in Dublin.  Everything you need for a city break.
Great location. Spacious flat in good complex. Helpful and responsive host. Would recommend.

The apartment was in a great location and very close to amenities - 15 minute walk to Temple Bar area, touristy area. 
Space was in a quiet gated area, was large and roomy  but in some serious need of TLC, some small repairs and some professional cleaning!
Good location

If youre thinking of staying at Malcolms apartment in Customs House Harbour make sure he had attended to - water that wont go down the bathroom sink and shower, the faulty room heaters, the cupboard with only half a hinge, the shower handle hanging by one dodgy screw, the filthy cooking utensils, the moth-eaten and tatty towels, the weeds on the balcony, the filthy glass on the balcony doors, the filthy oven, the dirty  and damp linen of previous renters in the cupboards and make sure the cupboards are free from clothes of previous renters. If he can guarantee those things, then the location is good. And be careful not to pay too much for what you get and dont take Malcolms word that he will deliver what he promises.

Malcolm's place was conveniently located and had everything we needed for our stay. I was particularly appreciative of the activity and restaurant suggestions he provided. The beds were comfortable and the curtains were effective at blocking out the light--I slept really well!

The place is in great center location. Easy walk to everything you would ever need in Dublin. Multiple public transportation options too. Apartment itself is a good size, has a balcony overlooking water and has everything you'd want in a kitchen. My biggest concern was a bathroom that needs a good scrubbing and all the drains needs to be cleaned. Sink fills up instantly when attempting to wash hands and shower fills up with dirty water while taking a shower. We also had issue with short supply of hot water. I did contact the host about the issues and never got a response.

The flat is in a great location, just across the river from Trinity College.   A few good pubs and restaurants close by.

Malcolm was not good replying to emails and we had to borrow a phone to get any response from him.   Then he emailed access codes etc.   The flat is nice but rather small - typical of city center locations.   It is in need of a little TLC - there are a few minor items that need to be fixed and also while we were there, there were large sacks of dirty laundry in the closets.   Easy free parking adjacent to the entrance was an added bonus in town.

Great location.  As mentioned in previous reviews, the furniture and carpet could use some upgrading, but everything worked, the kitchen was stocked and the apartment was comfortable.  The main tourist areas are a 10 minute walk and the place is fairly quiet except for the seagulls that squawk early in the morning.  Thanks Malcolm.

Malcolm's apartment was exactly as described.  It was clean, comfortable, well appointed, and only a short walk to major tourist attractions in the city center, and particularly the convention centre, which was my destination every day.  The weather was very nice during our stay, which made the balcony a very nice place to relax at the end of the day.  There were some easily fixed maintenance issues that I have corresponded to Malcolm privately about, and which I am sure will/were be dealt with before the next guests arrive. I highly recommend this property.

The appartment is at a great location. Only about 15 minute walk to the city centre. The living room is quite big and the WiFi is excellent. Beds are ok and there is plenty of closet space.

However, there are definetely some things that need to be fixed. These things have been mentioned before in previous reviews and are still not fixed. Things like not having hot water, the appartment feeling dusty and smelling weird, old laundry in the closets, etc.

Malcolm is not the best at responding to messages either. Once we had made the booking, it took about 4-5 messages to get the check-in instructions and get confirmation on a earlier check-in. After confirming our check-in and asking some questions, Malcolm didnt respond any more.

Overall I probably wont stay there again until the issues have been fixed and Malcolm does a better job at commucating.
Very handy two bedroom flat close to CCD,in the middle of the financial district. Comfortable, clean, good facilities, parking, and lots nearby. We had a great time.
Malcom was easy to reach when we needed him. Great location!
Good central location, everything you would need for a stay in Dublin
Good location, comfy and spacious. Nice host

Location is excellent for access to all of Dublins highlights.  
One of the reasons we choose this property was because of parking but after arriving and contacting the owner found out that parking access (card needed to open gate) was not available but would be okay because always cars "coming and going".  
Not really acceptable.
Property was as described, great to have a washing machine!  Some minor maintenance issues would have been nice.
Overall happy with the property.

Nice location, host did allow us to check in early, which was nice , since we had luggage with us. Apartment was ok, really needs updates.  Mold in bathroom, shower door handle is un-attached. Really dangerous.  Furniture dirty and shredded. Directions for gate and door confusing. Especially for people
That dont use such entry ways.  Host needs to rewrite directions to be more clear.
Nice guys. The accommodation is very central and the check in was very easy. Little furnished room.
Great place to stay in Dublin. It was very clean and comfortable, very near to the center of the city. Thanks for everything!
Wijk is super is waar ze wonen! Alles goed te voet te doen

We had a lovely stay at Padraig and Iuris apartment. They were very friendly and easy to communicate with. Our room was simple and cleanîexactly what we needed. The apartment was in a great location near the canal and we were able to walk throughout the city without needing public transportation. Recommend to friends!
We had a great time staying here, the host(s) were very friendly and helpful. Also our late check in was no problem at all :) would recommend!
Easy to find, well connected location (buses, tram, foot). We had a nice stay at Padraig and Iuri's.
Lovely appartement, spotless and arranged with great taste. Padraigand Iuri are really nice and quiet people, we couldn't have hoped for a better stay than the one we had! We highly recommend !
Great location! Great option for the price. Super cozy.
Luri was very accommodating. The apartment is in an excellent location. Nice building.  The bed is a little on the hard side.  Overall a good experience.
Great place to rest the head and shower after exploring Dublin all day!
Very nice contact and good location.

Wonderful place. Location was ideal- just marks the border between rathmines and portobello, both safe and hip and fun areas with lots of coffee, interesting restaurants, and only a short walk downtown. Easy access to and from the airport - a bus and a 7 minute walk. 

Iuri and Padraig were timely in their communication and even let us check in early when we arrived at Dublin mid morning. Would highly recommend them and this place for anyone coming to Dublin.

Paddy and Iuri have a lovely flat in a convenient location, a short walk from the city. The airport express bus takes you very close to their flat which is convenient. Check in was easy and they were very responsive to my texts and understanding of a delayed flight. They recommended a cafe for breakfast which was absolutely gorgeous. Thank you!
Great accommodation and location!
The location of the apartment is brilliant. The bus & the Luas are easy to reach. Its also possible to walk into town. The check-in and communication was really easy. We recommend the apartment.
Great locatio,  close to the Portobello canals. I recommend this place to anyone looking to stay over in Dublin
Location location... and this is exactly what you need. Thanks for a great stay. Perfect location & everything we need from a weekend stay in Dublin.

We thank Padraig and Iuri for the kindness and hospitality! Great location and a clean bedroom with enough space for our bags. A good place for a short stay over in Dublin. The hosts were easily reachable by phone and email for practical questions and the airline bus connection stops only 5 minutes away (walking) from the appartment.
We were disappointed. The room was smaller than expected, there was no proper heating, the bedsheet was covered with hair and little pieces of black cotton. There was no heating in the bathroom.
Very attentive hosts, super helpful and made it a very easy experience thank you!
Very nice hosts, the Air bnb was very clean
Thank you for being excellent hosts and we really appreciated the helpfulness, tips, and providing a safe, clean, and lovely place to make our stay in Dublin extra wonderful.

This is such a wonderful place to stay. Liam and Fiona made the instructions very clear on how to get in, and we are able to travel around the city if we dont have a car. The place is adorable and cozy and inviting we actually ended up spending an evening just hanging out there! There is a cute coffee shop around the corner called Love Supreme about a 10 min walks worth and then a few places to eat and none of them were disappointing. Its about a 25-30 min walk to the Quays and city center but its doable. Definitely would recommend and stay again when visiting Dublin! Thank you Liam and Fiona!!

Great place to stay!! We especially appreciate Liam and Fionas thorough list of recommendations in the area including local restaurants/pubs. Gary was beyond excellent in assisting us from the airport including carrying our bags upstairs and providing a map/directions to the city center. The accommodations were small but perfect for 2 people. We stayed in the Oscar Wilde room. Very quiet at night.
Very walkable to city center and the beautiful Phoenix Park!
A small cozy apartament with everything you need for your stay. Very convenient that the bus stop is right there, a few footsteps away from the front door.
I loved it! They were very accommodating and quick to answer any questions. They went above and beyond!
Liam and Fionas Oscar Wilde studio was great! It was close to everything we needed! We had so much fun staying there.

The flat was a small space but perfect for me and my partner located on the 3rd floor, quiet but a few flights of stairs. Liam and Fiona were very helpful before our arrival with suggestions of what to do in the city and the local buses. They also offered to book us a private transfer from the airport to the accommodation. We decided to pass on this as we couldn't check in until later in the day and we found a bus pass from the airport the "DoDublin" very useful for getting to and from the airport and also getting around the city VERY good value for money!! The great thing was the bus stop was right outside the accomodation and they were very frequent so we always had a way of getting around the city. Thank you so much Liam and Fiona for making this trip better for us!!

Apartment is in a great location: close to markets, pubs and restaurants. The bus station is just in front of the apartment. 
The communication with the host is perfect, Liam and Fiona are very kind and response quickly. My husband and I, we spent three nights and four days, for us was a little small but the place has everything that you need and its very clean. 
Thanks Liam and Fiona for your hospitality and kindness.
We had a great time and appreciated all the sight-seeing tips!
A great affordable spot with easy access to downtown.
Very clean, close to city center and easy check-in!
Nice place just a bus ride away from the centre.
Fiona and Liams place is very nice! Would love to stay here again when Im back in Dublin.
Brilliant location, great value for money. Really loved my stay here. Excellent communication from David, was very easy to get in touch with him.

David's place is excellent and the apartment is so central

Only issue is that the lack of amenities such as milk for coffee

And the girl who takes care of the place was late

Also please be aware that there is an extra cost for electricity not stated any where

Other than that an amazing place
Cool!
Best location
Great place and excellent host

Charging 10 euro for electricity after you ve already booked is not on. All charges should be clearly stated before . It's basically stealing as you as you don't have the option of canceling your booking. But I think it's Airbnb responsibility to prevent this. Other than that it is a good flat in a good location.
Very responsive host and a great location! Highly recommend this spot
Central and lots of space. Good communication.

Lovely clean apartment. In the heart of Dublin City with great access to everything Dublin has to offer. Check in was quick and easy as was the check out. Nothing negative to say about the apartment or the process.
Great location!

We had a good time in Dublin. The apartment is really well located and David was very friendly and helpful. The land lady met us and she was very helpful as well.

The apartment itself is very clean and well looked after. For a weekend for 6 people its absolutely perfect, but any longer than that and I might find somewhere else. Its very much like a student house, a bit rough around the edge, but for the cost of stay and for a couple of nights its absolutely perfect. Plus the service was very good so overall I have no issues.
Great location.  The accommodation is a little tired.

What a nice surprise to find this huge space available in the Temple Bar area and at that price! The rooms are spacious and the washer/dryer was a life saver after traveling for 8 days and getting there with a suitcase of dirty clothes. Ive seen 1 or 2 people comment on the noise but they apparently didnt read or comprehend where they were staying - near Temple Bar. Im a light sleeper and all it took was some ear plugs and I slept through the night. An amazing value for a group - I stayed alone and it was still a great value for 1! Highly recommended.
Nice Clean apartment to stay in...is as described...nice and close to city centre.
Davids place is great for a group that doesnt mind the loud city noise. I liked the place I was just surprised how noisy it was late at night and early in the morning.
Amazing location and good value - only downside was the toilet being mostly unusable.
The apartment was fantastically situated, although it was a little tired and in need of a little TLC it was nice and clean we would definitely stay again.
Clean, great location. Would stay again.
Great location for all the action of Dublin
Cannot beat the location! Will book again next time we're in Dublin :)

You will absolutely love this spacious flat.  Simply and elegantly appointed, you'll feel at home right away.  You are in the heart of the city with all the amenities that city centre offers; however, you are also in the heart of the city with everyone else who is enjoying it, so you may want to bring a set of ear plugs just in case you are a light sleeper.  If you enjoy stretching your legs, you will have endless tourist attraction destinations at your toe-tips.  Less inclined to wracking up mileage on your pedometer??  Not a bother, as finding transportation in David's ideal location is easy-peasy.

David's place is perfectly located for seeing central Dublin.  
Some street noise early in the evening. An older place but clean,  neat and tidy.  
Good value for money.

Check-in and communication worked very well.  Great location in the heart of Dublin. 

Unfortunately the apartment is very old and rustic and the host should think about a refurbishment. We did not feel too comfortable in there. Especially for the high price we would have expected a higher quality. The "double beds" are very small and not ideal for more than 1 person.  The water pipes sound like they're dripping.  The inside is very sound sensitive and even with closed windows you can hear everything from the outside.
Ottimo
Nice place and nice area
What location !! A great place to stay.

After traveling Europe the past month, I needed a place that was close to everything and yet quiet and spacious. I FOUND IT IN THIS Airbnb! More than enough rooms to accommodate large groups or families. 

Its close to Temple Bar and City Center. The bus ride from the airport to the apartment was really fast and close. 

Your gonna love the quick replys and suggestions from the owner and the house cleaner. They are awesome!

Ill be back! See ya next time Dublin!

Lovely location to discover Dublin! Our hosts were quick to respond and provided an easy check in with our plane landing so early in the morning. They provided local favourite spots to go to and a few bevys in the fridge. Their home is beautiful and would love to stay again!
Linda is friendly and very knowledgeable on places to visit in Dublin, especially if you like music. She fed us breakfast every morning and had nice coffee too! What a nice place to stay.

Linda's place is the best location for a holiday or short term business travellers as it is halfway between the city centre and the airport.  Literally, all that you need is just 5 minutes walk away, a green and silent area where you could chill after huge hiking or a long night at the bar area. A bus stop with all the buses to the city centre/airport, 12 mins from Drumcondra railway station, restaurants, bars, a Tesco with reliable prices. The apartment is clean and you are able to start your day with a coffee and a croissant even in the garden.  Who book a hotel room nowdays? :)
Everything was perfect! Linda is really friendly and can also help with everything! Hightly recommend!
Lindas place is warm and comfy, with music-inspired decor and all the amenities - a first rate stay.

My research reflected this would be the best area of Dublin for it's "in-betweenness" ¶.  to the airport and the Dublin experiences.   Bus transport was "just" the right way to get around AND they all had open WiFi!!!!   The TESCO shopping center, near by, outfitted us with a good cell plan and Sim card.    Eateries & Pubs just down the block.    Had looked into other Airbnb's in the area but this one stood-out.

We had a great time at Linda's place, which is a traditional cosy house in Dublin - close to the airport and close to the center (by bus or taxi). There are nice places to eat out close to her place too, as well as a park and bus stations. The communication was good too as she was very helpful at all times and replied within max 30 minutes. Every morning Linda had a breakfast prepared for us and even asked us what we would prefer. There was delicious good (not filter) coffee and we could use the whole kitchen, Internet was good, bathroom very clean, the room cosy with kettle and tea and heating so we were never cold. Linda can give you recommendatiosn for Dublin and around, especially pubs and traditional music. we definitely recommend this airbnb :)
Everything was as described, we had a great time and would definitely recommend staying at Linda's! We especially loved the breakfast options ;) Thanks!

Een prettige ruimte, gezellig huis met gedeelde ruimtes maar veel privacy. Linda heeft het goed voor elkaar voor de gasten !! Wij hebben haar nauwelijks gezien of gehoord, maar konden via app haar altijd goed bereiken. Ze reageerde zeer vlot en behulpzaam. Zeer tevreden over dit verblijf.

Our stay at Lindas place was fantastic. She was caring and had great advices for discovering Dublin and the places around Dublin. We followed some of her recommendations and were so happy we did. Also Linda was always available and provided us breakfast and fresh towels. Shes living in a lovely little house close to Dublin city. I would book her place again if I go back to Ireland :)
Such a lovely person! Helped us with local knowledge... had brekky waiting for us every morning. Cosy bedroom and nice clean bathroom.. we loved it!

Linda made us feel at home the second we arrived for the visit. She was great helping with directions from the airport to her place and even made special accommodations for us to check in a bit early the day we arrived. Linda recommended great local spots to visit and day trips to explore areas outside of the city. Linda also provided breakfast every morning (pastries and coffee) and again went out of her way to provide nut free options for breakfast for a peanut allergy. I highly recommend anyone visiting Dublin to stay with Linda if they have the opportunity!

It was a pleasant stay at Lindas AirBnB. We really liked the local tips which Linda gave us!  Every morning she brings us a little breakfast, this was lovely. Also the connection from the AirBnB into the city was good, because not far away from there is a  bus station from where you come in between 20 minutes into city centre.

Quiet room, nice bathroom, well situated between airport and city center. Real nice detail: Linda bought some breakfast for us :) ..she was hardly at home while we were there (fine by us, we're shy ;-) ), real easy going as well :) .. very recommendable!
Really enjoyed staying with Linda. Nice comfy bed, lovely breakfast and coffee and I absolutely loved the garden
Great stay! Linda and the place were quite lovely - highly recommend!
Very nice place, cute little garden, calm neighborhood. We really enjoyed our stay!
Great host with a warm, welcoming environment- especially for a first time traveler! I would definitely stay here again! City Center was easily accessible by walking or using a leapcard for the bus!

ABSOLUTELY RECOMMENDED!!!!!
My stay with Linda was AMAZING!!!!! The house is extremely clean, we walk from the house to temple bar everyday, she left yogurts, bread, ham and cheese for us and gave us great local recomendations, she also was in contact everytime. THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

The Linda's place is very good. Clean, comfortable, everything works well, strong reliable WiFi. Location is a bit far (30 min walks to the center of Dublin) but if you are fit and energetic it's not a problem. Besides, you need to burn the thousands of calories of Irish food and Guinness! If walking is too hard, there are convenient buses, stops are 2 min. from home. 
Linda is an excellent host. Quick responses, great advice and suggestions. The check-in and check-out were a breeze. The breakfast food is delicious - yogurt, cheeses, cereals, juices, bread and of course tea, coffee. 
I would recommend this place 100%!
Great room in a residential area close to centre. Good opportunity to experience real Dublin life but still be close to all the tourist areas.

Sarah, Jhon & Jack are excellent hosts, the room is great and you have all kinds of help if you need it, we received a great deal and they helped us a lot. The location of the house is great in a quiet environment where you can relax and very close to the center. Thank you very much Sarah and Jhon for all our stay was unbeatable we hope to return soon to Dublin.

Sarah is an incredible host, she helps us with a lot of information to go around the zone. The room is lovely and comfortable. Fairview is a nice zone even for a beer or something else and really close to the city. Thank you Sarah, Paul and Jack

Sarah and her boyfriend made us feel very welcome. The room is small but you will find everything you need, like tea, coffee and cookies en Sarah made a map with usefull places to eat and take the bus. You can easily walk to the centre. No taxi needed (except to go to the airport).
2nd time Ive stayed, just as good as the 1st.

Sarah was an absolutely wonderful host and her place was cute and clean. The room was in the perfect location. Transport connections were great - bus running past the house into the city centre. Thanks a lot!

Quiet, lovely neighborhood and literally a 20 second walk from the bus stop taking you to the center (in 15 mins)! The view is of a pretty park so you feel like you're outside of town but is so convenient to go back and forth. Sarah is so sweet and the room is so cozy, it felt like a true BnB:) Highly recommended.

Thanks Sarah!
I had a really relaxed time at your place. Everything was clean and the recommendations were really helpful.
Clean and quiet room close to local bars and restaurants city centre.

It was a fantastic place to stay. My first ever Airbnb experience and definitely exceeded my expectations. Hosts were lovely and friendly and gave tips on sightseeing. The house is in a lovely, safe family area of Dublin. A bus stops outside the house so you are into Dublin city centre in no time. Everywhere was immaculately clean and tidy. I loved that Sarah had left tea and coffee making facilities in the room  and bottles of water. Bed was very comfy too. We intend to come back and stay again. Thank you!
Sara and Paul were really nice with us, Sara gave us a map and some recommendations to have a great time at Dublin.  The room was comfortable and well equipped.
Great host -- you get useful info and you can be totally independent.
Sarah and Paul were very nice ! The place is really well located, clean and comfortable
Good location, great price, and fantastic hospitality.

Very welcoming hosts in a lovely clean house with a very comfy room in a great location with easy transport links to get anywhere. 25 minute pleasant walk to the city centre. 
Lots of thoughtful touches like toiletries, water, coffee,tea, fridge with milk, plenty of bottled water, cookies, sweets, a good selection of books with the offer that you can keep one if you want!, well researched and written information on local travel places to eat etc. 
So much to recommend I've probably missed something out.
Perfect Airbnb experience at a fraction of the cost of Dublin Hotel prices.
My stay was wonderful. Easy check in and great communication. Very thoughtful touches including the makings for tea. Would highly recommend.
Not recommended.  Confined to a bedroom without a chair, and no access to TV or radio.

Sarah and Paul are  very welcoming  thoughtful hosts. The location is great as Marino is a friendly neighbourhood, it is  easy to reach the Centre but quiet at night,  local shops and bars and Fairview Park near to enjoy some peace after a day in a very  busy city. The room has good cupboards with shelves and hanging space, a kettle and coffee, teabags etc. The bed was very comfy and warm.  The shared bathroom and shower is adjacent and all were clean and convenient.  Sarah has excellent local information in the room and is happy to help but also able to give you privacy. An excellent reasonably priced place to stay which I very much recommend.  I will happily return!
Excellent place to stay. Host was friendly and fast in communication. Thank you Sarah.
This was the perfect spot for what I needed. Room was well equipped in a quiet area, and very cozy! Location was ideal for working in the city, will def be back!
Very professional hosts, private space close to the airport for quick travel to or from. Would recommend staying

This is perfect for when you have a flight the next morning! Spacious, clean space + they provided a helpful printed guide for how to get around, how to get on WiFi, nearby food, etc. Also, cute doggies!
The location is prime being so close to the airport for early departures. The mini fridge is also a nice little amenity.

Stayed one night at Julie & Audrey's flat. Communication was very good, and they were extremely helpful re. late check in.  The flat is only 10min from the airport, so very convenient if you have a late/early flight. The place was sparkling clean and had small details like tea/coffee and biscuits. The bed is ultra comfortable, and shower was good too. I would definitely return!

The apartment was even better than described. It is 5 minutes away from the airport - in handy when you have to take a late night or early morning flight. There are some supermarkets, restaurants, hotels, all very close, so you have all the accessibility.

The room and private bath - both were very clean and spacious. Julie and Audrey were excellent hosts. Highly recommended and definitely will book again when I visit Dublin!

I needed a last minute place to stay before catching a flight out. The location is right near the airport and easy to access. Julie & Audrey were very quick to communicate and had very clear instructions on check in/ out. The space was very tidy and clean and included a private bathroom.
Very clean and we loved that there was a booklet with local places to go and get food. Very close to the airport which was great for our flight the next day! Overall great experience!
Very convenient location, right next to the airport!
Really good living,near to airport. I will book again when I come to Dublin.

This is a great choice for staying near the airport. Julie and Audrey really have Airbnb visitors in mindîthey even have a hotel-style printed brochure with tips and expectations. It's an easy walk from the bus stop.
Julie and Audrey where super nice and the doggies were amazing. I would always recommend this place to stay if you are coming to visit

Julie and Audreys place is conveniently located close to the airport, it is super clean, with a very comfortable bed. Some nice touches were the juice and water provided in the room as well as coffee and tea. Audrey was very welcoming when we arrived and made us feel at home right away. Definitely recommend!

We stayed there just overnight so we can' t say too much. It was easy to find,  very uncomplicated to handle,  clean, 
 very good connection to the airport.
Perfekter Aufenthalt!
Outstanding hosts. The location is great and the hospitality is even better! We really enjoyed our stay!

Julie and Audrey have set up a wonderful space for guests in an extremely convenient location. They were wonderful hosts throughout - from communication in advance to providing great advice on travelling in and around Dublin. It was such a pleasure!

The Hosts for this Air BnB were super kind and accommodating. Audrey was kind enough to book us a taxi for when we had an early morning flight out of Dublin! They provide you with some tour maps and pamphlets which is very convenient. Everything was super clean and they even cleaned the place during our stay a refreshed our towels and things like that. Although we found the place seemed pretty far from the city centre its location is nicely beside the Dublin Airport which made our flight out at 6am so much easier and cheaper via taxi. My sister and I would both highly recommend this place!
Super professional and great place to stay! Very easy to get to the airport and city centre via bus from this location as well. Highly recommend.

Great place to stay in while visiting Dublin. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy, communication was brilliant. Its a 10 minute drive away from the airport, and half hour away from city center. Definitely would recommend!
This accommodation was everything they said it was. Highly recommended, I felt very comfortable.
The ladies were wonderful with information & super kind. Nice, bright friendly space. Can't beat the price!

The apartment is spotlessly clean and very modern and comfortable. It is accessible to Dublin City Centre and particularly Dublin airport. The area also has shops and cafes and a gym nearby.  Audrey and Julie were great hosts; they met me on my arrival after I had to change my arrival time to much later than originally planned. The bedroom and bathroom were separate from the main living accommodation, affording a non-intrusive overnight stay. I would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Really comfortable and quiet place, everything is clean and the little attentions like the amienities for breakfast are pleasant. The location is pretty convenient when you are taking a plane. Julie and Audrey were very kind with us.
FANTASTIC PLACE !! Such a lovely nights stay ! Immaculate beautiful home , Julie and Audrey are amazing hosts so welcoming and friendly ! Highly recommended !
Perfect stay for our layover. Five minutes from the airport.
Everything was lovely! I would stay again when back in the area
Sehr freundliche Gastgeberinnen. Sauberer Raum mit sep. Bad/WC. Geniale Lage zum Airport.

Room was as described and clean. We felt welcome and the snacks were a nice treat.
Great place to stay when you need a loaction close to the airport.
Flat is close to airport, cost around 10-12 pounds for a taxi from airport to flat. Clean and easy check in. Food within walking distance
Basic accommodations for those needing a quick rest. I really appreciated the help booking a taxi the morning I left.

I enjoyed my brief stay at Audrey and Julies apartment. It is close to the airport and was very quiet and clean. Audrey was kind to call me a taxi in the morning back to the airport - this is a great place to stay for one or two nights!
It was neat and tidy. A television would have been a nice touch but at the end of the day, this was an honest room with a clean bed and thats all I needed.
Clean, quiet & convenient.
Julie and Audreys place was perfect for arriving or leaving Dublin by way of airport! They are very detailed oriented adding treats in the frig and coffee/tea in the morning.

Julie and Audreys place was perfect for our last night of a long trip. They are very close to the airport and their apartment was easy to find. The room is well furnished with guide books, taxi and good info, and even snacks. The bathroom was very updated and had some toiletries also available. Check in was easy and the home was quiet. A bonus was getting to meet their sweet dog!

Julie & Audreys place is as advertised, a clean double room with your own bathroom, perfect for a day or 2 in Dublin, before or after a flight or concert. No sitting area in bedroom, so not suitable for longer stay. Close to public transportation, and a shuttle to and from airport at Holiday Inn Express, about 10 min walk from appartment

It was basically like staying at a hotel but in someones home! Location suited us to a t... we were flying in one day and flying out the next to Canada so being close to the airport was key. Not far on the bus to Dublin City Centre either although I think I'd stay closer if we didn't need to be close to the airport. 

Hosts were lovely and the bedroom/bathroom had everything we needed including some sweet treats!

The room was perfect for what I needed--a late-night stay between flights into and out of Dublin airport. There was coffee and tea and two pastries in my room for breakfast, the bed was so comfortable for a weary traveler, and they communicated the access information clearly. If all you need is a bed near the Dublin Airport  and access to a lovely bathroom, this is the place. Note that taxi fare from the airport is give or take 15 Pounds. Taking the 41 Bus from just north of the intersection of Swords Road and Northwood Avenue (a 15 minute walk) was 2.50.
Julie and Audreys place was perfect for what we needed. Super close to the airport and in a nice area. Had a very comfortable stay!

Staying with Audrey and Julie was such a wonderful experience! Their apartment was impeccably clean and organized down to the very detail. They made it very easy for us when we arrived and were very hospitable and welcoming, along with their VERY cute puppies! The apartment was very calm, quiet and conveniently close to the airport. The bedroom was equipped with a mini fridge with water and OJ, and the pasties and tea came in handy, since we had a flight the next day and no time to grab food. Audrey was even nice enough to order us a taxi for the next morning to take us to the airport. Also, the apt is just a short walk down the main drag to McDonalds, Costa Coffee and other shops. I would highly recommend this room to any dog-lovers looking for a place near the airport!
Simple clean room in a quiet green location close to the airport. Practical for a sleep over if you need to catch the flight early AM.
Convenient to airport by taking the crowne plaza hotel shuttle, then walk 5 min.

My partner and I stayed at Julie and Audrey's place during our layover in Dublin. It's a perfect location if you need a place to crash overnight. It provides quick access to the airport and it's close enough to take a taxi to Dubin's city center, if you want to and have time. The bedroom and bathroom for guests were very clean and included some basic amenities (coffee, pastries, juice, basic toiletries, etc). Julie and Audrey were very friendly hosts and they have the cutest trio of little dogs! I highly recommend staying here!
Julie and Audrey are great hosts and the flat is good located. Especially when you need to go to the airport in the morning it's perfect. We can definitely recommend it!

Julie and Audrey's place is in a great location if you need to be close to the Dublin airport! We were only a 5-minute car ride from the airport, which was great after two weeks of traveling. The apartment is very clean and their communication with us leading up to checking in was great. The only thing to note is that there is a dog in the apartment, which I don't recall seeing on the listing. We didn't see the dog at all, but heard it barking for a while when we did self check-in and heard it running around the hallway in the evening. It wasn't a big issue for us, but something to note if you are not into dogs or want absolute quiet during your stay.
Great place to stay near the airport..very clean and all you need for a night or two.

I stayed here during an overnight layover. Taxi there was 13 euros and I took the bus in the morning (~3 euros). The room and bathroom was very clean, cozy, and perfect for what I needed. Check in was very easy with a lockbox as the hosts were not home at the time of my check in. Would stay here again!

We used the room to visit Dublin. There are two bus stops in the near you can use to see Dublin. In under 10min walking there is Lidl and Spar.
Julie and Audrey are very hospitable, even though they are not always to meet.
The dogs were our highlight, they are so super cute and trustingly!

The airport is really close to that home!

Thank you very much!
Perfect stop for the airport. We had an early flight and a late arrival and they were perfect with accommodating our trip!
Lovely apartment close to Dublin.
If you want to stay close to the airport for one night to get there quickly, we can recommend staying there.
A lovely host conveniently located to Dublin airport. Highly recommend for a flexible check-in or late flight

Accurate description of the place, Julie and Audrey were very helpful and kind. The place is close to the airport which was perfect as we needed to catch an early flight the day we left. Close also to public transportation. Wouldn't doubt to recommend the place to friends in the future.

Julie and Audrey are some of the most well-organized Airbnb hosts that I have stayed with. The room is very comfortable and conveniently close to the airport. If youre looking for a good nights sleep before or after your travels, I would definitely recommend!

Hosts were lovely and friendly. The space is clean and modern. However we did run into a few issues worth noting:
1. This price is set for 1 person, unlike most other listings on airbnb. You will be charged additional money for another guest.
2. There is an additional cleaning fee, which may not be apparent without clicking on the additional cost section.
3. Response time is lacking with this host: I messaged them on July 28th with the exact question: Will there be additional fees that will need to be paid at arrival or check-out?ù Host responded on August 26 at 6:36 (less than 24 hours before our stay and too late to cancel per the cancellation policy) saying that they would be charging extra for another person. Response time of over 4 weeks later is concerning of superhostù status.
4. The apartment is 13 minutes from the airport by car per (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps (not 5 minutes as listed in the description.) If arriving by bus from the airport, note that its a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) minute walk from the bus stop.

All in all, I wouldve canceled and booked at a local hotel for the confusing fee structure of this shared space if the host wouldve given me a response in adequate time.
Ladies were compassionate toward a medical issue I was having during my stay.

Sehr hilfsbereite und freundliche Gastgeber und alles sauber. Super vom Flughafen zu erreichen. 
Jeder Zeit wieder. :)

This place was wonderful as it was close to the airport, reasonably priced and the hosts were very hospitable and had some of the best instructions! The space was cosy, clean and comfortable. Also really appreciated the signs on the door as it made me coming in late at night very easy to know where to go without risk of waking someone. I appreciated the little snacks and pamphlet with local suggestions. Would definitely stay here again if I was passing through Dublin!
Great space, hotel like standard with small touches that make a difference, even a mini fridge! And a sparkling clean bathroom. I will definitely be back if I need to stay in the area. Thank you!
Sehr zu  empfehlen. Es war alles sauber. Die Wohnung ist direkt am Park und nur 5-10 Minuten vom Airport entfernt (Bus). In die City ist es auch nicht weit. Gastgeber sind sehr freundlich gewesen.

Julie and Audrey were so sweet and accommodating to our needs. They have a great spot, with easy access to the airport and local shops and restaurants. Their home was exactly what we needed to end our trip to Ireland!
Expect a warm friendly welcome in a lovely clean room thanks the 3 dogs were a added bonus definitly recommend this accomadation

We loved our stay at Julie and Audrey's. They were both very kind and friendly and made us feel very welcome and comfortable. Their apartment is beautiful and very close to the airport and Dublin city centre. It's a great location if you don't want to be right in the city. The room itself was great. I loved that they included a mini fridge, kettle and some snacks. They also had a little booklet with all kinds of information on the area. It was very well done and came in handy. The bed was very comfortable and we had a great nights sleep. The bathroom was very clean and modern. I wish we had been able to stay longer at Julie and Audrey's as we loved their apartment. We would highly recommend their place!

Julie and Audreys place was a perfect little stop over for my one day in Dublin. Its super close to the airport, either a 15 min walk + 10 bus ride or a quick taxi will get you there for ‚Ç¨8-9. It was so cozy, they even had tea and coffee set out for my early morning flight. I took the bus into the city center and it was easy to navigate getting around from their place even without phone service. Thanks again for a relaxing stay during my stop over!
Great spot!
We had a lovely stay at Julie & Audreys home. Sparkling clean with thoughtful touches and really close to the airport.
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Beautiful location with fantastic views. 
Will definitely recommend for others looking for accommodation
Lovely apartment to stay in. Great location. Communication was excellent and check in was easy. would recommend to anyone travelling to Dublin :)

Great views and great location away from Temple Bar. If you want to be in the heart of things, this won't work for you. But, if you like to retreat to peace and quiet and the views of the quay, then you will find this suits perfectly! On the bus line so you can easily access what you want so it shouldn't deter. I have horrible feet and walking was not fun, but I still liked the local. The apartment was clean and sophisticatedîa little tired in placesîbut it is a rental. Could use some new paint to cover wear and tear and needs new calking as things are getting a tad mildewy in parts. But wall-to-wall windows and views make it worth it. Do not expect friendliness from this host. Its all business and expect no accommodation to your needs. Seems cagey to be directed to a coffee shop to NOT meet someone and be given directions but never be given an address your entire stay. I get being careful, but this borders on paranoid. Once you get the directions via text, they are detailed and concise. BE SURE to have your cellphone and What's App installed or you will be in trouble. Great coffee shops all-around and convenient markets for basics you can see from the balcony. Dinner at Osteria Lucio was beyond convenient and I recommend it. Do yourself a favor and get to Paulie's Pizza one night. A short walk opposite of city center from the apartment and you'll thank me.
Very cool place and great location!
Its a nice and clean place. The host was friendly and responsive. We received all the necessary instructions and information before we arrived.
Apartamento muy bonito, cerca del centro andando
Great stay, superb location
This apartment is beautiful and has the most amazing views! We enjoyed staying there and felt very comfortable and well taken care of.
This place is amazing, had an awesome view and the Host was extremely nice! If youre planning a trip to Dublin, this is where you want to stay.

The views from this apartment were absolutely amazing. There are windows everywhere! The electric blinds worked well, but they are not very dark so it does get light when the sun starts to come up. The noise from the road below is noticeable, even with the windows closed, so if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs. The location was great, we walked everywhere from here. The restaurant just across the street (Charlotte Quay) was very good. The apartment looks luxurious, but it just didn't feel that way. We had some trouble getting the windows closed because they were slightly open when we arrived and it was like a wind tunnel in the apartment. It had more of a corporate apartment vibe than someone's home and there were not any of the amenities that we have experienced in other places we have stayed (a few tea bags, some sugar, coffee). For the price, I expected a bit more than what we got.

Enjoyed our stay. I think I would choose to stay closer to town.  If you have your own vehicle, parking isn't that great of an option. The views are spectacular I must say. It's hard to travel with 5 people and everyone enjoy a hot shower...but everything was clean so we were happy :)
Great location, lots of little cafes and restaurants nearby.
Excellent location and views.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This is a really nice apartment. The check in process is a bit strange as you are never actually given the address throughout the stay. Still able to find it easy enough. The place is clean and the host is very responsive. The temperature was the main issue. It is June and the master bedroom was brutally hot all day and night. There is not air conditioning or much ventilation so the only way to keep cool is open the slider door in the living room. The windows do not open. We had two fans pointed at us (blowing hot air around) in order to sleep. One of the showers only has hot water. All in all a fine place except that it was way too hot.
Fantastic location in heart of Grand Canal near theatre and great restaurants. Easy walking into central Dublin.  Apartment very stylish, comfortable and immaculately clean.

Great location and beautiful and stylish space. It is located about 1 mile or two away from the busy city center. We liked it as it was very quite and peaceful and the views were so beautiful. There is plenty of space in the apartment. There are also some places to eat in walking distance as well as a grocery store. We love the balcony overlooking the water. If there was a bistro set out there it would be a very nice touch. Overall we had a good stay. If you have your own car it is expensive to park in the deck across the street. We paid 80 euros for two nights. If this would blow your budget you may want to look for another alternative. We enjoyed having a washing machine and a place to cook breakfast. Nice place.
