We had a great stay here in Dublin. It's located in an upscale modern area about 10-15 min. outside the City Center. There's a grocery store, coffee shops and restaurants all in that area, making it easy for our family to get essentials that we need. Going in, we expected the space to be a little tight since it is a high rise apartment, after all. As others mentioned, the rooms can get extremely stuffy. Opening the windows let in a cool breeze, however one of the room's windows was bolted so it could not be opened and we had to use the fans to help us sleep. Also, as others mentioned, the check in process was strange. I understand the desire to keep the location classified, but the process seemed like we were following a treasure map, while dragging along a ton of luggage. Despite that, the place was extremely clean and while it was not necessarily walking distance into the City, the bus stop is close to the apartment, making it easy to use our pass to get in and out. Overall, we would stay here again.
Fabulous apartment in a great location. Would definitely return.
Great apartment! Thank you so much for your hospitality.

Rude attitude by the host (Adam), he received us with the AirPods in his ears, walked in front of us few meters away  without saying anything.
We were told that our apartment had a problem one hour before our check in and that the new apartment would be more comfortable and modern Than the other one, however the quality was inferior and the extra beds were uncomfortable, the plumbing system in the bathrooms wasnt working properly too. The price stayed the same

Overall we enjoyed our stay. The location is great. It's a 20 minute walk to the city centre and there are lots of great restaurants in the area. The view is absolutely incredible (lovely view over the harbour and over Sillicon Docks, where all the big tech companies are located).
However, there were some issues with the apartment. It was not that clean and is not that well maintained, with lots of (small) things broken or in a rather shabby state.
The host (Adam) was kind and when we told him our issues with the apartment he was very understanding and said he would make sure they will be fixed soon.
So if indeed the issues will be fixed, I would definitely recommend this apartment.

Not a great airbnb experience for us, we would not stay here again. In short, the apartment was dirty, wasn't properly stocked with soap and towels, a lot of things in the apartment are broken, and they changed the keypad to a keyed lock in the middle of our stay. 

The photos in the add must be from when the apartment was brand new. It looks very clean in the photo and it not nearly that clean in real life. 

The couch from the photos is not the couch in the apartment. The couch that is there is black and the add calls it a "sofa bed" and it is not. It does open up, but it looks like part of it is missing because it doesn't turn into a bed. 

The add says " all towels and toiletries" and ours had shampoo and conditioner but no soap in the bathroom. 

The master bedroom shower has mold in it. I did not look at the other shower. The master bedroom carpet is dirty and matted. It looks like the water tank or washer has leaked at some point and ruined the carpet and it has not been replaced. 

There was a thick layer of dust in a lot of areas, especially the vents. So much so that dust would fall from the bathroom exhaust vent when it was turned on. 

The window in the guest bedroom does not open at all. We asked about that and were told that it indeed does not open and they are waiting on a replacement for it. That is a problem when it is really hot during the day like it was during our stay. One of the windows in the living area does not open properly and has duct tape around it. 

During our stay, we came home to a random beeping noise throughout the apartment. We thought it was the alarm panel so we text the host, who told us it was probably the curtains, which are on a remote. It was the curtains, and the only solution to stop the beeping was to flip the breaker that controlled the curtains, which we did. We were not offered to have that fixed during our stay. 

Also during our stay, I was contacted by the owner who said they wanted to come and change our key pad on the door to a regular keyed lock. After initially telling them we would be gone for the day,  I immediately text back and asked if they could just wait until our stay was over to do that because the key pad was more convenient for us. We had different people in our group that came and went at different times and we didn't to have to keep up with physical keys and risk losing them. That request was ignored and the keypad was changed to a keyed lock anyway. They left 4 keys for us in a broken and unlocked mailbox in the building entryway.

Fantastic flat with awesome views in a very up and coming neighborhood.  Easy check in/out  process. Plenty of room for two couples. Would highly recommend this to any visiting the Dublin area. Car park is available within walking distance.
Very nice place.  Really was a wonderful stay

The host, Matt, was very rude and not welcoming at all. He was patronising and had his ear phones in the whole time and couldnt take his eyes off his phone while talking to us, which I consider to be very rude. The only nice thing he said all weekend was please leave a great reviewù when we left. It lists there is a gym, pool and hot tub, which isnt completely true as they are in a completely different complex about 5 miles away.. That was one of the main selling points for us so was very disappointed to find out it wasnt really the case.

Apartment was really good, slightly dirty in the bathrooms. Great location. Blinds were pretty useless, might as well had not been any. Limited hot water in the showers.

This apartment is in an amazing location right beside a lot of good restaurants and bars and easy walking into city centre.

The structure of the apartment is great with giant floor to ceiling windows and a balcony.

However the apartment is looking and feeling a bit tired with many scrapes and marks, there are some floor standing fans put in which is great as due to all of the windows the apartment is warm and the master bedroom window no longer opens to let in fresh air.

There is a problem with the remote control window blinds where putting them up or down in one bedroom does the same in the other bedroom so when sharing best to coordinate with the other guests.

The window in the second bedroom doesn't close properly which is maybe why the other room has been bolted closed.

All in its an amazing location but the apartment is tired and could do with some investment and TLC.
A great apartment with good views of you are looking for something clean and contemporary for a weekend break. Priced competitively.
Very Stylish apartment. Absolutely above your expectation.

The location was great! Host was very quick to answer questions. Close to everything that we wanted to do. Eateries right outside of the building! The view was great! I locked myself out of the building and they were quick to respond and get me access less than 10 min after calling. Highly recommend this place!
The host canceled this reservation 50 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great, bright, modern apartment in an interesting part of town near great restaurants and the theater and a short walk to almost every other part of Dublin you may want to go to.
Good space.  Host had someone come to the apartment when we had trouble working out the heating/air-conditioning.
Good location and a nicely laid out apartment.
Great views and location!
The host canceled this reservation 19 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Really nice location and everything you need for your stay in Dublin. You can reach the city centre by foot in about 10mins. Angela is a really nice host. Fully recommend.

Andreas place is greatîclean, cozy, and stylish. She provides so many great recommendations for things to do in the city (with specifics for each so you dont have to do a ton of googling before narrowing down the options), information on nearest shops and grocery stores, and was so easy and helpful to communicate with from the day we arrived. Its a bit of a walk to the south side of the city but we managed it easily every day! A great place to stay in Dublin thats affordable and feels like home.

This is a very well located apartment for all the major attractions of the city, just a few minutes walk to Capel Street and Temple Bar. The bed was comfy and we found the entry instructions clear. There is a really nice cafe for quality coffee and breakfast downstairs. Would recommend for two.

I have to say, I was very excited about staying here, and it simply did not live up to my expectations. Andrea was very communicative and understanding, but didnt provide a satisfactory response to the fact that she lied about there being a hot tub in the property, Im sorry, but in no world does a bath count as a hot tub and this is not made clear in the comments. This property is expensive, even for Dublin but is not in the city centre and I have never said this before when staying in an air Bnb but I think a hotel wouldve been better (and cheaper) in this case. There was nothing overly wrong with the property, it is well kept, but it feels dated and it is quite cramped, we spent a lot of money on coming to stay here as a birthday surprise and were left severely disappointed as we had much higher expectations. I just think that several things couldve been done a lot better, I certainly have high standards though, and this is a fine place to spend a couple of nights in Dublin. I have nothing against Andrea as she is a lovely host but I am afraid that I feel my experience was very sub par.
I loved it! Andrea is very quick to respond, and the house guide was LOVELY and helpful for planning our day trips from Dublin. The place was cozy. Would come back!!

Andrea's cosy apartment is exactly like in the pictures - perfectly cosy, clean and only a 2-minute-walk away from one of the main streets with many places to go out, go shopping or just to get to many bus or train possibilities as well. The apartment was perfectly prepared when we arrived - even some tea and milk was already prepared (thank you for that! ;) ).
We will definitely come back once we're planning on visiting Dublin again - which we definitely will! :)
A very clean, cosy place in a brilliant location for exploring the city.

This place is cute and quaint. It's got everything you need with nothing you don't. Andrea is a wonderful host...I especially appreciated the timely responses to messages and all the great food recommendations. Be sure to go down the street to Jay's Cafe for an A+ scone!

My husband and I were very happy with Andrea's apartment. It was very clean and her bed linens smelled like they just came out the wash! Most places I question the last time they were cleaned. Everything worked properly. The wifi worked well. Andrea was attentive to our questions. It's a fair walking distance to city center or the new commuter rail is near by if you're not up for walking. Even the bar across the street wasn't too loud- at night shutting the bedroom door kept the noise out. Our only dislike was the hallway smells like sour trash all the time so maybe the people who take care of the building can do something? Overall it was a very good experience there.
Cute, comfortable, clean place not too far from many sites in Dublin. Fantastic local tips!
Andrea's place was fab. Great location, clean and looked great. Plus all her local tips were really handy and spot on! Would definetely recommend
We had a great stay!
Beautiful apartment and the location was excellent. We were very close to everyone we wanted to see. Andrea was very hospitable during our stay.
Andreas place was in a great location and was exactly what we were expecting! We struggled a bit with finding the check in instructions but Andrea was very helpful in instructing us to find the keys.

Amazing place with a comfy bed and a  great location only 15 mins walk from temple bar. Quirky and cosy apartment with a pub opposite if you dont want to venture too far. Andreas a great host, providing tones of Information about Dublin tours and the best restaurants. Would highly recommend and cant wait to return!

A wonderful stay at a unit as described by host. Bright, comfortable, attractively decorated apartment. Outside the Center City but readily accessible to many attractions  by walking. Kitchen has all needed items  and extra food incidentals are stocked. Washer and dryer  combo an added welcomed feature. Host leaves a detailed guide to area restaurants. The neighborhood is quiet except at night  the bar across the street can be heard. This noise does not extend into the bedroom in the rear so a peaceful nights sleep is possible. Heed the hosts note of apartment being on second floor (two up from ground floor). We are 68yo and found no problem walking up and down the stairs....but hauling  my large luggage piece up the narrow stairway curves proved to be  a challenge.

Andreas proper apparent is very well located so you can reach the city by foot or by tram. Thanks to her recommendations we found perfect places to eat in the neighborhood. Very good place  for a stay right in the city of Dublin!

Andreas place was great! It was easy to walk to most everything, and she left detailed suggestions for places to go for food, which we greatly appreciated. The apartment was very cute and perfect for two people.
Such a beautiful apartment in a great location! Excellent recommendations of places to see and eat as well! Thank you!
We had a good stay at the apartment, which is well decorated with anything you'd need. Andrea also gave a very comprehensive guide for places in the city which was quite useful.

My sister and I stayed at Andreas place this past summer of 2019. Andreas place is exactly as described! It is clean, cute, bright, and beautiful!! The pictures and location description on this site are very accurate. My sister and I were able to easily walk to city centre, or transportation stops. We did have a bit of a bad experience trying to check in to the apartment. Andrea had accidentally given us the wrong lock-box confirmation. As two visitors from a different country, without WiFi we had no way to contact her. We were able to take refuge and get WiFi in the cute pub across the street. But after reaching out to Andrea, it was quite some time before we heard back from her. we ended up just trying different combinations of the 4 numbers in the original code and were able to figure it out. Once Andrea did respond, she was very apologetic. We understand that it was just a mistake, but it was still very inconvenient and ended up consuming most of our first day in Dublin. However, after that initial mishap, we had a completely AMAZING trip! Andrea checked in several times to make sure that we were enjoying our stay. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at Andreas apartment! It is fairly price and very worth the money.
It is a beautiful little Parisian getaway in a great area of Dublin
Precioso apartamento muy bien ubicado.
Centrally located and well equipped - we really enjoyed our time at Andreas place. Andrea was very accomodating and gave us some great tips about the area. Highly recommend.

Clean apartment and very much like described. It is very centrally located, so we were able to walk to everything in the city. Andrea gave us some very nice food suggestions. I can recommend Brother Hubbards (good for lunch and fair prices) and Chapter One (Michelin star restaurant, so quite expensive, but their pre-theatre menus are very! reasonable priced). 
We would love to come back another time and use Andreas apartment again.

Andrea's place has everything you need for a wonderful weekend - especially appreciated the fresh ground coffee and super comfortable bed.

The location next to the tram line makes it a perfect hub for a weekend of exploring Dublin
Clean and very well appointed. On Tram line and bus was 2 blocks away. We walked to Trinity college from the apartment.
Andrea was so easy to communicate with, in a great location, and the decor was beautiful!

Andreas apartment is a cozy spot in a fantastic location. It is an easy walk to the center of everything or a quick walk to the tram stop if youd rather use that option. She was quick with responses as well. Directions to accessing the apartment/finding the key box to enter/etc takes a few reads to try and understand, but the pictures she provides do help a little. Super cozy bed! Overall, a lovely, very enjoyable experience!

Andreas place is very nice and cozy. It is a short walk from the city center and all pubs. The bed was very comfy and the apartment itself is very warm!! Andrea was very nice and left a bunch of useful recommendations for food. Thank you so much for your hospitality!
Very clean, very nice flat with walking distance of everything downtown. I really enjoyed my stay.
Nice and clean appartment located centrally in North Inner City

Rae is a fantastic host, who is very attentive and great company. The room and house were both lovely and the place felt like home for us for the few days we were there. There is a delicious breakfast of toast, coffee, fruit and spreads in the morning and always a good conversation with Rae!

I cant say enough wonderful things about Raes place! It was so sweet and what we imagined staying in a true Irish home would be like!  Everything was absolutely perfect. He had thought of all the details. The place is beautifully decorated! Has a great amount of space and was sparkling clean. Rae was so great with giving directions and helping us out when needed! He even went above and beyond to walk us to a place to help get our phones sorted out. Its location is great! Its only a short 15ish minutes bus ride to the area of Dublin when all the tourist activities are like St.Patricks, Temple Bar, Guinness Store Front and many others. Included with our stay was a breakfast! Breakfast was always wonderful and Rae told us lots of information about Ireland! If you are looking for a amazing place to stay for your trip to Dublin, then  look no further! Rae truly is a super host!

This was our very first experience in the Air bb world Rae is the perfect host, he went above and beyond on accommodations, suggestions. Being helpful an attentive is an understatement he made the first leg our time in Ireland most comfortable along with a great experience 5 stars for Rae

Simply the best ! Rae was the perfect host for our first time in Dublin : very professional indeed, but most of all a very nice person who never hesitates to give some visiting advices, has so many stories to tell, and is an attentive person by nature.
Moreover the house is beautiful and very confortable, we really felt like home on this journey.
So if you're looking for some great human experience while going to Dublin, I would warmly recommend you to contact Rae.

We loved staying here and especially getting to know Rae. His home is full of charm. 

We took the bus into the town center (but I would say it is walkable if the weather is nice. Be sure to have exact change in coins! The bus drivers can be grumpy, haha. It is 3 euro per person, one way.) Rae gave us a map of the city which we used frequently, and he also gave us a 20% off coupon for the Guinness Factory - which we also used! The coupon says it must be used by 11 am, but we went around 12:30 pm and they accepted it : )  We also went to the National Archaeology Museum and the Natural History museum (close to one another) and I tell you, these are hidden gems that I think most people skip! (Lucky us? Haha, there are no lines to wait in.) The Archaeology one has treasures and finds from thousands of years ago that I honestly have not seen anywhere else in any of the other capitals we've visited, and especially not in these quantities or so well-preserved. The collection is so unique. 

Rae's home is a great place to begin a leisurely start to the day - this was one of those weekend trips where we came without a plan and wandered everywhere. If we had planned a little better we would have walked over to Drumnagh Castle, which is nearby. It closes early on Fridays but you can still see the outside - we learned a lot about local history, traditions, and culture from Rae. He's a collector of interesting tidbits and memorable facts, if you mention what you're interested in he'll tell you all about it! We loved chatting over breakfast and we had a grand time :)!
This house and the interior is pretty awesome and the choosen furniture is quite extraordinary. It was a really good choice to go there!
Great location, easy access to downtown Dublin. Beautiful home full of unique touches. Enjoyed breakfast and banter with Murray. She was lovely with many helpful insights.

A very nice place to stay in Dublin. Rooms are very nice and cozy, especially the bathroom. If you like you can have a small breakfast and take a coffe in the lovely garden. The hosts are very hospitable and lets you feel comfortable.
A small but important detail, there are USB plugs near the bed.
The accommodation is outside of the center of Dublin, but good connected by public bus.
Friendly and helpful host
Our overall stay at Raes was good. It was further from the main attractions than we were expecting.

Raes place is great. Walking distance to town and nice cosy place to stay. Best part is Rae and his wife who are genuinely lovely people who went above and beyond to make us feel comfy and at home. Can't imagine a better place to stay in Dublin

This is a great place to stay! Rae gave a lot great information about how to get to his place and into the city using the bus system. The Airbnb is about 10/15 min outside of the city, but plenty of bus routes cross by his house so it was easy to get in and out of the city. Overall highly recommend!
Rae is laid back and has time to chat, give advice as needed, and when i had an issue with my car he was so helpful.  I saved hundreds of euro as a result.  Rae is restoring two old volvos!

Rae is a great host, always willing to help. He gave us great Dublin tips and places to meet outside the tourist route of the city. The stories he told us over breakfast were also great and will remain in our memories. Rae's house is very well maintained and very cozy. We stayed in the upstairs bedroom which is a good size. The bed is great. The bathroom is spacious and the shower very good and with good pressure. There is a water heating system that you need to wait about 20 minutes between the baths for the water to warm up again. We stayed there for 10 days and felt like at home. We have so much to thank Rae. The title of superhost is very well deserved.
A hidden gem in Dublin! Stayed on work travel and it was just superb
Perfect for a relaxed Dublin City trip!

Rae's place was perfect! great location, close to downtown, just a few blocks from the bus with car parking also available. his home was perfectly and uniquely decorated. loved the bathroom and garden in particular! he had coffee, tea, toast, butter and jam available for breakfast and was always hospitable and available to talk or with a word of advice on things we wanted to do. great way to start our Ireland vacation. thanks Rae!

Raes place was absolutely lovely. It was the most comfortable place & felt like home :) He was a great host & the space was so wonderful in a quiet area. Would highly recommend to anyone going to visit Dublin!!

Highly recommended for anyone wanting to stay within the easiest reach of Dublin - buses running every few minutes to and from the heart of the city. 

Rae's wonderfully furnished house of art, craft and quirky vintage pieces made it a most interesting place to stay. 

Muraed was the perfect hospitable  stand-in host, making us welcome and comfortable - sharing the kitchen and outside spaces, available to help with local guidance.

Rae's place is beautiful and obviously very well thought out. We didn't get to meet Ray but his friend Muraed was very nice and inviting. We loved staying in the house. However, there are a couple of things that would have been good to know upfront. When other guests arrived it turned out the sound easily travels through the floors. Also, turning the heater on for the shower is something that needs to be planned in advance. And you'll spend extra time and money traveling from and to the city centre.

In short: if you're looking for a super quiet and luxurious stay close to the city, this may not be it - but if you're on a budget and looking for a comfortable place outside the city centre, Rae's place is perfect :-)
You will find a little paradise in a big town.
Rae's home was quiet and very comfortable.  We certainly felt welcomed and at home.

We spent two nights at rae's lovely house.  We were welcomed very hospitably, the communication was excelent and everything was perfect.
Highly recommended.

Such a beautifully style home. Would recommend to anyone. 

Muraed was an excellent and welcoming host! :)

Raes place is a charming cottage stay just outside the heart of Dublin.  Exceptionally clean, well taken care of with darling personal touches, its quiet but not far from all amenities and attractions. Its easily accessible by all transportation methods. Everything I wanted an Irish cottage to be.

My partner and I stayed at Rae's place for 3 nights.
Rae was a formidable host. He gave us great recommendations about things to do in the city. He is a very friendly and interesting person and we had great discussions with him.
The house was well located (~45min walking distance from the city center) and very clean.
If needs be, we would stay again at Rae's place without any hesitation and we would recommend anyone to do so.
To be welcomed by a passionate person
Raes place is super. Cool and quirky house but most of all a generous and kind host. Full of stories and local knowledge and really helpful on getting around Dublin. Highly recommended

Wonderful experience at Rae's lovely house!
It's cozy, clean, convenient, with everything needed for a travelling stay. The location is a bit suburb but quite near the bus stop. Since Dublin is actually not huge, it is not very faraway from the city center, like less than 30min bus ride. 
Rae gives detailed instruction for the stay as well as for our tour in Dublin. His recommended restaurants all turned out to be nice places. 
The most highlight is Rae's artistic interior design with many his own nice handcraft as well as many collections of good old things. He also maintains his lovely yard with sweet rasberries, his studio for all sorts of handcrafts and also his passionate antique car and motorcycle collections (and reinventions)! we even took a pic with the most retro-style Volvo. Highly r ecommend to everyone who wants to have an interesting experience beyond just a place to sleep!

This beautiful and extraordinary accommodation was absolutely one of our tops. 
The room was furnished with a lot of lovely details and we directly felt home. Everything was very clean and in shape. 
The hosts Rae and Rosa were so heartily and kind. 
Rae welcomed us and show us around. 
The house is so cute and fully equipped. We didnt miss anything. Several buses are in a short distance and it takes you not too long to get to the center.  
Rae was so concerned about our well being that we felt like visiting a friend. We highly recommend this place and if we ever get to ireland again well surely stay at Raes
Rae was a lovely host and his house was very clean and cosy! An easy and short bus trip into the centre of Dublin. I would highly recommend a stay at Raes!

My wife and I really enjoyed our stay. Its located in a quiet neighbourhood and it was quick and easy for us to get to and from the city center by bus. Rae gave us a lot of advice for getting around Dublin and places to visit. We really appreciated the friendliness and hospitality and enjoyed getting to know Rae. Would highly recommend and would certainly stay here again!

I had a wonderful time staying at Rae's. He is an excellent host who accommodated an early check in, replied quickly to messages and provided a map with plenty of advice about the area and tips for how to get around the city more quickly. The rain head shower was worth the price to stay alone and I'd be delighted to stay in Rae's stylish, well decorated home again.
Rae's home is a uniquely Irish experience. He has lovingly restored his place and now shares it with his guests. Rae has a wealth of information about Dublin and is a gracious host.

Rae was a grand host, very informative, welcoming and friendly, his place is meticulously decorated with antique and handmade pieces that made you feel like you went back in time. Rae's place is close enough to town that you can walk, we did several times, it catch the bus for a quick ride. We will seek this host out again when we are able to get back to Dublin.

Rae was an amicable, lovely host with such a beautiful home and garden. It was a pleasure to stay with him, get a thorough run down of local sites, and chat over tea and toast. We hope to see him again on another trip!
Superb alternative to a hotel. Close to lots of amenities, 2 minute walk to the Luas, and easy to get up into the Dublin mountains.

Terrific place. Was there for business. Quiet location. Aldi 5 minutes walk and the tram to Dublin 3 minutes walk and 30 minutes ride. 

Spotlessly clean and minimalist.  Excellent!
Functioneel en behoorlijk ok
Paul's place is great! I definitely recommend staying if you're planning on visiting Dublin.

Paul's place is located just a short walk from the city center and is perfect if you're working near Grand Canal Square. One of the airport shuttles stops less than a 5 min. walk away and there is a small supermarket crossing the street which makes it comfortable. If you check in during the specified hours there will be someone to meet you, so there is no need to do the self check-in.

This apartment is in a great location. It's about a 15 minute walk from the city centre. There's a SPAR grocery store just across the street which was very convenient for buying groceries. The place was very clean when we arrived and was nice for our stay!
Nice appartment, central and quiet. Communication with Paul was easy and quick. I recommend this place.
Very convenient place, well localized and clean !

We stayed two nights at Pauls appartement. His friend left us the key in a safe box with all the information and photos to locate it easily. It was really convenient for us because our flight was a bit delayed.

The appartement is well located in a quiet area, all clean, tidy and with all the equipment you might need (hair dryer, domestic iron, washing machine, ..).

I would definitely recommend anyone to stay at Pauls place to enjoy a good trip in Dublin!

Paul is a very good and attentive host.
The apartment is very well situated in Dublin close to the docklands and the city centre.
It has everything which is needed for a pleasant stay in Dublin.
Iver
Great space and in an amazing location, easy walk to city attractions and the elegant neighborhoods around
Very pleased with this accommodation. The building is safe and in a great location. Had everything we could ask for. And I thought it was a good value as well.

Paul is a great communicator.  My many questions were answered almost immediately.  The apartment is an a great location .. we walked everywhere.  We also like the fact that there was a Spar Grocery store at the end of the street.
Great experience - everything was smooth and place was clean

Paul was a great host.  The check in process was super easy and his location is right near the bus stop for the bus that takes you to the airport.  So super convenient. 

He was also very thoughtful in providing us a pack n play for our baby.  That was very helpful.  

Great host overall and wed definitely recommend staying with Paul.
Good place to stay for shorter trips if traveling party comprises of adults only and do not plan to cook much. Secure and convenient  location.
Clean, comfortable and great location. Sleeper sofa very comfortable..Totally recommend Dublin Bike Share!

Comfortable bed, good shower. Has balcony, intercom and microwave. Excellent location very close to town short walk away with amenities nearby. Little misunderstanding regarding location and check-in but host refunded me taxi fare which I thought was very good of him.

Pauls place is in a nice quiet location. Just a few minutes from a bus stop that can take you from and to the airport directly.
Sparking clean space with a great view to the outsides.
The place is well described and a wonderful stay for us. Located near the main attractions.

The location was very good, all the main things were within walking distance. Paul was accommodating with our check-in time and getting the keys was convenient. Place is clean and cozy, equipped well to allow us to cook there as well!

Paul's place was perfect for my business trip. Located on the 5th floor of an apartment building with an elevator, it was quiet, convenient, and located walking distance to my office along Grand Canal. There are convenice stores, restaurants, pubs within minutes walking distance. Reliable wifi, clean bathroom, and washing machine were all great!

This is a great little flat in a lovely area - close enough to centre that nothing feels far away but far enough that you arent surrounded by tourists. The Merrion square is right there which is a gorgeous park and lots of great cafes. 

Paul was quick to reply and provided a cot and big hair which was a great help
Great place. Couldnt have asked for better

Clean and quiet. A great place to come
back to at the end of a busy day. 20 minute walk from so many great things to do or see!
Great stay at Paul's place. Everything was perfect.

Pauls place was great! The apartment was super clean and spacious.  Check in was very simple with the lock box and Paul checked in with us to make sure everything was okay once we got there and if we needed anything.  The apartment building was in a great location and was very quiet.  The bed was spacious and comfortable.  There were plenty of towels, pillows and an extra comforter under the couch.  While I did not use the kitchen it was stocked well with plates, cups and silverware.  I did use the washing machine and it worked great! No dryer but I hung my clothes up and that worked just fine.  I would definitely recommend Pauls place to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable stay in Dublin.

Great flat in a quieter part of Dublin but only a 15/20min walk to city centre, plenty of buses, taxis or city bikes at the end of the street.  Sparkling clean, spotless bedding, well equipped, sofa bed very comfy for our 6ft son. Paul very kindly arranged an earlier check in time due to our earlier than expected arrival time, very accommodating and responsive to all our enquiries, offered local information. We would highly recommend this accommodation and location, near the canal, within short walking distance of some great eating places around the Grand Canal area, highly recommend (Website hidden by Airbnb) and HQ, great food and service. The sun shone, had a great stay in Dublin.
Perfect location.  Clean, bright, quiet, and includes every amenity one might need.  Hosts are very easy to communicate with. Recommend this apartment to anyone coming to Dublin!
Can't recommend this flat enough - Paul was super helpful in all his messages and the flat itself was great. Fab location and has everything you could need!

Paul's place is super convenient location wise and is right next to many of the tech offices near by - great for a work trip! The place was spotless and had all the basic amenities you need. Everything worked well and the check in was easy and very clear. I would absolutely stay again when traveling to Dublin.

I would highly recommend this spot to any of my friends and family. The apartment is a great home base for tourism or working. It's an easy 15 minute walk to Trinity College and to any of the tech offices. The space was clean and cozy and checking out was also a breeze. Thanks, Paul!
Paul's place is great. It is very centrally located and easy to get to and from. There are good coffee shops nearby. Most of all the apartment is very clean with great new appliances.
This is a cute and quiet apartment, but very basic. It needs upgrading (hooks in bath, drain cover, paper products, blackout drapes and extras) to justify the price.
Check in directions were a little spotty but once you got into the apartment, it was exactly as described. Thanks for hosting!
Great stay in a quiet neighbourhood but still only a short walk away from the city centre.
the stay went perfectly. the apartment is on top, big, clean in the heart of dublin. I advise him. Thanks brian!

Lovely room, lovely home, lovely host. 
Mary made me feel very welcome and could not have been kinder. Highly recommended.

We had a great weekend & the apartment was in the perfect position for walking to everywhere. we didnt have great weather so we caught taxis. The apartment was just what we needed - it was quirky with 2 bedrooms in the ceiling space. Denise was very helpful and her husband. Thank you
This is a cute apartment in a great location for exploring Dublin.

Located around a 20 minute walk from the centre, the apartment is located in a strategic location for exploration of the city. 

Apartment was adequate for 2-4 guests, but not the sort of place you could spend a lazy morning, but then Dublin isn't that kinda city! Great little cafe on the corner which does amazing breakfast, and make our Lidl groceries redundant. 

There are some niggles which have been recommended for improvement.
Excellent stay at a lovely apartment!

Denise's place is lovely. It's very centrally located and definitely a home away from home. We had such an amazing time in Dublin. The special touches of breakfast food was lovely as well. We will be back soon!

I've been travelling with airbnb for over 6 years now and Denise brings back the BNB to what hardly ever is offered any more.  She provided a kitchen which was well stocked with staples to let you immediately set up house - we were even able to cook up a breakfast our first morning without going to a store.  The lodging is conveniently close to busy O'Connell Street and walking to and from there is easy and safe.  Just a word of caution though about wandering further to the east or south-east from there - it gets sketchy fairly quickly.
Very nice little place close to the city! Denise is a really nice hostess.

We really enjoyed our stay and the city. Everything you need was in the apartment, and a lot of extras (like fresh fruit, a full refrigerator, and all kinds of shampoos etc.) The location is perfect, since everything is in walking distance. The only con was the thin walls and noise of the water pump, which gave us some problems sleeping.
Amazing! A good 10 min walk out of town but totally worth it to have a bit of space and such a great host!
Denise was amazing. We had a great time, place is in a great location and we walked everywhere. Cant wait to come back.
Very nice place, hosts are friendly and helpful.

Great apartment with character in great location. Compact space but fine for our group of 3.Used sofa bed which was very comfy. Great communication- quick to respond to any queries. 10 mins walk from Dublin City centre so ideal base for a Dublin break.
Had a lovely stay here. Denise was great. Would definitely recommend!
Denise's place is stylish and in a perfect location.  I highly recommend it!!

This is a stylish Georgian studio apartment that has been turned into a 2 bedroom apartment which is in a great location which makes it easy to access everywhere in Dublin. Denise leaves out a tonne of leaflets for her visitors to find their way around Dublin and to get the best value for their money! Denise is very flexible when it comes to being a host and is extremely generous and kind, communication between her and myself was nothing short for excellent! She has also signposted everything in her apartment to make yourself feel a little more at home from the lights, to the WiFi and to the immersion. Definitely a fantastic apartment and host for excellent value! Will definitely be looking to book here again for future experiences in Dublin!

Denise's apartment is very cosy, clean and confortable, feels like home. Denise is so nice and full of attentions. The location is perfect, calm neighbourhood, central and near bus stop toward the city and the airport. Will surely go back there if travelling to Dublin again.
Great positionwith great views over the city
A lovely apartment in a great location. Really modern and enjoyable place to relax as well.

there is free parking in the streets from 7pm to 7am and that the street parking is half that of the parking station. The guided tour of the Glasnevian cemetery was great. It covers the history of the making of Ireland and those that died to make it a united and independent country from England.
Excellent accommodation in a great location.
Breathtaking views on entering the apartment. Location 10/10. Value for 6 people outstanding. Can highly recommend.

Great views from 11th floor full length windows and balcony over the docks, and about a 15 minute walk to the City via the riverside and a few good pubs.
A few issues with the windows, but a quick call resulted in 2 fans arriving really quickly. Very modern apartment and well kitted out.

Apartment not clean, windows taped shut in bedrooms and living room.  Only one remote for all of the blinds in the apartment.  No separate one for bedrooms so all of the blinds either open or closed.    Sofa bed very uncoformable and needed a mattress.  The view was amazing which is why we close the apartment - however it is overpriced and disappointing that it wasn't clean.
Apartment is in a brilliant location and the views out over Dublin are amazing. Clean apartment and Communication is excellent. Would definitely recommend to anyone and would stay again.

This place has an incredible location and beautiful views.  The only downside is the description indicates there is a hot tub and this feature is not actually located on the premises; guests have access to a hot tub located offsite.
The apartment was lovely and in a nice setting. Had everything we needed for our trip.

The flat is modern but tired.  It has a fabulous view of the city,  it is well placed for the city centre and the bed linen and towels were clean. 
But, we found check-in instructions unclear - initially we were told we would meet the host at a meeting point and he would give us instructions for the flat and parking. At that time we were not told where the meeting point was and had to ask when we were actually in Dublin. The host did not meet us - we were texted a key code. No help was given about parking, a second request was ignored.
The  entry code key pad to the building was very difficult to use (needs replacing) and the flat itself needs deep cleaning and some maintenance. The fridge was quite smelly and the shower controls in the second bedroom were poor. There was no remote control for the blinds in one of the bedrooms so they could not be opened or closed. The bed had the most uncomfortable  mattress I have ever slept on.
All in all the flat served a purpose as we were only there for two nights but we found the whole experience very impersonal. We were asked for our time of  departure as soon as we crossed the threshold which left us with the feeling we were on some kind of conveyor belt.
Well located  apartment with great views over Canal area and easy walk to centre of town. modern apartment, recommened.
Great location and there are lots of lovely restaurants and bars nearby. For a quieter place to stay away from the main area of Dublin.

High-rise with apartment on 12th floor which appeared different than what was pictured. Windows are taped shut with duct tape thus limiting air flow except from the slider on the balcony. No furniture on balcony. Three fans in unit. We visited in early July and temperature in apartment was hot due to limited air flow. Linens clean.

Overall this apartment is BEAUTIFUL and the host was very responsive, after we had a few issues. We arrived and it wasnt cleaned properly and basic household items (dish soap, dish scrubber, etc.) were not provided. The host immediately purchased the essential items and had the unit cleaned during our stay but still wasnt up to what we were expecting. A few items advertised were slightly misleading (hot tub and gym) and not conveniently provided, which was disappointing.
It's a bit hard to locate but the location is great, we returned our car when we got there as parking is an issue. It's perfect for 4 people.
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
A few problems around timely responses with check-in instructions. Also no fans provided and all windows sealed, so couldnt effectively cool the unit. Great location and outlook. Well appointed.
Great location close to coffee shops, restaurants, train station, and supermarket. Bus stop just down the street. Amazing views and good space!

The place was suitable as a base to stay in which was close to the temple bar area. The apartment had fantastic views but was tired and had a lot of cobwebs and dust. The bed sheets and bathrooms were clean though.
In a great location and very modern! However, maybe cleanliness could have been dealt with better.
Great apt.  and location
My family and I loved staying at this place.
OTTIMA POSIZIONE
Great location and views but it wasnt as clean as we would expect and some basics were missing.
Well located place close to Bord Gais theater. Clean, comfortable beds.
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Amazing location, really central with all the amenities and space you could ask for.

Namestitev je odliƒçna. Vse, kar ƒçlovek potrebuje na potovanju. Lokacija namestitve je ravno tako odliƒçna. Do letali≈°ƒça je oddaljena pol ure, do centra mesta 15 min (izven prometnih konic). Avtobusne linije do centra mesta so v neposredni bli≈æini stavbe, postaja za letali≈°ƒçe je na drugi strani Samuel Becket mosta. Ker je namestitev  obrnjena v atrij stavbe, je ponoƒçi popolna ti≈°ina. Stavba ima dvigalo. Namestitev ima tudi balkon.

Michele is an amazing host, so thoughtful, communicative and went above and beyond to help me with check in and recommendations. 
The place itself is nice and comfortable, she thought of everything and the house is clean, cozy, well situated near the train and walkable to downtown. I would stay here again and again. Thanks!
Michele is a fantastic host who is considerate, welcoming and goes above and beyond your expectations.

If you want a perfect clean, friendly and silent house, this is what you need. Michele is the perfect guest. She waited my arrival at 2 am. 10-20 minutes to the center of the city. Easy access by tram or walk. The room is perfect for a bedroom. For all my futures visits in Dublin, this will be my first option. Thanks, Michele.
Had a super stay at Michele's. She was a very thoughtful and kind host. I can highly recommend her Airbnb.
The host canceled this reservation 52 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 40 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
This is what the AirBnb experience should be - straightforward, easy, cost-efficient and welcoming :)

Okay.  The place looks great in pictures but its cuter and cozier in person. Michele is fantastic and all the things you would want in an Airbnb host. She will answer all your questions and leave you to do what you want.  Her home is welcoming and she keeps it spotless.  Coffee and tea and fruit are always available and she brought in fresh bread from the bakery.  Really cant say enough good stuff about her and her place.  Its a tiny little historic neighborhood of little row houses that is surrounded by lots of construction (thanks to a burgeoning tech boom) but I didnt hear any of it.  Thank you Michele for a great introduction to Dublin.

I was travelling for work to Dublin attending an intense academic conference. I stayed with Michele for my entire trip and I could not have chosen a better place! The location was perfect with a short walk to the conference venue. Michele is the epitome of an Airbnb host - kind, caring, accommodating, upbeat and always on top of everything. An early morning check-in was not a problem and greatly appreciated after a red-eye trans-Atlantic flight. My room was just as described but I would like to highlight a large and comfortable bed that you can just melt into after a full and stressful day. I also had a private 5-piece bathroom all to myself! The flat is just like Michele - inviting and warm with the cutest backyard where I ate my dinners almost everyday. I highly recommend staying with Michele at her place.
Michele was very friendly and professional. The area is quiet and quaint. Short walk to the CCD, and tram stop. If you are like me you will be glad you stayed here.
Michele is a very friendly and attentative host. Her place is clean and cosy. The room is nice. I recommend a stay at Michele's place if you're travelling to Dublin!

Michele is a great host.  The place was very close to the Dublin Convention Centre, where I was having my conference.  The place is very clean and tidy.  Michele also made an extra effort to provide the breakfast you asked for.  Many thanks Michele.  I will definitely recommend it.

This is such a charming & cozy place to stay. The photos dont do it justice. Its a peaceful haven from the busy city but still so easy & quick to get around on the LUAS. Michele is a thoughtful & easygoing host. It was perfect for my long business trip.

It's a beautiful house, with a little cute garden, quiet, and near a tram station to the center of the city. Michelle is a lovely person! Kind-hearted, extremely polite, with great hospitality and always a big smiling. I would love to come again and again:)
This Airbnb is lovely and is in a terrific location, allowing easy access by foot to all of the popular tourist attractions in Dublin. We walked throughout the city and had a wonderful experience.
Fabulous stay and beautiful accomodation. Thanks Bridget!
Great location and full of homely comforts

Luke was very helpful in letting me make a last minute reservation and arranging for me to get into the apartment while he was out of town. As noted in the description, the room itself is quite small, but the bathroom (private, but not en-suite) is quite large, though unfinished. Overall, a very basic space, but complete with basic necessities.
Luke is a smart and pleasant host. The communication and the stay were very nice.
Luke is so hospitable and the location is really beneficial if you need to get to UCD. I would really recommend staying here.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Luke was a very good host. He was very hospitable, friendly and I enjoyed chatting with him and about his amazing experiences travelling and meeting people from around the world. He also had dinner prepared, unfortunately I already had my dinner so had to decline the offer. 
There was a leak in the room that morning that Luke had fixed. When confirming the booking he had warned me about it and said that he is not sure if due to the rains it may leak again. Even when I was at his place, he offered to cancel my booking if I felt it was worse than how he had described it over the phone. I liked his honesty. (fortunately there was no leak while I was there, even though it rained all night)
Place was fine. Bathroom was in the middle of repairs during my stay and wasn't very presentable. The room is quite small and there was an unpleasant odour in the bedroom/apartment.

She was very accommodating and helpful. Our plane arrived before check in time but she allowed us to bring in our bags and park our rental car there early! She also gave us recommendations on places to visit and the directions to them too!

Penny's little granny flat is a sweet, compact and very stylish abode. Perfectly situated for a sassanach doing the Dublin night run. Her recommendations for local venues were spot-on and the added touch of providing some toys for our daughter was very thoughtful.
Perfect place for 3 people. Nice and clean. Close to bus lines, pubs, and market.

I've stayed at Penny's place twice now, so I'd guess that's a pretty good recommendation in and of itself. It's a clean, well-kept spot in a quiet neighborhood but it's just a quick bus ride away from the city center. There is also a beautiful- but long- walk to Poolbeg Lighthouse that I highly recommend. Great place to stay, especially if you need to get to the airport in a hurry- it's only one bus stop away.

It was absolutely amazing staying here. Pennys house is quaint, clean, beautiful and very comfortable. She was amazing! Wonderful human and place to stay. She helped with places to go, restaurants, printing out a boarding pass because we had an emergency, and so much more. We had an amazing time!

Penny was very accommodating and welcoming, she allowed us to drop off the luggage and get the keys early which allowed us more time for sightseeing. We really enjoyed our St Patricks Day in Dublin. Thanks Penny
We had a great stay at Penny's, she was prompt with replies and very helpful. Would recommend!

The apartment was enlivened with the brilliant art of the hostess, who was warm, welcoming and a pleasure to get to know.  Ringsend is a fabulous location for getting into town or just taking in the port views!

We enjoyed Penny's place - found the location to be good. Only a half mile to the bus and to the tram which we used very often in the four days we were there. Only like 15 min bus ride to the airport which was also helpful for us when it was time to go home. I booked it because of the garden area behind the house, but we didn't get to enjoy it because of the weather. Sleeping space was plenty for three people. We really only were there to sleep as Dublin has so much history we kept ourselves busy seeing everything! It was a great trip!
Great location for Dublin airport comings and goings. Space was well appointed, comfortable and clean. Great value.
Nice place. Penny is a great hoste and caring. Would love to come back some day

Penny and her husband are very friendly and helpful. They had the room ready when we arrived early in the morning. It has everything you need. Great place to stay. Would come back anytime. Thank you for a great stay.
Penny was a great host, very easy to communicate with and very friendly. The place is clean and has all that you need on a visit to Dublin.
Pennys place is a delightful gem - just a short stretch of the legs from downtown, so much artful charm. Would definitely stay again!

If you want to experience staying in an Irish home, I would recommend this. Penny has a cute little place next to her house (apartment) and she could be reached for any issues you have. The place is nearby enough to catch the bus to other parts of the city. My experience was good as it was my last day before returning home.

Great compact space just outside of downtown. John was great in communicating with us, and check in was easy. Buses are plentiful to downtown, just aa few blocks away fro the apartment. We left our bags w/ John for a few hours after check out which was a nice perk, as our departing flight was late in the day.

We came for 3 night with our cat and that was perfect ! Penny is really kind. 
It s an lovely apartment perfect for 2 or 3. The apartment is totaly new ! Thank you again for everything !!

The place was even nicer than the pictures showed. It was a 30 minute + walk along the lovely Liffey River to downtown, which we enjoyed very much. Nice and quiet, very smooth communications, clean and very sweet little apartment. You will not at all regret booking with Penny!
Friendly service, good location close to public transport

Penny and her husband are warm and friendly people. We felt really welcome. Her place has a nice location close to Dublins Docklands and is easy walking to explore the rest of the city. Rent a car and explore the surroundings as well, like Glendalough and Newgrange, or coastal towns like Howth and Dalkey.
Penny was super nice and my friends and I enjoyed our stay. She was also very accommodating in letting us drop off our bags earlier than check in which we appreciated.
Great quiet location but still in the city! Instant coffee maker was a LIFE SAVER & the beds were super comfortable!
Nice, clean place to stay! Penny and John were very accomodating and friendly. About a 20-25 minute walk to downtown Dublin. A great affordable option for staying in Dublin!

Pennys place is well appointed. It does have a washing machine which is lovely. The garden is quite nice. It is about a 15 minute walk to get to the house from the 747 bus stop and unless you want a long walk a bus ride is needed to get to the city center. Penny is very responsive to communication and the check in process was extremely easy.
Super nice and welcoming. Place was cute and exactly as the pictures showed. Thank you :)
We had a great stay and an ideal location within easy walking distance to The Point makes Pennys a great find, will definitely be back again.

The space was very clean and cute. It was about 20 minutes outside the touristy areas, but in a quite area near the docks. The pullout sofa was surprisingly comfortable for two people and the shower was great!

This place was great! Just a walk over the bridge 10-15 minutes to the Luas where you can get all around Dublin. The place was very clean and had everything we needed and if not, Penny was very helpful. Their adorable dog was a plus!
Very nice location, 30mn walk from trinity College. Clean and tidy stay for two to three persons. Host is reactive, and has nice attentions.
Penny is a great host and the flat is great, it is very comfortable. She gave us useful tips about the city. The tram and the airport bus stops are close just few minutes walk from the flat.

Penny is unmatched in how great she is as a host! This place is great, opens up to a little back garden/patio, has lots of sunlight, includes maps, is close to transportation, and has everything youd need. Penny is an amazing host! Every question we had, she answered. She was generous and gracious, offering us thread and needle when our diaper bag ripped. Our one year old loved exploring the house and back garden. She made great local recommendations on top of all that. Great end to our trip to Ireland!
Great experience .
Great cosy place, lots of great local tips, comfy bed, good location for 3 arena, RDS and aviva stadiums. We had a great stay!
Great communication, easy check in and out.

Penny's Airbnb already looked good in the advert, and we were not at all disappointed when we arrived! It's a very cute little apartment, tastefully furnished and decorated, supplied with anything you could ask for, very clean. The best feature however, for me anyway, were the big windows/french doors out onto the garden. When you came back from the mad bustle of Dublin, this was like a haven of calmness where you could unwind. 
Check-in was easy, Penny was so willing to accomodate our wishes, quick to answer, so helpful with all information we needed. We were given many tips and help to get around, and there were cute, handwritten boards with recommendations for places to eat and stores to find all around. The location is great, right by the harbour, but because the house and especially the garden are set back from the main road, you wouldn't be able to tell. It's very quiet. Stores, restaurants and pubs are nearby, and you also find the bus stop there from where you can get to the city centre in 10 minutes. It really is a great base from where to explore Dublin! 
We will definitely be back if we ever travel to Dublin again and if Penny will have us! Thank you!
Die Lage der Wohnung ist toll. Gleich bei der S-Bahn und dem Flughafenbus. Und gerade bei Ebbe kann man am Strand laufen.

Pennys little apartment is a lovely place to stay if you visit Dublin. It is in a very quiet end of the city, but still just a short taxi ride into the city (or 20 min walk).  We found it very well appointed with many thoughtful touches. It was very clean and found the beds to be very comfortable. Penny and John were very gracious and safeguarded our bags upon our early arrival until checking time, allowing us to explore the city encumbered.

Penny's place was perfect for me for my last day in Dublin. It was located in a nice quiet neighborhood, but accessible to buses and shopping. It was close to the ferry port and easy access to the airport.
John and Penny provided lots of suggestions for local eating and drinking. The space was nicely decorated and had loads of nice extras like tea and coffee available.
Thanks for the great stay!

Pennys place was so peaceful and relaxing yet so close to all the local amenities. We walked into Dublin and back and that was such a lovely walk. Its a perfect spot for where we needed to be and I wouldnt hesitate to stay again.

The place is in the quiet area near the port. It takes 7 minutes to walk to the area central place with a couple of shops, pubs and a bus stop to the city centre. If you are determined to walk you should spare half an hour or a bit more to reach Trinity area. It leads along a very busy street though so it is not a pleasantly walk. 
It takes 10 minutes by bus nr 1.
The garden you have to share with the hosts and lovely singing birds early in the morning. The flat gives you all the privacy you need. The peace and quiet literally lulls you to sleep.
PS.
Watch out for dog poo everywhere along the pavements.

Penny is a super friendly person. We had a good tea and a long conversation. The rooms are fiedly, modern, open and very clean and very well decorated. We loved her Paintings.

We enjoed our stay and playing with her Dog. 
If we go again to Dublin we will come back.
Really good location, very clean and spacious apartment

Within a couple of minutes of being in Pennys place we knew we would come back for our next stay in Dublin. Penny couldnt have been more accommodating, she was absolutely delightful and so helpful. Even throughout the house there were whiteboards full of info and tips (Like bar recommendations). We had everything we needed, including a food cupboard full of tea and coffee as well as jam and milk in the fridge. While it is a 40 minute walk to the centre of Dublin (near-about Temple Bar), it was a straightforward walk with lots to see and cafes along the way. It was a very straightforward check in and check out process, and the whole time we felt completely at ease. It is a home from home.

My friend and I stayed at Pennys for 4 nights and it was one of our favorite places we stayed! Penny was so kind and helpful, and gave us lots of tips on the best restaurants around the area. It was a beautiful house, and everything was very clean. We would absolutely recommend to a friend!
Immaculately clean, lovely little flat with pretty garden. Highly recommended.

A quaint little place in a quiet neighborhood away from the bustle of the city center. We chose it mainly because of its relative proximity to the airport and ease of parking. Easily connected to the center by public transportation as well as taxi. Penny is a great host, very responsive and hospitable. The place was clean, comfortable, cosy, and matched the description. Definitely recommended!
Very nice and cosy place. The pictures dont do right to it as its bigger than the pictures can show. Very good isolated, comfy bed, clean, quiet area.

Pennys place was an absolute gem. It was in a peaceful location just a short walk from downtown, and the community was so friendly! Dublin is an awesome international city, but Ringsend has maintained a small town, authentically Irish charm despite being located next to a major metropolitan center. It was so nice to come home every night to the quiet seaside smells and sounds! The back garden was charming, the house was tastefully decorated with care, and it was exceptionally clean. But best of all, Penny and her whole family were so warm and welcoming. I would HIGHLY recommend this space to anyone, especially those who love the hustle and bustle by day, and peaceful sleeps in an Irish village at night:)
Phenomenal host! Super kind couple. Accommodating and able to fulfill all your requests! Great location, value. Clean! Would stay again!!  thanks for everything Penny and John!
The cutest space and the kindest hosts! Only stayed for one night but it was very conveniently located and was sparkling clean! Would recommend!
Penny is very warm and friendly person!
The place is very relaxing!!
Amazing place to stay, will definitely be staying again in the near future

We stayed at Penny's place during a weekend in Dublin. It's a really nice place, clean, comfortable and well equipped and the communication with Penny was also good. The neighbourhood is very quiet at night and very well connected to the city centre and the airport.
Penny is such a nice Host. The apartment was lovely. If I come to visit Dublin again, I would stay at Pennys.
Great place and hospitality.
It was pleasant to stay at Pennys place. The rooms were cosy and clean! Highly recommended for staying!
Very nice!!

Penny was a wonderful host and the house was beautiful and always clean. Great locations, and the neighborhood is very quiet and safe. Penny would always ask me if I needed anything else, she is a kind person and polite ,respectful of her residents' privacy, and it is evident that she takes pride in offering folks a nice place to stay.

Lovely place and lovely hosts. The listing is very clean and comfortable and most of all quiet! John and Penny were very pleasant and included really nice touches like providing all the necessaries for breakfast, probably the last thing you think about when traveling for work! I had a very pleasant stay and will definitely stay again.
Great accommodation in a good location.  Very many good tips and recommendations.  Perfectly equipped (including sockets adapter)
It's a great cozy place. For being a base of operations while exploring Dublin.
Great home to borrow for your vacation plans. Short walk to a great village and the DART station which made getting to town easy. The owners were always very helpful and accommodating!
Lovely house at a great location- close to playground and sports ground and Dalkey. Rory was very responsive to our questions.
Great communication and comfortable accommodation

One word : waow !
What a place we have discovered, even more, what a person we have discovered.
We were just looking for a simple evening out of town, but Dorothy made it simply beautifull.
Her house is a wonderfull home just by Malahide which is very convenient for a nice walk/diner in town.
Also her house is a very warm place, very clean, quiet, and very comfortable. Our room was more than we expected, every detail needed was there for us, and had a great night sleep.
In the morning, a very nice breakfast was waiting for us and we loved it. We even got to chat with Dorothy while having coffee and shared intersting stories with her.
We recommend this place 100% and look foward to see Dorothy again.
Great place to stay, great communication, easy check-in, and lovely light breakfast.

What a memorable time!

My husband and I stayed here for the first night of our honeymoon to recuperate after the long flight. The neighborhood is so peaceful and quiet and the bed was so comfortable we were able to get some much needed rest. Another plus is that there is a beautiful park with a castle within walking distance as well as plenty of restaurants. Our absolute favorite part though was Dorothy's superb hospitality! She cooked us a lovely breakfast that we'll never forget and she helped us figure out the train schedule to get to our next destination. Oh and their dog is absolutely delightful and so adorable he was the cherry on top of this wonderful experience!

Thanks so much Dorothy!

Thank you for the hospitality. Great room and bathroom. Super nice little town and great restaurant tip. Best bed of our ten-day trip. We will be back. 
In addition, a very tasty breakfast. Homemade small raisin particles. Love it.
Great location, Nice apartment
David was overall a good host, we had an issue which was caused a little bit of agro but his team dealt with it although could have been quicker
Great place
Great location. No hot water for showers despite being told the hot water was turned on. Housekeeper very pushy and invasive when checking out etc eg knocking on door for us to leave.

Must choose Davids when coming to Dublin!
Location: Very central. Close to DART/Busaras (main train/bus stations) if one chooses to travel outside Dublin City.
Accommodation: Too good.  Clean. Spacious. A nice two bed apartment with a balcony. 
Value for money: Definitely a positive. Except, one would have to pay ‚Ç¨5 every day for electricity so dont forget to add that to the total.
Great location.

Our stay was perfect, a lot of little things really pleased us. First of them was the ideal location close from everything you could ask (only walk for 4 days) while being realy quiet and peaceful. 
You can also enjoy a huge number of TV Chanel from every country.
Great surprise was also the very comfortable beds after a long day or night.
To sum up : highly recommanded !
Nice apartment near temple bar an public transport.

We were a family of 5 adults beginning our trip in Ireland. We found the beds very comfortable and slept well. The location was perfect for our activities. We went to Trinity College, Vintage tea tour. David was easy to communicate with. We will stay again!
Good base for a weekend in Dublin. A short walk away from temple bar (10/15mins). Or a 6‚Ç¨ taxi. safe and secure. Good communication on check in. In a nice part of town. Would definitely book again.
Carla, the care taker was very friendly and helpful. Very central location and the apartment was very spacious. Would definitely recommend this apartment
Great base from which to explore Dublin. All the main city centre attractions are within walking distance. We had a great 3 night stay.
Davids place was great! Him and his caretaker were quick to respond whenever I had a question. The apartment was clean and walking distance away from most attractions.
Lovely place. Large. Location was great, we walked everywhere!
Great location. Clean apartment. 2 bedrooms and 1 air mattress to fit 5 comfortably. A little difficult to communicate with caretaker, but overall worth the value!
A very nice apartment, in a convenient central location of Dublin.
Confortable y cerca de O'Connel street
Great stay - don't feel like the previous pictures or reviews do it full justice. No issues found, 4 people comfortably fit for the weekend
Good location, good value and a good all round trip!
Easy access to the city centre ,walking or public transport . Comfortable living area, away from city noise . Perfect for a city break .
Muy bien.

Awesome location, sun-drenched space, a balcony, a bath tub, a washing machine, and a TV system with heaps of movies.  Great for busy travellers looking for a place to relax with all the most valuable amenities.

Great location!  Easy walking and transit nearby.  Unit could use a little TLC, as looking worn in some places.  Think electric bill should be included in rental fee -  paid 5 euro per day for 9 days and were hardly there, which we thought was a bit steep.  Unit says it has two bedrooms and an air bed, and we assumed the air bed would be available to use if required.   When we asked where the airbed was, expecting it would be available in a closet, the caretaker said we did not mention it in the reservation, and it was not on site. No offer from caretaker to get it for us.  So, when we had two family members stay over unexpectedly on a couple of nights, we had to sleep on the living room floor.  Air bed should be available in a closet in case it is needed.   Overall, pleased with the rental, and would recommend it if you want to walk around Dublin.
Great host great place

I booked this apartment for mother for a one night stay, the Communication with David was very quick and professional. feedback from my mother was that she loved the place and would stay again, keep it up David and thanks to Carla as well.

Very nice place! About a 20 minute walk to temple bar area. We were late getting into the city and they were very flexible and able to meet us an hour and a half later than expected! We had five girls, two full sized beds in separate rooms and a queen blowup mattress in the living room. Worked out perfectly for us!
Nice location and clean space. Carla met us at the unit, and was very thorough in her welcome
Great place, secluded enough but still walking distance to major spots. Would stay again.

The apartment is really well located and the basic services are functioning well. We had problems with the cleanliness of the apartment. I also recommend that both parties respect the check-in and check-out times, especially after traveling more than 17 hours, we just wanted to get to the place to rest.
A warm welcome, clean apartment and close to amenities you. You can't go wromng booking with David
Davids place is very spacious, and makes you feel at home (plenty of coffee, shower gel etc). Defects with the flat were acknowledged by the caretaker instead of ignored and left.
This place had lots of space for our group of four. Away from some of the more touristy bits of Dublin but close to tram stops, restaurants, and lots of pubs! Would stay again

This place is a nightmare. 
Carla was very suspicious of me because I was traveling alone and kept asking me to confirm how many were staying. One thing the listing doesnt mention is that you need to pay for your electricity (¬£5 a day per person) you must pay in Cash/ on your phone as you are checking in. 
While you pay for electricity, not all of the lights work, the power stopped working on the outlets because I plugged in the electric fireplace. After waiting 30 minutes I got a text back from Carla saying that I was not allowed to use that and I was in the wrong for trying to but this apartment is COLD. Im warning you right now, the pictures make it look better than it is. It is run down, uncomfortable, and over all for the $275 I paid for 3 days, not worth it in the least. I would have rather spent $25 more and stayed in a hostel. Its dirty, I had to sleep on the couch the first night because the sheets had hair in them and I had to hang them up to dry. 
The washer (works horribly and smells like mold) in the kitchen had old cloths in it from a previous guest (Im assuming) and the cooktop was very slow. 
Im warning you now, dont let the location get you because in this case, it is not location location locationù it is bad bad badù
Save yourself, you need to be highly intoxicated to get though a stay here. 
As the days went on, I noticed more and more things that were dirty and broken. I took pictures when I arrived because I dont trust that Carla will tell the truth when it comes to something being broken, based on how she was acting when I first arrived. 
This was a super upsetting stay. I recommend finding elsewhere.

This house is very misrepresented. As I was looking for the hairdryer and iron I found drawers of junk, closets with luggage, plastic tubs full of stuff (clothes maybe?) The shelves are full of books, mail, knick knacks, an almost empty bottle of alcohol. I'm pretty sure someone lives here on a normal basis (which is fine, but I would like to be informed of that). Never found the iron, by the way, which I needed.  Had to pay ‚Ç¨5 a day for power, I was aware of that. But Carla made me worried I would run out of power. When I checked out the website to top up (just in case) I couldnt use it because I do not have an Irish phone number. So I lived in the dark for the first day worried I would run out of electricity.  I ended up figuring out how to check my electricity usage and by the 4th day as I was leaving I had 3 days worth of power left. (The website states that for a whole family ‚Ç¨25-28 a week would be average) So ‚Ç¨5 a day for a solo person that is touring the country is overkill.  So I paid for electricity for the rest of the week for whoever lives there. And if no one does live here,  the apartment needs to be cleared out of all unnecessary objects and half eaten food. 

Couch had a hole, chair seat was ripped, tile floor had huge chunk missing, coffee table was marred up, dishes all chipped, silverware bent beyond repair. Cords duct taped to walls. Dead flowers left on the coffee table. Half used bottle of tomato sauce and some ham in the fridge. Open corn flakes on the counter. Bathroom was decent, shower walls were funky though, stained grout had been painted over. No bathroom garbage can. Towels were like sandpaper. Bed was springy and uncomfortable.  Light fixtures hung down in front of doors and I was constantly worried about ripping the paper shades. Front door lock was a pain. Tv was basically useless,  only youtube, and you couldn't even use the search feature,  so I was stuck watching the popular videos that popped up.  Creepy phone on the wall that when picked up you could hear someones tv and living noises. I actually wanted to leave, but didnt want to pay for another room without a guarantee of getting my money back, so I just sucked it up and stayed. 

Location was pretty inaccurate. 5 mins to guiness, yes. But not 15 mins to trinity college, my Gps said 28 mins. Bad neighborhood.  Route home was dark and scary to walk at night.
Nice place and the area is quite convenient if you want to visit Dublin, but still have quiet nights.
Poco recomendable

Very nice quiet place only a short walk to pretty much everything. Lots of local options only a block away. If you are a sports fan following games, this place has every channel on the planet so you never miss a game/show/PPV.... Great service and no complaints.
Everything was fine. Thank you
Lovely apartment and extremely good location, walking distance to most places we wanted to visit in Dublin.
This appartment was very close to food outlets cake vegie and meat shops. Transport around Dublin was within easy walking distance. In all very handy for a tourist.

Excellent place, excellent location, and excellent host!

The property is located within a few minutes walk of all kinds of Dublin attractions, which made getting around very easy.

The property itself was a great home-away-from-home with all the amenities you could need. Someone was there to meet us at check in and show us around, which was very helpful, and checkout was fast and simple, which was convenient because we had a VERY early flight out.

The rules of the property were concise, and completely reasonable. Our hosts really knew how to make our stay as comfortable and accommodating as possible. It really made our trip to Dublin great.
Beautiful clean place, Carla was very welcoming and good location.
