The cleaning person needs to do an inventory of amenities and organize the little bit of closet space so there are places for the renter to unpack.  We drank instant coffee, and had to fix the shower door so it would stay closed. She was quick to respond to our texts, but really didnt have any solutions to our issues.   Would not stay here in the future.
Everything was all right.
Nice location.
You can expect a nice a functional space in an area of town with close access to the main areas off Dublin. The park next to the apartment is beautiful although the birds are quite load at sunrise
Deirdre is a great host and apartment is situated in a perfect place! Close to everything, in a calm neighborhood with a great view:) definitely recommend staying there
A wonderfully comfortable apartment in a great location! Also stunning views onto a beautiful  park! Deirdre was very welcoming and helpful. Highly recommend to stay!

Location was great, with easy access from airport and a 10 minute walk to the city centre. Getting access to the property could not have been easier, with Deidre responding to my messages within minutes. The bed was very comfortable and although the flat faced the road, it was in a quiet street.

Clean apartment, comfortable bed, good location for walking to town. Perfectly fine but nothing special. Lacks many details and is very loud at night, you can hear everyone in the flats around you and there's a lot of street noise. Host asked us to pretend to be her friends if her neighbours ask so I'm guessing she isn't supposed to rent it out, was sort of awkward. The shower is pretty horrible, the water pressure is weak, took me 10 minutes just to get my hair wet enough to wash, got to the point where I didn't even bother. We asked 2 weeks early if we could check in a couple hours early because we were coming off a 30 hour travel time, she said we could leave our bags with the cleaner (which we were not comfortable with) but she could not accommodate us early. As I said, perfectly fine but nothing special.
This is a cute, stylish studio/flat in Dublin. Lovely view. A bit removed from attractions, but still very walkable. I thought it was a good value.
Location location location. 1 easy bus from the airport, near theatres, and a short walk to Trinity college. Great for a quick stay in Dublin. Also, huge ceilings!
The flat is in walking distance to Dublin downtown and therefore well-located. It has a big window with a very nice view into the park. Communication with Dorothee was perfect. I enjoyed may stay.
Place was in the heart of things in a quiet neighbourhood.

Deirdre's place is perfect! It's an easy walk to local pubs, restaurants, Trinity campus, Museums, Dublin Castle, and more. It's also really adorable, and is right next to a beautiful park, which was a nice surprise when I arrived in Dublin. Her place is very clean, smelled amazing, and had everything I needed.

Great location and cozy little apartment ideal for a action packed few days in Dublin.
We walked to all our tours within a 15 to 25 minute stroll or if we wanted to go out for a meal or drink. We found one pub that was good value and it was nice to be welcomed by the locals plus farewelled on our last day. We had a rental car so there was plenty of parking outside the building and Deirdre provided parking permits. Deirdre was always available and checked on us daily, she even offered us a free night if our flight was being delayed/cancelled due to the tornado that was due to hit on our last day.
We would definitely stay here again if we get the chance to visit Dublin again.

Not the best Air Bnb experience we have had.  In future we would stay on southern side of Dublin as I believe this is a better area.  The walk to Temple bar is quite long and a bit concerning. Some maintenance issues when we arrived did spoil our stay in Dublin.

Flat was great! Take note of the fact that this does require a flight of stairs which is noted but may not be understood by some. The first floor in the U.K. is NOT the ground floor. Stairs were not a problem for us and the space was as described. Its a small studio but the space is used well and its perfect for a couple or single person. Theres a charming park next door. Transport is easy in Dublin but you will need to walk a couple blocks to the bus stop. Easy to get around and close enough but may not be walkableù to the action for some. Maybe a 15-20 minute walk to city center/temple bar area or a 5-10 bus ride. Space was clean and communication was easy and quick. Great stay!

Deirdre's place is exactly as shown in the photos.  Deirdre was a really good communicator and allowed me to check in early after an overnight flight, which was much appreciated!  The apartment is about a 10 minute walk straight down the street from the more touristy area.  The Spar grocery store around the corner was great for supplies and there's a fairly new cafe called Clement & Pekoe less than a five minute walk down the street.  Breakfast at Lovinspoon, less than a 10 minute walk down the street, was also great!  Deirdre's place offers great value in Dublin for solo travelers (as I was) and couples.

Thanks again for a fantastic stay at your beautiful apartment. The location was perfect to walk 10min to the city centre and close to walk to all the main city attractions. Everything we could of asked for. Deirdre our host was incredibly informative and regularly checked in and made every possible effort. Deirdre provided recommendations for food, activities and many more. Any questions were answered very promptly. Best value for money.
Great little studio in a beautiful location on the local park. Dierdra was very helpful and always responded quickly.
A nice studio apartment in Dublin. Close to many restaurants and things to see. Deirdre is very attentive to her customers needs. Very quick to respond.

A wonderful spot! Close to anything you need and an easy bus ride to the city central.
Lots of fun
Geen recensie

Good size and location.
Everything well used and basic. Needs updating.
Nice, cozy apartment with a quiet and peaceful neighbourhood.
Rosmarie was an excellent host. Her house was terrific!
Rosemarie made everything really easy for us. The place is great: big and clean with all necessary equipments.
The house was sparkling clean when we arrived. Only 15-20 mins from city centre.Would really recommend staying with this host!

Rosemarie goes out of her way to try to make your stay a good one.    Very responsive in communicating before, during, and after the stay.   Able to accommodate some smaller last minute tweaks to our plans and went the extra mile to ensure the place was clean after the last renters.   House is in a great location (close to the city and easy access to major highways and bus stations), on a quite / low traffic street, and has a private driveway   which has plenty of room.
The house was perfect for our use, communication was brilliant and i couldn't fault Rosmarie from start to finish she was a pleasure to deal with. Thank you.
Everything was Wonderful. Great Hospitality from Mrs. Rosmarie.

Yvonne's house is about 20 mins away (by bus) from the city center, it's quite close to the bus station but may need to check bus timing all the time. 

Communal areas especially the kitchen and the garden is spacious. 
The neighborhood area is quiet and silent.
if you are looking for a very warm welcome, tasty specials and good place, you are right here

Yvonne and her family made this vacation a wonderful trip to remember.  Their home was our haven to return to after busy days exploring.  We were greeted kindly upon arrival and our suitcases were carried upstairs to a very clean room.  All our travel questions were answered patiently and knowledgeably by Derek.  Our privacy was respected and yet we were welcomed to join them at their table, which we did often in the mornings....healthy breakfasts included in this amazing rate!  We felt right at home and enjoyed this family, including their 3 fine sons and 2 cats.  If we ever return to Ireland we will stay here!

A nice quiet house located in a beautiful neighborhood of Dublin but well communicated with the downtown by bus. The room was clean, bright, spacious and comfortable, with no luxuries but you don't miss anything. The wi-fi goes perfectly, so you can work or watch movies or be connected all time. The hosts are very kind and worried that you are comfortable, you can share tasty breakfast with them and their lovely boys -and cats.  They made the stay even more pleasant.

Lovely host and accommodation. Just a short bus or tram journey away from Dublins city centre. Host was very helpful at giving tips on what to do in the city and was a pleasure to stay with. Would 100% recommend.
Yvonne and her family are so friendly, they provide a lot of facilities and help. It has been a good experience

Yvonne and family are so kind and friendly. They helped us settle into a new city. Their house is clean and has amazing amenities. The room is just as clean and cozy as advertised. The bus stop is right in front of the house so you can easily access the city. 

She went out of the way to get a crib for our baby so that he can sleep okay at night.

In short, we came as strangers and left as a family. I will truly be grateful for whatever she did for us.
Great stay. Accommodations were good, location was very quiet but handy and the hospitality was excellent.

great place to stay. very close to everything. one thing is the kitchenette is only a toaster over and microwave, so a little difficult for proper cooking. it's not a problem for me, but if you want to eat in it may be a challenge.
Eamons bedsit was an excellent place to stay. Impeccably clean, well-locates, and exactly as advertised. I would certainly stay with him again.

This space exceeded my expectations. The room was small but clean with a cozy feel. The attached bath had a wonderful little shower and the kitchen appliances were perfect for preparing /reheating takeaway. The location of this place is ideal. Its located in a highly safe-feeling area of town yet only a short walk to the trinity college area. Note** apple maps misidentified the address as being a little down the street but (Hidden by Airbnb) maps got it right.

It was nice, clean and quiet place to stay. Eamon was waiting for me on time as promised. I appreciate good neighborhood - close to the Aircoach bus stop (fast and reliable connection to the airport) and a hotel which hosted a congress I've attended. Thank you veru much, Eamon, take care.

Eamon's place is a perfect location for solo travelers!!  I found the neighborhood to be safe and very walkable to nice parks, restaurants while not being in the middle of all of the madness.  Most of all Eamon was very hospitable and responsive.  I highly recommend!
Great little place with everything a lone traveler would need.
Friendly host, good communication. Quiet location, ideal for my purposes, would use again.
This is very clean and convenient location for a single traveler.  A very safe neighborhood.

The bedsit was very clean and comfortable and the one I stayed in (#4) was just perfect for a solo traveler.  I always felt safe both in the bedsit and in the neighborhood.  Public transportation stops (both buses and LUAS), grocery stores and restaurants were within walking distance. 
Eamon responded promptly to all my emails and provided me lots of information regarding Dublin and the area.  Check in/out was uncomplicated. The bedsit included a little kitchenette with a toaster oven , microwave, small refrigerator, sink, assortment of dishes and supplies to make coffee and tea. 
I will definitely consider staying at Eamons again if I travel to the Dublin area.

I guess the start of my stay sums up the rest of it.  Caught the bus from the airport which was running a bit late, walked around the corner from the neighbouring street and saw Eamon standing out the front.  Much to my embarrassment hed sent me a couple of messages which Id managed to miss.  On entering my bedsit I was almost scared to put my bags down, it really was that clean.  It wasnt big, but more than makes up for its size
with its comprehensive range of facilities and very clever design.  Eamon is a terrific host, full of information and tips.   Before my stay he was good enough to send a lot Id really interesting information about Dublin including comprehensive  location directions, making the property very easy to find.  Its very close to the 145 which heads right through the middle of the city and departs about every 10 minutes, is about 10 minutes away from the Charlemont stop, as well as being within easy walking distance to a variety of dining options as well as a large supermarket.  If I return to Dublin I do hope this AirBNB is available.

Eamon's place in a great location for visitors to Dublin and Eamon is an extraordinary host. You can stay in comfort and walk easily to Trinity College, St. Stephen's Green and many of the main museums. You are also close to buses to get around town and to and from the airport. Don't miss walking over to the many restaurants at Ranelagh Village.
Weiterzuempfehlen, sauber, freundlich, gute Lage, netter Gastgeber. Alles gut!

Eamons place is nice and cozy and perfect for a visit to Dublin. I think there are other Airbnb rooms on the property but wasnt able to hear them from my room. Nice touch of mini kitchen, motion sensor lights in the hall, and cozy personal living room. 15 min bus ride to downtown and maybe 25-30 min walk. Close to st Stephens Green. In my top 5 Airbnbs Ive stayed at.

Excellent apartment in a gorgeous area of Dublin. This apartment has everything you need, the wifi is excellent and its sparklingly clean. The tram and bus are within walking distance and there is a supermarket around the corner, which is helpful. Eamon is a considerate host and will ensure you have a pleasant stay.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Eamon's  and will strongly recommend his place to all friends and family planning to visit Ireland. My stay truly exceeded all expectations. Eamon was not only helpful in sending me additional information and answering questions I had prior to arriving in Ireland as well as offering suggestions the day I arrived, but went out of his way to make me feel right with a few  personal touches and a very nice gesture at the end of my stay.  

Will definitely stay here again If I visit Dublin.


Thanks for everything Eamon
Clean room,  warm enough on cool summer days, cool enough on hot summer days, well-equipped kitchen (much beyond expectations). Fast internet.

Eamon's place was absolutely great. It was supper clean, in a great quiet location near the canal and airport bus stop. Eamon welcomes you kindly and is always there to help. Overall this was the best Airbnb that I stayed at on my trip.
Great experience
Great tips on how to get about; very helpful.

Eamon was a super friendly and caring host. He was always ready to help. 
It was really important for him that I felt comfortable! 
The apartement was clean and cosy, nice bathroom and kitchen with everything I needed.
The neighbourhood is calm and its very easy to go to the city centre. 
It was a pleasure to stay at Eamons place!
Great experience great resource
Eamon is a great host and his place was perfect.

Generous, helpful and thoughtful host, Eamon made my first AirBnB experience a pleasure. I couldn't fault the property, the host or the experience.
As a single traveler, this property was perfect. The location was ideal - close enough to walk into town but also accessible to multiple forms of public transport.  
Highly recommend both the property and the host.

Eamon is a great host!  He was welcoming and helped me check in with my bags. The room and bathroom were very clean, equipped with a kitchenette for you to heat up your food and make tea/coffee, and the bed was comfortable. I truly appreciated the thoughtful touches of the Irish and Canadian flags in my room as well as the tea, coffee and biscuits available for you to enjoy. The location is quiet if you want to be away from the busy city centre yet close enough to walk or take transit to get there. Thank you Eamon for a wonderful stay!
Nice, cosy and well-located place with a very friendly and helpful host!
It is a lovely place to stay, with a decent amount of space for one person. The house is very close to both the train station and multiple bus stations.

This is a central location from which to explore Dublin.
The space is compact, clean and exactly as described.
The host is very responsive and accommodating but also lets you create your own space.

Location - not fare from center of Dublin, very quiet place and quiet area. There are a lot shops and bar in a short distance away.
The place is very clean, there is every thing you need for stay.
Eamon have given me a lot of touristic information about Dublin and Ireland.
As I have said to Eamon - room is much better than on photos, so I recommend it! This was one of the best in my AirBNB experience!
Thank you, Eamon! 5 from 5 stars!

Really good place, close to the city.
Even though I already knew Dublin I've received lots of information about the area near the apartment and about dublin

This is one of the best Airbnb experiences I have had. Everything is as it is described and more. I had the pleasure to meet Friar Eamon briefly when I checked in and he walked me around the bedsit and property,  giving a quick rundown of everything.

The apartment itself is conveniently located to all that Dublin had to offer. Transportation is nearby as well as many pubs and restaurants. If your travels take you to Dublin feel free to book with confidence.

I stayed in Eamons Bedsit No. 1 for three nights ì April 11-14. I selected it based on the wonderful reviews I read, and I was extremely happy with my choice. Upon reserving the bedsit last September, I received extensive information from Eamon regarding the suggested sites and locations to visit in Ireland and Dublin. Three weeks prior to my visit, he contacted me to confirm my time of arrival and provided me with several options for getting from the airport to the residence. I purchased AirCoach tickets (online) based on his suggestion, and it was nice to have transportation arranged in advance. Once I got off the AirCoach and began walking, I relied on my GPS rather than Eamons directions and walked passed his building. Fortunately, he was watching for me and caught my attention before I went too far. He was very thorough in showing me the amenities and took time to annotate a map for me with the routes to my first day destinations. I appreciated his understanding and patience as I was much later arriving from the airport than expected and I struggled a bit with figuring out the keys and the locks. The bedsit itself was immaculately clean, very comfortable, and the perfect size for a solo traveler. It was well-appointed and Eamon had clearly put a great deal of thought into assuring that travelers have all the things they might need. The little kitchen had everything but a stove, and Eamon offered the use of one upstairs should I want to cook. The shower had plenty of hot water, the pressure was excellent, and the bathroom was spotless. Best of all, Eamon was truly the perfect host ì he provided everything I needed and more, was engaged when necessary, but was completely respectful of my privacy, otherwise. I am entirely grateful to Eamon for his hospitality and his kindness, and I give him and Bedsit No. 1 the very highest of recommendations.
Eamons place was excellent. Good safe and convenient location. All facilities available.
This was an amazing stay! Eamon is the most gracious host. So helpful and kind. Such a peaceful and serene environment. I look very forward to returning. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Eamon is an perfectly prepared host! The room was perfectly prepared and clean!  He has a lot of tips for activities in and around Dublin. I really enjoyed my stay at his place and would definitely come back!

To all travellers wishing to see Dublin, this studio is the perfect place to stay the night. Located near a main artery into the city, and being only a few minutes walk away from St. Stephen's Green, you will yourself a short journey from the city center. However, being off of a quiet street, you will find that this studio offers the perfect balance of peace and quiet. Having just been renovated with high speed wifi, measured at around 15mbps upload and download, and safety features this venue is suitable for all modern communication and entertainment. Its kitchenette has everything that you may need to prepare a quick breakfast in the morning, or a cup of tea in the evening. The host is a very kind man that can offer very detailed recommendations for eateries, attractions, and public transportation. I definitely recommend this place to all.
Quiet place, privacy, really helpful and friendly host.

Eamonns place has the attributes of a great accommodation offer: location, cleanliness, accurately described facilities, accessibility and most of all, a customer-focus to ensure a comfortable and hassle- free stay.

Eamon is a really good host, so kind, helpful and patient. He gives a lot of tips on how to visit Dublin and he answers immediately to any request or problem. I really loved the room, it was cozy, clean and had everything I needed, the bus stop was close to the room so it wasnt hard to reach the city centre. Thank you Eamon for the peaceful staying.
Excellent place, thank you Eamon.

I highly recommend this location, especially for single female travelers. It is safe and secure. The host provides excellent information that helps with traveling around Dublin. He is extremely prompt with assistance and very kind. The bedsit was perfect. The kitchenette has everything I needed. The place was spotless. The bed was very comfortable.

Eamon is a very kind and practical host. Communication was swift and smooth, and I found the room I stayed in perfect for a single traveler. The location was also very practical to get in and out of Dublin. Would come back!
Excellent Airbnb experience. Eamon is more than helpful and always on time and on point. I would recommend to all :)

Eamons place is perfect.  He was an excellent host and the room was sparkling clean.  The room is located 10 mins walk from the nearest tram, grocery store, and restaurants.   I would definitely stay there again!
Responses were always very fast, I simply have no complaints at all. I fully recommend Eamon's place.
This is a safe, well-lit area in a quiet location, and only a 15 min bus ride to get downtown.  Perfect spot for a solo traveler!

What a lovely stay in a sweet little bed sit. It was spotless and each night I marveled at how comfortable my bed was and how quiet it was. Eamon is a gracious host, unobtrusive yet available for any questions or needs but I didnt need anything because it is all there down to filtered water and tea.
Everything about my stay was accurate and clear. I didn't need to ask anything. If I had to, I'm very confident Eamon would have the answer.
Very convenient location, ideal for a single person visiting Dublin for the first time.

Terrific accommodations well located, and the service is beyond reproach. 

Definitely recommend.

Eamon's place was just what I needed for my week in Dublin: well-designed, cosy and comfortable with a well-equipped kitchen, a great shower and reliable wi-fi. It's very well located in a quiet street, close to shops and public transport and within walking distance to Grafton Street, Trinity College, the National Gallery etc. It was a nice place to come back to after full days of sightseeing.

What made it extra special was Eamon's warmth and relaxed friendliness, his helpful advice and being around when I needed anything - a perfect host.
Eamon is nice and friendly
I enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend it to those traveling to the area. The neighborhood is very nice and Eamon is a great host.

The space is as described, its nice that there is a separate bedroom, bathroom and living space. The house is very calm and I had no issues with check in or during my stay. Communication with Eamon was superb as he obviously takes pride in the house and manages it proactively but not intrusively. This place is also in a very nice area of Dublin which felt very safe even coming back at night, had lots of nice cafes and restaurants nearby and was also very convenient for the air coach.

Eamon's place is in a quiet neighbourhood just south of the Grand Canal. You can walk to St. Stephen's Green in about 15 mins, or take city buses or the LUAS to easily get to other tourist attractions. Eamon was a very attentive host and provided lots of helpful information and recommendations for the city. Eamon's bedsits will be my first choice when in Dublin again.

Fr. Eamon is an Amazing host; very thorough, provides clear and detailed instructions.. he's extremely hospitable (it might be an Irish thing- very warm, and welcoming). His place is in a really nice, safe, upscale neighbourhood- walking distance to trains/ busses/ grocery stores/ pubs/ restaurants/ shopping options in the town of Ranelagh. If I ever return to Ireland, I'm going back here.
Lovely warm room in quiet location with easy access to bus and tram and local shops.

Eamon and his staff were so very helpful throughout my entire stay. Eamon was very thorough with instructions and if i had any questions, he was glad to help. I was so pleased with the studio, it was exactly what I needed as a solo traveler and the location was walking distance to nearby pubs, restaurants and the center of dublin if you dont mind longer distance & if not, an easy bus ride. I was very happy with everything and would easily stay again.
Wonderful place to stay, great localisation, hospitable house owners.   Clean, tidy and comfortable. Would not find anything better in such price.
Collin a very nice and always helpful person, a very clean and very comfortable home.

Super kind hosts and perfect accommodation for a young couple. We had a great time exploring Ireland and staying at Colin's place for the week. 
We had a rental car and also went by bus to Dublin, Colin helped us out with any questions we had about transportation and suggestions/places to see.
Would absolutely recommend, and if we happen to visit Ireland again we will definitely be staying here again!

Dear Maeve/Tom,

Thank you for having us in your tiny house. We really enjoyed it and for us it was a great time while we were visiting Dublin.

Especially we were happy about your hospitality, sitting in the garden and your wonderful breakfast.

Thanks a lot.
Best regards
Jana/Thomas
Incredible hosts!  Very helpful, amazing guest house with a beautiful garden.  Would love to stay again.
I really appreciated the beautiful garden view and the breakfast chats with the hosts. If I come to Dublin again, I surely will stay there again!

Maeve/Toms place is close to bus and tram transport that you can get into Dublin  central within 10 minutes. They are wonderful hosts supplying a light breakfast and very helpful with tips to see and do in Dublin and surrounds. The spacious unit overlooks Maeves garden full of colour.

Maeve & Tom were superlative hosts! The airbnb "cottage" is lovely, stylish and quite comfortable, with a sliding door opening to a garden, and a large well appointed bath. The space was complemented by their warm hospitality, and enjoyable/humorous conversations. The house is nearby to busses that make the short journey to city center - and Tom's personal transport to the Guinness Storehouse was most appreciated! Many thanks for making our stay in Dublin so enjoyable!
A great quiet, private, comfortable place

Super clean, cozy and bright accommodations.  Lovely garden to look out to or be in.  Nice breakfast to start off the day. Maeve and Tom were very helpful in giving recommendations on where to go and how to get there!, as well as a lift to the tram station!  We highly recommend Maeve and Tom's guest suite.

Maeve and Tom are great hosts and are very helpful with travel tips around Ireland. This was our first time in Ireland and the first time driving on the left side of the road, Maeve and Tom were very helpful by providing leap cards for local buses so we didn't have to worry too much about the traffic. The guesthouse is beautiful and comfortable with everything you need inside. The location is a quick bus ride into the city center so you can get as much of the city as you want without sacrificing comfort.
Fantastic location and great people. If I'm ever in Dublin again this will be my go to!!

The place was exactly as described. Clean, spacious, cozy, and filled with little amenities. The garden is beautiful and great for getting away from the city life. Maeve and Tom were so friendly and gracious. They gave us great tips on the city and bus tickets to get around which made getting around the city a breeze. Would definitely stay again and reccomend to anyone visiting Dublin!
Beautiful accommodation with everything you need. Maeve and Tom are excellent hosts. Every day started with a delicious breakfast. Excellent access to the city center.

Maeve and Tom were very accommodating and flexible during our stay. They had excellent hospitality and communication. 
Breakfast was wonderful and plenty to eat each morning. 
The hosts gave us tips on places to go and helped us to navigate the public transportation with ease.
The location was easy to find and a close walk to the center of the city. Bus and Luas stops were very close by, in case your feet hurt from all the walking. 
You won't be disappointed with your stay with Maeve and Tom, they exceeded our expectations as Air BnB hosts. :)

Maeve and Toms guest house was a wonderful place to stay for a weekend in Dublin! The house and gardens were as beautiful as the photos and were very comfortable  They went above and beyond to help us in any way they could during our stay and were more than happy to answer any questions we had! We chose to walk rather than take a bus most evenings, and it was a very simple 40 minute walk from the center of town. If public transportation is more your style, its very well connected to the entire city. I would 100% recommend their home to anyone!

Mauve and Toms place is a great! They were extremely helpful during our stay. The Airbnb is just a short bus ride to the main downtown area of Dublin making it a very convenient location. Id strongly recommend staying here.
Place is as described great hosts
Maeve and Tom are lovely hosts.  The property is quiet, lovely and very convenient to public transportation.  We would certainly re-book this property again on a future trip to Dublin.

This place is as advertised.  It has a luxurious bathroom and a lovely garden right outside your door.  We had no trouble navigating the area and the LEAP bus stop was a half block away.  Bed was comfy and breakfast was great.  All in all we would recommend this place.
This house was ideal for me working in the area
A good location. The unit itself was everything I needed for my stay in Dublin.
Amazing location and nice treatment.

Thank you David! The place was exactly what I was hoping for - in a main area, walkable to most everything, clean, and comfortable. Communication before and during my stay was great as David promptly returned my messages and was very helpful.
Great location, friendly communication.

This apartment is in a great location and is fine all around, but we had some trouble communicating with David and some huge issues with the cleanliness of the space. While this was resolved during our stay, it did put a damper on our trip.
Good location, one bedroom flat. Very communicative host.
The place was an amazing location, great apartment and David was so easy to communicate with! Highly recommend!

Highly recommend this place! Its a great place to stay in while exploring Dublin. The location was fantastic and the space was very clean. Our flight landed at 10am, but we werent able to check in until 2pm. David told us about a hostile nearby we could leave our bags while we explored the area in the meantime. Everything worked out great! David even left a map where he drew out how to get to the Airbnb from the hostile. David was very helpful and responded quickly. Read a review that the location is noisy, however, we did not have any problems with noise. Only slight complaint is that the bed was a bit springy, but was still able to get a good nights sleep. Overall, it was a wonderful stay, great price, and even better location!

Fully functional, located within walking distance to most recommended sights and a local store downstairs where you can grab cheap breakfast and coffee. There is a charming backyard garden for a morning workout too.
Great location and within walking distance for food and shopping.
Simple, clean and a good location.
Right in the center of everything!
The flat is clean , safe and well situated; the information clear and detailed. The only drawback was the noise because of the traffic in spite of the double-glazed windows.
Beautiful house in a great part of town. Peter is a great host.

Lovely modern house in beautiful area, close to shops and local amenities. The main area of the house is great for socialising and Peter was great with communication throughout the weekend! Would recommend if staying in Dublin :)

From start to finish our stay here was first class. 
 We was warmly welcomed by our hosts whom immediately made us feel comfortable in their home. 
 Any help we required before or during our stay was never a bother and was always offered before we even asked for, or needed it. This was the case for queries with the property and also the local area. 
  We was left alone with complete privacy and the full property to ourselves which positively added to the experience of our stay.

Overall our trip to Dublin was greatly enhanced due to the warm hospitality, professionalism and kindness of our hosts and the stay in their beautiful family home.
Outstanding hospitality and house in a charming neighborhood.

While we enjoyed the spaciousness of Peters place for our group of 6, the place was dirty - mouldy food left on counter, rotting flowers, empty dirty food wrappers in kids bedrooms, piles of things under the beds and generally just unclean. We also found the place to be lacking in the amenities we have found standard in other Airbnbs - phone chargers, blow dryers, laundry soap, etc. The area is a bit of a walk to shops, coffee etc but did feel very safe and quiet. Overall a 3/5 - large and safe but needs a good scrub and some little touches.
Couldnt recommend Peters property more. Spacious, stylish, clean and a lovely place to spend the weekend. Peter was so quick to respond, so thoughtful and an excellent host!

We had a lovely stay in your apartment it was perfect for our family.  Our 3 kids felt totally at home.  I would highly recommend a stay here as the proxmity to the city is great.  The apartment itself is very well laid out and everything is thought of even a few games for the kids.  We will definately return
Amazing location and a perfect apartment to see the whole city. Nicola gives amazing tips for the city and couldn't have been a better host!

With hotel prices in Dublin eye wateringly expensive,  this apartment is value for money.  A brilliant location and stunning accommodation,  its easily one of the best places to stay in Dublin.  Communication was excellent and check in was seamless. A fantastic flat that we will definitely use again.
This apartment is fantastic î you cant ask for a better location and there is so much comfortable space in the apartment itself. Really a find in Dublin.
Fabulous place, spotless and very modern, super local spot. Highly recommend!

This was an amazing apartment! Beautiful decor, very clean, and and an even better location. Nicola provided great recommendations for things to see, places to eat, etc. The apartment also came with lots of details of where to find extra blankets, how to turn on the heat, and other things of that sort that made the stay very easy. Overall, an amazing place for a weekend in Dublin!

Nicolas apartment is at a prime location in Dublin. It is close enough to everything but far enough away to avoid the crowd and noise of the temple bar area. I would highly recommend this apartment for a short stay or long stay in the heart of Dublin.
Great place in central Dublin!
Great central location and spacious flat.

What an incredible space! If you have an opportunity to stay here, DO!  The bedroom blocked out the noise of the city, but we found the city noise to be enjoyable when youre sitting in the living spaces.  I cant wait to return to stay here again!

Great location and spacious apartment! It definitely was loud in the living room on Saturday night (we were fairly warned) but it was dead quiet in the bedroom. We loved how much history the building had as well.
Everything about this accommodation is spot on. Comfort, style and location.

what a gorgeous place. so central, but safe and very well designed and finished. it was a real treat to stay somewhere as homely, but in the center of vibrant Dublin. a great find- I will be recommending it to family and friends and will definitely be back.

I grew up in Dublin but usually stay in the suburbs when we visit. Staying at Nicola's amazing apartment we were able to take our kids (ages 10 & 12) all the great museums and sights in Dublin - they especially loved St. Stephen's Green, the Book of Kells,  The Epic Museum and seeing the bog preserved bodies at the National Museum! What an amazing location Exchequer Street is, everything is within walking distance and having a huge Dunnes Stores food hall right next door is a real bonus. Nicola has done an amazing job leaving suggested restaurants and things to do in the area. Overall an A+ Airbnb experience!

This is such a beautiful space, convenient and within walking distances to nearly everything in Dublin.  Nicola is an amazing host-fantastic communication and super easy instructions for everything!  Highly recommend this place-worked perfectly for my familys visit to Dublin!
Absolutely gorgeous apartment, the photos really dont do it justice. Tastefully decorated, bright and spacious and incredible location. Highly recommend staying here for your Dublin trip!
Great place in a great location.  Met all my expectations wish I had more than one night in Dublin and the apartment but I know Ill be back.
Beautifully decorated flat in a great location!
Nicole's apartemnt is excellence on both place and apartment facilities. Good place and complete instruction on the local travelling and life. It is great recommended to stay there.

A great apartment in a great location. Very stylish and full of everyhting needed to have an enjoyable stay. The proximity to the heart of the all the action was a big benefit. Disappointed we could only stay the two nights.

Huge flat in a terrific central location. Very stylish and clean with a very easy check in/out process. Easy access to & from the airport using the Airlink 747 bus at College Green stop. This is a very lively neighbourhood with good nightlife steps away - this means that the common areas can get noisy in the evenings but we enjoyed this atmosphere and the bedroom itself was soundproofed and very quiet. This was my second stay here and I highly recommend it! Nicola is an excellent host.
Perfect location. Beautiful apartment.
The place is right in the heart of the city, really convenient. The flat is gigantic and clean. Nicola made sure that we have everything we could possible need for our stay!

Centrally located, very spacious with a unique layout, clean apartment with fully equipped kitchen. Nice street views, but no real noise.  It's a short walk away from many places to eat, grocery stores and local attractions. Add some 20 euro per night for parking though if arriving by car (note that nearby parking is not overnight).

Nicolas place was amazing!  Such a great apartment in an amazing location. Nicola is a fantastic host and the place has lots of great features. We only wish we had been able to spend more time in Dublin.  
I know there have been some comments about sound issues but that wasnt a problem in the least. We would stay here again in a second
The location cant be beat and Nicola provided extraordinary local tips. The back bedroom was quiet, even on the weekend, and the apartment has tremendous historical charm. Will return.

Nicola was a gracious host, and he was helpful and timely with his responses. The bunks and the queen bed are all in one room, and there is one bathroom.  The unit is more dated than others we used, but it was located in an area of Dublin that was near the things we wanted to do.
Beautiful, stylish apartment in a prime Dublin location. The perfect place for anyone looking to take in the sights and sounds of Dublin.
Nicolas place was just as it was described. We were very pleased with our accommodation and appreciated her recommendations. Beds were very comfortable.

First of all, amazing flat! Its super spacious and greatly laid out. Nicola made it super easy to know where everything was and the experience has been great, from keys pick up to check out. Great location and well worth the money.

Place was great and is even better than the pictures. It is a really nice set-up for a family. My children loved the bunk beds. Our only complaint is that the WiFi was poor. For myself, not a big deal, but a real problem for the children when we would come back to the flat in the evenings.  Other than that, a perfect place and the location could not be any better. Exchequer is a fun street with a ton going on and a grocery store right downstairs.

In a word...superb! From the point of booking to the point of us leaving, the communication, instructions, local knowledge, facilities, cleanliness and location were just amazing.

The apartment had a really homely feel to it, was decorated beautifully and had everything we needed to make our trip to Dublin that much more special.

You are located centrally and pretty much everything you could need to get to is within a 5-10 minute walk, or even closer if you used some of the bikes for hire right outside the front of the apartment.

If you are thinking of a city-centre apartment then you simply cannot go wrong with this one - Nicola was great and communication was very quick and easy.

We simply cannot wait to return to Dublin and wouldn't hesitate in booking this apartment again...10/10!

This apartment is spacious and features a nice layout. There was plenty of room for our family of four. The kitchen is large and well-stocked. In a time when Airbnbs are increasingly quasi-hotel rooms, this apartment has a charming lived-in feel and a sense of history to it. The location is as central as it gets in Dublin, allowing one to explore on foot in this wonderfully walkable city.

This apartment is right in the middle of the action. A fantastic apartment with huge space and a great view over a lively street. It is noisy at night but the bedroom is really quiet with comfortable beds. Loved staying here and how close it is to everything.
Great location, close to everything! The tips from Nicola were so helpful!

This apartment is a delight - modern, spacious, comfortable, well-appointed, and ideally located in the city centre. Nicola has left tons of notes, tips, and helpful hints that made everything a breeze. Our family of five spent a comfortable night in every single bed there was. Streets were a touch noisy on a Saturday night, but nothing the thick curtains and a white noise app couldnt drown out. Kitchen is stocked and easy too - we grabbed food from the fancy market across the street and prepared it without a hitch. If youre looking to stay in Dublin you could not find a better host or location than this gem!
Excellent location, amazing food and very good response to questions.  Nearby parking is a plus.

Great apartment right in the Heart of the action in Dublin but still extremely quiet. We had two children 4 and 6 and the bunks were great. Nicola is a thoughtful host and has detailed instructions throughout the apartment.

Nicolas place is perfectly placed to have easy access to Dublins bustling center. There were so many restaurants, pubs, and shops within walking distance. The apartment was exactly as advertised. Spacious and warm. Cant wait to return!

Nicolas Airbnb is in the best area of Dublin! We walked across the street and had the best dinner and went around the corner for a drink in the pub. Its everything you want, right at your front door. She had the best tips for Dublin and a sparkling clean and inviting apartment. We hope to be back again one day!

Nicolas place was beautiful, spacious, super clean and in a GREAT location. She had thoughtful touches and instructions throughout the space. It was also super easy to check in and out. We would highly recommend this space.

What an amazing spot in the most central Dublin location! The apartment is beautifully decorated...the art and unique decor make for a very special place to stay. Everything we wanted to see and do was quick walk away. Great home away from home when visiting Dublin! Only thing we missed was a French press pot or coffee maker, other than that apartment is very well equipped with any item you might need. Thanks for a great stay!

Nicola's place is lovely!  It is situated extremely well.  Close to Temple Bar, but not on the most busy bar-lined street so that it was perfect for our family including our daughter and her grandparents. There are many great shops and restaurants close by, including delicious ice cream. We felt like we were in the center of everything, but the apartment was still calm.  It is a very short walk to Trinity College.  There are a couple flights of stairs to go up, but my elderly in-laws managed them with no problem.  The furniture in the apartment is very tasteful and it is beautifully designed overall, with a great kitchen and bath with plenty of towels and a fantastic shower and tub.  The beds were very comfortable and the bedroom was extremely quiet.  We slept 5 people very comfortably on the main bed, two bunk beds, and the sofa bed.  Nicola provided a lot of helpful signs so we could figure out how to lock the doors, turn on the hot water, etc.  She also had a bunch of tips for restaurants and other things to see around Dublin.  The place is very kid-friendly--there are toys and scooters and my 9-year-old loved the bunk bed in particular.  We had a great stay and would love to come back.
Everything perfect.
The location is amazing. Close to tons of bars and restaurants and the hustle and bustle. Apartment was clean and Nicola was very helpful.

This apartment was miles better than we could have anticipated. The whole place was clean and comfortable and in a brilliant location.

Nicola went above and beyond with helpful notes throughout the apartment and a lovely little guide to the area.

I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone looking to be in central Dublin.
Nicolas place was perfect. Everything on her listing was exactly as described and the location was better then imagined. We cant wait to visit Dublin again and would stay here for sure.

Really amazing apartment in a perfect location. Highly recommended. So much better than any of the hotel options that I looked into. I was traveling with my 2 kids and it was perfect for them. Best Airbnb that Ive stayed in by far.

The apartment is great.  Its perfectly located for a great exploration of Dublin.  The owner is very thoughtful and there are a ton of wonderful touches that made the apartment feel like home.  I highly recommend this lovely place.
We experienced an almost magical holiday at Nicola's home. The scenery and surrounding majestic Atlantic was breathtaking. Not a view anyone could ever get used to or take for granted.   Colleen

Nicolas place was in a great location. You definitely have to be able to walk up the four flights to enter. It was clean and ample space for our party of four.  It is a noisy location but bedroom is fairly quiet.

Pros:
1. Excellent location in the heart of the old city. 
2. Responsive nice host.
3. Minimal noise in bedroom.
4. Toys for kids.
5. Great grocery store across the street.
6. Bunk beds in master.

Cons:
1. Not very clean. It was surface level cleaned but inside drawers, walls, washer, beds, etc it was  dirty and unkept. Beware of you open drawers.
2. Flies get in whenever open windows. It needs window screens. It was impossible to get ventilation without flies getting in. 
3. Master also has zero ventilation outside a door that leads to fire stairs and loud vents which limits the poss of opening at night.
4.. Limited hot water in shower. It was only warm enough for 5 minutes or so shower then gets cold and you will have to wait another 20-30 minutes  for it to heat up again. Remember to turn on the switch ahead of time. 
5. Large cell phone tower across the way a street or two away which was a big safety concern for us. This of course is of no fault of the owner. There is plenty of research that proves negative health impacts of distance to cell towers. Would have not rented it if wr had known ahead of time. I would be most concerned for children who ate most suceptible and adults who have health issues. 
6. Building needs to be kept up. There were dirty towels left outside the main door. While it's an old building with charm it felt very seedy and we questioned whether we made a mistake from the moment we arrived.

All in all the unit has tremendous potential to be lovely unit if it is kept up, deep cleaned after all guests and better organized.

This is such a wonderful spot - fantastic central  location, lovely & clean. Comms & info about  Dublin was spot on - that made navigating Dublin a breeze.

We had a wonderful sleep & wasnt disturbed by any noise from below. 

Thank you Nicola/Fergal for a fabulous stay. 

Will definitely stay again.
Great stylish place. A really nice location near Temple Bar. Keys were easy to pick up and drop off. A great space for our family of four.
Fantastic space!
Cracking spot - right in the heart of everything! You couldn't wish for a better location. Happily it was still quiet at night time and we always felt secure perched up high in the apartment.

This apartment is spacious and clean, and we found it to be perfectly located to what we wanted to do while in Dublin for just 3 days. The building itself is gorgeous from the outside and very historical and old. The immediate surrounding area has anything you could need. We walked everywhere we wanted to go and became familiar with the nearby establishments pretty quickly :)
There was no noise heard from the bedroom and any noise we heard from the kitchen area didnt bother us one bit. The location actually feels pretty quiet and safe. Would stay here again and hope we get the chance to!

Great location for a stay in Dublin.  No rental car needed at all.  Walking distance to all the main attractions along with a grocery store right next door.  The apartment is clean and tidy.  You will not be disappointed with your stay here.
Adam was really helpfull and reactive when needed. It was really cool sharing the flat with him
Adam was super responsive and easy to get along with. Check-in was simple, and we had access to everything we needed.

Adam has been a great host, it was a pleasure sharing the flat with him and have a  chat from time to time. The position is very close to the city center, but the bedroom is quite small, suitable for a single person.

Pictures are not accurate- lot of stuff in shared space, no lock on bedroom door, both bedroom & bathroom were very dirty (i.e. found a womans hair accessory in the bed that was not mine, lot of mold in bathroom- beware of allergies). However, Adam was very nice & accommodating with check-in & communication.

I would not recommend  stay in this place at all
1)	Bed and smelly mattress and bedset. I have been stayed in many Airbnb for last 3 years, I never had any problem with any of the place, but this place the bed set, matters is so old and smell horrible, I have to spent 80 Euro to buy a whole brand new bed set , so I can sleep. The mattress is supper old and smelly too. Everyday morning I have to leave the window open so I can stay  at night in the room .  

2)	Bad host behavior.  I was not be allowed to do laundry until after 11:00pm because Adam need to watch TV in the living room, he said it is very noise, but the water laundry is such a small one, the noise is not bad all, he just do not want to sacrifice even a little for his guest at all. The worst thing is that , he put his short in my laundry, next day in the morning I saw a man short in my laundry, I was pissed off and ask him why he did that , he denied what he did, so the short has leg and walked into the laundry itself?

3)	Unflushed toilet. Yes!!!!! Can you imaged that when you used the toilet in the morning, there some unflushed poop in the toilet and you saw it? That is f** so disgusting, it happened couple times, even tho on the day the day I checked out the place,  I saw it again, basically I lost my whole appetite  the whole day by seeing that, trust it , if you stay there ,you need to prepare for unflushed poop and the image will just hang in your mind all the time.  

4)	Horrible shower. It is impossible to take a good shower in this apt,  I have to go to gym everyday only for shower, feel free to stay here if you never shower 

5)	 the apartment is very old, which is fun, I paid $2000 for one month, I felt I definitely overpaid for a place like that for sure

6)	Lies. I asked Adam, how many people stay in the places, he said only himself, but turns out his girlfriend came to stay over all the time. Sometimes I have to wait for them to stop use the restroom so I can use the restroom, if I know there are 2 ppl stay there and I have to share the restroom with 2 other person I will never stay there. 

7)	Dirty Kitchen, if you want to use the kitchen to wash an apple, forget it, there are always dirty dishes in the kitchen sink and supper smelly with flies. 

8)	Noise from street, it is very close to the road, the noise is not too bad at night, but it will become really bad start early morning. I got woke up early in the morning by the car noise from the street, so I have to have a Nosie proof headset on, so I will not be woke up in the morning, which is very uncomfortable. 

All my Airbnb stay in last 3 years are all positive, this is my first time to give a negative review, because I have to speak out my mind this time , because it is such bizarre experience

Adam was attentive with me every time, and easy-going, from checking to check out.  He made easy for me to stay in, great host.  
It is somewhat expensive, but like the rest of the prices in Dublin near Merrion Sq. 
Apartment has old furniture and stuff, but it is just as shown in the pictures, without  surprise or cheating. 
Although his things are around the house, he always tells you that you can use everything as you want or need.  In short, good value for money in my opinion.

Thank you so much Adam for letting me stay with such short notice! Very much appreciated. I was canceled on 3x and this price was by far much better for someone just looking for a bed for two days. Very friendly and quiet place.
Wonderful cozy place in the centre of town and a great host.
We really enjoyed our stay at Bernadines place for St. Patricks day!! Great room in a good location with just a short bus ride to the city center. We recommend and would come again.

Bernadine and Brendan were amazing!  This was my first time using Airbnb and they probably ruined it for my future stays with other people.  I didn't really know what to expect, but they did everything they could to provide the absolute  best accommodations and hospitality possible.  Bernadine was quick to respond to any of my questions before I arrived in Dublin and when I arrived at their residence her and Brendan helped me with anything I needed.  My flight arrived later than expected and she was flexible with my check-in.  They both asked me about my plans, which I was flexible with, and they made recommendations and checked the weather for me in order to make the best decision.  They are a little bit outside of Dublin, but are in a great location with many amenities such as Aldi and the local pub/restaurant within walking distance.  The bus stop is also a short walk and only takes about 10 minutes to get into Dublin.  I could have not asked for better hospitality.  I would definitely recommend a stay here and would come back in a heartbeat if I come back to the Dublin area.
Lovely house, home from home in West Dublin. Just down the road from supermarket and pub. Sparklingly clean, en-suite and quiet. Would recommend and stay again.
Had a great stay at Bernadine's place in Palmerstown. Nice room and easy acces to the Dublin city centre by bus. Would definitely recommend!

Bernadine was very courteous during our stay. She was also very helpful and quick when we need to go somewhere or find a great place in Dublin. The house is located close to the center of Dublin, in a calm neighborhood with a great garden a few minutes walking distance. Hope to come back soon.
all great :) wonderful people and place

Bernadine is the perfect balance between being informative/helpful and nonintrusive.  Answered any questions I had and made helpful suggestions ahead of our visit.  Her place was perfectly described on the B&B site.  If we go back this is where we'll  stay!

The place was very easy to find and there's plenty of street parking in the area. The bus stop was also only a 3-4 minute walk away and 20 minutes away from the city. The room was smaller than expected but nonetheless very cozy and had a lot of extra amenities such as a power adaptor and mini tv. The bed is a bit worn out as you could feel all the springs when you lay down. In the morning, there is a fairly large selection of cereal and toast for breakfast. Bernadine was also very kind to lend us a leap card to use.
I would throughly recommend this place, the host is so friendly and welcoming. Her house is very clean and comfortable. And ideally located.
Lovely home with hospitable and accommodating hosts! Highly recommended!
It will be impressiveness experience in your traveling in Ireland
Great location, friendly host
Great location!
A lovely stay in Maud's flat in Dublin. Easy to walk to the City centre (15 min approx.) or to take a bus.
Mauds place is awesome! We walked everywhere! There was just enough space for the two of us and she gave awesome recommendations!

A beautiful space aesthetically, however the entire place smelled as though it had been recently painted causing my mother and I to have trouble breathing and brought about headaches after prolonged time spent in the home.
Great spot, great host!

We stayed at Mauds place for 3 nights and had an amazing time. Great location where we were able to walk everywhere despite the rainy weather. Maud provided a small book which had recommendations of places to eat, drink etc. We tried Las Tapas de Lola which was recommended in the book and it was delicious!

Such a great location in the city. Everything was 25min walk or less with the Guinness factory only about 15min away. The guest house was perfect size for two and the full kitchen with all the amenities was very useful. Maud was great, gave us lots of amazing suggestions when we got there and answered any questions we had along the way.
A cosy place, close to the city. Maud gave us lots of helpful recommendations on where to go and the sauna was a real bonus!

Maud's place is in a great location within walking distance of many of Dublin's attractions. The apartment was stylish and the sauna was a nice touch. Lots of great information available on local sites and restaurants.
Maud's place is exactly as advertised. It is a beautiful spot filled with homey touches that go a long way. We would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area!

My partner and I booked this place due to is location in relation to the Guinness storehouse and we were not disappointed as it was only a 5/10 minute walk away!

The studio was quirky and nice to stay in, was very clean which we appreciated!

The walk to the city centre takes about 20/30 minutes. 

Our taxi driver from the airport struggled to find the place but we got there eventually! However he suggested that we taxi back at night as he said it was not the safest of areas for tourists at night? Which left us slightly worried but it ended up being totally fine!

One thing I would say is that I feel the studio needs more locks. We were assured that the doors locked themselves but for safety cautious people like us, this had as feeling concerned and we would have preferred to have physical locks on both doors (e.g. garden & street entrance).

Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again! Thank you so much for your hospitality.
Very nice place
Had a brilliant stay in the Jungalow. Its cosy and quirky and a short walk from the city centre. Would 100% stay again
We had a very good stay at Mauds place. It's a comfortable studio and the sauna is lovely! The mattress was a bit old, you could feel the springs but we got used to that
Nice small place about 20 min walk outside the city. Comfortable for two people.
Mauds place is very swanky and I love it! Highly recommend for lone travelers l!

Maud was an amazing host who is very welcoming. The studio was perfect for our needs, its very comfortable cozy and clean. I strongly recommend this place if visiting Dublin; only a 6 min bus ride right into the city centre and has everything you need! Thanks again Maud!

Maud left tips (where to go, what to do) and they were perfect...we managed to fit in a trip to Howth, no Seals but still enjoyed. Go hungry if you like fish. 

We ate at Temple Bar - smokehouse - I had food poisoning the next day so we didn't leave the place much and the Amazon Fire stick made all the difference. 

There is an Lidl close by and a pharmacy. 
Alot of the tips of moving around were to catch busses etc. We walked everywhere and the walk was about 15mins in to temple bar and the same to William's st. Which has good nightlife. 

We definitely enjoyed our trip to Dublin and  Maud's place was a good spot to rest your head.

We had a great time at Maud's place, and would happily go back there! It has a good location, being so close to a Lidl and on the 150 bus route, and it was nice having our own entrance. The space was clean and the kitchen had everything we needed to cook several meals. Any issues we had, both before and during our stay, were quickly deal with and Maud and her whole family were always happy to help when we had questions about how to work the Amazon Fire TV stick and turn on the oven for example.

We were staying for 4 nights and really liked the place! We felt like home. Sauna was a nice add to the comfort! Own entrance to the street was great. Buss to the centre just around the corner! Bus stop less than one minute away.... to the city centre in 10 minutes by bus. Airport accessible by bus no 16 with 3,30‚Ç¨ or leap card. Own cooking facilities was a big plus to make our own breakfast every morning. Shops quite close for daily needs for groceries. Wifi worked well. Very friendly hosts and a lot of good tips how to move in the city, and where to go and eat as well. Teeling whisky distillery in walking distance was nice place to visit, that was a good tip as well. If in Dublin again, we will stay here again! Thanks for all the nice chats as well! Highly recommend this one!

Cosy and unique place to stay and we slept very comfortably here!  Met the host to check-in but we had our own backdoor so that was great. Slightly far to walk to town but we got used to it! We really enjoyed the nearby Guinness Factory!

A must-stay apartment. Great for couples/friends wanting a city break. 20 minutes from the centre. Beautifully designed; loved all the natural light! Super comfy bed! Perfect for relaxing after a busy day.
Maud is a great host! Thanks for everything and I hope to be back in Ireland again soon!

We enjoyed a week in the jungalow. It was centrally located for us, as we are big walkers. 20 min walks into town were easy and enjoyable. The private entrance is a rare treat in a city setting, so it was great to come and go freely. Maud is helpful and accommodating. We would stay again.

We really enjoyed our stay in Dublin at de Airbnb. But the kitchen wasnt as clean as expected and the mattress was a bit uncomfortable, because we could feel every single spring... We didnt use the Sauna but it looked quite nice. The Busstop is just around the corner, which is a big plus.
Fijne plek met alles wat je nodig hebt aanwezig. 20 min lopen naar het  centrum, maar ook leuke pubs en restaurantjes in de buurt.
Very nice host with a very nice place !
A really quiet nice place close to the city center.

We really enjoyed our stay in Mauds studio. All the essentials needed were there, and it was only a short walk from the city centre and grocery store. The studio was clean and cosy. Maud left us with many suggestions on where to eat and go which was nice. The sauna is a nice addition after a day of exploring. I would recommend this Airbnb.

We had an amazing stay in Dublin at Mauds place. The air bnb is situated within walking distance of the Guinness Storehouse, Jameson Distillery, Temple bar and several other popular tourist destinations. She was very helpful and quick to respond to any of our questions. She had some amazing restaurant recommendations. The place was clean and welcoming. Overall it was a lovely experience! Highly recommend.

Good location! Maud left a book of recommendations that were lovely. There is only one blanket in the place (the comforter on the bed) and its a kinda itchy blanket. Bed is not very soft.

We still enjoyed our time. The place was small, quiet, and cute. Its equipped with anything you might need to cook.
Good place to stay close walking to major tourist things. Sauna was nice after walking around all day.
Beautiful Airbnb in Dublin City. Next time, we will stay there too :)
Cool Airbnb spot
We had so much fun staying at Maud's, were able to walk everywhere in Dublin and enjoyed the hot sauna afterward. Hope to stay again in the future.

Mauds cozy guesthouse is lovely, quiet place to stay in a bustling city. It was the perfect location to explore Dublin from and were able to easily walk everywhere we wanted to go. She gave us wonderful recommendations for things to do and places to eat as well. Absolutely take the DART from Bray and take the cliff walk to Greystones!  We highly recommend Maud and her guesthouse to anyone visiting Dublin!
We spend 4 peaceful days in Maud's appartement in Dublin. The equipements and hospitality of Maud were great ! Thank you for everything.

My boyfriend and I had a great time staying here. This location is a bit of a walk from downtown but we never found this to be a problem. You can either take a ~25 minute walk or the bus station is super convenient and right around the corner. 

The place was clean and had a nice homey feeling to it. The sauna was a nice touch and we liked having the grocery store up the block so we could make our own breakfasts. The neighbourhood felt very safe even at night. Would recommend to a friend and personally come back!

Casa pulitissima e confortevole, proprietaria estremamente ospitale e sempre veloce nelle comunicazioni per messaggio,  ottima collocazione in una bella zona residenziale vicina ad ampi spazi verdi e al mare e ben collegata al centro dal treno urbano DART (ca. 15 minuti di percorrenza). Ho apprezzato molto la presenza in camera di una scrivania per lavorare.
Loved my stay
A great home in a very central location. Bob is an excellent host who has taken care to make sure his guests want for nothing during their stay. A real home from home

I cannot recommend Bob's place enough. The location is central and walkable, the house itself is very comfortable and has funky decorations, and Bob is a wonderful host. If you stay here, you'll be staying in a three-bedroom house, of which all three bedrooms are let out on Airbnb (Bob lives nearby, but not in this house). I met two other really great solo travellers while staying here. I had everything I needed, and Bob was super accommodating when it came to check-in/check-out times. If you're going to Dublin, do yourself a favour and stay here!

Everything you need to have a lovely jumping-off point for Dublin. Bob is so kind. Super quiet area with 3 convenience stores just across the street. Full kitchen with all the basics in case you cook. Every major tourist attraction is a 20 minute walk or less, and I felt safe walking alone at night here too. 
Dont miss: 
-The Fumbally for breakfast or lunch (their egg dish was my favorite thing I ate in the whole country) (3 min walk)
-Cathedral Cafe for nice lunch or breakfast (2 min walk)
-Jam Art Factory (local artists work for sale, gifts, 4 minute walk)
-Queen of Tarts for scones (10 min walk)

Bob's place was fantastic! Even better than described. Bob was incredibly hospitable and helpful in directing us during our first days in Ireland. We certainly wish we could have stayed longer. Would highly recomend.

Bob's apartment is situated within a 10 min. walking distance to the center of Dublin. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and he offers many amenities in the kitchen. Bob responds quickly and even though I arrived at the airport very late, he graciously stayed up and waited for me to let me in and show me around the apartment and have a chat. Thank you, Bob!

Cozy and homely space that was surprisingly quiet given its proximity to the centre. Easy walk to any and all needed amenities as well as must-see landmarks. Room was tidy, comfy and came with all we needed. Highly recommend!

Bob is an excellent host, he gave us precise directions to get to his place,  welcomed us with tea and coffee and gave us a lot of good advices about food and everything . Locations is great,  walkable distance of a lot of things. This is a 3 bedrooms house that we share with other guests. The house is very charming, with wooden parquet. 
Thank Bob,  that was cool.

Bob is such a great host and the space and location are unbeatable. I felt welcomed as soon as I entered, the check-in was smooth and he was very flexible. The room was excellent with beautiful furniture and furnishings. Bob immediately dove in to giving local tips tailored to my requests and gave a great overview of the city using maps. So very helpful. 10/10 would book again!

Bob's place is clean, very comfortable, and in a great location - you can walk anywhere - without it being noisy at night = pretty much perfect! I was greeted by Bob with a cup of tea and lots of tips on exploring Dublin. The use of the kitchen was really nice. I would definitely stay here again.

The only problem with Bob's place is that none of the photographs show what you really are getting: an incredibly thoughtful and helpful host, a space decorated and appointed very well and a location that can't be beat. We booked after another host cancelled and expected a basic, clean spot. Bob blew those simple expectations out of the water. This has been my best AirBnB experience, and I have had quite a lot. Don't hesitate to stay here!

Bobs place is located in a great location for exploring Dublin by foot. Bob was kind in spending time showing us a map of Dublin and pointing out areas and sites to explore. He also referred us to a variety of places to eat which made planning our days easier. We would like to return since there is so much more we would like to see.

We had a nice two night stay at Bobs place. Easy to get to from the airlink bus and walk everywhere. The bed was very comfy and space was friendly to come back to. It would be ideal for a group renting the whole place especially.

Bob was so helpful and hospitable! He gave me great suggestions on where to go and eat, and made me a cup of tea while we spoke about it. The room was really clean and the location was fantastic. 10/10 recommend!

Ontvangst bij Bob is zeer hartelijk en hij verteld graag over Dublin.
Kamer is prima en het huis staat redelijk dicht bij het centrum.
Lovely place to stay in a great location. Stylish and comfy, and Bob was a very helpful and communicative host.
We spent two days at Bobs place! It was nice, good instructions, good bed. We share the place with two other ppl. Nice place to stay in the center of Dublin !

Bobs place was fantastic! He is a great host, who fully stocked the house with coffee, tea, fruit, and cereal, making our stay very comfortable. The location is nice located, close to everything but in a quieter location. He is very responsive and helped us with all of our needs and questions.

I recommend this place for anyone looking for a shared place.
Lovely place, amazing location, Bob is a gem. Highly recommend!
My very 1st Airbnb experience, I had a great time in Dublin and my stay in Bob's place was more than I expected, thank you.

The house is wonderful! Its very clean and has many amenities! Bob is very kind and generous, an always ready with a friendly conversation or bit of guidance to brighten your visit! His recommendations for sites to visit are excellent and he takes wonderful care of his guests!

Bobs  place was very comfortable and he is a great host willing to share his wealth of knowledge about Dublin. This is a great location if you plan to take any of the Hop On Hop Off tours as there is a stop only a block away. Also convenient to the Airlink bus to and from the airport as that is only several blocks away. Overall a great experience for my first time using Airbnb.

We had a wonderful stay at Bobs home - he was such a kind, friendly, and helpful host! His home was in a great location (super central to a lot of the things we wanted to do in Dublin). He spent so much time helping us understand the city and recommending things for us to do - he was so helpful! His home was also so well decorated and had everything we needed!

Bob's place felt just like home. My room was spacious and comfortable and I slept really well. The other renters were kind and lovely too! The bathroom takes some getting used to but it's fine once you get the hang of it. The location is really good, it's basically 10 mins walk to everything you need, but at least you're not in the middle of the crazy crowds. Bob's place was so cozy and homey, it made me want to stay longer in Dublin!

A lovely place to stay in Dublin. The place had everything we needed - the umbrella especially! The location is convenient; it is within walking distance of the tourist spots and grocery stores. Bob was also very kind and gave us a lot of tips on how to get around Dublin. Would definitely stay again!

The place was close to the main areas in the city. It was clean. The host was really nice and helpful. 
He even gave us some tips about some activities. 
It is always nice to meet nice and kind people when you travel and just that was the case.

Bob gave us a very warm welcome with a cup of tea (we were woken through by the rain). He gave us very helpful recommendations regarding pubs and music locations. The room is big enough for two people and very cosy with an antique but comfortable bed. You have to share the bathroom with the other guest, which is no problem. It is really perfect that you can use the kitchen with coffee machine, tea, spices, cutlery etc. We enjoyed a very relaxed breakfast (milk and cereals were priced by Bob!). The room is located in a quiet col-du-sac Road. It is a 15 Minutes walk to temple bar. I can definitely recommend it!

I had such a wonderful stay at Bobs place in Dublin! The house is in a great location, beautifully decorated, and very comfortable. Great communication from the host and he met me upon arrival to give me a tour of the house and review the local map over a pot of tea. The house is within a short walk to all the local attractions plus plenty of restaurants. I was able to get around easily on foot. Bob had many great suggestions for restaurants, bars and shops. I loved all the little extras in the kitchen and the beautiful garden view. It was everything I could have wanted in an Airbnb experience and I will definitely stay at Bobs again the next time I visit Dublin! Safe house and neighborhood for my solo trip!
Bom local para um fim de semana!
Bob is a great host and his place is in a convenient location for exploring Dublin! Bob is very friendly and knowledgeable and also provides breakfast!
Great location, easy walk to all of central Dublin. Bob was a thoughtful and responsive host. Warm cosy space.
Great place, great location, wonderful host
We stayed at Robbies for a couple of night and it was nice place to stay with comfortable bed and hot water. We where also allowed to make food and where served breakfast every morning. Thanks again.

It was a pleasure staying at Robbies - clear directions and info; easy parking; kindness and friendly welcome and lots of interesting chat. Made our first night in Ireland full of ease and generosity.
Robbie's place was very clean, he was very friendly, and was great for 1 quick night near the airport. Would stay again!

Robbie was an excellent host, very welcoming, extremely helpful and made us feel right at home. His house is very comfortable and priced extremely well. Breakfast was lovely too. Would definitely recommend staying.
Great place for a few days stand - Robbie is very nice and helpfull, city center is easy to reach by bus, beds are confortable
Very nice to stay here, Robbie was very kind and easygoing and welcoming.
Great space great host

This place is a gem. Robbie's lovely, spacious home, coupled with his welcoming nature and entertaining stories created a fantastic base for my family and I. Super clean, super quiet and great location. No flaws! Thanks Robbie!

I enjoyed my stay at Robbies place. It was perfectly situated in south Dublin, just a few blocks from my primary area of visiting. The home is well maintained and the bedroom spacious and fitted with a comfortable bed. The bathroom is very clean and had all I needed. Robbie was a wonderful, helpful host.

Robbie is a great host. He is a great wealth of information and a phenomenal person altogether. He also went above and beyond when the adapter I brought from the States didn't work, he had one to loan us.
Robbies place was clean and comfortable and very convenient to Dublin. He's a thoughtful host and meticulous with directions and communication. I would definitely return if I need to.

Robbie kindly opens his home to his guests and is full of local knowledge and interesting information. The rooms are comfy, clean and spacious and he is in a good location to get the bus into Dublin. When we visited he really went the extra mile in making our stay most enjoyable.
No problems, spacious and clean, excellent communication from Robbie. Will stay again when working in South Dublin!
The cleanest place I've ever been!
Very clean.  Spacious room. Great communication.
Robbie's place is perfect to stay few days in Dublin. He is a very helpful host and his house is clean and has a good location in Dublin. I recommend it!
