This is a gem! Your close to the city, but feel like your in the country side. We woke up every morning to the sounds of birds chirping and stunning garden views. Teresa is there to answer any question you might have in a timely manner. This is where you should stay if you want to explore Ireland!

We absolutely adored our stay here. This place is a hidden gem. Wish we had more time to enjoy it! Quiet, safe, clean, and quaint. Well kept, beautiful garden. So glad we decided to stay outside the city.

Our stay was really nice. The cottage is perfectly equipped and clean. The location is great and the residence with the big garden is really calm. Teresa gave us a lot of splendid advices and she is very reactive. We would definitely come back there :)

Teresas place is amazingly beautiful.; surrounded by a stunning very green nicely manicured garden, The little cabin was a very relaxing place where to spent our time in Ireland.  Teresa was very kind and welcoming when we first arrived. The cabin has everything you need for your stay there. The cabin is very clean. I am very happy I stayed outside the city because when we would go into the city center, it was really busy (too busy for me) and its not even peak tourist time. The area that this place is located at is VERY nice area and there is a grade school only a couple of minutes away. I noticed this when we left her property to find breakfast and at about 9AM, we see their kids on bikes and being dropped off by their parents to the school. The only bad thing I have to say is that, I had to leave her place and had to leave Ireland and make my way back to the states.

Her place made me love Ireland more than ever, and this place will be my go to place when Im back in Ireland and I hope its soon!

Thanks Teresa!

I found this gorgeous cottage to be the ideal home base for 8 days of exploring Dublin and beyond. Beautiful, comfortable, private and quiet. Kitchen has all one needs to prepare simple meals which saved me quite a bit of money. Taking public transportation felt simple and safe for a solo female traveler, even late at night. Awesome neighborhood. Blackrock also has a pretty park and good eateries.

My husband and I stayed at Teresa's cabin for several days in early May while visiting Dublin. The cabin is very close to bus stops into central Dublin and for the airport express bus. It's also close to a shopping center with an Aldi's for your grocery needs. It's in a very quiet and private area, and provided a lovely respite after sightseeing all day in Dublin. The weather was chilly when we visited, and it was cozy and warm inside the cabin, despite the large windows (which have privacy curtains). We had access to a washing machine during our stay, which came in handy. Would definitely stay again!

This small cabin was perfect, if you are alone or with a significant other I highly recommend staying here! Not a far trip to Dublin center. You have the perfect privacy, convenient shopping centers within walking distance. Great view in the morning for a nice breakfast or coffee. Teresa is a GREAT host and replys almost instantaneously when you have a question or need something! For me this stay was easily a 10/10.

Teresa is a wonderful host! She was very hospitable and allowed us an earlier check in time which was a huge relief for us. The cottage itself is beautiful and has an amazing view of the garden which was so lovely to wake up to. It is also in a great location being only a few minutes away from bus stops, a train station and the Blackrock market. I would highly recommend staying here.

We loved it here, its a perfect little oasis that feels like youre in the countryside surrounded by the beautiful gardens, but close to Dublin via public transport, thats super easy to walk to, and all off the cute little cafes and pubs in Blackrock, as well as the shopping centre.

The cottage at Clonlea Studios is a quiet, charming haven in the middle of a bustling Dublin suburb. It is clean and comfortable, and a perfect base from which to explore Dublin, Wicklow, and Meath, all of which are just a short drive away. Also located a short walk from Blackrock center, which offers a variety of shops, restaurants, and the wonderful Blackrock Market, as well as easy access to public transportation. 

The kitchen is not equipped for any serious cooking, either in terms of size or equipment, so expect to be limited on that front. With so many excellent restaurant choices in the area, however, we didnt find this to be a significant problem. Easy access to laundry facilities was a huge plus, as was the lovely view of the garden from the cottages generous windows.

Teresa was an excellent host! She made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived, and responded to any questions quickly and thoroughly. Our entire stay was a great experience, and I highly recommend this property to other travelers!
Lovely cabin with nice garden, good connections everywhere, suitable for couples :)

This little cabin is the perfect place to stay if you want to visit Dublin but want a little more quiet than you would get in the city, or if you want to explore more of beautiful eastern Ireland. I was able to get to Howth, Bray, and Dublin in well under an hour via train. I was able to cook to help save some expenses, plus this place feels isolated and peaceful while still being easily accessible. I highly recommend!!
A gorgeous little cabin, thoughtfully appointed, set in an amazingly beautiful garden.   Convenient to everything we needed to do. Really thank you so much

A lovely little place to stay. Everything you need for a quiet retreat from the hussle and bussle of Dublin. A 15 minute walk to the train which is very regular and reasonably priced to get into the city. 
The host, Teresa is quick to reply with any queries you may have and very friendly. 
Would definitely recommend staying here.
We had an amazing time in the cabin! Such a lovely and cosy atmosphere, lovely location, there was everything we need in the place... absolutely brilliant! In addition, Teresa is a wonderful host!

If your looking for great value and privacy with easy transport into town or down the coast this is the one to go for. The gardens are beautiful to sit out in and your not overlooked, the place feels like a prefect little hide away and the host is attentive and lovely to deal with, can't fault it.
A beautiful compact haven in a garden of tranquility.
Fantastic place, beautiful grounds and a great location- a little outside of the fray of the city center.

The cabin is just wonderful! It's clean, it has all the basic features and more. It's warm and cozy inside, it's perfect for two people. 
I loved waking up seeing the garden full of birds and squirrels! 
The position is quite good too, in thirty minutes with the bus you are in the center of Dublin. 
Teresa is super sweet and she answers rapidly.
I highly recommend this place if you want to discover more about Ireland!
Great house... just what we needed.... loads of space, perfectly decorated and comfortable. Brain communicated really well and it all felt really comfortable. Magical.

Great house with a big garden - We stayed here as 4 couples and there was more than enough room for the 8 of us. The house is a short drive into Dun Laoghaire and a 15/20 min walk to the tram into Dublin. Brian was great and gave us suggestions for live music on the Sunday. Would definitely recommend staying here!

Staying with Imelda was great!! The location is good with easy transport to city center. The house is clean and comfy and with breakfast included, which is so nice before a long day out and about. Imelda herself is so kind and helpful! I will definitely stay here the next time we're going to Dublin! :) five star airbnb
She is really kind! I liked this house

answer any questions one might have. I felt at home with her, she has some nice touches in the room and kitchen. Decent breakfast (bread, milk, juice, tea, coffee available).  I had to exchange rental cars and she was kind enough to let me use her landline for a local call.  Thanks, Imelda for having me... :)
Great host, quiet location and easy access around the city with proximity to buses and trains
Imelda was very welcoming, we had a great stay!

Imelda's home is spotless, cozy and comfortable.   She's a wonderful host who will make you feel completely at home, and she provides many different teas, cereals, coffee, juice  and yoghurt for breakfast.  The room we stayed in (there are others) was spacious and bright during the day, and it had blackout shades and curtains for sleeping in past the early Dublin dawn.  She is a really interesting and fun person to talk to and has lots of tips for seeing the area.  Take a cab from the airport because there's no direct way to get there using public transport, though you can use buses or the train to get into the city in about 45 minutes from her quiet neighborhood.

Imelda is a great host! Her place is a quick walk to the bus stop to get to Dublins city center where all the action is located. The bus takes about 10 minutes and costs 3 Euro per person so just make sure you have coins. She greeted us on arrival, showed us how to work everything and gave us our space to rest. Imelda was very hospitable and provided cereal, yogurt and toast for us to grab in the morning. The bed was comfortable and we had a great nights rest. She does have a few rooms available for AirBnB so you may have other people staying there as well. This wasnt a big deal, we never even saw the other guests. Overall great experience, would recommend.
We had a great time and the bed was so comfortable. I would definitely recommend staying with Imelda!
I highly recommend staying at Imelda's home.  Very nice location only 5 miles form town center and a quick bus ride.  Very clean and nice home.  Imelda is a wonderful, friendly host.

This place was pretty awesome! Imelda is pretty awesome! As I arrived I had a morning flight and trouble with transportation (I couldnt figure it out) once I go to the house Imelda greeted me and was kind enough to make me a cup a tea so I could settle in! I highly recommend this place

Imelda is a great host with superb hospitality and a great heart.
Her house is in a very quite neighborhood, not too far from public transportation and for us ideally located between airport, city center and Howth (check it out if you get good weather!). We will be back at Imeldas when were in back in town.

Very comfy bed and pillows. Very clean, quiet residential area. Nice selection of cereals, fruits , breads for a healthy breakfast. Shared bathroom,which we knew about. Not ideal, but it is a real bed and breakfast, an actual home.

This was my first stay in Ireland and an Air BNB and we absolutely loved it. Imelda was so thoughtful and helpful. The place is adorable and in a beautiful quiet neighborhood.  She made us feel very welcomed and comfortable. The bed was so comfortable, I slept like a rock. Cant wait to come back.
Excellent place and friendly host

Hi Imelda, thx for being your guests - it was a nice stay for 3 Nights in Dublin - in the Morning we met People from all over the world at breakfast - good Train Connection to Dublin City and Howth - we enjoyed it - greetings from Martin and Gerda from Germany

Imelda is a wonderful host, she helped us navigating the public transport system and she was always available for us. The apartment is lovely and located in a peaceful  and friendly neighborhood, both the city centre and the airport are easily reachable by bus in around 20 minutes.
Imelda is a charming host and her place is spotless, welcoming and homey!
She made us feel at home. Its like visiting your grandmas house

You were absolutely amazing as a host and we certainly will be back for another visit. Great welcome to a great good bye, loved everything from the bed to the delicious thought out breakfast. You made us feel welcome not only as a guest but as part of your family, we didnt want to leave! You are a fantastic, kind lady and cant wait to see you again. Definitely recommending you to others. YOUR A STAR! X
Imelda has a nice house a bit outside Dublin. We went into the city centre with the DART and that was quite easy to do.
Imelda was so warm and welcoming!! She had great tips about getting around locally which made travel so much easier. Everything was clean and lovely. I would love to stay here again.
I really recommend it! :)
good stay

Really cosy house, with super kind and available host. Not exactly around Dublin's corner but super easy to get there with different options at your disposal.
It was a real pleasure to know Imelda and if a trip to Dublin happens in the future, we already know where to stay.
Imelda is a great host and looked after my parents very well.

Imelda is a lovely host with a beautiful house. The location is about 1/2 hour from the city centre by bus or train.
The area is quiet, Imeldas room is beautiful, clean.

It was a really nice stay and a super comfy bed with nice included breakfast but was more far from the city then we've expected but nevertheless an awesome stay for the days we've been there! Highly recommended!

Imelda is the kind of host that goes above and beyond and it shows!

All the linen smelled amazingly fresh and the beds are made super tight with thoughtful touches - like candy on the night stand and nicely folded towels on the comforter.

The entire home is sparkling clean like a 5 star hotel and smells great.

She offers a nice breakfast in the mornings with great advice on transportation throughout town.

The room is a short hop away from the 27A Bus or the Dart train from Harmonstown.

Extras included a charging converter because I didn't even think to bring one.

A+ would recommend. 

Hope to stay again soon 

Don't think about it, just book it!

My mother and I visited Dublin for the weekend and Imelda's place was the perfect stay for us! She will really make sure you feel 100% comfortable at her house. The place was clean, tidy and had beautiful little touches such as flowers and candleholders. Every morning we had a breakfast that Imelda provided - a wide selection of jams, spreads, as well as pastry, bread, coffees and teas. Imelda was very responsive to any of my questions prior to our arrival. She gave us some great recommendations about buying the city card and saving money, as well as some places to see. Her place is a comfortable bus ride from the city centre and in a great, quiet location. Thank you Imelda for being the perfect host! 
Jalia & Tara

She is very nice and her place is very organized. There is close by bus stop by 5mins walking distance. Personally I like the most bed where I slept one of the comfy bed so far:) hopefully I will visit her again. Thanks for being a great host :)
Imelda's home is excellent and made us feel at home. As many others have stated she makes you feel like part of the family. Her knowledge of the area and recommendations made the stay amazing!
Imelda was a very helpful host and ensured that we had all that we needed. The bed was super comfy! The breakfast options were also lovely
Amazing experiance! Imelda was very welcoming and attentive host. The hous and room was lovely and clean. Definitely recommend. Thank you Imelda
A lovely stay, close to town and a short walk to the bus stop

Imeldas home reminded me of the pensiones I stayed in Italy when I was a college student, except much much nicer. Imelda herself was lovely and very helpful. I did like my room; the bed was very comfortable with adequate coverings, lots of space to hang things, toiletries provided. Very quiet at night, easy to sleep. She also provided a stack of books and flyers of things to do in case you havent yet planned your trip. I appreciated that Imelda provided a very nice breakfast. My only frustration was the bathroom situation (sharing between four other guests; no shower after 9:30pm; showers to be kept to 5-10 minutes; having to wait over an hour in the morning when you really need to use the facilities) was somewhat frustrating. That aside, I enjoyed my stay.
Perfect room if you spend a weekend in Dublin. In walking distance to public transport and a close taxi ride from the airport. Definitely better than all the noisy stays in the city centre!
We had a nice time in the BnB and the connection to Dublin city by DART railway is really good.
Wonderful location next to Guinness, a bus stop and convince store. Newly renovated and clean. Easy check-in.
Vey nice to stay. Walking distance from famous sights.

A nice location very close to Guinness on the West side of the city. There was an oversight in cleaning the location  prior to our arrival but the site contact was super responsive in resolving the issue immediately. I would absolutely consider this location again for future visits to Dublin.
Lots of stairs, lots of neighbours, lots of nearby shops, clean apartment in the west of the city centre, bus stop right in front of it.
Perfect for a short stay close to Dublin City Centre. Within walking distance of many attractions e.g. Temple bar and Guinness factory.

Apt nice and clean. Contact with Host fast and easy. I can recommend this house. Only thing what i missed there was lack of info about way of working the water heating system, info about wifi password and maybe easier (more clear) instruction how to get to apt.

The stay went well. Very helpful and great suggestions for places to see while in Dublin. Would have liked more privacy in the shower as it seemed like it was missing a door. Very kind and helpful person.
Great stylish space located close to the Guinness store house and within walking distance to center of Dublin. We had a great stay and would stay here again!

Not exactly what we were expecting .. very basic accommodations. 

little confusing with contradicting addresses and information - he will send you an email with further information. That address was correct, so ignore the apps information. Also, the key sticks in the top bolt. 

WiFi password was hard to find - the instructions stated the password was posted on a whiteboard. We did not see a whiteboard in the apartment .. So we flagged down the sweet, excellent and extremely helpful cleaning lady! 

The hot water was a timed thing, so it was harder to get hot water.   I didnt get a hot shower for 3 days..

There was an issue with other Airbnb tenants in the building trying to get in their room. There was a ton of banging, chasing, and loud noise - I called the host to give him a heads up or ask for assistance. No word back from him.
5 stars! Exceeded expectations. Comfortable, cosy and sparkling clean! A great find. Would definitely book to stay again when visiting Dublin.
Good location for guiness factory and Kilmainham gaol prison. Easy check in and helpful host. Room ok for 1 night

The place is 25 minutes walk from the centre. Taking the bus or LUAS is quite expensive, about 3 pounds for a single journey. Lots of drunk people around, I helped one of them one day as he was lying on the pavement. Another day a bike was stolen from the shop next to the flat. The floor had not been cleaned properly, and the bed sheet and duvet cover didn't look clean. The shop next to the flat is very expensive. Water is a bit of an issue, as if you forget to put the timer on you can't get a hot shower. On the positive side, the big bus stops just in front of the flat. We did a ticket for the entire stay and we could move easily. The Guinness storehouse is around the corner. Christian is very friendly and responsive, and allowed us to leave the luggage after check out. Many trips to Lidl nearby (10 mins walk) which has good prices. Overall we managed to have a good holiday.
We didnt actually stay here in the end as it hadnt been cleaned, but Christian sorted out alternative accommodation for us.
Everything was as described on Airbnb! The flat is a 20 minute walk from the city centre. There is a small market just downstair, which is useful to grab a bite for breakfast/dinner.
Grest location close to Guinness and other pubs and places to eat. Friendly host with lots of tips for things to do. Place was quite clean and comfortable.  Would stay here again.
Very modern and recently remodeled.  Two minutes walk from the Guinness Storehouse and a couple of excellent pubs.  A slightly longer walk to central Dublin and Phoenix Park.  Highly recommended.

Small clean and easy to get around. 20 minute walk to temple bar and 5 minute walk to Guinness storehouse. We would definitely stay here again if we come back. Check in was easy and communication was quick.
You can't get closer to the home of Guinness

The apartment had a great location so we were walking distance of what we wanted to do as well as a few convenience stores for snacks. The space was very clean and we appreciated that the living room had a door to add privacy to those sleeping on the pull out. The pull out was much bigger than we expected and comfortably slept two people. Christian provided detailed instructions on checking in and we had no issues, he was also quick to respond with the few questions we had.
Great stay, great host!
Good location, clean, with all the things there one needs.
Very close to the Guinness store house. A good position for hop on hop off bus and tram. Great little kitchen. All details sent by Christian are easy to read and use.
Good experience, would stay again!
Suits the needs for the stay. Bit of a walk from the city center

Well equiped apartment. The price is high, but so it is in all Dublin. Although beeing a third floor without elevator, it is close to the city centre by foot, what is very convenient to save money in public transport, which is expensive in Dublin.
Recommendable.
A basic apartment but in a central location.
Great place located next to the guinness museum and 20 minute walk  from the temple bar district
Excellent accommodation! Just an observation: the wifi did not work while I stayed there, I believe it is not a frequent problem, but was occasional.
Good location and all you need for a great stay in Dublin

My friends and I visited Dublin to see a show at Vicar Street, and chose this apartment because it's within 10 mins walking distance. 
This apartment is slightly outside of the centre of Dublin but is conveniently located opposite a bus stop with regular buses right into the heart of the city.  It was very clean and comfortable with a particularly nice bathroom. There's a small supermarket a few doors down if you're planning on self-catering and a nice coffee shop very close by as well. 
The apartment is extremely convenient if you want to visit the Guinness storehouse. 

I'd definitely choose this apartment again if visiting Dublin again in the future, the hosts were great communicators and were kind enough to provide some tips for what to see locally.
A clean and cosy appartment. Perfect for a quick visit to Dublin.
The location of this place is perfect. Right in center city around everything you could want. All within walking distance. It was perfect for us! I would defiantly stay here again!
A nice appartement tjat is really close to the guinnes storehouse
Good room, close to train and bus station.
Nice place, not in the more touristic area, however, close to a pub and market. Facilities exactly as described.
Clean place,Great location!  Would definitely stay here again!
A very comfortable stay and self checking is great
Buen lugar, espacioso y como lo ves en las fotos. Acceso inmediato al transporte publico lo cual es muy conveniente.
Great location. Just as described.

Great location to Attractions ( Guinness brewery, The goal, hop on & hop off bus at front door). Number of pubs close by for good meals and a pint.  Flat is above a small store which catered for all food stuffs.  Great location and Facilities are also good.  recommend
Great location. Clean. Lots of space. Highly recommend.

It was such a cosy place in such a quiet neighbourhood after a busy day around Dublin. The 30-minute walk till the city center was really great! Jane was always so kind and we found everything there for us. Needless to say, it's a space for two people, but you'll find everything you need there, and even more! We totally recommend this place!
Probably my best airbnb experiences, The appartment is in such a nice area in Dublin, very close to the city, 5 stars

The accommodation was excellent with extra touches of food in the fridge on our arrival.  There were easy directions from the airport and clear instructions and maps left in the unit.  We loved the charming area of Dublin and the quiet beauty of the Square. Thankyou for allowing for an early checkin. Everything was excellent!

This apartment was a perfect base for exploring Dublin and its neighborhoods. We walked or took one of many buses that run into Dublin. There are coffee shops and restaurants nearby.

The apartment is just off a main street but is very quiet and tucked away within a lovely courtyard. (The last time we stayed in Dublin we were right in the center of the nightlife area and the noise kept us up until all hours.)

The airport bus stops right nearby and is convenient for getting to and from the airport. 

Well be back to stay here - it was convenient to the city center and we enjoyed being in a quiet area!

Elizabeth and Janes apartment is located in a comfortable and quiet gated community that is just outside downtown Dublin. We selected it because of its convenient location near downtown and UCD, where I was attending a meeting. Bus stops are close-by and provide convenient transport. The apartment is described accurately and the kitchen is well-stocked if you wish to do some cooking. We would happily stay here again.

Aanrader voor bezoek Dublin
Wel iets verder weg van centrum.
Schoon, compleet, veilige locatie.

This place was a wonderful find. We felt instantly at home (4 nights) in its comfort as well as beautiful landscaping to look at. We arrived jet lagged and there were a variety of coffees, teas, bread, cookies, and snacks to make a little lunch. 
    We never waited more than a few minutes for 1 of the 3 busses for a short ride into the city center (we got the 72 hr DoDublin card & used every feature). We knew we could always get a bus back from Nassau St adjacent to Trinity College.  The walk into the center was very doable. 
     The wonderful Donneybrook Fair supermarket a block away made it easy to eat breakfast and most dinners in (we had to buy dinners out on a 7 day tour when we left).  And it had s great selection of wine and local craft beer. 
      This place is a keeper!!!   
A practical  note - if tickets to Kilmainham Gaol are sold out they release more tickets online at 9-9:15 am every day.
Elizabeth & Janes place was wonderful! We could not have asked for a better experience in this quiet, close neighborhood to Dublin City Centre.

Situated in a lovely residential area.
The house is spotlessly clean and well equipped. 
Close to local amenities and short taxi ride to a number of great pubs and restaurants. 
Highly recommend this AirBnB.

The place full of nice touches, hospitality wise. Close to the center if you like to walk a bit, even better if you're a traveler with your own car as we were. The house was warm and sparkling clean, and despite we never met Jane, she was always in touch and extremely prompt in helping us if we had needed her. No doubt I'll book this place if I come to Dublin again.
Sauber, unkompliziert, freundlich, zentru (Hidden by Airbnb) ah - Jederzeit wieder!

Mariusz was a great host. He made sure we had all we needed and was quick to fix any issues we had. The apartment is conveniently located very near a tram station that you can use to get in 10 mins to city centre. If we return to Dublin we would gladly stay here again.

Mariusz gave us helpful travel recommendations. The space is as advertised and the location is great!Close enough to walk to the touristic areas, but also right in from of a train stop that can take you there even faster. Great value!

Mariusz was an amazing host. His place was wonderful to stay at. Very clean and the place was very nice and quiet. He was easy to talk to and very friendly. Gave you space and didnt bother you, but was always there for a chat and to give tips and suggestions. The location was great. The transit was easy to use and cheap but we chose to walk everywhere because it was a quick walk. Highly recommend staying here!!
What a super stylish place! The place is conveniently situated. Very clean. Perfect for a short stay!
Everything was perfect, the room was exactly like in the photos, and very clean. Just next to the tram station, very easy to go to the center of Dublin.

Mariusz's place was a nice flat about a 5 minute drive from the main tourist areas of Dublin.  The location had free parking on the street and access to the tram directly out front.  This is an area that I would consider up and coming, but it is not the best part of Dublin.
Really nice apartment, central and with a train station right across the street, which makes it really easy to get to all the sightseeing spots! :)

The room and the bathroom were really cozy, modern and perfectly clean. The apartmennt is located just in front of a tram station and is very easy to reach the city center. Mariusz was super helpful and we could check-in very late in the night. Thank you very much! Recommended!

My cousin and I stayed and Mariuszs place. He was so easy to work with! Quick responses, very helpful. His place was very stylish and clean. I literally have no complaints. Although we werent able to meet him, his friend stayed there and took care of things. Junior was also friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend anybody to stay there. When we come back to Dublin, I would stay with him again!

Booked for my son and his girlfriend - and they had a brilliant time.  They loved the apartment (and fact they didn't need to take towels and toiletries) and my communications with Mariusz were excellent.

Mariusz was a fantastic host. He greeted us very promptly and made us feel very welcome. He provided us with many recommendations and was available to answer questions. His place was very clean and very well decorated. The bed is comfortable and the location is ideal (right by public transportation). We would definitely stay here again.

Mariusz is a very friendly and welcoming host. I felt comfortable from the moment we met. His apartment is in a great location for connecting to public transportation in Dublin.  The room is clean and private with very modern bath attached, and super comfortable bed. I think Mariusz covered everything I could want or need to be comfortable. I am a single, senior, female adventurer and this stay couldn't have been better. I would highly recommend staying with Mariusz.

Tutto molto bene, check in facile, posizione ottima davanti alla fermata della tramvia. Appartamento carino, arredato con gusto, bel box doccia. Mariusz ci ha fatto sentire a casa, facile comunicare con lui e sempre disponibile.
We had a fantastic trip. The apartment is beautiful. Reactive and kind host.
Great space, accommodating host, and very clean! Wouldnt hesitate to stay here again!

Our accommodation was very modern. We had everything we needed. The location is very good. You can walk to the center of Dublin in foot.
Mariusz is a great host. He gave us valuable tips and has a great department.  We can recommended the accommodation to anyone.
Good place to stay if youre going to be out and about in Dublin, very comfortable and accomadating!

Mariuszs Apartment was perfect for our recent trip, not too close to temple bar not too far, it felt super safe, bed was so comfy & everything was spotlessly clean. 
Transport too & from was so easy & was so nice to know I could just text Mariusz or Junior for any help or directions. 

When we return to Dublin we will 100% be using this apartment again. Thankyou so much!
Great place to stay while exploring Dublin! Close enough to the tourist attractions that you can walk, far enough that you can take a break from the crowds. Very welcoming!
A very clean and contemporary place to stay, enjoyed it!

Mariusz' pad is right across from the LUAS stop, making it very easy to hop on the red line and travel downtown. The location is also within walking distance of the Irish Museum of Modern Art and the Kilmainham Jail, where you can take an excellent tour. This was my first time not staying in an Airbnb all to myself, and Mariusz made me feel most welcome and at home. It was great to have a conversation together about his experiences and observations about Ireland. I highly recommend staying with Mariusz.

We had a very positive experience with the host, who was very helpful and friendly. The room itself was tight for two people- the king frame (with queen mattress) and was pushed against the wall, making the bed hard to access for one person. The furniture provided made it possible to put away clothes but left little room to open and spread out suitcases other than on the bed. 

Very convenient to the tram, just across the street, which allowed us to access the entire city easily.
Mariusz is super friendly and welcoming host. We felt great at his place. The apartment is very stylish, close to city center and has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Thank you Mariusz.
Maruisz was a phenomenal host making great recommendations and extremely friendly. Bed was comfortable and everything was clean. Couldnt ask for a nicer place!

Mariuszs apartement is beautiful, we enjoyed our stay in a very modern and clean room. It was a pleasure to met Mariusz and our late arrival at 11pm wasnt a problem for him. He was very friendly, offered us coffee, water, Wifi, shampoo and a map of Dublin. We very recommend Mariusz and his apartement and would definitely stay a second time there.
This place is absolutely wonderful. One of the best I have ever stayed at. It is right across from the Luas which is PERFECT! The space itself is clean, hip, and safe. I would love to stay anytime!!!

Mariusz's place was wonderful. The space was very clean and stylish. We loved that the tram was conveniently located and easy to use. We really appreciated that the host let us drop off our luggage before our check In time so we wouldn't have to worry about hauling them around as we explored the city. The early check in was a huge bonus as we were very jet-lagged. We highly recommend staying at this Airbnb

Great apartment, with tram stop right outside to allow for quick and easy access into Dublin City centre. 
Mariusz went out of his way to help return some lost items so that was very much appreciated. Highly recommend staying here. Thanks

We stayed at 3 Airbnb's during our 2 week trip through UK/Ireland and we can safely say, Mariusz was by far the best host we had! We flew in early and he was not only willing to let us drop our bags off early, but made us coffee, provided us with a map of Dublin and shared his recommendations of places to go and see. My husband and I prefer to walk everywhere we go, we found it very easy to do from this location, but Mariusz's place is right across the street from the tram if you choose to use it. The place itself was beautiful and incredibly clean. It does get a little noisy some nights so I'd recommend ear plugs, but this was expected as all big cities have this issue. I wouldn't take a star away for that.
Mariusz is a perfect host. He is really friendly and helpful. The room is sparkly clean and very well decorated. The bed is really comfy. There is a tram station just in front of the house.
Very considerate host, and a lovely clean apartment. Very easy to get into the city centre, we walked which took around 15 minutes.

Mariusz is an exceptional host! His home is clean, inviting and overall amazing! Mariusz is extremely accommodating- providing maps of the city, personal recommendations, coffee in the morning, and available for any questions or concerns. Home is conveniently located to Guinness Factory and other tourist attractions. I HIGHLY recommend him and his home for any traveler.

Mariusz has the gift of design.  His place is so cool - classy, full of modern art, every detail is thoughtfully designed.    It is very comfortable and private with a keyed entrance to the room as well.  Great location. We loved staying there...hes the nicest guy - ready to help, friendly, kind, easy to share space with.
One of the most 'designy' and cleanest places I ever stayed at! A really good place, totally recommended!
Nice stay!

Mariusz was very friendly and recommended great things to do in Dublin. His place was very clean and we loved the decorations and style. We found it really useful that the Tram stopped right in front of the building. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Dublin!
It was a great place with easy transit options! Would gladly stay again if I went to Dublin again!

Mariusz has gone to great detail to present his place very nicely with lots of interesting and appropriate touches.
The apartment is very clean and if you are prepared to share spaces with others then it has everything you need.
The local area whilst very convenient for transport and location to the city, was unfortunately very noisy with voices from the street being heard well into the morning.

Mariuszs apartment is really stylish and clean. It was nice to come back to after a long day of walking around Dublin.Mariusz was friendly and made us feel at home. There is a tram station just across so easy to get into the centre, or u can just walk
Great room in host's apartment.  This place is super clean and very tastefully decorated.  Host was very nice and took time to explain local sites etc.  Would highly recommend staying here!
Beautifully stylish, clean and centrally located apartment. Would recommend it to anyone.

We stayed two nights at Mariusz apartment and it was great. He is such an open and kind person, so that we really rather felt like meeting a friend than being at a stangers place. 
The apartment is really stylish and the bed very comfy. It is very close to a Luas station from which you can easily go downtown. 
A cafe nearby offers good and cheap breakfast and to-go options.

Thank you Mariusz!
Very nice, quiet appartement, located directly opposite of the tramway, that brings you into the center within 10-15 min. Great for a short stay in Dublin.
Really great stay - Mariusz was very friendly and great to talk to. The flat and room were excellent too. Would definitely stay here again.
Beautiful apartment in a great location to explore Dublin. Mariusz is an amazing host !

Mariusz was very hospitable and keeps a very clean private room and bathroom. He had helpful tips for us, and the breakfast spot The Arch right by his apartment building was wonderful. We loved the live music in Dublin
We had an awesome two nights with Marious who has a very well designed home and close to all the tourist places we wanted to see.  All around he made our trip Dublin an excellent experience.
Mariusz is very hospital and helpful, and his place is super comfortable and stylish. It was a perfect stay in Dublin for us!

This was the perfect place to stay for the first leg of my Ireland adventure. I was able to park on the street behind the apartment and Mariusz was kind enough to let me drop my suitcase off early in the day. The train station was right across the street and so I was able to zip into temple bar in about 15 minutes, or walk there in about 25. Mariusz was responsive and helpful. Highly recommend!
it was amazing experience. Mariusz is so kind and helpful.  Place is amazing! very unique style.  very quiet street ,tram is across the street. i recommend this place. thank you Mariusz for host us !

The host was exceptional! He was very accommodating to our check in and out requests. He was also very welcoming and friendly, he provided us with local tips and sights and answered any questions during our stay. 
The room was exactly like the description, we enjoyed it!

Mariusz was a wonderful host with an equally wonderful apartment. 

The location is right across from the tram, two stops down from a major hub, 10 minutes to the center of action. Everything is spotless, well decorated, and designed to meet a travelers need. 

In advance of my visit, Mariusz communicated clearly & was super accommodating about letting me bring my bags over early instead of lugging them around all day. 

10/10 would stay here again!
The place is amazing. Very beautiful! Everything like on the pictures and even better! Perfect as well to park a car and reach the city by foot or tram! Just go there its great!

I highly recommend booking at Mariuszs place. The place is well decorated and very clean. The appartement is walking distance from the city center and there is a tram station across the street if you dont feel like walking. 
Mariusz was very accommodating and friendly ! 10/10

Beautiful and stylish apartment with everything we needed for our stay! Looks just like the photos. Mariusz was very accommodating and we were in a key location right next to the tram and actually walked quite a few key places in the city! I would definitely recommend to all.

The place was beautiful and incredibly well decorated. The on-suite bathroom and bedroom were very clean. Mariusz communicated well and quickly. Definitely the nicest Airbnb I have stayed in thus far.

Super suggested!

About the apartment: you can find all amenities listed by the announcement, the pictures correspond to reality, the location is very clever in front of the Fatima Luas stop (red line is the line perfect to reach the city center). 

About Mariusz: he's so helpful and friendly, always attentive to the guests needs. He's respectful but also a funny person who make you feel, for sure, as an old friend.

Our stay at Mariusz's place could not have been better.  Perfect host, as well as his friend Junior.  Very good location and beautiful apartment.  We had a very enjoyable stay and nothing to complain about!

Mariusz was away during our stay, so his friend Junior greeted us and gave us a tour and instructions on how to check out. He was very friendly and made us feel at home. It was a beautiful and cosy apartment that's steps away from a Luas stop and within walking distance to all the major attractions. Would definitely stay there again if we're ever back in Dublin!

Our stay here was incredible! Mariusz is a fantastic host who was extremely kind, had plenty of information about the city and made our stay so very easy and comfortable! His friend Junior was also very helpful and kind as well! Absolutely amazing stay!

Spent a couple nights at Mariuszs place in Dublin. Extremely convenient location. 10 minute walk to Guinness Storehouse, 30 second walk to the Fatima Luas stop. The Luas run frequently, so getting into town was never a task. Excellent value, would recommend.
Ottimo appartamento molto ben curato da suggerire

Great space neat legendary Guinness Factory. Makes extra efforts to communicate promptly and with tact. Stylish space that suits all your needs to rest your head. Would definitely recommend this host.

This place is great.  Its right across from the tram which gets you to the city center in under 20 minutes.  The apartment was very clean and the room was comfortable. Mariusz was very kind and made us feel right at home. He gave us plenty of suggestions for things to do and how to get around when we first arrived, and was great about answering questions.

Mariusz was very flexible with check-in and stayed up until after midnight for us. He was very good at recommending things to do in Dublin. 
The flat was clean and tidy, and very well decorated! The tram station is just on the doorstep of the building. 

Overall a very good stay, would definitely recommend
Es war ein sehr angenehmer aufenthalt.

The place was exactly as described- tasteful furniture, comfortable bed, everything was spotless.
I had some great conversations with the host & thoroughly enjoyed my stay!
Highly recommended! :)
The apartment is very nice, we loved how it is decorated! Mariusz is a lovely owner ! There is the luas stop right in front of the building which is really useful.

I had a great stay at Mariusz apartment, it was very clean and tidy. The bedroom had a private bathroom which had towels, hairdryer, body wash and shampoo. Good location, I used the tram to get into the city and the stop is right outside the apartment. 
Mariusz was a great host, very friendly and respectful. I would definitely recommend staying here

What a beautiful gem this apartment is. Stayed in Mariusz apartment for 2 day and really felt comfortable and welcoming. I was met with a warm smile from Mariusz who really is a brilliant host. As a creative person I absolutely loved the decor and the photography vibe it has to offer. Very chilled and relaxed atmospheric vibes. The luas tram is literally across the road from the apartment. Commuting into the city centre is about 10 minutes on the luas tram. Highly recommend. :)
Very well furnished house, very clean and 5 minutes from the city center by tram.  Recommended!  Mariusz is a perfect host.
Fantastic place

Such a lovely place to stay, quite and relaxing and so so comfortable. Patsey is a very welcoming host, and makes you feel at home, I was spoilt, I even got offered dinner on my first night which was so sound after a days work. Thank you Patsey! Louise
I had a fabulous stay at Patsey's lovely place. She is very helpful and makes you feel at home and is a great host. I would highly recommend and hope to stay again.

Patseys place is terrific. Lovely location and neighbourhood with a comfortable bed and great amenities. Patsey goes out of her way to make you feel comfortable in her home and makes a great cup of tea. Patsey also offers breakfast which is a great bonus and there is plenty of parking outside her place as well. Thanks Patsey for a fab stay!

Great value for Dublin.  This home appears to be located just on the edge of a nice neighborhood, but be warned that a direct route via gps to the Guinness Storehouse will take you through some sketchy areas.  

The house is clean in the rooms and bathrooms, but needs some elbow grease in the common areas.  The couch is pretty nasty.  They have, however spent some time recently renovating the bathrooms and bedrooms and they look great.  

The upstairs shower lost pressure after one shower.  It became a trickle you couldnt even wash your hands with.  The best shower is the downstairs one as it is consistent and also doesnt fluctuate between cold and scalding over and over again as is common with pump showers in Ireland.  

The host was very friendly and accommodated us on short notice.

Overall stay was good. It would have been even better if the house door had a number, the street had more parking space with cars not blocking the road and the downstairs bathroom was cleaner. However, despite these issues, the overall stay was still good and the rest of the house was clean. Carmel was good with responding to questions.
Patsey is a wonderful host and she has a beautiful and clean home

Patsey is very friendly and helpful. The place and room is very nice too. For my taste, the bed was too firm. The list of rules was just a bit much for me too feel completely at ease at times. Proximity to the train station was not bad but at night the bus takes an hour to get back from centre town. I liked meeting Patsey and she was very helpful, offering food and drink while I was battling a cold.
Had a great stay at Patsey's home which is immaculate and Patsey is a great host . Highly recommended.

Maria met me on the first night from the Luas and explained  everything so carefully about keys/access/the cat/how everything worked. Good WiFi. Apartment clean with everything I needed for a week stay. Maria is great to communicate with at home and over the messaging service on the air BnB app. Thanks for the great stay Maria.

Maria is a superhost! She is really kind and she helped me planning my journey! The house is very close to the Guinness storehouse and furthermore there is the Luas stop exactly in front of the house which goes straight to the city centre! Thanks again for everything!

Loved my stay at Maria's apartment. It was conveniently located near the Laus Red Line, but it is also a quick 20 minute walk to city centre from her place. Maria was thoughtful and helpful. She gave great advise on what to do in Dublin. We had lovely and hilarious conversations when I came back in the evenings.  I highly recommend staying with Maria when travelling to Dublin.
Maria is very kind. I was happy to be her guest for few days. The appartment was perfect and very clean.

Its a neat and cozy place and I slept very well there. Maria is a great hostess, explained everything and cared about my comfort. The place is very close to the Luas station, bus stops also nearby, and 20 -30 minutes walking distance to downtown. Recommend!
Clean and cosy, a nice stay

Nice warm and tidy place. Everything explained as required.

Maria, met me off Luas as arranged. Shower great room lovely and warm
Located very close to the luas stop and has just about everything that you need

My stay at Maria's house war perfect !
The apartment is really clean and cosy, its location is really good (2min from Luas Red Line, then around 15min from Dublin center). Maria is an excellent host, she will make you feel at home and she is always ready to help. I highly recommend !
Convenient location, great host. She communicated with me and was just such an accommodating host
Great host, great property . Quick transports links into town. Lovely historic building, loads of style.

Great location for the Guinness Storehouse and Jameson Distillery, but not for spending the night in downtown Dublin. I recommend this for a quiet night, but not for late drinking or for anyone other than a solo traveler. 

Keep in mind that you'll carry your luggage around until 7pm as it's a late checkin
Maria is a very pleasant host. Her place is right near a Luas stop so it was handy enough to get to and from Heuston Station. Good value.

Marias flat is absolutely perfect for a solo traveler. The space has everything you need and the tram thats just across the street is super easy to navigate anywhere you could want to go in Dublin (and thats coming from someone who is not great with public transportation). Maria is a wonderful host and makes you feel right at home.

Lovely well located flat . Great transport links . Couldnt recommend  the host enough.
Thanks Maria
Maria is a great host, the room is clean and I slept very well there. The location is close to the public transport
Maria was very helpful during my stay in Dublin.
It's a pretty place to live n very near to Heuston station through tram. Just text her exact timings of your arrival.
Maria provides lovely accommodation which is meters from the Luas stop.  Such a comfortable bed and she was an exceptional host.  Thank you very much Maria

For some unusual reasons I had to stay at 8 different locations in Dublin, Marias being both the last and best place. As advertised the room is on the small size but is well furnished and completely comfortable for the single traveller.  Access to a fridge and other kitchen faculties is easy and invited. The tram line is a minute away and for ‚Ç¨7+ for all day travel in Dublin very cheap and convenient. Maria is was great in every way to make my stay a fine one.
Perfect for a single traveler. Extremely close to a public transit stop. It's a good spot to crash for a night while visiting Dublin. Host was very kind. :)

Maria has a beautiful very clean home and is a wonderful host ! It couldnt be better! Thank you Maria , and as lm not a very good traveler and needed a lot of information and help , l appreciated all this very needed advice to find my way around , 
Warm wishes Josephine
Very cosy and warm (Website hidden by Airbnb) host.Hopefully will use room again.
A lovely quiet room near to the city centre. Maria is such a friendly host- she even came to meet me at the nearby Luas stop .

Maria is a fantastic host. She was very helpful before I came, she sent me several useful informations. She is a great host, very welcoming. And the accommodation is so clean! The room is very nice and the bed is fantastic. No noise from the outside, very quiet and one minute from the Luas, few minutes by Luas to downtown. I highly recommend this location. Thank you Maria.
Cosy, warm, quiet and comfy home away from home. Great location and Maria was a lovely host, very helpful and accommodating.
Maira is a great host and the location is great, it's convenient to all the places in Dublin. I had a great time in Dublin and would book again next time!
Very clean and great location.
Everything was perfect!
Really good place . Everything you would want

Maria is a lovely friendly lady, presenting a clean comfy flat. Enjoyed my stay there.
The 747 bus takes an hour to Houston station then short tram trip, its about a mile to the main centre from the tram stop but an easy walk along the Liffey, would recommend.
Maria was a great host. She met me at the Luas tram stop and gave me a very detailed explanation of everything. Sparkling clean, steps from public transport and nice touches.
Room was great, bed was great, shower was great, and the host was the most!
Superclean, easy communication, quiet neighbourhood, nice bed.

Maria met me at the trolly stop and walked me over to her flat.  It took less than 5 minutes.  Once I got into the flat I could smell a cat box.  Maria explained to me about five times how to shut my bedroom door.  When I moved the night stand to plug in my phone, Maria moved the nightstand back to its original place - she didn't even give me a chance to.  There were about 59 rules for using the kitchen.  Maria mentioned no less than three times not to open the doors quickly or I would bump her cat.  Unfortunately, I could not understand how to make the front door lock and unlock.  Again, there were like 48 steps to make the door lock and unlock.  Maybe it was because I had had a very long flight and an even longer day, but I had a difficult time putting all the steps together to make the door lock and unlock.  Maria was so rude when I made mistakes.  She was condescending, impolite, impatient and did not hide her anger with me.  The whole experience was so awful that I just gave up and checked myself into a hotel.  I just left Maria's space altogether.  Not recommended.
Brilliant pit stop
Maria help the person for any thing like call for a taxi. A warm welcome and an clear understand about my need.

Maria is a wonderful host - very welcoming and personable, great chat.  The flat itself is sparkling clean and comfortable.  Personally I really liked the location as transport links are excellent, the area is quiet, and its not in the middle of the city.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This Host cancelled my reservation on night my Stay!
Maria had decided that I was not the man in my profile Picture (it was me!, a picture 5 years old and few lbs extra)  and she stubbornly refused me access to the place.
Maria seriously underestimates how stressful this is for a client. That night in Dublin, there was multiple events in City and it was next to impossible find another place or Hotel.
While AirBnB were trying their best to find a suitable replacement ... it took hours. Four and a half hours in fact.
I have used AirBnB multiple times across Ireland and Europe, and have never experienced this behaviour. I have always got very positive reviews from everyone I stayed with, and I had also presented Maria my Passport/Driving Licence/Credit Card ... But, She still refused me access to place. As "I was not the person in Photo"???. 
She even had the vulgarity to say "The Person in the Photo looks Healthy".
After 4 and a half stressful hours, AirBnB managed to finally find me a replacement accommodation, and this "unhealthy" person did manage to run the Dublin half Marathon :)

Unless you want stress and drama ... avoid this host!

Maria was an excellent host who gave me all the information I needed to be welcome, comfortable and secure in her home and in the city in general. The space is cosy but perfect for a solo traveller and the transport links really are as convenient as described (the Luas is good but for a real experience, try the city bikes!) Thanks again for a fab stay, would definitely come back!
Cute place with a cute cat. Maria is lovely and helpful. I'd recommend buying a public transport ticket from the info shops in the city to make it easier to get around
Maria was really friendly and welcoming. The room is small but really nice, impeccable cleanliness and the main convenience is the tram almost in front of the house. Super recommended!
Lovely space, very clean and great location. Plus, Maria was great and very helpful at check in!
Maria was a wonderful host. Her home is spotlessly clean in a brilliant location for traveling in Dublin.
Maria was great, knows the area well and will go out of her way for you need something. comfy spot for anyone traveling alone and near downtown area. Her cat is also cute!

Maria was kind enough to meet me at the trolley stop and show me the way to get to her home, just a very short walk from the station. 
Her place is up a flight of steps from the street and then one more flight inside a hallway. Her apartment is small and because of who Maria is, it felt cozy and somehow familiar. 
I had a wonderful conversation with Maria on the night I was there, which made her home a warm place to visit. My room was on the small side but quite clean and neat. The kitchen was small as was the shared bathroom but everything was adequate for a one night stay. 
Marias Place was the way AirBnB s used to be. Youd open up your home to a traveler who needed a humble accommodation for a night or two. Youd give them a clean room and comfortable bed, some nice meaningful conversation that theyd never forget, and then in the morning wish them a good journey. All for a good price. 
That was my experience with Maria.
Great location,  close to the Luas and St James's hospital.  Parking in street.  Welcomed by Maria, helped with my luggage, shown around the property and all facilitates demonstrated.
Marias place was cozy, the bed was comfortable, area was easy to get to, Maria was friendly and helpful :)
Maria is a great host, lovely place to stay.
Thanks again Maria for everything. Thanks for being so helpful and nice. It was a pleasure.
Sparkling clean, great shower, very comfortable bed, great location next to tram stop, very quite. Nice host and lovely kitty, Id stay again. Nuala

Marias place is first class in every department 
I would highly recommend
Maria was a lovely host, very helpful and friendly. Room was very clean and tidy. I recommend her 100%!
Best place to stay in Dublin. Close enough to walk all around the without using the car, but far enough to be perfectly calm, far from the downtown noise. Maria was a perfect host.
Maria is super friendly and welcoming and her lovely flat is excellently located for exploring the sights of west Dublin, or a short hop on the Luas into the town centre.
Great host and place (clean and quite) near luas ! Many thanks Maria
Maria was an incredible host, and I highly recommend staying here. Its very close to public transportation and a very nice room to stay in.
It is a very nice, clean, tidy and comfy place, well connected and suitable. Maria also offers great hospitality
ok

Marie is absolutely wonderful. She warmly greeted us and chatted with us. Was very helpful with where to go and ordered a taxi for us to leave. Had breakfast ready and was just amazing! Location was great as well with easy access to bus directly to city center. 100% recommend.
We had a great time, the best way to experience Irish hospitality - wonderful room and a lovely breakfast! Would recommend this air bnb.
Good helpful host. Bed a bit uncomfortable. Very clean

Very nice and friendly host. The location is better than one may have expected. Its a bit suburban and quiet and there is a railway station and bus stop within 3 mins walking distance. Strongly recommend the bus 37 which takes you to anywhere of the city centre in 20-30 mins and it runs very frequently and on time. We went out one night and took uber home which costed ‚Ç¨20 ish. The room we stayed for the night was clean and has a very nice view over a greenspace. We had our own spacious bathroom adjacent to our room. The Phoenix Park is also near. Highly recommended.
Excelente persona y lugar inmejorable 100% recomendado

Empfehlenswert Unterkunft.
Ruhig uns sauber.

You can expect a cozy little room with THE BEST hospitality on the planet. Marie was waiting in the front garden for us and waved as we walked through the park from the train station. She allowed us to check in early so we could drop off our luggage before touring the city. Breakfast was provided each morning: fruit and granola, bread with butter and marmalade, and tea. Marie even set it out on Friday night because we had to be up and out early on Saturday morning. This place is easily accessible by train and bus. We loved having a homey space to come back to each evening. And we had some great conversations with Marie and Tom. Highly recommend this spot and hope to come back soon.
It's nice to stay in Dublin in the house of Marie. She's very kind and helpfull. With the bus or train it's easy to go to the centre of Dublin (about 20-30 minutes).
Marie is a fantastic host, loved staying in Marie & Tom's home...what a fab couple and hosts, couldn't be more helpful to us.  Gorgeous home, so inviting‚ù§Ô∏è

We had a twin room in a very nice detached house overlooking a park.  The bathroom, with shower, was in the next room and used just by us.  We had a nice breakfast each day of cereal, orange juice, boiled egg and rolls.
I felt at home and cared for, thank you!

My friend and I had the best stay at Maries place! She and her husband were so hospitable and helpful in every way with tips for the city and how to use the bus. She had breakfast for us every morning and was there every night before we went to bed. The location is great because its not in the busy and loud city center but its an easy bus ride from the corner of the street. Theres also a small town in walking distance to get food if you dont want to go into the city. Would recommend to anyone staying near Dublin!

Marie and her husband are exceptional hosts. They are very warm and welcoming, making it feel like your own home from home. The house is clean with close train and bus links to the city centre. In a fairly expensive city, it's also great value for money! 
Thanks Marie! :)

My friend and I stayed here for a long weekend and it was perfect. Easy to get into the town centre from there. Lovely area for a good night's sleep and we were meet by such warm hospitality + a great breakfast! We loved staying at Marie's :D
Marie was a wonderful host! She made sure we enjoyed our stay. The room was exactly as described and our stay was wonderful!

Marie is a  very hospitality ,helpful and kind person. We spent 5 wonderful days in dublin and in her house. We had every morning breakfast. I highly recommend you to stay at her house. Excellent person.
As expected would recommend, Marie is very friendly.

My fiancee and I spent a month with Siobhan and Rudy while studying in Dublin. I am not exaggerating when I say that Siobhan became family to us during our stay! She is genuinely one of the kindest, warmest, and most open-hearted people I have ever met. She was very supportive throughout our time and regularly helped my fiancee and I with making plans for day trips, visits around the area, and discovering the best pubs to frequent. 

She made fantastic breakfasts for us every morning with fresh-baked croissants, freshly-squeezed orange juice, mixed berries and fruit, yogurt, homemade granola, and tea & coffee. She opened her home to us while also being extremely respectful of our private space.

She has a lovely home that is just a short walk to city centre in the sweet Phibsboro neighborhood. Rudy (Siobhan's hound) is shy, but extremely loveable and I won him over with a good back scratch or two. 

Connecting with Siobhan was one of the happiest accidents of our trip. I must say: THANK YOU AirBnB for bringing such a cool person into our lives! If you have read this far and haven't booked yet, I would recommend jumping on it -- you will not be disappointed.

Dear Siobhan, until next time -- may it come swiftly!

Siobhan is an incredible host - the home is beautiful and spotless; our room was filled with thoughtful touches such as an electric bed warmer, a jug of water & glasses, an incredibly detailed binder full of suggestions for local food & entertainment, and more.  

Siobhan herself is extremely welcoming and was happy to chat or provide helpful advice to make the most of our trip. I can't recommend this airbnb enough!

The Best place to stay in Dublin. Siobhan is an incredible host, the room is clean, big and comfortable. 
The breakfast is delicious.
100% recommended

Our first experience with AirBnB and just I can say... Great! Siobhan made feel us like at our home. She is so kind and very helpful. The welcome was really good and she gave us a lot of information about Dublin and public transport. The house is really nice and the location is very good! There are bus and Luas stops at 1 minute walking. But the best is... Siobhan... Nice, kind and very helpful... We enjoyed lovely conversations with her! She gave us lot of recommendations and information. We love her dog... Rudy!!! Definetely it was a pleasure!

Siobhan's home was perfect for my visit to Dublin. Great location, close enough to the city centre to walk or take the tram a 2 min.walk. it was a very quiet street. Siobham's home was also very tastefully decorated and relaxing.  Siobhan's breakfasts were wonderful especially her homemade granola. Siobhan gave great tips for places to see that fit my intetests.  Good value for the price.

If you want to come into the door and feel home, then you have to book this lovely accomondation. We had a great time with Siobhan and Rudy. She gave us a lot of tipps and an amazing breakfast. It is a really nice place on earth.

This is my 2nd time staying here and will do so again next time I travel to Dublin. Her place is easy go get everywhere, whether you are driving or taking public transportation. Siobhan is a thoughtful hostess and extremely helpful.

I felt so welcomed at Siobhans home in Dublin! It was a wonderful to start the day with a breakfast in a cozy kitchen overlooking a garden. The neighborhood is close to Dublin city center and Phoenix Park.  I walked or took the bus or tram into town and into its surrounding neighborhoods. The bus and tram are extremely close by and convenient. The nearby Stoneybrook neighborhood had some great pubs and restaurants. 

Siobhan was very helpful in helping me figure out my best approach to navigating my way to various places. After spending time in some  Airbnbs with absentee hosts it was a pleasant experience to interact with a friendly and helpful host. I left feeling as if I had a new friend in Dublin.

Siobhan is an amazing host! So helpful and friendly. She provided so much local information. I took a day trip to the Cliffs of Moher leaving very early and she provided my breakfast even though I left before the usual breakfast time. Rudy helped me not miss my doggies back home. My trip was made better by staying with Siobhan and if I'm fortunate enough to return I'll definitely stay with her again!

Another memorable stay with Siobhan. Best air bnb in Dublin in my opinion. Thanks again Siobhan 
Anthony x

We had a really enjoyable stay with Siobhan who couldnt do enough to make our stay so comfortable and welcoming.  She is a truly lovely lady and we felt at home as soon as we arrived.  Rudy welcomed us also and is a beautiful friendly dog.  The little extras Siobhan provided added such a thoughtful touch such as fresh water and glasses in the bedroom and little chocolates - the bedroom was very comfortable and spacious and even had an electric blanket if you needed it.  Delicious fresh home-made granola for breakfast and fresh orange juice and croissant, berries and yogurt  each morning.  The location is perfect for the Luas and buses and nearby eateries.  Really enjoyed our chats with Siobhan who is so knowledgeable and she gave us excellent advice on anything we asked. We will miss this little home from home but we will definitely be back again.

We spent just two nights at Siobhans but managed to see and do a lot in Dublin thanks partly to her great recommendations and good advice. She even made good suggestions for other places we plan to visit in Ireland. Our room was quiet, comfortable and private. Lovely fresh flowers in the room and general areas were a nice touch as were the robe and slippers. Siobhan will be there for you but will also respect your privacy.  We enjoyed the tasty and healthy breakfasts. Siobhan is a wonderful and caring hostess and we left feeling we have a new friend. 

We were pleasantly surprised about how easy and fast it is to travel to and from  other parts of town, including the airport, using public transportation and the Leap Card recommended by Siobhan makes it very affordable.

The accommodation is as described and I highly recommend it.
Another memorable stay with Siobhan. Beautiful breakfast and excellent hospitality all round as per usual. Cant recommend highly enough!
This is our second time staying with Siobhan. We highly recommend it. She is a great host and we will stay again when we visit.
I felt very welcome and feel like I made another friend. Truly!
Brillant host,very informative and helpful,clean and comfy room

Siobhans home really feels like a home away from homeù, much thanks to Siobhans care of the house and the guests. Siobhan makes sure to prepare breakfast every morning! Everything is sparkling clean and the room was so comfortable. Rudy is such a nice dog, he keeps to himself most of the time, and I really enjoyed when he came say hi in his shy way. I also loved all the green you see outside the windows and the traditional blue door :) The neighborhood has new cafes and bars mixed in with a traditional residential neighborhood and I really liked that. I like walking all over and managed to walk everywhere from Phibsborough - there are also tram and bus stops just around the corner. Siobhan has many local tips ready for you and her communication is outstanding. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!
A quiet and comfortable home, conveniently close to the LUAS tram into town. Siobhan was helpful guiding us as new comers to Dublin. Local shops and eateries were close and convenient.

Siobhan is a wonderful host. She is lovely and helpful in anyway. We would definitely recommend this accommodation not only because of the super host but also because of the location, the lovely breakfast and the cute dog. We will surely come back! :)

The stay as Siobhan's home was wonderful. She was the perfect host. She gave us many valuable advices and prepared the map of Dublin for us. Everything was perfectly cleans and the breakfasts very tasty. The house is close to all of the major attractions and well connected by Luas to the rest of the city.

Great place near Phoenix park in a quiet neighbourhood with lots of small restaurants and grocery store near the house. You are a bit off center which is good if you prefer to be out of the crazy downtown vibe, but the house is two steps from the tram and you can easily reach the center of the city in a half-hour walk. Siobhan house is well decorated and very quiet. It was also nice to be able to have a cup of tea in the evening with her and however is also staying in the second room. And let's forget Rudy who is such an adorable and friendly dog !

Probably one of the best  share ABB experiences I've ever had. (I usually stay in whole apt. places ). Siobhan's house was wonderful and comfortable in all the right ways. The place is lovely, warm and very clean, nicely decorated everywhere etc. Siobhan put a lot of attention into great details like morning granola, toiletries and evening chocolates. She is an amazing, very positive hostess and was highly accomodating as well -- this was important because flooding delayed my arrival and I was trying to get over being really unpleasantly sick. Room was great and really comfy bed-- I was next to a room with a couple but didn't really hear them even once. 

The location in Phibsborough is lovely too-- right across from the tram and an easy ride to the airport. Would gladly stay here again when I get back to Dublin.

We stayed in Siobhan's house for 3 nights and it's absolutely perfect. The room is spotlessly clean and the bed is so comfortable that we didn't want to get up every morning. The location is very convenient and easily accessible to city centre by tram. Siobhan is very hospitable that she has prepared us breakfast every morning and she provided everything we need. She also gave us lots of useful info prior to our arrival. If you want to stay in a local neighborhood and not too far from city centre, Siobhan's house is definitely a good choice.

It was a pleasure spending time in Siobhan home, the bedroom and facilities were perfect, with breakfast available every morning. 

Siobhan was so helpful and gave great tips on where to go for dinner and travel around Dublin. 

Highly recommended
Perfect room, house and location. Siobhan is very kind andthe house is very beautiful . We would repeat again.
Graet place, nice bed and room, quiet clean. It was very good

Eamon is a fabulous host.  The bedsit was clean and cosy, and Eamon went out of his way to make sure that things were comfortable and convenient for us and our baby.  Also, the location is brilliant for exploring the city.  We highly recommend his place!
If you're thinking about visiting this awesome city, Eamon's place is perfect: well located and clean.
Lovely location and fully functional place . Eamon has been really helpful and great communication. It was my first stay in Ireland and felt like I am staying at home . Will always miss this flat .
A lovely location and fantastic host who went the extra mile to accommodate us and help us with any queries we had and made for an excellent stay in Dublin .
Great place to stay when visiting Dublin. Clean, comfortable  and close to public transportation. Highly recommend.
Highly recommended! Conveniently located with wonderful hospitality.

I am originally from Dublin. I was back on holiday after many years. This is by far the best location you can be in, walking distance to city. The flat was clean. The host was always responsive to me. The location is very safe. Eamon offers many tips and was very helpful. This is the only place I would want to stay in if I return to Dublin.

Eamon was a great host! Made the checking process very easy and provided lots of information on his location and fun things to do. His place was great, about 20 mins to the downtown core! We had a lovely stay and would come back again anytime!
Eamon's house is very close to the center. Very clean. We were able to cook dinner. 5

Eamon's place was cozy and sparking clean. It's within walking distance of restaurants, grocery stores, and the hustle and bustle of Dublin. Eamon made the check-in/out process very easy and was kind enough to give us helpful tips prior to arriving to Dublin. It was a great place to stay at.

Would definitely recommend staying at Eamons! Very close to bus stops and bike hires. We walked everywhere and it was still doable! His place is just as he described it so make sure you read every detail. We loved the location and the layout of his place :)
At Eamon, you will find a great hospitality and an ideal location to visit Dublin.

Excellent location & easy transport links into Dublin City Centre. The accommodation was spotless & very homely with all facilities as described. Eamon is a fantastic host who gave us a very warm welcome. His transport tips were particularly helpful. We really enjoyed our stay & would love to return.

This place is perfectly clean and would suit most traveler's needs wonderfully. I wish I'd realized the laundry situation sooner--I'd have packed more clothes. There were LOTS of maps and things available in the room for finding one's way around, which we found helpful. The bed isn't horribly uncomfortable, but it also isn't horribly comfortable. I tend to have back problems, but it wasn't so bad as to aggravate that. Overall, given the chance, we'd go here again on a return trip to Dublin.
Loved staying at Eamons place! Good location and great customer service!
Eamon's place is cozy, clean, convenient, and comfortable!

Eamon is very well organized and provides tons of very precise descriptions and tips.
He answers immediately to text messages and is very helpful. the place is super cozy and one can see that he puts a lot of effort into preparing everything for the guests. everything is super clean. 
the location is pretty central to the city center and ranelagh itself also offers a variety of bars and restaurants. according to some friends from dublin, when looking for pubs ranelagh is the place to be!
so definitely a recommendation to book! :)
We enjoyed our stay. The bedsit was clean and cozy. Father Eamon is a gem.
Excellent location, very clean, great value. Eamon is a superb host. A+++. Highly recommend.
Eamon was a great host.  The airbnb was exactly as advertised.  The location was perfect and I would love to stay here again.

The Bedsit.3 is a cozy space that you feel at home. We arrived so late at night and Eamon was waiting for us. This Bedsit is close to the centre city but you can use the public transport because is nerby the house. You have all that you need, a llitle kitchen with necessary equipments, a bathroom and comfortable bed.

He helped us in each question and problem that we had. He is so kind and an attentive person. He's great!

Is one of the best option if you go to Dublin. Of course, if I come back I 'll go again!! It has been fantastic!!

Thanks a milions for all, Eamon!!

Eamon's home was wonderful, and I very much enjoyed staying there. The security was excellent, quality of the space was very good, and proximity to downtown Dublin was perfect. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone looking to spend time in Dublin.

Eamons place is in a quiet area. If you want to visit Dublin but also want to get a good nights sleep this is the right place. It is about 10 minutes by bus get to the city centre of Dublin. We however enjoyed walking by foot into the city. This also only took 30-40 minutes and was a great way to start the day. You can pass through St Stephen's Green park on your way into the city centre and can stop on your way to get some good breakfast at one of the coffee shops.

Everything was perfect! The host: Eamon is an incredible host, he makes you feel supported and welcomed,  we could not be more happy about having him as our host in Dublin. 
The neighborhood: Is near to the city center, near to buses, Luas and near to the Air Coach stop. Also you have some supermarkets around the house, and nice pubs.  Ranelagh is a quiet place with beautiful houses and nice and kind neighbors, one of the best areas to live in Dublin.
