The flat:  Is better than in the pictures, everything was perfectly clean and cosy. Furnished and equipped with all the necessary amenities. 100% recommended :)
It was a pleasure staying at this location. Eamon made our stay stress free and offered much information about the area.  My husband and I felt right at home!
Good location and easy access to busses. Get a leap card. Publick bus routes will take you everywhere.
An excellent place to rent. Convenient access to the airport and to Dublin city. A solid value for money, with clean, comfortable accommodations.

The apartment was exactly as described. Close to the city centre through bus (the stop is  at a couple minute walking) and in an elegant neighborhood. The bedroom itself was perfect for a couple and the bathroom clean with a spacious shower. Eamon provided us with everything we needed and he was so easy to get in touch with throughout the stay. He was an excellent host and he really made us feel welcomed.
We will definitely recommend this apartment to everyone who'll ask and we're looking forward to coming back to Dublin.

Eamon is a darling man and his rooms are cozy and comfortable. We stayed with him for two weeks. He met us at check-in and helped us with our bags add we left. His communication is swift and he's willing to help out and make suggestions.
4 of us (including two feline travellers) liked the place a lot and would definitely stay there again.

The appartment is in a nice area Ranelagh, quite and calm, very close to the center of Dublin. You don¬¥t need tram or bus to reach the center. but you have a tram station also. Nearby there are supermarkets, Spar, Lidl.. Fantastic place to stay. Our host, Father Eamon, made it easier for us.
We highly recommend staying at Ramon's place.  It's convenient and Eamon was a great host.

This was a great find! Quiet neighborhood, close to everything, and a sweet, cozy inviting space. Eamon was a wonderful host - very accommodating and went out of his way to make sure I had everything I needed. I will definitely book here again on my next trip! Highly recommend.

Eamon's Place was very comfortable and clean. Eamon was a wonderful host, very welcoming and very prompt to respond to any of our needs. The location is very close to Ranelagh, It's about a 20 minute walk downtown and a 20 minute walk to Rathmines where there is a gym and pool. We highly recommend Eamon's Place. 
Gloria and Tim

This might have been my favorite Airbnb yet! I had a nice studio to myself, yet Eamon was just a phone call/text away if I needed anything. He gave suggestions and tips for exploring Dublin, and even let me know when I could park a rental car in the area without having to pay. He also provided coffee, tea, and basic kitchen supplies. And best part, the place is dog friendly! Theres not another dog friendly option in such an ideal location in this price range.

Eamon is a great host. He gave us a very warm welcome and hosted us in a very cosy and lovely apartment, very close to any attractions we were interested in. He's very available for any kind of information. I would definitely recommend him for your next trip to Dublin!

Mary was the best host we could wish for. She welcomed us at her beautiful house like we've been friends ever since. Donnybrook is a really nice neighbourhood, the bus stop (airport bus and city lines) is just a 3-min-walk away. It takes about 30 min from/to the airport and about 15 min to get to the city center (if you want to buy a ticket, make sure you have enough coins on you as they don't give back change on the bus! we bought a 72-h-ticket at the tourist-info in the city center, so we could use all lines. the "air coach"/airport bus is not included!)
Mary spoiled us with the best breakfast: coffee/tea, cereals, toast, butter, jam, fruits, orange juice - it was the perfect start into the day!
The room was super clean and very cosy, it felt like "coming home" every single day. Mary also provides towels, different kinds of shampoos/shower gel...there is also a tv, books, (Website hidden by Airbnb) many lovely details that make you feel comfy :)

Great place to stay if you want to be out of the city. Free parking at the house or a bus stop within close proximity as described. Room set up was perfect and Mary could not have been more lovely! Definitely would recommend to others.

Mary is unbelievably kind, and even upon checking in, we instantly felt welcomed, and comfortable! The room is perfect for my boyfriend and I, and incredibly clean. Marys breakfast spreads every morning were absolutely incredible. If you are looking to stay just outside all the busyness of the city, Marys is perfect for you!!

I was at Mary's house for three days and everything was nice. The house is very clean and tidy. The breakfast is delicious.
Mary is a very warm and attentive host.
Recommended!

We had a lovely stay at Mary's place. She is a geniunly kind and generous host, it was a true pleasure meeting her! The house was gorgeous and spotless, located about 20mins from the city center by bus. The location is really convinient, especialy for those catching an early flight, since it is less than 5mins away from an Aircoach buss stop which drives to the airport during the night.
Excellent stay at Marys house. Mary is a very welcoming and thoughtful host and very helpful. We enjoyed the amenities at the house and had a great time! Highly recommended.

Highly recommend this location for Dublin especially if you do not want to be in the middle of all the craziness of the city center. Marys home is beautiful, peaceful, warm and welcoming. 

Mary was an excellent host. She was very quick to reply and also gave us great local tips of things to do. 

The accommodations were exactly as pictured and described. For my husband and I, this was exactly what we were looking for and excellent value. Mary provides breakfast each morning in her beautiful kitchen - a treat!

Regarding proximity to Dublin City Center, the bus is a five minute walk from Marys house. If youre going to take the bus, we recommend buying a leap card in advance. We also rented a car and it took 10-15 minutes drive depending on where we were going. Its very convenient and I liked that we escaped the noise of the city and had peace and quiet in the suburbs without sacrificing much in the way of convenience. 

Overall, a great find and well worth it for many reasons!

Mrs Mary was a kind and gracious host. She exceeded our expectations in every way. She prepared fruit salad beforehand, - a thing unheard of from any other airbnb host. The bed linen smelled freshly laundered which is a heavenly smell in itself. The bedroom was properly heated which was a great relief. We didn't expect that at all, since previous hosts in Dublin didn't do this. If there's one thing, I'd have to nitpick 
it's that we'd have felt better being able to lock the bedroom from the inside. 

All in all though, a wonderful experience; Mrs Mary deserves her superhost status!
Perfect host and superb accommodation.
Above my highest expectation. Mary is an amazing host with cozy and lovely house. Place is amazing, sparkly clean and location is really great. I can only reccomed, 6 stars out of 5
Mary's place is just awesome.  The room is large, the house is beautiful and the hospitality offered by Mary was incredible.  Excellent breakfast and a perfect stay!  I highly recommend this place.

We stayed in Mary's place during a conference at UCD. It is well situated near the UCD campus and public transport. From here it is easy to venture out to do all sorts of things in Dublin. I have stayed in quite a few AirBnB locations and Mary's breakfast is truly fantastic. It will leave you with plenty of energy to get things done.

Mary and Seamus are very welcoming, easy to talk to and super friendly. This made our stay at their beautiful home even better. 
The room is on the 2nd floor and has everything you wish for. The bed is big and comfy. 
For breakfast we had the kitchen for ourselfs until 10am. There was plenty to choose from: toast, eggs, a bowl of various fresh fruits, yoghurt, juice, cerals, tea, coffee.
The area is perfect for exploring Dublin via bus or getting quickly to Wicklow Mountain National Park and its surroundings. It has been a great stay at Mary's and Seamus' place and we can absolutely recomment this accomodation.
It was super nice.

Mary was a fantastic hostess. She provided us with a beautiful breakfast each morning. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything was extremely clean and smelt fresh. The house is in a great location, a few minutes from city Centre but you have the peace and tranquility of the suburbs. Would highly recommend Marys place when staying in Dublin.

Amazing place! My wife and I had a wonderful stay at Mary's place. It is in a great location. It is quiet and clear, and very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again in my next visit to Dublin.
Very friendly hosts, cozy room, amazing bed, great breakfast!
We had a good time during our stay at Mary who was a kind host. The rooms are very nice and tidy.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with Mary for 2 nights.  Everything was as it is shown and described.  Had a great dinner just down the road at the Merion Inn which Mary recommended.  Was easy to leave our car and get the bus into Dublin for the day for 3 euros each.

Me and my boyfriend only stayed for two nights before moving on to other parts of Ireland. Mary gave us a very warm welcome and made sure we had everything we needed. She also recommended a nice place for dinner since we only arrived and didn't know where to go. We had a lot going on in that short time but it was super easy to coordinate and communicate with her. A real carefree and comfortable experience, thanks so much!

We had a wonderful stay. Mary's house is gorgeous, comfortable, quiet and very clean. Location is also excellent. Mary is a lovely host. She made sure we had all we needed and prepared a wonderful breakfast for us each morning, at the same time giving us a lot of independence. Excellent B&B. 
..
First time we have used airb&b and what a start. Mary set the bar very high in all aspects great choice for Dublin.  Bus at the top of the road.

Pretty nice and a warmly hosted BnB!

Everything was as it is described. We had our own room with a bathroom and toilet ensuit and a second room for living including a small frisch, a microwave as also a couch in front of a TV.  Everything is clean.
In the morning Mary has always prepared the table for breakfast. You can choose from a selection of cereals, have toast with different creams or marmelade,  boil yourself an egg and also have a selection of fruits. 

The towncenter of Dublin is between 45 and 60 minutes away from the BnB, but there is a busstation 5 minutes away. There also stops a bus line that drives to and from the airport 24 hours a day. Close to the BnB is an italian restaurant and a Pub. Both have good food and drinks.

Mary herself is very friendly and communicativ. She tries to help whenever she is asked.
Fabulous place
Very close to UCD, bus, and Luas. Mary and he family were delightful. Breakfast was delicious. Highly recommended!
Superb
Mary's house is beautiful! She's an amazing, kind-hearted host and will make you feel at home immediately. We enjoyed our stay at her house a lot. 10/10 would book again!
Mary thank you for your great and fun hospitality. We enjoyed the days with you very much and can highly recommend the accommodation to everyone.
Wonderful place with super friendly host. Everything was perfect!
Lovely comfortable home in an attractive suburb, facilities excellent and Mary is a delightfully animated host.
Just perfect
So gorgeous and clean!! I felt very comfortable and safe there. Definitely recommend staying at Marys place!

Stylish, spacious place - both the bedroom and your own living room as well as the whole house. Sparking cleanliness everywhere. Neighborhood indeed one of the best in Dublin.  Buses around the corner, local rail ~12 min walk. Mary kindly offered tea and cake upon arrival. Tons of important tiny details everywhere (bottles of water, tea, coffee, snacks, TVs both in bed- and living room, sweets, heating on when necessary etc.).
Schone kamer, op loopafstand van het centrum op een rustige plek, vriendelijk relaxte host

Ian is a very friendly host who strives to make your stay as comfortable as possible. He answers very quickly to questions of any kind. His house with the room for up to two people is functional and clean. It is due to its location ideal for a visit to Dublin.

Really good place to stay. The bedroom is way better than the pictures, it has heating inside and the bed its pretty big. We didnt saw Ian that much becouse of work and the comunication was perfect. By walking is like 25 minutes from the center or taking the 16 bus 2 blocks from the airbnb you can get in a few minutes.
Perfect if you are looking for a basic place with a comfy bed and warm shower!
A great place to stay in Dublin.

The house is clean and pretty, the bedroom very  comfortable. It is located 20 minutes walking from the city center (e.  g Trinity College and Temple Bar) Ian was helpful and kind and he provided us every information we needed. We definitely recommend this accommodation
Great place and great host ! Thank you Ian for having us !
Place is as advertised! Great location, quiet, and simple room. We had some issues getting in and out (door was a little tricky!), but otherwise a nice stay.

Good location, quiet area, walking distance to the city center but also bus stops are very near. Room is more spacious than it seems on the pictures. We've seen Ian only once but the whole stay was very straight forward and pleasant.

The place is inside a quiet neighborhood, around 15-20 minutes walking distance from the city center and the river.
The room is more spacious than it seems on the pictures, the bathroom was clean, and all fits very well for a 3 day-stay in Dublin.
We've seen Ian only once but the accommodation was nice.
Very good localizarion, close to the city center (20min walking) and the bus stop for the airport. The place is very quiet and confortable. Ian was very helpful, providing all the information.
Simple but spacious room with a gentle host. Good facilities. Extra safe house behind a fence. Public transport nearby.

Ian was an excellent host. Communication was very good. He answered all of my questions. Mobile phone or messages were no problem. The location is the best advantage. Very close to the city centre by bus or 15 minutes by walking. Direct public transport from  the airport to the house by bus number 16 or 41 takes just 30 minutes. There is also an Tesco expres close by.
Nice, clean place.  Ian was very helpful

Great stay! Ian is a very available and easy going person. The room is exactly what you see in the picture, so no surprise, the location is the best compromise between city centre and airport. Me and my girlfriend had everything we needed to enjoy our weekend in Dublin.
Alles wunderbar. Vielen Dank!

The bedroom downstairs was more than suitable for our short stay in Dublin. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very warm which was nice when we got home as it was cold during our trip to Dublin. Towels, hairdryer etc were provided which saved us having to carry these bulky travel items. The bathroom was also clean and tidy. The flat was located about a 20-30 min walk into the city centre, and there were many local cafes etc very close by the flat. The bus 16 from the airport dropped us off very close, like a 10 min walk or so, from the flat, and it was easy to get back to the airport too from there. Good value for the space and location, would recommend to others.
Very nice place to stay, Luas stop at a little walking distance (10min) and a Tesco nearby. The room was very clean and spacious.

Ian could not have been a better host! He was friendly, fun to talk to, and has good taste in music! The room itself was really clean and in a great location that was only a short walk to the city center. We 100% recommend staying here and hope to come back if we are ever in Dublin again. Best AirBNB ever!

Great experience! Bettys house is really nice and it is perfect for late arrivals. She was very kind and the breakfast was great. Good connection to the Dublin city and the airport through buses. Highly recommended.
The accomodations were wonderful and Betty was super helpful and kind. She made us feel at home and made the visit to Dublin really refreshing and magical experience.
Exactly what we needed! Clean room, perfect to accommodate our trip!
Received a lovely welcome and felt as though we were right at home
Betty provided great hospitality during our travels. Had breakfast available downstairs upon waking up. Her home is very nice and very clean. Very convenient by being close to the airport.
Lovely room with a lovely host.

We had lovely stay at Betty's place.   It was great to be able to wake up,  grab breakfast and catch the bus to Dublin. Betty was very friendly and called booked us a cab for our day trip. Location was ideal for taking a bus to either swords, Dublin or the Airport.

You can expect a warm and homelike atmosphere. Betty is a charming and very helpful host. She can offer you plenty of advice and information on local attractions and she goes out of her ways to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. She also has a great sense of humour. Also, you will find plenty of places to eat at the Applewood Village only 5 mins away. The bus stop into Sword is only another 5 mins. Swords will provide you with more pubs and restaurants, some of which are historic. Pretty well most of them are delights. There is also a  very modern shopping mall called the Pavilion where you will find everything you need or want. An express bus trip into Dublin is also available at the same bus stop near her place.
Great hospitality and very accommodating. Perfect for a quick crash before heading to the airport.
Betty is very kind and helpful! We loved her hospitality and her very lovely home. Would definitely recommend this home!

This comment is NOT linked to the property itself, we never had the chance to go there.

We booked a room for 3 people, and Betty contacted us few hours before the arrival to say that she only had 2 spaces available. 

We kindly asked her to cancel in order to find another room, she declined saying that we have to do it. 

This is a false information, in that situation SHE cannot welcome is so SHE has to cancel, otherwise we are the faulty one. 

We had to call the support in order to get some help. 

Would not recommend, based on our exchange with Betty. 

many thanks to AirB&B for helping us finding another roomù

Beautiful house in a residential area, quiet and very clean .. Betty, the hostess, is very kind and helpful .. we also had the breakfast that we prepared in the spacious kitchen. 

Thanks so much Betty

We were delayed, but that wasnt a problem! We got in contact and arrived in the middle of the night! We were welcomed very nice and warm!

Bathroom, kitchen and sleeping room were very clean, great bed and  good breakfast!

Definitely a stay worth!

Betty's place is a 20 minute walk to the beginning of town.  The room was clean and comfortable.
Please confirm number of guests you book.  We booked for 3, and she only gave us accommodations for 2.  We didn't know this until we arrive late in the evening.
One of the Best host I ever met!!
Betty is a very sweet lady and interesting to talk to. Make sure to leave some time to relax and chat with her!

We had a lovely stay in this quiet and pretty neighbourhood in Swords! Betty is a friendly hostess, who made us feel very welcome.  In addition, we really appreciated the possibility to make use of the kitchen.
It was better than i expected, very clean place. Betty was a lovely host, we felt like home!
Betty is very welcoming with a nice clean home.
Betty is such a lovely Person. It was a very nice stay. The bathroom and bedroom were super clean. We would have loved to stay longer
Nice quite little place

Very warm and friendly hosts! They gave us great tips for food and drinks. Lovely home and very cosy. Perfect for a city trip. It's in a residential area but close to a couple of good places for breakfast. Close to tram which get you easily to the city center. The bed is fine, only for us a little bit small because one of us is quite tall. Could be good to know. We had a very good stay here with these lovely people!
A lovely house with all the homely touches. Close to bus and tram links to the city centre, or the walk only takes 20-30mins.
Very helpful and understanding, thanks a lot!
Very cosy and beautiful room. Nearby the city center. My sister and  I loved it.

The room was beautiful and clean. The house is very close to some cool restaurants and a street away from James Joyces old home which was really cool. Kate has some great recommendations and we didnt take transit once. Overall a great place to stay!
A great place, comfortable bed and quite place to rest. Is near to Public transport.
Beautiful room not far at all from the centre. Kate was super helpful, gave us lots of great suggestions of where to go and made us feel right at home. Cant recommend this b&b enough!

Staying with Kate was a joy. The room was comfortable, the home lovely and an easy bus ride or ~30 minute walk to the city center. Kate was a kind and helpful host. Would definitely stay again and recommend others do the same.

Kate was an extremely nice host, always ready to help with questions we had and also really quick to answer us by message when we needed more info. The place is amazing, really great to spend a couple of days in the city and everything was clean and neat. The bedroom was lovely, the house was in a really good neighborhood even though was a bit far from the city center, we need to catch the tram or bus. I really recomend this place if you are planning to stay in Dublin.

Kate's apartment is a good place to stay in Dublin. The room is very cute and everything is very clean. Even if it is a shared bathroom we never interfered with each other. It is a bit outside of the center, but public transportation is very good and walking is also not too far. The neighborhood has nice breakfast places. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
Kate was very kind and helpful during our short weekend stay. The room was beautiful and extremely clean upon arrival. I highly recommend this place to any future travelers.
great host! definitely recommend
Ciara is a very kind host, if you need any advice, she is always keen to help you and make sure you enjoy your stay
Room is spacious and clean. Ciara was a friendly and welcoming host.
I had a great stay at Ciaras place. Thanks!
I'd highly recommend Ciara's place. Located on good bus links into Dublin city, walking distance to Blanchardstown shopping center and overalls really welcoming place to stay
It's a nice and cosy place. Room is quite big and comfortable.

It was a really lovely room and a great place to stay!

The host was lovely and very helpful.

Fabulous experience :D

John is a great host - the place is exactly as it appears in the pictures...check-in is extremely easy...the street is very quiet considering it's central location! I would recommend staying in John's little house :)
Easy check-in and check-out. Good location for tech company employees or those who just want to walk around Dublin. Nice pubs and restaurants nearby.
Tastefully renovated home next to the Grand Canal Dock. It's a quiet neighborhood and very convenient. Would definitely stay again. Thanks John!
Derek is such a nice host! I really enjoyed my stay. Had a great time at his house. Thank you so much, Derek.

Derek was absolutely fantastic! He made me feel so welcome to his house. He even played music to me! To top it off, Derek picked me from the bus stop as I was confused on how to get to his place, and also drove  me all the way to the airport on my return saving me an INCREDIBLE amount of Money! No one else has ever done that for me. I will recommend Derek any day to anyone. Thank you so much Derek for making my visit so enjoyable!

This place is sparking clean and nice, Derek is a great host, very much cooperative and helpful whatever assistance required about any thing,  the best option to live with such a great  host who  seemed to me one of the best musician in the world I must recommend to everyone.

Derek was incredibly welcoming and is a great guy overall. Just spent the evening at his place but would definitely book a longer stay with him if I'm ever backnin Dublin. Appreciate the hospitality and the ride to the airport (especially with it being so early on a Sunday morning).  Highly recommend both the house and the host.
Great host very friendly, beautiful home and easy to find.

Derek is a tremendous host and you can tell he enjoys hosting as well as simply having fun in everything he does. He's an incredible musician and also gave me tons of recommendations for where about to explore in Dublin, which I heedly noted and partook in. Great conversations and even gave me a departing ride to the airport on my way out. So thank you Derek for everything !!!

Derek is a great host. I was travelling for work and the location couldn't have been better, along with the hospitality. Derek would have a meal ready when I got home from work which was great. The bathroom shower and bedroom were great. I was made feel at home. All in all a great stay!!
Derek is a very friendly and helpful host. The room is cozy and very clean as the whole place and also very peaceful and quiet.
Very nice host, would stay again!
First and foremost Derek is a terrific guy. Witty, so witty and a wonderful host making you feel right at home. His home has great character and is a great location to both city and airport

Had a great stay with Derek ,a really super host 
Francis
Derek is a wonderful person, and a gem to stay with. Hes considerate and accommodating, and staying at his place was actually like visiting family!  Thanks Derek!
Derek provided clear instructions about how to arrive via public transportation. He is super friendly and the house is lovely. The free ride to the airport is a crucial feature of this place.

Derek is a very nice and warm host. I felt very relaxed at his place. He will also be there for you if needed - quick responses, very good communication.
House is very neat and clean. Garden and some music instruments put some "soul" to the house. I'd say, house has everything what ye need for a nice and comfy stay at Derek's house.
Great
Top class place to stay! Derek is a good host and goes the extra mile to make everything  easy
Derek was a great host! Very helpful from
Had a very enjoyable stay at Derek's home and very much appreciated his hospitality; he offered me tea and snacks, and kindly drove me to the airport. Would love to stay at Derek's again.
Derek is very friendly and helpful person. His place is very clean and spotless.  Very good value for money. Thanks Derek :)

Derek's place is clean, neat and tidy. It's a very quiet area, and has bus stops, shops and other amenities nearby. Derek is a great host. He's friendly and welcoming, and is eager to make sure all goes well.
Derek is a nice blog very friendly and with great sense of humor much recommended staying in his place
Derek is a very accommodating host and my stay went smoothly.
Polite, helpful and keeps the house clean and tidy
Derek's place was perfect. Located in a nice quite area, very quick and easy access to public transportation to downtown. The room was great, very comfy, clean, and inviting.
Host is very kind and helpful.  Facilities are clean and useful. If you find a room in dublin then I strongly suggest this place.

I had an amazing experience in Airbnb at Derek's place,  very kind host and fluid and interesting conversation. His home was lovely, clean and very nice decorated. It is not close to the city center but it is 15 minutes  by car to the airport. I would repeat for sure!
Derek is a great host, after a long journey he gave me a warm welcome with a nice cup of tea and a sandwich. The accommodation was exactly what I needed and more. Ill definitely be back again soon.
Derek is a great host... nice and friendly! The house was fine. No complaints.
Magic, quiet, amazing house, fantastic owner.

What an amazing host. I was made to feel so welcome and safe (really important to me as I travel on my own) Derek's kindness and consideration as always willing help. More importantly I was really relaxed and had peace of mind  staying with Derek.

As so many have stated before Noel and Fidelma go above and beyond as hosts.  The apartment is so well positioned in Dublin for easy walking to many places in Dublin.  You can't go wrong staying here.

The location for the price is excellent, we were able to walk to Trinity College and several other sights within 20 minutes.  There is a bus line which takes you directly to/from the airport and has a stop out front.

Noel is a very helpful and accommodating host, he took the time to ensure we were settled initially and even offered the use of his personal washer when I had a large amount of family laundry to wash.  The apartment comfortably sleeps 4 adults and our teenagers really liked the sunroom area with twin beds as their semi-private space.  We were able to prepare simple meals and the wifi was very good.

This is a garden apartment, so there are steps out front up to the street.  Some simple maintenance could make these steps easier to navigate and the front door needs a higher doorknob (the keyhole is low and pulling the key in it is the only way to shut this door).  The ceilings are low in the laundry/bath area and it feels a bit damp as many below-ground spaces are.

We had a pleasant stay with Noel. The place is like expected, located at a residential area, and very easy to access the city center (we always take the walk, but a bus stop is 15 m away from our door). We arrived very late, but the check in process was very smooth. We had some food in the fridge :-) Great for the breakfast of the following day. Very responsive and allow us to have a very appreciated late check out. Looking forward to return to a vibrant city as Dublin
Fantastic place. Ideal position: easy to walk to loads of attractions, great bars and restaurants nearby, private parking. Welcoming host and great facilities, even welding gin and tonic

Deidre and her husband were incredibly welcoming. Their home felt warm and welcoming, with breakfast in the morning and plenty of interesting stories to hear. They gave great tips for the local area, which my friend and I enjoyed more than Dublin. Plus, with the train a mere walk away, Dublin was close at hand and cheap to get to and from.

Deidre and her husband went above and beyond in every way, no question about it. This was by far the most amazing, friendliest place that I have ever stayed in, and no hotel or hostel could ever be worth the difference in savings. I fully plan to come visit and see the area again!

Thank you so much Deidre, for the best stay!

We had an amazingt time at Deirdre's and Kevin's beautiful home and would love to visit again in the future.
If you are looking for a quiet place to relax near to the sea, but still want to be close to Dublin this is your place.
Deirdre and Kevin were super accommodating and kind hosts, we need to mention that Deirdre is a passionate gardener so in the kitchen you can always find something fresh from her garden, and also her jams are amazing.
We couldn't wish better hosts, we had everything we could have need and more.
Thank you for everything ‚ô°

Deirdre and Kevin are wonderful hosts, who made us feel welcome as soon as we stepped into the house. Their homemade breakfast was amazing and we had a great time chatting with them every morning!!! They gave us great tips for exploring Ireland. Deirdre even gave me a tour of her garden when I told her my interest in urban farming. I highly recommend staying with her if you want a true bnb experience in a cute little town in Ireland! I would definitely stay here again if Im ever back. (:
Place was amazing and the hosts were really nice and welcoming. Very lovely place to stay.

Deirdre and her husband Kevin were wonderful people to stay with! They were very knowledgeable and really aided us in experiencing the best about Ireland. The fresh orange juice and hen eggs were delicious! You really are received so welcomingly and made to feel right at home. Skerries is a cute little sea town that is a joy to stay in. Highly recommend getting to know these two lovely people.

Very nice place, a lovely house with more than adorable hosts. A beautiful meeting that we will not forget. Thank you Deidre and Kevin. You give a very beautiful image of Ireland and Irish! Vincent and Stephanie (with an accent ... )

Our second stay at Deirdre and Kevin's house. A stay feels a little bit like coming home.
We will come back at the end of next week at the ending of our holidays

Dierdre and her husband Kevin were an absolute joy to stay with.  Their home is cozy and inviting.  Fresh squeezed orange juice and amazing conversation accompanied each mornings breakfast.  The town is walkable from their home, as well as the train to Dublin.  They were so helpful to me in giving advice for restaurants, using the rail system and I even attended a local play with them!!  I would recommend their home to anyone who wants the comforts of home while visiting the Dublin area‚ù§Ô∏è

This apartment is in the perfect location if you are looking to visit the Guinness Storehouse!! It is about a 20 - 25 minute walk to the Temple Bar Area. A bit of a walk, but it includes many great sites along the way that makes it worthwhile. The host was very helpful and quick with responses when we had difficulties!

AWFUL!  BEWARE!  My husband and I walked in, looked at each other and walked out (that's how bad it was).  We were fortunate that we were able to find a room at a hotel that evening.  After all, we were in Dublin, on St. Patrick's Day!!  My husband and I planned a trip to Ireland and had a layover in Dublin, coincidentally on St. Patrick's day.  All hotels were booked, so I took to Airbnb.  I found Christian's listing and reluctantly booked.  I read prior reviews, and in fairness, all were not great but come to find out TRUE! The walls, floors and windows were filthy, the bed felt like a concrete slab and it had a felt like we were in a youth hostel which is fine but not for the price we were paying.   All that aside, Christian  quadrupled the price because it was St. Patrick's Day.....not cool, not kind!  When I reached out to Christian he was non-apologetic and condescending. I reached out to Airbnb and had little success because I did not take photos (lesson learned).    Safe travels...

This a centrally located flat, bus stop is right outside the door. It was warm and had ample hot water. Please note that breakfast is not included but there is a quick mart close by. We had a great stay in Dublin!
Will stay with Christian again!
The place looks pretty seedy from the outside. Inside clean but. Reds updating. Not enough towels
Nice flat, great location within walking distance to cafes, groceries, city center, public transport. Highly recommend and would stay here again.
Cosy place a bit far from center
Easy to get to from airport and perfect for a couple of nights.
Nice place close to everything:)

Christian's place is in good location, close to the temple bar area, and the Guinness factory. The apartment was clean, easy to access, and he let us drop our luggage off a few hours before check in, which was very convenient. This is a great place for the price.
Clean apartment, a good value for staying in the heart of Dublin.

Christian's place was perfect for our night in Dublin. Its walking distance to everything you need, its super clean and very comfortable. We didn't get the chance to meet Christian but he gave us great check in instructions which made everything very easy!
Great location and public transport links. Safe and clean flat
This place and its host are just amazing! I will not hesitate in coming back next time
Great location, close to transit, spacious, clean
Great location.
Clean place. Close to many great locations. Would recommend!
Okay for the price

Great location, and very clean apartment on the 6th floor.  Really appreciated the complimentary coffee and tea.  There is a little breakfast place, pub, and market very close by as well.  Perfect for a weekend getaway.

The place is comfortable and convenient. All the amenities youd want (coffee, laundry, good shower, quiet, hair dryer, etc.), in a good location. Its definitely used just for Airbnb rather than being someones home, if youre cool with that. 

Quicker communication wouldve been nice.

Great place for us to rest on our first night in Dublin. We were able to walk to the Guinness Storehouse in less than 10 min. There are a few flights of stairs so might be something to consider. My mother struggled, but the rest of us had no problem.

The apartment had everything we needed for our mini break. The location was perfect and only a 10 minute bus journey into Temple Bar area. Christian as a host was great at communicating everything to us in plenty of time and answered any questions we had. We wouldnt hesitate to stay at this apartment again! Thanks Christian!
Saubere Unterkunft, leichter Check-in, gute Kommunikation zum Anbieter
I walked everywhere. Most important sights are within 1 mile radius.

Down the st from the Guiness Facotry and walking distance to all major sites.  Also conveniently located blocks from train station. Communication was amazing, helpful hints. Can't ask for more a real pleasure.

Christian's place is a wonderful little flat tucked away, but very close to everything! You're only a 5 min walk away from the Guinness Storehouse, as well as other breweries/distilleries. You're about a 10 min walk away from Temple Bar and other beautiful places to eat and drink. It was a lovely stay, and Christian was very helpful in giving us tips of what to do and where to eat. Thanks so much!
Fairly central, no tv or radio but useful travel guide books.
Great location! Walking distance to pretty much everything we wanted to see in Dublin.

Great location for a lot of tourist stops. Just a 5 minute walk to the Guiness brewery tour & a fifteen minute walk to the river front. Christian was very prompt in handling our extra needs & responding to any of our questions.

Very nice apartment in good location.
But the wifi didn't work and the host was unresponsive.

Incredible location with easy access to train, bus, and taxi transportation. The local pubs and coffee shops are a joy, and the flat itself is very well maintained. The view to Guiness' Gravity bar is great, and the convenience to local attractions makes this location a must-stay! Christian is great about suggesting local hotspots and timely responds to requests or questions.
Great location in Dublin city centre. Ciara is very lovely and quick to respond.

The apartment is simply amazing, it is so cozy and comfortable. The area is great for visiting the city because its very close to Christchurch and there are a lot of good restaurants around. 
Unfortunately I was not able to meet Ciara in person as she was not in Dublin over the weekend, but she was an amazing help. She went out of her way to return something to me that I forgot at her place, and was always very lovely while communicating. 
Definitely recommend staying with her to explore Dublin. I would definitely do it again! :)
Ciaras place is so conveniently located to everything you might want to see/do in Dublin and really easy to get to from the airport. Ciara was also an excellent communicator throughout my stay.
I really enjoyed my stay with Ciara! She was responsive, helpful, and very friendly!! The location was perfect!!!
The host canceled this reservation 54 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I stayed in Stuart & Gayles house for 2 weeks. The house is cozy and has a friendly feel to it and offers anything one could need for a little bit longer stay. The close proximity to some of the big tech companies and shopping options are ideal. For anything that came up, Stuart and Gayle were very responsive and helpful. Would stay here again!

This is a very cute and compact free standing home with two bedrooms up and a kitchen and living space below.  It is very centrally located, and the home is sparkling clean.  The hosts were very kind and responsive.  We would definitely stay here again.

Staying with Arlene was amazing! She was a phenomenal communicator from the start and very responsive to all of our questions. When she found out our flight was getting in at 6AM she allowed up to check in early at 8! Her home had so much charm and was steps away from the DART. She gave us great recommendations for places to visit. Her breakfasts were amazing and we felt like we were at home the entire time. Thank you for everything Arlene!!
Lovely stay, wish it could have been longer!

I was very impressed with this property and the hosts attention to detail and communication.
I recommend this to all potential visitors.

A clean, modern apartment with excellent facilities. Easy walking to bars and restaurants in the local area. Good access to Dublin City centre. We came for 3 nights to attend a music festival at the 3arena, which was around 12 minutes walk away. It was very convenient to able to walk home.
Excellent WiFi signal. Catherine was a great host.

Our stay in Catherines appartment was a really pleasant one. The appartment was closer to city centre than we expected, and the appartment itself was both bigger and better than we tought. 
Close to an Eurospar so you will have easy axcess to all your ¬´must haves¬ª. 
Catherine is a great host! She came to give us the keys when we arrived and gave us a lot of good advice on what to do (and what not to do). 
Through our weekend there she answered our questions quickly through the chat function. 
A perfect stay in Dublin!
Catherine is een attentvolle gastvrouw. We hebben genoten van onze citytrip naar Dublin.

Catherine's place is squeaky clean, very cute, and spacious. It was my first time visiting Ireland and I felt completely relaxed using her apartment as my home base. She's extremely prompt with responding to any questions you may have!

This apartment was very accurately advertised, and the interior was even nicer and more comfortable than what I was expecting! Catherine is a lovely hostess and made sure I had everything I needed for a great stay in Dublin. The location is great - in a very accessible neighborhood that gives you a taste of local life outside of the touristy spots but still quite accessible to the city center by foot or bus. I highly recommend for one or two guests looking to settle into life in Dublin for a bit!

Catherine was a wonderful host, and communicated very well. She has wonderful instruction, and makes checking in and checking out very easy. Even when I made a booking mistake she was quick to help me with a resolution which made my trip that much more pleasurable.

Thank you Catherine!

The apartment is beautiful, really bright and very clean. There's everything you need. Catherine is a great host, very nice and helpful. Next time we go to Dublin we'll stay for sure again here! Thank you so much again Catherine!

Our stay at Catherines was more than outstanding. The pictures perfectly describe the apartment. It was clean, and had all the necessary amenities. Bread, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, tea, etc. were all provided. Our location was in an ideal spot. About a 15 minute walk to the city center and a grocery story right around the corner. It was very easy finding the apartment and Catherine offered very detailed instructions and suggestions to do around Dublin. Catherine was an outstanding host!
super nice host with flexibility
Great host & home!  I was visiting Dublin for work and I loved the location relative to Silicon Docks, great food and also being able to walk to other Dublin hot spots.
Great apartment with everything you need. Anytime again.

Thanks to Catherine for an amazing stay in Dublin! The apartment was clean and beautifully decorated and a short walk away from Temple Bar. Catherine had left tea, coffee and cereal as well as fresh towels and shampoo etc. She was able to advise of things to do and always responded quickly to any messages we sent her. Fantastic host!

Better than advertised.  Good bed.  Very clean, everything works.  Great location(Il Valentino bakery is only 5 minutes away) bus stop in front of building.  Double glazed windows do a good job of dampening noise.  Catherine met us even though we were early.  We had only 1 question that was promptly answered.  5+ stars.
Perfect location and Catherine was incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!

Perfect place for one person or a couple in a hip area of Dublin. Catherine is the consummate Professional Host, who has clearly earned her SuperHost badge many times over. Comms were stellar and she met me in person to carefully explain all the particulars. Would recommend!

The flat is larger than the pictures portray, is stylishly updated with everything one would need for a short or long stay, sparkling clean,  I slept very well in the comfortable bed, there is plenty of storage for clothes, the bathroom is modern with hot water on demand...I could go on and on about how lovely the flat is but I'd only repeat what has been written by others. On top of all of that, Catherine is a great host as well. I hope to return for a much longer stay next summer!
Great location, comfortable space, everything you need!!!
Catherine's listing looks just like the pics and she is a wonderful host.

Catherine was very easy to communicate with at all times.  She was very accommodating with my arrival plans, for which I am grateful.  The apartment is truly lovely with all the amenities one could want and more, with a fireplace and a dryer!  Plenty of sunlight and lots of room to move about comfortably.  I stayed a month and it felt like home.  The trendy location is just far enough from the busy touristy section, yet close enough to walk anywhere in the city.  Sandymount Beach is about a mile away and perfect for running endlessly along the shore.  There are various groceries close by and numerous coffee shops/bakeries. Catherine's suggestions for where to eat are spot on - Juniors is amazing for Sunday brunch.  Highly recommend the oatmeal at Gertrude's and avocado toast at Honey Truffle.  I never met the neighbors, but everyone was respectfully quiet.  Apt is in a highly secured/gated community, in front of the bus stop, and I always felt safe.  I was also able to join a gym for the month, about three blocks away.  The apt is stylish and soon became a home away from home.  A definite must-stay!
This was not just perfectly located for us but so pretty and clean - and a hand-written Card handed to us with the keys made us feel even more welcome. Loved every single second!
I had a lovely stay at Catherine's place - communication was great, check-in was straightforward and the place was clean and comfortable. Would recommend!

Catherine is a truly wonderful host and provided warm comfortable surroundings, exactly as pictured. She is a very thoughtful and welcoming host.  The location is superb, with restaurants and a grocery nearby, recommendations from Catherine were welcome and excellent, thank you for a wonderful visit!  I look forward to staying here again!

This listing is in a perfect location for a walk to my office or to hop on the DART to access Dalkey or Howth easily. It was clean, stylish and offered all the amenities one would need for a longer stay in Dublin. I will be back!

This place was OUTSTANDING! My girlfriend and I care for St. Pattys day and has an amazing time. Great location, very clean, up to date amenities, and an outstanding host. I would recommend to travelers of all ages.
This is my second stay at Catherines lovely cottage and it was as fabulous and perfect as my first visit. Cant recommend the place enough.
Lovely stay! I keep coming back for work trips.
The cottage was bright, clean and modern. A lovely space. Location was very convenient. All of which made for a great trip. Thank you Catherine for being so accommodating. Cant wait to return!

Catherine was an outstanding host, very accommodating and great communication. Recently renovated cottage was as described and very clean and comfortable. Docklands location was great - easy walk to city centre,  and taxis nearby if needed. DART rail station also close by. Good grocery stores, restaurants, shops and pubs in the neighbourhood. Some construction noise nearby during the day but not a problem for us. We were in Dublin for a short vacation and would stay here again.

The cottage is lovely, modern and full of light. It has been recently modernized with a lovely, functional kitchen and splendid bathroom. Catherine has provided everything one could possibly need during a week-long stay and offered helpful tips to surrounding restaurants and amenities. Our communication with Catherine was always efficient and effortless, as was the check-in process. Dublin is more compact than we realized and it is a short and pleasant walk to museums, pubs and galleries. We particularly enjoyed the walk from the cottage along the canal to the many excellent restaurants in Portobello and Rathmines.

Catherines place is fantastic! Its super stylish and cozy and its in a great location. Catherine was a wonderful host. She was responsive and easy to communicate with. Ill definitely be back next time Im in town!
The cottage is in a perfect location for exploring Dublin and the surroundings. Public transportation is easily accessible. Catherine is a wonderful host.

It's hard to put into words exactly what makes a hostess great, but Catherine is it. She responds very quickly and helpfully. She provides more than most ABnB hosts in terms of foodstuffs, toiletries, etc. The apartment is sparkling clean and SO lovely and comfortable. It is in fact so pleasant and peaceful inside that you may want to skip the sightseeing, etc, so you can sit in front of a cozy fire or out in the sunny courtyard instead. The apartment is also perfectly located though the construction outside may intrude from time to time. I don't have plans to return to Dublin anytime soon, but I may invent some so I can return to this terrific and elegant cottage.

Stunning cottage with all the updated touches...absolutely loved the fireplace and rainshower!! Excellent location to restaurants, pubs, coffee shops, public transport. 
Catherine is delightful and gives a thorough run down of the cottage upon arrival...she also has a wealth of local suggestions. Hope to return!

Outstanding, beautiful , modern flat just outside of Dublins city center!  Just a short walk to downtown and all Dublin has to offer.  If not inclined to travel by foot, ground transportation, to include the train, is super close.   Catherine is an outstanding, responsive host, as well, and provided excellent recommendations for activities and dining.  We would love to stay again if we return to Ireland!
I enjoyed staying at this stylish, comfortable home in a fantastic, convenient location. The host is very welcoming and responsive. I'd enjoy staying here again.

Cottage is clean, modern, and within walking distance of major sights.   Also near public transportation for easily getting around the city and beyond .   Catherine is a great host and really goes above and beyond to accommodate needs for your stay.
This is a fantastic place to stay. Very stylish and extremely well appointed. Convenient to the centre of town.
Catherines listing is great!  Very clean, updated, comfortable and well located. I would definitely stay here again :)

Catherines listing is beautiful and just as described! I had a wonderful stay and the communication with Catherine was perfect. She is a fantastic host and will give you great local tips. Thank you for hosting me, Ill be back!!

The cottage was immaculate and Catherine responded very quickly to all of my messages and was very informative. I can see why she is a SUPER HOST! We would definitely stay in her cottage again. It was convenient to City Center, but just far away from the hustle and bustle of downtown to have quiet relaxing evenings.

Catherine was very helpful with answering questions about the area and I had no problem checking in or out. The washing machine worked perfectly and it was nice to relax in front of the fireplace. A store was but few steps away and there was nice restaurants not far off. I was happy with my stay.

Catherine is a lovely host. She was highly recommended to me by a friend who is a former employee of Airbnb and stayed at her place many times while traveling on business. Catherine made checking in and out so easy, and was super responsive along the way. The place itself is in a fabulous location, close to good restaurants (try Juniors - it's soooo tasty), markets, and transportation. It is very well decorated, super clean, and having the back garden is nice in the morning and evening when you want to have some fresh air come in while you're sitting with your glass of wine hanging out. The space is probably best suited for a couple or one individual, though I traveled with a friend and we didn't have an issue making it work. I have to travel to Dublin at least once a year and I definitely plan on coming back and staying at Catherine's place each time.
At Catherines you can expect a very cozy, comfortable apt with all the amenities, including an onsite washer/dryer!  You will be hosted by a warm, friendly attentive host!  You wont be disappointed!
Very classy and stylish home, beautifully equipped. Expensive but in our opinion worth the money. Highly recommended.

Convenient, stylish space within a 1-minute walk of a coffee shop, grocery store and a few eating spots. The host was responsive, flexible, clear and warmly hospitable in communications. Excellent stay.

Catherines has an amazing place in a great location. She met me at the door for check-in, showed me around her home, and gave me some great tips on local places to visit. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Dublin to visit.
Catherine was a good host. She accommodated my late check in and promptly responded to all my questions. Thank you!
Amazing place in an amazing city.  Can't wait to be back!

Im sorry to leave my first negative AirBnB review/experience. I stayed for 8 nights and 9 days, 6 of which had no consistent hot water. I was traveling for work and very busy so 90% of my use of the flat was to shower and sleep. 

Catherine was extremely nice and communicative but I think she should have treated this as an urgent issue and did not trust me when I first brought it up. The cost of an emergency plumber visit would be a pittance compared to the ~$1500 I was spending. She refunded me only one night but I was basically taking sponge baths for 6-7 days when Im working 12 hour days and getting soaked in the rain, so that does not seem like fair recourse. All you want is a nice bed and hot shower after these long days so it was extremely frustrating and stressful to be missing one huge feature of a business stay.

The hospitality was exceptional as the place and the breakfast. The fresh homemade scone was a plus in an already cosy and quiet environment. I will definitely get back if my path will cross Dublin again.

Elaine's space had everything and more that I could need as a solo traveler. Plenty of space (almost like a bachelor apartment), with options to properly cook in a private space if desired. She was incredibly helpful and considerate and I would definitely stay with her again!!

This is the absolute perfect place for a lone traveler. Elaine goes above and beyond to help you out during your stay. I wish I could have spent more time enjoying the area, but I was so busy in Dublin. Everything you need is in both rooms - tea kettle, toaster, fridge, hair dryer, umbrella, etc. The place is immaculate and it is so nice to have the room with the tv to yourself. Shes a two minute walk from the bus stop and a 10-15 minute bus ride right to OConnell Street. If I ever find myself going back to Dublin on my own, I would book here again in a heartbeat.
Elaine gave such a warm welcome and left a nice breakfast for me in the morning. Location is close to buses to that get you into the city center and the airport.

Elaine was the best Airbnb host I have ever had. She was unbelievably and kind and made me feel like family. The room was absolutely perfect and the breakfast was delicious. I had a bathroom and living to myself which was more than I could have asked for. If I could give Elaine 10 stars I would. She made Ireland feel like home.

A very warm welcome awaits you, accompanied by invaluable tips, breakfast, a quiet neighborhood and very comfortable bed. Ideal for one traveller, easy to commute into Dublin city centre and get to/from the airport. Elaine is a wonderful host and will go out of her way to help you.

I had a wonderful time at Elaines. The space provided was perfect starting point to explore Dublin. The amenities and extras made for a really pleasant experience. Easy to find and located in the north of Dublin close to the main bus routes.
Elaine is a fantastic host, very kind and thoughtful, and her room is the perfect spot to stay in as a lone traveller. Thoroughly recommended!
The room was comfortable, warm and with everything you would want from a bnb. Breakfast was lovely.

Elaine is a wonderful person, she made me feel like home. The location is perfect ! Great neighborhood, very quiet. Only a 5mn walk from the bus station where you can go to the Airport or the centre! The place is amazing, very tidy! This is the perfect spot if you're a lone traveller, you won't regret it! I can only recommend this place and Elaine is fantastic!
wonderful host,  great place,  excellent location - what more can you ask for?!

This place is lovely! Not too far from the centre of Dublin it was easy enough to get to. The room was immaculately clean and the little touches such as a breakfast kept in the fridge and a little note upon arrival made all the difference. Elaine gave me great directions to various sites on the day of my departure and even gave me a couple of food items so I wasnt going on my way hungry! Would definitely stay again!
Elaine was a great host. I really enjoyed her local recommendations. I would definitely stay here again.

It was definitely my best experience with airbnb! I want to thank Elaine for such great hospitality, care, advices and my perfect stay in Dublin .) 
100 % recommended .)

Elaines place is a perfect little studio with own entrance, little sitting room with TV, single bed and private shower/bath. While connected to the main house, you have your own space and are totally independent. Nice touches (homemade jam, berries , muesli and orange juice for  breakfast) and very good connections via bus into the city make it perfect for single  or work in Dublin.
Wonderful spot for the lone traveller. Amazing hosts.
Elaine is a wonderful host. Nice, comfortable space for a lone traveler. You can walk to several restaurants and delightful pubs in about 15 minutes. Its a very cute area. Would stay again, no doubt.

I cannot say enough great things about Elaines place and her incredible hospitality. There were so many special little touches in the room (hair dryer, umbrella, maps of the city, usb wall plug, etc.) and the space was great! Its a quick walk to the nearest bus stop which is incredibly easy to navigate in Dublin. I didnt have any solid plans for my trip, but had a great time in my short stay because Elaine gave great tips for the city. The Botanical Gardens are just down the road and theyre beautiful, definitely check them out! I hope to stay here again! :)

Hospitality at its finest! Elaine was more than accommodating for my nights stay and the extra touch of a warm cup of tea on arrival with a scone was just lovely. Would definitely recommend to a friend as it is a safe and welcoming stay.

This stay is perfect for solo travelers! Elaine is an amazing host and was eager to give me tips and recommendations for what to do with my time in Dublin. The place has so many personal touches that made it above and beyond, such as a heated blanket, breakfast in the morning, and much more! It is a short bus ride to the center of the city, but it was very easy to navigate with Elaine's help. If you're looking for a cozy, quiet place to rest and warm up if you're traveling alone in Dublin, this is truly the perfect spot.
great place to stay and great host.
this place is amazing! super close to everything we wanted to see! Sabrina is an awesome host!
Sabrina's place is centrally located. It's within walking distance to a lot of attractions, shops and bars. It's clean and comfortable.
A great host for a nice apartment in the heart of Dublin.

Great location near temple bar and within walking distance from Guinness and Jamison.  Although we were very disappointed in the cleanliness of the apartment.  Some of the pictures in the ad are not of this apt. The shower was filled with mold between the tiles, with a rug that is old and stained.  The couch has a big stain on it, and the walls are discolored and could use a wash or a new coat of paint.  Because of these areas it was hard to trust the cleanliness of the bedrooms.  We expected noise due to being in the heart of the city but it is much louder than expected throughout the night.  Sabrina was prompt at check in.  Although due to the lack of cleanliness we feel it was overpriced and would not stay here again.
PS.  Don't use the washer and dryer, it will shrink your clothing.
Close to town centre and temple bar area. Great for mates for a long weekend away
Dirty and a very noisy location.  May be OK for college kids but for a family I would not recommend this place at all.

My friends and I ended up staying here in a pinch and Sabrina was very accommodating!  She met us late to go over the place and was very accommodating.  The place itself was clean, spacious and had a cool vibe.  As busy as the street is below, none of the noise slipped in and we slept great.  The location cant be beat, this is a great spot to stay for a night out in Dublin!
Comfortable apartment in the heartù of Dublin!

Great location right in the heart of Dublin. Everything is within walking distance. There is some noise from the street, but we could sleep with the windows open just fine. Would definitely recommend it.
The location is really great,it was the best thing about the apartment.

The apartment is in a central location but the area is a bit sketchy and loud.  Sabrina is quick to respond to messages, questions and concerns.  The apartment was in need of a good cleaning and new bed linens.
Sabrina was a great host. Her appartment is centrally located (temple bar, guiness brewery, greyhound racing in walking distance). Perfect place in a wonderful city!

The apartment was in a great location right across the river from temple bar area and many other attractions a short walk away. The building is older and across from a bar so there will be some street noise but it didnt bother us.

What needs to be said has already been said in previous reviews, but I will confirm that this place is well-located and the host is extremely kind and met us promptly with the keys.  Unfortunately I also have to confirm that this unit needs maintenance in terms of cleaning and furnishings (Mold in shower, thin and stained linens, needs paint due to excessive wear).  I am disappointed in value for money as I booked it far in advance, emphasized to he host that I expected it to be clean, and at the time of our stay saw similar well-located listings for a lower price.
Fabulous location and great space! Would highly recommend. Very helpful hosts.
Great host, great apartment, great place to discover Dublin
Great central apartment with everything you need close by! Super smooth stay!

A very nice place to stay in Dublin. An easy walk to just about everywhere you would want to go. Not really in the main part of temple bar, but there are some nice pubs and a great shopping center nearby. The Japanese restaurant downstairs was great to have so close. Clean and as advertised. Sabrina also was very fast to communicate with answers to any questions we had.

Location was awesome! Seemed like in the middle of everything but at the same not too close. Apartment was cute and clean and Sabrina was extra accommodating with our early flight. Their directions and hints were also extremely helpful! Would definitely recommend you stay here!
nice place, located right in the center.
The apt is located in a great part of the city. You can walk to almost all the big sites and attractions within 30 min or easily catch a train/bus. The space was clean as well.

Sabrina was great and we appreciate she called a taxi to take us to the airport. 
Just one small issue, the heater did not work in the bedroom we stayed. 
The location was fantastic.

This apartment is in a great location just off the Luas red line and close to Jervis shopping centre and lots of restaurants. Would highly recommend for its location and also it was a very clean and modern place to stay.
We had a great stay , the location was unbelievable, close to everything! Very friendly host and quick responses.. will definitely be back !
Good location. Apartment okay if only 4 guests and need 2 beds.

Sabrina is a lovely host, responds quickly and really does her best to accommodate her guests. The apartment is small but perfect as a base. The door into the apartment feels a little flimsy, would be nice if it had a better lock so guests could feel a little more secure. The apartment was very clean, the bathroom is a little dated but nothing some paint and TLC wouldn't fix. The front bedrooms looks out onto the main street and gets alot of the street noise (it's to be expected for where it is) but the back bedrooms is quiet!! Overall a great base in the heart of the city!! Would stay again! Thanks Sabrina
Amazing Location! Very near to the famous HaPenny Bridge and Temple Bar! Sabrina is amazing and very helpful. Highly recommended.

Lovely apartment overlooking the action, an amazing location. A few. minutes walking to temple bar area but far enough that it wasnt loud at night. Bedrooms are in back away from street which also helps. Definitely recommend!
Nice place in Dublin. Very close to Temple Bar.

Apartment was clean, exactly as described and in a perfect location. 5 minute walk to OConnell Street & just beside Hapenny Bridge. Slightly noisy at night and in the morning but nothing major. Great communication with the host. Would definitely stay again.
Good location, we stayed on a Fri and Sat night, wasnt that noisy as other guests described on reviews.
Fantastic location, very organised host with very useful tips of the area. Quick responses to messages and helps wherever they can.

Great location and spacious apartment! We only stayed for one night but it was easy to get to from the airport and was in a great location for exploring Dublin. The rooms were spacious, the kitchen has everything youd need and the building was secure.
Perfect location and host!!

Sabrina gave us a warm welcome and showed us around the apartment. Communication and check-in was super easy! The apartment is in a great location close to public transportation and breakfast places. Very close to the inner city (everything in walking distance). Generally, the apartment is pretty noisy, from the street on one hand (which can be expected in a location like this), but also the building itself. The front door is very flimsy, it would really need a safer/stronger lock. But I guess that is not their fault as all doors in the building seem to be that way. We did not feel comfortable in the bathroom because many joints in the sink, the bathtub and the toilet were mouldy. This should be fixed soon. Also, one of the towels was dirty and also one of the pillow cases.

My family and I really enjoyed our stay! The apartment is in a great location, right next to the Temple Bar area, great restaurants, and awesome shops. The apartment was clean and the beds were comfortable. We were only here for 1 night, but would definitely stay again if we ever came back.
Flat is in an excellent location which makes it easy to explore Dublin and use local transport links. Host was friendly and flat was comfortable to stay in. 10/10 would stay again!

Sabrina was fantastic at communicating and even let us drop our stuff off early. You could not get an apartment in a better location, it was so central to temple bar and so convenient for everything that we wanted to do. Apartment was clean but could do with a little updating/maintenance perhaps. However can't fault it due to the price and location. thanks so much Sabrina! would definitely recommend.

The apartment is in a great location, very close to Temple Bar and OConnell Street.  The apartment is as as advertised but shabbier than we were expecting.  The bathroom appeared to have been cleaned quickly, leaving trash and sink residue from the previous guest.  This left me with an uneasy feeling about the cleanliness of the rest of the apartment.  To confirm this feeing, there were multiple stains on the couch and it appeared the throw rug had not been vacuumed.  Maybe a good choice for those looking for close proximity to bars and nightlife and not so concerned about cleanliness.
The apartment was in a brilliant centre location. Sabrina the host replied rapidly to all communication. Would recommend staying here.
Good location.
Great location and stay.  Thanks!
Nice apartment- great location!
Our host was extremely responsive, and we had a good stay. The location can be very loud, but this is likely very common for the area.
great location, fun places to eat and shop within a few minutes of apartment
Great location, great beds, shower and wifi, Sabrina was very availableto us.

The apartment is pratically in the center of Dublin just a couple minutes walking to Temple Bar.
The only problem was the heating in the rooms didn't work and it was a bit cold in Dublin at the time.
Awesome location! Great host!
Centrally located, walk to the river Starbucks and O'Connell St
Good location, hard to find at first, but Sabrina helped us figure out where to go. Thank you for having us on our last night in Ireland!
Location was amazing

Fantastic location for a great price, and Sabrina couldn't have been more helpful.
Would highly recommend
Great family apartment. Great location.

If you are looking to explore around Temple Bar area this is a great location. Easy access to all you are looking to do. A nice stroll over HaPenny Bridge to and from the Apartment gets you away from all the late night revelry of Temple Bar. Best of both worlds.

The host and location are brilliant - no complaints there. 
The property itself however is tired and feels dirty. We replaced bedding and towels for our 3 day stay there. 
If you are looking for somewhere to sleep after wild partying and dont care too much about feeling too fresh, then this place is great however if you plan to spend anytime in the communal areas or cooking for yourself then we wouldnt recommend it.
The apartment is in a perfect location. Sabrina is a wonderful host.

Well located, very clean! The apt was perfect and Sabrina did everything good in order to host us confortly! Thanks again!
Florian and his friends

It's a great location. 10 mins away from everything and some great brunch places. The flat itself is a bit dated and could do with a good scrub. I reckon they're have been several stags/hens stay at this apartment hence the honest wear and tear. Great value for what you get and would recommend it for a quick weekend on a budget.
Very grateful to Victoria for the room she is renting. She is very kind, so contfortable bed, very quiet and peaceful place.

This room is perfect if you want to explore Dublin. A tram stops nearby to take you to the city centre. The room itself was very clean and Victoria always was quick to respond. Overall a great experience.

Victoria's place is very well located if you're visiting the Sandyford area in Dublin. If you want to visit the city center you have a tram stop near by (7 min walk) that will take you to Dublin in 30 minutes. The room has all you need, even a kettle, and the on-suite bathroom is a great extra. The flat is very quiet so a good night sleep is guaranteed.
Great place located outside of the city centre but everything is easily reachable. Very modern place and nice view.

Apartment was very clean and fully stocked with everything we needed. It was very quiet in the evenings, even had the window open for both nights due to it being quite warm. There are various coffee, food and various other stores all at the bottom of apartment block. Victoria was always very quick to reply with any queries we had. Would definitely recommend to others to stay

Victorias place is perfect for my short stay in Dublin. Its clean and basically got every thing you may need. The location is very convenient, just less than 10 min walk to the closest LUAS station and only take you half an hour to the city centre. The place is highly recommended.
The house was very nice and has everything you need, also it is near the Luas. Victoria is very kind and tries to help you in anything
Great house, very comfortable, easy access to all amenities in Dun Loaghaire, just a short walk to all the Yacht clubs.

This was our SECOND stay at this Beautiful home. Once again it exceeded our expectations in terms of location, comfort and managing check in and out. Jane and Damian treated us like family would and this only made the house feel more like home to my husband, myself and our two young boys. In terms of value, they say location is everything - and this is certainly the case with this home. Literally across the street from the Dart for a 15 mins ride into Dublin. At least 10 great restaurants within walking distance - Fish Shack, Cavistons, Hartleys, the cookbook cafe and our new favourite in Dun Laoghaire, Olivetos. Culture and History is all around you - James Joyce Museum - I got to hear a live reading of Ulysses, 40 foot and Dun Laoghaire pier. Another magical vacation and our home away from home played a huge part. Thank you!

Host was very accommodating and her place is clean and sparkly. Quiet neighbourhood, good rest after a day of activities. Kitchen was well equipped for cooking as well. Place was well located, just 20 minutes away from the city by walking.

Dee is a marvelous host and her flat is very conveniently placed and allows for an in depth exploration of Dublin on foot and by public transit. Dee was very responsive to the few minor hiccups we had during our stay. I would not hesitate to recommend her flat for anyone wanting to visit Dublin!

The place is in a great location downtown Dublin and walking distance to everything. Dee met us at the gate and showed us around. The apartment is a little small but probably common for a Dublin apartment. The apartment is in the ground floor so you hear and see people leave throughout the evening. The refrigerator was great although it froze everything. Dee had milk and cereal in the apartment which was nice. Overall, a good place for a couple people max.

Dee's place was perfect for a stay in Dublin, Ireland. After a long day of exploring Dublin, or any where in Ireland for that matter, it was a relief to come back to such a comforting place to relax and get ready for the next day. I would recommend Dee's place to anyone who wants to stay in Dublin.
Comfortable apartment close to town centre

Dee's apartment is great! I loved the location (close enough to easily walk to all the attractions, but far enough from Temple Bar for peaceful, quiet evenings). She has so many recommendations for food and for places to shop and visit. Check-in and communication were great - Dee met me at the listing and walked me through everything. I highly recommend this apartment and Dee as a host!

Dee's place was perfectly located in central Dublin. Within walking distance of almost all the main attractions. Dee was very helpful with check in, and offered some great tips on exploring the city! 5/5

Dee was a fantastic host. She gave us many local tips that made the most of our time. The place itself was super cute, clean and you can walk everywhere from it. Would stay here again next time we get to Dublin :)
If ever I am back in Dublin, I would check first if Dees place is available. Highly recommended.
Quiet apartment complex. Nice walk along the river to the historic center. Dee was very nice and helpful.

Apartments located in nice area, very quite and safe. It was clean, had everything needed. Host was nice and friendly. Lived in this aparments during business trip for a week and can not complain about a thing

Excellent experience with our host Dee. Very prompt and helpful with her responses and recommendations on how to get about the city! The apartment is walking distance to the hustle and bustle of the city core and the Guiness Storehouse which was a big bonus if you enjoy long walks. Definitely a recommended spot for your next trip to Dublin! :)

its a good location, near Guinness, but about 1.5 miles to city center, which we walked to everyday for fun, or to catch a tour.  the place it self is small, perfect for a couple.  enough space to stretch out in the one bedroom and the one living room/kitchen.  we made our own breakfasts, there are stores all around for supplies like bread, eggs, peanut butter, milk, wines etc.   The bed is cozy and comfortable.  Dee supplies coffee and press.  
one bonus, its near the oldest bar, the Brazen head, which we stopped in every evening before heading home.
Dees apartment is great.The location is very nice,near the central of Dublin.The transportation is convenient.
Nice place, quiet for being so centrally located.

Dee was very responsive and the place was clean and had all of the necessities. The location was decent, 10min walk to Guinness and a 20min walk to the Temple Bar area. The bed was comfortable and the apartment complex was safe. My only complaints were that the breakfast cereals were stale and the milk was expired so dont count on breakfast as a cost savings, theres no TV for when you get back after a day of travel, and theres no parking so it did cost us 100Euro for the garage nearby for the week.
Dee was a vey good host

Perfectly located and quite: near the spire (Dublin center) and grocery shops, restaurants, pubs,.. John did everything to suit my needs (keys, extended stay). I would recommend you this apartment for 3/4 people!!!

I had booked the place for my mom and her friend who were visiting Dublin. Unfortunately the place is in much need of repairs and cleaning. 

The place is managed by a company and apparently has no involvement of the owner John

As soon as you entered the place, it smelt of damp/mold. There were damp/mold marks along the lower wall on the right in the entry passage and on the bedroom ceiling (I have pics which I will upload if I can or I can send them if anyone wants to see) .
