There was also a hole in the wall of the bedroom (also have a pic of that).

The freezer compartment of the refrigerator was encrusted with ice and not cleaned. Two of the stove hot plates did not work - this was however repaired on the second day.

The building was very well located; however the atmosphere within the building was not fresh. 
The host or his agent should have made at least one personal contact with us and helped us to settle down. There was no personal communication from anyone. 

Everything had to be done through the management website. 
I am so embarrassed for booking this place for my mom. Never again. Sorry Mom
Good location. Central. Good spacious room. Wifi included.
Great location, ideal for spending a few days in the city centre

Great apartment, great location
Amazing host super helpful
Older but very clean and spacious apartment right in the heart of Dublin. Excellent value.
Perfect location; short walk away from airport bus, trams, pubs and shops. Check-in and out very easy and John was great with communication. Highly recommend this apartment!
Great location and good little apartment!
Great location, quiet, and clean.

This place was a great place to stay.  Super clean, great location for touring around Dublin.   The host was responsive and flexible when I needed a change to my reservation.   You cant beat the price if you want to stay in the city.  I highly recommend this place.
The unit was very well positioned for sight seeing clean and comfortable. The host was welcoming and easy to contact.
Great communication with the host.  Very clean and the sofa bed was amazing (better than the regular bed!).

Johns place is a simple and clean apartment thats certainly well located in the Dublin city. However we had 4 guests in our group and we could only find beds for 3 guests (the sofa bed is a single). The double bed is fairly large so we ended up having 1 on the sofa and 3 in the double bed, so we managed but this is definitely something to be aware of! Overall I wouldnt recommend the apartment to groups of 4, but itd be just fine for a 3 or below :) 

John kindly allowed us to drop off our bags before check-in and was responsive to our messages throughout our stay. We also found a nice Italian restaurant nearby called The Italian Connection! 

Other than the bedding situation, the apartment has all the essentials: kitchen, bathroom, wifi etc. 

Can definitely recommend Johns place for smaller groups than ours!
A nice place where to stay, near to most place of interest I will really recommended.

Broken heater, slow wifi and a very compact house.
Very tight space
Nice apartment with great location. Everything is very well accessible. Good and fast communication with the host.
In a good location and on the whole you get what you pay for!
Absolutely amazing, this was my first airbnb ever and truly set a standard! space was great Amanda was so nice! highly recommend for anyone whonwants to stay in dublin
Nice & clean room/flat. We had a great time in Dublin.. highly recommend ! Thanks to Amanda for letting us drop the bags for the day :)
Amanda is a fantastic host! Her apartment is so clean, stylish, and cozy. I loved my stay here. It is the perfect location (Guinness storehouse is a 5 min walk!!). Highly recommend!
Amanda's a great and friendly host. The whole place is very clean and homely, and she had a lot of good tips about places to eat and visit. Also her cute dog George was a pleasure to meet!!!

Amanda was such a lovely host! Very sweet and gave us great tips for sites, food and drinks. She and her cute dog made us feel very welcome at her place. The apt has a good location and we were lucky that there was no noise coming from the bar below. The room wasnt big as you can tell from the pics but good enough. Usually, you dont spend much time in the room anyway when you travel.
Amandas home is so nice! The area is great and a nice walk to Temple Bar. She was welcoming! I recommend staying with her!!
Amanda and George were adorable. We really love to stay at their place. Well situated. Highly recommended!
We really enjoyed our time at Amanda and George's apartment. She was extremely welcoming and gave great advice! Thank you so much

I stayed at Amanda's apartment for 2 nights on my first trip to Dublin. Amanda is a very warm and friendly host who gave me an excellent map and amazing tips on how to get around. She also allowed me to store my bags there for a few hours before my flight after check out. She has a very friendly dog and though I have allergies, I had no reaction the entire stay. 
The apartment is in the Liberty area next to many cafes and bars that are open late and the main street to the river. I walked everywhere for the most part and felt fairly safe at night. The apartment is very secure as there is a code and key to get through two exterior doors and a bolt lock on the apartment door. The Guinness Storehouse is literally 10 minutes, the Teeling Distillery is 15 minutes, and Temple Bar is 20 min walking from the apartment. 

The location is amazing and would definitely recommend staying here if you need a reasonably priced place to crash while exploring Dublin on foot.

Amanda was really nice, she gave me a warm welcome (with a little help from George). The position is great, just a 10 min walk from all the main attractions in the city centre. The room is nice and cozy as showned on the add.

Amanda is such a friendly outgoing and kind host and her dog George is a lovely gentle being :) The property is very comfortable and extremely well located in the oldest neighbourhood in Dublin, The Liberties. I have an excellent stay here with a friend and would recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in central Dublin. Go raibh maith agat!
Amanda's place was a great option to stay for our Dublin trip, very good communication, quiet place and everything you need is very close to the apartment. I can recommend.
Amanda is super nice and the apartment is very thoughtful. We enjoyed the stay very much!!
Amanda was a lovely host, the apartment was nearby the city centre and I had everything I needed for a short city trip. Would love to be her guest again.

The room was just what I needed. Very clean and good to see a no shoe policy.
Amanda was great.
The real star of the show is George of course. Give him a good scratch and you have a friend for life! I might just dognap him next time I'm there xD
Amandas home is great! 20 mins walk from city center. 10 mins walk from Guinness. The Bathroom is clean and bed is comfy. George is really cute lol

This was my second stay at Amanda's (and George's...)
All good still as with first week.
Clean place, great location and friendly host

Amanda is a lovely host! She is super quick at replying to messages, her place is clean and comfortable and she is super friendly! When we arrived she had put water bottles on the table and arranged an adapter for our charges which was so great since we forgot to bring one. Definitely recommend, and her dog George is super cute and loves to cuddle!
Amandas place was very welcoming and clean. Bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless. Amanda is a wonderful host and one of the friendliest people youll ever meet. Highly recommended!
Very nice little place.

Amanda was an amazing host!!  Her place is very close to downtown Dublin and the Temple Bar area îwithin walking distance. Her apartment was adorable and comfortable I felt right at home being there! She went above and beyond our expectations by giving us local tips for where to go in Dublin, and even provided us with tea and coffee in our room. If youre looking for a place to stay in Dublin I really recommend Amanda!!
Amazing location and the sweetest dog as a co-host:)
Good accommodation, good localisation, and super great host !!!
Amandas place was clean, cozy, and inviting. She was also very  accommodating and communicative. Had a great time!
Perfect stay at Amanda's. She AND george are really good host. It is really well situated et cosy.
Beautiful apartment, great location, very good host. We would recommend it without any doubt.

Marys home was just as described, and our oasis after busy, long days of sightseeing. Pay attention to her notes and instructions, especially with the tv remotes. :) Including manuals for the appliances was genius, as the slight differences from home could have made it very confusing without.

The home is beautiful, with lots of natural light, and in a cozy residential area. Plenty of room to spread out and get alone time, even with 4 people staying there. Youre far enough from the city centre to be able to relax, yet close enough to catch public transit or drive in. Also enjoyed the plants and flowers outside the home, beautiful garden. 

Even when just sending her a message that we had arrived and when we were heading out, she responded quickly and so kindly. 

¢ Wi-fi: fast and great in all spots of the house
¢ Shower - clean with good hot water 
¢ Bathrooms - having a toilet on both levels is a great help with 4 people staying there. 
¢ Kitchen: beautiful, clean, and with all the basics youd need to make a simple meal.

Arlene and her beautiful home was easily the highlight of our visit to Dublin, and that is saying a lot!  She was a warm and welcoming spirit after our long journey to the city and consistently was a joy to be around.  She immediately made us feel welcome in her home, which was clean, safe, and quiet.  Hope to stay with her again on our next visit to Dublin!
Thank you Arlene for allowing me to stay in your gorgeous home and for being a wonderful host, I thoroughly enjoyed meeting you, and learning from you! Xo

This is a clean, beautiful, bright house with ample space and a lovely garden. Extremely good for transport into the city and to the airport, and the area is very peaceful and green. Arlene is a thoughtful, caring and attentive host.

Lovely house laid out over 3 floors in a lovely quiet part of Ballsbridge, 15/20 mins walk from the RDS, 2 mins walk from the dart line and just around the corner from the beach front. Arlene was a great host, very accommodating of our needs and we would stay again.
Great location and spot!
Overall it was a great stay. Great walking distances to all Dublin attractions. We had some difficulties figuring out the water temperature for all 5 guests, but we managed.

Great apartment with an amazing location to explore Dublin. Right in the heart of Temple Bar.

Excellent experience and Garrett was very accommodating, flexible and gave us some good tips of where to eat and explore in the City. 

Would highly recommend this place to any traveller looking to explore Dublin and have s great base with a cracking riverside view of the Liffey and bustling Dublin nightlife.

Cheers!

What a great location! Right in the heart of things, but just a couple blocks off of the center of Temple Bar to make it less noisy.  The views of the river, especially at sunset, were stunning.  We were visiting my daughter who is studying in Dublin and we comfortably fit five adults (four plus the night she stayed over).  Checking in was easy and Garrett was very responsive to questions.  I'd highly recommend this home as a great home base for seeing the sites in Dublin!

Loved everything about this place! Garrett met us and let us in and showed me where I could park. So nice and helpful. The apartment is very spacious and comfortable and nothing beats the views! I wish I could live there forever!!!
Great location,  amazing view of the river, and super friendly at check in even when our flight was delayed. Would definitely stay here again.
Fantastic location and apartment with all the facilities you'll need for a stay in Dublin. Our family of 5 were very comfortable and enjoyed looking out over the River Liffey.

This apartment is just as described.  Clean and plenty of space for 5 people. The location is perfect! Within walking distance to many tourist attractions. Communication was quick and easy with Garrett. We had a great stay and would definitely book here again if we get back to Dublin!
We had a lot of delays and had to keep pushing back our check-in time. Garrett was totally fine with this and also helped us find the quickest route to the apartment. Highly recommend!
Great location!!  Cant emphasize that enough. Host Garrett was easy to work with and his communication was very timely.

Simply charming. We booked this place for the view alone. Little did we know wed be about two blocks from all the fun Temple Bar has to offer. While visiting we got plenty of rain and Garretts place was the prefect retreat to cozy up with a cup of tea and enjoy the canal views. Garrett is a spectacular host and very responsive. With only two of us visiting we had more space than we needed with two bedrooms, it was delightful! We were traveling from the states and found this to be easy to navigate, comfortable, and a warm welcome to a beautiful city.
The views are every bit as good as the photos suggest, and the location is wonderful. As long as you're comfortable climbing two flights of stairs, this is a fine place to stay.
Great location, super helpful host!
This apartment is prime location and has the most amazing view. The pictures dont do it justice. Garrett was extremely helpful and we would definitely be back
Amazing location and great style.  The flat was clean and had great amenities, although we did have troubles with the hot water. The flat is well worn and dinged up.
This was a great place to stay! Perfectly placed and close to everything!
Great location & beautiful view of the the river.  It was  bit noisy our first night but that is to be expected near Temple Bar. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Excellent central location for touring Dublin.
For the price expected some updates and newer bedding.
Perfect location. We walked to everything. Great view of river! Responsive host. Plumbing is a bit rustic but works. Rooms are small. High noise level from busy street below.

Garretts place in Dublin was a great place to stay. Location was excellent and it comfortably housed our party of four.  One of Garretts associates let us in during check in and was very helpful. We enjoyed our stay in Dublin, and Garretts place was a big part of that.
Great apartment in a very convenient location with lots of lovely restaurants and bars within a very easy walking distance.
Great place with a great location. Everything we were looking for and was in walking distance to just about anything. Beautiful view over the river.
You couldnt get a better location and place to stay while in Dublin. Garrett was more than helpful with any enquirys. The apartment itself was perfect for a weekend break, thank you!
Excellent view!
Great apartment with an awesome view. Garrett was quick to respond to all questions. Location is in the heart of Dublin and we were able too walk everywhere. We would highly recommend.

Unloved apartment in need of refurb, but if you only want a doss house it is in a great location and just big enough for 4 people for a few nights. Also, the view over the Liffey is very good, but not unique!

Great location allowing you to easily come and go while enjoying all Dublin has to offer. As in most big cities there is a lot of drug use in area however the building itself is very secure. Recommend a walk to the harbour - lots to explore and do along the way. Place itself is dated but comfortable.

Garretts place is great! Location, amenities, communication with the host, everything was as advertised or better. We especially loved the location, just a few minutes walk from just about everything. A great spot and a great host!

Overall, this place was pretty good. The location is the biggest perk however there were some downsides. Im going to be as honest as possible about Garretts apartment. 

First the good...
-The location of the apartment could not be better. You are close to all the action of Temple Bar but far enough away to not be too bothered by the crowds. You are within walking distance to so many bars, restaurants and shops! The view of the river is amazing! 
-Communication with Garrett was excellent. He was always quick to respond, very helpful, and even let us check in early.  The instructions he emails to you are the best Ive come across using Airbnb and I loved the detail! 
-the apartment had blow dryers and extra plug converters so the amenities were great in that aspect. It was also very spacious for a big city apartment. 

Now the not-so-good...
- I feel like the photos do not really match the true place. Yes, it looks the same to an extent but in person it definitely needs a little sprucing upî new linens, new paint, and definitely new pillows. They were so flat and uncomfortable.  The bedrooms just seemed pretty outdated. 
- The toilet/plumbing is very tricky and loud. Getting the toilet to flush on the first try became a joke with us- we were like Yes! I got it this time! The water tank is loud, especially if using the washing machine but it didnt really bother us. Just an FYI if you have kids sleeping, etc. 
- the washer/dryer unit is also tricky.  It took us forever to figure it out.  You have to run a wash cycle in order to dry. It doesnt just dry. You can set the settings for just dry but it will still start washing all over again lol 
- It seemed like the windows were always open in kitchen, even when they werent. The noise was loud from the street but once youre in the bedroom with the doors closed, you couldnt hear the noise so it did not bother us much. 
- neighbors have a young child so we tried to be as quiet as possible when coming and going, especially at night.  Despite our efforts unlocking the door and trying to close the door was not an easy feat lol. It sounds silly but the door handle is so small and its had to get it to close without slamming.  It became another thing we laughed about on a daily basis. Hopefully we didnt disturb the kiddo too much.
Garrett takes great care of his place and will answer any questions you may have. Would recommend to friends!

Ok, this place is in a great location. The review by Denise from Wyandotte, MI in October 2019, said it best in her review, 100% accurate. This place needs updating big time. Theres a big problem with the plumbing, mostly the toilet. The shower was great, lots of hot water. Met the neighbor across the hallway, nice woman with child, we respected her wishes to be quiet after 9 pm. This place is a great cash cow for Garrett, his place is just what youll need to crash after a heavy weekend or night of partying the Temple Bar area. His place is 5 stars! I would stay here again,
Perfect location for a stay in the city of Dublin! Restaurants, breakfast and bars very near. Wunderful view! And the Appartement very clean!

We couldnt have asked for a better place for our honeymoon. Minutes walk away from almost everything you could possibly need. Shopping, food, drinking, tourist locations, romantic views of the river, located at the historical Isoldes Tower, this place has it all. Garrett was a responsive and extremely helpful host, with clear communication and instructions. Absolutely would stay again.
Great place for temple bar area.  Place is clean, not too loud, and overall great experience.
I spent a weekend at Arlene's lovely home. It was very clean, and the house is located in perhaps, the most beautiful area in Dublin.
Arlene is a very nice and beautiful lady! The room is very cozy and comfortable!! A wonderful trip!

Arlene was a lovely host and provided a very homey, welcoming atmosphere.  My room was cute and cozy and the house itself was beautiful with lots of great artwork throughout.  Breakfast was provided and Arlene provides a great spread with a lot of variety. The location is a bit far out of Dublin, true, but the DART stop a couple blocks away made it very easy to get into the city and the quiet neighborhood and seaside accessibility made this the perfect spot for me to relax after spending the day tramping around downtown.

Staying in Len and Marks (and Ricky!) home was unlike any other¬†Airbnb experience I've had.

From the moment we booked, Len and Mark were quick to offer us help and tips about our upcoming stay. I knew from that point that I'd booked the right place.

When we arrived, they welcomed us like family. We shared coffee, chocolates and drinks while they gave us more information about Dublin and our stay in general. It's beyond words the generosity I felt at how they kindly and freely shared their time and knowledge with us. It was a pleasant way to arrive for our vacation. Over the rest of our trip we didn't get a chance to see Len and Mark much, but any time we did, it was always nice.

Everything was clean and tidy for our stay. Their home was warm and inviting and also conveniently located. Theres a convenience store right across the street, the bus stop is only a few steps from the house, and the tram is about a 10 minute walk away. 

The room for our stay was comfortable and always a good temperature. The bed was comfortable and I was never lacking a good nights rest. The bathroom was nice, incredible water pressure in the shower and a full tub. Sorry again about hogging up the hot water that morning, Mark! 

Len and Mark are first class people, as is their hospitality. From the time we arrived to the time we left, they were warm and kind. I felt incredibly welcomed in their home and I feel lucky to have stayed with them.
Nice and cozy room with everything you need in a charming house.  Excellent connection to the city centre. Len and Mark are wonderful hosts.

Charming house accessible by bus from Dublin city centre (20 minutes). Quiet enjoyed during our 3 nights stay.
Home of Len & Mark super friendly
A good address that we recommend

Len & Marks place surpassed expectations. Very hospitable, the definition of going above and beyond. The room/house is gorgeous, and perfectly clean. The location is so convenient to many sites & a quick trip into city center. I couldnt recommend this place highly enough. Cant wait to visit again.

Sander and I stayed at Mark & Len's place during our five-day trip to Dublin. We had a wonderful time! Mark & Len's house is beautiful and the room as well as the en suite bathroom were very comfortable, clean and everything we needed was in there :). We also enjoyed the lite breakfast in the morning.

Len and Mark are both very kind, generous, helpful and hospitable. From the moment they welcomed us into their house, until the moment we left, they made us feel at home. For example, they gave us information about Dublin, the public transport system and which sites to visit. But they also invited us to share a glass of wine and whiskey and were genuinely curious how we experienced our days in Dublin/Ireland.

We would highly recommend this place. Thanks guys for making our holiday so memorable!

Oh my DEER (haha)
I have an unforgettable 5 days with Mark and Len
Theyre lovely friendly and intelligent couple I ever met in my whole life . 
The house location is wonderful for the guests, not far from the airport,quiet neighborhood,and close to bus stop and Grocery store.
Ricky (dog)is so adorable,such a sweet cute pie .
Im telling you guys the house is spacious,refreshing and stylish .On a scale from 1 to 10, I would say 25. 
And they provide delicious breakfast for me every day . 
Organic berries from the yard , yummy yogurt, fresh croissant with jam and butter,Cereal with Milk,and fancy espresso coffee machine . 
The room I was staying is amazing. Soft bed with four pillows, and big bathtub for the guest. 
Theyre patient when I have emotional breakdown , theyre good listener .
Theyre my lifesaver when I got injured in the Phoenix park . Len got out his important meeting, and Mark drove me to city private clinic. Theyre my hero and guardians. How can I return this favor in the rest of my life. Oh god 
I would never forget the practical advice they gave 
I would never forget the love they showed 
I would never forget the hospitality 
I would never forget ¶ I LOVE YOU GUYS 
Anyone seeing this review , I just want to tell you that book this beautiful house without any hesitation, theyre not just your host , theyre your friends and family . 
Btw Mark is Ryan Gosling with sexy Irish accent.
Check it out if u dont believe me ,but he is way taller 
And hotter . According to TIME magazine 
Again ,Love you ,Ill be back in the future 
Much love

You will not be disappointed! From having some wine ready after 9hours of delays to suggesting an itinerary change to get a real feel of dublin to showing us one of the most local pubs nearby, these guys were great! Their place is welcoming as are they and great location if you are like me and dont want to be IN the city center. Short ride with uber or taxi to city center and also close to public transportation as well. The house is beautiful in itself, but the friendliness of the hosts make it even more unique.  I would stay again if ever in dublin!

This was a return trip for us.  We wouldnt consider staying anywhere else in Dublin.  Mark and Len are amazing hosts.  The are so hospitable you will feel like you are staying with old friends. 
The accommodations are wonderful - clean and comfortable.  Great bed and shower.  
Location is perfect, only a short ride into the city center.  
Mark and Len are awesome at making suggestions for things to do and places to eat or have a pint.  
Great conversations at the end of the day.

Best accomodations so far.  Easily 5 stars.  Exceeded our expectations. Very comfortable, clothing optional, great conversatioms and travel advice.  Super clean and served a great breakfast.  We will definitely stay here when we return!!!

Beautiful home and wonderful hosts! 
Very easy to get to the center. There are a couple decent pubs within a few minutes walk from the house, including a brewery with good beer and excellent pizza. 
The ad mentions dogs, but don't let that put you off if you're not a fan of dogs. They keep to themselves (though happy with pets if you're offering) and I never heard a peep out of either.

Very clean, stylish apartment. Everything you need is there including cooking utensils, dishwasher, washing machine, hair dryer. Only one very minor caveat, and that is the good restaurants are at least a 15-minute walk away.  The SPAR across the street is very handy and actually has great fresh food options compared with convenience stores in the States. Bed very comfortable.  Very quiet building but the church bells across the street and the traffic on Patrick street can be noisy.

Fiona and Breda very helpful in Maggie's absence.

Overall, an excellent value and would definitely stay at Maggie's place again!

A perfect, cozy, lovely home spot in an excellent location.  Clean, comfortable, great kitchen, with extra care given from beginning to end.   Right on the transportation line, with magnificent views of beautiful St. Patrick's Church.   We'd book again in a heartbeat.
Cute, well appointed, spacious flat in a PERFECT location. Everything is super convenient from Maggies place and I would definitely recommend it :)
Close to town, easy walk to all amenities, cosy apartment for short stay in Dublin.
Fantastic location - fantastic host - fantastic apartment. Well definitely look Maggie up next time were coming through Dublin.

Great location & great view of the park/ church. Be a little careful at night time waking the back streets walking home. We had a little difficulty. Bottom floor stank of stagnant smoke. Bedrooms are small, one is way smaller & is smaller than a double bed. The beds are not good. Host flipped both mattresses so we were actually sleeping on the hard bottom of the mattress. Not too happy about that. Full kitchen & bathroom were great. 
We had a good stay. Apart from not sleeping the 4 nights due to the bad mattresses, it was a pleasant stay.
Great centrally located apartment
Appartement conforme au descriptif, au calme en plein centre ville.
This place was great! The view of St Patricks Cathedral was gorgeous and it was walking distance to a lot of fun stuff. Maggie was great, helpful, and responded quickly. Wed love to stay here again!
Perfect location in short walking distance to so many attractions. Great clean space. Wonderful host

I chose Maggies apartment based on location. It doesnt get any better for seeing Dublins key sites on foot or by bus. The beds are sublime. Kitchen well equipped if you want to cook. I especially appreciated a real coffee maker. The shower is a winner- lots of pressure. Most assuredly, I would return and highly recommend.

Maggies flat was better than expected. The location is extremely convenient, theres a small market across the road for snacks and their fresh sandwiches they made were really good. The flat is spotless, comfortable, personal effects at a minimum, and has all the amenities I look for. We did our laundry in the morning and let our clothing dry on the rack in the closet all day - set it up by the window. Was essentially perfect. Wed definitely recommend it to anyone.

The place is great, just as described. Its clean, located within walking distance of everything in Dublin. Maggie was very responsive, we arrived much earlier than expected and she answered our message and we were able to get in earlier than anticipated. Would definitely recommend
Superb location, comfortable beds,  easy space,  safe nest feeling.
The location is absolutely fabulous.  Amazing view of St. Patrick's Cathedral and the apartment was exactly as advertised.  Would highly recommend it!
Great place!

This apartment is in an excellent location and it was easy to walk to many of the sites. Being right across the street from an 800 year old church was a unique treat too. Although we didnt cook any meals there, the full kitchen is well equipped with everything, including a washing machine which came in very handy. Having an elevator is a huge plus.  The street below is a main road, so the traffic noise never really stops, so be sure to bring ear plugs for sleeping.
Amazing opportunity to stay at Maggies. Highly recommend!
Maggie's place is on an ideal location. It is spacious and light with all the amenities you need.  We loved being close  to the centre of town.

Maggies place is exactly as pictured and is spotlessly clean. There is an elevator in the building that helps with luggage. The shower was wonderful and had hot water and great water pressure. Communication was excellent and the Wi-Fi worked perfectly.

The flat overlooks St Patricks Church which offers a stunning view as well as church bells counting out the hour, every hour, all day and all night. Its a third floor unit and neighbors are quiet but there is street noise. Earplugs solved that for me.

Its a safe neighborhood. The bed was comfy and there were plenty of pillows. The location is good... its a short walk to Temple Bar, The Brazen Head, and the Guinness Storehouse. We appreciated the proximity and ease of getting around without a car. I would absolutely stay there again.
A great located appartment vis-a-vis the St. Patricks Cathedral - I loved the view! Comfortably equipped, very clean, everything was lovely. I hope I will return some day.
Very nice home and close to everything.
A great flat with an amazing vue, very central and easy to find. Clean and well looked after.
Great cozy place, very convenient location for walking around Dublin and a lovely view of the cathedral! The size was just right for three of us.
You will not be disappointed if you stay here. Wonderful.

Great location, authentic Irish area. Clothes didn't dry well due to the humid air, so don't plan to do laundry while on vacation. You can get Taxis right outside the door. Great view of St Patricks Cathedral.
This was my second stay at Maggie's flat. The location is very good. The flat is fully equipped and comfortable.

Lovely place as described.  It was very clean and we enjoyed the location, our thoughtful host,  and Bredas resourcefulness and kindness.  She offered  us a shower at her flat when the hot water failed!  However, the problem was quickly solved.
Fantastic location and comfortable
Patricia is helpful. We have been welcomed and supported for any needs. Warmfull communication. Location is perfect for those who prefer to be out of city .

This place is a great value. The room is extremely clean and comfortable. Both the double bed and the single bed are comfortable.

Patricia and Ian are very warm and welcoming hosts. They were quick to respond to any questions and were proactively helpful.

The location is ideal as well. The house is very close to a bus stop; from there, it is an easy ride into the city center.

Overall, this is a phenomenal place to stay, which I would highly recommend.
Very clean place - great walking distance to city centre

Tatianes place is welcoming. The room is very clean and bathroom as well, with all necessary amenities. She was very responsive with questions we had and flexible regarding check in. The place is also walking distance from city center.

Everything was perfect and clean. The flat is near the citycenter and we could use the kitchen.
Thank you Tatiane!

Tatianes place is in such a great location, walking distance from everything we wanted to see and do! Close to Brazen Head and only a couple minutes walk to Teelings Whiskey Distillery and St Patricks Cathedral. The room was cozy and comfortable and we had a great time staying with Tatiane!
Goed onderkomen. Snelle reactie op berichten.
They arranged early check-in for us! They are really flexible and friendly to guests.
It was great having access to the kitchen and being able to cook meals. It was close enough to walk into the city centre of Dublin.

Once you enter the apartment, you directly enter the living room. We thought it was quite noisy in the room. 
When we asked what the best spot is to get a breakfast, we got the answer that we should look it up our self.

Tatiane and her brother were lovely, and wonderful, accommodating hosts once we got in. The only reason for 4 stars is due to a lack of communication after answering when our flight would arrive, and the following difficulty in finding the right door to the apartment complex. We were given no code to buzz, and while I take some brunt of responsibility for not having WiFi, I feel its fair to share complicity with AirBnB hosts who Im sure know thats something to address with a bit better initiative. We were stuck at midnight for half an hour struggling to find the correct Southgate door, and make contact. Again, once we were in, they were fantastic, fun, and respectful. Overall, I certainly recommend staying with these clean, thoughtful people! We had an awesome stay!!
Great location, walking distance to city center. Good ammenities!
Good communication and prompt merting
Very clean and comfortable in a great location
Perfect location in walking distance from most sights: Guiness Storehouse, Arthurs pub, st. Patricks cathedral...
Had a nice weekend there
Fine place to stay if you are out all day
Clean and nice place. Funny detail with the bunny!
I am using airbnb for the last years ... And it is the cleanest flat that i found. Really quiet, central and high quality flat. We slept as babies :)

The place is great if you want to check out Dublin by foot (10-15' walking-distance) and still want some peace and quiet during the night. Tatiane is talkative and very open minded but also very busy, so we did not see her much. The beds are comfy and we were able to use the kitchen to make breakfast in the morning.
Great location. Wonderful host. Would stay again.
Awsome place, lovely host, very clean apartment, would definitely recommend for short or long stays.
A nice one night stay. In a quiet part of town where you can walk to everything. Was difficult to find at first, but the place is great and the facilities are great. Overall a nice stay.

Good location.  Very sad situation in the suite with a large rabbit in a very small and filthy cage - depressing - left alone and trapped in this small cage in the middle of the living space.  Safe yourself a bunch of euros and stay in a hostel - same type of set up!

Tatianes apartment is located in a large courtyard setting off the road. Safe and pleasant. The space was very clean. The beds were comfortable and the shower was good. It was good to have the bathroom  for our own use. The cotton sheets and beds were comfortable also.

Was given the location via Airbnb, looked for the place for an hour after back and forth messaging. Given a direct pin and went to that location and there were no places. Asked many people walking around the area they said they never heard of the apartments. Tried calling the number and didnt work. Host/her brother never came out to help us or made an effort to direct us. Had to find another Airbnb as it was obvious the host was not giving us any more options.

We did not meet Tatiane in person, but her brother gave us access to the appartment. They were both very friendly and very kind about flexible check in and out times. The room and bathroom are nice and clean, and the bunny is super cute. We were allowed to use the kitchen, but there was no milk and cereal and the dishwasher did not work.

We had a pleasant short stay. The private room and bathroom were both very clean and comfortable. Breakfast items were not provided as mentioned in the description, but there is a Lidl just up the road so we managed. We did not properly meet Tatiane which was a little disappointing. The flat is in a good location however and their bunny is adorable!
Tatiane and her flatmate were kind with us, we could leave our luggages at the apartment after check-out. We had an own bathroom, we could use their kitchen. Everything was fine.
Excellent place to stay

Nice and quiet place. Good location, 10min walking to the center. 
Very good conditions. Friendly and helpful host.

City center at a 20m walk, everything was very clean and the hosts are nice.
We felt quite at home. Recommended

Lovely flat in a good location in Dublin. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom facilities were great although showering may be difficult for any tall people.... Although we didnt meet Tatiane till our last day, her brother was very welcoming and flexible for when we checked in. Would recommend for a weekend in Dublin
Good option to stay In Dublin, walking distance from city center and attractions.
Great place, conveniently located and easy to get into city centre. Very good communication and friendly! Thanks for letting us stay!
A comfortable and well-situated apartment that's great for exploring Dublin and surrounding areas. Host was very good with communication and accommodating of our needs.
The place is nice and it was easy to contact the host.
It was an enjoyable stay

Overall the place is as represented, just a little smaller on the first floor than expected.  With location of bathroom, its a little tight to get ready all at the same time. Park views are lovely.  Cab drivers always thought we were in the park, so if you call one make sure you explain location.  We had a good time, and being able to walk to grocery and pubs is very convenient.
The house was clean and comunication good but it was very hard to close the doors and light in bathroom didn't work. Edward wasn't at Dublin during our visit so he can't fix it.
Location was great but felt it was over priced for all the maintenance issues

The house is situated in quiet and pleasant surroundings with lots of public transportation to the city and a grocery store and good pubs nearby. The house is clean and well equipped. Edward responded swiftly to inquiries and left fairly comprehensive instructions in the house. He should change the lock on the front door. It presents difficulties for exhausted travelers on first arrival.
Excellent location and great to have direct access into the Park.  The Angler's Rest was very nice local restaurant.
Ottima posizione e casa molto silenziosa e tranquilla. Lo consiglio in particolare alle famiglie che vogliono visitare Dublino!

We enjoyed our stay.  The place was very clean and is a lovely space.  There is a door from the grounds of the apartment into Phoenix Park which was lovely to use.  Lots of buses pass through Chapelizard into the city centre, and it was really handy to be able to get the Aircoach to Dublin Airport from Heuston, which is very near.  We thought it was very good value.  Thanks Fran

We found the townhouse to be conveniently located just outside of the city center of Dublin. The beds were comfortable, and the kitchen was fully appointed. We were able to make coffee, cook breakfast, and relax in the evenings. Convenience items were left for us such as salt, pepper, oil, tea, coffee, etc.  Those were nice touches. The access to Phoenix Park was a great plus. Communication about access to the townhouse was clear, and we had no issues with that part of it.  We never had any contact with the hosts during our stay, and that was fine.  It was nice, also, to be able to park our rental car there at no additional cost.  We could use the car when we wanted to travel farther distances, but we were also close to public transportation to the city center.  We did have one minor issue, though, with the townhouse.  The hot water heater is extremely small, so we were lucky if two people could take a 5-10 minute shower in the mornings.  At night, only one person could manage to have hot water for a shower. We were not told about this issue until a day or two before we arrived.  There were four of us there (all adults), so one of us wasn't able to take a shower at one time or another.  Other than that, we had no complaints with our stay.  We left well before the check out time as we had to catch a plane to London.  I emailed the hosts to let them know we were gone and that we had taken out all garbage and cleaned up as best as possible (there were no check out instructions other than the time). Later that day, the host emailed me to ask about a stylus on the turntable; they told us it was missing and wanted to know what happened.  Well, we couldn't tell them because we truly didn't know.  What I told them was that on our 3rd night there, we tried to use it, but when we found that it wouldn't work, we turned it off and closed the lid.  We never gave it another thought until I got an Airbnb request for us to pay for a replacement stylus that I was told was 1 year old.  Now, I would fully expect to pay for any damages that we might incur, but we are really at a loss about this.  It has left us feeling awkward and frustrated with no real means of solving it adequately for either us or the hosts.

Kate is fab! She couldnt have been more accommodating and gave us lots of local information. The apartment itself has everything you could need and more, from shower gel to cookies. Location is very central making it easy to get around on foot. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Kate was an amazing and accommodating host with lots of great suggestions for nearby places to eat or shop. Her apt was lovely - clean, functional and very well located. Great bakery around the corner for morning breads, Queen of Tarts for snacks/tea/ breakfast with great scones downstairs and Scout around the left corner for beautiful Irish wool scarves, blankets and clothes (better priced than on Grafton and better made goods too). This was a perfect apt for three of us, though it can hold 1 more comfortably.

Kate was really friendly and quick at getting back to me, as well as flexible in letting us arrive a little early. She also gave us various tips and directions for our stay in Dublin and had boiled the kettle ready for our arrival, which was a nice tough.

The flat was in an ideal location for everything in Dublin. Right next to Temple Bar area, full of bars and places to eat and also easy walking distance to everything else we wanted in Dublin, such as cathedrals, the castle, Grafton Street, train station etc etc. No car or bus needed for all the main attractions. It was also down a quiet side street, so it didn't feel like we were in a party area, when it came to wanting to get some sleep and relax. The area also felt very safe. Would definitely visit again.

Great appartement near Temple bar. Although in the heart of the tourist attractions, the appartement is in a quiet area. We were in Dublin for the St-Patrick's Parade and the appartement was conveniently situated beside the route of the parade. We recommend to anyone who is looking to be near downtown attractions while still wanting some calm away from the crowds.

Kate was a great host and the location was very ideal and close to everything.  Kate was always quick to reply and very helpful with various questions unrelated to the apartment.  I would definitely recommend staying with her!

Kate is an amazing woman, so kind, friendly and helpful. Her house is Absouletely fantastic, very modern, comfortable and extonishingly clean. Kate as all the little bits and bobs stored in the house e.g teas, shampoo etc. this made the house so homely and on our arrival to the house, Kate had the kettle boiling for us, making us feel so welcome, we would really recommend staying with Kate, and we look forward to staying in her house in the future. 
Thanks Kate
Kates place was outstanding. Excellent location, clean, tidy and communication with her was effortless. Hard to find any flaws with this gem of a place.
Perfect location, very good and effective communication and all you need is available in the apartment.
Very central apartment. Very easy access from airport on the number 747 Airlink bus. Great host. Great communication and Kate allowed us to check in early. Would stay again
Stylish comfortable heart of Dublin.
Great place!! Very clean and excellent location! Kate made the process very easy and had great communication. Thanks Kate!

We stayed 2 nights at Kates place in Dublin. This was the last part of our road trip of Ireland. It was perfect to have some extra space and laundry facilities by then. The location was excellent. Right by everything you want to see but still somewhat quiet. There are several cute eateries literally right out the door. 
The place was as described. Kate was very communicative and nice. Id recommend her place for sure.
Wo derail apartment and a lovely host who let us check in early as we had a morning flight. The apartment has everything you need and more and the location is ideal. Highly recommended :-)

Kate is a fabulous host and her place is ideally located right by the hustle and bustle of Dublin but on a quiet residential street. It was great for our plans of exploring Dublin and also taking day trips via bus tous. Nothing greater than a long day out in the Irish countryside than knowing you're going to have a wonderful place to rest after all the day's activities (and perhaps night time fun after an evening stroll in Temple bar). It's such a beautiful place and Kate really made sure our vacation was truly a delightful holiday.

A true 5 star listing! After staying in several disappointing places as we travelled across the UK and Ireland, it was a relief to stay in a place truly worthy of the good reviews. Excellent communication from Kate, great location, easy access with the elevator and extra set of keys, and a beautiful clean condo! Beds were comfortable and the shower and kitchen amenities were great. Thank you for the milk and cookies too! Would definitely stay here again.

Kate is an awesome host.  She met us at the bus stop right outside the apartment.  Very informative about the local area.  And her place is in the BEST location... easy bus access, city center & Temple bar area.  Markets very close.  Overall, a very pleasurable experience.  Highly recommend her place.

Kate's apartment was exactly what you'd want for visiting Dublin. Super central location close to all main attractions, but on a nice pedestrian street without any unwanted noise.  Apartment was spacious and clean - would definitely highly recommend.
Kates place is perfectly located to explore Dublin, and super quiet for the part of the city where its located. Would absolutely stay again.
Kates place was awesome and Kate was great to work with. Place was clean and perfect location. Kate was very assessable and communication was excellent. I highly recommend!
You cant get a better location! Great area for kids and adults. I was traveling with my in-laws and my children and the apartment was perfect for us.  Love the Irish hospitality!
Kates place was perfect!  Location was outstanding, apartment exactly as pictures indicate, super clean, and she even left us cookies and milk!  We love Kate and her apartment and you will too!

Katies flat is in a great location, easy to get to from the airport and to walk around Dublin.  Katie was very helpful with tips about travel and the right bus stop and Luas stop so that we didnt get lost!  The flat has everything you need for a short stay.  thank you for hosting my son and I.
Great location and our host, Kate, was very responsive.  We would stay at Kates place again.

Kate was a great host. She contacted me in advance of our stay to ensure we had all the information we needed to get to flat which was very helpful. The flat is in a fantastic location and is lovely inside. I would highly recommend staying at this flat if you are wanting to travel to Dublin.

We loved our stay on Cow's Lane. Great space, location, and amenities! It was the perfect place to spend our first night in Ireland. Breakfast at The Queen of Tarts was lovely. We hope to return and spend more time here!
Great stay in fab position

My brothers and I stayed at Kates place during our stop in Dublin. Kate gave very good instructions on how to get to her place, and she was very easy to communicate with. Her place is located in the middle of the Temple Bar area, with most major sites in walking distance. I would definitely stay here again!
This is a quiet and lovely flat in the heart of Temple Bar. We would definitely stay here again and Kate is a super hostess.

We had a great time @ Kates place. It was conveniently located to the city centre & Temple Bar. We were a family of four w/ adult children. The space accommodated us nicely. Nice touches with the tea, mil&, & biscuits.
Kate was very friendly to deal with in messages and on the day and the apartment was in a great central location. It was lovely to stay with friends and have the living space too.

Kates Temple Bar apartment is perfect for a girls getaway in Dublin! You can walk almost anywhere in Dublin from her place, and it is in a safe part of town. We felt comfortable walking back from a pub at night. The Temple Bar area can be very loud and busy but overall it was not too loud. It might be too noisy for a family with young kids, especially on the weekend, but it was absolutely perfect for us. It was great to have a kitchen. Kate was very hospitable and gave us tips and suggestions for getting the most out of our Dublin stay. We are definitely staying again if we come back!
As described. Close to airport bus link. Nice place.

GREAT find! this place is right in Temple Bar, walkable to all over the city and main attractions. Kate was so hospitable and met us downstairs, gave us recommendations, and the place had lots of helpful amenities (even multiple iPhone chargers!). Would definitely recommend Kates place again for anyone coming to Dublin. It comfortably fit 6 people. Also, try all the cakes at Queen of Tarts downstairs!
Lovely apartment in a great location! Kate was very good at keeping in touch with us. She also provided some very useful local tips. Very enjoyable stay.

Kate's place is perfectly located for exploring the city. It's clean, comfortable,  and mostly quiet (it was very warm while we were there, so had the windows open and some noise from a nearby bar could be heard into the wee hours). Our party of 4 adults were easily accommodated and everyone commented how much the liked the space. Highly recommend!

We stayed here two nights on a family vacation, four adults and one infant and were very comfortable. Kates place was central to all of our Dublin activities, including a Do Dublin bus stop. Highly recommend staying here.

Great locationîclose to everythingîand a cute apartment. Tucked just a bit off of a main street so the area was lively. There is a great breakfast and a great wine bar right outside the door. Wonderful places to start and end the day.
Kate is super nice. Pleasant stay.
Kate was a great host, apartment was in an amazing location. Close to everything, but in a little quieter area of Temple Bar.

We had such a fun time exploring Dublin from Kates cute and clean apartment.  The location on a pedestrian alley was so welcome after walking the busy streets all day¶and great for a quiet rest while still being part of the bustling city!  We began and ended our days right outside the apartment:  great breakfast place (Queen of Tarts) and cute wine bar/restaurant (Piglet.)  The neighborhood is safe and walkable to most sights in Dublin and the building itself is secure with a double set of auto-locking entry doors. This was a nice feature for myself and two daughters.  Kate is a great host, met us at the apartment and was available during our stay if we had any issues (we didnt.)  Kate stocked the apartment nicely with goodies, coffee/tea and extra toiletries.  Thank you, Kate, for sharing your Temple Bar apartment!

Kate's place is fabulous. It is a lovely space with many amenities and she makes you feel so welcome. It is centrally located and there are great shops and restaurants in walking distance near by. We had an excellent stay.
great apartment and location. Kate is a joy to deal with.

Great choice for a place right in the heart of Temple Bar, by the river and near so much.  The apartment is spacious and amenities are nice for the foreign traveler.  We spent each night lounging in the comfy living room recapping our day.  For sure, visit the Queen of Tarts cafe on Cow (Website hidden by Airbnb) is amazing.  This spot is a A+!

Kate offers a wonderful apartment in Temple Bar, steps away from many of the sites visitors will likely want to visit.  We walked comfortably to Christ Church, St. Patrick's, Trinity College, St. Stephen's Green, Iveach Gardens, Guinness Storehouse, Dublin Castor, the National Museum of Ireland, and pubs in Temple Bar.  What a great location!  Having our bedrooms on the quieter courtyard side of Cow's Lane was also a plus.  Kate met us at the apartment and was available throughout our stay for help we needed.  A great Dublin Airbnb.

Kate was a great host, her communication was super speedy and she even gave us travel directions from the airport. The apartment is a lovely space and the perfect central location for exploring and being able to pop back throughout the day. Lots of guide books and recommendation lists in the flat, packed with ideas! Plus biscuits and extras in the fridge! Will defo be back and would highly recommend, especially for groups of friends.

This airbnb is perfectly situated for any adventure you wish to have in Dublin proper. We recommend Queen of Tarts for pastries or a full breakfast. It really seemed to be a 10 minute walk from anywhere we planned to be...Trinity College, Grafton St, the Famine statue or anywhere else excepting temple bar, which was 5 mins away. Lots of resturants and pubs in the area too. The shower had great hot water and pressure and the beds were firm but comfortable.

Kate was very communicative.  Cow's Lane is prime location in Temple Bar.  Close enough to the action with enough distance from the madness.  Everything is at your fingertips.  The apartment was very comfortable and as a single traveler I felt safe.  I would absolutely stay there again.

Thanks again for providing such a pleasant place to stay. This apartment was a large, very clean place that is located very close to the main bar/entertainment area of Dublin but given its location on a quiet walking area it remains surprisingly quiet. There was no AC but not unexpected in Ireland. Cold water in the fridge and local tips were nice touches. Located near a bakery and breakfast restaurant is very convenient. The WiFi wasnt initially working but after some investigation the next day I saw it was unplugged and was not an issue subsequently. 

Overall a wonderful clean place very conveniently located but still relatively quiet. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
Beautiful appartment and great location. Perfect for a stay in Dublin.

We loved our stay at Kate's apartment! She was a wonderful host, providing easy check-in, local tips, fast and reliable wifi, and good communication. The apartment is stylish, spacious, and clean. The location was great and allowed us to walk to all of our destinations. We would absolutely recommend staying here when in Dublin.
Great Host, great flat, great stay. Thank you!
Fantastic location!

Pauls apartment is in the heart of Temple Bar, next to an abundance of activities, bars, and restaurants. Paul was very quick to respond and was flexible with us leaving for a late check-out. The instructions for check in were very clear and thorough!
Amazing location and very clear detailed check-in instructions.
Great location. We only stayed for a night but it was what we needed and Paul was so quick to respond! Appreciate their promptness!

This place is great for staying in the Temple Bar area for one or two nights. I wouldnt recommend for someone staying in Dublin for longer. If youre looking to explore Dublin and the nightlife with some friends, this place is it. If youre looking to nestle in for an extended trip and make this place your own, I wouldnt recommend it. The photos in the listing are a bit outdated and the apartment wasnt as clean as it appeared. That said, Paul was great at communicating and the rest of the process went smoothly.
Great location in the city center! Next to a pretty loud club/venue but they seemed to get quiet pretty early so not sure if it is actually open late. Excellent nights rest!

Paul was a great host. His flat in Dublin is in a perfect location--very close to Temple Bar and right down the street from a few cozy pubs. The apartment was sparkling clean and the check-in process was very smooth & efficient. Additionally, Paul provided great communication throughout. I would definitely recommend checking out Paul's flat the next time you're in Dublin!
I booked a visiting colleague of mine to stay in Pauls apartment and he absolutely loved it there. The space was lovely, clean and modern and was ideally located for exploring Dublin.
Fantastic location for exploring the city
Location location location. Cant beat it.
A little tired and dated. Perfect location. Shame the place isnt as pictured. Just needs some tlc. But great for location to temple bar.

AMAZING LOCATION!!!  Dont expect anything other than a crashpad.  Paul allowed us to check in early which we appreciated.  The apartment layout was as expected.  It wast very clean and bedroom carpet is in horrible shape.  That being said......if you dont mind the $ and arent planning on spending time in the apartment its as good of a spot as you can find from a location standpoint.
Great little spot in temple bar district. Very comfortable. Not too noisy considering the area.

Great value in a perfect location. Flat is very secure and makes for a great base.

Paul makes for a top host who communicates a lot of tips and gives clear instructions.
Great spot in a great location. Will be back again

Location is great, but we had no hot water for almost the entire 2 day stay, which was totally unacceptable having just arrived into Dublin from a long haul flight from Australia. It took several attempts to manually adjust the heating system to be able to get any hot water flowing. No instructions were provided for this and we had to contact the host to get details about this, which meant we could only have a shower on the last day. The kitchen sink was completely blocked too which meant we couldn't wash up or run much water. Very disappointed as everything this could be a great place given its location.

Pauls place is very central.  It's a very simple and spartan apartment with minimal appointments.  If you are looking for a very central place to stay in understandably noisy Temple Bar, this may be the place for you.
Lovely accommodation very clean great location

Paul was a great host. His response time is great and he is very helpful. The location of the apartment is in a little lane directly in Temple Bar. If there is a construction site behind the building it could be a bit noisy.  The apartment is very big and there is everything you need. Perfect location for Pub and city visiting in Dublin. Thanks Paul!

Im sure this is a great location for people wanting to bar hop and stay out all night. We had to leave by 6:30 am and so had to find a different parking garage then suggested in the listing and walk a distance. 
His directions are very well thought out and precise but because we had to park somewhere else it was still difficult to find. It was very noisy all night, and the bathroom was not clean. Notably some of this is our fault upon booking and choosing a place that fit our activities, because of this Im giving a 3 stars, rather than lower knowing we could have chosen better.
Central location, within short walk to Temple Bar, shopping and sights. Nice and tidy kitchen and living area.  Quiet location. Would recommend!
Amazing!!!
Ideal location for city centre stay.. Paul was great to deal with and good value for money.
Great location!
Great location, apartment was adequate. Communication consisted of 3 long pre planned messages and nothing else

Great location! However, if you are looking for a quiet place to sleep, this is not for you. We knew it was a busy area, so we were prepared for the noise level. They place wasn't spotless, but was in no way off putting. We would definitely stay here again!
Pauls place was exactly what I needed. Central location, great apartment, and simple enough to check-in and check-out. Would stay again!

Paul was a wonderful host! Quick to respond to messages and gave great local advice. This sizable apartment is located in the city center, steps away from some of the most popular bars in the city! If you arent used to city noise, this might not be the place for you. But if you want a true Dublin living experience, book now! Friendly neighbors, great location, clean, responsive host.
The location is perfect. It wasn't my cleanest experience but was a good value for the location for sure!
Great location, everything we needed while staying in Dublin.
Perfect spot to explore Dublin by foot.  Tons of bars nearby.  It was just me and my wife, so we had plenty of space.  Very clean as well.
The host canceled this reservation 17 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
It's in an excellent location right in the middle of Temple Bar district. Perfect for a good place to crash after a night out.
Great location for nightlife and tourist activities. Not as clean as expected but otherwise great spot.
Paul was a great host and the apartment was everything youd want for a stay in Dublin. Close to anyplace youd like to go and very comfortable.
Great location as it's near everything, quiet at spot at night.
Great place to stay. Comfortable, easy and fun. Comfy bed and nice kitchen. Just bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper as its near the popular pubs.

Paul was amazing! Our flight was delayed meaning we werent going to meet the key pickup time (before midnight) and he was so kind to come and meet us and then walk with us all the way to the apartment!  The apartment location is perfect, 24hour store just doors down and a couple minute walk to all pubs and bars!  The apartment was all that we needed, somewhere to sleep and shower! We ate out for all meals so cant comment on anything in the kitchen.  If youre looking to be out and about and need a central base this is perfect! Would return for sure.
Well placed and quiet location to visit Dublin. Just wished that the communication with Paul would have been more fluid.

Stay clear of this place.  The photo is not what it actually is.  If you have no problems with filthy floors, carpet, furniture and extremely questionable, old sheets and towels, this is your Dublin city-center dump.  (I have never written a review like this.)
If you want to be in the middle of a beautiful city with lots going on, this is a nice safe cozy place! Thanks for your hospitality!

We loved staying at Pauls place for our 4 days in Dublin.  We could not have asked for a better location in the heart of Temple Bar.  The apartment and its location felt very safe which to me is hard to find in such a metropolitan area.  Paul was very responsive and offered plenty of local tips.  He even let us check in early which we really appreciated.  Check out was a breeze.  Highly recommend.  Would stay again if the occasion arises.
The location of this apartment is perfect. We were able to walk everywhere!! Happy i was able to find this place while i did!

Great location to explore the city given our one night stay in Dublin. Absolutely centre of the city, which can get noisy but that's expected if you want to be in the midst of all the action. Apartment was also comfortable. Keys pick up arrangement could have been better.
Great location for Dublin city. Would recommend!

Great location on the edge of Dublins Cultural district. Easy walk to sites and dining. Paul provided excellent directions and made checking in/out and ease. Perfect place for a short weekend stop in the city.

Needs some cleaning, the toilet stopped working, very hot inside the room, there was heavy construction behind our room at 6am. These workers also peeked through the windows while I was getting ready (the blinds were broken and would not close). Positives: good location and Paul allowed early check in.
Excellent place & host. We very much enjoyed our stay and were thankful for Pauls suggestions. Key pick up is a bit out of the way, but its worth it for the location.

Fantastic location, easy checkin/checkout. This apartment is in the heart of the Temple Bar district within walking distance to all of the major attractions. Great nightlife options all around as well.
Great stay, thank you!
Apartment is exactly as described.  Right in the heart of Temple Bar you can't beat it for a night out in Dublin!

Paul was very quick to respond to our messages and his apartment is in a great location.  Very easy to access Temple Bar.  The Parking deck is a little further than expected - carrying luggage.  Over all a nice place to stay
Right in the middle of everything literally. Equipped kitchen with washer and dryer. Walking distance to anything you need.
Brilliant location and apartment was perfect. Would stay again

Paul's place is the perfect location if you want to party it up in Dublin! Steps away from temple bar, and just a 5-15 mile walk to most other tourist attractions. We loved the location and it felt safe.
All good

This flat was okay. We had to wear ear plugs and use a sound machine to cancel out the concert going on next door and people were yelling all night outside. The WIFI didnt work all the way and would cut out often on both our phones. Picking up the keys was difficult without a car and with a bunch of bags and wasnt ideal for a one night stay. Probably wouldnt choose this place again because of the above issues. The location was great and we liked being able to walk or Uber to a few places.
Great location

Very well located, the explanations for the recovery of the keys are clear and precise.  The apartment is clean.  There are however two black spots: the obsolescence of the furniture (broken awning, broken toilet brushes too, bed made up, etc ...) Damage, it raises the apartment to invest in furniture worthy of the name.  Benificier of blackout curtains would not be luxury too and it is the second bad point.
Great location! Efficient communication of check in/out instructions. Although we didn't meet Paul, we are pretty sure he is a wonderful host!
Perfect for heading to the Olympia. Will stay there again!
Amazing location for anyone going to events in the olympia.
Fantastic location close to the nightlife of Temple Bar. Big thank you to Paul whos a great host
We would definitely recommend Raes home for a stay in Dublin.
Rae is a great host who gives tips for sightseeing and cares about his guests.

A perfect stay, a real airbnb with all the advantages you can get. You are just at a 30 min walk from the center of Dublin (from St Patrick Cathedral) but if you don't like walking, the bus stop is very close. 
Rae is the perfect host, with a warm welcome, and with a coffee he can tell you where to go, give you information about what to do and where to eat (we listened to him and had a great lunch on the first day). He is here if you need, but not invading at all. His home is very cosy, it was a real pleasure to stay there and meet him. If we come back to Dublin, we'd love to stay here again if it's possible.

Rae's place is a lovely home with a comfortable bed and all the amenities a guest could reasonably ask for. We were given lots of advice on places to eat and landmarks to visit, we were also told how to best get around town.

Great stay at woodside! Muraed, Raes co-host, helped us with everything, from the indications for the arriving to recommendations for places to visit. The neighbourhood is very calm and close to the city center by bus. The included breakfast is a great point too!

We had such a nice stay at Rae .. Muraed was very welcoming and we felt very well .. Rae's home is special where you just have to spend time in Dublin .. It's all clean,  neat, extremely comfortable and you get many tips and Idden for Dublin .. you have a short walk to the bus stop, where many buses (29 min) in the city (but you can also run in about 45 min) Thanks Muraed for everything
10/10 would recommend to anybody who wants to have a great time in Dublin.

Rae is simply "AMAZINGGG". He made us feel welcome and comfortable. He treated us not like guests but like family. He gave us great tips for not only Dublin but other places and also overseas! His place is super chill and comfortable. Definitely coming back!!! 5/5! Thank you Rae! :D
Exceptional hospitality, quiet sleep (double-glazed windows), good company. Easy to get into town and interesting site seeing within walking diatance. Highly recommended.

Hands down the best AirBnB ever. Rae and Rosa are such kind people, sat with us at breakfast to talk about themselves and the city, had tons of suggestions on local places, and were just super welcoming. Their home is super cute and fairly close to the city center by bus. Our trip to Ireland would not have been as great without them :)

Rae was during our stay not at home but his wife Rosa was very helpful and nice to us. Their home is very nice, stylish and full of art. The house is near to bus station and connection to city center is easy therefore.

Rae's place in Crumlin is a bit out of the way but Rae's a good host and the room-rates are reasonable. The room we stayed in was not en-suite but it was clean and home-like and - as was the bathroom.

Klasse Typ und super Tipps.
Wir kommen gerne wieder!

What an amazing place to stay, the house is spotless and really well presented. The furniture, bed and everything about the house is charming and very well thought out. I cant recommend Rae enough. Amazing stay in an amazing location.

Rae is a very congenial host with a charming home & beautiful garden. He gave us great Dublin tips of things to do that we would have never tried otherwise, and all were a success! His home is in a quiet and safe neighborhood and is very pleasant. We were there two nights and could have happily stayed more!

Probably the best quality of AirBnB is the personal aspect. People and their homes, each filled with their own colourful personalities.  Among the many ordinary bedrooms out there, every now and then there is a host who just goes above and beyond. Rae is that host. We had a wonderful stay at his house. He was amazingly helpful, and just an all-round great person. Our stay there was an inspiring and enriching life experience.

Rae is the man! Seriously the best host we could have asked for on our trip for Ireland. He was so kind, thoughtful, and genuinely just an awesome guy. From the beginning, he gave us amazing directions and options how to get to house from the airport and checked in to make sure we were doing okay. He also provided great recommendations on what to do in Dublin since we had left our trip open to explore. One of our favorite places from his recommendations was seeing a small hidden castle he recommended (Castle Drimnagh, we had basically a personal tour for an unbeatable price). His house is full of charm, warm atmosphere, clean, and tidy. He went above and beyond for our stay, helping us out in many small ways. We are so thankful he was our host, making us feel looked after and cared for as we were traveling in a foreign country. We loved it so much we even wanted to come back and stay with him for our last night in Ireland on the way back to the airport and unfortunately for us, he was booked. We will definitely stay with him the next time we visit Ireland and couldn't recommend him highly enough. Thanks for a great experience! :D
Lovely Home, close to Dublin (15 Minutes by Bus).

Rae and Rosa are amzing hosts with an even more amazing house! I can only recommend staying there. Its just a 10-to-15-minute bus ride away from downtown Dublin. The place is quiet, super clean and you immediately see Raes passion for music, flea markets and everything motorized in all the small details around the house. Hes a proper Irishman with his heart in the right place. Well miss the relaxed breakfast conversations an the amazing shower!
Stay at Raes! Its a great airbnb experience! :-)

Rae's cosy home is the perfect resting place - whether to simply unwind and escape from your day-to-day or to find refuge after a long day. The bed was so comfy that we slept in every single day - it was just too tempting not to.

Rae was also extremely helpful in helping us plan out our days, providing us with maps, useful tips and suitable alternatives (e.g. better routes, spots to visit, etc.)

The house is only a 25-minute walk from the centre and there's also a public transit stop at the end of the street. The house is also located very conveniently so that you can swiftly get out to the highway for longer day trips.

The house is decorated with a very enchanting vintage feel, which is a cherry on top.

Thank you, Rae, for a very memorable visit!
- Susanna & Andreas

Rae is great communicator and lays everything out that you need to have a pleasant stay in Dublin.

House is very clean and has great character about it. 

Breakfast is available every morning and he is pleasant to chat with about his house, life , Dublin, etc

Rae is the perfect host. Great value for your stay. He makes you feel very welcome and he sure does "walk the extra mile" for you. We had lots of tips about what to do, how to get there etc. I highly recommend Rae's and I'll gladly stay at his again when I go back to Dublin.

My partner and I had a wonderful stay at Raes place. The house itself is lovely, clean, and an easy walk or bus ride to the city centre. Rae was a great host and gave us an authentic Dublin experience with good recommendations and good company. He even helped us plan our route to Kerry over a cup of coffee. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend if youre in the Dublin area!

It was a first time I was abroad and got very lucky to book a room at Rae's. It's a lovely wonderful place, and Rae is such a welcoming, polite and hospitable man. Thanks to Muraed for her kindness and for helping us out with everything! 
Jane- I would highly recommend Woodside to anyone who goes to see Dublin and also wants to feel this amazing friendliness and cordiality of the people living in this wonderful country) Woodside is located in a quite area close to the centre. Every detail of the house makes you feel at home. Rae, Rosa and Muraed are the best - always positive, helpful and understanding. Our impression of the visit is absolutely incredible!
Would strongly recommend.  Purchase a Leap card for bus travel ahead of time.  Taxi service using the taxi now app was very useful also!  Great home.

We felt really comfortable at the Woodside! The house was clean and just lovley. 
It was located near a bus stop and had good connections to Dublin City Centre. 
Muraed was really kind and helped us to find our way around. 
Id recommend it to anyone whos looking for a wonderful location to stay near Dublin. Absolutely amazing!
Super cosy room and amazing hosts as described in previous comments. Very good place to explore Dublin!
Rae's place is amazing! Very comfortable and you will be looked after. Loved our stay
Cool place, perfect for gear-heads!

Probably one of the best places I've stayed in! The house is lovely and decorated with taste. Muraed has been a nice company and has kindly waited for us at night as our flight had been delayed.
I would definitely come back!
Many thanks for this lovely moment!

Rae is a very sympatic host, with many tips to share about Dublin. His place is lovely, clean and quiet.  It is a bit far from Dublin center (45min walk for small legs), but there is buses near Raes house.

Rae is a very kind person. His sightseeing suggestions helped us so much and he helped us whenever we had a problem with anything. As a host, he always gave us whatever we needed and we had super interesting conversations with him that made our stay in Dublin much easier. 
Also his house is very beautiful and thought through in every detail. 
We would always suggest staying at Raes house and will definitely come back again.

We stayed for 5 days and it could not have been any better. The style of the house is very special and you appreciate every little detail.
The place was as clean as it could be and Rae gave us tons of tips for our trip in Dublin.
We were always offered a good breakfast with coffee or tee and felt very welcome.

All in all, one of the best experiences we've had so far with AirBnB Hosts and can recommend it to everyone.
Fantastic host and beautiful house

You need to visit this place and meet Rae to really understand why he is a superhost.  The house is warm, inviting and has positive vibes only.  Tastefully done interior and what you see in the picture is what you get plus so much more if you don't mind a lesson or two from the history pages with your morning coffee. 
It's an understatement to say that Rae is helpful and would highly recommend this place anyone travelling to this beautiful city.
This was my first time staying at an Airbnb, beautiful hse,Great experience. Rae is a gentleman and Rosa is a real lady. Wonderful hosts, Close to Crumlin hospital. Will return.

Rae is a wonderful host and has a very cozy home with a lot of stories to tell. He served us coffee and gave us lots of recommendations for what to do and where to go. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay with him again.
