We stayed with Rae for a long weekend and everything was fantastic. He was a great host and the accommodation was lovely. We enjoyed having breakfast with Rae and Rosa and they made us feel very welcome in Ireland. We highly recommend staying here.

Staying in Rae's house was a fantastic experience - he was very knowledgeable and had some great recommendations for places we should try out, and was very generous with his time and conversation over breakfast. And his brilliantly decorated home was a joy to stay in - stylish little touches and flourishes round every corner!

Thank you Rae for such a lovely stay. We really enjoyed meeting Rae (the host) as well as staying in his beautiful house, full of interesting decor! Rae himself was really lovely and gave us some great tips of where to go/what to do. We would definitely stay again if we are heading to Dublin!

Best place to stay in Dublin. Its a place you always wanna come back and you get some good advice to see Dublin and the surrounding. 
You can get everywhere easily by using the bus. 
Rae and Rosa are really superhosts!!
Expect a great place to stay and a wonderful host.

Party of four travelling for a weekend away. Michelle was very informative right from the get go, which also continued during our stay. 
Michelle went above and beyond my expectations of any host as I was trying to arrange some balloons for my partner for his birthday for when we where due to get there, she went out her way to let me know who to contact to arrange and was even willing to collect them. When we arrived she had bought him a cake to say happy birthday.... amazing! 
The apartment was spotless, stylish and extremely comfortable. We were allowed an early check in and late check out which made our trip even better due to flight timings. 
We walked in to town which wasnt too far away either and there was shops (tesco) etc nearby. 
I would highly recommend this gorgeous home and Michelles outstanding service. We will most definitely return. Thank you xxx
Great location and Michelle is a great host, great advice on where to go locally.
Michelle's apartment was outstanding! Fantastic place to stay especially after we spent 3 days in a camper. Would stay again if I ever fond myself in Dublin again.

Great apartment in secure-gated location of Dublin.  Walking distance to the attractions and clubs in Dublin 2.  Or if youre feeling lazy, a short 5mins taxi ride. Michelle is a great host, always in communication.

Michelle was so responsible host who gave quick feedbacks even if she was out of the town. She really cared about us through several messages. The house was clean and comfortable but there was some smoking smell while our staying which was only disappoint thing. (It didnt go away for 2 days) Besides that everything was great.
The place was very spacious and clean. Michelle was very responsive and a very good host. Would definitely would recommend!
A cosy flat made welcome by Michelle's neighbour.
Lovely apartment; convenient location and very helpful host.

Michelles apartment was very clean and had all the amenities that she listed. Her next door neighbour met us for a very easy checkin and arranged for a taxi for our trip to the airport for early in the morning. It has 2 bathrooms and a very cozy kitchen, living room. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Michelles apartment was in a great area. Bus 1 takes you right to the city center and there are great restaurants in the area. Michelle was fast to respond to emails and Avril her neighbor was very attentive. It worked perfect for our family of three. Would highly recommended to anyone.

Een goed gesitueerd appartement met centrum op loopafstand (20 minuten lopen), busstops en restaurants/bar in de directe omgeving. Rustig gelegen, netjes en van alle comfort voorzien. Supermarkt om de hoek. Een aanrader!
Perfect location for concerts or just to enjoy a great weekend away.

Michelle was a great host. She was very helpful and offered great travel tips. The apartment itself had all the amenities of home and was very comfortable.
Thank you Michelle
The apartment was sparkling clean and Michelle was very good at responding quickly and efficiently to my many questions about my trip. I would definitely stay here again if I came up to Dublin.
Michelles place was lovely, location was perfect, a lovely 30 minute walk into the city. Place was clean and communication between client was prompt and accurate. You will have a lovely stay here.
Thank you so much Michelle!
Alles super.

Het appartement ligt in een buitenwijk net buiten het centrum.
Met stevig doorwandelen ben je binnen een half uur bij alle bezienswaardigheden.
Het appartement is goed ingericht met 2 slaapkamers en 2 badkamers.
De ene slaapkamer heeft een ruim 2 persoons bed en de andere een wat smaller bed voor 2 personen.
De keuken was goed ingericht. Supermarkt naast het appartement was handig voor ontbijt.
Prima plek voor een stedentrip.

Lovely place to stay
Great location has everything you need around it
Michelle could not have been more helpful would definitely recommend!

Michelle's apartment is extremely comfortable and cosy, just like home away from home. Since Michelle was away her very kind friend Avery met us, gave us all the details and made us feel extremely comfortable. Michelle had stocked up the kitchen too very thoughtfully. The locatiin is great with a bus to the city centre right outside the apartment. Overall it was an amazing stay. Thanks Michelle and Avery.
Michelle was a lovely host! The flat is spotless, beautifully decorated, cosy and in a great location. Would stay here again when Im back in dublin
Michelle is outstanding hospital host. Apartment is very comfortable and clean. Everything is perfect
This was our 2nd time staying at Michelle's apartment and again we were not disappointed! The perfect host, great location and we will definitely book with Michelle again!

This place was amazing! Very clean and had everything you will need for your stay. It is located within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. We would definitely recommend this place for your stay in Dublin.

Excellent location in Temple Bar, the apartment is modern and clean in a newer complex. It's very quiet despite the prime location. Everything was within walking distance. Super easy check in and instructions on getting to the hotel from the Dublin airport, the apartment was even heated when we arrived! Nice touches like outlet adapters and guidebooks. Would definitely stay again.

I had a perfect stay. Everything was what I expected and the location is perfect for anyone. Its near the hip part of town (temple bar) and a 15 minute walk from just about anything, including all forms of public transportation! 

Highly recommended to anyone coming to Dublin for a day or a month!
Amazing apartment, had all the cooking supplies that I needed to make my own meals. Very clean and very comfortable!

A really great place to stay.  A stylish apartment with a nice little balcony, in a secure block with lift access.  The location was perfect.  Just minutes from Temple Bar, but those few minutes meant it was quiet when you needed it. Lots of great tips from the hosts.  We would highly recommend.
Best Airbnb I've ever stayed at. Everything was perfect. We had everything we needed and then some!

Superb location 
We stayed four nights, couldnt get a better location, around the corner from Temple Bar, with all its amenities, but an incredibly quiet apartment. It was great to receive Michael recommendations for location restaurants, day tours etc. Dublin is a very walkable city and we could easily walk to all the main attractions from the apartment Comfortable bed and well equipped enough if you choose to dine in, stove etc. We did this a couple of nights and bought food from Dollard, upmarket deli, there is also a Tesco supermarket on Fleet Street, and coffee shops and bakeries at your door step.

Micheal and his wife were perfect. They facilitated our arrival and provided us with valuable tips for staying in Dublin in the best conditions: places to see, restaurants, pubs ... The apartment is ideally located in the center of Dublin. We were not bothered by the noise despite the location near Temple Bar Street.
The bedroom is large, the living room is pleasant, the kitchen is sufficiently equipped and the bathroom has a bathtub. There is also a balcony.
The place is perfect to spend a few days in the capital of the Republic of Ireland!

This is such a perfect locationîthe best jumping off point for events & points of interest in all directions of Dublin. Great eateries mere steps away, a book store & artisans creative shops. And a theater. Micheal was an excellent host, facilitated a timely check-in & was easily available by message to answer any question. Recommend highly!
Good communication. Clean apt. Great hospitality
Great central location for whatever you want to do in Dublin. The apartment is nice and serves as great springboard for your daily excursions around town
Great location, within walking distance to anything you need.
The perfect place to stay and tour Dublin, if you like a beer and a whiskey you are feet away from Temple Bar.
Great location and great hospitality and tips from Michael!
Fantastic place! Everything was within walking distance! We absolutely loved everything and would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

Michael was a great host. He is very responsive. He accomodated our request to update our reservation when our daughterfell sick during the trip. Michael and his wife also brought a baby cot for our daughter. Great location. Its a great apartment for a family and is full of amenities. I highly recommend staying at Michaels place!
Nette Wohnung mit super Ausstattung - tolle Lage!
This apartment is in a perfect location. The airport bus stop is just around the corner. The building is secure and safe. The apartment had everything we needed for our stay.

Michael and Maylenes place was bigger than expected. It was spotless and the location was amazing! It was a 2 min walk to Christ Church, 4 min to Dublin Castle and just a block from the action of Temple Bar, Jameson and Grafton St were also in walking distance.  Michael was very quick to respond with questions and suggestions. Maylene met us at the apt. gave us a tour and proceeded to recommend great food options, shopping and showed us a map of Dublin which had hot spots marked out. A cafe located just downstairs was convenient for a quick bite or coffee. No shortage of food options nearby. It was quiet and we did not hear the bustle of Temple bar from our room at night. You can hear the church bells ring all day, I didnt notice them after awhile and they were not too loud to sleep.
This is the place to stay.  It is extremely clean and in the heart of everything you would want.  They also gave us numerous recommendations on places to eat, pubs etc.

Micheal's place has everything you will need or want in Temple Bar, Dublin.  We walked most places and felt very safe. When we couldn't walk, we took a taxi or bus with no problems. The flat is secure, clean and modern.  We didn't use the kitchen as we chose to experience the flavor of Dublin's eating establishments.  The flat is in a wonderful area close to shops, restaurants, pubs and the main hub of activities without the noise and traffic you would expect.  The wifi is good as well. I had forgotten to bring an electric currant converter for charging my electronic devices, but with some creativity and Micheal's help, that was a non issue.  The shower/tub was a little tricky for me because I have mobility issues but my husband was fine with the height of the tub. We feel it was a great stay with a comparable price.

This apartment is the perfect location for a visit to Dublin! We were able to walk to everything we wanted to visit. Micheal was the perfect host! We were having an issue with the washing machine on our last night, and he happily dropped by to fix it. I highly recommend renting from him!
Recommended and quite place to in Temple Bar.
Great location, very comfortable
A friendly, quiet and comfortable apartment in the heart of temple bar! We had a great time!
Great place, great location! Really easy to communicate with Micheal too. He gave us lots of info about the area and about Ireland in general...
Great location, easy to find. Perfect for a few nights in the city centre

Nice clean apartment with terrace in perfect location at edge of Temple Bar and next to Christchurch cathedral. Two blocks from HOHO bus stops and Dublinia/Wood Quai Viking settlement site. 
Very quiet except for seagull calls, church bells, and occasional distant happy revelers. Lots of restaurants, shops and pubs in easy walking distance. Taxis can come right to door and there is a lift, which is helpful for those with mobility issues. Has everything you need for an enjoyable and comfortable stay in Dublin.
Great location and great place.
Wonderful apartment in an amazing location! We only had three days in Dublin and staying here allowed us to see everything without a car.
Quaint, quiet, lovely apartment that is literally a hop skip and a jumpù from all a traveler could want to see, eat, drink, dance, shop, etc.
Everything you need, cleen, right at Temple Bar
What a great location for getting around Dublin .  The apartment was very clean and had everything we needed for our 3 night stay.

We absolutely loved Dublin, and this flat.  We used uber to get from the airport to the flat and it was cheap and quick but expect at least an hour to get through immigration. It took about 10 minutes in the IK, but well over 1 hour here.  Being in Dublin like being in a fairytale, the sights, the people, the food, we absolutely loved it all.  The flat was a good size, airy, had a balcony and super comfy bed.  It also had A Bluetooth speaker and washer and dryer.  We felt very safe and it was close to everything.  We spent an entire day on the Cliffs of Moher, absolutely riveting.   Internet was good and so was TV.  Wish we had more time. Dont change at the airport, there is a great exchange place for money right next to the flat.  All kinds of food, attractions, cabs buses and train nearby and inexpensive, plus its very good.  Its also a great place to get some ink we had a fabulous tattoo done at Reinkarnated tattoo, a dolphin with Celtic knotting. Definitely the place to get it done. The washer and dryer combo worked really wells for us.  Top notch place, I highly recommend it, and this was the only host that we actually met.  He was very hospitable.
Absolutely incredible location with even better hospitality! We strongly recommend this apartment to anyone visiting Dublin!
Perfect location for visiting Dublin, and Micheal is a very welcoming host!

The Temple Bar area catesr more to younger adults. It is a loud, pub infested, warren of streets  with particular establishments hard to find...crowed and extremely noisy at night. Senior citizens should look in other sections of the City for more sedate quarters. The unit itself was pretty much as advertised,  but priced a bit high I thought considering its difficult location and access. If you order a taxi, tell them to meet you around the corner in front of the Handel Hotel. Nobody seems to know where Scarlet Row is and there is no place to park in front of the building's entrance.

I do not say this lightly - this is one of the best AirBNBs I have ever stayed in. Check in meeting Maylene was easy and quick. 
The location was a fantastic spot in the city, and a great jumping off point for our trip.

It was CLEAN - this a huge thing for me when staying in Airbnbs. The apartment was simply fantastic, and had a number of nice touches including a Chrome cast so we could watch Netflix late at night, and a hair dryer so I didnt have to travel with one.

Maylene and Micheal were quick with their responses and easy to deal with. 

Highly suggest you stay here if youre taking a trip to Dublin!
Very cool, modern and clean in a wonderful location! Hosts are responsive and helpful!

Micheals place is very centrally located, and as advertised is clean, neat, light filled, and comfortable. We especially liked its proximity to The Queen of Tarts and Darkey Kelleys. Highly recommended.
Very clean, roomy apartment. Comfy bed, windows that open for fresh air I loved. Quiet as well especially being in walking distance to everything..Temple Bar, most major sites.

A true gem. The accommodation opens onto a courtyard, so its much quieter than other areas in Temple Bar... its incredibly central, so still worth bringing a pair of earplugs! You are steps away from pubs, shopping, some of the best attractions in the city. The hosts are thoughtful, communicative, and have put a lot of effort into creating a great experience for guests. We would definitely stay here again!
Apartamento muy bien situado, en pleno centro, en zona tranquila. El apartamento esta muy bien equipado, limpio y con muchos detalles.

The apartment was clean and comfortable; large bathroom with plenty of products and a complete kitchen with everything you will need for your stay. The bed was very comfortable.  Micheal's wife met us at the apartment and and gave us the run down on the apartment. Micheal was quick to respond to any questions that I did have. The location is perfect for your visit to Dublin. All of the sights are within walking distance from the apartment.

This has definitely been one of the best Airbnbs Ive ever stayed in.

The apartment was spacious and had all amenities you could imagine. You can tell that a lot of effort was put into ensuring that the guest has a very comfortable experience.
More importantly, the location is perfect. Youre only a few mins walks from all the main attractions in the city.

Micheal was the one who received me. He was kind enough to pick me up a few blocks away as I was lost and unable to find the apartment. He gave me a lot of helpful tips on what to do during my time.

This place had it all! Great location, great space, impeccably clean. The bed was high quality and we slept well each night. You would occasionally hear the drunken college yells on the weekend (expected in the temple bar area), but overall a very quiet place to stay. We walked everywhere. We had purchased the hop on-hop off tour and only used it one day due to rain. It was quicker to walk everywhere from our central location. Our hosts were very communicative and gave us great tips for places in the city. We truly wanted for nothing in the space. Everything we would need was already accounted for and when we come back in a couple years, we will be contacting this host again.
Great host. Perfect location. Second visit was just as good as our first.

The location is amazing! Easy walking distance to everything you'd want to see in the city. I was pleasantly surprised that it was very quiet given how close the airbnb is to so many local pubs/restaurants. Two great breakfast places literally right downstairs. I'd highly recommend.

Cannot say enough great things about the location.  It was perfect all that we wanted to do.  Temple Bar can be very congested but this location allowed for quiet time too.  We walked to St Stephens Green, shopped Grafton Street, toured Kilmainham Gaol, met our tour bus from Grisham Hotel, caught a train to Belfast from Connolly Station....all walking from this apartment.  Had a great time and we were very happy that we choose this apartment.  This was the 1st time using Airbnb and we were a bit nervous...nothing to fear with this one!  Thank you!
The host canceled this reservation 20 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The location was great: close to a train station, a bus stop for the airport, a well served village, and the sea.  A conversion gave the property a bright and airy feel.  The bedroom was at a mezzanine level; it was adequate but not big.  Niamh quickly responded online to all my questions.  Thanks Niamh!

Niamh was an excellent host-clear instructions and quick responses.  The apartment was lovely and close to the Main Street of Sandy cove which is a very sweet town.  We did not rent a car but good bus service nearby took us to local venues.

The place is very comfortable for two people, possibly three at most.  We had a wonderful time!  
Thanks Niamh!

Niamh's lovely cottage made a great base for a weekend visit to catch up with family in Dublin. We were within easy walking distance of shops and bistros in Glasthule, we were close to the DART station for a trip into central Dublin, and we had the views of Dublin bay around Sandy I've just round the corner. The cottage and facilities were all we needed for a comfy stay and we really enjoyed it.
Niamhs cottage is gorgeous. Perfect stay!
Very nice house in a lovely town. Location was perfect for being in Dun Laoghaire, with easy access to Dublin centre. Everything was very easy with checking in. Would definitely recommend.

A terrific, stylish cottage perfect for a couple getting away. Niamh was a terrific, responsive host, and the place was exactly as described. Wonderfully close to both the DART and the sea, walking distance to both Glasthule and Dun Laoghaire villages. Highly recommend.
Simply my favorite place to stay at! The perfect cozy retreat, love it!
Cosy family home that is incredibly close to Dalkey village and all public transport. Our family loved staying in this home for our extended Irish holiday and Suzanne was an awesome host!

The house's location is fantastic. This is the ideal place for a family as you have all the amenities at your doorstep coupled with a homey house that's inviting you in and providing a cosy space to unwind after a busy day out.

Ciara's place was just perfect.The location of the apartment is great to visit the city on foot. We had a great communication with Ciara, she answered very quickly and she was very flexible with the check-in/out times. 
Thanks Ciara!!!

This historic home is in a great central and safe location. The space itself was charming and our family of four were cozy and comfortable there for several nights. Ciara has good local recommendations, and there were other gems close by as well like yogakitchen above the pups coffee shop and a wonderful pub called the brazen head. The home is well over 100 years old and has some wear and tear. The stairs are very spiral and very narrow. Necessary to be cautious on for sure and if my kids were smaller than 6 & 10 I would have been quite nervous whenever they went up and down. We enjoyed Dublin and Ciaras home.

Ciara's home is amazing... Full of character. I visited Dublin with my mom and sister. Both of their first time traveling, and had prepared them to change their mindset/expectations, because accomodations are just different abroad. However, we were all pleasantly surprised by the house!!

We arrived late (11p) on Saturday night to the airport. Ciara had great instructions on taking the bus to her place which was awesome. I am an avid traveler but am always leery of taking a bus upon first arrival. However, she had great instructions. We arrived and entered the home with no problems. We were exhausted from 18 hrs of traveling on a red-eye, so went to bed pretty quickly. I gave my mom and sister each a double bed and curled up on the couch. The heat and water is on a timer and works for 1 hr in AM and PM--but we didn't realize this when we went to bed so the first night was chilly and we had cold showers the next morning.

Ciara's place was centrally located between Christ Church Cathedral and St. Patrick's. We were able to park right in front of the place with the parking pass provided. Once we arrived in Dublin, we walked everywhere as the place is walking distance to all the major tourist attractions. Ciara arranged for us to check in early since we had a very early flight arrival. The place was comfortable and we enjoyed our stay.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Our stay at Ciaras place was wonderful!  We would highly recommend it for anyone.
Perfect location! Street parking worked out well for our rental car!
My mother and I had a fantastic time at Ciaras home while staying Dublin, the house is very charming and the location is perfect - easy walking anywhere in central Dublin. Definitely recommend!
Location was absolutely Awesome!!

We loved Ciaras charming home. It was a lovely , old townhouse that she has decorated and set up beautifully with all the amenities you need.It is on a quiet street in an excellent location with street (Website hidden by Airbnb) was perfect for exploring Dublin. Ciara was helpful and left a useful booklet of suggestions and information. We would be happy to return and recommend it to others.

Apart from the fact that the property is in an ideal location and Ciara is a fabulous host, this place was definitely a perfect find for us. For our family of four (2 adult children) her house was just perfect. Thanks Ciara for helping us make the trip to Dublin to visit our family so wonderful.

The house is in a great location, an easy walk everywhere for sightseeing.  Its nice and bright and the sitting room is nice and cosy to come back to after a busy day. The small patio garden is cuteCiara is super friendly and helpful. She responded very quickly to any questions we had and made sure everything was OK. She was a great host.
Ciara is a great host. Listen to her recommendations, they are great. The townhouse is in a perfect location, very close to most attractions but still in a quiet location.
Ciara is a great host, responsive to any questions that you may have.  The place is clean and well kept.  The home is ideally located to many places that are in walking distance.

Ciaras home was perfect for us. Comfortable, clean and welcoming. In a lovely little street, right between Christ Church Cathedral and Saint-Patricks. Short walk to Dublin Castle, City Hall, Grafton Street and St-Stephens Green. A lovely home in a marvelous city. Would go back in a heartbeat.
Great location! Stylish apartment!
Fabulous location. Great tips about local amenities.

Just left Ciaras charming little townhouse and cant believe we got to stay here in this amazing place.  If you want to live like a local, shop, cook, drink in the cool and historic atmosphere of Dublin this is the place for you.  Ciaras place is eclectic and showcases her love of travel.  We felt perfectly at home there in every way.  Our goal was to experience the city as locals.  We  got the true Dublin experience staying here. Ciara is lovely as a host and we would recommend her to anyone.
My parents and I had a lovely stay at Ciara's house. It was within easy walking distance of lots of the places we wanted to visit and Ciara's suggestions of restaurants were great too.
Ciaras place is great! We had a nice time exploring the city and loved the quiet nights back home. Good communication and 100% would recommend!

This Airbnb is the best of both worlds. Close enough to all the good sites, cafes, and bars that you can walk anywhere in 10 or 15 minutes, but located on a quiet cul de sac where you can relax and sleep without disturbance. Thanks Ciara!
Ciaras is a great host and her place is perfect! Great location, quiet, comfortable. Everything you need. Ciara was wonderful and super helpful!

Ciara's place is in a great central location, easy to get around.  A couple things in the house could use some updating (loose toilet seat was the main concern).  Overall I'd recommend staying here for a couple night stay in Dublin!
Great space for a couple or two traveling together. A great springboard for days of activities. Tucked away to avoid the hustle and bustle. Will try and stay again if back in Dublin. Cheers!
This was one of my favorite Airbnbs ever. Super walkable to everything, stylish space, and Ciara was the best hostess ever!! Whenever I go back to Dublin, Ill try to stay at Ciaras!!

This is such a lovely townhouse in an excellent location. Highly recommend! The place is spacious, comfortable and feels lived-in (in a good way.) Ciara is a great host; quick to reply to any questions.
really great place!

We had a wonderful time at Ciara's home. We were lucky and met Ciara when we arrived. She is very friendly and helpful. She gave us some great tips to get started in Dublin. The location is unbeatable... Very close to Christ Church, Temple Bar, St. Patrick's Church, etc. Many pubs, restaurants and grocers are nearby. The house is nice and clean, check-In was very easy. All in all it's all we could have hoped for. Thanks again!
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This is a diamond in the rough! Location is perfect, Ciara even left helpful tips and recommendations. The home is beautiful, small and historic as well as exceptionally clean. Every message I sent was swiftly replied to. I am in love with how beautiful the home was. It was comfortable and nice to have a "home" to come back to after a long day of discovering Dublin
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Jackie and Karen are great host! Nice and quiet place, a bit fare away but the bus station is really nere.
This is a nice place and location is pretty good and quiet. Nothing modern or fancy but will do just fine for a short stay in Dublin. The beds however could be improved.

Lovely accommodation, hosts provided everything we could ask for and more! Great location with lots of nearby restaurants and bars, also right next to a bus route for easy access to city centre. Would 100% stay again; many thanks to Jackie & Karen!
A warm and comfortable stay which met all outlets needs. We will be back thank you very much.
Lovely stay.  Very convenient to Dublin   We would stay there again
Great apartment in a great location. Jackie & Karen are great hosts and we especially appreciated the thoughtful supplies in the kitchen. Also a lovely pub next door, perfect for a drink or food.

Jackie and Karen,
Were great with communication and thoughtful about leaving some staples that were well appreciated for our last few nights in Ireland. Thanks so much!
Great value.  Great location.

The flat is really conveniently located about a 10-minute ride to Dublin city centre, with the no. 29/31/31a bus stops just a minute's walk away. We had some trouble finding the place at first but Jackie couldn't have been more helpful or flexible with our check in and check out, which we appreciated greatly. 
We were lucky with a sunny day during our visit and went to nearby fishing village Howth on Jackie's recommendation; the pub she advised to visit there (mentioned in the guest book) was excellent, with delicious food, friendly service and reasonable prices. Dublin was an incredibly friendly place in general, we loved how people were always willing to help us confused tourists! 
We used the green DoDublin 3-day pass which covered airport transfers (747/757 bus), city buses and gives small discounts at some of the attractions on the route. The Guinness Storehouse was well worth the price of admission if only to taste the freshest version of their brew you can possibly imagine - fantastic! 
All in all we had a nice time and agree that Jackie deserves the title of Superhost. :)

Booked the apartment for my parents. Jackie and Karen were excellent to deal with, quick responses and very helpful in arranging check in. My parents were very happy with the apartment,  location was perfect.
Clean and cozy apartment.  Close to Clontarf Strand and the city is easily accessible.  Fantastic hosts. Undercover parking provided but no allocated space so limited number of spaces to choose from.

Great location, superb hostesss.  Greeting and added touches of juice, coffee and bread added to the stay,  Apartment was in a great location and within walking distance to restaurants and pubs.  Very close to DART station for access to city center and Howth village.
Couldnt ask for better in hospitality and comfort.
Great place to stay
Nice place in a quiet area.  Hosts were quick to respond and very helpful!
Great location close to the port and only 15 min drive to city center. Great local tips and restaurants will definitely stay again if driving to Ireland

Jackie & Karen made our stay so comfortable. We were able to check in a little earlier which was great (as travelling with baby). The location is great, close to shops, cafes, restaurants and the bus stop into town just at the bottom of the street! Very limited street noise which was great. The secure parking was convenient and they also left some breakfast basics in the kitchen which was very thoughtful. Provision of a travel cot also made life easier. A slightly stale/smokey smell in the common corridor/entrance to apartment but otherwise fine. Would definitely recommend this place to others.
Great location for a visit to Dublin. Make sure to visit "The Hollybrook" as well. Perfect pub experience on the first night in Ireland.

Book this place now before its taken.  We have booked many Airbnb places in the past. This place is by far one of best.  Jackie had some snacks and drinks for us upon our arrival.  She is a great host.  Everything is as shown in the pictures.  Great showers with good water pressure.  Two full bathrooms which is rare to find.  Beds were comfortable.  Jackie has created a book with important ph numbers, restaurants grocery store suggestions. Lots of important info which came in handy during our stay.  The location is very nice. Easy access to bus or taxi. Nearby grocery store. Kitchen fully stocked with needed utensils. 
Quiet safe neighborhood. 
Jackie was extremely helpful and kind. 
We highly recommend this place.

This flat was a charming place. Especially nice were the extra touches like leaving ham and cheese and bread for us. That came in handy with two teenage boys. Check in was very easy with the host living so close. The queen bed was very comfortable. The only issue was with the twin beds being very flimsy with the slats being held in place by plastic pieces. The wood slipped out twice by only sitting down on the bed. It was easy to put back together but I would have a hard time trusting an adult to sleep on one of them. Overall it was a very nice experience.

This is a well appointed and well situated apartment. It is close enough to the city centre but far enough away to be peaceful but with great services and restaurants nearby. An easy walk to the sea is a plus! Karen and Jackie responded promptly to requests and they were very gracious hostesses. The nice touches of milk, bread and a few basic supplies was much appreciated. We highly recommend this apartment!

Great location, filtered for only superhost so was expecting a nice place but was still pleasantly surprised at how nice it was in person.  Bus stop very close made Dublin stay a dream with no parking worries.  Jackie met us out front and showed us everything we needed and was quick to respond to messages.  Great stay!

We loved our stay with Jackie and Karen. Wonderful hosts! The place was clean, tidy, and very spacious. The hosts offered us advice on how to get around and what to see! A great introduction to Ireland!

Een comfortabel appartement zonder franjes, maar met een afgesloten parkeerplaats voor de auto en vlakbij een bushalte die je tot in het centrum brengt. Voor de bus koop je best een "leap card". Een rustige buurt in vergelijking met het levendige, drukke stadscentrum. We moesten even zoeken naar het juiste adres, maar met dank aan de Ierse vriendelijkheid en gastvrijheid vonden we dit zeer snel.
This place was a great home base as we explored the area. We appreciated the snacks that were provided as well as the variety of travel information.
Comfortable clean and safe accomodation well located. We were met by Karen who was very helpful. Appreciated the local tips folder left for guests and the fresh food supplies.
The host canceled this reservation 140 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 150 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 87 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Beautiful flat in Clontarf. The bus stop for going to Dublin is very close. The center of Dublin is 15 minutes away.
The flat is clean and has all the commodities that you definitely need in a house. There are two bedrooms with two separate toilets and this is good for privacy.
I definitely recommend this flat.
This is a great place to stay - a short walk to a the water and a quick bus trip into Dublin.  Jackie & Karen were wonderful hosts and had everything ready for us.  Highly recommend for a family!

The apartment is in a great location for exploring Dublin.  The bus stop is a minute away, the supermarket a two minute drive or 10 min walk.  The Yacht restaurant highly recommended! Howth is a great little fishing village, easy to drive to. Free parking on street or in private car park.  The apartment is well equipped and comfortable?
Spacious, secure and comfortable residence
Great location and place! Karen and Jackie added many personal touches to the place and provided great hospitality. The place was very spacious and a great place to stay at.
Jackie and Karen are great hosts! They added special touches that we did not experience at our other stays.

Jackie and Karen's place was a great find. We were within walking distance to some superb places to eat (the Yacht and Food Room) and were very close to public transportation. They left a binder and tons of brochures with helpful information for getting around, where to go, and what to do. They were really flexible when our plans changed (we tried to pack too much into one day) and we weren't sure when we would be there. They even checked in on us to make sure we had everything we needed before we left.
Great place, spacious, super clean and right next to the bus that will take you directly into the city center. I would definitely recommend this place to others.

Karen was so nice meeting us outside the property, showing us how the keypads work to get into the building. Once inside she patiently answered our questions, gave suggestions on where the closest restaurants were and how to get to the bus stop (right at the corner) and supermarket (up the road).
The apartment was very clean and well appointed with plenty of space. We felt very safe because there are two code-key doors and the outside is well-lit at night. The apartment is far enough away from the bustle of the city that there is no outside noise but so close enough by bus that it makes the perfect spot to stay if youre vacationing in Dublin. If we return to Dublin we will definitely see if this property is available!
Great location. Close to airport. Very roomy apartment.
The apartment was ideal and the location was as described. Beside bus routes and in a lovely area. The hosts Jackie and Karen were very friendly.
Comfortable accommodation in a quiet area. Supermarket and pub within walking distance. Hosts were excellent at responding to queries. Will stay again
Spotless quiet secure and central premises. Loved it

The accommodation was nice and very well equipped, close to shops, the city center and Temple Bar .. Ideal location!
We had a pleasant stay.

Couldnt be better situated - in the middle of everything with shops, restaurants and coffee within a couple of minutes walk. Apartment was spacious and quiet with a lovely view over the river and everything you could need. Don and Daniela are lovely and were super helpful over a little hiccup at check-in. Id definitely stay there again.

Check-In:

The check in was easy because the woman of the laundry shows everything in the house how it all works. If we have question we could go to her for further information, good service.

Staying: 
The staying is wonderful, all the pictures on the websites looks much darker than it is in real life. The master bedroom is much modern than you can see on the picture. The wooden table is gone ;). The bathroom is modern. Everything was clean so thats a good thing.

The Location:
If you want to travel to Dublin! This is the best location, you can walk to everywhere in the city centre and temple bar. The busses and trams are in front of the door. There is a supermarket a block away. 

The Communication:
Id love to see how passionated Don is with renting his place with customers. Hes sending a long message of information about the house and so on. His react on the same day when you send him a message.

Overall:
This is the place to be when you are in Dublin.

Don was an amazing host. His apartment could not have been in a better location. If you are all about experiencing the City Centre and being able to walk steps to the pubs in Temple bar, then this is the place for you. We were able to walk everywhere around Dublin and visit Trinity College, Stephens Green, St Patricks  Cathedral , and so on. It is a short three blocks to the Tara Street train station so we hopped on DART and visited a nearby town. We also took advantage of having a full kitchen and were able to cook breakfast every morning. The apartment comes with everything that you need and there are two grocery stores/food marts within 100 feet from the place. It was nice being able to walk out your door and immediately start enjoying the city. Don responded to all of my inquiries very quickly and he was very accommodating. Daniella (who checked us in) was very friendly and informative. She works at the laundromat which is in front of this building so she was accessible if we needed her. I would definitely book this place again. Thanks for everything!!
The apartment is spacious nd has everything you need to enjoy a weekend away. It is located perfectly, just a few minutes would into the centre of temple bar. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Great house, very well organised and great location for a touristic visit. Many amenities around and with view one the (Website hidden by Airbnb) of the very few times that photos are not accurate. The flat is more spacious than the pictures and Don a very organised and thoughtful host. I definitely recomend it.

Awesome location.   The apartment was very clean and included everything we could have asked for.  Great view of the Liffey and although close to Temple Bar we did not hear any noise at night.   Check-in and departure were easy - and Don provided all necessary info in advance. Highly recommended!
Toplocatie! Prettige appartement
This place is in walking distance to so many great attractions.  Beautiful apartment and a very helpful host!

Dons apartment is the ideal place to stay in Dublin! Its located right in the Temple Bar area, giving great convenience to all the fun Dublin sites. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to do while in Dublin! It was clean, stylish, and very cozy. We very much enjoyed our stay at Dons newly renovated space and felt very welcome in his home. We will definitely return!
Amazing location with lovely views. Apartment was clean and tidy. Great amenities. Fab shower and lovely kitchen. 100% returning in the future
Nice, clean apartment with everything we needed. Convenient to everything we wanted to see in Dublin. It was a lovely stay!

The flat was clean and had the basic amenities necessary. It is right above the main busy road so you will get all the noise, etc. Also the cabinet in the hall inside flat makes very loud noises every time water is ran or toilet flushed.  The flat is fine if you dont mind the awkward layout and industrial feel, but not comfortable feeling enough for us. If you just need a basecamp for going out and partying, its fine. If you want any comfort and relaxation, I cant recommend.

The apartment location is absolutely perfect, communication with Don is fast and very informative, check-in is easy to arrange and hasslefree.
The place is huge with nice high-quality accessories like a Dyson Pure Cool and an Amazon Alexa. 
We've stayed here the second time already, and we will definitely return.
If you want a place in the middle of it all. You should go here. Nice appartment with a working elevator, nice styled and clean place. Don is extremely kind. We would deff recommend it!
Spacious, clean, everything you need! Great location, couldnt get better!
Great clean place in perfect location.  Would stay again.  Don was very helpful.

This is a centrally located apartment, near many restaurants, pubs, and public transit. It is ideal for those who want to explore the city without a car. Don keeps his place very tidy and clean. Great view of the river.

A nice apartment perfectly located in the Temple Bar area of Dublin making it most convenient to the main tourist attractions and pickup points for various tours. Although a little noisy at times, that was not a distraction and the four adults in our party were extremely pleased with the apartment and particularly the location.

This is a great location in the heart of Dublin.  We stayed three days and we were in walking distinct to many of the tourist attractions.  The place was spacious, tidy, clean and in a handy location so you could stop by an take a break if needed.  Highly recommend this apartment.  Brenda, Alberta, Canada
Nice apartment , close to temple bar area. Very convenient. Grocery store , restaurants  very near by. Would  recommend to anyone travelling to Dublin .

Great location in the heart of Temple Bar District!  Private enough that it wasnt a distraction late at night but close enough to everything happening.  The place is comfortable and we had no issues at all with our stay.

Whoever wants to stay in the best part of Dublin with pubs, restaurants, shops, etc. around the corner: Choose this apartment! Located directly in Temple Bar, everything you need in this city is within walking distance.
The apartment is spacious, clean and provides it all. In the smaller bedroom it is a bit noisy though, but you will not spend your time in Dublin sleeping anyway, will you?
Don is a great host, he provides detailled information and communication with him is superfast and superfriendly. 
Highly recommended.
This apartment was great.  Close to everything
Fantastic location, and amazing aspect looking over the Liffey River. Great modern apartment with all you need. Don provided loads of local information too, and check in easy.

Don has a wonderful place in Dublin in Temple Bar. You can watch the tide go in and out from your living room window because the River Liffey is there behind the window, the pubs are near, the shops are near, the busis are near and even the taxi stand is in the other side of the Aston Quai. Although the apartment is near to everything the place is cosy and calm.
Spacious condominium with a responsive host in a great location at a good price.
Great location along the water and close to Temple Bar

Amazing amazing location! You are right in the middle of everything in Dublin. Only thing is the boiler for the water is insanely loud, and the shower slightly uncomfortable since theres no door. Other than that, it was a great location to be in!
The perfect living in the heart of lovely Dublin.

We really loved Don apartment! The location was really perfect to reach every place with a few minutes walk! Nice place to stay, the only thing is about the beds size, too small for 4 people, but really top anyway! We hope to come back soon!
As soon as you enter the apartment, you immediately feel at home : everything is there to make your stay a real pleasure : thank you Don!

Fantastic location and value for group travelers. Youre within walking distance to everything on major tourist lists and great bars and restaurants. Check-in was super easy thanks to the help of Don and Daniela, and the place was sparkling clean. Id recommend this to family and friends as its a huge value compared to many of the hotels in the area and the experience with the host.
Great place to stay. It was clean, comfortable and quiet.

We were just fine at Monika's home. Super friendly and helpful person. The room has everything you need to feel comfortable and has a private bathroom with shower. The location is a bit far from the center but a bus stop is a 5 minute walk away and a bus to Dublin city center leaves every 12 minutes. Highly recommended!
Absolutely wonderful!
Was really nice there stayed there 4 days and gonna stay there soon again. It is well connected to the city centre and the airport. The apartment is in a really nice area north of dublin.

Double room with en suite. Unable to use apartment outside of this and the room is a spare room in Monica's apartment where she is living with her family. She is very good at staying out of the way and gave me my own keys to the apartment. All communion took place through air bnb app
Such a normal and nice people! Every recommendation!
Monika is a great place in a great location. Would love to stay here again. Thanks Monika!

Great place to stay and perfect location if you want to be close to the airport. Good sized room and new clean bathroom. Monika went out of her way to help us get checked in and settled. Definitely recommend!
Monika's place is very clean and tiy, close to Dublin Airport and lots of shops within walking distance.
I strongly recommend Monika s place!!!!! Everything was perfect
Monika is very welcoming and i would highly recommend her accommodation.
N

Monika's place was amazing and exactly what I needed. She was so accommodating about my check-in, the room was clean and homey. It was the subtle touches that really made me feel at home. She had left a water bottle and some fruit on a side table. Those are the things that make me feel more like a family friend than a guest. Would highly recommend. :)
l would recommend! Very clean, easy instructions, very friendly and a great stay

Kind host, Clean and comfortable room
Lappartamento di Monika si trova vicino ad un parco quindi una bella zona anche per passeggiate
A goid place to stay
Monika was a lovely, helpful host (great communication). The room is warm, clean and bed is very comfortable. Good location too, 10 mins from the airport and easy to find/check-in.

Very nice neighborhood, close to the airport and few minutes from Costa, Mc Donalds and more... the room is cosy, Monika is very nice, she also left a bottle of water and some fruits in the room! :) recommended!

Friendly couple, cozy room. 
Perfect airbnb for a weekend trip to Dublin.
Near airport.
Honestly, can recommend this place for stay. Close to shops for breakfast and ideally between Airport and City Centre.
I had great couple of days at Monika's apartment.

Bills Airbnb was wonderful!! My husband and I stayed in the garden cottage for our wedding night after marrying in City Centre & it was perfect!
We loved the decor and style of the home, how quite and quaint it is and above all else THE BED! Wildly comfortable stay in the space, was simply perfect for us two. We just loved the greenery and plants in the space as well. Bill has the home bed technically savvy and also fast WiFi which we appreciated. We felt right at home!
Bill went above and beyond to accommodate us. Wed highly recommend this cottage and Bill to anyone staying in Dublin. :)
The host canceled this reservation 89 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great location close to city centre. Bill was quick to respond to any requests and has put together an awesome guide of the local neighborhood and city.

Staying here at Arbour Hill was lovely, really nice and quiet location and in walkable distances to most places. Cal was able to give good information and answered all questions within good time. Fabulous city and a good comfy bed!  Would reccomend:)
Nice place to stay. Quiet and short walk to some shops and cafes. Quick taxi ride to the city.  Hosts very friendly and informative about the area.
Amazing experience

Bella esperienza a Dublino. Abitazione perfetta con ogni comfort, abbastanza vicina al centro. Ci sta un bar che fa anche un ottima pizza nelle vicinzanze e diversi locali che fanno ottime colazioni. Ci siamo sentiti molto a casa. Consigliatissimo
This was the second time I have stayed in this lovely cottage. It is warm and clean and is in a great location. Would highly recommend

I stayed here for about 7 days during the week I attended Trinity College Dublin for student exchange. Everything we needed (sugar, salt, pepper, pasta, stove, oven etc) was available in the kitchen. However, a few things we hoped to have were brighter lights (for doing work), a dining table and a microwave. Those would be a bonus :) other than that, we had a lovely & comfortable stay in the cottage.
Brians place is in a quiet neighborhood with parking on the street or around the corner.  Beds were very comfortable.  We had everything we needed there.

The house was lovely. It was on a nice quiet street with parking at the front and a short walk to the local village & bus & Luas stops. The house was clean and tidy and had everything you could need. Cal was a great host & made everything really easy & answered all questions quickly.
We traveled with our 18 month old daughter & I would say it was a great place for a small family. I would happily stay here again and would recommend it to anyone staying in Dublin.
This is a lovely cottage, quick walk to public transportation. Check in was easy, space is small but perfect for a small family.

We traveled with our granddaughters (13 &15). I would say it was a great time for my family. A very quiet place, near to the bus stops (46a - 450 m, 37/39/39a - 650 m). We have got DoDublin tickets valid 72 hours for all buses including Airport coaches and Hop On Hop Off tours. The most important thing for my wife is an exellent heating system manually controled (nights were very cold). Spare pillows and quilts were available. Kitchen equipment is sufficient and made our stay more pleasant. WiFi was perfect. Local TV programs available and nice musical radio channels as well. The total accomodation price for a family with 2 children was very reasonable.
Such a great location and quick responses. (: Our host was very accommodating!

The cottage was a perfect place for our stay in Dublin! The location is perfect - quiet neighborhood, close to several bus stops, and delicious coffee shops and a Centra close by! We were lucky to be able to check in early and communication was quick and easy. 

Cal was great! Extremely responsive and quick to help. We had an error message on the water heater and he stopped by to fix it! 

Three of us stayed in the cottage and there was more than enough space. The cottage had all the amenities one may need when staying for more than a few days - kitchen equipment, towels, etc. 

Thank you!!!

We had an awesome stay at the cottage! It's in a great location if you prefer a not very busy neighbourhood. The only thing missing was a table, because we were three people which the small bar in the kitchen couldn't accommodate but this really wasn't much of a problem. Overall it was an incredibly amazing time we spend there!

The cottage had all of the basic amenities. The location was great...lots of good pubs and excellent restaurants in the area. It was a short bus ride into the city centre. Great place to use as a base to see Dublin.

Stony batter was so much fun. We had an amazing stay. My teenager and I stayed for a week. We were a 15 minute walk to the Guinness store and a 20 minute walk to temple bar. They were so much to do and see in the local area and the city bus was easy to figure out. Stony batter even had a weekend festival that we attended and saw some local music and entertainment. I would highly recommend this place. Not only is it close to everything, But it is clean and you have everything you need right there. Their local markets down the street that you can fill the fridge up with. The Wi-Fi was working perfectly which helped with evening schoolwork. We had a wonderful experience.
Lovely home, close to the city, excellent host, highly recommended
Very cute and comfortable apartment! Host recommendations are very helpful!

Check in process is easy and place is a good landing spot with fairly good location for seeing Dublin. I lucked out when finding it because I didn't know how close to Heuston Station it was. . . you can walk it if your bags are not too heavy.

The area is quiet and cute and just a short trip into the city centre. Public transport is extremely easy to get to and from the apartment. Apartment size and amenities are also great. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

The cottage is exactly as others have written. Clean, cozy and very close to busstop or a 15/20 min walk to the city centre. Very quiet neighbourhood. I liked the checkin process, easy way to get the keys by getting a code to the lockbox. No hassle with having to be there at a certain time to meet up with the owner.  The cottage has everything you need, is clean, has wifi and even adapters for your electric appliances from outside Ireland. Brian and Cal are fast in replying aswell. Me, my husband and our 2 young boys would definately stay here again! Thank you!
Great location and quick responses, would recommend!

Great place and amazing hosts. This place is much bigger than i expected the photos don't do it justice. I would 100% recommend Brian and Cal's place and I will defiantly come and stay again next time I'm in Dublin.

Good location. Reasonable walking distance to public transportation and some of the city attractions. Property small but functional. Living room furniture is worn and tatty, bedding,and towels were clean but stained, and overdue upgrade.

This house is in a good location for easy walking to stores, Jameson's Bow Street, and Guinness. For a bit more walking, you can reach several other great tourist attractions.  The LUAS is a short walk away, as is Heuston train station, should you decide to arrive in Dublin by rail or take a day trip. The one amenity lacking that would have been handy was a microwave, but there is a fully functioning oven, and an electric tea kettle.

The hosts, Brian and Cal had tips on the area, how to operate the shower and heating system, and a great explanation of the recycling program, with a separate bin for that in the kitchen. There is a washer for clothing, but no dryer, however items air dried quickly, and there are cleaners located within easy walking distance if needed.
A great emplacement (30 minutes of walk of the city) and a beautiful place to stay during your trip! Cal and bryan are very professionnel people!

A cute little house in a lovely neighbourhood. Its easy to walk from there to the city centre. It is an old house but equipped with everything you need. The communication was smooth and precise. We enjoyed our stay!

Eithnes place is very clean and comes with everything that you may need for a short trip. It is also at a very convenient location. She was quick at getting things fixed when we reached out for help. Thanks Eithne!

This apartment is in a great location, with great views. Booked for a birthday weekend with friends and first impressions were great. However, the finishing touches were lacking greatly. The apartment was dirty, with food crumbs in cupboards, dirty cupboard doors, dusty surfaces in all rooms. Bathrooms were also dirty and taps did not work properly meaning one shower was cold and the other scorching hot. The window seals in the double bedroom had been sealed with gaffer tape which did not stop the draft. 
The host did assist quickly with the broken remote controlled blinds and when we were without water for a night (no working toilets). Such a shame as this apartment could be amazing. Considering the high price tag for our stay, I would not recommend.
Really enjoyed staying here. Stylish place right in the business district of Dublin. Not a far walk to Grafton Street and the Temple Bar areas of the city.
Great location, in the stylish Charlotte Quay. Very close to shops bars and restaurants and a nice walk to the centre. Chic apartment, nice and warm and quiet.
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
I would 100% stay here again. We loved it! Beautiful and relaxing, Jens place was the perfect stay for our vacation. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Very nice place for those who want to cook down out of noisy towns. Loughshinny and Skerries are wonderful fishing villages, with very nice places to eat, from breakfast, to dinner (definitely check-out Olive Cafe/Deli). Fairly close to Dublin town, for days visit.
Jen has been wonderful, very supportive! Totally recommended!

This place is amazing. The cottage is in the perfect location, with the beach right on the doorstep. It is also a very quiet and peaceful area, but with local shops a short drive away. Skerries Harbour is not far, and there are plenty of lovely restaurants and cafes and a huge unspoilt beach. The cottage itself has a lovely layout and is very modern in decor. The kitchen is fabulous, the beds are super comfy and you can have a decent shower too. Thoroughly recommend this place. We would love to return one day.

It is a lovely place right in front of a beach. It is out of walking distance from any shops so car is a must but even this disadvantage wouldnt make me not to consider this place in future again. 
Cottage was spotless and all you need is in it. 
Jen is very responsive so any problem you might have is dealt with very fast.
Thank you.

Jen's place is really nice and is situated in a quiet area! The pictures are 100% accurate. Jen is a great host! She was always checking on us via messages during our trip, always offering tips and any help when we needed. She also left us a loaf of bread on our first night, which we really appreciated after our late night flight :) Highly recommend this place, however, make sure that you have a car as the area is quite remote and the first shops are about 5km away.
Lovely cottage right next to the beach. Great for walks along the shore. Living area is spacious and cosy. Lovely for a family holiday.

Jens beautiful home is set in a spectacular location with amazing views across the bay. From booking to check-out we had very quick responses to any queries we had, the house was very clean/tidy and provided a perfect location for us visiting family in the local surrounding  area. Its quiet, its laid back and its perfect for quiet getaway. Highly recommended.
Amazing Air BnB! We cant wait to return to Jens house & Loughshinny :-)

The little harbor is lovely and from the house you have a very nice view on the beach. Jen's house is very quiet and even with the storm you don't hear anything. The house is really lovely and well furnished. Beds are so comfortables !  Highly recommanded !
Lovely cottage, great layout and decor. Super kitchen. Really enjoyed our stay here.
A lovely space with a wonderful host.  Really wonderful location.
Lovely place to stay.  Very quaint.   The homemade bread she left so so nice and everything was very clean! She is a very nice lady as well and very knowledgeable about Dublin!

Beautiful Georgian townhouse, centrally located,  well kitted out studio let by a very efficient and friendly host.  Just the walk through the entrance hall and up the staircase to the studio is a joy in itself!
Nice place quite close of the centrum.
This spot was central, charming, and clean. I recommend.
amazing stay!

This was a great place to stay! It was nice to be out of the city Centre but close enough to walk every where. We never had to take a taxi. The place was very nice and historic. We liked the option of eating out or dining in with the full kitchen. The only negative is you can hear everything going outside if you are a light sleeper. Other than that everything was wonderful!
Really an amazing apartment, well located with an amazing host. I would definitely go back. Thanks Karin!
Its a lovely sized studio flat, nice little touches and all the items required for a good stay, even down to the home made jam.

Karin's apartment is so charming.  It's at the top of the building, so if stairs are an issue this might not be the place for you.  We loved having the studio to ourselves and we really enjoyed the fireplace in the living room.  The bed was a bit firm for our tastes, but otherwise we really enjoyed our stay in this historic building.  It felt like we were staying in a tiny bit of traditional Ireland, which is exactly what we wanted.

The apartment is beautiful, bright and spacious. The location is perfect, in walking distance to everything. Karin provides clear instructions and check in is fast and easy. Will definitely come back for my next trip to Dublin.
We had a lovely stay! Couldnt get the hot water to work at first, but Karin was prompt in helping us get it going. This apartment is darling, and we found it very walkable. Would recommend!

It is a very nice location, close to the city center. The room was huge, I really liked the room. Everything was clean, bathroom, room, etc.

Unfortunately, there were some issues with the Wifi. However, it was an exception and they will look into it.

My room was on the street side. Therefore, it was a bit noisy in the morning because of the traffic. Not a problem for me but if you are a light sleeper it could maybe be an issue.

Overall, good location and great host. Definitely, a place where I would come again.
Great place! Karin is very hospitable.

It was my mother and I's first time in Ireland and our stay at Karin's beautiful home was exactly what I was hoping for and more! The location was great! Right next to a park which we could see from our room and it was in great walking distance to access the whole city. Self check-in was nice and made me feel comfortable being able to get in and out on our own. She greeted us upon arrival and provided us with a map of Dublin and basically mapped out all the walking routes for us to all the places we wanted to go. She also provided us with some food for our stay which was very nice. I was just in love with all the character and history her house has. Flowers and plants everywhere! I will definitely be looking to stay there again if I'm ever back in Dublin.
Karins place is perfect location for staying in the heart of Dublin, lovely old building with lovely touches of styling and detail. What we expect of a town the age of Dublin 5/5.

Stay here. Its a most amazing building and each of Karins units are charming and tastefully outfitted. Youll have everything youll need in a wonderful part of town that is close to downtown Dublin but enough out of the way to avoid the crowds.  I walked into the unit and felt instantly at home and really couldve seen myself living there. Youll be delighted.

We enjoyed our stay with Karin very much. The house is absolutely beautiful and the apartment is equipped with everything you need: fully equipped kitchen, washing machine, bathroom, etc. etc.
Karin's house is 10 minutes away from the centre. The check-in and communication were perfect. On our next trip to Dublin we will definitely stay at karin again. Absolutely recommended!

Great place to stay in Dublin!  The apartment was immaculate and beautiful!   Location was great and walkable to all major sights.  Karen is an amazing host. Gave me so many great travel tips and made me feel so welcome!  Would definitely recommend to anymore traveling to Dublin!

No internet. No hot water. 

The Airbnb is charming and in a great location (though from my few days in Dublin, everything is pretty central). The host was extremely responsive leading up to my visit. The front door was in process of repair while I was staying, so I had to use the back entrance. No problem. Im not a high maintenance guy. 

But when I messaged her about there being no WiFi signal working on my second day , she choose not to respond at all (Of the four connections in the multi-unit house, only seldom would any show-up on my phone and when one did, the internet didnt function at all.) Very frustrating, especially because I had work for my job to do. (I had mentioned this in my message to the host). So when there was no hot water, I opted to not contact her. I will admit this. Initially I thought I had not turned on the hot water heater per the instructions in the apartment book. But no, even with the switch on, only cold water. 

Look, I hate leaving bad reviews. This is a really lovely house, my apartment was clean and welcoming, coffee left for me and even eggs in the refrigerator. But as far as the BASIC amenities go, it was really disappointing, pretty inexcusable.
This was a very nice space conveniently located to many great areas of town!

Karin runs this beautiful b&b with her entire heart and soul. Her home is a stunning work of beauty and hospitality, and it's clear so much care has gone into both presentation and accommodation. She is quick to help out whenever anything arises and knows the ins and outs of Dublin like no other. She's personable, informative and caring. The rooms are airy, comfortable and accommodating. This room can get a bit loud traffic wise so if you're sensitive to such, I'd highly advise booking one of her other majestic rooms for just a bit more. Walkable distance to close to everything.
Nice place, nice host, nice touches (with supplies for breakfast). A great location, everything was easy to get to either by walking to by nearby buses or trams
Though we ended up not being able to stay at Karins, she was a great host. Quick to respond, thorough instructions and great tips on everything youd need to know.
Great spot, very centrally located. Karin is a very sweet host, and the place is a great home base for exploring the city.

Karin is an excellent host.  She provides her guests with extensive, detailed information to ensure that travel and check-in goes well, and to help them plan their itineraries while in Dublin.  She personally took time to discuss our interests and give us advice.  We appreciated her suggestions very much.  Her apartment is lovely and beautifully equipped, and has a charming bookshelf full of good reading, much of it by Irish writers or about Ireland.
The single factor that was less than ideal was some traffic and pedestrian noise at night, but that's probably normal for city locations, and we were perhaps a bit sensitive to it, having just come from the relative silence of rural accommodations.

This is the second time we have stayed in one of Karin's beautiful apartments in this beautifully restored Georgian building on historic Mountjoy Square. The neighborhood is charming and within close walking distance to all Dublin has to offer.  Karin takes her role as a host seriously, there are many detailed touches, including guides to the city and some basic staples like fruit, yogurt, milk, eggs, coffee and tea. Highly recommended!

This apartment is comfortable and unique. It's within walking distance to most sites of interest, and there are some good local restaurants and pubs. Karin provided us with information about places to eat, current museum exhibits, and a map to help us get around the city. The apartment was a spacious and relaxing place to rest after a long day exploring Dublin, and it was fun to watch people in the park from the large windows.

Stellar in every way.  Art and architectual historians will be delighted.  The location on the Square with easy access to buses to the airport and town make a car unnecessary. Karin's notes on shops, places to visit, restaurants and pubs are impressive.  We took all her advice and were never disappointed. Karin is a knowledgeable, well-travelled woman who is delighted to meet you but will never intrude.  It is very much a home-- quiet and private. The kitchen is stocked with all new appliances and items to your personal liking.  The flat is small but not cramped. The  bath is a good size and the shower is roomy.  The bed is comfortable. The Square is a  wonderful park across the street. Karin's style and taste bring warmth and charm to this lovely 1792 townhouse.
Great location. Steps from OConnell st and major attractions in the city centre

Very stylish house throughout! The flat itself is airy, tastefully decorated and equipped with everything youd need. Its an easy walk away from city centre, very convenient for exploring Dublin. Highly recommended!

Karins home was the perfect final stop on our European vacation. The room was so bright, and clean, and the whole house was gorgeous. Perfectly located a short walk from the city center, with a lot of great little places along the way. Would highly recommend!

Karin's apartment was a beautiful space and made for an ideal jumping off point in Dublin. The building itself his historic and wonderfully appointed while the flat I stayed in had all the comforts of home. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone passing through the city or staying for longer stints.

Would definitely recommend staying at this apartment to anyone looking for a break In Dublin. A Georgian House with a wonderfully unique interior full of history & character and the location was very good as well.

The place is in a great location, staying there is like a trip into another era. The apartment is on the 3rd floor, so be ready to lift your bags. Also, the bed was quite squeaky. The view is nice though and I loved the books everywhere.

A great place to stay in a beautiful old building that has all the up to date amenities and conveniences. Karin was a great host and gave good instructions and tips. You could not beat the lovely view from the large windows.
The apartment was magical, in one second I had home with everything what I could possible need. Real nice, clean, inspiratiomal and cozy victorian place  ‚ù§Ô∏è
I would give Karin 6 stars but this website only allows 5. Simply outstanding!

The accommodation was comfortable and clean. Not only this but it is situated in an old Georgian styled house which is famous in the streets of Dublin. The location is ideal as it is close to the centre of Dublin, approximately a 10-15 minute walk to Temple Bar (the centre of Dublin), however not too close so that you are kept awake by the pubs and bars. Karin was very helpful with any information and very insightful with her suggestions for where to visit. Would highly recommend staying in this accommodation. Thank you Karin for a wonderful stay!
Exceptional location ! Wonderful stay .. would recommend and return for sure ...

Very romantic and beautiful place! Well located. Apartment is perfectly equipped with everything needed including the fireplace. Full of books. Excellent written  advices from the host on how to discover Dublin.  Nice view. "Feel at you parents/grand parents house" style. We loved it very much. Please note that it is a historical house - it has beautiful oak stairs ... but no elevator (if you need one).  We had a feeling that we lived in Dublin of 60-s with all benefits of 2019th :)

Loved staying at Karin's. Easy to walk to all the touristy areas even though it's a bit out of the way. We were surprised to see the studio fridge stocked with breakfast supplies and basics, thought it very thoughtful. Everything you could want is available. It is a wee noisy, if you are used to city noises you won't notice, but as it's in a beautiful older home the thin windows do let in lots of street noise even with the shutters closed,  we did find it very loud. Karin left us a fabulously detailed guide to Dublin as well, loved it. Great restaurants just down the road for supper.
A. Classic property, well located with a super helpful host. I recommend it!

A comfortable experience, the room is spacious and bright, the kitchen facilities are complete, you can make your own breakfast in the morning, Kavin is very friendly, can answer our questions in time, recommended to stay.
Apartment was very nice and clean, and close to everything you need.  Great stay!

This is a fantastic place to explore Dublin from. Some great spots for food within walking distance and Karin has given heaps of local tips and clues as to how to have a great time in Dublin. She went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. It was well worth it! Loved it.
Alles gut

Amazing overall experience with Karin's apartment. The apartment is really cute and the whole building is homey, bright and very well stylized. Not only I have enjoyed being there but also I got so many interior ideas. :)

Location is great and you can be anywhere in approximately 20 minutes (by foot). Additionally, the small things like eggs, milk, butter and juice that we found in refrigerator¬†were a very nice touch.
Delightful Flat, well equipped and very central. Could not have been nicer

The best way to describe Karin's apartment was charming.  We felt like we were truly staying in  an upscale Georgian hotel.  The interior is beautiful and well appointed.  On entering we were greeted by the aroma of fresh lilies.  The kitchen is thoughtful stocked with everything you need to cook but not a lot of useless clutter.  There were many thoughtful touches like very detailed instructions and recommendations and as well as books and movies.  The apartment is conveniently located and on several bus lines.  The downside of this is that it can be noisy.
Beautiful loft at an excellent location, equipped with all modern amenities.
Beautiful historic place on the north side. Loved the building and apartment. Very private

We had a wonderful stay. The location was great. Easy walk to everywhere. After a long day of sightseeing we took a bus and it dropped us off right by the apt.  Perfect place of you want to visit Dublin and not spend a lot of money on food amd getting around

Convenient location, ca 10 min walk to the tram into town. Lidl very close. Nice small townhouse, all basics are there, no tv, broadband is good. Nice little space on the back to sit outside with a table and two chairs.
Nice quiet neighborhood. Easy to get to major attractions. John was very attentive and quick to respond to questions.
Visit if you want to have a feel for living in the real Dublin rather than a city centre hotel. Nice space for a couple going out into the town but wanting a quiet retreat.
The house is nice with all services working perfectly. Very good location, clean and cozy. Highly recommended.

Location seemed far away. However transit (bus) use was great. The price also seemed a bit high for how small it was and the location. 
Very friendly host with prompt response time. Super friendly & helpful neighbours.

Staying in Johns house is a great experience as you are part of a local neighbourhood but in easy distance of centre.   Lovely neighbours, supermarkets handy, well equipped kitchen if you dont want to eat out. Didnt meet John but support team sent emails with full instructions. Mary next door will also help you - we had trouble with locking the front door and she showed us the knack.

John's team does an excellent job of communicating with you prior to your arrival. However, be prepared for a little more of a "bachelor pad" type feel. The stairs also posed an issue for my family because we're all six foot tall or more. I would not suggest anyone more than 5'8" stay here or risk hitting your head in the middle of the night to go to the restroom downstairs. All said, the location for getting to many of Dublin's main tourist attractions is good.
