This place is overall comfy, a good value in a convenient location.
We where really happy to stay. It was a home away from home. John an his team where really helpful.
Great place and great location!
Nice cosy apartment in a beautiful residential part of Dublin. Close to transport links and plenty of amenities nearby. An enjoyable stay.
Si estas de paseo es lindo, no es para estar todo el dia adentro.
Lovely location and good host
Great location. Perfect for one or two people who are in the city for a few days. Just down the road from restaurants, and really close to a bus stop. Very nice part of Dublin, too. Highly recommend!

Great place to stay for a visit to Dublin. Apartment was just as described. We loved the mezzanine bedroom. Very bright and airy. Brian was great and answered all our questions quickly. Big pluses for having parking permits and a laundry facilities in the building. Cute neighborhood. Tesco is a two minute walk. Shower had great water pressure!
Lovely little apartment in upmarket neighbourhood. Check in very easy. Some damp issue in the flat but I guess its the whole building!
Had a great time in Dublin

The communication with our host was excellent and he kindly added a day to our stay last minute when our plans changed . The publuc transportation was great and we had  no trouble  getting  around .We appreciated having laundry facilities  too. However should you have any mobility issues this might not be the place for you, as there are many stairs both inside and outside of unit.
Very easy check in, lovely apartment, great communication.
Its a great place to stay and walk
Apartment is nice and big great location 8 min walk from temple bar area etc
Great location very clean
Cool location, walking distance to many attractions. Tidy place with modern feel.

This apartment is in a great location. We found it easy to walk or bus to all of the sites we wanted to see. The apartment was clean and tidy when we arrived, and had lots of travel guides available for things to do and where to eat. We did have to pick up the keys at a bar around the corner but it was fast and easy. We were 3 guests and when we arrived there was only half a roll of toilet paper total for 2 bathrooms, which was a little awkward the first night. Would have been great to have a bit available for each bathroom for the first night. Overall a great stay and would definitely visit again!
Great apartment in the centre of Dublin. Fantastic communication from the host.
Great location and host communication was easy and problem free. Good for a family stay within walking distance of everything. Lift provides easy access to room for older guests.
Great apartment located near many amenities, clean. Would highly recommend it.

Great location. Large two story apartment within walking distance of many sites. Apartment was not as clean as it should have been and there are a few minor repairs that need attending. For the price, I'd expect better.

Perfect location for seeing Dublin. Lots of space. in need of a little TLC but all in working order, just what you need for a home from home break! 

Ask for specific directions as is a little tricky to find.

Great location, neither we or the taxi driver could find the building, it is right next to the radisson blu, and the build has a restaurant called Feast in it. Needs more kitchen equipment but otherwise grand.
Fantastic location, it was close to everything.

This was a generally nice apartment in a great area. There was plenty of space and we had everything we needed including 2 bathrooms which is not always available. The location was great, being a short walk to plenty of bars and restaurants. Sights such as Trinity College, OConnell Street and Temple Bar were all 10 to 15 minutes walk away. Malcolm gave us some good recommendations in his notes which we followed. My favourite venue was the Hairy Lemon!

We were disappointed with Malcolms communication. He only sent the message about check in, mentioning that we had to collect our keys from a nearby bar because he was not around, on the morning of our arrival. We didnt receive the message that Malcolm said he sent about what to do with the keys when we were leaving. There were a few aspects of the apartment that needed attention but, overall, we had a good stay.

The apartments is in a great location. It was clean but needs some repairs-fix curtain rods, there were not enough towels and the ones provided needed replacing so we bought our own as well as soap.  Several lights need replacing. Otherwise it was well located to amenities and was clean.

This apartment is broadly as described.  It is in a brilliant spot, an easy walk to many of Dublins attractions, as well as many bars and eateries.  It is very spacious, light and airy.

Unfortunately, it is let down by poor maintenance ì things break and just dont get fixed.  Many lights dont work and fittings appear to be falling apart. All of the curtains need rehanging and in the main bedroom, the rod is falling off the wall.  There are holes in the wall behind many doors.  The washing machine door would not open, but we were reimbursed for our costs at a nearby laundry service.

The quality of maintenance that does occur is poor.  As an example, there is still masking tape around doors from a repaint, and the light fittings are covered with paint.

Cleaning also needs attention.  Mould is caked on the bottom of the ensuite shower door, and all of the cooking appliances need a thorough clean.  The storage areas need a complete tidyout to remove or properly store all manner of items left in the apartment.

Finally, the apartment would benefit from a complete set of matching plates and bowls, a few mugs which fit in the coffee maker and some wine glasses.

The apartment is in a great location, just a couple of blocks from St. Patricks Cathedral. An easy walk to most all of the sights in Dublin. The apartment is stylish and we really liked having 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Picked up the key from the local pub around the corner, where we had our first Guinness in Ireland! Good way to start the vacation!
Great flat - convenient location - highly recommend. Thank you!

Nice spacious place in a great location.  Malcoln was not around so picked up the keys at a local Pub, per his instructions.  Nice apartment, but in need of some repairs.  For one thing, the washer/dryer combo is still broken.  This goes back to reviews I have read dating back to mid 2018 . Still does not work.  The freezer is in need of a good defrosting ..  about a half of it is one big ice ball . No way to make ice.  Kitchen was stocked ok. One martani glass and zero wine glasses for the future drinker out there.  Tried the oven once could not get it to turn on.  If your going to be out touring Dublin by yourself these things may not matter.  If you have a family they may. All in all a good clean place to stay.  Just don't expect  everything to be  as described.

Zeer teleurgesteld in dit appartement!
Contact met Malcolm verliep moeizaam, duurde vaak lang voor er een antwoordt kwam.
Ophalen van sleutel in een pub!
Verhuurder zelf niet aanwezig!
Woning in slechte conditie!
Gordijnen hangen los van de roede!
Veel verlichting doet het niet!
In 1 slaapkamer gordijnen niet te gebruiken vanwege kapotte roede , in de andere geen gordijnen!
In kledingkast zoveel spullen van eigenaar: geen ruimte voor eigen kleding .
Met zelfs in een lade vuil wasgoed!
Ik raad dit appartement niet aan, ik raad het eigenlijk af!
Jammer want de locatie is top!
Fabulous location as only 10 minute walk to get to Temple Bar and easy to get to all tourist attractions
This apartment has a fantastic location.

Nice apartment in a good area, but let down by poor housekeeping and lack of basic amenities. Owner really needs to get a grip as at the moment it is not good value for money compared to other properties we saw in the area.
Would not recommend.

Spacious apartment, great views and good location. We spent too much time trying to find front door. Malcolm said he would meet us nearby but sent us message he is away for weekend and did not give clear instructions to front door. There is a housing shortage in Dublin and building notices state they prohibit Airbnb in this condo. The cable didnt work.
This apartment is in a great location and is a good venue for a weekend in Dublin.

Malcolm has a very nicely located condo in the heart of central Dublin. We were able to walk to all the attractions, restaurants and pubs we visited during our four evening stay. The space is very comfortable for two couples. Just a note, Central Dublin is a very active place especially during the morning and afternoon rush hours. Have fun!

Pros:  clean space.  felt very safe.  clear communication. convenient location.
Other notes:  When we were letting ourselves into the place, there was a sign by the elevator that stated that AirBNB's were not allowed on premises.  This made us very uncomfortable, as we had already paid and didn't really have another good option.  We tried to stay under the radar, and we didn't have any issues, but it was unsettling.  The location itself felt very safe and was convenient to walk anywhere we wanted in Dublin.  Parking was across the street and was $3.20 euro an hour, but with free overnight parking. We were able to secure parking most times that we wanted it, and only had to use a nearby garage once.  We had two couples staying and as the listing noted, the bed was two single beds pushed together. Unfortunately, there was no way to secure the beds together, and as we slept, we ended up having a space open between them. It was like sleeping in two separate beds, because otherwise, we either were cramped on one single bed, or someone was on the uncomfortable crack.  This was disappointing.
Great place in a handy location. We would definitely stay there again.

Fantastic flat in superb location. It is spacious with two lovely bedrooms, one with an en suite which was great - having two bathrooms and two showers was a real bonus. The beds are comfy and the linens and towels were lovely. A beautiful flat with great furniture (not cheap stuff that is uncomfortable), lots of storage, lots of space and a fully kitted out kitchen, with washing machine and dishwasher. There were books, games and leaflets left out which were very helpful for our sightseeing. 
The location is really great, you are in walking distance to pretty much everything. And the complex is very nice and very quiet. 
Top notch, would go back and would recommend.

Brilliant apartment in great location with easy access to all major attractions. We had some issues particularly messages to host but he was great in allowing  us a slightly extended departure so were able to enjoy our last day luggage free
Good place near 3 arena and beside Croke Park
The accommodations were fine for a one night layover.
Great stay with Krystian. Nice quite place right by the stadium
Everything fine nice room in shared apartment ! Practically just in front of the croke park stadium and ten mins from city center
Decent stay. We were not in the Airbnb for majority of the day so we were fine with the place because our time was minimal. About ~25-30 minute walk to Temple Bar area.
Great Airbnb! Thank you very much for hosting me and my friend Krystian!

Great location, short walk through nice area to the main city. Krystian was always quick to respond and perfect host. Room is large, clean and bright. Bathroom has good shower. Tea and coffee making facilities added bonus.
Great room in a quit location but near the city center. Thanks Krystian!
Lovely place, local to what we needed and very accommodating, thank you.
Lovely clean flat located in walking distance of central Dublin with really nice restaurant in the same building. Perfect for our short stay.
Krystian was flexible, the room was cozy and check in/out was super easy! ‚ô•Ô∏è

Krystian is a very good host !!!!
I recommend it .

We stayed one night and I would highly recommend.

Its about a 20 min walk to the center from this apartment. 

Cars on the street can be a little loud from time to time but nothing to complain about. 

Hospitality was outstanding and check in was very easy and fast.
Was a great stay with my brother. Was a really good spot to stop and he gave us awesome recommendations for music and bars.

We had a lovely stay during our trip to Dublin! Krystian is a lovely host, answers really quick to messages and gave us some valuable tips on what to do in town! The room is spacious and clean, the bathroom tidy and moderm and the small area with cups, teabags and the water cooker was exactly as described. I would highly recommend the place.
Krystians appartement is extremely well located. We were almost able to do everything by feet.  The room is clean and cosy and was big enough for the three of us. Thanks a lot !
This was an easy walk to all the excitement at City Center.  I traveled with my friend for our first trip in Ireland and felt that it was a good value for the location.

We stayed one night only at Krystian's place. We couldn't meet him in person but all was as stated and as we expected, from easy check-in to the room itself, which is spacious, comfortable and clean.
Very good location, just outside city centre. To Temple Bar there is a 20-25 minutes walk. Bus stop is also close. Recommended.
Very nice property. Check-in was very simple and Kyrstian was very helpful through the whole process. Not in a very bustling part of the city but that was fine with us. Overall no complaints!
Perfect spot for the stadium less than a 2 minute walk if entering through the Hogan stand. Kristian is welcoming and friendly. The room was the perfect place to rest our heads for the night.
Very nice place and helpful landlord

Great place to stay. Clean and quiet. Located within walking distance to the city centre. The host was very welcoming and friendly- willing to help when needed. I will definitely recommend to others visiting Dublin.
Great comfortable place love the balcony
The room was lovely! Loved the balcony. There's no kitchen, which wasn't a problem for us, but just fyi to those who read reviews. I'd definitely stay again!
Easy to find apartment! Loved staying there!!!! Will book with them again in the future!!
Clean and basic accommodations. Krystian was very helpful.

Very uncomplicated, Communication was very good and fast.
Krystian is an exellent host, and had some great recommandations for our short visit to Dublin.

Krystian was a great host; very friendly and helpful with local tips etc.
The room and bathroom were all nice and clean. Unfortunately the walls are a bit thin so you could hear the cars from the streets. If youre a light sleeper, that may wake you up at times but the traffic stops at some point in the night.
Safe place to stay but is basic and you need to be quiet as the doors bang and people live there!
Nice private room with a shared bathroom. Host was very friendly.
Awesome place to stay! Right near a stadium and good food and activities. Cohost was awesome too!

Krystian's place is tidy and clean. It is quiet and well located. There are several bus routes to town and it had easy access from the airport. The cover image is not a view from the house itself, so don't expect that when you arrive. There was a brief misunderstanding regarding the number of beds required. You need to be very specific when requesting this, but it quickly sorted.
Sehr gute Lage, sehr netter Gastgeber und sehr saubere Unterkunft
Nice and friendly welcome. A good experience and I would repeat if I came again, certainly
This place was very nice and only a short walk away from Oconnell Street. Would definitely recommend!

We stayed here for one night! The bedroom was spacious and clean. The bathroom was large and usually available. It was fine. The water pressure isnt very strong in Ireland in general just as an FYI. The location was excellent, very easy to get into the city.
Perfect host and the accommodation is beautiful. Perfect walk to city centre with a great view of croke park. Perfect for a match day.
Very nice stay and very clean
Perfect! Good location and value for money.

Krystian's place was very clean and spacious. He provided clear check-in instructions and was very quick to respond to messages with questions. The walk to downtown was manageable and the building is located beside an Enterprise Rental Car which was extremely convenient. We would stay here again :)
Sehr nette Gastgeber
Todo bien

Krystian's place was great! He gave great directions on how to get to the place, and was very quick to respond. The room was very spacious and clean, and the Italian restaurant downstairs had some of the best pizza I've ever had! Would stay here again.
Nice room with one bigger bed and a small one on the floor. Bathroom is shared and nice. City center only about 20 minutes walking distance away.

The apartment of Krystian is very functional: it is close to the city centre (15 min on foot), in a typical area (far from mass tourism), above one great Italian restaurant (and we are Italians ourselves so we know what is good!), and clean. We didn't meet Krystian in person but the self check-in was really easy. Thanks!

Clean, close to city center (15/20 min walk) next to Croak Arena - helpful host!
Want more do you need!
Good description before arrival and uncomplicated stay.

This place is a great cheap stay and relatively easy to find - we did find it a bit more of a walk to the main tourist areas than we were expecting but it was nothing major. The Italian downstairs is fabulous!
Krystian is a wonderful host. His place is very clean and comfortable. You will have a great experience staying here. I highly recommend staying here.

Krystian's place is great if you're looking to stay a little outside the hussle and bustle of central Dublin. It was very comfortable and the room provided plenty of space for 2 travelers on their last night in Ireland. It was about a 30 minute walk to Temple Bar and about a 15 minute drive to the airport which made things relaxing when flying back to the U.S. the next day. The room and bathroom were clean. Would recommend staying here if you are looking for a room with some extra space in Dublin and for comfort.
Krystian was great answering an question I had and his apartment is well kept. The checking was good and his place is about a 20minute walk to the city
an Amazing man with an amazing place

Krystian was a great host! We had access to the balcony and the roof, which was a great way to spend our evening. We ate at the Italian restaurant downstairs that Kristian suggested - the seafood dishes were incredible! Highly recommend.
Great location and Krystian provided great assistance with local activities and eats.

Very nice place to stay. Parking is easily available on the street right outside. Host is very nice and accommodating. Only stayed 1 night as I was passing through but had everything I needed. Super clean. If you have issue with noise, i recommend earplugs as you face the street and people and cars can be heard, but thats anywhere in Dublin. Would definitely stay here when visiting again.

Great location... walking distance to the Garden of Remembrance where you can get on Hop on Hop off buses and the airport shuttle as well as being accessible by city bus. It is in a very safe building and Krystian is very friendly and offered great suggestions. The biggest drawback is the bathroom, which can be shared by up to 7 people (up to 3 people in each of 2 air bnb rooms plus host).
Excellent accueil de Krystian
Perfect spot to explore Dublin. Easy checking. Everything clean. Superb
Quaint and well situated space. Great location!
Perfect for an easy and fast place where to sleep in Dublin, even if it seems quite distant from the center is easy to reach by bus and even by walking is not more that 30m from the city center.
Good location.
Very nice.

Krystian was very helpful in seeing us in the apartment and stayed in touch whilst we arrived late!

The room is based within a very cosy and spacious apartment with a shared bathroom. The double room has a spare single bed and large window with shared balcony, overlooking the main road. Do be considerate with water usage, switching off lights and keeping noise to a minimum. Teas and coffees provided.

Pizza restaurant! - directly below is  an undeniably perfect Italian pizza and wine bar restaurant - attentive, knowledge waiters and manager, a warm welcome, real pizza menu, very quick service and a fab selection of imported wines and bottled beers - we went twice!

To the centre: 15 - 20 mins walk. Lots to see on the way!

Will definitely return again!
The host canceled this reservation 47 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Thanks for everythinh!
Krystians place has great amenities, and in a good location!

Krystian was a good guy who cared a lot about our privacy! He has always replied pretty fast and answered all the questions we had.
The apartment was nice as well!

Great stay! Kristian is easy to communicate with and very open with check-in/out. The rooms were comfortable and bathroom big and clean. There's free coffee and tea, which is really appreciated after a day out. The location is about a 20 min walk to the south so if you want to be in the middle of busy Dublin this might not be for you. But if you want quiet and cozy it ticks all the boxes! Also, try the restaurant downstairs (and their Tuesday deal!)
Krystians place is in a great location! The room was clean and cozy :)

Levente was a fantastic host, although we did not meet often, he was always answering quickly on my questions/requests through Airbnb. He gave me some good tips about the neighbourhood and traveling also. He was very helpful in every cases. I would definitely recommend as a host to anyone.
Great location in a secure location within a short distance to the city. Modern and functional.
Clean appartment with all the amenities.
Very nice stay close to city center. The hosts are welcoming and helpful regarding trips and plans. Would stay there again

Good place, we have received many TIPS for trips, food, drinks,...
Flat Is situated about 2 km from downtown, we only walked, we didn't use public transport - you can just walk if you are active, but it is demanding. Flat is clean and good equiped, situated in calm quarter. Few good local pubs nearby. We were very satisfied.

Levente was a very good host and Attila is a very friendly person! The flat itself is quite close to the centre and you can easily get there by bus or walk the way. The room was clean and everything provided by them was fresh and clean as well. I can definitely recommend this Airbnb!
Co-host Attila was a very kind man, we had little trouble to reach each other while arriving but then it was great stay. The room is nice, clean and comfy. Thank you for your hospitality!
We enjoyed our stay there. The room is nice and the city centre is in walking distance. Only the bathroom could have been a bit cleaner.
It was really nice!
decepcionante
Perfect stay! :) Thanks Levente and Attila!
Great place and a great host. You can easily walk or take the bus to city centre for all the pubs and attractions.

Levente and Attila are absolutely amazing hosts. We could not have asked for better. Our time with them was a pure enjoyment. They are so hospitable, friendly, communicative, easy going and there are thoughtful touches which made our stay even better. Thank you so much, we loved our visit with you.
I may fully recommend Levente¬¥s home. It was awesome!
Was a nice and uncomplicated stay. Thanks for having me.
It is a lovely place. Levente and Atthila were really friendly.
Great place with a super host!
Good amenities

I wasnt able to meet Lev in person but Atilla was a wonderful host! He gave me plenty of tips and recommendations which made my stay much easier and enjoyable, all together a very welcoming host! Lev always responded to my messages quickly and was very helpful even though we were unable to meet! Thank you both for a wonderful stay!
Much better than expected. Great hospitality. Fantastic value!

Levente is a fantastic friendly host and was really helpful, helping me work out public transport and lending me a usb charger. Lovely quiet room with comfy bed. Probably the best Airbnb Ive stayed in.

Levente is a wonderful host, which is evident through his friendliness and communication. It felt like he made the time to ensure I checked-in and was settled, just the offer of sitting down and having a chat before he started work was so genuine and caring.

Beautiful house in a town at 20 minutes from Dublin. The area is really quiet and pretty and there are several shops close by, including Tesco. The bus stop is on the main street; you can either catch the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Swords Express or the 142 (cheaper than the others) to get into town. The house is cosy and comfortable, it feels like home. It has everything one might need, including books and toys for children. Highly suggested!

Thanks so Much to Evan and his wife, my niece stayed here during a recent festival in Marley Park. These guys were amazing we could not have asked for more. I would 100% recommend staying here and will definitely use this in future on trips to Dublin.
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
nice place to stay
comfortable place to stay near the coast 3 minutes away from the train station or the ocean view

I highly recommend this if youre okay with commuting to the city and are looking for a more low key less touristy experience. 

Walking and taking public transport was super easy to do. 

The other guests were quiet and sharing a bathroom was never an issue.

My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights at Ineses and overall we had a great time. The location is very convenient and easy to access by train as its 30 into town and only 3 from Howth that is a great place to have a break from the city. Very easy transport from and to the airport.
Now about the actual room. We only met Ineses husband once during our stay and he was very kind and helpful. We were in Room 2 and it was very comfortable. However, the you can hear the trains and the noises in train station but we didnt mind as we are both deep sleepers. We only had two problems.  One was the fact that we found trash and used cutlery from the previous person in our room. The other one was that the check in was a mess as the communication with the host and their instructions were unclear. Other than that, I would recommend this place and would go back myself. Its a great value for money.
Buono, tutto OK

Very clean house with nice furniture and comfortable beds, well situated near sea and next to the DART station so you can get to the Dublin city center very quickly and comfortably. Nice communication, we got all the information we needed.

The house is very near the train station which is great to go to the city center (a trip of around 30 minutes).
 We met  Inise's husband and he was very helpful and gave us lot's of information. 
The room is clean and cozy.

Inese's place is a great value, as the DART station that reaches the city centre (30 mins ride) was just one minute away! Everything went smooth, great communication with the hosts, we had coffee & water in the room, soft bed and clean shared bathroom! Thank you!

I recommend this accommodation to everybody coming to visit Dublin. The location is excellent, near the DART railway station and there is a direct bus 102 service to Dublin Airport. From Sutton, it is possible to walk on the scenic route to Howth Cliff or to go to the beach and admire the beauty of nature. 
Inese and her husband, Alex are really kind people, who provide a calm and friendly accommodation in the house. I feel very lucky to have found this accommodation. Thanks again.

Great Location. Really handy for the station - really useful if you buy the Leap Visitor card and can hop on and off the Dart and Buses around the Dublin area. Love Howth and really enjoyed the walk around the peninsula.
Recommend for anyone on a budget.
Definitely stay here. Perfect location for Howth and city centre. Nice cafes nearby for breakfast too and beach Walk (if you can brave the wind). Flexible check in and out was ideal too !
Good location close to the beach and public transport, friendly and helpful hosts. Would stay again.
We really enjoyed the stay, we can recommend that.
We stayed at Ineses place for a week. Its a great place to explore Dublin and its surroundings.
Great pleace to visit! Thanks again Alex and Inese!
The place is good located - 20 minutes by train to the city center. The apartment was warm, but a bid dirty. Inese is very friendly and together with her husband they gave us everything we needed.
Loved Sarah's place! Perfect location- in walking distance to everything and very hospitable.

My colleague and I stayed in Sarah's appartament during our two week business trip to Dublin. After a saturated working day it just felt like coming home. The couches are very cosy and the bedrooms are quiet. Great location in the city. There is everything you need and more in the apartment and plenty of possibilities around it. It was great that we could leave our car in the underground garage.
We were happy to stay at Sarah's apartment!

Great spot, great location, great host. The place was clean and had all the amenities we needed for a very comfortable week away from home. Sarah was responsive whenever we needed something, and I would absolutely stay here again on my next visit to Dublin!
Very close to the centre of Dublin.

Sarah's place is very conveniently located for travelling around the city. We walked most of the days to and fro places like TCD, Connolly station, St James Hospital and the walks are no more than 30 mins as long as we didn't take the wrong turn. It is also walkable to the Pheonix Park which is very pretty and definitely worth a visit. 
Sarah was always contactable. We had one night where the whole building had no water due to an overlook by the city council and Sarah stayed reachable to help us out which we are really grateful. It was unfortunate that during our stay, the lift was down the whole period. But it wasn't too great of an issue except for when moving heavy luggage.

This apartment was perfect! It was very clean and came equipped with everything we needed. Sarah was extremely helpful and quick to respond when we had any questions. The location was perfect - just a 10 minute walk to Temple Bar. And the apartment felt safe since the building itself requires a key to get in and its located in a courtyard that also requires a fob to enter.

We have had a great weekend at Sarah's apartment. Unfortunately the lift was out of action during our stay and climbing the 3 floors was hard work for my husband who has problems with his knee but we made the most of it. Great location walking distance to everything and the apartment was exactly as described and shown in the pictures. We'd happily stay again. Oh and the TV was amazing!!

Clean, comfortable and peaceful location.  Comfy bed , good shower, WiFi and Netflix!  Kitchen was also well stocked including a slow cooker. Great location- close to Tesco(5 mins away) and on the 145 bus route so easy to get in to the city centre.
Bridgette and Seb were very welcoming and were close by if I needed anything..

Bridgette and Sebs place is phenomenal. Truly a home away from home. I was worried about it being a little far from the city center of Dublin, but the bus is easy to access and their place is worth it. Also a short bus ride away from the beautiful seaside town of Dun Laoghaire. The guest house is the perfect size. Not too cramped and it feels cozy and homey. They had provided some food in the fridge like cheese and bread and fruit- such an unexpected and lovely touch. 

Bridgette was the one who checked us in and out and she was so kind! We plan to visit Ireland again and hopefully well stay here!

The Airbnb was very nice and clean. The hosts were available whenever we needed them and provided us with everything we needed. They were very accommodating and gave us plenty of tips on how to get around and places that we should go.

Very friendly host, warm welcome and quick responses to all communication.   This space was great for a family of 4.  We had a vehicle, so accessing central Dublin was not a problem, but there are bus lines that are nearby.
We definitely recommend this accommodation to others!

You'll feel at home in Bridgette & Seb apartment studio. It is well furnished and convenient.    You will also experience irish kindness and hospitality. Just beware to your schedule if you are travelling by bus : it is located in a peaceful and very nice suburb of Dublin but on working days it may take up to an hour to go to the city center depending on the trafic.

The accommodation is very clean, well equipped and the hosts left food and cleaning products. There were many towels available, hair dryer and cleaning products. The kitchen was very well equipped and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable, there is a big tv with Netflix. Wifi works very well. Its very easy to find and I felt very safe too.  I highly recommend it

Super-cute and cozy studio, lots of breakfast food supplies. Gorgeous outdoor space with wisteria and lilacs and fun patio. Lots of parks nearby . 
Lovely hosts.

This was our second time @ Bridgette's and Seb's studio apartment and we didn't regret choosing it. Once again a very uncomplicated check-in (we arrived at midnight) and check-out. The location is not the biggest one but has everything you need including two kind hosts. Definetly a great place to stay while in Dublin and I'm sure not our last time there.
Beautiful place in the suburbs of south dublin, Brigette and Seb were very thoughtful to help stock up the fridge with essentials and were very responsive when communicating.

Bridgette and Seb were wonderful hosts! They were clear with instructions for how to check in and had great amenities. The place is cute and tucked away in a neighborhood but easy to access train or busses, also nice little walking areas. If I were to travel to Dublin again I would definitely stay there!

Great location for a quiet stay. Beside a huge park if you are into your fitness. Grocery store very close by also. All you need really. I will happily return for another stay. 

Thanks guys.
Amazing hosts. Provides us with everything we needed including travel tips. 5/5 stars :)
Excellent accommodation, with nothing lacking, and a host who goes out of their way to ensure you have everything you need to enjoy your stay.

Thank you Bridgette and Seb.
We had a fabulous time in Dublin and enjoyed staying in your accommodation so much. You are such amazingly hospital and friendly hosts - just wish we had booked another night!  With love and respect, The Lawson family xx
Everything was fine : welcome, appartement, and it was very quiet. I recommand!
Highly recommendable accomodation, very nice hosts, thank you!

Bridgette was absolutely lovely and thoughtful. She kept a few groceries for us which really helped us out as we had young kids. The check in was smooth and comfortable. The place is really nicely decorated and has all that you need. It was clean and cosy. The location I have to say was a little difficult for us. It took 45 minutes on the bus to get to Dublin City Center everyday which was a little tedious. If youre looking for a place close enough to the city Center and relying on public transport this isnt the best place. If you have a car or want to explore more of the country side then its perfect.
Very clean and very comfortable, just perfect for our little trip to Dublin to see the foo fighters, thanks again and we will be back as we need to see Dublin again!!
Lovely spacious bright studio with really helpful hosts. Convenient for the motorway but located in a quiet street next to a lovely big park, with a kids playground.
A little out of the way from the city, but nothing a tram ride can't fix. Friendly hosts, comfy guest house--had a great time in Dublin.

The studio apartment has everything you need in a compact space but still feels spacious. We stayed with our family of 4, includin (Website hidden by Airbnb) year old. We were a bit worried about how we would get on with everyone in one room, but it worked better than I expected and we would stay again.
Bridgette&Seb were very kind and helpful. We stayed there for 2 weeks. Our stay was great. I would highly recommend.
Great place if attending an event at the convention center

Jean is the perfect airbnb host. She is good fun, a perfect example of Irish friendliness and she has given us great tips around Dublin for food etc. Her house is beautiful, super clean and in a lovely location. The room was very spacious (which is quite unusual for Dublin)  and the bed was super comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back!
We loved our stay at Jeans place. It is a lovely little house. We felt right at home and Jeans is great and very friendly. Would stay again!

Jean's place was absolutely wonderful. She was completely hospitable and had fantastic amenities in the room. The room itself was spacious and the bed was so comfortable - you couldn't help but fall right to sleep. It is a slight walking distance to some parts of the city, but I did it just fine... While pregnant! You will not regret staying in this beautiful house.

All the comments written about Jean and the room are more than true. Jean is friendly, kind and very attentive. She gave us many advices on what to do and see in the city and tried to make our stay even more comfortable than it, already, was. The room was very clean, the bed very comfortable and the neighborhood quiet and safe. I would definitely recommend the stay at Jean's place.

My room was large, cosy, with a large double bed, confortable mattress and much space around. Bathroom confortable and clean as well. Nice details everywhere. There's no a wardrobe but a large drawer.
Great place in a good location. Host is a lovely person.

We could not have had a better experience in Dublin. Jean was so very welcoming and helped us navigate the city. Her home is beautiful and comfortable and within walking distance of of downtown Dublin.

I stayed at Jean's with my girlfriend for a couple of nights. She offered us great hospitility and gave lots of advice on non-touristic places to see. The room was just as described and the bed was so comfortable. Lots of pubs are only a few minutes away, the city centre can be reached within a 20min walk. Would totally recommend it.

Jane is extremely helpful and welcoming host! We loved our stay! The room is very cozy and comfortable. Location is great - it's very close to city center, but also a very quiet neighborhood. I definitely recommend to stay at Jane's place and would like to see Jane and Paul again.

I feel so lucky to have choosen this place to stay.
Cozy apartament, comfortable, quiet, spotlessly clean, equipped with every comfort and well server by public transportation.
The neighborhood is beautiful and is short distance from the old town centre.
Jean was incredibly sweet,  thoughful, she helped me with suggestions where to eat, drink beer, on places to see, always available to help me.
I would definitely reccomended Jeanss place to anyone  going to Dublin.
Overall it was great experience!

You can expect to find a gracious and helpful host.
You will find the place to be quite close to most places of interest and there are good bus services.
Perfect and cozy. Good size room with ensuite bathroom.

Jeans place is immaculate and extremely comfortable.
Jean is the best host we have every had, and she is so friendly and accommodating that we return to her house every year while we are in Ireland. 
Its amazing value for money too, very reasonably priced.
The room is very large, bright and clean and the bed is super comfortable.
The en-suite bathroom is small but very adequate and again, super clean.
Jean also leaves some amenities in the room, snacks, coffee, cookies etc.
My husband and I highly recommend this place
Outstanding host and details! So welcoming and nice! Good location, spacious and private room and great travel tips!

What a delightful home! Jean has a beautiful mews cottage with a well stocked rambling garden.
Our room was big enough to lay out our cases and all our stuff
It is private with a great en-suite and a very comfortable bed.
Jean kindly bought me some gluten-free Soda bread for breakfast as I mentioned I am coeliac- and this was unexpected! We could make ourselves breakfast and come and go as we pleased. As far as Airbnb goes Jean excelled her hosting! She told us places to go , buses to catch and cafes and shops to find what we needed.
It is walking distance to town yet quiet and peaceful. In the city but you wake to the sound of birdsong!
Jean is great! So helpful and friendly!

I stayed at Jean's for 4 nights with my boyfriend. The room is perfect with everything you may ever need.  It is very comfortable, it's like a room in one of the best hotels! The house is in a good position: you can easily walk to the main attractions of the city! 
But the best part of our stay was Jean! She's the perfect host! She is very friendly, she gave us precious suggestions and she was always ready to help us! 
I truly racommended this place, it's perfect!

Jeans place was outstanding! The area couldnt have been better- safe, central, and extremely walkable. The only time we needed to use public transportation was for the airport and Howth. The room was sparkling clean, and had everything we needed. Jean was so hospitable and welcoming, and gave some really great suggestions. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and would definitely recommend Jean and her beautiful space to anyone.
Jean is amazing.  She thinks of everything and goes above and beyond to make you comfortable.  Her room is close to everything and really easy to access sights in Dublin

Jean met us right at 1pm check-in.  She was gracious and offered some beverages and snack items in the room.  She went out of her way to help us find our way to Dublin center and also took us to the train station upon departure.  She provided several dvds in lieu of tv.

Jeans stylish home and beautiful garden is an experience in itself. The room is very comfortable with the advantage of the private bathroom. The bus station is very close so you can reach the center of the city in less than 10 minutes. The Airlink Bus  to the Airport is not far away - just a bus stop or a small walk. Lots of coffee houses, pubs and restaurants in the area for breakfast, meal and beer. We definitely had a great time at Jeans and we recommend it.
Jean's place is really pleasant, actually as pleasant as its owner. The area is quiet, safe, with very good restaurants nearby (10-minute walk max) and we loved staying there.

Jean is an awesome host, tending to every detail. The room was clean and warm and inviting. Great location, short cab ride or walk to Dublin center. Jean was also great at suggesting local restaurants and bars for a great local experience during our first trip to Dublin. HIGHLY RECCOMEND!!!!!!!!!!!

This comfortable room is in a perfect , quiet location, just a short walk to Portobello Bridge over the canal to the city center, or to the Luas, which is the light rail system. Several pubs and a coffee shop very close. I couldnt imagine a better location, or a more helpful host.

Jean was friendly, helpful and accommodating. We had great conversations about travel and Ireland.  Her home is beautifully decorated and the room is amazing, clean and spacious. Would absolutely stay again.
Thanks Jean, a great stay.  Look forward to returning on our next visit to Dublin.
Jean is an absolutely attentive and kind host. Her house is lovely, clean, and full of little details for your comfort. We'll definitely go back when we travel to Dublin again.
Jean's place is perfectly situated on the outskirts of Dublin City Centre. It's a convenient 10 minute walk from Temple Bar area which has many attractions and restaurants. We loved Jean's place!

This has got to be one of the best Airbnbs I have ever stayed at.  Jean was very communicative, provided great tips and directions from the airport. The bus from the airport stops about 10 minutes from her house. Jeans place is centrally located so its easy to get around. The bus to central Dublin is about 2 minutes from her house and the neighbourhood is very safe. There are tons of restaurants in the area and pubs. There is a canal 2 minutes from her house which is very beautiful if you want to go for a walk. 

The room exceeded my expectations. It was very clean, lots of towels. She provided tea (tons of selections), coffee (there is an espresso machine in the room!!!), cookies, sparkling water, biscuits and lots of options for breakfast. She went above and beyond to make sure my stay was comfortable. Her daughter was very helpful and friendly as well. 
I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a place in Dublin. You wont be disappointed! 
Thanks Jean :)

Jeans house was the perfect place to stay for a short holiday in Dublin. The room has literally everything you need and all the details are on point.
Everything is very clean and in order. Also the breakfast was very good,a lot of cereals, yoghurt,ham,cheese..
The location is very good, just 20 minutes walk from the main attractions. 
Jean is the best, very nice and kind and really helpful. Definitely recommended!
Jean's place is a home away from home and there is no other person that will make you feel more welcomed than her.

Jean is amazing host at such a wonderful place! She went above and beyond trying to accommodate our needs. Nice room with absolutely everything we could wish, breakfast, coffee, tea, chocolates. Jean has shown us around the neighborhood, and Also gave us a lot of tips on navigating the city. She is very personable and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay at her place!
Super easy, super cozy, super nice! Great location! It was super clean and Jean was very prompt in her replies and suggestions! Recommend!!!
Lovely little place in a great location! Excellent communication with Sean, and I loved that there was a parking spot available within the gated apartment complex.

Location is definitely a highlight for this flat.  It is right within walking distance to many great places, including the Dublinia museum, the Queen of Tarts, and Temple Bar.  

We are a family of four with two small children.   We fit comfortably in the flat as there was also a cot available for our toddler.  It might be too small for four adults.  

The flat was clean and had the basics in case you forgot something.  The sink in the bathroom does not work, so that was problematic for us.  We only stayed one night, so we didnt use the kitchen other than the fridge.
Good location, and a nice place for a good price

Sean has such a great place! It was a great location to explore the city. The apartment had all the amenities we needed during our stay. Sean was great to answer any questions we had and make nice recommendations for us for our trip to Dublin. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to any friends/family staying in Dublin!
Great location but disappointed that after contacting Sean within 2 hours of arriving to advise we had no water in the bathroom basin it was still not resolved after 5 days.

Overall the place was ok. its a tad run down and the bed was smaller than listed. However, its a good secure premise with plenty of free parking and only about 10 minutes walk to the temple bar area. 
Currently theres a fantastic chic restaurant called variety janeù just around the corner, not cheap but well worth a visit.
Location is unbelievable! Parking spot right out front and off street. Two blocks to all Temple Bar area has to offer. A bit sparsely outfitted for a longer stay but perfect for a stopover.

Good location in gated community, and security was good. If you are a good walker, almost all major tourist attractions can be reached on foot.
If using Mytaxi App, make sure you have the correct pick up address (try 45 lamb alley).
Host very ameniable, and borrowed a microwave for our stay at no extra cost. Would recommend to young to middle aged tourists .
Great location! Dublin is a gem! Really easy checkin and had everything you needed.
Great location, Sean was easy to work with, recommended!
Great place to stay! Walking distance to all major attractions, and felt very safe as the apartment is in a gated area. Sean was very easy to communicate with and very accommodating.
All good and close to centre of Dublin, with parking. Couple of things not quite perfect but these will be fixed. Cheers!

If youre looking for a clean place in a great location with a super helpful, responsive host then stay here! Sean was helpful and a speedy communicator. The flat is in the best location with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops and markets around. We would definitely stay here again!

Seans place was everything that we needed for our girls trip to Dublin! The sofa bed in the main living area is a great addition to sleep extra people and very comfortable. Sean was very easy to communicate with and answer any questions that we had. The place is in a great location - short walk to the heart of the city and it is in a small gated area which is a nice added safety feature. I would highly recommend Seans place! Great value.
Great location!

The Best Apartment, The Best Location!!!!
I recommend 100%
Thanks Sean!!!

Location, location, location...this is the best! Plus free parking!
Sean was very helpful at check in. The place is clean.
However, both the bed and sofa bed are very hard. Also, what I assume is the hot water heater in the closet in the hallway makes a very loud noise anytime someone flushes the toilet or uses the shower.

Great central location with easy bus/taxi service. The people we interacted with from food service to tourist hot spots were all fantastic. A very tourist friendly town and from what we kept hearing - the weather was perfect!

Items of note: unit contains nespresso machine and a French press for coffee! Kettle for hot water. Stove and small oven. Microwave. Fridge. Clothes washer/dryer in one appliance. Hairdryer. Iron and Board.  Plenty of soaps, shampoo, etc appear to be left by previous guests. Pleasant surprise!
Recomendo
A parking spot included for this apartment in a lovely neighborhood. Comfortable bed in a small bedroom. Enjoyed the living area and greatly appreciated the washer/dryer
I'm going to echo everyone else: this location is superb. Walking distance to pretty much all the Dublin highlights. The apartment itself was very nice too. Would definitely stay here again.

Overall this place is A+. What you see is exactly what you get. 2 of us were here for 6 nights comfortably. Laundry and full kitchen was a great asset. Awesome location and never felt unsafe. Very easy to communicate with Sean during booking, before arrival and during stay. 10/10 recommend.

Sean's apartment is a lovely place - perfect for a family or anyone wanting 2 private sleeping areas.  Sparkling clean, tastefully furnished, and very comfortable..  The location is great - right by Christ's Church, so in walking distance fro everything, but not in the tourist thicket.  Sean was very helpful and made checking in and out very easy.

Seans place was a great find for us. We have two kids, one in a travel cot, and the space worked well for us. I slept in the bed with our oldest and my husband slept on pull out couch to be closer to the baby. Both bed and couch were comfortable. The best part of this flat is the location. We stepped out the door to the right and had easy access to temple bar area, the brazen head (ate there the first evening -5 min walk) and other tourist sites. Had lunch at Queen of Tarts-very yummy. Ten minutes to the left is Guinness. We used the bus to get to Bray for a day. But, if you dont plan to leave Dublin you wouldnt need a bus if you stay here. A couple people said the location wasnt the safest but we had no problem. We were not out after dark, but the building is gated for extra security. The second best thing about the place is how well it is stocked. It had extra sheets/pillows. Kitchen stuff, etc...  washer/dryer comes in handy when traveling with little kids. Nice spot for shoes and stuff inside locker door but not yet in living room. We would stay here again!
Sean is lovely; great place
Great location, great value! Would recommend!
Great location, close to both Temple Bar area and the Guinness Storehouse. Sean was super helpful and gave us a good run down of the best spots to go.
Although this apartment was in a great location, there could have been better upkeep. We found mold in several places and the overall apartment had a musty smell.

You will not get a better location here. You're minutes away from all of the good tourist stops in Dublin but far enough away from City Centre that you can sleep at night.  Sean is a very responsive host and can answer any question you need. The apartment is on the small side but perfect if you plan on only using it as home base in between adventures.

Seans place has amazing proximity to everything we needed - so much so that the only transport we paid for was the Airport Express bus in and out.  There were some minor items inside the unit that require some TLC but the location far outweighed any slight tweaks.

Absolutely great location! Sean let me check-in early as my flight got in early in the morning. My sister took the bedroom and I had the pull out couch which was very comfortable. Sean was responsive right away with any questions I had and fixed a burnt out light bulb right away. You can literally walk to everything from here but the immediate area is very quiet and felt very safe. The Spar right on the corner is very convenient as well.
Great location, safe and lots of places in walking distance
Sean is a great guy and was super helpful on giving us tips on what is around the apartment to see and do. Great location!

Great location; about a 10 minute walk to Temple Bar and Guinness. Very close to public transportation as well.  We took the airlink to/from the airport and it was seamless.  The apartment was cozy and check-in and out was very easy.

Sean's place was absolutely ideal for my party of 3. As central and secure as can be, very little street noise considering the location. Fantastic value for being halfway between the Guinness Storehouse and Temple Bar for those so inclined. Hoping to return when next back in town for a gig. Vicar Street just a stone's throw away.

This Airbnb was an amazing location! Walking distance to all the top tourist attractions and stores, including grocery stores. Really appreciated the locked facility, the area felt safe. Host was very accommodating with early arrivals! Some negatives..the beds were not very comfortable and there was some issues with the cleanliness of the bathroom. Overall, a good stay!

Sean is an amazing host.  Prompt responses, very flexible, excellent recommendations, clean and well located space.  Short walk to a lot of local sights.  We would stay again if we ever come to Dublin.

Sean's place is in a terrific location. All the major sites in Dublin are easily walkable. The few times we called, a taxi arrived in minutes. We took the Aerobus from the airport, and it has a stop just a couple of blocks away. The condo is secure, quiet, and clean. There are nice restaurants and grocery stores nearby. We spent a week at the place and enjoyed every day there. I don't we could have found a better place in the city.

Sean's  place  was a wonderful place to stay for three of us.  The inens are so clean and comfortable. Kitchen  is very convenient.   The location is great. We could walk  to everyplace we want to see in Dublin.  It is also a very safe place.    Since I lost internet access in Ireland,  I worried about  check-in. But Sean soon arranged his helper to came and helped us for check-in.  
We  recommend  Sean's place for anyone who want to explore Dublin!
Nice flat, very well connected. Very easy to interact with Sean who was always ready to help and find solutions!

Great location!
Parking space is a big bonus.

Had a great stay

Good location from the city center, very friendly owner who is willing to give you the tips of the city. Location excellent for a couple when you are mainly visiting to see the city and not spend too much time in the house.
Amazing location, walking distance to most tourist attractions and cute coffee shops and the oldest pub in Dublin.

We loved this flat! So different, and in a wonderful area. We were closer to everything than we thought! A small space, but just fine for our family of four...and had the neatest little details. This was a fun addition to our trip! Thank you!!
Very clean, and awesome experience
Leuke Airbnb op een top lokatie.
A beautiful space not far from the centre! Would highly recommend!

This is a great house in a central part of Dublin! Once you arrive you are instantly comfortable. The fireplace was so cozy! We are a small family with a 7yo and had no trouble during our stay. There was a mix-up in the schedule and the house hadnt been cleaned before our arrival, but Michael made sure to get it taken care of right away. We were very appreciative of the care that went into our stay. A major bonus for me was the amazing shower, it worked great and provided much needed rejuvenation! 
Highly recommend staying here.
Thanks for creating that marvellous apartment full of light, we felt like home, esp. after heating the batteries and fireplace. Excellent location, everything in walking distance.
Absolutely awesome place, Micheal was a great host, super accommodating and the place is also walking distance from anything you need. Definitely would recommend staying here short or long stay
Die Wohnung liegt sehr ruhig und nicht weit vom Zentrum entfernt.Sie ist weiter zu empfehlen.

The apartment was very well located and a very pleasant place to stay. The space was clean and accommodated 4 travelers comfortably and we especially loved having a fireplace in the home. The second bedroom does get to be a bit stuffy as there is little circulation in that room but it was easy to freshen up the second floor by opening the patio door. Overall, an excellent choice for our visit to Ireland to experience Dublin and its charms!
We had a great time at Micheals place! He was very responsive and helpful. The home had everything we expected and included a booklet with history of the home and great recommendations.

This place was great! It was so unique, clean and comfortable and we had everything we needed. The hosts are fantastic and it was within a 10-20 min walk to most of the popular attractions. It is also less than a half hour away from the airport.

Perfect place! Walking distance to everything you would want to see. Exceptionally clean, and cleverly appointed.  Michael responded to all our questions, both ahead of and during our stay. The glass floored hallway is fabulous! There is a interesting book describing how this little house came to be; if you stay here, please read it. If we are back in Dublin, we will stay here again!
Location was absolutely perfect, home felt very comfortable and safe, lovely neighbors, overall a wonderful time.

A creatively-designed space that is flooded with light and is very private, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the nearby cafes and being able to walk everywhere. We had a lovely time and would recommend it to everyone.
Great location!
Really great place within walking distance to many places within Dublin. A little tricky to find initially but check in was seamless and the hosts were lovely. Would defiantly recommend!
Michael's place is wonderful! It's within easy walking of many places. Comfortable beds with extra pillows (my husband thanks you). We would definitely stay again!

This place is gorgeous! The use of space is brilliant and although its small it didnt feel it with four adults in. The location is perfect, only a ten minute walk to the river. Michael was so helpful and accommodating. Would highly recommend a stay here if youre visiting Dublin. Thanks, Michael!

Great location, clean space and very stylish! Michael was super nice and very prompt if I had any questions. Would recommend to anyone especially if location is big for you! My sister and I walked to most places which was very nice!

Great stylish place in an interesting location. Just around the corner from a bit of everything. My friend and I had a short stay but it was perfect to explore Dublin and recharge batteries at night.

Such a treat to stay in a design haven. We come from Copenhagen so appreciated the style.

Highly recommend
We enjoyed our time in this cute little town house - great design features. It was maybe a little small for our family of four with suitcases.
Tolle Lage, sauber und super Gastgeber
Sadly the house was not as clean as we expect it. There were dirty sheets with some yellow spots and not enough towels. It looks a little chaotic to us.
Well equipped house in a quiet location, at a walking distance from everything.

This place was so cool! Loved the unique hallway, staircase, and indoor/outdoor patio. The location was great and very close to St. Patricks Cathedral, Christ Church Cathedral and the Guinness Storehouse so we were able to walk everywhere.  Even Trinity College is walkable from here (about 30 min). It was definitely snug for four adults but it really doesnt matter when youre spending all your time out and about. My partner and I slept on the pullout couch while his parents had the realù bed and to be honest I slept like a rock! We didnt have a car so not sure how easy parking would be but wifi was great.
A light,airy and comfortable home - good location for the city centre approx 10 min walk.

This was our first experience using Airbnb and it exceeded our expectations.  Nicely designed home for a short or long visit to the city.  We found it easy to get to with plenty of available parking.  Great location within walking distance to great restaurants and all attractions.
Nice place. Conveniently located to downtown and popular points of interest.
So glad we found this beautiful space! Right downtown and close to everything, lovely home. Thanks again!

We had a great stay at this lovely house. We really liked its fantastic architecture and felt very comfortable. The location was really quiet and we had just a short way to City Centre. We can absolutely recommend!
Cute space and good location!
Walking distance and a stylish setting.  We loved the fireplace and the architect plans and excavation materials were really interesting.  Its a hidden gem!

This home is in an absolutely perfect location to explore Dublin by foot. We parked our car on arrival and didn't need it again until the day we left. We stayed 4 nights and loved it. It was super clean. We loved the fireplace at night. It has everything you need for a great stay. Michael was super helpful. We loved his guidebook and learning about how he created his architectural masterpiece in such a small space. One of our favorite pubs, The Liberty Bell, was a super short walk away. We ducked in there our first evening because of the rain, and it ended up being one of our favorites during our stay.
Great place and location.
Great accomodation, clean, space oriented, glass floor and roof (nice idea and a lot of light). Quiet area, 15 min walk to the city centre, 10 min walk to Jameson distilery :)

Unusual but attractive and generally functional space in a nice townhouse enclave/neighborhood.  Within walking distance (a mile and a half or less) to almost everything most people might be interested in.  Downstairs living room is a bit small, but we never got in before midnight so had little use for it.   (If you're in Dublin and get in before midnight then you might want to consider a different destination--say Lourdes or the Vatican--the next time you travel.) There's a gas fireplace in addition to a central heating system to shed the morning chill.  Kitchen was quite functional, although I'd have killed for a drip multi cup coffee maker.  Would definitely recommend to friends.
Great location and comfortable space!

Apartment is certainly nice but not what I expected. The furniture is different than the photos (and not as nice). The corner suite is next to a major construction site, which actually creates a terrible view. The apartment is located in a very isolated part of town. Great restaurants within a 10 minute walk but the building itself is empty. When I mentioned to the host that there was a homeless person sleeping outside both nights I was there, his response was, "I prefer not to get involved with these things."

The apartment is outstanding.  Key points:
-Lovely balcony deck view or quay
-Easy check-in and out
-Clean and modern
-Lots of amenities inside
-Comfortable beds and nice linens
-Easy access and convenient to city
-Great restaurants nearby

Some have mentioned there is a construction zone next door but hours of construction are very limited and reasonable.  I would not say it will detract from your enjoyment of the space.  The noise is not bad and it appears construction work will be done very soon.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Exactly as described, great location and great host.
The location is excellent and convenient to public transport.  I would stay there again if I came back to visit.

Beautiful location and nice view, but a very noisy floor that is shared with two other airbnb rooms. So it might be a single room, but I experienced it more as a hostel in terms of noise. Facilities were alright.
An excellent place next to the airport and train. Theres a beautiful beach, witch has amazing view.

Excellent location. Right on the dart line which, makes commuting easy. The 102 bus is right outside the dart station and it takes you to and from the airport.
A few downsides is that the place appears to be a run down and it was very cold inside. Value and price wise was okay, but there are better places in Dublin. You get what you pay for.

Nice place to stay. Very good idea to paint the house in blue. Easy to find. From the single-bed room a view to the sea. 

A 3 minute walk to train and bus station. Supermarket 15 minutes away. You can go to the City by dart (train).
Great comfortable stay!

Inese's house is easily accessible by DART or bus, and local amenities like a supermarket are just a short walking distance away. The single room is spotless, has a comfortable bed and a lovely view of the sea. You will find a great place for a short stay on the East coast of Dublin.
Es un lugar imperdible e impecable
Enjoyed my stay with Inese and she was very friendly and the house is in a lovely location

I would recommend this place if you will have a rental car while you are in Ireland. I didn't have one so I was planning on using the public bus system. The bus to get to Dublin or Howth is a 15 minute walk and then to Dublin is about a 45 minute ride. The bus that is straight across from the house is the 102 which is a private company, city bus passes don't work, that runs to the airport. On one morning I was doing a tour but it left around 7am and I had to take a taxi to that because the buses went running yet, just an fyi, that one is my bad I should have checked. But all that said once I finally got to the house everything was set up as was sent in the instructions. Check in was super easy. The room was clean and comfy. I could see the ocean inbetween the houses that were across the street. And the WiFi was fairly easy to connect to and had a strong connection.
Very good location, friendly hosts, beautiful Ireland
Perfect for working in dublin

Inese's accommodation is one of the best options if you want to stay near nature and to have a nice walk at the seaside every morning and afternoon. You can find all the services nearby. If you want to do a really amazing trip, start your trip walking from Inese's house along the scenic route to the cliffs of Howth. If you have the chance like I had you can see seals fishing their food in the sea. So try it, and enjoy yourself in Dublin with a good pint of Guiness.
Very comfortable beds
Great place to stay, close to main attractions and train into city centre. Highly recommend!

Elaine's airbnb is perfectly located in the city center. Well isolated from the outside, it also offers a quiet environment to rest if needed. The apartement is well furnished with all the required amenities to feel like home! I definitely recommend it.

Elaine and her husband Con were true super hosts, they were very helpful and accommodating during our stay. The flat was perfect, had everything we need and the location couldn't have been better. Thank you :)
Great location, perfect size for our need (three guys using it mainly for sleeping). Only bad part was the toilet, which had bad flow and was easily clogged.
Fantastic location and lovely apartment. Malcom was great with letting us check in earlier and allowing us to check out later. Thank you for a lovely stay.
Excellent location
≈öwietnia lokalizacja, brak bezpo≈õredniego kontaktu z w≈Ça≈õcicielem. Warunki do≈õƒá dobre.
Great location and super helpful host!

The apartment needs a deep cleaning. The photos look great, but do not reflect the actual state of the apartment. All closets are full with clothes, objects and dirty towels of somebody that probably lives there sometimes. The kitchen is a chaos. There was only 1 knife in an apartment with 4 beds. The TV doesnt work. The rooms are full with spiderwebs. The bathroom has stains everywhere. I expected a bit more for $200. $200 is probably cheap for an apartment for 4, but That is no justification for delivering a dirty apartment. We had a great time in Dublin, luckily not having to spend it in the apartment, one night there was a party somewhere, or maybe it was Mulligans pub. I was dead tired, so I slept,  but there wasa lot of noise. Malcolms responses are friendly, but he did not respond when I asked where to get the key.. stressed me out. In the end my mom called him to get response.  Kisses to everyone!

The apartment is spacious and has a great location in Dublin.  It is a bit shabby, but clean and neat with good tips for travelers and an adequate kitchen.  It could use a new doble mattress and new linens.  Malcolm did not always respond as quickly as I would have liked and didn't follow through with helping us make a duplicate set of keys, necessary because there is only one set of keys, however he was very polite.

The flat was in a super location and was clean and well presented, however we would have appreciated a response from Malcolm to any of our messages prior to arrival. 
When I went to pick up the keys the girl in the laundrette had no idea what I was talking about. We got the keys in the end, however it would be worth mentioning to the staff there so they are aware of such arrangements.
The washing machine wasnt working and there was no toilet roll when we arrived, we had to dash out and buy some. 
Also, only being provided one set of keys for a two roomed apartment for two couples was a little inconvenient and required us all to come and go en masse.
All that being said, we did overall enjoy our stay in Dublin.
We loved Dublin. The apartment  is in a great, central location and Malcolm was always available  to help us with all our queries.
considering price for city centre this place was ok.

Great location.  Have to walk 500m to a laundry business to pick up keys.  There are some cleanliness issues in the apartment (mold in bathroom, and dusty vents) - everything else is clean. Some of the electrical outlets were not working / visibly broken, the coffee machine didn't work - no channels on TV. There is a "utility closet" that houses water heating and is particularly noisy whenever going to bathroom.
Fantastic location in the Centre if Dublin with only a short walk to Temple Bar! We had a great weekend

Location of the apartment was fantastic and it was very easy to get in touch with Malcolm and check in.  
Unfortunately the lights in a couple of rooms didnt work, the apartment looked more tired than the pictures and the level of cleanliness was poor.
Good location

Superb location within walking distance of many attractions. Try checking in before or after rush hour as traffic can become heavily congested.  The best way to the location is definitely by bus or taxi. Overall a great experience!

Malcolm was easy to get in touch with over the phone but a little tougher on chat. 

The apartment was nice and well price however the bathroom could have done with more of a clean in our opinion. There was also a really really loud rave the first night which went onto till 3am, not sure if it was organised by the apartments but their windows were open so suggests it may happen a lot?

Easy to find and easy to gain access too as well. 

Overall it was a great place to stay and was very close to temple bar, thanks for letting us all stay!
Malcolm was always quick to respond to any questions we had. We arrived in Dublin before our check-in time and he was helpful in getting us checked in as soon as he could.
Nice stay and a great location thanks again

Basic accommodation in a great location.
It was perfect for what we needed. A deep clean, clear out and changing a few light bulbs would go a long way to making this a great place.

The location of the apartment was in a good area close to main attractions and bars and the only true highlight to the place. The cleanliness of the apartment was not to a suitable standard and no lights worked in the second bedroom. The beds were very uncomfortable and the apartment is located in a noisy area of the complex. The check in process was a bit inconvenient as we had to pick up the keys from a laundry place which wasnt communicated to us prior and the lady working there didnt know anything about the keys as this was not communicated to her. Overall it was an underwhelming experience. Best to spend minimal time in the apartment if choosing to stay here.  Great but expensive location to store your bags.
Exactly as expected!  Comfy sleep, close to all the fun. Clean.

Location is as advertised but the unit and building itself are showing some serious signs of wear & tear. If you have a car getting around is very difficult. The unit itself has no parking and the nearest lot is a 10 minute walk ( 15 minute drive due to 1 way streets ) and will set you back about $25 euros/ night. If you are there to party and simply looking for a crashpad it will be perfect, if you are looking for something a bit more comfortable you might want to consider other options.
Very convenient but needs modernising to bring up to standard
Great location and easy. Nice guy. Need to clean up the bathroom and theres a room without lights.

This apartment is extremely well located close to the entertainment district of Dublin and Trinity College.  You can easily walk to many of Dublins attractions from here. 

It is up two floors, but there is an elevator. The apartment is compact, but has all you need for 4 people.

Zeer moeizame communicatie met de verhuurder(s), lastig als je graag je reis een beetje op voorhand inplant. Het appartement is leuk gelegen en goed voor korte verblijven, maar verwacht geen buitensporige luxe.

Ottima posizione. 
Appartamento e servizi un po' trascurati, avrebbe bisogno di revisione
Nice place, just what we were looking for. Great location in Dublin.

If youre looking for something in the right location then this is the place for you. Everything is in walking distance and we felt safe the whole time. The beds were comfortable and there is plenty of storage,

 But it does need a bit of tlc and a deep clean (especially the bathroom.)

Communication with us was poor. It couldve been bad timing on our part and we did have several questions but of all the texts, calls and messages we sent 1 call was answered, and only 1 question was answered via text.

 There was only one set of keys which was a little inconvenient as well.

 If this place is given a bit of a sort out and you find the tv remote it will be excellent!

Malcolms apartment is in a great location for the citys places to see. Most places walkable. The space is comfortable. We were 3 older women and it was great. The building is old and fairly typical of an inner city space of that vintage. 
The key pick up was organised the day before and went very smoothly. We arrived in the evening and Malcolm made arrangements to suit that timing.

The appartment is perfectly situated in a quiet area although very close to the centre and the temple bar area. It wasnt the most charming appartment but it has all the basic needs that one requires.
Perfect for a family or a small party since it has two bedrooms.
Malcom was very quick answering our questions.
We picked up the keys in a nearby laundry, no problem
Thomas and Maria
Great location close to Temple Bar area
Great location close to Temple Bar for a night out. Easy to walk to/ from but far enough away so no noise. Collect keys from the friend. Close enough to walk to Trinity College and Grafton Street.
You will love the location.
Our stay in Dublin was really great. The apartment er has a really good location and is perfect for 4 people to stay. We are defiantly booking this place for our next trip to Dublin.!

If you can afford it, youll be glad you treated yourself! Rachel and Alans refurbished historic home overlooking a tree filled park is so spacious and tastefully decorated! It was perfect for our adult family of four! It is located a comfortable walk from the EPIC museum and  a quick taxi to Dublins other main tourist attractions.

This is a beautiful home in a perfect location.  It's very quiet on the park and yet easy to walk to many interesting and historic areas.  We pretty much walked everywhere since it was so convenient.  And the home itself is just as nice as the pictures suggest--beautiful, clean and very stylish.  The perfect place!

Great place located in a cute neighborhood.  Walk out to a really friendly park full of Dubliners and their dogs!  Just a block or two from the River Liffey, the Grand Canal and Trinity College.  Beautiful sunsets in the master bedroom.  Lots of easy food options when you tire of bars and Guinness.  And yes, they have cable TV!  Rachel was super gracious the whole way.  We loved the space.
Amazing place and location!
A perfect home, host was outstanding with special touches to make us feel so welcome.  Very well positioned in Dublin for the tourist places as well as new, shiny harbour area.

Rachels home is a beautifully appointed, spacious and welcoming place to stay for a visit to Dublin.  It is located very close to  the new Docklands area, and overlooks a lovely little park.  Beautiful comfortable beds, and the extra treat of an Aga stove made it an ideal base for our visit to Dublin.

Rachel's townhouse was perfect for me and two of my coworkers for a work trip. There was enough space for us to have our own private areas, but the communal area was great for collaboration. The location was safe and quiet at night and close to our office on the Grand Canal Docks. Downtown was about a 20 min walk and easy taxi ride.
