The apartment felt extremely safe & secure. Cant wait to come back to Dublin!

Paul's place was amazing! Great location & very clean. I went with three girl friends & I would recommend a family or a group of friends to stay here. Paul was great with the check in instructions. The apartment complex was a little confusing, but Paul's instructions were perfect & made it simple for us! I would definitely stay here again.
Great place and location
Myself and my 2 teenagers stayed 2 nights here. Great location, very secure, had everything we needed.

The location was perfect and the apartment was just what we were looking for. Super clean, quiet location, enough space so that we weren't on top of each other. We could walk to the major sites. Highly recommended!
Perfect location, communicative host, everything you need.
We enjoyed our stay in Dublin and at this apartment. It is in a convenient location and we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see and do.

We had a great time in Dublin. The location of this apartment was perfect!  It was very clean and quiet, within walking distance to everything. We would definitely recommend it to our friends and family.
A wonderful stay in a fantastic location. We were  so close to everything. The apartment was ideal for our stay .
This place is fabulous. Great location.
This amazing apartment is minutes away from everything you could hope for, absolutely best if the best!

Staying at Paul and Debbie's was a delight.  The central location was the main selling point for us, as we wanted to be able to walk to as many local attractions as possible.  Bus and train access was also immediately available for those days we took tours or ventured a little out into the country side.  The unit itself also had everything we needed for our week in Dublin.  Kitchen , washer and dryer, TV and 2 comfortable bed rooms kept us fed, clean, entertained, and well rested.  And Paul was quick to answer the few questions we did have (by email, we knew he was in a very different time zone).

Absolutely incredible location!!  Everything was as described. Clean, comfortable and easily accessible to everything. Could not have been happier with our accommodations. Thank you to Paul and we would recommend this apartment wholeheartedly!!
Really nice appartment in the heart of the city centre of Dublin. Everything was 100% ok

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It was very clean and within walking distance to many of Dublins attractions. The owner was on site when we arrived and was very welcoming and friendly. We would stay here again if we make another trip to Dublin.

The apartment is in a great location. We never felt unsafe and the train is right outside that goes into Dublin. The view is amazing from the huge deck and the apartment was very clean. I would definitely recommend this apartment to anyone.

We stayed at this apartment for a week while visiting touring around Dublin. The apartment is a 1 minute walk from the street car stop which runs very frequently. There was a review about it being in a shady area and we didnt get that vibe at all. For the price of this apartment you cant beat the location, amenities.
Nice flat with a nice view.
Liz n Steve were gresr Hists and made us feel right at home, Bus right outside the door  and local knowledge was fabulous. Recommend anytime...
Liz and her husband Stephen have a lovely setup, and are convenient and friendly. Simple but effective, made our stay in Dublin quite pleasant! Would stay again.
Tres jolie maison, accessible de dublin en bus.
Great place to stay ! We had a wonderful time. The house is lovely and the hosts are very kind and helpful. We felt at home
Rien de particulier tout est ok

We enjoyed our stay at Liz's place. The breakfast provided was wonderful with homemade bread, and Liz gave very helpful tips for locations to visit. The washroom was smaller than expected but if you have no accessibility requirements it should not be a major issue. Overall it was a lovely experience and fit our needs nicely!
Hello Danny, Thanks for being a great host, it was staying at home for me , very secured, great amenities, centrally located
Excellent space and location! Ali is very helpful!!
Ali was a great host. Gave us super detailed instructions to ensure that we arrive correctly. Everything is reachable by a short walk from the apartment.

My sister and i had a great stay at Alis. It is very well located (about a 15-20 min walk to multiple cathedrals, bars, restaurants, and other attractions). Her place was very clean and she even left us a bit of food for breakfast. Overall great stay.

Muy  bien ubicado, a un paso del centro y en un barrio con mucho encanto. Muy bien de precio, y con todo lo necesario. Ali muy atenta a nuestra llegada, y respondiendo a todas las cuestiones que le planteamos. Lo recomiendo sin duda!
Ali's place is cozy and nice , and she is kind and frendly host. She prepared lot of information and advices for our journey. Great location out of crowd but near to everything. Highly recomended!

I enjoyed my stay at Ali's home.  She was very prompt in her responses to my emails and even though she'd be out of town when I arrived, she arranged to have her dad meet me at the apartment and get me situated.  She also made sure I had the essentials for breakfast.  The apartment itself is not as close to the city center as I expected but the bus stops to and from the center were very close to the apartment.  I had a Leap Visitor card and though it was a 20-30 min between buses, it all worked out.  I'd recommend her place to anyone wanting a quiet and comfortable place to stay in Dublin.
A lovely bright room in quiet area but with fantastic access to the South Dublin seaside. A delicious and most welcome light breakfast every morning!
I really enjoyed staying at Emers Airbnb, would really recommend it and would come back again if I come back to Dun Laoghaire
It was a pleasure to stay at Emers house. Breakfast is included and she took care all is okay for us. it is a nice bright room on the first floor with garden view.
Great location, lovely stylish house and helpful host
Great communications and very obliging

Amazing location - the train could not be more convenient, and there was a lot of great stuff within a few minutes walk if you want to stay closer to home. The apartment has everything you need for a very comfortable stay, and Michael is *very* responsive to any questions. I'd definitely stay here again on my next Dublin visit.

We stayed at Michaels for St. Patricks Day and it was amazing! The studio looked just as described. The place is far enough outside of the city centre so we were not bothered by crazy crowds but right across from some bus stops to easily get into the city quickly. We would recommend this place for anyone staying in Dublin!

Michael is a great bloke, really quick to respond to any questions and was there to meet us.
Parking is excellent, to the side and free. Which means you can walk into dublin, we walked to botanic gardens, chester beaty library, jameson distillery and pubs etc.
Apartment itself is in a building with several other apartments so there is a bit of noise from them, not too much tho. 
Wifi, shower, tv all fine, no problems. Grateful for this place to stay for a family wedding.

We had a great time in this apartment! It's exactly as described, small but had everything we needed (including some snacks, everything needed for the bathroom, etc). Communication, check-in and check-out were very smooth (Michael even let us check-out late since he didn't have any guests). Michael was very nice to provide a list of suggestions for places in the neighborhood. Would definitely recommend!
Amazing apartment right off the Luas and not too far from the bus station. Place was so clean and cant beat the amenities! Michael has some great recommendations on where to go and what to do.

The house was cosy and super lovely. Much better than we did expect. There's a LUAS (tram) stop just opposite which takes you to the city centre in less than 15 minutes. Would absolutely recommend and repeat if I were to come back in Dublin. Michael and John were really nice and attentive.
Michaels place was equipped with everything we needed. It was very clean and located right next to a tram station in a quite neighborhood. We would definitely come back again!

We had a lovely stay at Michaels place during our 4-day visit to Dublin. Check-in was easy and quick. The neighborhood was nice and quiet but still close enough to walk to the city center in about 20 minutes. Theres also a LUAS station right across the street as well as easy access to buses. Michael had a ton of great suggestions on restaurants, pubs, and things to do. We also discovered Two Boys Brew, a 5 minute walk away, which had excellent breakfast and coffee. All in all, a fantastic stay and highly recommend!

We had a lovely stay at Michaels place. Check in was easy, the apartment was clean and well equipped. Michael was very kind and suggested us some pubs and restaurants. The apartment is located in phibsborough. Its easy to reach the city center with the tram, there is a tram stop right across the street. Highly recommended!
Nice and cozy flat! Perfect for two. Great bakery nearby, and the flat is only a few steps away from the tram station to take you into the city center!
Recomended
Gute Lage und alles Notwendige vorhanden. Kann man auf jeden Fall weiterempfehlen!

The apartment was perfect for our stay. It was very clean and in the apartment we had everything we need. The location is just great. Easy to get to the city center and to the airport. Michael gave us helpful recommendations in the nearby area. We had a great stay and highly recommend this accommodation.
This is a very clean, quiet and cozy room convenient to the Luas. Its got old Dublin area charm with some do not missù local pubs (Gravediggers) and bakery (Clarkes) within walking distance.
Great location right off the metro. Michaels communication was fantastic. Very clean and cozy space!

Michael's place was super easy to get to and check in/check out. He made every effort to communicate with us and provide local tips. The location is across the street from Luas, which is a quick and easy way to get into the city center. We definitely recommend the place, as we found it to be a great value!

Michael's place is perfectly located (the luas is literally across the street, this is so convenient when you get caught in the rain), it is extremely clean, and exactly as you see it in the pictures. I loved it.

This place is a gem. On the north side of Dublin, it is close to the train which takes you quickly into the city downtown where you can walk just about anywhere. We enjoyed coming back to our Airbnb which was our own spot.  The bed was comfy and we enjoyed having the window open for. A light breeze.  There is a TV but we never used it. We liked having our own fridge, and range for cooking. We went to a nearby Tesco (a 20 minute walk) and got a few things for sandwiches, snacks and it was nice having a place for them in the house. Coming from America, it was unique having the toilet separate from the shower, but that was also really nice. Lastly, Michaels recommendations were great and his directions were excellent. He replied pretty quick and we were so glad we stayed there and not in a hotel. Hoping to come back soon.
The space and location were great! Right on the train line, which made it very convenient. Michael was easy to communicate with and helpful. Would highly recommend staying here!
Michael was always very reliable and helpful. Good organisation and tips, so you feel yourself in good hands directly from the beginning of the stay.
Great little spot in Dublin! Very close to essentials like grocerys, public transportation, and local spots. Very cute apartment designed in just the perfect way for the space!
Great location and amenities. Kate and Barry were excellent hosts.

Barry, Kate,
Well all I can say .....its been (Website hidden by Airbnb) Vinnie Jones moment ...All the best !!!
Do yourself a favor and stay with Barry! The hotel-like room makes up for the not -in-city-centerù location. He is really helpful, welcoming, and makes sure you feel right at home!

Barry and Kate are good-vibes hosts. Their house is nice and tidy and located in very lovely neighborhood. From the beginning, I felt very welcome and I enjoyed the chats over cup of tea. :) I would definitely recommend staying at Barry's place if you are planning a stay in Dublin.
Barry and Kate are wonderful human beings and so very friendly. You won't find anywhere better
Berry's accomodation was perfect for us.  very nice contact, check in very pleasant and the room with the mattress bed very very comfortable, we really felt welcome.  highly recommended! Thanks
Barry was very hospitable and friendly. Quiet neighborhood with easy access via bus to city center. Stylish and clean place.
Super !

Nice room very close to the center of Dublin 
And a super nice host

Our stay at Barry's was overall great. We received some good advice on the city transport so that even though the place isn't directly in the centre, getting to the city or airport couldn't be easier. 
The house was very lovely and conveniently located, basically all you need (shops, restaurants, pubs) is in 5 minutes walking distance. 
We'll be happy to visit again.
I recommend Barry and his place for everyone who is looking for an authentic Irish experience. The flat is well furnished and the host made sure that our needs are met. We really enjoyed our stay.
Great place for a quick stay! Next to train for Dublin which was very convienent

Had a great stay here! It was very close to the train and bus station making it very easy to get to the airport and to the center of Dublin! The place was great and was exactly as described. Inese was very quick to respond to any questions making our stay quite pleasant. Would absolutely recommend to all and i would definitely stay here again!
It was a great stay. The house is near the DART station, but it isn't disturbing. Close to shop and cafe. Really recommend.

A few good things about this place is that it is close to the Railway link to the city centre and has parking on premises. 

Our check in was meant to be at 3 PM but the host messaged to say that the room will be ready only at 5PM. We were driving down from Dublin so we requested for the check in at 3PM as on the website but the host simply said NO and was not apologetic at all. We had to change our schedule and arrive later because of this. Tried to reach her on the mobile but the calls were unanswered and went to voicemail. 

The room is quite small and not well decorated. Its just a room with beds. No control over heating as well. There is a roof  window for skylight but it cannot be covered so be ready for sunlight whether you like it or not.

The bathroom was just messy. The hand shower was just leaking all over the place.

We were not even received by the host. Her husband let us in and gave us the keys to the room. Inese did not even think it was necessary to come and explain about the check in goof up on her part.

Our recommendation would be to avoid this place.
Very nice accommodation near the train station ! The decoration is really pretty and the host is very nice !
Ottima posizione per i servizi pubblici.  Spartana ,  molto graziosa la stanza, una vera casa irlandese..

Ineses place located in a very comfortable place which is between Howth and Dublin. The train station is literally next to the house so its convenient to go to Dublin City centre and Howth. 

Inese and Alex are nice and helpful as well. I will recommend others to select their place.
Nice place exactly as expected and as described. Close to train station for easy traveling. Suites close to beautiful area.
Triple room was great for the 3 of us! Location is great for walking to Howth and right by the train for a quick trip to central Dublin. Clean and lovely!

The place looked just like the pictures. The location was absolutely perfect. Pretty close to Dublin city center and to the airport. It was nice that it wasnt in the city. Plenty of things to walk to and see.
Very clean. Good location. Well worth the money
The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious. Stores and restaurants are just a short walk away and the water is viewable from the bathroom.

The room for three had plenty of space and the beds were comfortable. There is only one bathroom for all guests but we didnt find that to be a problem. It takes a bit to get into Dublin but the building is right near the train and the bus to the airport. All in all for sure a good stay for budget travelers!
Sale inadapte

Room is comfortable and location is very good: right beside Sutton train station. From there you can go anywhere in Dublin very fast. Inese was very helpful giving us a lot of useful tips for the city and answering our doubts promptly.

Inese was a very friendly host, even if we didn't see her very much. The rooms were perfectly clean and there was a bus station close to the house with busses directly to Dublin. Only thing missing was a place to eat, but we knew that before (as it's written in the description). So especially if you're out visiting Dublin all day there's everything you need at Inese's. Thanks for having us!
Je recommande

You get what you pay for here. It's basic and very convenient for travel. The Sutton/Howth area is a beautiful place that I definitely hope to visit again! 

We stayed in the room for 3 for 2 nights. This had a double bed and single bed. The single bed you can't see in the pictures but it was there!

The house is quiet except for passing trains but we all slept well. 

I would recommend this if you are just using it as a place to sleep for a couple of nights as it works as a convenient place to stay with no cooking facilities or "frills" such as a TV.

Out room was very clean and the house is located north of Dublin quite close to Sutton Dart station. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the city center from there. Ineses husband was very kind and offered us some local tips. Overall, we had a great stay at their place and I would recommend it to anyone since it is very good value for money although it doesnt have a kitchen (as it is specified) and the fridge is quite small.
Overall a very simple place to crash. If you are looking for simple and affordable, and plan to spend your time out and about, this works well.
We already miss that place. Great location, near to everything we've wanted :)
Nice spot, great location close to the rail station, easy to get downtown and to the airport
Very nice stay in Sutton.
Beautiful sea-side scenery close by (Howth) and VERY friendly host/accommodation. Great stay also for Dublin.
Nice place near seashore and railway station. Twenty minutes to get to the city center.

Joan's place has many amenities near by. Supermarket is nearby, bus stop is near by and it's a short walk to the Guinness storehouse, Teeling distillery and St James Hospital. We stayed 6 weeks and felt it was a little small for us. Place is not very sound proof so can we can hear neighbours's movement upstairs and people talking on the road.  The place is on the small side but would work fine for short term stays.

This apartment is a  great place to stay as its a stones throw from the centre of the city , Joan very kindly let us in early as our flight landed at 9.30, everything is there that you will need in the kitchen and the beds are lovely and comfy , in the bathroom there is shower gel and lots of washing up liquid in the kitchen, just oppersite is a super market and you can walk to the Guinness factory , we went to Arthurs pub which is just on the corner by the flat and the welcome is super, just a word of warning if you get a taxi from the airport ask how much it is as  we where charged 48 euros to the city and going back to the airport 25 euros a big difference , we walked our little legs off and enjoyed every minute of it and we would stay there again , thank you joan .
Had a great time here, perfect location and lovely place!

Super clean apartment that is next to very close to great food (Arthur's Pub) and within walking distance of downtown, St Patrick's Cathedral, Guinness, and all of the fun things in Dublin that tourists would like to go to. Thanks so much, Joan!
The Apartment is very good for a few day long city Trip. I would come to Joan again
Clean and tidy place, 10 minutes by bus from the city center. Highly recommended to anyone!

We enjoyed our stay, great location, everything we needed in one space and close enough for us to walk to all the attractions. If you have trouble sleeping on a hard bed I would maybe ask for an extra comforter to lay down, if you have problems with sleeping in a room where the street light illumination comes through the shade you may want to bring a sleeping mask.
Het appartement is gelegen op een prachtige locatie. Op loopafstand van alle mooie bezienswaardigheden.  Ideaal.

Joan was a great host her apartment was great with some lovely touches. 
Although not right in the centre it was literally less than five minutes walk from the Guinness brewery!!!
There were bus stops outside to take you into the centre or it was about a fifteen minute walk. 
Right across the road was Arthurs pub good food!
All in had a great couple of days and would certainly book again.

Great location- we were able to walk to the Book of Kells, St. Stephens Green with no problem, and Guinness Storehouse was especially close. Also close to grocery and other services. The apartment was very clean and provided plenty of space for three people (one couple and a single). Would stay again.
The stay at the Apartment was exactly like we thought. Everything was good.

Basic apartment, good location- perfect for walking around Dublin and with paid parking in easy reach. Only downside is the beds were a little uncomfortable if staying for more than one night but otherwise this airbnb is great value for money. Thanks Joan!

Joan was very hospitable and was there to greet us.  The location was great for sight-seers who enjoy walking. Buses were handy but we didnt need them. 

Its located on a busy street so be prepared for some noise at night.  Very friendly neighbourhood, especially at Arthurs pub beside the church.
Muito bem localizado. O pequeno almoco tinha pouca coisa
Very pleased with the apartment! A good location as its near the Guinness factory and there is a taxi port right outside. Things like shower wash and shampoo were provided which was great.
Good location. Walk to everything. On a busy street, but surprisingly not that loud. The beds were not that comfortable and made a bit of noise. But besides that, nice place!
Joan's place is in a nice location if you want to be near shops, grocers, bars, etc. It's a bit challenging working out meeting Joan.
We were just staying one day and was great for the job. Good facilities and great location near temple bar, Olympia theatre and Guinness storehouse
Great place and host!
Joan's flat was located in an excellent part of the city, easily accessible to everything. We had a great time in the city
Joan was excellent at assisting weary travelers, great location to walk about!
Joans place is lovely. We had a very nice one night stay there. The pictures are very accurate. Joan was a pleasure to communicate with and was very helpful in person.

A great centrally located place for ant traveler!
Very clean and comfortable.
Had a great stay!!
Every thing was as presented in the Airbnb listing, great location and a good value.
Great place to stay, very clean apartment with everything you need.
clean basic appartment that is walking distance to many of Dublin's attractions
Cleanest BnB we stayed at in Ireland. Had coffee, tea and snacks in the kitchen. WiFi was out when we were there and there's no TV if you need a break from the pub and a night in.

Joan's apartment was great.  We were within walking distance to the Guiness Storehouse, Teeling Distillery, Trinity College, the Temple Bar district, and Kilmainham Gaol.  We had all we needed at the apartment except for the wi-fi which was not working during our stay.

Great apartment in a great location. Guiness Storehouse just a short walk, bus line stops directly in front of apartment. Arthurs pub was an instant favorite. The food is good and the staff made us feel like locals. The lovely smell from the Bakery downstairs is an added bonus.
The only reason I didnt give Joans apartment 5 stars is the WiFi was not available during our stay. Would definitely stay here again when in Dublin.

Great 2 bed and 2 bathroom place, an amazing location Dublin is expensive but this was really a great location and Athurs pub was good food and value for your money! Hospitality at Athurs pub and the cookie shop just around the corner was exceptional! Joan is on time but there was no place to store luggage...but she did her best to book us in ASAP!
Very lovely apartment, and great location.
Nice flat and great location - able to walk to many attractions and steps away from grocery store and bakery/cafes.  No Television in flat. Noise from busy street can be heard in bedrooms.

The space is exactly as described, felt a little rushed at check in. The location is perfect and walking distance to everything. We didn't have access to the balcony. The side street is not ideal but we were fine. Can be noisy at night. I would stay again the flat again is amazing and close to all the sites u want to hit.

Nice location, clean, with a nice kitchen.  Breakfast wasn't what we expected:  instant coffee and dry cereal with no milk available in the kitchen.  We had some communication issues with luggage drop off but were accommodated.  The hot water is on a timer.
Lovely space in a great location! There's a really great cookie/coffee shop downstairs, and a Tesco just down the street. Very walkable.
Spacious apartment with everything you need in a fantastic location.  Joan was super helpful and very responsive as a host.  Couldnt have had a better experience!
Great location! Close to everything in Temple Bar. Very clean and tidy. Quite a few steps up to apartment. Entrance is on a side street/alley so just know to look there. Enjoyed very much.
Great location to be when you want to visit Dublin. Just pick up the Hop On/Off bus at the Guinness Storehouse(5 minutes walking from the flat) and use it to go places!

Joan was very responsive and met us at the apartment to show us how things worked. It was a clean and cozy little place but if you come while its warmer, you will have to open the windows that dont have any screens, thus we had many flys inside, and the bus stop right outside the bedrooms was very loud all night. The location was great for being in close proximity to walk to the city. Overall it worked well for us but light sleepers, make sure to bring ear plugs!

This spot is close to city center, about 15 minute walk to St. Patrick's Cathedral and other sights. It was very clean and well furnished and although on a city street, felt very safe with two locks-one at the street door, and another to the apartment itself.  The street is interesting to walk, with many little shops and a really good bakery only a 5 minute walk away.  Great value.
Clean, centrally located apartment, within 15-20min walk to so many places I wanted to visit.  Other amenities such as a grocery store were so close too!

The Apt was very clean. The internet was spotty at best which can make it difficult for a traveler to book and investigate places to visit. The location was central to everything but it was loud. That being said, it is a city and the nightlife is active so its to be expected. We had a lovely time and cant wait to visit Ireland again.
Lovely apartment in a great location. Easy walking distance to the Guinness Storehouse and other wonderful points of interest. Great pub around the corner!
Great location for a short stay in Dublin.

It's an ok place to stay but we wouldn't book this accommodation again! 

There are certainly a few things that need updating in this flat. The worst bit for us was the shower situation - we specifically booked a place with two bathrooms and two working showers for a good reason... but we ended up with only one shower kind of working ( it had very weak water pressure, awful if you try to rinse off shampoo from long hair). We have been made aware of the broken second shower two days before arrival and let Joan know that this is very inconvenient for us. We received a small discount after contacting Airbnb with the  issue but would have preferred a working shower. Apparently she couldn't fix it as the apartment was fully booked for the whole week but one could have at least tried it since we only arrived in the evening - that made a minimum of 9 hours to get a plumber in.

Anyways, apart from that there have been a few other issues with the flat regarding cleanliness (spider webs on the ceilings, dusty) and a weird smell in the whole house (we couldn't figure out where it came from). The beds are very uncomfortable and there are multiple lose or broken appliances - one of the armchairs in the living room e.g. is broken and can't be used. Also, the flat in general is not soundproofed at all - bring some ear plugs for the night.

Flat ok some improvement on cleaning would be great
Overall nice stay

Dublin is extremely expensive so other places are likely even more expensive. However, despite this apartment being newù, the furniture is obviously not. The beds are noisy, the handles on the doors fell off and the overall quality of the furnishings is low. No television and though the city is within walking distance, the neighborhood is not great.

Joans place could not be better located! We were on a quiet side street within walking distance to tons of restaurants, cafes, tourist attractions, and other hotspots. With two bathrooms, the apartment was easily comfortable for 4 adult guests. A great, central location for anyone looking to explore Dublin.

My 3 friends and I stayed in Joans place for two nights. It was a great flat for 4. Each bedroom has its own bathroom. Sadly one shower wasnt working. The flat is a 20 minute foot walk from grafton street and temple bar.

The location is excellent, lots of walkable attractions/cheap taxis/and - like everyone else says - our favorite bar in Dublin was right across the street! 

We were very disappointed, though, by the fact that we were notified ON WALKING IN the apt to get the keys that one shower was not working. I understand these things happen, but upon reading through the other reviews on Joans listing, it became clear that this is not a new issue. Other reviewers tell an oddly similar story. When we expressed our disappointment at being charged the 2 br/2 ba price anyway, Joan again doubled down on the fact that this is the first time theyve had to shut off the shower - which simply isnt true. The refund she sent was tiny (as was the refund sent to other reviewers.)

The beds are hard, but nothing crazy. The one other weird thing is a garbage smell that you cant quite get used to in most of the common areas.

Joans apartment is very clean and comfortable.  I would stay here again.  It is right beside St Catherines church, close to Guinness Storehouse, ChristChurch .  Cafe & Dessert bar is directly in front of the apartment . Great coffee and breakfast sandwiches, etc.  Arthurs pub is just at the corner and Excellent food.  Loved the seafood chowder!  Walking distance to train station and lots of bus options.
Very clean, great location, easily accessed by foot all the sites of Dublin

Cannot recommend this flat enough. Great location. Looks and feels brand new and has everything you could possibly need including cereal and coffee/tea for breakfast. Would stay here again during our next trip to Dublin. A perfect spot for 2 couples since there is an en suite bathroom and a other bathroom for the second bedroom.

Joans place was easy to get to and check in was very accommodating. Location is within walking distances to Grafton Street, St. Stephens Green, etc., and nearly around the corner from The Guinness Storehouse. Place was very clean and had everything we needed!
Accommodation was still dirty, hairs were left in bedroom and bathroom. Bed linen had marks on already. A bit of a walk to the city centre

Great location, easy walking distance to many of Dublins attractions.  Bus stop and taxi stop outside. Lovely and clean, bathroom and en-suite was great for three of us. Could easily accomodate 4. Joan supplies tea, coffee, cereal and sugar as well as some toiletries. The only downside was a musty smell at times. Not sure where that was coming from. Lots of pubs, restaurants, shops and bars nearby.
Great Flat in Central Dublin. Joan was a great host, and the little touches like tea, coffee, and cereals were much appreciated. Would 100% recommend.

Joan was great!  We werent in Dublin long but I wish we could have stayed longer in Joans place.  The location is great and she had so many suggestions of things to do and see!  The two bathrooms felt very luxurious as well.  Joan was helpful and kindîI would definitely stay again!
Nice appartment in the heart of Dublin. The appartment is a good value and the communication with Joan is very smoothly

This apartment is in an excellent and convenient location. Its handy to Heuston Station, and the central part of Dublin.  Arthurs is a very nice pub and restaurant just a 100 feet away.  The apartment is spotless,  and has a very functional kitchen.  Joan communicates very promptly.  We appreciated her meeting us at checkin to review what we needed to know. I would recommend Joans apartment.
Joan is great and so is her place!  Great location for exploring Dublin and check in/checkout was extremely easy. We would love to come back.
Nice smart apartment in great location
Great stay in this very well located appartment
Amazing views of the city and Saint Patricks from the balcony and great location, ten minute walk to Temple Bar area. Spacious and clean with comfortable beds, enough for our group of 6 to fit easily
We had an amazing stay!  The location was very walkable.  Thank you!!
Really spacious apartment with a great balcony in a fantastic location would definitely stay again.

The term superbù is misleading. The views are great, nice hardwood floors, and a great location but the carpets in the bedrooms are faded and the walls are scuffed up.  Plus one of the toilets was out of commission for most of our stay.
Great place!

This apartment wasn't over Temple Bar, but we were still able to walk a bit to it, as well as other attractions. There was a lot of room for extra people, 5 roll away beds and bedding. The host who met us was extremely nice and helpful. Our only complaint would be that we had 1 less bathroom than expected for a group of 9. They had a flood and the bathroom was closed. The flooring was also ruined and bumpy. The kitchen and view was beautiful!
Great location.

We really enjoyed the location and the amenities of this property. One of the biggest surprises was the wonderful Bosch built-in coffee maker. It really made the place.  We were able to fit 7 people very comfortably.  We were able to walk to everything from this site.

This is a really nice condo, with the kitchen and living room on the 5th floor, and the three bedrooms and two bathrooms on the floor below.  So the view is really nice out the front.  The steps to the lower floor are a bit steep, so if you have troubles with stairs, this may not be the best place.  Getting in and out of the unit is easy;  we were going to have a car rental, but decided it would be too much of a hassle to drive in Dublin, and we were right about that.   I'm not sure how convenient the parking would be or the cost.  You're within a 15 to 20 minute walk to the temple bar area and Trinity College, and maybe a bit longer to the Guinness storehouse, which you can see from the porch off of the living room. Stephens Green is about a 5 minute walk.

We only used the kitchen in the mornings, but it seemed to have anything one would need. Both the coffee maker and dishwasher worked well.  Plenty of hot water, and there were 7 of us.  With the 7th person in our group, she slept on a double cot on the main floor at the end of the dining room.  It may not work for everyone, but it worked for us. 

The taxi ride to and from the airport runs between 25 and 30 euros, and will take 25 to 45 minutes, depending on rush hour.

Adam was our contact person, and he was always prompt to get back with us

Great place for a large group who want to be within short walking distance of the Dublin city core. Apartment is as shown in photos with some wear and tear which is to be expected.  Most of the amenities were in working order except for some of the lights in the kitchen and common space - or we didn't know which switch turned those lights on. Regardless, an easy fix for the next guests. Communication was fairly easy and as thorough as it needed to be - nothing extra i.e. no suggestions of places or things to do in Dublin; but this worked for us so no complaints here.   Overall, a great space for a large group with easy access to the city!
Thank you
Cannot beat the location and works well enough for a large group. Expect some people to be sleeping on cots in the common areas.
The host canceled this reservation 9 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
a very nice Apartment for 6 people, not more. (3 very comfortable double beds, 4 uncomfortable additional fould up beds). All in all I can recommend it for a grup up to 6!
Barry was a superb host in his beautiful house. He was extremely welcoming and friendly and made me feel at easy, I felt part of the house from the outset.

Thank you so much - everything was wonderful! Kate and Barry were very welcoming, friendly and gracious. The room was was very clean and comfortable - and their home is located in a very safe and attractive neighborhood. The 15A bus stop is less than a block away, and will take you directly downtown. Highly recommended!!!

Oh my goodness. Where can I start? Incredible hospitality. Super responsive. Gave me multiple ways to contact them. Very helpful. Recommended several fun activities. Very great location. Right next to a few different buses. Very comfortable bed. A lot of different amenities. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks so much to the both of you for everything! :)
Great place at a great location in Dublin. Would recommend. Barry is very helpful as a host . The place is nice

I had the pleasure of staying at Barrys place for my week-long solo trip to Dublin. Although Terenure is a bit far from City Centre, Barrys place is really close to public transit (about a 3 minute walk to the nearest bus stop; about 20 minutes to City Centre via bus). The room I stayed in was big and bright, and the bathroom was really clean.

Barry goes out of his way to make you feel welcome and at home, and communication is always easy. 

Definitely recommend!

Barry and Kate are amazing hosts. They provided great tips as well as a list of restaurants/pubs to go to. Any questions you have they were quick to answer. They are both lovely people and I felt at home super quick. The bed was super comfy which was a plus. 10/10 would recommend if you want a great place to stay with genuinely nice people.

Wish I could add more than 5 stars to this review. Barry was amazing and went out of his way for us. Incredibly friendly and somehow has a 6th sense for when you need a cup of tea! Stay with Barry, youll be happy you did.

Barry is an excellent host who was quick to reply to our questions and made check-in and staying at his location very easy. 

The house is ideally located for visiting Dublin but not wanting to stay in the city center. It is right off of a main bus line that goes straight into the Dublin city center and to the airport. Also, the city center is walkable from the house. It took us about 45 minutes to walk to city center but it was very enjoyable. There is ample street parking at the location. 

The accommodations are very nice. The house is very well decorated on the inside and the room is large and very comfortable. The bed is big and comfortable. This place is as big and nice as the photos make it seem. The bathroom is shared with the other guest room, but you know that before booking. Shower is nice but there is only hot water some parts of the day (we never had a problem, there was always hot water when we wanted it). 

Unlike some other AirBnBs that advertise a "kitchen", the kitchen at Barry's is a real kitchen with a stove, fridge, some basic cooking supplies etc. This really enhanced our stay at Barry's as we had gotten tired of eating out and wanting to cook some of our own food. There was no microwave (or at least I did not find one) but that shouldn't be a problem. 

There is also a clothes washing machine that can be used but no dryer. This is probably only a surprise to American guests (but you can dry your clothes on the radiator). 

Internet is fast.

Very comfortable room just outside of the Dublin center! Easy to get to everything we wanted to see by bus. The room was spacious and comfy. You do share a bathroom with other guests, but it wasnt too inconvenient. Barry is super nice and welcoming! Would definitely stay here again.

Its a great place, cozy, a good room with a comfortable bed, the house has everything we need and we can rest and relax freely. The hosts are friendly, organized and helpful. Its next to bus station, a very easy locomotion. We love the stay, and we come back certainly for this place. Thank you !

All was great with Barry! He is an awesome lad. Plenty of hosting experience, very genuine and always helpful. The apartment is nice and is located about 15-20 minutes from the city center by bus. Would stay there again.
Barrys place was incredible. First time in Dublin and the location was awesome. Only about a 10 min bus ride to the city center. We felt at home at Barrys place and would recommend 100%.

Excellent location, lovely host and a really wonderful home. 
Barry is a pleasure to deal with and very hospitable - he went out of his way to facilitate our arrival time, the room was immaculate and the house is really tastefully decorated and very homely. 
5/5, thanks again Barry!

This is a lovely place to stay.  The shared bathroom is immaculate and the guest room beautiful and v comfortable.  The local area has an abundance of great places to eat and I found driving to the Aviva stadium in the morning rush hour very, very manageable in August.  I'd definitely stay again the next time I'm in Dublin.

Everything was wonderful & clean! The room was as expected but the cute garden and the kitchen were just awesome :) The hosts were really nice and gave us a lot of good must see tips. Thank you for everything!!

Barrys place was very nice, the location was excellent with lots of restaurants and pubs within walking distance. Barry was a wonderful host and very friendly and helpful with good recommendations. The room was clean and bed was super comfortable, probably the best nights rest we had the entire trip! Thanks Barry!

Barry is a perfect host, the place was cozy and we got some great tips for visiting Dublin. It's a bit outside of Dublin yet it is near a small "village center" that has everything you need. Can recommend it!
We enjoyed our stay so much at Barry's place. He was so friendly, accommodating, communicative, and helpful on our first stop in Ireland. We hope to stay with them again!

Definitely a great place to stay when visiting Dublin. Barrys place is in the area of Terenure. By bus it takes only around 15 min to get to the city center and costs approximately 3 ‚Ç¨. 
We felt very welcome during our stay. Barry provided a quick and easy self-check-in as no one was at the house at our arrival time. He left the lights on so we could find our room easily. Barry always answered quickly to our messages.
The room was nice and cozy and got everything someone could need (even towels & hairdryer).
I would recommend staying here :)
Barrys place was incredibly cozy, quiet, clean and you almost feel right at home. Wonderful experience, I highly recommend it;)
Barry's home was very cozy and felt welcoming! It was a quick bus ride to the city center and very easy to get to with public transport.

We were speechless. Barrys place is stylish, cozy and clean. Its very close to the city centre by bus and youve got bus stops literally on every corner (although we walked there a couple of times as well which was also really nice). Barry went out of his way to help us whenever we needed him (day or night), and was always beyond nice. He also gave us some great tips and ideas on what to do in Dublin. I cant imagine staying anywhere else when we visit Dublin again.

Barrys place is in an ideal location. Literally anything you could want or need is in a few minutes walk from the property. Its super clean and the bed is so comfy. Barry is on the ball in replying to messages and any questions you may have. Hes very easy going and considerate of different needs. The house is quiet and ideal for any solo travelers, couples and families alike. Keep in mind theres stairs! The Kitchen is huge and you can use at your leisure. Very easy to get to the city or different parts of the city with public transport on your doorstep. A nice touch would be a TV maybe? Overall I couldnt fault the place or the host

The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. The location was handy since it was close to bus routes and we could get a decent breakfast. Additionally, being less than 5 minutes from the local pub was great. Barry was an exceptional host, he made all the essential amenities available, was extremely friendly and even offered to take us to a gig across town. I would definitely recommend this Airbnb and we will definitely be back in future!
Dan is a fantastic host and he has a really lovely place. There's a nice Supervalu near and there's parking outside.

Great place, great host with Awesome experience. Communication/Response A1, Cleanliness/tidiness A1, Location not too far from the Dublin city center but a but far from the Dublin Airport, Hospitality A1, He infact made pizza for us at around 3am due to his worries about our stressful flight. Other factors you could think or worry about from a travellers perspective were all sorted and handled efficiently by Dan.

Very nice apartment, close to direct public transport to airport and to city center (even if everything in the city is at walking distance and we never took public transport). The house is very clean, the check-in/check-out easy and flexible. Fast communication with Gerry. Definitely recommended!
In short: Great Host! Very clean flat. City Center in walking distance. Very good price. I would definitely recommend.

The flat is on the ground floor and has access to a back garden, which was an unexpected surprise. It had pretty much everything we needed, including a small kitchen, and was clean and tidy. The location is great, in a quiet residential area, but within 15-30 min walk to most places we wanted to go. There are several grocery shops nearby. Perfect place to come back to after a long day.

Gerry provided a lot of useful info prior to check-in. We had a hiccup at the beginning with getting responses, but we later learned that Gerry was on vacation that weekend. After he returned, he met with us and enthusiastically answered all our questions and gave us an abundance of tips about Dublin. Really glad to have met Gerry and his wife. Our stay only went uphill from there. I would definitely stay here again next time.
The flat is perfect, better than on photos! Gerry help us to find a place to park our rent car. The street is really calm and flat is really well placed!
Nice apartment, close to direct public transport to airport and to city center, but wi-fi is very weak - phones connected very poorly, notebook ok, but not in another room.
Gerry's apartment is in a great location relative to downtown Dublin, and in a quiet neighborhood. He took time to meet with us upon arrival and provide local tips and insight.
Good flat nice and clean , good value for money, close to bus route and easy to find and quiet location

Clean apartment with a working oven and microwave including pots, pan, kettle, cafetiere and adequate cutlery. (No sharp knife, sieve, tea pot).
We were able to invite friends to eat using crockery/cutlery to set the table. Two garden chairs from outside enabled us all to sit at the kitchen table. When warmer, it would be possible to eat at the garden table.
Warm with heating on in the morning and evening. Individual radiators can be turned off. 
Washing machine available but not used on this occasion.
Very quiet apartment towards the back of the house. Little noise from fellow occupants.
Parking is in the red zone (3 hours only) and at a premium. Gerry advised us of free parking across the canal about 12mins walk from the house.
Convenient to Tesco Express, pharmacy, bars, restaurants and bus. The National Gallery is 25mins walk along the nearby canal, and St Patrick's Cathedral is 15mins walk. Very handy to major attractions and transport.
Enjoyed meeting and chatting with Gerry and his son.

The perfect apartament for a couple in Dublin, different from the photos but even better!! Located in Portobello, very nice area. 15min walking to St Patricks Catheral, 20-25min. to center-Temple bar, 2min. to bus to airport, parking free after 6.30pm nearby. Very clean. Gerry was very responsive, we could leave our luggage in the apartament after check-out. We have a really nice time!
Good area in walking distance to everything. Ok apartment, but the bed was small for two people. My boyfriend is 1.97m tall and there was only on duvet.
Gerry and his place are just amazing!
Overall a great space and very close to all the experiences we wanted to have in Dublin

I stayed at Gerry's place for two nights and could not have been happier! The check-in process was easy and Gerry was very helpful with local tips for tourism as well as how to get around! I would absolutely love to stay at Gerry's place again!
A nice and very clean flat in a quite area of Dublin. Near to the city, busses, supermarket, restaurants and pubs. Very good service from the owner about check in and out and things to do in Dublin.
Very nice apartment, spacious and homey
Everything was OK. The description of the apartment is correspond to reality. A good service for a good price.

Good place for our weekend stopover. We walked everywhere, and yes, most things are 10-30 minutes walk as posted in the description. There is a Tescos about five minutes walk away for convenience and grocery items. The neighborhood is old but safe.

The WiFi only works in the front room, not in the bedroom or bathroom. If youre looking to watch Netflix in bed or do a lot of Internet work, just take note that you may not be able to. It was adequate for our purposes of Netflixing and leisurely surfing the web (just one or two devices at a time).

Overall exactly as described in the listing, and very clean!
Gerrys place was great and easy to get to all the main attractions

Affordable and clean option in a good location. My brother and I were able to get to all desired attractions on foot throughout our stay. Theres a convenience store just down the street which made it easy to grab things as needed.
Lovely flat, lovely location. You need parking discs if you bring a car.
The host is very courteos. The apartment was very clean. And it was close to areas of interest.  We had a comfortable stay with Gerry.
Clean and tidy accommodation, within a short walk of the hustle and bustle of Dublin, yet in a quiet area. There is a Spar nearby where you can buy milk and other provisions.
This unit is much nicer than the photos. The unit is similar to the ones in the photos but not the exact unit. Great location, quiet, everything we needed.

Gerrys flat is in Portobello, a nice, quiet, residential neighborhood, and only a few blocks from shops and restaurants. The location is great for access to Dublin city center (20-30 minutes walking) and all that area has to offer. Gerry was very thorough with directions to the flat and the check-in process, making the whole experience a breeze. The flat was very clean and good sized for two people.

Gerrys place is the in the perfect location for a stay in Dublin. The apartment is very clean and comfortable. The neighborhood is lovely and convenient to city center. You can walk easily to most places. There are several buses too and from the neighborhood to city center as well as the light rail tram. If we had a question about anything, Gerry got back to us right away. We had a fabulous stay while in Dublin.

Really great location, not too far from all the best places to eat and drink. Lovely to walk along the canal. The apartment was clean, WiFi not top notch, and bring an eye mask if you get woken up by natural light seeping in. All in all, would certainly recommend!
great position adequate place
Very clean, convenient space! We walked everywhere over the weekend, no need for buses or cabs, save for the train trip out the Howth! Lovely flat for 2 people who don't mind sharing a double bed!

Gerrys unit was great for accessing all that Dublin has to offer. It is in walking distance of the city center and also very close to a bus line that runs through the center to the airport if youre in a hurry. Gerry was very quick to respond and his hospitality letting us drop our bags off early when we arrived was much appreciated.
Wonderful location, great little apartment. Wifi was a little spotty, but wouldn't have been an issue if we'd had phones with better reception in the UK.
The stay in the apartment has been correct.  All good.  Highly recommended.

This is a spacious, comfortable flat on a quiet street within walking distance of vibrant restaurant, bar, and shopping areas, St.Stephens Green and many central tourist sites of Dublin!
The flat is not posh, but clean, functional and reasonably comfortable. We would stay there again.

Great time in Dublin. Really appreciated this neighborhood, not only picturesque and serene, but perfectly situated in the close peripheral of central Dublin, so that I could easily and quickly get to all central points via multiple options (I preferred the beautiful walk to central points), and retire peacefully at night in peace and quiet. Super easy directions to all tour pick-up spots and airport transportation close by. The apartment is actually bigger than it looks in pictures. Kitchen was fully equipped, which was great at the start and end of the day for my morning coffee and leftovers in the evening :). Comfy bed and nice linens; I slept great. Wi-Fi was a problem that Gerry was responsive about solving, and although we didnt fully solve it, Gerry said it was a first and would ensure resolve for future guests. Really nice time, thanks Gerry!

The flat is perfect for two people willing to visit Dublin. It is situated in a quiet neighbourhood, at only 10 to 30 minutes to the center of the city. It is bigger than it looks on the pictures and had everything we needed. Gerry is a very friendly host and gives great advice on what to do/visit in the city!

This accommodation is of great value! The apartment is cosy, super clean, with everything you need and in a great location. Gerry was very responsive and kind. I have nothing to add, it was great and would definitely come back!
The flat was perfect with all necessary amenities. Except the WiFi doesnt really work. Great location, Walking along the grand canal is very pleasant. Will definitely stay here again.
Great place to stay for the Dublin Marathon or just exploring the city
Great place, well located by a wonderful host. My second time back.
Fantastic place, and great location!  I would definitely recommend staying here!
Really accommodating with regard to check-in. Really liked the place and in a great location to get around Dublin.

The apartment is as advertised.  It was clean, good wif-fi, and located in a central/safe area of Dublin to walk nearly everywhere. I highly recommend the apt, as well as the crepe restaurant directly below for breakfast.
Amazing place. Id go there again.

Visiting Dublin? YOU MUST STAY HERE. Micheal and his wife are the most fabulous hosts. The airbnb is in THE BEST location. Right in the heart of Temple Bar area. Walking distance to all major attractions. It even has the best pick-up spots for public transportation. Which is fantastic if you have a late/early morning flight :). I cannot express how gracious they were as hosts. Provided tons of local tips, advice, and even printed our boarding passes for us! 12/10 would recommend every time!

Michaels place is perfect for visiting Dublin. The apartment is spacious with lots of natural light and is in a very central location. Michael was prompt in answering messages and provided many helpful tips about the surrounding area. Thank you so much Michael!!!

Great location and comfortable apt. Had everything needed and even had good pillows.  Michea'l and Maylene were very helpful and hospitable. I would definitely recommend this apartment and would stay there again.
Amazing location close to the Temple Bar area. We had some issues with noise on weekdays though. Bedroom and living spaces were nice. The bathroom is a bit more dated and the shower was not clean.
Great location for visiting Dublin with lots off amenities.
Top apartment in an absolutely amazing location. Great host who responded quickly and gave some great tips and advice. Thank you again!

Located right on the pulse of so many different venues.  We walked to parks, shopping districts, historical sites, restaurants, Coffey shops and oh ya a pub or two.   The host was so very helpful and quick to respond to any issue or need.
Great location, far enough away from Temple Bar that there are fewer loud pub crawlers. We enjoyed the pub and Irish music at Darkey Kelly's.

Micheals place was exactly as described in the listing and as it appeared in the photos.  It was clean and roomy and nicely decorated, with plenty of extra personal care products on hand.  The location was very convenient to many Dublin sights, allowing us to walk most everywhere.  The only negative was that we were there over a bank holiday, and people drinking too much in Temple Bar occasionally woke us up at night as they stumbled home.  We knew this might be the case, based on prior reviews, so was something we could deal with.  Micheal was very helpful in providing guidance for our visit, and was an excellent communicator.  He went out of his way to help me troubleshoot international texting issues.
Location and communication with host was fantastic however felt the apartment needed a good clean.

This flat is located in a perfect part of Dublin to explore every region that surrounds it. While we didn't spend a lot of time at Temple Bar proper, we did find that the location made it extremely convenient to explore north and south of the Liffey. The host was fantastic and everything was as described.

This apartment is ideal for using as a home base to explore Dublin. The apartment was clean, well thought out and felt like home. We absolutely loved going literally around the corner to the most amazing restaurant for breakfast each morning (Queen of Tarts) and strolling through the back streets of the city in leisure. Micheals wife met us promptly to let us in and show us the ins and outs. It is close enough to Temple Bar to be convenient, but far enough away to be a little quieter especially on the weekend night we were there. We highly recommend this home if you prefer the privacy of self catering over hotels.

Micheals place is a wonderful spot to stay if you plan on exploring Dublin. You dont need to take a taxi or bus anywhere. Everything is walking distance and it was so convenient being able to walk the city and explore without worrying how to get places. Micheal met us upon arrival and showed us around and was very informative and welcoming. We would definitely recommend anyone to stay who is traveling to Dublin!
Such a wonderful host and a great location, we had a grand of a time!! The Craic was a def NINETY!!! We will definitely return and request the same Airbnb in the future, thanks again!
Perfect apartment
Great apartment in a lively location!

What an absolutely wonderful apartment!  Perfect location, close to everything but far enough away from the hustle and bustle.  Our host met us for check in and was beyond helpful.  The apartment was clean, modern and exceeded our expectations!  I would highly recommend this apartment!

If youre thinking about staying in Dublin, this is the place to stay! Micheals place is in the perfect location and literally has everything you need. We loved his warm hospitality and he gave us a ton of helpful tips and recommendations on places to see and eat. We loved walking everywhere, even though we had rented a car, we left it in the parking garage for our time in Dublin. After walking and sightseeing all day, coming back to the apartment felt like coming home. The bed was the most comfortable bed we had on our trip to Ireland. We are so happy we stayed here and hope to someday come back! Thanks Micheal and Maylene!

A wonderful location in the heart of the Temple Bar District, yet off on a cobblestone side street so there's no traffic noise while you sleep. Lovely look out the window to a beautiful, old church. Stylish touches. Cozy atmosphere!
A beautiful,  clean apartment near Temple Bar but away from the noise. Hosts are fabulous and the location is central to everything. Definitely will return. Thanks

The apartment is in an excellent location, close to everything but also generally very quiet. It is quite spacious, well furnished and has everything that you could need. Michael was easy to contact, met us on arrival and provided many tips and local knowledge. Overall, a great place to stay.

Michael and Maylienes apartment was the nicest of our tour of the UK and Ireland....spacious and clean and close to everything. My son and I were especially appreciative of Mayliene coming to personally save us and navigate us to the apartment when a cab dropped us off far away from where we were supposed to be. Lesson learned, like they suggest, take the 747 Airlink bus.... it was a much better (and more affordable) way to get to the airport.  Great space and experience all around.

Micheals place is so spacious, clean, the bed is so comfortable and it is super easy to get to from the airport. They also have two balconies, its so relaxing to sit there with my coffee. 
Micheal met us in person and give us a run down of the apartment. He is full of advice and local tips. His apartment is located on the quiet side of Temple Bar which is a big plus. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a place in Dublin.

If you can book this place, DO IT! 
Perfect location and really nice setup. 
Best AB&B I have stayed at so far!

The Temple Bar apartment is perfectly centrally located, in walking distance to most of Dublins attractions. The living room/ kitchen in particular is a great space- bright and sunny with a nice balcony leading off. The apartment is very generously provisioned with coffee, tea, oil, herbs and spices, plus every possible detergent you could want. 
The street outside can be noisy at nightî light sleepers will notice it. The smoke alarm is sensitive- I set it off cooking without doing anything terribly dramatic- a roast chicken in the oven!

Micahels Place is fabulous- centrally located to everything ( next to temple bar on south side) and yet quiet. The communication with a Michael was terrific- he and his wife were at hand to check us in. He even reserved a parking spot for us. The place is quite spacious. We had a great time. We would recommend it to everyone-
Wonderful hosts!  Clean, comfortable, stylish place with an elevator!  Great location!  Highly recommend!

This is a beautiful space and location, comfortable and has all the amenities one could ever need to enjoy the city! Wonderful, communicative host. The patio was an unexpected delightful place for morning coffee and evening wind-down. I already can't wait to return!

This is the must stay location for anyone planning on spending a lot of time in Dublin. It was within 10-15 minutes walking distance of 90% of the things we had planned. It's on the fringe of Temple Bar district which is great because you are very close to all the bar and restaurants, but you don't hear the crowds and party-goers. They had outlet converters and a blow dryer. The shower has amazing water pressure! There is a great pizza place a block away called DiFontanes. My husband and I would get a few slices at the end of the night and take it back to the apartment. Yum!

We had such a wonderful time in Dublin! The location of the apartment was perfect! So close to so many amazing bars/pubs, restaurants and historic sites. Our favorite place was Darkey Kelley's. Michael was a fantastic host! We got off on the wrong stop on the bus ride to the apartment, and he came to our rescue and found us out in the rain. He gave us many tips and suggestions on things to do and places to visit during our short stay. We wish we could've stayed longer! Will definitely visit Ireland again!
This apartement is the perfect stay in Dublin.

Excellent place 
Very clean and has all you need 
The hosts are very welcoming and make sure you know what is what 
They even left us informations about what to do where to go 
5 stars excellent air b n b

Great host and very convenient location. Cleanliness is very good but the place could certainly use an update. Can be very loud at night, especially on weekends. Please note that the bed a queen size, not a king. Also washing machine, while convenient, took hours to do a load and doesnt really dry at all.

Great large apartment that is very well equipped.  Micheal met us and spent time going over suggestions for restaurants, bars and activities. Apartment had everything we needed and more. Great location very close to temple bar. We walked everywhere from the apartment.
This location is fantastic. In walking distance to shops, pubs, restaurants, and all the nightlife spots, but removed enough to enjoy time personal time in the apartment. Highly recommended.
Great location and great place to stay!

We could not have found a more perfect location for exploring Dublins Temple Bar and the surrounding area.
We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The apartment building was secure. There were shops and restaraunts in the alley and the fun but noisy pubs were just a short walk away. The balcony was a great place to unwind and do a little people watching. The apartment was clean and comfortable and we will highly recommend it to friends and family.

Micheal and Marlenes apartment in Temple Bar is a gem. It is a corner unit and VERY well located. From the deck you can see a long way down Temple Bar and it appears as if you are surrounded by centuries of history everywhere, which you are!
The apartment is modern and airy and very well sourced with appliances , food and cooking items. Obviously our hosts take great pride in the accommodation and also the back up service and communication they provide. Could not recommend it more highly for visitors to Dublin.

We had a great stay in Micheal's apartment in Dublin. You couldn't ask for a better location as it was easily walkable to all attractions & restaurants. It was clean & very comfortable, and had absolutely everything we could need.

PERFECT LOCATION !!!

You can WALK literally to ANYWHERE !!... safe area 

Awesome BALCONY!
What more could you ask for. Close to all the amenities in Templebar, heaps of food options and nightlife.  I would highly recommend to anyone wanting to sray in Dublin.

This place is perfect location for anything you choose to do in Dublin. So close to the hustle and bustle of everything, yet quiet enough at night to get a great restful night sleep! Host are extremely helpful and have anything you could need ready for you! I would recommend every time!
Great apartment in a convenient location.
Comfort, consideration, rapid responses the questions, a good nights sleep despite being in Temple Bar, security, and just a relaxing environment to enjoy.

Location, location, location! If you are looking for a stylish and quiet apartment in the middle of Dublin close to the Temple bar district look no further. You can walk to all major attractions from here and have a lot of bars and restaurants close by. Also, if you are planning bus tours - all pick up locations are reachable by foot.  The Airlink bus stop to and from the airport as well as a taxi stand is close by too. The apartment is clean and bright. Any inquires to the host were answered quick. We enjoyed our time here very much and would not hesitate to return.
The apartment is ideally located and very central in Temple Bar. It could not be better.
Great little apartment in the perfect spot!

All the details that this hosts provides made this place the best Airbnb experience yet. They provide pretty much everything but your clothes. They had snacks, candy, selection of teas and coffee, percolator, French press, everything you could need in a kitchen, etc. Body wash, shampoo and conditioner, toothpaste, hairdryer, etc. one of my favorite things was coming to the apartment every night to the super comfortable bed. How comfortable, more comfortable than my multi thousand dollar mattress. I havent slept so well in forever. I had to lift the covers to look at the tags and I was surprised and intend to buy it this week.
Sehr gute Lage, ruhig und zentral am Rand des Stadtviertels Temple Bar. Die Wohnung ist sehr gut ausgestattet und sehr sauber.

The apartment was exactly the same as in the pictures. The location couldnt be any better, walking distance to everything you need. Micheal was very kind and help us with everything we asked and needed. Looking forward to stay again in Micheals apartment.

Great location in Dublin! The Airbnb is just off a main street and across from a grocery store. Kitchen is well stocked. Joan was lovely and made our check in with her super easy! Thanks for a great stay!
We have enjoyed our stay. Joan is an accommodating host. The apartment is very clean, adequately equipped and had an optimal location for our needs.
Great place centrally located within walking distance to many great places. The bakery on the street level was also fantastic and made the whole place smell fantastic. Dieters beware ;)
Great value for the location. Parking is paid and across the street. Guinness Store House is around the corner. Overall would recommend and stay again! Thanks for having us.

Net appartement voor niet te veel geld. Twee complete badkamers erbij, douche is prima zit alleen weinig druk op de leidingen. Het inbegrepen ontbijt zijn drie kommen ontbijtgranen. Joan was erg soepel met in- en uitchecken. Woonkamer voldoet prima en is aan een binnenplaats. Slaapkamers aan de straatkant, bij dichte ramen heb je er geen last van maar is erg luid hij geopende ramen. Kortom prima verblijf (op 15min lopen van Temple bar) en fijne host!

Joans place is in a good location for walking around the city. It has shops on the same road and good bus links into the centre. The apartment itself is clean and tidy and both bedrooms are a good size. I would recommend Joans place!

Joans apartment was very well located. It was a nice place to stay for the long weekend in Dublin. Joan was very nice and stayed late to accommodate my delayed check-in because my flight was significantly delayed. I would stay here again.

Joans place is in an excellent location and she met us for check in and gave us the local tips. The appartment has all the things a traveler needs. My only criticism would be that some furniture could do with repair/replacement.
Joan was kind enough to wait for us. We had communicated our plans but felt she was a little rude about us having a car and parking in Dublin. Place was a great location in Dublin
Great location, lovely clean spacious flat and helpful host !

We checked in late (10:30pm) and Joan met us with no problem that night.  There is no parking, just public parking or on the street during a certain time. The unit has two bed rooms that were comfortable and two full bathrooms and a living area. No TV but Wifi and a large kitchen. Right below the unit is Dublin Cookie company- great for coffee or cookies in the morning. There is a Lidl just a short walk (2 mins) down the road for snacks, sandwiches, wine/drinks or whatever else you may need. We walked to Arthurs Pub for a great lunch and drinks. Also to Guinness (about a 10 min walk). I would not recommend walking around outside the unit late at night alone. The entrance door to the unit is in an alleyway that is dark...

The first thing to note is there are a lot of stairs to climb, no elevator, so if you have limited mobility this is not the place for you. We enjoyed our stay in Joan's apartment. I loved that the living space is separate from the sleeping space. Being an early riser it is nice to enjoy some time away from the later risers. The beds and pillows are really comfortable. It is also nice to have 2 full bathrooms. The location is ideal for all sightseeing and public transit. Communication with Joan was always quick. As with most large cities, there is an issue with transients and drugs. Just be aware and all will be fine. I would not hesitate to stay at Joan's if in Dublin again.

The location is perfect - right in front of a bus stop and taxi stand, as well as walking distance to Christ Church and Guinness Storehouse. The place is clean and had great amenities, but the mattresses are not comfortable. On our last day, the power went out in the middle of the night and was out until the evening. We left earlier than planned as we were not able to have a hot shower, use wi-fi, or charge our devices. We also had to throw out food in the fridge. Our host was sympathetic but offered no compensation for our troubles.
Great little flat in a good location. Exactly what we wanted for a weekend away in Dublin.
Great location.  Be aware that there is no tv and you will have to climb stairs to the apartment.
Lovely apartment for a city break, super location for Guinness Storehouse. Very accommodating hosts with help when something left behind!
Joan's apartment is in a great location.  We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go in Dublin.  It is a great size for 2 couples.  Check in was seamless.  I would recommend.
Joan was very accommodating!

Good location. About a 15 minute walk to Heuston Station. Another 15-20 min walk to St. Stephens, Temple Bar, Grafton St, etc. Bus stop right out front and plenty of taxis around. Didn't find the neighborhood as bad as some reviews let on, nothing beyond what to expect when you're in a city.

OK amenities. Beds and chairs were uncomfortable but on par considering price point. 

Poor logistics. Listing indicates luggage dropoff allowed. I asked about this when booking and received no response. I asked again a couple weeks before our trip and I was told there was no space to dropoff luggage. Only accommodation offered was Joan would try to get us in as early as possible. Not a solution we could count on, we had to make other arrangements. Tipperary House near Heuston Station offers daily storage for 5 Euro a bag.

Finally, there was some issue with the WiFi. This did not affect us as we were traveling with a hotspot. However Joan gave a knock then walked right in on us while on the phone with I assume her provider in effort to fix. We were napping and showering after a long flight and made it clear the Wifi issue did not affect us. The walk in made for a good reminder to keep the door locked!
Nice place and great location!

The location was perfect, a nice steady 20 minute walk in to the temple bar area town, a stone's throw away from the Guinness factory & a short walk to the river. Plenty of supermarkets, bars, eating areas etc on every corner. The apartment was nice overall however, breakfast provided was advertised but it was clear that the cereal in the cupboard had been left by previous guests, there was no milk in the fridge or bread, butter etc so breakfast was not exactly provided. There was no toilet roll in either of the two bathrooms & we was not advised of this upon arrival of our stay. The bin in the kitchen had a lid that did not close leaving the whole kitchen smelly when there was waste food put in it.

Absolutely perfect apartment for our requirements. 15 mins walk from Temple Bar etc and an area full of true Dublin character and less touristy bars, we loved The Clock and had a great night drinking, chatting, and playing bingo with the locals. The apartment itself is wonderful stylish, spotless, spacious, and lots of little touches which shows the thoughtfulness of Joan (toiletries,phone leads,milk,hair dryer etc, iron) - wonderful all round !
Nice place pretty close to many areas of Dublin that are worth a visit. Enjoyed our stay.
Spacious flat with everything you need. Great location, plenty supermarkets and cafe/pubs round about. Less than 15 mins walk from Guinness Storehouse.
We stayed in Joan's appartment to explore Dublin and start our trip around Ireland. The value for money is really good and the location is perfect for walking tours around the city.

Clean, simple apartment with just what we needed to enjoy 2 nights in Dublin. Location was great for walking down Temple Bar area etc. Bus lines right out front. Can be a bit noisy outside at night but thats to be expected. Appreciated Joans hospitality.
Great location close to everything in Dublin!
Very nice, well kept apartment.  Great location and perfect walking distance to just about everything you need.

Joans place is spacious, clean and within walking distance to many sites.  Right down below is a great   coffee shop selling cookies and pastries, very convenient and delicious. There are also a couple grocery stores right across the street.  Would also highly recommend Arthurs pub just along in the next block and the Proof pizza restaurant in the same block.  Check in and check out was very convenient.
The apartment is very bright and spacious. Very close to a bus and taxi stop. Close to the center and close to the Guinness Storehouse. Recommended for a visit to Dublin
Close to Guinness Storehouse.
Perfect kitchen for preparing meals, excellent supermarket across the street. Very firm beds. Flat up two flights may be rough for older guests. Washing machine does not dry clothes..rack available.

The interior of Joans place was quite nice, particularly the shared living space. We were prepared based on reading previous reviews for the great deal of stairs to the unit and the limited free breakfastù which consisted of dry cereal but no milk. While the location was great to walk to the Guinness storehouse, temple bar area and many other attractions, the alleyway where the apartment is located has a clear issue of public urination. There were signs up to say urination in the alley is not permitted however during our brief two night stay we witnessed one man urinating right by the door we enter and the stench was almost unbearable while we waited for the host to greet us.
