If you can see past that and choose to stay here, I highly recommend Arthurs Jazz & Blues Pub. Great food, drinks and atmosphere just across the street!

Overall a decently renovated place, nice kitchen, but one of the bathroom sinks was plugged, the mattresses had no support, so we had back pain every morning, and it was very noisy at night, street noise, men yelling, and strange noises from the building that we couldnt identify, made it hard to fall asleep. About a 15-20 minute walk to town centre, but the entrance to the apartment is in an alleyway, where we  would find men urinating every night we came home. Also the hot water did not last long enough for both of us to shower, and I usually only shower for about 5 minutes.
We enjoyed our trip to Dublin, Joans Place is a good location for seeing the city. Thank you
Its a nice place to stay few days, clean, near from the Guinness Storehouse, the communication with Joan was good and fast during the whole process, I had a good experience I recommend it
The apartment is clean, super nice and great located. Recommended!

Joan is a wonderful host. The apartment was lovely and perfect for us. It was super clean and cosy.  The location  was perfect as it meant that everywhere was a walking distance away. Myself and two of my friends stayed at the apartment for 3 nights and we were extremely pleased :) we loved the fact that there were 2 bathrooms as it saved us time when getting ready in the morning. We definitely recommend Joans apartment as we would like to stay there again if we visit Dublin again
We stayed with our teenage daughter. The flat was really comfortable and there was plenty of space to cook and relax. The location is good - we walked in central Dublin.
Very Nice place in good neighborhood, you can reach the city center really quickly and eventhough the street is a bit loud, you can sleep well because of good windows.
It is a nice place for family to stay.

This apartment is in the perfect location!  It is a few minutes walk from all of the major attractions in Dublin: the Guinness Storehouse, the River Liffey, St Patricks Cathedral, etc.  We did not have a rental car during our visit in Dublin, so the close location was great.  The apartment was clean and had a washer and wifi.  It was also very nice that the apartment had two bathrooms.  Joan was a lovely host and we recommend this apartment if you are travelling to Dublin!

The location was absolutely perfect, we didnt have to take one bus or cab to do everything we wanted to do. 
The place is perfect if your main concern is location. The beds are a little bit uncomfortable, but everything was nice and clean and Joan was a great host. Slept four people just fine and the common area and washing machine were great to have.
Good location and spacious amenities.
Very lovely space. Clean and comfortable. The apartment was walking distance from museums, the guiness store house and teelings whiskey distillery.

Joan's place was perfectly placed for exploring Dublin with temple bar only being a short walk in one direction and the Guinness storehouse in the other. Joan gave us some great local tips including a lovely pub called Arthur's just a stones through from the apparent.
Well organized and planned.  Great location and Joan is very accommodating.
Perfect apartment for a weekend stay. As described and all functional although shower is no more than a dribble and pretty useless. Apart from that cant fault and we enjoyed our stay.
Great place, clean and comfortable apartment in central Dublin. Joan was very acoomodating and allowed us to check in early. Would definitely recommend!

Joans place was nice and exactly as described. It was clean. It was comfortable for 4 women traveling together. The water pressure in the second shower wasnt good, but the water was hot and there was plenty of it. The only thing was the alley access stunk like pee, and it didnt feel super safe. We came and went together however and never had any issues.
Apartment is in walking distance to all that Dublin has to offer. It was nice to have 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms

Joans place worked very well for the four of usîtwo couples. It was very clean and comfortable, and having two bathrooms was definitely a bonus. It is within walking distance of the center of Dublin and the places we wanted to visit, and we found parking nearby on the street.
Great location, short walk to Guiness Brewery and Temple Bar. Good place for 2 couples. Nice host and easy communication, only complaint is that the beds are a bit stiff.

A nice clean apartment. It is in a good location, the apartment is spacious and has everything you need. Joan was nice, showed me around and was quick at responding which was a huge help as it was a last minute booking.
Everything was fine. We will come back again!!
Clean, host was available when needed, explained layout of the apartment & details to operate appliances & such
Excellent location, clean apartment, and we liked the breakfast cereals in the pantry.
Joan's place was clean, bright and filled with all the amenities we needed :) Also a great location! Would stay here again.
Joan was very pleasant to deal with and responded to messages quickly. Great location and good recommendation to Arthurs pub. Would recommend.
Very handy location and nice clean apartment. We really enjoyed our stay!
Easy access to many tourist attractions. Comfortable beds; clean. Would stay there again.
The location for this place is amazing!

Had a great stay at Joans apartment. Excellent location if you are wanting to visit the Guinness storehouse and Jameson factory and An easy 15/20 min walk into the temple bar area. 
Great base for a family or friends/couples for a long weekend. 

Pubs and restaurants nearby or you can cook in the apartment. 

Thanks for hosting us Joan we had a great time.

Georgia
Good location. Joan very responsive. Living room furniture could be better. Beds were nice
A great place to stay in Dublin that is in a convenient  location  and handy to a Lidl supermarket. Accommodation is clean and comfortable  with plenty of amenities  and pleasing touches
We loved staying at Joan¬¥s place. The place was exactly as pictured and described and she always gave us an immediate response on questions. Thanks a lot for the good time!

Great location for walking around Dublin. However the laneway seemed to be used as the local toilet for any man that walked past. Which made the front entrance stink. So was grateful for the rain to wash it all away.
Apart from that, the apartment was great. Clean, cosy and very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again if ever we went back to Dublin and will also recommend to anyone
Great location and nice layout. We did have some small issues with cleanliness (like a half drank water glass leftover from the previous guests on the night stand) but overall it was a good value.

Pros- the apartment is very well equipped.
Within walking distance to city centre.
Supermarket close by.
Joan is very responsive.

Cons- the area looks a bit seedy but we feel safe inside the apartment.

Joans place is in a great location and she is extremely helpful. Her dinner recommendation at Arthurs was fantastic. The location of the Airbnb is great as well. Very close to the Guinness brewery and close to everything else. We walked everywhere.

A lovely two bedroom apartment close to most of Dublins attractions. There is a great kitchen and beds are comfortable. The wifi worked well and the apartment is near bakeries, pubs, grocery stores. The host responded to all our queries.
Perfect location and sparkling clean. Thank you so much!
A perfectly adequate place to stay in Dublin city centre. Communication was excellent and late check-in was kindly facilitated.
Good, solid AirBnB experience. An especially good location for an extended stay and for those comfortable learning how to use the local public transit system.

Good position, good value for money, good communication. Just a couple of things were not as expected: lack of hot water in one of the bathrooms and poor WiFi connection, that was essential for a business trip.
Location is good. Not too loud even though it faces a main street. Bathroom can use more cleaning. Also one of the sinks took forever to drain.
I would have given 5 points if not for the poor plumbing in the apartment. Sadly, it seems to be an irish problem.

Joans place is in a pretty central location and has a great amount of space when travelling in a group! There are a fair few steps to the apartment to be aware of if you struggle with mobility but otherwise theyre not an issue at all! Nice to be near lots of pubs, restaurants and supermarkets so you can enjoy Dublin to its fullest :)

Great location, the apartment is perfect for 2 couples. We loved the amenities and many things were very thoughful (coffe and cereal, shopping bags, adaptors from other countries, blow dryer...). Everything was just easy, thank you!

This place was very affordable relative to other stays in the area, and we got what we paid for.  Having the two bathrooms was definitely a plus.  Check-in was efficient and the location was great.  I would recommend this place to travelers looking for a place to stash their bags and sleep, but not necessarily to relax at.
Great place to stay in Dublin! It was so easy to get around the city and there were nice local pubs and restaurants as well! Joan was a great host and it was a nice place to stay.

Joans place was a great place to stay at for a weekend.  Joan met us on arrival and the apartment was clean and tidy.  The apartment is roughly 15 minute walk from the centre of Dublin & so easy to get to everywhere of interest! Would be more than happy to stay here again when revisiting Dublin.

The kindest hosts, very thoughtful and go well out of their way to make sure you feel at home and know where everything is in their locality. Their house is beautiful, the perfect place to stay when wanting to visit Dublin.

Amazing location. Nearby food and culture. Walkable to quite a bit of what we did in the city. Needs some general upkeep done (ie floors need a deep cleaning, curtains are falling, mattress are worn out, etc) overall worth the stay.
ok

Wow doesnt even come close. Beautiful apartment, amazing view and the area where the apartment is located is lovely. Would 100% recommend to anyone travelling to Dublin, thank you for an amazing stay! Hopefully will be back in the near future.

The location and flat were amazing and were sufficient for our large group of 9 ladies. It was more of a dormitory feeling with all the extra cots set up so we didn't spend a lot of time chilling/ relaxing there. That was our choice though as we wanted to stay there knowing it would be a bit cramped. It was also okay because we had tours and sightseeing to do and it was mainly a place for us to crash each night. It would be quite comfortable for a group of 4-6 adults though if you wanted to spend more time at the flat enjoying the view and a meal.
The view out the patio windows was incredible and we enjoyed it in the morning and evening. Also, we ate at restaurants downstairs and took advantage of the close grocery store across the street. The walk along the River Liffe to the center of town was a pleasant 25 minutes or so. We did laundry one night and we availed ourselves of the taxis always available right outside the door. 
The check-in and check out process were a bit clandestine in nature.  Two messages sent leading up to our stay were not acknowledged and info sent the day of our arrival was sent to a wrong number. 
But it all worked out in the end and we had a wonderful stay. Would stay again if in Dublin.
